consistent<,>/kənˈsɪstənt/<,>/kənˈsɪstənt/<,>adj.一致的<,>Her performance has been consistent throughout the season.<,>她整个赛季的表现都很稳定。<,>The results are consistent with our expectations.<,>结果与我们的预期一致。<,>He is consistent in his approach to problem-solving.<,>他解决问题的方法始终如一。<,>con(共同)+sist(站立)+ent→共同站在一起→一致的<,>persistent(adj. 坚持的)/insistent(adj. 坚持的)/resistant(adj. 抵抗的)  

battery<,>/ˈbætəri/<,>/ˈbætəri/<,>n.电池<,>My phone battery is running low.<,>我手机快没电了。<,>He replaced the batteries in the remote control.<,>他更换了遥控器的电池。<,>The car battery needs to be recharged.<,>汽车电池需要充电了。<,>bat(打)+tery→像打一样持续供电→电池<,>battle(n. 战斗)/buttery(adj. 含奶油的)/batter(v. 连续猛击)  

competent<,>/ˈkɒmpɪtənt/<,>/ˈkɑːmpɪtənt/<,>adj.能胜任的/有能力的<,>She is competent in handling complex projects.<,>她能胜任处理复杂项目。<,>The team needs competent leadership.<,>团队需要能干的领导。<,>He proved himself competent for the job.<,>他证明自己能胜任这份工作。<,>com(共同)+pet(追求)+ent→能共同追求目标→有能力的<,>competitive(adj. 竞争的)/complacent(adj. 自满的)/compliant(adj. 顺从的)  

preserve<,>/prɪˈzɜːv/<,>/prɪˈzɜːrv/<,>v.保存/保护<,>We must preserve our natural resources.<,>我们必须保护自然资源。<,>This method helps preserve food longer.<,>这种方法能延长食物保存时间。<,>The museum works to preserve ancient artifacts.<,>博物馆致力于保护古代文物。<,>pre(预先)+serve(保持)→预先保持→保存<,>reserve(v. 保留)/conserve(v. 节约)/deserve(v. 应得)  

possession<,>/pəˈzeʃn/<,>/pəˈzeʃn/<,>n.拥有<,>He took possession of the house last month.<,>他上个月拥有了这栋房子。<,>The team is in possession of the ball.<,>球队控球。<,>She lost all her possessions in the fire.<,>她在大火中失去了所有财产。<,>pos(放置)+sess(坐)+ion→把东西放在自己坐的地方→拥有<,>procession(n. 队伍)/profession(n. 职业)/precession(n. 先行)  

proximately<,>/ˈprɒksɪmətli/<,>/ˈprɑːksɪmətli/<,>adv.近似/接近<,>The results proximately match our predictions.<,>结果与我们的预测接近。<,>The two events occurred proximately in time.<,>两件事发生时间相近。<,>His answer was proximately correct.<,>他的回答基本正确。<,>proxim(接近)+ate+ly→接近地<,>approximately(adv. 大约)/proximity(n. 接近)/ultimate(adj. 最终的)  

wildfire<,>/ˈwaɪldfaɪə(r)/<,>/ˈwaɪldfaɪər/<,>n.野火<,>The wildfire spread quickly through the forest.<,>野火在森林中迅速蔓延。<,>Firefighters are battling the wildfire.<,>消防员正在扑灭野火。<,>Drought conditions increase wildfire risks.<,>干旱增加了野火风险。<,>wild(野生的)+fire(火)→野火<,>wildlife(n. 野生动物)/wilderness(n. 荒野)/wildcat(n. 野猫)  

compact<,>/kəmˈpækt/<,>/kəmˈpækt/<,>adj.紧密的/紧凑的<,>The apartment is small but compact.<,>公寓虽小但布局紧凑。<,>They signed a compact agreement.<,>他们签署了简洁的协议。<,>The car has a compact design.<,>这辆车设计紧凑。<,>com(共同)+pact(压紧)→共同压紧→紧凑的<,>impact(n. 影响)/contract(n. 合同)/pact(n. 协定)  

defy<,>/dɪˈfaɪ/<,>/dɪˈfaɪ/<,>v.违背/违抗<,>He defied his parents' wishes.<,>他违背了父母的意愿。<,>The invention defies the laws of physics.<,>这项发明违背物理定律。<,>She defied all expectations and succeeded.<,>她出乎所有人意料取得了成功。<,>de(离开)+fy(信任)→不信任→违抗<,>deny(v. 否认)/deify(v. 神化)/defect(n. 缺点)  

absolutely<,>/ˈæbsəluːtli/<,>/ˈæbsəluːtli/<,>adv.当然<,>You are absolutely right.<,>你完全正确。<,>I absolutely love this song.<,>我超级喜欢这首歌。<,>That's absolutely ridiculous!<,>那简直太荒谬了！<,>ab(离开)+solute(解决)+ly→完全解决地→当然<,>relatively(adv. 相对地)/resolutely(adv. 坚决地)/absolution(n. 赦免)
filter<,>/ˈfɪltə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪltər/<,>v.过滤<,>You should filter the water before drinking it.<,>你应该在喝水之前先过滤一下。<,>He used a coffee filter to make his morning brew.<,>他用咖啡滤纸制作了早晨的咖啡。<,>The air purifier helps to filter out dust and pollen.<,>空气净化器有助于过滤灰尘和花粉。<,>fil(线)+ter→用线编织的过滤网→过滤<,>falter(v. 支吾/v.蹒跚)/filtrate(v. 过滤/n.滤液)

server<,>/ˈsɜːvə(r)/<,>/ˈsɜːrvər/<,>n.服务器<,>The website is down because the server crashed.<,>网站无法访问，因为服务器崩溃了。<,>He works as a server administrator at a tech company.<,>他在一家科技公司担任服务器管理员。<,>Make sure to back up your data on the server regularly.<,>确保定期在服务器上备份你的数据。<,>serv(服务)+er(人或物)→提供服务的机器→服务器<,>servant(n. 仆人)/service(n. 服务/v.维修)

spoil<,>/spɔɪl/<,>/spɔɪl/<,>v.溺爱<,>Don't spoil your children by giving them everything they want.<,>不要溺爱孩子，给他们想要的一切。<,>The rain spoiled our picnic plans.<,>下雨破坏了我们的野餐计划。<,>Too much sugar can spoil your appetite for dinner.<,>吃太多糖会破坏你的晚餐食欲。<,>sp(谐音“溺”)+oil(油)→用油泡着→溺爱<,>soil(n. 土壤/v.弄脏)/spool(n. 线轴/v.缠绕)

rustle<,>/ˈrʌsl/<,>/ˈrʌsəl/<,>v.发出沙沙声<,>The leaves rustle in the wind.<,>树叶在风中沙沙作响。<,>I heard someone rustling papers in the next room.<,>我听到隔壁房间有人在翻动纸张。<,>The thief tried to rustle through the bushes quietly.<,>小偷试图悄悄地穿过灌木丛。<,>rus(拟声)+tle→模拟沙沙声→发出沙沙声<,>hustle(v. 催促/n.忙碌)/bustle(v. 忙碌/n.喧闹)

diversion<,>/daɪˈvɜːʃn/<,>/daɪˈvɜːrʒn/<,>n.转移；娱乐<,>The traffic diversion caused delays for commuters.<,>交通改道导致通勤者延误。<,>Reading is her favorite diversion on weekends.<,>阅读是她周末最喜欢的消遣。<,>The magician created a diversion to perform his trick.<,>魔术师制造了一个转移注意力的动作来表演他的戏法。<,>di(分开)+vers(转)+ion→转向不同方向→转移<,>diverse(adj. 多样的)/divert(v. 转移/v.娱乐)

complaint<,>/kəmˈpleɪnt/<,>/kəmˈpleɪnt/<,>n.抱怨，投诉<,>She filed a complaint about the noisy neighbors.<,>她对吵闹的邻居提出了投诉。<,>His constant complaints made everyone uncomfortable.<,>他不断的抱怨让每个人都感到不舒服。<,>The customer service department handles all complaints.<,>客服部门处理所有投诉。<,>com(完全)+plain(捶胸)→完全捶胸→抱怨<,>compliant(adj. 顺从的)/compliment(n. 称赞/v.恭维)

merge<,>/mɜːdʒ/<,>/mɜːrdʒ/<,>v.合并<,>The two companies decided to merge next year.<,>这两家公司决定明年合并。<,>Merge the two documents into one file.<,>将这两个文档合并成一个文件。<,>The lanes merge ahead, so be careful when driving.<,>前方车道合并，开车时要小心。<,>merg(沉)+e→沉入一起→合并<,>emerge(v. 出现)/submerge(v. 淹没)

priceless<,>/ˈpraɪsləs/<,>/ˈpraɪsləs/<,>adj.无价的，难以用价格衡量的<,>This ancient artifact is priceless to our museum.<,>这件古代文物对我们博物馆来说是无价之宝。<,>Her smile was priceless when she saw the surprise.<,>她看到惊喜时的笑容是无价的。<,>The experience of traveling with friends is priceless.<,>与朋友一起旅行的经历是无价的。<,>price(价格)+less(无)→无价的<,>worthless(adj. 无价值的)/priced(adj. 定价的)

honorary<,>/ˈɒnərəri/<,>/ˈɑːnəreri/<,>adj.荣誉的<,>He was given an honorary degree for his contributions.<,>他因贡献被授予荣誉学位。<,>She serves as the honorary president of the charity.<,>她担任这家慈善机构的荣誉主席。<,>The title is purely honorary with no real power.<,>这个头衔纯粹是荣誉性的，没有实权。<,>honor(荣誉)+ary(…的)→荣誉的<,>honorable(adj. 可敬的)/honorarium(n. 酬金)

chronic<,>/ˈkrɒnɪk/<,>/ˈkrɑːnɪk/<,>adj.长期的；慢性的<,>He suffers from chronic back pain.<,>他患有慢性背痛。<,>Chronic stress can lead to health problems.<,>长期压力会导致健康问题。<,>The city has a chronic shortage of affordable housing.<,>这座城市长期缺乏经济适用房。<,>chron(时间)+ic(…的)→长时间的→长期的<,>synchronous(adj. 同步的)/anachronism(n. 时代错误)
extracurricular<,>/ˌekstrəkəˈrɪkjələ(r)/<,>/ˌekstrəkəˈrɪkjələr/<,>adj.课外的<,>She participates in many extracurricular activities.<,>她参加了很多课外活动。<,>Extracurricular programs help students develop new skills.<,>课外活动帮助学生发展新技能。<,>Balancing academics and extracurriculars is important.<,>平衡学业和课外活动很重要。<,>extra(额外的)+curricular(课程的)→课外的<,>curriculum(n.课程)/extraneous(adj.无关的)  

lobby<,>/ˈlɒbi/<,>/ˈlɑːbi/<,>n.游说<,>Environmental groups lobby for stricter pollution laws.<,>环保组织游说制定更严格的污染法规。<,>The company hired a firm to lobby the government.<,>该公司雇佣了一家机构向政府游说。<,>He spent years lobbying for healthcare reform.<,>他花了多年时间为医疗改革游说。<,>lob(扔)+by→把意见"扔"给决策者→游说<,>hobby(n.爱好)/lob(v.投掷)  

inexhaustible<,>/ˌɪnɪɡˈzɔːstəbl/<,>/ˌɪnɪɡˈzɔːstəbl/<,>adj.用不完的/无穷无尽的<,>Her energy seems inexhaustible.<,>她的精力似乎无穷无尽。<,>Solar power is an inexhaustible energy source.<,>太阳能是用之不竭的能源。<,>His patience was nearly inexhaustible.<,>他的耐心几乎是无限的。<,>in(不)+exhaust(耗尽)+ible→用不完的<,>exhaustible(adj.可耗尽的)/exhaust(v.耗尽)  

inevitable<,>/ɪnˈevɪtəbl/<,>/ɪnˈevɪtəbl/<,>adj.不可避免的<,>Conflict was inevitable given their differences.<,>鉴于他们的分歧，冲突不可避免。<,>Technological progress is inevitable.<,>技术进步是不可避免的。<,>Death is the inevitable end of life.<,>死亡是生命不可避免的终结。<,>in(不)+evitable(可避免的)→不可避免的<,>evitable(adj.可避免的)/unavoidable(adj.不可避免的)  

contamination<,>/kənˌtæmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/kənˌtæmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>n.污染<,>The river showed signs of chemical contamination.<,>这条河显示出化学污染的迹象。<,>Food contamination can cause serious illnesses.<,>食品污染会导致严重疾病。<,>They tested the soil for radioactive contamination.<,>他们检测了土壤的放射性污染。<,>con(共同)+tamin(接触)+ation→共同接触污染物→污染<,>pollution(n.污染)/contaminate(v.污染)  

suspend<,>/səˈspend/<,>/səˈspend/<,>v.暂停<,>The school suspended the student for fighting.<,>学校因打架事件暂停该学生上课。<,>They decided to suspend the project temporarily.<,>他们决定暂时中止这个项目。<,>The athlete was suspended for doping violations.<,>这名运动员因违反兴奋剂规定被禁赛。<,>sus(在...下)+pend(悬挂)→挂在下面→暂停<,>pendulum(n.钟摆)/append(v.附加)  

imminent<,>/ˈɪmɪnənt/<,>/ˈɪmɪnənt/<,>adj.即将来临的<,>A storm is imminent according to the forecast.<,>根据预报，暴风雨即将来临。<,>They feared imminent attack from the enemy.<,>他们担心敌人即将发动攻击。<,>The doctor said death was imminent.<,>医生说死亡即将来临。<,>im(进入)+min(突出)+ent→即将进入突出状态→即将来临的<,>eminent(adj.著名的)/immanent(adj.内在的)  

obesity<,>/əʊˈbiːsəti/<,>/oʊˈbiːsəti/<,>n.肥胖<,>Childhood obesity has become a serious problem.<,>儿童肥胖已成为一个严重问题。<,>Obesity increases the risk of many diseases.<,>肥胖会增加许多疾病的风险。<,>The government launched a campaign against obesity.<,>政府发起了对抗肥胖的运动。<,>ob(过度)+es(吃)+ity→过度饮食导致的→肥胖<,>obese(adj.肥胖的)/obsession(n.痴迷)  

aid<,>/eɪd/<,>/eɪd/<,>v.援助/有助于<,>International organizations provided aid to the disaster area.<,>国际组织向灾区提供了援助。<,>This medicine aids digestion.<,>这种药物有助于消化。<,>Visual aids can enhance learning.<,>视觉教具可以促进学习。<,>a(加强)+id(给予)→给予帮助→援助<,>aide(n.助手)/add(v.增加)  

solution<,>/səˈluːʃn/<,>/səˈluːʃn/<,>n.解决/解决方法/溶液<,>We need to find a solution to this problem.<,>我们需要找到这个问题的解决方法。<,>The salt dissolved in the water to form a solution.<,>盐在水中溶解形成溶液。<,>Peaceful solutions are always preferable.<,>和平解决方案总是更可取。<,>solut(松开)+ion→松开问题→解决<,>resolution(n.决议)/dissolution(n.溶解)
tuition<,>/tjuːˈɪʃən/<,>/tuːˈɪʃən/<,>n.学费<,>The tuition for this course is quite expensive.<,>这门课程的学费相当昂贵。<,>She received a scholarship to cover her tuition fees.<,>她获得了奖学金来支付学费。<,>Parents often save money for their children's tuition.<,>父母经常为孩子的学费存钱。<,>tui(教)+tion(名词后缀)→教学的费用→学费<,>intuition(n.直觉)/tutor(n.导师/v.辅导)

esteem<,>/ɪˈstiːm/<,>/ɪˈstim/<,>v.尊重<,>He is highly esteemed by his colleagues.<,>他深受同事们的尊重。<,>Self-esteem is important for mental health.<,>自尊对心理健康很重要。<,>She esteems her teacher's opinion greatly.<,>她非常尊重老师的意见。<,>e(出)+steem(价值)→看重其价值→尊重<,>estimate(v.估计/n.估价)/steam(n.蒸汽/v.蒸)

purchase<,>/ˈpɜːtʃəs/<,>/ˈpɜːrtʃəs/<,>n.购买<,>She made a large purchase at the mall yesterday.<,>她昨天在商场进行了大采购。<,>Keep your receipt as proof of purchase.<,>保留收据作为购买凭证。<,>The company is considering the purchase of new equipment.<,>公司正在考虑购买新设备。<,>pur(完全)+chase(追逐)→完全追逐到手→购买<,>pursue(v.追求)/chase(v.追逐/n.追逐)

incorporate<,>/ɪnˈkɔːpəreɪt/<,>/ɪnˈkɔːrpəreɪt/<,>v.合并<,>The company plans to incorporate the new technology into its products.<,>公司计划将新技术融入产品中。<,>This design incorporates elements from different cultures.<,>这个设计融合了不同文化的元素。<,>The two firms will incorporate next month.<,>这两家公司将于下月合并。<,>in(进入)+corp(身体)+orate→使成为一个整体→合并<,>corporate(adj.公司的)/corporation(n.公司)

prevail<,>/prɪˈveɪl/<,>/prɪˈveɪl/<,>v.流行/v.普遍<,>This fashion style prevailed in the 1980s.<,>这种时尚风格在20世纪80年代很流行。<,>Justice will prevail in the end.<,>正义终将获胜。<,>The custom still prevails in some rural areas.<,>这个习俗在一些农村地区仍然盛行。<,>pre(前)+vail(价值)→价值在前→占优势→流行<,>prevalent(adj.流行的)/avail(v.利用/n.效用)

irrational<,>/ɪˈræʃənəl/<,>/ɪˈræʃənəl/<,>adj.不合理的/adj.不理性的<,>His fear of flying is completely irrational.<,>他对飞行的恐惧完全不理性。<,>Don't make irrational decisions when you're angry.<,>生气时不要做不理性的决定。<,>The pricing strategy seems irrational to many customers.<,>许多顾客认为这个定价策略不合理。<,>ir(不)+rational(理性的)→不理性的<,>rational(adj.理性的)/irritable(adj.易怒的)

inherent<,>/ɪnˈhɪərənt/<,>/ɪnˈhɪrənt/<,>adj.固有的<,>There are inherent risks in this investment.<,>这项投资有固有风险。<,>Her inherent kindness makes her popular.<,>她天生的善良使她受欢迎。<,>This problem is inherent in the system design.<,>这个问题是系统设计固有的。<,>in(内)+her(粘附)+ent→内在粘附的→固有的<,>inherit(v.继承)/coherent(adj.连贯的)

overexcited<,>/ˌəʊvərɪkˈsaɪtɪd/<,>/ˌoʊvərɪkˈsaɪtɪd/<,>adj.过于激烈的<,>The children became overexcited at the party.<,>孩子们在派对上变得过于兴奋。<,>Don't get overexcited about small successes.<,>不要对小成功过于激动。<,>His overexcited behavior worried his parents.<,>他过于激动的行为让父母担心。<,>over(过度)+excited(兴奋的)→过于兴奋的<,>overestimate(v.高估)/excited(adj.兴奋的)

preference<,>/ˈprefərəns/<,>/ˈprefərəns/<,>n.偏爱<,>She has a preference for classical music.<,>她偏爱古典音乐。<,>The teacher shows no preference to any student.<,>老师对任何学生都没有偏爱。<,>Customer preferences change over time.<,>顾客的偏好会随时间变化。<,>pre(前)+fer(拿)+ence→提前拿取→偏爱<,>reference(n.参考)/conference(n.会议)

evolution<,>/ˌiːvəˈluːʃən/<,>/ˌɛvəˈluːʃən/<,>n.演变/n.发展/n.进化<,>The theory of evolution explains species development.<,>进化论解释了物种的发展。<,>We can observe the evolution of technology in recent decades.<,>我们可以看到近几十年来技术的发展。<,>Language undergoes constant evolution.<,>语言在不断演变。<,>e(出)+volut(滚)+ion→向外滚动→发展<,>revolution(n.革命)/involve(v.包含)
exotic<,>/ɪɡˈzɒtɪk/<,>/ɪɡˈzɑːtɪk/<,>adj.异域的/adj.外国的<,>She loves wearing exotic clothing from different cultures.<,>她喜欢穿来自不同文化的异域服装。<,>The restaurant serves exotic dishes from around the world.<,>这家餐厅供应来自世界各地的外国菜肴。<,>He has an exotic collection of rare plants.<,>他收藏了一些稀有的外国植物。<,>ex(外)+otic(形容词后缀)→外国的<,>erotic(adj.色情的)/esoteric(adj.深奥的)

stockbroker<,>/ˈstɒkbrəʊkə(r)/<,>/ˈstɑːkbroʊkər/<,>n.股票经理人<,>The stockbroker advised his clients to invest in technology stocks.<,>股票经理人建议他的客户投资科技股。<,>She became a successful stockbroker after years of hard work.<,>经过多年的努力，她成为了一名成功的股票经理人。<,>The stockbroker lost a lot of money in the market crash.<,>股票经理人在市场崩盘中损失了很多钱。<,>stock(股票)+broker(经纪人)→股票经理人<,>stockholder(n.股东)/bookkeeper(n.簿记员)

misinterpret<,>/ˌmɪsɪnˈtɜːprɪt/<,>/ˌmɪsɪnˈtɜːrprɪt/<,>v.误解<,>Don't misinterpret my silence as agreement.<,>不要把我的沉默误解为同意。<,>The journalist misinterpreted the politician's statement.<,>记者误解了政治家的声明。<,>His actions were often misinterpreted by others.<,>他的行为经常被别人误解。<,>mis(错误)+interpret(解释)→误解<,>misunderstand(v.误解)/misrepresent(v.歪曲)

prosperity<,>/prɒˈsperəti/<,>/prɑːˈsperəti/<,>n.繁荣<,>The country enjoyed a period of great prosperity.<,>这个国家经历了一段繁荣的时期。<,>Economic prosperity depends on many factors.<,>经济繁荣取决于许多因素。<,>They wished for health and prosperity in the new year.<,>他们祝愿新的一年健康繁荣。<,>pro(向前)+sper(希望)+ity(名词后缀)→繁荣<,>posterity(n.后代)/priority(n.优先)

tank<,>/tæŋk/<,>/tæŋk/<,>n.水箱<,>The fish tank needs to be cleaned regularly.<,>鱼缸需要定期清洗。<,>They installed a new water tank on the roof.<,>他们在屋顶安装了一个新的水箱。<,>The car's gas tank was almost empty.<,>汽车的油箱几乎空了。<,>tan(皮革)+k→古代用皮革做的容器→水箱<,>bank(n.银行)/sank(v.下沉)

outdated<,>/ˌaʊtˈdeɪtɪd/<,>/ˌaʊtˈdeɪtɪd/<,>adj.过时的<,>This computer is outdated and needs to be replaced.<,>这台电脑过时了，需要更换。<,>His views on gender roles are quite outdated.<,>他对性别角色的看法相当过时。<,>The manual contains outdated information.<,>手册中包含过时的信息。<,>out(外)+date(日期)+ed(形容词后缀)→过时的<,>updated(adj.更新的)/upgraded(adj.升级的)

outnumber<,>/ˌaʊtˈnʌmbə(r)/<,>/ˌaʊtˈnʌmbər/<,>v.超过<,>Women outnumber men in this university.<,>在这所大学里，女生人数超过男生。<,>The protesters outnumbered the police officers.<,>抗议者的人数超过了警察。<,>Their team outnumbered ours by three players.<,>他们队比我们队多了三名队员。<,>out(超过)+number(数量)→超过<,>outrun(v.跑得比...快)/outlast(v.比...持久)

supervisor<,>/ˈsuːpəvaɪzə(r)/<,>/ˈsuːpərvaɪzər/<,>n.督导<,>The supervisor checked the quality of the products.<,>督导检查了产品的质量。<,>She reported the problem to her supervisor.<,>她把问题报告给了她的督导。<,>The construction site has a safety supervisor.<,>建筑工地有一名安全督导。<,>super(上)+vis(看)+or(人)→在上面看的人→督导<,>adviser(n.顾问)/surveyor(n.测量员)

fluctuate<,>/ˈflʌktʃueɪt/<,>/ˈflʌktʃueɪt/<,>v.波动<,>Prices tend to fluctuate during the holiday season.<,>假日期间价格往往会波动。<,>Her mood fluctuates depending on the weather.<,>她的情绪会随着天气波动。<,>The stock market fluctuated wildly today.<,>今天股市波动剧烈。<,>flu(流)+ctuate→像水流一样波动<,>fluent(adj.流利的)/affluent(adj.富裕的)

substance<,>/ˈsʌbstəns/<,>/ˈsʌbstəns/<,>n.物质<,>This substance is highly toxic.<,>这种物质有剧毒。<,>Scientists discovered a new substance in the lab.<,>科学家们在实验室发现了一种新物质。<,>The article lacks substance and is poorly written.<,>这篇文章缺乏实质内容，写得也很差。<,>sub(下)+stance(站)→站在下面的东西→物质<,>instance(n.实例)/distance(n.距离)
profitable<,>/ˈprɒfɪtəbl/<,>/ˈprɑːfɪtəbl/<,>adj.有利可图的/adj.有利益的<,>The new business proved to be highly profitable.<,>这项新业务被证明是非常有利可图的。<,>Investing in education is a profitable long-term strategy.<,>投资教育是一项有利可图的长期策略。<,>They turned a profitable idea into a successful company.<,>他们将一个有利可图的想法变成了一家成功的公司。<,>profit(利润)+able(能…的)→能带来利润的→有利可图的<,>beneficial(adj.有益的)/lucrative(adj.赚钱的)  

markedly<,>/ˈmɑːkɪdli/<,>/ˈmɑːrkɪdli/<,>adv.显著地<,>Her health has improved markedly since she started exercising.<,>自从开始锻炼以来，她的健康状况显著改善。<,>The company's profits have increased markedly this year.<,>公司的利润今年显著增长。<,>His attitude changed markedly after the incident.<,>那次事件后，他的态度显著改变了。<,>marked(显著的)+ly(副词后缀)→显著地<,>noticeably(adv.明显地)/significantly(adv.重大地)  

ineffective<,>/ˌɪnɪˈfektɪv/<,>/ˌɪnəˈfɛktɪv/<,>adj.无效的<,>The medicine was ineffective against the virus.<,>这种药物对病毒无效。<,>His attempts to calm the situation were ineffective.<,>他试图平息局势的努力是无效的。<,>The old marketing strategy proved ineffective.<,>旧的营销策略被证明是无效的。<,>in(不)+effective(有效的)→无效的<,>inefficient(adj.效率低的)/useless(adj.无用的)  

bleak<,>/bliːk/<,>/blik/<,>adj.荒凉的<,>The landscape was bleak and deserted.<,>这片景色荒凉而无人烟。<,>His future looks bleak without a job.<,>没有工作，他的未来看起来很黯淡。<,>They walked through the bleak winter forest.<,>他们走过荒凉的冬日森林。<,>联想：bleak→break(破碎)→破碎的景象→荒凉的<,>desolate(adj.荒芜的)/grim(adj.严酷的)  

optimistic<,>/ˌɒptɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>/ˌɑːptɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>adj.乐观的<,>She remains optimistic about her recovery.<,>她对康复保持乐观。<,>His optimistic attitude inspires everyone.<,>他乐观的态度激励着每个人。<,>The team is optimistic about winning the championship.<,>团队对赢得冠军持乐观态度。<,>optim(最好)+istic(…的)→乐观的<,>pessimistic(adj.悲观的)/hopeful(adj.有希望的)  

ultimate<,>/ˈʌltɪmət/<,>/ˈʌltəmət/<,>adj.最终的<,>Winning the gold medal was his ultimate goal.<,>赢得金牌是他的最终目标。<,>The ultimate decision rests with the board.<,>最终决定权在董事会。<,>This is the ultimate version of the software.<,>这是该软件的最终版本。<,>ultim(最后)+ate(…的)→最终的<,>final(adj.最后的)/penultimate(adj.倒数第二的)  

consumption<,>/kənˈsʌmpʃn/<,>/kənˈsʌmpʃən/<,>n.消耗/n.消费<,>Excessive consumption of sugar is unhealthy.<,>过量食用糖对健康不利。<,>The car has low fuel consumption.<,>这辆车油耗低。<,>Energy consumption has increased this year.<,>今年的能源消耗增加了。<,>con(完全)+sumpt(拿)+ion→完全拿走→消耗<,>expenditure(n.支出)/intake(n.摄入)  

foster<,>/ˈfɒstə(r)/<,>/ˈfɑːstər/<,>v.促进/v.培养<,>The program fosters creativity in children.<,>这个项目培养孩子们的创造力。<,>Good communication fosters strong relationships.<,>良好的沟通促进牢固的关系。<,>She fosters a love of reading in her students.<,>她培养学生对阅读的热爱。<,>联想：foster→fast(快)+er→快速成长→培养<,>nurture(v.培育)/hinder(v.阻碍)  

receipt<,>/rɪˈsiːt/<,>/rɪˈsit/<,>n.发票<,>Please keep your receipt as proof of purchase.<,>请保留发票作为购买凭证。<,>He asked for a receipt after paying.<,>付款后他索要了发票。<,>The receipt shows the date and amount paid.<,>发票显示了日期和支付金额。<,>re(回)+ceipt(拿)→拿回来的凭证→发票<,>recipe(n.食谱)/reception(n.接待)  

harsh<,>/hɑːʃ/<,>/hɑːrʃ/<,>adj.严酷的/adj.严峻的<,>The desert climate is harsh and unforgiving.<,>沙漠气候严酷而无情。<,>He received harsh criticism for his mistake.<,>他因错误受到严厉批评。<,>The winter was particularly harsh this year.<,>今年的冬天特别严酷。<,>联想：harsh→hard(硬)+sh→硬邦邦的→严酷的<,>severe(adj.严重的)/gentle(adj.温和的)
misfortune<,>/ˌmɪsˈfɔːtʃuːn/<,>/ˌmɪsˈfɔːrtʃən/<,>n.不幸/n.灾祸/n.灾难<,>He bore his misfortunes with great courage.<,>他以极大的勇气承受了不幸。<,>It was a misfortune that she lost her job.<,>她失去了工作，真是不幸。<,>The earthquake brought great misfortune to the region.<,>地震给该地区带来了巨大的灾难。<,>mis(坏)+fortune(运气)→坏运气→不幸<,>fortune(n.运气)/misfire(v.未达到预期效果)/misfit(n.不适应环境的人)  

citation<,>/saɪˈteɪʃn/<,>/saɪˈteɪʃən/<,>n.引文<,>The article contains several citations from famous authors.<,>这篇文章包含了几位著名作家的引文。<,>You must provide proper citations for your research paper.<,>你必须为研究论文提供适当的引文。<,>His speech was full of citations from historical documents.<,>他的演讲中引用了大量历史文献。<,>cit(引用)+ation(名词后缀)→引文<,>citation(n.引文)/recitation(n.背诵)/incitation(n.刺激)  

rape<,>/reɪp/<,>/reɪp/<,>n.强奸<,>The court sentenced him for committing rape.<,>法院因他犯强奸罪而判刑。<,>Rape is a serious crime that affects many victims.<,>强奸是影响许多受害者的严重罪行。<,>She bravely spoke out about her experience of rape.<,>她勇敢地说出了自己被强奸的经历。<,>rape(掠夺)→引申为性暴力<,>rap(n.说唱)/rapt(adj.全神贯注的)/rapid(adj.迅速的)  

ecological<,>/ˌiːkəˈlɒdʒɪkl/<,>/ˌiːkəˈlɑːdʒɪkl/<,>adj.生态学的<,>The ecological balance of the area is very fragile.<,>该地区的生态平衡非常脆弱。<,>We need to consider the ecological impact of this project.<,>我们需要考虑这个项目的生态影响。<,>Ecological studies show that pollution is increasing.<,>生态学研究表明污染正在加剧。<,>eco(生态)+logical(学科的)→生态学的<,>biological(adj.生物的)/geological(adj.地质的)/psychological(adj.心理的)  

lag<,>/læɡ/<,>/læɡ/<,>v.落后<,>Our team is lagging behind in the competition.<,>我们队在比赛中落后了。<,>Don't lag behind when we're walking.<,>我们走路时别落在后面。<,>Technology in this country lags behind others.<,>这个国家的技术落后于其他国家。<,>lag(落后)→与"leg"(腿)联想：腿短跑得慢<,>leg(n.腿)/tag(n.标签)/laggard(n.落后者)  

controversy<,>/ˈkɒntrəvɜːsi/<,>/ˈkɑːntrəvɜːrsi/<,>n.争议<,>The new policy caused much controversy.<,>新政策引起了很多争议。<,>There is controversy over the use of this drug.<,>关于这种药物的使用存在争议。<,>The book sparked controversy among scholars.<,>这本书在学者中引发了争议。<,>contro(反对)+vers(转)+y→相互反对转动→争议<,>converse(v.交谈)/contradict(v.反驳)/controvert(v.反驳)  

cornerstone<,>/ˈkɔːnəstəʊn/<,>/ˈkɔːrnərstoʊn/<,>n.基石<,>Trust is the cornerstone of any relationship.<,>信任是任何关系的基石。<,>This treaty is the cornerstone of international cooperation.<,>该条约是国际合作的基石。<,>The constitution is the cornerstone of our legal system.<,>宪法是我们法律体系的基石。<,>corner(角落)+stone(石头)→角落的石头→基石<,>milestone(n.里程碑)/tombstone(n.墓碑)/grindstone(n.磨石)  

erect<,>/ɪˈrekt/<,>/ɪˈrekt/<,>v.建立<,>They plan to erect a new monument in the square.<,>他们计划在广场上建立一座新纪念碑。<,>The company will erect a new office building next year.<,>公司明年将建立一栋新的办公楼。<,>It took them months to erect the bridge.<,>他们花了几个月时间建这座桥。<,>e(出)+rect(直)→使直立→建立<,>direct(adj.直接的)/correct(adj.正确的)/erection(n.建筑物)  

prematurely<,>/ˈpremətʃəli/<,>/ˌpriːməˈtʃʊrli/<,>adv.早熟地/adv.过早地<,>The baby was born prematurely at seven months.<,>这个婴儿七个月就早产了。<,>He died prematurely at the age of 40.<,>他40岁就过早去世了。<,>Don't make decisions prematurely without all the facts.<,>不要在没有掌握所有事实的情况下过早做决定。<,>pre(前)+mature(成熟)+ly→在成熟之前→过早地<,>mature(adj.成熟的)/immature(adj.不成熟的)/premature(adj.过早的)  

initiative<,>/ɪˈnɪʃətɪv/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃətɪv/<,>n.主动性<,>She showed great initiative in solving the problem.<,>她在解决问题时表现出极大的主动性。<,>The government has taken the initiative to improve education.<,>政府主动采取措施改善教育。<,>Lack of initiative can hinder career development.<,>缺乏主动性会阻碍职业发展。<,>initi(开始)+ative→主动开始→主动性<,>initial(adj.最初的)/initiate(v.开始)/initiation(n.开始)
dilute<,>/daɪˈluːt/<,>/daɪˈlut/<,>v.稀释/v.冲淡<,>She diluted the juice with water.<,>她用水稀释了果汁。<,>The impact of the news was diluted by time.<,>随着时间的推移，新闻的影响被冲淡了。<,>You can dilute the paint to make it lighter.<,>你可以稀释油漆使其颜色变浅。<,>di(分开)+lute(冲洗)→分开冲洗→稀释<,>pollute(v.污染)/absolute(adj.绝对的)/resolute(adj.坚决的)  

viewpoint<,>/ˈvjuːpɔɪnt/<,>/ˈvjuˌpɔɪnt/<,>n.观点<,>From my viewpoint, this plan is impractical.<,>从我的观点来看，这个计划不切实际。<,>The article presents a fresh viewpoint on the issue.<,>这篇文章提出了对该问题的新观点。<,>We need to consider all viewpoints before making a decision.<,>在做决定前我们需要考虑所有观点。<,>view(看)+point(点)→看问题的点→观点<,>standpoint(n.立场)/opinion(n.意见)/perspective(n.视角)  

typical<,>/ˈtɪpɪkəl/<,>/ˈtɪpɪkəl/<,>adj.典型的<,>This is a typical example of Renaissance art.<,>这是文艺复兴时期艺术的典型例子。<,>He gave a typical politician's answer.<,>他给出了一个典型的政客式回答。<,>The weather is typical for this time of year.<,>这种天气是这个季节的典型特征。<,>typ(类型)+ical(形容词后缀)→典型的<,>atypical(adj.非典型的)/stereotypical(adj.刻板的)/prototypical(adj.原型的)  

stray<,>/streɪ/<,>/streɪ/<,>n.走失的动物/v.流浪<,>The kind woman took in a stray cat.<,>这位善良的女士收养了一只流浪猫。<,>Stray dogs are common in this area.<,>这个地区流浪狗很常见。<,>Don't stray from the main topic.<,>不要偏离主题。<,>s(看作"失")+tray(盘子)→失散的盘子→走失<,>array(n.阵列)/betray(v.背叛)/portray(v.描绘)  

imbalance<,>/ɪmˈbæləns/<,>/ɪmˈbæləns/<,>n.不平衡<,>There is an imbalance between supply and demand.<,>供需之间存在不平衡。<,>The imbalance in power led to conflicts.<,>权力的不平衡导致了冲突。<,>Hormonal imbalance can cause health problems.<,>荷尔蒙失衡会导致健康问题。<,>im(不)+balance(平衡)→不平衡<,>balance(n.平衡)/counterbalance(v.抵消)/unbalance(v.使失去平衡)  

affiliation<,>/əˌfɪliˈeɪʃən/<,>/əˌfɪliˈeɪʃən/<,>n.隶属关系/n.单位团体<,>His affiliation with the university lasted 20 years.<,>他与这所大学的隶属关系持续了20年。<,>The journal requires authors to declare their affiliations.<,>该期刊要求作者声明其所属单位。<,>She has no political affiliations.<,>她没有政治隶属关系。<,>af(加强)+fili(子女)+ation→成为子女→隶属<,>association(n.协会)/relation(n.关系)/filiation(n.亲子关系)  

counterpart<,>/ˈkaʊntəpɑːt/<,>/ˈkaʊntərpɑːrt/<,>n.对等物<,>The foreign minister met with his Chinese counterpart.<,>外交部长会见了中国外交部长。<,>The male counterpart to this product is more expensive.<,>这款产品的男性对应款更贵。<,>The agreement was signed by both counterparts.<,>协议由双方对等代表签署。<,>counter(对应)+part(部分)→对应的部分→对等物<,>counteract(v.抵消)/counterbalance(n.平衡力)/counteroffer(n.还价)  

classify<,>/ˈklæsɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈklæsəˌfaɪ/<,>v.分类<,>Librarians classify books by subject.<,>图书管理员按主题对书籍进行分类。<,>These documents are classified as confidential.<,>这些文件被归类为机密。<,>Scientists classify animals into different species.<,>科学家将动物分为不同种类。<,>class(类别)+ify(使)→使成类别→分类<,>clarify(v.澄清)/specify(v.指定)/identify(v.识别)  

demonstration<,>/ˌdemənˈstreɪʃən/<,>/ˌdɛmənˈstreɪʃən/<,>n.展示/n.游行<,>The teacher gave a demonstration of the experiment.<,>老师做了实验示范。<,>Thousands joined the demonstration against the new law.<,>数千人参加了反对新法律的游行。<,>This product needs a live demonstration.<,>这个产品需要进行现场展示。<,>demon(展示)+stration→展示<,>manifestation(n.表现)/illustration(n.说明)/protest(n.抗议)  

outlive<,>/aʊtˈlɪv/<,>/aʊtˈlɪv/<,>v.比...活得长<,>She outlived her husband by 20 years.<,>她比丈夫多活了20年。<,>This tradition has outlived its usefulness.<,>这个传统已经失去了实用性却依然存在。<,>The old tree has outlived three generations.<,>这棵古树已经活过了三代人。<,>out(超过)+live(生活)→活得超过→比...活得长<,>outlast(v.比...持久)/outgrow(v.长得超过)/outdo(v.胜过)
reservation<,>/ˌrezəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛzərˈveɪʃən/<,>n.预定<,>I made a reservation at the restaurant for tonight.<,>我在餐厅预定了今晚的座位。<,>Do you have a reservation under your name?<,>你有用你的名字预定吗？<,>The hotel requires a reservation in advance.<,>酒店要求提前预定。<,>re(再)+serv(保持)+ation→保留位置→预定<,>preservation(n.保存)/conservation(n.保护)  

circumstance<,>/ˈsɜːkəmstəns/<,>/ˈsɜːrkəmstæns/<,>n.情况/n.环境<,>Under no circumstances should you open this door.<,>在任何情况下你都不应该打开这扇门。<,>The circumstances forced him to leave the country.<,>环境迫使他离开这个国家。<,>We need to consider all possible circumstances.<,>我们需要考虑所有可能的情况。<,>circum(周围)+stance(站立)→站在周围的事物→环境<,>situation(n.形势)/condition(n.条件)  

revolutionize<,>/ˌrevəˈluːʃənaɪz/<,>/ˌrɛvəˈluʃəˌnaɪz/<,>v.革命化<,>The invention will revolutionize the industry.<,>这项发明将彻底改变这个行业。<,>Smartphones have revolutionized communication.<,>智能手机彻底改变了通讯方式。<,>This new method could revolutionize education.<,>这种新方法可能会彻底改革教育。<,>revolution(革命)+ize(使...化)→使革命化<,>evolution(n.进化)/resolution(n.决心)  

outweigh<,>/aʊtˈweɪ/<,>/aʊtˈweɪ/<,>v.超过<,>The benefits outweigh the risks in this case.<,>在这种情况下，利益超过了风险。<,>Her achievements outweigh her mistakes.<,>她的成就超过了她的错误。<,>The advantages far outweigh the disadvantages.<,>优势远远超过劣势。<,>out(超过)+weigh(称重)→重量超过<,>overcome(v.克服)/surpass(v.超越)  

cast<,>/kɑːst/<,>/kæst/<,>v.投掷/v.扔<,>He cast the fishing line into the water.<,>他把鱼线抛入水中。<,>The tree cast a long shadow in the evening sun.<,>树在夕阳下投下长长的影子。<,>She cast her vote in the election.<,>她在选举中投了票。<,>与last(最后的)对比记忆<,>toss(v.轻抛)/hurl(v.猛投)  

uncertain<,>/ʌnˈsɜːtn/<,>/ʌnˈsɜːrtn/<,>adj.不确定的<,>I'm uncertain about the meeting time.<,>我不确定会议时间。<,>The future looks uncertain for the company.<,>公司的未来看起来不确定。<,>Her answer left me feeling uncertain.<,>她的回答让我感到不确定。<,>un(不)+certain(确定的)→不确定的<,>certain(adj.确定的)/doubtful(adj.可疑的)  

threat<,>/θret/<,>/θrɛt/<,>n.威胁<,>Climate change poses a serious threat.<,>气候变化构成严重威胁。<,>He received a death threat.<,>他收到了死亡威胁。<,>The storm is a threat to coastal areas.<,>这场风暴对沿海地区构成威胁。<,>与treat(对待)对比记忆<,>menace(n.威胁)/danger(n.危险)  

conservative<,>/kənˈsɜːvətɪv/<,>/kənˈsɜːrvətɪv/<,>adj.保守的<,>He has very conservative views.<,>他有非常保守的观点。<,>The estimate was conservative.<,>这个估计是保守的。<,>She dresses in a conservative style.<,>她穿着保守风格的服装。<,>con(完全)+serv(保持)+ative→完全保持原样的→保守的<,>progressive(adj.进步的)/liberal(adj.自由的)  

overestimate<,>/ˌəʊvərˈestɪmeɪt/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈɛstɪmeɪt/<,>v.高估<,>Don't overestimate your abilities.<,>不要高估你的能力。<,>We overestimated the time needed.<,>我们高估了所需时间。<,>The value was overestimated by 20%.<,>这个价值被高估了20%。<,>over(过度)+estimate(估计)→高估<,>underestimate(v.低估)/misjudge(v.误判)  

documentary<,>/ˌdɒkjəˈmentri/<,>/ˌdɑːkjəˈmentri/<,>n.纪录片<,>We watched a documentary about wildlife.<,>我们看了一部关于野生动物的纪录片。<,>The documentary exposed government corruption.<,>这部纪录片揭露了政府腐败。<,>She's filming a documentary on climate change.<,>她正在拍摄一部关于气候变化的纪录片。<,>document(文件)+ary→记录性影片<,>fiction(n.小说)/drama(n.戏剧)
relieve<,>/rɪˈliːv/<,>/rɪˈliv/<,>v.减轻/v.缓解<,>This medicine can help relieve your pain.<,>这种药物可以帮助缓解你的疼痛。<,>She relieved me of my duties for the day.<,>她免除了我当天的工作。<,>The good news relieved my anxiety.<,>这个好消息减轻了我的焦虑。<,>re(再次)+lieve(轻)→再次变轻→减轻<,>believe(v.相信)/grieve(v.悲伤)/retrieve(v.取回)

regardless<,>/rɪˈɡɑːdləs/<,>/rɪˈɡɑrdləs/<,>adv.不管/adv.不顾<,>He continued his work regardless of the noise.<,>他不顾噪音继续工作。<,>She decided to go regardless of the weather.<,>不管天气如何，她都决定去。<,>Regardless of what others say, follow your heart.<,>不管别人怎么说，跟随你的心。<,>regard(关心)+less(否定)→不关心→不管<,>regardful(adj.留心的)/disregard(v.忽视)/irregardless(adv.不管,非正式用法)

pause<,>/pɔːz/<,>/pɔz/<,>n.暂停/n.迟疑<,>There was a brief pause in the conversation.<,>谈话中有短暂的停顿。<,>He hit the pause button on the remote.<,>他按下了遥控器上的暂停键。<,>She spoke without pause for an hour.<,>她不停顿地说了一个小时。<,>paus(停止)+e→停止→暂停<,>cause(n.原因)/clause(n.条款)/applause(n.掌声)

launch<,>/lɔːntʃ/<,>/lɔntʃ/<,>v.发布/v.推出<,>The company will launch a new product next month.<,>公司将在下个月推出新产品。<,>They launched a campaign to raise awareness.<,>他们发起了一项提高意识的活动。<,>The rocket was successfully launched into space.<,>火箭成功发射进入太空。<,>laun(投掷)+ch→投掷出去→发射<,>lunch(n.午餐)/lynch(v.私刑)/blanch(v.漂白)

apartment<,>/əˈpɑːtmənt/<,>/əˈpɑrtmənt/<,>n.公寓<,>She lives in a small apartment downtown.<,>她住在市中心的一间小公寓里。<,>The apartment has a great view of the city.<,>这套公寓可以俯瞰城市美景。<,>They're looking for a two-bedroom apartment.<,>他们正在寻找一套两居室的公寓。<,>apart(分开)+ment(名词后缀)→分开的空间→公寓<,>department(n.部门)/compartment(n.隔间)/appointment(n.约会)

spark<,>/spɑːk/<,>/spɑrk/<,>n.火花<,>A spark from the fire landed on the carpet.<,>一个火星从火中落到了地毯上。<,>Her words ignited a spark of hope in him.<,>她的话在他心中点燃了希望的火花。<,>The spark between them was undeniable.<,>他们之间的火花不可否认。<,>sp(喷)+ark(弧)→喷出的弧光→火花<,>spare(v.饶恕)/sparkle(v.闪烁)/sparrow(n.麻雀)

eliminate<,>/ɪˈlɪmɪneɪt/<,>/ɪˈlɪməˌneɪt/<,>v.消除<,>The new policy aims to eliminate waste.<,>新政策旨在消除浪费。<,>He was eliminated in the first round of the competition.<,>他在比赛的第一轮就被淘汰了。<,>This treatment can help eliminate the virus.<,>这种治疗可以帮助消除病毒。<,>e(出)+limin(门槛)+ate→赶出门槛→消除<,>illuminate(v.阐明)/dominate(v.支配)/nominate(v.提名)

unintentionally<,>/ˌʌnɪnˈtenʃənəli/<,>/ˌʌnɪnˈtɛnʃənəli/<,>adv.无意地<,>I unintentionally offended her with my comment.<,>我无意中用评论冒犯了她。<,>He unintentionally left his keys at home.<,>他无意中把钥匙忘在家里了。<,>The damage was done unintentionally.<,>损害是无意中造成的。<,>un(不)+intention(意图)+al(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→无意地<,>intentionally(adv.故意地)/unintentional(adj.无意的)/intention(n.意图)

opposition<,>/ˌɒpəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑpəˈzɪʃn/<,>n.反对<,>There was strong opposition to the new law.<,>对新法律有强烈的反对意见。<,>The team faced tough opposition in the finals.<,>球队在决赛中遇到了强劲的对手。<,>He voiced his opposition to the plan.<,>他表达了对该计划的反对。<,>op(反)+posit(放置)+ion→反着放→反对<,>opposite(adj.相反的)/position(n.位置)/composition(n.作文)

polar<,>/ˈpəʊlə(r)/<,>/ˈpoʊlər/<,>adj.极地的<,>Polar bears live in the Arctic.<,>北极熊生活在北极地区。<,>The expedition studied polar ice caps.<,>探险队研究了极地冰盖。<,>They experienced polar temperatures during the trip.<,>他们在旅途中经历了极地温度。<,>pol(轴)+ar→轴的两端→极地的<,>solar(adj.太阳的)/polarity(n.极性)/polarize(v.极化)
integral<,>/ˈɪntɪɡrəl/<,>/ˈɪntəɡrəl/<,>adj.必需的/adj.不可缺少的<,>Teamwork is an integral part of our company culture.<,>团队合作是我们公司文化不可或缺的一部分。<,>Proper nutrition is integral to good health.<,>适当的营养对健康至关重要。<,>The engine is an integral component of the car.<,>发动机是汽车不可缺少的组成部分。<,>integer(整数)+al→完整的→不可缺少的<,>integrate(v.整合)/integrity(n.正直/n.完整)

guard<,>/ɡɑːd/<,>/ɡɑrd/<,>v.保护<,>The soldiers guard the border day and night.<,>士兵们日夜守卫着边境。<,>She guarded her privacy carefully.<,>她小心翼翼地保护自己的隐私。<,>Wear gloves to guard against cuts.<,>戴上手套以防割伤。<,>guard(守卫)→与"guide"同源<,>regard(v.看待/n.注意)/guarantee(n.v.保证)

branch<,>/brɑːntʃ/<,>/bræntʃ/<,>n.分支/n.分公司<,>The bank has branches all over the country.<,>这家银行在全国各地都有分行。<,>He works in the research branch of the company.<,>他在公司的研究部门工作。<,>The river divides into several branches here.<,>河流在这里分成几条支流。<,>branch(树枝)→企业像树一样分枝<,>brand(n.品牌)/brunch(n.早午餐)

affiliate<,>/əˈfɪlieɪt/<,>/əˈfɪliˌeɪt/<,>v.使隶属于<,>The hospital is affiliated with the medical school.<,>这家医院隶属于医学院。<,>Our company is affiliated to a larger corporation.<,>我们公司隶属于一家更大的企业。<,>She decided to affiliate herself with the professional organization.<,>她决定加入这个专业组织。<,>af(加强)+fili(儿子)→使成为儿子→使隶属<,>filiate(无此词)/affinity(n.密切关系)

irrigation<,>/ˌɪrɪˈɡeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪrəˈɡeɪʃən/<,>n.灌溉<,>The farmers use modern irrigation systems.<,>农民们使用现代化的灌溉系统。<,>Irrigation is essential for agriculture in dry areas.<,>灌溉对于干旱地区的农业至关重要。<,>The government invested in irrigation projects.<,>政府投资了灌溉工程。<,>ir(进入)+rig(水)+ation→把水引入→灌溉<,>irritation(n.激怒)/irregular(adj.不规则的)

stove<,>/stəʊv/<,>/stoʊv/<,>n.炉子<,>She cooked the soup on the gas stove.<,>她在煤气炉上煮汤。<,>We bought a new electric stove for the kitchen.<,>我们为厨房买了一个新的电炉。<,>The old wood stove kept the room warm.<,>旧木炉使房间保持温暖。<,>stove(炉子)→与"steam"同源<,>stovepipe(n.烟囱)/stove-top(adj.炉顶的)

memorable<,>/ˈmemərəbl/<,>/ˈmɛmərəbəl/<,>adj.值得纪念的<,>It was a memorable trip to Paris.<,>这是一次难忘的巴黎之旅。<,>His speech was short but memorable.<,>他的演讲简短但令人难忘。<,>The concert created many memorable moments.<,>音乐会创造了许多难忘的时刻。<,>memory(记忆)+able→值得记忆的<,>memorize(v.记忆)/memorial(n.纪念碑)

elimination<,>/ɪˌlɪmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ɪˌlɪməˈneɪʃən/<,>n.消除/n.淘汰<,>The elimination of poverty is our goal.<,>消除贫困是我们的目标。<,>He was disappointed by his early elimination from the competition.<,>他对比赛早期就被淘汰感到失望。<,>Proper waste elimination is important for public health.<,>妥善处理废物对公共卫生很重要。<,>e(出)+limin(门槛)+ation→扔出门槛→消除<,>illumination(n.照明)/limitation(n.限制)

revenue<,>/ˈrevənjuː/<,>/ˈrɛvəˌnu/<,>n.收入<,>The company's annual revenue increased by 20%.<,>公司年收入增长了20%。<,>Tax revenue is the main source of government income.<,>税收是政府收入的主要来源。<,>Advertising generates significant revenue for the website.<,>广告为网站带来可观的收入。<,>re(回)+ven(来)+ue→回来的东西→收入<,>avenue(n.大街)/revenge(n.v.报复)

decisive<,>/dɪˈsaɪsɪv/<,>/dɪˈsaɪsɪv/<,>adj.决定性的<,>This was the decisive battle of the war.<,>这是这场战争的决定性战役。<,>She played a decisive role in the negotiations.<,>她在谈判中起了决定性作用。<,>The last goal was decisive for the team's victory.<,>最后一个进球对球队的胜利起了决定性作用。<,>decide(决定)+ive→决定性的<,>incisive(adj.尖锐的)/divisive(adj.引起分歧的)
displace<,>/dɪsˈpleɪs/<,>/dɪsˈpleɪs/<,>v.取代/v.移置<,>The new technology will displace many traditional jobs.<,>这项新技术将取代许多传统工作。<,>The flood displaced thousands of people from their homes.<,>洪水使数千人离开了家园。<,>He was displaced by a younger employee.<,>他被一个更年轻的员工取代了。<,>dis(不)+place(位置)→不在原位→取代<,>replace(v.替换)/misplace(v.放错位置)/display(v.展示)

violation<,>/ˌvaɪəˈleɪʃən/<,>/ˌvaɪəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.违反/n.侵犯<,>Speeding is a violation of traffic laws.<,>超速是违反交通法规的行为。<,>The company was fined for environmental violations.<,>该公司因违反环保规定被罚款。<,>This action constitutes a violation of human rights.<,>这一行为构成对人权的侵犯。<,>viol(暴力)+ation(名词后缀)→违反<,>violence(n.暴力)/violate(v.违反)/violet(n.紫罗兰)

ideological<,>/ˌaɪdiəˈlɒdʒɪkəl/<,>/ˌaɪdiəˈlɑːdʒɪkəl/<,>adj.意识形态的/adj.思想体系的<,>The conflict has both political and ideological roots.<,>这一冲突既有政治根源也有意识形态根源。<,>They have strong ideological differences.<,>他们有强烈的意识形态分歧。<,>The party maintains strict ideological control.<,>该党保持严格的意识形态控制。<,>ideo(思想)+logical(逻辑的)→意识形态的<,>ideal(adj.理想的)/idle(adj.闲置的)/illogical(adj.不合逻辑的)

neighborhood<,>/ˈneɪbəhʊd/<,>/ˈneɪbərˌhʊd/<,>n.附近/n.街区<,>There's a good school in our neighborhood.<,>我们附近有一所好学校。<,>The whole neighborhood came to the party.<,>整个街区的人都来参加了聚会。<,>This is one of the safest neighborhoods in the city.<,>这是城市中最安全的街区之一。<,>neighbor(邻居)+hood(状态)→邻居所在的地方→街区<,>brotherhood(n.兄弟情谊)/childhood(n.童年)/likelihood(n.可能性)

calorie<,>/ˈkæləri/<,>/ˈkæləri/<,>n.卡路里/n.热量单位<,>This snack contains 200 calories.<,>这份零食含有200卡路里。<,>She counts calories to maintain her weight.<,>她计算卡路里来保持体重。<,>Burning calories through exercise is important for health.<,>通过运动消耗卡路里对健康很重要。<,>calor(热)+ie→热量单位<,>caloric(adj.热量的)/calorimeter(n.热量计)/calorie-free(adj.零卡的)

fierce<,>/fɪəs/<,>/fɪrs/<,>adj.激烈的/adj.凶猛的<,>The competition for the job was fierce.<,>这份工作的竞争非常激烈。<,>The lion gave us a fierce look.<,>狮子凶狠地看了我们一眼。<,>They engaged in a fierce debate.<,>他们进行了激烈的辩论。<,>fier(火)+ce→像火一样→激烈的<,>pierce(v.刺穿)/fear(n.恐惧)/fiercely(adv.激烈地)

mention<,>/ˈmenʃən/<,>/ˈmenʃən/<,>v.提及/v.说起<,>He didn't mention anything about his promotion.<,>他没有提及任何关于他升职的事。<,>The report mentions several possible solutions.<,>报告提到了几种可能的解决方案。<,>She mentioned that she might be late.<,>她提到她可能会迟到。<,>ment(思考)+ion→把想到的说出来→提及<,>mental(adj.精神的)/comment(n.评论)/invention(n.发明)

extend<,>/ɪkˈstend/<,>/ɪkˈstend/<,>v.延伸/v.延期<,>The road extends for miles through the forest.<,>这条路延伸数英里穿过森林。<,>The deadline has been extended by two weeks.<,>截止日期延长了两周。<,>He extended his hand in greeting.<,>他伸出手打招呼。<,>ex(出)+tend(伸展)→伸展出去→延伸<,>extent(n.程度)/extended(adj.延长的)/intend(v.打算)

column<,>/ˈkɒləm/<,>/ˈkɑːləm/<,>n.专栏/n.圆柱<,>She writes a weekly column for the newspaper.<,>她为报纸撰写每周专栏。<,>The ancient temple had marble columns.<,>这座古庙有大理石圆柱。<,>His opinion appears in the sports column.<,>他的观点出现在体育专栏中。<,>col(高)+umn→高耸的东西→圆柱<,>volume(n.体积)/solemn(adj.庄严的)/colon(n.冒号)

analytical<,>/ˌænəˈlɪtɪkəl/<,>/ˌænəˈlɪtɪkəl/<,>adj.分析的/adj.解析的<,>She has an analytical mind.<,>她有一个善于分析的头脑。<,>The report provides an analytical overview of the market.<,>该报告提供了对市场的分析概述。<,>This course develops analytical thinking skills.<,>这门课程培养分析思维能力。<,>ana(向上)+lyt(松开)+ical→把事物分解开来→分析的<,>analyze(v.分析)/analysis(n.分析)/synthetic(adj.合成的)
figure<,>/ˈfɪɡə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪɡjər/<,>n.数字/n.人物/n.外形<,>The figure shows a steady increase in sales.<,>图表显示销售额稳步增长。<,>She is a key figure in the company.<,>她是公司的关键人物。<,>He cut a fine figure in his new suit.<,>他穿着新西装显得很帅气。<,>fig(形状)+ure→数字/外形<,>finger(n.手指)/fibre(n.纤维)/fever(n.发烧)

frighten<,>/ˈfraɪtn/<,>/ˈfraɪtn/<,>v.使害怕/v.惊吓<,>The loud noise frightened the baby.<,>巨大的响声吓到了婴儿。<,>She was frightened by the horror movie.<,>她被恐怖电影吓到了。<,>Don't frighten the birds away.<,>别把鸟吓跑了。<,>fright(恐惧)+en(使动)→使害怕<,>brighten(v.使明亮)/tighten(v.变紧)/lighten(v.减轻)

preindustrial<,>/ˌpriːɪnˈdʌstriəl/<,>/ˌpriːɪnˈdʌstriəl/<,>adj.工业化以前的<,>This area still has a preindustrial lifestyle.<,>这个地区仍保持着工业化前的生活方式。<,>Preindustrial societies relied on agriculture.<,>工业化前的社会依赖农业。<,>The book describes preindustrial Europe.<,>这本书描述了工业化前的欧洲。<,>pre(前)+industrial(工业的)→工业化以前的<,>postindustrial(adj.后工业化的)/prehistoric(adj.史前的)

furnish<,>/ˈfɜːnɪʃ/<,>/ˈfɜːrnɪʃ/<,>v.提供/v.布置家具<,>The hotel furnished us with towels.<,>酒店为我们提供了毛巾。<,>They furnished their new house beautifully.<,>他们把新房子布置得很漂亮。<,>The report furnishes important data.<,>报告提供了重要数据。<,>furn(家具)+ish→提供/布置<,>finish(v.完成)/flourish(v.繁荣)/punish(v.惩罚)

scarcity<,>/ˈskeəsəti/<,>/ˈskersəti/<,>n.缺乏/n.短缺<,>There is a scarcity of water in this region.<,>这个地区水资源短缺。<,>The scarcity of jobs is a serious problem.<,>工作机会缺乏是个严重问题。<,>Food scarcity caused widespread hunger.<,>食物短缺导致普遍饥荒。<,>scarce(稀少的)+ity→缺乏<,>security(n.安全)/sincerity(n.真诚)

transform<,>/trænsˈfɔːm/<,>/trænsˈfɔːrm/<,>v.转变/v.改造<,>The caterpillar transformed into a butterfly.<,>毛毛虫变成了蝴蝶。<,>They transformed the old factory into apartments.<,>他们把旧工厂改造成了公寓。<,>Education can transform lives.<,>教育能改变人生。<,>trans(跨越)+form(形状)→转变形状<,>transfer(v.转移)/transmit(v.传输)/transplant(v.移植)

misled<,>/ˌmɪsˈled/<,>/ˌmɪsˈled/<,>v.(mislead过去式)误导/v.欺骗<,>The advertisement misled consumers.<,>广告误导了消费者。<,>He was misled by false information.<,>他被虚假信息误导了。<,>Her smile misled me into thinking she was friendly.<,>她的微笑让我误以为她很友好。<,>mis(错误)+lead(引导)→误导<,>mislaid(v.放错)/mistake(n.错误)/misread(v.读错)

intervene<,>/ˌɪntəˈviːn/<,>/ˌɪntərˈviːn/<,>v.干涉/v.介入<,>The teacher intervened in the students' argument.<,>老师介入了学生们的争论。<,>The government intervened to stabilize prices.<,>政府干预以稳定物价。<,>I intervened when I saw the fight.<,>看到打架时我进行了干预。<,>inter(在...之间)+vene(来)→来到中间→干涉<,>interview(n.面试)/intervene(v.干涉)/interfere(v.干扰)

vary<,>/ˈveəri/<,>/ˈveri/<,>v.变化/v.不同<,>Prices vary depending on the season.<,>价格随季节变化。<,>Opinions vary on this issue.<,>对这个问题的意见各不相同。<,>The quality of products varies greatly.<,>产品质量差异很大。<,>var(变化)+y→变化<,>very(adv.非常)/vary(v.变化)/vein(n.静脉)

bureaucracy<,>/bjʊəˈrɒkrəsi/<,>/bjʊˈrɑːkrəsi/<,>n.官僚主义/n.官僚机构<,>The bureaucracy makes everything slow.<,>官僚主义使一切变得缓慢。<,>He hates dealing with government bureaucracy.<,>他讨厌和政府官僚机构打交道。<,>The company suffers from too much bureaucracy.<,>公司深受官僚主义之害。<,>bureau(办公桌)+cracy(统治)→官僚统治<,>democracy(n.民主)/aristocracy(n.贵族)/autocracy(n.独裁)
recruiter<,>/rɪˈkruːtə(r)/<,>/rɪˈkruːtər/<,>n.招聘者<,>The recruiter contacted me for a job interview.<,>招聘者联系我参加面试。<,>She works as a recruiter for a tech company.<,>她在一家科技公司担任招聘专员。<,>The recruiter was impressed by his resume.<,>招聘者对他的简历印象深刻。<,>re(再)+cruit(招募)+er(人)→再次招募的人→招聘者<,>recruit(v.招募)/recruitment(n.招聘)/recruitee(n.新成员)

pattern<,>/ˈpætn/<,>/ˈpætərn/<,>n.模式<,>This fabric has a beautiful floral pattern.<,>这块布料有漂亮的花卉图案。<,>Her behavior follows a predictable pattern.<,>她的行为遵循可预测的模式。<,>The software detects unusual spending patterns.<,>该软件检测异常消费模式。<,>pat(拍)+tern(转向)→拍打形成的转向→模式<,>patent(n.专利)/patter(v.喋喋不休)/patron(n.赞助人)

necessity<,>/nəˈsesəti/<,>/nəˈsɛsəti/<,>n.必须/必要性<,>Food is a basic necessity of life.<,>食物是生活的基本必需品。<,>There's no necessity to rush.<,>没有必要着急。<,>The new law recognizes the necessity of environmental protection.<,>新法律承认环境保护的必要性。<,>ne(不)+cess(走)+ity(名词后缀)→不能走开的东西→必需品<,>necessary(adj.必要的)/necessitate(v.使成为必需)/necessitous(adj.贫困的)

deny<,>/dɪˈnaɪ/<,>/dɪˈnaɪ/<,>v.否认<,>He denied stealing the money.<,>他否认偷了钱。<,>The company denied responsibility for the accident.<,>公司否认对事故负有责任。<,>She couldn't deny the truth any longer.<,>她再也无法否认真相了。<,>de(向下)+ny(说不)→向下说不→否认<,>defy(v.违抗)/decry(v.谴责)/dent(n.凹痕)

drift<,>/drɪft/<,>/drɪft/<,>v.漂流<,>The boat began to drift out to sea.<,>小船开始向海上漂流。<,>Snow drifts blocked the road.<,>积雪堵塞了道路。<,>His mind started to drift during the long meeting.<,>在漫长的会议中，他的思绪开始飘忽。<,>d(向下)+rift(裂缝)→向下裂缝→漂流<,>draft(n.草稿)/shift(v.转移)/gift(n.礼物)

endorsement<,>/ɪnˈdɔːsmənt/<,>/ɪnˈdɔːrsmənt/<,>n.支持<,>The celebrity's endorsement boosted sales.<,>名人的支持促进了销售。<,>He got his manager's endorsement for the project.<,>他得到了经理对这个项目的支持。<,>The check requires your endorsement on the back.<,>支票需要你在背面背书。<,>en(使)+dorse(背面)+ment→使在背面→支持<,>endorse(v.支持)/endower(n.捐赠者)/endoscope(n.内窥镜)

dare<,>/deə(r)/<,>/der/<,>v.勇敢/敢于做<,>How dare you speak to me like that!<,>你竟敢这样跟我说话！<,>She dared to jump from the high diving board.<,>她敢从高跳板上跳下来。<,>I dare say you're right about this.<,>我敢说在这件事上你是对的。<,>d(做)+are(是)→做就是→敢于<,>dear(adj.亲爱的)/dart(v.投射)/date(n.日期)

consultancy<,>/kənˈsʌltənsi/<,>/kənˈsʌltənsi/<,>n.咨询公司<,>She works for a management consultancy.<,>她在一家管理咨询公司工作。<,>The consultancy provided valuable business advice.<,>这家咨询公司提供了宝贵的商业建议。<,>He set up his own financial consultancy.<,>他成立了自己的财务咨询公司。<,>consult(咨询)+ancy(状态)→咨询的状态→咨询公司<,>consultant(n.顾问)/consultation(n.咨询)/consul(n.领事)

constant<,>/ˈkɒnstənt/<,>/ˈkɑːnstənt/<,>adj.不断的<,>Her constant complaining annoys everyone.<,>她不断的抱怨让每个人都很烦。<,>The machine makes a constant humming noise.<,>机器不断发出嗡嗡声。<,>He's been a constant support to me.<,>他一直是我不变的支持。<,>con(共同)+stant(站)→共同站立的→不变的<,>instant(adj.立即的)/distant(adj.遥远的)/contestant(n.参赛者)

deposit<,>/dɪˈpɒzɪt/<,>/dɪˈpɑːzɪt/<,>v.存放/n.存款<,>Please deposit your luggage at the front desk.<,>请将您的行李存放在前台。<,>I made a deposit into my savings account.<,>我在储蓄账户存了一笔钱。<,>The river deposits silt at its mouth.<,>河流在河口沉积淤泥。<,>de(向下)+posit(放置)→向下放置→存放<,>position(n.位置)/dispose(v.处理)/exposit(v.解释)
transmit<,>/trænzˈmɪt/<,>/trænzˈmɪt/<,>v.传播/v.传导<,>Mosquitoes can transmit diseases.<,>蚊子可以传播疾病。<,>The radio tower transmits signals across the country.<,>无线电塔向全国传输信号。<,>Copper wires transmit electricity efficiently.<,>铜线能高效传导电力。<,>trans(穿过)+mit(发送)→发送穿过→传播<,>transfer(v.转移/n.转让)/submit(v.提交/v.屈服)/admit(v.承认/v.准许进入)

undermine<,>/ˌʌndəˈmaɪn/<,>/ˌʌndərˈmaɪn/<,>v.削弱<,>Constant criticism can undermine one's confidence.<,>持续的批评会削弱一个人的信心。<,>The scandal undermined the politician's reputation.<,>丑闻削弱了这位政治家的声誉。<,>Lack of sleep undermines your immune system.<,>睡眠不足会削弱你的免疫系统。<,>under(在...下)+mine(挖)→在下面挖→削弱<,>underline(v.在...下划线/v.强调)/determine(v.决定/v.查明)

resign<,>/rɪˈzaɪn/<,>/rɪˈzaɪn/<,>v.辞职<,>She resigned from her position as CEO.<,>她辞去了CEO的职位。<,>He resigned after the company's financial scandal.<,>在公司财务丑闻后他辞职了。<,>The minister resigned amid public pressure.<,>部长在公众压力下辞职了。<,>re(回)+sign(签字)→签字返回→辞职<,>design(v.设计/n.图案)/assign(v.分配/v.指派)

respective<,>/rɪˈspektɪv/<,>/rɪˈspektɪv/<,>adj.各自的<,>The students returned to their respective classrooms.<,>学生们回到了各自的教室。<,>They went to their respective homes after the meeting.<,>会议结束后他们各自回家了。<,>The team members have their respective responsibilities.<,>团队成员有各自的责任。<,>respect(方面)+ive(形容词后缀)→各个方面的→各自的<,>perspective(n.观点/n.远景)/retrospective(adj.回顾的/n.回顾展)

consent<,>/kənˈsent/<,>/kənˈsent/<,>n.同意<,>You need parental consent to go on the trip.<,>你需要父母同意才能参加这次旅行。<,>The patient gave consent for the surgery.<,>病人同意进行手术。<,>Silence does not imply consent.<,>沉默不等于同意。<,>con(共同)+sent(感觉)→共同感觉→同意<,>content(n.内容/adj.满足的)/dissent(v.不同意/n.异议)

reunion<,>/ˌriːˈjuːniən/<,>/ˌriːˈjuːnjən/<,>n.团聚<,>We have a family reunion every Thanksgiving.<,>每年感恩节我们都会家庭团聚。<,>The high school reunion brought back many memories.<,>高中同学聚会唤起了许多回忆。<,>The couple had an emotional reunion after years apart.<,>这对夫妻在分开多年后激动地团聚了。<,>re(再)+union(联合)→再次联合→团聚<,>union(n.联合/n.工会)/reunite(v.使重聚/v.再结合)

premium<,>/ˈpriːmiəm/<,>/ˈpriːmiəm/<,>n.保险费<,>You must pay the insurance premium annually.<,>你必须每年支付保险费。<,>The premium for comprehensive coverage is higher.<,>综合保险的保费更高。<,>He missed two premium payments.<,>他错过了两次保费支付。<,>pre(前)+mium(拿)→提前拿走的钱→保险费<,>primary(adj.主要的/n.预选)/premier(n.总理/adj.首要的)

interpretation<,>/ɪnˌtɜːprɪˈteɪʃn/<,>/ɪnˌtɜːrprɪˈteɪʃn/<,>n.解释/n.理解<,>His interpretation of the poem was unique.<,>他对这首诗的解释很独特。<,>Different cultures have different interpretations of this symbol.<,>不同文化对这个符号有不同的理解。<,>The judge's interpretation of the law was controversial.<,>法官对法律的解释存在争议。<,>inter(在...之间)+pret(表达)+ation→在中间表达→解释<,>interruption(n.打断/n.中断)/intervention(n.干预/n.介入)

concrete<,>/ˈkɒŋkriːt/<,>/ˈkɑːŋkriːt/<,>adj.具体的<,>We need concrete evidence to prove this theory.<,>我们需要具体的证据来证明这个理论。<,>Give me a concrete example of what you mean.<,>给我一个你所说的具体例子。<,>The plan is still abstract, not concrete.<,>这个计划还很抽象，不够具体。<,>con(共同)+crete(生长)→共同生长出来的→具体的<,>abstract(adj.抽象的/n.摘要)/discrete(adj.离散的/adj.不连续的)

facility<,>/fəˈsɪləti/<,>/fəˈsɪləti/<,>n.设施<,>The sports facility is open to the public.<,>这个体育设施对公众开放。<,>The hospital has state-of-the-art medical facilities.<,>这家医院拥有最先进的医疗设施。<,>Our school is upgrading its learning facilities.<,>我们学校正在升级学习设施。<,>fac(做)+ility(能力)→能够做事的地方→设施<,>familiarity(n.熟悉/n.亲近)/fertility(n.肥沃/n.繁殖力)
convert<,>/kənˈvɜːt/<,>/kənˈvɜrt/<,>v.转换/v.改变<,>She converted her garage into a home office.<,>她把车库改造成了家庭办公室。<,>The solar panels convert sunlight into electricity.<,>太阳能板将阳光转化为电能。<,>He converted to Buddhism last year.<,>他去年改信了佛教。<,>con(共同)+vert(转)→一起转变→转换<,>invert(v.倒置)/divert(v.转移)/revert(v.恢复)

prompt<,>/prɒmpt/<,>/prɑːmpt/<,>v.促使<,>The teacher's question prompted a lively discussion.<,>老师的问题引发了一场热烈的讨论。<,>His illness prompted him to change his lifestyle.<,>他的疾病促使他改变了生活方式。<,>The alarm prompted everyone to evacuate the building.<,>警报促使所有人撤离大楼。<,>pro(向前)+mpt(拿)→向前拿→促使<,>impromptu(adj.即兴的)/promptly(adv.迅速地)

weave<,>/wiːv/<,>/wiv/<,>v.织布/v.编织<,>She learned to weave baskets from her grandmother.<,>她从祖母那里学会了编篮子。<,>The spider weaves an intricate web.<,>蜘蛛编织出复杂的网。<,>The author weaves historical facts into the story.<,>作者将历史事实编织进故事中。<,>wea(织)+ve→编织<,>wave(n.波浪)/waive(v.放弃)

conformity<,>/kənˈfɔːməti/<,>/kənˈfɔːrməti/<,>n.一致<,>The product is in conformity with safety standards.<,>该产品符合安全标准。<,>Peer pressure often leads to conformity.<,>同伴压力常常导致从众行为。<,>There was little conformity in their opinions.<,>他们的意见几乎没有一致之处。<,>con(共同)+form(形状)+ity→共同形状→一致<,>uniformity(n.一致性)/deformity(n.畸形)

inaction<,>/ɪnˈækʃən/<,>/ɪnˈækʃən/<,>n.不作为<,>The government was criticized for its inaction during the crisis.<,>政府因在危机期间不作为而受到批评。<,>His inaction led to the problem getting worse.<,>他的不作为导致问题恶化。<,>Sometimes inaction is the best course of action.<,>有时不作为是最好的行动方针。<,>in(不)+action(行动)→不作为<,>inactive(adj.不活跃的)/interaction(n.互动)

trim<,>/trɪm/<,>/trɪm/<,>v.修剪<,>He trimmed the hedge every Saturday.<,>他每周六修剪树篱。<,>She trimmed the fat off the meat before cooking.<,>她在烹饪前把肉上的肥肉切掉了。<,>The company is looking to trim costs this year.<,>公司今年打算削减成本。<,>tri(三)+m→三面都修→修剪<,>tram(n.有轨电车)/triumph(n.胜利)

irony<,>/ˈaɪrəni/<,>/ˈaɪrəni/<,>n.讽刺<,>The irony was that he got lost on his way to the navigation conference.<,>讽刺的是他在去导航会议的路上迷路了。<,>There's a certain irony in a fire station burning down.<,>消防站被烧毁颇有讽刺意味。<,>She appreciated the irony of the situation.<,>她体会到了这个情况的讽刺之处。<,>iron(铁)+y→像铁一样冷→讽刺<,>icon(n.图标)/ivory(n.象牙)

monopolize<,>/məˈnɒpəlaɪz/<,>/məˈnɑːpəlaɪz/<,>v.垄断<,>The company was accused of trying to monopolize the market.<,>该公司被指控试图垄断市场。<,>He tends to monopolize conversations at parties.<,>他总想在聚会上垄断谈话。<,>No single country should monopolize global resources.<,>任何国家都不应垄断全球资源。<,>mono(单一)+pol(卖)+ize→独家卖→垄断<,>monopoly(n.垄断)/monologue(n.独白)

workload<,>/ˈwɜːkləʊd/<,>/ˈwɜːrkloʊd/<,>n.工作量<,>The new job comes with a heavy workload.<,>新工作的工作量很大。<,>She's struggling to manage her workload.<,>她正努力应对工作量。<,>The team shared the workload equally.<,>团队平均分担了工作量。<,>work(工作)+load(负荷)→工作量<,>overload(v.超载)/download(v.下载)

complicated<,>/ˈkɒmplɪkeɪtɪd/<,>/ˈkɑːmplɪkeɪtɪd/<,>adj.复杂的<,>The instructions were too complicated to follow.<,>说明书太复杂，难以遵循。<,>Their relationship is quite complicated.<,>他们的关系相当复杂。<,>This is a complicated mathematical problem.<,>这是一个复杂的数学问题。<,>com(一起)+plic(折叠)+ated→折叠在一起→复杂的<,>complex(adj.复杂的)/duplicate(v.复制)
property<,>/ˈprɒpəti/<,>/ˈprɑːpərti/<,>n.财产<,>He owns several properties in the city.<,>他在城里拥有几处房产。<,>The stolen property was recovered by the police.<,>被盗的财物被警方追回。<,>Intellectual property rights are important for innovation.<,>知识产权对创新很重要。<,>proper(适当的)+ty(名词后缀)→适当拥有的东西→财产<,>prosperity(n.繁荣)/poverty(n.贫穷)/propriety(n.礼节)

underrepresented<,>/ˌʌndəreprɪˈzentɪd/<,>/ˌʌndərˌreprɪˈzentɪd/<,>adj.未被充分代表的<,>Women are still underrepresented in leadership positions.<,>女性在领导职位中仍然未被充分代表。<,>Minority groups often feel underrepresented in government.<,>少数群体常感到在政府中缺乏代表。<,>The survey showed that rural areas are underrepresented in the study.<,>调查显示农村地区在该研究中代表性不足。<,>under(不足)+represent(代表)+ed(形容词后缀)→代表不足的<,>misrepresented(adj.被歪曲的)/overrepresented(adj.过度代表的)/unrepresented(adj.无代表的)

philosophy<,>/fɪˈlɒsəfi/<,>/fɪˈlɑːsəfi/<,>n.哲学<,>He studied philosophy at university.<,>他在大学学习哲学。<,>The company's philosophy emphasizes customer satisfaction.<,>该公司的理念强调客户满意度。<,>Her personal philosophy is to live each day to the fullest.<,>她的人生哲学是充实地过每一天。<,>philo(爱)+sophy(智慧)→爱智慧→哲学<,>psychology(n.心理学)/theology(n.神学)/sociology(n.社会学)

regime<,>/reɪˈʒiːm/<,>/rəˈʒiːm/<,>n.制度/n.管理体制<,>The new regime introduced economic reforms.<,>新政权推行了经济改革。<,>Under the current regime, taxes have increased.<,>在现行体制下，税收增加了。<,>A healthy diet and exercise regime is important for wellbeing.<,>健康的饮食和锻炼制度对健康很重要。<,>reg(统治)+ime→统治方式→制度<,>regimen(n.养生法)/regiment(n.团/v.严格控制)/regal(adj.帝王的)

bizarre<,>/bɪˈzɑː(r)/<,>/bɪˈzɑːr/<,>adj.古怪的/adj.奇怪的<,>She was wearing a bizarre costume to the party.<,>她穿着奇装异服去参加派对。<,>The movie had a bizarre plot twist at the end.<,>这部电影结尾有个奇怪的剧情转折。<,>His behavior became increasingly bizarre.<,>他的行为变得越来越古怪。<,>biz(商业)+arre→像商业广告一样夸张→古怪的<,>bazaar(n.集市)/blizzard(n.暴风雪)/bizarrely(adv.奇怪地)

ruin<,>/ˈruːɪn/<,>/ˈruːɪn/<,>v.毁坏<,>The storm ruined the crops.<,>暴风雨毁坏了庄稼。<,>Too much sugar will ruin your teeth.<,>吃太多糖会损坏你的牙齿。<,>His reputation was ruined by the scandal.<,>他的名誉因丑闻而毁。<,>ru(谐音"入")+in(里面)→进入破坏状态→毁坏<,>run(v.跑)/rain(n.雨/v.下雨)/rune(n.符文)

inspire<,>/ɪnˈspaɪə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈspaɪər/<,>v.鼓励<,>Her speech inspired the team to work harder.<,>她的演讲激励团队更加努力。<,>The beautiful scenery inspired the artist to paint.<,>美丽的风景激发了艺术家的创作灵感。<,>Teachers should inspire students to love learning.<,>老师应该激励学生热爱学习。<,>in(进入)+spire(呼吸)→注入精神→鼓励<,>expire(v.到期)/aspire(v.渴望)/perspire(v.出汗)

deforestation<,>/ˌdiːˌfɒrɪˈsteɪʃn/<,>/ˌdiːˌfɔːrɪˈsteɪʃn/<,>n.砍伐森林<,>Deforestation is a major environmental issue.<,>森林砍伐是一个重大环境问题。<,>The rate of deforestation in the Amazon is alarming.<,>亚马逊地区的森林砍伐速度令人担忧。<,>Policies are needed to reduce deforestation.<,>需要制定政策来减少森林砍伐。<,>de(去除)+forest(森林)+ation(名词后缀)→去除森林→砍伐森林<,>afforestation(n.造林)/reforestation(n.重新造林)/desertification(n.沙漠化)

exceptional<,>/ɪkˈsepʃənl/<,>/ɪkˈsepʃənl/<,>adj.例外的<,>She showed exceptional talent in music.<,>她在音乐方面表现出非凡的才能。<,>This year's harvest was exceptional.<,>今年的收成特别好。<,>The service at the hotel was exceptional.<,>这家酒店的服务非常出色。<,>exception(例外)+al(形容词后缀)→例外的<,>acceptable(adj.可接受的)/except(conj.除了)/exceptionable(adj.可反对的)

hazard<,>/ˈhæzəd/<,>/ˈhæzərd/<,>n.危险<,>Smoking is a health hazard.<,>吸烟危害健康。<,>The icy roads presented a hazard to drivers.<,>结冰的道路对司机构成危险。<,>Chemical hazards must be clearly labeled.<,>化学危险品必须明确标识。<,>haz(机会)+ard→靠运气的事→危险<,>haphazard(adj.随意的)/hazardous(adj.危险的)/hazardously(adv.危险地)
upgrade<,>/ˌʌpˈɡreɪd/<,>/ˈʌpˌɡreɪd/<,>v.升级<,>We need to upgrade our computer systems.<,>我们需要升级我们的电脑系统。<,>She upgraded her phone to the latest model.<,>她把手机升级到了最新型号。<,>The hotel offers a free room upgrade for VIP guests.<,>酒店为VIP客人提供免费的房间升级。<,>up(向上)+grade(等级)→升级<,>downgrade(v.降级)/upward(adj.向上的)/upkeep(n.保养)  

abnormally<,>/æbˈnɔːməli/<,>/æbˈnɔːrməli/<,>adv.不正常地<,>His blood pressure is abnormally high.<,>他的血压异常地高。<,>The plant grew abnormally fast in that soil.<,>这种植物在那片土壤中生长得异常快。<,>She was behaving abnormally at the party.<,>她在派对上的行为很不正常。<,>ab(偏离)+normal(正常)+ly(副词后缀)→不正常地<,>normally(adv.正常地)/abnormal(adj.异常的)/regularly(adv.定期地)  

accidentally<,>/ˌæksɪˈdentəli/<,>/ˌæksəˈdentəli/<,>adv.偶然地/adv.意外地<,>I accidentally deleted the important file.<,>我不小心删除了重要文件。<,>They met accidentally at the supermarket.<,>他们在超市偶然相遇了。<,>The fire started accidentally due to faulty wiring.<,>火灾因线路故障意外发生。<,>ac(朝向)+cid(落下)+ent+al+ly→偶然发生地<,>incidentally(adv.顺便)/intentionally(adv.故意地)/accident(n.事故)  

frontier<,>/ˈfrʌntɪə(r)/<,>/frʌnˈtɪr/<,>n.边境<,>They crossed the frontier at midnight.<,>他们在午夜越过了边境。<,>The frontier town was bustling with traders.<,>这个边境小镇挤满了商人。<,>Space exploration is the new frontier for scientists.<,>太空探索是科学家的新前沿。<,>front(前面)+ier(表地点)→边境<,>border(n.边界)/boundary(n.分界线)/forefront(n.最前线)  

considerable<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbl/<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbəl/<,>adj.相当多的<,>He spent a considerable amount of time on the project.<,>他在这个项目上花费了相当多的时间。<,>There's a considerable difference between the two versions.<,>两个版本之间有相当大的差异。<,>She has considerable experience in this field.<,>她在这个领域有相当丰富的经验。<,>consider(考虑)+able(能...的)→值得考虑的→相当多的<,>considerate(adj.体贴的)/inconsiderable(adj.微不足道的)/substantial(adj.大量的)  

legalize<,>/ˈliːɡəlaɪz/<,>/ˈliɡəˌlaɪz/<,>v.合法化<,>The government decided to legalize same-sex marriage.<,>政府决定将同性婚姻合法化。<,>Some states have legalized marijuana for medical use.<,>一些州已将医用大麻合法化。<,>They are campaigning to legalize euthanasia.<,>他们正在开展安乐死合法化运动。<,>legal(合法的)+ize(使...化)→合法化<,>illegalize(v.使非法)/legitimate(adj.合法的)/legislation(n.立法)  

dispensable<,>/dɪˈspensəbl/<,>/dɪˈspɛnsəbəl/<,>adj.可有可无的<,>These decorations are dispensable for the party.<,>这些装饰对派对来说是可有可无的。<,>He proved himself to be anything but dispensable.<,>他证明了自己绝不是可有可无的。<,>Many consider this step to be completely dispensable.<,>许多人认为这个步骤完全可以省略。<,>dis(分开)+pens(衡量)+able→可以分开衡量的→可有可无的<,>indispensable(adj.必不可少的)/disposable(adj.一次性的)/expendable(adj.可消耗的)  

certify<,>/ˈsɜːtɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈsɜrtəˌfaɪ/<,>v.保证/v.证明<,>The doctor will certify the cause of death.<,>医生将证明死亡原因。<,>This document certifies that you completed the course.<,>这份文件证明你完成了课程。<,>We need to certify the authenticity of the painting.<,>我们需要证明这幅画的真实性。<,>cert(确定)+ify(使...)→证明<,>certificate(n.证书)/rectify(v.纠正)/fortify(v.加强)  

insurer<,>/ɪnˈʃʊərə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈʃʊrər/<,>n.保险公司/n.承保人<,>The insurer refused to pay for the damages.<,>保险公司拒绝赔偿损失。<,>You should check what your insurer covers.<,>你应该查看你的保险公司承保范围。<,>He works as an insurer for a large company.<,>他在一家大公司担任承保人。<,>insure(保险)+er(人)→保险公司/承保人<,>insurance(n.保险)/assurer(n.保证人)/reinsurer(n.再保险公司)  

overstate<,>/ˌəʊvəˈsteɪt/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈsteɪt/<,>v.夸张<,>Don't overstate your qualifications on the resume.<,>不要在简历上夸大你的资历。<,>The media tends to overstate the importance of celebrity gossip.<,>媒体往往夸大名人八卦的重要性。<,>I think you're overstating the problem.<,>我认为你夸大了这个问题。<,>over(过度)+state(陈述)→夸张<,>understate(v.轻描淡写)/overestimate(v.高估)/exaggerate(v.夸张)
profound<,>/prəˈfaʊnd/<,>/prəˈfaʊnd/<,>adj.深刻的/adj.博学的<,>His speech had a profound impact on the audience.<,>他的演讲对听众产生了深远的影响。<,>She is a profound scholar in ancient history.<,>她是一位博学的古代历史学者。<,>The book offers profound insights into human nature.<,>这本书对人性的洞察非常深刻。<,>pro(向前)+found(基础)→深入基础的→深刻的<,>profuse(adj.大量的)/profoundly(adv.深刻地)/profundity(n.深度)  

agony<,>/ˈæɡəni/<,>/ˈæɡəni/<,>n.痛苦<,>He was in agony after the accident.<,>事故后他处于极度痛苦中。<,>The agony of losing a loved one is unbearable.<,>失去至亲的痛苦难以承受。<,>She cried out in agony when she broke her leg.<,>她摔断腿时痛苦地喊叫。<,>agon(挣扎)+y→挣扎的状态→痛苦<,>antagonize(v.对抗)/antagonist(n.对手)/ecstasy(n.狂喜)  

craft<,>/krɑːft/<,>/kræft/<,>n.手艺/v.精巧地制作<,>She learned the craft of pottery from her grandmother.<,>她从祖母那里学习了陶艺手艺。<,>He crafted a beautiful wooden chair.<,>他精心制作了一把漂亮的木椅。<,>The artisan's craft is highly valued in this region.<,>在这个地区，工匠的手艺备受推崇。<,>craf(力量)+t→需要力量的技术→手艺<,>draft(n.草稿)/graft(v.嫁接)/crafty(adj.狡猾的)  

obscurity<,>/əbˈskjʊərəti/<,>/əbˈskjʊrəti/<,>n.默默无闻<,>The poet lived in obscurity for most of his life.<,>这位诗人一生大部分时间都默默无闻。<,>Many great artists died in obscurity.<,>许多伟大的艺术家在默默无闻中去世。<,>His work was rescued from obscurity by a chance discovery.<,>他的作品因一次偶然发现而不再默默无闻。<,>ob(反)+scur(清楚)+ity→不清楚的状态→默默无闻<,>obscure(adj.模糊的)/security(n.安全)/perspicuity(n.明晰)  

guarantee<,>/ˌɡærənˈtiː/<,>/ˌɡærənˈti/<,>v.保证<,>The company guarantees a full refund if you're not satisfied.<,>如果不满意，公司保证全额退款。<,>This certificate guarantees the authenticity of the painting.<,>这份证书保证了画作的真实性。<,>I can guarantee that you'll love this product.<,>我可以保证你会喜欢这个产品。<,>guar(保护)+ant+ee→给予保护→保证<,>warranty(n.保修)/guardian(n.监护人)/guarantor(n.担保人)  

dolphin<,>/ˈdɒlfɪn/<,>/ˈdɑːlfɪn/<,>n.海豚<,>We saw a group of dolphins swimming near the boat.<,>我们看到一群海豚在船附近游泳。<,>The dolphin show at the aquarium was amazing.<,>水族馆的海豚表演非常精彩。<,>Dolphins are known for their intelligence.<,>海豚以聪明著称。<,>dol(海洋)+phin(鱼)→海洋中的鱼→海豚<,>porpoise(n.鼠海豚)/seal(n.海豹)/whale(n.鲸鱼)  

severity<,>/sɪˈverəti/<,>/sɪˈverəti/<,>n.严重性<,>The severity of the storm caused widespread damage.<,>风暴的严重性造成了广泛的破坏。<,>Doctors were shocked by the severity of his injuries.<,>医生们对他伤势的严重性感到震惊。<,>The judge considered the severity of the crime before sentencing.<,>法官在量刑前考虑了犯罪的严重性。<,>severe(严厉的)+ity→严厉的程度→严重性<,>sever(v.切断)/persevere(v.坚持)/severally(adv.各自地)  

discourage<,>/dɪsˈkʌrɪdʒ/<,>/dɪsˈkɜːrɪdʒ/<,>v.阻止/v.使气馁<,>High prices discourage people from buying.<,>高价格阻止人们购买。<,>Don't let failure discourage you from trying again.<,>不要让失败阻止你再次尝试。<,>His negative comments discouraged the whole team.<,>他的负面评论使整个团队气馁。<,>dis(反)+courage(勇气)→使失去勇气→使气馁<,>encourage(v.鼓励)/courage(n.勇气)/discouragement(n.沮丧)  

fault<,>/fɔːlt/<,>/fɔːlt/<,>n.过失<,>It's my fault that we missed the train.<,>我们错过火车是我的过失。<,>The engineer found a fault in the system.<,>工程师发现了系统中的故障。<,>She's always quick to admit her faults.<,>她总是很快承认自己的过失。<,>fault(错误)→与"false(假的)"同源<,>default(n.违约)/falter(v.蹒跚)/faultless(adj.完美的)  

robbery<,>/ˈrɒbəri/<,>/ˈrɑːbəri/<,>n.抢劫<,>The bank robbery was caught on camera.<,>银行抢劫被摄像头拍了下来。<,>He was sentenced to ten years for armed robbery.<,>他因持械抢劫被判十年。<,>The jewelry store was the target of a daring robbery.<,>珠宝店成为一起大胆抢劫的目标。<,>rob(抢夺)+ery→抢夺的行为→抢劫<,>robber(n.强盗)/rubber(n.橡胶)/robust(adj.强健的)
inanimate<,>/ɪnˈænɪmət/<,>/ɪnˈænɪmət/<,>adj.无生命的<,>The inanimate objects in the room seemed to have a life of their own.<,>房间里那些无生命的物体似乎有了自己的生命。<,>The scientist studied the difference between animate and inanimate matter.<,>科学家研究了有生命和无生命物质之间的区别。<,>Her paintings gave life to inanimate objects.<,>她的画作赋予了无生命物体生命。<,>in(否定)+animate(有生命的)→无生命的<,>animate(adj.有生命的/v.使有生气)/inanition(n.空虚/n.无生命)

calculation<,>/ˌkælkjʊˈleɪʃən/<,>/ˌkælkjəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.计算<,>His calculation of the budget was accurate.<,>他对预算的计算很准确。<,>After careful calculation, she decided to invest in the project.<,>经过仔细计算后，她决定投资这个项目。<,>The computer can perform complex calculations in seconds.<,>这台电脑能在几秒钟内完成复杂的计算。<,>calcul(计算)+ation(名词后缀)→计算<,>calculator(n.计算器)/calculus(n.微积分)/calibrate(v.校准)

baffle<,>/ˈbæfəl/<,>/ˈbæfəl/<,>v.使迷惑/困惑<,>The magician's trick completely baffled the audience.<,>魔术师的戏法完全迷惑了观众。<,>The complex instructions baffled the new employees.<,>复杂的说明让新员工感到困惑。<,>His strange behavior baffled his friends.<,>他奇怪的行为让朋友们感到困惑。<,>baff(打击)+le(小)→像被小打击一样→困惑<,>buffalo(n.水牛)/battle(n.战斗)/raffle(n.抽奖)

overcharge<,>/ˌəʊvəˈtʃɑːdʒ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈtʃɑːrdʒ/<,>v.多收钱<,>The taxi driver tried to overcharge the tourist.<,>出租车司机试图向游客多收钱。<,>Make sure they don't overcharge you for the repairs.<,>确保他们不会在维修费上多收你的钱。<,>I was overcharged by $10 at the restaurant.<,>我在餐厅被多收了10美元。<,>over(过度)+charge(收费)→多收钱<,>undercharge(v.少收钱)/recharge(v.再充电)/surcharge(n.附加费)

nap<,>/næp/<,>/næp/<,>n.小睡<,>He took a short nap after lunch.<,>他午饭后小睡了一会儿。<,>The baby is taking her afternoon nap.<,>宝宝正在睡午觉。<,>A 20-minute nap can refresh your mind.<,>20分钟的小睡可以让你精神焕发。<,>nap(小睡)→与"打盹"发音相似<,>napkin(n.餐巾纸)/knap(v.敲碎)/snap(v.折断)

disposal<,>/dɪˈspəʊzəl/<,>/dɪˈspoʊzəl/<,>n.处理/支配<,>The disposal of nuclear waste is a serious problem.<,>核废料的处理是个严重问题。<,>He has a large sum of money at his disposal.<,>他有一大笔钱可以自由支配。<,>The city improved its garbage disposal system.<,>这个城市改进了垃圾处理系统。<,>dis(分开)+pos(放置)+al→分开放置→处理<,>dispose(v.处理)/exposure(n.暴露)/composure(n.镇静)

authorities<,>/ɔːˈθɒrɪtiz/<,>/əˈθɔːrətiz/<,>n.当局<,>The local authorities are investigating the accident.<,>当地当局正在调查这起事故。<,>You need permission from the authorities to build here.<,>你需要当局的许可才能在这里建造。<,>The health authorities issued a new guideline.<,>卫生当局发布了新的指导方针。<,>author(作者)+ity(性质)+s→有权威的人→当局<,>authorize(v.授权)/authentic(adj.真实的)/authoritarian(adj.专制的)

chronicle<,>/ˈkrɒnɪkəl/<,>/ˈkrɑːnɪkəl/<,>v.记录<,>The book chronicles the history of the city.<,>这本书记录了这座城市的历史。<,>She chronicled her travels in a diary.<,>她在日记中记录了自己的旅行。<,>The newspaper chronicled the events of the war.<,>报纸记录了战争的经过。<,>chron(时间)+icle(小)→按时间顺序的小记录→编年史<,>chronology(n.年表)/chronic(adj.慢性的)/synchronize(v.同步)

shade<,>/ʃeɪd/<,>/ʃeɪd/<,>v.为...遮阳/挡光/遮蔽光线<,>The trees shade the house from the afternoon sun.<,>这些树为房子遮挡下午的阳光。<,>She shaded her eyes with her hand.<,>她用手为眼睛遮光。<,>The umbrella shaded us from the hot sun.<,>这把伞为我们遮挡了烈日。<,>shade(阴影)→与"shadow"同源<,>shadow(n.影子)/shady(adj.阴凉的)/sunshade(n.遮阳伞)

milestone<,>/ˈmaɪlstəʊn/<,>/ˈmaɪlstoʊn/<,>n.里程碑<,>Graduating from college was a major milestone in her life.<,>大学毕业是她人生的一个重要里程碑。<,>The invention marked a milestone in medical history.<,>这项发明是医学史上的一个里程碑。<,>They celebrated the milestone of their 50th anniversary.<,>他们庆祝了50周年这一里程碑。<,>mile(英里)+stone(石头)→里程碑<,>millstone(n.磨石)/cornerstone(n.基石)/tombstone(n.墓碑)
unstable<,>/ʌnˈsteɪbəl/<,>/ʌnˈsteɪbəl/<,>adj.不稳定的<,>The political situation in the country is unstable.<,>该国的政治局势不稳定。<,>Her mood was unstable after the accident.<,>事故后她的情绪不稳定。<,>The chemical compound is highly unstable at high temperatures.<,>这种化合物在高温下极不稳定。<,>un(否定前缀)+stable(稳定的)→不稳定的<,>stable(adj.稳定的)/instable(adj.不稳定的)  

strain<,>/streɪn/<,>/streɪn/<,>n.压力<,>The constant strain of work affected his health.<,>持续的工作压力影响了他的健康。<,>She felt the strain of caring for her sick mother.<,>她感受到了照顾生病母亲的压力。<,>The bridge collapsed under the strain of heavy traffic.<,>这座桥在繁忙交通的压力下倒塌了。<,>str(看作stress压力)+ain→压力<,>stress(n.压力)/constrain(v.强迫)  

municipal<,>/mjuːˈnɪsɪpəl/<,>/mjuˈnɪsəpəl/<,>adj.市政府的<,>The municipal government announced new policies.<,>市政府宣布了新政策。<,>Municipal elections will be held next month.<,>下个月将举行市政选举。<,>The park is maintained by the municipal authorities.<,>这个公园由市政当局维护。<,>muni(公共)+cip(拿)+al→管理公共事务的→市政府的<,>metropolitan(adj.大都市的)/federal(adj.联邦的)  

ideologically<,>/ˌaɪdiəˈlɒdʒɪkli/<,>/ˌaɪdiəˈlɑːdʒɪkli/<,>adv.意识形态上地<,>The two parties are ideologically opposed.<,>这两个政党在意识形态上是对立的。<,>He is ideologically committed to socialism.<,>他在意识形态上信奉社会主义。<,>The book analyzes the conflict ideologically.<,>这本书从意识形态上分析了冲突。<,>ideology(意识形态)+ical+ly→意识形态上地<,>ideology(n.意识形态)/ideal(adj.理想的)  

greedy<,>/ˈɡriːdi/<,>/ˈɡridi/<,>adj.贪婪的<,>The greedy businessman exploited his workers.<,>这个贪婪的商人剥削了他的工人。<,>Don't be greedy—leave some cake for others.<,>别贪心，给其他人留些蛋糕。<,>His greedy eyes fixed on the pile of money.<,>他贪婪的目光盯着那堆钱。<,>greed(贪婪)+y→贪婪的<,>need(n.需要)/green(adj.绿色的)  

robust<,>/rəʊˈbʌst/<,>/roʊˈbʌst/<,>adj.强健的<,>He has a robust constitution and rarely gets sick.<,>他体格强健，很少生病。<,>The company's financial position is robust.<,>该公司的财务状况很稳健。<,>This wine has a robust flavor.<,>这款酒味道浓郁。<,>ro(看作rock坚固)+bust(爆发)→强健的<,>robustness(n.健壮)/bust(n.半身像)  

diagnose<,>/ˈdaɪəɡnəʊz/<,>/ˈdaɪəɡnoʊz/<,>v.诊断<,>The doctor diagnosed the illness as pneumonia.<,>医生诊断该病为肺炎。<,>It's important to diagnose the problem early.<,>及早诊断问题很重要。<,>The mechanic diagnosed the fault in the engine.<,>机械师诊断出了发动机的故障。<,>dia(穿过)+gnos(知道)+e→通过检查知道→诊断<,>prognosis(n.预后)/gnosis(n.灵知)  

definite<,>/ˈdefɪnət/<,>/ˈdefənət/<,>adj.一定的，确切的<,>We need a definite answer by tomorrow.<,>我们需要明天之前得到确切的答复。<,>There was a definite improvement in his performance.<,>他的表现有明显的进步。<,>She has definite plans for the future.<,>她对未来有明确的计划。<,>de(加强)+fin(界限)+ite→有界限的→确切的<,>infinite(adj.无限的)/define(v.定义)  

reserved<,>/rɪˈzɜːvd/<,>/rɪˈzɜrvd/<,>adj.保留意见的；矜持的<,>She is very reserved and doesn't talk much.<,>她很矜持，话不多。<,>He remained reserved about his personal life.<,>他对自己的私生活保持沉默。<,>Some seats are reserved for VIPs.<,>一些座位是留给贵宾的。<,>re(再)+serv(保持)+ed→保留的<,>preserved(adj.保存的)/deserved(adj.应得的)  

affection<,>/əˈfekʃn/<,>/əˈfekʃən/<,>n.喜爱<,>She has a deep affection for her grandparents.<,>她对祖父母有着深厚的感情。<,>The dog showed affection by wagging its tail.<,>狗摇尾巴表示喜爱。<,>His affection for her was obvious to everyone.<,>他对她的喜爱大家都看得出来。<,>af(朝向)+fect(做)+ion→对某人做出一喜爱<,>affectionate(adj.深情的)/infection(n.感染)
material<,>/məˈtɪəriəl/<,>/məˈtɪriəl/<,>n.材料/n.原料/n.布料<,>This material is very soft and comfortable.<,>这种材料非常柔软舒适。<,>We need more material to finish the project.<,>我们需要更多材料来完成这个项目。<,>The dress is made of high-quality material.<,>这件连衣裙是用优质面料制成的。<,>mater(母亲)+ial→像母亲一样基础的东西→材料<,>maternal(adj.母亲的)/matter(n.物质)/immaterial(adj.不重要的)

conduct<,>/kənˈdʌkt/<,>/kənˈdʌkt/<,>v.进行/v.实行/v.传导<,>The scientist will conduct an experiment tomorrow.<,>科学家明天将进行一项实验。<,>Copper conducts electricity well.<,>铜的导电性能很好。<,>He conducted the orchestra beautifully.<,>他出色地指挥了管弦乐队。<,>con(共同)+duct(引导)→共同引导→进行<,>deduct(v.扣除)/induct(v.使正式就职)/abduct(v.绑架)

association<,>/əˌsəʊsiˈeɪʃn/<,>/əˌsoʊsiˈeɪʃn/<,>n.联系/n.协会/n.联想<,>There is a strong association between smoking and lung cancer.<,>吸烟和肺癌之间有很强的关联。<,>She joined the local business association.<,>她加入了当地的商业协会。<,>The smell of cookies brings happy childhood associations.<,>饼干的味道带来快乐的童年联想。<,>as(朝向)+soci(同伴)+ation→成为同伴→联系<,>dissociate(v.分离)/society(n.社会)/associate(v.联想)

collide<,>/kəˈlaɪd/<,>/kəˈlaɪd/<,>v.撞击/v.碰撞/v.冲突<,>Two cars collided at the intersection.<,>两辆车在十字路口相撞。<,>Their opinions collided during the meeting.<,>他们的观点在会议上发生了冲突。<,>The particles collide at high speed.<,>这些粒子以高速碰撞。<,>col(共同)+lide(滑)→一起滑动→碰撞<,>glide(v.滑行)/slide(v.滑动)/elide(v.省略)

industrious<,>/ɪnˈdʌstriəs/<,>/ɪnˈdʌstriəs/<,>adj.勤奋的/adj.勤劳的<,>She is the most industrious student in our class.<,>她是我们班最勤奋的学生。<,>The industrious ants worked all day.<,>勤劳的蚂蚁整天工作。<,>His industrious nature earned him a promotion.<,>他勤奋的天性为他赢得了晋升。<,>industry(工业)+ous→像工业一样不停运转的→勤奋的<,>industrial(adj.工业的)/indulgent(adj.放纵的)/indigenous(adj.本土的)

fascinate<,>/ˈfæsɪneɪt/<,>/ˈfæsəˌneɪt/<,>v.使着迷/v.吸引/v.迷住<,>The magician's tricks fascinated the children.<,>魔术师的把戏让孩子们着迷。<,>I'm fascinated by ancient history.<,>我对古代历史很着迷。<,>The exotic culture fascinated the tourists.<,>异国文化让游客们着迷。<,>fascin(魔力)+ate→施魔法→使着迷<,>fascination(n.魅力)/fascia(n.饰带)/fasten(v.固定)

prevalence<,>/ˈprevələns/<,>/ˈprɛvələns/<,>n.流行/n.普遍/n.盛行<,>The prevalence of smartphones has changed our lives.<,>智能手机的普及改变了我们的生活。<,>There is a high prevalence of diabetes in this area.<,>这个地区糖尿病发病率很高。<,>The prevalence of this fashion trend is worldwide.<,>这种时尚潮流在全球都很流行。<,>pre(前)+val(价值)+ence→价值在前→普遍<,>prevalent(adj.流行的)/equivalent(adj.等价的)/ambivalent(adj.矛盾的)

exert<,>/ɪɡˈzɜːt/<,>/ɪɡˈzɜːrt/<,>v.施加/v.运用/v.尽力<,>Don't exert too much pressure on the children.<,>不要给孩子施加太大压力。<,>He exerted all his strength to lift the box.<,>他用尽全力抬起箱子。<,>The new manager exerted his authority immediately.<,>新经理立即行使了他的权威。<,>ex(出)+ert(加入)→加入力量→施加<,>exertion(n.努力)/insert(v.插入)/assert(v.断言)

minor<,>/ˈmaɪnə(r)/<,>/ˈmaɪnər/<,>adj.次要的/adj.小的/n.未成年人<,>This is just a minor problem.<,>这只是个小问题。<,>She played a minor role in the play.<,>她在剧中扮演次要角色。<,>The law protects the rights of minors.<,>法律保护未成年人的权利。<,>min(小)+or→较小的→次要的<,>major(adj.主要的)/miner(n.矿工)/minus(prep.减去)

tempting<,>/ˈtemptɪŋ/<,>/ˈtɛmptɪŋ/<,>adj.吸引人的/adj.诱人的<,>The dessert looks very tempting.<,>这个甜点看起来非常诱人。<,>He received a tempting job offer.<,>他收到了一份诱人的工作邀请。<,>The store window displayed tempting goods.<,>商店橱窗展示着诱人的商品。<,>tempt(诱惑)+ing→诱惑人的→吸引人的<,>temptation(n.诱惑)/attempt(v.尝试)/contempt(n.轻视)
appropriation<,>/əˌprəʊpriˈeɪʃn/<,>/əˌproʊpriˈeɪʃn/<,>n.挪用<,>The treasurer was accused of appropriation of public funds.<,>财务主管被指控挪用公款。<,>Cultural appropriation can be a sensitive issue.<,>文化挪用可能是一个敏感问题。<,>His appropriation of company property led to his dismissal.<,>他挪用公司财产导致被解雇。<,>ap(加强)+propri(拥有)+ation→据为己有→挪用<,>expropriation(n.征用)/misappropriation(n.盗用)/proper(adj.适当的)  

injustice<,>/ɪnˈdʒʌstɪs/<,>/ɪnˈdʒʌstɪs/<,>n.不公正<,>The documentary highlights social injustice.<,>这部纪录片揭露了社会不公。<,>She fought against racial injustice all her life.<,>她一生都在与种族不公正作斗争。<,>The court's decision was a grave injustice.<,>法庭的判决极不公正。<,>in(不)+justice(正义)→不公正<,>justice(n.正义)/injury(n.伤害)/just(adj.公正的)  

irrelevant<,>/ɪˈreləvənt/<,>/ɪˈreləvənt/<,>adj.无关的<,>Your comment is completely irrelevant to the topic.<,>你的评论与主题完全无关。<,>Age should be irrelevant in job applications.<,>年龄在求职中应该是无关因素。<,>The judge ruled the evidence irrelevant.<,>法官裁定该证据无关。<,>ir(不)+relevant(相关的)→无关的<,>relevant(adj.相关的)/irreverent(adj.不敬的)/irresistible(adj.不可抗拒的)  

registration<,>/ˌredʒɪˈstreɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛdʒɪˈstreɪʃən/<,>n.注册/n.登记<,>Online registration is now open.<,>现在开放网上注册。<,>Vehicle registration must be renewed annually.<,>车辆登记必须每年更新。<,>The conference registration fee is $200.<,>会议注册费是200美元。<,>re(再)+gister(记录)+ation→再次记录→登记<,>registry(n.登记处)/registrar(n.登记员)/gesture(n.手势)  

democracy<,>/dɪˈmɒkrəsi/<,>/dɪˈmɑːkrəsi/<,>n.民主<,>Greece is the birthplace of democracy.<,>希腊是民主的发源地。<,>Free elections are essential to democracy.<,>自由选举对民主至关重要。<,>The country is transitioning to democracy.<,>这个国家正在向民主过渡。<,>demo(人民)+cracy(统治)→人民统治→民主<,>autocracy(n.独裁)/bureaucracy(n.官僚)/democrat(n.民主主义者)  

grateful<,>/ˈɡreɪtfl/<,>/ˈɡreɪtfəl/<,>adj.感激的<,>I'm grateful for your help.<,>我很感激你的帮助。<,>She was grateful to be alive after the accident.<,>事故后能活着她很感激。<,>We are grateful that the issue was resolved.<,>我们感激问题得到解决。<,>grate(高兴)+ful(充满)→充满高兴的→感激的<,>gratitude(n.感激)/graceful(adj.优雅的)/great(adj.伟大的)  

offense<,>/əˈfens/<,>/əˈfɛns/<,>n.冒犯<,>No offense intended by my remark.<,>我的话无意冒犯。<,>His behavior caused offense to many people.<,>他的行为冒犯了许多人。<,>Certain topics are likely to give offense.<,>某些话题容易引起冒犯。<,>of(反对)+fense(打击)→打击对方→冒犯<,>defense(n.防御)/fence(n.栅栏)/offensive(adj.冒犯的)  

atmosphere<,>/ˈætməsfɪə(r)/<,>/ˈætməsfɪr/<,>n.气氛/n.大气(层)<,>The restaurant has a romantic atmosphere.<,>这家餐厅有浪漫的氛围。<,>Pollution is damaging Earth's atmosphere.<,>污染正在破坏地球大气层。<,>There was an atmosphere of tension in the room.<,>房间里有紧张的气氛。<,>atmo(空气)+sphere(球体)→环绕地球的空气→大气层<,>hemisphere(n.半球)/biosphere(n.生物圈)/spherical(adj.球形的)  

approach<,>/əˈprəʊtʃ/<,>/əˈproʊtʃ/<,>n.方法<,>We need a new approach to solve this problem.<,>我们需要新的方法来解决这个问题。<,>His teaching approach is very effective.<,>他的教学方法很有效。<,>The scientific approach requires evidence.<,>科学方法需要证据。<,>ap(向)+proach(接近)→接近的方式→方法<,>reproach(v.责备)/approximate(adj.近似的)/proximity(n.接近)  

rival<,>/ˈraɪvl/<,>/ˈraɪvəl/<,>n.对手<,>The two companies are fierce rivals.<,>这两家公司是激烈的竞争对手。<,>He defeated his main rival in the election.<,>他在选举中击败了主要对手。<,>The teams have been rivals for decades.<,>这两支队伍竞争了几十年。<,>riv(河岸)+al→隔岸相对的→对手<,>arrival(n.到达)/rivalry(n.竞争)/river(n.河流)
commitment<,>/kəˈmɪtmənt/<,>/kəˈmɪtmənt/<,>n.承诺<,>He made a commitment to finish the project on time.<,>他承诺按时完成这个项目。<,>Her commitment to her family is admirable.<,>她对家庭的承诺令人钦佩。<,>They showed great commitment to the cause.<,>他们对这项事业表现出了极大的承诺。<,>com(共同)+mit(送)→共同送出→承诺<,>commission(n.佣金/v.委托)/committee(n.委员会)/committal(n.委托/v.交付)

furious<,>/ˈfjʊəriəs/<,>/ˈfjʊriəs/<,>adj.生气的/adj.激烈的<,>She was furious when she heard the news.<,>她听到这个消息时非常生气。<,>The furious storm caused a lot of damage.<,>猛烈的风暴造成了很大的破坏。<,>He gave a furious speech at the meeting.<,>他在会议上发表了激烈的演讲。<,>fury(愤怒)+ous(形容词后缀)→生气的<,>curious(adj.好奇的)/furious(adj.生气的)/serious(adj.严肃的)

accurate<,>/ˈækjərət/<,>/ˈækjərət/<,>adj.精确的<,>The measurements must be accurate to the millimeter.<,>测量必须精确到毫米。<,>Her prediction was surprisingly accurate.<,>她的预测出奇地准确。<,>He gave an accurate description of the suspect.<,>他对嫌疑人的描述非常准确。<,>ac(强调)+cur(关心)+ate(形容词后缀)→非常关心的→精确的<,>inaccurate(adj.不准确的)/accurate(adj.精确的)/approximate(adj.大约的)

abstract<,>/ˈæbstrækt/<,>/ˈæbˌstrækt/<,>adj.抽象的<,>Modern art is often abstract.<,>现代艺术通常是抽象的。<,>He gave an abstract explanation of the theory.<,>他对这个理论进行了抽象的解释。<,>The concept is too abstract for young children.<,>这个概念对小孩子来说太抽象了。<,>abs(离开)+tract(拉)→拉走→抽象的<,>contract(n.合同/v.收缩)/subtract(v.减去)/distract(v.分散注意力)

deprivation<,>/ˌdeprɪˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌdɛprəˈveɪʃən/<,>n.剥夺/n.匮乏<,>Sleep deprivation can affect your health.<,>睡眠不足会影响你的健康。<,>The children suffered from food deprivation.<,>这些孩子遭受了食物匮乏。<,>Social deprivation leads to many problems.<,>社会剥夺会导致许多问题。<,>de(去掉)+priv(私人)+ation(名词后缀)→剥夺<,>deprivation(n.剥夺)/derivation(n.起源)/depravity(n.堕落)

designate<,>/ˈdezɪɡneɪt/<,>/ˈdɛzɪɡˌneɪt/<,>v.指定/v.委派<,>They will designate a new leader soon.<,>他们很快就会指定一位新领导。<,>This area is designated as a nature reserve.<,>这个地区被指定为自然保护区。<,>She was designated to handle the project.<,>她被委派处理这个项目。<,>de(强调)+sign(标记)+ate(动词后缀)→指定<,>design(n.设计/v.设计)/resign(v.辞职)/assign(v.分配)

turtle<,>/ˈtɜːtl/<,>/ˈtɜrtl/<,>n.海龟<,>The turtle slowly crawled to the sea.<,>海龟慢慢地爬向大海。<,>We saw a giant turtle at the aquarium.<,>我们在水族馆看到了一只巨大的海龟。<,>The turtle's shell provides protection.<,>海龟的壳提供了保护。<,>turt(龟)+le(名词后缀)→海龟<,>turtle(n.海龟)/tortoise(n.陆龟)/terrapin(n.水龟)

expertise<,>/ˌekspɜːˈtiːz/<,>/ˌɛkspɜrˈtiːz/<,>n.专业知识<,>His expertise in engineering is impressive.<,>他在工程方面的专业知识令人印象深刻。<,>She has expertise in financial planning.<,>她在财务规划方面有专业知识。<,>The job requires special expertise.<,>这份工作需要特殊的专业知识。<,>expert(专家)+ise(名词后缀)→专业知识<,>expertise(n.专业知识)/experience(n.经验)/expert(n.专家)

vessel<,>/ˈvesl/<,>/ˈvɛsəl/<,>n.血管<,>Blood vessels carry blood throughout the body.<,>血管将血液输送到全身。<,>The doctor examined the damaged vessel.<,>医生检查了受损的血管。<,>Blocked vessels can cause serious problems.<,>堵塞的血管会导致严重的问题。<,>vess(容器)+el(名词后缀)→血管<,>vessel(n.血管)/vassal(n.封臣)/vassalage(n.臣属地位)

ventilate<,>/ˈventɪleɪt/<,>/ˈvɛntəˌleɪt/<,>v.使通风<,>Open the windows to ventilate the room.<,>打开窗户让房间通风。<,>The system ventilates the entire building.<,>这个系统为整栋大楼通风。<,>Properly ventilated areas are healthier.<,>通风良好的区域更健康。<,>vent(风)+ilate(动词后缀)→使通风<,>ventilate(v.使通风)/vent(n.通风口)/ventilation(n.通风)
trade-off<,>/ˈtreɪd ɒf/<,>/ˈtreɪd ɔːf/<,>n.权衡/n.交易<,>There is always a trade-off between quality and cost.<,>质量和成本之间总是需要权衡。<,>The trade-off for higher pay was longer working hours.<,>高薪的代价是更长的工作时间。<,>They made a trade-off to achieve mutual benefits.<,>他们进行了交易以实现互利。<,>trade(交易)+off(离开)→权衡取舍<,>compromise(n.妥协/v.折中)/sacrifice(n.牺牲/v.舍弃)  

endless<,>/ˈendləs/<,>/ˈɛndləs/<,>adj.无限的/adj.没完没了的<,>The desert seemed endless under the scorching sun.<,>在烈日下，沙漠似乎无边无际。<,>Their endless arguments exhausted everyone.<,>他们没完没了的争论让所有人精疲力尽。<,>The possibilities are endless if you work hard.<,>只要努力，可能性是无限的。<,>end(结束)+less(无)→没有尽头<,>limitless(adj.无限制的)/finite(adj.有限的)  

temptation<,>/tempˈteɪʃn/<,>/tɛmpˈteɪʃən/<,>n.诱惑<,>He resisted the temptation to eat the last piece of cake.<,>他忍住了吃最后一块蛋糕的诱惑。<,>Online shopping is full of temptations.<,>网上购物充满了诱惑。<,>She finally gave in to temptation and bought the dress.<,>她最终没经住诱惑买了那条裙子。<,>tempt(引诱)+ation(名词后缀)→诱惑<,>attraction(n.吸引)/seduction(n.引诱)  

legislation<,>/ˌledʒɪsˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌlɛdʒɪsˈleɪʃən/<,>n.立法<,>The new legislation aims to protect the environment.<,>新立法旨在保护环境。<,>They are debating the proposed legislation.<,>他们正在讨论提议的立法。<,>Strict legislation is needed to control pollution.<,>需要严格的立法来控制污染。<,>legis(法律)+lation(行为)→立法<,>regulation(n.规章)/jurisdiction(n.司法权)  

duplication<,>/ˌdjuːplɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌduːplɪˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.复制品<,>The artist made a duplication of his famous painting.<,>艺术家复制了他的名画。<,>Avoid duplication of work to save time.<,>避免重复工作以节省时间。<,>This document is a duplication of the original.<,>这份文件是原件的复制品。<,>du(双)+plic(折叠)+ation→复制<,>replica(n.复制品)/original(n.原件)  

trick<,>/trɪk/<,>/trɪk/<,>n.骗局/n.诡计<,>He played a trick on his friend for fun.<,>他恶作剧捉弄了他的朋友。<,>The scam was just a trick to steal money.<,>这个骗局只是为了偷钱。<,>She used a clever trick to solve the puzzle.<,>她用了一个聪明的技巧解开了谜题。<,>谐音“吹克”→吹嘘能克敌→诡计<,>trap(n.陷阱)/strategy(n.策略)  

evaluation<,>/ɪˌvæljuˈeɪʃn/<,>/ɪˌvæljuˈeɪʃən/<,>n.评价<,>The teacher's evaluation of the student was fair.<,>老师对学生的评价是公正的。<,>Performance evaluation is conducted every year.<,>每年都会进行绩效评价。<,>We need a proper evaluation of the project.<,>我们需要对项目进行适当的评估。<,>e(出)+valu(价值)+ation→评定价值<,>assessment(n.评估)/appraisal(n.鉴定)  

abandonment<,>/əˈbændənmənt/<,>/əˈbændənmənt/<,>n.放弃<,>The abandonment of the project disappointed everyone.<,>项目的放弃让所有人失望。<,>Child abandonment is a serious crime.<,>遗弃儿童是严重的罪行。<,>He felt a sense of abandonment after the breakup.<,>分手后他感到被抛弃。<,>a(无)+bandon(权力)+ment→放弃权力<,>desertion(n.遗弃)/surrender(n.投降)  

turbulent<,>/ˈtɜːbjələnt/<,>/ˈtɜːrbjələnt/<,>adj.动荡的/adj.骚乱的<,>The country went through a turbulent period.<,>这个国家经历了一段动荡时期。<,>The turbulent waters made sailing difficult.<,>汹涌的水流使航行变得困难。<,>His turbulent emotions were hard to control.<,>他骚动的情绪难以控制。<,>turb(搅动)+ulent(多…的)→混乱的<,>chaotic(adj.混乱的)/calm(adj.平静的)  

expel<,>/ɪkˈspel/<,>/ɪkˈspɛl/<,>v.开除/v.驱逐<,>The school decided to expel the student for cheating.<,>学校决定开除作弊的学生。<,>They were expelled from the country for illegal activities.<,>他们因非法活动被驱逐出境。<,>The fan was expelled from the stadium for bad behavior.<,>这名球迷因不良行为被驱逐出体育场。<,>ex(出)+pel(推)→推出→驱逐<,>exile(v.流放)/admit(v.接纳)
carpenter<,>/ˈkɑːpəntə(r)/<,>/ˈkɑːrpəntər/<,>n.木匠<,>My grandfather was a skilled carpenter who built our family home.<,>我的祖父是一位技艺精湛的木匠，他建造了我们的家。<,>The carpenter measured twice before cutting the wood.<,>木匠在切割木材前测量了两次。<,>She hired a carpenter to make custom furniture for her new apartment.<,>她雇了一位木匠为她的新公寓定制家具。<,>car(车)+pent(篷)+er(人)→造车篷的人→木匠<,>carpentry(n.木工手艺)/carpet(n.地毯)/cart(n.手推车)

hasty<,>/ˈheɪsti/<,>/ˈheɪsti/<,>adj.匆忙的<,>He made a hasty decision without thinking about the consequences.<,>他匆忙做出了决定，没有考虑后果。<,>She ate a hasty breakfast before rushing to work.<,>她匆忙吃了早餐就赶去上班了。<,>Don't be too hasty in judging others.<,>不要过于匆忙地评判他人。<,>haste(匆忙)+y(形容词后缀)→匆忙的<,>hasten(v.加速)/hazard(n.危险)/hasty(adj.草率的)

unprecedented<,>/ʌnˈpresɪdentɪd/<,>/ʌnˈpresɪdentɪd/<,>adj.史无前例的<,>The pandemic caused unprecedented changes in our daily lives.<,>这场疫情给我们的日常生活带来了前所未有的变化。<,>The company achieved unprecedented success this year.<,>公司今年取得了前所未有的成功。<,>This is an unprecedented opportunity for our team.<,>这对我们团队来说是一个前所未有的机会。<,>un(无)+precedent(先例)+ed→无先例的<,>precedent(n.先例)/president(n.总统)/resident(n.居民)
