extreme<,>/ɪkˈstriːm/<,>/ɪkˈstriːm/<,>adj.极端的<,>He took extreme measures to lose weight.<,>他采取了极端措施来减肥。<,>The weather conditions were extreme during the expedition.<,>探险期间的天气条件非常极端。<,>She has extreme views on this political issue.<,>她对这一政治问题持有极端观点。<,>ex(出)+treme(边界)→超出边界→极端的<,>extremity(n.极端)/extremist(n.极端主义者)/extremely(adv.极其)

outperform<,>/ˌaʊtpəˈfɔːm/<,>/ˌaʊtpərˈfɔːrm/<,>v.胜过<,>Our new product has outperformed all competitors in the market.<,>我们的新产品在市场上胜过所有竞争对手。<,>The student consistently outperforms her classmates in math.<,>这位学生在数学上一直胜过她的同学。<,>This fund has outperformed the market average for five consecutive years.<,>这只基金连续五年跑赢市场平均水平。<,>out(超过)+perform(表现)→表现超过→胜过<,>performance(n.表现)/performer(n.表演者)/underperform(v.表现不佳)

modernize<,>/ˈmɒdənaɪz/<,>/ˈmɑːdərnaɪz/<,>v.现代化<,>The government plans to modernize the country's infrastructure.<,>政府计划对国家基础设施进行现代化改造。<,>We need to modernize our production facilities to stay competitive.<,>我们需要现代化我们的生产设施以保持竞争力。<,>They modernized the old house while preserving its historic character.<,>他们在保留历史特色的同时对老房子进行了现代化改造。<,>modern(现代的)+ize(使...化)→使现代化<,>modernization(n.现代化)/moderate(adj.温和的)/modest(adj.谦虚的)

interactive<,>/ˌɪntərˈæktɪv/<,>/ˌɪntərˈæktɪv/<,>adj.交互的/互动的/合作的/相互交流的<,>The museum has many interactive exhibits for children.<,>博物馆有许多供儿童互动的展品。<,>This software features an interactive user interface.<,>这款软件具有交互式用户界面。<,>Interactive learning methods are more effective for language acquisition.<,>互动学习方法对语言习得更有效。<,>inter(相互)+act(行动)+ive(形容词后缀)→相互行动的→互动的<,>interaction(n.互动)/interact(v.互动)/interactive(adj.交互式的)

successively<,>/səkˈsesɪvli/<,>/səkˈsesɪvli/<,>adv.接连着地/继续地<,>He won three games successively in the tournament.<,>他在比赛中接连赢了三场比赛。<,>The company has reported profits growth successively for five quarters.<,>公司已连续五个季度报告利润增长。<,>She was promoted successively within two years of joining the company.<,>她在加入公司两年内接连获得晋升。<,>success(连续)+ive(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→连续地<,>successive(adj.连续的)/succession(n.连续)/successor(n.继任者)

innovation<,>/ˌɪnəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪnəˈveɪʃn/<,>n.创新/革新/新观念/新方法/新发明<,>Technological innovation drives economic growth.<,>技术创新推动经济增长。<,>The company is known for its culture of innovation.<,>这家公司以其创新文化而闻名。<,>This product represents a major innovation in the industry.<,>这款产品代表了该行业的重大创新。<,>in(进入)+nov(新)+ation(名词后缀)→引入新事物→创新<,>innovative(adj.创新的)/innovator(n.创新者)/renovation(n.翻新)

elaborately<,>/ɪˈlæbərətli/<,>/ɪˈlæbərətli/<,>adv.复杂地/精心设计地<,>The wedding cake was elaborately decorated with sugar flowers.<,>婚礼蛋糕精心装饰着糖花。<,>She dressed elaborately for the gala dinner.<,>她为晚宴精心打扮。<,>The palace was elaborately designed with intricate details.<,>宫殿设计精心，细节复杂。<,>e(出)+labor(劳动)+ate(动词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→付出劳动地→精心地<,>elaborate(adj.精心制作的)/laborious(adj.费力的)/collaborate(v.合作)
vegetarian<,>/ˌvedʒəˈteəriən/<,>/ˌvedʒəˈteriən/<,>n.素食主义者<,>My sister has been a vegetarian for five years.<,>我姐姐已经吃素五年了。<,>The restaurant offers a wide variety of vegetarian dishes.<,>这家餐厅提供多种素食选择。<,>Becoming a vegetarian can have health benefits.<,>成为素食主义者对健康有益。<,>veget(植物)+arian(人)→吃植物的人<,>vegan(n.纯素食者)/vegetable(n.蔬菜)  

faculty<,>/ˈfæklti/<,>/ˈfækəlti/<,>n.〔大学的〕全体教员<,>The faculty meeting will be held next Monday.<,>全体教员会议将在下周一举行。<,>She joined the faculty of Harvard University last year.<,>她去年加入了哈佛大学的教师队伍。<,>The faculty voted to change the curriculum.<,>全体教员投票决定修改课程。<,>fac(做)+ulty(能力)→有能力做事的群体<,>factory(n.工厂)/facility(n.设施)  

render<,>/ˈrendə(r)/<,>/ˈrɛndɚ/<,>v.给予<,>They rendered assistance to the victims.<,>他们向受害者提供了援助。<,>The jury rendered a verdict of not guilty.<,>陪审团作出了无罪判决。<,>This service renders great help to the community.<,>这项服务给社区提供了很大帮助。<,>ren(再)+der(给)→再次给予<,>surrender(v.投降)/tender(adj.温柔的)  

portray<,>/pɔːˈtreɪ/<,>/pɔrˈtreɪ/<,>v.描述<,>The book portrays life in rural areas vividly.<,>这本书生动地描述了乡村生活。<,>He was portrayed as a hero in the movie.<,>他在电影中被塑造成英雄形象。<,>The painting portrays a beautiful sunset.<,>这幅画描绘了美丽的日落。<,>por(向前)+tray(拉)→向前拉出形象<,>portrait(n.肖像)/betray(v.背叛)  

notion<,>/ˈnəʊʃn/<,>/ˈnoʊʃn/<,>n.想法，观点<,>I have no notion of what you're talking about.<,>我不知道你在说什么。<,>He has some strange notions about education.<,>他对教育有些奇怪的想法。<,>The notion that the earth is flat has been disproved.<,>地球是平的的观点已被推翻。<,>not(知道)+ion→知道的东西→想法<,>motion(n.运动)/emotion(n.情感)  

tropical<,>/ˈtrɒpɪkl/<,>/ˈtrɑːpɪkl/<,>adj.热带的<,>Bananas grow well in tropical climates.<,>香蕉在热带气候中生长良好。<,>We spent our vacation on a tropical island.<,>我们在一个热带岛屿上度过了假期。<,>Tropical storms are common in this area.<,>这个地区常有热带风暴。<,>trop(转)+ical→太阳直射区域<,>topic(n.话题)/typical(adj.典型的)  

character<,>/ˈkærəktə(r)/<,>/ˈkærɪktɚ/<,>n.角色；某物的特色<,>He played the main character in the play.<,>他在剧中扮演主角。<,>The old town has a unique character.<,>这个古镇有独特的特色。<,>Her character is very different from her sister's.<,>她的性格和她姐姐很不一样。<,>char(写)+acter→写出来的特征<,>charter(n.宪章)/characteristic(adj.典型的)  

infectious<,>/ɪnˈfekʃəs/<,>/ɪnˈfekʃəs/<,>adj.感染的，传染的<,>Laughter is infectious.<,>笑声具有感染力。<,>The disease is highly infectious.<,>这种疾病传染性很强。<,>He has an infectious enthusiasm for music.<,>他对音乐有着极具感染力的热情。<,>in(进入)+fect(做)+ious→进入体内起作用<,>affection(n.感情)/defect(n.缺陷)  

lawn<,>/lɔːn/<,>/lɔn/<,>n.草坪<,>The children are playing on the lawn.<,>孩子们正在草坪上玩耍。<,>We need to mow the lawn this weekend.<,>我们这周末需要修剪草坪。<,>The house has a beautiful front lawn.<,>这房子前面有块漂亮的草坪。<,>law(法律)+n→法律规定要维护的绿地<,>yawn(v.打哈欠)/pawn(n.典当)  

permanent<,>/ˈpɜːmənənt/<,>/ˈpɜːrmənənt/<,>adj.永久的<,>They are looking for a permanent solution.<,>他们正在寻找永久解决方案。<,>I got a permanent job at the bank.<,>我在银行得到了一份固定工作。<,>The tattoo is permanent and cannot be removed.<,>这个纹身是永久的，无法去除。<,>per(贯穿)+man(保持)+ent→一直保持<,>temporary(adj.临时的)/prominent(adj.突出的)
transcend<,>/trænˈsend/<,>/trænˈsɛnd/<,>v.超越<,>His ideas transcend the boundaries of traditional science.<,>他的思想超越了传统科学的界限。<,>Art can transcend cultural differences.<,>艺术可以超越文化差异。<,>Her performance transcended all expectations.<,>她的表现超出了所有人的预期。<,>trans(跨越)+scend(爬)→爬越→超越<,>ascend(v.上升)/descend(v.下降)/contend(v.竞争)

kidnap<,>/ˈkɪdnæp/<,>/ˈkɪdˌnæp/<,>v.绑架<,>The wealthy businessman was kidnapped for ransom.<,>这位富商被绑架以勒索赎金。<,>Kidnapping is a serious crime in all countries.<,>绑架在所有国家都是重罪。<,>The movie is about a child kidnapping case.<,>这部电影讲述了一个儿童绑架案。<,>kid(小孩)+nap(小睡)→趁小孩睡觉时绑走→绑架<,>kidney(n.肾脏)/napkin(n.餐巾)/snatch(v.抢夺)

dominate<,>/ˈdɒmɪneɪt/<,>/ˈdɑːmɪneɪt/<,>v.主导/v.主宰<,>This company dominates the smartphone market.<,>这家公司主导着智能手机市场。<,>He tends to dominate every conversation.<,>他总想主导每次谈话。<,>The castle dominates the skyline of the city.<,>这座城堡主宰着城市的天际线。<,>dom(家)+in(内)+ate(使)→使成为一家之主→主宰<,>dominant(adj.主导的)/domestic(adj.国内的)/donate(v.捐赠)

stabilize<,>/ˈsteɪbəlaɪz/<,>/ˈsteɪbəˌlaɪz/<,>v.使稳固/v.使安定<,>The government is trying to stabilize the economy.<,>政府正努力稳定经济。<,>His condition has stabilized after surgery.<,>手术后他的情况已经稳定。<,>This medication helps stabilize blood pressure.<,>这种药物有助于稳定血压。<,>stabil(稳定)+ize(使)→使稳定<,>stable(adj.稳定的)/instability(n.不稳定)/mobility(n.流动性)

consult<,>/kənˈsʌlt/<,>/kənˈsʌlt/<,>v.咨询<,>You should consult a doctor about your symptoms.<,>你应该就你的症状咨询医生。<,>I need to consult my lawyer before signing the contract.<,>签合同前我需要咨询我的律师。<,>The committee will consult with experts before making a decision.<,>委员会将在做决定前咨询专家。<,>con(共同)+sult(坐)→坐在一起商议→咨询<,>insult(v.侮辱)/result(n.结果)/assault(n.攻击)

resume<,>/ˈrezjumeɪ/<,>/ˈrɛzəˌmeɪ/<,>n.简历<,>Please send your resume to our HR department.<,>请将你的简历发送至我们的人力资源部门。<,>Your resume should highlight your work experience.<,>你的简历应该突出你的工作经验。<,>He updated his resume before applying for the job.<,>他在申请工作前更新了简历。<,>re(重新)+sume(拿)→重新拿出来的东西→简历<,>assume(v.假设)/consume(v.消耗)/presume(v.假定)

migrate<,>/maɪˈɡreɪt/<,>/ˈmaɪɡreɪt/<,>v.移民/v.迁徙<,>Many birds migrate south for the winter.<,>许多鸟类冬季会迁徙到南方。<,>His family migrated to Canada in the 1990s.<,>他的家人在1990年代移民到了加拿大。<,>These fish migrate upstream to spawn.<,>这些鱼会洄游到上游产卵。<,>migr(移动)+ate(使)→使移动→迁徙<,>immigrate(v.移入)/emigrate(v.移出)/migrant(n.移民)

isolation<,>/ˌaɪsəˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌaɪsəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.隔绝/n.隔离<,>The patient was placed in isolation to prevent infection.<,>病人被隔离以防止感染。<,>Living in the mountains gave him a sense of isolation.<,>住在山里让他有种与世隔绝的感觉。<,>Social isolation can lead to depression.<,>社会隔离可能导致抑郁。<,>isol(岛)+ation(状态)→像岛一样的状态→隔离<,>insulation(n.绝缘)/desolation(n.荒凉)/solitude(n.独处)

derive<,>/dɪˈraɪv/<,>/dɪˈraɪv/<,>v.获得<,>Many English words are derived from Latin.<,>许多英语单词源自拉丁语。<,>She derives great pleasure from reading.<,>她从阅读中获得极大乐趣。<,>The company derives most of its income from exports.<,>公司大部分收入来自出口。<,>de(从)+rive(河流)→从河流中获取→获得<,>deprive(v.剥夺)/arrive(v.到达)/thrive(v.繁荣)

conservation<,>/ˌkɒnsəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnsərˈveɪʃən/<,>n.保护<,>Wildlife conservation is important for biodiversity.<,>野生动物保护对生物多样性很重要。<,>Energy conservation helps reduce pollution.<,>节约能源有助于减少污染。<,>The building is under historical conservation.<,>这栋建筑受到历史保护。<,>con(共同)+serv(保持)+ation→共同保持→保护<,>preservation(n.保存)/reservation(n.保留)/observation(n.观察)
incidence<,>/ˈɪnsɪdəns/<,>/ˈɪnsɪdəns/<,>n.发生率<,>The incidence of diabetes has increased in recent years.<,>近年来糖尿病的发病率有所上升。<,>They studied the incidence of crime in urban areas.<,>他们研究了城市地区的犯罪发生率。<,>High incidence of flu was reported during winter.<,>据报道冬季流感发病率很高。<,>in(进入)+cid(落下)+ence(名词后缀)→落下的事件→发生率<,>accident(n.事故)/coincidence(n.巧合)/incident(n.事件)

perpetual<,>/pəˈpetʃuəl/<,>/pərˈpetʃuəl/<,>adj.永久的<,>They signed a perpetual peace treaty.<,>他们签署了一份永久和平条约。<,>The waterfall creates a perpetual mist in the valley.<,>瀑布在峡谷中形成了永久的水雾。<,>He was in perpetual motion, never sitting still.<,>他永远在动，从不停歇。<,>per(贯穿)+pet(追求)+ual(形容词后缀)→一直追求的→永久的<,>temporary(adj.临时的)/transient(adj.短暂的)/intermittent(adj.间歇的)

pessimistic<,>/ˌpesɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>/ˌpesɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>adj.悲观的<,>He took a pessimistic view of the economic situation.<,>他对经济形势持悲观态度。<,>Don't be so pessimistic - things might improve.<,>别这么悲观，情况可能会好转。<,>Her pessimistic predictions didn't come true.<,>她悲观的预测没有成真。<,>pess(最坏)+imistic(形容词后缀)→总想最坏情况的→悲观的<,>optimistic(adj.乐观的)/realistic(adj.现实的)/skeptical(adj.怀疑的)

crew<,>/kruː/<,>/kruː/<,>n.机组人员<,>The flight crew prepared for takeoff.<,>机组人员做好了起飞准备。<,>All crew members must attend the safety briefing.<,>所有机组人员都必须参加安全简报会。<,>The ship's crew worked day and night during the storm.<,>暴风雨期间船上的工作人员日夜工作。<,>发音类似"cruise"(巡航)→巡航需要机组人员<,>team(n.团队)/staff(n.全体员工)/personnel(n.全体人员)

mourn<,>/mɔːn/<,>/mɔːrn/<,>v.哀悼<,>The whole nation mourned the death of the president.<,>全国人民哀悼总统的逝世。<,>She still mourns her husband after ten years.<,>十年过去了，她仍在哀悼她的丈夫。<,>We mourn the loss of traditional values.<,>我们为传统价值观的丧失而哀伤。<,>moun(山)+rn(谐音"人")→山上的人们在哀悼<,>grieve(v.使悲伤)/lament(v.哀叹)/celebrate(v.庆祝)

vice<,>/vaɪs/<,>/vaɪs/<,>n.恶习<,>Smoking is his only vice.<,>吸烟是他唯一的恶习。<,>Gambling can become a destructive vice.<,>赌博可能成为一种破坏性的恶习。<,>The novel explores the vices of urban life.<,>这部小说探讨了城市生活的恶习。<,>发音类似"virus"(病毒)→恶习像病毒一样有害<,>virtue(n.美德)/habit(n.习惯)/addiction(n.瘾)

shot<,>/ʃɒt/<,>/ʃɑːt/<,>n.照相，照片<,>I got some great shots of the sunset.<,>我拍了一些很棒的日落照片。<,>This is my favorite shot from the wedding.<,>这是我在婚礼上最喜欢的照片。<,>Let me take a shot of you with this monument.<,>让我给你和这个纪念碑拍张照片。<,>shot原意"射击"→相机"射击"=拍照<,>photo(n.照片)/picture(n.图片)/snapshot(n.快照)

virus<,>/ˈvaɪrəs/<,>/ˈvaɪrəs/<,>n.病毒<,>The computer was infected by a dangerous virus.<,>电脑感染了一种危险的病毒。<,>Scientists are studying the new virus strain.<,>科学家正在研究新的病毒株。<,>The flu virus spreads quickly in winter.<,>流感病毒在冬季传播很快。<,>vi(生命)+rus(毁灭)→毁灭生命的→病毒<,>bacteria(n.细菌)/germ(n.微生物)/pathogen(n.病原体)

dorm<,>/dɔːm/<,>/dɔːrm/<,>n.宿舍<,>Most freshmen live in campus dorms.<,>大多数新生住在校园宿舍里。<,>The dorm rules prohibit overnight guests.<,>宿舍规定禁止留宿客人。<,>I left my textbook in the dorm.<,>我把课本落在宿舍了。<,>dormitory的缩写形式<,>apartment(n.公寓)/hostel(n.青年旅舍)/barracks(n.兵营)

erupt<,>/ɪˈrʌpt/<,>/ɪˈrʌpt/<,>v.爆发；喷出<,>The volcano erupted after decades of silence.<,>沉寂数十年后，火山爆发了。<,>Violence erupted during the protest.<,>抗议活动中爆发了暴力事件。<,>Laughter erupted from the audience.<,>观众中爆发出笑声。<,>e(出)+rupt(断裂)→断裂而出→爆发<,>explode(v.爆炸)/burst(v.突然发生)/outbreak(n.爆发)
impact<,>/ˈɪmpækt/<,>/ˈɪmˌpækt/<,>n.影响<,>The new policy had a significant impact on the economy.<,>新政策对经济产生了重大影响。<,>The impact of climate change is becoming more evident.<,>气候变化的影响正变得越来越明显。<,>His speech made a deep impact on the audience.<,>他的演讲对观众产生了深远的影响。<,>im(进入)+pact(压)→压进去→影响<,>compact(adj.紧凑的/n.合同)/impair(v.损害)/impart(v.传授)

index<,>/ˈɪndeks/<,>/ˈɪnˌdɛks/<,>n.指数/n.标志/n.指标<,>The stock market index reached a record high today.<,>今天股市指数创下历史新高。<,>The index at the back of the book helps you find information quickly.<,>书后的索引帮助你快速找到信息。<,>Inflation is often used as an index of economic health.<,>通货膨胀常被用作经济健康的指标。<,>in(进入)+dex(指向)→指向内部→索引<,>indices(复数形式)/indicate(v.指示)/indirect(adj.间接的)

claim<,>/kleɪm/<,>/kleɪm/<,>v.声称/v.索取<,>He claims to have seen a UFO last night.<,>他声称昨晚看到了不明飞行物。<,>You can claim your luggage at the baggage claim area.<,>你可以在行李提取区领取你的行李。<,>She filed a claim for compensation after the accident.<,>事故后她提出了赔偿要求。<,>clam(喊叫)+aim(目标)→喊出目标→声称<,>acclaim(v.欢呼/n.称赞)/exclaim(v.呼喊)/proclaim(v.宣布)

embrace<,>/ɪmˈbreɪs/<,>/ɪmˈbreɪs/<,>v.采纳/v.接受<,>The company embraced new technologies to improve efficiency.<,>公司采用新技术来提高效率。<,>She embraced the opportunity to study abroad.<,>她欣然接受了出国留学的机会。<,>We should embrace different cultures with an open mind.<,>我们应该以开放的心态接纳不同的文化。<,>em(进入)+brace(手臂)→用手臂抱住→接受<,>brace(n.支架/v.支撑)/embarrass(v.使尴尬)/embracement(n.拥抱)

enviable<,>/ˈenviəbl/<,>/ˈɛnviəbəl/<,>adj.值得羡慕的<,>She has an enviable collection of vintage cars.<,>她拥有一批令人羡慕的经典汽车收藏。<,>His enviable position in the company makes many colleagues jealous.<,>他在公司的令人羡慕的职位让许多同事嫉妒。<,>Their enviable lifestyle includes frequent world travels.<,>他们令人羡慕的生活方式包括频繁的世界旅行。<,>envy(羡慕)+able(能...的)→值得羡慕的<,>envious(adj.羡慕的)/environment(n.环境)/envelope(n.信封)

blouse<,>/blaʊz/<,>/blaʊs/<,>n.女衬衫<,>She wore a silk blouse with her business suit.<,>她穿了一件丝绸女衬衫配职业套装。<,>The floral blouse is perfect for spring outings.<,>这件印花女衬衫非常适合春游。<,>Her blouse was neatly ironed for the interview.<,>为了面试，她的女衬衫熨得很平整。<,>blouse(发音类似"布劳斯")→布做的衣服→女衬衫<,>blossom(n.花朵/v.开花)/blur(v.模糊)/blunt(adj.钝的)

deliver<,>/dɪˈlɪvə(r)/<,>/dɪˈlɪvər/<,>v.递送/v.发表演讲<,>The courier will deliver the package tomorrow morning.<,>快递员明天早上会递送包裹。<,>He delivered an inspiring speech at the graduation ceremony.<,>他在毕业典礼上发表了一场鼓舞人心的演讲。<,>The doctor delivered twins last night.<,>医生昨晚接生了一对双胞胎。<,>de(离开)+liver(自由)→让东西自由离开→递送<,>delivery(n.递送)/liver(n.肝脏)/deliberate(adj.故意的)

rhythm<,>/ˈrɪðəm/<,>/ˈrɪðəm/<,>n.节奏<,>The rhythm of the music made everyone want to dance.<,>音乐的节奏让每个人都想跳舞。<,>She has a natural sense of rhythm when playing the drums.<,>她打鼓时有天生的节奏感。<,>The rhythm of the ocean waves is very soothing.<,>海浪的节奏非常舒缓。<,>rhythm(谐音"瑞泽姆")→有节奏的韵律<,>rhyme(n.押韵)/rhinoceros(n.犀牛)/rhythmic(adj.有节奏的)

code<,>/kəʊd/<,>/koʊd/<,>n.代号/n.密码<,>Please enter your security code to access the system.<,>请输入您的安全密码以访问系统。<,>The spy used a secret code to communicate.<,>间谍使用秘密代号进行交流。<,>The genetic code determines our physical characteristics.<,>遗传密码决定了我们的身体特征。<,>code(谐音"扣的")→扣住秘密的东西→密码<,>decode(v.解码)/encode(v.编码)/coder(n.编码员)

monopoly<,>/məˈnɒpəli/<,>/məˈnɑːpəli/<,>n.垄断<,>The company has a monopoly on the smartphone market.<,>这家公司垄断了智能手机市场。<,>In some countries, tobacco is a government monopoly.<,>在一些国家，烟草是政府垄断行业。<,>Breaking up monopolies promotes fair competition.<,>打破垄断促进公平竞争。<,>mono(单一)+poly(卖)→独家售卖→垄断<,>monotony(n.单调)/polygon(n.多边形)/monologue(n.独白)
interfere<,>/ˌɪntəˈfɪə(r)/<,>/ˌɪntərˈfɪr/<,>adj.干涉/adj.妨碍<,>Please don't interfere with my work.<,>请不要干涉我的工作。<,>Loud music can interfere with your concentration.<,>嘈杂的音乐会妨碍你的注意力。<,>The bad weather interfered with our travel plans.<,>恶劣的天气妨碍了我们的旅行计划。<,>inter(在...之间)+fere(打击)→在中间打击→干涉<,>intervene(v.干预)/interrupt(v.打断)

contestant<,>/kənˈtestənt/<,>/kənˈtɛstənt/<,>n.参赛者<,>There are twenty contestants in the singing competition.<,>歌唱比赛中有二十位参赛者。<,>The youngest contestant won the first prize.<,>最年轻的参赛者获得了一等奖。<,>Each contestant will have three minutes to perform.<,>每位参赛者有三分钟的表演时间。<,>contest(比赛)+ant(人)→参赛者<,>competitor(n.竞争者)/participant(n.参与者)

ridiculous<,>/rɪˈdɪkjələs/<,>/rɪˈdɪkjələs/<,>adj.滑稽的/adj.可笑的<,>That's a ridiculous idea!<,>那是个可笑的想法！<,>He looked ridiculous in that oversized hat.<,>他戴那顶过大的帽子看起来很滑稽。<,>The price they're asking is absolutely ridiculous.<,>他们要的价格简直荒谬可笑。<,>rid(笑)+iculous(形容词后缀)→可笑的<,>ludicrous(adj.荒唐可笑的)/absurd(adj.荒谬的)

glamorous<,>/ˈɡlæmərəs/<,>/ˈɡlæmərəs/<,>adj.有魅力的/adj.迷人的<,>She looked glamorous in her evening gown.<,>她穿着晚礼服看起来很迷人。<,>Being a movie star seems like a glamorous job.<,>当电影明星似乎是份有魅力的工作。<,>The magazine showed the glamorous lives of celebrities.<,>杂志展示了名人们迷人的生活。<,>glamor(魅力)+ous(形容词后缀)→有魅力的<,>gorgeous(adj.华丽的)/charming(adj.迷人的)

mall<,>/mɔːl/<,>/mɔl/<,>n.商场<,>Let's meet at the shopping mall this afternoon.<,>我们今天下午在购物商场见面吧。<,>The new mall has over 200 stores.<,>新商场有超过200家店铺。<,>Parking at the mall is always difficult on weekends.<,>周末商场的停车总是很困难。<,>联想：mall发音类似"摩尔"→摩尔商场<,>market(n.市场)/plaza(n.广场)

chronically<,>/ˈkrɒnɪkli/<,>/ˈkrɑːnɪkli/<,>adv.慢性地/adv.持久地<,>He suffers from chronically high blood pressure.<,>他患有慢性高血压。<,>The problem has been chronically neglected.<,>这个问题被长期忽视。<,>She is chronically late for meetings.<,>她开会总是迟到。<,>chron(时间)+ical(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→时间上→持久地<,>acutely(adv.剧烈地)/persistently(adv.持续地)

prolonged<,>/prəˈlɒŋd/<,>/prəˈlɔːŋd/<,>adj.长时间的<,>The prolonged drought caused severe water shortages.<,>长时间的干旱导致严重缺水。<,>She took a prolonged vacation in Europe.<,>她在欧洲度了个长假。<,>Prolonged exposure to the sun can damage your skin.<,>长时间暴露在阳光下会损害皮肤。<,>pro(向前)+long(长)+ed(形容词后缀)→向前延长→长时间的<,>extended(adj.延长的)/lingering(adj.拖延的)

symptom<,>/ˈsɪmptəm/<,>/ˈsɪmptəm/<,>n.症状<,>Fever is a common symptom of the flu.<,>发烧是流感的常见症状。<,>The doctor asked about all my symptoms.<,>医生询问了我所有的症状。<,>These symptoms may indicate a serious condition.<,>这些症状可能表明病情严重。<,>sym(共同)+ptom(落下)→共同落下的表现→症状<,>syndrome(n.综合征)/sign(n.征兆)

compelling<,>/kəmˈpelɪŋ/<,>/kəmˈpɛlɪŋ/<,>adj.引人注目的<,>She gave a compelling performance in the play.<,>她在剧中表现出色，引人注目。<,>The evidence was so compelling that he had to confess.<,>证据如此有力，他不得不认罪。<,>This novel has a compelling storyline.<,>这部小说有个引人入胜的情节。<,>com(完全)+pel(推)+ing(形容词后缀)→完全推动的→引人注目的<,>fascinating(adj.迷人的)/persuasive(adj.有说服力的)

immensely<,>/ɪˈmensli/<,>/ɪˈmɛnsli/<,>adv.非常/adv.极大地<,>I enjoyed the concert immensely.<,>我非常喜欢这场音乐会。<,>Technology has improved our lives immensely.<,>科技极大地改善了我们的生活。<,>She was immensely proud of her son's achievement.<,>她为儿子的成就感到无比自豪。<,>im(不)+mens(测量)+ly(副词后缀)→无法测量的→极大地<,>extremely(adv.极其)/tremendously(adv.惊人地)
species<,>/ˈspiːʃiːz/<,>/ˈspiːʃiːz/<,>n.物种<,>This forest is home to many endangered species.<,>这片森林是许多濒危物种的家园。<,>The scientist discovered a new species of butterfly.<,>这位科学家发现了一种新的蝴蝶物种。<,>Protecting species diversity is crucial for the ecosystem.<,>保护物种多样性对生态系统至关重要。<,>speci(种类)+es→物种<,>specimen(n.标本)/special(adj.特殊的)/specific(adj.特定的)

battle<,>/ˈbætl/<,>/ˈbætl/<,>n.激战/n.战役<,>The soldiers fought a fierce battle for three days.<,>士兵们激战了三天。<,>This was a decisive battle in the war.<,>这是战争中的决定性战役。<,>She's battling against cancer courageously.<,>她正在勇敢地与癌症抗争。<,>bat(打)+tle→战斗<,>batter(v.连续猛击)/battlefield(n.战场)/battalion(n.营)

conflict<,>/ˈkɒnflɪkt/<,>/ˈkɑːnflɪkt/<,>n.冲突<,>The conflict between the two countries lasted for years.<,>两国之间的冲突持续了多年。<,>There's a conflict of interest in this case.<,>这个案件中存在利益冲突。<,>Her work schedule conflicts with family time.<,>她的工作时间与家庭时间冲突。<,>con(共同)+flict(打击)→互相打击→冲突<,>inflict(v.使遭受)/afflict(v.折磨)/friction(n.摩擦)

permeate<,>/ˈpɜːmieɪt/<,>/ˈpɜːrmieɪt/<,>v.渗透<,>The smell of coffee permeated the whole house.<,>咖啡的香味弥漫了整个房子。<,>New ideas are permeating through the organization.<,>新思想正在整个组织中渗透。<,>Water permeated through the cracks in the wall.<,>水从墙缝中渗了进来。<,>per(贯穿)+mea(通过)+te→渗透<,>permeable(adj.可渗透的)/impermeable(adj.不可渗透的)/permeation(n.渗透)

erroneous<,>/ɪˈrəʊniəs/<,>/ɪˈroʊniəs/<,>adj.错误的<,>The report contained several erroneous conclusions.<,>报告中包含几个错误的结论。<,>He was operating under an erroneous assumption.<,>他在一个错误的假设下操作。<,>The erroneous data led to wrong predictions.<,>错误的数据导致了错误的预测。<,>err(错误)+oneous→错误的<,>error(n.错误)/erratic(adj.不稳定的)/errand(n.差事)

compartment<,>/kəmˈpɑːtmənt/<,>/kəmˈpɑːrtmənt/<,>n.车厢/n.隔间<,>She put her bag in the overhead compartment.<,>她把包放在头顶的行李舱里。<,>The train has a separate compartment for smokers.<,>火车有专门的吸烟车厢。<,>The refrigerator has different compartments for different foods.<,>冰箱有不同的隔间来存放不同的食物。<,>com(共同)+part(部分)+ment→分隔的部分→隔间<,>apartment(n.公寓)/department(n.部门)/partition(n.分隔)

metropolitan<,>/ˌmetrəˈpɒlɪtən/<,>/ˌmetrəˈpɑːlɪtən/<,>adj.大都市的<,>He works for the metropolitan police department.<,>他在大都市警察局工作。<,>Metropolitan areas often have higher living costs.<,>大都市地区的生活成本通常更高。<,>The museum displays metropolitan art and culture.<,>博物馆展示大都市的艺术和文化。<,>metro(母亲)+polit(城市)+an→大都市的<,>cosmopolitan(adj.世界性的)/megalopolis(n.特大城市)/urban(adj.城市的)

grip<,>/ɡrɪp/<,>/ɡrɪp/<,>n.抓住<,>He tightened his grip on the rope.<,>他抓紧了绳子。<,>The movie kept me in its grip from start to finish.<,>这部电影从头到尾都吸引着我。<,>She has a firm grip on the situation.<,>她对局势有很好的掌控。<,>gr(抓)+ip→抓住<,>grasp(v.抓住)/grab(v.抓取)/gripe(v.抱怨)

crush<,>/krʌʃ/<,>/krʌʃ/<,>v.压碎/v.压榨<,>Don't crush the eggs when packing them.<,>包装时不要把鸡蛋压碎了。<,>She had a crush on her high school teacher.<,>她曾暗恋她的高中老师。<,>The machine crushes rocks into small pieces.<,>这台机器把石头压碎成小块。<,>cr(压)+ush→压碎<,>crash(v.碰撞)/crust(n.外壳)/rush(v.冲)

prior<,>/ˈpraɪə(r)/<,>/ˈpraɪər/<,>adj.先前的/adj.优先的<,>Prior experience is required for this job.<,>这份工作需要先前的工作经验。<,>This task takes prior over all others.<,>这项任务优先于其他所有任务。<,>He had no prior knowledge of the subject.<,>他对这个课题没有先前的知识。<,>pri(前)+or→先前的<,>priority(n.优先权)/posterior(adj.后面的)/anterior(adj.前面的)
formula<,>/ˈfɔːmjʊlə/<,>/ˈfɔːrmjələ/<,>n.公式<,>The scientist derived a new formula to solve the problem.<,>科学家推导出了一个新公式来解决这个问题。<,>This chemical formula represents water.<,>这个化学式代表水。<,>Babies need special formula if they can't drink breast milk.<,>婴儿如果不能喝母乳就需要特殊配方奶粉。<,>form(形式)+ula(小)→小形式→公式<,>formulate(v.制定/规划)/form(n.形式/v.形成)/formality(n.礼节/手续)

inescapable<,>/ˌɪnɪˈskeɪpəbl/<,>/ˌɪnɪˈskeɪpəbəl/<,>adj.不可避免的<,>Death is an inescapable fact of life.<,>死亡是生命中不可避免的事实。<,>The evidence makes his guilt inescapable.<,>证据使他的罪行无可辩驳。<,>We face inescapable challenges in this project.<,>我们在这个项目中面临着不可避免的挑战。<,>in(不)+escape(逃避)+able(能)→不能逃避的<,>escapable(adj.可避免的)/inevitable(adj.必然的)/unavoidable(adj.无法避免的)

skeptical<,>/ˈskeptɪkəl/<,>/ˈskeptɪkəl/<,>adj.怀疑的<,>Many scientists were skeptical about the new theory.<,>许多科学家对这个新理论持怀疑态度。<,>She gave me a skeptical look when I told her the news.<,>当我告诉她这个消息时，她给了我一个怀疑的眼神。<,>Investors are skeptical about the company's future.<,>投资者对公司的未来持怀疑态度。<,>skept(看)+ical→用怀疑的眼光看<,>cynical(adj.愤世嫉俗的)/doubtful(adj.可疑的)/suspicious(adj.多疑的)

harness<,>/ˈhɑːnɪs/<,>/ˈhɑːrnɪs/<,>v.利用/v.控制<,>We need to harness solar energy more efficiently.<,>我们需要更有效地利用太阳能。<,>The rider harnessed the horse before the race.<,>骑手在比赛前给马套上了马具。<,>Scientists are trying to harness the power of nuclear fusion.<,>科学家们正试图控制核聚变的力量。<,>har(军队)+ness→像军队一样控制<,>rein(n.缰绳/v.控制)/utilize(v.利用)/exploit(v.开发/v.剥削)

destination<,>/ˌdestɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌdestɪˈneɪʃn/<,>n.目的地<,>Paris is our final destination for this trip.<,>巴黎是我们这次旅行的最终目的地。<,>The package reached its destination safely.<,>包裹安全到达了目的地。<,>What's your dream travel destination?<,>你梦想的旅行目的地是哪里？<,>destin(命运)+ation→命运指向的地方<,>destiny(n.命运)/destitute(adj.贫困的)/station(n.车站/位置)

vocational<,>/vəʊˈkeɪʃənl/<,>/voʊˈkeɪʃənl/<,>adj.职业的<,>He's studying at a vocational school for mechanics.<,>他在一所职业技校学习机械。<,>Vocational training is important for job seekers.<,>职业培训对求职者很重要。<,>She received vocational guidance from a counselor.<,>她从顾问那里获得了职业指导。<,>vocation(职业)+al→职业的<,>avocation(n.副业)/professional(adj.专业的)/occupational(adj.职业的)

density<,>/ˈdensəti/<,>/ˈdensəti/<,>n.密度<,>The population density in this city is very high.<,>这个城市的人口密度很高。<,>Lead has a greater density than aluminum.<,>铅的密度比铝大。<,>The fog's density made driving dangerous.<,>浓雾使驾驶变得危险。<,>dens(密集)+ity→密集程度<,>intensity(n.强度)/consistency(n.一致性)/tenacity(n.坚韧)

variance<,>/ˈveəriəns/<,>/ˈveriəns/<,>n.不同<,>There's a wide variance in test scores among students.<,>学生们的考试成绩差异很大。<,>The budget shows variance from last year's figures.<,>预算与去年的数字有差异。<,>Cultural variance makes international business challenging.<,>文化差异使国际商务具有挑战性。<,>vari(变化)+ance→变化产生的不同<,>variety(n.多样性)/variable(adj.多变的)/variation(n.变化)

landmark<,>/ˈlændmɑːk/<,>/ˈlændmɑːrk/<,>n.地标<,>The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark in Paris.<,>埃菲尔铁塔是巴黎的著名地标。<,>The court's decision was a landmark in civil rights.<,>法院的判决是民权运动的里程碑。<,>We used the church tower as a landmark to find our way.<,>我们用教堂的塔作为地标来认路。<,>land(土地)+mark(标记)→土地上的标记<,>bookmark(n.书签)/hallmark(n.特点)/milestone(n.里程碑)

linger<,>/ˈlɪŋɡə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪŋɡər/<,>v.逗留/v.徘徊<,>The smell of coffee lingered in the kitchen.<,>咖啡的香味在厨房里久久不散。<,>He lingered at the door, reluctant to leave.<,>他在门口徘徊，不愿离开。<,>Winter lingers longer in the mountains.<,>冬天在山里停留得更久。<,>ling(长)+er→长时间停留<,>loiter(v.闲逛)/dawdle(v.磨蹭)/remain(v.停留)
luxurious<,>/lʌɡˈʒʊəriəs/<,>/ləˈɡʒʊriəs/<,>adj.奢侈的/adj.豪华的<,>She lives in a luxurious apartment in the city center.<,>她住在市中心的一套豪华公寓里。<,>The hotel offers luxurious amenities for its guests.<,>这家酒店为客人提供豪华的设施。<,>He bought a luxurious car to celebrate his promotion.<,>他买了一辆豪华轿车来庆祝升职。<,>lux(光)+urious(形容词后缀)→光彩夺目的→豪华的<,>luxury(n.奢侈品)/deluxe(adj.高级的)/luxuriant(adj.茂盛的)  

astronomical<,>/ˌæstrəˈnɒmɪkəl/<,>/ˌæstrəˈnɑːmɪkəl/<,>adj.天文数字的<,>The cost of the project was astronomical.<,>这个项目的成本高得惊人。<,>He earns an astronomical salary at his new job.<,>他在新工作中赚取天文数字般的薪水。<,>The price of the painting reached astronomical figures at the auction.<,>这幅画在拍卖会上拍出了天价。<,>astro(星星)+nomical(形容词后缀)→像星星一样数不清的→天文数字的<,>astrology(n.占星术)/astronaut(n.宇航员)/astrophysics(n.天体物理学)  

coordination<,>/kəʊˌɔːdɪˈneɪʃən/<,>/koʊˌɔːrdɪˈneɪʃən/<,>n.协调/n.(肌肉的)协调<,>The dance requires perfect coordination between the partners.<,>这个舞蹈需要舞伴之间完美的协调。<,>He has excellent hand-eye coordination for playing tennis.<,>他打网球时手眼协调能力极佳。<,>The project succeeded due to the good coordination among team members.<,>由于团队成员的良好协调，项目取得了成功。<,>co(共同)+ordin(顺序)+ation(名词后缀)→共同按顺序行动→协调<,>cooperate(v.合作)/coexist(v.共存)/coordinate(v.协调)  

currency<,>/ˈkʌrənsi/<,>/ˈkɜːrənsi/<,>n.货币<,>The euro is the official currency of many European countries.<,>欧元是许多欧洲国家的官方货币。<,>Foreign currency exchange rates fluctuate daily.<,>外币汇率每天都在波动。<,>Cryptocurrency has become a popular investment option.<,>加密货币已成为流行的投资选择。<,>curr(跑)+ency(名词后缀)→流通的东西→货币<,>current(adj.当前的)/occur(v.发生)/recur(v.复发)  

blame<,>/bleɪm/<,>/bleɪm/<,>v.谴责<,>Don't blame others for your mistakes.<,>不要把自己的错误归咎于他人。<,>The manager blamed the team for the project's failure.<,>经理因项目失败而责备团队。<,>She was blamed for the accident, though it wasn't her fault.<,>虽然事故不是她的错，但她受到了谴责。<,>b(不)+lame(跛的)→不跛的人被指责→谴责<,>flame(n.火焰)/fame(n.名声)/lame(adj.跛的)  

dismiss<,>/dɪsˈmɪs/<,>/dɪsˈmɪs/<,>v.解雇<,>The company dismissed several employees due to budget cuts.<,>由于预算削减，公司解雇了几名员工。<,>The teacher dismissed the class early today.<,>老师今天提前下课了。<,>He was dismissed from his position for misconduct.<,>他因行为不端被解职。<,>dis(分开)+miss(送)→送走→解雇<,>missile(n.导弹)/mission(n.任务)/remiss(adj.疏忽的)  

testify<,>/ˈtestɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈtestɪfaɪ/<,>v.作证/v.证明/v.检验<,>The witness will testify in court tomorrow.<,>证人明天将在法庭上作证。<,>His actions testify to his honesty.<,>他的行为证明了他的诚实。<,>The experiment will testify the effectiveness of the new drug.<,>这个实验将检验新药的有效性。<,>test(测试)+ify(动词后缀)→用测试证明→作证<,>testament(n.遗嘱)/contest(v.竞争)/protest(v.抗议)  

qualify<,>/ˈkwɒlɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈkwɑːlɪfaɪ/<,>v.使有资格<,>This certificate qualifies you to teach English.<,>这个证书使你有资格教英语。<,>She qualified for the finals after winning the semifinal match.<,>她在半决赛获胜后获得了决赛资格。<,>His experience qualifies him for the managerial position.<,>他的经验使他具备担任管理职位的资格。<,>qual(质量)+ify(动词后缀)→使达到质量标准→使有资格<,>quality(n.质量)/qualification(n.资格)/disqualify(v.取消资格)  

inquire<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪər/<,>v.询问<,>I'll inquire about the train schedule at the station.<,>我会在车站询问火车时刻表。<,>The police are inquiring into the cause of the accident.<,>警方正在调查事故原因。<,>She inquired whether the job position was still available.<,>她询问这个职位是否仍然空缺。<,>in(内)+quire(寻求)→向内寻求→询问<,>acquire(v.获得)/require(v.要求)/enquire(v.询问)  

emphasize<,>/ˈemfəsaɪz/<,>/ˈemfəsaɪz/<,>v.强调<,>The teacher emphasized the importance of punctuality.<,>老师强调了守时的重要性。<,>He emphasized his point by raising his voice.<,>他提高声音强调自己的观点。<,>The report emphasizes the need for environmental protection.<,>报告强调了环境保护的必要性。<,>em(使)+phas(显示)+ize(动词后缀)→使显示出来→强调<,>emphasis(n.重点)/emphatic(adj.强调的)/phase(n.阶段)
overwhelming<,>/ˌəʊvəˈwelmɪŋ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈwelmɪŋ/<,>adj.压倒性的<,>The team had an overwhelming victory.<,>这个团队取得了压倒性的胜利。<,>She felt an overwhelming sense of gratitude.<,>她感到无比感激。<,>The evidence was overwhelming.<,>证据确凿。<,>over(超过)+whelm(压倒)+ing→压倒性的<,>underwhelming(adj. 令人失望的)/overbearing(adj. 专横的)

flame<,>/fleɪm/<,>/fleɪm/<,>n.火焰<,>The flames spread quickly through the building.<,>火焰迅速蔓延到整栋建筑。<,>Her anger flamed up suddenly.<,>她的怒火突然爆发。<,>The candle flame flickered in the wind.<,>烛火在风中摇曳。<,>fl(飞)+ame(火)→飞舞的火→火焰<,>blame(v. 责备)/frame(n. 框架)

imitate<,>/ˈɪmɪteɪt/<,>/ˈɪmɪteɪt/<,>v.模仿<,>Children often imitate their parents' behavior.<,>孩子们经常模仿父母的行为。<,>He can imitate the president's voice perfectly.<,>他能完美模仿总统的声音。<,>The software imitates human thinking.<,>这个软件模仿人类思维。<,>imit(相似)+ate(使)→使相似→模仿<,>intimate(adj. 亲密的)/irritate(v. 激怒)

handle<,>/ˈhændl/<,>/ˈhændl/<,>n.把手/v.处理<,>He turned the door handle carefully.<,>他小心地转动门把手。<,>She knows how to handle difficult customers.<,>她知道如何应对难缠的顾客。<,>This suitcase has a broken handle.<,>这个手提箱的把手坏了。<,>hand(手)+le→用手操作的东西→把手<,>handsome(adj. 英俊的)/handful(n. 一把)

drought<,>/draʊt/<,>/draʊt/<,>n.干旱<,>The drought lasted for three months.<,>干旱持续了三个月。<,>Farmers suffered heavy losses due to the drought.<,>农民因干旱遭受重大损失。<,>Water conservation is important during a drought.<,>干旱期间节约用水很重要。<,>dr(干)+ought→干旱<,>draught(n. 通风)/doubt(n. 怀疑)

drummer<,>/ˈdrʌmə(r)/<,>/ˈdrʌmər/<,>n.鼓手<,>The drummer kept perfect time throughout the concert.<,>鼓手在整个音乐会中都保持着完美的节奏。<,>She's the best drummer in the band.<,>她是乐队里最好的鼓手。<,>The drummer's solo was amazing.<,>鼓手的独奏令人惊叹。<,>drum(鼓)+er(人)→打鼓的人→鼓手<,>dreamer(n. 梦想家)/dumber(adj. 更笨的)

revive<,>/rɪˈvaɪv/<,>/rɪˈvaɪv/<,>v.复兴/v.复苏<,>The doctor managed to revive the patient.<,>医生成功使病人苏醒过来。<,>They are trying to revive the old tradition.<,>他们正试图复兴这个古老的传统。<,>A cup of coffee revived me.<,>一杯咖啡让我恢复了精神。<,>re(重新)+viv(生命)+e→重新获得生命→复苏<,>revise(v. 修订)/survive(v. 生存)

vulnerable<,>/ˈvʌlnərəbl/<,>/ˈvʌlnərəbl/<,>adj.脆弱的/adj.易受影响的<,>Children are particularly vulnerable to this disease.<,>儿童特别容易感染这种疾病。<,>The system is vulnerable to cyber attacks.<,>这个系统容易受到网络攻击。<,>He seemed vulnerable after the loss.<,>失败后他看起来很脆弱。<,>vuln(伤)+er+able→容易受伤的→脆弱的<,>invulnerable(adj. 无敌的)/voluntary(adj. 自愿的)

spot<,>/spɒt/<,>/spɑːt/<,>n.点/n.地点/v.发现<,>There's a red spot on your shirt.<,>你衬衫上有个红点。<,>This is my favorite spot in the park.<,>这是公园里我最喜欢的地方。<,>I spotted a mistake in the report.<,>我发现了报告中的一个错误。<,>s(小)+pot(点)→小点→斑点<,>sport(n. 运动)/spout(v. 喷出)

suppress<,>/səˈpres/<,>/səˈpres/<,>v.镇压/v.压制<,>The government suppressed the rebellion.<,>政府镇压了叛乱。<,>She suppressed a laugh.<,>她忍住没笑出来。<,>This medicine helps suppress coughs.<,>这种药有助于止咳。<,>sup(下)+press(压)→压下去→压制<,>express(v. 表达)/oppress(v. 压迫)
diminish<,>/dɪˈmɪnɪʃ/<,>/dɪˈmɪnɪʃ/<,>v.减少<,>The water supply will diminish if we don't conserve it.<,>如果我们不节约用水，水资源将会减少。<,>His influence diminished over time.<,>随着时间的推移，他的影响力减弱了。<,>The pain should diminish after taking the medicine.<,>服药后疼痛应该会减轻。<,>di(向下)+min(小)+ish(动词后缀)→使变小→减少<,>demolish(v. 拆除)/vanish(v. 消失)

reconcile<,>/ˈrekənsaɪl/<,>/ˈrɛkənˌsaɪl/<,>v.使一致/v.使和解/v.调解<,>It's hard to reconcile his words with his actions.<,>很难将他的言行统一起来。<,>They finally reconciled after years of conflict.<,>经过多年的冲突，他们终于和解了。<,>The mediator helped reconcile the two parties.<,>调解员帮助双方达成和解。<,>re(重新)+con(一起)+cile(召集)→重新召集到一起→和解<,>conciliate(v. 安抚)/resemble(v. 相似)

artificial<,>/ˌɑːtɪˈfɪʃl/<,>/ˌɑrtəˈfɪʃəl/<,>adj.人造的/adj.虚伪的<,>The flowers are artificial, not real.<,>这些花是人造的，不是真的。<,>She gave an artificial smile.<,>她露出了虚伪的微笑。<,>Artificial intelligence is changing our lives.<,>人工智能正在改变我们的生活。<,>art(艺术)+fic(做)+ial(形容词后缀)→人工做出来的→人造的<,>authentic(adj. 真实的)/artistic(adj. 艺术的)

athletic<,>/æθˈletɪk/<,>/æθˈlɛtɪk/<,>adj.强壮的/adj.擅长运动的/adj.运动的/adj.运动员的<,>He has an athletic build.<,>他有强壮的体格。<,>She is very athletic and plays three sports.<,>她非常擅长运动，参加了三项运动。<,>The school has excellent athletic facilities.<,>学校有极好的运动设施。<,>athlet(运动员)+ic(形容词后缀)→运动员的<,>aesthetic(adj. 美学的)/sympathetic(adj. 同情的)

confrontational<,>/ˌkɒnfrʌnˈteɪʃənl/<,>/ˌkɑːnfrənˈteɪʃənl/<,>adj.对抗的/adj.有敌意的<,>He has a confrontational attitude.<,>他有一种对抗的态度。<,>The meeting became confrontational.<,>会议变得充满敌意。<,>Avoid being confrontational in discussions.<,>在讨论中避免对抗。<,>confront(对抗)+ation(名词后缀)+al(形容词后缀)→对抗的<,>confidential(adj. 机密的)/congratulation(n. 祝贺)

row<,>/rəʊ/<,>/roʊ/<,>v.划船<,>They rowed across the lake.<,>他们划船穿过了湖。<,>Can you row a boat?<,>你会划船吗？<,>We decided to row to the island.<,>我们决定划船去岛上。<,>row(排)→划船时桨排成一行<,>roe(n. 鱼卵)/raw(adj. 生的)

navigate<,>/ˈnævɪɡeɪt/<,>/ˈnævɪˌɡeɪt/<,>v.航行/v.驾驶<,>He learned to navigate by the stars.<,>他学会了通过星星导航。<,>It's difficult to navigate through the crowded streets.<,>在拥挤的街道上驾驶很困难。<,>The app helps you navigate the city.<,>这个应用帮助你导航城市。<,>nav(船)+ig(驱动)+ate(动词后缀)→驾驶船只→航行<,>negate(v. 否定)/investigate(v. 调查)

panic<,>/ˈpænɪk/<,>/ˈpænɪk/<,>n.惊慌<,>There was panic when the fire alarm went off.<,>火警响起时一片惊慌。<,>Don't panic in an emergency.<,>紧急情况下不要惊慌。<,>She felt a moment of panic when she lost her phone.<,>她丢失手机时感到一阵惊慌。<,>pan(潘神)+ic→潘神引起的恐惧→惊慌<,>picnic(n. 野餐)/pandemic(adj. 流行的)

hostile<,>/ˈhɒstaɪl/<,>/ˈhɑːstl/<,>adj.有敌意的<,>The crowd became hostile.<,>人群变得充满敌意。<,>He gave me a hostile look.<,>他给了我一个敌意的眼神。<,>The two countries have hostile relations.<,>两国关系敌对。<,>host(主人)+ile→主人对不速之客的态度→敌意的<,>hospital(n. 医院)/hospitable(adj. 好客的)

console<,>/kənˈsəʊl/<,>/kənˈsoʊl/<,>v.安慰<,>She tried to console her crying child.<,>她试图安慰哭泣的孩子。<,>Nothing could console him after the loss.<,>失去后没有什么能安慰他。<,>A friend's words can often console us.<,>朋友的话常常能安慰我们。<,>con(共同)+sole(单独)→共同分担孤独→安慰<,>condole(v. 慰问)/consult(v. 咨询)
endanger<,>/ɪnˈdeɪndʒə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈdeɪndʒər/<,>v.使……危险<,>Pollution can endanger wildlife.<,>污染会危及野生动物。<,>Smoking endangers your health.<,>吸烟危害健康。<,>His reckless driving endangered the passengers.<,>他的鲁莽驾驶危及乘客安全。<,>en(使)+danger(危险)→使危险<,>endear(v.使受喜爱)/engage(v.从事/v.吸引)  

prospect<,>/ˈprɒspekt/<,>/ˈprɑːspekt/<,>n.前景<,>The job offers good career prospects.<,>这份工作有良好的职业前景。<,>There is little prospect of rain today.<,>今天下雨的可能性很小。<,>She was excited by the prospect of traveling abroad.<,>她对出国旅行的前景感到兴奋。<,>pro(向前)+spect(看)→向前看→前景<,>perspective(n.观点/n.透视)/prosper(v.繁荣/v.成功)  

discern<,>/dɪˈsɜːn/<,>/dɪˈsɜːrn/<,>v.识别<,>It was hard to discern his true intentions.<,>很难辨别他的真实意图。<,>She could barely discern the shape in the fog.<,>她几乎无法辨认雾中的形状。<,>The expert can discern genuine antiques from fakes.<,>专家能辨别古董真伪。<,>dis(分开)+cern(区分)→识别<,>concern(n.关心/v.涉及)/decree(n.法令/v.颁布)  

judicial<,>/dʒuːˈdɪʃl/<,>/dʒuːˈdɪʃl/<,>adj.司法的<,>The case will go through judicial review.<,>此案将接受司法审查。<,>He wears a judicial robe in court.<,>他在法庭上穿着法官袍。<,>The judicial system must remain impartial.<,>司法系统必须保持公正。<,>jud(判断)+icial(形容词后缀)→司法的<,>prejudicial(adj.不利的)/judicious(adj.明智的)  

impair<,>/ɪmˈpeə(r)/<,>/ɪmˈper/<,>v.损害<,>Lack of sleep can impair your judgment.<,>睡眠不足会损害判断力。<,>The accident impaired his vision.<,>事故损害了他的视力。<,>Noise pollution impairs hearing over time.<,>噪音污染会逐渐损害听力。<,>im(不)+pair(配对)→使不完整→损害<,>repair(v.修理)/despair(n.绝望)  

motel<,>/məʊˈtel/<,>/moʊˈtel/<,>n.汽车旅馆<,>We stayed at a roadside motel.<,>我们住在路边的汽车旅馆。<,>The motel offers free parking.<,>这家汽车旅馆提供免费停车。<,>Motels are convenient for road trips.<,>汽车旅馆适合公路旅行。<,>motor(汽车)+hotel(旅馆)→汽车旅馆<,>hostel(n.青年旅舍)/hotelier(n.旅馆老板)  

signal<,>/ˈsɪɡnəl/<,>/ˈsɪɡnəl/<,>v.标志/n.信号<,>The bell signals the end of class.<,>铃声标志着下课。<,>She signaled to turn left.<,>她打了左转信号。<,>This agreement signals a new era.<,>该协议标志着一个新时代。<,>sign(标记)+al→信号<,>signature(n.签名)/significant(adj.重要的)  

therapy<,>/ˈθerəpi/<,>/ˈθerəpi/<,>n.疗法<,>Physical therapy helped his recovery.<,>物理疗法帮助他康复。<,>Music therapy can reduce stress.<,>音乐疗法可以减压。<,>She specializes in speech therapy.<,>她专攻言语治疗。<,>therap(治疗)+y→疗法<,>therapist(n.治疗师)/theorem(n.定理)  

diverse<,>/daɪˈvɜːs/<,>/daɪˈvɜːrs/<,>adj.各种各样的<,>The city has a diverse population.<,>这座城市人口多样。<,>We offer diverse courses to choose from.<,>我们提供多样化的课程选择。<,>The ecosystem is biologically diverse.<,>这个生态系统生物种类丰富。<,>di(分开)+vers(转)+e→转向不同方向→多样的<,>divert(v.转移)/diversion(n.转移)  

conserve<,>/kənˈsɜːv/<,>/kənˈsɜːrv/<,>v.保留/v.保护<,>We must conserve water during droughts.<,>干旱期间必须节约用水。<,>The museum works to conserve ancient artifacts.<,>博物馆致力于保护古代文物。<,>Turning off lights helps conserve energy.<,>关灯有助于节约能源。<,>con(共同)+serve(保持)→共同保持→保护<,>reserve(v.保留/n.储备)/deserve(v.应得)
adaptation<,>/ˌædəpˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌædəpˈteɪʃn/<,>n.改编版/n.适应<,>This film is an adaptation of a famous novel.<,>这部电影是一部著名小说的改编版。<,>Animals show remarkable adaptation to their environment.<,>动物对环境表现出惊人的适应能力。<,>The adaptation process can be challenging for some species.<,>对一些物种来说，适应过程可能具有挑战性。<,>adapt(适应)+tion(名词后缀)→适应/改编<,>adoption(n.收养)/adaption(n.适应，同adaptation)

resist<,>/rɪˈzɪst/<,>/rɪˈzɪst/<,>v.抵制<,>She couldn't resist the temptation of chocolate.<,>她无法抵制巧克力的诱惑。<,>The protesters resisted the new policy.<,>抗议者们抵制新政策。<,>This material resists heat very well.<,>这种材料非常耐热。<,>re(反)+sist(站)→站在对立面→抵制<,>insist(v.坚持)/persist(v.坚持)/desist(v.停止)

convince<,>/kənˈvɪns/<,>/kənˈvɪns/<,>v.使...相信<,>He tried to convince me of his innocence.<,>他试图让我相信他是无辜的。<,>The evidence convinced the jury of his guilt.<,>证据使陪审团相信他有罪。<,>I'm convinced that she's telling the truth.<,>我相信她说的是实话。<,>con(完全)+vince(征服)→完全征服对方→使相信<,>persuade(v.说服)/convert(v.转变)/convict(v.定罪)

burden<,>/ˈbɜːdn/<,>/ˈbɜːrdn/<,>n.负担<,>The financial burden was too heavy for the family.<,>经济负担对这个家庭来说太重了。<,>She didn't want to be a burden to her children.<,>她不想成为孩子们的负担。<,>The donkey carried a heavy burden up the hill.<,>驴子驮着重物上山。<,>burd(负担)+en(名词后缀)→负担<,>bargain(n.交易)/border(n.边界)/boredom(n.无聊)

payroll<,>/ˈpeɪrəʊl/<,>/ˈpeɪroʊl/<,>n.工资总额<,>The company has 200 employees on its payroll.<,>公司有200名员工在工资名单上。<,>Payroll taxes are deducted from employees' salaries.<,>工资税从员工薪水中扣除。<,>The payroll department handles all salary payments.<,>工资部门处理所有薪资支付。<,>pay(支付)+roll(名单)→工资名单→工资总额<,>parole(n.假释)/patrol(n.巡逻)/petrol(n.汽油)

unified<,>/ˈjuːnɪfaɪd/<,>/ˈjuːnɪfaɪd/<,>adj.统一的<,>The country became unified after years of division.<,>经过多年的分裂后，这个国家实现了统一。<,>We need a unified approach to solve this problem.<,>我们需要统一的方法来解决这个问题。<,>The team presented a unified front against their opponents.<,>团队在面对对手时表现出统一的立场。<,>uni(单一)+fy(使...化)+ed→统一的<,>identified(adj.被识别的)/unidentified(adj.不明的)/university(n.大学)

hasten<,>/ˈheɪsn/<,>/ˈheɪsn/<,>v.加速<,>We must hasten our preparations for the storm.<,>我们必须加快为暴风雨做准备。<,>The medicine will hasten your recovery.<,>这种药会加速你的康复。<,>He hastened to correct his mistake.<,>他赶紧纠正自己的错误。<,>haste(匆忙)+en(动词后缀)→加速<,>hasten(v.加速)/hazard(n.危险)/harvest(n.收获)

intertwine<,>/ˌɪntəˈtwaɪn/<,>/ˌɪntərˈtwaɪn/<,>v.交织/v.纠缠<,>Their fates were intertwined from childhood.<,>他们的命运从童年起就交织在一起。<,>The vines intertwined around the tree trunk.<,>藤蔓缠绕在树干上。<,>History and culture are often intertwined.<,>历史和文化常常交织在一起。<,>inter(相互)+twine(缠绕)→相互缠绕→交织<,>intervene(v.干预)/intertwist(v.缠绕)/interweave(v.交织)

accommodate<,>/əˈkɒmədeɪt/<,>/əˈkɑːmədeɪt/<,>v.容纳/v.适应<,>The hotel can accommodate 500 guests.<,>这家酒店可容纳500位客人。<,>We need to accommodate the special needs of these students.<,>我们需要适应这些学生的特殊需求。<,>The eye can accommodate to different light levels.<,>眼睛能适应不同的光线强度。<,>ac(向)+com(共同)+mod(方式)+ate→使方式一致→适应<,>commemorate(v.纪念)/accumulate(v.积累)/commute(v.通勤)

prescribe<,>/prɪˈskraɪb/<,>/prɪˈskraɪb/<,>v.开处方<,>The doctor prescribed some antibiotics for my infection.<,>医生为我的感染开了一些抗生素。<,>The law prescribes severe penalties for this crime.<,>法律规定对这种罪行处以重罚。<,>The teacher prescribed a list of books for summer reading.<,>老师开了一份暑期阅读书单。<,>pre(前)+scribe(写)→事先写好→开处方<,>describe(v.描述)/subscribe(v.订阅)/proscribe(v.禁止)
construction<,>/kənˈstrʌkʃ(ə)n/<,>/kənˈstrʌkʃən/<,>n.建筑<,>The construction of the new bridge will take two years.<,>新桥的建设将需要两年时间。<,>He works in the construction industry.<,>他在建筑行业工作。<,>The building is under construction.<,>这座建筑正在施工中。<,>con(共同)+struct(建造)+ion(名词后缀)→共同建造→建筑<,>destruction(n.破坏)/instruction(n.指示)/reconstruction(n.重建)

endure<,>/ɪnˈdjʊə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈdʊr/<,>v.忍受<,>She had to endure a lot of pain after the surgery.<,>手术后她不得不忍受很多痛苦。<,>I can't endure this noise any longer.<,>我再也无法忍受这种噪音了。<,>Their love endured many hardships.<,>他们的爱情经受了许多艰难困苦。<,>en(使)+dure(持续)→使持续→忍受<,>endurance(n.耐力)/durable(adj.耐用的)/during(prep.在...期间)

election<,>/ɪˈlekʃ(ə)n/<,>/ɪˈlekʃən/<,>n.选举<,>The presidential election will be held next month.<,>总统选举将于下个月举行。<,>He won the election by a narrow margin.<,>他以微弱优势赢得了选举。<,>Voter turnout was low in this election.<,>这次选举的投票率很低。<,>e(出)+lect(选择)+ion(名词后缀)→选出来→选举<,>selection(n.选择)/erection(n.建立)/electric(adj.电的)

jury<,>/ˈdʒʊəri/<,>/ˈdʒʊri/<,>n.陪审团<,>The jury reached a unanimous verdict.<,>陪审团达成了一致裁决。<,>She served on a jury last year.<,>她去年担任了陪审员。<,>The jury is still deliberating.<,>陪审团仍在审议中。<,>jur(法律)+y(名词后缀)→法律相关的人→陪审团<,>injury(n.伤害)/juror(n.陪审员)/jurisdiction(n.司法权)

glory<,>/ˈɡlɔːri/<,>/ˈɡlɔːri/<,>n.光荣/荣誉<,>He fought for the glory of his country.<,>他为祖国的荣誉而战。<,>The team returned home in glory.<,>球队载誉而归。<,>She basked in the glory of her success.<,>她沉浸在成功的荣耀中。<,>glo(发光)+ry(名词后缀)→发光的东西→光荣<,>glorious(adj.光荣的)/gory(adj.血腥的)/story(n.故事)

sew<,>/səʊ/<,>/soʊ/<,>v.缝上/缝纫<,>She learned to sew when she was a child.<,>她小时候学会了缝纫。<,>Can you sew this button back on for me?<,>你能帮我把这个纽扣缝回去吗？<,>He sewed a patch onto his jeans.<,>他在牛仔裤上缝了一个补丁。<,>s(形似针线)+ew(发音似"缝")→缝纫<,>sow(v.播种)/saw(n.锯子)/sewer(n.下水道)

sector<,>/ˈsektə(r)/<,>/ˈsektər/<,>n.部门<,>The technology sector is growing rapidly.<,>科技部门正在快速增长。<,>She works in the public sector.<,>她在公共部门工作。<,>This is a problem affecting all sectors of society.<,>这是一个影响社会所有部门的问题。<,>sect(切割)+or(名词后缀)→切割出来的部分→部门<,>section(n.部分)/insect(n.昆虫)/secret(adj.秘密的)

hazardous<,>/ˈhæzədəs/<,>/ˈhæzərdəs/<,>adj.危险的<,>Smoking is hazardous to your health.<,>吸烟对健康有害。<,>The chemicals are hazardous if inhaled.<,>这些化学品吸入后很危险。<,>It's hazardous to drive in this storm.<,>在这种暴风雨中开车很危险。<,>hazard(危险)+ous(形容词后缀)→危险的<,>hazard(n.危险)/hard(adj.硬的)/haphazard(adj.随意的)

deprive<,>/dɪˈpraɪv/<,>/dɪˈpraɪv/<,>v.剥夺<,>The court deprived him of his parental rights.<,>法庭剥夺了他的父母权利。<,>Sleep deprivation can affect your health.<,>睡眠剥夺会影响你的健康。<,>They were deprived of food for three days.<,>他们被剥夺食物三天。<,>de(去掉)+prive(私人)→去掉私人权利→剥夺<,>derive(v.获得)/private(adj.私人的)/deprivation(n.剥夺)

generous<,>/ˈdʒenərəs/<,>/ˈdʒenərəs/<,>adj.慷慨的<,>He was generous with his time and money.<,>他对时间和金钱都很慷慨。<,>She made a generous donation to the charity.<,>她向慈善机构慷慨捐赠。<,>The portions at this restaurant are very generous.<,>这家餐厅的份量非常大方。<,>gen(产生)+erous(形容词后缀)→不断产生的→慷慨的<,>genius(n.天才)/general(adj.一般的)/generate(v.产生)
constrain<,>/kənˈstreɪn/<,>/kənˈstreɪn/<,>v.限制<,>Financial constraints prevented them from expanding the business.<,>财务限制使他们无法扩大业务。<,>The tight schedule constrained our ability to explore the city.<,>紧张的日程限制了我们探索这座城市的能力。<,>The rules constrain what we can do in this area.<,>这些规则限制了我们在这个区域能做的事情。<,>con(共同)+strain(拉紧)→一起拉紧→限制<,>restrain(v.抑制/克制)/constraint(n.约束/限制)/construct(v.建造)  

phenomenon<,>/fəˈnɒmɪnən/<,>/fəˈnɑːmɪnən/<,>n.现象<,>The northern lights are a natural phenomenon.<,>北极光是一种自然现象。<,>This social phenomenon has attracted much attention.<,>这种社会现象引起了很多关注。<,>The scientist studied the unusual weather phenomenon.<,>科学家研究了这种异常的天气现象。<,>phen(出现)+omen(征兆)+on→出现的征兆→现象<,>phenomena(复数形式)/phenomenal(adj.非凡的)/phantom(n.幻影)  

assume<,>/əˈsjuːm/<,>/əˈsuːm/<,>v.假定/v.认为<,>Let's assume the meeting will be postponed.<,>我们假设会议会被推迟。<,>I assumed he knew about the plan.<,>我以为他知道这个计划。<,>She assumed an air of confidence.<,>她装出一副自信的样子。<,>as(加强)+sume(拿)→拿住→认为<,>presume(v.假定)/consume(v.消耗)/resume(v.恢复)  

conscientious<,>/ˌkɒnʃiˈenʃəs/<,>/ˌkɑːnʃiˈenʃəs/<,>adj.有良心的/adj.认真负责的<,>She is a conscientious worker who never cuts corners.<,>她是个认真负责的工人，从不偷工减料。<,>He made a conscientious effort to complete the project on time.<,>他认真努力按时完成项目。<,>The doctor was conscientious about patient care.<,>这位医生对病人护理非常尽责。<,>con(全部)+sci(知道)+entious→全知道的→认真的<,>conscious(adj.有意识的)/science(n.科学)/consensus(n.共识)  

concession<,>/kənˈseʃn/<,>/kənˈseʃn/<,>n.妥协<,>The company made concessions to the workers' demands.<,>公司对工人的要求做出了让步。<,>As a concession, they lowered the price by 10%.<,>作为让步，他们降价了10%。<,>The peace agreement required concessions from both sides.<,>和平协议需要双方都做出妥协。<,>con(共同)+cess(走)+ion→共同走向→妥协<,>access(n.入口)/process(n.过程)/recession(n.衰退)  

suspect<,>/səˈspekt/<,>/səˈspekt/<,>v.怀疑/n.嫌疑犯<,>I suspect he's not telling the truth.<,>我怀疑他没有说实话。<,>The police have arrested a suspect in the robbery case.<,>警方逮捕了抢劫案的一名嫌疑犯。<,>She suspected her colleague of stealing the documents.<,>她怀疑同事偷了文件。<,>sus(下)+pect(看)→向下看→怀疑<,>inspect(v.检查)/respect(v.尊重)/aspect(n.方面)  

sample<,>/ˈsɑːmpl/<,>/ˈsæmpl/<,>n.样本/n.样品<,>The doctor took a blood sample for testing.<,>医生取了血样进行检测。<,>Would you like to try a free sample of our new product?<,>您想试试我们新产品的免费样品吗？<,>The survey was based on a random sample of 1,000 people.<,>这项调查基于1000人的随机样本。<,>sam(相似)+ple→相似的物品→样品<,>example(n.例子)/simple(adj.简单的)/temple(n.寺庙)  

penalty<,>/ˈpenəlti/<,>/ˈpenəlti/<,>n.惩罚<,>There is a penalty for late payment.<,>延迟付款会有罚款。<,>The player received a penalty for breaking the rules.<,>这名球员因犯规受到处罚。<,>The death penalty is controversial in many countries.<,>死刑在许多国家都存在争议。<,>pen(惩罚)+alty→惩罚<,>penal(adj.刑事的)/penance(n.忏悔)/pension(n.养老金)  

representative<,>/ˌreprɪˈzentətɪv/<,>/ˌreprɪˈzentətɪv/<,>n.代表<,>She was chosen as the class representative.<,>她被选为班级代表。<,>The sales representative will visit us next week.<,>销售代表下周会来拜访我们。<,>This painting is representative of his early work.<,>这幅画代表了他早期的作品。<,>re(再)+present(呈现)+ative→再次呈现的人→代表<,>presentation(n.展示)/presence(n.出席)/resident(n.居民)  

soothe<,>/suːð/<,>/suːð/<,>v.安慰/v.减轻<,>The mother soothed her crying baby.<,>母亲安抚她哭泣的婴儿。<,>This cream will soothe your sunburn.<,>这种面霜会缓解你的晒伤。<,>Listening to music can soothe your nerves.<,>听音乐可以舒缓你的神经。<,>soo(看作soon很快)+the→很快就能减轻→安慰<,>smooth(adj.光滑的)/soot(n.煤烟)/soothee(虚构词)
entail<,>/ɪnˈteɪl/<,>/ɪnˈteɪl/<,>v.使需要/v.使必须<,>This project will entail a lot of hard work.<,>这个项目需要付出大量努力。<,>Owning a pet entails great responsibility.<,>养宠物意味着要承担很大责任。<,>The new policy entails changes in our daily routine.<,>新政策要求我们改变日常习惯。<,>en(使)+tail(尾巴)→使有尾巴→引申为"使需要"<,>detail(n.细节)/retail(n.零售)/entangle(v.纠缠)

objective<,>/əbˈdʒektɪv/<,>/əbˈdʒɛktɪv/<,>n.目标/n.目的<,>Our main objective is to improve customer satisfaction.<,>我们的主要目标是提高客户满意度。<,>She set clear objectives for her team.<,>她为团队设定了明确的目标。<,>The research achieved its primary objective.<,>这项研究实现了其主要目的。<,>object(物体)+ive(后缀)→引申为目标<,>subjective(adj.主观的)/objection(n.反对)/project(n.项目)

submit<,>/səbˈmɪt/<,>/səbˈmɪt/<,>v.提交<,>Please submit your report by Friday.<,>请在周五前提交你的报告。<,>He submitted his resignation yesterday.<,>他昨天提交了辞职信。<,>All applications must be submitted online.<,>所有申请都必须在线提交。<,>sub(下)+mit(送)→从下往上送→提交<,>admit(v.承认)/commit(v.承诺)/transmit(v.传输)

identify<,>/aɪˈdentɪfaɪ/<,>/aɪˈdɛntəˌfaɪ/<,>v.认出/v.识别<,>Can you identify the man in this photo?<,>你能认出照片中的这个人吗？<,>The witness identified the suspect in the lineup.<,>证人在队列中指认出了嫌疑人。<,>This app can identify plants from photos.<,>这个应用可以通过照片识别植物。<,>ident(相同)+ify(使)→使相同→识别<,>identity(n.身份)/identical(adj.相同的)/dentist(n.牙医)

infect<,>/ɪnˈfekt/<,>/ɪnˈfɛkt/<,>v.感染<,>The virus can infect both humans and animals.<,>这种病毒可以感染人类和动物。<,>Her enthusiasm infected the whole team.<,>她的热情感染了整个团队。<,>Make sure the wound doesn't get infected.<,>确保伤口不被感染。<,>in(进入)+fect(做)→进入体内作用→感染<,>affect(v.影响)/effect(n.效果)/perfect(adj.完美的)

burial<,>/ˈberiəl/<,>/ˈbɛriəl/<,>n.埋葬<,>The burial ceremony was held at sunset.<,>葬礼在日落时分举行。<,>Ancient burial sites were discovered in this area.<,>这个地区发现了古代墓葬。<,>They attended their grandfather's burial last week.<,>他们上周参加了祖父的葬礼。<,>bury(埋葬)+al(名词后缀)→埋葬<,>marriage(n.婚姻)/trial(n.审判)/denial(n.否认)

genius<,>/ˈdʒiːniəs/<,>/ˈdʒinjəs/<,>n.天才<,>Einstein was a scientific genius.<,>爱因斯坦是科学天才。<,>She has a genius for languages.<,>她有语言天赋。<,>This invention was pure genius.<,>这项发明完全是天才之作。<,>gen(产生)+ius→天生聪明的人→天才<,>genuine(adj.真正的)/genius(n.守护神)/ingenious(adj.灵巧的)

submerge<,>/səbˈmɜːdʒ/<,>/səbˈmɜrdʒ/<,>v.淹没<,>The flood submerged the entire village.<,>洪水淹没了整个村庄。<,>He submerged himself in his work.<,>他全身心投入工作。<,>The submarine submerged to avoid detection.<,>潜艇下潜以避免被发现。<,>sub(下)+merge(沉)→沉下去→淹没<,>emerge(v.出现)/merge(v.合并)/submersion(n.淹没)

stereotype<,>/ˈsteriətaɪp/<,>/ˈstɛriəˌtaɪp/<,>n.刻板印象/n.固有印象<,>We should avoid racial stereotypes.<,>我们应该避免种族刻板印象。<,>The movie challenges gender stereotypes.<,>这部电影挑战了性别刻板印象。<,>He doesn't fit the professor stereotype.<,>他不符合教授的刻板形象。<,>stereo(立体的)+type(类型)→固定的类型→刻板印象<,>prototype(n.原型)/archetype(n.原型)/phenotype(n.表现型)

clarify<,>/ˈklærɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈklɛrəˌfaɪ/<,>v.澄清/v.明确<,>Could you clarify your statement?<,>你能澄清一下你的声明吗？<,>The manager clarified the company's policy.<,>经理明确了公司的政策。<,>This diagram helps clarify the process.<,>这个图表有助于阐明流程。<,>clar(清楚)+ify(使)→使清楚→澄清<,>classify(v.分类)/glorify(v.美化)/verify(v.核实)
conversion<,>/kənˈvɜːʃən/<,>/kənˈvɜːrʒən/<,>n.转变<,>The conversion of the old factory into apartments took two years.<,>这座旧工厂改造成公寓花了两年时间。<,>Currency conversion rates fluctuate daily.<,>货币兑换率每天都在波动。<,>His conversion to vegetarianism surprised his family.<,>他改吃素食的决定让家人很惊讶。<,>con(共同)+vers(转)+ion→共同转变→转化<,>conversation(n.谈话)/version(n.版本)/inversion(n.倒置)  

resident<,>/ˈrezɪdənt/<,>/ˈrezɪdənt/<,>n.居民<,>The residents complained about the noisy construction.<,>居民们抱怨施工噪音太大。<,>She became a permanent resident of Canada last year.<,>她去年成为加拿大永久居民。<,>This building is for senior residents only.<,>这栋楼仅供老年居民居住。<,>re(反复)+sid(坐)+ent→长期坐在某处的人→居民<,>president(n.总统)/residence(n.住所)/residual(adj.残留的)  

aspect<,>/ˈæspekt/<,>/ˈæspekt/<,>n.方面<,>We need to consider every aspect of the problem.<,>我们需要考虑这个问题的每个方面。<,>The cultural aspect of the event was particularly interesting.<,>这次活动的文化方面特别有趣。<,>Her cheerful aspect brightened the room.<,>她愉快的表情让房间都明亮起来。<,>a(朝向)+spect(看)→看的方向→方面<,>respect(n.尊重)/inspect(v.检查)/prospect(n.前景)  

apologize<,>/əˈpɒlədʒaɪz/<,>/əˈpɑːlədʒaɪz/<,>v.道歉<,>He apologized for being late.<,>他为迟到道歉。<,>The company apologized to its customers for the error.<,>公司为错误向客户道歉。<,>She refused to apologize for telling the truth.<,>她拒绝为说出真相而道歉。<,>apo(远离)+log(说话)+ize→说开误会的话→道歉<,>apology(n.道歉)/catalog(n.目录)/dialogue(n.对话)  

decent<,>/ˈdiːsənt/<,>/ˈdiːsənt/<,>adj.像样的/正派的/规矩的<,>He found a decent job after graduation.<,>他毕业后找到了一份体面的工作。<,>It's not decent to talk with your mouth full.<,>满嘴食物说话不礼貌。<,>She comes from a decent family.<,>她出身于正派家庭。<,>de(向下)+cent(分)→价值超过一分钱的→体面的<,>descent(n.下降)/recent(adj.最近的)/accent(n.口音)  

fixture<,>/ˈfɪkstʃə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪkstʃər/<,>n.固定装置<,>The lighting fixtures need to be replaced.<,>这些照明装置需要更换。<,>She became a fixture at the local cafe.<,>她成了那家咖啡店的常客。<,>Bathroom fixtures were on sale last week.<,>上周浴室洁具打折。<,>fix(固定)+ture(名词后缀)→固定物<,>mixture(n.混合物)/texture(n.质地)/future(n.未来)  

institution<,>/ˌɪnstɪˈtjuːʃən/<,>/ˌɪnstɪˈtuːʃən/<,>n.机构<,>Harvard is a prestigious educational institution.<,>哈佛是著名的教育机构。<,>Marriage is an important social institution.<,>婚姻是重要的社会制度。<,>The bank is a financial institution.<,>银行是金融机构。<,>in(进入)+stitut(建立)+ion→建立起来的组织→机构<,>constitution(n.宪法)/substitution(n.替代)/destitution(n.贫困)  

scent<,>/sent/<,>/sent/<,>n.香味<,>The scent of roses filled the air.<,>空气中弥漫着玫瑰的香味。<,>She wears a light floral scent.<,>她用着淡淡的花香香水。<,>The dog followed the rabbit's scent.<,>狗追踪着兔子的气味。<,>s(蛇)+cent(分)→蛇分泌的香味物质<,>sent(v.发送过去式)/cent(n.分)/ascent(n.上升)  

welfare<,>/ˈwelfeə(r)/<,>/ˈwelfer/<,>n.幸福/福利<,>Animal welfare is important to many people.<,>动物福利对很多人来说很重要。<,>The company provides good employee welfare.<,>公司提供良好的员工福利。<,>She works in child welfare services.<,>她在儿童福利部门工作。<,>well(好)+fare(过活)→过得好→福利<,>farewell(n.告别)/warfare(n.战争)/welfare(n.福利)  

subsidy<,>/ˈsʌbsədi/<,>/ˈsʌbsədi/<,>n.补助<,>Farmers receive government subsidies.<,>农民获得政府补贴。<,>The housing subsidy helps low-income families.<,>住房补贴帮助低收入家庭。<,>The arts program relies on public subsidies.<,>这个艺术项目依赖公共补助。<,>sub(下面)+sid(坐)+y→坐在下面支持→补助<,>subside(v.平息)/subsidiary(adj.附属的)/obsidian(n.黑曜石)
superficial<,>/ˌsuːpəˈfɪʃəl/<,>/ˌsuːpərˈfɪʃəl/<,>adj.表面的<,>Her injuries were only superficial.<,>她的伤只是表面的。<,>He has a superficial knowledge of the subject.<,>他对这个学科只有肤浅的了解。<,>Don't be fooled by his superficial charm.<,>不要被他表面的魅力所迷惑。<,>super(超)+ficial(表面)→表面的<,>superficies(n.表面)/superfluous(adj.多余的)  

private<,>/ˈpraɪvət/<,>/ˈpraɪvɪt/<,>adj.私人的<,>This is a private conversation.<,>这是一次私人谈话。<,>He keeps his personal life very private.<,>他对自己的私生活非常保密。<,>The beach is on private property.<,>这片海滩是私人财产。<,>priv(私人的)+ate→私人的<,>privacy(n.隐私)/deprivation(n.剥夺)  

conventional<,>/kənˈvenʃənəl/<,>/kənˈvɛnʃənəl/<,>adj.传统的<,>They prefer conventional medicine to alternative therapies.<,>他们更喜欢传统医学而不是替代疗法。<,>It's conventional to shake hands when you meet someone.<,>见面握手是传统礼节。<,>The design is very conventional and boring.<,>这个设计非常传统且乏味。<,>con(共同)+vent(来)+ional→传统上大家共同遵循的<,>convention(n.惯例)/unconventional(adj.非常规的)  

wonder<,>/ˈwʌndə(r)/<,>/ˈwʌndər/<,>v.想知道/v.好奇<,>I wonder what time it is.<,>我想知道现在几点了。<,>She wondered at the beauty of the sunset.<,>她对日落的美景感到惊叹。<,>I was wondering if you could help me.<,>我在想你是否能帮我。<,>won(赢)+der→赢得好奇心→好奇<,>wander(v.漫步)/ponder(v.沉思)  

tedious<,>/ˈtiːdiəs/<,>/ˈtiːdiəs/<,>adj.冗长的<,>The lecture was long and tedious.<,>这个讲座又长又乏味。<,>Filling out the forms was a tedious process.<,>填写这些表格是个冗长的过程。<,>I find his stories rather tedious.<,>我觉得他的故事相当冗长乏味。<,>ted(厌倦)+ious→令人厌倦的<,>tedium(n.乏味)/teddy(n.泰迪熊)  

subordinate<,>/səˈbɔːdɪnət/<,>/səˈbɔːrdɪnət/<,>adj.从属的/adj.次要的<,>She is subordinate to the manager.<,>她从属于经理。<,>Safety is subordinate to speed in this company.<,>在这家公司，安全从属于速度。<,>He treated his subordinates with respect.<,>他尊重地对待他的下属。<,>sub(下)+ordin(顺序)+ate→顺序在下→从属的<,>coordinate(v.协调)/insubordinate(adj.不服从的)  

frame<,>/freɪm/<,>/freɪm/<,>v.制定/v.拟定〔计划、体制等〕<,>They are framing a new policy.<,>他们正在制定一项新政策。<,>The law was framed to protect consumers.<,>这项法律是为保护消费者而制定的。<,>He framed his answer carefully.<,>他仔细地构思了答案。<,>fram(框架)+e→制定框架→拟定<,>fame(n.名声)/flame(n.火焰)  

smuggle<,>/ˈsmʌɡl/<,>/ˈsmʌɡəl/<,>v.走私<,>They were caught smuggling drugs.<,>他们因走私毒品被抓。<,>He smuggled the letter out of the prison.<,>他把信偷偷带出了监狱。<,>She tried to smuggle her pet into the hotel.<,>她试图把宠物偷偷带进酒店。<,>smug(自鸣得意的)+gle→偷偷得意地走私<,>struggle(v.奋斗)/snuggle(v.依偎)  

reimbursement<,>/ˌriːɪmˈbɜːsmənt/<,>/ˌriːɪmˈbɜːrsmənt/<,>n.返还费用<,>You can claim reimbursement for travel expenses.<,>你可以申请差旅费报销。<,>The company offers full reimbursement for training costs.<,>公司提供培训费用的全额返还。<,>Please submit your receipts for reimbursement.<,>请提交收据以便报销。<,>re(重新)+im(进入)+burse(钱包)+ment→重新进入钱包→返还费用<,>disbursement(n.支付)/reimburse(v.偿还)  

disappear<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɪə(r)/<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɪr/<,>v.消失<,>The sun disappeared behind the clouds.<,>太阳消失在云层后面。<,>My keys have disappeared again!<,>我的钥匙又不见了！<,>The species is in danger of disappearing.<,>这个物种有灭绝的危险。<,>dis(不)+appear(出现)→不出现→消失<,>appear(v.出现)/dismay(v.使沮丧)
inhale<,>/ɪnˈheɪl/<,>/ɪnˈheɪl/<,>v.吸入<,>He took a deep breath to inhale the fresh air.<,>他深吸一口气，吸入新鲜空气。<,>Doctors advise not to inhale smoke.<,>医生建议不要吸入烟雾。<,>She inhaled the scent of the flowers.<,>她闻了闻花香。<,>in(进入)+hale(呼吸)→吸入<,>exhale(v. 呼出)/inhale(v. 吸入)/hale(adj. 强壮的)  

majority<,>/məˈdʒɒrəti/<,>/məˈdʒɔːrəti/<,>n.大多数<,>The majority of people voted for the new policy.<,>大多数人投票支持新政策。<,>She won the election by a large majority.<,>她以压倒性多数赢得了选举。<,>In the majority of cases, the treatment is effective.<,>在大多数情况下，这种治疗是有效的。<,>major(主要的)+ity(名词后缀)→大多数<,>minority(n. 少数)/majority(错误拼写)/major(adj. 主要的)  

memorize<,>/ˈmeməraɪz/<,>/ˈmeməraɪz/<,>v.熟记<,>Students are required to memorize the poem.<,>学生需要熟记这首诗。<,>He memorized all the important dates.<,>他记住了所有重要的日期。<,>She finds it hard to memorize names.<,>她发现很难记住名字。<,>memory(记忆)+ize(动词后缀)→熟记<,>memorandum(n. 备忘录)/memorial(n. 纪念碑)/remember(v. 记住)  

cumulative<,>/ˈkjuːmjələtɪv/<,>/ˈkjuːmjəleɪtɪv/<,>adj.积累的<,>The cumulative effect of pollution is alarming.<,>污染的累积效应令人担忧。<,>His knowledge is the result of cumulative study.<,>他的知识是不断学习积累的结果。<,>The cumulative score determines the winner.<,>累计得分决定胜负。<,>cumulate(积累)+ive(形容词后缀)→积累的<,>accumulate(v. 积累)/cumulus(n. 积云)/cumulative(adj. 累积的)  

trap<,>/træp/<,>/træp/<,>v.捕捉<,>They set a trap to catch the thief.<,>他们设下陷阱捉小偷。<,>The spider trapped the fly in its web.<,>蜘蛛用网捉住了苍蝇。<,>Don’t let your emotions trap you.<,>别让情绪困住你。<,>tr(捕捉)+ap(动作)→捕捉<,>trip(n. 旅行)/trap(v. 捕捉)/strap(n. 带子)  

lofty<,>/ˈlɒfti/<,>/ˈlɔːfti/<,>adj.高耸的；崇高的<,>The lofty mountains were covered in snow.<,>高耸的山脉被雪覆盖。<,>He has lofty ideals about changing the world.<,>他有改变世界的崇高理想。<,>The building’s lofty ceilings made it feel spacious.<,>高高的天花板让建筑显得宽敞。<,>loft(阁楼)+y(形容词后缀)→高耸的<,>loft(n. 阁楼)/lofty(adj. 崇高的)/lift(v. 举起)  

clarity<,>/ˈklærəti/<,>/ˈklærəti/<,>n.清晰，清楚<,>The clarity of his explanation impressed everyone.<,>他清晰的解释给大家留下了深刻印象。<,>She spoke with great clarity.<,>她说话非常清晰。<,>The water was of remarkable clarity.<,>水清澈见底。<,>clear(清晰的)+ity(名词后缀)→清晰<,>clarify(v. 澄清)/clarity(n. 清晰)/clarity(adj. 错误的词性)  

interact<,>/ˌɪntərˈækt/<,>/ˌɪntərˈækt/<,>v.互动<,>Children learn by interacting with others.<,>孩子们通过与他人互动学习。<,>The teacher encouraged students to interact during class.<,>老师鼓励学生在课堂上互动。<,>The app allows users to interact in real-time.<,>这个应用让用户实时互动。<,>inter(相互)+act(行动)→互动<,>interact(v. 互动)/interaction(n. 互动)/interactive(adj. 交互的)  

refine<,>/rɪˈfaɪn/<,>/rɪˈfaɪn/<,>v.提炼；改进，完善<,>They refine crude oil into various products.<,>他们将原油提炼成各种产品。<,>She refined her presentation based on feedback.<,>她根据反馈改进了演讲。<,>The process helps refine your skills.<,>这个过程有助于完善你的技能。<,>re(再)+fine(精细)→再精细→提炼<,>define(v. 定义)/refine(v. 提炼)/confine(v. 限制)  

confer<,>/kənˈfɜː(r)/<,>/kənˈfɜːr/<,>v.授予<,>The university will confer degrees at the ceremony.<,>大学将在典礼上授予学位。<,>They met to confer about the project.<,>他们开会讨论项目。<,>The title was conferred upon him for his achievements.<,>这个头衔因他的成就而授予他。<,>con(共同)+fer(带来)→共同带来→授予<,>confer(v. 授予)/infer(v. 推断)/refer(v. 参考)
anonymous<,>/əˈnɒnɪməs/<,>/əˈnɑːnɪməs/<,>adj.匿名的<,>The author chose to remain anonymous.<,>作者选择保持匿名。<,>An anonymous donor gave a large sum to the charity.<,>一位匿名捐赠者向慈善机构捐了一大笔钱。<,>The message was sent from an anonymous email address.<,>这条信息是从一个匿名邮箱发出的。<,>an(无)+onym(名字)+ous(形容词后缀)→无名字的→匿名的<,>synonymous(adj.同义的)/autonomous(adj.自治的)  

commentator<,>/ˈkɒmənteɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈkɑːmənteɪtər/<,>n.评论员<,>The sports commentator analyzed the match in detail.<,>体育评论员详细分析了这场比赛。<,>She works as a political commentator for a news channel.<,>她是一家新闻频道的政治评论员。<,>The commentator's witty remarks kept the audience engaged.<,>评论员风趣的评论让观众兴致勃勃。<,>comment(评论)+ator(人)→评论的人→评论员<,>commemorate(v.纪念)/commend(v.赞扬)  

keen<,>/kiːn/<,>/kiːn/<,>adj.敏锐的/浓厚的<,>He has a keen eye for detail.<,>他对细节有敏锐的洞察力。<,>She showed a keen interest in photography.<,>她对摄影表现出浓厚的兴趣。<,>The knife has a keen edge.<,>这把刀很锋利。<,>发音类似"keen"(渴望)→渴望了解→敏锐的<,>mean(adj.吝啬的/v.意味)/lean(v.倾斜/adj.瘦的)  

enforce<,>/ɪnˈfɔːs/<,>/ɪnˈfɔːrs/<,>v.强迫/迫使<,>The police enforce traffic laws strictly.<,>警方严格执行交通法规。<,>New regulations will be enforced next month.<,>新规将于下月强制执行。<,>Parents should enforce good habits in their children.<,>家长应该督促孩子养成好习惯。<,>en(使)+force(力量)→用力量使...→强迫<,>reinforce(v.加强)/endorse(v.认可)  

grocery<,>/ˈɡrəʊsəri/<,>/ˈɡroʊsəri/<,>n.杂货店<,>I need to stop by the grocery store on my way home.<,>我回家路上得去趟杂货店。<,>She works part-time at a local grocery.<,>她在当地一家杂货店兼职。<,>Online grocery shopping has become popular.<,>网上杂货购物变得流行起来。<,>groc(大量)+ery(场所)→卖大量日常用品的地方→杂货店<,>greengrocery(n.蔬菜水果店)/grocer(n.杂货商)  

spread<,>/spred/<,>/spred/<,>v.传播/扩散<,>The fire spread quickly through the building.<,>火势在楼内迅速蔓延。<,>She spread butter on the toast.<,>她把黄油涂在吐司上。<,>False information spreads faster than truth.<,>虚假信息比真相传播得更快。<,>s(散开)+pread(看作read读)→散开读→传播<,>sprawl(v.蔓延)/spray(v.喷洒)  

recruit<,>/rɪˈkruːt/<,>/rɪˈkruːt/<,>v.招聘<,>The company is recruiting new graduates.<,>公司正在招聘应届毕业生。<,>The army recruited thousands of volunteers.<,>军队招募了数千名志愿者。<,>We need to recruit more experienced staff.<,>我们需要招聘更多有经验的员工。<,>re(重新)+cruit(看作create创造)→重新创造团队→招聘<,>rescue(v.救援)/refute(v.驳斥)  

justified<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪfaɪd/<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪfaɪd/<,>adj.正当的<,>His anger was justified under the circumstances.<,>在这种情况下他的愤怒是正当的。<,>The price increase seems justified by rising costs.<,>成本上涨似乎证明了涨价是合理的。<,>Her concerns were fully justified.<,>她的担忧完全有道理。<,>just(正义的)+ify(使)+ed→被证明是正义的→正当的<,>justice(n.正义)/adjust(v.调整)  

eccentric<,>/ɪkˈsentrɪk/<,>/ɪkˈsentrɪk/<,>adj.古怪的<,>The eccentric professor wore mismatched shoes.<,>那位古怪的教授穿着不配对的鞋子。<,>Her eccentric behavior often surprises people.<,>她古怪的行为经常让人吃惊。<,>He has some eccentric ideas about education.<,>他对教育有些古怪的想法。<,>ec(出)+centr(中心)+ic→偏离中心的→古怪的<,>ecstatic(adj.狂喜的)/centric(adj.中心的)  

bridge<,>/brɪdʒ/<,>/brɪdʒ/<,>v.架桥于...之上/v.缩小<,>The government plans to bridge the river next year.<,>政府计划明年在河上架桥。<,>This program helps bridge the gap between rich and poor.<,>这个项目有助于缩小贫富差距。<,>Cultural exchanges can bridge misunderstandings.<,>文化交流可以消除误解。<,>b(看作"把")+ridge(山脊)→把山脊连接起来→架桥<,>abridge(v.删节)/fridge(n.冰箱)
neglect<,>/nɪˈɡlekt/<,>/nɪˈɡlɛkt/<,>v.疏忽/v.忽视<,>He neglected his duties and was fired.<,>他玩忽职守被解雇了。<,>Don't neglect your health while working.<,>工作时不要忽视健康。<,>The garden was neglected and overgrown.<,>花园无人打理，杂草丛生。<,>neg(否定)+lect(选择)→不选择→忽视<,>negligent(adj.疏忽的)/negligible(adj.微不足道的)

principle<,>/ˈprɪnsəpl/<,>/ˈprɪnsəpəl/<,>n.道德原则/n.原则<,>He refused to compromise his principles.<,>他拒绝违背自己的原则。<,>The machine works on the principle of gravity.<,>这台机器基于重力原理运作。<,>She's a woman of strong principles.<,>她是个原则性很强的人。<,>prin(第一)+cip(拿)+le→第一位要抓住的东西→原则<,>principal(n.校长/adj.主要的)/palindrome(n.回文)

stain<,>/steɪn/<,>/sten/<,>n.污渍/n.污点<,>There's a coffee stain on your shirt.<,>你衬衫上有咖啡渍。<,>The scandal left a stain on his reputation.<,>丑闻给他的名声留下了污点。<,>This fabric resists stains well.<,>这种面料抗污性很好。<,>st(站)+ain→站着不动的痕迹→污渍<,>sustain(v.维持)/strain(n.压力/v.拉紧)

encourage<,>/ɪnˈkʌrɪdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈkɜːrɪdʒ/<,>v.鼓励<,>The teacher encouraged me to try harder.<,>老师鼓励我再接再厉。<,>Positive feedback encourages good performance.<,>积极的反馈能鼓励良好表现。<,>He encouraged his son to pursue his dreams.<,>他鼓励儿子追求梦想。<,>en(使)+courage(勇气)→使人有勇气→鼓励<,>discourage(v.使气馁)/courage(n.勇气)

convincing<,>/kənˈvɪnsɪŋ/<,>/kənˈvɪnsɪŋ/<,>adj.令人信服的<,>She gave a convincing argument.<,>她提出了令人信服的论点。<,>The evidence was not convincing enough.<,>证据不够有说服力。<,>His performance was convincing and moving.<,>他的表演令人信服又感人。<,>con(完全)+vinc(征服)+ing→完全征服人的→令人信服的<,>convince(v.说服)/convict(v.定罪)

indiscriminately<,>/ˌɪndɪˈskrɪmɪnətli/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈskrɪmɪnətli/<,>adv.不加选择地/adv.不加区分地<,>He spends money indiscriminately.<,>他花钱大手大脚。<,>The pesticide kills insects indiscriminately.<,>这种杀虫剂不分种类地杀死昆虫。<,>She hugged people indiscriminately at the party.<,>她在聚会上见人就抱。<,>in(不)+discriminate(区分)+ly→不加区分地<,>discriminate(v.区分)/indiscreet(adj.轻率的)

resolute<,>/ˈrezəluːt/<,>/ˈrɛzəˌlut/<,>adj.坚定的<,>She was resolute in her decision.<,>她的决定很坚定。<,>We need resolute action to solve this problem.<,>我们需要果断行动来解决这个问题。<,>He remained resolute despite the pressure.<,>尽管有压力，他依然坚定不移。<,>re(反复)+solut(松开)+e→不松开→坚定的<,>resolve(v.解决)/absolute(adj.绝对的)

indicative<,>/ɪnˈdɪkətɪv/<,>/ɪnˈdɪkətɪv/<,>adj.指示的<,>His tone was indicative of anger.<,>他的语气表明他很生气。<,>These symptoms are indicative of the disease.<,>这些症状表明患有该疾病。<,>The survey results are indicative of public opinion.<,>调查结果反映了民意。<,>in(里)+dic(说)+ative→在里面说的→指示的<,>indicate(v.表明)/dedicate(v.奉献)

perish<,>/ˈperɪʃ/<,>/ˈpɛrɪʃ/<,>v.死亡<,>Many people perished in the earthquake.<,>许多人在地震中丧生。<,>The ancient civilization perished long ago.<,>这个古代文明早已消亡。<,>Without water, plants will perish.<,>没有水，植物会枯死。<,>per(完全)+ish(走)→完全走了→死亡<,>cherish(v.珍惜)/publish(v.出版)

philosopher<,>/fəˈlɒsəfə(r)/<,>/fəˈlɑːsəfər/<,>n.哲学家<,>Socrates was a great Greek philosopher.<,>苏格拉底是伟大的希腊哲学家。<,>The philosopher pondered the meaning of life.<,>这位哲学家思考生命的意义。<,>She studies to become a moral philosopher.<,>她学习成为一名道德哲学家。<,>philo(爱)+soph(智慧)+er→爱智慧的人→哲学家<,>philosophy(n.哲学)/sophisticated(adj.复杂的)
recipe<,>/ˈresəpi/<,>/ˈrɛsəpi/<,>n.食谱/n.秘诀<,>This is my grandmother's secret recipe for apple pie.<,>这是我祖母的苹果派秘方食谱。<,>Hard work is the recipe for success.<,>努力工作是成功的秘诀。<,>She shared her recipe for happiness with me.<,>她与我分享了她的幸福秘诀。<,>re(再)+cipe(拿)→再次拿取→秘诀<,>receipt(n.收据)/recipient(n.接受者)

excessive<,>/ɪkˈsesɪv/<,>/ɪkˈsɛsɪv/<,>adj.过度的<,>Excessive drinking is harmful to your health.<,>过度饮酒有害健康。<,>She was criticized for her excessive spending.<,>她因过度消费而受到批评。<,>The excessive noise made it hard to concentrate.<,>过度的噪音让人难以集中注意力。<,>ex(出)+cess(走)+ive→走出去的→过度的<,>access(n.入口)/success(n.成功)

rigor<,>/ˈrɪɡə(r)/<,>/ˈrɪɡər/<,>n.严格/n.严谨<,>The course is known for its academic rigor.<,>这门课程以学术严谨著称。<,>He applied rigor to every aspect of his work.<,>他对工作的每个方面都严格要求。<,>The rigor of military training prepared them well.<,>严格的军事训练使他们准备充分。<,>rig(僵硬)+or→僵硬→严格<,>rigid(adj.僵硬的)/vigor(n.活力)

deficient<,>/dɪˈfɪʃnt/<,>/dɪˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.不足的/adj.缺乏的<,>His diet is deficient in vitamins.<,>他的饮食缺乏维生素。<,>The report was deficient in important details.<,>这份报告缺少重要细节。<,>She feels deficient in social skills.<,>她觉得自己缺乏社交技巧。<,>de(向下)+fic(做)+ient→做得不够→不足的<,>efficient(adj.高效的)/sufficient(adj.充足的)

incompetence<,>/ɪnˈkɒmpɪtəns/<,>/ɪnˈkɑːmpɪtəns/<,>n.无能<,>His incompetence led to the project's failure.<,>他的无能导致了项目失败。<,>The manager was fired for incompetence.<,>经理因无能而被解雇。<,>Incompetence in leadership can be disastrous.<,>领导无能可能是灾难性的。<,>in(不)+competence(能力)→无能<,>competence(n.能力)/incomplete(adj.不完整的)

entitle<,>/ɪnˈtaɪtl/<,>/ɪnˈtaɪtl/<,>v.使具有资格<,>This ticket entitles you to a free drink.<,>这张票使你有资格获得一杯免费饮料。<,>Full-time employees are entitled to paid vacation.<,>全职员工有资格享受带薪假期。<,>The book is entitled "The Art of War".<,>这本书名为《孙子兵法》。<,>en(使)+title(头衔)→使有头衔→使有资格<,>enable(v.使能够)/enlist(v.征募)

adventurer<,>/ədˈventʃərə(r)/<,>/ədˈvɛntʃərər/<,>n.冒险者<,>He was a famous adventurer who explored the Amazon.<,>他是探索亚马逊的著名冒险家。<,>The young adventurer set out to climb Mount Everest.<,>这位年轻的冒险者出发去攀登珠穆朗玛峰。<,>She lived her life as an adventurer, always seeking new experiences.<,>她过着冒险家的生活，总是寻求新的体验。<,>ad(向)+vent(来)+ure(行为)+er(人)→走向未知的人→冒险者<,>venture(n.冒险)/advent(n.到来)

quicken<,>/ˈkwɪkən/<,>/ˈkwɪkən/<,>v.加快<,>She quickened her pace to catch the bus.<,>她加快步伐追赶公交车。<,>The medicine helps to quicken the healing process.<,>这种药物有助于加快愈合过程。<,>His heartbeat quickened when he saw her.<,>见到她时，他的心跳加快了。<,>quick(快)+en(使)→使变快→加快<,>quicken(v.加快)/quicken(v.复活)

divert<,>/daɪˈvɜːt/<,>/daɪˈvɜːrt/<,>v.使转向/v.转移注意力<,>They diverted the river to prevent flooding.<,>他们使河流改道以防止洪水。<,>The magician diverted the audience's attention with his left hand.<,>魔术师用左手转移了观众的注意力。<,>Traffic was diverted due to road construction.<,>由于道路施工，交通被改道。<,>di(分开)+vert(转)→转向分开→转移<,>convert(v.转变)/revert(v.恢复)

recommend<,>/ˌrekəˈmend/<,>/ˌrɛkəˈmɛnd/<,>v.推荐<,>I highly recommend this restaurant.<,>我强烈推荐这家餐厅。<,>The doctor recommended more exercise.<,>医生建议多运动。<,>Can you recommend a good book to read?<,>你能推荐一本好书吗？<,>re(再)+commend(委托)→再次委托→推荐<,>command(v.命令)/commend(v.称赞)
incalculable<,>/ɪnˈkælkjʊləb(ə)l/<,>/ɪnˈkælkjələb(ə)l/<,>adj.不可估量的/adj.无法计算的<,>The damage caused by the earthquake was incalculable.<,>地震造成的损失是不可估量的。<,>Her contribution to the project is incalculable.<,>她对项目的贡献是无法计算的。<,>The value of his advice is incalculable.<,>他的建议价值无法估量。<,>in(不)+calculable(可计算的)→无法计算的<,>calculable(adj.可计算的)/incomparable(adj.无与伦比的)

outcome<,>/ˈaʊtkʌm/<,>/ˈaʊtˌkʌm/<,>n.结果<,>The outcome of the experiment was unexpected.<,>实验的结果出人意料。<,>We are waiting for the outcome of the negotiations.<,>我们正在等待谈判的结果。<,>The final outcome will be announced tomorrow.<,>最终结果将于明天公布。<,>out(出来)+come(来)→出来的东西→结果<,>income(n.收入)/overcome(v.克服)

scaffolding<,>/ˈskæfəldɪŋ/<,>/ˈskæfəldɪŋ/<,>n.脚手架<,>The workers are putting up scaffolding around the building.<,>工人们正在大楼周围搭建脚手架。<,>The scaffolding collapsed during the storm.<,>脚手架在暴风雨中倒塌了。<,>Painting the house requires scaffolding.<,>粉刷房子需要脚手架。<,>scaff(支架)+fold(折叠)+ing→可折叠的支架→脚手架<,>scaffold(n.脚手架)/scuffle(v.扭打)

garage<,>/ˈɡærɑːʒ/<,>/ɡəˈrɑːʒ/<,>n.车库<,>He parked his car in the garage.<,>他把车停在了车库里。<,>We need to clean out the garage this weekend.<,>我们这个周末需要清理车库。<,>The garage door is broken and won't open.<,>车库门坏了，打不开。<,>gar(保护)+age(场所)→保护车的场所→车库<,>garbage(n.垃圾)/garrison(n.驻军)

domestic<,>/dəˈmestɪk/<,>/dəˈmɛstɪk/<,>adj.国内的<,>Domestic flights are usually cheaper than international ones.<,>国内航班通常比国际航班便宜。<,>She prefers domestic products to imported ones.<,>比起进口商品，她更喜欢国内产品。<,>The government is focusing on domestic issues.<,>政府正专注于国内问题。<,>dome(家)+stic→家庭的→国内的<,>dominant(adj.主导的)/dormant(adj.休眠的)

cultivate<,>/ˈkʌltɪveɪt/<,>/ˈkʌltəˌveɪt/<,>v.培养<,>He cultivated a love of reading in his children.<,>他培养了孩子们对阅读的热爱。<,>She is trying to cultivate good study habits.<,>她正在努力培养良好的学习习惯。<,>The school aims to cultivate creativity in students.<,>学校旨在培养学生的创造力。<,>cult(耕种)+ivate→像耕种一样培养<,>culture(n.文化)/cultivate(v.耕种)

formulate<,>/ˈfɔːmjʊleɪt/<,>/ˈfɔrmjəˌleɪt/<,>v.制定/v.规划<,>The committee formulated a new policy.<,>委员会制定了一项新政策。<,>Scientists are formulating a plan to combat the disease.<,>科学家们正在制定对抗该疾病的计划。<,>It took months to formulate the strategy.<,>制定这个策略花了几个月时间。<,>form(形式)+ulate→使形成→制定<,>formula(n.公式)/formative(adj.形成的)

shed<,>/ʃed/<,>/ʃɛd/<,>v.洒(热血)<,>The soldiers shed their blood for their country.<,>士兵们为祖国洒热血。<,>He was willing to shed blood to protect his family.<,>他愿意洒热血保护家人。<,>Many heroes have shed blood for our freedom.<,>许多英雄为我们的自由洒热血。<,>shed(流)+blood(血)→流血→洒热血<,>shred(v.撕碎)/shed(n.棚屋)

worldwide<,>/ˌwɜːldˈwaɪd/<,>/ˈwɜrldˌwaɪd/<,>adv.世界范围地/adv.全世界<,>The company has offices worldwide.<,>这家公司在全世界都有办事处。<,>The news spread worldwide within hours.<,>消息在几小时内传遍全世界。<,>This product is available worldwide.<,>这个产品在全球范围内都有销售。<,>world(世界)+wide(广泛的)→全世界<,>worldly(adj.世俗的)/world-class(adj.世界级的)

fuss<,>/fʌs/<,>/fʌs/<,>n.小题大做<,>She made a fuss over a small mistake.<,>她为一个小错误小题大做。<,>Don't make such a fuss about nothing.<,>别为一点小事大惊小怪。<,>He kicked up a fuss when he didn't get his way.<,>他没得逞就大吵大闹。<,>fuss(忙乱)→为小事忙乱→小题大做<,>fuzzy(adj.模糊的)/fuse(n.保险丝)
contention<,>/kənˈtenʃn/<,>/kənˈtɛnʃən/<,>n.争论<,>There was a lot of contention over the new policy.<,>对新政策有很多争论。<,>His contention was that the project was too expensive.<,>他的论点是这个项目太昂贵了。<,>The debate ended without any clear resolution to the contention.<,>辩论结束时争论仍未得到明确解决。<,>con(共同)+tent(伸展)+ion→共同伸展→争论<,>content(n.内容/adj.满足的)/intention(n.意图)

hijack<,>/ˈhaɪdʒæk/<,>/ˈhaɪˌdʒæk/<,>v.劫持<,>The terrorists tried to hijack the plane.<,>恐怖分子试图劫持飞机。<,>He hijacked the meeting to promote his own agenda.<,>他劫持了会议来推进自己的议程。<,>The radio station was hijacked by hackers.<,>电台被黑客劫持了。<,>hi(high)+jack(抢夺)→高空抢夺→劫持<,>highjack(劫持的变体)/hitchhike(v.搭便车)

dweller<,>/ˈdwelə(r)/<,>/ˈdwɛlər/<,>n.居住者<,>City dwellers often face high living costs.<,>城市居民经常面临高昂的生活成本。<,>The cave dwellers left behind ancient paintings.<,>洞穴居民留下了古老的壁画。<,>Most apartment dwellers don't own their homes.<,>大多数公寓住户不拥有他们的住房。<,>dwell(居住)+er(人)→居住者<,>dwell(v.居住)/sweller(膨胀的人)

buck<,>/bʌk/<,>/bʌk/<,>v.反对/n.美元<,>He always bucks against authority.<,>他总是反对权威。<,>This jacket costs fifty bucks.<,>这件夹克要五十美元。<,>The horse bucked its rider off.<,>马把骑手甩了下来。<,>buck(雄鹿)→雄鹿会顶撞→反对<,>duck(n.鸭子/v.躲避)/luck(n.运气)

view<,>/vjuː/<,>/vju/<,>v.看待<,>How do you view this situation?<,>你如何看待这种情况？<,>The house has a beautiful view of the mountains.<,>这房子能看到美丽的山景。<,>In my view, we should wait for more information.<,>在我看来，我们应该等待更多信息。<,>view(看)→看待<,>review(v.复习/n.评论)/interview(n.面试)

pronoun<,>/ˈprəʊnaʊn/<,>/ˈproʊnaʊn/<,>n.代词<,>"He" and "she" are personal pronouns.<,>"他"和"她"是人称代词。<,>Please replace the noun with a pronoun.<,>请用代词代替这个名词。<,>They asked everyone to state their preferred pronouns.<,>他们要求每个人说明自己偏好的代词。<,>pro(代替)+noun(名词)→代替名词的词<,>noun(n.名词)/pronounce(v.发音)

contribution<,>/ˌkɒntrɪˈbjuːʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːntrɪˈbjuːʃn/<,>n.贡献<,>She made significant contributions to science.<,>她对科学做出了重大贡献。<,>All contributions to the charity are tax-deductible.<,>对慈善机构的所有捐款都可以免税。<,>His contribution to the project was invaluable.<,>他对项目的贡献是无价的。<,>con(共同)+tribute(给予)+ion→共同给予→贡献<,>distribution(n.分配)/attribution(n.归因)

undecided<,>/ˌʌndɪˈsaɪdɪd/<,>/ˌʌndɪˈsaɪdɪd/<,>adj.不确定的<,>I'm still undecided about which college to choose.<,>我还没决定选哪所大学。<,>The jury remained undecided after hours of deliberation.<,>陪审团经过数小时审议后仍未作出决定。<,>Many voters are still undecided about the election.<,>许多选民对选举仍犹豫不决。<,>un(不)+decided(决定的)→未决定的<,>indecisive(adj.优柔寡断的)/decided(adj.明确的)

restrict<,>/rɪˈstrɪkt/<,>/rɪˈstrɪkt/<,>v.限制<,>The law restricts smoking in public places.<,>法律限制在公共场所吸烟。<,>They restricted access to the confidential files.<,>他们限制了对机密文件的访问。<,>His diet is restricted due to health issues.<,>由于健康问题，他的饮食受到限制。<,>re(回)+strict(拉紧)→拉紧限制<,>constrict(v.压缩)/district(n.地区)

reverse<,>/rɪˈvɜːs/<,>/rɪˈvɜːrs/<,>adj.相反的<,>We took the reverse route to avoid traffic.<,>我们走了相反的路线以避开交通。<,>Please press the reverse button to go backwards.<,>请按倒车按钮后退。<,>The results were the reverse of what we expected.<,>结果与我们预期的相反。<,>re(回)+verse(转)→转回去→相反的<,>verse(n.诗句)/diverse(adj.多样的)
grasp<,>/ɡrɑːsp/<,>/ɡræsp/<,>v.理解/v.抓住<,>She quickly grasped the main idea of the lecture.<,>她迅速理解了讲座的主要内容。<,>He grasped the rope tightly to avoid falling.<,>他紧紧抓住绳子以防坠落。<,>It took me a while to grasp the concept.<,>我花了一些时间才理解这个概念。<,>gr(抓)+asp(渴望)→渴望抓住→理解<,>grip(v.紧握)/grab(v.抢夺)/grasping(adj.贪婪的)

provoke<,>/prəˈvəʊk/<,>/prəˈvoʊk/<,>v.激怒<,>His rude remarks provoked her anger.<,>他粗鲁的言论激怒了她。<,>The decision provoked widespread criticism.<,>这个决定引发了广泛的批评。<,>Don't provoke the dog, it might bite you.<,>别激怒那只狗，它可能会咬你。<,>pro(向前)+voke(喊叫)→向前喊叫→激怒<,>evoke(v.唤起)/revoke(v.撤销)/convoke(v.召集)

texture<,>/ˈtekstʃə(r)/<,>/ˈtekstʃər/<,>n.质地<,>The fabric has a smooth texture.<,>这种面料质地光滑。<,>I love the rough texture of this handmade paper.<,>我喜欢这种手工纸的粗糙质地。<,>The cake has a light and fluffy texture.<,>这个蛋糕质地轻盈松软。<,>text(编织)+ure(状态)→编织的状态→质地<,>textile(n.纺织品)/context(n.上下文)/pretext(n.借口)

publicity<,>/pʌˈblɪsəti/<,>/pʌˈblɪsəti/<,>n.宣传<,>The movie gained a lot of publicity before its release.<,>这部电影在上映前获得了大量宣传。<,>Bad publicity can damage a company's reputation.<,>负面宣传会损害公司声誉。<,>They hired a firm to handle their publicity.<,>他们雇了一家公司来处理宣传工作。<,>public(公众的)+ity(状态)→面向公众的状态→宣传<,>publication(n.出版)/publicize(v.宣传)/public(n.公众)

format<,>/ˈfɔːmæt/<,>/ˈfɔːrmæt/<,>n.形式<,>The document should be saved in PDF format.<,>这份文件应以PDF格式保存。<,>The conference will follow a new format this year.<,>今年的会议将采用新的形式。<,>I prefer the digital format of books.<,>我更喜欢电子书的形式。<,>form(形状)+at→形成的样子→形式<,>formation(n.形成)/formula(n.公式)/formal(adj.正式的)

indifferent<,>/ɪnˈdɪfrənt/<,>/ɪnˈdɪfrənt/<,>adj.冷漠的<,>He was indifferent to her feelings.<,>他对她的感受漠不关心。<,>The audience seemed indifferent to the performance.<,>观众对表演似乎无动于衷。<,>She gave an indifferent shrug when asked about her plans.<,>当被问及计划时，她冷漠地耸了耸肩。<,>in(不)+different(不同的)→没有不同→漠不关心<,>different(adj.不同的)/indifference(n.冷漠)/differ(v.不同)

incentive<,>/ɪnˈsentɪv/<,>/ɪnˈsentɪv/<,>n.刺激<,>Bonus payments provide an incentive to work harder.<,>奖金提供了更努力工作的动力。<,>Tax incentives encourage investment in renewable energy.<,>税收激励措施鼓励对可再生能源的投资。<,>The company offers various incentives to its employees.<,>公司为员工提供各种激励措施。<,>in(进入)+cent(唱)+ive→进入歌唱状态→激励<,>incense(n.香)/incantation(n.咒语)/inception(n.开始)

prejudice<,>/ˈpredʒədɪs/<,>/ˈpredʒədɪs/<,>n.偏见<,>She faced prejudice because of her accent.<,>她因为口音而面临偏见。<,>We should judge people without prejudice.<,>我们应该不带偏见地评判他人。<,>His comments revealed deep-seated prejudices.<,>他的评论暴露了根深蒂固的偏见。<,>pre(预先)+judice(判断)→预先判断→偏见<,>judge(n.法官)/judicial(adj.司法的)/adjudge(v.判决)

assumption<,>/əˈsʌmpʃn/<,>/əˈsʌmpʃn/<,>n.假设<,>Their argument is based on a false assumption.<,>他们的论点基于一个错误的假设。<,>Don't make assumptions about people you don't know.<,>不要对你不认识的人做出假设。<,>The theory rests on several key assumptions.<,>这个理论基于几个关键假设。<,>as(加强)+sumpt(拿)+ion→拿住想法→假设<,>consume(v.消耗)/presume(v.假定)/resume(v.恢复)

habitual<,>/həˈbɪtʃuəl/<,>/həˈbɪtʃuəl/<,>adj.习惯的<,>He's a habitual liar.<,>他是个惯于说谎的人。<,>Her habitual lateness annoyed her colleagues.<,>她习惯性的迟到惹恼了同事。<,>Smoking had become habitual for him.<,>吸烟已成为他的习惯。<,>habit(习惯)+ual(的)→习惯的<,>habitat(n.栖息地)/habituate(v.使习惯)/inhabit(v.居住)
sculpture<,>/ˈskʌlp.tʃər/<,>/ˈskʌlp.tʃɚ/<,>n.雕塑<,>The museum has a beautiful sculpture of a horse.<,>博物馆里有一座漂亮的马雕塑。<,>She studied sculpture at art school.<,>她在艺术学校学习雕塑。<,>The sculpture was carved from marble.<,>这件雕塑是用大理石雕刻的。<,>sculp(雕刻)+ture(名词后缀)→雕刻的艺术品→雕塑<,>sculpt(v.雕刻)/sculptor(n.雕塑家)/architecture(n.建筑)

responsibility<,>/rɪˌspɒn.sɪˈbɪl.ə.ti/<,>/rɪˌspɑːn.səˈbɪl.ə.t̬i/<,>n.责任<,>It's your responsibility to finish the project on time.<,>按时完成项目是你的责任。<,>Parents have a responsibility to their children.<,>父母对孩子负有责任。<,>He took full responsibility for the mistake.<,>他为这个错误承担了全部责任。<,>response(回应)+ibility(能力)→能回应的能力→责任<,>respond(v.回应)/responsible(adj.负责的)/liability(n.义务)

manuscript<,>/ˈmæn.jʊ.skrɪpt/<,>/ˈmæn.jə.skrɪpt/<,>n.手稿<,>The author sent his manuscript to the publisher.<,>作者把手稿寄给了出版商。<,>This medieval manuscript is very valuable.<,>这份中世纪手稿非常珍贵。<,>She found an unpublished manuscript in the attic.<,>她在阁楼里发现了一份未出版的手稿。<,>manu(手)+script(写)→手写的→手稿<,>manual(adj.手工的)/script(n.剧本)/postscript(n.附言)

duplicate<,>/ˈdjuː.plɪ.keɪt/<,>/ˈduː.plɪ.keɪt/<,>n.副本/n.复制品<,>Please make a duplicate of this document.<,>请复印这份文件。<,>The painting is a duplicate of the original.<,>这幅画是原作的复制品。<,>He kept a duplicate key in his drawer.<,>他在抽屉里放了一把备用钥匙。<,>du(双)+plic(折叠)+ate→折叠成双→复制品<,>duplicity(n.口是心非)/replicate(v.复制)/complicate(v.使复杂化)

ecosystem<,>/ˈiː.kəʊˌsɪs.təm/<,>/ˈiː.koʊˌsɪs.təm/<,>n.生态系统<,>The rainforest has a delicate ecosystem.<,>雨林有一个脆弱的生态系统。<,>Pollution can damage the marine ecosystem.<,>污染会破坏海洋生态系统。<,>We need to protect the local ecosystem.<,>我们需要保护当地的生态系统。<,>eco(生态)+system(系统)→生态系统<,>ecology(n.生态学)/economy(n.经济)/symbiosis(n.共生)

humorous<,>/ˈhjuː.mər.əs/<,>/ˈhjuː.mɚ.əs/<,>adj.幽默的<,>He told a humorous story at the party.<,>他在聚会上讲了一个幽默的故事。<,>The movie has many humorous moments.<,>这部电影有很多幽默的时刻。<,>She has a very humorous personality.<,>她性格非常幽默。<,>humor(幽默)+ous(形容词后缀)→幽默的<,>humor(n.幽默)/humorless(adj.缺乏幽默感的)/humorousness(n.幽默感)

contaminate<,>/kənˈtæm.ɪ.neɪt/<,>/kənˈtæm.ə.neɪt/<,>v.污染/v.弄脏<,>The river was contaminated by industrial waste.<,>这条河被工业废水污染了。<,>Don't contaminate the food with dirty hands.<,>不要用脏手污染食物。<,>The oil spill contaminated the coastline.<,>石油泄漏污染了海岸线。<,>con(一起)+tamin(接触)+ate→一起接触→污染<,>contamination(n.污染)/contaminant(n.污染物)/decontaminate(v.净化)

orbit<,>/ˈɔː.bɪt/<,>/ˈɔːr.bɪt/<,>n.轨道<,>The satellite is in orbit around the Earth.<,>卫星在地球轨道上运行。<,>The moon's orbit takes about 28 days.<,>月球的轨道周期约为28天。<,>The spacecraft entered Mars' orbit.<,>航天器进入了火星轨道。<,>orb(圆圈)+it(走)→走圆圈→轨道<,>orbital(adj.轨道的)/orb(n.球体)/orbit(v.绕轨道运行)

evolve<,>/ɪˈvɒlv/<,>/ɪˈvɑːlv/<,>v.进化<,>Humans evolved from apes.<,>人类是从猿类进化而来的。<,>The company has evolved over the years.<,>这些年来公司不断发展。<,>The technology continues to evolve rapidly.<,>这项技术继续快速发展。<,>e(出)+volve(转)→转出来→进化<,>evolution(n.进化)/involve(v.包含)/revolve(v.旋转)

skyrocket<,>/ˈskaɪˌrɒk.ɪt/<,>/ˈskaɪˌrɑː.kɪt/<,>v.猛增<,>Prices have skyrocketed in recent months.<,>最近几个月价格猛涨。<,>The company's profits skyrocketed after the new product launch.<,>新产品推出后公司利润猛增。<,>Unemployment rates skyrocketed during the crisis.<,>危机期间失业率猛增。<,>sky(天空)+rocket(火箭)→像火箭一样冲上天空→猛增<,>rocket(n.火箭/v.迅速上升)/soar(v.高飞)/plummet(v.暴跌)
portion<,>/ˈpɔːʃn/<,>/ˈpɔːrʃn/<,>n.部分<,>She only ate a small portion of the meal.<,>她只吃了一小部分饭菜。<,>A large portion of the budget was spent on education.<,>预算的一大部分花在了教育上。<,>He divided the cake into equal portions for everyone.<,>他把蛋糕平均分成几份给大家。<,>port(部分)+ion(名词后缀)→部分<,>proportion(n.比例)/apportion(v.分配)  

cautious<,>/ˈkɔːʃəs/<,>/ˈkɔːʃəs/<,>adj.谨慎的<,>Be cautious when crossing the street.<,>过马路时要小心。<,>He gave a cautious reply to the sensitive question.<,>他对这个敏感问题给出了谨慎的回答。<,>The doctor was cautious about the patient's recovery.<,>医生对病人的康复持谨慎态度。<,>caut(小心)+ious(形容词后缀)→谨慎的<,>conscious(adj.有意识的)/curious(adj.好奇的)
