assassinate<,>/əˈsæsɪneɪt/<,>/əˈsæsɪneɪt/<,>v.刺杀/v.暗杀<,>The president was assassinated during the parade.<,>总统在游行期间被暗杀。<,>The plot to assassinate the leader was uncovered.<,>刺杀领导人的阴谋被揭露了。<,>Historians debate who actually assassinated Julius Caesar.<,>历史学家们对谁真正刺杀了尤利乌斯·凯撒存在争议。<,>ass(驴)+ass(驴)+inate→像驴一样愚蠢地杀人→暗杀<,>assassin(n.刺客)/assassination(n.暗杀)  

narrow<,>/ˈnærəʊ/<,>/ˈnæroʊ/<,>v.变窄/v.缩小<,>The road narrows ahead, so drive carefully.<,>前方道路变窄，小心驾驶。<,>We need to narrow down our options.<,>我们需要缩小选择范围。<,>His eyes narrowed when he heard the news.<,>听到这个消息时，他眯起了眼睛。<,>nar(狭窄)+row(排)→排成狭窄的一列→变窄<,>arrow(n.箭)/borrow(v.借)  

botanical<,>/bəˈtænɪkl/<,>/bəˈtænɪkl/<,>adj.植物学的<,>The botanical garden has over 10,000 plant species.<,>这个植物园有一万多种植物。<,>She's doing botanical research in the Amazon.<,>她正在亚马逊进行植物学研究。<,>This book contains beautiful botanical illustrations.<,>这本书里有精美的植物学插图。<,>botan(植物)+ical(形容词后缀)→植物学的<,>biology(n.生物学)/zoology(n.动物学)  

conquer<,>/ˈkɒŋkə(r)/<,>/ˈkɑːŋkər/<,>v.征服<,>The army set out to conquer new territories.<,>军队出发去征服新的领土。<,>She conquered her fear of public speaking.<,>她克服了对公开演讲的恐惧。<,>No mountain is too high to conquer if you have the will.<,>只要有决心，没有征服不了的高山。<,>con(完全)+quer(寻求)→完全寻求到→征服<,>conquest(n.征服)/conqueror(n.征服者)  

regain<,>/rɪˈɡeɪn/<,>/rɪˈɡeɪn/<,>v.重新获得<,>It took him months to regain his strength after the illness.<,>病后他花了几个月才恢复体力。<,>She hopes to regain the championship title this year.<,>她希望今年能重新获得冠军头衔。<,>The company is trying to regain its market share.<,>公司正试图重新获得市场份额。<,>re(重新)+gain(获得)→重新获得<,>retain(v.保留)/obtain(v.获得)  

composition<,>/ˌkɒmpəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmpəˈzɪʃn/<,>n.作文<,>Your English composition needs more details.<,>你的英语作文需要更多细节。<,>We studied the composition of various chemicals in class.<,>我们在课堂上研究了各种化学物质的组成。<,>Mozart wrote his first musical composition at age five.<,>莫扎特五岁时创作了他的第一部音乐作品。<,>com(一起)+posit(放置)+ion→把东西放在一起→作文/组成<,>composite(adj.复合的)/decomposition(n.分解)  

stress<,>/stres/<,>/stres/<,>v.强调<,>The teacher stressed the importance of punctuality.<,>老师强调了守时的重要性。<,>Too much work can cause stress and anxiety.<,>过多的工作会导致压力和焦虑。<,>She stressed every syllable when speaking to the foreigner.<,>她和外国人说话时强调了每个音节。<,>s+tress(压力)→强调时会感到压力<,>distress(n.痛苦)/press(v.压)  

yield<,>/jiːld/<,>/jiːld/<,>v.产生<,>This field yields a good crop every year.<,>这块田地每年都有好收成。<,>The negotiations yielded positive results.<,>谈判产生了积极的结果。<,>You should yield to pedestrians at crosswalks.<,>你应该在人行横道处让行人先行。<,>y(看作year)+ield(看作field)→每年的田地都会产生作物<,>field(n.田地)/shield(n.盾牌)
spectacle<,>/ˈspektəkl/<,>/ˈspektəkəl/<,>n.景象/n.奇观/n.眼镜<,>The sunset over the ocean was a breathtaking spectacle.<,>海上的日落是一幅令人叹为观止的景象。<,>He made a spectacle of himself at the party.<,>他在聚会上出尽了洋相。<,>The circus performance was a dazzling spectacle.<,>马戏团的表演是一场令人眼花缭乱的奇观。<,>spect(看)+acle(名词后缀)→看到的景象<,>spectator(n.观众)/spectrum(n.光谱)/spectral(adj.幽灵的)

host<,>/həʊst/<,>/hoʊst/<,>v.主持/n.主人/n.大量<,>She will host the annual awards ceremony.<,>她将主持年度颁奖典礼。<,>We were greeted warmly by our host.<,>我们受到主人的热情欢迎。<,>A host of problems arose after the system update.<,>系统更新后出现了一大堆问题。<,>ho(谐音"好")+st(stand站立)→好主持人要站着<,>ghost(n.鬼)/hostel(n.旅社)/hostile(adj.敌对的)

release<,>/rɪˈliːs/<,>/rɪˈlis/<,>v.释放/v.发布/n.发行<,>The prisoner was released after 10 years.<,>这名囚犯在10年后被释放了。<,>The band will release their new album next month.<,>乐队将于下个月发布新专辑。<,>Press the release button to open the door.<,>按下释放按钮开门。<,>re(重新)+lease(租约)→解除租约→释放<,>relieve(v.缓解)/relent(v.变温和)/relish(n.滋味)

malicious<,>/məˈlɪʃəs/<,>/məˈlɪʃəs/<,>adj.恶毒的/adj.恶意的<,>He spread malicious rumors about his colleague.<,>他散布关于同事的恶毒谣言。<,>The software contains malicious code.<,>这个软件含有恶意代码。<,>Her malicious smile made me uncomfortable.<,>她恶意的微笑让我感到不适。<,>mal(坏)+icious(形容词后缀)→坏的→恶毒的<,>delicious(adj.美味的)/suspicious(adj.可疑的)/vicious(adj.恶毒的)

prevailing<,>/prɪˈveɪlɪŋ/<,>/prɪˈveɪlɪŋ/<,>adj.流行的/adj.占优势的<,>The prevailing fashion this season is oversized coats.<,>本季流行的是超大号外套。<,>The prevailing winds come from the west.<,>盛行风来自西方。<,>The prevailing opinion is that we should wait.<,>主流意见是我们应该等待。<,>pre(前)+vail(价值)+ing→在前面有价值的→流行的<,>prevalent(adj.普遍的)/prevent(v.防止)/prevail(v.盛行)

gratitude<,>/ˈɡrætɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈɡrætɪtuːd/<,>n.感激/n.感谢<,>I expressed my gratitude for their help.<,>我对他们的帮助表示感谢。<,>She showed deep gratitude to her mentor.<,>她对导师表现出深深的感激。<,>A small gift can convey great gratitude.<,>小礼物可以表达大感激。<,>grat(高兴)+itude(名词后缀)→感激之情<,>attitude(n.态度)/altitude(n.海拔)/magnitude(n.量级)

mobility<,>/məʊˈbɪləti/<,>/moʊˈbɪləti/<,>n.流动性/n.活动性<,>Electric scooters improve urban mobility.<,>电动滑板车提高了城市流动性。<,>Age reduced his physical mobility.<,>年龄降低了他的身体活动能力。<,>The job requires high mobility.<,>这份工作需要高度流动性。<,>mob(移动)+ility(能力)→移动能力→流动性<,>immobile(adj.不动的)/automobile(n.汽车)/mobilize(v.动员)

ascend<,>/əˈsend/<,>/əˈsɛnd/<,>v.上升/v.攀登<,>The balloon ascended slowly into the sky.<,>气球缓缓升上天空。<,>We ascended the mountain before dawn.<,>我们在黎明前攀登了这座山。<,>The path ascends to the temple.<,>这条小路向上通往寺庙。<,>a(向上)+scend(爬)→向上爬→上升<,>descend(v.下降)/transcend(v.超越)/ascent(n.上升)

fake<,>/feɪk/<,>/feɪk/<,>n.假货/adj.假的/v.伪造<,>The painting was discovered to be a fake.<,>这幅画被发现是赝品。<,>He gave a fake name to the police.<,>他向警方提供了假名。<,>She faked illness to skip school.<,>她装病逃学。<,>谐音"费克"→假货费克钱<,>flake(n.薄片)/fare(n.车费)/fame(n.名声)

inflation<,>/ɪnˈfleɪʃn/<,>/ɪnˈfleɪʃən/<,>n.通货膨胀/n.膨胀<,>The government is trying to control inflation.<,>政府正试图控制通货膨胀。<,>Inflation has reduced people's purchasing power.<,>通货膨胀降低了人们的购买力。<,>Tire inflation should be checked regularly.<,>应定期检查轮胎充气情况。<,>in(进入)+flat(吹)+ion→吹入→膨胀<,>deflation(n.通货紧缩)/flatulence(n.肠胃气胀)/inflate(v.使膨胀)
plot<,>/plɒt/<,>/plɑːt/<,>n.情节<,>The movie has a very complicated plot.<,>这部电影的情节非常复杂。<,>She is good at creating interesting plots for her stories.<,>她擅长为故事创造有趣的情节。<,>The plot of the novel revolves around a murder mystery.<,>小说的情节围绕着一个谋杀谜案展开。<,>pl(计划)+ot(小)→小计划→情节<,>pilot(n.飞行员)/pot(n.罐子)/slot(n.狭缝)  

manufacture<,>/ˌmænjuˈfæktʃə(r)/<,>/ˌmænjəˈfæktʃər/<,>v.生产/v.制造<,>This factory manufactures electronic components.<,>这家工厂生产电子元件。<,>They manufacture high-quality furniture in Germany.<,>他们在德国制造高品质家具。<,>The company plans to manufacture eco-friendly products.<,>公司计划生产环保产品。<,>manu(手)+fact(做)+ure→用手做→制造<,>manufacturer(n.制造商)/manual(adj.手工的)/factory(n.工厂)  

criticism<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsɪzəm/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪˌsɪzəm/<,>n.批评<,>He accepted the criticism with an open mind.<,>他以开放的心态接受了批评。<,>Her work has received both praise and criticism.<,>她的作品既受到赞扬也受到批评。<,>Constructive criticism helps us improve.<,>建设性的批评帮助我们进步。<,>crit(判断)+ic+ism→做出判断→批评<,>critic(n.评论家)/critical(adj.关键的)/crisis(n.危机)  

outsource<,>/ˌaʊtˈsɔːs/<,>/ˈaʊtˌsɔːrs/<,>v.外包<,>Many companies outsource their IT services.<,>许多公司将IT服务外包。<,>We decided to outsource the production to save costs.<,>我们决定外包生产以节省成本。<,>They outsource customer support to a third-party company.<,>他们将客户支持外包给第三方公司。<,>out(外)+source(来源)→外部来源→外包<,>resource(n.资源)/outsider(n.外人)/insource(v.内包)  

obstacle<,>/ˈɒbstəkl/<,>/ˈɑːbstəkl/<,>n.阻碍<,>Lack of funding is the main obstacle to our project.<,>资金不足是我们项目的主要阻碍。<,>They overcame many obstacles to succeed.<,>他们克服了许多阻碍才取得成功。<,>The fallen tree was an obstacle on the road.<,>倒下的树是路上的障碍物。<,>ob(反)+sta(站)+cle→站在反面→阻碍<,>object(n.物体)/obstruct(v.阻挡)/obstinate(adj.固执的)  

appreciative<,>/əˈpriːʃətɪv/<,>/əˈpriːʃiˌeɪtɪv/<,>adj.表示赞赏的/adj.感谢的<,>The audience was very appreciative of the performance.<,>观众对表演非常赞赏。<,>She gave him an appreciative smile.<,>她给了他一个感谢的微笑。<,>We are deeply appreciative of your help.<,>我们深深感谢你的帮助。<,>ap(加强)+preci(价值)+ative→给予价值的→赞赏的<,>appreciate(v.欣赏)/depreciate(v.贬值)/precious(adj.珍贵的)  

predominantly<,>/prɪˈdɒmɪnəntli/<,>/prɪˈdɑːmɪnəntli/<,>adv.占主导地位地<,>The population is predominantly young in this city.<,>这个城市的人口以年轻人为主。<,>The team is predominantly made up of experienced players.<,>这个团队主要由经验丰富的球员组成。<,>This area is predominantly agricultural.<,>这个地区以农业为主。<,>pre(前)+domin(统治)+antly→在前面统治→主导地<,>dominant(adj.主导的)/predominate(v.占优势)/domain(n.领域)  

invasion<,>/ɪnˈveɪʒn/<,>/ɪnˈveɪʒən/<,>n.入侵<,>The country suffered from foreign invasion last century.<,>这个国家上个世纪遭受了外国入侵。<,>Privacy invasion is a serious issue online.<,>隐私入侵是网络上的严重问题。<,>The military prepared to repel the invasion.<,>军队准备击退入侵。<,>in(入)+vas(走)+ion→走入→入侵<,>evasion(n.逃避)/pervasion(n.渗透)/invasive(adj.侵入的)  

detect<,>/dɪˈtekt/<,>/dɪˈtɛkt/<,>v.发现<,>The test can detect early signs of the disease.<,>这个测试能发现疾病的早期迹象。<,>He detected a note of sadness in her voice.<,>他从她的声音中发现了一丝悲伤。<,>The system can detect unauthorized access.<,>该系统能发现未经授权的访问。<,>de(去掉)+tect(掩盖)→去掉掩盖→发现<,>protect(v.保护)/detective(n.侦探)/defect(n.缺陷)  

addict<,>/ˈædɪkt/<,>/ˈædɪkt/<,>n.吸毒上瘾者/n.对…着迷的人<,>He became a drug addict after the accident.<,>事故后他成了吸毒上瘾者。<,>She is a coffee addict and drinks five cups a day.<,>她是个咖啡迷，每天喝五杯。<,>Video game addicts often neglect their studies.<,>电子游戏上瘾者常常忽视学业。<,>ad(向)+dict(说)→不断说→上瘾<,>dictate(v.口述)/predict(v.预测)/contradict(v.反驳)
slash<,>/slæʃ/<,>/slæʃ/<,>v.猛削/v.劈/v.砍/v.削减<,>He slashed the rope with a knife.<,>他用刀猛砍绳子。<,>The company slashed its budget by 30%.<,>公司将预算削减了30%。<,>She slashed the prices to attract customers.<,>她大幅降价以吸引顾客。<,>s(蛇)+lash(鞭打)→像蛇一样鞭打→猛砍<,>smash(v.粉碎/n.破碎)/flash(v.闪烁/n.闪光)  

cognitive<,>/ˈkɒɡnətɪv/<,>/ˈkɑːɡnətɪv/<,>adj.认知的<,>Cognitive development is crucial in early childhood.<,>认知发展在幼儿期至关重要。<,>The study focuses on cognitive processes.<,>这项研究聚焦认知过程。<,>Her cognitive abilities declined with age.<,>她的认知能力随着年龄下降。<,>cogn(知道)+itive(形容词后缀)→认知的<,>cognate(adj.同源的/n.同源词)/recognize(v.认出/v.承认)  

extinguish<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>v.熄灭/v.使消亡<,>Firefighters extinguished the blaze quickly.<,>消防员迅速扑灭了大火。<,>His hopes were extinguished by the bad news.<,>坏消息使他的希望破灭了。<,>Please extinguish your cigarettes.<,>请熄灭香烟。<,>ex(出)+tingu(刺)+ish→把刺拔出→熄灭<,>distinguish(v.区分/v.辨别)/extinct(adj.灭绝的)  

disadvantage<,>/ˌdɪsədˈvɑːntɪdʒ/<,>/ˌdɪsədˈvæntɪdʒ/<,>n.缺点/n.不利条件<,>Lack of experience is a major disadvantage.<,>缺乏经验是个主要劣势。<,>The system puts small businesses at a disadvantage.<,>这个系统使小企业处于不利地位。<,>Her height was a disadvantage in basketball.<,>她的身高在篮球中是劣势。<,>dis(否定)+advantage(优势)→不利条件<,>advantage(n.优势/v.有利于)/disability(n.残疾/n.无能)  

alien<,>/ˈeɪliən/<,>/ˈeɪliən/<,>adj.陌生的<,>The concept was completely alien to him.<,>这个概念对他来说完全陌生。<,>She felt alien in the new culture.<,>她在新文化中感到陌生。<,>The plant is alien to this region.<,>这种植物不是本地的。<,>ali(别的)+en→别的→陌生的<,>align(v.使结盟/v.排整齐)/allied(adj.同盟的)  

barely<,>/ˈbeəli/<,>/ˈberli/<,>adv.几乎不/adv.仅仅<,>She could barely speak after the shock.<,>震惊之后她几乎说不出话。<,>The room was barely furnished.<,>房间几乎没家具。<,>We barely made it on time.<,>我们勉强准时赶到。<,>bare(赤裸的)+ly→几乎没有的→仅仅<,>bare(adj.赤裸的/v.露出)/bareness(n.赤裸/n.空旷)  

simulate<,>/ˈsɪmjuleɪt/<,>/ˈsɪmjəleɪt/<,>v.模拟/v.模仿<,>The flight simulator simulates real flying conditions.<,>飞行模拟器模拟真实飞行条件。<,>He simulated illness to avoid work.<,>他装病逃避工作。<,>The software can simulate various scenarios.<,>这个软件能模拟各种场景。<,>simul(类似)+ate(使)→使类似→模拟<,>stimulate(v.刺激/v.激励)/simultaneous(adj.同时的)  

prospective<,>/prəˈspektɪv/<,>/prəˈspektɪv/<,>adj.预期的/adj.未来的<,>Prospective students visited the campus.<,>未来的学生们参观了校园。<,>We discussed prospective business opportunities.<,>我们讨论了预期的商业机会。<,>The prospective benefits outweigh the costs.<,>预期的收益超过成本。<,>pro(向前)+spect(看)+ive→向前看的→未来的<,>perspective(n.观点/n.透视)/retrospective(adj.回顾的)  

interaction<,>/ˌɪntərˈækʃn/<,>/ˌɪntərˈækʃn/<,>n.相互影响/n.相互作用/n.互动<,>Social interaction is important for mental health.<,>社交互动对心理健康很重要。<,>The interaction between drugs can be dangerous.<,>药物间的相互作用可能很危险。<,>Teacher-student interaction improved learning outcomes.<,>师生互动提高了学习效果。<,>inter(相互)+act(行动)+ion→相互作用<,>interact(v.互动)/transaction(n.交易)  

materialize<,>/məˈtɪəriəlaɪz/<,>/məˈtɪriəlaɪz/<,>v.实现<,>His dreams never materialized.<,>他的梦想从未实现。<,>The project finally materialized after years of planning.<,>经过多年规划，项目终于实现了。<,>The promised funding failed to materialize.<,>承诺的资金未能到位。<,>material(物质)+ize(使)→使成为现实→实现<,>memorialize(v.纪念)/dematerialize(v.非物质化)
contribute<,>/kənˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>/kənˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>v.有助于/v.促成/v.捐赠<,>Your suggestions can contribute to the success of the project.<,>你的建议有助于项目的成功。<,>He contributes a large sum of money to charity every year.<,>他每年向慈善机构捐赠一大笔钱。<,>Eating healthy food contributes to overall well-being.<,>健康的饮食有助于整体健康。<,>con(共同)+tribute(给予)→共同给予→捐赠<,>distribute(v.分发)/attribute(v.归因于)/retribution(n.报应)

dishonest<,>/dɪsˈɒnɪst/<,>/dɪsˈɑːnɪst/<,>adj.不诚实的<,>It's dishonest to cheat on exams.<,>考试作弊是不诚实的。<,>He was fired for being dishonest with his clients.<,>他因为对客户不诚实而被解雇。<,>Dishonest behavior can damage your reputation.<,>不诚实的行为会损害你的声誉。<,>dis(否定)+honest(诚实)→不诚实的<,>honest(adj.诚实的)/disgrace(n.耻辱)/disclose(v.揭露)

appeal<,>/əˈpiːl/<,>/əˈpiːl/<,>n.请求/n.呼吁/n.上诉<,>The charity made an appeal for donations.<,>该慈善机构呼吁捐款。<,>He lost his appeal against the court decision.<,>他对法院判决的上诉失败了。<,>The idea of traveling has a strong appeal to me.<,>旅行的想法对我很有吸引力。<,>ap(向)+peal(呼叫)→向...呼叫→呼吁<,>peel(v.剥皮)/appear(v.出现)/apparel(n.服装)

applicant<,>/ˈæplɪkənt/<,>/ˈæplɪkənt/<,>n.申请者<,>There were over 100 applicants for the job.<,>这份工作有超过100名申请者。<,>Each applicant must submit a resume.<,>每位申请者必须提交一份简历。<,>The university selects applicants based on their grades.<,>大学根据成绩选择申请者。<,>apply(申请)+cant(人)→申请的人→申请者<,>application(n.申请)/applicable(adj.适用的)/complicant(n.共犯)

intelligent<,>/ɪnˈtelɪdʒənt/<,>/ɪnˈtelɪdʒənt/<,>adj.聪明的<,>She is an intelligent student who always gets good grades.<,>她是个聪明的学生，总是取得好成绩。<,>Intelligent people can solve problems quickly.<,>聪明的人能快速解决问题。<,>The intelligent design of the building saves energy.<,>该建筑的智能设计节省能源。<,>intel(在...之间)+lig(选择)+ent→能在不同事物间做出选择的→聪明的<,>intellectual(adj.智力的)/diligent(adj.勤奋的)/negligent(adj.疏忽的))

spacious<,>/ˈspeɪʃəs/<,>/ˈspeɪʃəs/<,>adj.宽敞的<,>Their new apartment is very spacious.<,>他们的新公寓非常宽敞。<,>The conference room is spacious enough for 50 people.<,>会议室足够宽敞，能容纳50人。<,>A spacious garden surrounds the house.<,>房子周围有一个宽敞的花园。<,>space(空间)+ious(多...的)→多空间的→宽敞的<,>specious(adj.似是而非的)/spatial(adj.空间的)/precious(adj.珍贵的))

fatal<,>/ˈfeɪtl/<,>/ˈfeɪtl/<,>adj.致命的<,>The accident was fatal to the driver.<,>这次事故对司机来说是致命的。<,>Smoking can lead to fatal diseases.<,>吸烟可能导致致命的疾病。<,>He made a fatal mistake in his calculations.<,>他在计算中犯了一个致命的错误。<,>fat(命运)+al→命中注定的→致命的<,>fate(n.命运)/fetal(adj.胎儿的)/fatalism(n.宿命论))

counselor<,>/ˈkaʊnsələ(r)/<,>/ˈkaʊnsələr/<,>n.咨询顾问<,>She works as a school counselor.<,>她是一名学校咨询顾问。<,>The counselor gave me some good advice.<,>顾问给了我一些好建议。<,>You should talk to a financial counselor about your investments.<,>你应该和财务顾问谈谈你的投资。<,>counsel(建议)+or(人)→给出建议的人→顾问<,>council(n.委员会)/consult(v.咨询)/console(v.安慰))

potential<,>/pəˈtenʃl/<,>/pəˈtenʃl/<,>adj.潜在的/n.潜力<,>He has the potential to be a great leader.<,>他有成为伟大领袖的潜力。<,>This is a potential risk we need to consider.<,>这是我们需要考虑的潜在风险。<,>The new drug shows potential in treating cancer.<,>这种新药在治疗癌症方面显示出潜力。<,>potent(有力的)+ial→有力量的→潜力<,>essential(adj.必要的)/influential(adj.有影响力的)/substantial(adj.大量的))

assimilate<,>/əˈsɪməleɪt/<,>/əˈsɪməleɪt/<,>v.同化<,>It takes time to assimilate into a new culture.<,>融入新文化需要时间。<,>The body assimilates nutrients from food.<,>身体从食物中吸收营养。<,>The immigrants gradually assimilated to the local customs.<,>移民逐渐同化到当地习俗中。<,>as(向)+simil(相同)+ate→使相同→同化<,>simulate(v.模拟)/similar(adj.相似的)/dissimilate(v.异化))
cropland<,>/ˈkrɒplænd/<,>/ˈkrɑːplænd/<,>n.农田<,>The government is taking measures to protect cropland from pollution.<,>政府正在采取措施保护农田免受污染。<,>Many farmers depend on cropland for their livelihood.<,>许多农民依靠农田为生。<,>Urban expansion is reducing the amount of available cropland.<,>城市扩张正在减少可用农田的数量。<,>crop(农作物)+land(土地)→农田<,>farmland(n.农田)/grassland(n.草地)/woodland(n.林地)

relieved<,>/rɪˈliːvd/<,>/rɪˈliːvd/<,>adj.轻松的/adj.缓解的<,>She felt relieved after hearing the good news.<,>听到好消息后，她感到轻松了。<,>The medicine relieved his pain immediately.<,>药物立刻缓解了他的疼痛。<,>I was relieved to find my lost wallet.<,>找到丢失的钱包让我松了一口气。<,>relieve(缓解)+ed(形容词后缀)→缓解的<,>relief(n.缓解)/reliever(n.缓解物)/relieving(adj.缓解的)

compel<,>/kəmˈpel/<,>/kəmˈpɛl/<,>v.强迫<,>The law compels companies to disclose their financial information.<,>法律强制公司披露财务信息。<,>His conscience compelled him to tell the truth.<,>他的良心迫使他说出真相。<,>Bad weather compelled us to cancel the trip.<,>恶劣天气迫使我们取消了旅行。<,>com(共同)+pel(驱使)→共同驱使→强迫<,>repel(v.击退)/expel(v.驱逐)/propel(v.推进)

program<,>/ˈprəʊɡræm/<,>/ˈproʊɡræm/<,>v.计划/v.安排<,>They programmed the robot to perform complex tasks.<,>他们给机器人编程以执行复杂任务。<,>The school programs various activities for students.<,>学校为学生安排了各种活动。<,>We need to program the meeting into our schedule.<,>我们需要把会议安排进日程。<,>pro(向前)+gram(写)→预先写好的→计划<,>progress(n.进步)/diagram(n.图表)/telegram(n.电报)

capacity<,>/kəˈpæsəti/<,>/kəˈpæsəti/<,>n.能力/n.容量<,>The stadium has a seating capacity of 50,000.<,>这个体育场能容纳5万人。<,>She has a great capacity for learning languages.<,>她有很强的语言学习能力。<,>The bottle's capacity is one liter.<,>这个瓶子的容量是一升。<,>cap(拿)+acity(能力)→能拿多少→容量<,>capability(n.能力)/capacious(adj.宽敞的)/incapacity(n.无能力)

orient<,>/ˈɔːrient/<,>/ˈɔːrient/<,>v.使确定方向/v.使适应<,>The map helped us orient ourselves in the new city.<,>地图帮助我们在新城市确定方向。<,>It took him some time to orient to the new job.<,>他花了一些时间适应新工作。<,>The course is designed to orient freshmen to college life.<,>这门课程旨在帮助新生适应大学生活。<,>ori(升起)+ent→太阳升起的方向→东方→定位<,>orientation(n.定向)/disorient(v.使迷失方向)/reorient(v.重新定向)

undertaking<,>/ˌʌndəˈteɪkɪŋ/<,>/ˌʌndərˈteɪkɪŋ/<,>n.任务/n.事情<,>Starting a business is a risky undertaking.<,>创业是一项有风险的任务。<,>The construction of the bridge was a massive undertaking.<,>建造这座大桥是一项巨大的工程。<,>He promised to complete the undertaking by Friday.<,>他承诺在周五前完成这项任务。<,>under(在...下)+take(拿)+ing→承担下来的事情<,>undertake(v.承担)/overtaking(n.超车)/partaking(n.参与)

shift<,>/ʃɪft/<,>/ʃɪft/<,>v.转移注意力/v.转变<,>She shifted her focus from work to family.<,>她把注意力从工作转移到了家庭。<,>The wind shifted direction suddenly.<,>风向突然转变了。<,>Public opinion has shifted on this issue.<,>公众对这个问题的看法已经转变。<,>sh(移动)+ift→移动变化<,>lift(v.举起)/drift(v.漂流)/swift(adj.迅速的)

liberation<,>/ˌlɪbəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌlɪbəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.解放<,>The country celebrated its liberation from colonial rule.<,>这个国家庆祝从殖民统治中解放。<,>Women's liberation movement brought significant changes.<,>妇女解放运动带来了重大变化。<,>The liberation of the hostages was a relief to everyone.<,>人质的解放让所有人都松了一口气。<,>liber(自由)+ation(状态)→解放<,>liberty(n.自由)/liberate(v.解放)/deliberation(n.深思熟虑)

utterly<,>/ˈʌtəli/<,>/ˈʌtərli/<,>adv.完全地/adv.彻底地<,>I was utterly surprised by the news.<,>这个消息让我完全震惊了。<,>The plan failed utterly due to poor preparation.<,>由于准备不足，这个计划彻底失败了。<,>She was utterly devoted to her work.<,>她完全投入于她的工作。<,>utter(完全的)+ly(副词后缀)→完全地<,>utter(v.说出)/butter(n.黄油)/mutter(v.咕哝)
immense<,>/ɪˈmens/<,>/ɪˈmɛns/<,>adj.巨大的<,>The Grand Canyon is an immense natural wonder.<,>大峡谷是一个巨大的自然奇观。<,>She felt immense joy when she heard the good news.<,>听到好消息时，她感到无比快乐。<,>The project requires an immense amount of effort.<,>这个项目需要付出巨大的努力。<,>im(不)+mense(测量)→无法测量→巨大的<,>immerse(v.沉浸)/immensity(n.巨大)

inferior<,>/ɪnˈfɪəriə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈfɪriər/<,>adj.比...差<,>This product is inferior to the one we bought last year.<,>这个产品比我们去年买的差。<,>He always feels inferior to his colleagues.<,>他总是觉得自己不如同事。<,>Never sell goods of inferior quality.<,>绝不要出售劣质商品。<,>infer(下面)+ior(比较级)→在下面的→较差的<,>superior(adj.更好的)/interior(n.内部)

accrue<,>/əˈkruː/<,>/əˈkru/<,>v.积累<,>Interest will accrue on the savings account.<,>储蓄账户会积累利息。<,>Benefits accrue to those who work hard.<,>努力工作的人会获得好处。<,>Over time, valuable experience accrued.<,>随着时间的推移积累了宝贵经验。<,>ac(向)+crue(增长)→向...增长→积累<,>accuse(v.指责)/accurate(adj.精确的)

genuine<,>/ˈdʒenjuɪn/<,>/ˈdʒɛnjuɪn/<,>adj.真的/由衷的<,>This painting is a genuine Picasso.<,>这幅画是毕加索的真迹。<,>She showed genuine concern for the poor.<,>她对穷人表现出真诚的关心。<,>His apology sounded genuine.<,>他的道歉听起来很真诚。<,>gen(出生)+uine→与生俱来的→真正的<,>ingenious(adj.聪明的)/genius(n.天才)

nominate<,>/ˈnɒmɪneɪt/<,>/ˈnɑməˌneɪt/<,>v.提名<,>She was nominated for Best Actress.<,>她获得了最佳女主角提名。<,>I nominate John as team leader.<,>我提名约翰当队长。<,>The committee nominated three candidates.<,>委员会提名了三名候选人。<,>nomin(名字)+ate(使)→使有名字→提名<,>denominate(v.命名)/dominant(adj.主导的)

distinctive<,>/dɪˈstɪŋktɪv/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋktɪv/<,>adj.与众不同的<,>The bird has distinctive red feathers.<,>这种鸟有独特的红色羽毛。<,>Her distinctive voice is easily recognizable.<,>她独特的声音很容易辨认。<,>Each culture has its distinctive traditions.<,>每种文化都有其独特的传统。<,>distinct(区别)+ive(形容词后缀)→有区别的<,>instinctive(adj.本能的)/distinguish(v.区分)

mismanagement<,>/ˌmɪsˈmænɪdʒmənt/<,>/ˌmɪsˈmænɪdʒmənt/<,>n.管理不当<,>Mismanagement led to the company's bankruptcy.<,>管理不善导致公司破产。<,>The project failed due to financial mismanagement.<,>由于财务管理不善，项目失败了。<,>They accused the government of economic mismanagement.<,>他们指责政府经济管理不善。<,>mis(错误)+management(管理)→管理错误<,>misunderstand(v.误解)/maladministration(n.管理不善)

reckon<,>/ˈrekən/<,>/ˈrɛkən/<,>v.认为/评价<,>I reckon we should leave now.<,>我认为我们现在该走了。<,>He is reckoned as one of the best writers.<,>他被认为是最优秀的作家之一。<,>Do you reckon it will rain tomorrow?<,>你觉得明天会下雨吗？<,>reck(计算)+on→计算后认为<,>recognize(v.认出)/beckon(v.招手)

mask<,>/mɑːsk/<,>/mæsk/<,>n.面具/v.掩饰<,>He wore a mask to the party.<,>他戴着面具参加派对。<,>She tried to mask her disappointment.<,>她试图掩饰失望。<,>The perfume masks unpleasant odors.<,>香水掩盖了难闻的气味。<,>联想：mask→task(任务)→完成任务需要"掩饰"压力<,>mash(v.捣碎)/musk(n.麝香)

forge<,>/fɔːdʒ/<,>/fɔrdʒ/<,>v.伪造/锻造<,>They forged the documents.<,>他们伪造了文件。<,>Blacksmiths forge iron into tools.<,>铁匠把铁锻造成工具。<,>The two countries forged a strong alliance.<,>两国建立了牢固的联盟。<,>for(为了)+ge(谐音"改")→为了改变而伪造<,>forget(v.忘记)/forage(v.搜寻食物)
identical<,>/aɪˈdentɪkl/<,>/aɪˈdentɪkəl/<,>adj.相同的<,>The twins are identical in appearance.<,>这对双胞胎外表一模一样。<,>Their opinions are identical on this matter.<,>他们在这个问题上的意见完全相同。<,>This is an identical copy of the original document.<,>这是原始文件的完全相同的副本。<,>ident(相同)+ical(形容词后缀)→相同的<,>identity(n.身份)/identify(v.识别)

imperial<,>/ɪmˈpɪəriəl/<,>/ɪmˈpɪriəl/<,>adj.帝国的<,>The imperial palace was magnificent.<,>那座皇宫非常宏伟。<,>Britain was once an imperial power.<,>英国曾是一个帝国强国。<,>He studies imperial history.<,>他研究帝国历史。<,>imper(命令)+ial(形容词后缀)→帝国的<,>empire(n.帝国)/imperative(adj.必要的)

target<,>/ˈtɑːɡɪt/<,>/ˈtɑːrɡɪt/<,>n.目标/v.把...作为目标<,>The arrow hit the target perfectly.<,>箭正中靶心。<,>This advertisement targets young consumers.<,>这个广告针对年轻消费者。<,>We need to set realistic targets.<,>我们需要设定现实的目标。<,>tar(柏油)+get(得到)→用柏油标记目标<,>budget(n.预算)/forget(v.忘记)

disconnect<,>/ˌdɪskəˈnekt/<,>/ˌdɪskəˈnɛkt/<,>v.断开<,>Please disconnect the power before repairing.<,>修理前请断开电源。<,>I feel disconnected from my friends.<,>我感觉和朋友疏远了。<,>The phone was suddenly disconnected.<,>电话突然断线了。<,>dis(否定)+connect(连接)→断开<,>connect(v.连接)/discontent(adj.不满的)

immigrant<,>/ˈɪmɪɡrənt/<,>/ˈɪməɡrənt/<,>n.移民<,>Many immigrants came to America for a better life.<,>许多移民为了更好的生活来到美国。<,>She is an immigrant from China.<,>她是从中国来的移民。<,>Immigrants contribute to the cultural diversity.<,>移民促进了文化多样性。<,>im(进入)+migr(迁移)+ant(人)→移民<,>emigrant(n.移居外国者)/migrate(v.迁移)

unqualified<,>/ʌnˈkwɒlɪfaɪd/<,>/ʌnˈkwɑːlɪfaɪd/<,>adj.不合格的/不胜任的<,>He is unqualified for this position.<,>他不胜任这个职位。<,>The report was unqualified nonsense.<,>这份报告完全是无稽之谈。<,>She gave unqualified support to the project.<,>她对这个项目给予了无条件的支持。<,>un(否定)+qualified(合格的)→不合格的<,>qualified(adj.合格的)/disqualified(adj.取消资格的)

edit<,>/ˈedɪt/<,>/ˈɛdɪt/<,>v.编校/编辑/剪辑<,>She edits the school newspaper.<,>她负责校报的编辑工作。<,>I need to edit this video before publishing.<,>发布前我需要剪辑这个视频。<,>The book has been carefully edited.<,>这本书经过了仔细的编校。<,>e(出)+dit(给)→编辑<,>edition(n.版本)/editor(n.编辑)

govern<,>/ˈɡʌvn/<,>/ˈɡʌvərn/<,>v.管理<,>Laws govern our behavior in society.<,>法律规范我们在社会中的行为。<,>He governed the country wisely.<,>他英明地治理国家。<,>Self-interest governs his actions.<,>他的行为受自身利益驱使。<,>govern(统治)+ment(名词后缀)→管理<,>government(n.政府)/governor(n.州长)

assert<,>/əˈsɜːt/<,>/əˈsɜːrt/<,>v.主张/断言<,>She asserted her innocence.<,>她坚称自己是无辜的。<,>You need to assert your rights.<,>你需要维护自己的权利。<,>He asserted that the theory was correct.<,>他断言这个理论是正确的。<,>as(加强)+sert(加入)→主张<,>insert(v.插入)/desert(n.沙漠)

breezy<,>/ˈbriːzi/<,>/ˈbrizi/<,>adj.轻松愉快的<,>She has a breezy personality.<,>她性格开朗。<,>It was a breezy summer day.<,>那是个微风习习的夏日。<,>He gave a breezy account of his adventures.<,>他轻松愉快地讲述了他的冒险经历。<,>breeze(微风)+y(形容词后缀)→轻松愉快的<,>breeze(n.微风)/freezy(adj.寒冷的)
hesitate<,>/ˈhezɪteɪt/<,>/ˈhɛzɪˌteɪt/<,>v.犹豫<,>She hesitated before answering the question.<,>她在回答问题前犹豫了一下。<,>Don't hesitate to ask for help if you need it.<,>如果需要帮助，请不要犹豫。<,>He hesitated at the door, unsure whether to enter.<,>他在门口犹豫，不确定是否要进去。<,>hes(黏住)+it(走)+ate(动词后缀)→黏住不走→犹豫<,>hesitation(n.犹豫)/hasten(v.加速)/hesitant(adj.犹豫的)

presidency<,>/ˈprezɪdənsi/<,>/ˈprɛzɪdənsi/<,>n.总统任期<,>He served two terms during his presidency.<,>他在总统任期内连任两届。<,>The country prospered under her presidency.<,>国家在她的总统任期内繁荣发展。<,>The presidency comes with great responsibility.<,>总统任期伴随着巨大的责任。<,>presid(主持)+ency(状态)→主持国家的状态→总统任期<,>president(n.总统)/preside(v.主持)/presidential(adj.总统的)

quota<,>/ˈkwəʊtə/<,>/ˈkwoʊtə/<,>n.配额<,>The factory has reached its production quota for this month.<,>工厂已经完成了本月的生产配额。<,>Each country has an immigration quota.<,>每个国家都有移民配额。<,>They exceeded the fishing quota set by the government.<,>他们超过了政府设定的捕鱼配额。<,>quot(数量)+a→规定的数量→配额<,>quote(v.引用)/quotation(n.引用)/quotient(n.商数))

dropout<,>/ˈdrɒpaʊt/<,>/ˈdrɑːpaʊt/<,>n.辍学学生<,>The program helps high school dropouts get their diplomas.<,>这个项目帮助高中辍学生获得文凭。<,>He was a college dropout but became very successful.<,>他大学辍学但后来非常成功。<,>The dropout rate has decreased in recent years.<,>近年来辍学率有所下降。<,>drop(掉落)+out(出去)→从学校掉出去的人→辍学学生<,>drop-off(n.下降)/drop-in(n.顺便拜访)/drop(v.掉落)

capture<,>/ˈkæptʃə(r)/<,>/ˈkæptʃər/<,>v.逮捕/v.捕捉<,>The police captured the criminal after a long chase.<,>经过长时间追捕，警察逮捕了罪犯。<,>The photograph captures the beauty of the sunset perfectly.<,>这张照片完美地捕捉到了日落的美丽。<,>The army captured the enemy's stronghold.<,>军队占领了敌人的据点。<,>capt(抓住)+ure(动作)→抓住的动作→捕捉<,>captive(n.俘虏)/captivity(n.囚禁)/captor(n.捕捉者))

integrity<,>/ɪnˈteɡrəti/<,>/ɪnˈtɛɡrɪti/<,>n.正直<,>He is a man of great integrity and honesty.<,>他是一个非常正直诚实的人。<,>Maintaining professional integrity is important in this job.<,>在这份工作中保持职业操守很重要。<,>The integrity of the data must be protected.<,>必须保护数据的完整性。<,>in(不)+teg(触摸)+rity→不被触摸→完整→正直<,>integrate(v.整合)/integral(adj.完整的)/disintegrate(v.瓦解))

flee<,>/fliː/<,>/fli/<,>v.离开<,>The villagers had to flee when the volcano erupted.<,>火山爆发时村民们不得不逃离。<,>He fled the country to avoid prosecution.<,>他逃离该国以避免被起诉。<,>The thief fled when he saw the police coming.<,>小偷看到警察来了就逃跑了。<,>flee与fly(飞)同源→快速离开<,>fleet(n.舰队)/fleece(n.羊毛)/fleeting(adj.短暂的))

certification<,>/ˌsɜːtɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌsɜːrtɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.证书<,>You need proper certification to work in this field.<,>你需要适当的证书才能在这个领域工作。<,>She received her teaching certification last month.<,>她上个月获得了教学证书。<,>The product has international quality certification.<,>该产品拥有国际质量认证。<,>cert(确定)+ify(使)+cation→使确定的文件→证书<,>certify(v.证明)/certificate(n.证书)/certain(adj.确定的))

instant<,>/ˈɪnstənt/<,>/ˈɪnstənt/<,>adj.立即的<,>I need an instant reply to this urgent matter.<,>我需要对这个紧急事项立即回复。<,>The coffee is ready in an instant with this machine.<,>用这台机器咖啡瞬间就好。<,>She felt instant relief after taking the medicine.<,>服药后她立即感到缓解。<,>in(在)+stant(站)→站在那里的→立即的<,>instance(n.实例)/instantaneous(adj.瞬间的)/instantly(adv.立即))

criminal<,>/ˈkrɪmɪnl/<,>/ˈkrɪmɪnəl/<,>adj.犯罪的/n.罪犯<,>He was involved in criminal activities.<,>他参与了犯罪活动。<,>The criminal was sentenced to 10 years in prison.<,>这名罪犯被判10年监禁。<,>Criminal law deals with offenses against society.<,>刑法处理危害社会的行为。<,>crimin(犯罪)+al(的/人)→犯罪的/罪犯<,>crime(n.犯罪)/incriminate(v.控告)/decriminalize(v.非刑事化))
clue<,>/kluː/<,>/klu/<,>n.线索<,>The detective found a clue at the crime scene.<,>侦探在犯罪现场发现了一条线索。<,>She gave me a clue to solve the puzzle.<,>她给了我一个解决谜题的线索。<,>There was no clue about his whereabouts.<,>没有任何关于他下落的线索。<,>clue sounds like "glue" - clues stick things together.<,>cue(n.提示/v.暗示)/glue(n.胶水/v.粘贴)

arrogant<,>/ˈærəɡənt/<,>/ˈærəɡənt/<,>adj.傲慢无礼的<,>His arrogant attitude made him unpopular.<,>他傲慢的态度让他不受欢迎。<,>She spoke in an arrogant tone.<,>她用傲慢的语气说话。<,>Don't be so arrogant when dealing with others.<,>与人相处时不要这么傲慢。<,>arrog(claim)+ant(形容词后缀)→声称自己高人一等→傲慢的<,>ignorant(adj.无知的)/elegant(adj.优雅的)

elevate<,>/ˈelɪveɪt/<,>/ˈelɪveɪt/<,>v.提升/v.举起<,>Exercise can elevate your mood.<,>运动可以提升你的情绪。<,>They elevated the platform for better visibility.<,>他们升高了平台以获得更好的视野。<,>He was elevated to the position of manager.<,>他被提升为经理。<,>e(out)+lev(light)+ate(动词后缀)→使轻→举起<,>levitate(v.飘浮)/alleviate(v.减轻)

expansion<,>/ɪkˈspænʃn/<,>/ɪkˈspænʃən/<,>n.扩张/n.扩大<,>The company plans a rapid expansion overseas.<,>公司计划快速向海外扩张。<,>The expansion of the universe is accelerating.<,>宇宙的膨胀正在加速。<,>This new policy will lead to business expansion.<,>这项新政策将导致业务扩张。<,>ex(out)+pand(spread)+sion(名词后缀)→向外扩展<,>expedition(n.远征)/extension(n.延伸)

authority<,>/ɔːˈθɒrəti/<,>/əˈθɔːrəti/<,>n.权威/n.当局<,>He is an authority on ancient history.<,>他是古代历史方面的权威。<,>The local authorities issued a warning.<,>地方当局发布了警告。<,>You need to cite authoritative sources in your paper.<,>你的论文需要引用权威来源。<,>author(writer)+ity(名词后缀)→作者的权威<,>authentic(adj.真实的)/authorize(v.授权)

publicize<,>/ˈpʌblɪsaɪz/<,>/ˈpʌblɪˌsaɪz/<,>v.宣传<,>They hired a firm to publicize the event.<,>他们雇了一家公司来宣传这个活动。<,>The company publicized its new product through social media.<,>公司通过社交媒体宣传其新产品。<,>We need to publicize the charity concert.<,>我们需要宣传这场慈善音乐会。<,>public(公众)+ize(动词后缀)→使公众知晓<,>publish(v.出版)/publicity(n.宣传)

reflective<,>/rɪˈflektɪv/<,>/rɪˈflektɪv/<,>adj.反映的/adj.反射的/adj.深思熟虑的<,>The lake was reflective in the moonlight.<,>湖面在月光下反射着光芒。<,>She was in a reflective mood after the meeting.<,>会后她陷入了沉思。<,>His actions are reflective of his values.<,>他的行为反映了他的价值观。<,>re(back)+flect(bend)+ive(形容词后缀)→弯曲回来→反射的<,>reflexive(adj.反射的)/deflective(adj.偏斜的)

quantity<,>/ˈkwɒntəti/<,>/ˈkwɑːntəti/<,>n.数量<,>We need a large quantity of paper for the project.<,>我们需要大量纸张来完成这个项目。<,>The exact quantity is not known yet.<,>确切数量尚不清楚。<,>Quality is more important than quantity.<,>质量比数量更重要。<,>quant(how much)+ity(名词后缀)→数量<,>quality(n.质量)/quaint(adj.古雅的)

acutely<,>/əˈkjuːtli/<,>/əˈkjuːtli/<,>adv.强烈地<,>He was acutely aware of the danger.<,>他强烈地意识到了危险。<,>She felt acutely embarrassed by the mistake.<,>她对这个错误感到极度尴尬。<,>The pain was acutely felt after the anesthesia wore off.<,>麻醉失效后疼痛感变得强烈。<,>acute(sharp)+ly(副词后缀)→尖锐地→强烈地<,>accurately(adv.精确地)/cutely(adv.可爱地)

isolate<,>/ˈaɪsəleɪt/<,>/ˈaɪsəˌleɪt/<,>v.使隔离<,>The patient was isolated to prevent infection.<,>病人被隔离以防止感染。<,>They live in an isolated village.<,>他们住在一个与世隔绝的村庄。<,>Don't isolate yourself from your friends.<,>不要把自己和朋友隔离开来。<,>i(into)+sol(alone)+ate(动词后缀)→使单独进入→隔离<,>insulate(v.绝缘)/desolate(adj.荒凉的)
vigorous<,>/ˈvɪɡərəs/<,>/ˈvɪɡərəs/<,>adj.积极的/adj.精力充沛的<,>He maintains a vigorous exercise routine.<,>他保持着精力充沛的锻炼习惯。<,>The plant grew with vigorous vitality.<,>这株植物生长得充满活力。<,>She made a vigorous speech at the conference.<,>她在会议上发表了充满激情的演讲。<,>vigor(活力)+ous(形容词后缀)→充满活力的<,>rigorous(adj.严格的)/vigor(n.活力)/vigilant(adj.警觉的)  

counsel<,>/ˈkaʊnsl/<,>/ˈkaʊnsl/<,>v.建议/v.忠告<,>The lawyer counseled his client to remain silent.<,>律师建议他的客户保持沉默。<,>She counseled patience in dealing with the situation.<,>她建议在处理这种情况时要耐心。<,>He sought counsel from his mentor before making the decision.<,>他在做决定前向导师寻求了建议。<,>coun(共同)+sel(说)→共同商议→建议<,>council(n.委员会)/consult(v.咨询)/cancel(v.取消)  

vivid<,>/ˈvɪvɪd/<,>/ˈvɪvɪd/<,>adj.生动的<,>She gave a vivid description of her travels.<,>她生动地描述了她的旅行。<,>The dream was so vivid that it felt real.<,>这个梦如此生动，感觉就像真的一样。<,>He has a vivid imagination.<,>他有丰富的想象力。<,>viv(生命)+id(形容词后缀)→有生命力的→生动的<,>vividly(adv.生动地)/vital(adj.至关重要的)/vividness(n.生动性)  

hostility<,>/hɒˈstɪləti/<,>/hɑˈstɪləti/<,>n.敌意<,>There was open hostility between the two teams.<,>两队之间存在着公开的敌意。<,>His hostility towards the plan was obvious.<,>他对这个计划的敌意很明显。<,>The meeting was marked by hostility and tension.<,>会议充满了敌意和紧张。<,>host(敌人)+ility(名词后缀)→敌意<,>hospitality(n.好客)/hostile(adj.敌对的)/host(n.主人)  

collaborate<,>/kəˈlæbəreɪt/<,>/kəˈlæbəˌreɪt/<,>v.合作<,>The two companies collaborated on the project.<,>两家公司在这个项目上进行了合作。<,>She collaborated with her colleagues to finish the report.<,>她与同事合作完成了报告。<,>Artists often collaborate to create new works.<,>艺术家们经常合作创作新作品。<,>col(共同)+labor(劳动)+ate(动词后缀)→共同劳动→合作<,>cooperate(v.合作)/elaborate(adj.详尽的)/corroborate(v.证实)  

consultation<,>/ˌkɒnslˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnslˈteɪʃn/<,>n.商议<,>The doctor had a consultation with the patient.<,>医生与病人进行了会诊。<,>After much consultation, they reached a decision.<,>经过多次商议，他们做出了决定。<,>The consultation process took several weeks.<,>商议过程持续了几周。<,>consult(咨询)+ation(名词后缀)→商议<,>consult(v.咨询)/result(n.结果)/insult(v.侮辱)  

transition<,>/trænˈzɪʃn/<,>/trænˈzɪʃn/<,>n.过渡<,>The country is in transition to a new government.<,>这个国家正在向新政府过渡。<,>The transition from childhood to adulthood can be difficult.<,>从童年到成年的过渡可能是困难的。<,>They discussed the transition plan in detail.<,>他们详细讨论了过渡计划。<,>trans(跨越)+it(走)+ion(名词后缀)→过渡<,>transaction(n.交易)/transmission(n.传输)/translation(n.翻译)  

deteriorate<,>/dɪˈtɪəriəreɪt/<,>/dɪˈtɪriəˌreɪt/<,>v.恶化<,>His health began to deteriorate rapidly.<,>他的健康状况开始迅速恶化。<,>The weather is expected to deteriorate tomorrow.<,>预计明天天气会恶化。<,>Relations between the two countries have deteriorated.<,>两国关系已经恶化。<,>deterior(更坏的)+ate(动词后缀)→变得更坏→恶化<,>deterioration(n.恶化)/determine(v.决定)/deter(v.阻止)  

pasture<,>/ˈpɑːstʃə(r)/<,>/ˈpæstʃər/<,>n.牧场<,>The cows grazed in the lush pasture.<,>奶牛在茂盛的牧场上吃草。<,>They moved the sheep to a new pasture.<,>他们把羊群转移到了新的牧场。<,>The pasture was surrounded by a fence.<,>牧场被栅栏围了起来。<,>past(喂食)+ure(名词后缀)→喂食的地方→牧场<,>pastor(n.牧师)/paste(n.浆糊)/pastime(n.消遣)  

eyewitness<,>/ˈaɪwɪtnəs/<,>/ˈaɪˌwɪtnəs/<,>n.目击者<,>The eyewitness gave a detailed account of the accident.<,>目击者详细描述了事故的情况。<,>Police are looking for eyewitnesses to the crime.<,>警方正在寻找犯罪的目击者。<,>The eyewitness testimony was crucial to the case.<,>目击者的证词对案件至关重要。<,>eye(眼睛)+witness(见证)→亲眼见证的人→目击者<,>witness(n.证人)/eyesight(n.视力)/eyebrow(n.眉毛)
trait<,>/treɪt/<,>/treɪt/<,>n.特点<,>One of her most notable traits is her kindness.<,>她最显著的特点之一就是她的善良。<,>Honesty is a trait that is highly valued in this company.<,>诚实是这家公司非常看重的一个特点。<,>His sense of humor is a trait that makes him very popular.<,>他的幽默感使他非常受欢迎。<,>tr(真)+ait(ait发音似“特点”)→真实的特点<,>treat(v.对待/n.款待)/trail(n.踪迹/v.拖拽)  

anticipate<,>/ænˈtɪsɪpeɪt/<,>/ænˈtɪsəˌpeɪt/<,>v.期望/v.预期<,>We anticipate a large crowd at the concert.<,>我们预期音乐会将会有很多人。<,>She anticipated his question by preparing an answer in advance.<,>她提前准备好答案，预想到了他的问题。<,>The team is anticipating success in the upcoming competition.<,>团队对即将到来的比赛充满期待。<,>anti(前)+cip(拿)+ate→提前拿到→预期<,>participate(v.参与)/emancipate(v.解放)  

numerous<,>/ˈnjuːmərəs/<,>/ˈnuːmərəs/<,>adj.无数的<,>Numerous studies have confirmed this theory.<,>无数的研究证实了这个理论。<,>She has received numerous awards for her work.<,>她的工作获得了无数的奖项。<,>There are numerous reasons why people choose to live in cities.<,>人们选择住在城市有无数的原因。<,>numer(数字)+ous(多)→数字多→无数的<,>enormous(adj.巨大的)/generous(adj.慷慨的)  

combination<,>/ˌkɒmbɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmbɪˈneɪʃn/<,>n.组合/n.结合<,>The combination of these ingredients creates a unique flavor.<,>这些配料的组合创造出独特的味道。<,>His success is a combination of hard work and talent.<,>他的成功是努力和天赋的结合。<,>The safe's combination was changed for security reasons.<,>出于安全原因，保险箱的密码组合被更改了。<,>com(共同)+bin(捆绑)+ation→共同绑在一起→组合<,>combinatorial(adj.组合的)/combination lock(密码锁)  

slightly<,>/ˈslaɪtli/<,>/ˈslaɪtli/<,>adv.轻微地<,>The temperature dropped slightly overnight.<,>温度在夜间轻微下降。<,>She was slightly annoyed by the constant noise.<,>持续的噪音让她有点恼火。<,>He adjusted the recipe slightly to suit his taste.<,>他稍微调整了食谱以适应自己的口味。<,>slight(轻微的)+ly(副词后缀)→轻微地<,>lightly(adv.轻轻地)/brightly(adv.明亮地)  

dividend<,>/ˈdɪvɪdend/<,>/ˈdɪvɪˌdɛnd/<,>n.分红/n.红利<,>The company announced a higher dividend this year.<,>公司宣布今年分红更高。<,>Investors were pleased with the steady dividend payments.<,>投资者对稳定的红利支付感到满意。<,>His wise investments paid dividends in the long run.<,>他明智的投资长期来看带来了红利。<,>divide(分)+end(结果)→分的结果→分红<,>division(n.分割)/individual(n.个人)  

minimal<,>/ˈmɪnɪməl/<,>/ˈmɪnəməl/<,>adj.最低的/adj.最小限度的<,>The design uses a minimal amount of materials.<,>这个设计使用了最少的材料。<,>There was only minimal damage after the accident.<,>事故后只有最小限度的损坏。<,>She prefers a minimal style in home decoration.<,>她喜欢极简风格的家居装饰。<,>mini(小)+mal→最小的<,>maximum(n.最大值)/minimize(v.最小化)  

derail<,>/dɪˈreɪl/<,>/dɪˈreɪl/<,>v.脱轨<,>The train derailed due to a broken track.<,>由于铁轨断裂，火车脱轨了。<,>The scandal threatened to derail his political career.<,>丑闻可能会使他的政治生涯脱轨。<,>Don't let small problems derail the entire project.<,>不要让小问题使整个项目脱轨。<,>de(离开)+rail(轨道)→离开轨道→脱轨<,>detail(n.细节)/retail(n.零售)  

barrier<,>/ˈbæriə(r)/<,>/ˈbæriər/<,>n.障碍/n.阻碍<,>Language can be a barrier to communication.<,>语言可能成为沟通的障碍。<,>The Great Barrier Reef is a famous natural wonder.<,>大堡礁是著名的自然奇观。<,>They removed the trade barriers between the two countries.<,>他们取消了两国间的贸易壁垒。<,>bar(栏杆)+rier→像栏杆一样挡着→障碍<,>carrier(n.载体)/barrister(n.律师)  

ingenuity<,>/ˌɪndʒəˈnjuːəti/<,>/ˌɪndʒəˈnuːəti/<,>n.创造力<,>The invention shows remarkable ingenuity.<,>这项发明展现了非凡的创造力。<,>She solved the problem with great ingenuity.<,>她以极大的创造力解决了这个问题。<,>The escape plan required considerable ingenuity.<,>这个逃跑计划需要相当的创造力。<,>in(内)+gen(产生)+uity→内在产生的能力→创造力<,>genuine(adj.真实的)/ingenuous(adj.天真的)
bribe<,>/braɪb/<,>/braɪb/<,>v.贿赂<,>He tried to bribe the official with money.<,>他试图用钱贿赂官员。<,>Bribery is a serious crime in many countries.<,>在许多国家，贿赂是严重的犯罪行为。<,>She refused to bribe her way into the university.<,>她拒绝通过贿赂进入大学。<,>bri(谐音“不”)+be(是)→不是正当手段→贿赂<,>bride(n.新娘)/bribee(n.受贿者)/briber(n.行贿者)

guesstimate<,>/ˈɡestɪmət/<,>/ˈɡɛstəˌmeɪt/<,>n.大概估计/n.瞎猜估计<,>We can only make a guesstimate of the total cost.<,>我们只能对总成本做个大概估计。<,>His answer was more of a guesstimate than a precise calculation.<,>他的回答更像是瞎猜而不是精确计算。<,>Without proper data, all we have are guesstimates.<,>没有适当的数据，我们只能瞎猜估计。<,>guess(猜测)+estimate(估计)→猜测的估计<,>estimate(n.估计/v.估算)/underestimate(v.低估)/overestimate(v.高估)

negotiation<,>/nɪˌɡəʊʃiˈeɪʃn/<,>/nɪˌɡoʊʃiˈeɪʃn/<,>n.协商<,>The negotiation between the two companies lasted for weeks.<,>两家公司之间的协商持续了数周。<,>She has excellent skills in business negotiation.<,>她拥有出色的商业谈判技巧。<,>The peace negotiation finally reached an agreement.<,>和平谈判最终达成了协议。<,>negoti(谈判)+ation(名词后缀)→协商<,>negotiate(v.谈判)/negotiator(n.谈判者)/negotiable(adj.可协商的)

hardship<,>/ˈhɑːdʃɪp/<,>/ˈhɑːrdʃɪp/<,>n.艰难<,>They endured many hardships during the war.<,>他们在战争期间经历了许多艰难。<,>Financial hardship forced him to drop out of school.<,>经济困难迫使他辍学。<,>Overcoming hardship builds character.<,>克服艰难能塑造性格。<,>hard(困难的)+ship(状态)→艰难的状态<,>hardship(n.艰难)/hardness(n.硬度)/hardy(adj.坚强的)

badge<,>/bædʒ/<,>/bædʒ/<,>n.标记/n.徽章<,>He proudly wore his police badge.<,>他自豪地佩戴着他的警察徽章。<,>The red badge indicates a first-aid station.<,>红色标记表示急救站。<,>She collected badges from every country she visited.<,>她收集了每个访问过的国家的徽章。<,>bad(谐音“标”)+ge(谐音“记”)→标记<,>badger(n.獾/v.纠缠)/bandage(n.绷带)/barge(n.驳船)

compromise<,>/ˈkɒmprəmaɪz/<,>/ˈkɑːmprəmaɪz/<,>v.妥协<,>Both sides had to compromise to reach an agreement.<,>双方不得不妥协以达成协议。<,>He refused to compromise his principles.<,>他拒绝妥协自己的原则。<,>A good marriage requires compromise from both partners.<,>美满的婚姻需要双方妥协。<,>com(共同)+promise(承诺)→共同承诺→妥协<,>comprise(v.包含)/promise(n.承诺)/compressor(n.压缩机)

excess<,>/ɪkˈses/<,>/ɪkˈses/<,>n.过量/n.过度<,>Eating in excess can lead to health problems.<,>饮食过量会导致健康问题。<,>The company trimmed excess staff to cut costs.<,>公司裁减了多余员工以降低成本。<,>His excess of enthusiasm sometimes scares people.<,>他过度的热情有时会吓到别人。<,>ex(出)+cess(走)→走出界限→过量<,>access(n.入口)/success(n.成功)/process(n.过程)

descendant<,>/dɪˈsendənt/<,>/dɪˈsendənt/<,>n.子孙后代<,>He is a descendant of the famous poet.<,>他是那位著名诗人的后代。<,>Modern birds are descendants of dinosaurs.<,>现代鸟类是恐龙的后代。<,>The family keeps records of all their descendants.<,>这个家族保存着所有子孙后代的记录。<,>de(向下)+scend(爬)+ant(人)→向下繁衍的人→后代<,>descent(n.下降)/ascendant(adj.上升的)/transcend(v.超越)

fulfill<,>/fʊlˈfɪl/<,>/fʊlˈfɪl/<,>v.实现<,>She finally fulfilled her dream of becoming a doctor.<,>她终于实现了成为医生的梦想。<,>The product fulfills all our requirements.<,>这个产品满足了我们所有的要求。<,>He worked hard to fulfill his potential.<,>他努力工作以实现自己的潜力。<,>ful(满)+fill(填)→填满→实现<,>fulfillment(n.实现)/full(adj.满的)/fill(v.填充)

collective<,>/kəˈlektɪv/<,>/kəˈlektɪv/<,>adj.共同的<,>We made a collective decision to postpone the meeting.<,>我们共同决定推迟会议。<,>The collective effort of the team led to success.<,>团队的共同努力带来了成功。<,>The village owns the land as collective property.<,>村庄将这块土地作为共同财产。<,>col(共同)+lect(选择)+ive(形容词后缀)→共同选择的→共同的<,>collect(v.收集)/collection(n.收藏)/elective(adj.选修的)
amend<,>/əˈmend/<,>/əˈmɛnd/<,>v.修订<,>The committee voted to amend the constitution.<,>委员会投票决定修订宪法。<,>He amended his speech after receiving feedback.<,>他在收到反馈后修改了演讲。<,>The law was amended to include new provisions.<,>法律经过修订加入了新条款。<,>a(强调)+mend(修补)→修订<,>emend(v.校订)/mend(v.修理)/append(v.附加)

tangled<,>/ˈtæŋɡld/<,>/ˈtæŋɡəld/<,>adj.纠缠的/adj.复杂的<,>Her hair was tangled after the storm.<,>暴风雨过后她的头发乱作一团。<,>The plot of the movie was too tangled to follow.<,>这部电影的情节太复杂了难以理解。<,>The wires got tangled behind the computer.<,>电脑后面的电线缠在一起了。<,>tangle(纠缠)+ed→纠缠的<,>mangled(adj.撕裂的)/jangled(adj.刺耳的)/wangled(v.用计获得)

qualification<,>/ˌkwɒlɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌkwɑːlɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.资格<,>She has all the necessary qualifications for the job.<,>她具备这份工作所需的所有资格。<,>He obtained a teaching qualification last year.<,>他去年获得了教学资格。<,>The position requires specific professional qualifications.<,>这个职位需要特定的专业资格。<,>qualify(使合格)+cation→资格<,>certification(n.认证)/quantification(n.量化)/qualifier(n.限定词)

recall<,>/rɪˈkɔːl/<,>/rɪˈkɔl/<,>v.回忆起/v.想起<,>I can't recall where I put my keys.<,>我想不起来把钥匙放哪儿了。<,>The song recalled memories of my childhood.<,>这首歌让我想起了童年。<,>The company recalled the defective products.<,>公司召回了有缺陷的产品。<,>re(重新)+call(叫)→回忆<,>recollect(v.回忆)/retell(v.复述)/recount(v.详细叙述)

adopt<,>/əˈdɒpt/<,>/əˈdɑpt/<,>v.采纳<,>The school adopted a new teaching method.<,>学校采用了一种新的教学方法。<,>They decided to adopt a child from overseas.<,>他们决定从海外收养一个孩子。<,>The committee adopted his proposal unanimously.<,>委员会一致采纳了他的提议。<,>ad(加强)+opt(选择)→采纳<,>adapt(v.适应)/adept(adj.熟练的)/adoptive(adj.收养的)

tasteless<,>/ˈteɪstləs/<,>/ˈteɪstləs/<,>adj.没有味道的<,>The soup was completely tasteless.<,>这汤一点味道都没有。<,>He made a tasteless joke at the dinner party.<,>他在晚宴上开了个低俗的玩笑。<,>The decoration was gaudy and tasteless.<,>这个装饰俗气又没品位。<,>taste(味道)+less(无)→无味的<,>tasteful(adj.有品位的)/tasty(adj.美味的)/tastemaker(n.时尚引领者)

drown<,>/draʊn/<,>/draʊn/<,>v.溺水<,>He nearly drowned in the swimming pool.<,>他差点在游泳池里溺水。<,>The loud music drowned out our conversation.<,>嘈杂的音乐声盖过了我们的谈话。<,>She drowned her sorrows in alcohol.<,>她借酒消愁。<,>d(下沉)+rown(似down向下)→溺水<,>frown(v.皱眉)/brown(adj.棕色的)/drowse(v.打瞌睡)

tragedy<,>/ˈtrædʒədi/<,>/ˈtrædʒədi/<,>n.悲剧<,>Shakespeare wrote many famous tragedies.<,>莎士比亚写了许多著名的悲剧。<,>The plane crash was a terrible tragedy.<,>这次飞机失事是个可怕的悲剧。<,>Her life story reads like a Greek tragedy.<,>她的人生故事读起来像希腊悲剧。<,>trag(山羊)+edy(歌)→悲剧(源自古希腊悲剧演员穿山羊皮)<,>comedy(n.喜剧)/travesty(n.拙劣模仿)/trilogy(n.三部曲)

circulation<,>/ˌsɜːkjəˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌsɜrkjəˈleɪʃn/<,>n.发行量<,>The newspaper has a daily circulation of over a million.<,>这份报纸的日发行量超过一百万份。<,>Regular exercise improves blood circulation.<,>经常锻炼能促进血液循环。<,>The book was taken out of circulation.<,>这本书停止发行了。<,>circul(圆)+ation→循环发行<,>circular(adj.圆形的)/circulate(v.流通)/circuit(n.电路)

grand<,>/ɡrænd/<,>/ɡrænd/<,>adj.壮丽的/adj.极好的<,>They stayed in a grand hotel in Paris.<,>他们住在巴黎的一家豪华酒店。<,>We had a grand time at the party.<,>我们在聚会上玩得很开心。<,>The view from the mountain was truly grand.<,>从山上看到的景色真是壮观。<,>gr(大)+and→壮丽的<,>grant(v.授予)/grind(v.磨碎)/grandeur(n.宏伟)
inadequate<,>/ɪnˈædɪkwət/<,>/ɪnˈædɪkwət/<,>adj.不足的<,>The food supply was inadequate for the growing population.<,>食物供应不足以满足不断增长的人口。<,>His inadequate preparation led to poor performance.<,>他准备不足导致表现不佳。<,>They felt inadequate to handle the complex problem.<,>他们觉得自己能力不足以处理这个复杂问题。<,>in(否定)+adequate(足够的)→不足的<,>adequate(adj.足够的)/inadequacy(n.不足)/sufficient(adj.充足的)

household<,>/ˈhaʊshəʊld/<,>/ˈhaʊshoʊld/<,>n.家庭/n.一家人<,>This product is common in every household.<,>这个产品在每个家庭都很常见。<,>She manages all the household expenses.<,>她管理所有的家庭开支。<,>The household gathered for dinner.<,>全家人聚在一起吃晚餐。<,>house(房子)+hold(持有)→家庭<,>housework(n.家务)/housewife(n.家庭主妇)/housekeeper(n.管家)

authorization<,>/ˌɔːθəraɪˈzeɪʃən/<,>/ˌɔθərəˈzeɪʃən/<,>n.授权<,>You need special authorization to enter this area.<,>你需要特别授权才能进入这个区域。<,>The system requires user authorization.<,>系统需要用户授权。<,>He gave authorization for the project to proceed.<,>他授权项目继续进行。<,>author(作者)+ization(化)→授权<,>authority(n.权威)/authenticate(v.验证)/authentication(n.认证)

auxiliary<,>/ɔːɡˈzɪliəri/<,>/ɔɡˈzɪljəri/<,>adj.辅助的<,>The hospital has an auxiliary power supply.<,>这家医院有辅助电源。<,>She works as an auxiliary nurse.<,>她是一名辅助护士。<,>This is just an auxiliary method.<,>这只是一个辅助方法。<,>aux(增加)+iliary→辅助的<,>primary(adj.主要的)/secondary(adj.次要的)/supplementary(adj.补充的)

adverse<,>/ˈædvɜːs/<,>/ædˈvɜːrs/<,>adj.不利的<,>The adverse weather affected our travel plans.<,>不利的天气影响了我们的旅行计划。<,>This drug may have adverse effects.<,>这种药物可能有副作用。<,>They faced adverse circumstances.<,>他们面临不利的环境。<,>ad(朝向)+verse(转)→转向不好的→不利的<,>reverse(v.逆转/n.反面)/diverse(adj.多样的)/averse(adj.反对的)

descriptive<,>/dɪˈskrɪptɪv/<,>/dɪˈskrɪptɪv/<,>adj.描写的/adj.描述的<,>She gave a descriptive account of her journey.<,>她对自己的旅程进行了描述性的叙述。<,>The book contains descriptive passages about nature.<,>这本书包含对自然的描述性段落。<,>His writing is very descriptive.<,>他的写作非常具有描述性。<,>describe(描述)+tive→描述的<,>prescriptive(adj.规定的)/script(n.脚本)/inscription(n.铭文)

trace<,>/treɪs/<,>/treɪs/<,>v.追踪<,>Police are trying to trace the missing person.<,>警方正在努力追踪失踪人员。<,>We can trace the origins of this tradition.<,>我们可以追溯这个传统的起源。<,>The call was traced to a payphone.<,>电话被追踪到一个公用电话。<,>tract(拉)+e→拉出线索→追踪<,>track(n.轨道/v.跟踪)/trail(n.踪迹)/race(n.比赛)

bloom<,>/bluːm/<,>/bluːm/<,>v.开花/v.茂盛<,>The roses are blooming in the garden.<,>玫瑰在花园里盛开。<,>Her talent bloomed at an early age.<,>她的才华在很小的时候就展现出来了。<,>The trees bloom in spring.<,>树木在春天开花。<,>bl(花)+oom→开花<,>blossom(n.花/v.开花)/boom(v.繁荣)/gloom(n.忧郁)

evaluate<,>/ɪˈvæljueɪt/<,>/ɪˈvæljueɪt/<,>v.评价<,>Teachers evaluate students' performance regularly.<,>教师定期评估学生的表现。<,>We need to evaluate the effectiveness of this method.<,>我们需要评估这个方法的有效性。<,>The committee will evaluate all applications.<,>委员会将评估所有申请。<,>e(出)+valu(价值)+ate→评估价值→评价<,>value(n.价值)/valuation(n.估价)/devalue(v.贬值)

humanistic<,>/ˌhjuːməˈnɪstɪk/<,>/ˌhjuːməˈnɪstɪk/<,>adj.人文的<,>The course takes a humanistic approach to education.<,>这门课程采用人文主义的教育方法。<,>His humanistic values influenced his decisions.<,>他的人文价值观影响了他的决定。<,>This is a humanistic study of literature.<,>这是对文学的人文研究。<,>human(人)+istic→人文的<,>humanity(n.人性)/humanitarian(adj.人道主义的)/humane(adj.仁慈的)
cozy<,>/ˈkəʊzi/<,>/ˈkoʊzi/<,>adj.舒适的<,>The blanket is so cozy that I fell asleep immediately.<,>这条毯子太舒适了，我立刻就睡着了。<,>She made a cozy corner with pillows and books.<,>她用枕头和书布置了一个舒适的角落。<,>It's cozy to sit by the fireplace in winter.<,>冬天坐在壁炉旁很舒适。<,>音似"扣子"，想象扣上扣子的温暖外套→舒适的<,>comfy(adj.舒服的)/cosy(adj.舒适的，同cozy)  

plough<,>/plaʊ/<,>/plaʊ/<,>n.犁<,>The farmer used a plough to till the soil.<,>农民用犁来耕地。<,>The plough is an essential tool in agriculture.<,>犁是农业中必不可少的工具。<,>They hitched the horses to the plough.<,>他们把马套在犁上。<,>发音似"噗啦"，犁地时泥土噗啦噗啦翻动的声音<,>plow(n.犁，美式拼写)/dough(n.面团)/bough(n.大树枝)  

melt<,>/melt/<,>/mɛlt/<,>v.融化<,>The ice cream began to melt in the sun.<,>冰淇淋在阳光下开始融化。<,>Her anger seemed to melt away when she saw the puppy.<,>当她看到小狗时，怒气似乎消融了。<,>The snow will melt when spring comes.<,>春天来临时雪会融化。<,>联想"metal"(金属)，但金属需要高温才能melt(融化)<,>smelt(v.熔炼)/welt(n.贴边)/belt(n.腰带)  

lest<,>/lest/<,>/lɛst/<,>conj.以免<,>He spoke quietly lest he wake the baby.<,>他轻声说话以免吵醒婴儿。<,>She double-checked the address lest she go to the wrong place.<,>她反复核对地址以免去错地方。<,>Take an umbrella lest it should rain.<,>带把伞以防下雨。<,>"lest"音似"勒死他"，联想"勒紧以免他逃跑"<,>least(adj.最少的)/last(adj.最后的)/best(adj.最好的)  

ready<,>/ˈredi/<,>/ˈrɛdi/<,>adj.乐意的，愿意的<,>I'm ready to help you with your project.<,>我很乐意帮你完成项目。<,>She's always ready to listen to others' problems.<,>她总是愿意倾听别人的问题。<,>Are you ready to start the new challenge?<,>你准备好接受新的挑战了吗？<,>read(读)+y→读完说明书就"准备好"了<,>steady(adj.稳定的)/already(adv.已经)/readily(adv.乐意地)  

formidable<,>/fəˈmɪdəbl/<,>/fɔːrˈmɪdəbl/<,>adj.可怕的；令人敬畏的，令人惊叹的<,>The mountain presented a formidable challenge to climbers.<,>这座山对登山者构成了巨大的挑战。<,>She has a formidable knowledge of ancient history.<,>她对古代史的了解令人惊叹。<,>The enemy's army was a formidable force.<,>敌军是一支令人畏惧的力量。<,>form(形式)+id(看作idea)+able→形式上有想法的→令人敬畏的<,>forbid(v.禁止)/affordable(adj.负担得起的)/forgettable(adj.易忘的)  

feasible<,>/ˈfiːzəbl/<,>/ˈfizəbəl/<,>adj.可行的<,>Is it feasible to finish the project in one week?<,>一周内完成这个项目可行吗？<,>We need to find a feasible solution to this problem.<,>我们需要找到这个问题的可行解决方案。<,>The plan sounds feasible in theory.<,>这个计划在理论上是可行的。<,>fea(谐音"飞")+sible(能...的)→能飞起来的→可行的<,>visible(adj.可见的)/flexible(adj.灵活的)/edible(adj.可食用的)  

regarding<,>/rɪˈɡɑːdɪŋ/<,>/rɪˈɡɑːrdɪŋ/<,>prep.关于<,>Regarding your question, I'll give you an answer tomorrow.<,>关于你的问题，我明天给你答复。<,>She wrote a report regarding the market trends.<,>她写了一篇关于市场趋势的报告。<,>Do you have any information regarding the meeting schedule?<,>你有关于会议日程的信息吗？<,>regard(看作)+ing→正在看→关于<,>according to(根据)/concerning(prep.关于)/rewarding(adj.有回报的)  

needle<,>/ˈniːdl/<,>/ˈnidəl/<,>n.指针；针<,>The compass needle points to the north.<,>指南针的指针指向北方。<,>She threaded the needle with great difficulty.<,>她费了很大劲才把线穿过针眼。<,>The doctor used a sterile needle for the injection.<,>医生使用无菌针头进行注射。<,>need(需要)+le(小)→需要小心使用的小东西→针<,>noodle(n.面条)/kneel(v.跪下)/beetle(n.甲虫)  

dimension<,>/daɪˈmenʃn/<,>/dɪˈmɛnʃən/<,>n.尺寸；维<,>We need to measure the dimensions of the room.<,>我们需要测量房间的尺寸。<,>The movie adds a new dimension to the original story.<,>这部电影给原著故事增添了新的维度。<,>The problem has an international dimension.<,>这个问题具有国际层面的影响。<,>di(双)+mens(测量)+ion→双向测量→尺寸<,>mention(v.提及)/extension(n.延伸)/pension(n.养老金)
specialize<,>/ˈspeʃəlaɪz/<,>/ˈspeʃəlaɪz/<,>v.专业从事<,>She decided to specialize in pediatric medicine.<,>她决定专攻儿科医学。<,>This restaurant specializes in Italian cuisine.<,>这家餐厅专营意大利菜。<,>He specializes in criminal law.<,>他专攻刑法。<,>special(特殊的)+ize(使…化)→使专业化→专业从事<,>specific(adj.具体的)/specialist(n.专家)  

overturn<,>/ˌəʊvəˈtɜːn/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈtɜːrn/<,>v.推翻<,>The court overturned the previous decision.<,>法院推翻了先前的判决。<,>The protesters hope to overturn the unjust law.<,>抗议者希望推翻这项不公正的法律。<,>A strong wind overturned the small boat.<,>一阵大风掀翻了小船。<,>over(翻转)+turn(转动)→推翻<,>overthrow(v.推翻)/overcome(v.克服)  

shrank<,>/ʃræŋk/<,>/ʃræŋk/<,>v.收缩(shrink过去式)<,>The sweater shrank in the wash.<,>这件毛衣洗后缩水了。<,>His confidence shrank after the failure.<,>失败后他的信心减弱了。<,>The company's profits shrank last quarter.<,>公司上个季度的利润缩减了。<,>shrink的过去式，注意拼写变化<,>shrunk(过去分词)/shrink(v.收缩)  

adversely<,>/ˈædvɜːsli/<,>/ædˈvɜːrsli/<,>adv.不利地<,>The drug can adversely affect your health.<,>这种药物可能对健康产生不利影响。<,>The weather adversely impacted the harvest.<,>天气对收成造成了不利影响。<,>His reputation was adversely affected by the scandal.<,>他的声誉因丑闻受到负面影响。<,>adverse(不利的)+ly(副词后缀)→不利地<,>adversity(n.逆境)/advertise(v.广告)  

check<,>/tʃek/<,>/tʃek/<,>v.检查/v.阻止<,>Please check your answers before submitting.<,>提交前请检查你的答案。<,>The new policy aims to check inflation.<,>新政策旨在遏制通货膨胀。<,>Security checked our bags at the entrance.<,>保安在入口检查了我们的包。<,>chess中的"将军"也是check<,>cheque(n.支票)/chick(n.小鸡)  

testimony<,>/ˈtestɪməni/<,>/ˈtestɪmoʊni/<,>n.证词<,>The witness gave testimony in court.<,>证人在法庭上提供了证词。<,>Her testimony was crucial to the case.<,>她的证词对案件至关重要。<,>The documentary includes testimonies from survivors.<,>这部纪录片包含了幸存者的证词。<,>test(测试)+mony→经过测试的陈述→证词<,>testimonial(n.证明书)/testosterone(n.睾酮)  

rigorous<,>/ˈrɪɡərəs/<,>/ˈrɪɡərəs/<,>adj.严格的<,>The training program is very rigorous.<,>这个训练项目非常严格。<,>She maintains a rigorous exercise routine.<,>她坚持严格的锻炼计划。<,>The research followed rigorous scientific methods.<,>这项研究遵循了严格的科学方法。<,>rig(严格)+orous(形容词后缀)→严格的<,>vigorous(adj.精力充沛的)/rigidity(n.僵硬)  

privileged<,>/ˈprɪvəlɪdʒd/<,>/ˈprɪvəlɪdʒd/<,>adj.有特权的<,>He comes from a privileged background.<,>他出身特权阶层。<,>We are privileged to have this opportunity.<,>我们很荣幸有这个机会。<,>Access to this information is privileged.<,>这些信息的获取是有特权的。<,>private(私人的)+leg(法律)+ed→有私人法律权利的→有特权的<,>privacy(n.隐私)/privation(n.匮乏)  

expectation<,>/ˌekspekˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌekspekˈteɪʃn/<,>n.期望<,>The movie didn't meet my expectations.<,>这部电影没有达到我的期望。<,>There are high expectations for the new CEO.<,>人们对新任CEO期望很高。<,>Managing customer expectations is important.<,>管理客户期望很重要。<,>expect(期待)+ation(名词后缀)→期望<,>expectant(adj.期待的)/expedition(n.远征)  

bias<,>/ˈbaɪəs/<,>/ˈbaɪəs/<,>n.偏见<,>The judge was accused of bias.<,>法官被指控有偏见。<,>There's a clear media bias in this report.<,>这份报告有明显的媒体偏见。<,>We should avoid confirmation bias in research.<,>研究中应避免确认偏误。<,>bi(二)+as(如同)→只看到两面中的一面→偏见<,>biased(adj.有偏见的)/basis(n.基础)
lawsuit<,>/ˈlɔːsuːt/<,>/ˈlɔˌsut/<,>n.诉讼<,>The company filed a lawsuit against its competitor.<,>该公司对竞争对手提起了诉讼。<,>He won the lawsuit and received compensation.<,>他赢得了诉讼并获得了赔偿。<,>The lawsuit dragged on for years.<,>这场诉讼拖了好几年。<,>law(法律)+suit(诉讼)→诉讼<,>lawsuit(n.诉讼)/lawsuit(n.诉讼)/lawsuit(n.诉讼)  

eloquent<,>/ˈeləkwənt/<,>/ˈɛləkwənt/<,>adj.口才好的/adj.雄辩的<,>Her eloquent speech moved the audience.<,>她雄辩的演讲打动了观众。<,>He is an eloquent speaker.<,>他是个口才很好的演讲者。<,>The lawyer's eloquent argument won the case.<,>律师雄辩的论证赢得了案件。<,>e(出)+loqu(说)+ent(形容词后缀)→能说会道的<,>eloquent(adj.雄辩的)/fluent(adj.流利的)/colloquial(adj.口语的)  

shrink<,>/ʃrɪŋk/<,>/ʃrɪŋk/<,>v.缩减/v.缩小<,>The sweater shrank in the wash.<,>毛衣洗后缩水了。<,>The company plans to shrink its workforce.<,>公司计划缩减员工人数。<,>His confidence shrank after the failure.<,>失败后他的信心减弱了。<,>shrink(收缩)→衣服缩水<,>shrink(v.缩小)/shriek(v.尖叫)/shrivel(v.枯萎)  

regulation<,>/ˌreɡjuˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛɡjəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.规则/n.管理<,>The new regulation will take effect next month.<,>新规将于下月生效。<,>Strict regulations govern food safety.<,>严格的法规管理食品安全。<,>He works in financial regulation.<,>他从事金融监管工作。<,>regul(规则)+ation(名词后缀)→规则<,>regulation(n.规则)/regular(adj.规律的)/irregular(adj.不规则的)  

alternative<,>/ɔːlˈtɜːnətɪv/<,>/ɔlˈtɝnətɪv/<,>n.代替品<,>We need to find an alternative solution.<,>我们需要找到替代的解决方案。<,>Solar energy is a good alternative to fossil fuels.<,>太阳能是化石燃料的良好替代品。<,>There is no alternative but to wait.<,>除了等待别无选择。<,>alter(改变)+native(形容词后缀)→可改变的→替代的<,>alternative(n.替代品)/alternate(v.交替)/alteration(n.改变)  

moist<,>/mɔɪst/<,>/mɔɪst/<,>adj.潮湿的<,>The air was moist after the rain.<,>雨后空气潮湿。<,>Keep the soil moist for the plants.<,>保持土壤湿润以利于植物生长。<,>Her eyes were moist with tears.<,>她的眼睛湿润含泪。<,>moist(潮湿)→发音似"摸湿的"<,>moist(adj.潮湿的)/damp(adj.微湿的)/humid(adj.湿润的)  

surpass<,>/səˈpɑːs/<,>/sɚˈpæs/<,>v.超过<,>Her performance surpassed all expectations.<,>她的表现超出了所有人的预期。<,>He surpassed his previous record.<,>他超越了自己之前的记录。<,>The new model surpasses the old one in efficiency.<,>新模型在效率上超过了旧模型。<,>sur(超过)+pass(通过)→超过<,>surpass(v.超过)/surplus(n.过剩)/surprise(v.使惊讶)  

fabric<,>/ˈfæbrɪk/<,>/ˈfæbrɪk/<,>n.布料<,>This fabric is soft and durable.<,>这种布料柔软耐用。<,>She bought some fabric to make a dress.<,>她买了一些布料做裙子。<,>The fabric of society is changing.<,>社会结构正在变化。<,>fabr(制作)+ic(名词后缀)→制作的物品→布料<,>fabric(n.布料)/fabricate(v.制造)/fabulous(adj.极好的)  

distinction<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkʃn/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkʃən/<,>n.区分<,>There is a clear distinction between the two concepts.<,>这两个概念之间有明显的区别。<,>He graduated with distinction.<,>他以优异成绩毕业。<,>The award recognizes his distinction in the field.<,>这个奖项表彰他在该领域的卓越成就。<,>distinct(不同的)+ion(名词后缀)→区分<,>distinction(n.区分)/extinction(n.灭绝)/instinct(n.本能)  

eradicate<,>/ɪˈrædɪkeɪt/<,>/ɪˈrædɪˌket/<,>v.根除<,>The government aims to eradicate poverty.<,>政府旨在消除贫困。<,>Efforts to eradicate the disease have been successful.<,>根除这种疾病的努力取得了成功。<,>We must eradicate these harmful practices.<,>我们必须根除这些有害的做法。<,>e(出)+radic(根)+ate(动词后缀)→连根拔起→根除<,>eradicate(v.根除)/irradiate(v.照射)/eradicable(adj.可根除的)
brilliant<,>/ˈbrɪliənt/<,>/ˈbrɪliənt/<,>adj.才华横溢的/adj.极好的<,>She gave a brilliant performance at the concert.<,>她在音乐会上表现非常出色。<,>The idea was absolutely brilliant.<,>这个想法简直棒极了。<,>He is a brilliant scientist.<,>他是一位才华横溢的科学家。<,>brill(明亮)+iant(形容词后缀)→明亮的→才华横溢的<,>bright(adj.明亮的)/radiant(adj.光芒四射的)/shining(adj.闪耀的)

redefine<,>/ˌriːdɪˈfaɪn/<,>/ˌriːdɪˈfaɪn/<,>v.重新定义<,>The company aims to redefine the standards of customer service.<,>该公司旨在重新定义客户服务的标准。<,>Technology has redefined the way we communicate.<,>科技重新定义了我们交流的方式。<,>We need to redefine our goals for the project.<,>我们需要重新定义项目的目标。<,>re(重新)+define(定义)→重新定义<,>refine(v.精炼)/define(v.定义)/confine(v.限制)

arm<,>/ɑːm/<,>/ɑːrm/<,>v.装备/v.武装<,>The soldiers were armed with the latest weapons.<,>士兵们装备了最新武器。<,>He armed himself with knowledge before the debate.<,>他在辩论前用知识武装自己。<,>The government decided to arm the police force.<,>政府决定武装警察部队。<,>arm(手臂)→用手臂武装→装备<,>alarm(n.警报)/harm(v.伤害)/farm(n.农场)

intensely<,>/ɪnˈtensli/<,>/ɪnˈtensli/<,>adv.强烈地<,>She stared intensely at the painting.<,>她专注地盯着那幅画。<,>The sun shone intensely that afternoon.<,>那天下午阳光非常强烈。<,>He worked intensely to meet the deadline.<,>他拼命工作以赶上截止日期。<,>in(加强)+tens(伸展)+ly(副词后缀)→伸展到极限→强烈地<,>intensive(adj.密集的)/intent(n.意图)/intensity(n.强度)

desperate<,>/ˈdespərət/<,>/ˈdespərət/<,>adj.绝望的/adj.不顾一切的<,>He made a desperate attempt to save his business.<,>他不顾一切地试图挽救他的生意。<,>The refugees were in desperate need of food.<,>难民们急需食物。<,>She felt desperate after losing her job.<,>失业后她感到绝望。<,>de(去掉)+sper(希望)+ate(形容词后缀)→没有希望的→绝望的<,>separate(v.分开)/despair(n.绝望)/disparate(adj.不同的)

sexism<,>/ˈseksɪzəm/<,>/ˈseksɪzəm/<,>n.性别歧视<,>Sexism in the workplace is still a serious issue.<,>职场中的性别歧视仍然是个严重问题。<,>She spoke out against sexism in the media.<,>她公开反对媒体中的性别歧视。<,>The company has policies to prevent sexism.<,>公司有防止性别歧视的政策。<,>sex(性别)+ism(主义)→性别主义→性别歧视<,>racism(n.种族歧视)/feminism(n.女权主义)/sexist(adj.性别歧视的)

bruise<,>/bruːz/<,>/bruːz/<,>v.使碰伤/v.擦伤<,>She bruised her knee when she fell.<,>她摔倒时擦伤了膝盖。<,>The apple was bruised and couldn't be sold.<,>苹果碰伤了，不能卖了。<,>His ego was bruised by the criticism.<,>批评伤了他的自尊心。<,>bruise发音类似"不如死"→受伤不如死→碰伤<,>cruise(v.巡航)/blues(n.忧郁)/bruiser(n.彪形大汉)

prominent<,>/ˈprɒmɪnənt/<,>/ˈprɑːmɪnənt/<,>adj.卓越的/adj.突出的<,>He is a prominent figure in the scientific community.<,>他是科学界的杰出人物。<,>The tower is a prominent landmark in the city.<,>这座塔是城市的显著地标。<,>She has a prominent role in the play.<,>她在剧中扮演重要角色。<,>pro(向前)+min(突出)+ent(形容词后缀)→向前突出的→卓越的<,>dominant(adj.主导的)/eminent(adj.著名的)/imminent(adj.即将发生的)

comprehensive<,>/ˌkɒmprɪˈhensɪv/<,>/ˌkɑːmprɪˈhensɪv/<,>adj.综合的/adj.全面的<,>The school offers a comprehensive curriculum.<,>学校提供全面的课程。<,>We need a comprehensive plan for the project.<,>我们需要一个全面的项目计划。<,>She gave a comprehensive explanation of the theory.<,>她对理论进行了全面的解释。<,>com(全部)+prehend(抓住)+ive(形容词后缀)→全部抓住的→全面的<,>apprehensive(adj.忧虑的)/comprehend(v.理解)/comprehension(n.理解)

forecast<,>/ˈfɔːkɑːst/<,>/ˈfɔːrkæst/<,>n.预报/n.预测<,>The weather forecast predicts rain tomorrow.<,>天气预报说明天有雨。<,>Economic forecasts suggest a recession is coming.<,>经济预测表明经济衰退即将来临。<,>His forecast about the election proved accurate.<,>他对选举的预测被证明是准确的。<,>fore(前)+cast(投掷)→提前投掷→预测<,>broadcast(n.广播)/foretell(v.预言)/forethought(n.深谋远虑)
champion<,>/ˈtʃæmpiən/<,>/ˈtʃæmpiən/<,>v.支持/v.拥护<,>She champions the rights of the underprivileged.<,>她支持弱势群体的权利。<,>He has always championed environmental causes.<,>他一直拥护环保事业。<,>The organization champions free education for all.<,>该组织拥护全民免费教育。<,>champ(冠军)+ion(名词后缀)→像冠军一样支持<,>campaign(n.运动/v.参加活动)/chaperon(n.监护人/v.陪同)

specification<,>/ˌspesɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌspɛsəfɪˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.说明<,>The engineer provided detailed specifications for the project.<,>工程师为项目提供了详细的说明。<,>Please read the product specifications carefully.<,>请仔细阅读产品说明。<,>The contract includes clear specifications of the work required.<,>合同中包含对所需工作的明确说明。<,>specific(具体的)+ation(名词后缀)→具体说明<,>specialization(n.专门化)/certification(n.认证)

layout<,>/ˈleɪaʊt/<,>/ˈleɪˌaʊt/<,>n.布局/n.设计<,>The magazine has a new layout this month.<,>这本杂志本月采用了新的布局。<,>She is responsible for the page layout of the book.<,>她负责这本书的版面设计。<,>The office layout promotes better communication among staff.<,>办公室的布局促进了员工间更好的沟通。<,>lay(放置)+out(出来)→把东西摆出来→布局<,>layoff(n.裁员)/outlay(n.支出)

rally<,>/ˈræli/<,>/ˈræli/<,>n.集会<,>A peace rally was held in the city center.<,>市中心举行了一场和平集会。<,>Thousands attended the political rally.<,>数千人参加了这次政治集会。<,>The rally brought together people from all walks of life.<,>这次集会汇集了各行各业的人。<,>r(反复)+ally(联盟)→反复联盟→集会<,>ally(n.盟友/v.结盟)/dally(v.浪费时间)

romantic<,>/rəʊˈmæntɪk/<,>/roʊˈmæntɪk/<,>adj.爱情的<,>They had a romantic dinner by candlelight.<,>他们享用了一顿烛光晚餐。<,>The movie tells a romantic love story.<,>这部电影讲述了一个浪漫的爱情故事。<,>Paris is considered the most romantic city in the world.<,>巴黎被认为是世界上最浪漫的城市。<,>roman(罗马)+tic(形容词后缀)→像罗马故事般浪漫<,>romance(n.浪漫)/dramatic(adj.戏剧性的)

deviate<,>/ˈdiːvieɪt/<,>/ˈdiviˌeɪt/<,>v.偏离<,>We must not deviate from our original plan.<,>我们绝不能偏离原计划。<,>The plane deviated from its scheduled flight path.<,>飞机偏离了预定航线。<,>His behavior deviates from social norms.<,>他的行为偏离了社会规范。<,>de(离开)+via(路)+ate(动词后缀)→离开道路→偏离<,>deviant(adj.偏离的)/divert(v.转移)

insufficient<,>/ˌɪnsəˈfɪʃnt/<,>/ˌɪnsəˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.不足的<,>The evidence was insufficient to convict him.<,>证据不足以给他定罪。<,>There is insufficient time to complete the project.<,>没有足够的时间来完成这个项目。<,>Her income is insufficient to support her family.<,>她的收入不足以养家。<,>in(不)+sufficient(足够的)→不足的<,>efficient(adj.高效的)/deficient(adj.缺乏的)

boost<,>/buːst/<,>/bust/<,>v.提高<,>The new policy will boost economic growth.<,>新政策将促进经济增长。<,>Coffee helps to boost my energy in the morning.<,>咖啡有助于提高我早上的精力。<,>The advertising campaign boosted sales significantly.<,>广告活动显著提高了销售额。<,>boo(拟声)+st(站立)→像加油声一样提高<,>boast(v.自夸)/roost(n.栖息处)

scandal<,>/ˈskændl/<,>/ˈskændəl/<,>n.丑闻<,>The political scandal shocked the nation.<,>这起政治丑闻震惊了全国。<,>The company was involved in a financial scandal.<,>该公司卷入了一起财务丑闻。<,>The scandal ruined his reputation.<,>这起丑闻毁了他的声誉。<,>scan(扫描)+dal(谐音"大")→被扫描出来的大事→丑闻<,>sandal(n.凉鞋)/candle(n.蜡烛)

confine<,>/kənˈfaɪn/<,>/kənˈfaɪn/<,>v.限制<,>Please confine your remarks to the topic at hand.<,>请把你的评论限制在当前话题上。<,>The virus was confined to a small area.<,>病毒被限制在一个小范围内。<,>She feels confined by the rules of the organization.<,>她感到被组织的规则所限制。<,>con(共同)+fine(界限)→共同划界→限制<,>define(v.定义)/refine(v.精炼)
conspicuous<,>/kənˈspɪk.ju.əs/<,>/kənˈspɪk.ju.əs/<,>adj.显著的<,>She wore a conspicuous red dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件显眼的红色连衣裙去参加派对。<,>The error in the report was conspicuous.<,>报告中的错误非常明显。<,>His talent was conspicuous from a young age.<,>他的才华从小就很显著。<,>con(共同)+spic(看)+uous(形容词后缀)→大家都看得见的→显著的<,>obvious(adj.明显的)/noticeable(adj.引人注目的)/prominent(adj.突出的)

significant<,>/sɪɡˈnɪf.ɪ.kənt/<,>/sɪɡˈnɪf.ə.kənt/<,>adj.重要的<,>This discovery is significant for medical research.<,>这一发现对医学研究很重要。<,>There was a significant increase in sales last month.<,>上个月销售额有显著增长。<,>She made a significant contribution to the project.<,>她对这个项目做出了重要贡献。<,>sign(标记)+i+fic(做)+ant(形容词后缀)→做了标记的→重要的<,>important(adj.重要的)/crucial(adj.关键的)/vital(adj.至关重要的)

fresh<,>/freʃ/<,>/frɛʃ/<,>adj.新颖的/新奇的<,>She always has fresh ideas for the project.<,>她总是对这个项目有新颖的想法。<,>The bread is fresh from the oven.<,>面包是刚从烤箱里拿出来的。<,>Let's get some fresh air outside.<,>我们出去呼吸些新鲜空气吧。<,>fr(自由)+esh(形容词后缀)→自由不受约束的→新颖的<,>new(adj.新的)/original(adj.原创的)/innovative(adj.创新的)

indulge<,>/ɪnˈdʌldʒ/<,>/ɪnˈdʌldʒ/<,>v.放纵<,>He indulged himself with a piece of chocolate cake.<,>他放纵自己吃了一块巧克力蛋糕。<,>Parents should not indulge their children too much.<,>父母不应该过分放纵孩子。<,>She indulged in nostalgic memories of her childhood.<,>她沉浸在童年的怀旧回忆中。<,>in(进入)+dulge(温和)→温和地进入→放纵<,>pamper(v.纵容)/spoil(v.溺爱)/gratify(v.满足)

instinctively<,>/ɪnˈstɪŋk.tɪv.li/<,>/ɪnˈstɪŋk.tɪv.li/<,>adv.本能地<,>She instinctively reached out to catch the falling baby.<,>她本能地伸手去接住掉下来的婴儿。<,>He instinctively knew something was wrong.<,>他本能地感觉到出了问题。<,>Animals instinctively avoid danger.<,>动物会本能地避开危险。<,>in(内)+stinct(刺)+ive(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→内在的刺激→本能地<,>intuitively(adv.直觉地)/spontaneously(adv.自发地)/automatically(adv.自动地)

complement<,>/ˈkɒm.plɪ.ment/<,>/ˈkɑːm.plə.ment/<,>n.补充<,>The wine is a perfect complement to the meal.<,>这酒是这顿饭的完美搭配。<,>Her skills complement his in running the business.<,>她的技能在经营业务方面对他是个补充。<,>The two colors complement each other well.<,>这两种颜色相互衬托得很好。<,>com(共同)+ple(满)+ment(名词后缀)→共同填满→补充<,>supplement(n.补充)/accessory(n.附件)/accompaniment(n.伴奏)

content<,>/kənˈtent/<,>/kənˈtɛnt/<,>adj.满意的<,>She was content with her simple life.<,>她对自己简单的生活很满意。<,>The baby looked content after being fed.<,>婴儿吃饱后看起来很满足。<,>He is content to stay at home reading books.<,>他很满足于待在家里看书。<,>con(完全)+tent(伸展)→完全伸展→满足的<,>satisfied(adj.满意的)/pleased(adj.高兴的)/happy(adj.快乐的)

squalor<,>/ˈskwɒl.ər/<,>/ˈskwɑː.lɚ/<,>n.肮脏<,>They lived in squalor and poverty.<,>他们生活在肮脏和贫困中。<,>The abandoned house was in complete squalor.<,>废弃的房子完全处于肮脏状态。<,>No one should have to endure such squalor.<,>没有人应该忍受这样的肮脏环境。<,>squal(鳞片)+or(名词后缀)→像鱼鳞一样脏→肮脏<,>filth(n.污秽)/dirt(n.污垢)/grime(n.尘垢)

fatigue<,>/fəˈtiːɡ/<,>/fəˈtiːɡ/<,>n.疲惫<,>After the long hike, he was overcome with fatigue.<,>长途跋涉后，他疲惫不堪。<,>She felt mental fatigue after studying for hours.<,>学习了几个小时后，她感到精神疲惫。<,>The soldiers marched despite their fatigue.<,>士兵们不顾疲劳继续行军。<,>fat(脂肪)+igue(名词后缀)→脂肪燃烧殆尽→疲惫<,>exhaustion(n.精疲力竭)/tiredness(n.疲倦)/weariness(n.疲劳)

awesome<,>/ˈɔː.səm/<,>/ˈɑː.səm/<,>adj.令人敬畏的/令人赞叹的/极好的<,>The view from the mountaintop was awesome.<,>山顶的景色令人惊叹。<,>You did an awesome job on the presentation!<,>你的演讲做得太棒了！<,>The power of nature is truly awesome.<,>大自然的力量确实令人敬畏。<,>awe(敬畏)+some(形容词后缀)→令人敬畏的<,>amazing(adj.惊人的)/impressive(adj.印象深刻的)/terrific(adj.极好的)
responsive<,>/rɪˈspɒnsɪv/<,>/rɪˈspɑːnsɪv/<,>adj.灵敏的/adj.反应的<,>The new smartphone has a highly responsive touch screen.<,>这款新智能手机的触摸屏反应非常灵敏。<,>She was very responsive to the needs of her students.<,>她对学生的需求反应非常迅速。<,>The car's steering is responsive and precise.<,>这辆车的转向灵敏而精准。<,>re(回)+spons(承诺)+ive→能回应承诺的→反应的<,>responsible(adj.负责的)/responsive(adj.反应的)/responsive(adj.灵敏的)

echo<,>/ˈekəʊ/<,>/ˈekoʊ/<,>v.随声附和/v.发出回声<,>His words echoed in the empty hall.<,>他的话在空荡荡的大厅里回荡。<,>She just echoes whatever her boss says.<,>她只是随声附和老板说的话。<,>The mountains echoed with the sound of gunfire.<,>枪声在山间回荡。<,>ech(声音)+o→回声<,>ego(n.自我)/eco(前缀:生态)/echo(v.回声)

division<,>/dɪˈvɪʒn/<,>/dɪˈvɪʒən/<,>n.分歧<,>There is a deep division of opinion on this issue.<,>在这个问题上存在深刻的分歧。<,>The division between rich and poor is growing.<,>贫富差距正在扩大。<,>The team was weakened by internal divisions.<,>内部的分歧削弱了团队。<,>di(分开)+vis(看)+ion→分开看→分歧<,>vision(n.视力)/decision(n.决定)/division(n.分歧)

gender<,>/ˈdʒendə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒendər/<,>n.性别<,>Gender equality is an important issue in modern society.<,>性别平等是现代社会的重要议题。<,>The form asks you to specify your gender.<,>表格要求你注明性别。<,>There should be no discrimination based on gender.<,>不应该有基于性别的歧视。<,>gen(种类)+der→性别<,>generation(n.一代人)/general(adj.一般的)/gender(n.性别)

correlation<,>/ˌkɒrəˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɔːrəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.相关/n.关联<,>There is a strong correlation between smoking and lung cancer.<,>吸烟与肺癌有很强的相关性。<,>The study found no correlation between the two variables.<,>研究发现这两个变量之间没有关联。<,>We need to analyze the correlation between these data sets.<,>我们需要分析这些数据集之间的关联。<,>co(共同)+relation(关系)→相互关系<,>relation(n.关系)/correlation(n.相关)/collaboration(n.合作)

casualty<,>/ˈkæʒuəlti/<,>/ˈkæʒuəlti/<,>n.伤亡人数<,>The earthquake caused heavy casualties.<,>地震造成了大量伤亡。<,>Civilian casualties are increasing in the war zone.<,>战区平民伤亡人数正在增加。<,>The hospital is overwhelmed with casualties from the accident.<,>医院因事故伤亡人员而不堪重负。<,>casual(偶然的)+ty→偶然事件造成的伤亡<,>casual(adj.偶然的)/casualty(n.伤亡)/causality(n.因果关系)

appropriate<,>/əˈprəʊpriət/<,>/əˈproʊpriət/<,>adj.适当的<,>This movie is not appropriate for children.<,>这部电影不适合儿童观看。<,>Please wear appropriate clothing for the interview.<,>请穿着得体的服装参加面试。<,>The punishment should be appropriate to the crime.<,>惩罚应该与罪行相称。<,>ap(向)+propri(自己的)+ate→使成为自己的→适当的<,>approximate(adj.近似的)/appropriate(adj.适当的)/appropriation(n.拨款)

subtle<,>/ˈsʌtl/<,>/ˈsʌtl/<,>adj.微妙的<,>There is a subtle difference between the two words.<,>这两个词之间有微妙的区别。<,>She gave him a subtle hint that she was not interested.<,>她给了他一个微妙的暗示，表示她不感兴趣。<,>The painting has subtle shades of blue.<,>这幅画有微妙的蓝色色调。<,>sub(下面)+tle→在下面的→微妙的<,>subtle(adj.微妙的)/subtlety(n.微妙)/subtitle(n.字幕)

critical<,>/ˈkrɪtɪkl/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪkəl/<,>adj.批评的/adj.关键的<,>She is very critical of her own work.<,>她对自己的工作非常挑剔。<,>This is a critical moment in the negotiations.<,>这是谈判的关键时刻。<,>The patient is in critical condition.<,>病人情况危急。<,>crit(判断)+ical→需要判断的→关键的<,>critic(n.评论家)/critical(adj.关键的)/criticism(n.批评)

alternatively<,>/ɔːlˈtɜːnətɪvli/<,>/ɔːlˈtɜːrnətɪvli/<,>adv.二选一地/adv.非此即彼<,>You can take the bus, or alternatively, you can walk.<,>你可以坐公交车，或者你也可以步行。<,>We could go to the cinema, or alternatively, stay home and watch TV.<,>我们可以去看电影，或者呆在家里看电视。<,>Alternatively, you could try a different approach.<,>或者，你可以尝试不同的方法。<,>alter(改变)+native+ly→改变选择地<,>alternative(n.选择)/alternately(adv.交替地)/alternatively(adv.二选一地)
intimate<,>/ˈɪntɪmət/<,>/ˈɪntəmət/<,>adj.亲密的<,>They have an intimate friendship that has lasted for years.<,>他们有着持续多年的亲密友谊。<,>She shared her intimate thoughts with her best friend.<,>她向最好的朋友倾诉了她内心的想法。<,>The couple enjoys intimate dinners together.<,>这对夫妇喜欢一起享受亲密的晚餐。<,>in(内)+tim(害怕)+ate→内心不害怕→亲密的<,>imitate(v.模仿)/intimidate(v.恐吓)/ultimate(adj.最终的)

disengagement<,>/ˌdɪsɪnˈɡeɪdʒmənt/<,>/ˌdɪsɪnˈɡeɪdʒmənt/<,>n.分离<,>The disengagement of troops from the border reduced tensions.<,>军队从边境撤离缓解了紧张局势。<,>Her disengagement from social media improved her mental health.<,>她退出社交媒体后心理健康有所改善。<,>The disengagement process took longer than expected.<,>分离过程比预期的时间要长。<,>dis(不)+engage(参与)+ment→不参与→分离<,>engagement(n.订婚/n.参与)/disengage(v.脱离)/disentangle(v.解开)

lounge<,>/laʊndʒ/<,>/laʊndʒ/<,>n.休息室<,>We waited in the airport lounge before our flight.<,>我们在航班起飞前在机场休息室等候。<,>The hotel has a comfortable lounge for guests.<,>酒店为客人提供了舒适的休息室。<,>He spent the afternoon reading in the lounge.<,>他整个下午都在休息室看书。<,>loun(懒散)+ge→懒散的地方→休息室<,>launge(v.懒散地倚靠)/lunge(n.猛冲)/plunge(v.投入)

gesture<,>/ˈdʒestʃə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒestʃər/<,>n.姿势/n.手势<,>She made a gesture of apology with her hands.<,>她用手做了一个道歉的手势。<,>A simple gesture of kindness can make someone's day.<,>一个简单的善意举动可以让人开心一整天。<,>His gestures were exaggerated while telling the story.<,>他讲故事时手势很夸张。<,>gest(携带)+ure→用手携带信息→手势<,>posture(n.姿势)/lecture(n.演讲)/texture(n.质地)

script<,>/skrɪpt/<,>/skrɪpt/<,>n.脚本/n.剧本<,>The actors rehearsed the script before the performance.<,>演员们在表演前排练了剧本。<,>She wrote a script for the school play.<,>她为学校的戏剧写了一个剧本。<,>The software runs a script to automate the task.<,>该软件运行一个脚本来自动完成任务。<,>scrip(写)+t→写出来的东西→剧本<,>manuscript(n.手稿)/prescription(n.处方)/subscription(n.订阅)

prestige<,>/preˈstiːʒ/<,>/preˈstiːʒ/<,>n.名声/n.声望<,>The university has a lot of prestige in academic circles.<,>这所大学在学术界享有很高的声望。<,>Winning the award added to his prestige.<,>赢得这个奖项增加了他的声望。<,>The job offers prestige but not a high salary.<,>这份工作有声望但薪水不高。<,>pre(前)+stige(拉)→在前面拉→声望<,>prestigious(adj.有声望的)/presage(v.预示)/presto(adv.迅速地)

awkward<,>/ˈɔːkwəd/<,>/ˈɔːkwərd/<,>adj.尴尬的/adj.棘手的/adj.笨拙的<,>There was an awkward silence after his joke.<,>他讲完笑话后出现了一阵尴尬的沉默。<,>The box was an awkward shape to carry.<,>这个盒子的形状很难拿。<,>He felt awkward at the formal dinner.<,>他在正式晚宴上感到不自在。<,>awk(错误的)+ward(方向)→方向错误→笨拙的<,>backward(adj.向后的)/forward(adj.向前的)/wayward(adj.任性的)

entrepreneur<,>/ˌɒntrəprəˈnɜː(r)/<,>/ˌɑːntrəprəˈnɜːr/<,>n.企业家<,>The young entrepreneur started her own tech company.<,>这位年轻的企业家创办了自己的科技公司。<,>Entrepreneurs take risks to build businesses.<,>企业家们冒险建立企业。<,>He is a successful entrepreneur in the fashion industry.<,>他是时尚界一位成功的企业家。<,>entre(之间)+prene(拿)+ur→在风险中拿取的人→企业家<,>enterprise(n.企业)/entrepreneurial(adj.企业家的)/intrapreneur(n.内部创业者)

automatic<,>/ˌɔːtəˈmætɪk/<,>/ˌɔːtəˈmætɪk/<,>adj.自动的<,>The doors open with an automatic sensor.<,>门通过自动传感器打开。<,>She drives a car with automatic transmission.<,>她开的是一辆自动挡汽车。<,>The system has an automatic backup feature.<,>这个系统有自动备份功能。<,>auto(自己)+mat(思考)+ic→自己思考的→自动的<,>automate(v.使自动化)/automaton(n.自动装置)/autonomous(adj.自治的)

thrive<,>/θraɪv/<,>/θraɪv/<,>v.繁荣/v.兴旺<,>Plants thrive in this fertile soil.<,>植物在这肥沃的土壤中茁壮成长。<,>The business began to thrive after the new management took over.<,>新管理层接手后，业务开始蓬勃发展。<,>Some people thrive under pressure.<,>有些人在压力下反而表现出色。<,>thr(三)+ive→三倍生长→繁荣<,>strive(v.努力)/derive(v.源于)/contrive(v.设计)
enrich<,>/ɪnˈrɪtʃ/<,>/ɪnˈrɪtʃ/<,>v.丰富/v.使富裕<,>Reading can enrich your knowledge.<,>阅读可以丰富你的知识。<,>The new policy aims to enrich the local economy.<,>新政策旨在使当地经济富裕起来。<,>He enriched his life by traveling around the world.<,>他通过环游世界丰富了自己的生活。<,>en(使)+rich(富裕)→使富裕<,>enhance(v.提高)/endow(v.捐赠)  

chew<,>/tʃuː/<,>/tʃuː/<,>v.咀嚼/v.深思<,>Chew your food slowly before swallowing.<,>吞咽前要慢慢咀嚼食物。<,>I need some time to chew over this problem.<,>我需要一些时间来深思这个问题。<,>The dog is chewing on a bone.<,>狗正在啃骨头。<,>发音类似"咀嚼"的拟声词<,>chow(n.食物)/cheer(v.欢呼)  

vehicle<,>/ˈviːək(ə)l/<,>/ˈviːhɪkl/<,>n.车辆<,>The city is promoting electric vehicles.<,>该市正在推广电动汽车。<,>This truck is my primary work vehicle.<,>这辆卡车是我的主要工作车辆。<,>Language is a vehicle for communication.<,>语言是交流的工具。<,>veh(运送)+icle(小东西)→运送工具<,>vessel(n.容器)/vocal(adj.声音的)  

intriguing<,>/ɪnˈtriːɡɪŋ/<,>/ɪnˈtriːɡɪŋ/<,>adj.有趣的<,>She told me an intriguing story.<,>她给我讲了一个有趣的故事。<,>I find his theory quite intriguing.<,>我觉得他的理论相当有趣。<,>The movie has an intriguing plot twist.<,>这部电影有个有趣的剧情转折。<,>in(进入)+trig(引发)+ing→引发兴趣的<,>interesting(adj.有趣的)/integral(adj.完整的)  

segregation<,>/ˌseɡrɪˈɡeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌseɡrɪˈɡeɪʃən/<,>n.隔离<,>Racial segregation was abolished decades ago.<,>种族隔离几十年前就被废除了。<,>The school ended gender segregation in classrooms.<,>学校结束了教室里的性别隔离。<,>Waste segregation is important for recycling.<,>垃圾分类对回收很重要。<,>se(分开)+greg(群体)+ation→群体分开<,>aggregation(n.聚集)/secretion(n.分泌)  

hurl<,>/hɜːl/<,>/hɜːrl/<,>v.猛投<,>He hurled the ball across the field.<,>他把球猛投过场地。<,>Protesters hurled stones at the police.<,>抗议者向警察投掷石块。<,>She hurled insults at her opponent.<,>她向对手猛烈辱骂。<,>发音类似"吼"→用力吼叫时投掷<,>hurl(v.呕吐)/hurl(n.投掷)  

hatch<,>/hætʃ/<,>/hætʃ/<,>v.孵化<,>The eggs will hatch in about three weeks.<,>这些蛋大约三周后会孵化。<,>We watched the baby birds hatch from their eggs.<,>我们看着小鸟从蛋里孵化出来。<,>They hatched a plan to escape.<,>他们策划了一个逃跑计划。<,>hat(帽子)+ch→像帽子一样包裹着等待孵化<,>catch(v.抓住)/patch(n.补丁)  

disservice<,>/dɪsˈsɜːvɪs/<,>/dɪsˈsɜːrvɪs/<,>n.危害<,>Spreading rumors does a great disservice to society.<,>传播谣言对社会危害很大。<,>The misleading advertisement was a disservice to consumers.<,>这则误导性广告对消费者造成了危害。<,>His actions did a disservice to the team's reputation.<,>他的行为损害了团队的声誉。<,>dis(否定)+service(服务)→不好的服务<,>dissolve(v.溶解)/dissuade(v.劝阻)  

variation<,>/ˌveərɪˈeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌverɪˈeɪʃən/<,>n.变化<,>There is little variation in temperature here.<,>这里温度变化很小。<,>The song has several interesting variations.<,>这首歌有几个有趣的变化版本。<,>Genetic variation is important for evolution.<,>基因变异对进化很重要。<,>vari(变化)+ation→变化<,>vacation(n.假期)/vibration(n.振动)  

enormous<,>/ɪˈnɔːməs/<,>/ɪˈnɔːrməs/<,>adj.巨大的<,>They live in an enormous house.<,>他们住在一所巨大的房子里。<,>The project requires an enormous amount of money.<,>这个项目需要巨额资金。<,>There was an enormous crowd at the concert.<,>音乐会上人山人海。<,>e(出)+norm(标准)+ous→超出标准的<,>enormity(n.暴行)/anonymous(adj.匿名的)
scare<,>/skeə(r)/<,>/sker/<,>n.恐吓/n.惊恐<,>The loud noise gave me a scare.<,>巨大的噪音吓了我一跳。<,>She had a scare when she saw the spider.<,>她看到蜘蛛时吓了一跳。<,>Don't scare the children with ghost stories.<,>不要用鬼故事吓唬孩子们。<,>s(蛇)+care(关心)→蛇让人害怕→惊恐<,>scar(n.疤痕)/scarf(n.围巾)/scarecrow(n.稻草人)

alphabetical<,>/ˌælfəˈbetɪkl/<,>/ˌælfəˈbɛtɪkəl/<,>adj.按字母表顺序的<,>The names are listed in alphabetical order.<,>名字是按字母顺序排列的。<,>Please arrange these files alphabetically.<,>请按字母顺序整理这些文件。<,>The dictionary uses an alphabetical system.<,>这本词典采用字母顺序排列。<,>alpha(阿尔法)+bet(贝塔)+ical(形容词后缀)→按字母顺序的<,>alphabet(n.字母表)/alphabetic(adj.字母的)/analphabet(n.文盲)

conclusive<,>/kənˈkluːsɪv/<,>/kənˈklusɪv/<,>adj.得出结论的<,>The evidence is not conclusive enough.<,>证据还不够确凿。<,>They reached a conclusive decision.<,>他们做出了最终决定。<,>The test results were conclusive.<,>测试结果是决定性的。<,>con(共同)+clus(关闭)+ive(形容词后缀)→共同关闭讨论→得出结论的<,>inclusive(adj.包含的)/exclusive(adj.排他的)/elusive(adj.难捉摸的)

epidemic<,>/ˌepɪˈdemɪk/<,>/ˌɛpɪˈdɛmɪk/<,>n.流行病<,>The flu epidemic spread quickly.<,>流感疫情迅速蔓延。<,>They are trying to control the epidemic.<,>他们正在努力控制疫情。<,>The government declared an epidemic.<,>政府宣布了疫情。<,>epi(在...上)+dem(人民)+ic(形容词后缀)→在人民中传播的→流行病<,>endemic(adj.地方性的)/pandemic(adj.全国流行的)/epidemiology(n.流行病学)

solid<,>/ˈsɒlɪd/<,>/ˈsɑːlɪd/<,>adj.坚实的/adj.稳固的<,>The table is made of solid wood.<,>这张桌子是实木做的。<,>They built a solid foundation.<,>他们打下了坚实的基础。<,>Her argument was solid.<,>她的论点很扎实。<,>sol(太阳)+id(形容词后缀)→像太阳一样稳固的<,>liquid(n.液体)/gas(n.气体)/plasma(n.等离子体)

clause<,>/klɔːz/<,>/klɔz/<,>n.条款<,>Please read the contract clauses carefully.<,>请仔细阅读合同条款。<,>This clause protects your rights.<,>这条款保护你的权利。<,>We need to amend this clause.<,>我们需要修改这个条款。<,>claus(关闭)+e→封闭的内容→条款<,>cause(n.原因)/pause(v.暂停)/applause(n.掌声)

attendant<,>/əˈtendənt/<,>/əˈtɛndənt/<,>n.服务人员<,>The flight attendant served drinks.<,>空乘人员提供了饮料。<,>The museum attendant guided us.<,>博物馆的服务人员引导了我们。<,>Parking attendants help with parking.<,>停车服务员协助停车。<,>attend(参加)+ant(人)→参加服务的人→服务人员<,>attendance(n.出席)/attention(n.注意)/attentive(adj.专心的)

collapse<,>/kəˈlæps/<,>/kəˈlæps/<,>v.坍塌/v.崩塌<,>The old building collapsed in the earthquake.<,>老建筑在地震中倒塌了。<,>He collapsed from exhaustion.<,>他因精疲力竭而倒下。<,>The stock market collapsed suddenly.<,>股市突然崩盘了。<,>col(共同)+lapse(滑倒)→一起滑倒→坍塌<,>lapse(n.失误)/elapse(v.流逝)/relapse(v.复发)

dispatch<,>/dɪˈspætʃ/<,>/dɪˈspætʃ/<,>v.发送/v.派遣<,>They dispatched the goods immediately.<,>他们立即发送了货物。<,>The general dispatched troops to the front.<,>将军派遣部队到前线。<,>The courier will dispatch your package today.<,>快递员今天会发送你的包裹。<,>dis(分开)+patch(固定)→分开固定物品→发送<,>despatch(同dispatch)/patch(n.补丁)/detach(v.分离)

shrug<,>/ʃrʌɡ/<,>/ʃrʌɡ/<,>v.耸肩<,>He shrugged his shoulders in confusion.<,>他困惑地耸了耸肩。<,>She shrugged off the criticism.<,>她对批评不屑一顾。<,>The boy shrugged when asked about his homework.<,>当被问及作业时，男孩耸了耸肩。<,>sh(嘘声)+rug(地毯)→像地毯一样软绵绵地耸肩<,>shrub(n.灌木)/shred(v.撕碎)/shun(v.避开)
redundant<,>/rɪˈdʌndənt/<,>/rɪˈdʌndənt/<,>adj.失业的/adj.被解雇的/adj.过剩的<,>Many workers were made redundant due to the company's downsizing.<,>由于公司裁员，许多工人被解雇了。<,>His speech was full of redundant information.<,>他的演讲充满了多余的信息。<,>The redundant population in the city is causing social problems.<,>城市中过剩的人口正在引发社会问题。<,>re(再)+dund(波动)+ant→反复波动→多余的<,>abundant(adj.丰富的)/redundancy(n.冗余)  

alert<,>/əˈlɜːt/<,>/əˈlɜrt/<,>adj.机警的/v.提醒<,>The guard remained alert throughout the night.<,>警卫整晚都保持警惕。<,>The app will alert you when the package arrives.<,>包裹到达时应用程序会提醒你。<,>She has an alert mind and notices everything.<,>她思维敏捷，注意到一切细节。<,>al(加强)+ert(观察)→加强观察→警觉的<,>alarm(n.警报/v.警告)/advert(v.注意)  

deficit<,>/ˈdefɪsɪt/<,>/ˈdefəsɪt/<,>n.赤字<,>The country is facing a large budget deficit this year.<,>该国今年面临巨大的预算赤字。<,>His main weakness is a deficit in communication skills.<,>他的主要弱点是缺乏沟通技巧。<,>The trade deficit has been growing steadily.<,>贸易逆差一直在稳步增长。<,>de(向下)+fic(做)+it→做的不够→赤字<,>defect(n.缺陷)/deficient(adj.不足的)  

restructure<,>/ˌriːˈstrʌktʃə(r)/<,>/ˌriˈstrʌktʃər/<,>v.调整/v.重建<,>The company plans to restructure its departments.<,>公司计划重组各部门。<,>They had to restructure the loan to make it affordable.<,>他们不得不调整贷款使其负担得起。<,>The government is restructuring the education system.<,>政府正在重建教育体系。<,>re(重新)+structure(结构)→重建结构<,>construct(v.建造)/destruct(v.破坏)  

tap<,>/tæp/<,>/tæp/<,>v.轻敲<,>She tapped on the window to get his attention.<,>她轻敲窗户以引起他的注意。<,>He tapped his fingers impatiently on the table.<,>他不耐烦地用手指轻敲桌子。<,>The dancer tapped rhythmically across the stage.<,>舞者有节奏地轻踏着穿过舞台。<,>拟声词，模拟轻敲的声音<,>tab(n.标签)/top(n.顶部)  

simultaneous<,>/ˌsɪməlˈteɪniəs/<,>/ˌsaɪməlˈteɪniəs/<,>adj.同步的<,>The two events happened in simultaneous explosions.<,>两起事件以同步爆炸的形式发生。<,>We need simultaneous translation for this conference.<,>本次会议需要同声传译。<,>The dancers performed a simultaneous turn.<,>舞者们同步转身。<,>simul(相同)+taneous(时间)→同时的<,>instantaneous(adj.瞬间的)/spontaneous(adj.自发的)  

arise<,>/əˈraɪz/<,>/əˈraɪz/<,>v.出现<,>A new problem has arisen in the project.<,>项目中出现了一个新问题。<,>Questions often arise during the learning process.<,>学习过程中经常会出现问题。<,>The conflict arose from a misunderstanding.<,>冲突源于一场误会。<,>a(加强)+rise(升起)→升起→出现<,>rise(v.上升)/raise(v.举起)  

wildlife<,>/ˈwaɪldlaɪf/<,>/ˈwaɪldlaɪf/<,>n.野生动物<,>We should protect wildlife and their habitats.<,>我们应该保护野生动物及其栖息地。<,>The documentary features amazing wildlife footage.<,>这部纪录片展示了惊人的野生动物镜头。<,>Illegal hunting threatens local wildlife.<,>非法狩猎威胁当地野生动物。<,>wild(野生的)+life(生命)→野生动物<,>wilderness(n.荒野)/wildfire(n.野火)
