overwhelm<,>/ˌəʊvəˈwelm/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈwelm/<,>v.压倒/v.战胜<,>The floodwaters overwhelmed the small village.<,>洪水淹没了小村庄。<,>She was overwhelmed by the amount of work.<,>她被大量的工作压垮了。<,>Our team overwhelmed the opponents in the final.<,>我们队在决赛中战胜了对手。<,>over(过度)+whelm(淹没)→过度淹没→压倒<,>underwhelm(v.未达预期)/overpower(v.制服)  

motivation<,>/ˌməʊtɪˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌmoʊtɪˈveɪʃn/<,>n.动力/n.积极性<,>His main motivation is to provide for his family.<,>他的主要动力是养家糊口。<,>The teacher tried to increase students' motivation.<,>老师试图提高学生的积极性。<,>Lack of motivation can affect work performance.<,>缺乏积极性会影响工作表现。<,>motiv(动机)+ation(状态)→动力状态<,>motive(n.动机)/motivate(v.激励)
delicate<,>/ˈdelɪkət/<,>/ˈdɛlɪkɪt/<,>adj.细微的/adj.精细的<,>The delicate fabric requires gentle washing.<,>这种精细的面料需要轻柔洗涤。<,>He handled the delicate situation with great care.<,>他非常谨慎地处理了这个微妙的情况。<,>The delicate balance of nature must be preserved.<,>必须保护自然界微妙的平衡。<,>delic(精美)+ate(形容词后缀)→精美的→精细的<,>dedicate(v.奉献)/delicious(adj.美味的)/deliberate(adj.故意的)

remarkable<,>/rɪˈmɑːkəbl/<,>/rɪˈmɑrkəbəl/<,>adj.显著的/adj.杰出的<,>She made remarkable progress in her studies.<,>她在学习上取得了显著进步。<,>This is a remarkable achievement for such a young artist.<,>对如此年轻的艺术家来说，这是杰出成就。<,>The view from the top was truly remarkable.<,>从顶部看到的景色确实非常壮观。<,>re(再)+mark(标记)+able(能)→能再次被标记的→显著的<,>remark(n.评论)/marketable(adj.有销路的)/memorable(adj.难忘的)

slavery<,>/ˈsleɪvəri/<,>/ˈsleɪvəri/<,>n.奴隶制度<,>Slavery was abolished in the 19th century.<,>奴隶制度在19世纪被废除。<,>The novel depicts the horrors of slavery.<,>这部小说描写了奴隶制的恐怖。<,>Many fought against the injustice of slavery.<,>许多人反抗奴隶制的不公正。<,>slave(奴隶)+ry(名词后缀)→奴隶制度<,>slaver(n.奴隶贩子)/slaver(v.流口水)/savory(adj.美味的)

untreated<,>/ʌnˈtriːtɪd/<,>/ʌnˈtritɪd/<,>adj.未经处理的<,>The untreated water may contain harmful bacteria.<,>未经处理的水可能含有有害细菌。<,>Untreated wood will rot faster.<,>未经处理的木材会腐烂得更快。<,>His untreated illness became worse.<,>他未经治疗的病情恶化了。<,>un(不)+treat(处理)+ed(形容词后缀)→未经处理的<,>retreated(v.撤退)/entreated(v.恳求)/untested(adj.未经测试的)

suspicious<,>/səˈspɪʃəs/<,>/səˈspɪʃəs/<,>adj.怀疑的<,>The police found his behavior suspicious.<,>警方发现他的行为可疑。<,>She gave me a suspicious look.<,>她怀疑地看了我一眼。<,>I'm suspicious of his motives.<,>我对他的动机表示怀疑。<,>sus(下)+spic(看)+ious(形容词后缀)→从下面看→怀疑的<,>auspicious(adj.吉利的)/suspicion(n.怀疑)/suspense(n.悬念)

ancient<,>/ˈeɪnʃənt/<,>/ˈeɪnʃənt/<,>adj.古代的<,>We visited the ancient ruins of Rome.<,>我们参观了罗马的古迹。<,>Ancient civilizations had advanced knowledge.<,>古代文明拥有先进的知识。<,>This tradition dates back to ancient times.<,>这个传统可以追溯到古代。<,>anci(古老)+ent(形容词后缀)→古代的<,>patient(adj.耐心的)/ambient(adj.周围的)/anecdote(n.轶事)

distort<,>/dɪˈstɔːt/<,>/dɪˈstɔrt/<,>v.歪曲/v.扭曲<,>The mirror distorted her reflection.<,>镜子扭曲了她的倒影。<,>Don't distort the facts to suit your argument.<,>不要歪曲事实来迎合你的论点。<,>The loudspeaker distorted the sound.<,>扬声器使声音失真了。<,>dis(分开)+tort(扭曲)→扭曲<,>retort(v.反驳)/distract(v.分散注意力)/disturb(v.打扰)

skip<,>/skɪp/<,>/skɪp/<,>v.跳过<,>Let's skip the introduction and get to the main point.<,>让我们跳过介绍直接进入主题。<,>The children skipped happily down the path.<,>孩子们开心地沿着小路蹦蹦跳跳。<,>He skipped class to go to the movies.<,>他逃课去看电影了。<,>s(快速)+kip(跳跃)→快速跳跃→跳过<,>slip(v.滑倒)/skin(n.皮肤)/skit(n.幽默短剧)

wishful<,>/ˈwɪʃfəl/<,>/ˈwɪʃfəl/<,>adj.一厢情愿的<,>That's just wishful thinking on your part.<,>那只是你的一厢情愿。<,>His wishful expectations were not met.<,>他一厢情愿的期望没有实现。<,>She had a wishful look in her eyes.<,>她眼中流露出渴望的神情。<,>wish(愿望)+ful(充满)→充满愿望的→一厢情愿的<,>willful(adj.任性的)/wistful(adj.惆怅的)/wishy-washy(adj.优柔寡断的)

entrepreneurship<,>/ˌɒntrəprəˈnɜːʃɪp/<,>/ˌɑntrəprəˈnɜrʃɪp/<,>n.企业管理<,>Entrepreneurship requires both creativity and business skills.<,>企业管理需要创造力和商业技能。<,>She studied entrepreneurship at university.<,>她在大学学习了企业管理。<,>Successful entrepreneurship can create many jobs.<,>成功的企业管理可以创造许多就业机会。<,>entrepreneur(企业家)+ship(名词后缀)→企业管理<,>enterprise(n.企业)/entertainment(n.娱乐)/enrollment(n.注册)
bride<,>/braɪd/<,>/braɪd/<,>n.新娘<,>The bride looked stunning in her white gown.<,>新娘穿着白色礼服，看起来美极了。<,>He kissed the bride at the end of the ceremony.<,>仪式结束时他亲吻了新娘。<,>All eyes were on the bride as she walked down the aisle.<,>当新娘走过通道时，所有人的目光都集中在她身上。<,>brid(结合)+e→结合的人→新娘<,>bribe(v.贿赂)/bridegroom(n.新郎)/bridge(n.桥梁)

unfold<,>/ʌnˈfəʊld/<,>/ʌnˈfoʊld/<,>v.展开/打开/展现<,>She unfolded the map to find their location.<,>她展开地图寻找他们的位置。<,>The story unfolds in a small coastal town.<,>故事在一个海滨小镇展开。<,>As the investigation continues, new facts unfold.<,>随着调查继续，新的事实逐渐展现。<,>un(否定)+fold(折叠)→不折叠→展开<,>enfold(v.包裹)/unfounded(adj.无根据的)/unfolded(adj.展开的)

interference<,>/ˌɪntəˈfɪərəns/<,>/ˌɪntərˈfɪrəns/<,>n.干涉/干扰/妨碍<,>The radio signal was weak due to interference.<,>由于干扰，无线电信号很弱。<,>Parents should avoid interference in their children's decisions.<,>父母应避免干涉孩子的决定。<,>There was political interference in the judicial process.<,>司法过程中存在政治干涉。<,>inter(在...之间)+fer(带来)+ence→带到中间→干涉<,>inference(n.推论)/intervene(v.干预)/difference(n.差异))

assault<,>/əˈsɔːlt/<,>/əˈsɔlt/<,>n.攻击/袭击/v.攻击<,>The soldiers launched an assault on the enemy position.<,>士兵们向敌军阵地发起攻击。<,>He was charged with sexual assault.<,>他被指控性侵犯。<,>The mountain climbers faced an assault of bad weather.<,>登山者遭遇恶劣天气的袭击。<,>as(加强)+sault(跳)→跳起来攻击<,>insult(v.侮辱)/consult(v.咨询)/result(n.结果))

shareholder<,>/ˈʃeəhəʊldə(r)/<,>/ˈʃerhoʊldər/<,>n.股东/股票持有人<,>The shareholders voted against the merger.<,>股东们投票反对合并。<,>Major shareholders have significant influence in company decisions.<,>大股东对公司决策有重大影响。<,>Shareholders will receive dividends next month.<,>股东们下个月将收到分红。<,>share(股份)+holder(持有者)→股份持有者<,>stakeholder(n.利益相关者)/sharecropper(n.佃农)/shareware(n.共享软件))

breakthrough<,>/ˈbreɪkθruː/<,>/ˈbreɪkˌθru/<,>n.突破性进展/重大发现<,>Scientists announced a major breakthrough in cancer research.<,>科学家宣布在癌症研究方面取得重大突破。<,>The negotiation reached a breakthrough after hours of discussion.<,>经过数小时讨论，谈判取得突破性进展。<,>This invention represents a technological breakthrough.<,>这项发明代表了一项技术突破。<,>break(打破)+through(通过)→打破障碍通过→突破<,>breakdown(n.故障)/breakout(n.爆发)/breakwater(n.防波堤))

footnote<,>/ˈfʊtnəʊt/<,>/ˈfʊtnoʊt/<,>n.注脚/脚注<,>The author added a footnote to explain the technical term.<,>作者添加了一个脚注来解释这个专业术语。<,>Please check the footnote for additional references.<,>请查看脚注获取更多参考资料。<,>Important historical context is provided in the footnotes.<,>重要的历史背景在脚注中提供。<,>foot(脚)+note(注释)→脚部注释<,>headnote(n.眉批)/endnote(n.尾注)/notepad(n.记事本))

applicable<,>/əˈplɪkəbl/<,>/ˈæplɪkəbəl/<,>adj.可应用的/适用的<,>This rule is not applicable in all situations.<,>这条规则并非在所有情况下都适用。<,>The discount is only applicable to members.<,>折扣仅适用于会员。<,>The law is applicable nationwide.<,>这项法律在全国范围内适用。<,>ap(加强)+plic(折叠)+able→能够被折叠使用的→可应用的<,>applicant(n.申请人)/application(n.申请)/applique(n.贴花))

controversial<,>/ˌkɒntrəˈvɜːʃl/<,>/ˌkɑːntrəˈvɜːrʃl/<,>adj.受到争议的/有争议的<,>The new policy is highly controversial.<,>新政策极具争议性。<,>He is a controversial figure in politics.<,>他是政坛上一位有争议的人物。<,>The decision sparked controversial debates.<,>这个决定引发了争议性辩论。<,>contro(反对)+vers(转)+ial→相互反对转的→有争议的<,>contradictory(adj.矛盾的)/conversational(adj.对话的)/convertible(adj.可转换的))

inherit<,>/ɪnˈherɪt/<,>/ɪnˈhɛrɪt/<,>v.继承/经遗传获得<,>She inherited a large fortune from her grandfather.<,>她从祖父那里继承了一大笔财产。<,>The prince will inherit the throne.<,>王子将继承王位。<,>He inherited his mother's artistic talent.<,>他继承了母亲的艺术天赋。<,>in(内)+her(继承)+it→内部继承→继承<,>inherent(adj.固有的)/inhibit(v.抑制)/inhabit(v.居住))
facilitate<,>/fəˈsɪlɪteɪt/<,>/fəˈsɪləˌteɪt/<,>v.使便利/v.促进<,>Good infrastructure can facilitate economic growth.<,>良好的基础设施能促进经济增长。<,>The new software facilitates data analysis.<,>新软件使数据分析更加便利。<,>Teachers facilitate learning by providing guidance.<,>教师通过提供指导来促进学习。<,>fac(做)+il(容易)+itate(使)→使容易做→促进<,>felicitate(v.祝贺)/facility(n.设施)/felicity(n.幸福)

manifest<,>/ˈmænɪfest/<,>/ˈmænəˌfɛst/<,>v.表明<,>Her smile manifested her happiness.<,>她的笑容表明她很开心。<,>The symptoms manifested after two days.<,>症状在两天后显现出来。<,>He manifested no interest in the proposal.<,>他对这个提议显得毫无兴趣。<,>mani(手)+fest(打击)→用手打击→表明<,>manifesto(n.宣言)/manifold(adj.多样的)/manipulate(v.操纵)

fiscal<,>/ˈfɪskəl/<,>/ˈfɪskəl/<,>adj.财政的<,>The government introduced new fiscal policies.<,>政府出台了新的财政政策。<,>Fiscal year ends in December.<,>财政年度在十二月结束。<,>We need to control fiscal expenditure.<,>我们需要控制财政支出。<,>fisc(国库)+al(的)→财政的<,>physical(adj.物理的)/fictile(adj.可塑造的)/fissile(adj.易分裂的)

gown<,>/ɡaʊn/<,>/ɡaʊn/<,>n.长袍<,>The bride wore a beautiful white gown.<,>新娘穿着一件漂亮的白色长袍。<,>Doctors wear surgical gowns in the operating room.<,>医生在手术室里穿手术袍。<,>She changed into her evening gown for the party.<,>她换上晚礼服去参加派对。<,>g(贵)+own(拥有)→拥有高贵的衣服→长袍<,>growl(v.咆哮)/clown(n.小丑)/brown(adj.棕色的)

rate<,>/reɪt/<,>/reɪt/<,>n.费用<,>The hotel rates are quite reasonable.<,>这家酒店的费用相当合理。<,>What's the interest rate for this loan?<,>这笔贷款的利率是多少？<,>The birth rate has declined in recent years.<,>近年来出生率有所下降。<,>rat(计算)+e→计算出来的→费用<,>rake(n.耙子)/rite(n.仪式)/rote(n.死记硬背)

mortality<,>/mɔːˈtæləti/<,>/mɔrˈtæləti/<,>n.死亡率<,>Infant mortality has decreased significantly.<,>婴儿死亡率显著下降。<,>The mortality rate from the disease is high.<,>这种疾病的死亡率很高。<,>War increases mortality among civilians.<,>战争增加了平民的死亡率。<,>mort(死)+ality(性质)→死亡率<,>morality(n.道德)/immortality(n.不朽)/mortal(adj.致命的)

decline<,>/dɪˈklaɪn/<,>/dɪˈklaɪn/<,>v.拒绝<,>She declined the invitation politely.<,>她礼貌地拒绝了邀请。<,>The company's profits have declined this year.<,>公司今年的利润下降了。<,>He declined to comment on the issue.<,>他拒绝就此事发表评论。<,>de(向下)+cline(倾斜)→向下倾斜→拒绝<,>incline(v.倾斜)/recline(v.斜靠)/define(v.定义)

mournful<,>/ˈmɔːnfəl/<,>/ˈmɔrnfəl/<,>adj.悲哀的/adj.令人惋惜的<,>The mournful song made everyone cry.<,>这首悲伤的歌让每个人都哭了。<,>She gave a mournful look at the ruined house.<,>她悲伤地看着被毁的房子。<,>The news cast a mournful atmosphere over the gathering.<,>这个消息给聚会蒙上了悲伤的气氛。<,>mourn(哀悼)+ful(充满的)→充满哀悼的→悲哀的<,>mourning(n.哀悼)/mountain(n.山)/morning(n.早晨)

paradox<,>/ˈpærədɒks/<,>/ˈpærəˌdɑks/<,>n.悖论<,>It's a paradox that standing is more tiring than walking.<,>站着比走路更累是个悖论。<,>The paradox puzzled many philosophers.<,>这个悖论困扰了许多哲学家。<,>His answer was full of paradoxes.<,>他的回答充满了矛盾。<,>para(旁边)+dox(观点)→旁边的观点→悖论<,>paradigm(n.范例)/paragon(n.模范)/parade(n.游行)

simultaneously<,>/ˌsɪməlˈteɪniəsli/<,>/ˌsaɪməlˈteɪniəsli/<,>adv.同步地/adv.同时地<,>The two events occurred simultaneously.<,>这两个事件同时发生。<,>They finished their speeches simultaneously.<,>他们同时结束了演讲。<,>The dancers moved simultaneously to the music.<,>舞者们随着音乐同步移动。<,>simul(相同)+tane(时间)+ously(副词后缀)→同时地<,>simulate(v.模拟)/simile(n.明喻)/similar(adj.相似的)
strategy<,>/ˈstrætədʒi/<,>/ˈstrætədʒi/<,>n.策略<,>Our company needs a new marketing strategy.<,>我们公司需要一个新的营销策略。<,>His strategy for winning the game was brilliant.<,>他赢得比赛的策略非常出色。<,>She developed a strategy to improve her grades.<,>她制定了一个提高成绩的策略。<,>strat(层) + egy(引导)→层层引导→策略<,>tactic(n. 战术)/plan(n. 计划)/scheme(n. 方案)

literacy<,>/ˈlɪtərəsi/<,>/ˈlɪtərəsi/<,>n.识字/n.有文化<,>Literacy rates have improved in the country.<,>这个国家的识字率提高了。<,>Digital literacy is essential in today's world.<,>数字素养在当今世界至关重要。<,>Basic literacy skills include reading and writing.<,>基本的文化技能包括阅读和写作。<,>liter(文字) + acy(状态)→识字状态<,>illiteracy(n. 文盲)/literature(n. 文学)/literal(adj. 字面的)

apathy<,>/ˈæpəθi/<,>/ˈæpəθi/<,>n.冷漠<,>There is widespread apathy among voters.<,>选民普遍表现出冷漠。<,>His apathy towards his studies worried his parents.<,>他对学习的冷漠让父母很担心。<,>The apathy of the public towards environmental issues is concerning.<,>公众对环境问题的冷漠令人担忧。<,>a(无) + pathy(感情)→无感情→冷漠<,>sympathy(n. 同情)/empathy(n. 共情)/antipathy(n. 反感)

boom<,>/buːm/<,>/buːm/<,>n.繁荣<,>The city experienced an economic boom in the 1990s.<,>这座城市在20世纪90年代经历了经济繁荣。<,>The baby boom after the war changed demographics.<,>战后的婴儿潮改变了人口结构。<,>There's a boom in the tech industry.<,>科技行业正在蓬勃发展。<,>象声词，模拟爆炸或增长的声音<,>doom(n. 厄运)/bloom(v. 开花)/gloom(n. 忧郁)

oblige<,>/əˈblaɪdʒ/<,>/əˈblaɪdʒ/<,>v.迫使<,>The law obliges companies to pay taxes.<,>法律强制公司纳税。<,>I felt obliged to help my neighbor.<,>我觉得有义务帮助我的邻居。<,>Circumstances obliged him to sell his house.<,>情况迫使他卖掉了房子。<,>ob(朝向) + lig(绑)→绑住某人→迫使<,>obligate(v. 使负有义务)/obliging(adj. 乐于助人的)/obligation(n. 义务)

incompatibility<,>/ˌɪnkəmˌpætəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌɪnkəmˌpætəˈbɪləti/<,>n.不兼容<,>There is an incompatibility between the two software systems.<,>这两个软件系统不兼容。<,>The incompatibility of their personalities led to arguments.<,>他们性格不合导致争吵。<,>Drug incompatibility can cause harmful reactions.<,>药物不兼容可能引起有害反应。<,>in(不) + compatibility(兼容性)→不兼容<,>compatibility(n. 兼容性)/incompatible(adj. 不兼容的)/compatible(adj. 兼容的)

commerce<,>/ˈkɒmɜːs/<,>/ˈkɑːmɜːrs/<,>n.商业<,>E-commerce has grown rapidly in recent years.<,>电子商务近年来发展迅速。<,>The city is a center of commerce and trade.<,>这座城市是商业和贸易中心。<,>International commerce requires knowledge of different cultures.<,>国际贸易需要了解不同的文化。<,>com(共同) + merce(交易)→共同交易→商业<,>commercial(adj. 商业的)/merchant(n. 商人)/market(n. 市场)

attribute<,>/əˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>/əˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>v.归因于<,>She attributes her success to hard work.<,>她把成功归因于努力工作。<,>The poem is attributed to an unknown author.<,>这首诗被归因于一位无名作者。<,>He attributes his good health to regular exercise.<,>他把身体健康归因于定期锻炼。<,>at(向) + tribute(给予)→把...给予→归因于<,>contribute(v. 贡献)/distribute(v. 分配)/tribute(n. 贡品)

cafeteria<,>/ˌkæfəˈtɪəriə/<,>/ˌkæfəˈtɪriə/<,>n.自助餐厅<,>We usually have lunch in the school cafeteria.<,>我们通常在学校自助餐厅吃午饭。<,>The hospital cafeteria serves healthy meals.<,>医院自助餐厅提供健康餐食。<,>The office cafeteria is closed for renovations.<,>办公室自助餐厅因装修关闭。<,>cafe(咖啡) + teria(场所)→提供咖啡食物的地方→自助餐厅<,>cafe(n. 咖啡馆)/restaurant(n. 餐厅)/buffet(n. 自助餐)

cripple<,>/ˈkrɪpl/<,>/ˈkrɪpl/<,>n.残疾/n.跛子<,>The accident left him a cripple for life.<,>那次事故使他终身残疾。<,>She works with crippled children.<,>她与残疾儿童一起工作。<,>The old war cripple told stories of his youth.<,>那位年老的战争残疾者讲述他年轻时的故事。<,>crip(弯曲) + ple(小)→身体弯曲的人→跛子<,>disabled(adj. 残疾的)/limp(v. 跛行)/handicap(n. 障碍)
shuttle<,>/ˈʃʌt(ə)l/<,>/ˈʃʌt(ə)l/<,>n.航天飞机<,>The space shuttle was launched successfully.<,>航天飞机成功发射了。<,>She took the shuttle bus to the airport.<,>她乘坐机场班车去机场。<,>The shuttle service runs every 30 minutes.<,>班车服务每30分钟一班。<,>shut(关闭)+tle→往返关闭的航天器→航天飞机<,>shuffle(v.拖曳/v.洗牌)/shutter(n.百叶窗/v.关闭)

nightmare<,>/ˈnaɪtmeə(r)/<,>/ˈnaɪtmer/<,>n.噩梦<,>I had a terrible nightmare last night.<,>昨晚我做了一个可怕的噩梦。<,>The exam was a complete nightmare.<,>这次考试简直是一场噩梦。<,>Losing my passport was a real nightmare.<,>丢失护照真是一场噩梦。<,>night(夜晚)+mare(母马)→夜晚的母马→噩梦<,>nightfall(n.黄昏)/daymare(n.白日噩梦)

startle<,>/ˈstɑːt(ə)l/<,>/ˈstɑːrt(ə)l/<,>v.使惊讶<,>The loud noise startled the baby.<,>巨大的声响吓到了婴儿。<,>She was startled by his sudden appearance.<,>他突然出现吓了她一跳。<,>The news will startle everyone.<,>这个消息会让所有人吃惊。<,>start(开始)+le→突然开始→使惊讶<,>stark(adj.完全的)/start(v.开始)

debris<,>/ˈdeɪbriː/<,>/dəˈbriː/<,>n.残骸/n.碎片<,>The road was covered with debris after the explosion.<,>爆炸后路上满是残骸。<,>They cleared the debris from the construction site.<,>他们清理了建筑工地的碎片。<,>Space debris is a growing problem.<,>太空碎片是个日益严重的问题。<,>de(向下)+bris(破碎)→向下破碎→残骸<,>debris(n.碎片)/debris(n.瓦砾)

assemble<,>/əˈsemb(ə)l/<,>/əˈsemb(ə)l/<,>v.收集/v.组装<,>The workers assembled the furniture quickly.<,>工人们快速组装好了家具。<,>We need to assemble all the evidence.<,>我们需要收集所有证据。<,>The team will assemble at 9 am.<,>团队将在上午9点集合。<,>as(加强)+semble(相似)→把相似的东西放一起→组装<,>resemble(v.相似)/ensemble(n.整体)

perception<,>/pəˈsepʃ(ə)n/<,>/pərˈsepʃ(ə)n/<,>n.看法/n.意识<,>Public perception of the issue has changed.<,>公众对这个问题的看法已经改变。<,>His perception of colors is unusual.<,>他对颜色的感知与众不同。<,>Visual perception is important for drivers.<,>视觉感知对司机很重要。<,>per(完全)+cept(拿)+ion→完全拿住→感知<,>conception(n.概念)/deception(n.欺骗)

coastal<,>/ˈkəʊst(ə)l/<,>/ˈkoʊst(ə)l/<,>adj.海滨的<,>We stayed at a coastal resort.<,>我们住在一个海滨度假村。<,>Coastal erosion is a serious problem.<,>海岸侵蚀是个严重问题。<,>The coastal highway offers beautiful views.<,>海滨公路景色优美。<,>coast(海岸)+al(的)→海滨的<,>costal(adj.肋骨的)/coastal(adj.海岸的)

desert<,>/dɪˈzɜːt/<,>/dɪˈzɜːrt/<,>v.放弃/v.抛弃<,>He deserted his family.<,>他抛弃了他的家人。<,>The soldier was accused of deserting his post.<,>这名士兵被指控擅离职守。<,>Many plants can't survive in the desert.<,>许多植物无法在沙漠中生存。<,>de(离开)+sert(加入)→离开加入→抛弃<,>dessert(n.甜点)/desert(n.沙漠)

peer<,>/pɪə(r)/<,>/pɪr/<,>n.同龄人<,>She gets along well with her peers.<,>她和同龄人相处得很好。<,>Peer pressure can be difficult to resist.<,>同辈压力可能难以抗拒。<,>The study compared students with their peers.<,>这项研究将学生与同龄人进行了比较。<,>peer(看)→互相看的人→同龄人<,>pier(n.码头)/pear(n.梨)

embody<,>/ɪmˈbɒdi/<,>/ɪmˈbɑːdi/<,>v.体现<,>The statue embodies the spirit of freedom.<,>这座雕像体现了自由精神。<,>His actions embody our company's values.<,>他的行为体现了我们公司的价值观。<,>The law embodies principles of justice.<,>这项法律体现了正义原则。<,>em(使)+body(身体)→使有身体→体现<,>embed(v.嵌入)/embolden(v.鼓励)
sympathetic<,>/ˌsɪmpəˈθetɪk/<,>/ˌsɪmpəˈθetɪk/<,>adj.同情的<,>She gave me a sympathetic smile when I told her my problem.<,>当我告诉她我的问题时，她给了我一个同情的微笑。<,>He was sympathetic to the plight of the homeless.<,>他对无家可归者的困境表示同情。<,>The teacher was very sympathetic towards the struggling student.<,>老师对那个学习困难的学生非常同情。<,>sym(共同)+path(感情)+etic→有共同感情的→同情的<,>apathetic(adj.冷漠的)/empathic(adj.移情的)  

backup<,>/ˈbækʌp/<,>/ˈbækˌʌp/<,>n.后补/n.援助<,>We need a backup plan in case the first one fails.<,>我们需要一个备用计划以防第一个计划失败。<,>The police called for backup when the situation got out of control.<,>当情况失控时，警察请求了支援。<,>Always keep a backup of your important files.<,>始终保留重要文件的备份。<,>back(后面)+up(向上)→在后面支持→后补/援助<,>backup(n.备份)/back out(v.退出)/back down(v.让步)  

notably<,>/ˈnəʊtəbli/<,>/ˈnoʊtəbli/<,>adv.显著地/adv.尤其<,>Several world leaders, notably the French president, attended the summit.<,>几位世界领导人，尤其是法国总统，出席了峰会。<,>She has many talents, notably in music and painting.<,>她有很多才能，尤其在音乐和绘画方面。<,>The weather has been notably warmer this winter.<,>今年冬天天气明显更暖和了。<,>note(注意)+ably(可…地)→值得注意地→显著地<,>noticeably(adv.明显地)/remarkably(adv.非凡地)  

exploit<,>/ɪkˈsplɔɪt/<,>/ɪkˈsplɔɪt/<,>v.开发/v.开采<,>The company plans to exploit the newly discovered oil field.<,>该公司计划开采新发现的油田。<,>We should exploit solar energy more efficiently.<,>我们应该更有效地开发利用太阳能。<,>He was accused of exploiting his workers.<,>他被指控剥削工人。<,>ex(出)+ploit(折叠)→把资源从折叠状态展开→开发<,>explore(v.探索)/employ(v.雇用)  

poetry<,>/ˈpəʊɪtri/<,>/ˈpoʊɪtri/<,>n.诗歌<,>She has a deep love for classical poetry.<,>她非常热爱古典诗歌。<,>His poetry often reflects his personal struggles.<,>他的诗歌常常反映他个人的挣扎。<,>The beauty of nature inspired her poetry.<,>大自然的美激发了她的诗歌创作。<,>poet(诗人)+ry(名词后缀)→诗歌<,>prose(n.散文)/verse(n.诗句)  

discriminate<,>/dɪˈskrɪmɪneɪt/<,>/dɪˈskrɪməˌneɪt/<,>v.歧视/v.区别<,>It's illegal to discriminate against people based on their race.<,>基于种族歧视他人是违法的。<,>The test can discriminate between different types of bacteria.<,>这个测试可以区分不同类型的细菌。<,>She has a discriminating taste in art.<,>她对艺术有敏锐的鉴赏力。<,>dis(分开)+crimin(区分)+ate→区别对待→歧视<,>discrimination(n.歧视)/differentiate(v.区分)  

readjust<,>/ˌriːəˈdʒʌst/<,>/ˌriəˈdʒʌst/<,>v.重新调整/v.再调整<,>It took him some time to readjust to civilian life after leaving the army.<,>离开军队后，他花了一些时间重新适应平民生活。<,>You may need to readjust the focus of the camera.<,>你可能需要重新调整相机的焦距。<,>The company is readjusting its marketing strategy.<,>公司正在重新调整其营销策略。<,>re(再)+adjust(调整)→再调整<,>adjust(v.调整)/realign(v.重新排列)  

slight<,>/slaɪt/<,>/slaɪt/<,>adj.轻微的<,>There was a slight delay in the train schedule.<,>火车时刻表有轻微的延误。<,>She felt a slight pain in her ankle.<,>她感到脚踝有轻微的疼痛。<,>He gave her a slight nod of acknowledgment.<,>他向她微微点头示意。<,>s(小)+light(轻的)→轻微的<,>slim(adj.苗条的)/sleight(n.灵巧)  

strip<,>/strɪp/<,>/strɪp/<,>n.狭长的一块<,>He cut the paper into thin strips.<,>他把纸剪成细长的条。<,>A narrow strip of land connects the two islands.<,>一条狭长的陆地连接着这两个岛屿。<,>She was wearing a strip of cloth as a headband.<,>她用一条布条当头带。<,>s(细长)+trip(旅行)→细长的旅行路线→狭长的一块<,>stripe(n.条纹)/strap(n.带子)  

tackle<,>/ˈtækl/<,>/ˈtækəl/<,>v.解决/v.处理<,>We need to tackle this problem immediately.<,>我们需要立即解决这个问题。<,>The government is tackling the issue of unemployment.<,>政府正在处理失业问题。<,>He tackled the difficult task with enthusiasm.<,>他热情地处理了这项艰巨的任务。<,>tack(钉住)+le(动词后缀)→钉住问题→解决<,>attack(v.攻击)/tickler(n.棘手的问题)
steady<,>/ˈstɛdi/<,>/ˈstɛdi/<,>adj.稳定的<,>She kept a steady hand while painting.<,>她在画画时保持手稳。<,>The company has shown steady growth over the years.<,>公司多年来保持稳定增长。<,>He has a steady job with good benefits.<,>他有一份稳定且福利好的工作。<,>stead(站立)+y(形容词后缀)→稳稳站立的→稳定的<,>ready(adj.准备好的)/study(v.学习/n.研究)

minority<,>/maɪˈnɒrɪti/<,>/maɪˈnɔːrəti/<,>n.少数/n.少数民族<,>Only a minority of students voted against the proposal.<,>只有少数学生投票反对这个提议。<,>The rights of minorities should be protected.<,>少数民族的权利应该得到保护。<,>Women are in the minority in this engineering class.<,>这个工程班里女生占少数。<,>minor(较小的)+ity(名词后缀)→较小的部分→少数<,>majority(n.多数)/priority(n.优先权)

aspirational<,>/ˌæspəˈreɪʃənl/<,>/ˌæspəˈreɪʃənl/<,>adj.渴望成功的<,>She comes from an aspirational middle-class family.<,>她来自一个渴望成功的中产阶级家庭。<,>The brand targets aspirational young professionals.<,>这个品牌的目标客户是渴望成功的年轻专业人士。<,>His aspirational speech inspired many students.<,>他充满抱负的演讲激励了许多学生。<,>aspiration(抱负)+al(形容词后缀)→有抱负的<,>inspirational(adj.鼓舞人心的)/respirational(adj.呼吸的)

discipline<,>/ˈdɪsəplɪn/<,>/ˈdɪsəplɪn/<,>n.训练/n.管教<,>Military discipline is very strict.<,>军队纪律非常严格。<,>Parents should teach their children discipline.<,>父母应该教导孩子遵守纪律。<,>She lacks discipline in her study habits.<,>她的学习习惯缺乏自律。<,>disciple(门徒)+ine→门徒需要遵守的→纪律<,>disciple(n.门徒)/principle(n.原则)

threshold<,>/ˈθreʃhəʊld/<,>/ˈθreʃhoʊld/<,>n.门槛<,>He stood at the threshold of the house.<,>他站在房子的门槛处。<,>The noise level was above the pain threshold.<,>噪音水平超过了痛阈。<,>This marks the threshold of a new era.<,>这标志着一个新时代的开始。<,>thresh(打谷)+old→打谷场的入口→门槛<,>throat(n.喉咙)/through(prep.通过)

soar<,>/sɔː(r)/<,>/sɔːr/<,>v.高飞<,>Eagles soar high in the sky.<,>鹰在高空中翱翔。<,>Prices have soared in recent months.<,>最近几个月物价飞涨。<,>Her spirits soared when she heard the good news.<,>听到这个好消息，她情绪高涨。<,>s+oar(桨)→像划桨一样向上→高飞<,>sore(adj.疼痛的)/roar(v.咆哮)

uneven<,>/ʌnˈiːvn/<,>/ʌnˈiːvən/<,>adj.不均衡的<,>The road surface is uneven and dangerous.<,>路面不平整很危险。<,>There is an uneven distribution of wealth in the country.<,>这个国家的财富分配不均。<,>Her performance has been uneven this season.<,>她本赛季的表现时好时坏。<,>un(不)+even(平的)→不平的<,>even(adj.平的)/oven(n.烤箱)

crucial<,>/ˈkruːʃl/<,>/ˈkruːʃl/<,>adj.关键的<,>This is a crucial moment in the game.<,>这是比赛的关键时刻。<,>Your decision will be crucial to our success.<,>你的决定对我们的成功至关重要。<,>Sleep is crucial for good health.<,>睡眠对健康至关重要。<,>cruc(十字)+ial→处于十字路口的→关键的<,>cruel(adj.残酷的)/crustal(adj.地壳的)

athletics<,>/æθˈletɪks/<,>/æθˈletɪks/<,>n.体育运动<,>He excelled in athletics during high school.<,>他在高中时擅长体育运动。<,>The school has a strong athletics program.<,>这所学校有强大的体育项目。<,>Athletics require both skill and endurance.<,>体育运动需要技巧和耐力。<,>athlete(运动员)+ics(学科)→运动员的学科→体育<,>aesthetic(adj.美学的)/arithmetic(n.算术)

needy<,>/ˈniːdi/<,>/ˈniːdi/<,>adj.贫穷的<,>The charity helps needy families in the community.<,>这个慈善机构帮助社区里的贫困家庭。<,>She works with needy children in the orphanage.<,>她在孤儿院与贫困儿童一起工作。<,>Donations will go to the most needy areas.<,>捐款将用于最贫困的地区。<,>need(需要)+y(形容词后缀)→需要帮助的→贫穷的<,>greedy(adj.贪婪的)/speedy(adj.快速的)
enthusiastic<,>/ɪnˌθjuːziˈæstɪk/<,>/ɪnˌθuːziˈæstɪk/<,>adj.热情的<,>She is very enthusiastic about the new project.<,>她对新项目非常热情。<,>His enthusiastic speech inspired everyone.<,>他热情的演讲激励了所有人。<,>The team gave an enthusiastic response to the idea.<,>团队对这个想法给出了热情的回应。<,>en(使)+thus(神)+iastic→像神一样充满热情→热情的<,>enthusiasm(n.热情)/apathetic(adj.冷漠的)

trigger<,>/ˈtrɪɡə(r)/<,>/ˈtrɪɡər/<,>v.引发/v.引起<,>The loud noise triggered his anxiety.<,>巨大的噪音引发了他的焦虑。<,>Her comment triggered a heated debate.<,>她的评论引起了一场激烈的辩论。<,>This event could trigger a chain reaction.<,>这个事件可能引发连锁反应。<,>trig(拉)+ger→拉动引发→引发<,>tiger(n.老虎)/tricker(n.骗子)

essential<,>/ɪˈsenʃl/<,>/ɪˈsenʃl/<,>adj.必须的/adj.本质的<,>Water is essential for life.<,>水是生命必需的。<,>The essential difference is their approach.<,>本质的区别在于他们的方法。<,>These tools are essential for the job.<,>这些工具是工作必需的。<,>ess(存在)+ential→存在的→本质的<,>necessary(adj.必要的)/fundamental(adj.基本的)

agenda<,>/əˈdʒendə/<,>/əˈdʒendə/<,>n.议程<,>Let's review the agenda for the meeting.<,>让我们回顾一下会议议程。<,>The main agenda item was budget cuts.<,>主要议程项目是预算削减。<,>She added a new topic to the agenda.<,>她在议程上添加了一个新话题。<,>ag(做)+enda(需要做的事)→议程<,>agent(n.代理人)/agony(n.痛苦))

owe<,>/əʊ/<,>/oʊ/<,>v.欠钱<,>I owe you twenty dollars.<,>我欠你二十美元。<,>He owes his success to hard work.<,>他把成功归功于努力工作。<,>We owe a debt of gratitude to our teachers.<,>我们欠老师一份感激之情。<,>ow(拥有)+e→拥有别人的东西→欠<,>own(v.拥有)/owl(n.猫头鹰))

justice<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪs/<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪs/<,>n.公平<,>The court will deliver justice.<,>法庭将主持公道。<,>She fights for social justice.<,>她为社会公平而奋斗。<,>Justice must be blind to wealth and status.<,>正义必须无视财富和地位。<,>just(公正)+ice→公平<,>justify(v.证明合理)/adjust(v.调整))

donor<,>/ˈdəʊnə(r)/<,>/ˈdoʊnər/<,>n.捐赠者<,>The blood donor saved a life.<,>献血者救了一条命。<,>He is a regular donor to the charity.<,>他是该慈善机构的定期捐赠者。<,>Anonymous donors funded the project.<,>匿名捐赠者为项目提供了资金。<,>don(给予)+or(人)→给予的人→捐赠者<,>donate(v.捐赠)/dominor(n.统治者))

convict<,>/kənˈvɪkt/<,>/kənˈvɪkt/<,>v.证明……有罪<,>The jury convicted him of theft.<,>陪审团判定他犯有盗窃罪。<,>She was convicted on three counts.<,>她被判三项罪名成立。<,>New evidence could convict the suspect.<,>新证据可能证明嫌疑人有罪。<,>con(完全)+vict(征服)→完全征服→定罪<,>victory(n.胜利)/convince(v.说服))

underestimate<,>/ˌʌndərˈestɪmeɪt/<,>/ˌʌndərˈestɪmeɪt/<,>v.低估<,>Never underestimate your opponent.<,>永远不要低估你的对手。<,>We underestimated the difficulty of the task.<,>我们低估了任务的难度。<,>His abilities are often underestimated.<,>他的能力经常被低估。<,>under(下面)+estimate(估计)→在下面估计→低估<,>overestimate(v.高估)/undervalue(v.低估价值))

flat<,>/flæt/<,>/flæt/<,>adj.平的/n.公寓<,>The land here is very flat.<,>这里的土地非常平坦。<,>She lives in a small flat in London.<,>她住在伦敦的一个小公寓里。<,>He fell flat on his face.<,>他脸朝下摔倒了。<,>fl(飞)+at(在)→飞不起来→平的<,>apartment(n.公寓)/level(adj.水平的))
confidential<,>/ˌkɒnfɪˈdenʃəl/<,>/ˌkɑːnfɪˈdenʃəl/<,>adj.机密的<,>This document is strictly confidential.<,>这份文件是严格保密的。<,>She works in a confidential capacity.<,>她从事机密工作。<,>He was accused of leaking confidential information.<,>他被指控泄露机密信息。<,>con(共同)+fid(信任)+ential→共同信任的→机密的<,>confident(adj.自信的)/confidant(n.知己)  

unexpected<,>/ˌʌnɪkˈspektɪd/<,>/ˌʌnɪkˈspektɪd/<,>adj.意想不到的<,>The news came as an unexpected surprise.<,>这个消息来得意外。<,>His arrival was completely unexpected.<,>他的到来完全出人意料。<,>We encountered unexpected difficulties.<,>我们遇到了意想不到的困难。<,>un(否定)+expect(期待)+ed→没有预料到的<,>unanticipated(adj.未预料到的)/unforeseen(adj.未预见到的)  

vitamin<,>/ˈvɪtəmɪn/<,>/ˈvaɪtəmɪn/<,>n.维他命<,>Oranges are rich in vitamin C.<,>橙子富含维生素C。<,>Vitamin deficiency can cause health problems.<,>维生素缺乏会导致健康问题。<,>She takes vitamin supplements daily.<,>她每天服用维生素补充剂。<,>vita(生命)+min→维持生命的物质<,>mineral(n.矿物质)/protein(n.蛋白质)  

jeopardize<,>/ˈdʒepədaɪz/<,>/ˈdʒepərdaɪz/<,>v.危害/v.危及<,>Smoking can jeopardize your health.<,>吸烟会危害你的健康。<,>The scandal jeopardized his career.<,>丑闻危及了他的职业生涯。<,>Don't jeopardize the project by rushing it.<,>不要因为匆忙而危害这个项目。<,>jeopard(危险)+ize(使)→使处于危险中<,>hazard(v.冒险/n.危险)/endanger(v.危及)  

disproportionately<,>/ˌdɪsprəˈpɔːʃənətli/<,>/ˌdɪsprəˈpɔːrʃənətli/<,>adv.比例不均地/adv.不成比例地<,>The burden fell disproportionately on the poor.<,>负担不成比例地落在了穷人身上。<,>Resources are distributed disproportionately.<,>资源分配不均。<,>He was disproportionately punished for a minor mistake.<,>他因为一个小错误受到了过重的惩罚。<,>dis(否定)+proportion(比例)+ate+ly→不成比例地<,>proportionately(adv.成比例地)/unequally(adv.不平等地)  

bacteria<,>/bækˈtɪəriə/<,>/bækˈtɪriə/<,>n.细菌<,>Washing hands kills harmful bacteria.<,>洗手能杀死有害细菌。<,>Some bacteria are beneficial to health.<,>有些细菌对健康有益。<,>The bacteria spread rapidly in warm conditions.<,>细菌在温暖条件下迅速传播。<,>bacter(细菌)+ia(复数后缀)→细菌<,>virus(n.病毒)/germ(n.微生物)  

achieve<,>/əˈtʃiːv/<,>/əˈtʃiːv/<,>v.达到/v.实现<,>She worked hard to achieve her goals.<,>她努力工作以实现目标。<,>The team achieved great success.<,>团队取得了巨大成功。<,>It's important to achieve a balance between work and life.<,>实现工作与生活的平衡很重要。<,>a(强调)+chieve(首领)→成为首领→达到目标<,>accomplish(v.完成)/attain(v.获得)  

bump<,>/bʌmp/<,>/bʌmp/<,>v.颠簸<,>The car bumped along the rough road.<,>汽车在崎岖的路上颠簸行驶。<,>I bumped my head on the low ceiling.<,>我的头撞到了低矮的天花板上。<,>The plane bumped during the landing.<,>飞机在降落时颠簸。<,>拟声词，模拟碰撞的声音<,>jolt(v.颠簸)/lump(n.肿块)  

existence<,>/ɪɡˈzɪstəns/<,>/ɪɡˈzɪstəns/<,>n.存在/n.生存<,>The existence of life on other planets is still unproven.<,>其他行星上存在生命尚未被证实。<,>They struggled for their daily existence.<,>他们为日常生存而挣扎。<,>This law came into existence last year.<,>这项法律去年开始生效。<,>exist(存在)+ence(名词后缀)→存在<,>presence(n.存在)/subsistence(n.生存)  

sweep<,>/swiːp/<,>/swiːp/<,>v.扫除/v.清除<,>She sweeps the floor every morning.<,>她每天早上扫地。<,>The new policy will sweep away old regulations.<,>新政策将清除旧规章。<,>A wave of change is sweeping the country.<,>变革浪潮正席卷全国。<,>拟声词，模拟扫地的声音<,>wipe(v.擦拭)/swept(过去式)
shrewd<,>/ʃruːd/<,>/ʃruːd/<,>adj.精明的<,>He is a shrewd businessman who always makes profitable deals.<,>他是一个精明的商人，总能做成有利可图的交易。<,>Her shrewd observation helped solve the problem quickly.<,>她敏锐的观察帮助迅速解决了问题。<,>The judge made a shrewd decision based on the evidence.<,>法官根据证据做出了精明的决定。<,>发音类似“熟读”→熟读的人精明<,>shrew(n.泼妇)/screwed(adj.搞砸的)/shred(v.撕碎)

illuminate<,>/ɪˈluːmɪneɪt/<,>/ɪˈluməˌneɪt/<,>v.阐释/v.阐明<,>The professor illuminated the complex theory with simple examples.<,>教授用简单的例子阐明了这个复杂的理论。<,>The documentary illuminated the causes of the economic crisis.<,>这部纪录片阐释了经济危机的起因。<,>Street lights illuminate the road at night.<,>路灯在夜晚照亮道路。<,>illumin(光)+ate(使)→使明白<,>illustrate(v.说明)/eliminate(v.消除)/luminate(发光)

realm<,>/relm/<,>/rɛlm/<,>n.领域/n.方面<,>The discovery opened up a new realm of scientific research.<,>这一发现开辟了科学研究的新领域。<,>In the realm of art, he is considered a genius.<,>在艺术领域，他被认为是天才。<,>The king ruled over a vast realm.<,>国王统治着一个广阔的王国。<,>real(真实的)+m→真实存在的领域<,>real(adj.真实的)/reel(n.卷轴)/ream(n.令纸)

blueprint<,>/ˈbluːprɪnt/<,>/ˈbluˌprɪnt/<,>n.蓝图/n.设计图<,>The architect drew up the blueprint for the new building.<,>建筑师绘制了新大楼的设计图。<,>This plan is the blueprint for our future development.<,>这个计划是我们未来发展的蓝图。<,>The genetic blueprint determines our physical characteristics.<,>基因蓝图决定了我们的身体特征。<,>blue(蓝色)+print(印刷)→蓝图<,>blue(adj.蓝色的)/print(n.印刷)/blunt(adj.钝的)

pension<,>/ˈpenʃn/<,>/ˈpɛnʃən/<,>n.养老金<,>He receives a monthly pension after retirement.<,>退休后他每月领取养老金。<,>The company provides a generous pension scheme for its employees.<,>公司为员工提供丰厚的养老金计划。<,>She lives on her state pension.<,>她靠国家养老金生活。<,>pens(支付)+ion→定期支付的养老金<,>tension(n.紧张)/dimension(n.维度)/pensioner(n.领养老金者)

administration<,>/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃn/<,>/ədˌmɪnəˈstreɪʃən/<,>n.管理/n.政府<,>The school administration handles all disciplinary matters.<,>学校管理部门处理所有纪律问题。<,>The new administration introduced several reforms.<,>新政府推行了几项改革。<,>She works in hospital administration.<,>她在医院行政部门工作。<,>administer(管理)+ation→管理<,>minister(n.部长)/admission(n.入场)/admiration(n.钦佩)

track<,>/træk/<,>/træk/<,>v.追踪/n.轨迹/n.踪迹<,>The police tracked the suspect to his hideout.<,>警方追踪嫌疑人到他的藏身处。<,>We lost track of time while chatting.<,>我们聊天时忘记了时间。<,>The athlete ran around the track.<,>运动员绕着跑道跑步。<,>tract(拉)+k→拉出痕迹→追踪<,>tract(n.大片土地)/trick(n.诡计)/truck(n.卡车)

ponder<,>/ˈpɒndə(r)/<,>/ˈpɑːndər/<,>v.仔细考虑<,>He pondered over the decision for days.<,>他花了几天时间仔细考虑这个决定。<,>She sat quietly, pondering her future.<,>她安静地坐着，思考她的未来。<,>The committee is pondering the proposal.<,>委员会正在考虑这个提议。<,>pond(池塘)+er→像池塘一样深沉思考<,>wonder(v.想知道)/pander(v.迎合)/ponderous(adj.笨重的)

paradise<,>/ˈpærədaɪs/<,>/ˈpærəˌdaɪs/<,>n.天堂<,>The island is a tropical paradise.<,>这个岛屿是热带天堂。<,>He thought he had found paradise in her love.<,>他认为在她的爱中找到了天堂。<,>The garden was like a paradise on earth.<,>这个花园就像人间天堂。<,>para(旁边)+dise(看作dice骰子)→旁边掷骰子决定命运的地方→天堂<,>parasite(n.寄生虫)/paradigm(n.范例)/paradox(n.悖论)

ethnic<,>/ˈeθnɪk/<,>/ˈɛθnɪk/<,>adj.种族的<,>The city has a diverse ethnic population.<,>这个城市有着多元的种族人口。<,>They celebrated their ethnic traditions.<,>他们庆祝自己的种族传统。<,>Ethnic conflicts have caused many problems in the region.<,>种族冲突在该地区引发了许多问题。<,>ethn(种族)+ic→种族的<,>ethic(n.伦理)/esthetic(adj.美学的)/exotic(adj.异国的)
accelerate<,>/əkˈseləreɪt/<,>/əkˈsɛləreɪt/<,>v.加速<,>He pressed the gas pedal to accelerate the car.<,>他踩下油门加速汽车。<,>The company plans to accelerate production next month.<,>公司计划下个月加速生产。<,>Regular exercise can accelerate your metabolism.<,>定期锻炼可以加速新陈代谢。<,>ac(强调)+celer(速度)+ate(动词后缀)→加速<,>decelerate(v.减速)/celerity(n.迅速)  

bitter<,>/ˈbɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈbɪtər/<,>adj.痛苦的/adj.苦味的<,>She felt bitter after the breakup.<,>分手后她感到痛苦。<,>The medicine has a bitter taste.<,>这药有苦味。<,>His bitter words hurt her deeply.<,>他刻薄的话深深伤害了她。<,>bit(咬)+ter→咬到苦的东西→苦的<,>better(adj.更好的)/butter(n.黄油)  

ambition<,>/æmˈbɪʃn/<,>/æmˈbɪʃən/<,>n.野心/n.抱负<,>His ambition is to become a CEO.<,>他的抱负是成为首席执行官。<,>She has great ambitions for her career.<,>她对事业有远大抱负。<,>Ambition drove him to work harder.<,>野心驱使他更加努力工作。<,>ambi(周围)+tion→想掌控周围→野心<,>ambiguous(adj.模糊的)/ambient(adj.周围的)  

confess<,>/kənˈfes/<,>/kənˈfɛs/<,>v.承认/v.忏悔<,>He finally confessed his mistake.<,>他终于承认了自己的错误。<,>She confessed to stealing the money.<,>她承认偷了钱。<,>The criminal confessed his crimes to the priest.<,>罪犯向神父忏悔了他的罪行。<,>con(完全)+fess(说)→全部说出来→承认<,>profess(v.宣称)/confuse(v.混淆)  

extent<,>/ɪkˈstent/<,>/ɪkˈstɛnt/<,>n.程度/n.范围<,>The extent of the damage is still unknown.<,>损坏程度尚不清楚。<,>To some extent, I agree with you.<,>在某种程度上，我同意你的观点。<,>The forest covers a large extent of land.<,>这片森林覆盖了大片土地。<,>ex(出)+tent(伸展)→伸展出的范围→程度<,>extend(v.延伸)/content(n.内容)  

accountant<,>/əˈkaʊntənt/<,>/əˈkaʊntənt/<,>n.会计<,>She works as an accountant in a big firm.<,>她在一家大公司当会计。<,>The accountant is responsible for the financial records.<,>会计负责财务记录。<,>He hired an accountant to manage his taxes.<,>他雇了一名会计管理税务。<,>account(账目)+ant(人)→管账的人→会计<,>account(v.解释/n.账户)/countant(无此词)  

sheer<,>/ʃɪə(r)/<,>/ʃɪr/<,>adj.纯粹的/adj.陡峭的<,>It was sheer luck that we won the game.<,>我们赢得比赛纯属运气。<,>The cliff has a sheer drop of 100 meters.<,>悬崖有100米的陡峭落差。<,>She wore a dress of sheer silk.<,>她穿了一件薄丝绸裙子。<,>sheer→she(她)+er(人)→她是个纯粹的人<,>shear(v.剪羊毛)/cheer(v.欢呼)  

deliberate<,>/dɪˈlɪbərət/<,>/dɪˈlɪbərət/<,>adj.故意的/v.仔细考虑<,>It was a deliberate insult.<,>这是蓄意侮辱。<,>They deliberated for hours before making a decision.<,>他们仔细考虑了数小时才做决定。<,>His deliberate actions caused the accident.<,>他的故意行为导致了事故。<,>de(完全)+liber(自由)+ate→完全自由选择→故意的<,>liberate(v.解放)/delicate(adj.精致的)  

pave<,>/peɪv/<,>/peɪv/<,>v.铺路<,>They paved the road with asphalt.<,>他们用沥青铺路。<,>His hard work paved the way for success.<,>他的努力为成功铺平了道路。<,>The courtyard is paved with stone slabs.<,>院子用石板铺成。<,>pave→pa(拼音"趴")+ve(拼音"路")→趴在路上→铺路<,>save(v.节省)/wave(n.波浪)  

measure<,>/ˈmeʒə(r)/<,>/ˈmɛʒər/<,>n.措施/v.测量<,>The government took strict measures to control pollution.<,>政府采取严格措施控制污染。<,>Can you measure the length of this table?<,>你能测量这张桌子的长度吗？<,>Prevention is better than cure, as the old measure goes.<,>正如古训所说，预防胜于治疗。<,>meas(测量)+ure→测量结果→措施<,>treasure(n.财富)/pleasure(n.愉快)
potentially<,>/pəˈtenʃəli/<,>/pəˈtɛnʃəli/<,>adv.潜在地<,>This drug could potentially cure the disease.<,>这种药物可能潜在地治愈这种疾病。<,>He is potentially the best candidate for the job.<,>他潜在地是这个职位的最佳人选。<,>The situation is potentially dangerous.<,>这种情况潜在地很危险。<,>potential(潜在的)+ly(副词后缀)→潜在地<,>possibly(adv.可能地)/probably(adv.很可能地)

remove<,>/rɪˈmuːv/<,>/rɪˈmuv/<,>v.消除/v.移除/v.更新<,>Please remove your shoes before entering.<,>进入前请脱鞋。<,>The stain was difficult to remove.<,>这个污渍很难去除。<,>We need to remove the old software and install the new version.<,>我们需要移除旧软件并安装新版本。<,>re(再)+move(移动)→移除<,>move(v.移动)/remote(adj.遥远的)

allergic<,>/əˈlɜːdʒɪk/<,>/əˈlɜrdʒɪk/<,>adj.过敏的<,>I'm allergic to peanuts.<,>我对花生过敏。<,>She had an allergic reaction to the medication.<,>她对这种药物有过敏反应。<,>Many people are allergic to pollen in spring.<,>许多人在春天对花粉过敏。<,>allerg(y)(过敏)+ic(形容词后缀)→过敏的<,>energy(n.能量)/logic(n.逻辑)

available<,>/əˈveɪləbl/<,>/əˈveɪləbəl/<,>adj.可获得的/adj.可利用的<,>The book is available in the library.<,>这本书在图书馆可以借到。<,>I'm available for a meeting tomorrow.<,>我明天有空参加会议。<,>Fresh fruits are available all year round.<,>新鲜水果全年都有供应。<,>avail(有益)+able(能够)→可获得的<,>valuable(adj.有价值的)/variable(adj.可变的)

initial<,>/ɪˈnɪʃəl/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃəl/<,>adj.初步的/adj.最初的<,>The initial results are promising.<,>初步结果很有希望。<,>Please write your initial here.<,>请在这里签上你的首字母。<,>Our initial plan didn't work out.<,>我们最初的计划没有成功。<,>init(开始)+ial(形容词后缀)→最初的<,>original(adj.原始的)/essential(adj.必要的)

consensus<,>/kənˈsensəs/<,>/kənˈsɛnsəs/<,>n.共识/n.一致<,>The committee reached a consensus on the issue.<,>委员会在这个问题上达成了共识。<,>There is a general consensus that education is important.<,>人们普遍认为教育很重要。<,>The consensus among experts is that climate change is real.<,>专家们的共识是气候变化是真实的。<,>con(共同)+sens(感觉)+us→共同的感觉→共识<,>census(n.人口普查)/consent(v.同意)

opponent<,>/əˈpəʊnənt/<,>/əˈpoʊnənt/<,>n.反对者<,>He defeated his opponent in the debate.<,>他在辩论中击败了对手。<,>The team's main opponent this season is very strong.<,>本赛季该队的主要对手非常强大。<,>Political opponents often criticize each other.<,>政治对手经常互相批评。<,>op(反对)+pon(放置)+ent(人)→反对者<,>component(n.组成部分)/proponent(n.支持者)

modify<,>/ˈmɒdɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈmɑdəˌfaɪ/<,>v.改变<,>We need to modify our plans.<,>我们需要修改我们的计划。<,>The software was modified to fix the bug.<,>软件被修改以修复这个错误。<,>You can modify the recipe to suit your taste.<,>你可以修改食谱以适应你的口味。<,>mod(模式)+ify(使)→使改变模式→改变<,>codify(v.编纂)/notify(v.通知)

signify<,>/ˈsɪɡnɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈsɪɡnəˌfaɪ/<,>v.表明/v.象征<,>A red light signifies danger.<,>红灯表示危险。<,>This gift signifies our appreciation.<,>这份礼物象征我们的感谢。<,>What does this symbol signify?<,>这个符号代表什么？<,>sign(标志)+ify(使)→使成为标志→象征<,>simplify(v.简化)/magnify(v.放大)

accumulate<,>/əˈkjuːmjəleɪt/<,>/əˈkjumjəˌleɪt/<,>v.积累<,>Dust accumulates quickly in this room.<,>这个房间灰尘积累得很快。<,>He has accumulated a large collection of books.<,>他积累了大量藏书。<,>Over time, small savings can accumulate into a large sum.<,>随着时间的推移，小额储蓄可以积累成一笔巨款。<,>ac(加强)+cumul(堆积)+ate(动词后缀)→积累<,>calculate(v.计算)/circulate(v.循环)
mining<,>/ˈmaɪnɪŋ/<,>/ˈmaɪnɪŋ/<,>n.采矿业<,>Mining is a major industry in this region.<,>采矿业是这个地区的主要产业。<,>He works in a gold mining company.<,>他在一家金矿开采公司工作。<,>The environmental impact of mining is significant.<,>采矿对环境的影响很大。<,>mine(矿)+ing(名词后缀)→采矿<,>miner(n.矿工)/mineral(n.矿物)  

violent<,>/ˈvaɪələnt/<,>/ˈvaɪələnt/<,>adj.暴力的<,>The movie contains violent scenes.<,>这部电影包含暴力场景。<,>He has a violent temper.<,>他脾气暴躁。<,>The protest turned violent.<,>抗议活动演变成了暴力事件。<,>viol(force力量)+ent(形容词后缀)→暴力的<,>violet(n.紫罗兰)/violin(n.小提琴)  

adversity<,>/ədˈvɜːsəti/<,>/ədˈvɜːrsəti/<,>n.逆境<,>He overcame many adversities in his life.<,>他克服了生活中的许多逆境。<,>Adversity makes us stronger.<,>逆境使我们更强大。<,>They faced financial adversity.<,>他们面临财务困境。<,>ad(朝向)+vers(转)+ity(名词后缀)→转向不好的方向→逆境<,>adverse(adj.不利的)/diversity(n.多样性)  

dynamics<,>/daɪˈnæmɪks/<,>/daɪˈnæmɪks/<,>n.动力学<,>He studies fluid dynamics.<,>他研究流体动力学。<,>The dynamics of the group changed after the new member joined.<,>新成员加入后，小组的互动方式发生了变化。<,>Social dynamics are complex.<,>社会动力学很复杂。<,>dynam(power力量)+ics(学科)→动力学<,>dynamic(adj.动态的)/dynamite(n.炸药)  

chaos<,>/ˈkeɪɒs/<,>/ˈkeɪɑːs/<,>n.混乱<,>The room was in complete chaos.<,>房间里一片混乱。<,>The storm caused chaos in the city.<,>暴风雨在城市中造成了混乱。<,>There was chaos at the airport due to the strike.<,>由于罢工，机场一片混乱。<,>联想：chao(拼音"吵")+s→吵闹导致混乱<,>cosmos(n.宇宙)/chorus(n.合唱)  

persistent<,>/pəˈsɪstənt/<,>/pərˈsɪstənt/<,>adj.持续的/坚持不懈的<,>She has a persistent cough.<,>她持续咳嗽。<,>His persistent efforts paid off.<,>他坚持不懈的努力得到了回报。<,>There was persistent rain all week.<,>整个星期都在下雨。<,>per(完全)+sist(站立)+ent(形容词后缀)→完全站立不动→坚持的<,>insistent(adj.坚持的)/consistent(adj.一致的)  

ritual<,>/ˈrɪtʃuəl/<,>/ˈrɪtʃuəl/<,>n.仪式<,>The wedding ritual was beautiful.<,>婚礼仪式很美丽。<,>Morning coffee is part of my daily ritual.<,>早晨喝咖啡是我日常仪式的一部分。<,>They performed an ancient ritual.<,>他们举行了一个古老的仪式。<,>rite(仪式)+ual(形容词后缀)→仪式<,>habitual(adj.习惯的)/spiritual(adj.精神的)  

criteria<,>/kraɪˈtɪəriə/<,>/kraɪˈtɪriə/<,>n.标准<,>What are the selection criteria?<,>选拔标准是什么？<,>She meets all the criteria for the job.<,>她符合这份工作的所有标准。<,>The judging criteria are very strict.<,>评判标准非常严格。<,>criter(判断)+ia(复数后缀)→判断标准<,>criterion(单数形式)/critical(adj.关键的)  

impose<,>/ɪmˈpəʊz/<,>/ɪmˈpoʊz/<,>v.强加于<,>Don't impose your views on others.<,>不要把你的观点强加给别人。<,>The government imposed new taxes.<,>政府征收了新税。<,>She didn't want to impose on their hospitality.<,>她不想强求他们的热情款待。<,>im(在...上)+pose(放置)→强加<,>compose(v.组成)/expose(v.暴露)  

untiring<,>/ʌnˈtaɪərɪŋ/<,>/ʌnˈtaɪrɪŋ/<,>adj.不知疲倦的<,>She is an untiring worker.<,>她是个不知疲倦的工人。<,>His untiring efforts led to success.<,>他不懈的努力带来了成功。<,>The volunteers showed untiring enthusiasm.<,>志愿者们表现出不知疲倦的热情。<,>un(不)+tiring(疲倦的)→不知疲倦的<,>tiring(adj.令人疲倦的)/retiring(adj.退休的)
contrary<,>/ˈkɒntrəri/<,>/ˈkɑːntreri/<,>adj.相反的<,>Contrary to popular belief, cats are not always aloof.<,>与普遍看法相反，猫并不总是高冷的。<,>He took a contrary view on the issue.<,>他对这个问题持相反观点。<,>The results were contrary to our expectations.<,>结果与我们的预期相反。<,>contra(反对)+ary(形容词后缀)→相反的<,>contrast(n.对比)/contradict(v.反驳)/controversy(n.争议)

nutritious<,>/njuːˈtrɪʃəs/<,>/nuːˈtrɪʃəs/<,>adj.有营养的<,>Fresh vegetables are highly nutritious.<,>新鲜蔬菜非常有营养。<,>She prepared a nutritious meal for her children.<,>她为孩子准备了营养餐。<,>This cereal is fortified with nutritious ingredients.<,>这种谷物添加了营养成分。<,>nutri(营养)+tious(形容词后缀)→有营养的<,>nutrition(n.营养)/malnourished(adj.营养不良的)/nourish(v.滋养)

anxiety<,>/æŋˈzaɪəti/<,>/æŋˈzaɪəti/<,>n.焦虑<,>He felt anxiety before the job interview.<,>他在工作面试前感到焦虑。<,>Anxiety can affect your sleep quality.<,>焦虑会影响睡眠质量。<,>She takes medication for her anxiety disorder.<,>她服药治疗焦虑症。<,>anx(痛苦)+iety(名词后缀)→焦虑<,>angst(n.忧虑)/ease(n.轻松)/worry(n.担心)

rewarding<,>/rɪˈwɔːdɪŋ/<,>/rɪˈwɔːrdɪŋ/<,>adj.有意义的<,>Teaching is a rewarding profession.<,>教学是很有意义的职业。<,>Volunteering can be emotionally rewarding.<,>志愿活动能带来精神上的满足。<,>The project was challenging but ultimately rewarding.<,>这个项目很有挑战性但最终很有意义。<,>reward(奖励)+ing(形容词后缀)→有回报的<,>reward(n.报酬)/award(n.奖项)/compensate(v.补偿)

straightforward<,>/ˌstreɪtˈfɔːwəd/<,>/ˌstreɪtˈfɔːrwərd/<,>adj.直接的<,>His instructions were clear and straightforward.<,>他的指示清晰直接。<,>She gave a straightforward answer to the question.<,>她直接回答了问题。<,>The process is quite straightforward.<,>这个过程相当简单明了。<,>straight(直的)+forward(向前)→直向前→直接的<,>direct(adj.直接的)/frank(adj.坦率的)/complicated(adj.复杂的)

descent<,>/dɪˈsent/<,>/dɪˈsɛnt/<,>n.血统/后裔<,>He is of Italian descent.<,>他有意大利血统。<,>The plane began its descent to the airport.<,>飞机开始向机场降落。<,>She traced her family's descent from royalty.<,>她追溯了自己家族的皇室血统。<,>de(向下)+scent(爬)→向下爬→下降/血统<,>dissent(v.不同意)/ascent(n.上升)/ancestor(n.祖先)

hospitality<,>/ˌhɒspɪˈtæləti/<,>/ˌhɑːspɪˈtæləti/<,>n.友好<,>We were impressed by their hospitality.<,>他们的热情好客给我们留下深刻印象。<,>The hotel is known for its excellent hospitality.<,>这家酒店以优质服务闻名。<,>Southern hospitality is legendary.<,>南方人的热情好客是出了名的。<,>hospit(客人)+ality(名词后缀)→好客<,>hospital(n.医院)/host(n.主人)/hostile(adj.敌对的)

stuff<,>/stʌf/<,>/stʌf/<,>n.材料/东西<,>Put your stuff in the locker.<,>把你的东西放进储物柜。<,>This pillow is stuffed with feathers.<,>这个枕头是用羽毛填充的。<,>Do you have the stuff we need for the project?<,>你有我们项目需要的东西吗？<,>与staff(员工)区分记忆<,>material(n.材料)/substance(n.物质)/belongings(n.物品)

reflect<,>/rɪˈflekt/<,>/rɪˈflɛkt/<,>v.反映/反射/思考<,>The lake reflects the surrounding mountains.<,>湖水倒映着周围的山峦。<,>Take time to reflect on your decisions.<,>花时间思考你的决定。<,>His actions reflect his values.<,>他的行为反映了他的价值观。<,>re(回)+flect(弯曲)→弯曲回来→反射<,>deflect(v.偏转)/inflect(v.弯曲)/introspect(v.内省)

carpentry<,>/ˈkɑːpəntri/<,>/ˈkɑːrpəntri/<,>n.木工活<,>He learned carpentry from his father.<,>他跟父亲学习木工。<,>The carpentry work was done beautifully.<,>木工活做得很漂亮。<,>Modern carpentry requires both skill and creativity.<,>现代木工需要技术和创意。<,>carpent(木匠)+ry(名词后缀)→木工活<,>carpenter(n.木匠)/sculpture(n.雕塑)/woodwork(n.木制品)
decode<,>/diːˈkəʊd/<,>/diːˈkoʊd/<,>v.解码<,>Scientists are trying to decode the ancient manuscript.<,>科学家们正试图破译这份古老的手稿。<,>The software can decode encrypted messages quickly.<,>这个软件能快速解码加密信息。<,>Children learn to decode words when they start reading.<,>孩子们开始阅读时学习解码单词。<,>de(去除)+code(代码)→去除代码→解码<,>encode(v.编码)/decoder(n.解码器)

flaw<,>/flɔː/<,>/flɔ/<,>n.缺点/n.瑕疵<,>The diamond has a tiny flaw that affects its value.<,>这颗钻石有个小瑕疵影响了它的价值。<,>Her argument had a major logical flaw.<,>她的论点有个重大逻辑缺陷。<,>The plan was good, but its flaw was the high cost.<,>这个计划很好，但缺点是成本太高。<,>fl(飞)+aw(啊)→飞起来发现有瑕疵→"啊！有瑕疵"<,>flow(n.流动)/flee(v.逃跑)/flawless(adj.无瑕疵的)

reveal<,>/rɪˈviːl/<,>/rɪˈvil/<,>v.揭露<,>The investigation revealed some shocking facts.<,>调查揭露了一些令人震惊的事实。<,>She revealed her true feelings at last.<,>她终于表露了真实情感。<,>The curtain rose to reveal a beautiful stage set.<,>幕布升起，露出了精美的舞台布景。<,>re(再)+veal(面纱)→再次揭开面纱→揭露<,>conceal(v.隐藏)/revel(v.狂欢)/veil(n.面纱)

tutor<,>/ˈtjuːtə(r)/<,>/ˈtuːtər/<,>v.辅导<,>She tutors students in mathematics after school.<,>她课后辅导学生数学。<,>He was tutored at home until high school.<,>他在家接受辅导直到高中。<,>The university offers free tutoring services.<,>大学提供免费辅导服务。<,>tut(教导)+or(人)→教导的人→导师/辅导<,>tutorial(adj.辅导的)/mentor(n.导师)/tutee(n.被辅导者)

accustom<,>/əˈkʌstəm/<,>/əˈkʌstəm/<,>v.使习惯<,>It took time to accustom myself to the new schedule.<,>我花时间适应了新作息。<,>Soldiers must accustom themselves to harsh conditions.<,>士兵必须习惯艰苦条件。<,>The puppies were quickly accustomed to their new home.<,>小狗们很快习惯了新家。<,>ac(加强)+custom(习惯)→使习惯<,>custom(n.习惯)/accustomed(adj.习惯的)/customer(n.顾客)

acquaintance<,>/əˈkweɪntəns/<,>/əˈkweɪntəns/<,>n.熟人<,>He's not a friend, just a business acquaintance.<,>他不是朋友，只是生意上的熟人。<,>I made several new acquaintances at the conference.<,>我在会议上认识了几位新朋友。<,>We're only casual acquaintances, not close friends.<,>我们只是泛泛之交，不是密友。<,>ac(加强)+quaint(知道)+ance→知道的人→熟人<,>acquaint(v.使认识)/quaint(adj.古雅的)/acquiesce(v.默许)

distribution<,>/ˌdɪstrɪˈbjuːʃn/<,>/ˌdɪstrɪˈbjuːʃn/<,>n.分布/n.分配<,>The distribution of wealth is unequal in this country.<,>这个国家的财富分配不均。<,>This map shows the population distribution across the region.<,>这张地图显示该地区的人口分布。<,>We handle the distribution of products to retailers.<,>我们负责向零售商分配产品。<,>dis(分开)+tribute(给予)+ion→分开给予→分配<,>contribution(n.贡献)/attribute(n.属性)/retribution(n.报应)

trend<,>/trend/<,>/trɛnd/<,>n.趋势<,>There's a growing trend towards remote work.<,>远程工作趋势日益增长。<,>Fashion trends change every season.<,>时尚趋势每季都在变化。<,>The data shows an upward trend in sales.<,>数据显示销售呈上升趋势。<,>tend(倾向)+r→倾向的方向→趋势<,>tend(v.倾向于)/trench(n.沟渠)/tendency(n.倾向)

irritate<,>/ˈɪrɪteɪt/<,>/ˈɪrɪteɪt/<,>v.激怒<,>His constant complaining really irritates me.<,>他不停的抱怨真让我恼火。<,>The smoke irritated her eyes.<,>烟雾刺激了她的眼睛。<,>Don't irritate the dog or it might bite.<,>别激怒那只狗，它可能会咬人。<,>ir(进入)+rit(擦)+ate→摩擦进入→刺激<,>irritation(n.刺激)/irritable(adj.易怒的)/aggravate(v.加剧)

intrinsic<,>/ɪnˈtrɪnsɪk/<,>/ɪnˈtrɪnsɪk/<,>adj.本质的/adj.固有的<,>The intrinsic value of gold makes it a safe investment.<,>黄金的固有价值使其成为安全投资。<,>She has an intrinsic love for learning.<,>她对学习有着内在的热爱。<,>The intrinsic properties of the material determine its uses.<,>这种材料的固有特性决定了它的用途。<,>intrin(内部)+sic(跟随)→跟随内部的→内在的<,>extrinsic(adj.外在的)/intricate(adj.复杂的)/intrinsic(adj.本质的)
deem<,>/diːm/<,>/dim/<,>v.认为<,>I deem it necessary to inform you of the changes.<,>我认为有必要通知你这些变化。<,>He was deemed the best candidate for the job.<,>他被认为是这份工作的最佳人选。<,>The court deemed the evidence insufficient.<,>法庭认为证据不足。<,>deem(判断)+e→认为<,>seem(v.似乎)/teem(v.充满)/redeem(v.赎回)  

arouse<,>/əˈraʊz/<,>/əˈraʊz/<,>v.唤起<,>The loud noise aroused the baby from sleep.<,>巨大的噪音把婴儿从睡梦中吵醒。<,>His speech aroused great enthusiasm among the crowd.<,>他的演讲在人群中激起了极大的热情。<,>The documentary aroused public awareness of environmental issues.<,>这部纪录片唤起了公众对环境问题的意识。<,>a(加强)+rouse(唤醒)→唤起<,>rouse(v.唤醒)/arise(v.出现)/raise(v.举起)  

suburban<,>/səˈbɜːbən/<,>/səˈbɜːrbən/<,>adj.郊区的<,>They moved to a quiet suburban neighborhood.<,>他们搬到了一个安静的郊区社区。<,>Suburban life is often considered more peaceful than city life.<,>郊区生活通常被认为比城市生活更宁静。<,>The school is located in a suburban area with lots of greenery.<,>这所学校位于一个绿树成荫的郊区。<,>sub(下面)+urban(城市的)→城市下面的→郊区的<,>urban(adj.城市的)/rural(adj.乡村的)/suburb(n.郊区)  

pursue<,>/pəˈsjuː/<,>/pərˈsuː/<,>v.追求<,>She decided to pursue a career in medicine.<,>她决定追求医学事业。<,>The police pursued the suspect through the streets.<,>警察在街上追捕嫌疑人。<,>He has been pursuing his dream of becoming a musician for years.<,>多年来他一直在追求成为音乐家的梦想。<,>pur(向前)+sue(跟随)→向前跟随→追求<,>pursuit(n.追求)/pursuant(adj.依据的)/purser(n.事务长)  

ideology<,>/ˌaɪdiˈɒlədʒi/<,>/ˌaɪdiˈɑːlədʒi/<,>n.意识形态<,>Political ideology often influences people's voting behavior.<,>政治意识形态常常影响人们的投票行为。<,>The two parties have very different ideologies.<,>这两个党派有着非常不同的意识形态。<,>His ideology is based on the principles of equality and justice.<,>他的意识形态基于平等和正义的原则。<,>ideo(思想)+logy(学科)→思想体系→意识形态<,>ideal(n.理想)/idol(n.偶像)/ideologue(n.空想家)  

layman<,>/ˈleɪmən/<,>/ˈleɪmən/<,>n.门外汉<,>As a layman, I find this scientific paper hard to understand.<,>作为一个门外汉，我发现这篇科学论文很难理解。<,>The doctor explained the procedure in terms a layman could understand.<,>医生用门外汉也能理解的术语解释了手术过程。<,>This book is written for laymen, not experts.<,>这本书是为门外汉而不是专家写的。<,>lay(外行的)+man(人)→外行人→门外汉<,>laywoman(n.女门外汉)/layperson(n.外行)/layoff(n.解雇)  

instantaneous<,>/ˌɪnstənˈteɪniəs/<,>/ˌɪnstənˈteɪniəs/<,>adj.即时的/瞬间的<,>The camera provides instantaneous feedback.<,>这台相机提供即时反馈。<,>Death was instantaneous in the accident.<,>事故中死亡是瞬间发生的。<,>We live in an age of instantaneous communication.<,>我们生活在一个即时通讯的时代。<,>instant(立即)+aneous(形容词后缀)→即时的<,>instant(adj.立即的)/instance(n.例子)/instantiate(v.例示)  

seasick<,>/ˈsiːsɪk/<,>/ˈsiːsɪk/<,>adj.晕船的<,>She gets seasick even on calm waters.<,>即使在平静的水面上她也会晕船。<,>Take this medicine if you feel seasick.<,>如果你感到晕船就吃这个药。<,>The rough waves made half the passengers seasick.<,>汹涌的波浪使一半的乘客晕船。<,>sea(海)+sick(病的)→海上病的→晕船的<,>airsick(adj.晕机的)/carsick(adj.晕车的)/homesick(adj.想家的)  

lack<,>/læk/<,>/læk/<,>v.缺少<,>The project lacks sufficient funding.<,>这个项目缺乏足够的资金。<,>He lacks the experience needed for this job.<,>他缺少这份工作所需的经验。<,>Her speech lacked conviction.<,>她的演讲缺乏说服力。<,>lack(缺口)→缺少<,>slack(adj.松弛的)/black(adj.黑色的)/lick(v.舔)  

exaggerate<,>/ɪɡˈzædʒəreɪt/<,>/ɪɡˈzædʒəreɪt/<,>v.夸张<,>Don't exaggerate - it wasn't that bad!<,>别夸张——没那么糟糕！<,>He tends to exaggerate his accomplishments.<,>他倾向于夸大自己的成就。<,>The media often exaggerates the dangers of new technologies.<,>媒体经常夸大新技术的危险。<,>ex(出)+agger(堆积)+ate(动词后缀)→堆出界限→夸张<,>aggregate(v.聚集)/aggravate(v.加重)/exacerbate(v.恶化)
magnify<,>/ˈmæɡnɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈmæɡnəˌfaɪ/<,>v.放大<,>This microscope can magnify objects up to 1000 times.<,>这台显微镜可以将物体放大1000倍。<,>He tends to magnify small problems into big issues.<,>他倾向于把小问题放大成大问题。<,>The media often magnifies celebrities' personal lives.<,>媒体经常放大名人的私生活。<,>magn(大)+ify(使)→使变大→放大<,>amplify(v.放大)/minify(v.缩小)/magnitude(n.量级)  

utilization<,>/ˌjuːtəlaɪˈzeɪʃn/<,>/ˌjutələˈzeɪʃən/<,>n.利用<,>The utilization of solar energy is becoming more popular.<,>太阳能的利用正变得越来越普遍。<,>Efficient utilization of resources is crucial for sustainability.<,>资源的有效利用对可持续性至关重要。<,>The study focuses on the utilization of waste materials.<,>这项研究专注于废弃材料的利用。<,>util(用)+ization(过程)→利用的过程<,>utility(n.效用)/utilize(v.利用)/reutilization(n.再利用)  

twist<,>/twɪst/<,>/twɪst/<,>v.扭曲<,>She twisted her ankle while playing basketball.<,>她在打篮球时扭伤了脚踝。<,>The road twists through the mountains.<,>这条路蜿蜒穿过群山。<,>He twisted the facts to support his argument.<,>他歪曲事实来支持他的论点。<,>tw(转)+ist→转动→扭曲<,>wrist(n.手腕)/writhe(v.扭动)/tortuous(adj.曲折的)  

expedition<,>/ˌekspəˈdɪʃn/<,>/ˌɛkspəˈdɪʃən/<,>n.探险/n.远征<,>The team went on an expedition to the Arctic.<,>这支队伍去北极探险了。<,>Lewis and Clark led an expedition across America.<,>刘易斯和克拉克领导了一次横跨美洲的远征。<,>The scientific expedition discovered new species.<,>这次科学探险发现了新物种。<,>ex(出)+ped(脚)+ition→走出去→远征<,>excursion(n.短途旅行)/mission(n.任务)/expeditious(adj.迅速的)  

switch<,>/swɪtʃ/<,>/swɪtʃ/<,>v.转换<,>She switched from coffee to tea.<,>她从咖啡改喝茶了。<,>He switched jobs last month.<,>他上个月换了工作。<,>Can you switch the light off?<,>你能把灯关掉吗？<,>sw(摇摆)+itch→摇摆变化→转换<,>twitch(v.抽搐)/swap(v.交换)/shift(v.轮班)  

inheritance<,>/ɪnˈherɪtəns/<,>/ɪnˈhɛrɪtəns/<,>n.继承/n.遗产<,>He received a large inheritance from his grandfather.<,>他从祖父那里继承了一大笔遗产。<,>Genetic inheritance determines many traits.<,>基因遗传决定许多特征。<,>The dispute over the inheritance lasted years.<,>关于遗产的争议持续了多年。<,>in(内)+herit(继承)+ance→继承来的东西<,>heritage(n.遗产)/heredity(n.遗传)/inherent(adj.固有的)  

sponsor<,>/ˈspɒnsə(r)/<,>/ˈspɑːnsər/<,>v.赞助/n.赞助商<,>The company sponsors several sports teams.<,>这家公司赞助了几支运动队。<,>He found a sponsor for his research project.<,>他为研究项目找到了赞助商。<,>The event needs more sponsors to cover costs.<,>这个活动需要更多赞助商来支付费用。<,>spons(承诺)+or(人)→承诺支持的人<,>donor(n.捐赠者)/patron(n.资助人)/endorse(v.背书)  

deterioration<,>/dɪˌtɪəriəˈreɪʃn/<,>/dɪˌtɪriəˈreɪʃən/<,>n.恶化/n.退化<,>There has been a deterioration in air quality.<,>空气质量已经恶化。<,>The patient showed signs of mental deterioration.<,>病人显示出精神退化的迹象。<,>Prevent the deterioration of the building's structure.<,>防止建筑结构的恶化。<,>de(向下)+terior(糟糕)+ation→变得更糟<,>degradation(n.退化)/decline(n.下降)/amelioration(n.改善)  

ongoing<,>/ˈɒnɡəʊɪŋ/<,>/ˈɑːnɡoʊɪŋ/<,>adj.持续的/adj.不间断的<,>The investigation is still ongoing.<,>调查仍在进行中。<,>Ongoing maintenance is required for the equipment.<,>设备需要持续维护。<,>They discussed the ongoing projects.<,>他们讨论了正在进行的项目。<,>on(在)+going(进行)→正在进行中的<,>outgoing(adj.外向的)/incoming(adj.进来的)/ongoingness(n.持续性)  

refreshing<,>/rɪˈfreʃɪŋ/<,>/rɪˈfrɛʃɪŋ/<,>adj.新鲜的<,>The lemonade was very refreshing on a hot day.<,>热天里柠檬水非常提神。<,>His honesty was refreshing in politics.<,>他的诚实给政界带来一股清流。<,>A refreshing breeze came from the sea.<,>从海上吹来一阵清新的微风。<,>re(再)+fresh(新鲜)+ing→再次变得新鲜<,>renewing(adj.更新的)/invigorating(adj.提神的)/stale(adj.不新鲜的)
incidentally<,>/ˌɪnsɪˈdentəli/<,>/ˌɪnsɪˈdentəli/<,>adv.顺便地/adv.附带<,>Incidentally, I saw your brother at the mall yesterday.<,>顺便提一下，我昨天在商场看到你弟弟了。<,>He mentioned, incidentally, that he was leaving soon.<,>他顺便提到他很快就要离开了。<,>Incidentally, this is the same model we discussed last week.<,>附带说一下，这就是我们上周讨论的同一型号。<,>in(进入)+cid(落下)+ent(形容词后缀)+al(副词后缀)→偶然落下的→顺便地<,>accidentally(adv.意外地)/intentionally(adv.故意地)

imprison<,>/ɪmˈprɪzn/<,>/ɪmˈprɪzn/<,>v.监禁<,>The dictator imprisoned his political opponents.<,>独裁者监禁了他的政敌。<,>He was imprisoned for ten years for his crimes.<,>他因犯罪被监禁了十年。<,>The castle was used to imprison rebels during the war.<,>这座城堡在战争期间被用来关押叛乱分子。<,>im(进入)+prison(监狱)→进入监狱→监禁<,>prison(n.监狱)/imprisonment(n.监禁)/emprison(v.使陷入)

present<,>/prɪˈzent/<,>/prɪˈzent/<,>v.呈现/v.给予<,>She presented her research at the conference.<,>她在会议上展示了她的研究。<,>He presented his wife with a beautiful necklace.<,>他送给妻子一条漂亮的项链。<,>The company will present its new product line next month.<,>公司将于下个月推出新产品线。<,>pre(前)+sent(存在)→呈现在前面→呈现<,>presence(n.存在)/presentation(n.展示)/represent(v.代表)

uninformed<,>/ˌʌnɪnˈfɔːmd/<,>/ˌʌnɪnˈfɔːrmd/<,>adj.无知的/adj.未受过教育的<,>His uninformed opinions caused a lot of controversy.<,>他无知的意见引起了很多争议。<,>She made an uninformed decision without consulting anyone.<,>她在没有咨询任何人的情况下做出了一个无知的决定。<,>The article was criticized for being uninformed and biased.<,>这篇文章因无知和偏见而受到批评。<,>un(否定)+informed(有知识的)→无知的<,>informed(adj.消息灵通的)/misinformed(adj.被误导的)/uneducated(adj.未受教育的)

overlap<,>/ˌəʊvəˈlæp/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈlæp/<,>v.重叠<,>The two projects overlap in terms of timeline.<,>这两个项目在时间线上有重叠。<,>Their responsibilities often overlap at work.<,>他们的工作职责经常重叠。<,>The roof tiles overlap to prevent leaks.<,>屋顶瓦片重叠以防止漏水。<,>over(在...上)+lap(重叠)→在上面重叠→重叠<,>overlay(v.覆盖)/overload(v.超载)/overlap(n.重叠部分)

slim<,>/slɪm/<,>/slɪm/<,>adj.苗条的<,>She has a slim figure and always looks elegant.<,>她身材苗条，总是看起来很优雅。<,>The chances of success are slim.<,>成功的机会很渺茫。<,>He's trying to stay slim by exercising regularly.<,>他通过定期锻炼来保持苗条。<,>slim→slice(切片)→像切片一样薄→苗条的<,>slender(adj.纤细的)/skinny(adj.皮包骨的)/plump(adj.丰满的)

urban<,>/ˈɜːbən/<,>/ˈɜːrbən/<,>adj.城市的/adj.都市的<,>Urban areas are usually more crowded than rural ones.<,>城市地区通常比农村地区更拥挤。<,>She prefers urban life to country living.<,>她更喜欢都市生活而不是乡村生活。<,>The urban population has been growing rapidly.<,>城市人口一直在快速增长。<,>urb(城市)+an(形容词后缀)→城市的<,>suburban(adj.郊区的)/rural(adj.农村的)/metropolitan(adj.大都市的)

rank<,>/ræŋk/<,>/ræŋk/<,>v.排列/v.分级<,>The students were ranked according to their test scores.<,>学生们根据考试成绩排名。<,>This university ranks among the top in the country.<,>这所大学在全国名列前茅。<,>He was promoted to the rank of captain.<,>他被提升为上尉军衔。<,>rank→range(范围)→在范围内排列→排列<,>rank(n.等级)/arrange(v.安排)/range(n.范围)

untrustworthy<,>/ʌnˈtrʌstwɜːði/<,>/ʌnˈtrʌstwɜːrði/<,>adj.不值得信任的/adj.怀疑的<,>He proved to be untrustworthy when he broke his promise.<,>当他违背诺言时，他被证明是不可信任的。<,>The source of the information is untrustworthy.<,>信息的来源不可靠。<,>I find his behavior increasingly untrustworthy.<,>我发现他的行为越来越不可信。<,>un(否定)+trustworthy(值得信任的)→不值得信任的<,>trustworthy(adj.值得信任的)/distrustful(adj.不信任的)/unreliable(adj.不可靠的)

Automatically<,>/ˌɔːtəˈmætɪkli/<,>/ˌɔːtəˈmætɪkli/<,>adv.自动地/adv.不经思考地<,>The doors open automatically when you approach.<,>当你靠近时，门会自动打开。<,>She automatically reached for her phone when it rang.<,>电话响起时，她不假思索地伸手去拿。<,>The system updates automatically every night.<,>系统每晚自动更新。<,>auto(自动)+matic(形容词后缀)+al(副词后缀)→自动地<,>automate(v.使自动化)/automatic(adj.自动的)/mechanically(adv.机械地)
accountable<,>/əˈkaʊntəbl/<,>/əˈkaʊntəbəl/<,>adj.应负责的/adj.有责任的<,>The manager is accountable for the team's performance.<,>经理对团队的表现负责。<,>You will be held accountable for your actions.<,>你要对自己的行为负责。<,>Politicians should be accountable to the public.<,>政治家应该对公众负责。<,>account(账户)+able(能够)→能够解释账户→有责任的<,>countable(adj.可数的)/accountant(n.会计师)  

collaborative<,>/kəˈlæbərətɪv/<,>/kəˈlæbəˌreɪtɪv/<,>adj.合作的<,>This project requires a collaborative effort.<,>这个项目需要合作努力。<,>They have a collaborative relationship with the university.<,>他们与大学有合作关系。<,>The book is the result of collaborative work.<,>这本书是合作完成的成果。<,>co(共同)+labor(劳动)+ative→共同劳动的→合作的<,>cooperative(adj.合作的)/correlative(adj.相关的)  

practice<,>/ˈpræktɪs/<,>/ˈpræktɪs/<,>n.做法<,>This is a common business practice.<,>这是常见的商业做法。<,>Good hygiene practices prevent disease.<,>良好的卫生习惯预防疾病。<,>The doctor has a private practice.<,>这位医生有私人诊所。<,>pract(做)+ice→实际做出来的→做法<,>practise(v.练习)/precise(adj.精确的)  

diligence<,>/ˈdɪlɪdʒəns/<,>/ˈdɪlədʒəns/<,>n.勤奋<,>Her diligence earned her a promotion.<,>她的勤奋为她赢得了晋升。<,>Success comes from diligence and perseverance.<,>成功来自勤奋和坚持。<,>The student shows great diligence in his studies.<,>这个学生学习非常勤奋。<,>di(分开)+lig(选择)+ence→不断选择区分→勤奋<,>intelligence(n.智力)/negligence(n.疏忽)  

victim<,>/ˈvɪktɪm/<,>/ˈvɪktəm/<,>n.受害者<,>The victim identified the attacker.<,>受害者认出了袭击者。<,>Many innocent people became victims of the war.<,>许多无辜的人成为战争的受害者。<,>The charity helps victims of domestic violence.<,>这个慈善机构帮助家庭暴力的受害者。<,>vict(征服)+im→被征服的人→受害者<,>vicious(adj.恶毒的)/victory(n.胜利)  

urge<,>/ɜːdʒ/<,>/ɜrdʒ/<,>v.催促<,>I urge you to reconsider your decision.<,>我敦促你重新考虑你的决定。<,>She felt an urge to travel.<,>她有一种想去旅行的冲动。<,>The doctor urged him to quit smoking.<,>医生敦促他戒烟。<,>urg(驱动)+e→推动→催促<,>surge(v.汹涌)/merge(v.合并)  

fertility<,>/fəˈtɪləti/<,>/fərˈtɪləti/<,>n.多产/n.肥沃<,>The fertility of the soil ensures good crops.<,>土壤的肥沃保证了作物的丰收。<,>Fertility rates have declined in recent years.<,>近年来生育率下降了。<,>This region is known for its fertility.<,>这个地区以土地肥沃著称。<,>fert(生育)+ility→生育能力→多产<,>sterility(n.不育)/futility(n.无用)  

foundation<,>/faʊnˈdeɪʃn/<,>/faʊnˈdeɪʃən/<,>n.基金会<,>The foundation supports medical research.<,>这个基金会支持医学研究。<,>She established a charitable foundation.<,>她建立了一个慈善基金会。<,>The building has a solid foundation.<,>这座建筑有坚实的基础。<,>found(建立)+ation→建立的东西→基金会<,>fundation(n.资金)/founder(n.创始人)  

reception<,>/rɪˈsepʃn/<,>/rɪˈsepʃən/<,>n.接待<,>The hotel reception is open 24 hours.<,>酒店前台24小时开放。<,>We got a warm reception at the conference.<,>我们在会议上受到了热烈欢迎。<,>The radio has poor reception here.<,>这里的收音机信号很差。<,>re(再)+cept(拿)+ion→再次拿取→接待<,>conception(n.概念)/perception(n.感知)  

elite<,>/eɪˈliːt/<,>/ɪˈliːt/<,>n.精英<,>The school educates the elite of society.<,>这所学校培养社会精英。<,>He belongs to the political elite.<,>他属于政治精英阶层。<,>The elite troops were sent first.<,>精英部队被首先派出。<,>e(出)+lite(选择)→选出来的→精英<,>elicit(v.引出)/elate(v.使兴奋)
suicide<,>/ˈsuːɪsaɪd/<,>/ˈsuːəˌsaɪd/<,>n.自杀<,>He committed suicide after losing his job.<,>他在失业后自杀了。<,>Suicide rates have been increasing in recent years.<,>近年来自杀率一直在上升。<,>She left a suicide note before taking her own life.<,>她在自杀前留下了一封遗书。<,>sui(自己)+cide(杀)→自杀<,>homicide(n. 杀人)/genocide(n. 种族灭绝)/pesticide(n. 杀虫剂)

incompetent<,>/ɪnˈkɒmpɪtənt/<,>/ɪnˈkɑːmpɪtənt/<,>adj.无能力的/adj.不胜任的<,>The manager was fired for being incompetent.<,>经理因不胜任工作被解雇了。<,>He proved himself incompetent to handle the project.<,>他证明了自己无力处理这个项目。<,>An incompetent teacher can harm students' learning.<,>一个无能的老师会损害学生的学习。<,>in(不)+competent(有能力的)→无能力的<,>competent(adj. 有能力的)/incomplete(adj. 不完整的)/inconsistent(adj. 不一致的)

tremendous<,>/trəˈmendəs/<,>/trəˈmɛndəs/<,>adj.巨大的<,>The earthquake caused tremendous damage.<,>地震造成了巨大的破坏。<,>She has a tremendous amount of work to do.<,>她有大量的工作要做。<,>The concert was a tremendous success.<,>这场音乐会取得了巨大的成功。<,>trem(颤抖)+endous→让人颤抖的→巨大的<,>tremble(v. 颤抖)/tremor(n. 震动)/tremendously(adv. 极大地)

recyclable<,>/ˌriːˈsaɪkləbl/<,>/ˌriˈsaɪkləbəl/<,>adj.可回收利用的<,>This bottle is made of recyclable plastic.<,>这个瓶子是用可回收塑料制成的。<,>We should separate recyclable materials from trash.<,>我们应该把可回收材料从垃圾中分离出来。<,>The company uses only recyclable packaging.<,>这家公司只使用可回收包装。<,>re(再)+cycle(循环)+able(能)→可回收的<,>recycle(v. 回收)/reusable(adj. 可重复使用的)/biodegradable(adj. 可生物降解的)

visualize<,>/ˈvɪʒuəlaɪz/<,>/ˈvɪʒuəˌlaɪz/<,>v.想象<,>Try to visualize yourself succeeding.<,>试着想象自己成功的样子。<,>I can't visualize how this machine works.<,>我无法想象这台机器是如何工作的。<,>She visualized the scene in her mind before painting it.<,>她在画之前先在脑海中想象了这个场景。<,>visual(视觉的)+ize(使)→使视觉化→想象<,>visual(adj. 视觉的)/vision(n. 视力)/visually(adv. 视觉上)

exertion<,>/ɪɡˈzɜːʃn/<,>/ɪɡˈzɜːrʃn/<,>n.运用<,>After much exertion, he finally solved the problem.<,>经过大量努力，他终于解决了问题。<,>Physical exertion is good for your health.<,>体力活动对你的健康有好处。<,>She collapsed from the exertion of running the marathon.<,>她因跑马拉松的劳累而晕倒了。<,>ex(出)+ert(插入)+ion→把力量使出来→运用<,>exert(v. 运用)/insert(v. 插入)/assert(v. 断言)

slack<,>/slæk/<,>/slæk/<,>adj.疲软的/adj.萧条的<,>The rope became slack after being stretched.<,>绳子被拉长后变得松弛了。<,>Business is slack during the summer months.<,>夏季的生意很萧条。<,>He was criticized for his slack performance at work.<,>他因工作表现疲软而受到批评。<,>s(死)+lack(缺乏)→死气沉沉缺乏活力→疲软的<,>slacken(v. 放松)/slacker(n. 懒人)/slackness(n. 松懈)

rigid<,>/ˈrɪdʒɪd/<,>/ˈrɪdʒɪd/<,>adj.严格的<,>The school has rigid rules about uniforms.<,>学校对制服有严格的规定。<,>His rigid attitude makes compromise difficult.<,>他严格的态度使得妥协很困难。<,>The material is too rigid to bend easily.<,>这种材料太硬不容易弯曲。<,>rig(僵硬)+id→僵硬的→严格的<,>rigidity(n. 严格)/rigorous(adj. 严密的)/rigidly(adv. 严格地)

organic<,>/ɔːˈɡænɪk/<,>/ɔːrˈɡænɪk/<,>adj.有机的<,>We grow organic vegetables in our garden.<,>我们在花园里种植有机蔬菜。<,>Organic food is becoming more popular.<,>有机食品越来越受欢迎。<,>The company specializes in organic cosmetics.<,>这家公司专营有机化妆品。<,>organ(器官)+ic→像器官一样自然生长的→有机的<,>organism(n. 有机体)/organize(v. 组织)/inorganic(adj. 无机的)

reproduction<,>/ˌriːprəˈdʌkʃn/<,>/ˌriːprəˈdʌkʃn/<,>n.繁殖<,>The reproduction rate of rabbits is very high.<,>兔子的繁殖率很高。<,>This is a reproduction of a famous painting.<,>这是一幅名画的复制品。<,>The museum displays reproductions of ancient artifacts.<,>博物馆展出古代文物的复制品。<,>re(再)+pro(向前)+duct(引导)+ion→再次引导产生→繁殖<,>produce(v. 生产)/product(n. 产品)/reproductive(adj. 生殖的)
strap<,>/stræp/<,>/stræp/<,>v.用带绑住<,>He strapped the bag to his bike.<,>他用带子把包绑在自行车上。<,>She strapped on her helmet before riding.<,>她在骑车前系好了头盔。<,>The box was strapped tightly with rope.<,>箱子被绳子牢牢绑住。<,>s+trap(陷阱)→像陷阱一样绑住<,>strip(v.剥去/n.条带)/trap(n.陷阱/v.困住)  

precision<,>/prɪˈsɪʒən/<,>/prɪˈsɪʒən/<,>n.精确性<,>The surgeon operated with great precision.<,>外科医生以极高的精确性进行手术。<,>This instrument measures with laser precision.<,>这个仪器能以激光级精度测量。<,>His speech lacked precision and clarity.<,>他的演讲缺乏精确性和清晰度。<,>pre(预先)+cis(切)+ion→提前切好→精确<,>decision(n.决定)/incision(n.切口)  

standardize<,>/ˈstændədaɪz/<,>/ˈstændərdaɪz/<,>v.标准化<,>The company standardized its production process.<,>该公司标准化了生产流程。<,>We need to standardize the test procedures.<,>我们需要标准化测试程序。<,>The software standardizes file formats.<,>该软件统一了文件格式。<,>standard(标准)+ize(化)→标准化<,>normalize(v.正常化)/stabilize(v.稳定化)  

aptly<,>/ˈæptli/<,>/ˈæptli/<,>adv.适当地<,>The quote was aptly chosen for the occasion.<,>这个引用很适合这个场合。<,>She aptly described the complex situation.<,>她恰当地描述了复杂情况。<,>The color was aptly named "sunset orange".<,>这个颜色被恰当地命名为"日落橙"。<,>apt(恰当的)+ly(副词后缀)→适当地<,>abruptly(adv.突然地)/aptitude(n.天资)  

promotion<,>/prəˈməʊʃən/<,>/prəˈmoʊʃən/<,>n.促销<,>The store is running a holiday promotion.<,>商店正在进行节日促销。<,>He got a promotion to manager last month.<,>他上个月晋升为经理。<,>This promotion offers 50% discount.<,>这次促销提供五折优惠。<,>pro(向前)+mot(移动)+ion→向前推动→促销<,>demotion(n.降级)/motion(n.运动)  

paralyze<,>/ˈpærəlaɪz/<,>/ˈpærəlaɪz/<,>v.瘫痪/麻痹<,>The accident paralyzed his legs.<,>事故使他的双腿瘫痪。<,>Fear paralyzed her at the critical moment.<,>恐惧使她在关键时刻动弹不得。<,>The strike paralyzed the transportation system.<,>罢工使交通系统瘫痪。<,>para(旁边)+lyze(松开)→身体一侧松开→瘫痪<,>analyze(v.分析)/parasite(n.寄生虫)  

degeneration<,>/dɪˌdʒenəˈreɪʃən/<,>/dɪˌdʒenəˈreɪʃən/<,>n.退化/变质<,>The disease causes muscle degeneration.<,>这种疾病会导致肌肉退化。<,>Urban sprawl leads to environmental degeneration.<,>城市扩张导致环境恶化。<,>This is a clear case of moral degeneration.<,>这是明显的道德沦丧。<,>de(向下)+gener(产生)+ation→向下产生→退化<,>generation(n.一代人)/regeneration(n.再生)  

refrain<,>/rɪˈfreɪn/<,>/rɪˈfreɪn/<,>v.抑制/避免<,>Please refrain from smoking here.<,>请勿在此吸烟。<,>She refrained from commenting on the issue.<,>她避免对这个问题发表评论。<,>I could hardly refrain from laughing.<,>我几乎忍不住要笑出来。<,>re(回)+frain(缰绳)→拉回缰绳→抑制<,>restrain(v.克制)/refresh(v.刷新)  

flavor<,>/ˈfleɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈfleɪvər/<,>n.口味<,>This ice cream has a unique tropical flavor.<,>这种冰淇淋有独特的热带风味。<,>The sauce adds extra flavor to the dish.<,>这种酱汁为菜肴增添了额外的风味。<,>I prefer mild flavors to spicy ones.<,>比起辣味，我更喜欢温和的口味。<,>fla(看作fly)+vor(看作vour吃)→飞着吃→风味<,>favor(n.喜爱)/fever(n.发烧)  

adventure<,>/ədˈventʃə(r)/<,>/ədˈventʃər/<,>n.冒险<,>They went on an adventure in the Amazon.<,>他们去亚马逊河探险了。<,>Starting a business is quite an adventure.<,>创业是一次很大的冒险。<,>The book describes his adventures in Africa.<,>这本书描述了他在非洲的冒险经历。<,>ad(加强)+vent(来)+ure→来到危险→冒险<,>venture(n.风险投资)/invent(v.发明)
agonize<,>/ˈæɡənaɪz/<,>/ˈæɡəˌnaɪz/<,>v.使痛苦<,>She agonized over the decision for days.<,>她为这个决定痛苦了好几天。<,>He agonized about telling his parents the truth.<,>他对于是否告诉父母真相感到非常痛苦。<,>The team agonized over their loss in the finals.<,>球队为决赛失利感到痛苦万分。<,>agon(痛苦)+ize(动词后缀)→使痛苦<,>agony(n.极度痛苦)/antagonize(v.对抗)  

mount<,>/maʊnt/<,>/maʊnt/<,>v.增加<,>Pressure is mounting on the government to take action.<,>政府采取行动的压力正在增加。<,>Costs continue to mount as the project progresses.<,>随着项目推进，成本不断增加。<,>Her anxiety mounted as the exam date approached.<,>随着考试日期临近，她的焦虑感不断增加。<,>mount(山)→像山一样堆积→增加<,>amount(n.数量)/mountain(n.山)  

oppose<,>/əˈpəʊz/<,>/əˈpoʊz/<,>v.反对<,>Many residents oppose the new construction plan.<,>许多居民反对新的建设计划。<,>She opposed the idea from the very beginning.<,>她从一开始就反对这个想法。<,>The senator opposed the bill on moral grounds.<,>参议员基于道德理由反对该法案。<,>op(反)+pose(放)→放在对立面→反对<,>propose(v.提议)/suppose(v.假设)  

justifiable<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪfaɪəbl/<,>/ˈdʒʌstəˌfaɪəbəl/<,>adj.理所应当的<,>His anger was justifiable given the circumstances.<,>考虑到当时的情况，他的愤怒是理所应当的。<,>The price increase seems justifiable due to rising costs.<,>由于成本上涨，涨价似乎理所应当。<,>She had justifiable reasons for being late.<,>她有充分的理由迟到。<,>just(正义)+ify(使)+able(可...的)→可证明为正当的<,>justified(adj.有正当理由的)/justice(n.正义)  

promote<,>/prəˈməʊt/<,>/prəˈmoʊt/<,>v.促进<,>Exercise promotes good health.<,>锻炼促进健康。<,>The new policy aims to promote economic growth.<,>新政策旨在促进经济增长。<,>She was promoted to manager last month.<,>她上个月被提升为经理。<,>pro(向前)+mote(移动)→向前移动→促进<,>demote(v.降级)/remote(adj.遥远的)  

renewable<,>/rɪˈnjuːəbl/<,>/rɪˈnuːəbəl/<,>adj.可再生的<,>Solar energy is a renewable resource.<,>太阳能是可再生资源。<,>The company invests in renewable energy projects.<,>公司投资于可再生能源项目。<,>We need to shift to renewable energy sources.<,>我们需要转向可再生能源。<,>re(再)+new(新)+able(可...的)→可再生的<,>nonrenewable(adj.不可再生的)/renew(v.更新)  

hypothesis<,>/haɪˈpɒθəsɪs/<,>/haɪˈpɑːθəsɪs/<,>n.假设，假说<,>Scientists tested their hypothesis through experiments.<,>科学家通过实验验证他们的假设。<,>The research begins with a working hypothesis.<,>研究从一个工作假设开始。<,>Her hypothesis proved to be correct.<,>她的假设被证明是正确的。<,>hypo(在...下)+thesis(论点)→基础论点→假设<,>thesis(n.论文)/synthesis(n.合成)  

presentation<,>/ˌprezənˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌpriːzenˈteɪʃən/<,>n.展示；讲话<,>He gave an excellent presentation at the conference.<,>他在会议上做了精彩的展示。<,>The product presentation lasted two hours.<,>产品展示持续了两小时。<,>Her presentation skills need improvement.<,>她的演讲技巧需要提高。<,>present(呈现)+ation(名词后缀)→展示<,>representation(n.代表)/preservation(n.保存)  

cater<,>/ˈkeɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈkeɪtər/<,>v.迎合<,>The restaurant caters to vegetarian customers.<,>这家餐厅迎合素食顾客。<,>Our program caters to different learning styles.<,>我们的课程迎合不同的学习风格。<,>The event catered to local business owners.<,>这个活动迎合了当地企业主。<,>cat(猫)+er→像猫一样讨好→迎合<,>caterer(n.餐饮承办人)/caterpillar(n.毛毛虫)  

unbiased<,>/ʌnˈbaɪəst/<,>/ʌnˈbaɪəst/<,>adj.公正的<,>We need an unbiased opinion on this matter.<,>我们需要对此事的公正意见。<,>The journalist provided an unbiased report.<,>记者提供了公正的报道。<,>The judge remained unbiased throughout the trial.<,>法官在整个审判过程中保持公正。<,>un(不)+bias(偏见)+ed→没有偏见的<,>biased(adj.有偏见的)/unfair(adj.不公平的)
immersive<,>/ɪˈmɜːsɪv/<,>/ɪˈmɜːrsɪv/<,>adj.沉浸的/adj.身临其境的<,>The game offers an immersive virtual reality experience.<,>这款游戏提供了沉浸式的虚拟现实体验。<,>She was completely immersed in the immersive storytelling.<,>她完全沉浸在身临其境的故事叙述中。<,>The immersive theater performance made the audience feel like part of the show.<,>沉浸式剧场表演让观众感觉自己是演出的一部分。<,>im(进入)+mers(沉)+ive(形容词后缀)→沉浸的<,>immerse(v.沉浸)/submerse(v.浸没)/emerge(v.浮现)

domain<,>/dəˈmeɪn/<,>/doʊˈmeɪn/<,>n.领域<,>This topic falls outside my domain of expertise.<,>这个主题超出了我的专业领域。<,>He is a leading expert in the domain of artificial intelligence.<,>他是人工智能领域的顶尖专家。<,>The company expanded its business into new domains.<,>公司将业务扩展到了新的领域。<,>dom(统治)+ain→统治范围→领域<,>dominant(adj.支配的)/dominate(v.支配)/dominion(n.主权)

primitive<,>/ˈprɪmɪtɪv/<,>/ˈprɪmɪtɪv/<,>adj.原始的/adj.简单的<,>Primitive humans used stone tools.<,>原始人类使用石器。<,>The software has a primitive user interface.<,>这个软件的用户界面很简单。<,>They lived in primitive conditions without electricity.<,>他们生活在没有电的原始条件下。<,>prim(第一)+itive→最初的→原始的<,>prime(adj.主要的)/primary(adj.初级的)/primal(adj.最初的)

urgent<,>/ˈɜːdʒənt/<,>/ˈɜːrdʒənt/<,>adj.急迫的<,>This is an urgent matter that needs immediate attention.<,>这是一件需要立即关注的紧急事件。<,>She received an urgent call from the hospital.<,>她接到了医院打来的紧急电话。<,>The doctor said the surgery was urgent.<,>医生说手术很紧急。<,>urg(驱动)+ent→驱动的→急迫的<,>urge(v.催促)/urgency(n.紧急)/emergent(adj.紧急的)

threaten<,>/ˈθretn/<,>/ˈθretn/<,>v.威胁<,>The storm threatened to destroy the village.<,>暴风雨威胁要摧毁村庄。<,>He threatened to resign if his demands were not met.<,>他威胁说如果他的要求得不到满足就辞职。<,>Pollution threatens the survival of many species.<,>污染威胁着许多物种的生存。<,>threat(威胁)+en(动词后缀)→威胁<,>thread(n.线)/treat(v.对待)/throat(n.喉咙)

throne<,>/θrəʊn/<,>/θroʊn/<,>n.王位<,>The king ascended the throne at a young age.<,>国王年轻时登上了王位。<,>The prince is next in line for the throne.<,>王子是王位的下一任继承人。<,>The queen sat gracefully on her throne.<,>女王优雅地坐在她的王位上。<,>thron(座位)+e→王座→王位<,>throne(n.王位)/throng(n.人群)/thorn(n.刺)

underfunded<,>/ˌʌndəˈfʌndɪd/<,>/ˌʌndərˈfʌndɪd/<,>adj.资金不足的<,>The school is underfunded and lacks basic resources.<,>这所学校资金不足，缺乏基本资源。<,>Many public hospitals are underfunded.<,>许多公立医院资金不足。<,>The underfunded project was eventually canceled.<,>这个资金不足的项目最终被取消了。<,>under(不足)+fund(资金)+ed→资金不足的<,>underestimate(v.低估)/underground(adj.地下的)/underpaid(adj.报酬过低的)

jail<,>/dʒeɪl/<,>/dʒeɪl/<,>n.监狱<,>He was sentenced to three years in jail.<,>他被判处三年监禁。<,>The criminal escaped from jail last night.<,>罪犯昨晚越狱了。<,>Conditions in the jail are reported to be poor.<,>据报道，监狱的条件很差。<,>jail(监狱)→与gaol(监狱)同义<,>jail(n.监狱)/bail(n.保释)/nail(n.钉子)

assessment<,>/əˈsesmənt/<,>/əˈsesmənt/<,>n.评估/n.评价<,>The teacher gave a fair assessment of the student's work.<,>老师对学生的作业进行了公正的评价。<,>The company conducts regular performance assessments.<,>公司定期进行绩效评估。<,>The assessment of the damage will take several days.<,>损失评估需要几天时间。<,>assess(评估)+ment(名词后缀)→评估<,>access(n.入口)/excess(n.过量)/asset(n.资产)

frustrate<,>/frʌˈstreɪt/<,>/ˈfrʌstreɪt/<,>v.使挫败/v.使沮丧<,>Technical problems frustrated our attempts to complete the project on time.<,>技术问题使我们按时完成项目的努力受挫。<,>She felt frustrated by the lack of progress.<,>她因缺乏进展而感到沮丧。<,>The bad weather frustrated our plans for a picnic.<,>恶劣的天气使我们野餐的计划泡汤了。<,>frust(徒劳)+ate(动词后缀)→使徒劳→使挫败<,>fluster(v.使慌乱)/illustrate(v.说明)/fracture(n.骨折)
abolition<,>/ˌæbəˈlɪʃən/<,>/ˌæbəˈlɪʃən/<,>n.废除<,>The abolition of slavery was a major turning point in history.<,>奴隶制的废除是历史上的一个重要转折点。<,>Many activists fought for the abolition of capital punishment.<,>许多活动家为废除死刑而斗争。<,>The new law led to the abolition of outdated regulations.<,>新法律导致过时法规的废除。<,>ab(离开)+olit(生长)+ion→使停止生长→废除<,>abolish(v.废除)/addition(n.增加)/absolution(n.赦免)

detective<,>/dɪˈtektɪv/<,>/dɪˈtektɪv/<,>n.侦探<,>The detective carefully examined the crime scene.<,>侦探仔细检查了犯罪现场。<,>She enjoys reading detective novels in her spare time.<,>她闲暇时喜欢读侦探小说。<,>The famous detective solved the mysterious case within a week.<,>这位著名侦探在一周内破解了这个神秘案件。<,>detect(发现)+ive(人)→发现真相的人→侦探<,>detector(n.探测器)/defective(adj.有缺陷的)/protective(adj.保护的)

skyscraper<,>/ˈskaɪskreɪpə(r)/<,>/ˈskaɪˌskreɪpər/<,>n.摩天大楼<,>The new skyscraper dominates the city skyline.<,>这座新的摩天大楼成为城市天际线的主角。<,>Construction of the world's tallest skyscraper was completed last year.<,>世界最高摩天大楼的建造于去年完工。<,>From the top of the skyscraper, you can see the whole city.<,>从摩天大楼顶部可以看到整座城市。<,>sky(天空)+scrape(擦)+er→擦到天空的建筑→摩天大楼<,>scraper(n.刮刀)/landscaper(n.园艺师)/skyline(n.天际线)

corruption<,>/kəˈrʌpʃən/<,>/kəˈrʌpʃən/<,>n.腐败<,>The government launched a campaign against corruption.<,>政府发起了一场反腐败运动。<,>Corruption in the police force undermined public trust.<,>警察队伍中的腐败损害了公众信任。<,>Journalists exposed widespread corruption in the company.<,>记者揭露了该公司普遍存在的腐败现象。<,>cor(完全)+rupt(打破)+ion→完全破坏→腐败<,>eruption(n.爆发)/interruption(n.中断)/disruption(n.破坏)

intolerant<,>/ɪnˈtɒlərənt/<,>/ɪnˈtɑːlərənt/<,>adj.无法容忍的<,>He is intolerant of people who disagree with him.<,>他无法容忍与自己意见相左的人。<,>Many plants are intolerant of extreme cold.<,>许多植物无法忍受极端寒冷。<,>Her intolerant attitude created tension in the office.<,>她不宽容的态度在办公室造成了紧张气氛。<,>in(不)+tolerant(宽容的)→不宽容的<,>tolerant(adj.宽容的)/intolerable(adj.无法忍受的)/tolerance(n.宽容)

pierce<,>/pɪəs/<,>/pɪrs/<,>v.刺穿<,>The needle pierced her finger accidentally.<,>针不小心刺穿了她的手指。<,>Her scream pierced the silence of the night.<,>她的尖叫声划破了夜的寂静。<,>The cold wind pierced through his thin jacket.<,>寒风穿透了他单薄的夹克。<,>pie(馅饼)+rce→像叉子刺穿馅饼→刺穿<,>pier(n.码头)/piece(n.碎片)/fierce(adj.凶猛的)

compensate<,>/ˈkɒmpenseɪt/<,>/ˈkɑːmpenseɪt/<,>v.弥补<,>Nothing can compensate for the loss of a loved one.<,>没有什么能弥补失去亲人的痛苦。<,>The company compensated workers for their overtime.<,>公司补偿了员工的加班时间。<,>His enthusiasm compensates for his lack of experience.<,>他的热情弥补了经验的不足。<,>com(共同)+pens(支付)+ate→一起支付→补偿<,>compensation(n.补偿)/dispense(v.分配)/expense(n.花费)

gap<,>/ɡæp/<,>/ɡæp/<,>n.差距<,>There is a significant gap between rich and poor in this country.<,>这个国家贫富差距显著。<,>Bridging the generation gap requires mutual understanding.<,>弥合代沟需要相互理解。<,>The gap in the fence allowed the dog to escape.<,>篱笆上的缺口让狗逃了出去。<,>g(沟)+ap(分离)→分离的沟→差距<,>gape(v.张开)/gasp(v.喘息)/grab(v.抓取)

worship<,>/ˈwɜːʃɪp/<,>/ˈwɜːrʃɪp/<,>v.崇拜/n.崇拜，喜爱<,>Many people worship in churches on Sundays.<,>许多人周日去教堂做礼拜。<,>Teenagers often worship pop stars.<,>青少年常常崇拜流行歌星。<,>The ancient temple was used for sun worship.<,>这座古庙曾用于太阳崇拜。<,>wor(价值)+ship(状态)→认为有价值→崇拜<,>warship(n.军舰)/workmanship(n.工艺)/friendship(n.友谊)

gallery<,>/ˈɡæləri/<,>/ˈɡæləri/<,>n.美术馆<,>We spent the afternoon at the art gallery.<,>我们在美术馆度过了一个下午。<,>The gallery is hosting an exhibition of modern sculpture.<,>美术馆正在举办现代雕塑展。<,>Her paintings were displayed in the National Gallery.<,>她的画作在国家美术馆展出。<,>gall(走廊)+ery(场所)→有走廊的场所→美术馆<,>gala(n.庆典)/galley(n.厨房)/gully(n.沟渠)
coach<,>/kəʊtʃ/<,>/koʊtʃ/<,>n.教练<,>The football coach trained the team for the championship.<,>足球教练为球队备战冠军赛。<,>She hired a life coach to help with her career.<,>她聘请了一位人生教练来帮助她的职业发展。<,>The coach gave motivational speeches before each game.<,>教练在每场比赛前都会做激励性演讲。<,>联想：car（车）+ coach（教练）→教练车<,>couch(n.长沙发)/coax(v.哄骗)  

cancel<,>/ˈkænsəl/<,>/ˈkænsəl/<,>v.取消<,>They had to cancel the meeting due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，他们不得不取消会议。<,>Please cancel my subscription to the magazine.<,>请取消我的杂志订阅。<,>The flight was canceled at the last minute.<,>航班在最后一刻被取消了。<,>can(能)+cel(停止)→能够停止→取消<,>cancer(n.癌症)/candle(n.蜡烛)  

strike<,>/straɪk/<,>/straɪk/<,>n.罢工<,>The workers went on strike for better pay.<,>工人们为争取更高工资而罢工。<,>The strike paralyzed the city's transportation system.<,>罢工使城市交通系统瘫痪。<,>Teachers threatened to go on strike if their demands weren't met.<,>教师们威胁如果不满足要求就会罢工。<,>str(街道)+ike→工人们在街上抗议→罢工<,>stroke(n.中风/v.抚摸)/strive(v.努力)  

rebellion<,>/rɪˈbeljən/<,>/rɪˈbeljən/<,>n.叛逆<,>Teenage rebellion is a common phase of development.<,>青少年叛逆是成长过程中的常见阶段。<,>The rebellion against the government was quickly suppressed.<,>反对政府的叛乱很快被镇压。<,>His rebellion against school rules got him suspended.<,>他违反校规的行为导致被停学。<,>re(反)+bell(战争)+ion→反叛战争→叛逆<,>religion(n.宗教)/revelation(n.启示)  

distract<,>/dɪˈstrækt/<,>/dɪˈstrækt/<,>v.分心/分散注意<,>The noise distracted me from my work.<,>噪音让我无法专心工作。<,>Don't distract the driver while he's operating the vehicle.<,>司机开车时不要分散他的注意力。<,>She tried to distract the baby with a toy.<,>她试图用玩具转移宝宝的注意力。<,>dis(分开)+tract(拉)→把注意力拉开→分心<,>attract(v.吸引)/extract(v.提取)  

imperative<,>/ɪmˈperətɪv/<,>/ɪmˈperətɪv/<,>adj.必须的/必要的<,>It's imperative that we finish this project on time.<,>我们必须按时完成这个项目。<,>Wearing a seatbelt is imperative for safety.<,>系安全带对安全至关重要。<,>It became imperative to find a solution immediately.<,>必须立即找到解决方案。<,>imper(命令)+ative→必须执行的→必要的<,>imperial(adj.帝国的)/impervious(adj.不受影响的)  

geology<,>/dʒiˈɒlədʒi/<,>/dʒiˈɑːlədʒi/<,>n.地质学<,>He studied geology at university.<,>他在大学学习地质学。<,>The geology of this region shows volcanic activity.<,>该地区的地质显示有火山活动。<,>Geology helps us understand Earth's history.<,>地质学帮助我们了解地球历史。<,>geo(地球)+logy(学科)→研究地球的学科<,>geography(n.地理学)/geometry(n.几何学)  

sway<,>/sweɪ/<,>/sweɪ/<,>v.影响<,>Her speech swayed public opinion.<,>她的演讲影响了公众舆论。<,>The wind made the trees sway gently.<,>风吹得树木轻轻摇摆。<,>He's not easily swayed by others' opinions.<,>他不容易被别人的意见左右。<,>s(蛇)+way(路)→蛇在路上摇摆→影响<,>swear(v.发誓)/sweat(n.汗水)  

costume<,>/ˈkɒstjuːm/<,>/ˈkɑːstuːm/<,>n.服装<,>She wore a beautiful costume to the party.<,>她穿着漂亮的服装参加派对。<,>The actors changed costumes between scenes.<,>演员们在场景之间更换服装。<,>Traditional costumes reflect cultural heritage.<,>传统服装反映文化遗产。<,>cost(花费)+ume→花费制作的服装<,>custom(n.习惯)/cosmos(n.宇宙)  

manual<,>/ˈmænjuəl/<,>/ˈmænjuəl/<,>adj.手工的/体力的<,>Manual labor is becoming less common.<,>体力劳动正变得越来越少见。<,>The car has both automatic and manual transmission.<,>这辆车有自动和手动变速箱。<,>She prefers manual calculation to using a calculator.<,>比起计算器，她更喜欢手工计算。<,>manu(手)+al(的)→手工的<,>manufacture(v.制造)/manuscript(n.手稿)
quantifiable<,>/ˈkwɒntɪfaɪəbl/<,>/ˈkwɑːntɪfaɪəbl/<,>adj.可量化的<,>The benefits of the new policy are not easily quantifiable.<,>新政策的益处不容易量化。<,>We need quantifiable data to support our claims.<,>我们需要可量化的数据来支持我们的主张。<,>Her success is quantifiable in terms of sales figures.<,>她的成功可以通过销售数据来衡量。<,>quant(数量)+ify(使)+able(能够)→能够量化的<,>qualitative(adj. 定性的)/quantitative(adj. 定量的)  

expenditure<,>/ɪkˈspendɪtʃə(r)/<,>/ɪkˈspendɪtʃər/<,>n.费用/n.花销<,>The government plans to reduce public expenditure.<,>政府计划减少公共开支。<,>Our monthly expenditure exceeds our income.<,>我们每月的支出超过了收入。<,>They kept a record of all household expenditures.<,>他们记录了所有的家庭开销。<,>ex(出)+pend(花费)+iture→花费出去→支出<,>expense(n. 费用)/expend(v. 花费)/revenue(n. 收入)  

breed<,>/briːd/<,>/briːd/<,>v.繁殖/v.导致<,>Rabbits breed very quickly.<,>兔子繁殖得非常快。<,>Poverty often breeds crime.<,>贫困常常滋生犯罪。<,>This dog breed originated in Germany.<,>这种犬种起源于德国。<,>breed(养育)→繁殖后代<,>bleed(v. 流血)/bread(n. 面包)/breeder(n. 饲养员)  

emerge<,>/ɪˈmɜːdʒ/<,>/ɪˈmɜːrdʒ/<,>v.出现<,>The sun emerged from behind the clouds.<,>太阳从云层后面露出来了。<,>New evidence has emerged in the case.<,>案件出现了新的证据。<,>She emerged as the winner after a tough competition.<,>经过激烈竞争后，她脱颖而出成为赢家。<,>e(出)+merge(沉没)→从沉没中出来→出现<,>merge(v. 合并)/submerge(v. 淹没)/emergency(n. 紧急情况)  

noted<,>/ˈnəʊtɪd/<,>/ˈnoʊtɪd/<,>adj.著名的<,>She is a noted expert in her field.<,>她是该领域著名的专家。<,>The restaurant is noted for its seafood dishes.<,>这家餐厅以海鲜菜肴闻名。<,>He gave a lecture at a noted university.<,>他在一所著名大学做了讲座。<,>note(注意)+ed→被注意的→著名的<,>notice(v. 注意)/notable(adj. 显著的)/notorious(adj. 臭名昭著的)  

position<,>/pəˈzɪʃn/<,>/pəˈzɪʃən/<,>v.安放/n.位置/n.职位<,>Please position the chair near the window.<,>请把椅子放在窗户旁边。<,>He applied for a managerial position.<,>他申请了一个管理职位。<,>The company is in a strong financial position.<,>公司财务状况良好。<,>pos(放置)+ition→放置的地方→位置<,>disposition(n. 性情)/composition(n. 作文)/opposition(n. 反对)  

extinction<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋkʃn/<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋkʃən/<,>n.灭绝<,>Many species are threatened with extinction.<,>许多物种面临灭绝的威胁。<,>The dodo bird is a well-known example of extinction.<,>渡渡鸟是著名的灭绝物种例子。<,>Conservation efforts aim to prevent extinction.<,>保护工作旨在防止灭绝。<,>ex(出)+stinct(刺)+ion→刺灭→灭绝<,>distinct(adj. 明显的)/instinct(n. 本能)/extinguish(v. 熄灭)
