receptionist<,>/rɪˈsepʃənɪst/<,>/rɪˈsepʃənɪst/<,>n.接待员<,>The receptionist greeted us with a smile.<,>接待员微笑着欢迎我们。<,>She works as a receptionist in a hotel.<,>她在酒店做接待员。<,>The receptionist answered all our questions patiently.<,>接待员耐心地回答了我们所有问题。<,>reception(接待)+ist(人)→接待的人→接待员<,>reception(n. 接待)/recipient(n. 接受者)/conception(n. 概念)  

reckless<,>/ˈrekləs/<,>/ˈrekləs/<,>adj.鲁莽的<,>He was fined for reckless driving.<,>他因鲁莽驾驶被罚款。<,>Don't make reckless decisions without thinking.<,>不要不假思索地做出鲁莽决定。<,>Her reckless behavior put others in danger.<,>她的鲁莽行为使他人陷入危险。<,>reck(顾虑)+less(无)→无所顾虑的→鲁莽的<,>wreck(n. 残骸)/reckon(v. 认为)/feckless(adj. 无能的)  

abuse<,>/əˈbjuːs/<,>/əˈbjuːs/<,>n.虐待/v.滥用<,>Child abuse is a serious crime.<,>虐待儿童是严重的罪行。<,>He was accused of abusing his power.<,>他被指控滥用职权。<,>Drug abuse can lead to health problems.<,>药物滥用会导致健康问题。<,>ab(偏离)+use(使用)→偏离正常使用→滥用<,>accuse(v. 指控)/disuse(n. 废弃)/misuse(v. 误用)
accuse<,>/əˈkjuːz/<,>/əˈkjuz/<,>v.指控<,>He was accused of stealing the money.<,>他被指控偷了钱。<,>She accused him of lying.<,>她指责他说谎。<,>The company was accused of fraud.<,>该公司被指控欺诈。<,>ac(强调)+cuse(原因)→强调原因→指控<,>excuse(n.借口/v.原谅)/abuse(v.滥用/n.虐待)

biochemistry<,>/ˌbaɪəʊˈkemɪstri/<,>/ˌbaɪoʊˈkemɪstri/<,>n.生物化学<,>She is studying biochemistry at university.<,>她在大学学习生物化学。<,>Biochemistry is essential for understanding life processes.<,>生物化学对于理解生命过程至关重要。<,>Advances in biochemistry have led to new medical treatments.<,>生物化学的进步带来了新的医疗方法。<,>bio(生命)+chemistry(化学)→生物化学<,>biology(n.生物学)/biophysics(n.生物物理学)

optimism<,>/ˈɒptɪmɪzəm/<,>/ˈɑːptɪmɪzəm/<,>n.乐观<,>Her optimism helped her through difficult times.<,>她的乐观帮助她度过了困难时期。<,>There is reason for optimism about the future.<,>有理由对未来保持乐观。<,>His optimism was contagious.<,>他的乐观具有感染力。<,>optim(最好)+ism(主义)→认为最好→乐观<,>pessimism(n.悲观)/optimum(n.最佳条件)

predict<,>/prɪˈdɪkt/<,>/prɪˈdɪkt/<,>v.预测<,>The weather forecast predicts rain tomorrow.<,>天气预报预测明天会下雨。<,>It's hard to predict what will happen.<,>很难预测会发生什么。<,>He predicted that the team would win.<,>他预测这个队会赢。<,>pre(前)+dict(说)→提前说→预测<,>prevent(v.预防)/dictate(v.口述)

notoriously<,>/nəʊˈtɔːriəsli/<,>/noʊˈtɔːriəsli/<,>adv.臭名昭著地<,>He is notoriously late for meetings.<,>他开会迟到是出了名的。<,>The area is notoriously dangerous at night.<,>这个地区晚上非常危险。<,>She is notoriously difficult to work with.<,>众所周知，她很难共事。<,>notori(恶名)+ous(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→臭名昭著地<,>famous(adj.著名的)/infamous(adj.声名狼藉的)

board<,>/bɔːd/<,>/bɔːrd/<,>n.董事会<,>She sits on the board of directors.<,>她是董事会成员。<,>The board will meet next week.<,>董事会将于下周开会。<,>He was elected to the board last year.<,>他去年当选为董事会成员。<,>board(木板)→古代在木板上记录决策→董事会<,>bored(adj.无聊的)/aboard(adv.在船上)

pose<,>/pəʊz/<,>/poʊz/<,>v.形成<,>The new law poses a threat to civil liberties.<,>新法律对公民自由构成威胁。<,>The question poses a real challenge.<,>这个问题提出了真正的挑战。<,>He posed for a photograph.<,>他摆好姿势拍照。<,>pos(放置)+e→放置在那里→形成<,>position(n.位置)/oppose(v.反对)

memorandum<,>/ˌmeməˈrændəm/<,>/ˌmeməˈrændəm/<,>n.备忘录<,>He sent a memorandum to all staff.<,>他向所有员工发送了一份备忘录。<,>The memorandum outlined the new policy.<,>备忘录概述了新政策。<,>Please refer to the memorandum for details.<,>详情请参阅备忘录。<,>memor(记忆)+andum(东西)→帮助记忆的东西→备忘录<,>memory(n.记忆)/memorial(n.纪念碑)

puzzling<,>/ˈpʌzlɪŋ/<,>/ˈpʌzlɪŋ/<,>adj.迷惑的，困扰的<,>His behavior is quite puzzling.<,>他的行为相当令人困惑。<,>I find the instructions puzzling.<,>我觉得这些说明令人困惑。<,>It's a puzzling situation.<,>这是一个令人困惑的情况。<,>puzzle(谜)+ing(形容词后缀)→像谜一样的→迷惑的<,>puzzled(adj.困惑的)/baffling(adj.令人困惑的)

reliable<,>/rɪˈlaɪəbl/<,>/rɪˈlaɪəbl/<,>adj.可靠的<,>He is a reliable employee.<,>他是一个可靠的员工。<,>This car is very reliable.<,>这辆车非常可靠。<,>We need reliable information.<,>我们需要可靠的信息。<,>rely(依赖)+able(能够)→可以依赖的→可靠的<,>dependable(adj.可靠的)/unreliable(adj.不可靠的)
replacement<,>/rɪˈpleɪsmənt/<,>/rɪˈpleɪsmənt/<,>n.代替<,>The mechanic suggested a replacement for the broken part.<,>机械师建议更换损坏的零件。<,>She was hired as a replacement for the previous manager.<,>她被聘用来接替前任经理。<,>Finding a suitable replacement took longer than expected.<,>找到合适的替代人选比预期的时间要长。<,>re(重新)+place(放置)+ment(名词后缀)→重新放置→代替<,>displacement(n.位移/n.取代)/supplant(v.取代)/substitute(n.替代品/v.替代)

reinforce<,>/ˌriːɪnˈfɔːs/<,>/ˌriːɪnˈfɔːrs/<,>v.增强/v.强化<,>The teacher used examples to reinforce the lesson.<,>老师用例子来强化课程内容。<,>Extra troops were sent to reinforce the border.<,>增派了部队去加强边境防御。<,>Positive feedback can reinforce good behavior.<,>积极的反馈能强化良好行为。<,>re(再次)+in(进入)+force(力量)→再次加入力量→增强<,>enforce(v.实施)/fortify(v.加强)/intensify(v.加强)

impart<,>/ɪmˈpɑːt/<,>/ɪmˈpɑːrt/<,>v.传授/v.教授<,>It is the teacher's duty to impart knowledge to students.<,>向学生传授知识是教师的职责。<,>The documentary imparts valuable information about wildlife.<,>这部纪录片传授了关于野生动物的宝贵知识。<,>He tried to impart his wisdom to the younger generation.<,>他试图把自己的智慧传授给年轻一代。<,>im(进入)+part(部分)→成为你的一部分→传授<,>impartible(adj.不可分割的)/partition(n.分割)/impartial(adj.公正的)

diversity<,>/daɪˈvɜːsəti/<,>/daɪˈvɜːrsəti/<,>n.多样性<,>The university promotes cultural diversity among its students.<,>该大学促进学生间的文化多样性。<,>Biodiversity is essential for a healthy ecosystem.<,>生物多样性对健康的生态系统至关重要。<,>The team benefits from the diversity of its members' backgrounds.<,>团队受益于成员背景的多样性。<,>di(分开)+vers(转)+ity(名词后缀)→转向不同方向→多样性<,>adversity(n.逆境)/university(n.大学)/divert(v.转移)

occupation<,>/ˌɒkjuˈpeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑːkjuˈpeɪʃn/<,>n.职业<,>Teaching is a rewarding occupation.<,>教书是一个有回报的职业。<,>What is your current occupation?<,>你目前的职业是什么？<,>The building was used for industrial occupations in the past.<,>这栋建筑过去用于工业职业。<,>oc(朝向)+cup(拿)+ation(名词后缀)→拿住某个领域→职业<,>preoccupation(n.全神贯注)/occupancy(n.占用)/occupier(n.占用者)

intense<,>/ɪnˈtens/<,>/ɪnˈtens/<,>adj.激烈的/adj.强烈的<,>The competition was intense, with everyone giving their best.<,>比赛非常激烈，每个人都全力以赴。<,>She felt an intense pain in her shoulder.<,>她感到肩膀一阵剧痛。<,>The movie had an intense emotional impact on the audience.<,>这部电影对观众产生了强烈的情感冲击。<,>in(不)+tense(伸展)→绷紧不放松→强烈的<,>intensive(adj.密集的)/intent(n.意图)/tension(n.紧张)

dramatically<,>/drəˈmætɪkli/<,>/drəˈmætɪkli/<,>adv.大幅度地/adv.戏剧性地<,>Sales have increased dramatically this quarter.<,>本季度销售额大幅增长。<,>The landscape changes dramatically as you climb higher.<,>随着你爬得更高，风景会发生戏剧性变化。<,>Her life improved dramatically after she got the new job.<,>得到新工作后，她的生活有了戏剧性的改善。<,>drama(戏剧)+tic+ally(副词后缀)→像戏剧一样→戏剧性地<,>dramatic(adj.戏剧性的)/traumatic(adj.创伤的)/pragmatic(adj.务实的)

awareness<,>/əˈweənəs/<,>/əˈwernəs/<,>n.意识<,>Public awareness of environmental issues is growing.<,>公众对环境问题的意识正在增强。<,>The campaign aims to raise awareness about mental health.<,>该活动旨在提高人们对心理健康的认识。<,>He has no awareness of how his actions affect others.<,>他没有意识到自己的行为如何影响他人。<,>a(加强)+ware(注意)+ness(名词后缀)→注意的状态→意识<,>beware(v.当心)/unaware(adj.不知道的)/wary(adj.谨慎的)

virtually<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuəli/<,>/ˈvɜːrtʃuəli/<,>adv.几乎<,>The project is virtually complete, with just a few details left.<,>这个项目几乎完成了，只剩下一些细节。<,>Virtually all the students passed the exam.<,>几乎所有的学生都通过了考试。<,>With the new software, the task becomes virtually effortless.<,>有了新软件，这项任务变得几乎不费力气。<,>virtual(虚拟的)+ly(副词后缀)→几乎像虚拟的一样→几乎<,>virtue(n.美德)/virtual(adj.虚拟的)/virtuoso(n.艺术大师)

maturity<,>/məˈtʃʊərəti/<,>/məˈtʃʊrəti/<,>n.成熟<,>The fruit will reach maturity in about two weeks.<,>这些水果大约两周后就会成熟。<,>Emotional maturity is important in relationships.<,>情感成熟在人际关系中很重要。<,>The wine is bottled at peak maturity.<,>这种酒在成熟高峰期装瓶。<,>mat(成熟)+ur(e)+ity(名词后缀)→成熟的状态→成熟<,>immature(adj.不成熟的)/premature(adj.早熟的)/maturate(v.成熟)
rare<,>/reə(r)/<,>/rer/<,>adj.罕见的/adj.稀少的<,>It's rare to see such a beautiful sunset.<,>能看到如此美丽的日落实属罕见。<,>This species of bird is becoming increasingly rare.<,>这种鸟类变得越来越稀少。<,>She has a rare talent for music.<,>她在音乐方面有着罕见的天赋。<,>rare(稀有的)与rear(后部)发音相似<,>scarce(adj.稀少的)/uncommon(adj.不常见的)  

curb<,>/kɜːb/<,>/kɜːrb/<,>v.限制/v.控制<,>The government is trying to curb inflation.<,>政府正试图控制通货膨胀。<,>He needs to curb his temper.<,>他需要控制自己的脾气。<,>New laws were introduced to curb pollution.<,>出台了新法律来限制污染。<,>curb(路边石)→限制在路边<,>restrain(v.抑制)/control(v.控制)/curb与kerb(英式拼写)  

favor<,>/ˈfeɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈfeɪvər/<,>n.恩惠/n.善意的行为<,>Could you do me a favor?<,>你能帮我个忙吗？<,>She asked for a favor in return.<,>她要求回报一个恩惠。<,>He did it as a favor to his friend.<,>他这是为了帮朋友的忙。<,>favor(恩惠)与flavor(味道)发音相似<,>benefit(n.好处)/kindness(n.善意)  

productivity<,>/ˌprɒdʌkˈtɪvəti/<,>/ˌprɑːdʌkˈtɪvəti/<,>n.生产力<,>New technology has improved productivity.<,>新技术提高了生产力。<,>Employee productivity is crucial for the company.<,>员工生产力对公司至关重要。<,>The factory is working at maximum productivity.<,>工厂正在以最大生产力运转。<,>product(产品)+ivity(名词后缀)→生产力<,>efficiency(n.效率)/output(n.产出)  

mechanism<,>/ˈmekənɪzəm/<,>/ˈmekənɪzəm/<,>n.机制<,>The body has natural defense mechanisms.<,>身体有自然的防御机制。<,>We need to understand the mechanism of this machine.<,>我们需要了解这台机器的运作机制。<,>The market has its own adjustment mechanism.<,>市场有其自身的调节机制。<,>mechan(机械)+ism(主义)→机制<,>system(n.系统)/process(n.过程)  

helicopter<,>/ˈhelɪkɒptə(r)/<,>/ˈhelɪkɑːptər/<,>n.直升飞机<,>The helicopter landed on the roof.<,>直升机降落在屋顶上。<,>We took a helicopter tour of the city.<,>我们乘坐直升机游览了城市。<,>The rescue team arrived by helicopter.<,>救援队乘直升机抵达。<,>helico(螺旋)+pter(翅膀)→直升飞机<,>airplane(n.飞机)/aircraft(n.飞行器)  

validity<,>/vəˈlɪdəti/<,>/vəˈlɪdəti/<,>n.有效性/n.真实性<,>The validity of the contract is in question.<,>合同的有效性受到质疑。<,>We need to check the validity of these claims.<,>我们需要核实这些说法的真实性。<,>The passport's validity has expired.<,>护照的有效期已过。<,>valid(有效的)+ity(名词后缀)→有效性<,>authenticity(n.真实性)/legitimacy(n.合法性)  

relevant<,>/ˈreləvənt/<,>/ˈreləvənt/<,>adj.相关的<,>Please provide only relevant information.<,>请只提供相关信息。<,>This evidence is not relevant to the case.<,>这个证据与案件无关。<,>Make sure your skills are relevant to the job.<,>确保你的技能与工作相关。<,>re(再)+lev(举)+ant→再次举起的→相关的<,>related(adj.有关的)/pertinent(adj.切题的)  

miracle<,>/ˈmɪrəkl/<,>/ˈmɪrəkl/<,>n.奇迹<,>It would take a miracle to solve this problem.<,>解决这个问题需要奇迹。<,>The doctors said her recovery was a miracle.<,>医生说她的康复是个奇迹。<,>They prayed for a miracle.<,>他们祈祷奇迹发生。<,>mir(惊奇)+acle(名词后缀)→奇迹<,>wonder(n.奇迹)/marvel(n.奇迹)  

fertilizer<,>/ˈfɜːtəlaɪzə(r)/<,>/ˈfɜːrtəlaɪzər/<,>n.肥料<,>Plants grow better with fertilizer.<,>施肥后植物长得更好。<,>Organic fertilizer is better for the environment.<,>有机肥料对环境更好。<,>The farmer spread fertilizer on the field.<,>农民在田里撒肥料。<,>fertile(肥沃的)+izer(使...化)→肥料<,>manure(n.粪肥)/compost(n.堆肥)
shady<,>/ˈʃeɪdi/<,>/ˈʃeɪdi/<,>adj.阴凉的<,>We found a shady spot under the tree to rest.<,>我们在树下找到一块阴凉的地方休息。<,>He wore a shady hat to protect himself from the sun.<,>他戴了一顶遮阳帽来防晒。<,>The garden is full of shady corners perfect for reading.<,>花园里有许多阴凉的角落，非常适合阅读。<,>shade(阴影)+y(形容词后缀)→阴凉的<,>shadow(n.阴影/v.跟踪)/shaky(adj.摇晃的/adj.不可靠的)

poll<,>/pəʊl/<,>/poʊl/<,>n.民意测验<,>The latest poll shows a decline in the president's approval rating.<,>最新的民意测验显示总统的支持率下降了。<,>They conducted a poll to gather public opinion on the new policy.<,>他们进行了一项民意测验来收集公众对新政策的看法。<,>According to the poll, most people support the environmental initiative.<,>根据民意测验，大多数人支持这项环保倡议。<,>pol(政治)+l→与政治相关的调查→民意测验<,>pole(n.柱子/n.极地)/pool(n.水池/v.集中)

countermeasure<,>/ˈkaʊntəmeʒə(r)/<,>/ˈkaʊntərmeʒər/<,>n.对策<,>The government is developing countermeasures against cyber attacks.<,>政府正在制定针对网络攻击的对策。<,>Effective countermeasures have reduced the impact of the disease.<,>有效的对策减少了疾病的影响。<,>They implemented several countermeasures to prevent data breaches.<,>他们实施了几项对策以防止数据泄露。<,>counter(对抗)+measure(措施)→对策<,>counterpart(n.对应的人或物)/counteract(v.抵消/v.中和)

worldly<,>/ˈwɜːldli/<,>/ˈwɜːrldli/<,>adj.世间的/adj.尘世的<,>He has a worldly attitude and enjoys traveling.<,>他有一种世俗的态度，喜欢旅行。<,>She gave up her worldly possessions to live a simple life.<,>她放弃了尘世的财产，过上了简单的生活。<,>His wisdom comes from years of worldly experience.<,>他的智慧来自于多年的世俗经验。<,>world(世界)+ly(形容词后缀)→世间的<,>wordly(拼写错误)/worldwide(adj.全球的)

legislator<,>/ˈledʒɪsleɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈledʒɪsleɪtər/<,>n.立法者<,>The legislators debated the new bill for hours.<,>立法者们就新法案辩论了几个小时。<,>She is a respected legislator known for her integrity.<,>她是一位受人尊敬的立法者，以正直著称。<,>The legislator proposed a law to protect endangered species.<,>这位立法者提出了一项保护濒危物种的法律。<,>legis(法律)+lator(人)→立法者<,>legislation(n.立法)/legitimate(adj.合法的)

campaign<,>/kæmˈpeɪn/<,>/kæmˈpeɪn/<,>n.活动<,>The charity launched a campaign to raise funds for the homeless.<,>慈善机构发起了一项为无家可归者筹款的活动。<,>He is running a campaign to promote environmental awareness.<,>他正在开展一项提高环保意识的活动。<,>The advertising campaign was a huge success.<,>这次广告活动取得了巨大的成功。<,>camp(田野)+aign→原指军事活动，现泛指各种活动<,>champagne(n.香槟)/companion(n.同伴)

odds<,>/ɒdz/<,>/ɑːdz/<,>n.可能性<,>The odds of winning the lottery are very low.<,>中彩票的可能性非常低。<,>Despite the odds, she succeeded in her business venture.<,>尽管可能性不大，她的商业冒险还是成功了。<,>What are the odds that it will rain tomorrow?<,>明天下雨的可能性有多大？<,>odd(奇怪的)+s→奇怪的事情发生的可能性<,>odds(n.差异)/odds(n.赌注)

shepherd<,>/ˈʃepəd/<,>/ˈʃepərd/<,>v.引导/v.带领<,>The teacher shepherded the students through the museum.<,>老师带领学生们参观博物馆。<,>He shepherded the project to completion despite many challenges.<,>尽管面临许多挑战，他还是引导项目完成了。<,>The guide shepherded the tourists safely through the forest.<,>导游带领游客安全地穿过森林。<,>sheep(羊)+herd(放牧人)→牧羊人→引导<,>sheepdog(n.牧羊犬)/sheepish(adj.羞怯的)

schedule<,>/ˈʃedjuːl/<,>/ˈskedʒuːl/<,>n.计划表<,>Please check the schedule for the meeting time.<,>请查看计划表以确定会议时间。<,>Her busy schedule leaves little time for relaxation.<,>她繁忙的计划表几乎没有时间放松。<,>The train schedule has been changed due to maintenance work.<,>由于维修工作，火车时刻表已经更改。<,>sched(纸)+ule→写在纸上的计划→计划表<,>scheme(n.计划/v.策划)/school(n.学校)

access<,>/ˈækses/<,>/ˈækses/<,>v.取得/v.获取<,>Students can access the library resources online.<,>学生可以在线获取图书馆资源。<,>She was granted access to the confidential files.<,>她被允许获取机密文件。<,>The new software makes it easier to access information.<,>新软件使获取信息更加容易。<,>ac(强调)+cess(走)→走过去→获取<,>assess(v.评估)/excess(n.过量)
owl<,>/aʊl/<,>/aʊl/<,>n.猫头鹰<,>The owl hooted in the night.<,>猫头鹰在夜晚鸣叫。<,>Owls are known for their excellent night vision.<,>猫头鹰以出色的夜视能力闻名。<,>She has a collection of owl figurines.<,>她收集了许多猫头鹰小雕像。<,>发音类似“嗷呜”→猫头鹰的叫声<,>fowl(n.家禽)/howl(v.嚎叫)

interpret<,>/ɪnˈtɜːprɪt/<,>/ɪnˈtɜːrprɪt/<,>v.口译/v.解释<,>Can you interpret this passage for me?<,>你能帮我解释一下这段话吗？<,>She interpreted the speech from English to Chinese.<,>她把演讲从英语口译成中文。<,>Different people may interpret the law differently.<,>不同的人对法律可能有不同的解释。<,>inter(在...之间)+pret(表达)→在中间表达→口译<,>interrupt(v.打断)/intercept(v.拦截)

intervention<,>/ˌɪntəˈvenʃn/<,>/ˌɪntərˈvenʃn/<,>n.干涉<,>Military intervention is sometimes necessary.<,>军事干预有时是必要的。<,>The teacher's intervention stopped the fight.<,>老师的干预制止了打架。<,>They called for UN intervention in the crisis.<,>他们呼吁联合国干预这场危机。<,>inter(在...之间)+vent(来)+ion→来到中间→干涉<,>invention(n.发明)/convention(n.惯例)

bemoan<,>/bɪˈməʊn/<,>/bɪˈmoʊn/<,>v.抱怨/v.惋惜<,>He bemoaned his bad luck.<,>他抱怨自己运气不好。<,>The fans bemoaned the team's loss.<,>球迷们为球队的失利感到惋惜。<,>She bemoaned the lack of funding for education.<,>她对教育资金不足表示惋惜。<,>be(使)+moan(呻吟)→使呻吟→抱怨<,>bewail(v.哀悼)/lament(v.哀叹)

determine<,>/dɪˈtɜːmɪn/<,>/dɪˈtɜːrmɪn/<,>v.决定<,>Genes determine our eye color.<,>基因决定我们的眼睛颜色。<,>We need to determine the cause of the problem.<,>我们需要确定问题的原因。<,>The judge will determine the sentence tomorrow.<,>法官明天将作出判决。<,>de(加强)+term(界限)+ine→划清界限→决定<,>terminate(v.终止)/exterminate(v.消灭)

incur<,>/ɪnˈkɜː(r)/<,>/ɪnˈkɜːr/<,>v.引起/v.导致<,>He incurred heavy losses in the stock market.<,>他在股市中遭受了重大损失。<,>Speeding may incur a fine.<,>超速可能会导致罚款。<,>The project incurred unexpected expenses.<,>这个项目产生了意外开支。<,>in(进入)+cur(跑)→跑进去→招致<,>occur(v.发生)/recur(v.复发)

literal<,>/ˈlɪtərəl/<,>/ˈlɪtərəl/<,>adj.字面的<,>This is the literal meaning of the word.<,>这是这个词的字面意思。<,>He took her remark in a literal sense.<,>他从字面上理解了她的话。<,>The translation is too literal and sounds unnatural.<,>这个翻译太字面化了，听起来不自然。<,>liter(文字)+al→文字的→字面的<,>literary(adj.文学的)/literate(adj.有文化的)

proposition<,>/ˌprɒpəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌprɑːpəˈzɪʃn/<,>n.提议/n.主题<,>He made an interesting business proposition.<,>他提出了一个有趣的商业提议。<,>The proposition was rejected by the committee.<,>这个提议被委员会否决了。<,>This is the central proposition of his theory.<,>这是他理论的核心主题。<,>pro(向前)+posit(放置)+ion→向前放置→提议<,>proposal(n.建议)/position(n.位置)

feasibility<,>/ˌfiːzəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌfiːzəˈbɪləti/<,>n.可行<,>We need to study the feasibility of the plan.<,>我们需要研究这个计划的可行性。<,>The feasibility report will be ready next week.<,>可行性报告下周就能完成。<,>They questioned the feasibility of the project.<,>他们对这个项目的可行性提出了质疑。<,>feas(做)+ibility(能力)→能够做→可行性<,>possibility(n.可能性)/flexibility(n.灵活性)

destructive<,>/dɪˈstrʌktɪv/<,>/dɪˈstrʌktɪv/<,>adj.破坏性的/adj.毁灭性的<,>The hurricane was highly destructive.<,>飓风极具破坏性。<,>Smoking has destructive effects on health.<,>吸烟对健康有毁灭性影响。<,>Their criticism was constructive, not destructive.<,>他们的批评是建设性的，不是破坏性的。<,>de(向下)+struct(建造)+ive→把建造的东西向下推→破坏性的<,>constructive(adj.建设性的)/instructive(adj.有教育意义的)
denationalize<,>/diːˈnæʃənəlaɪz/<,>/diːˈnæʃənəˌlaɪz/<,>v.使非国有化<,>The government decided to denationalize the railway system.<,>政府决定对铁路系统实行非国有化。<,>Many industries were denationalized in the 1980s.<,>许多行业在20世纪80年代被非国有化。<,>Denationalizing public services can lead to increased efficiency.<,>公共服务非国有化可以提高效率。<,>de(去除)+national(国家的)+ize(使...化)→使非国有化<,>nationalize(v. 国有化)/denature(v. 使变性)/denote(v. 表示)

resort<,>/rɪˈzɔːt/<,>/rɪˈzɔːrt/<,>n.度假胜地<,>We're going to a beach resort for our vacation.<,>我们要去一个海滨度假胜地度假。<,>This mountain resort is popular with skiers.<,>这个山区度假胜地很受滑雪者欢迎。<,>The island has become a luxury resort for the rich.<,>这个岛屿已成为富人的豪华度假胜地。<,>re(再次)+sort(种类)→再次去的地方→度假胜地<,>retort(n. 反驳/v.回嘴)/resound(v. 回响)/resource(n. 资源)

engage<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ/<,>v.忙于，从事/雇佣<,>She engages in volunteer work on weekends.<,>她周末从事志愿者工作。<,>The company engaged a new marketing director.<,>公司雇佣了一位新的市场总监。<,>He was engaged in conversation and didn't notice the time.<,>他忙于谈话，没注意到时间。<,>en(使)+gage(抵押)→使抵押→忙于(古义引申)<,>enrage(v. 激怒)/engrave(v. 雕刻)/gage(n. 抵押品)

disarm<,>/dɪsˈɑːm/<,>/dɪsˈɑːrm/<,>v.解除/消除<,>The soldiers were ordered to disarm the enemy.<,>士兵们受命解除敌人的武装。<,>Her smile disarmed his anger.<,>她的微笑化解了他的怒气。<,>International treaties aim to disarm nuclear weapons.<,>国际条约旨在解除核武器。<,>dis(去除)+arm(武器)→解除武装<,>alarm(n. 警报)/rearm(v. 重新武装)/armada(n. 舰队)

approximately<,>/əˈprɒksɪmətli/<,>/əˈprɑːksɪmətli/<,>adv.大约<,>The trip will take approximately three hours.<,>这次旅行大约需要三个小时。<<,>Approximately 50 people attended the meeting.<,>大约有50人参加了会议。<,>The cost is approximately $100 per person.<,>费用大约是每人100美元。<,>approximate(近似的)+ly(副词后缀)→大约地<,>proximate(adj. 最近的)/approbation(n. 认可)/appropriate(adj. 适当的)

cover<,>/ˈkʌvə(r)/<,>/ˈkʌvər/<,>v.遮盖/遮蔽<,>She covered the baby with a blanket.<,>她用毯子盖住了婴儿。<,>Clouds covered the sun during the eclipse.<,>日食期间云层遮住了太阳。<,>The report covers all aspects of the issue.<,>这份报告涵盖了问题的各个方面。<,>co(完全)+ver(盖)→完全盖住→遮盖<,>hover(v. 盘旋)/clover(n. 三叶草)/covert(adj. 隐蔽的)

validation<,>/ˌvælɪˈdeɪʃn/<,>/ˌvælɪˈdeɪʃn/<,>n.证实<,>The experiment needs scientific validation.<,>这个实验需要科学验证。<,>Her success was a validation of her hard work.<,>她的成功证明了她努力的价值。<,>The document requires official validation.<,>这份文件需要官方认证。<,>valid(有效的)+ation(名词后缀)→证实<,>valuation(n. 估价)/invalid(adj. 无效的)/validity(n. 有效性)

widespread<,>/ˈwaɪdspred/<,>/ˈwaɪdspred/<,>adj.广泛传播的<,>There is widespread support for the new policy.<,>新政策得到了广泛支持。<,>The disease became widespread in the region.<,>这种疾病在该地区广泛传播。<,>Widespread use of smartphones has changed communication.<,>智能手机的广泛使用改变了通讯方式。<,>wide(宽的)+spread(传播)→广泛传播的<,>widespreaded(错误拼写)/wide-ranging(adj. 范围广泛的)/widen(v. 加宽)

unethical<,>/ʌnˈeθɪkl/<,>/ʌnˈeθɪkəl/<,>adj.不道德的<,>It's unethical to plagiarize someone else's work.<,>抄袭他人作品是不道德的。<,>The company was accused of unethical business practices.<,>该公司被指控有不道德的商业行为。<,>Animal testing is considered unethical by many.<,>许多人认为动物实验是不道德的。<,>un(不)+ethical(道德的)→不道德的<,>unethic(错误拼写)/ethical(adj. 道德的)/ethic(n. 伦理)

withdraw<,>/wɪðˈdrɔː/<,>/wɪðˈdrɔː/<,>v.撤销/撤退<,>He decided to withdraw his application.<,>他决定撤销申请。<,>The troops were ordered to withdraw from the border.<,>军队被命令从边境撤退。<,>You can withdraw cash from this ATM.<,>你可以从这个ATM机取现金。<,>with(向后)+draw(拉)→向后拉→撤退<,>withdrawal(n. 撤退)/withhold(v. 扣留)/withstand(v. 抵抗)
relay<,>/ˈriːleɪ/<,>/ˈriːleɪ/<,>v.接替/v.转播<,>He will relay the message to the team.<,>他会把消息转达给团队。<,>The radio station will relay the live concert.<,>电台将转播这场现场音乐会。<,>She relayed the baton smoothly in the race.<,>她在比赛中顺利交接了接力棒。<,>re(重新)+lay(放置)→重新放置→转播<,>delay(v.延迟/n.耽搁)/repay(v.偿还/v.报答)  

fluently<,>/ˈfluːəntli/<,>/ˈfluːəntli/<,>adv.流利地<,>She speaks French fluently.<,>她法语说得很流利。<,>He can write English fluently after years of practice.<,>经过多年练习，他能流利地书写英语。<,>The interpreter translated the speech fluently.<,>译员流利地翻译了演讲。<,>flu(流动)+ent(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→流动般地→流利地<,>frequent(adj.频繁的/v.常去)/fluency(n.流利)  

mysteriously<,>/mɪˈstɪəriəsli/<,>/mɪˈstɪriəsli/<,>adv.神秘地<,>The stranger smiled mysteriously and left.<,>那个陌生人神秘地笑了笑就离开了。<,>The ancient artifact disappeared mysteriously.<,>这件古代文物神秘消失了。<,>Mysteriously, the lights went out by themselves.<,>神秘的是，灯自己熄灭了。<,>mystery(神秘)+ious(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→神秘地<,>seriously(adv.严肃地)/curiously(adv.好奇地)  

hinder<,>/ˈhɪndə(r)/<,>/ˈhɪndər/<,>v.阻碍<,>Bad weather may hinder the rescue operation.<,>恶劣天气可能阻碍救援行动。<,>Lack of funding hindered the research progress.<,>资金不足阻碍了研究进展。<,>His injury didn't hinder him from winning the game.<,>他的伤没有阻碍他赢得比赛。<,>hind(后面)+er(表动作)→拖在后面→阻碍<,>hind(adj.后面的)/hint(n.暗示/v.暗示)  

session<,>/ˈseʃn/<,>/ˈseʃən/<,>n.会议/n.学年<,>The conference has three sessions today.<,>今天会议有三场。<,>The summer session begins in July.<,>夏季学期七月开始。<,>She attended a therapy session yesterday.<,>她昨天参加了一次治疗会。<,>sess(坐)+ion(名词后缀)→坐着讨论→会议<,>season(n.季节)/cession(n.割让)  

postdoctoral<,>/ˌpəʊstˈdɒktərəl/<,>/ˌpoʊstˈdɑːktərəl/<,>adj.博士后的<,>He got a postdoctoral position at Harvard.<,>他在哈佛获得了博士后职位。<,>Postdoctoral research usually lasts 2-3 years.<,>博士后研究通常持续2-3年。<,>She published several papers during her postdoctoral studies.<,>她在博士后期间发表了几篇论文。<,>post(后)+doctoral(博士的)→博士后的<,>doctoral(adj.博士的)/postgraduate(adj.研究生的)  

prioritize<,>/praɪˈɒrətaɪz/<,>/praɪˈɔːrətaɪz/<,>v.优先<,>We need to prioritize safety in this project.<,>在这个项目中我们需要优先考虑安全。<,>The government will prioritize education funding.<,>政府将优先考虑教育资金。<,>Learn to prioritize your tasks effectively.<,>学会有效地优先处理你的任务。<,>prior(优先的)+itize(动词后缀)→使优先<,>priority(n.优先权)/privatize(v.私有化)  

bipartisan<,>/ˌbaɪˈpɑːtɪzæn/<,>/ˌbaɪˈpɑːrtɪzən/<,>adj.两党的<,>The bill received bipartisan support.<,>该法案获得了两党支持。<,>They formed a bipartisan committee to address the issue.<,>他们成立了两党委员会来解决这个问题。<,>Bipartisan cooperation is rare in recent years.<,>近年来两党合作很罕见。<,>bi(双)+partisan(党派的)→两党的<,>partisan(n.党派成员)/bilateral(adj.双边的)  

reluctance<,>/rɪˈlʌktəns/<,>/rɪˈlʌktəns/<,>n.勉强/n.不情愿<,>He showed great reluctance to attend the meeting.<,>他非常不情愿参加会议。<,>Her reluctance to speak made the situation awkward.<,>她不愿开口让情况变得尴尬。<,>They signed the contract with obvious reluctance.<,>他们明显不情愿地签了合同。<,>re(反)+luct(斗争)+ance(名词后缀)→反抗状态→不情愿<,>reluctant(adj.不情愿的)/resultant(adj.作为结果的)  

intuitive<,>/ɪnˈtjuːɪtɪv/<,>/ɪnˈtuːɪtɪv/<,>adj.直觉的<,>She has an intuitive understanding of people's feelings.<,>她对人们的感受有直觉的理解。<<,>The software has an intuitive interface.<,>这个软件有直观的界面。<,>His decision was based on intuitive judgment.<,>他的决定基于直觉判断。<,>in(内)+tuit(看)+ive(形容词后缀)→内心看到的→直觉的<,>intuition(n.直觉)/instructive(adj.有教育意义的)
quote<,>/kwəʊt/<,>/kwoʊt/<,>v.引用<,>He quoted a famous line from Shakespeare in his speech.<,>他在演讲中引用了莎士比亚的一句名言。<,>She always quotes her favorite author when giving advice.<,>她给别人建议时总是引用她最喜欢的作家的话。<,>The article quotes several experts on climate change.<,>这篇文章引用了多位气候变化专家的观点。<,>quot(数目)+e→引用时要注明出处编号<,>quota(n. 配额)/quaint(adj. 古雅的)/quiver(v. 颤抖)

pragmatic<,>/præɡˈmætɪk/<,>/præɡˈmætɪk/<,>adj.务实的/adj.讲求实际的<,>We need a pragmatic approach to solve this problem.<,>我们需要一个务实的方法来解决这个问题。<,>His pragmatic attitude helped the company survive the crisis.<,>他务实的态度帮助公司度过了危机。<,>She is known for her pragmatic decision-making style.<,>她以务实的决策风格而闻名。<,>pragm(行动)+atic→注重实际行动的<,>dogmatic(adj. 教条的)/dramatic(adj. 戏剧性的)/pragmatism(n. 实用主义)

alleviate<,>/əˈliːvieɪt/<,>/əˈliːvieɪt/<,>v.减轻/v.缓解<,>The medicine helped to alleviate her pain.<,>这种药有助于缓解她的疼痛。<,>We need to find ways to alleviate poverty in this region.<,>我们需要找到减轻这个地区贫困的方法。<,>His kind words alleviated my anxiety.<,>他善意的话语缓解了我的焦虑。<,>al(加强)+lev(轻)+iate→使变轻→减轻<,>elevate(v. 提升)/levitate(v. 飘浮)/allegiance(n. 忠诚)

underlying<,>/ˌʌndəˈlaɪɪŋ/<,>/ˌʌndərˈlaɪɪŋ/<,>adj.潜在的/adj.基础的<,>The underlying cause of the problem was poor communication.<,>这个问题的根本原因是沟通不畅。<,>There are underlying tensions between the two departments.<,>这两个部门之间存在潜在矛盾。<,>The report examines the underlying principles of the theory.<,>这份报告研究了该理论的基本原理。<,>under(在...下)+lying(躺着的)→在下面躺着的→潜在的<,>underline(v. 强调)/undertaking(n. 事业)/underestimate(v. 低估)

generate<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪt/<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪt/<,>v.产生<,>The wind turbines generate electricity for the whole town.<,>这些风力涡轮机为整个城镇发电。<,>His comments generated a lot of controversy.<,>他的评论引发了很多争议。<,>The meeting generated many creative ideas.<,>这次会议产生了许多创意想法。<,>gener(产生)+ate(使)→使产生<,>general(adj. 一般的)/degenerate(v. 退化)/regenerate(v. 再生)

dysfunction<,>/dɪsˈfʌŋkʃn/<,>/dɪsˈfʌŋkʃn/<,>n.失常<,>Family dysfunction can affect children's development.<,>家庭功能失调会影响孩子的成长。<,>The team's poor performance was due to organizational dysfunction.<,>团队表现不佳是由于组织功能失调。<,>He specializes in treating sexual dysfunction.<,>他专门治疗性功能障碍。<,>dys(不良)+function(功能)→功能不良<,>function(n. 功能)/malfunction(n. 故障)/disjunction(n. 分离)

invasive<,>/ɪnˈveɪsɪv/<,>/ɪnˈveɪsɪv/<,>adj.入侵的<,>Invasive species can threaten local ecosystems.<,>入侵物种可能威胁当地生态系统。<,>The surgery requires invasive procedures.<,>这个手术需要侵入性操作。<,>She felt his questions were too invasive.<,>她觉得他的问题太过侵犯隐私。<,>in(进入)+vas(走)+ive→走进来的→入侵的<,>evasive(adj. 逃避的)/pervasive(adj. 普遍的)/persuasive(adj. 有说服力的)

ignore<,>/ɪɡˈnɔː(r)/<,>/ɪɡˈnɔːr/<,>v.忽视<,>He chose to ignore the rude comments.<,>他选择无视那些粗鲁的评论。<,>You can't ignore the warning signs of illness.<,>你不能忽视疾病的警告信号。<,>The teacher ignored the student's raised hand.<,>老师忽视了那个学生举起的手。<,>i(不)+gnor(知道)+e→装作不知道→忽视<,>ignorant(adj. 无知的)/ignorance(n. 无知)/neglect(v. 疏忽)

specific<,>/spəˈsɪfɪk/<,>/spəˈsɪfɪk/<,>adj.具体的<,>Please give me specific instructions for this task.<,>请给我这项任务的具体指示。<,>There is no specific treatment for this condition.<,>这种情况没有具体的治疗方法。<,>She asked for specific examples to illustrate the point.<,>她要求具体的例子来说明这一点。<,>speci(种类)+fic(做)→做出种类的→具体的<,>special(adj. 特别的)/specimen(n. 标本)/specify(v. 详细说明)

elegant<,>/ˈelɪɡənt/<,>/ˈelɪɡənt/<,>adj.高雅的/adj.雅致的<,>She wore an elegant black dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件优雅的黑色连衣裙参加派对。<,>The hotel lobby has an elegant design.<,>酒店大堂设计雅致。<,>His solution to the problem was simple yet elegant.<,>他解决问题的方法简单而优雅。<,>e(出)+leg(选)+ant→精挑细选出来的→优雅的<,>elephant(n. 大象)/eloquent(adj. 雄辩的)/elevate(v. 提升)
capital<,>/ˈkæpɪtl/<,>/ˈkæpɪtl/<,>adj.资金的/adj.资本的<,>We need more capital to expand our business.<,>我们需要更多资金来扩展业务。<,>London is the financial capital of the UK.<,>伦敦是英国的金融中心。<,>He made a capital investment in the startup.<,>他对这家初创公司进行了资本投资。<,>cap(头)+ital→像头一样重要→资本<,>capitol(n.国会大厦)/captain(n.船长)

indicate<,>/ˈɪndɪkeɪt/<,>/ˈɪndɪˌkeɪt/<,>v.表明<,>The survey indicates a shift in public opinion.<,>调查表明公众意见有所转变。<,>His tone indicated that he was not pleased.<,>他的语气表明他不高兴。<,>The sign indicates the direction to the hospital.<,>标志指示了去医院的方向。<,>in(内)+dic(说)+ate→内部说出→表明<,>dedicate(v.奉献)/predicate(n.谓语)

eligible<,>/ˈelɪdʒəbl/<,>/ˈelɪdʒəbəl/<,>adj.适合的/adj.胜任的<,>Only eligible candidates will be considered.<,>只有符合条件的候选人会被考虑。<,>She is eligible for a promotion this year.<,>她今年有资格晋升。<,>This coupon is eligible for all items in the store.<,>这张优惠券适用于店内所有商品。<,>e(出)+lig(选择)+ible→能被选出的→合格的<,>illegible(adj.难辨认的)/intelligible(adj.可理解的)

procedure<,>/prəˈsiːdʒə(r)/<,>/prəˈsidʒər/<,>n.程序<,>Please follow the correct procedure when applying.<,>申请时请遵循正确的程序。<,>The surgical procedure took three hours.<,>这个外科手术程序花了三个小时。<,>There's a standard procedure for handling complaints.<,>处理投诉有标准程序。<,>pro(向前)+ced(走)+ure→向前走的过程→程序<,>process(n.过程)/proceed(v.继续进行)

unrealistic<,>/ˌʌnrɪəˈlɪstɪk/<,>/ˌʌnriəˈlɪstɪk/<,>adj.不现实的<,>It's unrealistic to expect perfection.<,>期待完美是不现实的。<,>His plan sounds exciting but unrealistic.<,>他的计划听起来激动人心但不现实。<,>The movie portrays an unrealistic view of high school life.<,>这部电影描绘了不现实的高中生活。<,>un(不)+realistic(现实的)→不现实的<,>idealistic(adj.理想主义的)/realistic(adj.现实的)

occur<,>/əˈkɜː(r)/<,>/əˈkɜr/<,>v.发生<,>When did the accident occur?<,>事故是什么时候发生的？<,>It never occurred to me that she might be lying.<,>我从未想过她可能在撒谎。<,>Mistakes are bound to occur in such a complex process.<,>在如此复杂的过程中难免会发生错误。<,>oc(朝向)+cur(跑)→跑向→发生<,>recur(v.复发)/concur(v.同意)

aggravate<,>/ˈæɡrəveɪt/<,>/ˈæɡrəˌveɪt/<,>v.加重/v.加剧<,>His comments only aggravated the situation.<,>他的评论只会使情况恶化。<,>Smoking aggravates respiratory problems.<,>吸烟会加重呼吸问题。<,>The noise aggravated her headache.<,>噪音加剧了她的头痛。<,>ag(加强)+grav(重)+ate→使更重→加重<,>aggregate(v.聚集)/mitigate(v.减轻)

frankly<,>/ˈfræŋkli/<,>/ˈfræŋkli/<,>adv.坦率地<,>Frankly, I don't think this plan will work.<,>坦率地说，我认为这个计划行不通。<,>She spoke frankly about her concerns.<,>她坦率地谈到了她的担忧。<,>To put it frankly, your performance was disappointing.<,>坦率地说，你的表现令人失望。<,>frank(坦白的)+ly(副词后缀)→坦率地<,>blankly(adv.茫然地)/frenzy(n.狂热)

thrilling<,>/ˈθrɪlɪŋ/<,>/ˈθrɪlɪŋ/<,>adj.令人兴奋的<,>The roller coaster ride was thrilling.<,>坐过山车令人兴奋。<,>It was a thrilling moment when they announced the winner.<,>当他们宣布获胜者时，那是一个令人兴奋的时刻。<,>The book provides a thrilling adventure story.<,>这本书提供了一个令人兴奋的冒险故事。<,>thrill(激动)+ing→令人激动的<,>chilling(adj.寒冷的)/filling(n.填充物)

irreversible<,>/ˌɪrɪˈvɜːsəbl/<,>/ˌɪrɪˈvɜrsəbəl/<,>adj.不可逆的/adj.不可取消的<,>The decision is irreversible.<,>这个决定是不可撤销的。<,>Climate change may cause irreversible damage.<,>气候变化可能造成不可逆转的损害。<,>Some medications can have irreversible side effects.<,>有些药物可能有不可逆的副作用。<,>ir(不)+re(反)+vers(转)+ible→不能反转的→不可逆的<,>reversible(adj.可逆的)/invisible(adj.看不见的)
marine<,>/məˈriːn/<,>/məˈrin/<,>adj.海洋的<,>Marine life is diverse and beautiful.<,>海洋生物多样而美丽。<,>He studies marine biology at university.<,>他在大学学习海洋生物学。<,>The marine ecosystem is fragile and needs protection.<,>海洋生态系统脆弱，需要保护。<,>mar(海)+ine(形容词后缀)→海洋的<,>maritime(adj. 海上的)/submarine(n. 潜水艇)  

interracial<,>/ˌɪntəˈreɪʃəl/<,>/ˌɪntərˈreɪʃəl/<,>adj.种族间的<,>Interracial marriages are becoming more common.<,>跨种族婚姻变得越来越普遍。<,>The school promotes interracial understanding.<,>这所学校促进种族间的理解。<,>Interracial friendships can break down stereotypes.<,>跨种族的友谊可以打破刻板印象。<,>inter(在...之间)+racial(种族的)→种族间的<,>intracial(adj. 种族内的)/international(adj. 国际的)  

grave<,>/ɡreɪv/<,>/ɡreɪv/<,>adj.严重的<,>The situation is grave and requires immediate action.<,>情况严重，需要立即采取行动。<,>He made a grave mistake that cost him his job.<,>他犯了一个严重的错误，导致他失去了工作。<,>The doctor's expression was grave when he delivered the news.<,>医生传达消息时表情严肃。<,>grave(n. 坟墓)→像坟墓一样沉重→严重的<,>brave(adj. 勇敢的)/gravel(n. 砾石)  

undocumented<,>/ʌnˈdɒkjʊmentɪd/<,>/ʌnˈdɑːkjʊmentɪd/<,>adj.无证明的<,>Undocumented workers often face exploitation.<,>无证工人经常面临剥削。<,>The software has undocumented features.<,>这个软件有一些未记录的功能。<,>He entered the country undocumented.<,>他是无证入境这个国家的。<,>un(否定)+documented(有证明的)→无证明的<,>documented(adj. 有证明的)/unregistered(adj. 未注册的)  

appoint<,>/əˈpɔɪnt/<,>/əˈpɔɪnt/<,>v.任命<,>The board will appoint a new CEO next month.<,>董事会将在下个月任命一位新的首席执行官。<,>She was appointed as the head of the department.<,>她被任命为部门主管。<,>They appointed a committee to investigate the matter.<,>他们任命了一个委员会来调查此事。<,>ap(加强)+point(点)→指定某一点→任命<,>disappoint(v. 使失望)/anoint(v. 涂油)  

rhetorical<,>/rɪˈtɒrɪkəl/<,>/rɪˈtɔːrɪkəl/<,>adj.修辞的<,>His speech was full of rhetorical questions.<,>他的演讲充满了反问句。<,>She used rhetorical devices to persuade the audience.<,>她使用修辞手法来说服听众。<,>The politician's rhetorical skills are impressive.<,>这位政治家的修辞技巧令人印象深刻。<,>rhetor(演说家)+ical(形容词后缀)→修辞的<,>theoretical(adj. 理论的)/historical(adj. 历史的)  

momentum<,>/məˈmentəm/<,>/moʊˈmentəm/<,>n.动力，势头<,>The team gained momentum in the second half.<,>球队在下半场势头渐起。<,>The movement is building momentum.<,>这场运动正在积聚动力。<,>It's important to maintain momentum in your studies.<,>保持学习势头很重要。<,>moment(瞬间)+um→瞬间的力量→动力<,>momentous(adj. 重大的)/momentary(adj. 瞬间的)  

deserve<,>/dɪˈzɜːv/<,>/dɪˈzɜːrv/<,>v.值得<,>You deserve a break after all your hard work.<,>你努力工作后值得休息一下。<,>She deserves recognition for her achievements.<,>她的成就值得认可。<,>The punishment he received was more than he deserved.<,>他受到的惩罚超出了他应得的。<,>de(加强)+serve(服务)→值得服务→值得<,>reserve(v. 保留)/preserve(v. 保存)  

drastically<,>/ˈdræstɪkli/<,>/ˈdræstɪkli/<,>adv.激烈地，猛烈地<,>Prices have increased drastically this year.<,>今年价格急剧上涨。<,>Her health improved drastically after the treatment.<,>治疗后她的健康状况大幅改善。<,>We need to drastically reduce our expenses.<,>我们需要大幅削减开支。<,>drastic(激烈的)+ally(副词后缀)→激烈地<,>dramatically(adv. 戏剧性地)/fantastically(adv. 极好地)  

particle<,>/ˈpɑːtɪkl/<,>/ˈpɑːrtɪkl/<,>n.粒子，微粒<,>Dust particles floated in the sunlight.<,>尘埃微粒在阳光中漂浮。<,>A particle of sand got into my eye.<,>一粒沙子进了我的眼睛。<,>Scientists study subatomic particles.<,>科学家研究亚原子粒子。<,>part(部分)+icle(小)→小部分→粒子<,>particle(n. 粒子)/particular(adj. 特定的)
miniature<,>/ˈmɪnɪtʃə(r)/<,>/ˈmɪnɪtʃər/<,>adj.微型的<,>She collects miniature dolls from around the world.<,>她收集来自世界各地的微型玩偶。<,>The artist painted a miniature portrait of the queen.<,>艺术家画了一幅女王的微型肖像。<,>He built a miniature model of the Eiffel Tower.<,>他建造了一个埃菲尔铁塔的微型模型。<,>mini(小)+ature(状态)→微型的<,>minimal(adj.最小的)/minimum(n.最小值)  

merit<,>/ˈmerɪt/<,>/ˈmerɪt/<,>v.值得/n.优点<,>His suggestion merits serious consideration.<,>他的建议值得认真考虑。<,>One of the merits of this plan is its simplicity.<,>这个计划的优点之一是简单。<,>She received a certificate of merit for her hard work.<,>她因努力工作获得了优秀证书。<,>mer(值得)+it→值得<,>demerit(n.缺点)/inherit(v.继承)  

category<,>/ˈkætəɡəri/<,>/ˈkætəɡɔːri/<,>n.种类<,>These books fall into the fiction category.<,>这些书属于小说类。<,>There are several categories of competition.<,>比赛有几个类别。<,>Which category does this product belong to?<,>这个产品属于哪一类？<,>cate(完全)+gory(聚集)→完全聚集→分类<,>catalog(n.目录)/cater(v.迎合)  

liability<,>/ˌlaɪəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌlaɪəˈbɪləti/<,>n.责任/n.债务<,>The company accepted liability for the accident.<,>公司承担了事故的责任。<,>He has huge tax liabilities this year.<,>他今年有巨额税务债务。<,>Poor spelling is a liability in this job.<,>拼写差对这份工作是个不利因素。<,>lia(绑)+bility(能力)→被绑住的责任<,>reliability(n.可靠性)/ability(n.能力)  

hack<,>/hæk/<,>/hæk/<,>v.黑客攻击<,>Someone tried to hack into my email account.<,>有人试图入侵我的电子邮件账户。<,>The system was hacked last night.<,>系统昨晚遭到了黑客攻击。<,>He learned how to hack when he was in college.<,>他在大学时学会了黑客技术。<,>hack(砍)→像砍伐一样入侵<,>hacker(n.黑客)/hackneyed(adj.陈腐的)  

matter<,>/ˈmætə(r)/<,>/ˈmætər/<,>v.重要/v.要紧<,>It doesn't matter if you're late.<,>你迟到没关系。<,>What matters most is your health.<,>最重要的是你的健康。<,>This decision matters to everyone.<,>这个决定对每个人都很重要。<,>mat(物质)+ter→重要的物质<,>material(n.材料)/maternal(adj.母亲的)  

brutal<,>/ˈbruːtl/<,>/ˈbruːtl/<,>adj.残酷的<,>The murder was particularly brutal.<,>这起谋杀特别残忍。<,>He suffered a brutal attack last night.<,>他昨晚遭到了残酷的袭击。<,>The dictator ruled with brutal force.<,>独裁者以残酷的武力统治。<,>brut(野兽)+al→像野兽一样残酷<,>brute(n.野兽)/brutish(adj.粗野的)  

biodiversity<,>/ˌbaɪəʊdaɪˈvɜːsəti/<,>/ˌbaɪoʊdaɪˈvɜːrsəti/<,>n.生物多样性<,>We must protect the biodiversity of the rainforest.<,>我们必须保护雨林的生物多样性。<,>The island has amazing biodiversity.<,>这个岛屿有惊人的生物多样性。<,>Loss of biodiversity is a serious problem.<,>生物多样性的丧失是个严重问题。<,>bio(生物)+diversity(多样性)→生物多样性<,>biology(n.生物学)/biodegradable(adj.可生物降解的)  

subsequently<,>/ˈsʌbsɪkwəntli/<,>/ˈsʌbsɪkwəntli/<,>adv.随后<,>He was arrested and subsequently released.<,>他被逮捕随后被释放。<,>She graduated and subsequently found a good job.<,>她毕业了随后找到了一份好工作。<,>The plan was approved and subsequently implemented.<,>计划获得批准随后实施。<,>sub(下面)+sequent(跟随)+ly→随后<,>consequently(adv.因此)/sequential(adj.连续的)  

bother<,>/ˈbɒðə(r)/<,>/ˈbɑːðər/<,>v.困扰<,>Don't bother me while I'm working.<,>我工作时别打扰我。<,>The noise bothered her all night.<,>噪音困扰了她一整夜。<,>It bothers me that he's always late.<,>他总是迟到让我很困扰。<,>both(两者)+er→两者都困扰<,>brother(n.兄弟)/bothersome(adj.讨厌的)
subconscious<,>/ˌsʌbˈkɒnʃəs/<,>/ˌsʌbˈkɑːnʃəs/<,>adj.下意识的/adj.潜意识的<,>Her fear of spiders was subconscious.<,>她对蜘蛛的恐惧是潜意识的。<,>He acted on a subconscious impulse.<,>他出于下意识的冲动行事。<,>Subconscious thoughts influence our behavior.<,>潜意识的想法会影响我们的行为。<,>sub(在...之下)+conscious(意识)→潜意识<,>conscious(adj.有意识的)/unconscious(adj.无意识的)

genetic<,>/dʒɪˈnetɪk/<,>/dʒəˈnɛtɪk/<,>adj.基因的<,>Genetic testing can reveal health risks.<,>基因检测可以揭示健康风险。<,>Eye color is a genetic trait.<,>眼睛颜色是一种遗传特征。<,>Scientists study genetic mutations.<,>科学家研究基因突变。<,>gene(基因)+tic(形容词后缀)→基因的<,>generic(adj.通用的)/genesis(n.起源)

recurrence<,>/rɪˈkʌrəns/<,>/rɪˈkɜːrəns/<,>n.再次发生<,>There was a recurrence of the disease.<,>这种疾病再次发生了。<,>We hope to prevent a recurrence of the problem.<,>我们希望防止问题再次发生。<,>The recurrence rate is high for this type of cancer.<,>这种癌症的复发率很高。<,>re(再次)+cur(跑)+ence(名词后缀)→再次发生<,>occurrence(n.发生)/concurrence(n.同时发生)

defect<,>/ˈdiːfekt/<,>/ˈdiˌfɛkt/<,>n.缺点<,>The product was recalled due to a manufacturing defect.<,>该产品因制造缺陷被召回。<,>His main defect is impatience.<,>他的主要缺点是缺乏耐心。<,>They found a defect in the design.<,>他们在设计中发现了缺陷。<,>de(离开)+fect(做)→做不好→缺点<,>effect(n.效果)/infect(v.感染)

retailer<,>/ˈriːteɪlə(r)/<,>/ˈriˌteɪlər/<,>n.零售商<,>The retailer offers a wide selection of products.<,>这家零售商提供多种产品选择。<,>Online retailers are growing rapidly.<,>在线零售商正在快速增长。<,>She works as a fashion retailer.<,>她是一名时尚零售商。<,>retail(零售)+er(人)→零售商<,>wholesaler(n.批发商)/detailer(n.细节处理者)

memo<,>/ˈmeməʊ/<,>/ˈmɛmoʊ/<,>n.备忘录<,>He sent a memo to all employees.<,>他向所有员工发送了一份备忘录。<,>Please check the memo for updates.<,>请查看备忘录以获取更新。<,>The meeting details are in the memo.<,>会议细节在备忘录中。<,>memory(记忆)的缩写→备忘录<,>memory(n.记忆)/memento(n.纪念品)

chain<,>/tʃeɪn/<,>/tʃeɪn/<,>n.连锁店<,>This coffee chain has locations worldwide.<,>这家咖啡连锁店在全球都有分店。<,>She bought the necklace from a jewelry chain.<,>她从一家珠宝连锁店买了这条项链。<,>The fast-food chain is expanding.<,>这家快餐连锁店正在扩张。<,>chain(链条)→像链条一样连接的分店→连锁店<,>change(v.改变)/chair(n.椅子)

executive<,>/ɪɡˈzekjətɪv/<,>/ɪɡˈzɛkjətɪv/<,>n.执行官<,>The company hired a new executive.<,>公司聘请了一位新的执行官。<,>She is the chief executive officer.<,>她是首席执行官。<,>Executive decisions affect the whole company.<,>执行官的决策影响整个公司。<,>execute(执行)+ive(人)→执行官<,>execution(n.执行)/executor(n.遗嘱执行人)

ballet<,>/ˈbæleɪ/<,>/bæˈleɪ/<,>n.芭蕾<,>She has been practicing ballet since childhood.<,>她从小就开始练习芭蕾。<,>We went to see a ballet performance.<,>我们去看了芭蕾表演。<,>The ballet dancer moved gracefully.<,>芭蕾舞者动作优雅。<,>ball(球)+et(小)→像小球一样轻盈的舞蹈→芭蕾<,>bullet(n.子弹)/ballad(n.民谣)

enrollment<,>/ɪnˈrəʊlmənt/<,>/ɪnˈroʊlmənt/<,>n.入学人数<,>The school's enrollment has increased this year.<,>今年学校的入学人数增加了。<,>Enrollment for the course is now open.<,>该课程的报名现已开放。<,>What is the total enrollment at the university?<,>这所大学的总入学人数是多少？<,>enroll(注册)+ment(名词后缀)→入学人数<,>employment(n.就业)/engagement(n.订婚)
propose<,>/prəˈpəʊz/<,>/prəˈpoʊz/<,>v.提出/v.建议/v.求婚<,>He proposed a new plan to the committee.<,>他向委员会提出了一个新计划。<,>She proposed to him on Valentine's Day.<,>她在情人节那天向他求婚了。<,>I propose that we take a short break.<,>我建议我们休息一会儿。<,>pro(向前)+pose(放置)→向前放→提出<,>oppose(v.反对)/dispose(v.处理)/expose(v.暴露)

frantic<,>/ˈfræntɪk/<,>/ˈfræntɪk/<,>adj.疯狂的/adj.狂乱的/adj.急切的<,>She was frantic with worry when her child went missing.<,>孩子失踪时她急得发狂。<,>The frantic search for the missing documents continued all night.<,>对丢失文件的疯狂搜寻持续了一整夜。<,>He made frantic efforts to finish the project on time.<,>他拼命努力按时完成项目。<,>frant(狂)+ic(形容词后缀)→疯狂的<,>fanatic(n.狂热者)/frenetic(adj.狂热的)/frank(adj.坦率的)

allegedly<,>/əˈledʒɪdli/<,>/əˈlɛdʒɪdli/<,>adv.据说/adv.据称/adv.据传<,>The man allegedly stole the car.<,>据称这个男人偷了车。<,>She was allegedly seen at the scene of the crime.<,>据称有人在犯罪现场看到过她。<,>The company allegedly violated environmental regulations.<,>据称该公司违反了环保规定。<,>allege(宣称)+ed(过去式)+ly(副词后缀)→据说<,>legally(adv.合法地)/illegally(adv.非法地)/legend(n.传说)

manipulate<,>/məˈnɪpjʊleɪt/<,>/məˈnɪpjəˌleɪt/<,>v.操纵/v.操控/v.熟练处理<,>He knows how to manipulate public opinion.<,>他知道如何操纵舆论。<,>The surgeon manipulated the instruments with great skill.<,>外科医生非常熟练地操作着器械。<,>Children can manipulate their parents to get what they want.<,>孩子们会操控父母来得到他们想要的东西。<,>mani(手)+pul(拉)+ate(动词后缀)→用手拉→操纵<,>manufacture(v.制造)/manicure(n.修指甲)/maneuver(v.调遣)

coverage<,>/ˈkʌvərɪdʒ/<,>/ˈkʌvərɪdʒ/<,>n.报道/n.覆盖范围/n.保险范围<,>The media gave extensive coverage to the event.<,>媒体对这个事件进行了广泛报道。<,>This insurance policy provides worldwide coverage.<,>这份保险单提供全球范围的保障。<,>The satellite provides coverage of the entire continent.<,>这颗卫星覆盖整个大陆。<,>cover(覆盖)+age(名词后缀)→覆盖范围<,>average(n.平均数)/beverage(n.饮料)/leverage(n.杠杆作用)

novel<,>/ˈnɒvəl/<,>/ˈnɑːvəl/<,>adj.新颖的/n.小说<,>She came up with a novel solution to the problem.<,>她想出了一个新颖的解决方案。<,>His approach is quite novel in this field.<,>他的方法在这个领域相当新颖。<,>I'm reading a novel by the famous author.<,>我正在读这位著名作家的小说。<,>nov(新)+el(形容词后缀)→新颖的<,>novice(n.新手)/innovation(n.创新)/naval(adj.海军的)

previous<,>/ˈpriːviəs/<,>/ˈpriviəs/<,>adj.之前的/adj.先前的/adj.过早的<,>He had no previous experience in teaching.<,>他之前没有教学经验。<,>The previous owner left some furniture in the house.<,>前房主在房子里留下了一些家具。<,>She resigned from her previous job last month.<,>她上个月辞去了之前的工作。<,>pre(前)+vi(路)+ous(形容词后缀)→前面的路→之前的<,>precious(adj.珍贵的)/envious(adj.嫉妒的)/obvious(adj.明显的)

neutrality<,>/njuːˈtræləti/<,>/nuːˈtræləti/<,>n.中立/n.中性/n.中立状态<,>The country maintained strict neutrality during the war.<,>该国在战争期间保持严格中立。<,>Chemical neutrality is important in this experiment.<,>化学中性在这个实验中很重要。<,>Journalists should observe neutrality in their reporting.<,>记者在报道中应该保持中立。<,>neutr(中性)+al(形容词后缀)+ity(名词后缀)→中立<,>natural(adj.自然的)/neutral(adj.中立的)/nutrition(n.营养)

underscore<,>/ˌʌndəˈskɔː(r)/<,>/ˌʌndərˈskɔr/<,>v.强调/v.在...下划线<,>The report underscores the importance of education.<,>报告强调了教育的重要性。<,>Please underscore the key points in the text.<,>请在文本中给要点划下划线。<,>His actions underscore his commitment to the cause.<,>他的行动强调了他对这项事业的承诺。<,>under(在...下)+score(划线)→在下面划线→强调<,>underline(v.强调)/understate(v.轻描淡写)/underestimate(v.低估)

indispensable<,>/ˌɪndɪˈspensəbl/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈspɛnsəbəl/<,>adj.必不可少的/adj.必需的/adj.责无旁贷的<,>Water is indispensable to life.<,>水对生命是必不可少的。<,>She has become an indispensable member of the team.<,>她已成为团队中不可或缺的一员。<,>This tool is indispensable for the job.<,>这个工具对这项工作必不可少。<,>in(不)+dis(分开)+pens(衡量)+able(能够)→不能分开衡量的→必不可少的<,>dispensable(adj.可有可无的)/dependable(adj.可靠的)/responsible(adj.负责的)
puzzle<,>/ˈpʌz(ə)l/<,>/ˈpʌzəl/<,>v.迷惑<,>The riddle puzzled me for hours.<,>这个谜语让我困惑了好几个小时。<,>Her behavior puzzles everyone around her.<,>她的行为让周围的人都感到困惑。<,>He was puzzled by the complex instructions.<,>他被复杂的说明书弄糊涂了。<,>puzz(困惑)+le(动词后缀)→使困惑<,>muzzle(n.口套/v.使缄默)/dazzle(v.使目眩/n.耀眼)  

illustrate<,>/ˈɪləstreɪt/<,>/ˈɪləˌstreɪt/<,>v.阐明/v.说明<,>The diagram illustrates the process clearly.<,>这个图表清晰地说明了整个过程。<,>She illustrated her point with a personal story.<,>她用个人故事阐明了自己的观点。<,>This case illustrates the importance of teamwork.<,>这个案例说明了团队合作的重要性。<,>il(加强)+lustr(光)+ate(动词后缀)→用光照亮→阐明<,>demonstrate(v.证明/v.示威)/frustrate(v.挫败/adj.挫败的)  

sanitation<,>/ˌsanɪˈteɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌsænəˈteɪʃən/<,>n.卫生环境/n.卫生设备<,>Proper sanitation is essential for public health.<,>适当的卫生环境对公共健康至关重要。<,>The city improved its sanitation facilities.<,>这个城市改善了它的卫生设施。<,>Lack of sanitation can lead to disease outbreaks.<,>缺乏卫生设备可能导致疾病爆发。<,>sanit(健康)+ation(名词后缀)→卫生<,>sanitary(adj.卫生的)/sanitize(v.消毒)  

defensive<,>/dɪˈfensɪv/<,>/dɪˈfɛnsɪv/<,>adj.防守的/adj.防御的<,>The team took a defensive position.<,>这个团队采取了防守的姿势。<,>She gave a defensive answer to the criticism.<,>她对批评给出了防御性的回答。<,>Defensive driving can prevent accidents.<,>防御性驾驶可以预防事故。<,>de(向下)+fens(打击)+ive(形容词后缀)→向下打击→防御的<,>offensive(adj.冒犯的/n.进攻)/defensible(adj.可辩护的)  

perspective<,>/pəˈspektɪv/<,>/pərˈspektɪv/<,>n.视角/n.观点<,>From my perspective, the decision was wrong.<,>从我的角度来看，这个决定是错误的。<,>The painting shows an interesting perspective.<,>这幅画展示了一个有趣的视角。<,>We need to consider different perspectives on this issue.<,>我们需要考虑这个问题的不同观点。<,>per(通过)+spect(看)+ive(名词后缀)→看事物的方式→视角<,>prospective(adj.预期的)/retrospective(adj.回顾的)  

migration<,>/maɪˈɡreɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/maɪˈɡreɪʃən/<,>n.迁徙/n.移居<,>Bird migration is a fascinating phenomenon.<,>鸟类迁徙是一个迷人的现象。<,>There has been a large migration to urban areas.<,>出现了向城市地区的大规模移居。<,>Climate change affects animal migration patterns.<,>气候变化影响动物的迁徙模式。<,>migr(移动)+ation(名词后缀)→迁徙<,>immigration(n.移民入境)/emigration(n.移民出境)  

float<,>/fləʊt/<,>/floʊt/<,>v.漂浮<,>The boat floated gently on the water.<,>小船在水面上轻轻漂浮。<,>Balloons float in the air because of helium.<,>气球因为氦气而在空中漂浮。<,>Leaves were floating down the river.<,>树叶正顺流漂浮而下。<,>fl(流动)+oat(似"船")→像船一样流动→漂浮<,>flood(n.洪水/v.淹没)/flout(v.藐视)  

flexible<,>/ˈfleksɪb(ə)l/<,>/ˈflɛksəbəl/<,>adj.灵活的<,>Yoga makes your body more flexible.<,>瑜伽让你的身体更加灵活。<,>We need a flexible approach to solve this problem.<,>我们需要灵活的方法来解决这个问题。<,>Her schedule is quite flexible this week.<,>她这周的日程相当灵活。<,>flex(弯曲)+ible(能...的)→能弯曲的→灵活的<,>inflexible(adj.不灵活的)/reflexible(adj.可反射的)  

capable<,>/ˈkeɪpəb(ə)l/<,>/ˈkeɪpəbəl/<,>adj.有能力的<,>She is capable of handling difficult situations.<,>她有能力处理困难情况。<,>This machine is capable of performing multiple tasks.<,>这台机器能够执行多项任务。<,>He proved himself capable as a leader.<,>他证明了自己是个有能力的领导者。<,>cap(抓住)+able(能...的)→能抓住的→有能力的<,>incapable(adj.无能力的)/capacity(n.能力)  

practical<,>/ˈpraktɪk(ə)l/<,>/ˈpræktɪkəl/<,>adj.实践的/adj.实用的<,>This is a practical solution to our problem.<,>这是我们问题的一个实用解决方案。<,>She has a lot of practical experience in this field.<,>她在这个领域有很多实践经验。<,>The design needs to be both beautiful and practical.<,>这个设计需要既美观又实用。<,>pract(实践)+ical(形容词后缀)→实践的<,>theoretical(adj.理论的)/practicable(adj.可行的)
territory<,>/ˈterɪtri/<,>/ˈterɪtɔːri/<,>n.领域/n.领土<,>The explorers claimed the new land as their territory.<,>探险家们宣称这块新土地是他们的领土。<,>He is an expert in the territory of molecular biology.<,>他是分子生物学领域的专家。<,>Wild animals mark their territory with scent.<,>野生动物用气味标记它们的领地。<,>terr(土地)+itory(名词后缀)→领土<,>terrain(n.地形)/territorial(adj.领土的)

urbanization<,>/ˌɜːbənaɪˈzeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɜːrbənəˈzeɪʃn/<,>n.城市化<,>Rapid urbanization has caused many environmental problems.<,>快速城市化引发了许多环境问题。<,>The government is trying to control the pace of urbanization.<,>政府正试图控制城市化的速度。<,>Urbanization brings both opportunities and challenges.<,>城市化既带来机遇也带来挑战。<,>urban(城市的)+ization(名词后缀)→城市化<,>urban(adj.城市的)/rural(adj.农村的)

privilege<,>/ˈprɪvəlɪdʒ/<,>/ˈprɪvəlɪdʒ/<,>n.特权<,>Education should be a right, not a privilege.<,>教育应该是权利而非特权。<,>He abused his privileges as a government official.<,>他滥用作为政府官员的特权。<,>With great privilege comes great responsibility.<,>拥有巨大特权意味着承担巨大责任。<,>priv(私人的)+lege(法律)→私人法律→特权<,>privacy(n.隐私)/privation(n.匮乏)

forthcoming<,>/ˌfɔːθˈkʌmɪŋ/<,>/ˌfɔːrθˈkʌmɪŋ/<,>adj.即将来临的<,>The forthcoming election has attracted much attention.<,>即将到来的选举引起了很多关注。<,>Details of the forthcoming product launch will be announced soon.<,>即将推出的产品详情将很快公布。<,>She was very forthcoming with information about the project.<,>她很爽快地提供了项目信息。<,>forth(向前)+coming(来)→即将到来的<,>upcoming(adj.即将到来的)/outgoing(adj.外向的)

widen<,>/ˈwaɪdn/<,>/ˈwaɪdn/<,>v.拓宽/v.变宽<,>The city plans to widen this road next year.<,>市政府计划明年拓宽这条路。<,>Reading can widen your horizons.<,>阅读可以拓宽你的视野。<,>The gap between rich and poor continues to widen.<,>贫富差距继续扩大。<,>wide(宽的)+en(动词后缀)→变宽<,>broaden(v.变宽)/narrow(v.变窄)

deduction<,>/dɪˈdʌkʃn/<,>/dɪˈdʌkʃn/<,>n.扣款<,>Tax deductions can reduce your taxable income.<,>税收扣款可以减少你的应税收入。<,>The detective made a brilliant deduction from the clues.<,>侦探从线索中做出了精彩的推论。<,>Your salary will be paid after all deductions.<,>你的工资将在所有扣款后支付。<,>de(向下)+duct(引导)+ion→向下引导→扣款<,>induction(n.归纳)/reduction(n.减少)

virtual<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuəl/<,>/ˈvɜːrtʃuəl/<,>adj.虚拟的/adj.事实上的<,>Virtual reality technology is becoming more popular.<,>虚拟现实技术越来越受欢迎。<,>He is the virtual leader of the group, though not officially.<,>他是这个团队事实上的领导者，尽管没有正式头衔。<,>The meeting will be held in a virtual environment.<,>会议将在虚拟环境中举行。<,>virt(力量)+ual→有力量的→事实上的<,>virtue(n.美德)/visual(adj.视觉的)

boast<,>/bəʊst/<,>/boʊst/<,>v.自夸<,>He always boasts about his achievements.<,>他总是夸耀自己的成就。<,>The town boasts a beautiful lake and park.<,>这个镇子自豪地拥有一座美丽的湖和公园。<,>It's not good to boast in front of others.<,>在别人面前自夸不好。<,>boat(船)+s→像船一样浮夸→自夸<,>toast(n.烤面包/v.干杯)/roast(v.烤)

monetary<,>/ˈmʌnɪtri/<,>/ˈmɑːnɪteri/<,>adj.货币的<,>The government introduced new monetary policies.<,>政府出台了新的货币政策。<,>Monetary inflation affects everyone's purchasing power.<,>货币通胀影响每个人的购买力。<,>The monetary value of the painting is hard to estimate.<,>这幅画的货币价值难以估计。<,>monet(钱)+ary(形容词后缀)→货币的<,>money(n.钱)/momentary(adj.瞬间的)

dim<,>/dɪm/<,>/dɪm/<,>adj.暗淡的/adj.愚蠢的<,>The lights were too dim to read by.<,>灯光太暗，无法阅读。<,>He made a dim remark that confused everyone.<,>他说了句愚蠢的话，把大家都搞糊涂了。<,>Her memory of the event is growing dim.<,>她对这件事的记忆逐渐模糊。<,>di(二)+m→两个月亮→光线暗淡<,>dumb(adj.哑的)/dam(n.水坝)
sensible<,>/ˈsensəbl/<,>/ˈsensəbəl/<,>adj.理智的/明智的<,>It's sensible to wear a coat in cold weather.<,>在寒冷的天气里穿外套是明智的。<,>She gave me some sensible advice.<,>她给了我一些明智的建议。<,>A sensible person thinks before acting.<,>理智的人三思而后行。<,>sens(感觉)+ible(能…的)→能感觉到的→明智的<,>sensitive(adj.敏感的)/sensational(adj.轰动的)

infant<,>/ˈɪnfənt/<,>/ˈɪnfənt/<,>n.婴儿/幼儿<,>The infant was sleeping peacefully in the crib.<,>婴儿在婴儿床里安静地睡着。<,>Infant mortality has decreased in recent years.<,>近年来婴儿死亡率有所下降。<,>She works in an infant care center.<,>她在婴幼儿护理中心工作。<,>in(不)+fant(说话)→不会说话的人→婴儿<,>infantry(n.步兵)/infantry(n.步兵)

precedent<,>/ˈpresɪdənt/<,>/ˈprɛsɪdənt/<,>n.先例/惯例<,>This decision sets a dangerous precedent.<,>这个决定开创了一个危险的先例。<,>There is no precedent for this situation.<,>这种情况没有先例。<,>The court followed legal precedent.<,>法院遵循了法律先例。<,>pre(前)+ced(走)+ent→先前走过的→先例<,>president(n.总统)/preceding(adj.在前的)

activate<,>/ˈæktɪveɪt/<,>/ˈæktəˌveɪt/<,>v.激活/启动<,>Press this button to activate the machine.<,>按下这个按钮启动机器。<,>The alarm is activated by motion.<,>警报器由运动激活。<,>Vitamin D helps activate calcium absorption.<,>维生素D有助于激活钙的吸收。<,>act(行动)+ivate(使)→使行动→激活<,>active(adj.活跃的)/activity(n.活动)

accomplish<,>/əˈkʌmplɪʃ/<,>/əˈkɑːmplɪʃ/<,>v.实现/完成<,>She accomplished her goal of running a marathon.<,>她实现了跑马拉松的目标。<,>The team accomplished the project ahead of schedule.<,>团队提前完成了项目。<,>It takes hard work to accomplish great things.<,>完成伟大的事业需要努力工作。<,>ac(强调)+com(完全)+plish(充满)→完全充满→完成<,>complete(v.完成)/comply(v.遵从)

immigration<,>/ˌɪmɪˈɡreɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪməˈɡreɪʃən/<,>n.移民/移居<,>Immigration laws vary from country to country.<,>各国的移民法各不相同。<,>She works for the immigration department.<,>她在移民局工作。<,>The city has a large immigration population.<,>这个城市有大量移民人口。<,>im(进入)+migr(迁移)+ation→迁移进入→移民<,>emigration(n.移居国外)/migration(n.迁移)

approve<,>/əˈpruːv/<,>/əˈpruːv/<,>v.赞同/批准<,>The committee approved the new policy.<,>委员会批准了新政策。<,>I don't approve of his behavior.<,>我不赞同他的行为。<,>The plan was approved unanimously.<,>该计划获得一致通过。<,>ap(强调)+prove(证明)→证明可行→批准<,>improve(v.改进)/prove(v.证明)

pessimist<,>/ˈpesɪmɪst/<,>/ˈpɛsəmɪst/<,>n.悲观主义者<,>He's such a pessimist - he always expects the worst.<,>他是个十足的悲观主义者，总是做最坏的打算。<,>The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity.<,>悲观主义者在每个机会里看到的都是困难。<,>Don't be a pessimist; look on the bright side.<,>不要做悲观主义者，看看光明的一面。<,>pess(坏的)+imist(人)→总想坏事的人→悲观主义者<,>optimist(n.乐观主义者)/pessimism(n.悲观主义)

aggressive<,>/əˈɡresɪv/<,>/əˈɡrɛsɪv/<,>adj.挑衅的/侵略性的/有进取心的<,>His aggressive behavior caused problems.<,>他挑衅的行为引发了问题。<,>She has an aggressive marketing strategy.<,>她有积极的营销策略。<,>The dog became aggressive when threatened.<,>狗受到威胁时变得具有攻击性。<,>ag(朝向)+gress(走)+ive→走向别人的→侵略的<,>progressive(adj.进步的)/digressive(adj.离题的)

toxic<,>/ˈtɒksɪk/<,>/ˈtɑːksɪk/<,>adj.有毒的/有害的<,>The chemical is highly toxic to humans.<,>这种化学物质对人类有剧毒。<,>They were exposed to toxic fumes.<,>他们接触到了有毒烟雾。<,>The relationship became toxic over time.<,>这段关系逐渐变得有害。<,>tox(毒)+ic(…的)→有毒的<,>intoxicant(n.麻醉剂)/detox(v.解毒)
ruling<,>/ˈruːlɪŋ/<,>/ˈruːlɪŋ/<,>n.裁定<,>The court's ruling was in favor of the defendant.<,>法院的裁定对被告有利。<,>She challenged the ruling of the judge.<,>她对法官的裁定提出了质疑。<,>The ruling set a precedent for future cases.<,>这项裁定为未来的案件树立了先例。<,>rule(规则)+ing(名词后缀)→裁定<,>rolling(adj.滚动的)/ruling(n.裁定)/ruled(adj.受统治的)

prolong<,>/prəˈlɒŋ/<,>/prəˈlɔːŋ/<,>v.延长<,>The doctor advised him to prolong his rest period.<,>医生建议他延长休息时间。<,>They decided to prolong the meeting by another hour.<,>他们决定将会议再延长一小时。<,>Good care can prolong a patient's life.<,>良好的护理可以延长病人的生命。<,>pro(向前)+long(长)→延长<,>prolong(v.延长)/belong(v.属于)/along(prep.沿着)

tension<,>/ˈtenʃn/<,>/ˈtenʃn/<,>n.紧张<,>There was a lot of tension in the room during the debate.<,>辩论期间房间里充满了紧张气氛。<,>She felt the tension in her shoulders after working all day.<,>工作一整天后，她感到肩膀紧张。<,>The tension between the two countries is increasing.<,>两国之间的紧张局势正在加剧。<,>tense(紧张的)+ion(名词后缀)→紧张<,>tension(n.紧张)/intention(n.意图)/attention(n.注意)

specialist<,>/ˈspeʃəlɪst/<,>/ˈspeʃəlɪst/<,>n.专家<,>He is a specialist in ancient history.<,>他是古代史专家。<,>The patient was referred to a heart specialist.<,>病人被转诊给心脏专家。<,>She works as a specialist in computer programming.<,>她是一名计算机编程专家。<,>special(特殊的)+ist(人)→专家<,>specialist(n.专家)/specialize(v.专攻)/specialty(n.专业)

encounter<,>/ɪnˈkaʊntə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈkaʊntər/<,>v.遭遇<,>They encountered many difficulties during the expedition.<,>他们在探险期间遭遇了许多困难。<,>I encountered an old friend at the supermarket.<,>我在超市遇到了一位老朋友。<,>The soldiers encountered heavy resistance.<,>士兵们遭遇了激烈的抵抗。<,>en(使)+counter(相对)→遭遇<,>encounter(v.遭遇)/counter(n.柜台)/count(v.计数)

reap<,>/riːp/<,>/riːp/<,>v.收割/v.收获<,>Farmers reap the wheat in autumn.<,>农民们在秋天收割小麦。<,>You will reap the benefits of your hard work.<,>你将收获辛勤工作的成果。<,>They reaped a large profit from the investment.<,>他们从投资中获得了丰厚的利润。<,>联想：read(读)→reap(收割)→读书如收割知识<,>reap(v.收割)/leap(v.跳跃)/heap(n.堆)

institute<,>/ˈɪnstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈɪnstɪtuːt/<,>n.研究所/n.学会/n.学院<,>He works at a scientific research institute.<,>他在一家科研研究所工作。<,>The institute was founded in 1950.<,>这个学会成立于1950年。<,>She graduated from a prestigious art institute.<,>她毕业于一所著名的艺术学院。<,>in(在...里)+stitute(建立)→建立在内→学院<,>institute(n.学院)/constitute(v.组成)/substitute(n.替代品)

maintenance<,>/ˈmeɪntənəns/<,>/ˈmeɪntənəns/<,>n.维修<,>The building requires regular maintenance.<,>这栋建筑需要定期维修。<,>He is responsible for the maintenance of the equipment.<,>他负责设备的维修。<,>Proper maintenance can extend the life of your car.<,>适当的维修可以延长你汽车的使用寿命。<,>main(主要的)+tenance(保持)→保持主要功能→维修<,>maintenance(n.维修)/sustenance(n.维持)/retention(n.保留)

legend<,>/ˈledʒənd/<,>/ˈledʒənd/<,>n.传奇<,>The story of King Arthur is a famous legend.<,>亚瑟王的故事是一个著名的传奇。<,>He became a legend in the music industry.<,>他成为了音乐界的传奇人物。<,>Local legends say there's a ghost in the old house.<,>当地传说老房子里有鬼。<,>leg(读)+end(结束)→读到最后→传奇故事<,>legend(n.传奇)/legion(n.军团)/ledge(n.壁架)

groundless<,>/ˈɡraʊndləs/<,>/ˈɡraʊndləs/<,>adj.无理由的/adj.无根据的<,>His fears turned out to be groundless.<,>他的恐惧被证明是没有根据的。<,>The accusations against her were completely groundless.<,>对她的指控完全是无稽之谈。<,>Don't spread groundless rumors.<,>不要散布毫无根据的谣言。<,>ground(基础)+less(无)→无基础的→无根据的<,>groundless(adj.无根据的)/grounded(adj.接地的)/groundwork(n.基础工作)
undertake<,>/ˌʌndəˈteɪk/<,>/ˌʌndərˈteɪk/<,>v.承担/v.着手/v.开始<,>She decided to undertake the project despite the challenges.<,>尽管有挑战，她还是决定承担这个项目。<,>He undertook a journey across the desert.<,>他开始了一次穿越沙漠的旅程。<,>The company will undertake the construction of the new bridge.<,>公司将着手建造新桥。<,>under(在...下)+take(拿)→在责任下拿→承担<,>overtake(v. 超过)/undertaker(n. 承办人)  

commodity<,>/kəˈmɒdəti/<,>/kəˈmɑːdəti/<,>n.商品<,>Oil is a valuable commodity in the global market.<,>石油是全球市场上的重要商品。<,>The store sells various household commodities.<,>这家商店出售各种家居商品。<,>Commodity prices have been fluctuating recently.<,>最近商品价格一直在波动。<,>com(共同)+mod(模式)+ity→共同模式下的物品→商品<,>common(adj. 普通的)/community(n. 社区)  

stimulate<,>/ˈstɪmjuleɪt/<,>/ˈstɪmjəleɪt/<,>v.刺激/v.激励<,>The teacher used games to stimulate students' interest.<,>老师用游戏来激发学生的兴趣。<,>Caffeine can stimulate the nervous system.<,>咖啡因能刺激神经系统。<,>The new policy aims to stimulate economic growth.<,>新政策旨在刺激经济增长。<,>stim(刺)+ulate(使)→使受刺→刺激<,>simulate(v. 模拟)/stipulate(v. 规定)  

tough<,>/tʌf/<,>/tʌf/<,>adj.困难的/adj.粗暴的<,>It was a tough decision to make.<,>这是个艰难的决定。<,>The coach is tough but fair.<,>教练很严厉但公平。<,>This meat is too tough to chew.<,>这块肉太硬嚼不动。<,>谐音"塔夫"→塔里的夫人很严厉→粗暴的<,>rough(adj. 粗糙的)/though(conj. 尽管)  

vital<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>adj.重要的<,>Water is vital for all living things.<,>水对所有生物都至关重要。<,>She plays a vital role in the team.<,>她在团队中起着重要作用。<,>Early detection is vital for treating the disease.<,>早期发现对治疗这种疾病很重要。<,>vit(生命)+al→与生命有关的→重要的<,>viral(adj. 病毒的)/vile(adj. 卑鄙的)  

ankle<,>/ˈæŋkl/<,>/ˈæŋkəl/<,>n.脚踝<,>She twisted her ankle while playing basketball.<,>她打篮球时扭伤了脚踝。<,>He wore a bracelet around his ankle.<,>他脚踝上戴了个脚链。<,>The swelling in his ankle has gone down.<,>他脚踝的肿胀已经消退了。<,>谐音"安扣"→安全扣住脚的部分→脚踝<,>uncle(n. 叔叔)/angle(n. 角度)  

surgical<,>/ˈsɜːdʒɪkl/<,>/ˈsɜːrdʒɪkl/<,>adj.手术的<,>He is wearing surgical gloves.<,>他戴着手术手套。<,>The patient needs surgical intervention.<,>病人需要手术干预。<,>The hospital has a new surgical wing.<,>医院新建了一个手术楼。<,>surg(外科)+ical→外科的→手术的<,>surge(n. 浪潮)/surgeon(n. 外科医生)  

peculiar<,>/pɪˈkjuːliə(r)/<,>/pɪˈkjuːliər/<,>adj.奇怪的/adj.特有的<,>He has a peculiar way of speaking.<,>他说话方式很奇怪。<,>This plant is peculiar to this region.<,>这种植物是这个地区特有的。<,>There was a peculiar smell in the room.<,>房间里有股怪味。<,>pecu(钱)+liar(说谎者)→有钱的说谎者很奇怪→奇怪的<,>particular(adj. 特定的)/pecuniary(adj. 金钱的)  

fade<,>/feɪd/<,>/feɪd/<,>v.褪色<,>The color of the curtains has faded in the sun.<,>窗帘的颜色在阳光下褪色了。<,>Her memory of that day is fading.<,>她对那天的记忆正在消退。<,>The music faded away as the show ended.<,>演出结束时音乐渐渐消失。<,>谐音"飞的"→颜色飞走了→褪色<,>face(n. 脸)/fame(n. 名声)  

pursuit<,>/pəˈsjuːt/<,>/pərˈsuːt/<,>n.追求<,>He devoted his life to the pursuit of knowledge.<,>他毕生追求知识。<,>The police are in pursuit of the suspect.<,>警方正在追捕嫌疑人。<,>Happiness is found in the pursuit, not the attainment.<,>幸福在于追求的过程而非获得。<,>pur(向前)+suit(跟随)→向前跟随→追求<,>pursue(v. 追求)/purser(n. 事务长)
sophisticated<,>/səˈfɪstɪkeɪtɪd/<,>/səˈfɪstɪˌkeɪtɪd/<,>adj.复杂的/adj.精密的/adj.老于世故的<,>The device uses sophisticated technology to monitor air quality.<,>该设备采用精密技术监测空气质量。<,>She has a sophisticated taste in fashion.<,>她对时尚有着老练的品味。<,>The math problem requires sophisticated analytical skills.<,>这道数学题需要复杂的分析能力。<,>soph(智慧)+ist(人)+icated→充满智慧的→精密的<,>complicated(adj.复杂的)/worldly(adj.世故的)/naive(adj.天真的)

lobbyist<,>/ˈlɒbiɪst/<,>/ˈlɑːbiɪst/<,>n.游说者<,>The oil company hired lobbyists to influence the new legislation.<,>石油公司雇佣说客来影响新立法。<,>Environmental lobbyists are pushing for stricter regulations.<,>环保游说者正在推动更严格的法规。<,>As a lobbyist, he has connections with many politicians.<,>作为说客，他与许多政客有联系。<,>lobby(大厅)+ist(人)→在议会大厅活动的人<,>advocate(n.倡导者)/activist(n.活动家)/diplomat(n.外交官)

lessen<,>/ˈlesn/<,>/ˈlɛsən/<,>v.减少<,>Regular exercise can lessen the risk of heart disease.<,>定期锻炼可以降低心脏病风险。<,>The pain will lessen after taking this medicine.<,>服用这种药物后疼痛会减轻。<,>We need to lessen our environmental impact.<,>我们需要减少对环境的影响。<,>less(更少)+en(使)→使更少<,>reduce(v.减少)/alleviate(v.缓解)/aggravate(v.加重)

handgun<,>/ˈhændɡʌn/<,>/ˈhændˌɡʌn/<,>n.手枪<,>The police officer drew his handgun in self-defense.<,>警官出于自卫拔出了手枪。<,>Strict laws regulate handgun ownership in this state.<,>该州有严格的法律规范手枪所有权。<,>He keeps a loaded handgun in his nightstand.<,>他在床头柜里放了一把上膛的手枪。<,>hand(手)+gun(枪)→手持的枪<,>rifle(n.步枪)/shotgun(n.猎枪)/holster(n.枪套)

influential<,>/ˌɪnfluˈenʃl/<,>/ˌɪnfluˈɛnʃəl/<,>adj.有影响力的<,>She became an influential figure in the tech industry.<,>她成为科技行业有影响力的人物。<,>This book was highly influential in shaping my worldview.<,>这本书对我世界观的形成影响很大。<,>The newspaper is known for its influential editorial board.<,>该报以其有影响力的编辑委员会而闻名。<,>in(进入)+flu(流)+ential→能流入人心的<,>impactful(adj.有影响的)/authoritative(adj.权威的)/insignificant(adj.无关紧要的)

detached<,>/dɪˈtætʃt/<,>/dɪˈtætʃt/<,>adj.冷静的/adj.超然的<,>The doctor remained detached while delivering the bad news.<,>医生在传达坏消息时保持冷静。<,>He has a detached view of the political situation.<,>他对政治局势持超然态度。<,>The house has a detached garage in the backyard.<,>这栋房子在后院有一个独立车库。<,>de(离开)+tach(钉)+ed→从钉子上取下的→分离的<,>objective(adj.客观的)/impartial(adj.公正的)/involved(adj.卷入的)

biography<,>/baɪˈɒɡrəfi/<,>/baɪˈɑːɡrəfi/<,>n.传记<,>The library has an extensive collection of celebrity biographies.<,>图书馆有大量名人传记收藏。<,>He's writing an authorized biography of the famous scientist.<,>他正在为这位著名科学家撰写授权传记。<,>Her biography reveals many unknown aspects of her early life.<,>她的传记揭示了她早年生活的许多不为人知的方面。<,>bio(生命)+graphy(写)→写生命的故事<,>autobiography(n.自传)/memoir(n.回忆录)/hagiography(n.圣徒传)

curriculum<,>/kəˈrɪkjələm/<,>/kəˈrɪkjələm/<,>n.课程<,>The school is revising its curriculum to include more STEM subjects.<,>学校正在修订课程，增加更多STEM科目。<,>This course is part of the core curriculum for freshmen.<,>这门课是大一核心课程的一部分。<,>The new curriculum emphasizes critical thinking skills.<,>新课程强调批判性思维能力。<,>curr(跑)+iculum→学习的跑道<,>syllabus(n.教学大纲)/program(n.项目)/extracurricular(adj.课外的)

margin<,>/ˈmɑːdʒɪn/<,>/ˈmɑːrdʒɪn/<,>n.利润<,>The company operates on very thin margins.<,>该公司利润微薄。<,>Leave a wide margin when taking notes for annotations.<,>做笔记时要留出宽边距以便批注。<,>We won the game by a narrow margin of two points.<,>我们以两分的微弱优势赢得了比赛。<,>marg(标记)+in→标记出来的边缘部分<,>profit(n.利润)/edge(n.边缘)/border(n.边界)

fearlessly<,>/ˈfɪələsli/<,>/ˈfɪrləsli/<,>adv.无畏地/adv.大胆地<,>The firefighters fearlessly entered the burning building.<,>消防员无畏地进入燃烧的建筑物。<,>She fearlessly challenged the CEO's decision at the meeting.<,>她在会议上大胆质疑CEO的决定。<,>The young activist spoke fearlessly against injustice.<,>这位年轻的活动家无畏地反对不公正现象。<,>fear(恐惧)+less(无)+ly(副词后缀)→无恐惧地<,>boldly(adv.大胆地)/courageously(adv.勇敢地)/timidly(adv.胆怯地)
randomly<,>/ˈrændəmli/<,>/ˈrændəmli/<,>adv.随机地<,>The winner was chosen randomly from all participants.<,>获胜者是从所有参与者中随机选出的。<,>He randomly picked a book from the shelf.<,>他随机从书架上拿了一本书。<,>The computer generates numbers randomly.<,>电脑随机生成数字。<,>random(随机)+ly(副词后缀)→随机地<,>rarely(adv. 很少)/readily(adv. 乐意地)

discrimination<,>/dɪˌskrɪmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/dɪˌskrɪmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>n.歧视<,>Racial discrimination is illegal in many countries.<,>种族歧视在许多国家是非法的。<,>She faced gender discrimination at her workplace.<,>她在工作中遭遇了性别歧视。<,>The law prohibits discrimination based on age.<,>法律禁止基于年龄的歧视。<,>dis(分开)+crimin(区分)+ation(名词后缀)→区别对待→歧视<,>discern(v. 辨别)/discrepancy(n. 差异)

stimulus<,>/ˈstɪmjələs/<,>/ˈstɪmjələs/<,>n.刺激<,>The tax cut was a stimulus to the economy.<,>减税是对经济的刺激。<,>Light is a stimulus for plant growth.<,>光是植物生长的刺激因素。<,>The government announced a new economic stimulus package.<,>政府宣布了新的经济刺激方案。<,>stimul(刺激)+us(名词后缀)→刺激<,>simulate(v. 模拟)/stipend(n. 津贴)

competence<,>/ˈkɒmpɪtəns/<,>/ˈkɑːmpɪtəns/<,>n.能力<,>Her linguistic competence impressed the interviewers.<,>她的语言能力给面试官留下了深刻印象。<,>Professional competence is required for this position.<,>这个职位需要专业能力。<,>He demonstrated great competence in handling the crisis.<,>他在处理危机时表现出很强的能力。<,>com(共同)+pet(追求)+ence(名词后缀)→共同追求的能力→能力<,>compete(v. 竞争)/component(n. 组件)

sneak<,>/sniːk/<,>/sniːk/<,>v.溜走<,>The cat sneaked into the kitchen at night.<,>猫在晚上溜进了厨房。<,>He sneaked out of the meeting early.<,>他提前溜出了会议。<,>She sneaked a glance at her phone during class.<,>她在上课时偷偷看了一眼手机。<,>sn(蛇形)+eak→像蛇一样溜走<,>snake(n. 蛇)/sneaker(n. 运动鞋)

exceed<,>/ɪkˈsiːd/<,>/ɪkˈsiːd/<,>v.超过<,>The results exceeded our expectations.<,>结果超出了我们的预期。<,>Do not exceed the speed limit.<,>不要超速。<,>His performance exceeded all competitors.<,>他的表现超过了所有竞争对手。<,>ex(出)+ceed(走)→走出去→超过<,>proceed(v. 进行)/recede(v. 后退)

turbulence<,>/ˈtɜːbjələns/<,>/ˈtɜːrbjələns/<,>n.气流；骚乱<,>The plane experienced severe turbulence during the flight.<,>飞机在飞行中遇到了强烈气流。<,>Political turbulence affected the country's economy.<,>政治骚乱影响了该国的经济。<,>The river's turbulence made swimming dangerous.<,>湍急的河水使游泳变得危险。<,>turb(搅动)+ulence(名词后缀)→搅动状态→骚乱<,>turbid(adj. 浑浊的)/turbine(n. 涡轮机)

address<,>/əˈdres/<,>/əˈdres/<,>v.解决<,>We need to address this issue immediately.<,>我们需要立即解决这个问题。<,>The mayor addressed the crowd's concerns.<,>市长解决了民众的担忧。<,>The book addresses the problem of climate change.<,>这本书探讨了气候变化的问题。<,>ad(向)+dress(指向)→指向问题→解决<,>redress(v. 纠正)/addressee(n. 收件人)

trade<,>/treɪd/<,>/treɪd/<,>v.做买卖；交换<,>They trade goods with neighboring countries.<,>他们与邻国进行商品贸易。<,>He traded his old car for a new bicycle.<,>他用旧车换了一辆新自行车。<,>Stock trading requires careful analysis.<,>股票交易需要仔细分析。<,>trad(传递)+e→传递商品→贸易<,>trail(n. 小径)/tread(v. 踩踏)

deal<,>/diːl/<,>/diːl/<,>v.买卖毒品<,>He was arrested for dealing drugs.<,>他因贩卖毒品被捕。<,>The police are cracking down on drug dealing.<,>警方正在打击毒品交易。<,>She was accused of dealing in illegal substances.<,>她被指控贩卖非法物质。<,>deal(交易)→特指毒品交易<,>dealer(n. 经销商)/dial(v. 拨号)
hike<,>/haɪk/<,>/haɪk/<,>v.作长途徒步旅行<,>We decided to hike through the mountains this weekend.<,>我们决定这个周末徒步穿越山区。<,>She loves to hike in national parks.<,>她喜欢在国家公园里徒步旅行。<,>Hiking is a great way to stay fit.<,>徒步旅行是保持健康的好方法。<,>hi(嗨)+ke(客)→徒步旅行时打招呼<,>bike(n.自行车)/like(v.喜欢)/strike(v.打击)

action<,>/ˈækʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˈækʃən/<,>n.行动<,>He took immediate action to solve the problem.<,>他立即采取行动解决问题。<,>Actions speak louder than words.<,>行动胜于雄辩。<,>The movie is full of exciting action scenes.<,>这部电影充满了激动人心的动作场面。<,>act(行动)+ion(名词后缀)→行动<,>active(adj.活跃的)/actor(n.演员)/actual(adj.实际的)

resultant<,>/rɪˈzʌlt(ə)nt/<,>/rɪˈzʌltənt/<,>adj.作为结果而发生的<,>The resultant force caused the object to move.<,>合力使物体移动。<,>The resultant effect of the changes was positive.<,>这些变化产生的效果是积极的。<,>They studied the resultant data carefully.<,>他们仔细研究了结果数据。<,>result(结果)+ant(形容词后缀)→作为结果的<,>resistant(adj.抵抗的)/result(n.结果)/consultant(n.顾问)

consequent<,>/ˈkɒnsɪkw(ə)nt/<,>/ˈkɑːnsɪkwənt/<,>adj.作为结果的；必然的<,>The consequent rise in prices worried consumers.<,>随之而来的价格上涨让消费者担忧。<,>His illness was consequent upon poor nutrition.<,>他的疾病是营养不良的结果。<,>We must consider the consequent effects of this decision.<,>我们必须考虑这个决定的必然影响。<,>con(一起)+sequ(跟随)+ent→跟随而来的→必然的<,>sequence(n.顺序)/subsequent(adj.随后的)/consequence(n.后果)

composer<,>/kəmˈpəʊzə(r)/<,>/kəmˈpoʊzər/<,>n.作曲家<,>Mozart was a famous composer from Austria.<,>莫扎特是来自奥地利的著名作曲家。<,>The composer is working on a new symphony.<,>这位作曲家正在创作一部新的交响乐。<,>She aspires to be a film composer one day.<,>她渴望有一天能成为电影配乐作曲家。<,>compose(作曲)+er(人)→作曲家<,>composure(n.镇静)/composite(adj.复合的)/compost(n.堆肥)

slave<,>/sleɪv/<,>/sleɪv/<,>v.作苦工；奴役<,>They were forced to slave in the mines.<,>他们被迫在矿井里做苦工。<,>She slaved away at her desk all night.<,>她整晚都在书桌前辛苦工作。<,>Don't slave over the report - take breaks.<,>不要为报告做苦工，要休息。<,>slave(奴隶)→像奴隶一样工作<,>save(v.拯救)/shave(v.刮胡子)/sleeve(n.袖子)

grunt<,>/ɡrʌnt/<,>/ɡrʌnt/<,>v.作呼噜声；咕哝<,>The pig grunted loudly when it saw food.<,>猪看到食物时大声哼哼。<,>He just grunted in response to my question.<,>他只是咕哝着回答了我的问题。<,>Soldiers grunt as they carry heavy equipment.<,>士兵们搬运重装备时发出哼哼声。<,>gr(拟声)+unt→发出哼哼声<,>grant(v.授予)/grin(v.咧嘴笑)/grind(v.磨碎)

abide<,>/əˈbaɪd/<,>/əˈbaɪd/<,>v.忍受；遵守<,>I can't abide his rude behavior.<,>我无法忍受他粗鲁的行为。<,>We must abide by the rules of the game.<,>我们必须遵守游戏规则。<,>She abided patiently through the long speech.<,>她耐心地忍受了冗长的演讲。<,>a(加强)+bide(居住)→坚持住→忍受<,>aside(adv.在旁边)/abode(n.住所)/abide(v.遵守)

value<,>/ˈvæljuː/<,>/ˈvæljuː/<,>v.尊重，重视；估价<,>I value your opinion on this matter.<,>我重视你对此事的意见。<,>The jeweler valued the diamond at $10,000.<,>珠宝商估价这颗钻石价值1万美元。<,>We should value our time with family.<,>我们应该珍惜与家人在一起的时光。<,>val(价值)+ue→重视价值<,>valve(n.阀门)/vague(adj.模糊的)/volume(n.音量)

dignity<,>/ˈdɪɡnəti/<,>/ˈdɪɡnəti/<,>n.庄重；尊严；体面<,>She maintained her dignity throughout the trial.<,>她在整个审判过程中保持了尊严。<,>The elderly should be treated with dignity.<,>应该以尊重的态度对待老年人。<,>He lost his dignity when he got drunk at the party.<,>他在派对上喝醉时失去了体面。<,>dign(值得)+ity(名词后缀)→值得尊重→尊严<,>design(n.设计)/digital(adj.数字的)/indignant(adj.愤慨的)
outermost<,>/ˈaʊtəməʊst/<,>/ˈaʊtərˌmoʊst/<,>adj.最外面的/adj.最远的<,>The outermost layer of the Earth is called the crust.<,>地球的最外层被称为地壳。<,>He lives in the outermost part of the village.<,>他住在村子的最边缘。<,>The outermost planets in our solar system are gas giants.<,>我们太阳系最外围的行星是气态巨行星。<,>outer(外面的)+most(最)→最外面的<,>innermost(adj.最里面的)/uppermost(adj.最高的)

optimum<,>/ˈɒptɪməm/<,>/ˈɑːptɪməm/<,>adj.最优的/adj.最适宜的<,>This temperature is optimum for plant growth.<,>这个温度对植物生长最适宜。<,>We need to find the optimum solution to this problem.<,>我们需要找到这个问题的最佳解决方案。<,>The car performs at its optimum level when properly maintained.<,>汽车在适当保养时性能最佳。<,>opt(选择)+imum(最)→最优选择→最优的<,>optimal(adj.最佳的)/maximum(n.最大值)

initially<,>/ɪˈnɪʃəli/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃəli/<,>adv.最初/adv.开始<,>Initially, I thought the project would be easy.<,>最初，我以为这个项目会很容易。<,>She was initially hesitant to accept the offer.<,>她最初对接受这个提议犹豫不决。<,>The plan initially seemed perfect, but problems arose later.<,>这个计划最初看起来很完美，但后来出现了问题。<,>initial(最初的)+ly(副词后缀)→最初<,>originally(adv.最初)/finally(adv.最终)

makeup<,>/ˈmeɪkʌp/<,>/ˈmeɪkˌʌp/<,>n.化妆品/n.性格/n.构造/n.组成<,>She never leaves the house without wearing makeup.<,>她从不素颜出门。<,>The makeup of this committee needs to be more diverse.<,>这个委员会的组成需要更加多样化。<,>His cheerful makeup makes him popular among colleagues.<,>他开朗的性格使他在同事中很受欢迎。<,>make(制造)+up(向上)→化妆品<,>make-up(化妆品)/make out(理解)

integral<,>/ˈɪntɪɡrəl/<,>/ˈɪn.t̬ə.ɡrəl/<,>adj.作为组成部分的/adj.内置的<,>Teamwork is an integral part of our company culture.<,>团队合作是我们公司文化的重要组成部分。<,>The engine comes with integral safety features.<,>这个发动机配有内置的安全功能。<,>This chapter is integral to understanding the whole book.<,>这一章对于理解整本书至关重要。<,>integer(完整)+al(形容词后缀)→完整的部分→组成部分的<,>integrate(v.整合)/disintegrate(v.瓦解)

composition<,>/ˌkɒmpəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmpəˈzɪʃn/<,>n.组成/n.构成/n.结构<,>The composition of this alloy makes it very strong.<,>这种合金的组成使其非常坚固。<,>She is studying musical composition at university.<,>她在大学学习音乐作曲。<,>The composition of the painting is very balanced.<,>这幅画的构图非常平衡。<,>com(一起)+posit(放置)+ion→放在一起→组成<,>composite(adj.复合的)/decomposition(n.分解)

block<,>/blɒk/<,>/blɑːk/<,>n.阻塞/n.障碍物<,>There's a block in the pipe that needs to be cleared.<,>管道里有堵塞需要清理。<,>The protesters formed a human block on the road.<,>抗议者在路上组成了人墙。<,>Writer's block prevented him from finishing his novel.<,>写作障碍使他无法完成小说。<,>bl(阻挡)+ock→阻挡物→障碍<,>blockade(n.封锁)/blockbuster(n.大片)

damn<,>/dæm/<,>/dæm/<,>v.谴责<,>The critic damned the movie with faint praise.<,>评论家用敷衍的表扬谴责了这部电影。<,>He was damned by his own words.<,>他被自己的话所谴责。<,>The report damned the government's handling of the crisis.<,>这份报告谴责了政府对危机的处理。<,>dam(损害)+n→造成损害→谴责<,>dam(n.水坝)/condemn(v.谴责)

ample<,>/ˈæmpl/<,>/ˈæmpl/<,>adj.足够的/adj.宽敞的<,>There is ample evidence to support his claim.<,>有充分的证据支持他的主张。<,>The hotel room was ample for our needs.<,>酒店房间对我们的需求来说足够宽敞。<,>We have ample time to finish the project.<,>我们有足够的时间完成这个项目。<,>ampl(大的)+e→大的→足够的<,>sample(n.样品)/example(n.例子)

suffice<,>/səˈfaɪs/<,>/səˈfaɪs/<,>v.足够<,>A simple apology will suffice.<,>一个简单的道歉就足够了。<,>Two examples should suffice to illustrate the point.<,>两个例子足以说明这一点。<,>Our supplies will suffice for the entire trip.<,>我们的补给足够整个旅程使用。<,>suf(下面)+fic(做)+e→在下面做好→足够<,>sufficient(adj.足够的)/deficient(adj.不足的)
lease<,>/liːs/<,>/lis/<,>n.租约/n.契约/n.租契<,>They signed a lease for the apartment.<,>他们签署了公寓的租约。<,>The lease agreement is valid for one year.<,>这份租赁合同有效期为一年。<,>Breaking the lease may result in penalties.<,>违反租约可能会导致罚款。<,>lea(草地)+se(看作see)→看到草地就想租下来<,>release(v.释放/n.发行)/please(v.请/adj.高兴的)

charter<,>/ˈtʃɑːtə(r)/<,>/ˈtʃɑrtər/<,>v.包租(飞机、船等)<,>We chartered a yacht for our vacation.<,>我们包租了一艘游艇度假。<,>The company chartered a plane for the business trip.<,>公司包租了一架飞机出差。<,>They decided to charter a bus for the school trip.<,>他们决定为学校旅行包租一辆巴士。<,>chart(图表)+er→按图表规划包租<,>chapter(n.章节)/character(n.性格/n.角色)

headquarters<,>/ˌhedˈkwɔːtəz/<,>/ˈhɛdˌkwɔrtərz/<,>n.总部<,>The company's headquarters is in New York.<,>公司的总部在纽约。<,>Police headquarters received an anonymous call.<,>警察总部接到一个匿名电话。<,>The rebels attacked the military headquarters.<,>叛军袭击了军事总部。<,>head(头)+quarters(住处)→头头住的地方<,>headrest(n.头枕)/headway(n.进展)

executive<,>/ɪɡˈzekjətɪv/<,>/ɪɡˈzɛkjətɪv/<,>n.(机构或公司的)主管/n.经理<,>She was promoted to executive last year.<,>她去年被提升为主管。<,>The executives are having a meeting now.<,>高管们正在开会。<,>He is the chief executive of the company.<,>他是公司的首席执行官。<,>ex(出)+ecut(执行)+ive→执行事务的人<,>execution(n.执行)/executor(n.执行者)

main<,>/meɪn/<,>/men/<,>n.总管道/n.干线<,>Water was leaking from the main.<,>水从总管道漏出。<,>The main was damaged during construction.<,>施工期间干线被损坏了。<,>They are repairing the gas main.<,>他们正在修理煤气总管。<,>mai(看作may可能)+n→可能是主要管道<,>mane(n.鬃毛)/maim(v.使残废)

overall<,>/ˌəʊvərˈɔːl/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈɔl/<,>adj.总的<,>The overall situation is improving.<,>总体情况正在改善。<,>What's your overall impression?<,>你的总体印象如何？<,>The overall cost was higher than expected.<,>总成本比预期要高。<,>over(在...上)+all(全部)→在所有之上的<,>overage(n.超额/adj.超龄的)/overhaul(v.彻底检修)

conceit<,>/kənˈsiːt/<,>/kənˈsit/<,>n.自负/n.自高自大<,>His conceit made him unpopular.<,>他的自负使他不受欢迎。<,>She is full of conceit about her beauty.<,>她对自己的美貌非常自负。<,>His conceit blinded him to his faults.<,>他的自负让他看不到自己的缺点。<,>con(共同)+ceit(拿)→什么都想拿→自负<,>conceive(v.构思)/concept(n.概念)

ultraviolet<,>/ˌʌltrəˈvaɪələt/<,>/ˌʌltrəˈvaɪəlɪt/<,>adj.紫外(线)的<,>Ultraviolet rays can damage your skin.<,>紫外线会伤害你的皮肤。<,>This lamp emits ultraviolet light.<,>这盏灯发出紫外线。<,>Ultraviolet radiation is invisible to humans.<,>紫外线辐射是人眼看不见的。<,>ultra(超)+violet(紫色)→超过紫色的<,>infrared(adj.红外线的)/ultrasonic(adj.超声的)

descendant<,>/dɪˈsendənt/<,>/dɪˈsɛndənt/<,>n.子孙/n.后裔<,>He is a descendant of the royal family.<,>他是皇室的后裔。<,>Many Americans are descendants of immigrants.<,>许多美国人是移民的后代。<,>This tradition has been passed down to descendants.<,>这个传统已经传给了子孙后代。<,>de(向下)+scend(爬)+ant→向下爬的人→后代<,>ascendant(adj.上升的)/transcend(v.超越)

endow<,>/ɪnˈdaʊ/<,>/ɪnˈdaʊ/<,>v.资助/v.赋予<,>The university was endowed by a wealthy businessman.<,>这所大学由一位富商资助。<,>Nature has endowed her with great beauty.<,>大自然赋予了她惊人的美貌。<,>He endowed a scholarship for poor students.<,>他为贫困学生设立了奖学金。<,>en(使)+dow(给予)→给予资助<,>endorse(v.背书/v.赞同)/endure(v.忍受)
datum<,>/ˈdeɪtəm/<,>/ˈdætəm/<,>n.资料/n.数据/n.已知数<,>The datum for this research was collected over five years.<,>这项研究的数据收集历时五年。<,>Each datum in the database must be verified.<,>数据库中的每个数据都必须经过验证。<,>The survey provides important demographic data.<,>这项调查提供了重要的人口统计数据。<,>data的单数形式<,>data(n.数据)/date(n.日期)/debate(n.辩论)

qualification<,>/ˌkwɒlɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌkwɑːlɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.资格/n.学历<,>She has all the necessary qualifications for the job.<,>她具备这份工作所需的所有资格。<,>His academic qualifications are impressive.<,>他的学历令人印象深刻。<,>The course leads to a professional qualification.<,>这门课程可以获得专业资格。<,>qualify(使合格)+cation(名词后缀)<,>certification(n.认证)/quantification(n.量化)/qualitative(adj.定性的)

bourgeois<,>/ˈbʊəʒwɑː/<,>/bʊrˈʒwɑː/<,>adj.中产阶级的/adj.庸俗的/adj.资产阶级的<,>He had bourgeois tastes in art and music.<,>他在艺术和音乐方面有着中产阶级的品味。<,>The play satirizes bourgeois values.<,>这部戏剧讽刺了资产阶级的价值观。<,>Her bourgeois lifestyle was evident in her home decor.<,>她中产阶级的生活方式在她的家居装饰中显而易见。<,>源自法语"bourg"(城镇)+"geois"(居民)<,>bourgeoisie(n.资产阶级)/bohemian(adj.波西米亚的)/bourbon(n.波旁威士忌)

woodpecker<,>/ˈwʊdpekə(r)/<,>/ˈwʊdpekər/<,>n.啄木鸟<,>We heard a woodpecker tapping on the tree.<,>我们听到啄木鸟在树上啄木的声音。<,>The woodpecker's beak is specially adapted for drilling into wood.<,>啄木鸟的喙特别适合钻入木头。<,>A red-headed woodpecker visited our backyard today.<,>今天一只红头啄木鸟光顾了我们的后院。<,>wood(木头)+peck(啄)+er(者)→啄木者<,>woodcock(n.丘鹬)/woodchuck(n.土拨鼠)/woodcarver(n.木雕师)

bump<,>/bʌmp/<,>/bʌmp/<,>v.撞上<,>I bumped my head on the low doorway.<,>我的头撞到了低矮的门框上。<,>The car bumped into the fence.<,>汽车撞上了栅栏。<,>She bumped against the table in the dark.<,>她在黑暗中撞到了桌子。<,>拟声词，模拟碰撞的声音<,>jump(v.跳跃)/lump(n.肿块)/dump(v.倾倒)

crash<,>/kræʃ/<,>/kræʃ/<,>v.(发出巨响的)猛撞<,>The two cars crashed at the intersection.<,>两辆车在十字路口相撞。<,>A plane crashed in the mountains yesterday.<,>昨天一架飞机在山中坠毁。<,>He crashed his bike into a tree.<,>他骑着自行车猛撞上了一棵树。<,>拟声词，模拟撞击的巨响<,>smash(v.粉碎)/clash(v.冲突)/crush(v.压碎)

way<,>/weɪ/<,>/weɪ/<,>n.(特定的)状态/n.状况<,>Things are in a bad way at the company.<,>公司的情况很糟糕。<,>She's in no way responsible for the accident.<,>她绝不应对这起事故负责。<,>The project is under way and should be finished soon.<,>项目正在进行中，应该很快就会完成。<,>原义为"道路"，引申为"状态"<,>weigh(v.称重)/whey(n.乳清)/wary(adj.谨慎的)

superb<,>/suːˈpɜːb/<,>/suːˈpɜːrb/<,>adj.壮丽的/adj.超等的<,>The view from the mountaintop was superb.<,>从山顶看到的景色壮丽无比。<,>She gave a superb performance in the play.<,>她在剧中表现出色。<,>The restaurant offers superb service and food.<,>这家餐厅提供一流的服务和美食。<,>super(超级)+b→超级的<,>super(adj.超级的)/superior(adj.优越的)/supreme(adj.至高无上的)

ornament<,>/ˈɔːnəmənt/<,>/ˈɔːrnəmənt/<,>n.装饰物<,>The Christmas tree was covered with ornaments.<,>圣诞树上挂满了装饰品。<,>She wore a simple dress with no ornament.<,>她穿了一件没有任何装饰的简单连衣裙。<,>The building's facade has elaborate stone ornaments.<,>建筑物的外立面有精美的石雕装饰。<,>orna(装饰)+ment(名词后缀)<,>adornment(n.装饰)/ornate(adj.华丽的)/ornithology(n.鸟类学)

decorative<,>/ˈdekərətɪv/<,>/ˈdekəreɪtɪv/<,>adj.装饰的/adj.可作装饰的<,>The room has many decorative elements.<,>这个房间有很多装饰元素。<,>She bought some decorative pillows for the sofa.<,>她为沙发买了一些装饰靠垫。<,>The plate is more decorative than functional.<,>这个盘子装饰性大于实用性。<,>decorate(装饰)+ive(形容词后缀)<,>decor(n.装饰)/decoration(n.装饰)/decorum(n.礼节)
ornamental<,>/ˌɔːnəˈment(ə)l/<,>/ˌɔrnəˈmɛntl/<,>adj.装饰的<,>The garden is full of ornamental plants.<,>花园里种满了观赏植物。<,>She wore an ornamental brooch on her dress.<,>她在裙子上别了一枚装饰胸针。<,>The ornamental details on the building are exquisite.<,>建筑物上的装饰细节非常精致。<,>ornament(装饰)+al(形容词后缀)→装饰的<,>ornament(n.装饰品)/ornate(adj.华丽的)/decorative(adj.装饰性的)  

mount<,>/maʊnt/<,>/maʊnt/<,>v.装配<,>He mounted the TV on the wall.<,>他把电视机安装在墙上。<,>The camera was mounted on a tripod.<,>相机被安装在三脚架上。<,>They mounted a new engine in the car.<,>他们给汽车装配了一台新引擎。<,>mount(山)→像山一样稳固地安装→装配<,>amount(n.数量)/mound(n.土堆)/dismount(v.拆卸)  

shipment<,>/ˈʃɪpmənt/<,>/ˈʃɪpmənt/<,>n.装载的货物；装货<,>The shipment of goods arrived late.<,>这批货物迟到了。<,>They prepared the shipment for export.<,>他们为出口准备好了货物。<,>The shipment was delayed due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，装货被延误了。<,>ship(船)+ment(名词后缀)→用船运的货物→装载的货物<,>ship(v.运输)/cargo(n.货物)/freight(n.货运)  

can<,>/kæn/<,>/kæn/<,>v.装罐头<,>They can fresh fruits in the summer.<,>他们在夏天把新鲜水果装罐。<,>This factory cans fish for export.<,>这家工厂把鱼装罐出口。<,>She learned how to can vegetables from her grandmother.<,>她从祖母那里学会了如何将蔬菜装罐。<,>can(容器)→把食物装入容器→装罐头<,>can(n.罐头)/tin(n.锡罐)/jar(n.广口瓶)  

array<,>/əˈreɪ/<,>/əˈreɪ/<,>v.（美观地）排列/n.陈列<,>The books were arrayed neatly on the shelf.<,>书本整齐地排列在书架上。<,>An array of delicious food was displayed at the party.<,>聚会上陈列着各式各样的美食。<,>The store has a beautiful array of jewelry.<,>商店里陈列着漂亮的珠宝。<,>ar(加强)+ray(光线)→像光线一样整齐排列→排列<,>arrange(v.安排)/display(n.展示)/assortment(n.分类)  

diversion<,>/daɪˈvɜːʃ(ə)n/<,>/daɪˈvɜːrʒ(ə)n/<,>n.转移；改道；娱乐<,>The traffic diversion caused delays.<,>交通改道导致了延误。<,>Reading is his favorite diversion.<,>阅读是他最喜欢的消遣。<,>The river diversion project was completed last year.<,>河流改道工程去年完成了。<,>di(分开)+vers(转)+ion(名词后缀)→转向不同方向→转移<,>diverse(adj.多样的)/divert(v.转移)/conversion(n.转换)  

convert<,>/kənˈvɜːt/<,>/kənˈvɜːrt/<,>v.转变，改变，变换<,>They converted the garage into a bedroom.<,>他们把车库改造成了卧室。<,>Solar panels convert sunlight into electricity.<,>太阳能板将阳光转化为电能。<,>He converted to Buddhism last year.<,>他去年改信了佛教。<,>con(共同)+vert(转)→共同转变→转换<,>invert(v.倒置)/revert(v.恢复)/divert(v.转移)  

transition<,>/trænˈzɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/trænˈzɪʃ(ə)n/<,>n.转变，变迁；过渡<,>The transition from childhood to adulthood can be difficult.<,>从童年到成年的过渡可能很困难。<,>The company is in transition to new management.<,>公司正在向新的管理层过渡。<,>Spring is a transition between winter and summer.<,>春天是冬天和夏天之间的过渡季节。<,>trans(跨越)+it(走)+ion(名词后缀)→跨越的过程→过渡<,>transit(n.运输)/transaction(n.交易)/transmission(n.传输)  

torque<,>/tɔːk/<,>/tɔːrk/<,>n.转（力）矩，扭（力）矩<,>The engine produces a high torque at low speeds.<,>这台发动机在低速时产生高扭矩。<,>Torque is important for vehicle acceleration.<,>扭矩对车辆加速很重要。<,>He adjusted the torque on the bolts.<,>他调整了螺栓的扭矩。<,>torq(扭转)+ue→扭转的力→扭矩<,>torsion(n.扭转)/torture(n.折磨)/tortuous(adj.曲折的)  

box<,>/bɒks/<,>/bɑːks/<,>n.（法庭的）专席<,>The witness stood in the box to give evidence.<,>证人站在专席上作证。<,>The jury box was full during the trial.<,>审判期间陪审团专席坐满了人。<,>The defendant's box was positioned near the judge.<,>被告专席被安排在法官附近。<,>box(盒子)→像盒子一样封闭的区域→专席<,>bench(n.法官席)/dock(n.被告席)/stand(n.证人席)
workshop<,>/ˈwɜːkʃɒp/<,>/ˈwɜrkʃɑp/<,>n.专题讨论会<,>She attended a creative writing workshop last weekend.<,>她上周末参加了一个创意写作专题讨论会。<,>The workshop on climate change was very informative.<,>关于气候变化的专题讨论会信息量很大。<,>He organized a photography workshop for beginners.<,>他为初学者组织了一个摄影专题讨论会。<,>work(工作)+shop(场所)→工作场所→专题讨论会<,>workshop(n.车间)/seminar(n.研讨会)/forum(n.论坛)

patent<,>/ˈpeɪtnt/<,>/ˈpætnt/<,>adj.专利的/n.专利<,>The company holds the patent for this innovative technology.<,>这家公司持有这项创新技术的专利。<,>He applied for a patent to protect his invention.<,>他申请了专利以保护他的发明。<,>The patent law prevents others from copying this design.<,>专利法防止他人抄袭这个设计。<,>pat(公开)+ent(形容词后缀)→公开的→专利的<,>latent(adj.潜在的)/potent(adj.强有力的)/patient(adj.耐心的)

clutch<,>/klʌtʃ/<,>/klʌtʃ/<,>v.抓住/v.掌握/v.攫取<,>She clutched her purse tightly in the crowded subway.<,>在拥挤的地铁里她紧紧抓住钱包。<,>The eagle clutched its prey with its sharp talons.<,>老鹰用锋利的爪子抓住了猎物。<,>He clutched at the opportunity to study abroad.<,>他抓住了出国留学的机会。<,>cl(抓紧)+utch(动作)→抓紧的动作→抓住<,>crutch(n.拐杖)/clench(v.紧握)/grasp(v.抓住)
