nest<,>/nest/<,>/nɛst/<,>v.筑巢/v.为...筑巢<,>The birds are nesting in the old oak tree.<,>鸟儿们正在那棵老橡树上筑巢。<,>She nested the fragile china carefully in the box.<,>她小心翼翼地把易碎的瓷器放在盒子里。<,>The software allows you to nest functions within each other.<,>这个软件允许你将函数嵌套使用。<,>n(鸟)+est(最高级)→鸟最安全的地方→巢<,>net(n.网)/next(adj.下一个)/vest(n.背心)

coin<,>/kɔɪn/<,>/kɔɪn/<,>v.铸造(硬币)<,>The government decided to coin new commemorative coins.<,>政府决定铸造新的纪念币。<,>He coined the term "cyberspace" in his novel.<,>他在小说中创造了"网络空间"这个词。<,>Ancient civilizations often coined money with the ruler's image.<,>古代文明经常铸造带有统治者形象的货币。<,>co(共同)+in(进入)→共同进入流通→铸造硬币<,>corn(n.玉米)/join(v.加入)/coil(n.线圈)

noted<,>/ˈnəʊtɪd/<,>/ˈnoʊtɪd/<,>adj.著名的/adj.知名的<,>She is a noted expert in marine biology.<,>她是海洋生物学领域的著名专家。<,>The restaurant is noted for its authentic Italian cuisine.<,>这家餐厅以地道的意大利菜闻名。<,>His noted achievements earned him international recognition.<,>他著名的成就为他赢得了国际认可。<,>note(注意)+ed(形容词后缀)→被注意的→著名的<,>noted(adj.著名的)/notable(adj.值得注意的)/noticeable(adj.明显的)

watchful<,>/ˈwɒtʃfʊl/<,>/ˈwɑtʃfəl/<,>adj.注意的/adj.警惕的<,>Be watchful for any suspicious activity in the neighborhood.<,>要警惕社区里的任何可疑活动。<,>The mother kept a watchful eye on her playing children.<,>母亲密切注视着她玩耍的孩子们。<,>The security guard remained watchful throughout the night.<,>保安整夜保持警惕。<,>watch(看)+ful(充满)→充满关注的→警惕的<,>watchful(adj.警惕的)/careful(adj.小心的)/wakeful(adj.清醒的)

inject<,>/ɪnˈdʒekt/<,>/ɪnˈdʒɛkt/<,>v.注射/v.注满/v.喷射<,>The doctor will inject the vaccine into your arm.<,>医生会把疫苗注射到你的手臂里。<,>They injected new funds into the failing business.<,>他们向这家濒临倒闭的企业注入了新资金。<,>The comedian injected humor into his serious speech.<,>这位喜剧演员在他严肃的演讲中注入了幽默。<,>in(进入)+ject(投掷)→投掷进去→注射<,>inject(v.注射)/reject(v.拒绝)/project(v.投射)

storage<,>/ˈstɔːrɪdʒ/<,>/ˈstɔrɪdʒ/<,>n.贮藏/n.保管<,>We need more storage space for our winter clothes.<,>我们需要更多空间来存放冬装。<,>The data is kept in cloud storage for easy access.<,>数据保存在云存储中以方便访问。<,>Proper food storage prevents spoilage.<,>适当的食物储存可以防止变质。<,>store(储存)+age(名词后缀)→储存的地方→贮藏<,>storage(n.储存)/storeroom(n.储藏室)/stockage(n.库存)

position<,>/pəˈzɪʃn/<,>/pəˈzɪʃən/<,>n.形势/n.主张/n.立场<,>What is your position on this controversial issue?<,>你对这个有争议的问题持什么立场？<,>The company's financial position has improved this quarter.<,>公司的财务状况本季度有所改善。<,>He took up a teaching position at the university.<,>他在大学里担任了教职。<,>posit(放置)+ion(名词后缀)→放置的状态→位置/立场<,>position(n.位置)/disposition(n.性情)/composition(n.组成)
metropolitan<,>/ˌmetrəˈpɒlɪt(ə)n/<,>/ˌmetrəˈpɑːlɪt(ə)n/<,>adj.主要都市的/n.(东正教和天主教的)大主教<,>London is a metropolitan city with a rich cultural heritage.<,>伦敦是一个拥有丰富文化遗产的大都市。<,>The metropolitan area is known for its vibrant nightlife.<,>这个都市区以其充满活力的夜生活而闻名。<,>The metropolitan bishop presided over the ceremony.<,>大主教主持了仪式。<,>metro(地铁)+politan(城市的)→大都市的<,>cosmopolitan(adj.世界性的)/municipal(adj.市政的)

principally<,>/ˈprɪnsɪp(ə)li/<,>/ˈprɪnsəpli/<,>adv.主要，大抵<,>The company is principally involved in software development.<,>该公司主要从事软件开发。<,>He is principally known for his contributions to physics.<,>他主要以对物理学的贡献而闻名。<,>The book is principally aimed at young readers.<,>这本书主要面向年轻读者。<,>principal(主要的)+ly(副词后缀)→主要地<,>principality(n.公国)/principle(n.原则)

stalk<,>/stɔːk/<,>/stɔk/<,>n.主茎，叶柄<,>The flower has a long green stalk.<,>这朵花有一根长长的绿色茎。<,>He carefully cut the stalk of the plant.<,>他小心地切断了植物的茎。<,>The corn stalks swayed in the wind.<,>玉米秆在风中摇摆。<,>stalk(茎)与stock(库存)发音相似<,>stem(n.茎)/trunk(n.树干)

preside<,>/prɪˈzaɪd/<,>/prɪˈzaɪd/<,>v.主持；主奏<,>She will preside over the meeting tomorrow.<,>她将主持明天的会议。<,>The famous pianist presided at the concert.<,>这位著名钢琴家在音乐会上担任主奏。<,>The judge presided over the court proceedings.<,>法官主持了法庭诉讼程序。<,>pre(前)+side(坐)→坐在前面→主持<,>reside(v.居住)/subside(v.平息)

eject<,>/ɪˈdʒekt/<,>/ɪˈdʒɛkt/<,>v.逐出，排斥；喷射<,>The volcano ejected a huge cloud of ash.<,>火山喷出了大量的火山灰。<,>He was ejected from the bar for causing trouble.<,>他因闹事被赶出了酒吧。<,>The machine automatically ejects the finished product.<,>机器自动弹出成品。<,>e(出)+ject(投掷)→投掷出去→喷射<,>inject(v.注射)/reject(v.拒绝)

bamboo<,>/bæmˈbuː/<,>/bæmˈbu/<,>n.竹；竹杆，竹棍<,>The panda was eating bamboo leaves.<,>熊猫正在吃竹叶。<,>They built a fence using bamboo poles.<,>他们用竹竿建了一道篱笆。<,>Bamboo grows very quickly in tropical climates.<,>竹子在热带气候下生长得非常快。<,>bam(拟声)+boo→竹子生长时的声音<,>bamboo与bambino(意大利语：婴儿)相似

jewellery<,>/ˈdʒuːəlri/<,>/ˈdʒuəlri/<,>n.珠宝，珠宝饰物<,>She wore beautiful jewellery to the party.<,>她戴着漂亮的珠宝去参加派对。<,>The jewellery store was robbed last night.<,>昨晚珠宝店被抢劫了。<,>He gave her a piece of jewellery for their anniversary.<,>他为他们的周年纪念日送了她一件珠宝。<,>jewel(宝石)+ry(集合名词后缀)→珠宝<,>jewelry(美式拼写)/jeweller(珠宝商)

wrinkle<,>/ˈrɪŋk(ə)l/<,>/ˈrɪŋkəl/<,>n.皱纹/vt.使起皱纹<,>She has wrinkles around her eyes when she smiles.<,>她笑的时候眼角会有皱纹。<,>Don't wrinkle your new dress.<,>别把你的新裙子弄皱了。<,>The paper wrinkled when it got wet.<,>纸湿了就起皱了。<,>wrink(皱)+le(小)→小皱纹<,>crinkle(v.使沙沙作响)/twinkle(v.闪烁)

axial<,>/ˈæksɪəl/<,>/ˈæksiəl/<,>adj.轴的；轴向的<,>The machine has an axial rotation mechanism.<,>这台机器有一个轴向旋转机构。<,>They studied the axial tilt of the Earth.<,>他们研究了地球的轴向倾斜。<,>The engineer checked the axial alignment of the parts.<,>工程师检查了零件的轴向对齐。<,>axi(轴)+al(形容词后缀)→轴向的<,>axiom(n.公理)/axle(n.车轴)

axis<,>/ˈæksɪs/<,>/ˈæksɪs/<,>n.轴，轴线<,>The Earth rotates on its axis.<,>地球绕地轴旋转。<,>The graph has an x-axis and a y-axis.<,>图表有x轴和y轴。<,>The alliance formed an axis of power.<,>这个联盟形成了一个权力轴心。<,>axi(轴)+s→轴线<,>axes(axis的复数)/access(n.入口)
ambient<,>/ˈæmbiənt/<,>/ˈæmbiənt/<,>adj.周围的/adj.包围着的<,>The ambient temperature in the room was comfortable.<,>房间里的环境温度很舒适。<,>She loves the ambient lighting in the café.<,>她喜欢咖啡馆里的氛围灯光。<,>The music created an ambient atmosphere.<,>音乐营造了一种环绕的氛围。<,>ambi(周围)+ent(形容词后缀)→周围的<,>ambition(n.野心)/ambiguous(adj.模棱两可的)  

periodic<,>/ˌpɪəriˈɒdɪk/<,>/ˌpɪriˈɑːdɪk/<,>adj.周期的/adj.一定时期的<,>The periodic table organizes all known elements.<,>周期表整理了所有已知元素。<,>He makes periodic visits to his grandparents.<,>他定期去看望祖父母。<,>The magazine publishes periodic updates on the topic.<,>该杂志定期发布关于该主题的更新。<,>period(周期)+ic(形容词后缀)→周期的<,>periodical(n.期刊)/episodic(adj.偶尔发生的)  

anniversary<,>/ˌænɪˈvɜːsəri/<,>/ˌænɪˈvɜːrsəri/<,>n.周年纪念日<,>They celebrated their 10th wedding anniversary.<,>他们庆祝了结婚十周年纪念日。<,>The company marked its 50th anniversary with a big party.<,>公司举办了一场盛大的派对庆祝成立50周年。<,>Today is the anniversary of our first meeting.<,>今天是我们第一次见面的纪念日。<,>anni(年)+vers(转)+ary(名词后缀)→一年转一次→周年纪念<,>annual(adj.每年的)/university(n.大学)  

peripheral<,>/pəˈrɪfərəl/<,>/pəˈrɪfərəl/<,>adj.外围的/adj.末梢的<,>The peripheral devices include the keyboard and mouse.<,>外围设备包括键盘和鼠标。<,>He has some peripheral vision loss.<,>他的周边视力有些丧失。<,>The issue is peripheral to the main discussion.<,>这个问题是主要讨论的外围问题。<,>peri(周围)+pher(携带)+al(形容词后缀)→外围的<,>perimeter(n.周长)/periphery(n.外围)  

perimeter<,>/pəˈrɪmɪtə(r)/<,>/pəˈrɪmɪtər/<,>n.周（边）/n.周长<,>The soldiers guarded the perimeter of the camp.<,>士兵们守卫着营地的周边。<,>Calculate the perimeter of the rectangle.<,>计算这个长方形的周长。<,>A fence marks the perimeter of the property.<,>栅栏标出了地产的边界。<,>peri(周围)+meter(测量)→测量周围→周长<,>parameter(n.参数)/diameter(n.直径)  

anybody<,>/ˈenibɒdi/<,>/ˈenibɑːdi/<,>n.重要人物<,>Is anybody here a doctor?<,>这里有医生吗？<,>She isn't just anybody—she's the CEO.<,>她不是一般人，她是CEO。<,>If anybody can do it, it's you.<,>如果有人能做到，那就是你。<,>any(任何)+body(人)→任何人→重要人物<,>nobody(n.小人物)/somebody(n.大人物)  

responsible<,>/rɪˈspɒnsəbl/<,>/rɪˈspɑːnsəbl/<,>adj.可靠的/adj.责任重大的<,>She is responsible for the project's success.<,>她对项目的成功负责。<,>He's a very responsible employee.<,>他是个非常可靠的员工。<,>This is a responsible position.<,>这是一个责任重大的职位。<,>re(回)+spons(承诺)+ible(形容词后缀)→能承诺的→可靠的<,>response(n.回应)/responsive(adj.反应迅速的)  

consequence<,>/ˈkɒnsɪkwəns/<,>/ˈkɑːnsɪkwens/<,>n.重要（性）/n.重大意义<,>This decision will have serious consequences.<,>这个决定将产生严重后果。<,>He is a man of consequence in the industry.<,>他是业内举足轻重的人物。<,>The consequences of global warming are alarming.<,>全球变暖的后果令人担忧。<,>con(共同)+sequ(跟随)+ence(名词后缀)→跟随而来的结果→重要性<,>sequence(n.顺序)/subsequent(adj.随后的)  

category<,>/ˈkætəɡəri/<,>/ˈkætəɡɔːri/<,>n.种类/n.类目/n.范畴<,>The books are divided into different categories.<,>这些书被分成不同的类别。<,>This product falls under the luxury category.<,>这个产品属于奢侈品类别。<,>She won in the best actress category.<,>她赢得了最佳女演员奖项。<,>cate(完全)+gor(聚集)+y(名词后缀)→完全聚集→类别<,>catalogue(n.目录)/cater(v.迎合)  

species<,>/ˈspiːʃiːz/<,>/ˈspiːʃiːz/<,>n.种/n.物种/n.种类<,>This forest is home to many endangered species.<,>这片森林是许多濒危物种的家园。<,>Humans are a highly intelligent species.<,>人类是一种高度智慧的物种。<,>Scientists discovered a new species of butterfly.<,>科学家发现了一种新的蝴蝶物种。<,>speci(外观)+es(名词后缀)→外观相同的一类→物种<,>special(adj.特别的)/specific(adj.特定的)
hearty<,>/ˈhɑːti/<,>/ˈhɑːrti/<,>adj.热情友好的/adj.丰盛的<,>He gave me a hearty welcome.<,>他热情地欢迎了我。<,>We enjoyed a hearty meal after the long hike.<,>长途徒步后，我们享用了一顿丰盛的饭菜。<,>Her hearty laughter filled the room.<,>她爽朗的笑声充满了整个房间。<,>heart(心)+y(形容词后缀)→发自内心的→热情的<,>hardy(adj.强壮的)/hearty(adj.热情的)  

neutron<,>/ˈnjuːtrɒn/<,>/ˈnuːtrɑːn/<,>n.中子<,>Neutrons have no electric charge.<,>中子不带电荷。<,>The nucleus contains protons and neutrons.<,>原子核包含质子和中子。<,>Neutron stars are incredibly dense.<,>中子星的密度极高。<,>neutr(中性)+on(基本粒子)→中子<,>proton(n.质子)/electron(n.电子)  

intermediate<,>/ˌɪntəˈmiːdiət/<,>/ˌɪntərˈmiːdiət/<,>n.中间体/n.调解人<,>He acted as an intermediate between the two parties.<,>他充当了两方之间的调解人。<,>This compound is an important chemical intermediate.<,>这种化合物是一种重要的化学中间体。<,>The course is designed for intermediate learners.<,>这门课程是为中级学习者设计的。<,>inter(在...之间)+medi(中间)+ate→中间的<,>immediate(adj.立即的)/intermediary(n.中介)  

proton<,>/ˈprəʊtɒn/<,>/ˈproʊtɑːn/<,>n.质子/n.氕核<,>A proton has a positive charge.<,>质子带正电荷。<,>The number of protons determines the element.<,>质子数决定元素种类。<,>Proton therapy is used in cancer treatment.<,>质子疗法用于癌症治疗。<,>prot(第一)+on(基本粒子)→质子<,>neutron(n.中子)/electron(n.电子)  

qualitative<,>/ˈkwɒlɪtətɪv/<,>/ˈkwɑːlɪteɪtɪv/<,>adj.质的/adj.定性的<,>We need qualitative analysis of the data.<,>我们需要对数据进行定性分析。<,>There was a qualitative improvement in their work.<,>他们的工作有了质的提升。<,>The research focuses on qualitative differences.<,>这项研究关注质的差异。<,>qualit(质量)+ative(形容词后缀)→质的<,>quantitative(adj.定量的)/quality(n.质量)  

fabricate<,>/ˈfæbrɪkeɪt/<,>/ˈfæbrɪkeɪt/<,>v.捏造/v.制作<,>He fabricated an excuse for being late.<,>他为迟到编造了一个借口。<,>This company fabricates aircraft parts.<,>这家公司制造飞机零件。<,>The story was completely fabricated.<,>这个故事完全是捏造的。<,>fabric(结构)+ate(动词后缀)→制作<,>fabric(n.织物)/fabrication(n.制造)  

fabrication<,>/ˌfæbrɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌfæbrɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.捏造/n.制作<,>The document turned out to be a fabrication.<,>这份文件原来是伪造的。<,>Metal fabrication requires precision.<,>金属加工需要精确度。<,>He was accused of fabrication of evidence.<,>他被指控伪造证据。<,>fabric(结构)+ation(名词后缀)→制作<,>fabricate(v.制造)/fable(n.寓言)  

volunteer<,>/ˌvɒlənˈtɪə(r)/<,>/ˌvɑːlənˈtɪr/<,>n.志愿者/v.志愿<,>She works as a volunteer at the hospital.<,>她在医院做志愿者。<,>He volunteered to help with the project.<,>他自愿帮忙这个项目。<,>Many volunteers participated in the rescue.<,>许多志愿者参加了救援。<,>volunt(意愿)+eer(人)→自愿者<,>voluntary(adj.自愿的)/volunteer(n.志愿者)  

rebuke<,>/rɪˈbjuːk/<,>/rɪˈbjuːk/<,>v.指责/v.非难/v.斥责<,>The teacher rebuked him for cheating.<,>老师因他作弊而斥责他。<,>She received a stern rebuke from her boss.<,>她受到了老板的严厉指责。<,>His actions drew rebukes from the public.<,>他的行为招致了公众的谴责。<,>re(回)+buke(打)→打回去→斥责<,>rebuff(v.断然拒绝)/reproach(v.责备)  

indicative<,>/ɪnˈdɪkətɪv/<,>/ɪnˈdɪkətɪv/<,>adj.指示的/adj.陈述的<,>His tone was indicative of anger.<,>他的语气显示出愤怒。<,>This is indicative of a larger problem.<,>这表明了一个更大的问题。<,>The indicative mood is used for statements.<,>陈述语气用于陈述事实。<,>indicat(指示)+ive(形容词后缀)→指示的<,>indicate(v.指示)/indicative(adj.指示的)
denote<,>/dɪˈnəʊt/<,>/dɪˈnoʊt/<,>v.指示/v.意味着<,>The red light denotes danger.<,>红灯表示危险。<,>In mathematics, 'x' often denotes an unknown quantity.<,>在数学中，"x"通常代表未知数。<,>His silence denoted his disapproval.<,>他的沉默表示他不赞成。<,>de(向下)+note(标记)→向下标记→指示<,>connote(v.隐含/v.暗示)/annotate(v.注释/v.评注)

instructor<,>/ɪnˈstrʌktə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈstrʌktər/<,>n.指导者/n.教员<,>The driving instructor was very patient with me.<,>驾驶教练对我非常耐心。<,>She works as a yoga instructor at the local gym.<,>她在当地健身房担任瑜伽教练。<,>The instructor demonstrated the proper technique.<,>指导者示范了正确的技巧。<,>in(进入)+struct(建造)+or(人)→指导建造的人→指导者<,>educator(n.教育家)/tutor(n.导师/n.家庭教师)

designate<,>/ˈdezɪɡneɪt/<,>/ˈdɛzɪɡˌneɪt/<,>v.指定/v.指示/v.指明<,>They designated him as team leader.<,>他们指定他为团队领导。<,>The red line designates the boundary.<,>红线标明了边界。<,>This area is designated for parking only.<,>这个区域专门用于停车。<,>de(加强)+sign(标记)+ate(动词后缀)→做标记→指定<,>assign(v.分配/v.指派)/resign(v.辞职)

colonial<,>/kəˈləʊniəl/<,>/kəˈloʊniəl/<,>adj.殖民地的/adj.殖民的<,>The country has many colonial buildings.<,>这个国家有许多殖民时期的建筑。<,>They studied the colonial history of America.<,>他们研究了美国的殖民历史。<,>The colonial power exploited the local resources.<,>殖民国家剥削了当地资源。<,>colony(殖民地)+al(形容词后缀)→殖民地的<,>colonize(v.殖民)/colonist(n.殖民者)

vocation<,>/vəʊˈkeɪʃn/<,>/voʊˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.职业/n.行业<,>Teaching is more than a job; it's a vocation.<,>教学不仅仅是一份工作，更是一种使命。<,>He found his vocation in medicine.<,>他在医学领域找到了自己的职业。<,>She has a true vocation for nursing.<,>她天生适合做护士。<,>voc(声音)+ation→听从内心的声音→职业<,>vacation(n.假期)/avocation(n.副业/n.业余爱好)

notable<,>/ˈnəʊtəbl/<,>/ˈnoʊtəbl/<,>adj.值得注意的/adj.著名的<,>She is a notable scientist in her field.<,>她是该领域著名的科学家。<,>There were several notable achievements this year.<,>今年有几项值得注意的成就。<,>The museum has many notable paintings.<,>博物馆有许多著名的画作。<,>note(注意)+able(能够)→值得注意的<,>noticeable(adj.显而易见的)/notorious(adj.臭名昭著的)

merit<,>/ˈmerɪt/<,>/ˈmɛrɪt/<,>v.值得/v.应受赏(罚)<,>His suggestion merits serious consideration.<,>他的建议值得认真考虑。<,>The case merits further investigation.<,>这个案件需要进一步调查。<,>She certainly merits a promotion.<,>她确实应该得到晋升。<,>mer(获得)+it→值得获得<,>demerit(n.缺点/n.过失)/inherit(v.继承)

weaver<,>/ˈwiːvə(r)/<,>/ˈwiːvər/<,>n.织布工/n.编织者<,>The weaver created beautiful tapestries.<,>织布工制作了美丽的挂毯。<,>She learned the art from a master weaver.<,>她从一位编织大师那里学习了这门艺术。<,>The weaver's hands moved swiftly across the loom.<,>织布工的手在织布机上快速移动。<,>weave(编织)+er(人)→编织的人<,>waver(v.摇摆/v.犹豫)/beaver(n.海狸)

brace<,>/breɪs/<,>/breɪs/<,>n.支柱/v.拉紧/v.撑牢<,>He wore a brace on his injured knee.<,>他在受伤的膝盖上戴了护具。<,>Brace yourself for some bad news.<,>做好心理准备，有个坏消息。<,>The workers braced the wall with wooden beams.<,>工人们用木梁支撑墙壁。<,>b(像支架)+race(比赛)→比赛用的支架→支柱<,>embrace(v.拥抱/n.包围)/trace(v.追踪/n.痕迹)

check<,>/tʃek/<,>/tʃɛk/<,>n.支票/n.帐单<,>He wrote a check for $100.<,>他开了一张100美元的支票。<,>Could we have the check, please?<,>请给我们账单好吗？<,>I'll pay by check, not cash.<,>我要用支票支付，不用现金。<,>che(车)+ck(存款)→车款存款→支票<,>cheque(n.支票，英式拼写)/chick(n.小鸡)
second<,>/ˈsɛkənd/<,>/ˈsɛkənd/<,>v.支持<,>I second the proposal to improve the working conditions.<,>我支持改善工作条件的提议。<,>She seconded his motion during the meeting.<,>她在会议上附议了他的动议。<,>Can I second the idea of having a team outing?<,>我可以支持团队出游的想法吗？<,>sec(跟随)+ond→跟随别人→支持<,>second(n.秒/adj.第二的)/secondary(adj.次要的)/secondhand(adj.二手的)

bearing<,>/ˈbɛərɪŋ/<,>/ˈbɛrɪŋ/<,>n.方位/n.轴承/n.忍受<,>The compass helps in determining the bearing of the ship.<,>指南针有助于确定船的方位。<,>The machine's bearing needs to be replaced.<,>机器的轴承需要更换。<,>She showed great bearing under pressure.<,>她在压力下表现出极大的忍耐力。<,>bear(承受)+ing→承受的东西→轴承<,>bearing(n.举止)/bearing(n.关系)/bearing(n.生育)

symptom<,>/ˈsɪmptəm/<,>/ˈsɪmptəm/<,>n.症状/n.征兆<,>Fever is a common symptom of the flu.<,>发烧是流感的常见症状。<,>The sudden drop in sales is a symptom of a larger problem.<,>销售额的突然下降是一个更大问题的征兆。<,>He ignored the early symptoms of the disease.<,>他忽视了疾病的早期症状。<,>sym(共同)+ptom(现象)→共同的现象→症状<,>symptom(n.症状)/syndrome(n.综合征)/asymptomatic(adj.无症状的)

regime<,>/reɪˈʒiːm/<,>/rəˈʒiːm/<,>n.政权/n.制度<,>The new regime implemented several reforms.<,>新政权实施了几项改革。<,>The fitness regime helped her lose weight.<,>健身制度帮助她减轻了体重。<,>The country is under a military regime.<,>该国处于军事政权统治下。<,>reg(统治)+ime→统治方式→政权<,>regimen(n.养生法)/regiment(n.团/v.严格控制)/regal(adj.帝王的)

politics<,>/ˈpɒlɪtɪks/<,>/ˈpɑːlɪtɪks/<,>n.政纲/n.政见<,>His politics are quite conservative.<,>他的政见相当保守。<,>She entered politics at a young age.<,>她年轻时进入了政界。<,>The party's politics focus on economic reform.<,>该党的政纲侧重于经济改革。<,>polit(城市)+ics→管理城市的事务→政治<,>political(adj.政治的)/politician(n.政治家)/polity(n.政体)

platform<,>/ˈplætfɔːm/<,>/ˈplætfɔːrm/<,>n.政纲/n.平台<,>The party's platform includes tax cuts.<,>该党的政纲包括减税。<,>The train arrived at platform 3.<,>火车到达了3号站台。<,>She gave her speech from the platform.<,>她在讲台上发表了演讲。<,>plat(平的)+form(形状)→平的形状→平台<,>plateau(n.高原)/platter(n.大浅盘)/platformer(n.平台游戏)

confirmation<,>/ˌkɒnfəˈmeɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnfərˈmeɪʃn/<,>n.证实/n.确认<,>We are waiting for confirmation of the appointment.<,>我们正在等待约会的确认。<,>The DNA test provided confirmation of his identity.<,>DNA测试证实了他的身份。<,>Please send a confirmation email after booking.<,>预订后请发送确认邮件。<,>con(完全)+firm(坚定)+ation→完全坚定→确认<,>confirm(v.确认)/affirmation(n.肯定)/infirm(adj.虚弱的)

testify<,>/ˈtɛstɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈtɛstɪfaɪ/<,>v.作证/v.证实<,>He agreed to testify in court.<,>他同意在法庭上作证。<,>The results testify to the effectiveness of the treatment.<,>结果证明了治疗的有效性。<,>She testified against her former employer.<,>她作证指控她的前雇主。<,>test(证据)+ify(使)→使成为证据→作证<,>testimony(n.证词)/attest(v.证明)/protest(v.抗议)

audience<,>/ˈɔːdiəns/<,>/ˈɔːdiəns/<,>n.正式会见/n.观众<,>The ambassador had an audience with the king.<,>大使觐见了国王。<,>The show attracted a large audience.<,>演出吸引了大量观众。<,>She addressed the audience confidently.<,>她自信地向观众讲话。<,>audi(听)+ence→听的人→观众<,>audible(adj.听得见的)/auditorium(n.礼堂)/audio(n.音频)

correctly<,>/kəˈrɛktli/<,>/kəˈrɛktli/<,>adv.正确地<,>Please answer the questions correctly.<,>请正确回答问题。<,>He pronounced the word correctly.<,>他正确地发音了这个词。<,>The machine is not functioning correctly.<,>机器运转不正常。<,>cor(完全)+rect(直)+ly→完全直→正确地<,>correct(adj.正确的)/incorrectly(adv.错误地)/correction(n.改正)
positive<,>/ˈpɒzətɪv/<,>/ˈpɑːzətɪv/<,>adj.正的/adj.阳性的/adj.正极的/adj.正数的<,>The test result came back positive.<,>检测结果呈阳性。<,>He has a positive attitude towards life.<,>他对生活持积极态度。<,>The battery has a positive terminal.<,>电池有一个正极。<,>pos(放置)+itive→放在正确位置的→正的<,>negative(adj.负的/adj.阴性的)/passive(adj.被动的)/possessive(adj.占有的)  

normalization<,>/ˌnɔːməlaɪˈzeɪʃən/<,>/ˌnɔːrmələˈzeɪʃən/<,>n.正常化/n.标准化<,>The normalization of relations between the two countries is progressing well.<,>两国关系正常化进展顺利。<,>Data normalization is important in database design.<,>数据标准化在数据库设计中很重要。<,>The normalization process took several months.<,>标准化过程花了几个月时间。<,>normal(正常的)+ization(化)→正常化<,>formalization(n.形式化)/neutralization(n.中和)/optimization(n.优化)  

sign<,>/saɪn/<,>/saɪn/<,>n.征兆/n.迹象/n.病症<,>Dark clouds are a sign of rain.<,>乌云是下雨的征兆。<,>She showed no signs of illness.<,>她没有表现出任何病症。<,>This could be a sign of economic recovery.<,>这可能是经济复苏的迹象。<,>sign(标记)→作为某种情况的标记→征兆<,>signal(n.信号)/sigh(n.叹息)/design(n.设计)  

conqueror<,>/ˈkɒŋkərə(r)/<,>/ˈkɑːŋkərər/<,>n.征服者/n.胜利者<,>William the Conqueror invaded England in 1066.<,>征服者威廉于1066年入侵英格兰。<,>The conqueror claimed the land as his own.<,>征服者宣称这片土地归他所有。<,>History is written by the conquerors.<,>历史是由胜利者书写的。<,>con(完全)+quer(寻求)+or(人)→完全寻求到的人→征服者<,>conquest(n.征服)/conquer(v.征服)/conquerable(adj.可征服的)  

controversy<,>/ˈkɒntrəvɜːsi/<,>/ˈkɑːntrəvɜːrsi/<,>n.争论/n.辩论/n.争吵<,>The new policy caused much controversy.<,>新政策引起了很多争论。<,>They engaged in a heated controversy.<,>他们进行了激烈的辩论。<,>The controversy lasted for months.<,>这场争吵持续了数月。<,>contro(反对)+vers(转)+y→相互反对转动→争论<,>controvert(v.反驳)/controversial(adj.有争议的)/conversation(n.谈话)  

suppress<,>/səˈpres/<,>/səˈpres/<,>v.镇压/v.抑制/v.禁止发表/v.封锁/v.查禁<,>The government suppressed the rebellion.<,>政府镇压了叛乱。<,>She suppressed a laugh.<,>她忍住没笑。<,>The newspaper was suppressed by the authorities.<,>该报被当局查禁了。<,>sup(下)+press(压)→压下去→镇压<,>oppress(v.压迫)/repress(v.抑制)/express(v.表达)  

gust<,>/ɡʌst/<,>/ɡʌst/<,>n.阵风/n.一阵狂风<,>A sudden gust of wind blew his hat off.<,>一阵突如其来的风把他的帽子吹掉了。<,>The gusts reached 50 miles per hour.<,>阵风达到每小时50英里。<,>She felt a gust of cold air.<,>她感到一阵冷风。<,>gust(尝)→像突然尝到风一样→阵风<,>gusto(n.爱好)/gusty(adj.阵风的)/gush(v.涌出)  

clinic<,>/ˈklɪnɪk/<,>/ˈklɪnɪk/<,>n.诊所/n.医务室/n.会诊/n.门诊时间<,>She works at a dental clinic.<,>她在一家牙科诊所工作。<,>The doctor holds clinic on Tuesday afternoons.<,>医生周二下午门诊。<,>They had a clinic to discuss the difficult case.<,>他们就这个疑难病例进行了会诊。<,>clin(床)+ic→有床看病的地方→诊所<,>clinical(adj.临床的)/clinician(n.临床医生)/clinicist(n.临床医师)  

diagnose<,>/ˈdaɪəɡnəʊz/<,>/ˈdaɪəɡnoʊz/<,>v.诊断(疾病)<,>The doctor diagnosed pneumonia.<,>医生诊断出肺炎。<,>It's difficult to diagnose this condition early.<,>这种病症早期很难诊断。<,>They used new technology to diagnose the problem.<,>他们使用新技术来诊断问题。<,>dia(穿过)+gnos(知道)+e→全面了解→诊断<,>prognose(v.预测)/misdiagnose(v.误诊)/diagnosis(n.诊断)  

sincerity<,>/sɪnˈserəti/<,>/sɪnˈsɪrəti/<,>n.真诚/n.诚意/n.真实<,>I appreciate your sincerity.<,>我欣赏你的真诚。<,>He spoke with great sincerity.<,>他说话非常诚恳。<,>There was no doubt about her sincerity.<,>她的诚意毋庸置疑。<,>sincere(真诚的)+ity(状态)→真诚<,>sincere(adj.真诚的)/insincerity(n.不真诚)/sincerely(adv.真诚地)
cherish<,>/ˈtʃerɪʃ/<,>/ˈtʃɛrɪʃ/<,>v.珍爱/v.怀有（感情）<,>She cherishes the memories of her childhood.<,>她珍视童年的回忆。<,>He cherishes a deep love for his country.<,>他对祖国怀有深厚的爱。<,>I will always cherish the gift you gave me.<,>我会永远珍惜你送给我的礼物。<,>cher(亲爱的)+ish(动词后缀)→像对亲爱的物品一样珍惜<,>perish(v. 死亡/v.毁灭)/flourish(v.繁荣/v.茂盛)

detective<,>/dɪˈtektɪv/<,>/dɪˈtɛktɪv/<,>n.侦探/n.警探/n.私人侦探<,>The detective solved the case in just three days.<,>侦探仅用三天就破获了案件。<,>She hired a private detective to follow her husband.<,>她雇了一名私家侦探跟踪她的丈夫。<,>Detective stories are very popular among readers.<,>侦探小说在读者中很受欢迎。<,>detect(发现)+ive(人)→发现真相的人<,>defective(adj.有缺陷的)/protective(adj.保护的)

underline<,>/ˌʌndəˈlaɪn/<,>/ˈʌndərˌlaɪn/<,>v.强调/v.着重/n.预告<,>Please underline the key points in the text.<,>请在文中划出重点。<,>The report underlines the importance of education.<,>报告强调了教育的重要性。<,>The underline of the movie was very intriguing.<,>这部电影的预告非常引人入胜。<,>under(下面)+line(线)→在下面划线→强调<,>underline(v.强调)/headline(n.标题)/deadline(n.截止日期)

grind<,>/ɡraɪnd/<,>/ɡraɪnd/<,>v.磨碎/v.碾碎/v.把...磨成粉<,>She grinds coffee beans every morning.<,>她每天早上都磨咖啡豆。<,>The mill was used to grind wheat into flour.<,>这个磨坊用来把小麦磨成面粉。<,>Don't grind your teeth while sleeping.<,>睡觉时不要磨牙。<,>gr(表示摩擦)+ind→摩擦的动作<,>grin(v.露齿而笑)/grand(adj.宏伟的)

discount<,>/ˈdɪskaʊnt/<,>/ˈdɪsˌkaʊnt/<,>n.折扣/v.打折扣卖<,>The store offers a 20% discount on all items.<,>这家店所有商品打八折。<,>They discounted the price to attract more customers.<,>他们降价以吸引更多顾客。<,>Student discounts are available with valid ID.<,>凭有效证件可享受学生折扣。<,>dis(不)+count(计算)→不按原价计算<,>account(n.账户)/recount(v.叙述)

literally<,>/ˈlɪtərəli/<,>/ˈlɪtərəli/<,>adv.照字义/adv.逐字地<,>He took her words literally and got upset.<,>他按字面理解她的话，结果生气了。<,>The phrase shouldn't be understood literally.<,>这个短语不应该按字面理解。<,>I was literally frozen with fear.<,>我真的吓呆了。<,>liter(文字)+al+ly→按照文字地<,>literary(adj.文学的)/literal(adj.字面的)

illuminate<,>/ɪˈluːmɪneɪt/<,>/ɪˈluməˌneɪt/<,>v.照明/v.照亮/v.阐明<,>The street was illuminated by bright lights.<,>街道被明亮的灯光照亮。<,>His explanation illuminated the complex problem.<,>他的解释阐明了这个复杂的问题。<,>The full moon illuminated the night sky.<,>满月照亮了夜空。<,>il(加强)+lumin(光)+ate→使发光<,>eliminate(v.消除)/luminous(adj.发光的)

summon<,>/ˈsʌmən/<,>/ˈsʌmən/<,>v.召唤/v.鼓起（勇气）<,>The king summoned his advisors to the palace.<,>国王召集顾问们进宫。<,>She summoned all her courage to face the challenge.<,>她鼓起全部勇气面对挑战。<,>The court summoned the witness to testify.<,>法庭传唤证人作证。<,>sum(全部)+mon(提醒)→全部提醒→召集<,>common(adj.普通的)/summit(n.顶峰)

marsh<,>/mɑːʃ/<,>/mɑrʃ/<,>n.沼泽地/n.湿地<,>The marsh is home to many rare birds.<,>这片沼泽地是许多稀有鸟类的家园。<,>They got stuck in the marsh while hiking.<,>他们在徒步旅行时陷入了沼泽。<,>The marsh was covered in morning mist.<,>沼泽地被晨雾笼罩着。<,>mar(海)+sh→像海一样潮湿的地方<,>march(v.行军)/harsh(adj.严厉的)

entertainment<,>/ˌentəˈteɪnmənt/<,>/ˌɛntərˈteɪnmənt/<,>n.招待/n.娱乐/n.招待会<,>The hotel provides excellent entertainment for guests.<,>这家酒店为客人提供优质的娱乐服务。<,>TV is a popular form of entertainment.<,>电视是一种流行的娱乐形式。<,>The company held an entertainment for its clients.<,>公司为客户举办了一场招待会。<,>enter(进入)+tain(保持)+ment→让人保持愉快的事物<,>containment(n.遏制)/maintenance(n.维护)
hindrance<,>/ˈhɪndrəns/<,>/ˈhɪndrəns/<,>n.障碍/n.妨碍<,>Lack of funding is a major hindrance to the project.<,>资金不足是这个项目的主要障碍。<,>His stubbornness was a hindrance to their progress.<,>他的固执妨碍了他们的进展。<,>Noise can be a hindrance to concentration.<,>噪音会妨碍注意力集中。<,>hind(后面)+rance(状态)→拖后腿的状态→障碍<,>hindrance(n.障碍)/hindrance(n.妨碍)/hindrance(n.阻碍)

hose<,>/həʊz/<,>/hoʊz/<,>n.软管/n.袜类（包括连裤袜、长筒袜、短袜）<,>He used a hose to water the garden.<,>他用软管给花园浇水。<,>She bought a pair of nylon hose.<,>她买了一双尼龙长筒袜。<,>The firefighter unrolled the hose to extinguish the fire.<,>消防员展开软管灭火。<,>hose(软管)→像软管一样的长筒袜<,>hose(n.软管)/hose(n.袜类)/hose(n.长筒袜)

sofa<,>/ˈsəʊfə/<,>/ˈsoʊfə/<,>n.长沙发/n.沙发<,>They sat together on the sofa watching TV.<,>他们一起坐在沙发上看电视。<,>The cat loves to sleep on the sofa.<,>猫喜欢在沙发上睡觉。<,>We need to buy a new sofa for the living room.<,>我们需要为客厅买一个新沙发。<,>sofa(沙发)→舒适的休息家具<,>sofa(n.长沙发)/sofa(n.沙发)/couch(n.长沙发)

tensile<,>/ˈtensaɪl/<,>/ˈtɛnsəl/<,>adj.张力的/adj.能伸长的<,>The tensile strength of the material is very high.<,>这种材料的抗拉强度非常高。<,>Steel has good tensile properties.<,>钢具有良好的拉伸性能。<,>They tested the tensile limit of the rope.<,>他们测试了绳子的拉伸极限。<,>tens(拉伸)+ile(能…的)→能拉伸的<,>tensile(adj.张力的)/tensile(adj.能伸长的)/tension(n.张力)

warfare<,>/ˈwɔːfeə(r)/<,>/ˈwɔːrfer/<,>n.战争/n.战争状态<,>Modern warfare relies heavily on technology.<,>现代战争高度依赖技术。<,>Psychological warfare is used to demoralize the enemy.<,>心理战用于瓦解敌人士气。<,>The country has been in a state of warfare for years.<,>这个国家多年来一直处于战争状态。<,>war(战争)+fare(状态)→战争状态<,>warfare(n.战争)/warfare(n.战争状态)/war(n.战争)

battle<,>/ˈbætl/<,>/ˈbætl/<,>v.战斗/v.与…作战<,>The soldiers battled bravely against the enemy.<,>士兵们勇敢地与敌人作战。<,>She battled cancer for many years.<,>她与癌症斗争了许多年。<,>The two teams will battle for the championship.<,>这两支队伍将争夺冠军。<,>bat(打)+tle→战斗<,>battle(v.战斗)/battle(v.与…作战)/combat(v.战斗)

predominant<,>/prɪˈdɒmɪnənt/<,>/prɪˈdɑːmɪnənt/<,>adj.占优势的/adj.主要的<,>Red is the predominant color in the painting.<,>红色是这幅画的主要颜色。<,>English is the predominant language in this region.<,>英语是这个地区的主要语言。<,>His predominant emotion was anger.<,>他的主要情绪是愤怒。<,>pre(前)+dominant(支配的)→占优势的<,>predominant(adj.占优势的)/predominant(adj.主要的)/dominant(adj.支配的)

unfold<,>/ʌnˈfəʊld/<,>/ʌnˈfoʊld/<,>v.展开/v.展现，呈现<,>She unfolded the map to find their location.<,>她展开地图寻找他们的位置。<,>The story unfolds in a small village.<,>故事在一个小村庄展开。<,>As the meeting progressed, the plan began to unfold.<,>随着会议的进行，计划开始呈现。<,>un(打开)+fold(折叠)→展开<,>unfold(v.展开)/unfold(v.展现)/fold(v.折叠)

cling<,>/klɪŋ/<,>/klɪŋ/<,>v.粘住/v.依附/v.坚持<,>The wet shirt clung to his body.<,>湿衬衫粘在他身上。<,>The child clung to his mother in fear.<,>孩子害怕地依附在母亲身边。<,>She clung to the hope that he would return.<,>她坚持他会回来的希望。<,>cling(粘住)→像胶水一样粘住<,>cling(v.粘住)/cling(v.依附)/cling(v.坚持)

viscous<,>/ˈvɪskəs/<,>/ˈvɪskəs/<,>adj.粘滞的/adj.粘性的<,>Honey is a viscous liquid.<,>蜂蜜是一种粘性液体。<,>The oil became more viscous in the cold.<,>油在寒冷中变得更粘滞。<,>The viscous substance was hard to clean.<,>这种粘性物质很难清理。<,>visc(粘)+ous(有…性质的)→粘性的<,>viscous(adj.粘滞的)/viscous(adj.粘性的)/viscosity(n.粘性)
coherent<,>/kəʊˈhɪərənt/<,>/koʊˈhɪrənt/<,>adj.连贯的/有条理的/一致的<,>Her argument was coherent and well-structured.<,>她的论点连贯且有逻辑。<,>The report presents a coherent analysis of the situation.<,>这份报告对情况进行了连贯的分析。<,>He struggled to give a coherent answer.<,>他努力给出一个连贯的回答。<,>co(共同)+her(粘附)+ent→共同粘在一起→连贯的<,>incoherent(adj.不连贯的)/adherent(adj.粘附的)

album<,>/ˈælbəm/<,>/ˈælbəm/<,>n.册子<,>She keeps all her photos in an album.<,>她把所有照片都保存在相册里。<,>I bought a stamp album for my collection.<,>我为我的收藏买了一本集邮册。<,>The band released their new album last week.<,>乐队上周发行了新专辑。<,>alb(白色)+um→白色相册<,>alum(n.明矾)/alba(n.晨曲)

glue<,>/ɡluː/<,>/ɡlu/<,>v.粘牢<,>She glued the pieces of the broken vase together.<,>她把破碎的花瓶碎片粘在一起。<,>The poster was glued to the wall.<,>海报被粘在墙上。<,>This glue dries very quickly.<,>这种胶水干得很快。<,>gl(光)+ue→光亮的胶水<,>blue(adj.蓝色的)/clue(n.线索)

cement<,>/sɪˈment/<,>/səˈmɛnt/<,>v.粘结<,>They cemented their friendship with a handshake.<,>他们通过握手巩固了友谊。<,>The bricks were cemented together.<,>砖块被水泥粘合在一起。<,>This agreement will cement our partnership.<,>这个协议将巩固我们的合作关系。<,>ce(切)+ment(名词后缀)→切割后粘合<,>segment(n.部分)/sentiment(n.情绪)

adhere<,>/ədˈhɪə(r)/<,>/ədˈhɪr/<,>v.粘附/追随/坚持<,>The sticker adheres firmly to the surface.<,>贴纸牢牢粘在表面上。<,>She adheres to her principles.<,>她坚持自己的原则。<,>They adhere to the traditional methods.<,>他们遵循传统方法。<,>ad(向)+her(粘)+e→粘向某物<,>cohere(v.粘合)/inhere(v.固有)

strip<,>/strɪp/<,>/strɪp/<,>n.窄条/长带<,>He tore a strip of paper from the notebook.<,>他从笔记本上撕下一条纸。<,>The beach has a narrow strip of sand.<,>海滩有一条狭窄的沙滩带。<,>She wore a dress with a striped pattern.<,>她穿着一条条纹图案的裙子。<,>st(站立)+rip(撕)→撕下的长条<,>strap(n.带子)/stripe(n.条纹)

grasshopper<,>/ˈɡrɑːshɒpə(r)/<,>/ˈɡræshɑːpər/<,>n.蚱蜢/蝗虫/蚂蚱<,>A grasshopper jumped onto my hand.<,>一只蚱蜢跳到了我手上。<,>The field was full of grasshoppers.<,>田地里到处都是蝗虫。<,>Grasshoppers can jump very high.<,>蚱蜢能跳得很高。<,>grass(草)+hopper(跳跃者)→草丛中的跳跃者<,>cricket(n.蟋蟀)/locust(n.蝗虫)

wink<,>/wɪŋk/<,>/wɪŋk/<,>v.眨眼/使眼色<,>He winked at me to show he was joking.<,>他向我眨眼表示他在开玩笑。<,>She winked in the bright sunlight.<,>她在明亮的阳光下眨眼。<,>The stars seemed to wink in the night sky.<,>星星似乎在夜空中眨眼。<,>win(赢)+k→赢得注意的动作<,>blink(v.眨眼)/twinkle(v.闪烁)

further<,>/ˈfɜːðə(r)/<,>/ˈfɜrðər/<,>v.增进<,>This meeting will further our understanding.<,>这次会议将增进我们的理解。<,>She wants to further her education.<,>她想继续深造。<,>The new policy will further economic growth.<,>新政策将促进经济增长。<,>fur(皮毛)+ther(更)→使皮毛更长<,>farther(adj.更远的)/feather(n.羽毛)

multiplication<,>/ˌmʌltɪplɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌmʌltəplɪˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.乘法/增加<,>Children learn multiplication in elementary school.<,>孩子们在小学学习乘法。<,>The multiplication of cells leads to growth.<,>细胞的增殖导致生长。<,>Rapid multiplication of bacteria can cause infection.<,>细菌的快速繁殖会导致感染。<,>multi(多)+plic(折叠)+ation→多次折叠→乘法<,>addition(n.加法)/division(n.除法)
liability<,>/ˌlaɪəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌlaɪəˈbɪləti/<,>n.责任/n.债务<,>The company has limited liability for its debts.<,>公司对其债务承担有限责任。<,>He accepted liability for the accident.<,>他承担了事故的责任。<,>The liability of the manufacturer was clearly stated in the contract.<,>合同中明确规定了制造商的责任。<,>li(绑)+ability(能力)→被绑定的责任<,>reliability(n.可靠性)/stability(n.稳定性)/flexibility(n.灵活性)

shipbuilding<,>/ˈʃɪpˌbɪldɪŋ/<,>/ˈʃɪpˌbɪldɪŋ/<,>n.造船(业)/n.造船学<,>China has a long history of shipbuilding.<,>中国有着悠久的造船历史。<,>The shipbuilding industry is booming in this coastal city.<,>这座沿海城市的造船业正在蓬勃发展。<,>He studied shipbuilding at university.<,>他在大学学习造船学。<,>ship(船)+building(建造)→造船<,>shipyard(n.造船厂)/shipwreck(n.船只失事)/shipshape(adj.整齐的)

mint<,>/mɪnt/<,>/mɪnt/<,>n.造币厂/n.巨额钱财<,>The Royal Mint produces all UK coins.<,>英国皇家造币厂生产所有英国硬币。<,>He made a mint from his investments.<,>他从投资中赚了一大笔钱。<,>The old coin was produced at the Philadelphia Mint.<,>这枚旧硬币是在费城造币厂生产的。<,>min(小)+t(钱)→造小钱的地方→造币厂<,>mind(n.头脑)/minty(adj.有薄荷味的)/mintage(n.铸币)

hollow<,>/ˈhɒləʊ/<,>/ˈhɑːloʊ/<,>v.凿空/v.挖空<,>They hollowed out a log to make a canoe.<,>他们挖空了一根原木做独木舟。<,>The tree was hollowed by insects.<,>这棵树被虫子蛀空了。<,>He hollowed a pumpkin for Halloween.<,>他为万圣节挖空了一个南瓜。<,>hol(洞)+low(低)→在低处挖洞→挖空<,>hallow(v.使神圣)/hollow(adj.空的)/follow(v.跟随)

hymn<,>/hɪm/<,>/hɪm/<,>n.赞美诗/n.圣歌/n.赞歌<,>The choir sang a beautiful hymn.<,>唱诗班唱了一首优美的赞美诗。<,>They wrote a hymn in praise of nature.<,>他们写了一首歌颂自然的赞歌。<,>The hymn was sung at the wedding ceremony.<,>婚礼上唱了这首圣歌。<,>hy(高)+mn(声音)→高声唱的歌→赞美诗<,>hymnal(n.赞美诗集)/hymnody(n.赞美诗研究)/hymnbook(n.赞美诗集)

glorify<,>/ˈɡlɔːrɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈɡlɔːrɪfaɪ/<,>v.赞美/v.颂扬(上帝)<,>The poem glorifies the beauty of nature.<,>这首诗赞美了大自然的美丽。<,>They glorified God in their songs.<,>他们在歌声中颂扬上帝。<,>The film glorifies war too much.<,>这部电影过分美化了战争。<,>glory(荣耀)+fy(使)→使荣耀→赞美<,>glorification(n.赞美)/glorious(adj.光荣的)/glory(n.荣耀)

fore<,>/fɔː(r)/<,>/fɔːr/<,>adv.在(或向)船头/adv.在(或向)飞行器头部<,>The captain stood at the fore of the ship.<,>船长站在船头。<,>The fore of the plane was damaged in the crash.<,>飞机头部在坠毁中受损。<,>He moved fore to get a better view.<,>他走向船头以获得更好的视野。<,>for(前)+e→在前面→船头<,>foremost(adj.最重要的)/forehead(n.前额)/forecast(v.预测)

therein<,>/ˌðeərˈɪn/<,>/ˌðerˈɪn/<,>adv.在那里<,>The answer lies therein.<,>答案就在那里。<,>He found the documents and the truth therein.<,>他找到了文件，也发现了其中的真相。<,>The beauty of the poem is therein.<,>这首诗的美就在其中。<,>there(那里)+in(里面)→在那里<,>thereby(adv.因此)/thereafter(adv.此后)/thereupon(adv.于是)

overseas<,>/ˌəʊvəˈsiːz/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈsiːz/<,>adv.在海外/adv.(向)国外<,>He works overseas.<,>他在海外工作。<,>Many students choose to study overseas.<,>许多学生选择出国留学。<,>The company has branches overseas.<,>该公司在海外设有分支机构。<,>over(越过)+seas(海洋)→越过海洋→海外<,>overseer(n.监工)/oversee(v.监督)/oversea(adj.海外的)

ashore<,>/əˈʃɔː(r)/<,>/əˈʃɔːr/<,>adv.在岸上/adv.上岸<,>The sailors went ashore for supplies.<,>水手们上岸去补给。<,>The whale was washed ashore.<,>鲸鱼被冲上了岸。<,>We'll go ashore at the next port.<,>我们将在下一个港口上岸。<,>a(在)+shore(岸)→在岸上<,>ashore(adv.在岸上)/ashore(adj.岸上的)/ashore(v.使上岸)
outside<,>/ˌaʊtˈsaɪd/<,>/ˌaʊtˈsaɪd/<,>prep.在…外/prep.向…外<,>The children are playing outside the house.<,>孩子们正在房子外面玩耍。<,>She looked outside the window and saw the rain.<,>她向窗外望去，看到了雨。<,>He stepped outside to get some fresh air.<,>他走到外面呼吸新鲜空气。<,>out(外)+side(边)→在外边<,>inside(prep.在…内)/outdoors(adv.在户外)

brand<,>/brænd/<,>/brænd/<,>v.在…上打烙印<,>The cattle were branded with the ranch's symbol.<,>牛群被打上了牧场的标记。<,>This experience branded him for life.<,>这段经历给他留下了终生的烙印。<,>They branded their products with a unique logo.<,>他们用独特的标志给自己的产品打上烙印。<,>brand(燃烧)→用火烧出标记→打烙印<,>burn(v.燃烧)/blend(v.混合)

alongside<,>/əˌlɒŋˈsaɪd/<,>/əˌlɔːŋˈsaɪd/<,>prep.在…旁边<,>The boat was moored alongside the pier.<,>小船停泊在码头旁边。<,>She worked alongside some of the best scientists.<,>她和一些最优秀的科学家一起工作。<,>The new building stands alongside the old one.<,>新大楼矗立在旧楼旁边。<,>along(沿着)+side(边)→沿着边→在旁边<,>beside(prep.在旁边)/aside(adv.在旁边)

roam<,>/rəʊm/<,>/roʊm/<,>v.在…漫步/v.漫游<,>He likes to roam the streets at night.<,>他喜欢夜晚在街上漫步。<,>The cattle roam freely in the pasture.<,>牛群在牧场上自由走动。<,>Her thoughts began to roam as she gazed out the window.<,>她望着窗外，思绪开始漫游。<,>与Rome(罗马)同音→在罗马漫步<,>wander(v.漫步)/stroll(v.散步)

over<,>/ˈəʊvə(r)/<,>/ˈoʊvər/<,>prep.在（做）…时<,>They discussed the matter over dinner.<,>他们在吃饭时讨论了这件事。<,>She fell asleep over her book.<,>她看书时睡着了。<,>We'll talk about it over coffee.<,>我们喝咖啡时再谈这件事。<,>over(在…上方)→在…过程中<,>during(prep.在…期间)/while(conj.当…时)

reproduction<,>/ˌriːprəˈdʌkʃn/<,>/ˌriːprəˈdʌkʃn/<,>n.再生产/n.繁殖<,>The museum has a reproduction of the famous painting.<,>博物馆有这幅名画的复制品。<,>Sexual reproduction increases genetic diversity.<,>有性繁殖增加了基因多样性。<,>This is a high-quality reproduction of the original document.<,>这是原始文件的高质量复制品。<,>re(再)+production(生产)→再生产<,>duplicate(n.复制品)/propagation(n.繁殖)

specification<,>/ˌspesɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌspesɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.规格/n.明确说明<,>The engineer checked the technical specifications carefully.<,>工程师仔细检查了技术规格。<,>The contract includes detailed specifications for the project.<,>合同包含了该项目的详细说明。<,>Please provide the exact specifications of the product.<,>请提供产品的确切规格。<,>specific(具体的)+ation→具体化→规格说明<,>requirement(n.要求)/description(n.描述)

disastrous<,>/dɪˈzɑːstrəs/<,>/dɪˈzæstrəs/<,>adj.灾难性的/adj.悲惨的<,>The earthquake had disastrous consequences.<,>地震带来了灾难性的后果。<,>His decision proved to be disastrous for the company.<,>他的决定被证明对公司是灾难性的。<,>The party was a disastrous failure.<,>这次聚会是一次惨败。<,>disaster(灾难)+ous(形容词后缀)→灾难性的<,>catastrophic(adj.灾难性的)/tragic(adj.悲惨的)

operation<,>/ˌɒpəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑːpəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.运算<,>The computer can perform millions of operations per second.<,>这台计算机每秒能进行数百万次运算。<,>He is learning basic mathematical operations.<,>他正在学习基本的数学运算。<,>The new algorithm speeds up the operation significantly.<,>新算法显著加快了运算速度。<,>operate(操作)+tion→操作过程→运算<,>calculation(n.计算)/computation(n.计算)

freight<,>/freɪt/<,>/freɪt/<,>n.货运/n.运费<,>The freight train carried goods across the country.<,>货运列车将货物运往全国各地。<,>We need to calculate the freight charges for this shipment.<,>我们需要计算这批货物的运费。<,>The port handles both passenger and freight traffic.<,>这个港口处理客运和货运业务。<,>与weight(重量)相关→运输重物→货运<,>cargo(n.货物)/shipping(n.运输)
locomotive<,>/ˌləʊkəˈməʊtɪv/<,>/ˌloʊkəˈmoʊtɪv/<,>adj.运动的/adj.机动的<,>The locomotive pulled the train up the steep hill.<,>机车拉着火车爬上陡峭的山坡。<,>His job involves the maintenance of locomotive engines.<,>他的工作包括维护机车发动机。<,>The company specializes in locomotive manufacturing.<,>这家公司专门从事机车制造。<,>loco(地方)+mot(移动)+ive(形容词后缀)→从一个地方移动到另一个地方→运动的<,>automotive(adj.汽车的)/motive(n.动机)  

lunar<,>/ˈluːnə(r)/<,>/ˈluːnər/<,>adj.月亮的<,>The astronauts collected lunar rocks during their mission.<,>宇航员在执行任务时采集了月球岩石。<,>Lunar eclipses occur when the Earth blocks sunlight from reaching the Moon.<,>当地球挡住太阳光到达月球时，就会发生月食。<,>Many cultures have festivals based on the lunar calendar.<,>许多文化都有基于阴历的节日。<,>lun(月亮)+ar(形容词后缀)→月亮的<,>solar(adj.太阳的)/polar(adj.极地的)  

undertake<,>/ˌʌndəˈteɪk/<,>/ˌʌndərˈteɪk/<,>v.从事/v.承诺<,>She decided to undertake a new research project.<,>她决定从事一个新的研究项目。<,>He undertook to finish the work by Friday.<,>他承诺在周五前完成这项工作。<,>The company undertakes to provide excellent customer service.<,>公司承诺提供优质的客户服务。<,>under(在...下)+take(拿)→在责任下拿取→承诺<,>overtake(v.超过)/mistake(n.错误)  

primitive<,>/ˈprɪmətɪv/<,>/ˈprɪmɪtɪv/<,>adj.远古的/adj.未开化的<,>Primitive humans used stone tools for hunting.<,>远古人类使用石器狩猎。<,>The tribe still lives a primitive lifestyle.<,>这个部落仍然过着未开化的生活。<,>Scientists study primitive organisms to understand evolution.<,>科学家研究原始生物以理解进化。<,>prim(第一)+itive(形容词后缀)→最早的一远古的<,>primary(adj.主要的)/prime(adj.首要的)  

dome<,>/dəʊm/<,>/doʊm/<,>n.圆屋顶/n.拱顶<,>The cathedral's dome is visible from miles away.<,>大教堂的圆顶从几英里外就能看到。<,>They stood under the dome of the ancient temple.<,>他们站在古庙的拱顶下。<,>The observatory has a retractable dome for stargazing.<,>天文台有一个可伸缩的圆顶用于观星。<,>dom(房屋)+e→房屋的顶部→圆屋顶<,>domestic(adj.家庭的)/domain(n.领域)  

cylinder<,>/ˈsɪlɪndə(r)/<,>/ˈsɪlɪndər/<,>n.圆筒/n.柱(面)/n.汽缸<,>She placed the cookies in a glass cylinder.<,>她把饼干放在一个玻璃圆筒里。<,>The engine has six cylinders for better performance.<,>这台发动机有六个汽缸以获得更好的性能。<,>Mathematicians study the properties of cylinders.<,>数学家研究圆柱体的性质。<,>cyl(圆)+inder→圆形物体→圆筒<,>calendar(n.日历)/cylinder(n.圆柱体)  

satisfactorily<,>/ˌsætɪsˈfæktərəli/<,>/ˌsætɪsˈfæktərəli/<,>adv.圆满地<,>The project was completed satisfactorily.<,>这个项目圆满完成了。<,>She answered all the questions satisfactorily.<,>她圆满地回答了所有问题。<,>The machine is functioning satisfactorily after repairs.<,>修理后机器运转良好。<,>satisfy(满足)+actory(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→满足地→圆满地<,>satisfactory(adj.令人满意的)/satisfaction(n.满足)  

nucleus<,>/ˈnjuːkliəs/<,>/ˈnuːkliəs/<,>n.原子核/n.细胞核<,>The nucleus of an atom contains protons and neutrons.<,>原子核包含质子和中子。<,>DNA is stored in the nucleus of a cell.<,>DNA储存在细胞核中。<,>Scientists are studying the nucleus to understand genetic diseases.<,>科学家正在研究细胞核以了解遗传疾病。<,>nuc(坚果)+leus→像坚果的核心→原子核<,>nuclear(adj.核的)/neutral(adj.中立的)  

prototype<,>/ˈprəʊtətaɪp/<,>/ˈproʊtətaɪp/<,>n.原型/n.典型/n.范例<,>The engineer built a prototype of the new device.<,>工程师制作了新设备的原型。<,>This novel is considered a prototype of modern literature.<,>这部小说被认为是现代文学的典范。<,>They tested the car prototype before mass production.<,>他们在批量生产前测试了汽车原型。<,>proto(原始)+type(类型)→原始类型→原型<,>archetype(n.原型)/stereotype(n.刻板印象)  

vowel<,>/ˈvaʊəl/<,>/ˈvaʊəl/<,>n.元音/n.元音字母<,>The word "apple" starts with a vowel.<,>单词"apple"以元音开头。<,>In English, the vowels are A, E, I, O, U.<,>英语中，元音字母是A、E、I、O、U。<,>Some languages have more vowel sounds than English.<,>有些语言比英语有更多的元音发音。<,>vow(誓言)+el→发音时声带振动的音→元音<,>consonant(n.辅音)/bowel(n.肠)
marshal<,>/ˈmɑːʃəl/<,>/ˈmɑːrʃəl/<,>n.元帅/n.陆军元帅<,>The marshal led the troops into battle.<,>元帅率领部队进入战斗。<,>He was promoted to the rank of marshal.<,>他被提升为元帅军衔。<,>The marshal's strategy ensured victory.<,>元帅的战略确保了胜利。<,>mar(战争)+shal(首领)→战争首领→元帅<,>martial(adj.军事的)/marsh(n.沼泽)

subscription<,>/səbˈskrɪpʃən/<,>/səbˈskrɪpʃən/<,>n.订阅（费）/n.用户费（的缴纳）<,>I canceled my magazine subscription.<,>我取消了杂志订阅。<,>The subscription fee is due next week.<,>订阅费下周到期。<,>They offer a yearly subscription at a discount.<,>他们提供折扣价的年度订阅。<,>sub(下)+script(写)+ion→写下订单→订阅<,>description(n.描述)/prescription(n.处方)

prophet<,>/ˈprɒfɪt/<,>/ˈprɑːfɪt/<,>n.预言家/n.先知<,>The prophet foretold the coming disaster.<,>先知预言了即将到来的灾难。<,>Many considered him a true prophet.<,>许多人认为他是真正的预言家。<,>The prophet's words were later proven true.<,>先知的预言后来被证实是真的。<,>pro(前)+phet(说)→提前说的人→先知<,>profit(n.利润)/prophetic(adj.预言的)

prophecy<,>/ˈprɒfəsi/<,>/ˈprɑːfəsi/<,>n.预言/n.预言能力<,>Her prophecy about the storm came true.<,>她对风暴的预言应验了。<,>The ancient book contains many prophecies.<,>这本古书包含许多预言。<,>He had the gift of prophecy.<,>他有预言的天赋。<,>pro(前)+phecy(说)→提前说→预言<,>prophesy(v.预言)/frequency(n.频率)

prediction<,>/prɪˈdɪkʃən/<,>/prɪˈdɪkʃən/<,>n.预言/n.预告/n.预报<,>The weather prediction was accurate.<,>天气预报很准确。<,>His prediction about the election proved correct.<,>他对选举的预言证明是正确的。<,>Scientific predictions help us prepare for the future.<,>科学预测帮助我们为未来做准备。<,>pre(前)+dict(说)+ion→提前说→预言<,>diction(n.措辞)/addiction(n.上瘾)

preset<,>/ˌpriːˈset/<,>/ˌpriːˈset/<,>v.预先装置<,>I preset the oven to 180 degrees.<,>我把烤箱预设为180度。<,>The camera settings were preset for beginners.<,>相机设置为初学者预设好了。<,>You can preset your favorite radio stations.<,>你可以预设你最喜欢的电台。<,>pre(前)+set(设置)→预先设置<,>reset(v.重置)/upset(v.打乱)

beforehand<,>/bɪˈfɔːhænd/<,>/bɪˈfɔːrhænd/<,>adv.预先/adv.提前地<,>We prepared everything beforehand.<,>我们预先准备好了一切。<,>It's better to book tickets beforehand.<,>最好提前订票。<,>She knew about the surprise beforehand.<,>她提前知道了这个惊喜。<,>before(前)+hand(手)→提前动手→预先<,>beforehand(adv.预先)/afterhand(adv.事后)

budget<,>/ˈbʌdʒɪt/<,>/ˈbʌdʒɪt/<,>n.预算/n.〔政府的〕预算<,>We need to stick to our budget.<,>我们需要坚持预算。<,>The government announced its annual budget.<,>政府公布了年度预算。<,>She keeps a tight budget for household expenses.<,>她对家庭开支保持严格的预算。<,>bud(花蕾)+get(得到)→控制花销→预算<,>badge(n.徽章)/budge(v.移动)

foresee<,>/fɔːˈsiː/<,>/fɔːrˈsiː/<,>v.预见/v.预知/v.看穿<,>No one could foresee the economic crisis.<,>没有人能预见到经济危机。<,>She foresaw the problems and prepared solutions.<,>她预见到了问题并准备了解决方案。<,>It's hard to foresee what will happen next.<,>很难预见接下来会发生什么。<,>fore(前)+see(看)→提前看到→预见<,>foresight(n.远见)/foreseer(n.预见者)

prevention<,>/prɪˈvenʃən/<,>/prɪˈvenʃən/<,>n.预防/n.阻止/n.妨碍<,>Prevention is better than cure.<,>预防胜于治疗。<,>The program focuses on crime prevention.<,>这个项目专注于预防犯罪。<,>Vaccination is an important disease prevention measure.<,>疫苗接种是重要的疾病预防措施。<,>pre(前)+vent(来)+ion→提前来阻止→预防<,>intervention(n.干预)/convention(n.惯例)
tulip<,>/ˈtjuːlɪp/<,>/ˈtuːlɪp/<,>n.郁金香<,>The garden was full of colorful tulips in spring.<,>春天花园里开满了五颜六色的郁金香。<,>She received a bouquet of red tulips for her birthday.<,>她生日时收到了一束红色郁金香。<,>Tulips are often associated with the Netherlands.<,>郁金香常与荷兰联系在一起。<,>联想: "two lips"（两片嘴唇）→ 郁金香花瓣形状<,>lily(n.百合)/daisy(n.雏菊)/rose(n.玫瑰)  

intonation<,>/ˌɪntəˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪntəˈneɪʃn/<,>n.语调/n.声调/n.发声<,>Her intonation rose at the end of the question.<,>她提问时句尾语调上扬。<,>Correct intonation is crucial in language learning.<,>正确的语调在语言学习中至关重要。<,>The actor practiced his intonation for the role.<,>演员为角色练习发声。<,>in(加强)+ton(音调)+ation→语调<,>tone(n.音调)/inflection(n.变调)/pronunciation(n.发音)  

cosmic<,>/ˈkɒzmɪk/<,>/ˈkɑːzmɪk/<,>adj.宇宙的/adj.广大无边的/adj.极大的<,>Scientists study cosmic radiation from space.<,>科学家研究来自太空的宇宙辐射。<,>The event had cosmic significance for humanity.<,>该事件对人类具有重大意义。<,>He felt a cosmic connection to the stars.<,>他感受到与星辰的宇宙联系。<,>cosm(宇宙)+ic(形容词后缀)→宇宙的<,>comic(adj.滑稽的)/cosmos(n.宇宙)/cosmetic(n.化妆品)  

cosmos<,>/ˈkɒzmɒs/<,>/ˈkɑːzmoʊs/<,>n.宇宙<,>The telescope revealed wonders of the cosmos.<,>望远镜揭示了宇宙的奇观。<,>Ancient philosophers pondered the nature of the cosmos.<,>古代哲学家思考宇宙的本质。<,>Our understanding of the cosmos is constantly expanding.<,>我们对宇宙的认识在不断扩展。<,>cosm(宇宙)+os→宇宙<,>chaos(n.混乱)/cosmic(adj.宇宙的)/microcosm(n.微观世界)  

overlap<,>/ˌəʊvəˈlæp/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈlæp/<,>v.与...交搭/v.重叠<,>The two projects overlap in their objectives.<,>这两个项目在目标上有重叠。<,>Their vacation dates overlap by three days.<,>他们的假期日期有三天重叠。<,>The roof tiles overlap to prevent leaks.<,>屋顶瓦片交叠以防漏水。<,>over(在...上)+lap(重叠)→重叠<,>overlay(v.覆盖)/overpass(n.天桥)/overlap(n.重叠部分)  

excuse<,>/ɪkˈskjuːz/<,>/ɪkˈskjuːs/<,>v.为...辩解/v.使免除<,>He tried to excuse his late arrival.<,>他试图为自己迟到辩解。<,>This ticket excuses you from the entrance fee.<,>这张票可使你免门票。<,>Nothing can excuse such rude behavior.<,>任何理由都不能为这种粗鲁行为开脱。<,>ex(出)+cuse(原因)→找出原因→辩解<,>accuse(v.指控)/because(conj.因为)/exclusive(adj.独家的)  

senseless<,>/ˈsensləs/<,>/ˈsensləs/<,>adj.愚蠢的/adj.无意义的<,>It was a senseless act of violence.<,>这是毫无意义的暴力行为。<,>The movie plot was completely senseless.<,>这部电影的情节毫无意义。<,>He fell senseless after the blow.<,>他挨了一击后失去了知觉。<,>sense(感觉)+less(无)→无感觉的→无意义的<,>sensible(adj.明智的)/sensitive(adj.敏感的)/nonsense(n.胡说)  

amusement<,>/əˈmjuːzmənt/<,>/əˈmjuːzmənt/<,>n.乐趣/n.娱乐/n.消遣<,>The children screamed with amusement on the rides.<,>孩子们在游乐设施上兴奋尖叫。<,>Reading is her favorite amusement.<,>阅读是她最喜爱的消遣。<,>The clown provided amusement for the crowd.<,>小丑为人群带来欢乐。<,>a(使)+muse(缪斯)+ment→使有灵感→娱乐<,>amuse(v.娱乐)/museum(n.博物馆)/music(n.音乐)  

torpedo<,>/tɔːˈpiːdəʊ/<,>/tɔːrˈpiːdoʊ/<,>n.鱼雷/n.水雷<,>The submarine launched a torpedo at the enemy ship.<,>潜艇向敌舰发射了一枚鱼雷。<,>Naval mines are sometimes called torpedoes.<,>水雷有时被称为torpedoes。<,>The torpedo hit its target with precision.<,>鱼雷精确命中目标。<,>源自拉丁语"torpere"(使麻木)→像被电鳗击中般<,>tornado(n.龙卷风)/torrid(adj.酷热的)/torpedo(v.破坏)  

margin<,>/ˈmɑːdʒɪn/<,>/ˈmɑːrdʒɪn/<,>n.余地/n.幅度/n.差额/n.利润/n.赚头<,>Leave a wide margin when taking notes.<,>做笔记时要留宽边距。<,>Our team won by a narrow margin.<,>我们队以微弱优势获胜。<,>The company operates on thin profit margins.<,>公司利润微薄。<,>marg(边缘)+in→边缘部分→余地<,>marine(adj.海洋的)/marginal(adj.边缘的)/marginally(adv.略微地)
roundabout<,>/ˈraʊndəbaʊt/<,>/ˈraʊndəˌbaʊt/<,>adj.转弯抹角的/adj.迂回的<,>He gave a roundabout answer to avoid the question.<,>他给出了一个拐弯抹角的回答来回避问题。<,>The route was very roundabout, taking us through several small villages.<,>这条路线非常迂回，带我们穿过了几个小村庄。<,>Her explanation was so roundabout that I couldn't understand her point.<,>她的解释太拐弯抹角了，我无法理解她的观点。<,>round(圆)+about(周围)→绕圈的→迂回的<,>circuitous(adj.迂回的)/direct(adj.直接的)  

kidnap<,>/ˈkɪdnæp/<,>/ˈkɪdˌnæp/<,>v.诱拐/v.绑架<,>The wealthy businessman was kidnapped for ransom.<,>这位富商被绑架以勒索赎金。<,>Police rescued the kidnapped child unharmed.<,>警方救出了被绑架的孩子，孩子没有受伤。<,>Kidnapping is a serious crime punishable by law.<,>绑架是一种严重的犯罪行为，会受到法律惩罚。<,>kid(小孩)+nap(小睡)→趁小孩睡觉时抱走→绑架<,>abduct(v.诱拐)/hijack(v.劫持)  

guilt<,>/ɡɪlt/<,>/ɡɪlt/<,>n.内疚/n.有罪/n.犯罪<,>She was consumed by guilt after lying to her friend.<,>她对朋友撒谎后感到非常内疚。<,>The jury found him guilty beyond reasonable doubt.<,>陪审团判定他有罪，证据确凿。<,>His face showed clear signs of guilt when questioned.<,>被询问时，他脸上明显表现出内疚。<,>gui(拼音"跪")+lt→跪下认罪→内疚<,>innocence(n.无罪)/remorse(n.悔恨)  

shadowy<,>/ˈʃædəʊi/<,>/ˈʃædoʊi/<,>adj.有影的/adj.幽暗的<,>The alley was dark and shadowy at night.<,>这条小巷在夜晚黑暗而幽暗。<,>We saw a shadowy figure moving in the distance.<,>我们看到远处有个模糊的身影在移动。<,>The room was shadowy with only one small lamp on.<,>房间里只有一盏小灯，显得很幽暗。<,>shadow(影子)+y(形容词后缀)→有影子的→幽暗的<,>dim(adj.昏暗的)/bright(adj.明亮的)  

avail<,>/əˈveɪl/<,>/əˈveɪl/<,>v.有益于/v.有用/n.效用<,>All his efforts availed him nothing in the end.<,>他所有的努力最终都没有用。<,>The medicine is of no avail against this disease.<,>这种药对这种疾病无效。<,>She tried every available means to no avail.<,>她尝试了所有可用的方法都无济于事。<,>a(加强)+vail(价值)→有价值→有用<,>prevail(v.盛行)/veil(n.面纱)  

ambitious<,>/æmˈbɪʃəs/<,>/æmˈbɪʃəs/<,>adj.有雄心的/adj.热望的<,>She has ambitious plans to start her own company.<,>她有雄心勃勃的计划要创办自己的公司。<,>The ambitious young man worked day and night to achieve his goals.<,>这个有抱负的年轻人日夜工作以实现目标。<,>Their ambitious project required huge investments.<,>他们雄心勃勃的项目需要巨额投资。<,>amb(周围)+it(走)+ious→四处奔走→有雄心的<,>aspiring(adj.有抱负的)/unambitious(adj.无野心的)  

significant<,>/sɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt/<,>/sɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt/<,>adj.重要的/adj.重大的/adj.影响深远的<,>This discovery could have significant implications for medicine.<,>这一发现可能对医学产生重大影响。<,>There has been a significant increase in sales this quarter.<,>本季度销售额有了显著增长。<,>She made a significant contribution to the project.<,>她对这个项目做出了重要贡献。<,>sign(标记)+i+fic(做)+ant→做了标记的→重要的<,>important(adj.重要的)/insignificant(adj.不重要的)  

validity<,>/vəˈlɪdəti/<,>/vəˈlɪdəti/<,>n.(法律上的)有效/n.符合逻辑/n.正确<,>The validity of the contract was questioned in court.<,>合同的合法性在法庭上受到质疑。<,>Scientists debated the validity of the research findings.<,>科学家们对研究结果的有效性进行了辩论。<,>Your argument lacks logical validity.<,>你的论点缺乏逻辑有效性。<,>valid(有效的)+ity(名词后缀)→有效性<,>invalidity(n.无效)/veracity(n.真实性)  

availability<,>/əˌveɪləˈbɪləti/<,>/əˌveɪləˈbɪləti/<,>n.有效(性)/n.可得性<,>The availability of fresh water is decreasing in many areas.<,>许多地区淡水的可获得性正在下降。<,>Check the availability of seats before booking your flight.<,>在预订航班前检查座位情况。<,>The drug's availability was limited due to high demand.<,>由于需求量大，这种药物的供应有限。<,>avail(有用)+ability(能力)→可用性<,>accessibility(n.可及性)/unavailability(n.不可得)  

finite<,>/ˈfaɪnaɪt/<,>/ˈfaɪnaɪt/<,>adj.有限的/adj.有尽的<,>Earth's natural resources are finite and must be conserved.<,>地球的自然资源是有限的，必须加以保护。<,>Human knowledge is finite compared to the vastness of the universe.<,>与浩瀚的宇宙相比，人类的知识是有限的。<,>The project has a finite budget that cannot be exceeded.<,>这个项目的预算有限，不能超支。<,>fin(结束)+ite→有结束的→有限的<,>infinite(adj.无限的)/limited(adj.有限的)
magnet<,>/ˈmæɡnɪt/<,>/ˈmæɡnɪt/<,>n.有吸引力的人（或物）<,>She is a magnet for attention wherever she goes.<,>她走到哪里都是众人瞩目的焦点。<,>The new shopping mall has become a magnet for tourists.<,>新购物中心已成为吸引游客的热点。<,>His charisma makes him a natural magnet in social situations.<,>他的魅力使他在社交场合中自然成为焦点人物。<,>mag(魔法)+net(网)→像魔法网一样吸引人<,>magnate(n.巨头)/magnify(v.放大)  

profitable<,>/ˈprɒfɪtəbl/<,>/ˈprɑːfɪtəbl/<,>adj.有利的；有益的<,>The investment proved to be highly profitable.<,>这项投资被证明是非常有利可图的。<,>Reading is a profitable way to spend your free time.<,>阅读是度过空闲时间的有益方式。<,>They made a profitable deal with the foreign company.<,>他们与外国公司做了一笔有利可图的交易。<,>profit(利润)+able(能)→能产生利润的<,>beneficial(adj.有益的)/lucrative(adj.赚钱的)  

advantageous<,>/ˌædvənˈteɪdʒəs/<,>/ˌædvənˈteɪdʒəs/<,>adj.有利的，有助的<,>The new tax policy is advantageous to small businesses.<,>新税收政策对小企业有利。<,>It's advantageous to learn a second language at an early age.<,>从小学习第二语言是有帮助的。<,>His height gives him an advantageous position in basketball.<,>他的身高让他在篮球中占据有利位置。<,>advantage(优势)+ous(形容词后缀)→有优势的<,>beneficial(adj.有益的)/profitable(adj.有利可图的)  

courteous<,>/ˈkɜːtiəs/<,>/ˈkɜːrtiəs/<,>adj.有礼貌的，谦恭的<,>The staff were always courteous and helpful.<,>工作人员总是彬彬有礼且乐于助人。<,>It's courteous to say "thank you" when someone helps you.<,>当别人帮助你时说"谢谢"是有礼貌的。<,>He gave a courteous reply to the interviewer's difficult question.<,>他对面试官的难题给予了礼貌的回答。<,>court(宫廷)+eous(形容词后缀)→像宫廷礼仪一样的<,>gracious(adj.亲切的)/polite(adj.礼貌的)  

bead<,>/biːd/<,>/biːd/<,>n.有孔小珠；水珠；露珠<,>She was stringing colorful beads to make a necklace.<,>她正在串彩色珠子做项链。<,>Beads of sweat formed on his forehead.<,>他的额头上形成了汗珠。<,>Morning dew left tiny beads on the spider's web.<,>晨露在蜘蛛网上留下了小水珠。<,>be+ad(广告)→像广告牌上的亮点→珠子<,>bean(n.豆子)/beak(n.鸟嘴)  

commonsense<,>/ˌkɒmənˈsens/<,>/ˌkɑːmənˈsens/<,>adj.有常识的<,>His commonsense approach solved the problem quickly.<,>他常识性的方法迅速解决了问题。<,>It's commonsense not to touch a hot stove.<,>不碰热炉子是常识。<,>She gave some commonsense advice about saving money.<,>她给出了一些关于省钱的常识性建议。<,>common(共同)+sense(感觉)→大家都有的感觉→常识<,>nonsense(n.胡说)/sensible(adj.明智的)  

conservative<,>/kənˈsɜːvətɪv/<,>/kənˈsɜːrvətɪv/<,>adj.保守的，守旧的<,>He holds very conservative views on social issues.<,>他在社会问题上持非常保守的观点。<,>The design is too conservative for my taste.<,>这个设计对我的品味来说太保守了。<,>She comes from a conservative family background.<,>她来自一个思想保守的家庭。<,>con(完全)+serve(保持)+ative→完全保持原样的→保守的<,>progressive(adj.进步的)/liberal(adj.自由的)  

liable<,>/ˈlaɪəbl/<,>/ˈlaɪəbl/<,>adj.有（法律）责任的<,>The company is liable for any damages caused by its products.<,>公司对其产品造成的任何损害负有责任。<,>You could be liable if someone gets hurt on your property.<,>如果有人在你房产上受伤，你可能要承担责任。<,>He was found liable for breach of contract.<,>他被认定对违约负有责任。<,>li(法律)+able(能)→在法律上能负责的<,>reliable(adj.可靠的)/pliable(adj.易弯曲的)  

yacht<,>/jɒt/<,>/jɑːt/<,>n.游艇，快艇<,>They spent the weekend sailing their new yacht.<,>他们周末驾驶新游艇出海。<,>The billionaire owns a luxury yacht in Monaco.<,>这位亿万富翁在摩纳哥拥有一艘豪华游艇。<,>We went for a sunset cruise on a chartered yacht.<,>我们租了一艘游艇进行日落巡航。<,>发音类似"要特"→要特别享受就坐游艇<,>yarn(n.纱线)/yawn(v.打哈欠)  

uranium<,>/jʊˈreɪniəm/<,>/jʊˈreɪniəm/<,>n.铀<,>Uranium is used as fuel in nuclear power plants.<,>铀被用作核电站的燃料。<,>The country has large deposits of uranium ore.<,>这个国家有大量的铀矿储量。<,>Enriched uranium can be used to make nuclear weapons.<,>浓缩铀可用于制造核武器。<,>Uran(天王星)+ium(元素后缀)→最初在天王星发现<,>plutonium(n.钚)/radium(n.镭)
tanker<,>/ˈtæŋkə(r)/<,>/ˈtæŋkər/<,>n.油船/n.空中加油飞机<,>The oil tanker spilled its cargo into the sea.<,>油轮把货物泄漏到了海里。<,>The air force uses tankers for mid-air refueling.<,>空军使用空中加油飞机进行空中加油。<,>The tanker was carrying thousands of gallons of fuel.<,>这艘油轮运载着数千加仑的燃料。<,>tank(油箱)+er(名词后缀)→装油的船→油船<,>tanker/tango(探戈)/tanner(制革工人)

postal<,>/ˈpəʊstl/<,>/ˈpoʊstl/<,>adj.邮政的/adj.邮局的<,>I received a postal package from my friend.<,>我收到了朋友寄来的邮政包裹。<,>The postal service is very efficient in this country.<,>这个国家的邮政服务非常高效。<,>She works at the postal office downtown.<,>她在市中心的邮局工作。<,>post(邮件)+al(形容词后缀)→邮政的<,>postal/poster(海报)/portal(门户)

superiority<,>/suːˌpɪəriˈɒrəti/<,>/suːˌpɪriˈɔːrəti/<,>n.优越(性)/n.优势<,>Our team demonstrated clear superiority in the competition.<,>我们团队在比赛中展现了明显的优势。<,>His sense of superiority makes him unpopular.<,>他的优越感让他不受欢迎。<,>The superiority of this product is its durability.<,>这个产品的优势在于它的耐用性。<,>superior(高级的)+ity(名词后缀)→优越性<,>superiority/superficiality(表面性)/superfluity(多余)

elbow<,>/ˈelbəʊ/<,>/ˈelboʊ/<,>v.用肘挤/v.挤进<,>He elbowed his way through the crowd.<,>他用肘挤过人群。<,>She elbowed me accidentally while turning.<,>她转身时不小心用肘碰到了我。<,>The player elbowed his opponent to get the ball.<,>球员用肘挤开对手去抢球。<,>el(古英语"前臂")+bow(弯曲)→弯曲的前臂→肘部<,>elbow/endow(捐赠)/embow(使成弓形)

paper<,>/ˈpeɪpə(r)/<,>/ˈpeɪpər/<,>v.贴壁纸<,>We decided to paper the bedroom with floral patterns.<,>我们决定用花卉图案的壁纸贴卧室。<,>He spent the weekend papering the living room.<,>他花了一整个周末给客厅贴壁纸。<,>The walls were freshly papered in blue stripes.<,>墙壁新贴了蓝色条纹的壁纸。<,>paper(纸)+动词后缀→把纸贴上去→贴壁纸<,>paper/pepper(胡椒)/pamper(溺爱)

cutter<,>/ˈkʌtə(r)/<,>/ˈkʌtər/<,>n.用于切割的器械<,>The chef used a vegetable cutter to prepare the salad.<,>厨师用蔬菜切割器准备沙拉。<,>This laser cutter can slice through metal.<,>这台激光切割机可以切割金属。<,>The cookie cutter makes perfect heart shapes.<,>这个饼干切割器能做出完美的心形。<,>cut(切)+er(名词后缀)→切割的工具<,>cutter/clutter(杂乱)/butter(黄油)

net<,>/net/<,>/net/<,>v.用网捕/v.用网覆盖<,>Fishermen net hundreds of fish every morning.<,>渔民们每天早上用网捕捞数百条鱼。<,>We need to net the strawberry plants to protect them from birds.<,>我们需要用网覆盖草莓植株以防鸟类啄食。<,>The tennis court was netted to keep the balls inside.<,>网球场被网围住以防球飞出。<,>net(网)→把网用作动词→用网捕<,>net/nut(坚果)/neat(整洁的)

head<,>/hed/<,>/hed/<,>v.用头顶(球)/v.朝...行进<,>The soccer player headed the ball into the goal.<,>足球运动员用头顶球射门得分。<,>We're heading to the beach this weekend.<,>我们这个周末要去海滩。<,>The ship is heading north towards the Arctic.<,>船只正向北朝北极方向航行。<,>head(头)→用头做动作→顶球<,>head/heat(加热)/heed(注意)

tug<,>/tʌɡ/<,>/tʌɡ/<,>v.用力拖/n.猛拉/n.拖<,>The child tugged at his mother's sleeve.<,>孩子用力拉着他妈妈的袖子。<,>We felt a sudden tug on the fishing line.<,>我们突然感觉到鱼线被猛拉了一下。<,>The tug boats helped guide the large ship into port.<,>拖船帮助引导大船进港。<,>tug→发音类似"拖格"→拖的动作<,>tug/tug(拖船)/tag(标签)

hook<,>/hʊk/<,>/hʊk/<,>v.(使)钩住/v.挂住<,>He hooked the fish and started reeling it in.<,>他钩住鱼开始收线。<,>Her dress got hooked on a nail.<,>她的裙子被钉子钩住了。<,>Please hook the painting on that wall.<,>请把那幅画挂在那面墙上。<,>hook(钩)→用钩子挂住东西<,>hook/hood(兜帽)/hoot(鸣笛声)
formulate<,>/ˈfɔːmjʊleɪt/<,>/ˈfɔːrmjʊleɪt/<,>v.规划/v.制定/v.准备<,>Scientists need to formulate a new hypothesis.<,>科学家需要提出一个新的假设。<,>She formulated a plan to improve sales.<,>她制定了一个提高销售额的计划。<,>The committee will formulate new policies next week.<,>委员会下周将制定新政策。<,>form(形式)+ulate(动词后缀)→使成形→规划<,>formula(n.公式)/form(n.形式)/formality(n.正式手续)

sniff<,>/snɪf/<,>/snɪf/<,>v.用鼻子吸/v.嗅<,>The dog sniffed at the ground for clues.<,>狗在地上嗅来嗅去寻找线索。<,>She sniffed the flowers to enjoy their fragrance.<,>她闻了闻花香。<,>He sniffed the milk to see if it was fresh.<,>他闻了闻牛奶看是否新鲜。<,>sn(鼻子动作声)+iff→嗅的动作<,>snuff(v.掐灭/n.鼻烟)/snip(v.剪断)/snap(v.突然折断)

courageous<,>/kəˈreɪdʒəs/<,>/kəˈreɪdʒəs/<,>adj.勇敢的/adj.无畏的<,>The firefighters were courageous in saving lives.<,>消防员在救人时表现得很勇敢。<,>She made a courageous decision to speak out.<,>她勇敢地决定站出来说话。<,>It was courageous of him to admit his mistake.<,>他承认错误很勇敢。<,>courage(勇气)+ous(形容词后缀)→有勇气的<,>courage(n.勇气)/encourage(v.鼓励)/discourage(v.使气馁)

emigrate<,>/ˈemɪɡreɪt/<,>/ˈemɪɡreɪt/<,>v.永久移居国外<,>My grandparents emigrated from Italy to America.<,>我的祖父母从意大利移民到美国。<,>Many people emigrate for better opportunities.<,>许多人为了更好的机会移民。<,>He plans to emigrate to Canada next year.<,>他计划明年移民加拿大。<,>e(出)+migr(迁移)+ate(动词后缀)→向外迁移<,>immigrate(v.移入)/migrate(v.迁移)/emigrant(n.移民)

perpetual<,>/pəˈpetʃuəl/<,>/pərˈpetʃuəl/<,>adj.永久的/adj.四季开花的<,>They signed a perpetual lease for the property.<,>他们签署了该房产的永久租约。<,>The garden has perpetual blooms all year round.<,>这个花园一年四季都有花开。<,>Her perpetual optimism is inspiring.<,>她永远的乐观很鼓舞人心。<,>per(完全)+pet(追求)+ual→完全追求→永久的<,>perpetuate(v.使永久)/perpetuity(n.永久)/perpetrate(v.犯罪)

everlasting<,>/ˌevəˈlɑːstɪŋ/<,>/ˌevərˈlæstɪŋ/<,>adj.永久的/adj.持久的<,>The lovers promised everlasting devotion.<,>这对恋人承诺永恒的爱。<,>This material is known for its everlasting quality.<,>这种材料以其持久的品质闻名。<,>The mountains seem everlasting.<,>这些山似乎永恒不变。<,>ever(永远)+last(持续)+ing→永远持续的<,>eternal(adj.永恒的)/permanent(adj.永久的)/enduring(adj.持久的)

eternal<,>/ɪˈtɜːnl/<,>/ɪˈtɜːrnl/<,>adj.永久的/adj.不朽的<,>Many religions believe in eternal life.<,>许多宗教相信永生。<,>The stars seem eternal in the night sky.<,>夜空中的星星似乎永恒。<,>Their love was described as eternal.<,>他们的爱情被描述为永恒的。<,>etern(时代)+al→跨越时代的<,>external(adj.外部的)/internal(adj.内部的)/infernal(adj.地狱的)

stiffness<,>/ˈstɪfnəs/<,>/ˈstɪfnəs/<,>n.硬度<,>The stiffness of the new shoes made them uncomfortable.<,>新鞋的硬度让它们穿着不舒服。<,>The stiffness of the material affects its durability.<,>材料的硬度影响其耐用性。<,>Morning stiffness is common with arthritis.<,>早晨僵硬是关节炎的常见症状。<,>stiff(硬的)+ness(名词后缀)→硬度<,>stiffen(v.变硬)/stiff(adj.僵硬的)/stuff(n.材料)

comply<,>/kəmˈplaɪ/<,>/kəmˈplaɪ/<,>v.应允/v.遵照/v.照做<,>All employees must comply with safety regulations.<,>所有员工必须遵守安全规定。<,>The company failed to comply with environmental laws.<,>该公司未能遵守环境法规。<,>He complied with the doctor's orders.<,>他遵照了医生的指示。<,>com(共同)+ply(折叠)→共同折叠→遵从<,>compliance(n.遵从)/supply(v.供应)/reply(v.回答))

bound<,>/baʊnd/<,>/baʊnd/<,>adj.应当的/adj.必定的<,>You're bound to succeed with such dedication.<,>你如此专注，必定会成功。<,>It was bound to happen sooner or later.<,>这事迟早会发生。<,>She felt bound by her promise.<,>她觉得受自己承诺的约束。<,>bound作为bind的过去分词→被绑住的→受约束的<,>bind(v.捆绑)/boundary(n.边界)/bounce(v.弹跳))
salute<,>/səˈluːt/<,>/səˈlut/<,>v.（向…）行军礼/v.（向…）致敬<,>The soldiers salute their commanding officer every morning.<,>士兵们每天早上向指挥官敬礼。<,>He raised his hand to salute the passing flag.<,>他举手向经过的旗帜致敬。<,>We salute the brave firefighters for their service.<,>我们向勇敢的消防员致敬。<,>sal(健康)+ute(动作)→表示祝愿的动作→致敬<,>salutary(adj.有益的)/salutation(n.问候)/salubrious(adj.有益健康的)

cater<,>/ˈkeɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈkeɪtər/<,>v.迎合/v.投合<,>The restaurant caters to vegetarians with a special menu.<,>这家餐厅为素食者提供特别菜单。<,>She always caters to her children's whims.<,>她总是迎合孩子们的突发奇想。<,>The event was catered by a famous chef.<,>这次活动由一位著名厨师提供餐饮服务。<,>cat(猫)+er→像猫一样讨好→迎合<,>caterpillar(n.毛毛虫)/caterwaul(v.发出刺耳叫声)/catercorner(adj.对角线的)

press<,>/pres/<,>/prɛs/<,>n.出版社/n.印刷所/n.印刷机<,>The book will be published by Oxford University Press.<,>这本书将由牛津大学出版社出版。<,>He works at a local printing press.<,>他在当地一家印刷所工作。<,>The newspaper went to press at midnight.<,>这份报纸在午夜付印。<,>press(压)→印刷需要压力→印刷机<,>impress(v.给...留下印象)/express(v.表达)/depress(v.使沮丧)

printer<,>/ˈprɪntə(r)/<,>/ˈprɪntər/<,>n.印刷工/n.印花工<,>The printer is working late to finish the job.<,>印刷工正在加班完成工作。<,>She apprenticed as a textile printer.<,>她当过纺织品印花工的学徒。<,>The new laser printer produces high-quality prints.<,>新的激光打印机可以打印出高质量的作品。<,>print(印刷)+er(人)→印刷的人→印刷工<,>painter(n.画家)/pointer(n.指针)/sprinter(n.短跑选手)

harbour<,>/ˈhɑːbə(r)/<,>/ˈhɑrbər/<,>v.怀着（不好的想法、恐惧或希望）/v.包含，藏有/v.窝藏<,>He harbours a grudge against his former boss.<,>他对前老板怀恨在心。<,>The old house harbours many secrets.<,>这栋老房子藏着许多秘密。<,>It's illegal to harbour fugitives.<,>窝藏逃犯是违法的。<,>har(硬)+bour(地方)→坚硬的地方→港口→藏身处<,>arbor(n.乔木)/barber(n.理发师)/harpoon(n.鱼叉)

diet<,>/ˈdaɪət/<,>/ˈdaɪət/<,>n.日常饮食/n.日常食物<,>A balanced diet is essential for good health.<,>均衡饮食对健康至关重要。<,>She's on a strict diet to lose weight.<,>她正在严格控制饮食来减肥。<,>The Mediterranean diet is considered very healthy.<,>地中海饮食被认为非常健康。<,>die(死亡)+t→不健康饮食会导致死亡→饮食<,>dieter(n.节食者)/dietary(adj.饮食的)/dietetics(n.饮食学)

tempt<,>/tempt/<,>/tɛmpt/<,>v.引诱/v.诱惑/v.劝诱<,>The smell of fresh bread tempted him into the bakery.<,>新鲜面包的香味引诱他走进了面包店。<,>I was tempted to buy the expensive dress.<,>我差点忍不住买了那件昂贵的连衣裙。<,>Don't tempt fate by taking unnecessary risks.<,>不要冒不必要的风险来试探命运。<,>tem(时间)+pt→在关键时刻引诱→诱惑<,>attempt(n.尝试)/contempt(n.轻视)/tempo(n.速度))

cite<,>/saɪt/<,>/saɪt/<,>v.引证/v.引用/v.〔法院〕传召，传讯<,>The professor cited several studies to support his argument.<,>教授引用了几项研究来支持他的论点。<,>She was cited for speeding last week.<,>她上周因超速被传讯。<,>The article cites Shakespeare frequently.<,>这篇文章频繁引用莎士比亚。<,>cit(唤起)+e→唤起证据→引用<,>site(n.地点)/sight(n.视力)/recite(v.背诵)

ignite<,>/ɪɡˈnaɪt/<,>/ɪɡˈnaɪt/<,>v.引燃/v.着火<,>A spark ignited the dry grass.<,>一个火星引燃了干草。<,>His speech ignited the crowd's enthusiasm.<,>他的演讲点燃了人群的热情。<,>The fireworks ignited with a loud bang.<,>烟花伴随着巨响点燃了。<,>ig(进入)+nite(夜晚)→进入夜晚需要点火→引燃<,>ignition(n.点火)/igneous(adj.火的)/ignorant(adj.无知的)

derivation<,>/ˌderɪˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌdɛrəˈveɪʃən/<,>n.引出/n.起源/n.衍生<,>The derivation of this word is from Latin.<,>这个词源自拉丁语。<,>The derivation of the formula took several hours.<,>这个公式的推导花了好几个小时。<,>The derivation of new words is an ongoing process in language.<,>新词的衍生是语言中持续进行的过程。<,>de(向下)+riv(河流)+ation→河流向下→起源<,>derivative(n.衍生物)/deprivation(n.剥夺)/derision(n.嘲笑))
banker<,>/ˈbæŋkə(r)/<,>/ˈbæŋkər/<,>n.银行家<,>He is a successful banker in London.<,>他是伦敦一位成功的银行家。<,>The banker advised me on my investments.<,>这位银行家就我的投资给了我建议。<,>She became a banker after graduating from business school.<,>她从商学院毕业后成为了一名银行家。<,>bank(银行)+er(人)→银行家<,>bank(n.银行)/banking(n.银行业)/bankable(adj.可获利的)

obscure<,>/əbˈskjʊə(r)/<,>/əbˈskjʊr/<,>adj.无名的/adj.鲜为人知的<,>The artist was obscure during his lifetime.<,>这位艺术家生前默默无闻。<,>The origins of this tradition are obscure.<,>这个传统的起源鲜为人知。<,>He found an obscure reference in an old book.<,>他在一本旧书中发现了一个鲜为人知的参考资料。<,>ob(反)+scure(清晰)→不清晰的→鲜为人知的<,>obscurity(n.默默无闻)/obscenely(adv.可憎地)/obsequious(adj.谄媚的)

inasmuch<,>/ˌɪnəzˈmʌtʃ/<,>/ˌɪnəzˈmʌtʃ/<,>adv.因为/adv.由于<,>Inasmuch as you are here, let's begin the meeting.<,>既然你来了，我们就开始会议吧。<,>He was excused inasmuch as he was ill.<,>他因为生病被原谅了。<,>Inasmuch as we have time, we should finish this today.<,>由于我们还有时间，今天应该完成这个。<,>in(在)+as(如同)+much(多)→如同多→因为<,>insofar(adv.在...范围内)/insomuch(adv.到如此程度)/inasmuch as(因为)

through<,>/θruː/<,>/θru/<,>prep.因为/prep.由于<,>He succeeded through hard work.<,>他因为努力工作而成功。<,>Through your help, we finished on time.<,>由于你的帮助，我们按时完成了。<,>She got the job through her connections.<,>她因为人脉得到了这份工作。<,>th(穿过)+rough(粗糙的)→穿过困难→因为<,>though(conj.虽然)/thorough(adj.彻底的)/throughout(prep.遍及)

consciousness<,>/ˈkɒnʃəsnəs/<,>/ˈkɑːnʃəsnəs/<,>n.意识/n.知觉<,>He lost consciousness after the accident.<,>事故后他失去了知觉。<,>She has a strong social consciousness.<,>她有强烈的社会意识。<,>The meditation improved his self-consciousness.<,>冥想提高了他的自我意识。<,>con(共同)+sci(知道)+ous(形容词后缀)+ness(名词后缀)→共同知道→意识<,>conscience(n.良心)/conscious(adj.有意识的)/subconscious(adj.潜意识的)

observation<,>/ˌɒbzəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑːbzərˈveɪʃn/<,>n.意见/n.短评/n.按语<,>He made an interesting observation about the painting.<,>他对这幅画提出了一个有趣的意见。<,>The book contains many witty observations.<,>这本书包含许多机智的短评。<,>She added an observation at the end of the report.<,>她在报告末尾加了一条按语。<,>ob(强调)+serve(保持)+ation(名词后缀)→保持注意→观察后意见<,>observatory(n.天文台)/observant(adj.观察力敏锐的)/observe(v.观察)

cross<,>/krɒs/<,>/krɔːs/<,>adj.恼怒的<,>She was cross with me for being late.<,>她因为我迟到而恼怒。<,>Don't be cross - it was an honest mistake.<,>别生气，这是个无心的错误。<,>His cross expression scared the children.<,>他恼怒的表情吓到了孩子们。<,>cr(哭)+oss(ossify僵化)→哭到僵化→恼怒的<,>across(prep.穿过)/crossing(n.十字路口)/crossly(adv.生气地)

refrain<,>/rɪˈfreɪn/<,>/rɪˈfreɪn/<,>v.抑制/v.制止/v.忍住<,>Please refrain from smoking in this area.<,>请勿在此区域吸烟。<,>She could hardly refrain from laughing.<,>她几乎忍不住要笑出来。<,>The doctor advised him to refrain from alcohol.<,>医生建议他戒酒。<,>re(再)+frain(约束)→再次约束→抑制<,>restrain(v.抑制)/constrain(v.强迫)/refrain(n.副歌)

restrain<,>/rɪˈstreɪn/<,>/rɪˈstreɪn/<,>v.制止/v.抑制<,>He had to restrain his anger.<,>他不得不抑制自己的愤怒。<,>The police restrained the violent protesters.<,>警察制止了暴力抗议者。<,>She restrained herself from making a rude comment.<,>她克制自己没有做出粗鲁的评论。<,>re(回)+strain(拉紧)→拉回来→抑制<,>restraint(n.克制)/constrain(v.强迫)/refrain(v.忍住)

singular<,>/ˈsɪŋɡjələ(r)/<,>/ˈsɪŋɡjələr/<,>adj.异常的/adj.奇异的<,>He has a singular ability to remember names.<,>他有记住名字的异常能力。<,>The plant has a singular appearance.<,>这种植物有奇异的外观。<,>Her singular behavior puzzled everyone.<,>她异常的行为让所有人都困惑。<,>sing(唱)+ular(形容词后缀)→像唱歌一样→奇异的<,>single(adj.单一的)/singularity(n.奇异)/plural(adj.复数的)
house<,>/haʊs/<,>/haʊs/<,>n.议院/n.会议厅<,>The House of Representatives passed the bill.<,>众议院通过了该法案。<,>The conference was held in the main house.<,>会议在主会议厅举行。<,>They debated the issue in the house.<,>他们在议院里辩论这个问题。<,>hou(hold)+se→容纳的地方→议院<,>horse(n.马)/hose(n.软管)/hover(v.盘旋)  

obligation<,>/ˌɒblɪˈɡeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑːblɪˈɡeɪʃn/<,>n.义务/n.职责/n.责任<,>He felt a moral obligation to help.<,>他感到有道义上的责任去帮助。<,>Paying taxes is a legal obligation.<,>纳税是法律义务。<,>She fulfilled her family obligations.<,>她履行了家庭责任。<,>ob(加强)+lig(捆绑)+ation→必须捆绑的责任<,>observation(n.观察)/oblivion(n.遗忘)/obliging(adj.乐于助人的)  

formerly<,>/ˈfɔːməli/<,>/ˈfɔːrmərli/<,>adv.以前/adv.从前<,>This building was formerly a school.<,>这栋建筑从前是所学校。<,>He was formerly the CEO of the company.<,>他以前是这家公司的CEO。<,>The town was formerly known for its mines.<,>这个镇以前以矿产闻名。<,>former(之前的)+ly(副词后缀)→从前<,>formally(adv.正式地)/formula(n.公式)/formation(n.形成)  

veil<,>/veɪl/<,>/veɪl/<,>v.以面纱遮掩/v.遮盖<,>She veiled her face with a scarf.<,>她用围巾遮住了脸。<,>The truth was veiled in mystery.<,>真相被神秘掩盖。<,>Morning fog veiled the mountains.<,>晨雾笼罩着群山。<,>veil→ve(看)+il→不让看→遮掩<,>vail(v.降低/n.小费)/vein(n.静脉)/veal(n.小牛肉)  

desert<,>/dɪˈzɜːt/<,>/dɪˈzɜːrt/<,>v.遗弃/v.擅离(职守)<,>He deserted his family.<,>他抛弃了家人。<,>Many soldiers deserted during the war.<,>战争期间许多士兵擅离职守。<,>The village was deserted after the disaster.<,>灾难后村庄被遗弃了。<,>de(离开)+sert(加入)→离开加入的地方→遗弃<,>dessert(n.甜点)/deserve(v.应得)/insert(v.插入)  

forsake<,>/fəˈseɪk/<,>/fɔːrˈseɪk/<,>v.遗弃/v.抛弃/v.摒绝<,>He forsook his bad habits.<,>他摒弃了坏习惯。<,>She was forsaken by her friends.<,>她被朋友抛弃了。<,>They forsook the old traditions.<,>他们摒弃了旧传统。<,>for(完全)+sake(缘故)→完全不要→抛弃<,>forswear(v.发誓放弃)/fortake(v.误拿)/forsooth(adv.确实)  

transmission<,>/trænzˈmɪʃn/<,>/trænsˈmɪʃn/<,>n.传播/n.传染<,>The transmission of diseases is a serious problem.<,>疾病传播是个严重问题。<,>The car has automatic transmission.<,>这辆车是自动变速的。<,>Radio transmission was interrupted.<,>无线电传播中断了。<,>trans(跨越)+miss(发送)+ion→跨空间发送→传播<,>transaction(n.交易)/transition(n.过渡)/transfusion(n.输血)  

displace<,>/dɪsˈpleɪs/<,>/dɪsˈpleɪs/<,>v.移置/v.取代/v.置换<,>Computers have displaced typewriters.<,>电脑取代了打字机。<,>The flood displaced thousands of people.<,>洪水使数千人流离失所。<,>Hydrogen displaces oxygen in this reaction.<,>这个反应中氢置换了氧。<,>dis(离开)+place(位置)→离开原位→移置<,>display(v.展示)/displease(v.使不快)/dispose(v.处理)  

displacement<,>/dɪsˈpleɪsmənt/<,>/dɪsˈpleɪsmənt/<,>n.移置/n.免职/n.置换<,>The displacement of soil caused erosion.<,>土壤移位导致了侵蚀。<,>His displacement from the position was unexpected.<,>他被免职出人意料。<,>Water displacement is used to measure volume.<,>水的置换用于测量体积。<,>displace(移置)+ment(名词后缀)→移置<,>displeasure(n.不悦)/disclosure(n.披露)/disposal(n.处理)  

colonist<,>/ˈkɒlənɪst/<,>/ˈkɑːlənɪst/<,>n.移民/n.殖民地居民<,>Early colonists faced many hardships.<,>早期移民面临许多困难。<,>The colonists rebelled against the king.<,>殖民地居民反抗国王。<,>These plants were brought by colonists.<,>这些植物是移民带来的。<,>colony(殖民地)+ist(人)→殖民地居民<,>colonial(adj.殖民的)/colonize(v.殖民)/colonnade(n.柱廊)
instrumental<,>/ˌɪnstrəˈmentl/<,>/ˌɪnstrəˈmɛntl/<,>adj.器乐的/adj.有帮助的<,>She was instrumental in organizing the charity event.<,>她在组织慈善活动中发挥了重要作用。<,>The band played an instrumental piece at the concert.<,>乐队在音乐会上演奏了一首器乐曲。<,>His advice was instrumental in solving the problem.<,>他的建议对解决问题很有帮助。<,>instrument(乐器)+al(形容词后缀)→与乐器有关的→器乐的<,>integral(adj.完整的)/incidental(adj.附带的)/fundamental(adj.基本的)

wardrobe<,>/ˈwɔːdrəʊb/<,>/ˈwɔːrdroʊb/<,>n.衣柜/n.衣橱/n.藏衣室<,>She bought a new wardrobe for her bedroom.<,>她为卧室买了一个新衣柜。<,>His wardrobe is full of designer clothes.<,>他的衣橱里全是名牌服装。<,>The movie features stunning period wardrobes.<,>这部电影展示了令人惊叹的复古服装。<,>ward(守卫)+robe(长袍)→存放衣服的地方→衣柜<,>cupboard(n.橱柜)/closet(n.壁橱)/garment(n.衣服)

garment<,>/ˈɡɑːmənt/<,>/ˈɡɑːrmənt/<,>n.衣服/n.服装/n.衣着<,>The garment industry employs thousands in this city.<,>服装业在这个城市雇佣了数千人。<,>She carefully folded each garment before packing.<,>她在打包前仔细地叠好每件衣服。<,>This garment is made from organic cotton.<,>这件衣服是用有机棉制成的。<,>gar(装饰)+ment(名词后缀)→装饰身体的物品→衣服<,>garnish(v.装饰)/garner(v.收集)/armament(n.武器装备)

Islam<,>/ˈɪzlɑːm/<,>/ˈɪzlɑm/<,>n.伊斯兰教/n.回教<,>Islam is one of the world's major religions.<,>伊斯兰教是世界主要宗教之一。<,>He converted to Islam last year.<,>他去年皈依了伊斯兰教。<,>The mosque is an important place of worship in Islam.<,>清真寺是伊斯兰教重要的礼拜场所。<,>Islam在阿拉伯语中意为"顺从"(真主)<,>Muslim(n.穆斯林)/Islamic(adj.伊斯兰教的)/Buddhism(n.佛教)

evenly<,>/ˈiːvnli/<,>/ˈivənli/<,>adv.一致地/adv.平静地<,>Spread the icing evenly over the cake.<,>把糖霜均匀地涂在蛋糕上。<,>The teams were evenly matched in the competition.<,>比赛中两队势均力敌。<,>She breathed evenly while sleeping.<,>她睡觉时呼吸均匀。<,>even(均匀的)+ly(副词后缀)→均匀地<,>eventually(adv.最终)/evening(n.傍晚)/evidently(adv.明显地)

compatible<,>/kəmˈpætəbl/<,>/kəmˈpætəbəl/<,>adj.兼容的<,>This software is compatible with most operating systems.<,>这个软件与大多数操作系统兼容。<,>Their blood types are not compatible for transfusion.<,>他们的血型不适合输血。<,>The couple found they were highly compatible.<,>这对夫妇发现他们非常合得来。<,>com(共同)+pat(忍受)+ible(能...的)→能共同存在的→兼容的<,>comparable(adj.可比较的)/compassionate(adj.有同情心的)/competent(adj.有能力的)

stitch<,>/stɪtʃ/<,>/stɪtʃ/<,>n.一针/n.缝线/v.缝<,>She put the last stitch in the embroidery.<,>她绣完了最后一针。<,>The doctor gave me three stitches on the wound.<,>医生给我的伤口缝了三针。<,>Can you stitch this button back on my shirt?<,>你能帮我把这个纽扣缝回衬衫上吗？<,>stitch与stick(粘住)形似→针线"粘"合布料<,>switch(v.转换)/sketch(n.草图)/snitch(v.告密)

troop<,>/truːp/<,>/trup/<,>n.一群/n.一队/n.大量<,>A troop of monkeys crossed the road.<,>一群猴子穿过了马路。<,>Troops were deployed to maintain peace.<,>军队被部署来维持和平。<,>She came with a whole troop of friends.<,>她带着一大群朋友来了。<,>troop与group(群)意思相近<,>troupe(n.剧团)/troll(n.巨怪)/trophy(n.奖杯)

concert<,>/ˈkɒnsət/<,>/ˈkɑːnsərt/<,>n.一齐/n.一致/n.协作<,>The choir sang in perfect concert.<,>合唱团完美和谐地演唱。<,>They worked in concert to finish the project.<,>他们齐心协力完成了项目。<,>We attended a classical music concert last night.<,>我们昨晚参加了一场古典音乐会。<,>con(共同)+cert(确定)→共同确定→一致行动<,>concern(n.关心)/convert(v.转换)/consent(v.同意)

chop<,>/tʃɒp/<,>/tʃɑp/<,>n.一块排骨/n.肉块<,>He ordered pork chops for dinner.<,>他晚餐点了猪排。<,>Chop the onions into small pieces.<,>把洋葱切成小块。<,>The lumberjack took a chop at the tree.<,>伐木工人砍了一下树。<,>chop与chip(碎片)相关→砍成碎片<,>shop(n.商店)/chap(n.家伙)/chirp(v.鸟叫)
baby<,>/ˈbeɪbi/<,>/ˈbeɪbi/<,>n.一家中年龄最小的人<,>She is the baby of the family.<,>她是家里最小的孩子。<,>The baby of the group always gets special attention.<,>团队中最年轻的人总是得到特别的关注。<,>He is the baby in the office, but very capable.<,>他是办公室里最年轻的，但非常能干。<,>bab(婴儿)+y(名词后缀)→婴儿→家中最小的成员<,>infant(n.婴儿)/toddler(n.学步儿童)/newborn(n.新生儿)

episode<,>/ˈepɪsəʊd/<,>/ˈepɪsoʊd/<,>n.（人生的）一段经历/（小说的）片段，插曲<,>That was an embarrassing episode in my life.<,>那是我人生中尴尬的一段经历。<,>The novel contains several exciting episodes.<,>小说中有几个激动人心的片段。<,>This TV series has 20 episodes.<,>这部电视剧有20集。<,>epi(在…之间)+sode(进入)→插入的部分→插曲<,>chapter(n.章节)/segment(n.部分)/installment(n.分期连载)

cluster<,>/ˈklʌstə(r)/<,>/ˈklʌstər/<,>n.串，束，簇/群，组/v.群聚；聚集<,>A cluster of stars can be seen in the night sky.<,>夜空中可以看到一群星星。<,>People clustered around the famous actor.<,>人们聚集在那位著名演员周围。<,>Grapes grow in clusters.<,>葡萄成串生长。<,>clust(群)+er(名词后缀)→群组<,>bunch(n.串)/group(n.组)/gather(v.聚集)

generalization<,>/ˌdʒenrəlaɪˈzeɪʃn/<,>/ˌdʒɛnərələˈzeɪʃən/<,>n.一般化；概括，综合<,>His conclusion is an overgeneralization.<,>他的结论过于笼统。<,>Scientific progress often comes from generalization.<,>科学进步常常来自概括。<,>This theory is a generalization of many observations.<,>这个理论是许多观察的综合。<,>general(一般的)+ization(名词后缀)→一般化<,>specialization(n.专业化)/categorization(n.分类)/summarization(n.总结)

burglar<,>/ˈbɜːɡlə(r)/<,>/ˈbɜːrɡlər/<,>n.夜盗，窃贼<,>The burglar was caught by the police.<,>窃贼被警察抓住了。<,>We installed an alarm to prevent burglars.<,>我们安装了警报器以防盗贼。<,>A burglar broke into our house last night.<,>昨晚有个窃贼闯入了我们家。<,>burg(城堡)+lar(人)→夜间闯入城堡的人→夜盗<,>thief(n.小偷)/robber(n.强盗)/intruder(n.入侵者)

amateur<,>/ˈæmətə(r)/<,>/ˈæmətər/<,>adj.业余的/n.业余爱好者<,>He is an amateur photographer.<,>他是个业余摄影师。<,>The competition is open to both professionals and amateurs.<,>比赛对专业和业余选手都开放。<,>She sings well for an amateur.<,>作为业余爱好者，她唱得不错。<,>amat(爱)+eur(人)→出于爱好而做的人→业余爱好者<,>professional(adj.专业的/n.专业人士)/novice(n.新手)/dilettante(n.浅薄的涉猎者)

metallurgy<,>/məˈtælədʒi/<,>/ˈmɛtlˌɜrdʒi/<,>n.冶金学，冶金术<,>He studied metallurgy in college.<,>他在大学学习冶金学。<,>Modern metallurgy has made great progress.<,>现代冶金学取得了巨大进步。<,>This factory specializes in powder metallurgy.<,>这家工厂专门从事粉末冶金。<,>metal(金属)+lurgy(工艺)→金属工艺→冶金学<,>chemistry(n.化学)/alchemy(n.炼金术)/smelting(n.熔炼)

Jesus<,>/ˈdʒiːzəs/<,>/ˈdʒiːzəs/<,>n.耶稣<,>Jesus is the central figure of Christianity.<,>耶稣是基督教的中心人物。<,>They prayed to Jesus for help.<,>他们向耶稣祈祷求助。<,>The teachings of Jesus have influenced millions.<,>耶稣的教导影响了数百万人。<,>来自希伯来语Yeshua(约书亚)的希腊语形式<,>Christ(n.基督)/Messiah(n.救世主)/Savior(n.救主)

fort<,>/fɔːt/<,>/fɔːrt/<,>n.要塞，堡垒<,>The soldiers defended the fort bravely.<,>士兵们勇敢地守卫着要塞。<,>This old fort was built in the 18th century.<,>这座旧堡垒建于18世纪。<,>They took shelter in the abandoned fort.<,>他们在废弃的堡垒中避难。<,>来自拉丁语fortis(强壮的)→坚固的建筑→堡垒<,>castle(n.城堡)/fortress(n.要塞)/stronghold(n.据点)

postulate<,>/ˈpɒstjəleɪt/<,>/ˈpɑːstʃəleɪt/<,>v.假定，假设<,>Einstein postulated the theory of relativity.<,>爱因斯坦提出了相对论假设。<,>The scientist postulated a new hypothesis.<,>这位科学家提出了一个新的假设。<,>We must postulate certain conditions for this experiment.<,>我们必须为这个实验假设某些条件。<,>post(后)+ulate(带来)→事后提出的→假设<,>assume(v.假定)/presume(v.推测)/hypothesize(v.假设)
prescription<,>/prɪˈskrɪpʃən/<,>/prɪˈskrɪpʃən/<,>n.药方/n.处方/n.处方药<,>The doctor wrote a prescription for antibiotics.<,>医生开了一张抗生素的处方。<,>This medicine is available only by prescription.<,>这种药只能凭处方购买。<,>She forgot to bring her prescription to the pharmacy.<,>她忘记带处方去药房了。<,>pre(预先)+script(写)+ion→预先写好的→处方<,>subscription(n.订阅/n.捐款)/description(n.描述/n.说明书)

cradle<,>/ˈkreɪdl/<,>/ˈkreɪdl/<,>n.摇篮/n.发源地<,>The baby slept peacefully in the cradle.<,>婴儿在摇篮里安静地睡觉。<,>Greece is often called the cradle of Western civilization.<,>希腊常被称为西方文明的发源地。<,>She gently rocked the cradle with her foot.<,>她用脚轻轻摇晃着摇篮。<,>cra(抓)+dle(小)→抓握的小东西→摇篮<,>crater(n.火山口/n.弹坑)/cable(n.电缆/n.缆绳)

waver<,>/ˈweɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈweɪvər/<,>v.犹豫不决/v.摇摆<,>He began to waver in his decision.<,>他开始对自己的决定犹豫不决。<,>The candle flame wavered in the breeze.<,>烛火在微风中摇曳。<,>Her voice wavered as she spoke about her loss.<,>她谈到自己的损失时声音颤抖了。<,>wave(波浪)+er→像波浪一样→摇摆<,>waiver(n.弃权/n.免除)/wander(v.漫游/v.徘徊)

wag<,>/wæɡ/<,>/wæɡ/<,>v.(狗)摇摆(尾巴)/v.摇晃(手指)<,>The dog wagged its tail happily.<,>狗高兴地摇着尾巴。<,>She wagged her finger at the naughty child.<,>她对淘气的孩子摇了摇手指。<,>His beard wags when he talks.<,>他说话时胡子一翘一翘的。<,>wag→wig(假发)→摇动假发<,>wage(n.工资/v.进行)/swag(n.赃物/n.摇晃)

oxide<,>/ˈɒksaɪd/<,>/ˈɑːksaɪd/<,>n.氧化物<,>Rust is a form of iron oxide.<,>锈是铁氧化物的一种形式。<,>Aluminum oxide is used as an abrasive.<,>氧化铝被用作研磨剂。<,>The compound decomposes into its constituent oxides.<,>该化合物分解为其组成的氧化物。<,>oxi(氧)+de→氧化物<,>dioxide(n.二氧化物)/peroxide(n.过氧化物)

oxidize<,>/ˈɒksɪdaɪz/<,>/ˈɑːksɪdaɪz/<,>v.氧化/v.使生锈<,>Iron oxidizes when exposed to air and moisture.<,>铁暴露在空气和湿气中会氧化。<,>The copper statue has oxidized to a green color.<,>铜像氧化变成了绿色。<,>Enzymes help oxidize fats in the body.<,>酶帮助氧化体内的脂肪。<,>oxide(氧化物)+ize(使)→使变成氧化物→氧化<,>oxygenize(v.氧化/v.充氧)/deoxidize(v.脱氧/v.还原)

domestic<,>/dəˈmestɪk/<,>/dəˈmestɪk/<,>adj.家养的<,>Domestic cats are popular pets worldwide.<,>家猫是世界各地受欢迎的宠物。<,>They keep domestic rabbits in their backyard.<,>他们在后院养了家兔。<,>The farm raises both domestic and wild animals.<,>农场既饲养家畜也饲养野生动物。<,>dome(家)+stic→家里的→家养的<,>domicile(n.住所/v.定居)/dominant(adj.支配的/adj.显性的)

foster<,>/ˈfɒstə(r)/<,>/ˈfɔːstər/<,>v.培养/v.抚育/v.代养<,>The program fosters creativity in children.<,>这个项目培养孩子们的创造力。<,>They decided to foster a child in need.<,>他们决定代养一个有需要的孩子。<,>Good communication fosters strong relationships.<,>良好的沟通能培养牢固的关系。<,>fost(食物)+er→提供食物→养育<,>fester(v.化脓/v.恶化)/fosterage(n.养育/n.寄养)

balcony<,>/ˈbælkəni/<,>/ˈbælkəni/<,>n.阳台/n.楼厅/n.楼座<,>She stood on the balcony enjoying the view.<,>她站在阳台上欣赏风景。<,>We had seats in the first balcony at the theater.<,>我们在剧院的一楼包厢有座位。<,>The hotel room has a small balcony overlooking the sea.<,>酒店房间有一个可以俯瞰大海的小阳台。<,>bal(球)+cony→球形的突出部分→阳台<,>balcony→ballet(芭蕾)+cony→看芭蕾的楼座<,>balcony/veranda(n.走廊/n.阳台)/gallery(n.画廊/n.楼座)

anode<,>/ˈænəʊd/<,>/ˈænoʊd/<,>n.阳极/n.正极/n.板极<,>The anode attracts negatively charged particles.<,>阳极吸引带负电荷的粒子。<,>Connect the red wire to the anode terminal.<,>将红线连接到正极端子。<,>This metal serves as the anode in the battery.<,>这种金属在电池中作为阳极。<,>ana(向上)+ode(路)→电流向上的路→阳极<,>cathode(n.阴极/n.负极)/electrode(n.电极)
proverb<,>/ˈprɒvɜːb/<,>/ˈprɑːvɜːrb/<,>n.谚语/n.格言/n.箴言<,>As the proverb says, "Actions speak louder than words."<,>正如谚语所说：“行动胜于雄辩。”<,>He often quotes proverbs in his speeches.<,>他经常在演讲中引用谚语。<,>This ancient proverb still holds true today.<,>这句古老的谚语至今仍然适用。<,>pro(前)+verb(词)→前人说的话→谚语<,>adage(n.格言)/maxim(n.箴言)/saying(n.俗语)

banquet<,>/ˈbæŋkwɪt/<,>/ˈbæŋkwɪt/<,>n.宴会/n.盛会/n.酒席<,>The company held a grand banquet to celebrate its anniversary.<,>公司举办了一场盛大的宴会来庆祝周年纪念。<,>They were invited to a wedding banquet.<,>他们被邀请参加婚宴。<,>The banquet featured delicious food and live music.<,>宴会上有美味的食物和现场音乐。<,>ban(禁止)+quet(安静)→不安静的场合→宴会<,>feast(n.盛宴)/dinner(n.晚餐)/reception(n.招待会)

scope<,>/skəʊp/<,>/skoʊp/<,>n.范围/n.机会/n.眼界<,>The scope of this research is quite broad.<,>这项研究的范围相当广泛。<,>She was given more scope to develop her skills.<,>她获得了更多发展技能的机会。<,>Traveling broadens one's scope.<,>旅行可以开阔人的眼界。<,>s(看)+cope(处理)→能看到的处理范围→范围<,>range(n.范围)/extent(n.程度)/spectrum(n.光谱)

cloak<,>/kləʊk/<,>/kloʊk/<,>v.掩盖/v.掩饰/v.覆盖<,>He tried to cloak his disappointment with a smile.<,>他试图用微笑掩饰失望。<,>The mountains were cloaked in mist.<,>群山被雾气笼罩。<,>Her words cloaked a hidden threat.<,>她的话里暗藏威胁。<,>clo(布)+ak(动作)→用布盖住→掩盖<,>conceal(v.隐藏)/disguise(v.伪装)/veil(v.遮盖)

sharply<,>/ˈʃɑːpli/<,>/ˈʃɑːrpli/<,>adv.严厉地/adv.苛刻地<,>She spoke sharply to the naughty child.<,>她严厉地训斥了那个淘气的孩子。<,>Prices rose sharply last month.<,>上个月物价急剧上涨。<,>The road turns sharply to the left.<,>这条路急转向左。<,>sharp(尖锐的)+ly(副词后缀)→尖锐地→严厉地<,>harshly(adv.严厉地)/severely(adv.严重地)/abruptly(adv.突然地)

prolong<,>/prəˈlɒŋ/<,>/prəˈlɔːŋ/<,>v.延长/v.拉长/v.拖延<,>They prolonged their stay in Paris.<,>他们延长了在巴黎的停留时间。<,>The medicine can prolong life.<,>这种药物可以延长生命。<,>Don't prolong the meeting unnecessarily.<,>不要不必要地拖延会议。<,>pro(向前)+long(长)→向前拉长→延长<,>extend(v.延伸)/lengthen(v.加长)/delay(v.延迟)

retard<,>/rɪˈtɑːd/<,>/rɪˈtɑːrd/<,>v.阻碍/v.减缓/v.放慢<,>Bad weather retarded our progress.<,>恶劣的天气阻碍了我们的进展。<,>Lack of education can retard a child's development.<,>缺乏教育会减缓儿童的发展。<,>The drug retards the growth of cancer cells.<,>这种药物能减缓癌细胞的生长。<,>re(回)+tard(慢)→使慢下来→阻碍<,>hinder(v.妨碍)/impede(v.阻止)/slow(v.减慢)

pickle<,>/ˈpɪkl/<,>/ˈpɪkl/<,>n.腌制食品/n.泡菜<,>I love eating pickles with my sandwich.<,>我喜欢在三明治里加泡菜。<,>These cucumbers will be made into pickles.<,>这些黄瓜将被做成腌菜。<,>Grandma's homemade pickles are delicious.<,>奶奶自制的腌菜很好吃。<,>pick(挑选)+le(小)→挑选出来的小菜→泡菜<,>preserve(n.蜜饯)/sauerkraut(n.德国泡菜)/chutney(n.酸辣酱)

dentist<,>/ˈdentɪst/<,>/ˈdentɪst/<,>n.牙科医生<,>I have an appointment with the dentist tomorrow.<,>我明天约了牙医。<,>The dentist filled my cavity.<,>牙医补了我的蛀牙。<,>She has been a dentist for over 20 years.<,>她当牙医已经20多年了。<,>dent(牙齿)+ist(人)→处理牙齿的人→牙医<,>orthodontist(n.正畸医生)/periodontist(n.牙周病医生)/oral surgeon(n.口腔外科医生)

opium<,>/ˈəʊpiəm/<,>/ˈoʊpiəm/<,>n.鸦片/n.麻醉剂<,>Opium was once used as a painkiller.<,>鸦片曾被用作止痛药。<,>The Opium Wars changed Chinese history.<,>鸦片战争改变了中国历史。<,>Opium addiction is dangerous.<,>鸦片成瘾很危险。<,>opi(汁液)+um(物质)→从罂粟中提取的物质→鸦片<,>morphine(n.吗啡)/heroin(n.海洛因)/narcotic(n.麻醉药)
deposit<,>/dɪˈpɒzɪt/<,>/dɪˈpɑːzɪt/<,>n.押金/n.存款/v.存放<,>You need to pay a deposit to rent the apartment.<,>你需要支付押金才能租这间公寓。<,>He deposited the money in the bank.<,>他把钱存入了银行。<,>The river deposited silt at its mouth.<,>河流在河口处沉积了淤泥。<,>de(向下)+posit(放置)→放下→存放<,>dispose(v.处理)/position(n.位置)/opposite(adj.相反的)

squeeze<,>/skwiːz/<,>/skwiz/<,>v.压榨/v.榨取/n.挤压<,>She squeezed the juice from the orange.<,>她从橙子里榨出果汁。<,>He squeezed through the narrow gap.<,>他从狭窄的缝隙中挤了过去。<,>The company is squeezing its suppliers for lower prices.<,>公司正在压榨供应商以获取更低的价格。<,>sque(挤压声)+eeze→挤压的动作<,>squeak(v.吱吱叫)/squeegee(n.橡皮刮板)/squelch(v.压制)
