compression<,>/kəmˈpreʃən/<,>/kəmˈprɛʃən/<,>n.压缩/n.压紧/n.浓缩<,>The compression of the spring stores energy.<,>弹簧的压缩储存了能量。<,>Data compression reduces file sizes.<,>数据压缩减小了文件大小。<,>He felt a compression in his chest.<,>他感到胸部有压迫感。<,>com(共同)+press(压)+ion→一起压→压缩<,>depression(n.沮丧)/expression(n.表达)/impression(n.印象)

squash<,>/skwɒʃ/<,>/skwɑːʃ/<,>v.压碎/n.果汁饮料/n.南瓜<,>He accidentally squashed the tomato.<,>他不小心把番茄压碎了。<,>Would you like some orange squash?<,>你要来点橙汁饮料吗？<,>Butternut squash is rich in vitamins.<,>冬南瓜富含维生素。<,>squa(挤压声)+sh→压碎的声音<,>squashy(adj.易压碎的)/squashable(adj.可压扁的)/squashiness(n.易压碎性)

overwhelming<,>/ˌəʊvəˈwelmɪŋ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈwelmɪŋ/<,>adj.压倒的/adj.势不可挡的<,>The response to our appeal was overwhelming.<,>对我们呼吁的响应是压倒性的。<,>She felt an overwhelming urge to cry.<,>她感到一股无法抑制的想哭的冲动。<,>The evidence against him was overwhelming.<,>对他不利的证据是压倒性的。<,>over(过度)+whelm(淹没)+ing→过度淹没的<,>underwhelming(adj.未达到预期的)/overbearing(adj.专横的)/overpowering(adj.强烈的)

overwhelm<,>/ˌəʊvəˈwelm/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈwelm/<,>v.使不知所措/v.压倒/v.击败<,>The floodwaters overwhelmed the village.<,>洪水淹没了村庄。<,>She was overwhelmed by grief.<,>她被悲伤压垮了。<,>Our team overwhelmed the opponents.<,>我们队击败了对手。<,>over(过度)+whelm(淹没)→过度淹没→压倒<,>underwhelm(v.未达到预期)/overpower(v.制服)/overcome(v.克服)

velocity<,>/vəˈlɒsəti/<,>/vəˈlɑːsəti/<,>n.迅速/n.快速/n.速度<,>The car was moving at high velocity.<,>汽车正以高速行驶。<,>The velocity of light is constant.<,>光速是恒定的。<,>He completed the task with surprising velocity.<,>他以惊人的速度完成了任务。<,>veloc(快速)+ity→快速的状态<,>veracity(n.真实)/voracity(n.贪婪)/velocity(n.速度)

circulation<,>/ˌsɜːkjəˈleɪʃən/<,>/ˌsɜːrkjəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.血液循环/n.流通/n.发行量<,>Exercise improves blood circulation.<,>运动改善血液循环。<,>The newspaper has a wide circulation.<,>这份报纸发行量很大。<,>The new coins are now in circulation.<,>新硬币现在已流通。<,>circu(环)+lation→循环的状态<,>circumference(n.圆周)/circuit(n.电路)/circular(adj.圆形的)

patrol<,>/pəˈtrəʊl/<,>/pəˈtroʊl/<,>n.巡逻/n.巡查/v.巡逻<,>The police increased patrols in the area.<,>警方加强了该地区的巡逻。<,>We saw a patrol car on the street.<,>我们在街上看到了一辆巡逻车。<,>Soldiers patrol the border every night.<,>士兵每晚在边境巡逻。<,>patr(父亲)+ol→像父亲一样巡视<,>petrol(n.汽油)/patron(n.赞助人)/patriot(n.爱国者)

cruise<,>/kruːz/<,>/kruz/<,>v.巡航/v.漫游/n.游轮<,>We cruised along the coast.<,>我们沿着海岸巡航。<,>They went on a Caribbean cruise.<,>他们乘坐游轮去了加勒比海。<,>The car was cruising at 60 mph.<,>汽车以每小时60英里的速度巡航。<,>cruis(十字)+e→像十字一样四处游走<,>bruise(n.瘀伤)/cruse(n.小罐)/crusade(n.十字军东征)
quest<,>/kwest/<,>/kwɛst/<,>v.寻找/v.追求<,>He went on a quest to find the hidden treasure.<,>他踏上了寻找隐藏宝藏的旅程。<,>Her lifelong quest for knowledge never ends.<,>她对知识的毕生追求永无止境。<,>The knight embarked on a quest to rescue the princess.<,>骑士踏上了营救公主的征程。<,>ques(询问)+t(动作)→不断询问→追求<,>request(n.请求/v.要求)/question(n.问题/v.询问)  

cigar<,>/sɪˈɡɑː(r)/<,>/sɪˈɡɑr/<,>n.雪茄烟/n.叶卷烟<,>He lit a cigar and leaned back in his chair.<,>他点燃一支雪茄，靠在椅子上。<,>The smell of cigar smoke filled the room.<,>雪茄烟的味道充满了房间。<,>She gave him a box of expensive cigars as a gift.<,>她送给他一盒昂贵的雪茄作为礼物。<,>cigar(音似"雪茄")<,>cigarette(n.香烟)/pipe(n.烟斗)  

scholarship<,>/ˈskɒləʃɪp/<,>/ˈskɑːlərʃɪp/<,>n.奖学金/n.学问/n.学识<,>She won a scholarship to study abroad.<,>她获得了出国留学的奖学金。<,>His scholarship in ancient history is widely recognized.<,>他在古代历史方面的学识广受认可。<,>The university offers various scholarships for outstanding students.<,>该大学为优秀学生提供多种奖学金。<,>scholar(学者)+ship(状态)→学者的状态→学识<,>fellowship(n.研究员职位/n.友谊)/leadership(n.领导能力)  

radiant<,>/ˈreɪdiənt/<,>/ˈreɪdiənt/<,>adj.容光焕发的/adj.灿烂的<,>The bride looked radiant on her wedding day.<,>新娘在婚礼当天容光焕发。<,>The radiant sun warmed the earth.<,>灿烂的阳光温暖了大地。<,>Her radiant smile brightened everyone's day.<,>她灿烂的笑容让每个人的一天都明亮起来。<,>radi(光线)+ant(形容词后缀)→发光的→灿烂的<,>radiate(v.辐射/v.散发)/radius(n.半径)  

gorgeous<,>/ˈɡɔːdʒəs/<,>/ˈɡɔrdʒəs/<,>adj.极其漂亮的/adj.极其吸引人的/adj.绚丽的/adj.华丽的<,>She wore a gorgeous dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件极其漂亮的裙子去参加派对。<,>The sunset over the ocean was absolutely gorgeous.<,>海上的日落极其绚丽。<,>They stayed in a gorgeous hotel during their vacation.<,>他们在度假期间住在一家极其豪华的酒店。<,>gorge(峡谷)+ous(形容词后缀)→像峡谷一样壮观的→绚丽的<,>gorge(n.峡谷)/gorgon(n.蛇发女妖)  

option<,>/ˈɒpʃn/<,>/ˈɑːpʃn/<,>n.选择/n.取舍<,>You have the option to take the exam or write a paper.<,>你可以选择参加考试或写论文。<,>We need to consider all our options carefully.<,>我们需要仔细考虑所有的选择。<,>The menu offers several vegetarian options.<,>菜单提供几种素食选择。<,>opt(选择)+ion(名词后缀)→选择<,>optional(adj.可选择的)/adoption(n.采纳/n.收养)  

cock<,>/kɒk/<,>/kɑːk/<,>n.公鸡<,>The cock crowed at dawn.<,>公鸡在黎明时分啼叫。<,>They keep several cocks on their farm.<,>他们在农场养了几只公鸡。<,>The cock's feathers were brightly colored.<,>这只公鸡的羽毛颜色鲜艳。<,>cock(拟声词，模仿公鸡叫声)<,>hen(n.母鸡)/rooster(n.公鸡)  

melody<,>/ˈmelədi/<,>/ˈmelədi/<,>n.旋律/n.曲调/n.歌曲<,>She hummed a familiar melody.<,>她哼着一首熟悉的旋律。<,>The melody of this song is very catchy.<,>这首歌的曲调非常朗朗上口。<,>He composed a beautiful melody for the poem.<,>他为这首诗创作了一首优美的歌曲。<,>mel(甜)+ody(唱)→甜美的歌唱→旋律<,>melodic(adj.旋律的)/harmony(n.和声)  

overhang<,>/ˌəʊvəˈhæŋ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈhæŋ/<,>v.悬于...之上/v.悬垂<,>The cliff overhangs the river below.<,>悬崖悬垂在下面的河流上。<,>Be careful of the overhanging branches.<,>小心那些悬垂的树枝。<,>The balcony overhangs the street by several feet.<,>阳台悬垂在街道上方几英尺处。<,>over(在...上)+hang(悬挂)→悬垂<,>overhead(adj.头顶上的)/underhang(不存在，反义构词)  

console<,>/kənˈsəʊl/<,>/kənˈsoʊl/<,>n.悬臂/n.肘托/n.控制台<,>The pilot checked the instruments on the console.<,>飞行员检查了控制台上的仪器。<,>He rested his arms on the console while driving.<,>开车时他把手臂放在肘托上。<,>The computer console was blinking with warning lights.<,>电脑控制台闪烁着警告灯。<,>con(共同)+sole(单独)→共同支撑的单独部件→控制台<,>consolation(n.安慰)/control(n.控制/v.操纵)
propaganda<,>/ˌprɒpəˈɡændə/<,>/ˌprɑːpəˈɡændə/<,>n.宣传<,>The government used propaganda to influence public opinion.<,>政府利用宣传来影响公众舆论。<,>The film was criticized for its political propaganda.<,>这部电影因政治宣传而受到批评。<,>She saw through the propaganda and made her own decision.<,>她看穿了宣传，做出了自己的决定。<,>pro(向前)+paganda(传播)→向前传播→宣传<,>propagate(v.传播/v.繁殖)/propensity(n.倾向/n.癖好)

declaration<,>/ˌdekləˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌdekləˈreɪʃn/<,>n.宣布/n.宣言<,>The declaration of independence was a historic moment.<,>独立宣言是一个历史性时刻。<,>He made a declaration of love to her.<,>他向她表白爱意。<,>The company issued a declaration about its new policy.<,>公司发布了关于新政策的声明。<,>de(强调)+clar(清楚)+ation→清楚地宣布→宣言<,>clarify(v.澄清)/declare(v.宣布)/declarative(adj.声明的)

narration<,>/nəˈreɪʃn/<,>/nəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.叙述/n.故事/n.叙述法<,>His narration of the event was very detailed.<,>他对事件的叙述非常详细。<,>The book is written in first-person narration.<,>这本书是用第一人称叙述的。<,>She has a talent for vivid narration.<,>她有生动叙述的天赋。<,>narrat(讲述)+ion→讲述的行为→叙述<,>narrate(v.叙述)/narrative(n.叙述/adj.叙事的)/narrator(n.叙述者)

sequence<,>/ˈsiːkwəns/<,>/ˈsiːkwəns/<,>n.序列/n.顺序<,>Please arrange these numbers in sequence.<,>请按顺序排列这些数字。<,>The DNA sequence was analyzed by scientists.<,>科学家分析了DNA序列。<,>He described the sequence of events leading to the accident.<,>他描述了导致事故的事件顺序。<,>sequ(跟随)+ence→一个接一个→顺序<,>consequence(n.结果)/subsequence(n.后继)/sequential(adj.连续的)

warrant<,>/ˈwɒrənt/<,>/ˈwɔːrənt/<,>n.令状/n.许可证<,>The police obtained a search warrant.<,>警方获得了搜查令。<,>You need a warrant to enter the property.<,>你需要许可证才能进入该物业。<,>The judge issued an arrest warrant for the suspect.<,>法官对嫌疑人发出了逮捕令。<,>war(战争)+rant(叫喊)→战争中叫喊需要授权→许可证<,>warranty(n.保证)/guarantee(n.保证/v.担保)/warrantor(n.保证人)

requisite<,>/ˈrekwɪzɪt/<,>/ˈrekwɪzɪt/<,>adj.需要的/adj.必要的/n.必需品<,>Patience is a requisite quality for a teacher.<,>耐心是教师必备的品质。<,>She packed all the requisites for the trip.<,>她打包了旅行所需的所有必需品。<,>The job has certain requisite skills.<,>这份工作有某些必备技能。<,>re(再)+quis(寻求)+ite→一再寻求的→必需品<,>requisition(n.征用/v.征用)/prerequisite(n.先决条件)/exquisite(adj.精致的)

embroidery<,>/ɪmˈbrɔɪdəri/<,>/ɪmˈbrɔɪdəri/<,>n.绣花/n.刺绣/n.绣制品<,>She learned embroidery from her grandmother.<,>她从祖母那里学会了刺绣。<,>The dress was decorated with beautiful embroidery.<,>这件连衣裙装饰着美丽的绣花。<,>He admired the intricate embroidery on the pillow.<,>他欣赏枕头上复杂的绣制品。<,>em(进入)+broider(编织)+y→编织进去→刺绣<,>embroider(v.刺绣)/embroid(n.刺绣品)/broider(v.编织)

nun<,>/nʌn/<,>/nʌn/<,>n.修女/n.尼姑<,>The nun dedicated her life to helping the poor.<,>这位修女毕生致力于帮助穷人。<,>She became a nun at the age of twenty.<,>她在二十岁时成为了一名修女。<,>The nuns prayed together in the chapel.<,>修女们在小教堂里一起祈祷。<,>nun(发音类似"none")→一无所有→修女<,>nunnery(n.女修道院)/monk(n.和尚)/priest(n.牧师)

eloquence<,>/ˈeləkwəns/<,>/ˈeləkwəns/<,>n.雄辩/n.口才/n.修辞<,>His eloquence moved the audience to tears.<,>他的雄辩让观众感动得流泪。<,>She is known for her eloquence in public speaking.<,>她以公开演讲的口才而闻名。<,>The lawyer's eloquence won the case.<,>律师的雄辩赢得了案件。<,>e(出)+loqu(说)+ence→能说会道→雄辩<,>eloquent(adj.雄辩的)/colloquial(adj.口语的)/soliloquy(n.独白)

wind<,>/wɪnd/<,>/wɪnd/<,>n.风<,>The wind blew the leaves off the trees.<,>风把树叶从树上吹落。<,>Strong winds are expected tomorrow.<,>预计明天会有大风。<,>She felt the cool wind on her face.<,>她感觉到凉爽的风吹在脸上。<,>wind(发音类似"win'd")→赢得风→风<,>windy(adj.有风的)/window(n.窗户)/winding(adj.蜿蜒的)
directory<,>/dəˈrektəri/<,>/dɪˈrektəri/<,>n.姓名地址录<,>You can find his contact details in the directory.<,>你可以在姓名地址录中找到他的联系方式。<,>The telephone directory lists all the numbers in the area.<,>电话簿列出了该地区所有的电话号码。<,>She looked up the company's address in the business directory.<,>她在商业名录中查找了公司的地址。<,>direct(指导)+ory(场所)→指导查找信息的场所<,>dictator(n.独裁者)/director(n.导演/n.主管)

pacific<,>/pəˈsɪfɪk/<,>/pəˈsɪfɪk/<,>adj.性情温和的<,>He has a pacific nature and rarely gets angry.<,>他性情温和，很少生气。<,>The pacific tone of her voice calmed everyone down.<,>她温和的语气让大家都平静下来。<,>Despite the provocation, he remained pacific in his response.<,>尽管受到挑衅，他的回应依然温和。<,>paci(和平)+fic(做)→制造和平的<,>specific(adj.具体的)/terrific(adj.极好的)

survival<,>/səˈvaɪvəl/<,>/sərˈvaɪvəl/<,>n.幸存/n.残存/n.幸存者<,>Survival in the wilderness requires special skills.<,>在野外生存需要特殊技能。<,>The survival rate of the disease has improved significantly.<,>这种疾病的存活率已显著提高。<,>He was the sole survival of the plane crash.<,>他是飞机失事的唯一幸存者。<,>sur(超过)+viv(生活)+al→超越生命的状态<,>revival(n.复兴)/arrival(n.到达)

flush<,>/flʌʃ/<,>/flʌʃ/<,>n.脸红/n.一阵强烈情感/n.(流露出的)一阵激情<,>A flush of embarrassment spread across her face.<,>一阵尴尬的红晕浮现在她脸上。<,>He felt a sudden flush of anger at the unfair treatment.<,>他对不公平的待遇感到一阵愤怒。<,>The team's victory brought a flush of excitement to the fans.<,>球队的胜利给球迷带来一阵兴奋。<,>flash(闪光)与flush(脸红)都表示突然出现<,>blush(v.脸红)/flash(n.闪光)

formal<,>/ˈfɔːməl/<,>/ˈfɔːrməl/<,>adj.正规的/adj.庄重的<,>The invitation requires formal attire.<,>请柬要求穿正装。<,>They had a formal meeting to discuss the contract.<,>他们举行了正式会议讨论合同。<,>His speech was too formal for such a casual occasion.<,>他的演讲在这种非正式场合显得太庄重了。<,>form(形式)+al→注重形式的<,>normal(adj.正常的)/informal(adj.非正式的)

constituent<,>/kənˈstɪtjuənt/<,>/kənˈstɪtʃuənt/<,>adj.构成的/n.选民<,>Hydrogen and oxygen are constituent elements of water.<,>氢和氧是水的组成元素。<,>The senator listened carefully to his constituents' concerns.<,>参议员认真听取了选民们的关切。<,>Each constituent part plays a vital role in the machine.<,>每个组成部分在机器中都起着至关重要的作用。<,>con(共同)+stitut(站立)+ent→共同站在一起的<,>constitute(v.组成)/institute(n.学院)

scarlet<,>/ˈskɑːlɪt/<,>/ˈskɑːrlɪt/<,>n.猩红色/adj.猩红的<,>She was dressed in a striking scarlet dress.<,>她穿着一件醒目的猩红色连衣裙。<,>The maple leaves turned scarlet in autumn.<,>枫叶在秋天变成了猩红色。<,>He was caught scarlet-handed stealing the jewels.<,>他在偷珠宝时被当场抓获。<,>scar(伤疤)+let(小)→像伤疤一样的红色<,>crimson(n.深红色)/cardinal(adj.深红色的)

religion<,>/rɪˈlɪdʒən/<,>/rɪˈlɪdʒən/<,>n.宗教<,>Freedom of religion is protected by the constitution.<,>宗教信仰自由受宪法保护。<,>She studies comparative religion at university.<,>她在大学学习比较宗教学。<,>Ancient Egyptians had a complex religion with many gods.<,>古埃及人有着多神崇拜的复杂宗教体系。<,>re(再)+lig(绑)+ion→将人与神再次绑在一起<,>region(n.地区)/legion(n.军团)

novelty<,>/ˈnɒvəlti/<,>/ˈnɑːvəlti/<,>n.新颖/n.新奇的事物<,>The novelty of the idea attracted many investors.<,>这个想法的新颖性吸引了许多投资者。<,>Tourists enjoy buying local novelties as souvenirs.<,>游客喜欢购买当地新奇物品作为纪念品。<,>After a while, the novelty of the gadget wore off.<,>过了一段时间，这个小玩意的新奇感就消失了。<,>nov(新)+elty→新的事物<,>novel(n.小说)/naval(adj.海军的)

regenerative<,>/rɪˈdʒenərətɪv/<,>/rɪˈdʒenəreɪtɪv/<,>adj.回授的/adj.再生的<,>The regenerative braking system saves energy in electric cars.<,>再生制动系统为电动汽车节省能源。<,>Scientists are studying the regenerative abilities of certain animals.<,>科学家正在研究某些动物的再生能力。<,>This process has a regenerative effect on the environment.<,>这个过程对环境有再生作用。<,>re(再)+gener(产生)+ative→再次产生的<,>degenerative(adj.退化的)/generate(v.产生)
bridegroom<,>/ˈbraɪdɡruːm/<,>/ˈbraɪdˌɡruːm/<,>n.新郎<,>The bridegroom looked nervous but happy at the wedding.<,>婚礼上，新郎看起来很紧张但很开心。<,>The bridegroom kissed his bride after exchanging vows.<,>交换誓言后，新郎亲吻了他的新娘。<,>Everyone toasted the bride and bridegroom.<,>每个人都向新娘和新郎敬酒。<,>bride(新娘)+groom(马夫)→新郎<,>bride(n.新娘)/groom(n.马夫/v.照料)

novel<,>/ˈnɒv(ə)l/<,>/ˈnɑːv(ə)l/<,>adj.新的/adj.异常的<,>She came up with a novel idea to solve the problem.<,>她提出了一个新颖的解决问题的方法。<,>The novel approach surprised everyone.<,>这种异常的方法让每个人都感到惊讶。<,>This is a novel experience for me.<,>这对我来说是一次新奇的经历。<,>nov(新的)+el(形容词后缀)→新的<,>novel(n.小说)/nova(n.新星)

zinc<,>/zɪŋk/<,>/zɪŋk/<,>n.锌/v.在…上镀锌<,>Zinc is an essential mineral for the human body.<,>锌是人体必需的矿物质。<,>They decided to zinc the roof to prevent rust.<,>他们决定在屋顶上镀锌以防生锈。<,>The zinc coating protects the metal underneath.<,>锌涂层保护下面的金属。<,>联想"zoo"(动物园)+"ink"(墨水)→动物园用墨水涂锌板<,>sink(v.下沉/n.水槽)/pink(n.粉红色)

appreciation<,>/əˌpriːʃɪˈeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/əˌpriːʃiˈeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>n.欣赏/n.感激<,>She showed great appreciation for the gift.<,>她对这份礼物表示了极大的欣赏。<,>I'd like to express my appreciation for your help.<,>我想对你的帮助表示感激。<,>The art appreciation class is very popular.<,>艺术欣赏课非常受欢迎。<,>ap(加强)+preci(价值)+ation(名词后缀)→给予价值→欣赏<,>depreciation(n.贬值)/apprehension(n.理解/忧虑)

psychology<,>/saɪˈkɒlədʒi/<,>/saɪˈkɑːlədʒi/<,>n.心理学/n.心理<,>He majored in psychology at university.<,>他在大学主修心理学。<,>Understanding consumer psychology is important for marketing.<,>理解消费者心理对营销很重要。<,>Her knowledge of psychology helps her in counseling.<,>她的心理学知识帮助她进行咨询。<,>psycho(心理)+logy(学科)→心理学<,>physiology(n.生理学)/psychiatry(n.精神病学)

crab<,>/kræb/<,>/kræb/<,>n.蟹/n.蟹肉/v.捕蟹<,>We had delicious crab for dinner.<,>我们晚餐吃了美味的蟹肉。<,>He likes to crab at the beach on weekends.<,>他喜欢周末在海边捕蟹。<,>The crab moved sideways along the shore.<,>螃蟹沿着岸边横着走。<,>联想"crab"发音像"快捕"→捕蟹<,>crib(n.婴儿床)/crop(n.庄稼)

subscript<,>/ˈsʌbskrɪpt/<,>/ˈsʌbskrɪpt/<,>adj.写在下方的/n.下标<,>Please write your name in subscript letters.<,>请用下标字母写下你的名字。<,>The chemical formula uses subscripts to show the number of atoms.<,>化学公式使用下标显示原子数量。<,>In mathematics, subscripts are often used for sequences.<,>在数学中，下标常用于序列。<,>sub(下面)+script(写)→写在下面→下标<,>superscript(n.上标)/subscription(n.订阅)

sideways<,>/ˈsaɪdweɪz/<,>/ˈsaɪdweɪz/<,>adv.斜向一边地<,>The car skidded sideways on the icy road.<,>汽车在结冰的路面上向一侧打滑。<,>He looked at her sideways, unsure of her reaction.<,>他斜眼看着她，不确定她的反应。<,>The crab walked sideways across the sand.<,>螃蟹横着走过沙滩。<,>side(边)+way(路)+s→斜向一边地<,>sidewalk(n.人行道)/sideways(adj.横向的)

jean<,>/dʒiːn/<,>/dʒiːn/<,>n.斜纹布/n.牛仔裤<,>She was wearing a pair of blue jeans.<,>她穿着一条蓝色牛仔裤。<,>This jacket is made of durable jean fabric.<,>这件夹克是用耐用的斜纹布制成的。<,>Denim jeans are popular worldwide.<,>牛仔布牛仔裤在世界各地都很受欢迎。<,>来自Genoa(热那亚)的斜纹布→牛仔裤<,>gene(n.基因)/jeans(n.牛仔裤)

gradient<,>/ˈɡreɪdiənt/<,>/ˈɡreɪdiənt/<,>n.斜坡<,>The road has a steep gradient that makes cycling difficult.<,>这条路有一个陡峭的斜坡，使得骑车很困难。<,>The temperature gradient affects weather patterns.<,>温度梯度影响天气模式。<,>They measured the gradient of the hill for the construction project.<,>他们为建设项目测量了山丘的坡度。<,>grad(步)+i+ent(名词后缀)→一步步上升→斜坡<,>gradient(adj.渐变的)/graduate(v.毕业)
vicious<,>/ˈvɪʃəs/<,>/ˈvɪʃəs/<,>adj.邪恶的/adj.恶性的<,>The dictator ruled with a vicious hand.<,>这个独裁者以残暴手段统治。<,>He suffered from a vicious cycle of addiction.<,>他陷入了成瘾的恶性循环。<,>The dog gave a vicious growl.<,>那只狗发出凶恶的低吼。<,>vic(邪恶)+ious(形容词后缀)→邪恶的<,>viscous(adj.粘性的)/delicious(adj.美味的)

evil<,>/ˈiːv(ə)l/<,>/ˈivəl/<,>n.邪恶/n.罪恶/n.祸害<,>Money is the root of all evil.<,>金钱是万恶之源。<,>She fought against the evil in the world.<,>她与世上的邪恶作斗争。<,>The witch cast an evil spell.<,>女巫施了一个邪恶的咒语。<,>live(生活)反过来→邪恶<,>devil(n.魔鬼)/veil(n.面纱)

team<,>/tiːm/<,>/tim/<,>v.协作/v.合作<,>We need to team up to finish this task.<,>我们需要合作完成这项任务。<,>They teamed together to solve the problem.<,>他们一起合作解决问题。<,>The departments will team on the new initiative.<,>各部门将合作推进新计划。<,>team本身作名词指"团队"，作动词指"协作"<,>beam(n.光束)/steam(n.蒸汽)

coefficient<,>/ˌkəʊɪˈfɪʃ(ə)nt/<,>/ˌkoʊəˈfɪʃənt/<,>n.协同因素/n.系数/n.率<,>The coefficient of friction was calculated.<,>计算出了摩擦系数。<,>Temperature coefficient affects the results.<,>温度系数会影响结果。<,>Teamwork is a coefficient of success.<,>团队合作是成功的协同因素。<,>co(共同)+efficient(有效率的)→共同起作用的因素<,>efficient(adj.有效率的)/sufficient(adj.充足的)

wedge<,>/wɛdʒ/<,>/wɛdʒ/<,>n.楔/v.楔入/v.挤入<,>He used a wedge to keep the door open.<,>他用楔子让门保持开着。<,>She wedged her foot in the door.<,>她把脚挤进门缝里。<,>The company is trying to wedge into the market.<,>公司正试图挤入市场。<,>wed(结婚)+ge→像结婚一样紧密结合→楔入<,>edge(n.边缘)/pledge(n.誓言)

decimal<,>/ˈdesɪml/<,>/ˈdɛsəməl/<,>adj.小数的/adj.十进制的<,>The decimal system is widely used in mathematics.<,>十进制在数学中广泛使用。<,>Convert the fraction to a decimal.<,>把分数转换成小数。<,>This scale shows decimal precision.<,>这个刻度显示小数精度。<,>dec(十)+imal→与十有关的→十进制的<,>fraction(n.分数)/percent(n.百分比)/integer(n.整数)

footpath<,>/ˈfʊtpɑːθ/<,>/ˈfʊtˌpæθ/<,>n.小路/n.人行道<,>We walked along the footpath through the woods.<,>我们沿着林间小路行走。<,>The footpath is only for pedestrians.<,>这条人行道仅供行人使用。<,>Keep to the footpath when walking in the park.<,>在公园里行走时要走小路。<,>foot(脚)+path(路径)→用脚走的路→小路<,>sidewalk(n.人行道)/trail(n.小径)/pavement(n.人行道)

pamphlet<,>/ˈpæmflət/<,>/ˈpæmflɪt/<,>n.小册子<,>They distributed pamphlets about the event.<,>他们分发了关于活动的小册子。<,>This pamphlet explains the new policy.<,>这本小册子解释了新政策。<,>I picked up a health pamphlet at the clinic.<,>我在诊所拿了一本健康小册子。<,>pam(手掌)+phlet(折叠)→可以握在手掌中的折叠印刷品→小册子<,>brochure(n.小册子)/leaflet(n.传单)/booklet(n.小册子)

slack<,>/slæk/<,>/slæk/<,>adj.萧条的/adj.懈怠的<,>Business was slack during the winter months.<,>冬季的生意很萧条。<,>Don't be slack in your studies.<,>学习上不要懈怠。<,>The rope was slack and needed tightening.<,>绳子松了，需要拉紧。<,>s(死)+lack(缺乏)→死气沉沉缺乏活力→萧条的<,>lax(adj.松懈的)/slow(adj.缓慢的)/sluggish(adj.迟钝的)

disappearance<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɪərəns/<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɪrəns/<,>n.消失/n.消散/n.失踪<,>The disappearance of the plane remains a mystery.<,>飞机的消失仍然是个谜。<,>Police are investigating her sudden disappearance.<,>警方正在调查她的突然失踪。<,>The magician's disappearance act amazed the audience.<,>魔术师的消失表演让观众惊叹。<,>dis(不)+appear(出现)+ance→不出现→消失<,>appearance(n.出现)/vanishing(n.消失)/absence(n.缺席)

recreation<,>/ˌrekriˈeɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛkriˈeɪʃən/<,>n.消遣/n.娱乐活动<,>Reading is my favorite recreation.<,>阅读是我最喜欢的消遣。<,>The park offers many recreation facilities.<,>这个公园提供许多娱乐设施。<,>Team sports are good for recreation and exercise.<,>团队运动是很好的娱乐和锻炼方式。<,>re(再)+creation(创造)→再次创造活力→娱乐<,>entertainment(n.娱乐)/leisure(n.休闲)/amusement(n.娱乐)

consumer<,>/kənˈsjuːmə(r)/<,>/kənˈsuːmər/<,>n.消费者/n.用户<,>Consumer rights should be protected.<,>消费者权益应该得到保护。<,>The product is popular among young consumers.<,>这个产品在年轻消费者中很受欢迎。<,>Consumer demand drives the market.<,>消费者需求推动市场。<,>consume(消费)+er(人)→消费的人→消费者<,>customer(n.顾客)/user(n.用户)/buyer(n.买家)
consumption<,>/kənˈsʌmpʃən/<,>/kənˈsʌmpʃən/<,>n.消费（量）<,>The consumption of electricity has increased this month.<,>这个月的电力消费量增加了。<,>Excessive consumption of sugar can lead to health problems.<,>过量消费糖分会导致健康问题。<,>The government is trying to reduce fuel consumption.<,>政府正试图减少燃料消耗。<,>con(共同)+sumpt(拿)+ion→共同拿取→消费<,>assumption(n.假设)/presumption(n.假定)/resumption(n.恢复)

depression<,>/dɪˈpreʃən/<,>/dɪˈpreʃən/<,>n.消沉/n.不景气萧条期<,>He fell into a deep depression after losing his job.<,>失业后他陷入了深深的消沉。<,>The Great Depression affected many countries worldwide.<,>大萧条影响了全球许多国家。<,>She is seeing a therapist for her depression.<,>她因消沉正在看心理医生。<,>de(向下)+press(压)+ion→向下压→消沉<,>expression(n.表达)/impression(n.印象)/compression(n.压缩)

token<,>/ˈtəʊkən/<,>/ˈtoʊkən/<,>n.辅币/n.象征<,>He gave her a ring as a token of his love.<,>他给了她一枚戒指作为爱的象征。<,>You need a token to operate this machine.<,>你需要辅币才能操作这台机器。<,>The white flag is a token of surrender.<,>白旗是投降的象征。<,>to(向)+ken(知道)→让人知道的东西→象征<,>taken(v.拿)/broken(adj.破碎的)/spoken(adj.口头的)

ivory<,>/ˈaɪvəri/<,>/ˈaɪvəri/<,>n.象牙（质）/n.乳白色<,>The piano keys are made of ivory.<,>钢琴键是由象牙制成的。<,>She wore an ivory-colored dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件乳白色的裙子去参加派对。<,>Ivory trade is banned in many countries.<,>象牙贸易在许多国家是被禁止的。<,>ivo(象牙)+ry(名词后缀)→象牙<,>ivy(n.常春藤)/irony(n.讽刺)/ivory tower(象牙塔)

forward<,>/ˈfɔːwəd/<,>/ˈfɔrwərd/<,>adv.向前/adv.向将来/v.转递<,>Please move forward in the line.<,>请向前移动排队。<,>I will forward your email to the manager.<,>我会把你的邮件转递给经理。<,>We need to think forward to solve this problem.<,>我们需要向前看以解决这个问题。<,>fore(前)+ward(方向)→向前<,>backward(adv.向后)/toward(prep.朝向)/reward(n.奖励)

southwards<,>/ˈsaʊθwədz/<,>/ˈsaʊθwərdz/<,>adv.向南方<,>The birds flew southwards for the winter.<,>鸟儿们向南飞去过冬。<,>We are traveling southwards to reach the coast.<,>我们正向南旅行去往海岸。<,>The river flows southwards into the sea.<,>这条河向南流入大海。<,>south(南)+wards(方向)→向南方<,>northwards(adv.向北方)/eastwards(adv.向东方)/westwards(adv.向西方)

orientation<,>/ˌɔːriənˈteɪʃən/<,>/ˌɔriənˈteɪʃən/<,>n.定位/n.方向<,>The orientation of the building is towards the east.<,>这座建筑的朝向是东方。<,>New employees will attend an orientation session.<,>新员工将参加一个定位会议。<,>He has a good orientation in the forest.<,>他在森林中有很好的方向感。<,>orient(东方)+ation→朝向东方→方向<,>disorientation(n.迷失方向)/reorientation(n.重新定位)/orientation course(定位课程)

defy<,>/dɪˈfaɪ/<,>/dɪˈfaɪ/<,>v.向…挑战/v.蔑视<,>She defied the authorities by organizing the protest.<,>她通过组织抗议来挑战当局。<,>He defied his parents' wishes and dropped out of school.<,>他蔑视父母的愿望并辍学了。<,>The small boat defied the stormy seas.<,>小船挑战了暴风雨的海面。<,>de(否定)+fy(信任)→不信任→蔑视<,>deny(v.否认)/deify(v.神化)/defiant(adj.挑衅的)

hail<,>/heɪl/<,>/heɪl/<,>v.向…欢呼，招呼<,>The crowd hailed the victorious team.<,>人群向获胜的队伍欢呼。<,>She hailed a taxi to go to the airport.<,>她招呼了一辆出租车去机场。<,>The president was hailed as a hero.<,>总统被欢呼为英雄。<,>hail(冰雹)→像冰雹一样密集的欢呼<,>nail(n.钉子)/fail(v.失败)/mail(n.邮件)

yearn<,>/jɜːn/<,>/jɜrn/<,>v.渴望，向往<,>He yearns for his homeland after years abroad.<,>在国外多年后他渴望回到家乡。<,>She yearned to see her family again.<,>她渴望再次见到家人。<,>The child yearned for a new bicycle.<,>这个孩子向往一辆新自行车。<,>year(年)+n→一年到头都想要→渴望<,>earn(v.赚取)/learn(v.学习)/yeast(n.酵母)
spice<,>/spaɪs/<,>/spaɪs/<,>n.香料/n.调味品<,>She added some spice to the soup.<,>她在汤里加了一些香料。<,>This curry needs more spice.<,>这个咖喱需要更多的调味品。<,>Variety is the spice of life.<,>变化是生活的调味品。<,>sp(喷)+ice(冰)→喷出冰一样的香料<,>slice(n.薄片/v.切片)/splice(v.拼接/n.接合处)

pilgrim<,>/ˈpɪlɡrɪm/<,>/ˈpɪlɡrəm/<,>n.香客/n.朝圣者<,>The pilgrims traveled to the holy site.<,>朝圣者们前往圣地。<,>Many pilgrims visit this temple every year.<,>每年有许多香客来这座寺庙朝拜。<,>He dressed like a medieval pilgrim.<,>他穿得像中世纪的朝圣者。<,>pil(虔诚)+grim(严酷)→虔诚面对严酷的朝圣者<,>pilgrimage(n.朝圣之旅)/peregrine(n.游隼/adj.外来的)

fragrant<,>/ˈfreɪɡrənt/<,>/ˈfreɪɡrənt/<,>adj.香的/adj.芬芳的<,>The flowers are very fragrant.<,>这些花非常芬芳。<,>She loves fragrant soaps.<,>她喜欢香皂。<,>The air was fragrant with lavender.<,>空气中弥漫着薰衣草的香气。<,>frag(碎)+rant(叫)→碎裂的叫喊变成芬芳<,>flagrant(adj.臭名昭著的)/fragility(n.脆弱性)

incense<,>/ˈɪnsens/<,>/ˈɪnˌsɛns/<,>n.香/n.熏香/n.香气<,>Burning incense filled the room with a sweet smell.<,>燃烧的熏香使房间充满甜美的气味。<,>The temple was full of incense smoke.<,>寺庙里满是熏香的烟雾。<,>She was angered by the incense of his remarks.<,>他话语中的激怒了她。<,>in(进入)+cense(燃烧)→燃烧进入空气的香<,>intense(adj.强烈的)/innocence(n.清白)

uniformly<,>/ˈjuːnɪfɔːmli/<,>/ˈjunəˌfɔrmli/<,>adv.相同地/adv.一贯<,>The students were uniformly dressed.<,>学生们穿着统一的服装。<,>The paint was applied uniformly.<,>油漆被均匀地涂抹。<,>He has been uniformly successful.<,>他一贯很成功。<,>uni(单一)+form(形式)+ly(副词后缀)→单一形式地<,>unilateral(adj.单边的)/unify(v.统一)

resemblance<,>/rɪˈzembləns/<,>/rɪˈzɛmbləns/<,>n.相似/n.相似性<,>There's a strong resemblance between the twins.<,>这对双胞胎非常相似。<,>The painting bears no resemblance to the original.<,>这幅画与原作毫无相似之处。<,>I can see the family resemblance.<,>我能看出家族相似性。<,>re(再)+sembl(相似)+ance(名词后缀)→再次相似<,>assemble(v.集合)/dissemble(v.掩饰)

analogy<,>/əˈnælədʒi/<,>/əˈnælədʒi/<,>n.相似/n.类似/n.比拟<,>He explained the concept by analogy.<,>他通过类比解释这个概念。<,>There's an analogy between the heart and a pump.<,>心脏和泵有相似之处。<,>The teacher used a computer analogy.<,>老师用了电脑的比喻。<,>ana(类似)+logy(学说)→类似的学说<,>anthology(n.选集)/apology(n.道歉)

interact<,>/ˌɪntərˈækt/<,>/ˌɪntərˈækt/<,>v.相互作用<,>The chemicals interact with each other.<,>这些化学物质相互作用。<,>Children learn by interacting with their environment.<,>儿童通过与环境的互动学习。<,>The two systems don't interact well.<,>这两个系统不能很好地互动。<,>inter(相互)+act(行动)→相互行动<,>intercept(v.拦截)/interface(n.界面)

correlation<,>/ˌkɒrəˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɔrəˈleɪʃn/<,>n.相互关系<,>There's a correlation between smoking and lung cancer.<,>吸烟和肺癌有关联。<,>The study found no correlation.<,>研究发现没有相关性。<,>We need to examine the correlation more closely.<,>我们需要更仔细地检查这种关系。<,>co(共同)+relation(关系)→共同关系<,>collaboration(n.合作)/correction(n.改正)

reciprocal<,>/rɪˈsɪprəkl/<,>/rɪˈsɪprəkəl/<,>adj.相互的/adj.互利的<,>They have a reciprocal agreement.<,>他们有互惠协议。<,>Friendship should be reciprocal.<,>友谊应该是相互的。<,>The two countries made reciprocal concessions.<,>两国做出了互惠让步。<,>re(回)+cip(拿)+rocal→互相拿取<,>reciprocate(v.回报)/reciprocity(n.互惠)
coincide<,>/ˌkəʊɪnˈsaɪd/<,>/ˌkoʊɪnˈsaɪd/<,>v.相巧合/v.相符合<,>Our vacations coincided this year.<,>今年我们的假期碰巧重合了。<,>His story coincides with the facts.<,>他的陈述与事实相符。<,>The two events coincided perfectly.<,>这两个事件完全巧合。<,>co(共同)+in(在)+cide(落下)→共同落下→巧合<,>incident(n.事件)/concide(v.切割)/coincidence(n.巧合)

inversely<,>/ɪnˈvɜːsli/<,>/ɪnˈvɜːrsli/<,>adv.相反地<,>The results vary inversely with temperature.<,>结果与温度成反比变化。<,>They are inversely related.<,>它们呈反比关系。<,>He did the opposite, inversely following instructions.<,>他反其道而行，与指示相反。<,>in(反)+verse(转)+ly(副词后缀)→反转地→相反地<,>reverse(v.反转)/invert(v.倒置)/converse(adj.相反的)

devotion<,>/dɪˈvəʊʃn/<,>/dɪˈvoʊʃn/<,>n.献身/n.热诚/n.专心<,>Her devotion to her work is admirable.<,>她对工作的热忱令人钦佩。<,>He showed great devotion to his family.<,>他对家人表现出极大的奉献精神。<,>The monk's devotion to prayer was absolute.<,>这位僧侣对祈祷的专注是绝对的。<,>de(完全)+vote(投票)+ion(名词后缀)→完全投入→献身<,>devote(v.奉献)/devotional(adj.虔诚的)/emotion(n.情感)

linear<,>/ˈlɪniə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪniər/<,>adj.线的/adj.长度的<,>The design features linear patterns.<,>这个设计以线性图案为特色。<,>Linear measurements are crucial in construction.<,>长度测量在建筑中至关重要。<,>The relationship is not linear.<,>这种关系不是线性的。<,>line(线)+ar(形容词后缀)→线的<,>lineage(n.血统)/liner(n.班轮)/linearity(n.线性)

qualify<,>/ˈkwɒlɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈkwɑːlɪfaɪ/<,>v.限制/v.限定/v.修饰<,>His statement needs to be qualified.<,>他的陈述需要加以限定。<,>She qualified her praise with criticism.<,>她在表扬中加入了批评。<,>The adjective qualifies the noun.<,>这个形容词修饰名词。<,>qual(质量)+ify(使)→使有质量→限定<,>quality(n.质量)/qualification(n.资格)/quantify(v.量化)

realistic<,>/ˌriːəˈlɪstɪk/<,>/ˌriːəˈlɪstɪk/<,>adj.现实的/adj.现实主义的<,>Her goals are realistic and achievable.<,>她的目标现实且可实现。<,>The painting has a realistic style.<,>这幅画具有现实主义风格。<,>We need a realistic approach to the problem.<,>我们需要一个现实的方法来解决这个问题。<,>real(真实)+istic(形容词后缀)→现实的<,>realism(n.现实主义)/realize(v.实现)/idealistic(adj.理想主义的)

striking<,>/ˈstraɪkɪŋ/<,>/ˈstraɪkɪŋ/<,>adj.显著的/adj.惊人的<,>The resemblance between them is striking.<,>他们之间的相似之处非常显著。<,>She has striking blue eyes.<,>她有一双惊人的蓝眼睛。<,>The contrast is striking.<,>对比非常鲜明。<,>strike(打击)+ing(形容词后缀)→打击人的→惊人的<,>stricken(adj.受打击的)/striker(n.罢工者)/strikingly(adv.显著地)

microscopic<,>/ˌmaɪkrəˈskɒpɪk/<,>/ˌmaɪkrəˈskɑːpɪk/<,>adj.显微镜的/adj.微观的/adj.极小的<,>Microscopic organisms live in the water.<,>微观生物生活在水中。<,>The damage was microscopic.<,>损伤极其微小。<,>We need a microscopic examination.<,>我们需要显微镜检查。<,>micro(微小)+scopic(看的)→用显微镜看的→微观的<,>microscope(n.显微镜)/macroscopic(adj.宏观的)/microbe(n.微生物)

apparent<,>/əˈpærənt/<,>/əˈpærənt/<,>adj.显然的<,>His happiness was apparent.<,>他的快乐显而易见。<,>For no apparent reason, she left.<,>她无缘无故地离开了。<,>The solution is apparent to everyone.<,>这个解决方案对每个人来说都是显而易见的。<,>ap(加强)+par(出现)+ent(形容词后缀)→出现的→显然的<,>appear(v.出现)/transparent(adj.透明的)/parent(n.父母)

distinctly<,>/dɪˈstɪŋktli/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋktli/<,>adv.显然/adv.清楚地<,>I distinctly remember telling you.<,>我清楚地记得告诉过你。<,>The sound was distinctly audible.<,>声音清晰可闻。<,>His accent is distinctly British.<,>他的口音明显是英国口音。<,>dis(分开)+tinct(刺)+ly(副词后缀)→刺出来地→清楚地<,>distinct(adj.明显的)/distinction(n.区别)/extinct(adj.灭绝的)
bacon<,>/ˈbeɪkən/<,>/ˈbeɪkən/<,>n.咸猪肉/n.熏猪肉<,>I love having bacon and eggs for breakfast.<,>我喜欢早餐吃熏猪肉和鸡蛋。<,>The smell of frying bacon filled the kitchen.<,>煎熏猪肉的香味充满了厨房。<,>Bacon is often used to add flavor to dishes.<,>熏猪肉常用来给菜肴增添风味。<,>ba(拼音"把")+con(convention 会议)→把会议上的熏猪肉<,>beacon(n.灯塔/n.信号)/baton(n.指挥棒/n.接力棒)

gossip<,>/ˈɡɒsɪp/<,>/ˈɡɑːsɪp/<,>n.闲谈/n.碎嘴子/n.漫笔<,>She enjoys a good gossip with her friends.<,>她喜欢和朋友闲聊。<,>Office gossip can sometimes be harmful.<,>办公室闲话有时可能有害。<,>The magazine is full of celebrity gossip.<,>这本杂志充满了名人八卦。<,>gos(go的变体)+sip(啜饮)→边喝边聊<,>gospel(n.福音/n.真理)/gossamer(n.蛛丝/adj.轻薄的)

ramble<,>/ˈræmbl/<,>/ˈræmbəl/<,>v.闲逛/v.漫步/v.漫谈/v.闲聊<,>We rambled through the countryside all afternoon.<,>我们在乡间漫步了整个下午。<,>He tends to ramble when he's nervous.<,>他紧张时容易东拉西扯。<,>The old man rambled on about his youth.<,>老人絮絮叨叨地讲着他年轻时的故事。<,>ram(公羊)+ble(able能够)→公羊能够漫步<,>scramble(v.攀爬/v.争夺)/gamble(v.赌博/n.冒险)

precede<,>/prɪˈsiːd/<,>/prɪˈsiːd/<,>v.先于/v.领先<,>The appetizer will precede the main course.<,>开胃菜会在主菜之前上。<,>A period of calm often precedes a storm.<,>暴风雨前常有一段平静期。<,>The mayor preceded the governor in speaking.<,>市长在州长之前发言。<,>pre(前)+cede(走)→走在前面<,>proceed(v.继续进行)/recede(v.后退/v.减弱)

priority<,>/praɪˈɒrəti/<,>/praɪˈɔːrəti/<,>n.先/n.前/n.优先/n.重点<,>Safety should be our top priority.<,>安全应该是我们的首要任务。<,>This project has priority over others.<,>这个项目比其他项目优先。<,>He gave priority to his family over work.<,>他把家庭放在工作之前。<,>prior(优先的)+ity(名词后缀)→优先权<,>posteriority(n.在后/n.后验)/superiority(n.优越/n.优势)

shower<,>/ˈʃaʊə(r)/<,>/ˈʃaʊər/<,>v.下阵雨/v.使湿透<,>It started to shower just as we left.<,>我们刚出门就开始下阵雨了。<,>They showered the newlyweds with rice.<,>他们向新婚夫妇撒米表示祝福。<,>The coach showered praise on the team.<,>教练对球队大加赞扬。<,>show(展示)+er(人)→展示雨的人<,>power(n.力量/v.驱动)/tower(n.塔/v.高耸)

decline<,>/dɪˈklaɪn/<,>/dɪˈklaɪn/<,>v.下倾/v.偏斜/v.衰退<,>The road declines sharply after the bend.<,>转弯后道路急剧下降。<,>She declined the invitation politely.<,>她礼貌地拒绝了邀请。<,>The company's profits have been declining.<,>公司利润一直在下降。<,>de(向下)+cline(倾斜)→向下倾斜<,>incline(v.倾斜/n.斜坡)/recline(v.斜倚/v.躺卧)

descent<,>/dɪˈsent/<,>/dɪˈsɛnt/<,>n.下降/n.出身/n.斜坡<,>The plane began its descent into the airport.<,>飞机开始向机场降落。<,>He is of French descent.<,>他有法国血统。<,>The path was a steep descent to the valley.<,>这条小路是通往山谷的陡坡。<,>de(向下)+scent(爬)→向下爬<,>dissent(v.不同意/n.异议)/decent(adj.得体的/adj.相当好的)

subordinate<,>/səˈbɔːdɪnət/<,>/səˈbɔːrdɪnət/<,>adj.下级的/adj.辅助的<,>She is subordinate to the manager.<,>她是经理的下属。<,>The subordinate clause explains the main idea.<,>从句解释主要意思。<,>Personal interests should be subordinate to team goals.<,>个人利益应服从团队目标。<,>sub(下面)+ordinate(排列)→排在下面的<,>coordinate(v.协调/n.坐标)/insubordinate(adj.不服从的)

inferior<,>/ɪnˈfɪəriə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈfɪriər/<,>n.下级/n.晚辈/n.次品<,>No one should be made to feel inferior.<,>不应该让任何人感到低人一等。<,>These goods are of inferior quality.<,>这些商品质量低劣。<,>He treats his subordinates as inferiors.<,>他把下属当下等人对待。<,>infer(推断)+ior(比较级)→推断为较差的<,>superior(adj.优越的/n.上级)/interior(adj.内部的/n.内部)
slim<,>/slɪm/<,>/slɪm/<,>adj.细长的/adj.微小的<,>She has a slim figure.<,>她身材苗条。<,>The chances of success are slim.<,>成功的几率很小。<,>He keeps slim by exercising regularly.<,>他通过定期锻炼保持身材苗条。<,>s(蛇)+lim(limit限制)→蛇形限制→细长的<,>slime(n.黏液)/slip(v.滑倒)/skim(v.略读)

taper<,>/ˈteɪpə(r)/<,>/ˈteɪpər/<,>n.细小的蜡烛/n.微光<,>The taper flickered in the wind.<,>细小的蜡烛在风中闪烁。<,>There was a taper of light at the end of the tunnel.<,>隧道尽头有一丝微光。<,>She lit a taper to find her way in the dark.<,>她点燃一支细蜡烛在黑暗中找路。<,>tape(磁带)+r→像磁带一样细长→细小的蜡烛<,>paper(n.纸张)/tap(v.轻拍)/temper(n.脾气)

petty<,>/ˈpeti/<,>/ˈpeti/<,>adj.细小的/adj.器量小的<,>Don't worry about such petty details.<,>不要为这些琐碎的细节担心。<,>He is known for his petty behavior.<,>他以小气的行为著称。<,>Petty arguments can ruin relationships.<,>小争吵会破坏关系。<,>pet(宠物)+ty→像宠物一样小→细小的<,>pretty(adj.漂亮的)/pity(n.怜悯)/party(n.聚会)

nice<,>/naɪs/<,>/naɪs/<,>adj.细微的/adj.微妙的<,>There's a nice distinction between the two words.<,>这两个词之间有细微的区别。<,>She made a nice adjustment to the recipe.<,>她对食谱做了微妙的调整。<,>He has a nice sense of humor.<,>他有微妙的幽默感。<,>nice(尼斯)+e→像尼斯湖一样深不可测→微妙的<,>vice(n.恶习)/rice(n.米饭)/dice(n.骰子)

filament<,>/ˈfɪləmənt/<,>/ˈfɪləmənt/<,>n.细丝/n.长丝/n.灯丝<,>The bulb's filament broke.<,>灯泡的灯丝断了。<,>Silk is made from fine filaments.<,>丝绸是由细丝制成的。<,>Spider webs are made of sticky filaments.<,>蜘蛛网是由粘性的细丝构成的。<,>fila(线)+ment(名词后缀)→细丝<,>film(n.电影)/element(n.元素)/flagrant(adj.臭名昭著的)

bacterium<,>/bækˈtɪəriəm/<,>/bækˈtɪriəm/<,>n.细菌<,>This bacterium causes food poisoning.<,>这种细菌会引起食物中毒。<,>Scientists study bacterium under microscopes.<,>科学家们在显微镜下研究细菌。<,>Antibiotics can kill harmful bacteria.<,>抗生素可以杀死有害细菌。<,>bact(棒)+erium(场所)→像小棒一样的东西→细菌<,>battery(n.电池)/barter(v.物物交换)/bachelor(n.学士)

germ<,>/dʒɜːm/<,>/dʒɜːrm/<,>n.细菌/n.病原菌/n.幼芽<,>Wash your hands to kill germs.<,>洗手可以杀死细菌。<,>The germ of an idea grew into a big project.<,>一个想法的萌芽发展成了一个大项目。<,>This medicine fights disease-causing germs.<,>这种药物对抗致病菌。<,>ger(生长)+m→生长的小东西→细菌/幼芽<,>gem(n.宝石)/term(n.学期)/germane(adj.有关的)

systematically<,>/ˌsɪstəˈmætɪkli/<,>/ˌsɪstəˈmætɪkli/<,>adv.系统地/adv.有规则地<,>He organized the files systematically.<,>他有系统地整理了文件。<,>The research was conducted systematically.<,>这项研究是系统地进行的。<,>She approaches problems systematically.<,>她系统地处理问题。<,>system(系统)+atic+ally→系统地<,>sympathetically(adv.同情地)/synthetically(adv.综合地)/systemic(adj.系统的)

spectrum<,>/ˈspektrəm/<,>/ˈspektrəm/<,>n.系列/n.范围/n.波谱<,>The rainbow shows the full spectrum of colors.<,>彩虹显示了完整的色彩光谱。<,>His interests cover a wide spectrum.<,>他的兴趣范围很广。<,>The political spectrum ranges from left to right.<,>政治光谱从左到右。<,>spect(看)+rum→看到的一系列东西→光谱<,>specter(n.幽灵)/spectacle(n.景象)/inspect(v.检查)

lace<,>/leɪs/<,>/leɪs/<,>v.系带/v.用带子束紧<,>She laced up her boots tightly.<,>她紧紧地系好靴子的带子。<,>He laced his fingers together nervously.<,>他紧张地交叉手指。<,>The dress is laced at the back.<,>这件连衣裙在后面系带。<,>la(拉)+ce(侧)→从侧面拉紧→系带<,>lake(n.湖泊)/late(adj.迟的)/pace(n.步伐)
tape<,>/teɪp/<,>/teɪp/<,>v.系/v.捆<,>She used tape to secure the package.<,>她用胶带捆紧了包裹。<,>He taped the poster to the wall.<,>他把海报贴在墙上。<,>Make sure to tape the edges properly.<,>确保把边缘粘好。<,>tap(轻敲)+e→像轻敲一样固定→捆<,>tape(n.磁带)/tame(adj.驯服的)/type(n.类型)  

drama<,>/ˈdrɑːmə/<,>/ˈdrɑːmə/<,>n.戏剧性事件/n.戏剧性<,>The meeting was full of drama.<,>会议充满了戏剧性。<,>She loves watching drama series.<,>她喜欢看连续剧。<,>His life is like a drama.<,>他的人生像一出戏剧。<,>dra(拉)+ma→拉长情节→戏剧<,>dramatic(adj.戏剧性的)/trauma(n.创伤)/dream(n.梦)  

theatre<,>/ˈθɪətə(r)/<,>/ˈθiːətər/<,>n.剧场/n.戏院<,>We went to the theatre last night.<,>昨晚我们去了剧院。<,>The theatre was packed with people.<,>剧院里挤满了人。<,>She works in a theatre.<,>她在剧院工作。<,>thea(看)+tre→观看表演的地方→剧院<,>theater(美式拼写)/amphitheatre(n.圆形剧场)/theory(n.理论)  

comedy<,>/ˈkɒmədi/<,>/ˈkɑːmədi/<,>n.喜剧/n.喜剧场面<,>He prefers comedy over tragedy.<,>比起悲剧他更喜欢喜剧。<,>The sitcom is a great comedy.<,>这部情景喜剧很棒。<,>Life is full of comedy.<,>生活中充满喜剧场面。<,>come(来)+dy→让人发笑的场景→喜剧<,>tragedy(n.悲剧)/comic(adj.喜剧的)/cosmos(n.宇宙)  

assault<,>/əˈsɔːlt/<,>/əˈsɔːlt/<,>v.袭击/n.攻击<,>The army launched an assault at dawn.<,>军队在黎明发动了攻击。<,>He was arrested for assault.<,>他因袭击被捕。<,>The castle survived many assaults.<,>城堡经受住了多次攻击。<,>as(加强)+sault(跳)→跳起来攻击→袭击<,>assail(v.攻击)/vault(n.拱顶)/salt(n.盐)  

usage<,>/ˈjuːsɪdʒ/<,>/ˈjuːsɪdʒ/<,>n.习惯用法<,>This word has different usages.<,>这个词有不同的用法。<,>The usage of this tool is simple.<,>这个工具的用法很简单。<,>Language usage changes over time.<,>语言用法会随时间变化。<,>us(使用)+age(状态)→使用的方式→用法<,>use(v.使用)/sage(n.圣人)/message(n.信息)  

quench<,>/kwentʃ/<,>/kwentʃ/<,>v.熄灭/v.扑灭/v.压制<,>Water can quench fire.<,>水可以灭火。<,>He quenched his thirst with a cold drink.<,>他用冷饮解渴。<,>Nothing could quench her curiosity.<,>什么也压制不了她的好奇心。<,>quen(熄灭)+ch→使熄灭→扑灭<,>drench(v.浸透)/wrench(v.扭伤)/quaint(adj.古雅的)  

extinguish<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>v.熄灭/v.扑灭/v.消灭<,>Firefighters extinguished the blaze.<,>消防员扑灭了大火。<,>The storm extinguished our campfire.<,>暴风雨熄灭了我们的营火。<,>We must extinguish this threat.<,>我们必须消灭这个威胁。<,>ex(出)+stingu(刺)+ish→刺灭→熄灭<,>distinguish(v.区分)/extinct(adj.灭绝的)/anguish(n.痛苦)  

absorption<,>/əbˈsɔːpʃn/<,>/əbˈsɔːrpʃn/<,>n.吸收/n.专注<,>The sponge has good absorption.<,>海绵有很好的吸收性。<,>His absorption in work is impressive.<,>他对工作的专注令人印象深刻。<,>Plants need sunlight for absorption.<,>植物需要阳光进行吸收。<,>ab(离开)+sorb(吸)+tion→吸收<,>adsorption(n.吸附)/absorption(n.吸收)/sorption(n.吸着)  

intake<,>/ˈɪnteɪk/<,>/ˈɪnteɪk/<,>n.吸入/n.输入能量<,>Increase your water intake in summer.<,>夏天要增加水分摄入。<,>The engine's air intake is blocked.<,>发动机的进气口堵塞了。<,>Monitor your calorie intake.<,>监控你的卡路里摄入量。<,>in(进入)+take(拿)→拿进去→吸入<,>outtake(n.排出)/undertake(v.承担)/intake(n.摄入)
physically<,>/ˈfɪzɪkli/<,>/ˈfɪzɪkli/<,>adv.身体上/adv.体格上<,>He is physically strong and can lift heavy objects.<,>他体格强壮，能举起重物。<,>She was physically exhausted after the marathon.<,>马拉松后她身体上非常疲惫。<,>The therapy helps both mentally and physically.<,>这种疗法对心理和身体都有帮助。<,>physic(物理)+ally(副词后缀)→与身体相关地<,>psychologically(adv.心理上)/mentally(adv.精神上)  

substantial<,>/səbˈstænʃl/<,>/səbˈstænʃl/<,>adj.大而坚固的<,>The table is made of substantial oak wood.<,>这张桌子由坚固的橡木制成。<,>They made substantial progress in the project.<,>他们在项目中取得了实质性进展。<,>A substantial amount of money was donated.<,>捐赠了巨额资金。<,>sub(下面)+stant(站立)+ial→在下面稳稳站立的→坚固的<,>superficial(adj.表面的)/insubstantial(adj.脆弱的)  

body<,>/ˈbɒdi/<,>/ˈbɑːdi/<,>n.物体<,>The celestial body was visible through the telescope.<,>通过望远镜可以看到那个天体。<,>The car's body was damaged in the accident.<,>事故中汽车车身受损。<,>A foreign body was found in the machine.<,>机器里发现了异物。<,>bod(词根：身体)+y→物体的外形<,>corpse(n.尸体)/corpus(n.语料库)  

luncheon<,>/ˈlʌntʃən/<,>/ˈlʌntʃən/<,>n.午宴/n.午餐/n.便宴<,>The business luncheon lasted two hours.<,>商务午宴持续了两小时。<,>She prepared a light luncheon for the guests.<,>她为客人准备了简单的午餐。<,>The charity luncheon raised $50,000.<,>慈善午宴筹集了5万美元。<,>lunch(午餐)+eon(名词后缀)→正式午餐场合<,>banquet(n.盛宴)/brunch(n.早午餐)  

ignorance<,>/ˈɪɡnərəns/<,>/ˈɪɡnərəns/<,>n.无知/n.无学/n.愚昧<,>His ignorance of the law surprised everyone.<,>他对法律的无知让所有人惊讶。<,>Ignorance is not an excuse for wrongdoing.<,>无知不能作为做错事的借口。<,>The campaign aims to eliminate ignorance about the disease.<,>该活动旨在消除对这种疾病的无知。<,>i(不)+gnor(知道)+ance→不知道的状态<,>arrogance(n.傲慢)/innocence(n.天真)  

insignificant<,>/ˌɪnsɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt/<,>/ˌɪnsɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt/<,>adj.无意义的/adj.低微的<,>The difference in their scores was insignificant.<,>他们分数的差异微不足道。<,>He held an insignificant position in the company.<,>他在公司担任低微的职位。<,>The damage was insignificant compared to the overall value.<,>与总体价值相比，损坏微不足道。<,>in(不)+significant(重要的)→不重要的<,>significant(adj.重要的)/magnificent(adj.宏伟的)  

doubtless<,>/ˈdaʊtləs/<,>/ˈdaʊtləs/<,>adv.无疑地/adv.很可能<,>She will doubtless arrive on time as usual.<,>她无疑会像往常一样准时到达。<,>This is doubtless the best solution available.<,>这很可能是现有的最佳解决方案。<,>He was doubtless the most talented player on the team.<,>他无疑是队里最有天赋的选手。<,>doubt(怀疑)+less(无)→没有怀疑地<,>doubtful(adj.可疑的)/undoubtedly(adv.确实地)  

indefinite<,>/ɪnˈdefɪnət/<,>/ɪnˈdefɪnət/<,>adj.无限期的<,>The workers were given indefinite leave.<,>工人们获得了无限期休假。<,>The project was postponed for an indefinite period.<,>项目被无限期推迟。<,>Her stay in the country was of indefinite duration.<,>她在该国的停留是无限期的。<,>in(不)+definite(明确的)→不明确的期限<,>definite(adj.明确的)/infinite(adj.无限的)  

infinitely<,>/ˈɪnfɪnətli/<,>/ˈɪnfɪnətli/<,>adv.无限地/adv.无边地<,>The universe is infinitely vast.<,>宇宙是无限广阔的。<,>This method is infinitely better than the previous one.<,>这个方法比之前的好无数倍。<,>Her patience seemed infinitely extended.<,>她的耐心似乎无限延伸。<,>infinite(无限的)+ly(副词后缀)→无限地<,>finitely(adv.有限地)/definitely(adv.明确地)  

unlimited<,>/ʌnˈlɪmɪtɪd/<,>/ʌnˈlɪmɪtɪd/<,>adj.无限的/adj.不定的<,>The package includes unlimited data usage.<,>该套餐包含无限数据流量。<,>She has unlimited potential in this field.<,>她在这个领域有无限的潜力。<,>The resources are not unlimited, so use them wisely.<,>资源不是无限的，要明智使用。<,>un(不)+limit(限制)+ed→不受限制的<,>limited(adj.有限的)/delimited(adj.划定界限的)
infinite<,>/ˈɪnfɪnət/<,>/ˈɪnfənət/<,>n.无限/n.无穷（大）<,>The universe is infinite and full of mysteries.<,>宇宙是无限的，充满了奥秘。<,>His patience seems to be infinite.<,>他的耐心似乎是无穷无尽的。<,>They discussed the concept of infinite space.<,>他们讨论了无限空间的概念。<,>in(不)+finite(有限的)→无限的<,>finite(adj.有限的)/definite(adj.明确的)

fearless<,>/ˈfɪələs/<,>/ˈfɪrləs/<,>adj.无畏的/adj.大胆的<,>She is a fearless explorer who travels to remote places.<,>她是一位无畏的探险家，经常去偏远的地方。<,>The fearless soldier charged into battle.<,>那位无畏的士兵冲进了战场。<,>His fearless attitude inspires everyone around him.<,>他无畏的态度激励着身边的每个人。<,>fear(恐惧)+less(无)→无畏的<,>fearful(adj.害怕的)/daring(adj.大胆的)

innumerable<,>/ɪˈnjuːmərəbl/<,>/ɪˈnuːmərəbl/<,>adj.无数的/adj.数不清的<,>There are innumerable stars in the night sky.<,>夜空中有着无数的星星。<,>He has read innumerable books on the subject.<,>他读过无数关于这个主题的书。<,>Innumerable people attended the concert.<,>无数的人参加了这场音乐会。<,>in(不)+numer(数)+able(能)→数不清的<,>numerous(adj.许多的)/countless(adj.数不尽的)

inorganic<,>/ˌɪnɔːˈɡænɪk/<,>/ˌɪnɔːrˈɡænɪk/<,>adj.无生物的/adj.无机的<,>Rocks and minerals are inorganic substances.<,>岩石和矿物是无机物质。<,>This fertilizer contains inorganic compounds.<,>这种肥料含有无机化合物。<,>Inorganic chemistry is a challenging subject.<,>无机化学是一门具有挑战性的学科。<,>in(无)+organic(有机的)→无机的<,>organic(adj.有机的)/synthetic(adj.合成的)

ruthless<,>/ˈruːθləs/<,>/ˈruθləs/<,>adj.无情的/adj.冷酷的<,>The ruthless dictator oppressed his people.<,>那个无情的独裁者压迫他的人民。<,>She made a ruthless decision to cut costs.<,>她做了一个无情的决定来削减成本。<,>In business, sometimes you have to be ruthless.<,>在商界，有时候你必须冷酷无情。<,>ruth(怜悯)+less(无)→无情的<,>merciless(adj.残忍的)/pitiless(adj.无情的)

incapable<,>/ɪnˈkeɪpəbl/<,>/ɪnˈkeɪpəbl/<,>adj.无能力的/adj.无资格的<,>He is incapable of telling a lie.<,>他不会说谎。<,>She felt incapable of handling the situation.<,>她觉得自己无力处理这种情况。<,>The old machine is incapable of performing the new task.<,>那台旧机器无法完成新任务。<,>in(不)+capable(有能力的)→无能力的<,>capable(adj.有能力的)/able(adj.能够的)

unique<,>/juːˈniːk/<,>/juˈnik/<,>adj.无可匹敌的/adj.极好的<,>Each person's fingerprint is unique.<,>每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。<,>This is a unique opportunity you shouldn't miss.<,>这是一个你不该错过的绝佳机会。<,>Her style of painting is truly unique.<,>她的绘画风格确实无可匹敌。<,>uni(单一)+que→唯一的<,>unusual(adj.不寻常的)/special(adj.特别的)

faultless<,>/ˈfɔːltləs/<,>/ˈfɔltləs/<,>adj.无过失的/adj.无缺点的<,>Her performance was faultless.<,>她的表演完美无缺。<,>He gave a faultless explanation of the theory.<,>他对这个理论给出了无可挑剔的解释。<,>The diamond appears to be faultless under the microscope.<,>这颗钻石在显微镜下看起来完美无瑕。<,>fault(过失)+less(无)→无过失的<,>flawless(adj.无瑕疵的)/perfect(adj.完美的)

foreign<,>/ˈfɒrən/<,>/ˈfɔːrən/<,>adj.外国的/adj.国外的<,>She speaks several foreign languages fluently.<,>她能流利地说好几种外语。<,>Foreign investments have boosted the local economy.<,>外国投资促进了当地经济。<,>He has many friends from foreign countries.<,>他有许多来自国外的朋友。<,>for(前)+eign→外来的<,>domestic(adj.国内的)/alien(adj.外国的)

nought<,>/nɔːt/<,>/nɔt/<,>n.无/n.零<,>All his efforts came to nought.<,>他所有的努力都化为乌有。<,>The score was three to nought.<,>比分是三比零。<,>They reduced the risks to nought.<,>他们将风险降为零。<,>nought→nothing(无)<,>zero(n.零)/nil(n.零)
filth<,>/fɪlθ/<,>/fɪlθ/<,>n.污秽/n.污物/n.淫猥<,>The alley was filled with filth and garbage.<,>小巷里满是污秽和垃圾。<,>He was disgusted by the filth in the movie.<,>他对电影中的淫秽内容感到恶心。<,>The river was polluted with industrial filth.<,>这条河被工业污物污染了。<,>fil(脏)+th(名词后缀)→污秽<,>filthy(adj.肮脏的)/filtrate(v.过滤)

snail<,>/sneɪl/<,>/sneɪl/<,>n.蜗牛/n.行动缓慢的人<,>The snail left a shiny trail on the sidewalk.<,>蜗牛在人行道上留下了一条闪亮的痕迹。<,>My grandma moves at a snail's pace.<,>我奶奶行动像蜗牛一样慢。<,>He's such a snail when it comes to paperwork.<,>他处理文书工作时慢得像蜗牛。<,>s(像蜗牛壳)+nail(钉子)→像钉子上爬的蜗牛<,>trail(n.痕迹/v.拖拽)/sail(v.航行)

hum<,>/hʌm/<,>/hʌm/<,>n.嗡嗡声/v.哼曲子<,>The hum of the refrigerator kept me awake.<,>冰箱的嗡嗡声让我睡不着。<,>She hummed a tune while cooking.<,>她做饭时哼着小曲。<,>There was a constant hum from the computer fan.<,>电脑风扇持续发出嗡嗡声。<,>拟声词，模仿嗡嗡声<,>ham(n.火腿)/hymn(n.赞美诗)

compliment<,>/ˈkɒmplɪmənt/<,>/ˈkɑːmplɪmənt/<,>n.致意/n.问候/v.赞美/v.祝贺<,>She paid me a lovely compliment on my dress.<,>她热情地赞美了我的裙子。<,>With the compliments of the season!<,>致以节日的问候！<,>He complimented her on her excellent presentation.<,>他祝贺她做了精彩的演讲。<,>com(共同)+pli(满足)+ment→共同满足→赞美<,>complement(n.补充物)/supplement(n.增补)

question<,>/ˈkwestʃən/<,>/ˈkwɛstʃən/<,>v.询问/v.讯问<,>The police questioned the suspect for hours.<,>警方讯问了嫌疑人好几个小时。<,>May I question you about your research?<,>我能询问下你的研究吗？<,>She questioned the validity of the theory.<,>她对这一理论的有效性提出了质疑。<,>quest(寻求)+ion→寻求答案→询问<,>inquisition(n.调查)/query(n.疑问)

literal<,>/ˈlɪtərəl/<,>/ˈlɪtərəl/<,>adj.字面的/adj.文字的<,>This is a literal translation from French.<,>这是从法语直译过来的。<,>He's so literal that he misses the jokes.<,>他太字面化了，听不出笑话。<,>The literal meaning of 'butterfly' is different from its symbolic meaning.<,>"蝴蝶"的字面意思与其象征意义不同。<,>liter(文字)+al(形容词后缀)→文字的<,>literary(adj.文学的)/literate(adj.有文化的)

illiterate<,>/ɪˈlɪtərət/<,>/ɪˈlɪtərət/<,>adj.文盲的/n.文盲<,>Many adults in the village are still illiterate.<,>村里很多成年人仍是文盲。<,>Illiterate people often face employment difficulties.<,>文盲常常面临就业困难。<,>She teaches illiterate women to read.<,>她教不识字的妇女认字。<,>il(不)+literate(有文化的)→不识字的<,>literate(adj.有文化的)/alliterate(v.押头韵)

stationery<,>/ˈsteɪʃənri/<,>/ˈsteɪʃəneri/<,>n.信笺/n.文具<,>I bought some nice stationery for writing letters.<,>我买了些漂亮的信纸写信。<,>The stationery department is on the third floor.<,>文具部在三楼。<,>Her stationery had a floral border.<,>她的信纸有花卉边框。<,>station(固定)+ery→固定使用的文具<,>stationary(adj.静止的)/sanctuary(n.避难所)

plague<,>/pleɪɡ/<,>/pleɪɡ/<,>n.瘟疫/n.鼠疫<,>The plague killed millions in the Middle Ages.<,>中世纪时瘟疫夺去了数百万人的生命。<,>A plague of locusts destroyed the crops.<,>蝗灾毁坏了庄稼。<,>He's been plaguing me with questions all day.<,>他一整天都在用问题烦我。<,>plag(打击)+ue→打击人的疾病→瘟疫<,>plaque(n.匾)/plagiarism(n.剽窃)

softness<,>/ˈsɒftnəs/<,>/ˈsɔːftnəs/<,>n.温和/n.柔和/n.软弱<,>The softness of the fabric pleased her.<,>布料的柔软让她很满意。<,>There's a certain softness in his voice when he speaks to children.<,>他和孩子说话时声音特别温和。<,>His softness made him an easy target for bullies.<,>他的软弱使他容易成为欺凌对象。<,>soft(软的)+ness(名词后缀)→柔软<,>toughness(n.坚韧)/hardness(n.硬度)
graze<,>/ɡreɪz/<,>/ɡreɪz/<,>v.喂草/v.放牧（牲畜）<,>The cows graze in the meadow every morning.<,>牛群每天早上在草地上吃草。<,>Shepherds graze their sheep on the hillside.<,>牧羊人在山坡上放牧羊群。<,>The farmer grazed the cattle near the river.<,>农夫在河边放牧牛群。<,>grass(草)+aze(动词后缀)→喂草<,>glaze(v.上釉/n.釉)/grace(n.优雅/v.使优美)  

locality<,>/ləʊˈkæləti/<,>/loʊˈkæləti/<,>n.位置/n.地点/n.发生地<,>The locality of the accident was marked with a sign.<,>事故发生地点被标记了一个标志。<,>This locality is known for its scenic beauty.<,>这个地区以其风景优美而闻名。<,>The police are investigating the locality of the crime.<,>警方正在调查犯罪发生地。<,>local(地方的)+ity(名词后缀)→地点<,>location(n.位置)/locate(v.定位)/locale(n.现场)  

situated<,>/ˈsɪtʃueɪtɪd/<,>/ˈsɪtʃueɪtɪd/<,>adj.位于…的<,>The hotel is situated near the beach.<,>酒店位于海滩附近。<,>Their house is situated in a quiet neighborhood.<,>他们的房子位于一个安静的社区。<,>The university is situated in the heart of the city.<,>大学位于市中心。<,>sit(坐)+uate(动词后缀)+ed(形容词后缀)→坐落于…的<,>situate(v.使位于)/situation(n.情况)/site(n.地点)  

bachelor<,>/ˈbætʃələ(r)/<,>/ˈbætʃələr/<,>n.未婚男子/n.学士<,>He is a bachelor and enjoys his single life.<,>他是个单身汉，享受单身生活。<,>She earned a bachelor's degree in psychology.<,>她获得了心理学学士学位。<,>The bachelor party was held last night.<,>昨晚举行了单身派对。<,>bach(独身)+elor(人)→未婚男子<,>spinster(n.未婚女子)/master(n.硕士)/doctor(n.博士)  

unpaid<,>/ʌnˈpeɪd/<,>/ʌnˈpeɪd/<,>adj.未付的/adj.无偿的<,>The bill remains unpaid for three months.<,>账单三个月未付。<,>She does unpaid work for the charity.<,>她为慈善机构做无偿工作。<,>Unpaid leave is not allowed in this company.<,>这家公司不允许无薪休假。<,>un(否定前缀)+paid(已付的)→未付的<,>underpaid(adj.报酬过低的)/overpaid(adj.多付的)/repay(v.偿还)  

stern<,>/stɜːn/<,>/stɜːrn/<,>n.艉，船尾/n.臀部<,>The captain stood at the stern of the ship.<,>船长站在船尾。<,>She gave him a stern look.<,>她严厉地看了他一眼。<,>The stern of the boat was damaged in the storm.<,>船尾在风暴中受损。<,>steer(驾驶)+rn→船尾<,>stark(adj.严酷的)/stork(n.鹳)/sternum(n.胸骨)  

commission<,>/kəˈmɪʃn/<,>/kəˈmɪʃn/<,>n.委托/n.委任/n.委托状<,>The artist received a commission to paint a portrait.<,>艺术家接到委托画一幅肖像。<,>He was given a commission as an officer.<,>他被委任为军官。<,>The salesperson earns a commission on each sale.<,>销售人员每笔销售都有佣金。<,>com(共同)+mission(任务)→委托<,>omission(n.遗漏)/admission(n.承认)/permission(n.许可)  

latitude<,>/ˈlætɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈlætɪtuːd/<,>n.纬度/n.黄纬<,>The ship's latitude was 40 degrees north.<,>船的纬度是北纬40度。<,>They enjoy more latitude in making decisions.<,>他们在决策上有更多自由。<,>The city lies at a high latitude.<,>这座城市位于高纬度地区。<,>lat(宽的)+itude(名词后缀)→纬度<,>altitude(n.海拔)/attitude(n.态度)/longitude(n.经度)  

vitamin<,>/ˈvɪtəmɪn/<,>/ˈvaɪtəmɪn/<,>n.维生素/n.维他命<,>Oranges are rich in vitamin C.<,>橙子富含维生素C。<,>She takes vitamin supplements every day.<,>她每天服用维生素补充剂。<,>Vitamin D is important for bone health.<,>维生素D对骨骼健康很重要。<,>vita(生命)+min(微量)→维生素<,>mineral(n.矿物质)/protein(n.蛋白质)/nutrient(n.营养素)  

Venus<,>/ˈviːnəs/<,>/ˈviːnəs/<,>n.维纳斯/n.美人<,>The statue of Venus is displayed in the museum.<,>维纳斯雕像在博物馆展出。<,>She was considered the Venus of her time.<,>她被认为是那个时代的美人。<,>Venus is the Roman goddess of love.<,>维纳斯是罗马的爱神。<,>源自罗马神话爱神名<,>veneer(n.饰面/v.镶饰)/venom(n.毒液)/venerate(v.崇敬)
idealism<,>/aɪˈdɪəlɪzəm/<,>/aɪˈdiəˌlɪzəm/<,>n.唯心主义/n.理想主义<,>His idealism often clashes with the harsh realities of life.<,>他的理想主义常常与残酷的现实生活发生冲突。<,>She pursued her dreams with unwavering idealism.<,>她以坚定的理想主义追求自己的梦想。<,>The novel explores the conflict between idealism and pragmatism.<,>这部小说探讨了理想主义与实用主义之间的冲突。<,>ideal(理想)+ism(主义)→理想主义<,>realism(n.现实主义)/materialism(n.唯物主义)

mast<,>/mɑːst/<,>/mæst/<,>n.桅杆<,>The ship's mast was damaged in the storm.<,>船的桅杆在暴风雨中受损了。<,>He climbed up the mast to fix the sail.<,>他爬上桅杆去修理船帆。<,>The flag was flying high on the mast.<,>旗帜在桅杆上高高飘扬。<,>联想：master(主人)→桅杆是船的"主人"<,>mask(n.面具/v.掩饰)/mash(v.捣碎/n.糊状物)

enclosure<,>/ɪnˈkləʊʒə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈkloʊʒər/<,>n.围场/n.围栏/n.围绕<,>The animals were kept in a large enclosure.<,>动物们被关在一个大围场里。<,>The letter came with an enclosure of important documents.<,>信里附有重要文件。<,>The garden has a beautiful enclosure of hedges.<,>花园周围有漂亮的树篱围栏。<,>en(使)+close(关闭)+ure→围起来的地方<,>disclosure(n.揭露)/exposure(n.暴露)

violation<,>/ˌvaɪəˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌvaɪəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.违犯/n.侵犯/n.妨碍<,>Speeding is a violation of traffic laws.<,>超速是违反交通法规的行为。<,>The company was fined for violation of environmental regulations.<,>该公司因违反环境法规而被罚款。<,>This action constitutes a violation of human rights.<,>这一行为构成对人权的侵犯。<,>viol(暴力)+ation→违反行为<,>violation(n.违反)/violence(n.暴力)

violate<,>/ˈvaɪəleɪt/<,>/ˈvaɪəˌleɪt/<,>v.违犯/v.违背/v.侵犯<,>He was accused of violating the contract.<,>他被指控违反合同。<,>The noise violated the peace of the neighborhood.<,>噪音扰乱了社区的宁静。<,>This policy violates basic human rights.<,>这项政策侵犯了基本人权。<,>viol(暴力)+ate(动词后缀)→使用暴力→违反<,>violate(v.违反)/violent(adj.暴力的)

towards<,>/təˈwɔːdz/<,>/tɔːrdz/<,>prep.用于/prep.有助于<,>She saved money towards buying a new car.<,>她存钱准备买新车。<,>This donation will go towards helping the homeless.<,>这笔捐款将用于帮助无家可归者。<,>His attitude towards work is very positive.<,>他对工作的态度非常积极。<,>to(向)+wards(方向)→朝向某个方向<,>forward(adv.向前)/backward(adv.向后)

plead<,>/pliːd/<,>/plid/<,>v.为...辩护/v.抗辩<,>The lawyer will plead the case in court tomorrow.<,>律师明天将在法庭上为此案辩护。<,>He pleaded guilty to the charges.<,>他对指控表示认罪。<,>She pleaded with him to stay.<,>她恳求他留下来。<,>plea(恳求)+d→恳求式的辩护<,>plead(v.辩护)/plea(n.恳求)

catalogue<,>/ˈkætəlɒɡ/<,>/ˈkæt̬əlɔːɡ/<,>v.为...编目录<,>The librarian is cataloguing the new books.<,>图书管理员正在为新书编目。<,>All the museum's artifacts have been carefully catalogued.<,>博物馆的所有文物都被仔细编目了。<,>We need to catalogue these documents for easy reference.<,>我们需要为这些文件编目以便查阅。<,>cata(完全)+logue(说)→完全说出来→编目录<,>catalog(n.目录)/dialogue(n.对话)

microprocessor<,>/ˈmaɪkrəʊˌprəʊsesə(r)/<,>/ˈmaɪkroʊˌprɑːsesər/<,>n.微信息处理机<,>The computer's performance depends on its microprocessor.<,>电脑的性能取决于它的微处理器。<,>Modern cars contain dozens of microprocessors.<,>现代汽车包含数十个微处理器。<,>This new microprocessor is much faster than the previous model.<,>这款新微处理器比上一代快得多。<,>micro(微小)+processor(处理器)→微处理器<,>microscope(n.显微镜)/macroprocessor(n.宏处理器)

subtle<,>/ˈsʌtl/<,>/ˈsʌt̬əl/<,>adj.微妙的/adj.精巧的<,>There was a subtle change in her attitude.<,>她的态度有微妙的变化。<,>The painting has subtle shades of blue.<,>这幅画有微妙的蓝色色调。<,>He made a subtle reference to the problem.<,>他巧妙地提到了这个问题。<,>sub(下面)+tle→在表面之下的→微妙的<,>subtle(adj.微妙的)/subtitle(n.字幕)
atom<,>/ˈætəm/<,>/ˈætəm/<,>n.原子<,>An atom is the smallest unit of matter.<,>原子是物质的最小单位。<,>The scientist studied the structure of an atom.<,>科学家研究了原子的结构。<,>Atoms combine to form molecules.<,>原子结合形成分子。<,>a(不)+tom(切割)→不可再切割的最小物质→原子<,>atomic(adj.原子的)/molecule(n.分子)/proton(n.质子)

calculus<,>/ˈkælkjʊləs/<,>/ˈkælkjələs/<,>n.微积分/n.结石<,>He is studying calculus in college.<,>他在大学学习微积分。<,>The doctor found a kidney calculus during the examination.<,>医生在检查中发现了一颗肾结石。<,>Calculus is essential for understanding physics.<,>微积分对于理解物理学至关重要。<,>calcul(计算)+us→计算的学问→微积分<,>calculate(v.计算)/calcium(n.钙)/algebra(n.代数)

gleam<,>/ɡliːm/<,>/ɡlim/<,>n.微光/v.发微光<,>A gleam of light came through the window.<,>一束微光透过窗户照进来。<,>Her eyes gleamed with excitement.<,>她的眼睛闪烁着兴奋的光芒。<,>The old watch gleamed in the sunlight.<,>那只旧手表在阳光下闪闪发光。<,>gl(光)+eam→微光<,>glow(v.发光/n.光辉)/glimmer(n.微光/v.闪烁)/beam(n.光束/v.发光)

negligible<,>/ˈneɡlɪdʒəbl/<,>/ˈnɛɡlɪdʒəbəl/<,>adj.微不足道的<,>The difference in price is negligible.<,>价格差异微不足道。<,>His contribution to the project was negligible.<,>他对项目的贡献微乎其微。<,>The risk of infection is negligible.<,>感染的风险可以忽略不计。<,>neg(不)+lig(选择)+ible→不值得选择的→微不足道的<,>neglect(v.忽视/n.疏忽)/negligent(adj.疏忽的)/eligible(adj.合格的)

microwave<,>/ˈmaɪkrəweɪv/<,>/ˈmaɪkroʊweɪv/<,>n.微波<,>She heated the food in the microwave.<,>她用微波炉加热食物。<,>Microwaves are used in radar technology.<,>微波被用于雷达技术。<,>The microwave oven is a common kitchen appliance.<,>微波炉是常见的厨房电器。<,>micro(微小)+wave(波)→微波<,>microscope(n.显微镜)/macrowave(不存在的词)/radio wave(n.无线电波)

awful<,>/ˈɔːfʊl/<,>/ˈɔfəl/<,>adj.威严的/adj.令人崇敬的<,>The king had an awful presence.<,>国王有着威严的气势。<,>The awful beauty of the mountains took our breath away.<,>山脉庄严的美景让我们惊叹不已。<,>He spoke with awful dignity.<,>他说话时带着令人敬畏的尊严。<,>awe(敬畏)+ful(充满)→充满敬畏的→威严的<,>awesome(adj.极好的)/awe(n.敬畏/v.使敬畏)/lawful(adj.合法的)

majesty<,>/ˈmædʒəsti/<,>/ˈmædʒəsti/<,>n.雄伟/n.威严/n.庄严/n.陛下<,>The majesty of the Grand Canyon is breathtaking.<,>大峡谷的雄伟令人叹为观止。<,>Her Majesty the Queen will attend the ceremony.<,>女王陛下将出席仪式。<,>The ancient temple was built to inspire majesty.<,>这座古庙的建造是为了激发庄严感。<,>maj(大)+esty→雄伟<,>major(adj.主要的)/majestic(adj.雄伟的)/magistrate(n.地方法官)

prestige<,>/preˈstiːʒ/<,>/prɛˈstiʒ/<,>n.威望/n.威信/n.声望<,>The university has great prestige worldwide.<,>这所大学在世界范围内享有很高的声望。<,>He gained prestige through his scientific discoveries.<,>他通过科学发现获得了威望。<,>The position carries a lot of prestige.<,>这个职位带有很高的威信。<,>pre(前)+stige(束缚)→在前面束缚住别人的注意力→威望<,>prestigious(adj.有声望的)/pressure(n.压力)/privilege(n.特权)

endanger<,>/ɪnˈdeɪndʒə/<,>/ɛnˈdeɪndʒər/<,>v.危及/v.危害<,>Smoking endangers your health.<,>吸烟危害你的健康。<,>The construction project may endanger local wildlife.<,>这个建设项目可能会危及当地野生动物。<,>His reckless driving endangered other road users.<,>他鲁莽的驾驶危及了其他道路使用者。<,>en(使)+danger(危险)→使处于危险中→危及<,>danger(n.危险)/endangered(adj.濒危的)/engage(v.从事)

crisis<,>/ˈkraɪsɪs/<,>/ˈkraɪsɪs/<,>n.危机/n.转折点<,>The country is facing an economic crisis.<,>该国正面临经济危机。<,>The patient reached a crisis in his illness.<,>病人的病情到了转折点。<,>The crisis brought the community together.<,>这次危机使社区团结起来。<,>cri(判断)+sis→需要作出判断的时刻→危机<,>critic(n.批评家)/critical(adj.关键的)/criticism(n.批评)
peril<,>/ˈper.əl/<,>/ˈpɛr.əl/<,>n.危机/n.危险的事物<,>The explorers faced great peril in the uncharted jungle.<,>探险家们在未知的丛林中面临巨大危险。<,>Ignoring the warning signs could put you in peril.<,>忽视警告标志可能会让你陷入危险。<,>His reckless actions brought peril to the entire team.<,>他鲁莽的行为给整个团队带来了危险。<,>per(完全)+il(走)→完全走向危险→危机<,>pearl(n.珍珠)/pedal(n.踏板/v.踩踏板)  

dismiss<,>/dɪsˈmɪs/<,>/dɪsˈmɪs/<,>v.解雇/v.开除<,>The manager decided to dismiss the lazy employee.<,>经理决定解雇那个懒惰的员工。<,>The teacher dismissed the class early today.<,>老师今天提前下课了。<,>He dismissed her suggestion with a wave of his hand.<,>他挥手驳回了她的建议。<,>dis(离开)+miss(送)→送走→解雇<,>dismal(adj.阴沉的)/dispose(v.处理/v.安排)  

fro<,>/frəʊ/<,>/froʊ/<,>adv.往/adv.去/adv.回/adv.向后<,>The pendulum swings to and fro.<,>钟摆来回摆动。<,>He paced fro and fro in the waiting room.<,>他在候诊室里来回踱步。<,>The boat rocked fro in the stormy sea.<,>小船在暴风雨的海面上来回摇晃。<,>与to连用构成to and fro(来回地)<,>frog(n.青蛙)/from(prep.从)  

mesh<,>/meʃ/<,>/mɛʃ/<,>n.网眼/n.筛孔/n.网络<,>The fish were caught in the fine mesh of the net.<,>鱼被细密的网眼困住了。<,>The gears need to mesh perfectly for the machine to work.<,>齿轮需要完美啮合机器才能运转。<,>Her ideas meshed well with the team's plan.<,>她的想法与团队计划很契合。<,>me(我)+sh(筛)→我的筛子→网眼<,>mash(v.捣碎/n.糊状物)/marsh(n.沼泽)  

network<,>/ˈnet.wɜːk/<,>/ˈnɛt.wɝk/<,>n.网络/n.广播网<,>She has a wide network of professional contacts.<,>她拥有广泛的职业人脉网络。<,>The TV show is broadcast on a major network.<,>这个电视节目在主要电视网播出。<,>Computer networks have revolutionized communication.<,>计算机网络彻底改变了通讯方式。<,>net(网)+work(工作)→网络工作→网络<,>net(n.网/adj.净的)/notework(n.笔记本)  

web<,>/web/<,>/wɛb/<,>n.网/n.网状物<,>A spider was spinning its web in the corner.<,>一只蜘蛛正在角落织网。<,>The internet is often called the World Wide Web.<,>互联网常被称为万维网。<,>He was caught in a web of lies.<,>他陷入了谎言的罗网。<,>we(我们)+b(布)→我们织的布→网<,>wed(v.结婚)/wet(adj.湿的)  

stubborn<,>/ˈstʌb.ən/<,>/ˈstʌb.ɚn/<,>adj.顽固的/adj.顽强的<,>The stubborn child refused to eat his vegetables.<,>这个固执的孩子拒绝吃蔬菜。<,>She has a stubborn belief in her own abilities.<,>她对自己的能力有着坚定的信念。<,>This stain is stubborn and hard to remove.<,>这个污渍很顽固，很难清除。<,>stub(树桩)+born(出生)→像树桩一样天生顽固<,>stubble(n.短须)/stumble(v.绊倒)  

trifle<,>/ˈtraɪ.fəl/<,>/ˈtraɪ.fəl/<,>v.玩忽/v.闲混/v.嬉耍<,>Don't trifle with her feelings.<,>不要玩弄她的感情。<,>He trifled away his inheritance on gambling.<,>他把继承的财产赌博挥霍掉了。<,>She trifled with her food instead of eating it.<,>她拨弄着食物而不是吃它。<,>tri(三)+fle(小东西)→把时间花在小事上→闲混<,>trifling(adj.微不足道的)/truffle(n.松露)  

completion<,>/kəmˈpliː.ʃən/<,>/kəmˈpliː.ʃən/<,>n.完成/n.结束/n.完满<,>The completion of the project is scheduled for next month.<,>该项目计划于下个月完成。<,>Upon completion of the course, you'll receive a certificate.<,>课程结束后，您将获得证书。<,>The artist viewed the painting as near completion.<,>艺术家认为这幅画接近完成了。<,>com(完全)+plet(填满)+ion→完全填满→完成<,>competition(n.比赛)/complement(n.补充物)  

crooked<,>/ˈkrʊk.ɪd/<,>/ˈkrʊk.ɪd/<,>adj.弯的/adj.歪的/adj.畸形的<,>The picture hung crooked on the wall.<,>这幅画歪挂在墙上。<,>He gave me a crooked smile.<,>他对我露出狡黠的微笑。<,>The path was crooked and hard to follow.<,>小路弯弯曲曲，很难走。<,>crook(弯曲)+ed(形容词后缀)→弯曲的<,>crook(n.弯曲部分/v.使弯曲)/cooked(adj.煮熟的)
hull<,>/hʌl/<,>/hʌl/<,>n.外壳/n.豆荚/n.薄膜<,>The hull of the ship was painted blue.<,>船的外壳被漆成了蓝色。<,>Peas grow inside a green hull.<,>豌豆生长在绿色的豆荚里。<,>Remove the hull before eating the seeds.<,>吃种子前要去掉薄膜。<,>hull发音类似"壳"→外壳<,>hull(n.外壳)/hurl(v.猛投)/hole(n.洞)

diplomatic<,>/ˌdɪpləˈmætɪk/<,>/ˌdɪpləˈmætɪk/<,>adj.外交的/adj.有策略的<,>He handled the situation with diplomatic skill.<,>他以外交手腕处理了这个局面。<,>She gave a diplomatic answer to avoid offending anyone.<,>她给出了一个圆滑的回答以避免冒犯任何人。<,>The ambassador is on a diplomatic mission.<,>大使正在执行外交任务。<,>diplo(双)+matic(行动)→两边行动→外交的<,>diploma(n.文凭)/democratic(adj.民主的)

alien<,>/ˈeɪliən/<,>/ˈeɪliən/<,>adj.外国的/n.外国人<,>The concept was alien to their culture.<,>这个概念对他们的文化来说很陌生。<,>He is an alien living in this country.<,>他是居住在这个国家的外国人。<,>The movie is about aliens from outer space.<,>这部电影讲的是来自外太空的外星人。<,>ali(其他)+en(形容词后缀)→其他的→外国的<,>alien(adj.外国的)/align(v.对齐)/allied(adj.同盟的)

strange<,>/streɪndʒ/<,>/streɪndʒ/<,>adj.陌生的/adj.不熟悉的<,>The town seemed strange to the newcomer.<,>这个小镇对新人来说很陌生。<,>I heard a strange noise last night.<,>昨晚我听到了一个奇怪的声音。<,>His behavior is becoming increasingly strange.<,>他的行为变得越来越奇怪了。<,>str(街道)+ange(音似"安家")→在陌生街道安家<,>strange(adj.陌生的)/strain(n.压力)/strangle(v.扼死)

distort<,>/dɪˈstɔːt/<,>/dɪˈstɔːrt/<,>v.歪曲/v.曲解/v.扭曲<,>The media distorted the facts about the event.<,>媒体歪曲了事件的真相。<,>Pain distorted his face.<,>疼痛使他的脸扭曲了。<,>The mirror distorted her reflection.<,>镜子使她的影像变形了。<,>dis(分开)+tort(扭曲)→扭曲分开→歪曲<,>distort(v.歪曲)/retort(v.反驳)/extort(v.勒索)

twist<,>/twɪst/<,>/twɪst/<,>v.歪曲/v.曲解<,>He twisted my words to make me look bad.<,>他曲解我的话让我难堪。<,>The road twists through the mountains.<,>这条路蜿蜒穿过群山。<,>She twisted her ankle while running.<,>她在跑步时扭伤了脚踝。<,>tw(二)+ist→两股力量→扭曲<,>twist(v.扭曲)/wrist(n.手腕)/twin(n.双胞胎)

tile<,>/taɪl/<,>/taɪl/<,>n.瓷砖/n.贴砖/n.瓦片<,>The bathroom floor is covered with ceramic tiles.<,>浴室地面铺着瓷砖。<,>We need to replace some broken roof tiles.<,>我们需要更换一些破损的屋顶瓦片。<,>He spent the afternoon tiling the kitchen.<,>他花了一下午时间给厨房贴瓷砖。<,>tile发音类似"台儿"→瓷砖台面<,>tile(n.瓷砖)/till(conj.直到)/tail(n.尾巴)

watt<,>/wɒt/<,>/wɑːt/<,>n.瓦(特)<,>This light bulb uses 60 watts of power.<,>这个灯泡功率是60瓦。<,>The heater has a 2000-watt capacity.<,>这个加热器的功率是2000瓦。<,>Watt is a unit of electrical power.<,>瓦特是电功率的单位。<,>来自发明家James Watt的姓氏<,>watt(n.瓦特)/what(pron.什么)/wet(adj.湿的)

elliptical<,>/ɪˈlɪptɪkəl/<,>/ɪˈlɪptɪkəl/<,>adj.椭圆的/adj.省略的<,>The Earth's orbit is elliptical, not circular.<,>地球的轨道是椭圆形的，不是圆形的。<,>She gave an elliptical answer to avoid the question.<,>她给出了一个含糊的回答来回避问题。<,>The gym has several elliptical machines.<,>健身房有几台椭圆机。<,>ellipse(椭圆)+ical(形容词后缀)→椭圆的<,>elliptical(adj.椭圆的)/ecliptic(n.黄道)/ellipsis(n.省略)

haul<,>/hɔːl/<,>/hɔːl/<,>v.拖曳/v.拖运<,>They hauled the boat onto the shore.<,>他们把船拖上了岸。<,>The truck hauled a load of bricks to the construction site.<,>卡车把一车砖块运到了建筑工地。<,>It was a long haul to the top of the mountain.<,>登上山顶是一段漫长的路程。<,>haul发音类似"haul"(嚎)→用力拖曳时发出的声音<,>haul(v.拖曳)/hall(n.大厅)/hail(n.冰雹)
hip<,>/hɪp/<,>/hɪp/<,>n.臀部/n.髋<,>She put her hands on her hips and sighed.<,>她双手叉腰叹了口气。<,>He broke his hip in the accident.<,>他在事故中摔断了髋骨。<,>The baby's hips were checked by the doctor.<,>医生检查了婴儿的髋部。<,>hi(嗨)+p(屁股)→臀部<,>lip(n.嘴唇)/tip(n.尖端/v.倾斜)

devour<,>/dɪˈvaʊə(r)/<,>/dɪˈvaʊər/<,>v.吞食/v.吞灭/v.毁灭<,>The lion devoured its prey quickly.<,>狮子迅速吞食了猎物。<,>The fire devoured the entire building.<,>大火吞噬了整个建筑。<,>She devoured the novel in one sitting.<,>她一口气读完了这本小说。<,>de(完全)+vour(吃)→完全吃掉→吞食<,>endeavor(n.努力/v.尽力)/flour(n.面粉)

retirement<,>/rɪˈtaɪəmənt/<,>/rɪˈtaɪərmənt/<,>n.退休/n.引退/n.退隐<,>He's planning for his retirement at 65.<,>他计划65岁退休。<,>They moved to a quiet retirement village.<,>他们搬到了一个安静的退休社区。<,>Her retirement from politics surprised everyone.<,>她从政界引退让所有人惊讶。<,>re(回)+tire(疲倦)+ment→疲倦后回归→退休<,>requirement(n.要求)/replacement(n.替换)

drawback<,>/ˈdrɔːbæk/<,>/ˈdrɔˌbæk/<,>n.妨碍/n.弊端<,>The main drawback of this plan is the cost.<,>这个计划的主要弊端是成本。<,>Lack of parking space is a big drawback.<,>缺少停车位是个大妨碍。<,>One drawback of working from home is isolation.<,>在家工作的一个弊端是孤独。<,>draw(拉)+back(回)→往回拉→妨碍<,>feedback(n.反馈)/setback(n.挫折)

inference<,>/ˈɪnfərəns/<,>/ˈɪnfərəns/<,>n.推论/n.推断的结果<,>We can make an inference from these facts.<,>我们可以从这些事实中做出推论。<,>His inference turned out to be correct.<,>他的推断结果证明是正确的。<,>Statistical inference is important in research.<,>统计推断在研究中很重要。<,>in(进入)+fer(带来)+ence→带进结论→推论<,>reference(n.参考)/conference(n.会议)

rational<,>/ˈræʃnəl/<,>/ˈræʃənəl/<,>adj.合理的/adj.适度的<,>There must be a rational explanation.<,>一定有个合理的解释。<,>She made a rational decision after careful thought.<,>经过仔细思考后她做出了合理的决定。<,>Keep a rational approach to problem-solving.<,>保持解决问题的适度方法。<,>ratio(比率)+nal→符合比率的→合理的<,>national(adj.国家的)/emotional(adj.情绪的)

propulsion<,>/prəˈpʌlʃn/<,>/prəˈpʌlʃən/<,>n.推进/n.推进力<,>Jet propulsion moves the airplane forward.<,>喷气推进推动飞机前进。<,>The spacecraft uses ion propulsion.<,>航天器使用离子推进力。<,>Swimmers use leg propulsion in the water.<,>游泳者在水里用腿部推进。<,>pro(向前)+puls(驱动)+ion→向前驱动→推进<,>compulsion(n.强迫)/repulsion(n.排斥)

propel<,>/prəˈpel/<,>/prəˈpel/<,>v.推进/v.推动<,>The engine propels the boat through the water.<,>发动机推动船在水中前进。<,>Ambition propelled him to work harder.<,>雄心推动他更加努力工作。<,>Wind propels the sails of the windmill.<,>风推动风车的叶片。<,>pro(向前)+pel(推)→向前推→推进<,>compel(v.强迫)/repel(v.击退)

recommendation<,>/ˌrekəmenˈdeɪʃn/<,>/ˌrekəmenˈdeɪʃən/<,>n.推荐/n.介绍/n.建议<,>I got the job through a professor's recommendation.<,>我通过一位教授的推荐得到了这份工作。<,>The doctor's recommendation was to rest.<,>医生的建议是休息。<,>This restaurant comes highly recommended.<,>这家餐厅受到高度推荐。<,>re(再)+commend(委托)+ation→再次委托→推荐<,>commendation(n.表扬)/accommodation(n.住宿)

overthrow<,>/ˌəʊvəˈθrəʊ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈθroʊ/<,>v.推翻/n.推翻/n.瓦解<,>The rebels planned to overthrow the government.<,>叛军计划推翻政府。<,>The overthrow of the regime led to chaos.<,>政权的瓦解导致了混乱。<,>They succeeded in the overthrow of the dictator.<,>他们成功推翻了独裁者。<,>over(超过)+throw(扔)→扔过头→推翻<,>overcome(v.克服)/overtake(v.超过)
impulse<,>/ˈɪmpʌls/<,>/ˈɪmˌpʌls/<,>n.冲动/n.推动<,>He bought the car on impulse.<,>他一时冲动买了这辆车。<,>The impulse of the engine drives the wheels.<,>发动机的推动力驱动车轮。<,>She couldn't resist the impulse to laugh.<,>她忍不住想笑。<,>im(向内)+pulse(推)→内心推动→冲动<,>pulse(n.脉搏)/compulsion(n.强迫)/repulse(v.击退)

presumably<,>/prɪˈzjuːməbli/<,>/prɪˈzuːməbli/<,>adv.推测起来/adv.大概<,>Presumably, he forgot about the meeting.<,>他大概是忘了开会。<,>She's presumably at home by now.<,>她现在大概在家。<,>Presumably, the package will arrive tomorrow.<,>包裹大概明天会到。<,>pre(预先)+sum(拿)+ably→预先拿到的想法→推测起来<,>probably(adv.很可能)/supposedly(adv.据称)/assumably(adv.可假定地)

gather<,>/ˈɡæðə(r)/<,>/ˈɡæðər/<,>v.推测/v.推断<,>I gather from your tone that you're unhappy.<,>从你的语气我推测你不高兴。<,>We can gather some useful information from the data.<,>我们可以从数据中推断出一些有用信息。<,>As far as I can gather, they're leaving tomorrow.<,>据我推测，他们明天离开。<,>gath(聚集)+er→把信息聚集起来→推测<,>collect(v.收集)/assemble(v.集合)/conclude(v.得出结论)

shove<,>/ʃʌv/<,>/ʃʌv/<,>v.推/v.(使劲)推<,>He shoved the door open with his shoulder.<,>他用肩膀使劲推开了门。<,>Don't shove - wait your turn in line.<,>别推挤，排队等候。<,>She shoved the papers into her bag.<,>她把文件塞进包里。<,>sh(音似"使")+ove(over)→使过去→推<,>push(v.推)/shovel(n.铲子)/shove off(phr.离开)

solidarity<,>/ˌsɒlɪˈdærəti/<,>/ˌsɑːlɪˈdærəti/<,>n.团结/n.休戚相关<,>The workers showed great solidarity during the strike.<,>工人们在罢工期间表现出极大的团结。<,>There's a strong sense of solidarity in the community.<,>社区里有很强的休戚相关感。<,>International solidarity is important in fighting poverty.<,>国际团结对消除贫困很重要。<,>solid(坚固的)+arity→坚固的状态→团结<,>unity(n.团结)/solitude(n.孤独)/solidity(n.坚固)

regiment<,>/ˈredʒɪmənt/<,>/ˈrɛdʒəmənt/<,>n.团/n.军团/n.一大群<,>He served in the 7th Cavalry Regiment.<,>他在第七骑兵团服役。<,>A regiment of ants marched across the path.<,>一大群蚂蚁穿过小路。<,>The soldiers were divided into three regiments.<,>士兵们被分成三个军团。<,>reg(统治)+i+ment→统治的单位→军团<,>regime(n.政权)/region(n.地区)/regal(adj.帝王的)

bandit<,>/ˈbændɪt/<,>/ˈbændɪt/<,>n.土匪/n.盗匪/n.歹徒<,>The bandits robbed the travelers on the road.<,>土匪在路上抢劫了旅行者。<,>He was attacked by a bandit in the alley.<,>他在小巷里遭到歹徒袭击。<,>The village was terrorized by bandits.<,>村庄受到盗匪的恐吓。<,>ban(禁止)+dit(给)→被禁止给予的人→土匪<,>band(n.乐队)/banish(v.放逐)/bandage(n.绷带)

lever<,>/ˈliːvə(r)/<,>/ˈlɛvər/<,>n.途径/n.工具/n.手段<,>Education is a powerful lever for social change.<,>教育是社会变革的有力工具。<,>He used his connections as a lever to get the job.<,>他利用人脉作为获得工作的手段。<,>This policy could be a useful lever in negotiations.<,>这项政策可能是谈判中的有用途径。<,>lev(举起)+er→能举起东西的工具→杠杆→手段<,>level(n.水平)/leveraged(adj.杠杆的)/leverage(n.影响力)

overtake<,>/ˌəʊvəˈteɪk/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈteɪk/<,>v.突然发生/v.压倒<,>A sudden storm overtook the hikers.<,>突如其来的暴风雨袭击了徒步者。<,>Sleep overtook him during the boring lecture.<,>他在无聊的讲座中睡着了。<,>The company was overtaken by financial difficulties.<,>公司被财务困难压倒。<,>over(超过)+take(拿)→超过而拿到→压倒<,>undertake(v.承担)/takeover(n.接管)/overwhelm(v.淹没)

nose<,>/nəʊz/<,>/noʊz/<,>n.突出部分/n.(如船头等)<,>The ship's nose plowed through the waves.<,>船头破浪前进。<,>He carefully painted the nose of the model airplane.<,>他仔细地给模型飞机的机头涂色。<,>The nose of the car was damaged in the accident.<,>车头在事故中受损。<,>nose(鼻子)→像鼻子一样突出的部分<,>nostril(n.鼻孔)/nozzle(n.喷嘴)/nasal(adj.鼻的)
bald<,>/bɔːld/<,>/bɔld/<,>adj.秃头的/adj.无毛的<,>He started going bald in his twenties.<,>他二十多岁就开始秃头了。<,>The mountain top was bald and rocky.<,>山顶光秃秃的，布满岩石。<,>The dog has a bald patch on its back.<,>这只狗背上有一块没毛的地方。<,>bal(球)+d→像球一样光秃秃的<,>bold(adj.大胆的)/ball(n.球)/balm(n.香油)

projector<,>/prəˈdʒektə(r)/<,>/prəˈdʒɛktər/<,>n.投影仪/n.探照灯<,>The teacher used a projector to show the slides.<,>老师用投影仪展示幻灯片。<,>The ship's projector lit up the night sky.<,>船上的探照灯照亮了夜空。<,>We need to fix the projector before the presentation.<,>我们需要在演示前修好投影仪。<,>pro(向前)+ject(投掷)+or(物)→向前投射的机器<,>project(n.项目/v.投射)/inject(v.注射)/reject(v.拒绝)

poll<,>/pəʊl/<,>/poʊl/<,>n.投票/v.对...进行民意测验<,>The latest poll shows the president's approval rating has dropped.<,>最新民调显示总统支持率下降了。<,>They polled 1,000 people about their shopping habits.<,>他们对1000人的购物习惯进行了调查。<,>Don't forget to vote in the class poll tomorrow.<,>别忘了参加明天的班级投票。<,>pol(城市)+l→古代在城市进行的投票<,>pole(n.柱子)/pool(n.水池)/pull(v.拉)

dizzy<,>/ˈdɪzi/<,>/ˈdɪzi/<,>adj.头晕眼花的/adj.眩晕的<,>I felt dizzy after spinning around.<,>转圈后我感到头晕。<,>The height made her dizzy.<,>高度让她感到眩晕。<,>He was dizzy with excitement.<,>他兴奋得头晕目眩。<,>diz(旋转)+zy→旋转导致眩晕<,>fizzy(adj.起泡的)/daisy(n.雏菊)/drizzle(n.细雨)

steal<,>/stiːl/<,>/stil/<,>v.偷偷地做/v.窃取<,>He stole a glance at her.<,>他偷偷看了她一眼。<,>Someone stole my wallet on the bus.<,>有人在公交车上偷了我的钱包。<,>She stole the show with her performance.<,>她的表演抢尽了风头。<,>ste(站立)+al→偷偷站着拿东西<,>steel(n.钢铁)/seal(n.印章)/stale(adj.不新鲜的)

misery<,>/ˈmɪzəri/<,>/ˈmɪzəri/<,>n.痛苦/n.悲惨/n.不幸<,>The war brought misery to millions.<,>战争给数百万人带来了痛苦。<,>He was in misery after losing his job.<,>失业后他生活在痛苦中。<,>Living in poverty is a life of misery.<,>生活在贫困中是一种悲惨的生活。<,>miser(痛苦)+y→痛苦的状态<,>mystery(n.谜)/misery(n.痛苦)/mastery(n.掌握)

torment<,>/ˈtɔːment/<,>/ˈtɔrˌmɛnt/<,>n.痛苦/v.折磨<,>The memories were a constant torment to him.<,>这些记忆不断折磨着他。<,>Don't torment the cat with that stick.<,>不要用那根棍子折磨猫。<,>She suffered terrible torments during the war.<,>战争期间她遭受了巨大的痛苦。<,>tor(扭曲)+ment→使人精神扭曲<,>tornado(n.龙卷风)/tournament(n.锦标赛)/torrent(n.急流)

thrash<,>/θræʃ/<,>/θræʃ/<,>v.痛打/v.鞭打/v.打<,>The waves thrashed against the rocks.<,>海浪猛烈拍打着岩石。<,>He thrashed the boy for stealing.<,>他因为偷窃痛打了那个男孩。<,>The boxer was thrashing his opponent.<,>拳击手正在痛打对手。<,>thr(三)+ash(灰)→打三次变成灰<,>trash(n.垃圾)/thresh(v.打谷)/thrust(v.猛推)

dominant<,>/ˈdɒmɪnənt/<,>/ˈdɑmənənt/<,>adj.统治的/n.主因<,>The dominant team won easily.<,>占统治地位的队伍轻松获胜。<,>Genetics is the dominant factor in eye color.<,>遗传是眼睛颜色的主因。<,>The lion is the dominant animal in the jungle.<,>狮子是丛林中的统治性动物。<,>dom(家)+in(内)+ant→在家做主的人<,>dominate(v.支配)/dominion(n.领土)/domino(n.多米诺骨牌)

dominate<,>/ˈdɒmɪneɪt/<,>/ˈdɑməˌneɪt/<,>v.统治/v.支配/v.控制<,>The castle dominates the town.<,>城堡俯瞰着整个城镇。<,>He dominates every conversation.<,>他主导着每次谈话。<,>The company dominates the smartphone market.<,>这家公司主导着智能手机市场。<,>dom(家)+in(内)+ate→在家做主<,>dominant(adj.统治的)/nominate(v.提名)/domicile(n.住所)
statistics<,>/stəˈtɪstɪks/<,>/stəˈtɪstɪks/<,>n.统计/n.统计数字<,>The statistics show that crime rates have decreased.<,>统计数据显示犯罪率有所下降。<,>She is studying statistics at university.<,>她在大学学习统计学。<,>These statistics are crucial for our research.<,>这些统计数据对我们的研究至关重要。<,>stat(状态)+ist(人)+ics(学科)→研究状态的学科→统计学<,>static(adj.静态的)/status(n.地位)/statute(n.法令)

even<,>/ˈiːv(ə)n/<,>/ˈiːvən/<,>adj.平稳的/adj.均匀的<,>The road is very even and easy to drive on.<,>这条路非常平坦，开车很容易。<,>Her breathing became slow and even.<,>她的呼吸变得缓慢而均匀。<,>Spread the icing in an even layer.<,>把糖霜均匀地涂抹开。<,>eve(前夕)+n→像平安夜一样平静→平稳的<,>event(n.事件)/evening(n.傍晚)/ever(adv.曾经)

identical<,>/aɪˈdentɪk(ə)l/<,>/aɪˈdɛntɪkəl/<,>adj.同一的/adj.恒等的<,>The twins are identical in appearance.<,>这对双胞胎外表一模一样。<,>This is the identical room we stayed in last year.<,>这是我们去年住过的同一个房间。<,>The two documents are identical in content.<,>这两份文件内容完全相同。<,>ident(相同)+ical(形容词后缀)→同一的<,>identity(n.身份)/identify(v.识别)/ideology(n.意识形态)

likeness<,>/ˈlaɪknəs/<,>/ˈlaɪknəs/<,>n.同样/n.类似/n.相似<,>There's a strong likeness between the two paintings.<,>这两幅画非常相似。<,>He bears a striking likeness to his father.<,>他和他父亲长得惊人地像。<,>The artist captured her likeness perfectly.<,>艺术家完美地捕捉到了她的神韵。<,>like(像)+ness(名词后缀)→相似<,>likely(adj.可能的)/likewise(adv.同样地)/alike(adj.相似的)

simultaneous<,>/ˌsɪm(ə)lˈteɪnɪəs/<,>/ˌsaɪməlˈteɪniəs/<,>adj.同时的/adj.同时存在的<,>The two events were simultaneous but unrelated.<,>这两个事件同时发生但没有关联。<,>We need simultaneous translation for the conference.<,>我们需要为会议提供同声传译。<,>The explosions were nearly simultaneous.<,>爆炸几乎是同时发生的。<,>simul(相同)+taneous(时间)→同时的<,>simulate(v.模拟)/similar(adj.相似的)/simile(n.明喻)

accessory<,>/əkˈsɛs(ə)ri/<,>/əkˈsɛsəri/<,>n.同谋/n.帮凶/adj.附属的<,>She was charged as an accessory to the crime.<,>她被指控为犯罪的从犯。<,>These shoes come with matching accessories.<,>这双鞋配有相配的饰品。<,>The car has many optional accessories.<,>这辆车有许多可选配件。<,>ac(向)+cess(走)+ory(物)→走向主犯的物品→帮凶<,>access(n.通道)/excess(n.过量)/process(n.过程)

homogeneous<,>/ˌhɒmə(ʊ)ˈdʒiːnɪəs/<,>/ˌhoʊməˈdʒiːniəs/<,>adj.同类的<,>The population in this area is quite homogeneous.<,>这个地区的人口相当同质。<,>We need a homogeneous mixture for the experiment.<,>我们需要一个均匀的混合物来做实验。<,>The group was homogeneous in terms of age.<,>这个群体在年龄方面很相似。<,>homo(相同)+gene(基因)+ous(形容词后缀)→同类的<,>heterogeneous(adj.异类的)/homonym(n.同形异义词)/homosexual(adj.同性恋的)

coordinate<,>/kəʊˈɔːdɪneɪt/<,>/koʊˈɔːrdɪneɪt/<,>adj.同等的<,>We need to take coordinate action on this issue.<,>我们需要在这个问题上采取协调一致的行动。<,>The dancers' movements were perfectly coordinated.<,>舞者们的动作完美协调。<,>The two departments work in a coordinate manner.<,>这两个部门以协调的方式工作。<,>co(共同)+ordin(顺序)+ate(使)→使顺序相同→协调<,>subordinate(adj.下级的)/inordinate(adj.过度的)/ordinal(adj.顺序的)

whilst<,>/waɪlst/<,>/waɪlst/<,>conj.同时/conj.然而<,>He read the newspaper whilst eating breakfast.<,>他一边吃早餐一边看报纸。<,>Whilst I understand your point, I disagree.<,>虽然我理解你的观点，但我不同意。<,>She listened carefully whilst taking notes.<,>她一边认真听一边做笔记。<,>while的变体，多用于英式英语<,>while(conj.当...时候)/whistle(n.哨子)/whisker(n.胡须)

notify<,>/ˈnəʊtɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈnoʊtɪfaɪ/<,>v.通知/v.告知/v.报告<,>Please notify me when the package arrives.<,>包裹到达时请通知我。<,>The school will notify parents about the changes.<,>学校将通知家长有关变更。<,>You must notify the authorities of any changes.<,>你必须向当局报告任何变更。<,>not(知道)+ify(使)→使知道→通知<,>notice(n.通知)/notion(n.概念)/notable(adj.显著的)
advertise<,>/ˈædvətaɪz/<,>/ˈædvərˌtaɪz/<,>v.登广告<,>They decided to advertise the new product on TV.<,>他们决定在电视上为新产品登广告。<,>She advertised her car for sale in the local newspaper.<,>她在当地报纸上登广告卖车。<,>The company is advertising for a new manager.<,>公司正在登广告招聘新经理。<,>ad(向)+vert(转)+ise(动词后缀)→把注意力转向→登广告<,>advertisement(n.广告)/advert(n.广告)/advertent(adj.注意的)

correspondence<,>/ˌkɒrɪˈspɒndəns/<,>/ˌkɔːrəˈspɑːndəns/<,>n.通信/n.相关/n.相似<,>There has been a long correspondence between the two friends.<,>这两个朋友之间有长期的通信往来。<,>The correspondence between the two accounts was remarkable.<,>这两个账户之间的相似之处非常明显。<,>She is in charge of the company's foreign correspondence.<,>她负责公司的对外通信。<,>cor(共同)+respond(回答)+ence(名词后缀)→相互回答→通信<,>correspondent(n.记者/通讯员)/corresponding(adj.相应的)/respond(v.回答)

popularity<,>/ˌpɒpjuˈlærəti/<,>/ˌpɑːpjəˈlærəti/<,>n.通俗性/n.普及/n.流行<,>The singer's popularity has increased rapidly.<,>这位歌手的知名度迅速提高。<,>This style of music gained popularity in the 1980s.<,>这种音乐风格在20世纪80年代流行起来。<,>The popularity of social media has changed the way we communicate.<,>社交媒体的普及改变了我们的交流方式。<,>popular(流行的)+ity(名词后缀)→流行性<,>population(n.人口)/popularize(v.普及)/populace(n.平民)

inflation<,>/ɪnˈfleɪʃn/<,>/ɪnˈfleɪʃən/<,>n.通货膨胀/n.物价飞涨<,>The government is trying to control inflation.<,>政府正在努力控制通货膨胀。<,>High inflation makes life difficult for ordinary people.<,>高通货膨胀使普通人的生活变得困难。<,>The inflation rate has risen to 5% this year.<,>今年的通货膨胀率已上升到5%。<,>in(进入)+flat(吹)+ion(名词后缀)→吹入→膨胀<,>deflation(n.通货紧缩)/inflate(v.膨胀)/flatulent(adj.浮夸的)

currency<,>/ˈkʌrənsi/<,>/ˈkɜːrənsi/<,>n.通货/n.货币<,>The dollar is the official currency of the United States.<,>美元是美国的官方货币。<,>Foreign currency exchange rates fluctuate daily.<,>外币汇率每天都在波动。<,>This old coin is no longer in currency.<,>这枚旧硬币已不再流通。<,>curr(跑)+ency(名词后缀)→流通的东西→货币<,>current(adj.当前的)/occur(v.发生)/concur(v.同意)

entry<,>/ˈentri/<,>/ˈɛntri/<,>n.入口/n.通道/n.条目<,>Please use the side entry to the building.<,>请使用大楼的侧门入口。<,>There was a long queue at the entry to the museum.<,>博物馆入口处排起了长队。<,>He made an entry in his diary every night.<,>他每晚都在日记中写一条记录。<,>entr(进入)+y(名词后缀)→进入的地方→入口<,>enter(v.进入)/entrance(n.入口)/entrepreneur(n.企业家)

customary<,>/ˈkʌstəməri/<,>/ˈkʌstəˌmɛri/<,>adj.通常的/adj.照惯例的<,>It is customary to shake hands when you meet someone.<,>见面时握手是惯例。<,>The customary practice in this company is to have a meeting every Monday.<,>这家公司的惯例是每周一开会。<,>She arrived at the customary time of 9 o'clock.<,>她按照惯例在9点钟到达。<,>custom(习惯)+ary(形容词后缀)→习惯的<,>customer(n.顾客)/customize(v.定制)/accustom(v.使习惯)

ordinarily<,>/ˈɔːdnrəli/<,>/ˈɔːrdnˌɛrəli/<,>adv.通常/adv.大概<,>Ordinarily, I would agree with you, but not this time.<,>通常我会同意你的意见，但这次不行。<,>He is ordinarily a very calm person.<,>他通常是个非常冷静的人。<,>The store is ordinarily open until 9 pm.<,>这家商店通常营业到晚上9点。<,>ordinary(普通的)+ly(副词后缀)→通常地<,>ordinary(adj.普通的)/extraordinary(adj.非凡的)/order(n.顺序)

hydrocarbon<,>/ˌhaɪdrəˈkɑːbən/<,>/ˌhaɪdroʊˈkɑːrbən/<,>n.烃/n.碳氢化合物<,>Petroleum is a mixture of various hydrocarbons.<,>石油是各种碳氢化合物的混合物。<,>Methane is the simplest hydrocarbon.<,>甲烷是最简单的碳氢化合物。<,>The burning of hydrocarbons releases carbon dioxide.<,>碳氢化合物的燃烧会释放二氧化碳。<,>hydro(水)+carbon(碳)→碳氢化合物<,>hydrogen(n.氢)/carbon(n.碳)/carbohydrate(n.碳水化合物)

resignation<,>/ˌrezɪɡˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛzɪɡˈneɪʃən/<,>n.听从/n.屈从/n.顺从<,>He accepted his fate with resignation.<,>他顺从地接受了自己的命运。<,>Her resignation to the situation surprised everyone.<,>她对现状的屈从让所有人感到惊讶。<,>The workers showed resignation to the new rules.<,>工人们表现出对新规定的顺从。<,>re(再)+sign(签字)+ation(名词后缀)→再次签字→辞职→屈从<,>resign(v.辞职)/design(n.设计/v.设计)/signature(n.签名)
blacksmith<,>/ˈblæk.smɪθ/<,>/ˈblæk.smɪθ/<,>n.铁匠/n.锻工<,>The blacksmith forged a beautiful horseshoe.<,>铁匠打造了一只漂亮的马蹄铁。<,>He learned the trade from a skilled blacksmith.<,>他从一位技艺高超的铁匠那里学到了这门手艺。<,>The blacksmith's hammer rang through the village.<,>铁匠的锤声响彻整个村庄。<,>black(黑色)+smith(工匠)→铁匠(因常接触黑色金属)<,>goldsmith(n.金匠)/locksmith(n.锁匠)/silversmith(n.银匠)

ferrous<,>/ˈfer.əs/<,>/ˈfɛr.əs/<,>adj.铁的/adj.亚铁的<,>This mineral contains ferrous compounds.<,>这种矿物含有亚铁化合物。<,>Ferrous metals are prone to rust.<,>含铁金属容易生锈。<,>The doctor prescribed ferrous sulfate for anemia.<,>医生开了硫酸亚铁治疗贫血。<,>ferr(铁)+ous(形容词后缀)→含铁的<,>ferric(adj.铁的)/nonferrous(adj.非铁的)/ferrous oxide(氧化亚铁)

adjoin<,>/əˈdʒɔɪn/<,>/əˈdʒɔɪn/<,>v.贴近/v.毗连/v.靠近<,>Our property adjoins the park.<,>我们的房产与公园毗邻。<,>The dining room adjoins the kitchen.<,>餐厅紧挨着厨房。<,>Canada adjoins the United States.<,>加拿大与美国接壤。<,>ad(向)+join(连接)→向...连接→毗连<,>adjacent(adj.邻近的)/adjoining(adj.毗邻的)/disjoin(v.分开))

hop<,>/hɒp/<,>/hɑːp/<,>v.单足跳<,>The child hopped on one foot across the room.<,>孩子单脚跳着穿过房间。<,>He hopped over the puddle to keep his shoes dry.<,>他跳过水坑以免弄湿鞋子。<,>Rabbits hop quickly through the field.<,>兔子在田野里快速跳跃。<,>h(形似单脚站立)+op(动作)→单脚跳<,>skip(v.蹦跳)/jump(v.跳跃)/leap(v.飞跃)

skip<,>/skɪp/<,>/skɪp/<,>v.蹦跳着走/v.跳绳/v.略过<,>The children skipped down the sidewalk.<,>孩子们在人行道上蹦蹦跳跳地走。<,>She skips breakfast every morning.<,>她每天早上都不吃早餐。<,>Let's skip the boring parts of the lecture.<,>我们跳过讲座中无聊的部分吧。<,>s(蛇形)+kip(轻快动作)→轻快跳跃<,>hop(v.单脚跳)/leap(v.飞跃)/skim(v.略读)

overlook<,>/ˌəʊ.vəˈlʊk/<,>/ˌoʊ.vɚˈlʊk/<,>v.眺望/v.看漏/v.宽容<,>Our hotel room overlooks the ocean.<,>我们的酒店房间可以俯瞰大海。<,>He overlooked an important detail in the contract.<,>他忽略了合同中的一个重要细节。<,>I'll overlook your mistake this time.<,>这次我会宽容你的错误。<,>over(在上)+look(看)→从上面看→俯瞰<,>oversee(v.监督)/overcast(adj.阴天的)/overload(v.超载)

regulate<,>/ˈreɡ.jə.leɪt/<,>/ˈreɡ.jə.leɪt/<,>v.调整/v.调节/v.校准<,>This device regulates water temperature.<,>这个装置调节水温。<,>The government regulates financial markets.<,>政府监管金融市场。<,>She needs to regulate her sleeping schedule.<,>她需要调整她的睡眠时间表。<,>reg(统治)+ulate(使)→使受统治→调节<,>regular(adj.规则的)/regulation(n.规章)/deregulate(v.解除管制)

modulate<,>/ˈmɒd.jʊ.leɪt/<,>/ˈmɑː.dʒə.leɪt/<,>v.调节(声音)<,>He modulated his voice to sound more persuasive.<,>他调节声音使其更有说服力。<,>The radio signal was modulated for clarity.<,>为了提高清晰度，无线电信号被调制了。<,>She modulates her tone when speaking to children.<,>她对孩子说话时会调整语气。<,>mod(模式)+ulate(使)→使有模式→调节<,>modulator(n.调节器)/modulation(n.调制)/moderate(adj.适度的)

settlement<,>/ˈset.əl.mənt/<,>/ˈset̬.əl.mənt/<,>n.调停/n.定居点<,>They reached a peaceful settlement.<,>他们达成了和平解决方案。<,>The early settlers built a small settlement.<,>早期移民建立了一个小定居点。<,>The divorce settlement was finalized yesterday.<,>离婚协议昨天最终确定了。<,>settle(安顿)+ment(名词后缀)→安顿之处→定居点<,>resettlement(n.重新安置)/settler(n.移民者)/unsettled(adj.未解决的)

mischief<,>/ˈmɪs.tʃɪf/<,>/ˈmɪs.tʃɪf/<,>n.调皮/n.捣蛋/n.胡闹<,>The children were full of mischief.<,>孩子们调皮捣蛋。<,>His eyes twinkled with mischief.<,>他的眼睛里闪烁着调皮的光芒。<,>Don't get into mischief while I'm gone.<,>我不在的时候别胡闹。<,>mis(坏)+chief(头)→坏主意→恶作剧<,>mischievous(adj.调皮的)/miscreant(n.恶棍)/misfortune(n.不幸)
accord<,>/əˈkɔːd/<,>/əˈkɔːrd/<,>n.符合/n.协议<,>The two parties reached an accord on the new policy.<,>双方就新政策达成协议。<,>His actions are in accord with his words.<,>他的言行一致。<,>The peace accord was signed last week.<,>和平协议上周签署。<,>ac(强调)+cord(心)→心心相印→符合<,>record(n.记录/v.录音)/concord(n.和谐)/discord(n.不一致)  

questionnaire<,>/ˌkwestʃəˈneə(r)/<,>/ˌkwestʃəˈner/<,>n.调查表/n.征求意见表<,>Please fill out the questionnaire about your shopping habits.<,>请填写关于您购物习惯的调查表。<,>The company sent a questionnaire to all employees.<,>公司向所有员工发送了征求意见表。<,>This questionnaire will help us improve our services.<,>这份调查表将帮助我们改进服务。<,>question(问题)+naire(后缀)→问题表→调查表<,>questioner(n.提问者)/questioning(adj.质疑的)/questionable(adj.可疑的)
