sweetness<,>/ˈswiːtnəs/<,>/ˈswiːtnəs/<,>n.甜蜜/n.芬芳/n.愉悦/n.美好<,>The sweetness of her smile melted his heart.<,>她甜蜜的微笑融化了他的心。<,>I love the sweetness of fresh flowers in spring.<,>我喜欢春天鲜花的芬芳。<,>There's a special sweetness in childhood memories.<,>童年回忆中有种特别的美好。<,>sweet(甜的)+ness(名词后缀)→甜蜜<,>sweeten(v.变甜)/sweetheart(n.爱人)/sweetly(adv.甜美地)  

dessert<,>/dɪˈzɜːt/<,>/dɪˈzɜːrt/<,>n.甜点心<,>We had chocolate cake for dessert.<,>我们吃了巧克力蛋糕作为甜点。<,>Would you like some dessert after dinner?<,>晚餐后要来些甜点吗？<,>The restaurant is famous for its creative desserts.<,>这家餐厅以创意甜点闻名。<,>des(强调)+sert(服务)→餐后服务→甜点<,>desert(n.沙漠/v.抛弃)/dissert(v.论述)/insert(v.插入)  

Catholic<,>/ˈkæθlɪk/<,>/ˈkæθlɪk/<,>adj.天主教的/n.天主教徒<,>She attends a Catholic school.<,>她在一所天主教学校上学。<,>There are many Catholic churches in this city.<,>这座城市有许多天主教堂。<,>He converted to become a Catholic last year.<,>他去年皈依成为天主教徒。<,>cata(向下)+hol(整体)+ic→普世教会→天主教的<,>cathedral(n.大教堂)/catechism(n.教义问答)/catholicity(n.普遍性)  

astronomy<,>/əˈstrɒnəmi/<,>/əˈstrɑːnəmi/<,>n.天文学<,>He has been interested in astronomy since childhood.<,>他从小就对天文学感兴趣。<,>Modern astronomy uses powerful telescopes.<,>现代天文学使用强大的望远镜。<,>She got a degree in astronomy last year.<,>她去年获得了天文学学位。<,>astro(星星)+nomy(学科)→研究星星的学科→天文学<,>astronaut(n.宇航员)/astrology(n.占星术)/asteroid(n.小行星)  

embody<,>/ɪmˈbɒdi/<,>/ɪmˈbɑːdi/<,>v.体现/v.包含/v.收录<,>This sculpture embodies the spirit of freedom.<,>这座雕塑体现了自由精神。<,>The new law embodies several important principles.<,>新法律包含了几项重要原则。<,>His works embody the essence of traditional culture.<,>他的作品收录了传统文化的精髓。<,>em(使)+body(身体)→使具体化→体现<,>embodiment(n.化身)/embed(v.嵌入)/embolden(v.鼓励)  

theme<,>/θiːm/<,>/θiːm/<,>n.题目/n.主题/n.主旋律/n.主位/n.词干<,>The theme of the conference is sustainable development.<,>会议的主题是可持续发展。<,>Can you identify the main theme of this novel?<,>你能识别出这本小说的主题吗？<,>The theme music is very memorable.<,>这首主题曲非常令人难忘。<,>the(神)+me(我)→神圣的主题→主题<,>thesis(n.论文)/theory(n.理论)/thematic(adj.主题的)  

nominate<,>/ˈnɒmɪneɪt/<,>/ˈnɑːmɪneɪt/<,>v.提名/v.推荐/v.任命<,>She was nominated for Best Actress.<,>她被提名最佳女演员。<,>I'd like to nominate John for the position.<,>我想推荐约翰担任这个职位。<,>The president nominated a new ambassador.<,>总统任命了一位新大使。<,>nomin(名字)+ate(使)→使有名字→提名<,>nominee(n.被提名者)/denominate(v.命名)/ignominy(n.耻辱)  

finance<,>/ˈfaɪnæns/<,>/ˈfaɪnæns/<,>v.提供资金<,>The government will finance the new infrastructure project.<,>政府将为新的基础设施项目提供资金。<,>We need to find someone to finance our startup.<,>我们需要找到人为我们的初创企业提供资金。<,>The research is financed by a private foundation.<,>这项研究由私人基金会资助。<,>fin(结束)+ance→资金周转→提供资金<,>financial(adj.金融的)/financier(n.金融家)/fine(n.罚款)
nourish<,>/ˈnʌrɪʃ/<,>/ˈnɜːrɪʃ/<,>v.提供养分/v.养育<,>Parents nourish their children with love and care.<,>父母用爱和关怀养育孩子。<,>This soil is rich enough to nourish all kinds of plants.<,>这片土壤足够肥沃，能滋养各种植物。<,>A balanced diet helps to nourish the body.<,>均衡的饮食有助于滋养身体。<,>nour(滋养)+ish(动词后缀)→提供养分<,>nourishment(n. 营养)/flourish(v.繁荣/n.华丽辞藻)

enhance<,>/ɪnˈhɑːns/<,>/ɪnˈhæns/<,>v.提高/v.增加/v.改进<,>The new software will enhance our productivity.<,>新软件将提高我们的生产效率。<,>Good lighting can enhance the beauty of a room.<,>良好的照明能提升房间的美感。<,>Regular exercise enhances your overall health.<,>定期锻炼能改善你的整体健康。<,>en(使)+hance(高)→使变高→提高<,>advance(v.前进/n.进展)/entrance(n.入口/v.使狂喜)

elevate<,>/ˈelɪveɪt/<,>/ˈelɪveɪt/<,>v.提拔/v.抬高<,>He was elevated to the position of manager.<,>他被提拔为经理。<,>The platform can be elevated to different heights.<,>这个平台可以抬升到不同高度。<,>Reading good books elevates the mind.<,>阅读好书能提升思想境界。<,>e(出)+lev(轻)+ate(动词后缀)→使轻而上升→抬高<,>levitate(v.飘浮)/alleviate(v.减轻)

purify<,>/ˈpjʊərɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈpjʊrɪfaɪ/<,>v.提纯/v.精炼(金属)<,>The water needs to be purified before drinking.<,>这些水需要净化后才能饮用。<,>They purify gold by removing all impurities.<,>他们通过去除所有杂质来提纯黄金。<,>The air purifier helps to purify the indoor air.<,>空气净化器有助于净化室内空气。<,>pur(纯)+ify(使)→使纯净<,>puritan(n.清教徒)/putrefy(v.腐烂)

raise<,>/reɪz/<,>/reɪz/<,>v.提出/v.发起/v.发出<,>She raised an important question at the meeting.<,>她在会议上提出了一个重要问题。<,>The community raised funds for the new hospital.<,>社区为新医院筹集了资金。<,>He raised his voice to make himself heard.<,>他提高嗓门让别人听清。<,>rais(升起)+e→使升起→提出<,>rise(v.上升/n.上涨)/arise(v.出现)

introduce<,>/ˌɪntrəˈdjuːs/<,>/ˌɪntrəˈduːs/<,>v.提出(议案等)<,>The senator introduced a new bill in Congress.<,>参议员在国会提出了一项新法案。<,>Let me introduce my proposal for the project.<,>让我介绍一下我对这个项目的提议。<,>They introduced a new method to solve the problem.<,>他们提出了一种解决问题的新方法。<,>intro(向内)+duce(引导)→向内引导→提出<,>produce(v.生产/n.农产品)/reduce(v.减少)

peculiarity<,>/pɪˌkjuːliˈærəti/<,>/pɪˌkjuːliˈærəti/<,>n.特性/n.独特性/n.怪癖<,>Each culture has its own peculiarities.<,>每种文化都有其独特性。<,>One of his peculiarities is collecting bottle caps.<,>他的怪癖之一是收集瓶盖。<,>The peculiarity of this plant is its ability to survive in extreme conditions.<,>这种植物的特性是能在极端条件下生存。<,>peculiar(独特的)+ity(名词后缀)→独特性<,>particularity(n.特殊性)/pecuniary(adj.金钱的)

individual<,>/ˌɪndɪˈvɪdʒuəl/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈvɪdʒuəl/<,>adj.特殊的<,>Each individual flower has its own beauty.<,>每一朵花都有其独特的美。<,>We respect individual differences in learning styles.<,>我们尊重学习风格上的个体差异。<,>The teacher gave individual attention to each student.<,>老师给予每个学生个别关注。<,>in(不)+divid(分开)+ual→不可分开的→个体的<,>divide(v.分开)/indivisible(adj.不可分割的)

essential<,>/ɪˈsenʃəl/<,>/ɪˈsenʃəl/<,>adj.极其重要的/adj.必不可少的<,>Water is essential for life.<,>水是生命必不可少的。<,>Good communication skills are essential in this job.<,>良好的沟通技巧对这份工作至关重要。<,>Sleep is essential to your health.<,>睡眠对你的健康至关重要。<,>essent(存在)+ial→存在所必需的→必不可少的<,>essence(n.本质)/existential(adj.存在的)

bore<,>/bɔː(r)/<,>/bɔːr/<,>n.讨厌的人/n.麻烦事<,>He's such a bore at parties.<,>他在聚会上真是个讨厌鬼。<,>Doing paperwork is a real bore.<,>做文书工作真是件烦人的事。<,>Don't be such a bore - let's have some fun!<,>别这么扫兴 - 我们找点乐子吧!<,>bore(钻孔)→像钻孔一样令人厌烦<,>boar(n.公猪)/soar(v.高飞)
earthenware<,>/ˈɜːθnweə(r)/<,>/ˈɜːrθnwer/<,>n.陶器<,>The museum has a collection of ancient earthenware.<,>博物馆收藏了一批古代陶器。<,>She bought a beautiful earthenware vase at the market.<,>她在市场上买了一个漂亮的陶制花瓶。<,>Earthenware is more porous than porcelain.<,>陶器比瓷器更具透气性。<,>earth(土)+en(形容词后缀)+ware(器皿)→陶器<,>porcelain(n.瓷器)/stoneware(n.炻器)/pottery(n.陶器总称)

flee<,>/fliː/<,>/fliː/<,>v.逃走/v.逃避<,>The villagers had to flee their homes during the flood.<,>洪水期间村民们不得不逃离家园。<,>He tried to flee from the scene of the accident.<,>他试图从事故现场逃走。<,>The suspect fled the country before the police could arrest him.<,>嫌疑人在警方逮捕前逃往国外。<,>flee与fly(飞)同源→快速离开<,>escape(v.逃脱)/retreat(v.撤退)/evade(v.逃避)

outlaw<,>/ˈaʊtlɔː/<,>/ˈaʊtlɔː/<,>n.逃犯/n.歹徒<,>The famous outlaw was finally captured by the sheriff.<,>那个著名的逃犯终于被警长抓获。<,>In medieval times, outlaws lived outside the protection of the law.<,>在中世纪，歹徒生活在法律保护之外。<,>The government has declared these drugs to be outlaw substances.<,>政府已宣布这些药品为违禁物质。<,>out(外)+law(法律)→法律之外的人→逃犯<,>bandit(n.土匪)/criminal(n.罪犯)/fugitive(n.逃亡者)

wade<,>/weɪd/<,>/weɪd/<,>v.趟(河)/v.跋涉<,>We had to wade across the shallow river.<,>我们不得不趟过这条浅河。<,>The children were wading in the pool happily.<,>孩子们正在水池里开心地玩水。<,>It took me hours to wade through all the paperwork.<,>我花了几个小时才处理完所有文件。<,>wade与water(水)相关→涉水<,>ford(v.涉水而过)/paddle(v.涉水)/trudge(v.跋涉)

probe<,>/prəʊb/<,>/proʊb/<,>n.探针/v.用探针探查<,>The doctor used a probe to examine the wound.<,>医生用探针检查伤口。<,>Scientists are probing the mysteries of the universe.<,>科学家正在探索宇宙的奥秘。<,>The journalist probed into the corruption scandal.<,>记者深入调查了这起腐败丑闻。<,>pro(向前)+be(存在)→向前探索<,>explore(v.探索)/investigate(v.调查)/examine(v.检查)

expedition<,>/ˌekspəˈdɪʃn/<,>/ˌekspəˈdɪʃn/<,>n.探险/n.探险队<,>They organized an expedition to the South Pole.<,>他们组织了一次南极探险。<,>The scientific expedition made several important discoveries.<,>科学考察队做出了几项重要发现。<,>It took three months for the expedition to reach the summit.<,>探险队花了三个月才到达顶峰。<,>ex(出)+ped(脚)+ition→走出去→探险<,>journey(n.旅行)/mission(n.任务)/voyage(n.航行)

charcoal<,>/ˈtʃɑːkəʊl/<,>/ˈtʃɑːrkoʊl/<,>n.炭/n.木炭/n.生物炭<,>We used charcoal to grill the meat.<,>我们用木炭来烤肉。<,>The artist drew a beautiful sketch with charcoal.<,>艺术家用炭笔画了一幅漂亮的素描。<,>Charcoal filters are used to purify water.<,>活性炭过滤器用于净化水。<,>char(烧焦)+coal(煤)→木炭<,>carbon(n.碳)/ash(n.灰烬)/graphite(n.石墨)

plain<,>/pleɪn/<,>/pleɪn/<,>adj.坦白的/adj.普通的<,>She was wearing a plain white dress.<,>她穿着一件朴素的白色连衣裙。<,>Let me be plain with you - your work is not good enough.<,>坦白告诉你 - 你的工作不够好。<,>The food was plain but delicious.<,>食物很简单但很美味。<,>plain与plane(平面)同源→平坦的→简单的<,>simple(adj.简单的)/ordinary(adj.普通的)/frank(adj.坦率的)

negotiate<,>/nɪˈɡəʊʃieɪt/<,>/nɪˈɡoʊʃieɪt/<,>v.谈判/v.交涉/v.议定<,>The two countries are negotiating a peace treaty.<,>两国正在谈判和平条约。<,>She successfully negotiated a higher salary.<,>她成功谈成了更高的薪水。<,>It's difficult to negotiate this steep hill on a bicycle.<,>骑自行车很难爬上这座陡峭的山。<,>neg(否定)+oti(空闲)+ate→不空闲→忙于谈判<,>bargain(v.讨价还价)/mediate(v.调解)/discuss(v.讨论)

greed<,>/ɡriːd/<,>/ɡriːd/<,>n.贪心/n.贪婪<,>Greed is one of the seven deadly sins.<,>贪婪是七宗罪之一。<,>His greed for power destroyed his career.<,>他对权力的贪欲毁了他的事业。<,>The company's greed led to environmental damage.<,>公司的贪婪导致了环境破坏。<,>greed与grass(草)同源→像草一样疯长的欲望<,>avarice(n.贪财)/lust(n.欲望)/gluttony(n.暴食)
moss<,>/mɒs/<,>/mɔːs/<,>n.苔藓/n.地衣<,>The stones were covered with moss.<,>石头上长满了苔藓。<,>Moss grows best in damp, shady areas.<,>苔藓在潮湿阴暗的地方生长得最好。<,>The old tree trunk was soft with moss.<,>老树干上长满了柔软的苔藓。<,>联想：moist（潮湿的）+ moss→苔藓喜欢潮湿环境<,>lichen（n. 地衣）/mossy（adj. 长满苔藓的）

pedal<,>/ˈpedl/<,>/ˈpedl/<,>n.（自行车的）踏脚/n.踏板/n.脚蹬/n.（汽车或机器的）踏板<,>He pressed the pedal to accelerate the car.<,>他踩下踏板加速汽车。<,>My bike's pedal broke during the ride.<,>骑行时我的自行车踏板坏了。<,>She adjusted the piano pedals before playing.<,>她在演奏前调整了钢琴踏板。<,>ped（脚）+ al（名词后缀）→用脚操作的东西<,>peddle（v. 叫卖）/pedestal（n. 基座）

thereof<,>/ˌðeərˈɒv/<,>/ˌðerˈʌv/<,>adv.它的/adv.其/adv.由此<,>He explained the rules and the consequences thereof.<,>他解释了规则及其后果。<,>The contract and all matters arising thereof shall be governed by English law.<,>本合同及其引起的一切事项受英国法律管辖。<,>She spoke of her success and the pride thereof.<,>她谈到她的成功及由此产生的自豪。<,>there（那里）+ of（的）→属于那里的→由此<,>therein（adv. 在其中）/thereupon（adv. 于是）

trivial<,>/ˈtrɪviəl/<,>/ˈtrɪviəl/<,>adj.琐碎的/adj.平常的<,>Don't waste time on trivial matters.<,>不要把时间浪费在琐事上。<,>His speech was full of trivial details.<,>他的演讲充满了琐碎的细节。<,>It was just a trivial mistake.<,>这只是个小错误。<,>tri（三）+ via（路）→古罗马三岔路口→琐碎小事聚集处<,>trifle（n. 琐事）/trivia（n. 琐事）

detail<,>/ˈdiːteɪl/<,>/ˈdiːteɪl/<,>n.琐碎/n.小事<,>She explained every detail of the plan.<,>她解释了计划的每个细节。<,>The report contains too many unnecessary details.<,>报告包含太多不必要的细节。<,>He has an eye for detail.<,>他善于观察细节。<,>de（加强）+ tail（切割）→切得很细→细节<,>retail（v. 零售）/entail（v. 需要）

concern<,>/kənˈsɜːn/<,>/kənˈsɜːrn/<,>n.所关切的事/n.商行<,>Environmental protection is a major concern.<,>环境保护是大家主要关心的问题。<,>He works for a large business concern.<,>他在一家大商行工作。<,>This matter is of no concern to me.<,>这件事与我无关。<,>con（共同）+ cern（分离）→共同分离→关心<,>discern（v. 辨别）/concert（n. 音乐会）

what<,>/wɒt/<,>/wɑːt/<,>adj.所…的<,>I saw what books you bought.<,>我看到了你买的那些书。<,>Tell me what clothes you prefer.<,>告诉我你喜欢什么衣服。<,>What money he had was stolen.<,>他所有的钱都被偷了。<,>疑问代词what作形容词用法<,>that（adj. 那个的）/which（adj. 哪个的）

miniature<,>/ˈmɪnətʃə(r)/<,>/ˈmɪnətʃər/<,>n.缩影/adj.缩小的<,>She collects miniature models of cars.<,>她收集汽车缩微模型。<,>The park is a miniature version of the landscape.<,>这个公园是景观的缩影。<,>He painted a miniature portrait.<,>他画了一幅微型肖像。<,>mini（小）+ ature（名词后缀）→小东西<,>minimal（adj. 最小的）/minimum（n. 最小值）

hurt<,>/hɜːt/<,>/hɜːrt/<,>n.（对感情造成的）伤害/n.创伤<,>His words caused her deep hurt.<,>他的话深深伤害了她。<,>Time heals all hurts.<,>时间能治愈一切创伤。<,>She tried to hide her hurt feelings.<,>她试图掩饰受伤的感情。<,>hurt作名词表示情感伤害<,>harm（n. 伤害）/injure（v. 伤害）

deform<,>/dɪˈfɔːm/<,>/dɪˈfɔːrm/<,>v.损坏…的形状<,>The accident deformed the metal frame.<,>事故使金属框架变形了。<,>Heat can deform plastic materials.<,>高温会使塑料材料变形。<,>The disease deformed his hands.<,>这种疾病使他的手变形了。<,>de（否定）+ form（形状）→使形状改变<,>reform（v. 改革）/conform（v. 符合）
deformation<,>/ˌdiːfɔːˈmeɪʃən/<,>/ˌdifɔrˈmeɪʃən/<,>n.损坏/n.变形/n.畸形<,>The deformation of the metal was caused by extreme heat.<,>金属的变形是由极端高温引起的。<,>His spine showed signs of deformation.<,>他的脊柱显示出畸形的迹象。<,>The car's deformation indicated a serious accident.<,>汽车的损坏表明发生了严重事故。<,>de(否定)+form(形状)+ation(名词后缀)→形状改变→变形<,>reformation(n.改革)/information(n.信息)/formation(n.形成)

fringe<,>/frɪndʒ/<,>/frɪndʒ/<,>n.穗/n.毛边/n.边缘<,>She wore a shawl with colorful fringes.<,>她披着一条有彩色流苏的披肩。<,>They live on the fringe of the city.<,>他们住在城市边缘。<,>The idea was considered fringe science.<,>这个想法被认为是边缘科学。<,>联想"fringe benefits"(附加福利)→边缘的好处<,>hinge(n.铰链)/cringe(v.畏缩)/infringe(v.侵犯)

scrap<,>/skræp/<,>/skræp/<,>n.碎片/n.废料/v.废弃<,>He collected metal scraps for recycling.<,>他收集金属废料进行回收。<,>The project was scrapped due to budget cuts.<,>由于预算削减，该项目被废弃了。<,>She wrote her phone number on a scrap of paper.<,>她把电话号码写在一张小纸片上。<,>scrapbook(剪贴簿)→收集碎片的本子<,>scrape(v.刮擦)/scram(v.迅速离开)/scalp(n.头皮)

random<,>/ˈrændəm/<,>/ˈrændəm/<,>n.随机/adj.随机的<,>The computer generates random numbers.<,>计算机生成随机数。<,>We asked random people for directions.<,>我们随机向路人问路。<,>It was just a random coincidence.<,>这只是一个随机的巧合。<,>ran(跑)+dom(领域)→在领域里乱跑→随机<,>ransom(n.赎金)/radium(n.镭)/randomly(adv.随机地)

garlic<,>/ˈɡɑːlɪk/<,>/ˈɡɑːrlɪk/<,>n.蒜/n.大蒜<,>Garlic is essential in Italian cooking.<,>大蒜是意大利烹饪中必不可少的。<,>The smell of garlic lingered in the kitchen.<,>厨房里弥漫着大蒜的气味。<,>She added crushed garlic to the sauce.<,>她在酱汁里加入了捣碎的大蒜。<,>gar(矛)+lic(小)→像小矛头的蒜瓣<,>garlicky(adj.有大蒜味的)/garret(n.阁楼)/garnish(v.装饰)

plastic<,>/ˈplæstɪk/<,>/ˈplæstɪk/<,>adj.塑料的/adj.塑性的<,>Plastic bags are harmful to the environment.<,>塑料袋对环境有害。<,>The artist works with plastic materials.<,>这位艺术家使用塑料材料创作。<,>Clay is a plastic substance when wet.<,>黏土在湿润时具有可塑性。<,>plas(塑造)+tic(形容词后缀)→可塑造的<,>elastic(adj.有弹性的)/fantastic(adj.极好的)/placid(adj.平静的)

shorthand<,>/ˈʃɔːthænd/<,>/ˈʃɔːrthænd/<,>n.速记/n.速记法<,>Journalists often use shorthand to take notes quickly.<,>记者经常使用速记法快速做笔记。<,>She took the message in shorthand.<,>她用速记记下了这条消息。<,>Learning shorthand can improve your writing speed.<,>学习速记可以提高你的书写速度。<,>short(短)+hand(手)→缩短手写时间→速记<,>longhand(n.普通书写)/handshake(n.握手)/handstand(n.倒立)

scout<,>/skaʊt/<,>/skaʊt/<,>v.搜索/v.侦察<,>The team scouted for a new location.<,>团队在寻找新的地点。<,>He was scouting for talent at the competition.<,>他在比赛中寻找人才。<,>The military sent scouts ahead of the main force.<,>军队在主部队之前派出了侦察兵。<,>s(蛇)+cout(计算)→蛇在计算路线→侦察<,>scour(v.彻底搜索)/scoot(v.迅速移动)/shout(v.喊叫)

laundry<,>/ˈlɔːndri/<,>/ˈlɔːndri/<,>n.送洗衣店去洗的东西<,>She does the laundry every Sunday.<,>她每个星期天洗衣服。<,>The hotel offers laundry service.<,>酒店提供洗衣服务。<,>He forgot to pick up his laundry from the cleaners.<,>他忘了从洗衣店取回送洗的衣服。<,>laun(洗)+dry(干)→洗后弄干→洗衣<,>launder(v.洗熨)/laundress(n.洗衣女工)/launch(v.发射)

replace<,>/rɪˈpleɪs/<,>/rɪˈpleɪs/<,>v.把...放回原处<,>Please replace the books after reading.<,>阅读后请把书放回原处。<,>They replaced the old windows with new ones.<,>他们用新窗户替换了旧窗户。<,>Can you replace me at the meeting tomorrow?<,>明天你能代替我参加会议吗？<,>re(重新)+place(放置)→重新放回<,>displace(v.取代)/misplace(v.放错位置)/placement(n.安置)
loosely<,>/ˈluːsli/<,>/ˈlusli/<,>adv.松松地/adv.松散地<,>The rope was tied loosely around the post.<,>绳子松松地绑在柱子上。<,>She wore her hair loosely tied back.<,>她把头发松散地扎在后面。<,>The fabric hung loosely from her shoulders.<,>布料从她肩上松松地垂下来。<,>loose(松的)+ly(副词后缀)→松散地<,>tightly(adv.紧紧地)/closely(adv.紧密地)  

rear<,>/rɪə(r)/<,>/rɪr/<,>v.饲养/v.培植/v.抚养<,>He rears cattle on his farm.<,>他在农场养牛。<,>She carefully rears her children to be independent.<,>她精心抚养孩子，让他们独立。<,>They rear rare plants in the greenhouse.<,>他们在温室里培植稀有植物。<,>rear(后面)→在后面培育→抚养<,>raise(v.抚养/v.举起)/bear(v.生育/v.忍受)  

perish<,>/ˈperɪʃ/<,>/ˈpɛrɪʃ/<,>v.死亡/v.夭折/v.枯萎<,>Many soldiers perished in the battle.<,>许多士兵在战斗中阵亡。<,>The flowers perished in the frost.<,>花朵在霜冻中枯萎了。<,>Without water, the crops will perish.<,>没有水，庄稼会枯死。<,>per(完全)+ish(走)→完全走了→死亡<,>cherish(v.珍爱)/flourish(v.茂盛)  

hiss<,>/hɪs/<,>/hɪs/<,>n.嘶嘶声/v.嘶嘶作声<,>The snake let out a loud hiss.<,>蛇发出响亮的嘶嘶声。<,>The steam hissed from the kettle.<,>水壶里的蒸汽嘶嘶作响。<,>The audience hissed at the bad performance.<,>观众对糟糕的表演发出嘘声。<,>拟声词，模仿嘶嘶的声音<,>kiss(v.亲吻)/miss(v.错过)  

rip<,>/rɪp/<,>/rɪp/<,>v.撕/v.扯破/v.划破<,>She ripped the paper in half.<,>她把纸撕成两半。<,>His jeans were ripped at the knee.<,>他的牛仔裤膝盖处撕破了。<,>Be careful not to rip the page.<,>小心别把书页撕破。<,>rip(撕)→与“ripe(成熟的)”对比记忆<,>rip(v.撕)/ripe(adj.成熟的)  

speculate<,>/ˈspekjuleɪt/<,>/ˈspɛkjəˌleɪt/<,>v.猜测/v.推测/v.投机<,>They speculated about the cause of the accident.<,>他们猜测事故的原因。<,>He likes to speculate in the stock market.<,>他喜欢在股市投机。<,>Scientists can only speculate about life on other planets.<,>科学家只能推测其他星球上的生命。<,>spec(看)+ulate→用眼睛看→推测<,>calculate(v.计算)/circulate(v.循环)  

smuggle<,>/ˈsmʌɡl/<,>/ˈsmʌɡəl/<,>v.私运/v.走私<,>They tried to smuggle drugs across the border.<,>他们试图走私毒品过境。<,>He smuggled a letter out of prison.<,>他把一封信偷偷带出监狱。<,>Customs officers caught him smuggling cigarettes.<,>海关官员抓到他走私香烟。<,>smug(自以为是的)+gle→偷偷摸摸的行为→走私<,>struggle(v.奋斗)/snuggle(v.依偎)  

confidence<,>/ˈkɒnfɪdəns/<,>/ˈkɑːnfɪdəns/<,>n.私房话/n.秘密/n.机密<,>She told me her secrets in confidence.<,>她私下告诉我她的秘密。<,>He spoke with confidence about his plans.<,>他自信地谈论他的计划。<,>The documents are marked "Strictly Confidence."<,>文件上标着“绝密”。<,>con(完全)+fid(信任)+ence→完全信任→机密<,>confident(adj.自信的)/confidant(n.知己)  

velvet<,>/ˈvelvɪt/<,>/ˈvɛlvət/<,>adj.丝绒制的/adj.柔软光滑的<,>She wore a velvet dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件丝绒连衣裙去参加派对。<,>The cat's fur was as soft as velvet.<,>猫的毛像丝绒一样柔软。<,>He ran his fingers over the velvet cushion.<,>他的手指滑过丝绒靠垫。<,>vel(绒毛)+vet→丝绒<,>velvet(adj.丝绒制的)/velveteen(n.棉绒)  

treasurer<,>/ˈtreʒərə(r)/<,>/ˈtrɛʒərər/<,>n.司库/n.财务主管<,>He was elected treasurer of the club.<,>他被选为俱乐部的财务主管。<,>The treasurer manages the organization's funds.<,>财务主管管理组织的资金。<,>She keeps accurate records as the company treasurer.<,>作为公司财务主管，她保持着准确的记录。<,>treasure(财富)+er(人)→管理财富的人→财务主管<,>treasure(n.宝藏)/measure(v.测量)
exposition<,>/ˌekspəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌɛkspəˈzɪʃən/<,>n.说明/n.解释/n.展览会/n.博览会<,>The professor gave a clear exposition of the theory.<,>教授对这一理论进行了清晰的说明。<,>The World Exposition attracts millions of visitors every year.<,>世界博览会每年吸引数百万游客。<,>His exposition of the problem helped us understand it better.<,>他对这个问题的解释帮助我们更好地理解了它。<,>ex(出)+posit(放)+ion→把内容展示出来→说明/展览<,>exposure(n.暴露/n.曝光)/composition(n.作文/n.构成)

preach<,>/priːtʃ/<,>/pritʃ/<,>v.说教/v.布道/v.鼓吹<,>The priest preaches about kindness every Sunday.<,>牧师每个周日都宣讲仁慈。<,>She preached the importance of environmental protection.<,>她鼓吹环境保护的重要性。<,>He preaches what he practices.<,>他身体力行自己宣扬的道理。<,>pre(前)+ach(说)→在前面说→布道<,>breach(n.违反/v.破坏)/peach(n.桃子)

observe<,>/əbˈzɜːv/<,>/əbˈzɜrv/<,>v.说/v.评述/v.评论/v.观察<,>She observed that the plan was impractical.<,>她评论说这个计划不切实际。<,>The scientist observed the behavior of the animals carefully.<,>科学家仔细观察了动物的行为。<,>It's interesting to observe how children interact.<,>观察孩子们如何互动很有趣。<,>ob(加强)+serve(保持)→保持看→观察<,>reserve(v.保留/n.储备)/deserve(v.应得)

momentary<,>/ˈməʊməntri/<,>/ˈmoʊmənteri/<,>adj.瞬息间的/adj.片刻的<,>There was a momentary silence after his speech.<,>他演讲后出现了片刻的沉默。<,>She felt a momentary pang of guilt.<,>她感到一阵短暂的愧疚。<,>The power outage was only momentary.<,>停电只是瞬间的。<,>moment(瞬间)+ary(形容词后缀)→瞬间的<,>momentous(adj.重大的)/monetary(adj.货币的)

instantaneous<,>/ˌɪnstənˈteɪniəs/<,>/ˌɪnstənˈteɪniəs/<,>adj.瞬间的/adj.即刻的<,>The camera provides instantaneous photos.<,>这个相机可以即时成像。<,>Death was instantaneous in the accident.<,>事故中死亡是瞬间发生的。<,>The reaction was almost instantaneous.<,>反应几乎是即刻发生的。<,>instant(立即)+aneous(形容词后缀)→即刻的<,>simultaneous(adj.同时的)/spontaneous(adj.自发的)

couch<,>/kaʊtʃ/<,>/kaʊtʃ/<,>n.睡椅/n.长沙发椅<,>He was lying on the couch watching TV.<,>他躺在沙发上看电视。<,>The therapist asked her to sit on the couch.<,>治疗师让她坐在长沙发上。<,>We need to buy a new couch for the living room.<,>我们需要为客厅买一个新沙发。<,>发音类似"靠椅"→可以靠的椅子→长沙发<,>coach(n.教练/v.指导)/crouch(v.蹲下)

slumber<,>/ˈslʌmbə(r)/<,>/ˈslʌmbər/<,>n.睡眠/n.沉睡状态<,>The baby fell into a peaceful slumber.<,>婴儿进入了平静的睡眠。<,>The volcano had been in slumber for centuries.<,>这座火山已经沉睡了几百年。<,>He awoke from his slumber refreshed.<,>他从睡梦中醒来，精神焕发。<,>slum(贫民窟)+ber→在贫民窟里睡觉→睡眠<,>slump(v.暴跌/n.萧条)/plumber(n.水管工)

buffalo<,>/ˈbʌfələʊ/<,>/ˈbʌfəloʊ/<,>n.水牛/n.水陆坦克<,>We saw a herd of buffalo near the river.<,>我们在河边看到了一群水牛。<,>The buffalo is an important animal in some cultures.<,>水牛在某些文化中是重要的动物。<,>American buffalo once roamed the plains in large numbers.<,>美洲野牛曾经大量栖息在平原上。<,>buff(浅黄色)+alo→浅黄色的大型动物→水牛<,>buffet(n.自助餐/v.打击)/buff(n.爱好者)

hydraulic<,>/haɪˈdrɒlɪk/<,>/haɪˈdrɔːlɪk/<,>adj.水力的/adj.水力学的<,>The machine uses hydraulic power to operate.<,>这台机器使用水力来运作。<,>They installed a new hydraulic system in the building.<,>他们在大楼里安装了一个新的液压系统。<,>Hydraulic engineering is his specialty.<,>水利工程是他的专业。<,>hydra(水)+aulic(管道)→水力管道的→水力的<,>hydroelectric(adj.水力发电的)/aerodynamic(adj.空气动力学的)

watery<,>/ˈwɔːtəri/<,>/ˈwɔːtəri/<,>adj.充满水的/adj.与水有关的/adj.湿的/adj.味淡的<,>Her eyes were watery from the cold wind.<,>她的眼睛因为寒风而湿润。<,>The soup was too watery and lacked flavor.<,>这汤太淡了，没什么味道。<,>The watery surface of the lake reflected the moonlight.<,>湖水表面反射着月光。<,>water(水)+y(形容词后缀)→充满水的<,>wary(adj.谨慎的)/weary(adj.疲倦的)
rinse<,>/rɪns/<,>/rɪns/<,>v.冲洗/v.嗽（口）<,>Rinse the vegetables under cold water before cooking.<,>烹饪前用冷水冲洗蔬菜。<,>She rinsed her mouth with salt water after the tooth extraction.<,>拔牙后她用盐水漱口。<,>Don't forget to rinse the soap off your hands thoroughly.<,>别忘了把手上的肥皂彻底冲洗干净。<,>rin(雨)+se→像雨水一样冲洗<,>race(n.比赛/v.疾驰)/ring(n.戒指/v.打电话)  

wrestle<,>/ˈresl/<,>/ˈrɛsəl/<,>n.摔交/n.斗争/n.搏斗<,>He won a gold medal in freestyle wrestling at the Olympics.<,>他在奥运会上获得了自由式摔跤金牌。<,>The company is wrestling with financial difficulties this quarter.<,>公司本季度正在与财务困难作斗争。<,>They wrestled for control of the remote all evening.<,>他们整晚都在争夺遥控器的控制权。<,>wrest(扭)+le(动作)→扭打动作→摔跤<,>wrest(v.扭夺/n.扳手)/rustle(v.沙沙响/n.沙沙声)  

numerical<,>/njuːˈmerɪkl/<,>/nuˈmɛrɪkəl/<,>adj.数字的/adj.数值的<,>The test results were presented in numerical form.<,>测试结果以数字形式呈现。<,>She has a strong numerical ability that helps her in accounting.<,>她很强的数字能力对会计工作很有帮助。<,>This equation requires numerical analysis to solve.<,>这个方程需要数值分析来求解。<,>numer(数字)+ical(形容词后缀)→数字的<,>numerous(adj.许多的)/numeral(n.数字)  

reckon<,>/ˈrekən/<,>/ˈrɛkən/<,>v.计算/v.认为<,>I reckon we'll need about 20 chairs for the meeting.<,>我认为我们需要大约20把椅子来开会。<,>Farmers reckon their profits at the end of each season.<,>农民们在每个季节末计算他们的利润。<,>She's reckoned to be one of the best lawyers in town.<,>她被认为是镇上最好的律师之一。<,>reck(注意)+on→注意计算→计算<,>beckon(v.招手)/recognize(v.认出)  

harp<,>/hɑːp/<,>/hɑrp/<,>n.竖琴/n.天琴座<,>The angel in the painting is playing a golden harp.<,>画中的天使正在弹奏金色的竖琴。<,>Lyra is also known as the Harp constellation.<,>天琴座也被称为竖琴星座。<,>She has been practicing the harp since she was six years old.<,>她从六岁起就开始练习竖琴。<,>harp→竖琴的形状像字母"H"<,>hard(adj.坚硬的)/harpy(n.鸟身女妖)  

erect<,>/ɪˈrekt/<,>/ɪˈrɛkt/<,>adj.直立的<,>The soldiers stood erect during the entire ceremony.<,>士兵们在整个仪式期间都笔直地站着。<,>This plant has erect stems that grow up to two meters tall.<,>这种植物有直立的茎，能长到两米高。<,>The monument was erected in memory of the war heroes.<,>这座纪念碑是为纪念战争英雄而建立的。<,>e(出)+rect(直)→直立的<,>direct(adj.直接的)/correct(adj.正确的)  

terminology<,>/ˌtɜːmɪˈnɒlədʒi/<,>/ˌtɜrməˈnɑlədʒi/<,>n.术语学/n.术语<,>Medical terminology can be difficult for laypeople to understand.<,>医学术语对外行人来说可能很难理解。<,>He's writing a dictionary of computer terminology.<,>他正在编写一本计算机术语词典。<,>The course introduces the basic terminology of linguistics.<,>这门课程介绍了语言学的基本术语。<,>termin(界限)+ology(学科)→界定概念的学科→术语学<,>terminal(n.终端)/determine(v.决定)  

proficient<,>/prəˈfɪʃnt/<,>/prəˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.熟练的/adj.精通的<,>She is proficient in three foreign languages.<,>她精通三门外语。<,>After years of practice, he became proficient at playing the piano.<,>经过多年的练习，他熟练掌握了钢琴演奏。<,>The new employee is already proficient with the company's software.<,>新员工已经熟练掌握了公司的软件。<,>pro(向前)+fic(做)+ient→能做向前的→精通的<,>efficient(adj.高效的)/sufficient(adj.充足的)  

proficiency<,>/prəˈfɪʃnsi/<,>/prəˈfɪʃənsi/<,>n.熟练/n.精通<,>His proficiency in Spanish impressed the interviewers.<,>他对西班牙语的精通给面试官留下了深刻印象。<,>The job requires a high level of proficiency in Excel.<,>这份工作要求熟练掌握Excel。<,>She took a test to demonstrate her language proficiency.<,>她参加了一个考试来证明她的语言熟练程度。<,>pro(向前)+fic(做)+iency→能做向前的状态→精通<,>deficiency(n.缺乏)/efficiency(n.效率)  

input<,>/ˈɪnpʊt/<,>/ˈɪnˌpʊt/<,>v.输入/n.输入<,>Please input your password to log in.<,>请输入密码登录。<,>The computer processes the input data very quickly.<,>计算机非常快速地处理输入数据。<,>We welcome input from all team members on this project.<,>我们欢迎所有团队成员对这个项目提出意见。<,>in(进入)+put(放)→放进去→输入<,>output(n.输出)/impute(v.归咎于)
grant<,>/ɡrɑːnt/<,>/ɡrænt/<,>n.拨款<,>The government provided a grant for the research project.<,>政府为这个研究项目提供了拨款。<,>She received a grant to study abroad.<,>她获得了出国留学的拨款。<,>The university offers grants to students in need.<,>大学为有需要的学生提供拨款。<,>gr(看作give)+ant(蚂蚁)→给蚂蚁的拨款<,>grand(adj.宏伟的)/grain(n.谷物)/grantee(n.受让人)  

dependant<,>/dɪˈpendənt/<,>/dɪˈpendənt/<,>n.受赡养者<,>He listed his children as dependants on the tax form.<,>他在税表上将孩子列为受赡养者。<,>The insurance policy covers all dependants.<,>保险单涵盖所有受赡养者。<,>She is the sole dependant of her elderly parents.<,>她是年迈父母的唯一受赡养者。<,>depend(依赖)+ant(人)→依赖他人的人<,>dependent(adj.依赖的)/independant(adj.独立的)/pendant(n.垂饰)  

miser<,>/ˈmaɪzə(r)/<,>/ˈmaɪzər/<,>n.守财奴/n.吝啬鬼<,>The old miser refused to spend any money.<,>那个老守财奴拒绝花一分钱。<,>He was known as a miser who hoarded his wealth.<,>他以一个囤积财富的吝啬鬼而闻名。<,>Don't be such a miser, share your snacks!<,>别这么吝啬，分享你的零食！<,>mis(看作miss)+er(人)→错过给予的人→吝啬鬼<,>misery(n.痛苦)/miserly(adj.吝啬的)/mister(n.先生)  

trolley<,>/ˈtrɒli/<,>/ˈtrɑːli/<,>n.手推车/n.有轨电车<,>She pushed the trolley around the supermarket.<,>她推着手推车在超市里转。<,>We took the trolley to the city center.<,>我们乘坐有轨电车去市中心。<,>The airport trolley was very convenient for our luggage.<,>机场手推车对我们的行李非常方便。<,>troll(滚动)+ey→滚动的东西→手推车<,>troll(n.巨怪)/trawl(v.拖网捕鱼)/dolly(n.洋娃娃)  

manuscript<,>/ˈmænjuskrɪpt/<,>/ˈmænjəskrɪpt/<,>n.手稿/n.底稿/n.原稿<,>The author submitted the manuscript to the publisher.<,>作者将手稿提交给了出版商。<,>This ancient manuscript was discovered in a cave.<,>这份古老的手稿是在一个洞穴里发现的。<,>The museum displays Beethoven's original manuscripts.<,>博物馆展出了贝多芬的原稿。<,>manu(手)+script(写)→手写的东西→手稿<,>manual(adj.手工的)/script(n.脚本)/postscript(n.附言)  

handbook<,>/ˈhændbʊk/<,>/ˈhændbʊk/<,>n.手册/n.便览/n.指南<,>This handbook contains all the rules of the game.<,>这本手册包含了游戏的所有规则。<,>Every employee received a safety handbook.<,>每位员工都收到了一本安全手册。<,>Refer to the handbook if you have any questions.<,>如有任何问题，请参考手册。<,>hand(手)+book(书)→手边的书→手册<,>notebook(n.笔记本)/textbook(n.教科书)/cookbook(n.食谱)  

adoption<,>/əˈdɒpʃn/<,>/əˈdɑːpʃn/<,>n.收养/n.采纳/n.采取<,>The adoption process can take several months.<,>收养过程可能需要几个月。<,>The company's adoption of new technology improved efficiency.<,>公司对新技术的采用提高了效率。<,>They celebrated the adoption of their new child.<,>他们庆祝收养了新孩子。<,>ad(加强)+opt(选择)+ion→经过选择后采取<,>adaptation(n.适应)/option(n.选择)/adoptive(adj.收养的)  

revenue<,>/ˈrevənjuː/<,>/ˈrevənuː/<,>n.收入/n.收入数目<,>The company's revenue increased by 20% this year.<,>公司今年的收入增长了20%。<,>Tax revenue is used to fund public services.<,>税收用于资助公共服务。<,>Advertising is a major source of revenue for the website.<,>广告是该网站的主要收入来源。<,>re(回)+ven(来)+ue→回来的东西→收入<,>avenue(n.大街)/revenge(n.报复)/venue(n.场所)  

oath<,>/əʊθ/<,>/oʊθ/<,>n.誓言/n.誓约/n.宣誓<,>He took an oath to tell the truth in court.<,>他在法庭上宣誓说实话。<,>The president swore an oath to protect the constitution.<,>总统宣誓保护宪法。<,>Breaking a solemn oath has serious consequences.<,>违背庄严的誓言会有严重后果。<,>oa(看作oral)+th→口头说的话→誓言<,>loath(adj.不情愿的)/boath(n.船)/oats(n.燕麦)  

vow<,>/vaʊ/<,>/vaʊ/<,>n.誓言/n.誓约/n.许愿<,>They exchanged vows at their wedding.<,>他们在婚礼上交换了誓言。<,>She made a vow to never lie again.<,>她发誓再也不说谎了。<,>The monk took a vow of silence.<,>僧侣立誓保持沉默。<,>v(看作victory)+ow(看作own)→胜利属于自己→誓言<,>vowel(n.元音)/avow(v.公开宣称)/vogue(n.时尚)
pledge<,>/plɛdʒ/<,>/plɛdʒ/<,>n.誓言/v.使发誓<,>He made a pledge to support her through thick and thin.<,>他发誓无论顺境逆境都会支持她。<,>They pledged their allegiance to the flag.<,>他们向国旗宣誓效忠。<,>She pledged to donate a portion of her income to charity.<,>她承诺将收入的一部分捐给慈善机构。<,>pl(保证)+edge(边缘)→站在边缘保证→誓言<,>pledget(n.小拭子)/sledge(n.雪橇/v.乘雪橇)

indoor<,>/ˈɪndɔː(r)/<,>/ˈɪnˌdɔr/<,>adj.室内的/adj.室内进行的<,>Indoor plants need proper sunlight to thrive.<,>室内植物需要适当的阳光才能茁壮成长。<,>We prefer indoor activities during winter.<,>冬天我们更喜欢室内活动。<,>The concert was moved to an indoor venue due to rain.<,>由于下雨，音乐会被移到室内场地举行。<,>in(内)+door(门)→门内的→室内的<,>outdoor(adj.户外的)/indoors(adv.在室内)

wholesome<,>/ˈhəʊlsəm/<,>/ˈhoʊlsəm/<,>adj.对健康有益的<,>Fresh fruits and vegetables are wholesome foods.<,>新鲜水果和蔬菜是有益健康的食物。<,>She has a wholesome attitude towards life.<,>她对生活有着健康的态度。<,>The book provides wholesome entertainment for children.<,>这本书为儿童提供健康的娱乐。<,>whole(完整的)+some(形容词后缀)→完整的→健康的<,>handsome(adj.英俊的)/tiresome(adj.令人厌倦的)

moderately<,>/ˈmɒdərətli/<,>/ˈmɑːdərətli/<,>adv.适度地/adv.适中<,>He drinks moderately at social events.<,>他在社交场合饮酒适度。<,>The prices are moderately expensive.<,>价格适中偏贵。<,>She exercises moderately three times a week.<,>她每周适度锻炼三次。<,>moderate(适度的)+ly(副词后缀)→适度地<,>immoderately(adv.过度地)/moderator(n.调解人)

fitting<,>/ˈfɪtɪŋ/<,>/ˈfɪtɪŋ/<,>adj.适当的/n.配件<,>It's fitting that we celebrate this occasion together.<,>我们一起庆祝这个场合很合适。<,>The plumber installed new pipe fittings.<,>水管工安装了新的管道配件。<,>Her speech was fitting for the solemn ceremony.<,>她的演讲适合这个庄严的仪式。<,>fit(适合)+ing→适合的→适当的<,>fittingly(adv.适当地)/unfitting(adj.不适当的)

fitness<,>/ˈfɪtnəs/<,>/ˈfɪtnəs/<,>n.适当/n.恰当/n.健康<,>Physical fitness is important for overall health.<,>身体健康对整体健康很重要。<,>He questioned the fitness of the candidate for the job.<,>他质疑候选人是否适合这份工作。<,>The fitness of the solution was debated by the committee.<,>委员会讨论了该解决方案的适当性。<,>fit(适合)+ness(名词后缀)→适合的状态→健康<,>illness(n.疾病)/weakness(n.虚弱)

vision<,>/ˈvɪʒn/<,>/ˈvɪʒən/<,>n.视力/n.眼力/n.想象力<,>Her vision has deteriorated with age.<,>随着年龄增长，她的视力下降了。<,>The leader had a clear vision for the company's future.<,>这位领导人对公司的未来有清晰的愿景。<,>The artist's vision transformed ordinary objects into art.<,>艺术家的想象力将普通物品变成了艺术品。<,>vis(看)+ion→看的能力→视力<,>revision(n.修订)/television(n.电视)

attendant<,>/əˈtendənt/<,>/əˈtɛndənt/<,>n.侍者/n.侍从/n.护理人员<,>The flight attendant served drinks to passengers.<,>空乘人员为乘客提供饮料。<,>The king had many attendants at his court.<,>国王在宫廷中有许多侍从。<,>Hospital attendants care for patients' basic needs.<,>医院护理人员照顾病人的基本需求。<,>attend(出席)+ant(人)→出席的人→侍者<,>attendance(n.出席)/attention(n.注意)

occurrence<,>/əˈkʌrəns/<,>/əˈkɜːrəns/<,>n.发生的事<,>Earthquakes are rare occurrences in this region.<,>地震在这个地区很少发生。<,>The daily occurrence of traffic jams frustrates commuters.<,>每天发生的交通堵塞让通勤者感到沮丧。<,>Such strange occurrences are difficult to explain.<,>这种奇怪的事件很难解释。<,>occur(发生)+ence(名词后缀)→发生的事<,>recurrence(n.复发)/concurrence(n.同时发生)

snob<,>/snɒb/<,>/snɑːb/<,>n.势利小人<,>The wine snob turned up his nose at the affordable bottle.<,>那个葡萄酒势利眼对价格实惠的酒嗤之以鼻。<,>She's such a snob about fashion brands.<,>她对时尚品牌非常势利。<,>Academic snobs look down on popular literature.<,>学术势利眼看不起通俗文学。<,>s(死)+nob(贵族)→死要面子的贵族→势利小人<,>knob(n.把手)/snub(v.冷落)
snobbish<,>/ˈsnɒbɪʃ/<,>/ˈsnɑːbɪʃ/<,>adj.势利的/adj.谄上欺下的<,>She gave a snobbish glance at his old-fashioned clothes.<,>她势利地瞥了一眼他那过时的衣服。<,>His snobbish attitude made him unpopular among his peers.<,>他那谄上欺下的态度使他在同龄人中不受欢迎。<,>The snobbish remarks about the restaurant were uncalled for.<,>对那家餐厅的势利评论是不必要的。<,>snob(势利的人)+ish(形容词后缀)→势利的<,>slobbish(adj.邋遢的)/knobbly(adj.多节的)

influence<,>/ˈɪnfluəns/<,>/ˈɪnfluəns/<,>n.势力/n.权势<,>Her father has a lot of influence in the business world.<,>她父亲在商界很有权势。<,>The media has a strong influence on public opinion.<,>媒体对舆论有很强的影响力。<,>He used his influence to get his friend a job.<,>他利用自己的权势为朋友谋得一份工作。<,>in(进入)+flu(流动)+ence(名词后缀)→流入→影响→权势<,>affluence(n.富裕)/confluence(n.汇合)

municipal<,>/mjuːˈnɪsɪpl/<,>/mjuːˈnɪsəpl/<,>adj.市的/adj.市立的<,>The municipal government is responsible for local services.<,>市政府负责当地的服务。<,>She works at the municipal library.<,>她在市立图书馆工作。<,>Municipal taxes have increased this year.<,>今年市税增加了。<,>muni(公共的)+cip(拿)+al(形容词后缀)→管理公共事务的→市立的<,>metropolitan(adj.大都市的)/municipality(n.自治市)

conform<,>/kənˈfɔːm/<,>/kənˈfɔːrm/<,>v.使遵守/v.一致<,>All members must conform to the rules.<,>所有成员都必须遵守规则。<,>His behavior does not conform to social norms.<,>他的行为不符合社会规范。<,>The product conforms to international standards.<,>该产品符合国际标准。<,>con(共同)+form(形状)→使形状相同→一致<,>confirm(v.确认)/deform(v.使变形)

automate<,>/ˈɔːtəmeɪt/<,>/ˈɔːtəmeɪt/<,>v.使自动化<,>The factory has automated most of its production processes.<,>这家工厂已经自动化了大部分生产流程。<,>We need to automate the billing system to save time.<,>我们需要自动化计费系统以节省时间。<,>Automating the assembly line increased efficiency.<,>自动化装配线提高了效率。<,>auto(自动)+mate(动词后缀)→使自动化<,>animate(v.使有生气)/estimate(v.估计)

divert<,>/daɪˈvɜːt/<,>/daɪˈvɜːrt/<,>v.使转向/v.转移<,>The river was diverted to prevent flooding.<,>河流被改道以防止洪水。<,>He tried to divert attention from the real issue.<,>他试图转移人们对真正问题的注意力。<,>The traffic was diverted due to road construction.<,>由于道路施工，交通被改道。<,>di(分开)+vert(转)→转向<,>convert(v.转变)/revert(v.恢复)

specialize<,>/ˈspeʃəlaɪz/<,>/ˈspeʃəlaɪz/<,>v.使专门化/v.专业化<,>This restaurant specializes in Italian cuisine.<,>这家餐厅专营意大利菜。<,>He decided to specialize in pediatric medicine.<,>他决定专攻儿科医学。<,>The company specializes in eco-friendly products.<,>该公司专营环保产品。<,>special(专门的)+ize(动词后缀)→使专门化<,>specify(v.详细说明)/speculate(v.推测)

hazard<,>/ˈhæzəd/<,>/ˈhæzərd/<,>v.使遭危险/n.危险<,>Smoking hazards your health.<,>吸烟危害你的健康。<,>Working at heights is a serious hazard.<,>高空作业是一个严重的危险。<,>The chemicals pose a hazard to the environment.<,>这些化学品对环境构成危险。<,>haz(机会)+ard(名词后缀)→冒险→危险<,>haphazard(adj.随意的)/hazardous(adj.危险的)

standardize<,>/ˈstændədaɪz/<,>/ˈstændərdaɪz/<,>v.使与标准比较<,>The industry needs to standardize its measurements.<,>该行业需要标准化其测量方法。<,>We standardized the testing procedures for consistency.<,>我们标准化了测试程序以确保一致性。<,>Standardizing the parts reduced production costs.<,>标准化零件降低了生产成本。<,>standard(标准)+ize(动词后缀)→使标准化<,>standardization(n.标准化)/stand(站立)

lengthen<,>/ˈleŋθən/<,>/ˈleŋθən/<,>v.使延长/v.变长<,>The days lengthen in the summer.<,>夏季白天变长。<,>She lengthened her skirt by adding a hem.<,>她加了一条边使裙子变长。<,>The meeting was lengthened by an hour.<,>会议延长了一小时。<,>length(长度)+en(动词后缀)→使变长<,>strengthen(v.加强)/lengthy(adj.冗长的)
shame<,>/ʃeɪm/<,>/ʃeɪm/<,>v.使羞愧/v.玷辱<,>His actions shamed his family.<,>他的行为让他的家人蒙羞。<,>She felt a deep sense of shame after the incident.<,>事件发生后，她感到深深的羞愧。<,>They tried to shame him into apologizing.<,>他们试图让他羞愧而道歉。<,>sha(谐音:傻)+me(我)→我傻→羞愧<,>blame(v.责备/n.责任)/fame(n.名声/v.使有名)

freshen<,>/ˈfreʃn/<,>/ˈfreʃən/<,>v.使显得新鲜<,>She opened the window to freshen the room.<,>她打开窗户让房间显得新鲜。<,>A quick shower will freshen you up.<,>快速冲个澡会让你精神焕发。<,>The rain freshened the air after the heatwave.<,>热浪过后，雨水让空气变得清新。<,>fresh(新鲜的)+en(使动)→使新鲜<,>refresh(v.使恢复精神)/fresco(n.壁画)

distinguish<,>/dɪˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>v.使显出特色/v.使杰出<,>His talent distinguishes him from his peers.<,>他的才华使他在同龄人中脱颖而出。<,>Can you distinguish between these two colors?<,>你能区分这两种颜色吗？<,>She distinguished herself in the field of science.<,>她在科学领域表现杰出。<,>dis(分开)+sting(刺)+uish→用刺分开→区分<,>extinguish(v.熄灭)/anguish(n.痛苦)

evaporate<,>/ɪˈvæpəreɪt/<,>/ɪˈvæpəˌreɪt/<,>v.使脱水/v.发散蒸气<,>The sun will evaporate the water on the road.<,>太阳会使路上的水蒸发。<,>Her hopes evaporated when she heard the news.<,>听到这个消息后，她的希望破灭了。<,>Heat causes the liquid to evaporate quickly.<,>热量使液体迅速蒸发。<,>e(出)+vapor(蒸汽)+ate(使)→使变成蒸汽<,>vapor(n.蒸汽)/operate(v.操作)

ventilate<,>/ˈventɪleɪt/<,>/ˈvɛntəˌleɪt/<,>v.使通风/v.使换气<,>We need to ventilate the room to remove the smell.<,>我们需要给房间通风以去除气味。<,>The doctor said the patient needs well-ventilated air.<,>医生说病人需要通风良好的空气。<,>The building has a system to ventilate all offices.<,>这栋楼有一个为所有办公室通风的系统。<,>vent(通风口)+ilate(使)→使通风<,>vent(n.通风口)/validate(v.验证)

moor<,>/mɔː(r)/<,>/mʊr/<,>v.使停泊/v.使固定<,>The ship was moored at the dock overnight.<,>船在码头停泊了一夜。<,>They moored the boat to a tree on the shore.<,>他们把船系在岸边的一棵树上。<,>The spacecraft was moored to the space station.<,>宇宙飞船停泊在空间站上。<,>moor(谐音:木)→木头可以固定船<,>mood(n.心情)/moon(n.月亮)

resign<,>/rɪˈzaɪn/<,>/rɪˈzaɪn/<,>v.使顺从/v.使听任于<,>He resigned himself to his fate.<,>他听天由命了。<,>She resigned from her position last week.<,>她上周辞去了职务。<,>We must resign ourselves to the fact that we can't change it.<,>我们必须接受我们无法改变这个事实。<,>re(再)+sign(签字)→再次签字→辞职<,>design(v.设计/n.图案)/resin(n.树脂)

perfect<,>/pəˈfekt/<,>/pərˈfɛkt/<,>v.使熟练/v.使改善<,>She practiced daily to perfect her skills.<,>她每天练习以使自己的技能更熟练。<,>The chef perfected the recipe over many years.<,>厨师多年来不断完善这个食谱。<,>He worked hard to perfect his English pronunciation.<,>他努力提高英语发音水平。<,>per(完全)+fect(做)→完全做好→完善<,>prefect(n.长官)/affect(v.影响)

infect<,>/ɪnˈfekt/<,>/ɪnˈfɛkt/<,>v.使受影响<,>His enthusiasm infected everyone around him.<,>他的热情感染了周围的每个人。<,>The virus can infect both humans and animals.<,>这种病毒可以感染人类和动物。<,>Her positive attitude infected the whole team.<,>她积极的态度影响了整个团队。<,>in(进入)+fect(做)→进入体内做→感染<,>affect(v.影响)/effect(n.效果)

lubricate<,>/ˈluːbrɪkeɪt/<,>/ˈlubrɪˌkeɪt/<,>v.使润滑/v.加润滑油<,>You need to lubricate the gears regularly.<,>你需要定期给齿轮加润滑油。<,>The mechanic lubricated all the moving parts.<,>机械师给所有活动部件加了润滑油。<,>This oil will help lubricate the engine.<,>这种油有助于润滑发动机。<,>lubric(光滑)+ate(使)→使光滑<,>lubricant(n.润滑剂)/lucrative(adj.有利可图的)
soften<,>/ˈsɒf(ə)n/<,>/ˈsɔːf(ə)n/<,>v.使软化/v.变温和<,>She tried to soften the blow by giving him some good news first.<,>她试图先告诉他一些好消息来缓和打击。<,>The butter will soften if you leave it out of the fridge.<,>如果把黄油从冰箱里拿出来，它会变软。<,>His voice softened when he spoke to the child.<,>当他跟孩子说话时，声音变得温和了。<,>soft(软)+en(使)→使软化<,>harden(v. 使变硬)/loosen(v. 放松)/tighten(v. 使变紧)

facilitate<,>/fəˈsɪlɪteɪt/<,>/fəˈsɪləˌteɪt/<,>v.使容易/v.助长<,>The new software will facilitate the data analysis process.<,>新软件将使数据分析过程更加容易。<,>Good infrastructure facilitates economic growth.<,>良好的基础设施有助于经济增长。<,>The teacher used visual aids to facilitate learning.<,>老师使用视觉教具来促进学习。<,>facil(容易)+itate(使)→使容易<,>felicitate(v. 祝贺)/fabricate(v. 制造)/fascinate(v. 使着迷)

acquaint<,>/əˈkweɪnt/<,>/əˈkweɪnt/<,>v.使认识/v.使了解<,>Let me acquaint you with the new procedures.<,>让我向你介绍新的程序。<,>She acquainted herself with the local customs before traveling.<,>她在旅行前熟悉了当地的风俗。<,>We became acquainted at the conference last year.<,>我们在去年的会议上相识。<,>ac(强调)+quaint(知道)→使知道→使认识<,>acquire(v. 获得)/acquit(v. 宣告无罪)/quaint(adj. 古雅的)

tiresome<,>/ˈtaɪəs(ə)m/<,>/ˈtaɪərsəm/<,>adj.使人厌倦的/adj.讨厌的<,>The long meeting was tiresome for everyone.<,>漫长的会议让每个人都感到厌倦。<,>He found her constant complaints tiresome.<,>他觉得她不断的抱怨很烦人。<,>The repetitive task became tiresome after a while.<,>重复的任务过一会儿就变得令人厌倦了。<,>tire(疲倦)+some(产生…的)→产生疲倦的→使人厌倦的<,>tireless(adj. 不知疲倦的)/tedious(adj. 单调乏味的)/wearisome(adj. 令人疲倦的)

sorrowful<,>/ˈsɒrəʊf(ə)l/<,>/ˈsɑːroʊfəl/<,>adj.使人伤心的/adj.悲伤的<,>The sorrowful news brought tears to her eyes.<,>这个令人伤心的消息让她流下了眼泪。<,>He had a sorrowful expression on his face.<,>他脸上带着悲伤的表情。<,>The song had a sorrowful melody that touched everyone.<,>这首歌有触动每个人的悲伤旋律。<,>sorrow(悲伤)+ful(充满…的)→充满悲伤的→使人伤心的<,>joyful(adj. 快乐的)/dolorous(adj. 忧伤的)/mournful(adj. 悲哀的)

blaze<,>/bleɪz/<,>/bleɪz/<,>v.使燃烧/v.燃烧<,>The fire blazed through the forest.<,>大火在森林中熊熊燃烧。<,>Her eyes blazed with anger.<,>她的眼中燃烧着怒火。<,>They blazed a trail through the wilderness.<,>他们在荒野中开辟了一条道路。<,>bl(光亮)+aze→燃烧发光→燃烧<,>blare(v. 高声鸣叫)/blame(v. 责备)/blazon(v. 宣扬)

subdue<,>/səbˈdjuː/<,>/səbˈduː/<,>v.使屈服/v.征服<,>The army managed to subdue the rebellion.<,>军队设法镇压了叛乱。<,>She tried to subdue her laughter during the serious meeting.<,>在严肃的会议上，她试图忍住笑声。<,>The medication helped to subdue the pain.<,>药物有助于减轻疼痛。<,>sub(下)+due(引导)→向下引导→使屈服<,>subside(v. 平息)/sublet(v. 转租)/submerge(v. 淹没)

bend<,>/bend/<,>/bend/<,>v.使屈从/v.屈从<,>He refused to bend to their demands.<,>他拒绝屈从于他们的要求。<,>The tree branches bent under the weight of the snow.<,>树枝在雪的重量下弯曲了。<,>She bent down to pick up the coin.<,>她弯下腰捡起硬币。<,>b(弯曲)+end(末端)→使末端弯曲→使屈从<,>blend(v. 混合)/bond(n. 纽带)/bent(adj. 弯曲的)

suit<,>/suːt/<,>/suːt/<,>v.使配合/v.彼此协调<,>The color of the curtains suits the room perfectly.<,>窗帘的颜色与房间非常协调。<,>This job suits her skills and interests.<,>这份工作适合她的技能和兴趣。<,>The schedule doesn't suit my plans.<,>这个时间表不符合我的计划。<,>s(适合)+uit(走)→走向适合→使配合<,>suite(n. 套房)/pursuit(n. 追求)/fruit(n. 水果)

confront<,>/kənˈfrʌnt/<,>/kənˈfrʌnt/<,>v.使面对/v.使对证<,>She had to confront her fears to move forward.<,>她必须面对恐惧才能前进。<,>The suspect was confronted with the evidence.<,>嫌疑人被出示了证据。<,>We need to confront this problem directly.<,>我们需要直接面对这个问题。<,>con(共同)+front(前面)→共同在前面→使面对<,>comfort(v. 安慰)/confuse(v. 使困惑)/confound(v. 使混淆)
paralyse<,>/ˈpærəlaɪz/<,>/ˈpærəˌlaɪz/<,>v.使麻痹/v.使瘫痪<,>The venom can paralyse small animals.<,>这种毒液能使小动物麻痹。<,>He was paralysed from the waist down after the accident.<,>事故后他从腰部以下瘫痪了。<,>Fear paralysed her and she couldn't move.<,>恐惧使她动弹不得。<,>para(旁边)+lyse(松开)→身体一侧松软→瘫痪<,>analyse(v.分析)/paralysis(n.瘫痪状态)  

deafen<,>/ˈdefn/<,>/ˈdɛfən/<,>v.使聋<,>The explosion was loud enough to deafen anyone nearby.<,>爆炸声大得足以震聋附近的人。<,>Years of loud music have deafened him slightly.<,>多年听大声音乐使他听力有些下降。<,>Please turn it down - you'll deafen us all!<,>请调低音量-你会把我们耳朵震聋的！<,>deaf(聋的)+en(使动)→使聋<,>deafen(v.使聋)/deaf(adj.聋的)/death(n.死亡)  

subject<,>/səbˈdʒekt/<,>/səbˈdʒɛkt/<,>v.使隶属<,>Ancient Rome subjected many lands to its rule.<,>古罗马使许多土地臣服于它的统治。<,>She was subjected to cruel treatment.<,>她遭受了残酷对待。<,>The area was subjected to heavy bombing.<,>该地区遭受了猛烈轰炸。<,>sub(下)+ject(投掷)→投掷到下方→使隶属<,>object(n.物体/v.反对)/project(n.项目/v.投射)  

terrify<,>/ˈterɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈtɛrəˌfaɪ/<,>v.使恐怖/v.使惊吓<,>Horror movies terrify me.<,>恐怖片吓坏我了。<,>The thought of failing terrifies him.<,>想到失败他就害怕。<,>She was terrified by the sudden noise.<,>突如其来的声响吓坏了她。<,>terr(恐怖)+ify(使动)→使恐怖<,>terrible(adj.可怕的)/terror(n.恐怖)  

insulate<,>/ˈɪnsjuleɪt/<,>/ˈɪnsəˌleɪt/<,>v.使绝缘/v.使绝热<,>The walls are insulated to keep the heat in.<,>墙壁做了隔热处理以保持热量。<,>Rubber is used to insulate electrical wires.<,>橡胶用来使电线绝缘。<,>We need to insulate the pipes to prevent freezing.<,>我们需要给管道保温防止冻结。<,>insula(岛)+ate(使)→使像孤岛一样隔离→绝缘<,>isolate(v.隔离)/insulin(n.胰岛素)  

integrate<,>/ˈɪntɪɡreɪt/<,>/ˈɪntəˌɡreɪt/<,>v.使结合/v.使并入<,>The school integrates children with special needs.<,>这所学校接收有特殊需求的儿童。<,>We need to integrate these ideas into our plan.<,>我们需要把这些想法融入我们的计划。<,>The new immigrants are gradually integrating into society.<,>新移民正逐渐融入社会。<,>integer(完整)+ate(使)→使完整→结合<,>disintegrate(v.瓦解)/integer(n.整数)  

alternate<,>/ˈɔːltəneɪt/<,>/ˈɔltərˌneɪt/<,>v.使交替/adj.交替的<,>We alternate between French and Spanish classes.<,>我们轮流上法语和西班牙语课。<,>The stripes alternate between black and white.<,>条纹黑白相间。<,>She works on alternate weekends.<,>她隔周周末工作。<,>alter(改变)+nate→交替改变<,>alternative(n.选择/adj.替代的)/alter(v.改变)  

degrade<,>/dɪˈɡreɪd/<,>/dɪˈɡreɪd/<,>v.使降低/v.使堕落<,>Plastic bags degrade very slowly in nature.<,>塑料袋在自然界降解很慢。<,>His behavior degraded the whole team.<,>他的行为降低了整个团队的素质。<,>Don't degrade yourself by lying.<,>不要用说谎贬低自己。<,>de(向下)+grade(等级)→使等级下降→降低<,>upgrade(v.升级)/gradual(adj.逐渐的)  

minimize<,>/ˈmɪnɪmaɪz/<,>/ˈmɪnəˌmaɪz/<,>v.使减到最小<,>We must minimize the risk of infection.<,>我们必须把感染风险降到最低。<,>The software minimizes energy consumption.<,>这个软件能最小化能耗。<,>She minimized her involvement in the scandal.<,>她极力淡化自己与丑闻的关联。<,>mini(小)+mize(使)→使最小化<,>maximize(v.最大化)/minimum(n.最小值)  

mingle<,>/ˈmɪŋɡl/<,>/ˈmɪŋɡəl/<,>vt.使混合/vt.混合起来<,>Guests mingled in the reception area.<,>宾客们在接待区交际。<,>Oil doesn't mingle with water.<,>油和水不相溶。<,>Her tears mingled with the rain on her face.<,>她脸上的泪水和雨水混在一起。<,>ming(混乱)+le→混合<,>single(adj.单一的)/jingle(v.叮当响)
interconnect<,>/ˌɪntəkəˈnekt/<,>/ˌɪntərkəˈnɛkt/<,>v.使互相联系<,>The internet interconnects computers all over the world.<,>互联网将全世界的电脑互相连接起来。<,>The two systems are designed to interconnect seamlessly.<,>这两个系统被设计成无缝互联。<,>We need to interconnect these ideas to form a coherent argument.<,>我们需要把这些想法联系起来，形成一个连贯的论点。<,>inter(相互)+connect(连接)→相互连接<,>interact(v.相互作用)/interlink(v.连结)  

reconcile<,>/ˈrekənsaɪl/<,>/ˈrɛkənˌsaɪl/<,>v.使和好/v.调停<,>They finally reconciled after years of feuding.<,>经过多年的争吵，他们终于和好了。<,>It's hard to reconcile his actions with his words.<,>很难将他的言行统一起来。<,>The mediator helped reconcile the two parties.<,>调解人帮助双方达成和解。<,>re(再)+con(一起)+cile(召集)→再次召集到一起→和解<,>conciliate(v.安抚)/rectify(v.纠正)  

oblige<,>/əˈblaɪdʒ/<,>/əˈblaɪdʒ/<,>v.使感激/v.施恩惠于<,>I'm much obliged for your help.<,>我非常感激你的帮助。<,>The law obliges companies to pay taxes.<,>法律要求公司纳税。<,>She obliged me with a loan.<,>她慷慨地借给我一笔钱。<,>ob(朝向)+lig(绑)→绑住别人→施恩<,>obligate(v.使负有义务)/oblivious(adj.健忘的)  

enrich<,>/ɪnˈrɪtʃ/<,>/ɛnˈrɪtʃ/<,>v.使富裕/v.使丰富<,>Reading enriches the mind.<,>阅读丰富心灵。<,>The discovery of oil enriched the country.<,>石油的发现使这个国家富裕起来。<,>We should enrich our lives with meaningful activities.<,>我们应该用有意义的活动来丰富生活。<,>en(使)+rich(富裕)→使富裕<,>impoverish(v.使贫穷)/enhance(v.提高)  

embarrass<,>/ɪmˈbærəs/<,>/ɛmˈbærəs/<,>v.使...陷入困境<,>The question embarrassed him so much that he blushed.<,>这个问题让他非常尴尬，脸都红了。<,>Lack of funds embarrassed the project.<,>资金短缺使项目陷入困境。<,>She was embarrassed by her mistake.<,>她为自己的错误感到难堪。<,>em(进入)+barr(障碍)→进入障碍→使困窘<,>embargo(n.禁运)/embrace(v.拥抱)  

decay<,>/dɪˈkeɪ/<,>/dɪˈkeɪ/<,>v.使腐朽/v.使腐烂<,>The fallen leaves began to decay.<,>落叶开始腐烂。<,>Sugar can decay your teeth.<,>糖会腐蚀你的牙齿。<,>The old building is in a state of decay.<,>这栋老建筑处于腐朽状态。<,>de(向下)+cay(落)→向下落→腐烂<,>decompose(v.分解)/delay(v.推迟)  

contrast<,>/ˈkɒntrɑːst/<,>/ˈkɑːntræst/<,>v.使对比/v.形成对比<,>Her black dress contrasted sharply with the white background.<,>她的黑色连衣裙与白色背景形成鲜明对比。<,>Contrast these two paintings carefully.<,>仔细对比这两幅画。<,>His actions contrast with his words.<,>他的言行不一。<,>contra(相反)+st(站)→相反地站着→对比<,>contract(n.合同)/contest(v.竞赛)  

baffle<,>/ˈbæfl/<,>/ˈbæfəl/<,>v.使挫折/n.迷惑<,>The mystery baffled the detectives.<,>这个谜团难倒了侦探们。<,>He was baffled by the complex instructions.<,>他被复杂的说明弄糊涂了。<,>The noise baffle reduced the engine sound.<,>消音器降低了发动机的声音。<,>baff(打击)+le(小)→小打击→使困惑<,>buffalo(n.水牛)/battle(n.战斗)  

mature<,>/məˈtʃʊə(r)/<,>/məˈtʊr/<,>v.使成熟/adj.成熟的<,>Wine matures with age.<,>酒越陈越香。<,>She has matured into a fine young woman.<,>她已经成长为一位优秀的年轻女性。<,>This is a mature decision.<,>这是个成熟的决定。<,>mat(母亲)+ure(状态)→像母亲一样→成熟<,>immature(adj.不成熟的)/nature(n.自然)  

ice<,>/aɪs/<,>/aɪs/<,>v.使成冰/n.冰<,>The pond iced over last night.<,>昨晚池塘结冰了。<,>She iced the cake with chocolate frosting.<,>她用巧克力糖霜给蛋糕上了冰。<,>The roads are dangerous when they ice up.<,>道路结冰时很危险。<,>ice本身就是基础词汇<,>slice(n.薄片)/dice(n.骰子)
overload<,>/ˌəʊvəˈləʊd/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈloʊd/<,>v.使超载<,>Don't overload the washing machine with clothes.<,>别让洗衣机超负荷运转。<,>Too much work can overload your mind.<,>过多的工作会让你的大脑超负荷。<,>The truck was overloaded with heavy cargo.<,>卡车因装载过重而超载。<,>over(超过)+load(负载)→超过负载→使超载<,>overlook(v.忽视)/overcome(v.克服)/overlap(v.重叠)

tangle<,>/ˈtæŋɡl/<,>/ˈtæŋɡəl/<,>v.使缠结/使纠缠<,>Her hair got tangled in the brush.<,>她的头发被梳子缠住了。<,>The wires were all tangled together.<,>电线全都缠在一起了。<,>They were tangled in a complicated relationship.<,>他们陷入了一段复杂的关系中。<,>tan(音似"缠")+gle→缠结<,>jangle(v.发出刺耳声)/mangle(v.乱砍)/dangle(v.悬挂)

sweeten<,>/ˈswiːtn/<,>/ˈswiːtn/<,>v.使变甜/变甜<,>She sweetened her tea with honey.<,>她在茶里加了蜂蜜让它变甜。<,>The deal was sweetened with extra benefits.<,>这笔交易因额外福利而更具吸引力。<,>Fruits sweeten as they ripen.<,>水果成熟时会变甜。<,>sweet(甜)+en(使)→使变甜<,>sweetness(n.甜味)/sweetheart(n.爱人)/sweeten up(讨好)

thicken<,>/ˈθɪkən/<,>/ˈθɪkən/<,>v.使变厚/使变粗/使变密<,>Add flour to thicken the sauce.<,>加入面粉让酱汁变稠。<,>The fog began to thicken as night fell.<,>夜幕降临时雾变得更浓了。<,>His accent thickened when he got angry.<,>他生气时口音变得更重了。<,>thick(厚)+en(使)→使变厚<,>thickness(n.厚度)/thickly(adv.厚地)/thick-skinned(adj.厚脸皮的)

establish<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃ/<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃ/<,>v.使...被接受<,>He worked hard to establish his reputation.<,>他努力建立自己的声誉。<,>The theory was established after years of research.<,>经过多年研究，这个理论被确立了。<,>They established a new rule for the competition.<,>他们为比赛制定了一条新规则。<,>e(出)+stabl(稳定)+ish(使)→使稳定→确立<,>establishment(n.建立)/established(adj.已确立的)/reestablish(v.重建)

develop<,>/dɪˈveləp/<,>/dɪˈveləp/<,>v.使(底片)显影<,>He developed the film in a darkroom.<,>他在暗房里冲洗了胶卷。<,>It takes skill to develop photos properly.<,>正确冲洗照片需要技巧。<,>The photo lab can develop your pictures in an hour.<,>照相馆可以在一小时内冲洗你的照片。<,>de(完全)+velop(包裹)→完全展开→显影<,>developer(n.开发者)/development(n.发展)/underdeveloped(adj.欠发达的)

jog<,>/dʒɒɡ/<,>/dʒɑːɡ/<,>v.慢跑(尤作为锻炼)<,>She jogs every morning to stay fit.<,>她每天早上慢跑以保持健康。<,>He jogged around the park for an hour.<,>他在公园里慢跑了一个小时。<,>Jogging is good for your heart.<,>慢跑对心脏有好处。<,>jog(音似"脚")→用脚跑→慢跑<,>jogger(n.慢跑者)/joggle(v.轻摇)/jogging(n.慢跑运动)

engage<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ/<,>v.使(齿轮等)啮合<,>Make sure the gears are properly engaged.<,>确保齿轮正确啮合。<,>The clutch engages when you release the pedal.<,>松开踏板时离合器会啮合。<,>These two parts should engage smoothly.<,>这两个部件应该能平稳啮合。<,>en(使)+gage(保证)→使保证→啮合<,>engagement(n.啮合)/disengage(v.脱离)/engaging(adj.迷人的)

vector<,>/ˈvektə(r)/<,>/ˈvektər/<,>n.矢量/飞机航线<,>The plane followed its designated vector.<,>飞机沿着指定的航线飞行。<,>Force is a vector quantity in physics.<,>力是物理学中的矢量量。<,>The wind vector affected the flight path.<,>风向矢量影响了飞行路线。<,>vect(携带)+or→携带方向的量→矢量<,>sector(n.部门)/director(n.导演)/victor(n.胜利者)

nourishment<,>/ˈnʌrɪʃmənt/<,>/ˈnɜːrɪʃmənt/<,>n.食物/营养(情况)<,>Plants get nourishment from the soil.<,>植物从土壤中获取营养。<,>Babies need proper nourishment to grow.<,>婴儿需要适当的营养才能成长。<,>The soup provides essential nourishment.<,>这汤提供了必需的营养。<,>nourish(滋养)+ment→滋养物→营养<,>nourishing(adj.滋养的)/malnourishment(n.营养不良)/nourisher(n.滋养品)
pantry<,>/ˈpæntri/<,>/ˈpæntri/<,>n.食品柜/n.餐具室<,>She stored the canned goods in the pantry.<,>她把罐头食品存放在食品柜里。<,>The dishes are kept in the pantry.<,>餐具放在餐具室里。<,>He found some snacks in the pantry.<,>他在食品柜里找到了一些零食。<,>pan(平底锅)+try(尝试)→尝试放锅的地方→食品柜<,>pantry vs. larder(食品储藏室)

experimentally<,>/ɪkˌsperɪˈmentəli/<,>/ɪkˌsperɪˈmentəli/<,>adv.实验上/adv.实验性地<,>The new drug was tested experimentally.<,>这种新药进行了实验性测试。<,>He approached the problem experimentally.<,>他用实验性的方法解决了这个问题。<,>The results were obtained experimentally.<,>这些结果是实验得出的。<,>experiment(实验)+al(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→实验性地<,>experimentally vs. theoretically(理论上地)

experimentation<,>/ɪkˌsperɪmenˈteɪʃn/<,>/ɪkˌsperɪmenˈteɪʃn/<,>n.实验/n.试验<,>Experimentation is essential in science.<,>实验在科学中至关重要。<,>They conducted experimentation on the new material.<,>他们对新材料进行了试验。<,>The project requires further experimentation.<,>这个项目需要进一步的实验。<,>experiment(实验)+ation(名词后缀)→实验<,>experimentation vs. investigation(调查)

virtual<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuəl/<,>/ˈvɜːrtʃuəl/<,>adj.实际上的/adj.实质上的<,>He is the virtual leader of the group.<,>他是这个团队实际上的领导者。<,>The meeting was held in virtual space.<,>会议在虚拟空间举行。<,>She has virtual control over the company.<,>她对公司有实质上的控制权。<,>virt(美德)+ual(形容词后缀)→有美德的→实质上的<,>virtual vs. actual(实际的)

execution<,>/ˌeksɪˈkjuːʃn/<,>/ˌeksɪˈkjuːʃn/<,>n.实行/n.执行/n.处死刑<,>The execution of the plan was flawless.<,>这个计划的执行完美无缺。<,>The criminal faced execution.<,>罪犯面临死刑。<,>Proper execution is key to success.<,>正确的实行是成功的关键。<,>ex(出)+ecut(跟随)+ion(名词后缀)→执行<,>execution vs. implementation(实施)

quartz<,>/kwɔːts/<,>/kwɔːrts/<,>n.石英<,>Quartz is used in watches.<,>石英用于手表。<,>The countertop is made of quartz.<,>台面是由石英制成的。<,>She collects quartz crystals.<,>她收集石英晶体。<,>quart(夸脱)+z→石英<,>quartz vs. crystal(晶体)

graphite<,>/ˈɡræfaɪt/<,>/ˈɡræfaɪt/<,>n.石墨/n.石墨电极<,>Graphite is used in pencils.<,>石墨用于铅笔。<,>The battery contains graphite electrodes.<,>电池含有石墨电极。<,>Graphite conducts electricity.<,>石墨导电。<,>graph(写)+ite(矿物)→用于书写的矿物→石墨<,>graphite vs. diamond(金刚石)

whitewash<,>/ˈwaɪtwɒʃ/<,>/ˈwaɪtwɑːʃ/<,>n.石灰水/v.粉饰<,>They applied whitewash to the walls.<,>他们在墙上刷了石灰水。<,>The report was a whitewash of the scandal.<,>这份报告粉饰了丑闻。<,>He tried to whitewash his mistakes.<,>他试图粉饰自己的错误。<,>white(白色)+wash(洗)→用白色洗→粉饰<,>whitewash vs. cover-up(掩盖)

limestone<,>/ˈlaɪmstəʊn/<,>/ˈlaɪmstoʊn/<,>n.石灰石<,>Limestone is used in construction.<,>石灰石用于建筑。<,>The cave is formed from limestone.<,>这个洞穴是由石灰石形成的。<,>They mined limestone from the quarry.<,>他们从采石场开采石灰石。<,>lime(石灰)+stone(石头)→石灰石<,>limestone vs. marble(大理石)

humidity<,>/hjuːˈmɪdəti/<,>/hjuːˈmɪdəti/<,>n.湿气/n.湿度<,>The humidity is high today.<,>今天湿度很高。<,>Plants need proper humidity to grow.<,>植物需要适当的湿度才能生长。<,>The humidity made the air feel heavy.<,>湿气让空气感觉沉重。<,>humid(潮湿的)+ity(名词后缀)→湿度<,>humidity vs. moisture(水分)
handout<,>/ˈhændaʊt/<,>/ˈhændˌaʊt/<,>n.施舍物/n.救济品<,>The homeless shelter provides free handouts to those in need.<,>收容所为无家可归者提供免费救济品。<,>He refused to live on handouts and found a job.<,>他拒绝靠施舍生活，找了份工作。<,>Charities often distribute handouts during natural disasters.<,>慈善机构常在自然灾害期间分发救济物资。<,>hand(手)+out(出)→从手里给出→施舍物<,>handover(n.移交)/handbook(n.手册)/handshake(n.握手)  

verse<,>/vɜːs/<,>/vɜːrs/<,>n.诗/n.韵文/n.诗节<,>She wrote a beautiful verse for the wedding.<,>她为婚礼写了一首优美的诗。<,>The song has three verses and a chorus.<,>这首歌有三段主歌和一段副歌。<,>He recited a verse from Shakespeare.<,>他背诵了莎士比亚的一节诗。<,>vers(转)+e→诗句的转折→诗节<,>version(n.版本)/versus(prep.对抗)/versatile(adj.多才多艺的)  

unemployment<,>/ˌʌnɪmˈplɔɪmənt/<,>/ˌʌnɪmˈplɔɪmənt/<,>n.失业/n.失业人数<,>Unemployment rates rose sharply during the recession.<,>经济衰退期间失业率急剧上升。<,>He's been on unemployment benefits for six months.<,>他已领取失业救济金六个月了。<,>The government launched programs to reduce unemployment.<,>政府启动了减少失业的计划。<,>un(否定)+employ(雇佣)+ment(状态)→失业状态<,>employment(n.就业)/employer(n.雇主)/employee(n.雇员)  

disgrace<,>/dɪsˈɡreɪs/<,>/dɪsˈɡreɪs/<,>n.失宠/n.耻辱/n.丢脸<,>The scandal brought disgrace to his family.<,>丑闻给他的家族带来了耻辱。<,>He resigned in disgrace after the incident.<,>事件后他耻辱地辞职了。<,>Being caught cheating was a total disgrace.<,>作弊被抓是彻底的丢脸。<,>dis(否定)+grace(优雅)→失去优雅→耻辱<,>grace(n.优雅)/disgraceful(adj.可耻的)/gracious(adj.亲切的)  

residual<,>/rɪˈzɪdʒuəl/<,>/rɪˈzɪdʒuəl/<,>adj.剩余的/adj.残余的<,>Residual sugar gives this wine a sweet finish.<,>残留糖分让这款酒有甜美的余味。<,>The machine removes residual moisture from the clothes.<,>这台机器去除衣物上的残余水分。<,>After the fire, only residual structures remained.<,>火灾后只剩下残余的建筑结构。<,>re(再)+sid(坐)+ual→再次坐下后剩下的→残余的<,>resident(n.居民)/residue(n.残留物)/preside(v.主持)  

remainder<,>/rɪˈmeɪndə(r)/<,>/rɪˈmeɪndər/<,>n.剩余物/n.余数<,>We ate the remainder of the cake the next day.<,>我们第二天吃掉了剩下的蛋糕。<,>In division, 5 is the remainder of 23÷6.<,>23除以6的余数是5。<,>The remainder of the group arrived later.<,>小组的其余成员稍后到达。<,>remain(保持)+der→保持下来的部分→剩余物<,>reminder(n.提醒物)/remaining(adj.剩余的)/remains(n.残余)  

excel<,>/ɪkˈsel/<,>/ɪkˈsel/<,>v.胜过/v.杰出<,>She excels in mathematics and physics.<,>她在数学和物理方面很出色。<,>The new model excels its predecessors in performance.<,>新款在性能上胜过前代产品。<,>He excelled himself in the final exam.<,>他在期末考试中超常发挥。<,>ex(出)+cel(升起)→脱颖而出→杰出<,>excellent(adj.优秀的)/excellence(n.卓越)/except(prep.除...外)  

stiff<,>/stɪf/<,>/stɪf/<,>adj.生硬的<,>His stiff manner made others uncomfortable.<,>他生硬的举止让别人不舒服。<,>The new shoes felt stiff at first.<,>新鞋刚开始穿起来很硬。<,>She gave a stiff smile to the stranger.<,>她对陌生人僵硬地笑了笑。<,>sti(站)+ff→像站着一样不动→生硬的<,>staff(n.员工)/stifle(v.抑制)/stiffen(v.变硬)  

ecology<,>/iˈkɒlədʒi/<,>/iˈkɑːlədʒi/<,>n.生态学/n.个体生态学<,>Ecology studies the relationship between organisms and their environment.<,>生态学研究生物与环境的关系。<,>The oil spill caused severe damage to marine ecology.<,>石油泄漏对海洋生态造成严重破坏。<,>Urban ecology focuses on cities as ecosystems.<,>城市生态学将城市视为生态系统研究。<,>eco(生态)+logy(学科)→生态学<,>economy(n.经济)/ecosystem(n.生态系统)/ecological(adj.生态的)  

hide<,>/haɪd/<,>/haɪd/<,>n.生皮/n.兽皮/n.皮革<,>The sofa is made of genuine cow hide.<,>这个沙发是用真牛皮制作的。<,>Native Americans used buffalo hides for tents.<,>美洲原住民用水牛皮做帐篷。<,>This bag is crafted from high-quality hide.<,>这个包是用优质皮革制作的。<,>hid(藏)+e→动物藏身的外皮→兽皮<,>hide(v.隐藏)/hike(n.远足)/hive(n.蜂房)
vital<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>adj.生命的/adj.生机的<,>Water is vital for all living organisms.<,>水对所有生物都至关重要。<,>She plays a vital role in the team.<,>她在团队中扮演着关键角色。<,>The heart is a vital organ.<,>心脏是维持生命的器官。<,>vit(生命)+al(形容词后缀)→与生命有关的<,>vital(vitality n.活力)/vile(adj.卑鄙的)/viral(adj.病毒的)

producer<,>/prəˈdjuːsə(r)/<,>/prəˈduːsər/<,>n.生产者/n.舞台监督<,>He is a famous film producer.<,>他是一位著名的电影制片人。<,>The company is a major producer of electronic goods.<,>这家公司是电子产品的主要生产商。<,>The producer decided to change the script.<,>舞台监督决定修改剧本。<,>pro(向前)+duce(引导)+er(人)→引导生产的人<,>produce(v.生产)/product(n.产品)/reproduce(v.复制)

productivity<,>/ˌprɒdʌkˈtɪvəti/<,>/ˌprɑːdʌkˈtɪvəti/<,>n.生产率/n.多产<,>New machines have increased our productivity.<,>新机器提高了我们的生产率。<,>The writer's productivity is amazing.<,>这位作家的多产令人惊叹。<,>Employee productivity is crucial for company success.<,>员工生产率对公司成功至关重要。<,>product(产品)+ivity(名词后缀)→生产能力<,>production(n.生产)/productive(adj.多产的)/reproductivity(n.繁殖力)

productive<,>/prəˈdʌktɪv/<,>/prəˈdʌktɪv/<,>adj.生产的/adj.出产...的<,>It was a very productive meeting.<,>这是一次非常有成效的会议。<,>The region is productive of oil.<,>这个地区盛产石油。<,>She has a productive imagination.<,>她有着丰富的想象力。<,>pro(向前)+duct(引导)+ive(形容词后缀)→能向前引导的<,>product(n.产品)/production(n.生产)/reproductive(adj.生殖的)

hoist<,>/hɔɪst/<,>/hɔɪst/<,>v.升起/v.扯起来<,>They hoisted the flag at sunrise.<,>他们在日出时升起了旗帜。<,>The workers hoisted the heavy box onto the truck.<,>工人们把重箱子吊上了卡车。<,>He hoisted himself up onto the wall.<,>他把自己拉上了墙。<,>hoist与moist(潮湿的)形似但义异<,>heist(n.抢劫)/host(n.主人)/hoarse(adj.嘶哑的)

kidney<,>/ˈkɪdni/<,>/ˈkɪdni/<,>n.肾/n.腰子<,>He donated one of his kidneys to his sister.<,>他捐了一个肾给他的妹妹。<,>Kidney beans are good for health.<,>腰豆对健康有益。<,>The doctor examined his kidney function.<,>医生检查了他的肾功能。<,>kid(小孩)+ney→像小孩一样需要保护的器官<,>kidnap(v.绑架)/kindle(v.点燃)/kitten(n.小猫)

deliberately<,>/dɪˈlɪbərətli/<,>/dɪˈlɪbərətli/<,>adv.故意地/adv.审慎地<,>He deliberately ignored my question.<,>他故意忽视我的问题。<,>She walked deliberately slowly.<,>她故意走得很慢。<,>The jury deliberated deliberately before reaching a verdict.<,>陪审团在达成裁决前进行了审慎的商议。<,>de(完全)+liber(权衡)+ate(动词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→完全权衡后地<,>liberate(v.解放)/deliberation(n.深思熟虑)/delicate(adj.精致的)

censor<,>/ˈsensə(r)/<,>/ˈsensər/<,>v.审查/v.检查<,>The government censors all media content.<,>政府审查所有媒体内容。<,>They censored several scenes from the movie.<,>他们删剪了电影中的几个场景。<,>Emails are often censored in this company.<,>这家公司经常审查电子邮件。<,>cens(评估)+or(人)→进行评估的人<,>sensor(n.传感器)/census(n.人口普查)/censorship(n.审查制度)

mystery<,>/ˈmɪstri/<,>/ˈmɪstəri/<,>n.神秘小说/n.侦探小说<,>She loves reading mystery novels.<,>她喜欢读神秘小说。<,>The disappearance remains a mystery.<,>失踪事件仍然是个谜。<,>He writes mystery stories for a living.<,>他以写侦探小说为生。<,>myst(神秘)+ery(名词后缀)→神秘的事物<,>history(n.历史)/mastery(n.精通)/minister(n.部长)

shrine<,>/ʃraɪn/<,>/ʃraɪn/<,>n.神殿/n.神龛/n.圣祠<,>They visited the ancient shrine.<,>他们参观了古老的神殿。<,>The family has a small shrine at home.<,>这家人家里有个小神龛。<,>Many pilgrims come to this shrine every year.<,>每年都有许多朝圣者来到这个圣祠。<,>shine(发光)+r→发光的地方→神圣的地方<,>shrink(v.收缩)/shrimp(n.虾)/shrine与shine发音相似
divine<,>/dɪˈvaɪn/<,>/dɪˈvaɪn/<,>adj.神的/adj.敬神的<,>The ancient temple was considered a divine place.<,>这座古庙被认为是神圣之地。<,>She has a divine voice that captivates everyone.<,>她有一副令人着迷的天籁之音。<,>They believed the message was of divine origin.<,>他们相信这条信息来自神灵。<,>div(神)+ine(形容词后缀)→神的<,>devote(v.奉献)/divinity(n.神性)  

deliberate<,>/dɪˈlɪbərət/<,>/dɪˈlɪbərɪt/<,>adj.深思熟虑的/adj.审慎的<,>He made a deliberate choice after much thought.<,>经过深思熟虑后，他做出了审慎的选择。<,>The jury took a deliberate approach to the case.<,>陪审团对此案采取了谨慎的态度。<,>Her actions were slow and deliberate.<,>她的动作缓慢而谨慎。<,>de(加强)+liber(权衡)+ate→仔细权衡的<,>liberate(v.解放)/deliberation(n.慎重考虑)  

profound<,>/prəˈfaʊnd/<,>/prəˈfaʊnd/<,>adj.见解深刻的/adj.渊博的<,>His speech had a profound impact on the audience.<,>他的演讲对听众产生了深远的影响。<,>She has a profound knowledge of ancient history.<,>她对古代历史有渊博的知识。<,>The book offers profound insights into human nature.<,>这本书对人性的见解非常深刻。<,>pro(向前)+found(基础)→深入基础的→深刻的<,>profuse(adj.大量的)/found(v.建立)  

trench<,>/trentʃ/<,>/trɛntʃ/<,>n.深沟/n.壕沟/n.战壕<,>The soldiers dug a trench for protection.<,>士兵们挖了一条战壕用于防护。<,>There was a deep trench along the roadside.<,>路边有一条深沟。<,>The archaeologists found artifacts in the ancient trench.<,>考古学家在古壕沟中发现了文物。<,>trench(切割)→挖出的沟<,>bench(n.长凳)/wrench(v.扭伤/n.扳手)  

photography<,>/fəˈtɒɡrəfi/<,>/fəˈtɑːɡrəfi/<,>n.摄影术<,>She has a passion for black-and-white photography.<,>她对黑白摄影情有独钟。<,>Digital photography has revolutionized the industry.<,>数码摄影彻底改变了这个行业。<,>He won an award for his wildlife photography.<,>他的野生动物摄影作品获奖了。<,>photo(光)+graph(写)+y→用光写作→摄影<,>geography(n.地理学)/autograph(n.亲笔签名)  

editorial<,>/ˌedɪˈtɔːriəl/<,>/ˌɛdɪˈtɔriəl/<,>n.社论/n.期刊的社论<,>The newspaper published an editorial on climate change.<,>报纸发表了一篇关于气候变化的社论。<,>She writes editorials for a leading magazine.<,>她为一家主流杂志撰写社论。<,>The editorial criticized the government's new policy.<,>这篇社论批评了政府的新政策。<,>edit(编辑)+orial→编辑写的文章<,>edition(n.版本)/editor(n.编辑)  

sociology<,>/ˌsəʊsiˈɒlədʒi/<,>/ˌsoʊsiˈɑːlədʒi/<,>n.社会学<,>He is studying sociology at university.<,>他正在大学攻读社会学。<,>Sociology helps us understand human behavior in groups.<,>社会学帮助我们理解群体中的人类行为。<,>Her research focuses on urban sociology.<,>她的研究重点是城市社会学。<,>soci(社会)+ology(学科)→研究社会的学科<,>psychology(n.心理学)/biology(n.生物学)  

conceive<,>/kənˈsiːv/<,>/kənˈsiːv/<,>v.设想/v.以为/v.怀孕<,>It's hard to conceive of life without electricity.<,>很难想象没有电的生活。<,>She conceived a brilliant plan for the project.<,>她为这个项目构想了一个绝妙的计划。<,>They were overjoyed when she conceived a child.<,>当她怀孕时，他们欣喜若狂。<,>con(共同)+ceive(拿)→共同拿想法→构想<,>deceive(v.欺骗)/perceive(v.察觉)  

reject<,>/rɪˈdʒekt/<,>/rɪˈdʒɛkt/<,>v.舍弃/v.抛弃/v.排斥<,>The committee rejected his proposal.<,>委员会拒绝了他的提议。<,>Her body rejected the transplanted organ.<,>她的身体排斥移植的器官。<,>They rejected all the damaged goods.<,>他们丢弃了所有损坏的商品。<,>re(回)+ject(扔)→扔回去→拒绝<,>eject(v.喷射)/inject(v.注射)  

serpent<,>/ˈsɜːpənt/<,>/ˈsɜːrpənt/<,>n.蛇（尤指大蛇或毒蛇）<,>The ancient symbol featured a coiled serpent.<,>这个古老的符号是一条盘绕的蛇。<,>They found a huge serpent in the jungle.<,>他们在丛林中发现了一条巨蛇。<,>The serpent in the story represented evil.<,>故事中的蛇象征着邪恶。<,>serp(爬行)+ent→爬行动物<,>serum(n.血清)/serene(adj.宁静的)
extravagant<,>/ɪkˈstrævəɡənt/<,>/ɪkˈstrævəɡənt/<,>adj.奢侈的/adj.过度的<,>She has an extravagant taste in fashion.<,>她对时尚有着奢侈的品味。<,>His extravagant spending left him in debt.<,>他过度的消费让他负债累累。<,>The party was an extravagant affair with no expense spared.<,>这个派对极尽奢华，不惜成本。<,>extra(超出)+vag(漫游)+ant→漫游超出界限→奢侈的<,>extravaganza(n.盛大表演)/vagrant(n.流浪者)  

maid<,>/meɪd/<,>/meɪd/<,>n.少女/n.处女<,>The maid served tea to the guests.<,>少女为客人们端上茶。<,>She worked as a maid in a wealthy household.<,>她在一个富裕的家庭做女仆。<,>The young maid was full of innocence and charm.<,>这个年轻的少女充满纯真与魅力。<,>maid(少女)与made(制造)发音相同<,>maiden(n.少女)/bridesmaid(n.伴娘)  

maiden<,>/ˈmeɪdn/<,>/ˈmeɪdn/<,>n.少女/n.未婚女子<,>The maiden danced gracefully at the festival.<,>少女在节日上优雅地跳舞。<,>Her maiden name was Smith before she got married.<,>她婚前的姓氏是史密斯。<,>The ship's maiden voyage was a great success.<,>这艘船的处女航非常成功。<,>maid(少女)+en(后缀)→少女<,>maid(n.女仆)/matron(n.主妇)  

scorch<,>/skɔːtʃ/<,>/skɔːrtʃ/<,>v.烧焦/v.枯萎<,>The sun scorched the grass during the drought.<,>干旱期间太阳把草晒焦了。<,>She accidentally scorched her shirt while ironing.<,>她熨衣服时不小心把衬衫烫焦了。<,>The leaves scorched in the intense heat.<,>叶子在酷热中枯萎了。<,>s(死)+corch(谐音"烤")→烤死→烧焦<,>scorch(v.烧焦)/torch(n.火炬)  

context<,>/ˈkɒntekst/<,>/ˈkɑːntekst/<,>n.上下文/n.来龙去脉<,>You need to understand the context of the sentence.<,>你需要理解这句话的上下文。<,>The decision was made in the context of the economic crisis.<,>这个决定是在经济危机的背景下做出的。<,>Without context, his words seemed harsh.<,>没有背景，他的话显得很苛刻。<,>con(共同)+text(文本)→共同文本→上下文<,>content(n.内容)/pretext(n.借口)  

Heaven<,>/ˈhevən/<,>/ˈhevən/<,>n.上帝/n.神<,>They prayed to Heaven for guidance.<,>他们向上帝祈祷指引。<,>The view from the mountain was like Heaven on earth.<,>从山上看到的景色宛如人间天堂。<,>May his soul rest in Heaven.<,>愿他的灵魂在天堂安息。<,>heave(举起)+n→被举起的至高之处→天堂<,>heaven(n.天堂)/hell(n.地狱)  

counsel<,>/ˈkaʊnsl/<,>/ˈkaʊnsl/<,>n.商议/n.忠告/n.律师<,>He sought counsel from his mentor.<,>他向导师寻求建议。<,>The defendant has the right to legal counsel.<,>被告有权获得律师辩护。<,>After much counsel, they decided to proceed.<,>经过多次商议，他们决定继续。<,>coun(共同)+sel(说)→共同说→商议<,>council(n.委员会)/consult(v.咨询)  

tradesman<,>/ˈtreɪdzmən/<,>/ˈtreɪdzmən/<,>n.商人/n.店主/n.手艺人<,>The tradesman delivered the goods on time.<,>商人准时送货。<,>He was a skilled tradesman who took pride in his work.<,>他是个技艺精湛的手艺人，对自己的工作感到自豪。<,>The local tradesman knew all his customers by name.<,>当地的店主能叫出所有顾客的名字。<,>trade(贸易)+s+man(人)→从事贸易的人→商人<,>tradesman(n.商人)/tradesmen(pl.商人们)  

trader<,>/ˈtreɪdər/<,>/ˈtreɪdər/<,>n.商人<,>The trader exchanged goods with foreign merchants.<,>商人与外国商人交换货物。<,>She works as a stock trader on Wall Street.<,>她在华尔街做股票交易员。<,>The spice trader traveled to distant lands.<,>香料商人远行至异国他乡。<,>trade(贸易)+er(人)→从事贸易的人→商人<,>trader(n.商人)/trade(n.贸易)  

dealer<,>/ˈdiːlər/<,>/ˈdiːlər/<,>n.商人/n.毒品贩/n.发牌者<,>The art dealer sold the painting for a high price.<,>艺术品商人以高价卖出了这幅画。<,>The police arrested the drug dealer last night.<,>警方昨晚逮捕了那个毒品贩子。<,>In poker, the dealer distributes the cards.<,>在扑克中，发牌者分发牌。<,>deal(交易)+er(人)→交易的人→商人<,>dealer(n.商人)/dealing(n.交易)
ware<,>/weə(r)/<,>/wer/<,>n.物品/n.商品/n.货物<,>The shop sells various household wares.<,>这家商店出售各种家居用品。<,>She displayed her pottery wares at the fair.<,>她在展会上展示了自己的陶器作品。<,>The merchant imported fine wares from China.<,>商人从中国进口了精美的商品。<,>ware(注意)+house(房子)→warehouse(仓库)<,>wear(v.穿/n.服装)/swear(v.发誓)/aware(adj.意识到的)

merchandise<,>/ˈmɜːtʃəndaɪs/<,>/ˈmɜːrtʃəndaɪs/<,>n.商品/n.货物<,>The store has a wide selection of merchandise.<,>这家商店有各种各样的商品。<,>They sell their merchandise online.<,>他们在网上销售商品。<,>The merchandise was damaged during shipping.<,>货物在运输过程中受损了。<,>merchant(商人)+dise→商品<,>commodity(n.商品)/goods(n.货物)/inventory(n.存货)

blue<,>/bluː/<,>/bluː/<,>adj.伤心的/adj.下流的<,>She felt blue after hearing the bad news.<,>听到坏消息后她很伤心。<,>He told a blue joke at the party.<,>他在聚会上讲了个下流笑话。<,>The movie has some blue content.<,>这部电影有些下流内容。<,>blue(蓝色)→忧郁的蓝色→伤心的<,>blew(v.吹，blow的过去式)/brew(v.酿造)/blur(v.模糊)

goodness<,>/ˈɡʊdnəs/<,>/ˈɡʊdnəs/<,>n.善良/n.善行/n.美德<,>Her goodness is known to everyone.<,>她的善良是众所周知的。<,>He did it out of the goodness of his heart.<,>他做这件事是出于内心的善良。<,>Goodness always triumphs in the end.<,>善良最终总会战胜邪恶。<,>good(好)+ness(名词后缀)→善良<,>godness(错误拼写)/kindness(n.仁慈)/virtue(n.美德)

underwear<,>/ˈʌndəweə(r)/<,>/ˈʌndərwer/<,>n.衫衣/n.内衣/n.贴身衣<,>She bought some new underwear.<,>她买了一些新内衣。<,>Don't forget to pack clean underwear.<,>别忘了带干净的内衣。<,>He prefers cotton underwear.<,>他更喜欢棉质内衣。<,>under(下面)+wear(穿)→穿在下面的衣服→内衣<,>underweight(adj.体重不足的)/overwear(n.外衣)/underwater(adj.水下的)

cancel<,>/ˈkænsl/<,>/ˈkænsəl/<,>v.取消<,>They had to cancel the meeting.<,>他们不得不取消会议。<,>She canceled her subscription to the magazine.<,>她取消了对这本杂志的订阅。<,>The flight was canceled due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，航班被取消了。<,>can(能)+cel(停止)→能够停止→取消<,>cancer(n.癌症)/candle(n.蜡烛)/channel(n.频道)

gap<,>/ɡæp/<,>/ɡæp/<,>n.差距/n.山口/n.山峡<,>There is a big gap between rich and poor.<,>贫富之间存在巨大差距。<,>We hiked through the mountain gap.<,>我们徒步穿过了山口。<,>The generation gap causes misunderstandings.<,>代沟导致了误解。<,>gap(缺口)→差距<,>cap(n.帽子)/map(n.地图)/tap(v.轻敲)

sift<,>/sɪft/<,>/sɪft/<,>v.筛/v.过滤<,>She sifted the flour before baking.<,>她在烘焙前筛了面粉。<,>The detective sifted through the evidence.<,>侦探仔细审查了证据。<,>Sift the sand to remove impurities.<,>把沙子过滤以去除杂质。<,>sift(筛选)→shift(转移)→通过筛选转移<,>shift(v.转移)/lift(v.举起)/gift(n.礼物)

shark<,>/ʃɑːk/<,>/ʃɑːrk/<,>n.鲨鱼/n.诈骗钱财者<,>We saw a shark while diving.<,>我们潜水时看到了一条鲨鱼。<,>Beware of loan sharks.<,>小心放高利贷的人。<,>The shark attacked the swimmer.<,>鲨鱼袭击了游泳者。<,>shark(鲨鱼)→sharp(锋利的)→鲨鱼锋利的牙齿<,>sharp(adj.锋利的)/spark(n.火花)/stark(adj.完全的)

gravel<,>/ˈɡrævl/<,>/ˈɡrævəl/<,>n.砂砾/n.砂砾层/n.结石<,>The path was covered with gravel.<,>小路上铺满了砂砾。<,>He has kidney gravel.<,>他有肾结石。<,>The gravel crunched under our feet.<,>砂砾在我们脚下嘎吱作响。<,>grave(坟墓)+l→像坟墓一样坚硬的→结石<,>grovel(v.匍匐)/gavel(n.木槌)/gravy(n.肉汁)
sardine<,>/sɑːˈdiːn/<,>/sɑrˈdin/<,>n.沙丁鱼<,>The sardines were packed tightly in the can.<,>沙丁鱼被紧紧地塞在罐头里。<,>We had grilled sardines for dinner.<,>我们晚餐吃了烤沙丁鱼。<,>Sardines are rich in omega-3 fatty acids.<,>沙丁鱼富含欧米伽-3脂肪酸。<,>sar(沙)+dine(鱼)→沙丁鱼<,>sardonic(adj.讽刺的)/sardius(n.红宝石)

tone<,>/təʊn/<,>/toʊn/<,>n.色调/n.光度<,>She adjusted the tone of the painting to make it warmer.<,>她调整了画的色调使其更温暖。<,>The tone of his voice was serious.<,>他说话的语气很严肃。<,>This monitor has excellent color tone reproduction.<,>这台显示器色彩还原极佳。<,>ton(声音)+e→色调/音调<,>tune(n.曲调)/stone(n.石头)/toner(n.墨粉)

scan<,>/skæn/<,>/skæn/<,>n.扫描<,>The doctor ordered a CT scan for further examination.<,>医生要求做CT扫描进一步检查。<,>She quickly scanned the newspaper for the headline.<,>她快速浏览报纸寻找头条。<,>Airport security uses body scan technology.<,>机场安检使用人体扫描技术。<,>sc(看)+an→扫描<,>scanner(n.扫描仪)/scant(adj.不足的)/scandal(n.丑闻)

uproar<,>/ˈʌprɔː(r)/<,>/ˈʌpˌrɔr/<,>n.骚动/n.扰乱/n.喧嚣<,>The announcement caused an uproar in the crowd.<,>这个宣布在人群中引起了骚动。<,>The classroom was in complete uproar when the teacher left.<,>老师离开后教室里一片混乱。<,>The political scandal created a national uproar.<,>政治丑闻引发了全国哗然。<,>up(向上)+roar(吼叫)→喧嚣<,>uproot(v.根除)/upright(adj.正直的)/roar(n.吼叫)

prose<,>/prəʊz/<,>/proʊz/<,>n.散文<,>He writes beautiful prose about country life.<,>他写了关于乡村生活的优美散文。<,>The novel alternates between poetry and prose.<,>这部小说交替使用诗歌和散文体。<,>Her prose style is clear and concise.<,>她的散文风格清晰简洁。<,>pro(向前)+se→散文(直白的表达)<,>pose(v.摆姿势)/probe(v.探查)/prose(n.与verse(诗)相对)

emission<,>/ɪˈmɪʃn/<,>/ɪˈmɪʃən/<,>n.散发/n.传播/n.发出物<,>The factory reduced its carbon emissions by 20%.<,>这家工厂减少了20%的碳排放。<,>The emission of light from the firefly fascinated the children.<,>萤火虫发出的光让孩子们着迷。<,>New regulations control vehicle emissions strictly.<,>新法规严格控制车辆排放。<,>e(出)+miss(发送)+ion→散发<,>mission(n.任务)/omission(n.遗漏)/admission(n.承认)

stroll<,>/strəʊl/<,>/stroʊl/<,>n.散步/n.溜达/n.闲逛<,>We took a leisurely stroll along the beach.<,>我们沿着海滩悠闲地散步。<,>He goes for a morning stroll every day.<,>他每天早晨都去散步。<,>The couple enjoyed a romantic stroll in the park.<,>这对情侣在公园里享受浪漫的散步。<,>str(街道)+oll→在街上走→散步<,>scroll(n.卷轴)/stroller(n.婴儿车)/troll(n.巨怪)

triangular<,>/traɪˈæŋɡjələ(r)/<,>/traɪˈæŋɡjələr/<,>adj.三角的/adj.三者间的<,>The triangular sail caught the wind perfectly.<,>三角帆完美地捕捉到了风。<,>They formed a triangular alliance for the project.<,>他们为这个项目组成了三方联盟。<,>The triangular relationship caused many complications.<,>三角关系引发了许多复杂问题。<,>tri(三)+angular(角的)→三角的<,>rectangle(n.长方形)/angular(adj.有角的)/triad(n.三人组)

mute<,>/mjuːt/<,>/mjut/<,>n.弱音器<,>The violinist attached a mute to soften the sound.<,>小提琴手装上弱音器使声音变柔和。<,>He pressed the mute button during the commercial.<,>广告时间他按了静音键。<,>The trumpet's mute created a special effect.<,>小号的弱音器产生了特殊效果。<,>mut(改变)+e→改变声音→弱音器<,>mutation(n.突变)/mutter(v.嘀咕)/muted(adj.柔和的)

choice<,>/tʃɔɪs/<,>/tʃɔɪs/<,>n.入选者/adj.优等的<,>She was the obvious choice for team leader.<,>她是队长的当然人选。<,>We stayed at a choice hotel during our vacation.<,>我们假期住在一家高档酒店。<,>The restaurant offers choice cuts of meat.<,>这家餐厅提供上等肉块。<,>cho(选)+ice→选择的结果→入选者<,>voice(n.声音)/rejoice(v.高兴)/choir(n.合唱团)
tolerant<,>/ˈtɒlərənt/<,>/ˈtɑːlərənt/<,>adj.容忍的/adj.有耐力的<,>She is very tolerant of different opinions.<,>她对不同的意见非常宽容。<,>He has a tolerant attitude towards mistakes.<,>他对错误持宽容态度。<,>The plant is tolerant of drought.<,>这种植物耐旱。<,>toler(忍受)+ant(形容词后缀)→能忍受的→容忍的<,>tolerate(v.容忍)/intolerant(adj.不宽容的)  

commodity<,>/kəˈmɒdəti/<,>/kəˈmɑːdəti/<,>n.日用品/n.商品/n.物品<,>Oil is a valuable commodity in the global market.<,>石油是全球市场上的重要商品。<,>She bought some household commodities at the supermarket.<,>她在超市买了一些日用品。<,>The price of commodities has risen sharply.<,>商品价格大幅上涨。<,>com(共同)+mod(模式)+ity(名词后缀)→共同模式下的物品→商品<,>common(adj.普通的)/commodious(adj.宽敞的)  

routine<,>/ruːˈtiːn/<,>/ruːˈtiːn/<,>adj.日常的/n.常规<,>He follows a strict daily routine.<,>他遵循严格的日常惯例。<,>The work has become routine and boring.<,>这份工作变得例行公事且无聊。<,>She broke her exercise routine due to illness.<,>她因生病中断了锻炼习惯。<,>rout(路线)+ine→按路线走→常规<,>route(n.路线)/rut(n.车辙)  

undertaking<,>/ˌʌndəˈteɪkɪŋ/<,>/ˌʌndərˈteɪkɪŋ/<,>n.任务/n.事业/n.承诺<,>Starting a business is a risky undertaking.<,>创业是一项有风险的事业。<,>He gave an undertaking to finish the project on time.<,>他承诺按时完成项目。<,>The government supports this charitable undertaking.<,>政府支持这项慈善事业。<,>under(在...下)+take(拿)+ing→承担下来的事→任务<,>undertake(v.承担)/overtake(v.超过)  

deem<,>/diːm/<,>/diːm/<,>v.认为/v.相信/v.想<,>The court deemed the evidence insufficient.<,>法院认为证据不足。<,>She deemed it necessary to apologize.<,>她认为有必要道歉。<,>I deem him trustworthy.<,>我认为他值得信赖。<,>deem与seem形似但意不同<,>seem(v.似乎)/redeem(v.赎回)  

awake<,>/əˈweɪk/<,>/əˈweɪk/<,>v.认识到<,>He finally awoke to the dangers of smoking.<,>他终于认识到了吸烟的危害。<,>The incident awoke her interest in politics.<,>这件事激发了她对政治的兴趣。<,>We must awake to the reality of climate change.<,>我们必须认识到气候变化的现实。<,>a(加强)+wake(醒)→完全醒来→认识到<,>awaken(v.唤醒)/wake(v.醒来)  

recognition<,>/ˌrekəɡˈnɪʃn/<,>/ˌrekəɡˈnɪʃn/<,>n.认出/n.识别<,>She received recognition for her outstanding work.<,>她因出色的工作得到了认可。<,>Facial recognition technology is widely used now.<,>人脸识别技术现在应用广泛。<,>There was no recognition in his eyes when he saw me.<,>他看到我时眼神里没有认出我的意思。<,>re(再)+cogn(知道)+ition→再次知道→认出<,>cognition(n.认知)/recognize(v.认出)  

identification<,>/aɪˌdentɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/aɪˌdentɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.身份证/n.认出/n.鉴定<,>Please show your identification at the entrance.<,>请在入口处出示身份证件。<,>The identification of the victim took several days.<,>受害者的鉴定花了好几天。<,>He carries his identification with him at all times.<,>他总是随身携带身份证。<,>ident(相同)+ify(使)+cation→使确认相同→鉴定<,>identity(n.身份)/identical(adj.相同的)  

merciful<,>/ˈmɜːsɪfl/<,>/ˈmɜːrsɪfl/<,>adj.仁慈的/adj.宽大的<,>The judge was merciful and gave him a light sentence.<,>法官很仁慈，给了他轻判。<,>God is merciful to sinners.<,>上帝对罪人是宽大的。<,>She gave him a merciful smile.<,>她给了他一个宽厚的微笑。<,>merci(怜悯)+ful(充满...的)→充满怜悯的→仁慈的<,>mercy(n.仁慈)/merciless(adj.无情的)  

hostage<,>/ˈhɒstɪdʒ/<,>/ˈhɑːstɪdʒ/<,>n.人质<,>The terrorists took three people hostage.<,>恐怖分子劫持了三名人质。<,>He was held hostage for three months.<,>他被扣为人质三个月。<,>The negotiation aims to free the hostages.<,>谈判旨在解救人质。<,>host(主人)+age(状态)→被当作"主人"控制的状态→人质<,>hostel(n.旅舍)/hostility(n.敌意)
pitch<,>/pɪtʃ/<,>/pɪtʃ/<,>n.沥青<,>The road was covered with pitch to make it waterproof.<,>路上铺了沥青以防水。<,>He slipped on the pitch and fell.<,>他在沥青上滑倒了。<,>The smell of pitch was strong near the construction site.<,>建筑工地附近沥青的气味很浓。<,>pit(坑)+ch→沥青常用来填坑<,>patch(n.补丁/v.修补)/pith(n.精髓/adj.重要的)  

personnel<,>/ˌpɜːsəˈnel/<,>/ˌpɜːrsəˈnel/<,>n.人事部门<,>The personnel department is responsible for hiring new employees.<,>人事部门负责招聘新员工。<,>All personnel must attend the safety training.<,>所有员工都必须参加安全培训。<,>She works in personnel management.<,>她从事人事管理工作。<,>person(人)+nel→与人相关的部门<,>personal(adj.个人的)/personage(n.要人)  

humanity<,>/hjuːˈmænəti/<,>/hjuːˈmænəti/<,>n.人类/人性/人情<,>The invention has benefited all humanity.<,>这项发明使全人类受益。<,>He showed great humanity towards the refugees.<,>他对难民表现出极大的人道关怀。<,>Studying humanities helps us understand human culture.<,>学习人文学科有助于我们理解人类文化。<,>human(人)+ity(性质)→人的性质<,>humidity(n.湿度)/humility(n.谦逊)  

personality<,>/ˌpɜːsəˈnæləti/<,>/ˌpɜːrsəˈnæləti/<,>n.人格/个性/名人<,>Her cheerful personality makes her popular.<,>她开朗的个性使她受欢迎。<,>He developed a split personality after the accident.<,>事故后他出现了人格分裂。<,>The show features famous personalities from different fields.<,>这个节目邀请了来自不同领域的名人。<,>person(人)+ality(性质)→人的特质<,>personal(adj.个人的)/personnel(n.人事部门)  

thermal<,>/ˈθɜːməl/<,>/ˈθɜːrməl/<,>adj.热的/温热的<,>Thermal springs are popular tourist attractions.<,>温泉是受欢迎的旅游景点。<,>She wore thermal underwear to keep warm.<,>她穿着保暖内衣御寒。<,>The plant uses thermal energy to generate electricity.<,>该工厂利用热能发电。<,>therm(热)+al→热的<,>thermos(n.热水瓶)/thermometer(n.温度计)  

tropic<,>/ˈtrɒpɪk/<,>/ˈtrɑːpɪk/<,>n.回归线/热带地区<,>The Tropic of Cancer is located at 23.5°N.<,>北回归线位于北纬23.5度。<,>Many exotic fruits grow in the tropics.<,>许多异国水果生长在热带地区。<,>They took a cruise through the tropics.<,>他们在热带地区乘船游览。<,>trop(转)+ic→太阳回转的地方<,>topic(n.话题)/trophic(adj.营养的)  

tropical<,>/ˈtrɒpɪkəl/<,>/ˈtrɑːpɪkəl/<,>adj.热带的/湿热的<,>Tropical rainforests are rich in biodiversity.<,>热带雨林生物多样性丰富。<,>We escaped the tropical heat by staying indoors.<,>我们待在室内躲避热带炎热。<,>This plant thrives in tropical climates.<,>这种植物在热带气候中茁壮成长。<,>tropic(热带)+al→热带的<,>typical(adj.典型的)/topical(adj.局部的)  

concession<,>/kənˈseʃn/<,>/kənˈseʃn/<,>n.让步/迁就<,>The company made concessions to the workers' demands.<,>公司对工人的要求做出了让步。<,>As a concession, they agreed to lower the price.<,>作为让步，他们同意降低价格。<,>The treaty involved territorial concessions.<,>该条约涉及领土让步。<,>con(共同)+cess(走)+ion→共同走向妥协<,>concessionaire(n.特许权获得者)/concessive(adj.让步的)  

combustion<,>/kəmˈbʌstʃən/<,>/kəmˈbʌstʃən/<,>n.燃烧<,>The combustion of fossil fuels releases carbon dioxide.<,>化石燃料的燃烧会释放二氧化碳。<,>Spontaneous combustion caused the fire.<,>自燃引起了火灾。<,>Engine efficiency depends on complete combustion.<,>发动机效率取决于完全燃烧。<,>com(完全)+bust(燃烧)+ion→完全燃烧<,>combustible(adj.易燃的)/combustor(n.燃烧室)  

whisker<,>/ˈwɪskə(r)/<,>/ˈwɪskər/<,>n.髯/连鬓胡子<,>The old man had long white whiskers.<,>老人留着长长的白胡子。<,>The cat's whiskers help it navigate in the dark.<,>猫的胡须帮助它在黑暗中导航。<,>He trimmed his whiskers carefully.<,>他仔细修剪了连鬓胡子。<,>whisk(拂)+er→拂动的毛发<,>whisper(v.低语)/whisk(n.搅拌器)
flock<,>/flɒk/<,>/flɑːk/<,>v.群集/v.聚集<,>Birds of a feather flock together.<,>物以类聚。<,>Tourists flock to the beach in summer.<,>夏天游客们蜂拥至海滩。<,>Sheep flock to the shepherd.<,>羊群聚集在牧羊人周围。<,>fl(飞)+ock(群体)→飞行的群体→群集<,>block(n.块/v.阻塞)/frock(n.连衣裙)/flop(v.失败)

conviction<,>/kənˈvɪkʃn/<,>/kənˈvɪkʃən/<,>n.确信/n.信服/n.深信<,>He spoke with great conviction about his beliefs.<,>他非常坚定地谈论自己的信仰。<,>The jury reached a unanimous conviction.<,>陪审团达成一致的有罪判决。<,>Her eyes shone with conviction.<,>她的眼中闪烁着坚定的光芒。<,>con(完全)+vict(征服)+ion→完全征服→确信<,>eviction(n.驱逐)/convince(v.说服)/convivial(adj.欢乐的)

certainty<,>/ˈsɜːtnti/<,>/ˈsɜːrtnti/<,>n.确实性/n.确信/n.确实<,>There's no certainty that the project will succeed.<,>不能确定这个项目会成功。<,>She answered with absolute certainty.<,>她回答得斩钉截铁。<,>Death is the only certainty in life.<,>死亡是生命中唯一确定的事。<,>certain(确定的)+ty(名词后缀)→确定性<,>uncertainty(n.不确定)/certify(v.证明)/certificate(n.证书)

positively<,>/ˈpɒzətɪvli/<,>/ˈpɑːzətɪvli/<,>adv.确定的/adv.断然<,>She positively identified the suspect.<,>她明确指认了嫌疑人。<,>I can positively say this is the best solution.<,>我可以肯定地说这是最佳解决方案。<,>The test results came back positively.<,>检测结果呈阳性。<,>positive(积极的)+ly(副词后缀)→确定地<,>negatively(adv.否定地)/posit(假设)/position(n.位置)

quantify<,>/ˈkwɒntɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈkwɑːntɪfaɪ/<,>v.确定...的数量<,>It's difficult to quantify the damage.<,>很难量化损失程度。<,>Scientists quantified the chemical components.<,>科学家们量化了化学成分。<,>We need to quantify our progress.<,>我们需要量化我们的进展。<,>quant(数量)+ify(使)→使数量化<,>quality(n.质量)/quantity(n.数量)/qualify(v.使合格)

deficient<,>/dɪˈfɪʃnt/<,>/dɪˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.缺乏的/adj.欠缺的<,>His diet is deficient in vitamins.<,>他的饮食缺乏维生素。<,>The report was deficient in important details.<,>这份报告缺少重要细节。<,>She feels deficient in social skills.<,>她觉得自己社交能力不足。<,>de(否定)+fic(做)+ient→做得不够→缺乏的<,>efficient(adj.高效的)/sufficient(adj.充足的)/proficient(adj.熟练的)

deficiency<,>/dɪˈfɪʃnsi/<,>/dɪˈfɪʃənsi/<,>n.缺乏/n.不足<,>Iron deficiency can cause anemia.<,>缺铁会导致贫血。<,>The bridge collapsed due to structural deficiencies.<,>由于结构缺陷，桥梁倒塌了。<,>Vitamin D deficiency is common in winter.<,>冬季常见维生素D缺乏。<,>de(否定)+fic(做)+iency→做得不够→缺乏<,>efficiency(n.效率)/sufficiency(n.充足)/proficiency(n.熟练)

scarcity<,>/ˈskeəsəti/<,>/ˈskersəti/<,>n.缺乏/n.不足<,>Water scarcity is a serious problem in this region.<,>这个地区水资源短缺是个严重问题。<,>The scarcity of jobs led to high unemployment.<,>工作机会稀缺导致高失业率。<,>There's a scarcity of evidence in this case.<,>这个案件证据不足。<,>scarce(稀少的)+ity(名词后缀)→缺乏<,>rarity(n.稀有)/security(n.安全)/sincerity(n.真诚)

flaw<,>/flɔː/<,>/flɑː/<,>n.缺点/n.瑕疵<,>There's a flaw in your argument.<,>你的论点有漏洞。<,>The diamond has a tiny flaw.<,>这颗钻石有个微小瑕疵。<,>Perfectionism is actually a character flaw.<,>完美主义实际上是一种性格缺陷。<,>fl(飞)+aw(啊)→飞的时候"啊"发现瑕疵<,>flow(v.流动)/flea(n.跳蚤)/flax(n.亚麻)

induce<,>/ɪnˈdjuːs/<,>/ɪnˈduːs/<,>v.劝诱/v.引起<,>Nothing could induce her to change her mind.<,>什么都不能劝她改变主意。<,>The drug may induce sleep.<,>这种药物可能引起睡意。<,>His speech induced great enthusiasm.<,>他的演讲激起了极大热情。<,>in(进入)+duce(引导)→引导进入→引起<,>deduce(v.推断)/reduce(v.减少)/seduce(v.引诱)
persuasion<,>/pəˈsweɪʒ(ə)n/<,>/pərˈsweɪʒən/<,>n.劝说/n.说服<,>Her powers of persuasion are remarkable.<,>她的说服力非常出色。<,>He used gentle persuasion to change her mind.<,>他用温和的劝说改变了她的想法。<,>Persuasion is an important skill in negotiations.<,>说服是谈判中的一项重要技能。<,>per(彻底)+suas(敦促)+ion→彻底敦促→说服<,>dissuasion(n.劝阻)/persuasive(adj.有说服力的)

claim<,>/kleɪm/<,>/kleɪm/<,>n.权利/n.所有权<,>She has a legal claim to the property.<,>她对该财产有合法的所有权。<,>He filed a claim for compensation.<,>他提出了赔偿要求。<,>The insurance company denied his claim.<,>保险公司拒绝了他的索赔。<,>clam(喊叫)→主张权利时要大声<,>acclaim(v.欢呼)/exclaim(v.呼喊)/proclaim(v.宣布)

late<,>/leɪt/<,>/leɪt/<,>adj.去世不久的<,>The late president was greatly respected.<,>已故总统深受尊敬。<,>She inherited the estate from her late husband.<,>她从已故丈夫那里继承了遗产。<,>The museum exhibits works by late artists.<,>博物馆展出了已故艺术家的作品。<,>late本身也有"迟的"意思→生命迟到终点<,>latest(adj.最新的)/lately(adv.最近)

extract<,>/ɪkˈstrækt/<,>/ˈɛkstrækt/<,>v.取出/v.提取/n.摘录<,>They extract oil from sunflower seeds.<,>他们从葵花籽中提取油。<,>The dentist extracted my wisdom tooth.<,>牙医拔掉了我的智齿。<,>This book contains extracts from famous novels.<,>这本书收录了著名小说的节选。<,>ex(出)+tract(拉)→拉出来→提取<,>abstract(adj.抽象的)/contract(n.合同)/distract(v.分散注意力)

crank<,>/kræŋk/<,>/kræŋk/<,>n.曲柄/v.用曲柄转动<,>He turned the crank to start the engine.<,>他转动曲柄启动发动机。<,>The old car requires cranking to start.<,>这辆旧车需要摇柄启动。<,>She cranked the window open slowly.<,>她慢慢摇下车窗。<,>cr(弯曲)+ank(角度)→弯曲的把手→曲柄<,>cranky(adj.古怪的)/crane(n.起重机)/cram(v.填塞)
