expel<,>/ɪkˈspel/<,>/ɪkˈspɛl/<,>v.开除/v.驱逐/v.排出<,>The school may expel students for bad behavior.<,>学校可能会开除行为不端的学生。<,>The fan expels hot air from the computer.<,>风扇将热空气从电脑中排出。<,>They were expeled from the country for illegal activities.<,>他们因非法活动被驱逐出境。<,>ex(出)+pel(推)→推出去→驱逐<,>repel(v.击退)/compel(v.强迫)/propel(v.推进)

dissipate<,>/ˈdɪsɪpeɪt/<,>/ˈdɪsəˌpeɪt/<,>v.驱散/v.消散/v.浪费<,>The fog dissipated as the sun rose.<,>太阳升起时雾气消散了。<,>He dissipated his fortune on gambling.<,>他把财产挥霍在赌博上。<,>The police dissipated the crowd.<,>警察驱散了人群。<,>dis(分开)+sip(扔)+ate→四处扔→消散<,>dissipated(adj.放荡的)/dissipation(n.消散)/disperse(v.分散)

spherical<,>/ˈsferɪk(ə)l/<,>/ˈsfɪrɪkəl/<,>adj.球形的/adj.球面的<,>The Earth is not perfectly spherical.<,>地球并非完美的球形。<,>We bought spherical Christmas ornaments.<,>我们买了球形圣诞装饰品。<,>The experiment used spherical containers.<,>实验使用了球形容器。<,>sphere(球体)+ical(形容词后缀)→球形的<,>cylindrical(adj.圆柱形的)/cubical(adj.立方体的)

global<,>/ˈɡləʊb(ə)l/<,>/ˈɡloʊbəl/<,>adj.全球的<,>Climate change is a global issue.<,>气候变化是全球性问题。<,>The company has a global presence.<,>这家公司业务遍布全球。<,>We need global cooperation to solve this.<,>我们需要全球合作来解决这个问题。<,>globe(地球)+al(形容词后缀)→全球的<,>local(adj.地方的)/glocal(adj.全球本土化的)

Jupiter<,>/ˈdʒuːpɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒupɪtər/<,>n.木星/n.丘庇特<,>Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system.<,>木星是太阳系中最大的行星。<,>In Roman mythology, Jupiter was the king of gods.<,>在罗马神话中，丘庇特是众神之王。<,>The Jupiter probe sent back amazing images.<,>木星探测器传回了惊人的图像。<,>来自罗马主神朱庇特的名字<,>Jovian(adj.木星的)/Juno(朱诺，朱庇特之妻)
plea<,>/pliː/<,>/pli/<,>n.请愿/n.请求/n.恳求<,>He made a heartfelt plea for help.<,>他真诚地请求帮助。<,>The defendant entered a plea of not guilty.<,>被告提出无罪抗辩。<,>Her plea for mercy moved the judge.<,>她恳求宽恕打动了法官。<,>plea与please(请)同源<,>plead(v.恳求)/pleat(n.褶)

petition<,>/pəˈtɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/pəˈtɪʃən/<,>n.请愿/v.向…请愿<,>They started a petition to save the park.<,>他们发起请愿拯救公园。<,>She petitioned the court for custody of the children.<,>她向法院请求获得孩子监护权。<,>Over 10,000 people signed the petition.<,>超过万人签署了这份请愿书。<,>pet(寻求)+ition→寻求支持→请愿<,>competition(n.比赛)/repetition(n.重复)

sight<,>/saɪt/<,>/saɪt/<,>n.景象/n.名胜/n.风景<,>The Grand Canyon is an amazing sight.<,>大峡谷是令人惊叹的景观。<,>She lost her sight in the accident.<,>她在事故中失明了。<,>We visited all the major sights in Paris.<,>我们游览了巴黎所有主要景点。<,>see(看)的名词形式<,>site(n.地点)/cite(v.引用)

mistress<,>/ˈmɪstrəs/<,>/ˈmɪstrəs/<,>n.情妇/n.情人<,>He was rumored to have a mistress.<,>传闻他有个情妇。<,>In the 18th century, many aristocrats kept mistresses.<,>18世纪许多贵族都有情人。<,>She became his mistress while still married.<,>她在已婚时成为了他的情人。<,>mistr(主人)+ess(女性)→女主人→情妇<,>master(n.主人)/mister(先生)

mosque<,>/mɒsk/<,>/mɑːsk/<,>n.清真寺<,>The mosque's minaret towered over the city.<,>清真寺的尖塔高耸于城市上空。<,>Friday prayers are held at the mosque.<,>周五礼拜在清真寺举行。<,>This is one of the oldest mosques in Europe.<,>这是欧洲最古老的清真寺之一。<,>源自阿拉伯语"masjid"(礼拜场所)<,>mask(n.面具)/moss(n.苔藓)

cleanliness<,>/ˈklenlinəs/<,>/ˈklɛnlinəs/<,>n.清洁<,>Cleanliness is next to godliness.<,>清洁近乎神圣。<,>The restaurant prides itself on its cleanliness.<,>这家餐厅以清洁为荣。<,>Personal cleanliness prevents diseases.<,>个人卫生能预防疾病。<,>clean(清洁的)+liness(名词后缀)<,>cleanness(n.干净)/clearness(n.清晰)

inclination<,>/ˌɪnklɪˈneɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌɪnkləˈneɪʃən/<,>n.倾斜/n.点头/n.斜坡<,>The tower has a noticeable inclination.<,>这座塔有明显的倾斜。<,>He showed no inclination to help.<,>他没有表现出帮忙的意思。<,>The road has a steep inclination.<,>这条路有个陡坡。<,>in(向内)+clin(倾斜)+ation→倾斜<,>declination(n.衰退)/recline(v.斜倚)

rap<,>/ræp/<,>/ræp/<,>n.轻敲击声/v.敲击<,>There was a rap at the door.<,>有人轻轻敲门。<,>He rapped his fingers on the table impatiently.<,>他不耐烦地用手指敲桌子。<,>The judge gave him a rap on the knuckles.<,>法官给了他一个轻微警告。<,>拟声词，模仿敲击声<,>wrap(v.包裹)/trap(n.陷阱)

rash<,>/ræʃ/<,>/ræʃ/<,>adj.轻率的/adj.鲁莽的<,>It was rash to make such a decision.<,>做这样的决定太轻率了。<,>Don't be rash - think it through first.<,>别鲁莽，先想清楚。<,>His rash actions caused many problems.<,>他的鲁莽行为引发许多问题。<,>rash原义"皮疹"，引申为"轻率"<,>rush(v.匆忙)/cash(n.现金)

bronze<,>/brɒnz/<,>/brɑːnz/<,>n.青铜色<,>The statue had a beautiful bronze patina.<,>雕像有着美丽的青铜色铜绿。<,>She won a bronze medal at the Olympics.<,>她在奥运会上获得铜牌。<,>The sunset turned the sea to bronze.<,>夕阳把大海染成青铜色。<,>bronze与brown(棕色)同源<,>brass(n.黄铜)/blonde(adj.金色的)
industrious<,>/ɪnˈdʌstriəs/<,>/ɪnˈdʌstriəs/<,>adj.勤劳的/adj.勤奋的<,>She is an industrious student who always completes her assignments on time.<,>她是个勤奋的学生，总是按时完成作业。<,>The industrious workers finished the project ahead of schedule.<,>勤劳的工人们提前完成了项目。<,>His industrious nature earned him a promotion.<,>他勤奋的天性为他赢得了晋升。<,>industry(工业)+ous(形容词后缀)→像工业一样不停运转→勤劳的<,>industrial(adj.工业的)/industriousness(n.勤奋)  

admiration<,>/ˌædməˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌædməˈreɪʃn/<,>n.钦佩/n.赞美/n.羡慕<,>Her talent drew admiration from everyone in the room.<,>她的才华赢得了房间里每个人的钦佩。<,>He looked at the painting with admiration.<,>他带着赞赏的目光看着这幅画。<,>She felt a surge of admiration for his courage.<,>她对他的勇气感到一阵钦佩。<,>admire(钦佩)+ation(名词后缀)→钦佩<,>adoration(n.崇拜)/adulation(n.奉承)  

agreeable<,>/əˈɡriːəbl/<,>/əˈɡriːəbəl/<,>adj.惬意的/adj.同意的<,>The weather was agreeable for a picnic.<,>天气很适合野餐。<,>She found his proposal quite agreeable.<,>她觉得他的提议很令人愉快。<,>He was agreeable to the changes in the plan.<,>他同意对计划进行修改。<,>agree(同意)+able(形容词后缀)→同意的/惬意的<,>disagreeable(adj.不愉快的)/pleasurable(adj.愉悦的)  

section<,>/ˈsekʃn/<,>/ˈsekʃən/<,>n.部分<,>This section of the book is particularly interesting.<,>这本书的这一部分特别有趣。<,>The city is divided into several sections.<,>这座城市被划分为几个区域。<,>Please complete the first section of the form.<,>请填写表格的第一部分。<,>sect(切割)+ion(名词后缀)→部分<,>segment(n.部分)/portion(n.一部分)  

segment<,>/ˈseɡmənt/<,>/ˈseɡmənt/<,>n.切片/n.部分/n.段/n.节<,>The orange was divided into segments.<,>橙子被分成了几瓣。<,>This segment of the market is growing rapidly.<,>市场的这一部分正在快速增长。<,>The TV show had a segment on local news.<,>这个电视节目有一个关于本地新闻的片段。<,>seg(切割)+ment(名词后缀)→部分<,>section(n.部分)/fragment(n.碎片)  

slit<,>/slɪt/<,>/slɪt/<,>v.切开/n.狭长的切口<,>She slit the envelope open with a knife.<,>她用刀划开了信封。<,>There was a narrow slit in the wall.<,>墙上有一条狭长的缝隙。<,>He carefully slit the fabric along the marked line.<,>他小心地沿着标记线剪开了布料。<,>s+lit(点燃)→像点燃时裂开的缝隙→切口<,>slice(v.切片)/split(v.分裂)  

hardy<,>/ˈhɑːdi/<,>/ˈhɑːrdi/<,>adj.强壮的/adj.耐劳的<,>These plants are hardy and can survive in harsh conditions.<,>这些植物很耐寒，能在恶劣的环境中生存。<,>He was a hardy traveler, unafraid of rough terrain.<,>他是个强壮的旅行者，不怕崎岖的地形。<,>The hardy breed of sheep thrives in the mountains.<,>这种耐寒的绵羊在山里茁壮成长。<,>hard(坚硬的)+y(形容词后缀)→强壮的<,>hearty(adj.衷心的)/hardly(adv.几乎不)  

compulsory<,>/kəmˈpʌlsəri/<,>/kəmˈpʌlsəri/<,>adj.强迫的/adj.义务的<,>Attendance at the meeting is compulsory for all employees.<,>所有员工都必须参加会议。<,>Military service is compulsory in some countries.<,>在某些国家，服兵役是义务的。<,>The course includes compulsory assignments.<,>这门课程包括必修作业。<,>com(完全)+puls(驱动)+ory(形容词后缀)→强迫的<,>compulsive(adj.强迫的)/mandatory(adj.强制的)  

constraint<,>/kənˈstreɪnt/<,>/kənˈstreɪnt/<,>n.限制/n.束缚/n.约束<,>Budget constraints forced them to cancel the project.<,>预算限制迫使他们取消了项目。<,>He felt the constraints of his strict upbringing.<,>他感受到了严格教养的束缚。<,>There are legal constraints on how the money can be used.<,>关于资金的使用有法律限制。<,>con(共同)+strain(拉紧)+t→约束<,>restraint(n.克制)/restriction(n.限制)  

mighty<,>/ˈmaɪti/<,>/ˈmaɪti/<,>adj.强大的/adj.巨大的<,>The mighty river flowed through the valley.<,>这条大河穿过山谷。<,>He made a mighty effort to lift the heavy box.<,>他费了很大的力气才抬起那个沉重的箱子。<,>The mighty oak tree stood for centuries.<,>这棵巨大的橡树屹立了几个世纪。<,>might(力量)+y(形容词后缀)→强大的<,>mighty(adv.非常)/almighty(adj.全能的)
thoughtless<,>/ˈθɔːtləs/<,>/ˈθɔtləs/<,>adj.欠考虑的/adj.自私的<,>His thoughtless remarks hurt her feelings.<,>他欠考虑的言论伤害了她的感情。<,>It was thoughtless of him to leave without saying goodbye.<,>他不辞而别真是太自私了。<,>She made a thoughtless decision that caused problems for everyone.<,>她做了一个欠考虑的决定，给大家带来了麻烦。<,>thought(思考)+less(无)→没有思考的→欠考虑的<,>thoughtful(adj.体贴的)/careless(adj.粗心的)

denounce<,>/dɪˈnaʊns/<,>/dɪˈnaʊns/<,>v.谴责/v.声讨/v.告发<,>The minister denounced the violence in his speech.<,>部长在讲话中谴责了暴力行为。<,>She denounced her neighbor for illegal activities.<,>她告发了邻居的非法活动。<,>The treaty was denounced by several countries.<,>该条约遭到多个国家的声讨。<,>de(向下)+nounce(说)→公开指责→谴责<,>announce(v.宣布)/pronounce(v.发音)/renounce(v.放弃)

pious<,>/ˈpaɪəs/<,>/ˈpaɪəs/<,>adj.虔诚的/adj.虔奉宗教的<,>She is a pious woman who prays every day.<,>她是个虔诚的女人，每天祈祷。<,>His pious words didn't match his actions.<,>他虔诚的言辞与行为不符。<,>The pious pilgrims traveled to the holy site.<,>虔诚的朝圣者前往圣地。<,>pi(虔诚)+ous(形容词后缀)→虔诚的<,>impious(adj.不虔诚的)/pity(n.怜悯)

lobby<,>/ˈlɒbi/<,>/ˈlɑːbi/<,>n.前厅/n.(剧院的)门廊<,>We'll meet in the hotel lobby at 7 pm.<,>我们晚上7点在酒店大堂见面。<,>The actors waited in the theater lobby.<,>演员们在剧院门廊等候。<,>There's a coffee shop in the office building lobby.<,>办公楼大堂里有家咖啡店。<,>lob(叶)+by(场所)→像树叶一样聚集的地方→前厅<,>hobby(n.爱好)/lob(n.高球)

consistent<,>/kənˈsɪstənt/<,>/kənˈsɪstənt/<,>adj.前后一致的/adj.连贯的<,>Her story was consistent with the evidence.<,>她的说法与证据一致。<,>He has been consistent in his support for the policy.<,>他一贯支持这项政策。<,>The team needs to show consistent performance.<,>球队需要表现稳定。<,>con(一起)+sist(站立)+ent→站在一起→一致的<,>persistent(adj.坚持的)/insistent(adj.坚决的)

predecessor<,>/ˈpriːdɪsesə(r)/<,>/ˈprɛdəˌsɛsɚ/<,>n.前辈/n.前任者<,>The new CEO improved on his predecessor's work.<,>新CEO在前任工作的基础上有所改进。<,>This model is much faster than its predecessor.<,>这个型号比它的前身快得多。<,>My predecessor left detailed notes for me.<,>我的前任给我留下了详细的笔记。<,>pre(前)+de(离开)+cess(走)+or(人)→走在前面的人→前任<,>successor(n.继任者)/processor(n.处理器)

visa<,>/ˈviːzə/<,>/ˈviːzə/<,>n.签证<,>I need to apply for a tourist visa.<,>我需要申请旅游签证。<,>Her visa expires next month.<,>她的签证下个月到期。<,>The embassy denied his visa application.<,>大使馆拒绝了他的签证申请。<,>vis(看)+a→被查看的证件→签证<,>vista(n.远景)/visor(n.面甲)

modesty<,>/ˈmɒdəsti/<,>/ˈmɑːdəsti/<,>n.谦逊/n.端庄<,>Her modesty prevented her from taking credit.<,>她的谦逊使她不愿居功。<,>He spoke with great modesty about his achievements.<,>他非常谦虚地谈论自己的成就。<,>Dress with modesty is required in the temple.<,>寺庙要求穿着端庄。<,>mod(方式)+esty→适度的方式→谦逊<,>modest(adj.谦虚的)/modern(adj.现代的)

gracious<,>/ˈɡreɪʃəs/<,>/ˈɡreɪʃəs/<,>adj.谦和的<,>The host was gracious to all the guests.<,>主人对所有客人都很谦和。<,>She gave a gracious smile to the reporters.<,>她向记者们露出谦和的微笑。<,>His gracious manner made everyone feel welcome.<,>他谦和的态度让每个人都感到受欢迎。<,>grace(优雅)+ious→优雅而谦和的<,>gracious(adj.亲切的)/graceful(adj.优雅的)

migrate<,>/maɪˈɡreɪt/<,>/ˈmaɪɡreɪt/<,>v.迁移/v.移居<,>Many birds migrate south for the winter.<,>许多鸟类冬季南迁。<,>His family migrated to Canada last year.<,>他的家人去年移居加拿大。<,>Workers migrate to cities for better jobs.<,>工人们为更好的工作迁移到城市。<,>migr(移动)+ate→移动→迁移<,>immigrate(v.移民入境)/emigrate(v.移民出境)
kilowatt<,>/ˈkɪləwɒt/<,>/ˈkɪləwɑːt/<,>n.千瓦（特）<,>The solar panel produces 5 kilowatts of power.<,>这块太阳能电池板能产生5千瓦的电力。<,>Our electricity bill is measured in kilowatt-hours.<,>我们的电费是按千瓦时计算的。<,>A typical hairdryer uses about 1.5 kilowatts.<,>普通吹风机功率约为1.5千瓦。<,>kilo(千)+watt(瓦特)→千瓦<,>kilometer(n.千米)/kilobyte(n.千字节)

pertinent<,>/ˈpɜːtɪnənt/<,>/ˈpɜːrtnənt/<,>adj.恰当的/adj.有关的<,>She asked several pertinent questions about the project.<,>她就这个项目提出了几个切中要害的问题。<,>This information is not pertinent to our discussion.<,>这个信息与我们的讨论无关。<,>His remarks were brief but pertinent.<,>他的评论简短但中肯。<,>per(完全)+tin(保持)+ent→完全保持相关的→恰当的<,>impertinent(adj.无礼的)/permanent(adj.永久的)

apt<,>/æpt/<,>/æpt/<,>adj.恰当的/adj.聪明的<,>That's an apt description of the situation.<,>那是对形势的恰当描述。<,>She's apt at solving difficult problems.<,>她善于解决难题。<,>The word "fast" is apt to describe his running speed.<,>用"快"来形容他的跑步速度很恰当。<,>apt本身就有"恰当"的意思<,>adept(adj.熟练的)/aptitude(n.天资)

utensil<,>/juːˈtensl/<,>/juːˈtensl/<,>n.器皿/n.用具<,>Kitchen utensils include knives, forks and spoons.<,>厨房用具包括刀、叉和勺子。<,>She bought some new cooking utensils.<,>她买了一些新的烹饪用具。<,>Plastic utensils are convenient for picnics.<,>塑料餐具适合野餐使用。<,>ut(用)+ensil(物品)→使用的物品→用具<,>essential(adj.必要的)/utensil与tool(n.工具)同义

maple<,>/ˈmeɪpl/<,>/ˈmeɪpl/<,>n.槭树/n.枫树<,>The maple leaves turn red in autumn.<,>枫叶在秋天变红。<,>Maple syrup is made from the sap of maple trees.<,>枫糖浆是从枫树汁液中提取的。<,>Canada's flag features a red maple leaf.<,>加拿大国旗上有一片红色枫叶。<,>map(地图)+le→加拿大地图像枫叶→枫树<,>apple(n.苹果)/map(n.地图)

follower<,>/ˈfɒləʊə(r)/<,>/ˈfɑːloʊər/<,>n.信徒/n.追随者<,>He has thousands of followers on social media.<,>他在社交媒体上有数千名粉丝。<,>The religious leader and his followers gathered for prayer.<,>宗教领袖和他的信徒们聚集在一起祈祷。<,>Early followers of the movement faced persecution.<,>该运动的早期追随者曾遭受迫害。<,>follow(跟随)+er(人)→追随者<,>following(adj.接下来的)/follower与fan(n.粉丝)同义

siren<,>/ˈsaɪrən/<,>/ˈsaɪrən/<,>n.汽笛/n.警报器<,>The ambulance siren woke me up.<,>救护车的警笛声把我吵醒了。<,>When the air raid siren sounds, go to the shelter.<,>空袭警报响起时，请前往避难所。<,>In Greek mythology, sirens lured sailors to their deaths.<,>希腊神话中，海妖用歌声引诱水手走向死亡。<,>siren原指希腊神话中的海妖，现指警报声<,>siren与alarm(n.警报)同义

motel<,>/məʊˈtel/<,>/moʊˈtel/<,>n.汽车游客旅馆<,>We stayed at a roadside motel during our trip.<,>我们旅行时住在路边的一家汽车旅馆。<,>Motels usually have parking spaces near the rooms.<,>汽车旅馆通常在房间附近设有停车位。<,>The motel offers basic amenities at affordable prices.<,>这家汽车旅馆以实惠的价格提供基本设施。<,>motor(汽车)+hotel(旅馆)→汽车旅馆<,>hotel(n.酒店)/hostel(n.青年旅社)

garage<,>/ˈɡærɑːʒ/<,>/ɡəˈrɑːʒ/<,>n.汽车修理站<,>My car is in the garage for repairs.<,>我的车在修理厂维修。<,>He keeps his tools in the garage.<,>他把工具放在车库里。<,>We rented a house with a two-car garage.<,>我们租了一栋带双车位车库的房子。<,>gar(保护)+age(场所)→保护车的场所→车库<,>garbage(n.垃圾)/garage与workshop(n.修理厂)同义

motorway<,>/ˈməʊtəweɪ/<,>/ˈmoʊtərweɪ/<,>n.汽车道/n.快车路<,>There was heavy traffic on the motorway this morning.<,>今天早上高速公路上交通拥堵。<,>The speed limit on this motorway is 120 km/h.<,>这条高速公路的限速是每小时120公里。<,>We took the motorway to save time.<,>我们走高速公路以节省时间。<,>motor(汽车)+way(道路)→汽车专用道路<,>freeway(n.高速公路)/highway(n.公路)
hitherto<,>/ˌhɪðəˈtuː/<,>/ˌhɪðərˈtuː/<,>adv.迄今/adv.到目前为止<,>Hitherto, we have not encountered any major issues.<,>迄今为止，我们还没有遇到任何重大问题。<,>This was a hitherto unknown species of butterfly.<,>这是一种迄今未知的蝴蝶种类。<,>Hitherto, his contributions have gone unnoticed.<,>到目前为止，他的贡献一直未被注意到。<,>hi(嗨)+the(那个)+to(到)→嗨，那个到现在→迄今<,>heretofore(adv. 在此之前)/henceforth(adv. 从今以后)

barometer<,>/bəˈrɒmɪtə(r)/<,>/bəˈrɑːmɪtər/<,>n.气压计/n.晴雨表<,>The barometer is falling, which indicates a storm is coming.<,>气压计在下降，这表明暴风雨即将来临。<,>Public opinion is often seen as a barometer of social change.<,>公众舆论常被视为社会变革的晴雨表。<,>He checked the barometer before planning the outdoor event.<,>他在计划户外活动前查看了气压计。<,>baro(重量)+meter(测量)→测量重量的仪器→气压计<,>thermometer(n. 温度计)/hydrometer(n. 比重计)

pant<,>/pænt/<,>/pænt/<,>v.气喘<,>After running up the stairs, he was panting heavily.<,>跑上楼梯后，他气喘吁吁。<,>The dog panted in the heat of the summer sun.<,>狗在夏日炎热的阳光下喘着气。<,>She paused to pant for breath after the intense workout.<,>剧烈运动后，她停下来喘口气。<,>pan(平底锅)+t(像汗滴)→像平底锅上滴汗→气喘<,>pants(n. 裤子)/pint(n. 品脱)

jack<,>/dʒæk/<,>/dʒæk/<,>n.起重器/n.传动装置<,>We used a jack to lift the car and change the tire.<,>我们用千斤顶抬起汽车更换轮胎。<,>The mechanic adjusted the jack to reach the right height.<,>机械师调整千斤顶以达到合适的高度。<,>The machine's jack was damaged and needed replacement.<,>机器的传动装置损坏了，需要更换。<,>jack(人名)+up(向上)→杰克向上→起重器<,>hijack(v. 劫持)/jacket(n. 夹克)

scratch<,>/skrætʃ/<,>/skrætʃ/<,>n.划痕/n.划伤<,>There was a deep scratch on the surface of the table.<,>桌面上有一道很深的划痕。<,>Be careful not to leave any scratches on the new car.<,>小心别在新车上留下任何划痕。<,>The cat left a scratch on my arm.<,>猫在我的手臂上留下了一道抓痕。<,>sc(拼音“撕开”)+ratch(近似“抓”)→撕开抓→划痕<,>snatch(v. 抢夺)/sketch(n. 草图)

count<,>/kaʊnt/<,>/kaʊnt/<,>n.起诉理由/n.罪状<,>The prosecutor listed all the counts against the defendant.<,>检察官列出了对被告的所有指控。<,>He was found guilty on three counts of fraud.<,>他被判犯有三项欺诈罪。<,>Each count in the indictment carries a maximum penalty of five years.<,>起诉书中的每一项罪名最高可判处五年徒刑。<,>count(计数)→罪名计数→罪状<,>account(n. 账户)/discount(n. 折扣)

message<,>/ˈmesɪdʒ/<,>/ˈmesɪdʒ/<,>n.启示/n.要旨/n.教训<,>The story carries an important message about kindness.<,>这个故事传达了一个关于善良的重要启示。<,>What's the main message of the speech?<,>演讲的主要要旨是什么？<,>The failure taught him a valuable message about perseverance.<,>这次失败给了他关于坚持的宝贵教训。<,>mess(混乱)+age(年龄)→混乱年龄中领悟→启示<,>massage(n. 按摩)/passage(n. 段落)

enlighten<,>/ɪnˈlaɪtn/<,>/ɪnˈlaɪtn/<,>v.启发/v.开导/v.启蒙<,>The teacher's words enlightened me on the subject.<,>老师的话让我对这个课题有了启发。<,>He traveled to enlighten himself about different cultures.<,>他旅行以开导自己了解不同的文化。<,>The book aims to enlighten readers about environmental issues.<,>这本书旨在启蒙读者了解环境问题。<,>en(使)+light(光)+en(动词后缀)→使有光→启发<,>lighten(v. 减轻)/brighten(v. 照亮)

implore<,>/ɪmˈplɔː(r)/<,>/ɪmˈplɔːr/<,>v.乞求/v.恳求/v.哀求<,>She implored the judge for mercy.<,>她恳求法官宽恕。<,>The child implored his parents to let him stay up late.<,>孩子哀求父母让他晚点睡。<,>He implored his friend to tell the truth.<,>他乞求朋友说出真相。<,>im(进入)+plore(流出)→内心流出→哀求<,>explore(v. 探索)/deplore(v. 谴责)

knight<,>/naɪt/<,>/naɪt/<,>n.骑士/n.武士/n.爵士<,>The knight rode bravely into battle.<,>骑士勇敢地骑马投入战斗。<,>He was made a knight by the queen for his services.<,>他因功绩被女王封为爵士。<,>The samurai is Japan's version of the European knight.<,>武士是日本版的欧洲骑士。<,>k(国王)+night(夜晚)→国王夜晚的守卫→骑士<,>night(n. 夜晚)/knot(n. 结)
marvel<,>/ˈmɑːv(ə)l/<,>/ˈmɑːrv(ə)l/<,>n.奇迹/n.惊奇/v.惊奇<,>The Grand Canyon is a natural marvel.<,>大峡谷是一个自然奇迹。<,>She marveled at the beauty of the sunset.<,>她对日落的美丽感到惊奇。<,>His invention is a marvel of modern technology.<,>他的发明是现代技术的奇迹。<,>mar(大海)+vel(看)→像大海一样令人惊叹→奇迹<,>marvelous(adj.惊人的)/marble(n.大理石)/marsh(n.沼泽)  

subsequently<,>/ˈsʌbsɪkwəntli/<,>/ˈsʌbsɪkwəntli/<,>adv.其后/adv.其次/adv.接着<,>He failed the exam and subsequently dropped out of school.<,>他考试不及格，随后辍学了。<,>The team lost the first game but subsequently won the championship.<,>球队输了第一场比赛，但接着赢得了冠军。<,>She apologized and subsequently corrected her mistake.<,>她道了歉，随后纠正了错误。<,>sub(下面)+sequent(跟随)+ly→随后发生→接着<,>consequently(adv.因此)/sequent(adj.连续的)/sequential(adj.顺序的)  

cheat<,>/tʃiːt/<,>/tʃiːt/<,>n.欺诈/n.骗取/v.欺骗<,>He was caught cheating on the test.<,>他考试作弊被抓了。<,>Don't let anyone cheat you out of your money.<,>别让任何人骗走你的钱。<,>The company was accused of cheating its customers.<,>这家公司被指控欺骗顾客。<,>chat(聊天)+eat(吃)→用聊天和吃来分散注意力→欺骗<,>cheater(n.骗子)/cheap(adj.便宜的)/cheese(n.奶酪)  

periodical<,>/ˌpɪəriˈɒdɪk(ə)l/<,>/ˌpɪriˈɑːdɪk(ə)l/<,>n.期刊/n.杂志<,>She subscribes to a scientific periodical.<,>她订阅了一本科学期刊。<,>The library has a wide collection of periodicals.<,>图书馆有大量的期刊收藏。<,>This article was published in a monthly periodical.<,>这篇文章发表在一本月刊上。<,>period(周期)+ical→定期出版的→期刊<,>periodic(adj.周期的)/period(n.时期)/periodicity(n.周期性)  

currently<,>/ˈkʌrəntli/<,>/ˈkɜːrəntli/<,>adv.当前<,>He is currently working on a new project.<,>他目前正在做一个新项目。<,>The store is currently closed for renovations.<,>这家商店目前因装修而关闭。<,>Currently, the weather is perfect for hiking.<,>目前天气非常适合徒步旅行。<,>current(当前的)+ly→当前地<,>currency(n.货币)/current(n.水流)/currant(n.醋栗)  

universally<,>/ˌjuːnɪˈvɜːsəli/<,>/ˌjuːnɪˈvɜːrsəli/<,>adv.普遍地/adv.一般地<,>This rule is universally accepted.<,>这条规则被普遍接受。<,>The film was universally praised by critics.<,>这部电影受到评论家的一致好评。<,>His theory is not universally applicable.<,>他的理论并不普遍适用。<,>universal(普遍的)+ly→普遍地<,>universe(n.宇宙)/university(n.大学)/universality(n.普遍性)  

bushel<,>/ˈbʊʃ(ə)l/<,>/ˈbʊʃ(ə)l/<,>n.蒲式耳（容量单位）<,>A bushel of apples weighs about 48 pounds.<,>一蒲式耳苹果大约重48磅。<,>They harvested twenty bushels of wheat this year.<,>他们今年收获了20蒲式耳小麦。<,>The price of corn is $5 per bushel.<,>玉米的价格是每蒲式耳5美元。<,>bush(灌木)+el→像灌木丛一样堆起来的量→蒲式耳<,>bushel(n.蒲式耳)/busy(adj.忙碌的)/bush(n.灌木)  

raisin<,>/ˈreɪz(ə)n/<,>/ˈreɪz(ə)n/<,>n.葡萄干<,>She added raisins to the oatmeal cookies.<,>她在燕麦饼干里加了葡萄干。<,>Raisins are dried grapes.<,>葡萄干是晒干的葡萄。<,>He sprinkled raisins on his cereal.<,>他在麦片上撒了些葡萄干。<,>rais(raise升起)+in→晒干的葡萄→葡萄干<,>raising(n.养育)/raisin(n.葡萄干)/reason(n.原因)  

fracture<,>/ˈfræktʃə(r)/<,>/ˈfræktʃər/<,>n.破裂/n.裂痕/v.破裂<,>The X-ray showed a fracture in his arm.<,>X光显示他的手臂有骨折。<,>The earthquake caused fractures in the building.<,>地震导致建筑物出现裂痕。<,>The glass fractured when it hit the floor.<,>玻璃掉到地上时破裂了。<,>fract(打破)+ure→破裂<,>fraction(n.分数)/fractal(n.分形)/fractious(adj.易怒的)  

destructive<,>/dɪˈstrʌktɪv/<,>/dɪˈstrʌktɪv/<,>adj.破坏（性）的/adj.危害的<,>The hurricane was highly destructive.<,>飓风破坏性极大。<,>Smoking is destructive to your health.<,>吸烟对健康有害。<,>The fire caused destructive damage to the forest.<,>大火对森林造成了毁灭性破坏。<,>de(向下)+struct(建造)+ive→破坏性的<,>destruction(n.破坏)/constructive(adj.建设性的)/structure(n.结构)
bankrupt<,>/ˈbæŋkrʌpt/<,>/ˈbæŋkrʌpt/<,>adj.破产的/v.使破产<,>The company went bankrupt last year.<,>这家公司去年破产了。<,>His extravagant lifestyle bankrupted him.<,>他奢侈的生活方式使他破产了。<,>The recession bankrupted many small businesses.<,>经济衰退使许多小企业破产。<,>bank(银行)+rupt(破裂)→银行账户破裂→破产<,>rupture(n.破裂/v.使破裂)/corrupt(adj.腐败的/v.使腐败)

persecute<,>/ˈpɜːsɪkjuːt/<,>/ˈpɜːrsɪkjuːt/<,>v.迫害/v.残害<,>Many people were persecuted for their religious beliefs.<,>许多人因宗教信仰而受到迫害。<,>The dictator persecuted political dissidents.<,>独裁者迫害政治异见者。<,>She felt persecuted by her colleagues.<,>她觉得被同事迫害。<,>per(完全)+secut(跟随)→一直跟随→迫害<,>prosecute(v.起诉/v.检举)/persecution(n.迫害)

incline<,>/ɪnˈklaɪn/<,>/ɪnˈklaɪn/<,>n.坡度<,>The road has a steep incline.<,>这条路有一个陡峭的坡度。<,>She walked up the incline slowly.<,>她慢慢地走上斜坡。<,>The treadmill can adjust its incline.<,>跑步机可以调整坡度。<,>in(向内)+cline(倾斜)→向内倾斜→坡度<,>decline(v.下降/n.衰退)/recline(v.斜倚)

flask<,>/flɑːsk/<,>/flæsk/<,>n.瓶<,>He poured the water from the flask.<,>他从瓶子里倒出水。<,>The scientist used a flask in the experiment.<,>科学家在实验中使用了一个烧瓶。<,>She carried a flask of tea with her.<,>她随身带着一瓶茶。<,>fl(流动)+ask(问)→流动的容器→瓶<,>flash(n.闪光/v.闪现)/flask(n.烧瓶)

tack<,>/tæk/<,>/tæk/<,>n.平头钉/v.钉住<,>He used a tack to pin the notice on the board.<,>他用一个平头钉把通知钉在板上。<,>She tacked the fabric together before sewing.<,>她在缝纫前把布料钉在一起。<,>The sailor tacked the sail to change direction.<,>水手调整帆的方向。<,>t(钉)+ack(动作)→钉的动作→平头钉<,>tackle(v.处理/n.滑车)/stack(n.堆/v.堆积)

terrace<,>/ˈterəs/<,>/ˈterəs/<,>n.平台/n.阳台/n.露台<,>They had dinner on the terrace.<,>他们在露台上吃晚饭。<,>The house has a beautiful terrace with a view.<,>房子有一个带美景的漂亮露台。<,>The rice fields are built in terraces.<,>稻田是梯田式的。<,>terr(地)+ace(名词后缀)→地上的平台→露台<,>terrain(n.地形)/territory(n.领土)

civilian<,>/sɪˈvɪliən/<,>/sɪˈvɪliən/<,>n.平民/adj.平民的<,>The civilians were evacuated from the war zone.<,>平民从战区撤离。<,>He works as a civilian employee in the army.<,>他在军队中担任文职雇员。<,>Civilian casualties must be minimized.<,>必须尽量减少平民伤亡。<,>civil(公民的)+ian(人)→公民→平民<,>military(adj.军事的/n.军队)/civil(adj.公民的)

tranquil<,>/ˈtræŋkwɪl/<,>/ˈtræŋkwɪl/<,>adj.平静的/adj.稳定的<,>The lake was tranquil in the morning.<,>早晨的湖面很平静。<,>She has a tranquil personality.<,>她性格沉稳。<,>The tranquil atmosphere helped him relax.<,>宁静的氛围帮助他放松。<,>tran(跨越)+quil(安静)→非常安静→平静的<,>quiet(adj.安静的)/calm(adj.平静的)

equation<,>/ɪˈkweɪʒn/<,>/ɪˈkweɪʒn/<,>n.平衡/n.反应式<,>The equation of supply and demand affects prices.<,>供求平衡影响价格。<,>He solved the chemical equation quickly.<,>他很快解出了这个化学反应式。<,>Life is not a simple equation.<,>生活不是一个简单的平衡。<,>equ(平等)+ation(名词后缀)→平等状态→平衡<,>equate(v.等同)/equator(n.赤道)

equilibrium<,>/ˌiːkwɪˈlɪbriəm/<,>/ˌiːkwɪˈlɪbriəm/<,>n.平衡/n.均衡论<,>The market is in equilibrium now.<,>市场现在处于平衡状态。<,>She lost her equilibrium and fell.<,>她失去平衡摔倒了。<,>The chemical reaction reached equilibrium.<,>化学反应达到了平衡。<,>equi(平等)+libr(平衡)+ium(状态)→平衡状态<,>libra(n.天秤座)/liberate(v.解放)
commonplace<,>/ˈkɒmənpleɪs/<,>/ˈkɑːmənpleɪs/<,>adj.平凡的/n.平常话<,>His speech was full of commonplace remarks.<,>他的演讲充满了陈词滥调。<,>The idea was once revolutionary but is now commonplace.<,>这个想法曾经是革命性的，但现在很普通。<,>She dismissed his comment as mere commonplace.<,>她认为他的评论只是老生常谈。<,>common(普通的)+place(地方)→普通的地方→平凡的<,>commonwealth(n.联邦)/commonality(n.共性)/commoner(n.平民)  

frequency<,>/ˈfriːkwənsi/<,>/ˈfriːkwənsi/<,>n.频繁/n.频率<,>The frequency of earthquakes in this region is alarming.<,>这个地区地震的频率令人担忧。<,>He visits his parents with increasing frequency.<,>他越来越频繁地看望父母。<,>The radio station broadcasts at a frequency of 98.6 MHz.<,>这个电台以98.6兆赫的频率广播。<,>frequent(频繁的)+cy(名词后缀)→频率<,>frequent(adj.频繁的)/sequence(n.顺序)/consequence(n.结果)  

barren<,>/ˈbærən/<,>/ˈbærən/<,>adj.贫瘠的/adj.不孕的<,>The barren land could not support crops.<,>这片贫瘠的土地无法种植庄稼。<,>After years of trying, they discovered she was barren.<,>经过多年的尝试，他们发现她不孕。<,>The desert is a barren wasteland.<,>沙漠是一片贫瘠的荒地。<,>bar(障碍)+ren(人)→阻碍人生活的地方→贫瘠的<,>baron(n.男爵)/barrel(n.桶)/barrier(n.障碍)  

float<,>/fləʊt/<,>/floʊt/<,>n.漂浮物/n.浮标<,>The children played with a float in the pool.<,>孩子们在游泳池里玩浮漂。<,>The fisherman's float bobbed on the water.<,>渔夫的浮标在水面上晃动。<,>We used a float to cross the river.<,>我们用木筏渡河。<,>fl(流动)+oat(像船)→漂浮物<,>flood(n.洪水)/flock(n.群)/flout(v.飘动)  

bleach<,>/bliːtʃ/<,>/bliːtʃ/<,>v.漂白/v.变白<,>She bleached her hair blonde.<,>她把头发漂成金色。<,>The sun bleached the curtains over time.<,>随着时间的推移，太阳使窗帘褪色。<,>Use bleach to disinfect the surface.<,>用漂白剂给表面消毒。<,>bleak(暗淡的)+ch→使变白<,>bleak(adj.暗淡的)/bleat(v.咩咩叫)/breach(n.违反)  

flake<,>/fleɪk/<,>/fleɪk/<,>n.片/n.薄片<,>Snow flakes were falling gently.<,>雪花轻轻飘落。<,>Add some chocolate flakes to the cake.<,>在蛋糕上加些巧克力片。<,>The paint is starting to flake off.<,>油漆开始剥落。<,>fl(飞)+ake(像雪)→雪花片<,>fake(adj.假的)/flare(v.闪耀)/flame(n.火焰)  

deflection<,>/dɪˈflekʃn/<,>/dɪˈflekʃn/<,>n.偏斜/n.偏差<,>The deflection of the light was measured.<,>光的偏斜被测量了。<,>There was a slight deflection in the missile's path.<,>导弹的路径有轻微偏差。<,>The wall prevented the deflection of sound.<,>墙阻止了声音的偏转。<,>de(离开)+flect(弯曲)+ion→偏斜<,>reflection(n.反射)/inflection(n.屈折)/flexible(adj.灵活的)  

prejudice<,>/ˈpredʒədɪs/<,>/ˈpredʒədɪs/<,>n.偏见/n.损害<,>He has a prejudice against foreigners.<,>他对外国人有偏见。<,>The lawsuit was dismissed without prejudice.<,>诉讼被无损害地驳回。<,>Her testimony was free from prejudice.<,>她的证词没有偏见。<,>pre(预先)+judice(判断)→偏见<,>judge(n.法官)/justice(n.正义)/jury(n.陪审团)  

adjacent<,>/əˈdʒeɪsnt/<,>/əˈdʒeɪsnt/<,>adj.毗连的/adj.紧接着的<,>Our hotel room was adjacent to the beach.<,>我们的酒店房间毗连海滩。<,>The adjacent buildings were damaged in the fire.<,>毗连的建筑物在火灾中受损。<,>Please sit in the adjacent seat.<,>请坐在旁边的座位上。<,>ad(向)+jacent(躺)→向...躺→毗连的<,>adjoin(v.毗连)/adjective(n.形容词)/adjust(v.调整)  

cape<,>/keɪp/<,>/keɪp/<,>n.披肩/n.海角<,>She wore a red cape to the party.<,>她穿了一件红色披肩去参加派对。<,>Cape of Good Hope is a famous landmark.<,>好望角是一个著名的地标。<,>The superhero's cape fluttered in the wind.<,>超级英雄的披肩在风中飘扬。<,>cap(头)+e→披在头上的→披肩<,>cap(n.帽子)/cape(v.跳跃)/caper(n.跳跃)
clash<,>/klæʃ/<,>/klæʃ/<,>n.冲突/n.抵触/n.碰撞声<,>There was a clash between the two teams during the match.<,>比赛期间两队发生了冲突。<,>The clash of opinions led to a heated debate.<,>意见的抵触引发了一场激烈的辩论。<,>We heard the clash of metal from the construction site.<,>我们听到建筑工地传来金属碰撞的声音。<,>cl(碰撞)+ash(灰烬)→碰撞产生灰烬→冲突<,>crash(v.碰撞/n.坠毁)/smash(v.打碎/n.破碎声)

collide<,>/kəˈlaɪd/<,>/kəˈlaɪd/<,>v.碰撞/v.冲突/v.抵触<,>The two cars collided at the intersection.<,>两辆车在十字路口相撞。<,>His interests collide with his responsibilities.<,>他的兴趣与责任相冲突。<,>Their opinions collided during the meeting.<,>会议期间他们的意见发生了抵触。<,>col(共同)+lide(滑)→一起滑向→碰撞<,>collision(n.碰撞)/collude(v.共谋)/slide(v.滑动)

ingredient<,>/ɪnˈɡriːdiənt/<,>/ɪnˈɡridiənt/<,>n.配料/n.成分<,>Flour is the main ingredient in bread.<,>面粉是面包的主要成分。<,>This recipe requires several exotic ingredients.<,>这个食谱需要几种异国配料。<,>Trust is an essential ingredient in any relationship.<,>信任是任何关系中的重要成分。<,>in(进入)+gred(走)+ient→走进去的东西→成分<,>gredient(错误拼写)/congredient(数学术语)

shell<,>/ʃel/<,>/ʃɛl/<,>n.炮弹/n.猎枪子弹<,>The artillery fired hundreds of shells during the battle.<,>战斗期间炮兵发射了数百发炮弹。<,>He loaded his shotgun with shells for hunting.<,>他给猎枪装上子弹准备打猎。<,>The beach was covered with beautiful seashells.<,>海滩上布满了美丽的贝壳。<,>shell(贝壳)→形状相似→炮弹<,>bullet(n.子弹)/pellet(n.小球)/missile(n.导弹)

battery<,>/ˈbætəri/<,>/ˈbætəri/<,>n.炮组/n.排炮<,>The coastal defense has several powerful batteries.<,>海岸防御有几组强大的炮组。<,>A battery of cameras recorded the event.<,>一排摄像机记录了这个事件。<,>My phone battery needs charging.<,>我手机需要充电了。<,>bat(打)+tery→连续打击的武器→炮组<,>battle(n.战斗)/barter(v.易货)/buttery(adj.含奶油的)

foam<,>/fəʊm/<,>/foʊm/<,>n.泡沫塑料/n.泡沫<,>The ocean waves were topped with white foam.<,>海浪顶端覆盖着白色泡沫。<,>This mattress is made of memory foam.<,>这个床垫是用记忆泡沫塑料做的。<,>The beer had a thick layer of foam.<,>啤酒有一层厚厚的泡沫。<,>foam(发音似"浮沫")→浮在水面的泡沫<,>fame(n.名声)/form(n.形式)/fume(n.烟雾)

bypass<,>/ˈbaɪpɑːs/<,>/ˈbaɪpæs/<,>n.旁通管/v.绕过<,>The surgeon performed a heart bypass operation.<,>外科医生做了心脏搭桥手术。<,>We took a bypass to avoid the city traffic.<,>我们走旁路避开城市交通。<,>The new highway bypasses three small towns.<,>新高速公路绕过了三个小镇。<,>by(旁边)+pass(通过)→从旁边通过→绕过<,>overpass(n.天桥)/underpass(n.地下通道)/passby(n.路人)

limp<,>/lɪmp/<,>/lɪmp/<,>v.蹒跚/n.跛行<,>After the injury, he could only limp home.<,>受伤后，他只能一瘸一拐地回家。<,>The dog had a noticeable limp in its left leg.<,>这只狗左腿明显跛行。<,>Her argument was limp and unconvincing.<,>她的论点软弱无力，没有说服力。<,>lim(界限)+p→超出正常行走界限→跛行<,>lamp(n.灯)/lump(n.肿块)/limb(n.肢体)

stagger<,>/ˈstæɡə(r)/<,>/ˈstæɡər/<,>v.蹒跚/v.使摇晃<,>The drunk man staggered down the street.<,>醉汉摇摇晃晃地走在街上。<,>The news staggered him and he nearly fell.<,>这个消息让他震惊得几乎跌倒。<,>We should stagger our work shifts to avoid crowding.<,>我们应该错开工作时间以避免拥挤。<,>stag(站立)+ger→站立不稳→蹒跚<,>swagger(v.大摇大摆)/scatter(v.分散)/slaughter(n.屠杀)

ascend<,>/əˈsend/<,>/əˈsɛnd/<,>v.攀登/v.登高<,>We will ascend the mountain at dawn.<,>我们将在黎明时分登山。<,>The smoke ascended slowly into the sky.<,>烟雾缓缓升上天空。<,>He ascended to the position of CEO last year.<,>他去年升任CEO职位。<,>a(向上)+scend(爬)→向上爬→攀登<,>descend(v.下降)/transcend(v.超越)/ascendant(adj.上升的)
dispatch<,>/dɪˈspætʃ/<,>/dɪˈspætʃ/<,>v.派遣/v.调度/n.急件<,>The general dispatched troops to the border.<,>将军派遣部队前往边境。<,>Please dispatch this package immediately.<,>请立即发送这个包裹。<,>The news was sent by dispatch.<,>这个消息是通过急件发送的。<,>dis(分开)+patch(固定)→分派出去→派遣<,>despatch(同义词)/patch(n.补丁/v.修补)

faction<,>/ˈfækʃn/<,>/ˈfækʃən/<,>n.派别/n.宗派/n.小集团<,>The party split into several factions.<,>这个政党分裂成了几个派别。<,>He leads a powerful faction within the organization.<,>他在组织内领导着一个强大的小集团。<,>Political factions often disagree on key issues.<,>政治派别经常在关键问题上意见不一。<,>fact(做)+ion(名词后缀)→做事的小团体→派别<,>fiction(n.小说)/fraction(n.分数)

hover<,>/ˈhɒvə(r)/<,>/ˈhʌvər/<,>v.徘徊/v.翱翔/v.盘旋<,>The helicopter hovered above the building.<,>直升机在大楼上空盘旋。<,>She hovered near the door, unsure whether to enter.<,>她在门附近徘徊，不确定是否要进去。<,>Bees hover around flowers to collect nectar.<,>蜜蜂在花朵周围盘旋采集花蜜。<,>h(高)+over(上方)→在上方盘旋<,>cover(v.覆盖)/hovercraft(n.气垫船)

drainage<,>/ˈdreɪnɪdʒ/<,>/ˈdreɪnɪdʒ/<,>n.排水/n.下水道<,>The city's drainage system needs improvement.<,>这个城市的排水系统需要改进。<,>Poor drainage caused flooding in the area.<,>排水不畅导致该地区发生洪水。<,>They installed new drainage pipes in the yard.<,>他们在院子里安装了新的排水管。<,>drain(排水)+age(名词后缀)→排水系统<,>drain(v.排水)/sewage(n.污水)

range<,>/reɪndʒ/<,>/reɪndʒ/<,>v.排列<,>He ranged the books alphabetically on the shelf.<,>他按字母顺序把书排列在书架上。<,>The mountains range along the coast.<,>山脉沿海岸排列。<,>Her interests range from art to science.<,>她的兴趣从艺术到科学范围广泛。<,>ran(跑)+ge→排列成行<,>arrange(v.安排)/change(v.改变)

clap<,>/klæp/<,>/klæp/<,>n.拍手喝采声/n.霹雳声<,>The audience gave a loud clap after the performance.<,>表演结束后观众报以热烈的掌声。<,>A sudden clap of thunder startled us.<,>突然的雷声吓了我们一跳。<,>She acknowledged the applause with a clap.<,>她用掌声回应喝彩。<,>拟声词，模仿拍手的声音<,>slap(v.拍打)/flap(v.拍动)

reptile<,>/ˈreptaɪl/<,>/ˈreptl/<,>n.爬行动物<,>Snakes and lizards are reptiles.<,>蛇和蜥蜴都是爬行动物。<,>The zoo has a special exhibit for reptiles.<,>动物园有一个专门的爬行动物展区。<,>Some reptiles can live for over 100 years.<,>有些爬行动物可以活100年以上。<,>rept(爬行)+ile(能...的)→能爬行的动物<,>amphibian(n.两栖动物)/mammal(n.哺乳动物)

overhear<,>/ˌəʊvəˈhɪə(r)/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈhɪr/<,>v.偶然听到/v.偷听<,>I overheard their conversation by accident.<,>我偶然听到了他们的谈话。<,>She overheard the secret while standing nearby.<,>她站在附近时偷听到了这个秘密。<,>It's rude to overhear private discussions.<,>偷听私人谈话是不礼貌的。<,>over(在上方)+hear(听)→无意中听到<,>overcome(v.克服)/overlook(v.忽视)

ohm<,>/əʊm/<,>/oʊm/<,>n.欧姆<,>The resistor has a value of 100 ohms.<,>这个电阻器的阻值是100欧姆。<,>Ohm's law relates voltage, current and resistance.<,>欧姆定律描述了电压、电流和电阻之间的关系。<,>Measure the circuit's resistance in ohms.<,>用欧姆测量电路的电阻。<,>来自物理学家Georg Ohm的姓氏<,>home(n.家)/foam(n.泡沫)

hostess<,>/ˈhəʊstəs/<,>/ˈhoʊstəs/<,>n.女主人/n.旅馆女老板<,>The hostess welcomed all the guests warmly.<,>女主人热情地欢迎所有客人。<,>She works as a hostess in a luxury hotel.<,>她在一家豪华酒店当女老板。<,>The airline hostess demonstrated safety procedures.<,>空乘人员演示了安全程序。<,>host(主人)+ess(女性)→女主人<,>host(n.主人)/guest(n.客人)
feminine<,>/ˈfemənɪn/<,>/ˈfɛmənɪn/<,>adj.女性的/adj.女子气的<,>She has a very feminine voice.<,>她的声音非常女性化。<,>The dress has a feminine design.<,>这条裙子设计得很女性化。<,>He was criticized for his feminine mannerisms.<,>他因为女性化的举止而受到批评。<,>fem(女性)+ine(形容词后缀)→女性的<,>masculine(adj.男性的)/feminist(n.女权主义者)

waitress<,>/ˈweɪtrəs/<,>/ˈweɪtrəs/<,>n.女侍者/n.女服务员<,>The waitress brought us the menu.<,>女服务员给我们拿来了菜单。<,>She works as a waitress in a cafe.<,>她在一家咖啡馆当女服务员。<,>The waitress was very attentive to our needs.<,>这位女服务员对我们的需求非常关注。<,>wait(等待)+ress(女性后缀)→女服务员<,>waiter(n.男服务员)/hostess(n.女主人)

goddess<,>/ˈɡɒdes/<,>/ˈɡɑːdəs/<,>n.女神<,>Athena was the Greek goddess of wisdom.<,>雅典娜是希腊的智慧女神。<,>They worshipped the goddess of fertility.<,>他们崇拜生育女神。<,>She moved like a goddess on the stage.<,>她在舞台上像女神一样移动。<,>god(神)+dess(女性后缀)→女神<,>god(n.神)/deity(n.神性)

blouse<,>/blaʊz/<,>/blaʊs/<,>n.女衬衫/n.罩衫<,>She wore a silk blouse to the party.<,>她穿了一件丝绸女衬衫去参加聚会。<,>The blouse is too tight for me.<,>这件罩衫对我来说太紧了。<,>Her blouse was stained with coffee.<,>她的女衬衫被咖啡弄脏了。<,>bl(布料)+ouse(后缀)→女式上衣<,>shirt(n.衬衫)/tunic(n.束腰外衣)

coward<,>/ˈkaʊəd/<,>/ˈkaʊərd/<,>adj.懦怯的/adj.胆小的<,>He was too coward to face the challenge.<,>他太懦弱，不敢面对挑战。<,>Don't be such a coward!<,>别这么胆小！<,>The coward ran away from the fight.<,>那个胆小鬼从战斗中逃跑了。<,>cow(吓唬)+ard(人)→被吓到的人→懦夫<,>brave(adj.勇敢的)/timid(adj.胆怯的)

radiator<,>/ˈreɪdieɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈreɪdieɪtər/<,>n.暖气片/n.散热器<,>The radiator in my room is not working.<,>我房间的暖气片坏了。<,>The car's radiator was leaking.<,>汽车的散热器在漏水。<,>She leaned against the warm radiator.<,>她靠在温暖的暖气片上。<,>radi(辐射)+ator(物)→辐射热量的装置<,>heater(n.加热器)/convector(n.对流加热器)

strive<,>/straɪv/<,>/straɪv/<,>v.努力/v.奋斗/v.力求<,>We must strive for excellence.<,>我们必须追求卓越。<,>He strives to improve his skills every day.<,>他每天努力提高自己的技能。<,>They are striving to achieve their goals.<,>他们正在努力实现目标。<,>striv(竞争)+e→努力竞争<,>struggle(v.奋斗)/endeavor(v.努力)

mess<,>/mes/<,>/mɛs/<,>v.弄脏/v.弄乱/v.搞糟<,>Don't mess up the living room!<,>别把客厅弄乱了！<,>The kids messed the kitchen while cooking.<,>孩子们做饭时把厨房弄得一团糟。<,>He messed his hair while running.<,>他跑步时把头发弄乱了。<,>me(我)+ss(乱)→我弄乱了<,>mass(n.大量)/mesh(n.网眼)

distortion<,>/dɪˈstɔːʃn/<,>/dɪˈstɔːrʃn/<,>n.歪曲/n.畸变<,>The newspaper gave a distortion of the facts.<,>报纸歪曲了事实。<,>There's some distortion in the audio recording.<,>录音中有一些畸变。<,>The mirror causes optical distortion.<,>镜子造成了光学畸变。<,>dis(分开)+tort(扭曲)+ion→扭曲分开→畸变<,>contortion(n.扭弯)/deformation(n.变形)

shorten<,>/ˈʃɔːtn/<,>/ˈʃɔːrtn/<,>v.弄短/v.缩小/v.减少<,>Can you shorten this skirt for me?<,>你能帮我把这条裙子改短吗？<,>The days shorten in winter.<,>冬天白天变短。<,>We need to shorten the meeting time.<,>我们需要缩短会议时间。<,>short(短)+en(使)→使变短<,>lengthen(v.延长)/abbreviate(v.缩写)
Saturn<,>/ˈsætɜːn/<,>/ˈsætərn/<,>n.土星<,>Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun.<,>土星是距离太阳第六远的行星。<,>Saturn has beautiful rings around it.<,>土星周围有美丽的光环。<,>The Cassini spacecraft explored Saturn for years.<,>卡西尼号航天器探索土星多年。<,>Sat(坐)+urn(骨灰瓮)→坐落在天空中的土星<,>saturnine(adj.忧郁的)/satyr(n.森林之神)  

milky<,>/ˈmɪlki/<,>/ˈmɪlki/<,>adj.牛奶的/adj.乳白色的<,>She added milky coffee to her morning routine.<,>她将牛奶咖啡加入早晨的日常。<,>The milky way stretched across the night sky.<,>银河横贯夜空。<,>His teeth were milky white.<,>他的牙齿是乳白色的。<,>milk(牛奶)+y(形容词后缀)→像牛奶的<,>milky(乳白色) vs. chalky(白垩色的)  

wrench<,>/rentʃ/<,>/rɛntʃ/<,>v.拧/v.扭伤/n.拧<,>He wrenched the door open with all his strength.<,>他用尽全力拧开了门。<,>The sudden movement wrenched her ankle.<,>突然的动作扭伤了她的脚踝。<,>Keep a wrench in your toolbox for emergencies.<,>工具箱里放一把扳手应急。<,>wr(扭曲)+ench(动作)→拧的动作<,>wrench(v.拧) vs. wrest(v.扭夺)  

wring<,>/rɪŋ/<,>/rɪŋ/<,>v.拧/v.挤/v.扭/v.榨<,>She wrung out the wet towel.<,>她把湿毛巾拧干。<,>He wrung his hands in anxiety.<,>他焦虑地绞着双手。<,>The dictator wrung taxes from the people.<,>独裁者榨取人民的税收。<,>wr(扭曲)+ing(动作)→扭的动作<,>wring(v.拧) vs. ring(n.戒指)  

peer<,>/pɪə(r)/<,>/pɪr/<,>v.凝视<,>The child peered through the keyhole.<,>孩子透过钥匙孔凝视。<,>She peered at the fine print.<,>她眯着眼看小字。<,>Scientists peer into the mysteries of the universe.<,>科学家们探索宇宙的奥秘。<,>p(眼睛)+eer(人)→用眼睛看的人<,>peer(v.凝视) vs. pier(n.码头)  

nickel<,>/ˈnɪkl/<,>/ˈnɪkəl/<,>n.镍/n.镍币<,>Nickel is used in making stainless steel.<,>镍用于制造不锈钢。<,>Can you spare a nickel?<,>能借我五分钱吗？<,>The coin contains 25% nickel.<,>这枚硬币含25%的镍。<,>nick(刻痕)+el(小)→刻痕的小金属<,>nickel(n.镍) vs. pickle(n.泡菜)  

junior<,>/ˈdʒuːniə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒunjər/<,>n.年少者/n.晚辈<,>He is three years my junior.<,>他比我小三岁。<,>Junior staff attended the training.<,>初级员工参加了培训。<,>She played on the junior varsity team.<,>她在少年代表队打球。<,>jun(年轻)+ior(比较级)→更年轻的<,>junior(晚辈) vs. senior(长辈)  

annually<,>/ˈænjuəli/<,>/ˈænjuəli/<,>adv.年年/adv.每年<,>The festival is held annually.<,>这个节日每年举办一次。<,>Employees receive bonuses annually.<,>员工每年获得奖金。<,>The report is published annually.<,>这份报告每年出版。<,>ann(年)+ual(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→每年地<,>annually(每年) vs. daily(每日)  

practicable<,>/ˈpræktɪkəbl/<,>/ˈpræktɪkəbəl/<,>adj.能实行的/adj.适用的<,>The plan is not practicable in winter.<,>这个计划在冬季不可行。<,>We need to find a practicable solution.<,>我们需要找到可行的解决方案。<,>The mountain path is barely practicable.<,>这条山路几乎无法通行。<,>practic(实践)+able(能够)→能够实践的<,>practicable(可行的) vs. practical(实用的)  

capability<,>/ˌkeɪpəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌkeɪpəˈbɪlɪti/<,>n.能力/n.才能<,>The software has advanced capabilities.<,>这个软件有高级功能。<,>She has the capability to lead.<,>她有领导才能。<,>Nuclear capability changed warfare.<,>核能力改变了战争形态。<,>cap(抓住)+ability(能力)→掌握的能力<,>capability(能力) vs. capacity(容量)
basin<,>/ˈbeɪsən/<,>/ˈbeɪsən/<,>n.内海/n.盆地/n.流域<,>The Amazon basin is home to diverse wildlife.<,>亚马逊流域是多种野生动物的家园。<,>She filled the basin with warm water.<,>她在盆里装满了温水。<,>The basin of the Mediterranean is surrounded by three continents.<,>地中海的内海被三大洲环绕。<,>bas(基础)+in(里面)→底部凹陷的容器→盆<,>basic(adj.基础的)/basis(n.基础)/bastion(n.堡垒)  

interior<,>/ɪnˈtɪəriə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈtɪriər/<,>n.内部/adj.内部的<,>The interior of the house was beautifully decorated.<,>房子的内部装修得很漂亮。<,>He specializes in interior design.<,>他专攻室内设计。<,>The car's interior is made of premium leather.<,>这辆车的内部采用优质皮革制成。<,>inter(在...之间)+ior→在其中的部分→内部<,>exterior(n.外部)/inferior(adj.下等的)/anterior(adj.前面的)  

tickle<,>/ˈtɪkl/<,>/ˈtɪkəl/<,>v.挠/v.胳肢/v.逗乐<,>The baby laughed when I tickled her feet.<,>当我挠宝宝的脚时她笑了。<,>This joke really tickled my funny bone.<,>这个笑话真的逗乐了我。<,>Feathers can tickle your skin lightly.<,>羽毛能轻轻挠痒你的皮肤。<,>tick(滴答声)+le(小动作)→像钟表轻触般发痒<,>tackle(v.处理)/pickle(n.泡菜)/fickle(adj.善变的)  

incredible<,>/ɪnˈkredəbl/<,>/ɪnˈkrɛdəbəl/<,>adj.难以置信的/adj.惊人的<,>The acrobat performed incredible stunts.<,>杂技演员表演了惊人的特技。<,>It's incredible how fast technology develops.<,>科技发展速度之快令人难以置信。<,>She has an incredible memory for details.<,>她对细节有着惊人的记忆力。<,>in(不)+cred(相信)+ible→不能相信的<,>credible(adj.可信的)/incredulous(adj.怀疑的)/indelible(adj.去不掉的)  

difficult<,>/ˈdɪfɪkəlt/<,>/ˈdɪfɪˌkʌlt/<,>adj.难以满足的<,>The professor is difficult to please with assignments.<,>这位教授很难对作业满意。<,>This math problem is too difficult for me.<,>这道数学题对我来说太难了。<,>She's going through a difficult phase in her life.<,>她正在经历人生中一段艰难的时期。<,>dif(分开)+fic(做)+ult→事情分开做→困难的<,>different(adj.不同的)/diffident(adj.羞怯的)/deficit(n.赤字)  

refugee<,>/ˌrefjuˈdʒiː/<,>/ˈrɛfjʊˌdʒi/<,>n.难民/n.流亡者<,>The refugee camp provides temporary shelter.<,>难民营提供临时住所。<,>Many refugees fled the war-torn country.<,>许多难民逃离了饱受战争蹂躏的国家。<,>She works for an organization that helps refugees.<,>她为一个帮助难民的组织工作。<,>re(回)+fug(逃)+ee(人)→逃回来的人<,>refuge(n.避难所)/fugitive(n.逃亡者)/effigy(n.肖像)  

pumpkin<,>/ˈpʌmpkɪn/<,>/ˈpʌmpkɪn/<,>n.南瓜<,>We carved funny faces on the pumpkin for Halloween.<,>我们在南瓜上刻了滑稽的脸来庆祝万圣节。<,>Pumpkin pie is a traditional Thanksgiving dessert.<,>南瓜派是传统的感恩节甜点。<,>The pumpkin grew very big in our garden.<,>我们花园里的南瓜长得非常大。<,>pump(泵)+kin(小)→形状像充气泵的蔬菜<,>plumpkin(不存在词)/bumpkin(n.乡巴佬)/plump(adj.丰满的)  

polar<,>/ˈpəʊlə(r)/<,>/ˈpoʊlər/<,>adj.南极的/adj.北极的/adj.极性的<,>Polar bears live in the Arctic region.<,>北极熊生活在北极地区。<,>The Earth's polar ice caps are melting.<,>地球的极地冰盖正在融化。<,>These two opinions are polar opposites.<,>这两种观点截然相反。<,>pole(极地)+ar→极地的<,>solar(adj.太阳的)/polarity(n.极性)/polarize(v.两极分化)  

masculine<,>/ˈmæskjəlɪn/<,>/ˈmæskjəlɪn/<,>adj.男性的<,>He has a very masculine voice.<,>他有着非常阳刚的嗓音。<,>Some cultures associate blue with masculine traits.<,>某些文化将蓝色与男性特质联系起来。<,>The design features clean, masculine lines.<,>这个设计采用了简洁阳刚的线条。<,>mascul(男性)+ine→男性的<,>feminine(adj.女性的)/muscular(adj.肌肉发达的)/mask(n.面具)  

baron<,>/ˈbærən/<,>/ˈbærən/<,>n.男爵/n.贵族/n.巨商<,>The oil baron owns several refineries.<,>这位石油大亨拥有多家炼油厂。<,>Baron is a title of nobility in Britain.<,>男爵是英国的贵族头衔。<,>The media baron controls major newspapers.<,>这位传媒巨头控制着主要报纸。<,>bar(阻挡)+on→阻挡他人的人→有权势者<,>barren(adj.贫瘠的)/barn(n.谷仓)/barony(n.男爵领地)
endurance<,>/ɪnˈdjʊərəns/<,>/ɪnˈdʊrəns/<,>n.耐久力/n.持久力<,>Long-distance runners need great endurance.<,>长跑运动员需要很强的耐力。<,>Her endurance during the marathon was impressive.<,>她在马拉松比赛中的耐力令人印象深刻。<,>The endurance of this material makes it perfect for outdoor use.<,>这种材料的耐久性使其非常适合户外使用。<,>endure(忍受)+ance(名词后缀)→耐力<,>insurance(n.保险)/assurance(n.保证)/endearment(n.亲爱)

sodium<,>/ˈsəʊdiəm/<,>/ˈsoʊdiəm/<,>n.钠<,>Sodium is a highly reactive metal.<,>钠是一种高活性金属。<,>Table salt contains sodium and chlorine.<,>食盐含有钠和氯。<,>Too much sodium in your diet can lead to high blood pressure.<,>饮食中过多的钠会导致高血压。<,>soda(苏打)+ium(化学元素后缀)→钠<,>potassium(n.钾)/calcium(n.钙)/magnesium(n.镁)

pasture<,>/ˈpɑːstʃə(r)/<,>/ˈpæstʃər/<,>n.牧场<,>The cows were grazing in the pasture.<,>牛在牧场上吃草。<,>We walked through the green pasture.<,>我们走过绿色的牧场。<,>The farmer rotates his livestock between different pastures.<,>农民在不同的牧场间轮换放牧。<,>past(喂食)+ure(场所)→喂食的场所→牧场<,>pasture(n.牧场)/pastor(n.牧师)/pasteurize(v.巴氏消毒)

intent<,>/ɪnˈtent/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnt/<,>adj.目不转睛的/adj.热切的<,>She gave him an intent look.<,>她目不转睛地看着他。<,>He was intent on finishing the project on time.<,>他热切地想要按时完成项目。<,>With intent eyes, the child watched the magician's performance.<,>孩子热切地注视着魔术师的表演。<,>in(加强)+tent(伸展)→全神贯注的<,>intend(v.打算)/intense(adj.强烈的)/intention(n.意图)

end<,>/end/<,>/ɛnd/<,>n.目标/n.目的<,>The end justifies the means.<,>目的正当可以不择手段。<,>She worked hard to achieve her end.<,>她努力工作以实现目标。<,>What is the end of this research project?<,>这个研究项目的目的是什么？<,>end(结束)→最终要达到的→目的<,>bend(v.弯曲)/lend(v.借出)/mend(v.修理)

oyster<,>/ˈɔɪstə(r)/<,>/ˈɔɪstər/<,>n.牡蛎<,>He ordered a dozen oysters at the seafood restaurant.<,>他在海鲜餐厅点了一打牡蛎。<,>The world is your oyster.<,>世界任你驰骋。<,>Pearls are formed inside oysters.<,>珍珠是在牡蛎内部形成的。<,>oy(拟声)+ster→牡蛎开合的声音<,>moister(n.潮湿)/roister(v.喧闹)/cloister(n.修道院)

magician<,>/məˈdʒɪʃn/<,>/məˈdʒɪʃən/<,>n.魔法师/n.变戏法的人<,>The magician pulled a rabbit out of the hat.<,>魔术师从帽子里变出一只兔子。<,>He trained for years to become a professional magician.<,>他训练多年成为专业魔术师。<,>The children were amazed by the magician's tricks.<,>孩子们对魔术师的戏法感到惊奇。<,>magic(魔法)+ian(人)→会魔法的人<,>musician(n.音乐家)/technician(n.技术员)/physician(n.医生)

skyscraper<,>/ˈskaɪskreɪpə(r)/<,>/ˈskaɪˌskreɪpər/<,>n.摩天楼<,>New York is famous for its skyscrapers.<,>纽约以其摩天大楼闻名。<,>The new skyscraper dominates the city skyline.<,>新的摩天大楼成为城市天际线的主角。<,>It took three years to build this 80-story skyscraper.<,>建造这座80层的摩天大楼花了三年时间。<,>sky(天空)+scrape(擦)+er→擦着天空的建筑<,>landscaper(n.园艺师)/scrap(n.碎片)/scraper(n.刮刀)

module<,>/ˈmɒdjuːl/<,>/ˈmɑːdʒuːl/<,>n.模块/n.组件<,>This course consists of six modules.<,>这门课程由六个模块组成。<,>The spacecraft was built in separate modules.<,>航天器是分模块建造的。<,>You can add more memory modules to your computer.<,>你可以给电脑添加更多内存模块。<,>mod(模式)+ule(小)→小模式→模块<,>model(n.模型)/modular(adj.模块化的)/modulate(v.调节)

ambiguous<,>/æmˈbɪɡjuəs/<,>/æmˈbɪɡjuəs/<,>adj.模棱两可的/adj.分歧的<,>His answer was deliberately ambiguous.<,>他的回答故意模棱两可。<,>The law is ambiguous on this issue.<,>法律在这个问题上表述模糊。<,>She gave me an ambiguous smile that I couldn't interpret.<,>她给了我一个难以理解的暧昧微笑。<,>ambi(两边)+gu(走)+ous→两边走的→模棱两可的<,>ambitious(adj.有野心的)/ambient(adj.周围的)/ambivalence(n.矛盾心理)
feel<,>/fiːl/<,>/fil/<,>v.摸起来<,>The fabric feels soft against the skin.<,>这种布料摸起来很柔软。<,>I feel a slight breeze on my face.<,>我感觉到脸上有一丝微风。<,>She felt the texture of the paper carefully.<,>她仔细地摸着纸张的质地。<,>fee(费用)+l(联想“了”)→摸起来像钱一样舒服<,>feet(n.脚)/fell(v.砍伐)/flee(v.逃跑)

destiny<,>/ˈdestəni/<,>/ˈdɛstəni/<,>n.命运/n.天数<,>He believes in destiny and fate.<,>他相信命运和天数。<,>It was her destiny to become a great leader.<,>成为伟大的领袖是她的命运。<,>They met by destiny, not by chance.<,>他们的相遇是命中注定，不是偶然。<,>destin(注定)+y(名词后缀)→命运<,>destination(n.目的地)/destitute(adj.穷困的)

doom<,>/duːm/<,>/dum/<,>n.厄运/n.毁灭/v.注定<,>The prophecy foretold doom for the kingdom.<,>预言预示了王国的厄运。<,>Their plan was doomed to fail from the start.<,>他们的计划从一开始就注定失败。<,>The doom of the ancient city came suddenly.<,>这座古城的毁灭来得突然。<,>d(联想“地”)+oom(联想“墓”)→地下坟墓→毁灭<,>boom(n.繁荣/v.迅速发展)/bloom(v.开花/n.花)

proposition<,>/ˌprɒpəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌprɑpəˈzɪʃən/<,>n.命题/n.主题/n.提议<,>He made an interesting business proposition.<,>他提出了一个有趣的商业提议。<,>The proposition was too complex for the students.<,>这个命题对学生来说太复杂了。<,>Let's discuss the main proposition of your thesis.<,>我们来讨论你论文的主要主题。<,>pro(向前)+posit(放置)+ion→向前提出的东西→提议<,>proposal(n.建议)/position(n.位置)

bid<,>/bɪd/<,>/bɪd/<,>v.报价/v.命令<,>He bid $500 for the painting at the auction.<,>他在拍卖会上为这幅画出价500美元。<,>The king bid his knights to prepare for battle.<,>国王命令骑士们准备战斗。<,>She decided to bid on the antique vase.<,>她决定竞标这个古董花瓶。<,>b(联想“币”)+id(身份证)→用身份证报价<,>bit(n.一点)/bidet(n.坐浴盆)

destine<,>/ˈdestɪn/<,>/ˈdɛstɪn/<,>v.命定/v.注定/v.预定<,>She seemed destined for greatness from birth.<,>她似乎从出生就注定伟大。<,>This room is destined to be the nursery.<,>这个房间预定用作育婴室。<,>Their love was destined to overcome all obstacles.<,>他们的爱情注定能克服一切障碍。<,>de(向下)+stine(站立)→命运已定<,>destiny(n.命运)/determine(v.决定)

sensible<,>/ˈsensəbl/<,>/ˈsɛnsəbəl/<,>adj.明显的/adj.感觉得到的<,>There was a sensible drop in temperature overnight.<,>夜间气温明显下降。<,>She gave me some sensible advice.<,>她给了我一些明智的建议。<,>The change in his attitude was quite sensible.<,>他态度的变化相当明显。<,>sens(感觉)+ible(能够)→能够感觉到的<,>sensitive(adj.敏感的)/sensual(adj.感官的)

explicit<,>/ɪkˈsplɪsɪt/<,>/ɪkˈsplɪsɪt/<,>adj.明晰的/adj.直率的<,>She gave explicit instructions for the task.<,>她对这项任务给出了明确的指示。<,>The movie contains explicit language.<,>这部电影包含直白的语言。<,>I need an explicit answer to my question.<,>我需要对我的问题有一个明确的回答。<,>ex(出)+plic(折叠)+it→把折叠的打开→明晰的<,>implicit(adj.含蓄的)/elicit(v.引出)

decidedly<,>/dɪˈsaɪdɪdli/<,>/dɪˈsaɪdɪdli/<,>adv.明确地/adv.坚决地<,>He spoke decidedly about his plans.<,>他明确地谈到了他的计划。<,>She shook her head decidedly in refusal.<,>她坚决地摇头表示拒绝。<,>The team played decidedly better in the second half.<,>球队在下半场表现得明显更好。<,>decide(决定)+d+ly(副词后缀)→决定性地<,>decided(adj.明确的)/decisive(adj.决定性的)

formulation<,>/ˌfɔːmjuˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌfɔrmjəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.表述方式<,>The formulation of this policy took several months.<,>这项政策的表述方式花了几个月时间。<,>His formulation of the problem was very clear.<,>他对这个问题的表述非常清晰。<,>We need to improve the formulation of our marketing message.<,>我们需要改进营销信息的表述方式。<,>form(形式)+ul+ation(名词后缀)→形成表述<,>formation(n.形成)/formula(n.公式)
brightness<,>/ˈbraɪtnəs/<,>/ˈbraɪtnəs/<,>n.明亮/n.辉煌/n.聪明<,>The brightness of the sun made her squint.<,>阳光的明亮使她眯起了眼睛。<,>Her brightness was evident in her quick answers.<,>她的聪明在她迅速的回答中显而易见。<,>The brightness of the stars was breathtaking.<,>星星的辉煌令人叹为观止。<,>bright(明亮的)+ness(名词后缀)→明亮<,>lightness(n.轻盈)/darkness(n.黑暗)

classic<,>/ˈklæsɪk/<,>/ˈklæsɪk/<,>n.名著/adj.不朽的<,>This novel is considered a classic of English literature.<,>这本小说被认为是英国文学的经典之作。<,>She wore a classic black dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件经典的黑裙去参加派对。<,>His work has a classic elegance.<,>他的作品有一种不朽的优雅。<,>class(等级)+ic(形容词后缀)→经典的<,>classical(adj.古典的)/classify(v.分类)

promptly<,>/ˈprɒmptli/<,>/ˈprɑːmptli/<,>adv.敏捷地/adv.迅速地<,>She replied to the email promptly.<,>她迅速回复了邮件。<,>The firemen arrived promptly after the call.<,>消防员在接到电话后迅速赶到。<,>He promptly paid his debts.<,>他敏捷地偿还了债务。<,>prompt(迅速的)+ly(副词后缀)→迅速地<,>prompt(v.促使)/properly(adv.适当地)

sensitivity<,>/ˌsensəˈtɪvəti/<,>/ˌsensəˈtɪvəti/<,>n.敏感性/n.灵敏性<,>Her sensitivity to criticism is well known.<,>她对批评的敏感性众所周知。<,>The device has high sensitivity to light.<,>这个设备对光有很高的灵敏性。<,>He showed great sensitivity to her feelings.<,>他对她的感受表现出极大的敏感性。<,>sensitive(敏感的)+ity(名词后缀)→敏感性<,>sensibility(n.感性)/sentiment(n.情感)

representation<,>/ˌreprɪzenˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌreprɪzenˈteɪʃn/<,>n.描写/n.陈述/n.代表<,>This painting is a representation of rural life.<,>这幅画是对乡村生活的描写。<,>He gave a fair representation of the facts.<,>他对事实进行了公正的陈述。<,>She is the legal representation of the company.<,>她是公司的法律代表。<,>represent(代表)+ation(名词后缀)→代表<,>presentation(n.展示)/repetition(n.重复)

nursery<,>/ˈnɜːsəri/<,>/ˈnɜːrsəri/<,>n.苗圃<,>We bought some plants from the nursery.<,>我们从苗圃买了一些植物。<,>The nursery is full of young trees.<,>苗圃里满是幼树。<,>She works in a plant nursery.<,>她在一家植物苗圃工作。<,>nurse(护理)+ery(场所)→苗圃<,>nursing(n.护理)/nurture(v.养育)

deposition<,>/ˌdepəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌdepəˈzɪʃn/<,>n.免职/n.罢免<,>The deposition of the king led to chaos.<,>国王的免职导致了混乱。<,>They demanded the deposition of the corrupt official.<,>他们要求罢免那个腐败的官员。<,>The deposition was announced yesterday.<,>罢免的消息昨天宣布了。<,>depose(免职)+ition(名词后缀)→免职<,>position(n.位置)/disposition(n.性情)

confidential<,>/ˌkɒnfɪˈdenʃl/<,>/ˌkɑːnfɪˈdenʃl/<,>adj.秘密的/adj.亲信的<,>This information is strictly confidential.<,>这些信息是严格保密的。<,>He is a confidential advisor to the president.<,>他是总统的亲信顾问。<,>Please keep this document confidential.<,>请对这份文件保密。<,>confide(信任)+ential(形容词后缀)→秘密的<,>confident(adj.自信的)/influential(adj.有影响力的)

enchant<,>/ɪnˈtʃɑːnt/<,>/ɪnˈtʃænt/<,>v.迷住/v.用魔法迷惑<,>The beautiful scenery enchanted the visitors.<,>美丽的景色迷住了游客。<,>The fairy enchanted the prince with her magic.<,>仙女用魔法迷惑了王子。<,>She was enchanted by the melody.<,>她被旋律迷住了。<,>en(使)+chant(歌唱)→用歌声迷住<,>chant(v.吟唱)/enhance(v.增强)

fascinate<,>/ˈfæsɪneɪt/<,>/ˈfæsɪneɪt/<,>v.迷住/v.迷人<,>The story fascinated the children.<,>这个故事迷住了孩子们。<,>He was fascinated by her beauty.<,>他被她的美貌迷住了。<,>Science has always fascinated him.<,>科学一直让他着迷。<,>fascin(魔力)+ate(动词后缀)→迷住<,>fascination(n.魅力)/fabricate(v.编造)
superstition<,>/ˌsuːpəˈstɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌsuːpərˈstɪʃ(ə)n/<,>n.迷信/n.迷信行为<,>Many people still believe in superstitions like black cats bringing bad luck.<,>许多人仍然相信黑猫带来厄运之类的迷信。<,>Breaking a mirror is considered a superstition that brings seven years of bad luck.<,>打破镜子被认为是一种会带来七年厄运的迷信。<,>Her fear of the number 13 is just a silly superstition.<,>她对数字13的恐惧只是一种愚蠢的迷信。<,>super(超过)+stit(站)+ion→站在理性之上的→迷信<,>superstitious(adj.迷信的)/tradition(n.传统)/intuition(n.直觉)  

stray<,>/streɪ/<,>/streɪ/<,>v.迷路/adj.迷路的<,>The dog strayed from its home and got lost in the woods.<,>这只狗从家里走失，在树林里迷路了。<,>She picked up a stray cat and decided to adopt it.<,>她收养了一只迷路的猫。<,>Stray bullets from the fight hit nearby buildings.<,>打斗中流弹击中了附近的建筑物。<,>s+tray(盘子)→像盘子里的东西滚出去→偏离<,>stray(v.迷路)/stay(v.停留)/spray(v.喷洒)  

perplex<,>/pəˈpleks/<,>/pərˈpleks/<,>v.迷惑/v.困惑/v.难住<,>The complicated instructions perplexed the new employees.<,>复杂的说明让新员工感到困惑。<,>Her strange behavior perplexed everyone at the party.<,>她奇怪的行为让派对上的每个人都感到困惑。<,>This math problem has perplexed students for years.<,>这道数学题多年来一直难住学生。<,>per(完全)+plex(折叠)→完全折叠→使困惑<,>complex(adj.复杂的)/perplexed(adj.困惑的)/perplexity(n.困惑)  

bewilder<,>/bɪˈwɪldə(r)/<,>/bɪˈwɪldər/<,>v.迷惑/v.把…弄糊涂<,>The sudden change of plans bewildered the team.<,>计划的突然改变让团队感到困惑。<,>The maze was designed to bewilder visitors.<,>这个迷宫的设计就是为了迷惑游客。<,>She looked bewildered by all the technical jargon.<,>她看起来被所有的技术术语弄糊涂了。<,>be(使)+wild(荒野的)+er→使像在荒野中一样迷失<,>bewildering(adj.令人困惑的)/wild(adj.野生的)/wilder(v.使迷失方向)  

snap<,>/snæp/<,>/snæp/<,>v.猛咬/v.突然折断<,>The alligator snapped at the tourist's camera.<,>鳄鱼猛咬向游客的相机。<,>She snapped the pencil in half out of frustration.<,>她沮丧地把铅笔折成两半。<,>The branch snapped under the weight of the snow.<,>树枝在雪的重量下突然折断了。<,>s+nap(小睡)→突然从小睡中惊醒→猛咬<,>snap(v.猛咬)/slap(v.拍打)/snip(v.剪断)  

hurl<,>/hɜːl/<,>/hɜːrl/<,>v.猛投/v.猛冲<,>He hurled the ball across the field.<,>他把球猛投过场地。<,>Protesters hurled insults at the politician.<,>抗议者向政客猛投侮辱。<,>The truck hurled down the highway at top speed.<,>卡车以最高速度在公路上猛冲。<,>h+url(网址)→像发送网址一样快速投掷<,>hurl(v.猛投)/curl(v.卷曲)/hurdle(n.障碍)  

jerk<,>/dʒɜːk/<,>/dʒɜːrk/<,>v.猛地一拉/v.急拉<,>She jerked the door open when she heard the scream.<,>听到尖叫声，她猛地拉开门。<,>The fish jerked the line and almost got away.<,>鱼急拉鱼线，差点逃脱。<,>He jerked the wheel to avoid hitting the dog.<,>他猛地拉动方向盘以避免撞到狗。<,>j+erk(怪人)→怪人突然的动作→急拉<,>jerk(v.急拉)/junk(n.垃圾)/perk(v.振作)  

ally<,>/ˈælaɪ/<,>/ˈælaɪ/<,>n.盟国/n.同盟者/n.伙伴<,>During the war, the two countries became allies.<,>战争期间，这两个国家成为了盟国。<,>She found an ally in her coworker who shared her views.<,>她在同事中找到了一个志同道合的伙伴。<,>The organization has many allies in the fight for equality.<,>该组织在争取平等的斗争中有许多同盟者。<,>al(加强)+ly(绑)→绑在一起的人→同盟<,>alloy(n.合金)/alley(n.小巷)/rally(v.集结)  

threshold<,>/ˈθreʃhəʊld/<,>/ˈθreʃhoʊld/<,>n.门槛/n.入门/n.开端<,>She paused at the threshold before entering the room.<,>她在门槛处停顿了一下才进入房间。<,>This discovery crosses the threshold into a new era of science.<,>这一发现跨入了科学的新纪元。<,>The noise level was just below the pain threshold.<,>噪音水平刚好低于疼痛阈值。<,>thresh(反复踩)+old(老)→老门槛被反复踩踏<,>thresh(v.打谷)/hold(v.持有)/withhold(v.保留)  

charm<,>/tʃɑːm/<,>/tʃɑːrm/<,>n.魅力/n.妩媚/v.迷人<,>Her charm won over everyone at the party.<,>她的魅力征服了派对上的每个人。<,>The old town has a certain charm that attracts tourists.<,>这个古镇有一种吸引游客的魅力。<,>He managed to charm his way out of trouble.<,>他设法用魅力摆脱了麻烦。<,>char(炭)+m→炭火般吸引人的魅力<,>charm(n.魅力)/harm(n.伤害)/alarm(n.警报)
fair<,>/feə(r)/<,>/fer/<,>adj.美丽的<,>She has fair hair and blue eyes.<,>她有一头美丽的金发和一双蓝眼睛。<,>The fair maiden danced in the meadow.<,>美丽的少女在草地上跳舞。<,>The painting captured the fair landscape perfectly.<,>这幅画完美地捕捉了美丽的风景。<,>fairy(仙女)+air(空气)→仙女般美丽的<,>fare(n.车费/v.进展)/fear(n.恐惧/v.害怕)

offensive<,>/əˈfensɪv/<,>/əˈfensɪv/<,>adj.冒犯的/adj.进攻的<,>His comments were highly offensive.<,>他的评论极具冒犯性。<,>The team launched an offensive against their rivals.<,>队伍向对手发起了进攻。<,>The smell from the garbage was offensive.<,>垃圾的气味令人不快。<,>offend(冒犯)+sive→冒犯的<,>defensive(adj.防御的)/offense(n.冒犯/n.进攻)

pore<,>/pɔː(r)/<,>/pɔːr/<,>n.毛孔/n.气孔/n.细孔<,>She cleans her pores with a special face wash.<,>她用特殊洗面奶清洁毛孔。<,>The leaf has tiny pores for gas exchange.<,>叶子上有用于气体交换的小气孔。<,>Water seeped through the pores in the rock.<,>水从岩石的细孔中渗出。<,>pour(倾倒)对比记忆→液体从孔中流出<,>pore over(仔细阅读)/pour(v.倾倒)

fuss<,>/fʌs/<,>/fʌs/<,>n.大惊小怪/v.忙乱<,>Don't make a fuss over such a small mistake.<,>不要为这样的小错误大惊小怪。<,>She fussed about preparing dinner for the guests.<,>她忙着为客人准备晚餐。<,>There was a lot of fuss when the celebrity arrived.<,>名人到达时引起了一阵忙乱。<,>发音似"发丝"→为头发丝般小事忙乱<,>fuzzy(adj.模糊的)/fuse(n.保险丝/v.融合)

cartoon<,>/kɑːˈtuːn/<,>/kɑːrˈtuːn/<,>n.动画片/n.漫画<,>Children love watching cartoons on TV.<,>孩子们喜欢看电视上的动画片。<,>He drew a political cartoon for the newspaper.<,>他为报纸画了一幅政治漫画。<,>The cartoon character became very popular.<,>这个卡通角色变得非常受欢迎。<,>car(车)+toon(音似"图")→车上的图画→漫画<,>carton(n.纸板箱)/cartoon(错误拼写)

vine<,>/vaɪn/<,>/vaɪn/<,>n.蔓/n.藤/n.藤本植物<,>The grape vines grew along the fence.<,>葡萄藤沿着篱笆生长。<,>Ivy is a common type of vine.<,>常春藤是一种常见的藤本植物。<,>The old house was covered with flowering vines.<,>老房子上爬满了开花的藤蔓。<,>wine(葡萄酒)对比记忆→葡萄藤酿葡萄酒<,>vineyard(n.葡萄园)/vanilla(n.香草)

expire<,>/ɪkˈspaɪə(r)/<,>/ɪkˈspaɪər/<,>v.满期/v.到期/v.断气<,>My passport will expire next month.<,>我的护照下个月就到期了。<,>The contract expires at the end of the year.<,>合同年底期满。<,>The old man expired peacefully in his sleep.<,>老人在睡梦中安详地断气了。<,>ex(出)+pire(呼吸)→呼出最后一口气→断气<,>inspire(v.激励)/perspire(v.出汗)

bull<,>/bʊl/<,>/bʊl/<,>n.买空的证券投机商<,>The bull made a fortune in the stock market.<,>这个证券投机商在股市赚了大钱。<,>Bulls are optimistic about market trends.<,>买空者对市场趋势持乐观态度。<,>He worked as a bull on Wall Street.<,>他在华尔街做证券投机商。<,>bull(公牛)→像公牛一样冲进市场<,>bear(n.卖空的投机商)/bully(n.恶霸/v.欺负)

wharf<,>/wɔːf/<,>/wɔːrf/<,>n.码头/n.停泊所<,>The ship was tied up at the wharf.<,>船停泊在码头。<,>Fishermen unloaded their catch at the wharf.<,>渔民们在码头卸下他们的捕获物。<,>There are many warehouses near the wharf.<,>码头附近有许多仓库。<,>wharf(发音似"卧夫")→码头工人卧着休息<,>wharfinger(n.码头管理员)/whirl(v.旋转)

circus<,>/ˈsɜːkəs/<,>/ˈsɜːrkəs/<,>n.马戏/n.马戏团<,>We went to see the circus last weekend.<,>我们上周末去看了马戏表演。<,>The circus performers were amazing.<,>马戏团的表演者令人惊叹。<,>Circus animals are trained very well.<,>马戏团的动物训练有素。<,>circ(圆)+us(我们)→我们围成圆看表演<,>circle(n.圆圈/v.环绕)/circuit(n.电路/n.巡回)
filter<,>/ˈfɪltə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪltər/<,>v.滤过<,>You should filter the water before drinking it.<,>喝水前应该先过滤。<,>The air filter needs to be replaced.<,>空气过滤器需要更换了。<,>She filtered out the irrelevant information.<,>她过滤掉了不相关的信息。<,>fil(线)+ter→用线编织过滤→滤过<,>falter(v.蹒跚/v.支吾)/filer(n.档案员)

ass<,>/æs/<,>/æs/<,>n.傻瓜/n.蠢笨的人/n.驴<,>Don't be such an ass!<,>别这么蠢！<,>He's acting like a complete ass.<,>他表现得像个十足的傻瓜。<,>The farmer loaded the ass with hay.<,>农夫给驴驮上干草。<,>ass与"as"同音→像驴一样固执<,>arse(n.屁股)/ask(v.询问)

propeller<,>/prəˈpelə(r)/<,>/prəˈpelər/<,>n.螺旋桨/n.推进器<,>The boat's propeller got tangled in seaweed.<,>船的螺旋桨被海草缠住了。<,>Jet engines are more efficient than propellers.<,>喷气发动机比螺旋桨更高效。<,>He studied the design of aircraft propellers.<,>他研究飞机螺旋桨的设计。<,>pro(向前)+pell(推)+er→向前推的装置<,>propel(v.推进)/proper(adj.适当的)

spiral<,>/ˈspaɪrəl/<,>/ˈspaɪrəl/<,>adj.螺旋形的/adj.盘旋的<,>The staircase has a beautiful spiral design.<,>楼梯有漂亮的螺旋设计。<,>The smoke spiraled up into the sky.<,>烟雾盘旋着升上天空。<,>Her hair fell in spiral curls.<,>她的头发呈螺旋状卷曲。<,>spir(呼吸)+al→像呼吸一样有节奏的盘旋<,>spinal(adj.脊柱的)/spire(n.尖顶)

nut<,>/nʌt/<,>/nʌt/<,>n.螺帽/n.螺母<,>Tighten the nut with a wrench.<,>用扳手拧紧螺母。<,>I need a 10mm nut for this bolt.<,>这个螺栓需要10毫米的螺母。<,>The nuts and bolts came loose.<,>螺母和螺栓松了。<,>nut原意"坚果"→形状相似<,>but(conj.但是)/net(n.网)

Roman<,>/ˈrəʊmən/<,>/ˈroʊmən/<,>n.古罗马人/n.罗马人<,>The Romans built many roads in Britain.<,>罗马人在英国修建了许多道路。<,>Roman architecture is very impressive.<,>罗马建筑令人印象深刻。<,>She studies Roman history at university.<,>她在大学学习罗马历史。<,>Rome(罗马)+an(人)→罗马人<,>romance(n.浪漫)/roaming(adj.漫游的)

thesis<,>/ˈθiːsɪs/<,>/ˈθisɪs/<,>n.论文/n.论题/n.论点<,>She's writing her master's thesis.<,>她正在写硕士论文。<,>The professor disagreed with my thesis.<,>教授不同意我的论点。<,>His thesis on climate change was groundbreaking.<,>他关于气候变化的论文具有开创性。<,>the(神)+sis(站立)→站得住脚的观点<,>hypothesis(n.假设)/synthesis(n.合成)

forum<,>/ˈfɔːrəm/<,>/ˈfɔːrəm/<,>n.论坛/n.讨论会<,>I posted my question on an online forum.<,>我在网络论坛上发布了问题。<,>The city council held a public forum.<,>市议会举行了一次公开讨论会。<,>This website is a forum for political debate.<,>这个网站是政治辩论的论坛。<,>for(为了)+um(地方)→为了讨论的地方<,>form(n.形式)/quorum(n.法定人数)

oval<,>/ˈəʊvəl/<,>/ˈoʊvəl/<,>adj.卵形的/n.卵形<,>She has a beautiful oval face.<,>她有一张漂亮的鹅蛋脸。<,>The track is oval in shape.<,>跑道是椭圆形的。<,>He drew an oval on the paper.<,>他在纸上画了一个椭圆形。<,>ov(蛋)+al→像蛋的形状<,>oral(adj.口头的)/ovary(n.卵巢)

video<,>/ˈvɪdiəʊ/<,>/ˈvɪdioʊ/<,>adj.录像的<,>We watched a video recording of the concert.<,>我们观看了音乐会的录像。<,>The security camera captured video evidence.<,>监控摄像头拍下了视频证据。<,>She works in video production.<,>她从事视频制作工作。<,>vid(看)+eo→可以看的<,>audio(adj.声音的)/vivid(adj.生动的)
reed<,>/riːd/<,>/rid/<,>n.芦笛/n.牧笛<,>He played a tune on his reed pipe.<,>他用芦笛吹奏了一首曲子。<,>The sound of the reed echoed through the valley.<,>芦笛的声音在山谷中回荡。<,>She made a simple reed instrument for the school project.<,>她为学校项目制作了一个简单的芦笛乐器。<,>reed(芦苇)+pipe(管)→芦笛<,>read(v.阅读)/breed(v.繁殖/n.品种)

leakage<,>/ˈliːkɪdʒ/<,>/ˈlikɪdʒ/<,>n.漏/n.泄漏/n.漏出物<,>There was a leakage in the water pipe.<,>水管有漏水现象。<,>The company reported a data leakage last month.<,>公司上个月报告了一起数据泄露事件。<,>Oil leakage from the tanker caused environmental damage.<,>油轮的石油泄漏造成了环境破坏。<,>leak(漏)+age(状态)→泄漏<,>leak(v.漏/n.漏洞)/lake(n.湖)

hug<,>/hʌɡ/<,>/hʌɡ/<,>v.搂/n.紧紧拥抱<,>She gave her son a warm hug before he left.<,>她在儿子离开前给了他一个温暖的拥抱。<,>They hugged each other when they met at the airport.<,>他们在机场见面时互相拥抱。<,>The child hugged the teddy bear tightly.<,>孩子紧紧抱着泰迪熊。<,>hug音似"哈格"→哈哈笑着拥抱<,>bug(n.虫子)/rug(n.地毯)

stairway<,>/ˈsteəweɪ/<,>/ˈstɛrweɪ/<,>n.楼梯<,>The stairway to the attic is quite steep.<,>通往阁楼的楼梯相当陡峭。<,>He slipped and fell down the stairway.<,>他滑倒并从楼梯上摔了下来。<,>The emergency stairway was well lit.<,>紧急楼梯照明良好。<,>stair(阶梯)+way(路)→楼梯<,>staircase(n.楼梯)/doorway(n.门口)

monopoly<,>/məˈnɒpəli/<,>/məˈnɑːpəli/<,>n.垄断/n.独占/n.专利<,>The company has a monopoly on the production of this drug.<,>这家公司垄断了这种药物的生产。<,>In some countries, tobacco is a government monopoly.<,>在一些国家，烟草是政府垄断的。<,>He tried to break the monopoly of the big corporations.<,>他试图打破大公司的垄断。<,>mono(单一)+poly(卖)→独家卖→垄断<,>monotony(n.单调)/polygon(n.多边形)

bridle<,>/ˈbraɪdl/<,>/ˈbraɪdl/<,>n.马笼头/n.马勒/v.束缚/v.抑制<,>She adjusted the horse's bridle before riding.<,>她在骑马前调整了马笼头。<,>He could hardly bridle his anger when he heard the news.<,>听到这个消息时，他几乎控制不住怒火。<,>The new law will bridle the power of the president.<,>新法律将限制总统的权力。<,>brid(马)+le(小)→马的小装备→马笼头<,>bridal(adj.新娘的)/brittle(adj.易碎的)

willow<,>/ˈwɪləʊ/<,>/ˈwɪloʊ/<,>n.柳树/n.柳木<,>The willow branches swayed gently in the breeze.<,>柳枝在微风中轻轻摇曳。<,>He carved the figure from a piece of willow.<,>他用一块柳木雕刻了这个形象。<,>We had a picnic under the weeping willow.<,>我们在垂柳下野餐。<,>will(意志)+low(低)→低垂的意志→柳树<,>pillow(n.枕头)/wallow(v.打滚)

streamline<,>/ˈstriːmlaɪn/<,>/ˈstrimlaɪn/<,>n.流线/n.流线型<,>The new car has a very streamlined design.<,>这款新车采用了非常流线型的设计。<,>We need to streamline our production process.<,>我们需要精简生产流程。<,>The bird's wings are perfectly streamlined for flight.<,>鸟的翅膀完全符合飞行的流线型。<,>stream(流)+line(线)→流线<,>mainstream(n.主流)/timeline(n.时间线)

rascal<,>/ˈrɑːskl/<,>/ˈræskəl/<,>n.流氓/n.恶棍/n.无赖<,>That little rascal stole my cookies again!<,>那个小淘气又偷了我的饼干！<,>He was known as the town rascal in his youth.<,>他年轻时是镇上有名的无赖。<,>Don't trust him - he's a complete rascal.<,>别相信他——他是个彻头彻尾的恶棍。<,>ras(擦)+cal(小)→到处擦碰的小东西→无赖<,>tascal(无此词)/basket(n.篮子)

prevalent<,>/ˈprevələnt/<,>/ˈprɛvələnt/<,>adj.流行的/adj.盛行的<,>This disease is prevalent in tropical areas.<,>这种疾病在热带地区很流行。<,>Smartphones have become prevalent in modern society.<,>智能手机在现代社会已经非常普及。<,>The prevalent opinion is that we should wait.<,>普遍意见是我们应该等待。<,>pre(前)+val(价值)+ent→价值在前的→流行的<,>prevent(v.预防)/relevant(adj.相关的)
exile<,>/ˈeksaɪl/<,>/ˈɛɡˌzaɪl/<,>v.流放/n.被流放者<,>The king was exiled to a remote island.<,>国王被流放到一个偏远的岛屿。<,>He lived in exile for twenty years.<,>他在流亡中度过了二十年。<,>Many political dissidents were exiled during the revolution.<,>许多政治异见者在革命期间被流放。<,>ex(出)+ile(走)→走出去→流放<,>elite(n.精英)/exhale(v.呼气)/excite(v.使兴奋)

flux<,>/flʌks/<,>/flʌks/<,>n.流/n.涨潮/n.流量<,>The flux of water in the river increased after the rain.<,>雨后河水的流量增加了。<,>The company is in a state of constant flux.<,>公司处于不断变化的状态。<,>The flux and reflux of the tides fascinated him.<,>潮汐的涨落让他着迷。<,>flu(流动)+x→流动的状态<,>flue(n.烟道)/flax(n.亚麻)/flex(v.弯曲)

track<,>/træk/<,>/træk/<,>v.留下足迹<,>The deer tracked through the snow.<,>鹿在雪地上留下了足迹。<,>He tracked mud all over the clean floor.<,>他把泥巴踩得干净的地板上到处都是。<,>Scientists are tracking the migration patterns of birds.<,>科学家正在追踪鸟类的迁徙模式。<,>tract(拉)+k→拉出痕迹→留下足迹<,>truck(n.卡车)/trick(n.诡计)/trace(v.追踪)

gramophone<,>/ˈɡræməfəʊn/<,>/ˈɡræməˌfoʊn/<,>n.留声机<,>My grandfather still has an antique gramophone.<,>我祖父还有一台古董留声机。<,>They danced to the music from the gramophone.<,>他们随着留声机播放的音乐跳舞。<,>The gramophone was a revolutionary invention in its time.<,>留声机在它那个时代是一项革命性的发明。<,>gram(写)+phone(声音)→记录声音的机器<,>telephone(n.电话)/microphone(n.麦克风)/saxophone(n.萨克斯)

otherwise<,>/ˈʌðəwaɪz/<,>/ˈʌðərˌwaɪz/<,>adv.另外/adv.在其他方面<,>You'd better hurry, otherwise you'll miss the train.<,>你最好快点，否则会错过火车。<,>The food was expensive, but otherwise the restaurant was nice.<,>食物很贵，但除此之外餐厅不错。<,>He seems rude, but otherwise he's a good person.<,>他看起来粗鲁，但在其他方面是个好人。<,>other(其他)+wise(方式)→以其他方式<,>likewise(adv.同样地)/clockwise(adj.顺时针的)/otherwise(conj.否则)

province<,>/ˈprɒvɪns/<,>/ˈprɑːvɪns/<,>n.领域/n.范围/n.职权<,>This matter is outside my province of responsibility.<,>这件事不在我的职责范围内。<,>He is an expert in the province of ancient history.<,>他是古代历史领域的专家。<,>The new law falls under the province of the federal government.<,>新法律属于联邦政府的职权范围。<,>pro(前)+vince(征服)→被征服的地区→领域<,>prince(n.王子)/convince(v.说服)/provident(adj.有远见的)

consul<,>/ˈkɒnsl/<,>/ˈkɑːnsl/<,>n.领事<,>The French consul will attend the ceremony.<,>法国领事将出席仪式。<,>He was appointed consul to a small country.<,>他被任命为一个小国家的领事。<,>The consul helped the stranded tourists.<,>领事帮助了被困的游客。<,>con(共同)+sul(召集)→共同召集的人→领事<,>counsel(n.劝告/v.商议)/console(v.安慰)/consult(v.咨询)

retail<,>/ˈriːteɪl/<,>/ˈriˌteɪl/<,>n.零售<,>She works in retail management.<,>她从事零售管理工作。<,>The retail price of the product is too high.<,>这个产品的零售价格太高了。<,>This shop only sells goods at retail.<,>这家店只零售商品。<,>re(再)+tail(切)→再切分→零售<,>detail(n.细节)/entail(v.需要)/retailer(n.零售商)

flexible<,>/ˈfleksəbl/<,>/ˈflɛksəbəl/<,>adj.灵活的/adj.可变通的<,>We need a more flexible approach to solve this problem.<,>我们需要更灵活的方法来解决这个问题。<,>She has a flexible schedule this week.<,>她这周的时间安排很灵活。<,>The material is light and flexible.<,>这种材料既轻便又柔韧。<,>flex(弯曲)+ible(能)→能弯曲的→灵活的<,>reflexible(adj.可反射的)/inflexible(adj.不可弯曲的)/reflective(adj.反射的)

inspiration<,>/ˌɪnspəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪnspəˈreɪʃən/<,>n.灵感/n.妙想/n.鼓舞<,>The beautiful scenery was her inspiration for the painting.<,>美丽的风景是她这幅画的灵感来源。<,>His speech was an inspiration to all of us.<,>他的演讲对我们所有人都是鼓舞。<,>I need some inspiration for my new novel.<,>我需要一些灵感来写我的新小说。<,>in(入)+spir(呼吸)+ation→吸入灵气→灵感<,>expiration(n.期满)/perspiration(n.汗水)/respiration(n.呼吸)
grove<,>/ɡrəʊv/<,>/ɡroʊv/<,>n.林子/n.小树林/n.园林<,>We took a walk through the grove of oak trees.<,>我们穿过橡树林散步。<,>The grove was filled with the sound of birds.<,>小树林里充满了鸟鸣声。<,>They planted a grove of fruit trees behind the house.<,>他们在房子后面种了一片果树园。<,>grove与"grow"(生长)相关，树林是植物生长的地方<,>glove(n.手套)/grave(n.坟墓/adj.严肃的)

neighbouring<,>/ˈneɪbərɪŋ/<,>/ˈneɪbərɪŋ/<,>adj.邻近的/adj.接壤的<,>The neighbouring village is just a mile away.<,>邻近的村庄只有一英里远。<,>Canada and the USA are neighbouring countries.<,>加拿大和美国是接壤的国家。<,>We often visit our neighbouring towns on weekends.<,>我们经常在周末去邻近的城镇。<,>neighbour(邻居)+ing→像邻居一样靠近的<,>neighborly(adj.友善的)/nebulous(adj.模糊的)

vicinity<,>/vɪˈsɪnəti/<,>/vɪˈsɪnəti/<,>n.邻近/n.附近地区<,>There are several restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel.<,>酒店附近有几家餐馆。<,>The police searched the vicinity for clues.<,>警方在附近地区搜寻线索。<,>All houses in the vicinity were evacuated.<,>附近的所有房屋都被疏散了。<,>vicin(邻近)+ity(名词后缀)→邻近地区<,>vanity(n.虚荣)/velocity(n.速度)

fission<,>/ˈfɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˈfɪʃən/<,>n.裂开/n.分裂生殖<,>Nuclear fission releases enormous energy.<,>核裂变释放巨大能量。<,>Some bacteria reproduce by fission.<,>有些细菌通过分裂生殖。<,>The fission of the political party caused chaos.<,>政党的分裂导致了混乱。<,>fiss(裂)+ion→裂开的过程<,>fusion(n.融合)/friction(n.摩擦)

prey<,>/preɪ/<,>/preɪ/<,>n.猎物/v.捕获<,>The lion stalked its prey silently.<,>狮子悄悄地跟踪它的猎物。<,>Owls prey on small rodents at night.<,>猫头鹰在夜间捕食小型啮齿动物。<,>Some scams prey on elderly people.<,>有些骗局专门针对老年人。<,>prey与"pray"(祈祷)发音相同但意思不同<,>pray(v.祈祷)/pry(v.窥探)

martyr<,>/ˈmɑːtə(r)/<,>/ˈmɑːrtər/<,>n.烈士/n.殉难者<,>He died a martyr for his beliefs.<,>他为信仰而殉道。<,>The monument honors the martyrs of the revolution.<,>这座纪念碑纪念革命烈士。<,>She was martyred for speaking the truth.<,>她因说出真相而殉难。<,>mart(伤害)+yr→受伤害的人→殉道者<,>murder(n.谋杀)/martial(adj.军事的)

grin<,>/ɡrɪn/<,>/ɡrɪn/<,>v.咧着嘴笑<,>He grinned from ear to ear when he heard the good news.<,>听到好消息时，他笑得合不拢嘴。<,>The child grinned mischievously.<,>孩子顽皮地咧嘴笑了。<,>She grinned at me across the room.<,>她在房间那头对我咧嘴笑。<,>grin与"green"(绿色)发音相似<,>groan(v.呻吟)/grain(n.谷物)

expect<,>/ɪkˈspekt/<,>/ɪkˈspekt/<,>v.料想/v.认为<,>I expect he'll arrive around noon.<,>我料想他中午左右会到。<,>We're expecting about 50 guests at the party.<,>我们预计会有50位客人参加聚会。<,>She expects to graduate next year.<,>她预计明年毕业。<,>ex(出)+pect(看)→向外看→期待<,>except(conj.除了)/expert(n.专家)

quantitative<,>/ˈkwɒntɪtətɪv/<,>/ˈkwɑːntɪteɪtɪv/<,>adj.量的/adj.定量的<,>We need quantitative data to support our theory.<,>我们需要定量数据来支持我们的理论。<,>The study focuses on quantitative analysis.<,>这项研究侧重于定量分析。<,>There's a quantitative difference between the two approaches.<,>这两种方法有量的差异。<,>quantity(数量)+ative→与数量有关的<,>qualitative(adj.定性的)/quantum(n.量子)

blush<,>/blʌʃ/<,>/blʌʃ/<,>v.脸红/n.害臊/n.脸红<,>She blushed when he complimented her.<,>他称赞她时，她脸红了。<,>A faint blush appeared on her cheeks.<,>她的脸颊上出现了淡淡的红晕。<,>He said it without a blush of shame.<,>他毫无愧色地说出这件事。<,>blush与"brush"(刷子)发音相似<,>flush(v.冲洗/n.脸红)/blunt(adj.钝的)
allied<,>/ˈælaɪd/<,>/ˈælaɪd/<,>adj.联合的/adj.联姻的<,>The allied forces worked together to win the battle.<,>盟军合力作战以赢得战役。<,>They are allied by marriage.<,>他们因婚姻而结盟。<,>The two companies are allied in this project.<,>两家公司在这个项目上联合。<,>all(全部)+ied→全部联合的<,>alloy(n.合金)/allay(v.减轻)

ripple<,>/ˈrɪp(ə)l/<,>/ˈrɪpəl/<,>n.涟漪/n.细浪/n.波纹<,>A small stone created ripples in the pond.<,>一颗小石子在池塘中激起涟漪。<,>The news sent ripples through the community.<,>这个消息在社区中引起波动。<,>Her laughter rippled through the room.<,>她的笑声在房间里荡漾。<,>rip(撕开)+ple→水被"撕开"形成波纹<,>crumple(v.弄皱)/cripple(n.跛子)

mitten<,>/ˈmɪt(ə)n/<,>/ˈmɪtn/<,>n.连指手套<,>She wore warm mittens in the snow.<,>她在雪地里戴着保暖的连指手套。<,>The toddler lost one mitten.<,>这个幼儿丢了一只连指手套。<,>These mittens are handmade.<,>这些连指手套是手工制作的。<,>mitt(手)+en→手上的东西<,>mitt(n.棒球手套)/mutton(n.羊肉)

attachment<,>/əˈtætʃmənt/<,>/əˈtætʃmənt/<,>n.爱慕/n.附件/n.连接物<,>She has a strong attachment to her hometown.<,>她对家乡怀有深厚的感情。<,>Please check the email attachment.<,>请查看邮件附件。<,>The vacuum cleaner comes with various attachments.<,>吸尘器配有各种配件。<,>attach(附加)+ment→附加的东西<,>detachment(n.分离)/enchantment(n.魅力)

junction<,>/ˈdʒʌŋ(k)ʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˈdʒʌŋkʃən/<,>n.连接点/n.汇合处<,>The accident happened at a busy junction.<,>事故发生在繁忙的交叉路口。<,>This is the junction of two rivers.<,>这是两条河流的汇合处。<,>The train stopped at the junction station.<,>火车在枢纽站停下了。<,>junct(连接)+ion→连接的地方<,>conjunction(n.连词)/injunction(n.禁令)

chestnut<,>/ˈtʃɛsnʌt/<,>/ˈtʃɛsˌnʌt/<,>n.栗子/n.栗树/n.栗色<,>We roasted chestnuts over the fire.<,>我们在火上烤栗子。<,>The old chestnut tree provides shade in summer.<,>这棵老栗树在夏天提供阴凉。<,>She dyed her hair chestnut brown.<,>她把头发染成栗棕色。<,>chest(箱子)+nut(坚果)→像箱子里的坚果<,>hazelnut(n.榛子)/walnut(n.核桃)

exceptional<,>/ɪkˈsɛpʃ(ə)n(ə)l/<,>/ɪkˈsɛpʃənəl/<,>adj.优越的/adj.例外的<,>She showed exceptional talent in music.<,>她在音乐方面表现出非凡的天赋。<,>This is an exceptional circumstance.<,>这是个特殊情况。<,>The service was exceptional at that restaurant.<,>那家餐厅的服务非常出色。<,>except(除外)+ional→例外的<,>exceptionable(adj.可反对的)/exceptive(adj.例外的)

solar<,>/ˈsəʊlə/<,>/ˈsoʊlər/<,>adj.利用太阳光的<,>They installed solar panels on the roof.<,>他们在屋顶安装了太阳能板。<,>Solar energy is renewable.<,>太阳能是可再生的。<,>The solar system includes eight planets.<,>太阳系包括八颗行星。<,>sol(太阳)+ar→太阳的<,>polar(adj.极地的)/lunar(adj.月亮的)

impose<,>/ɪmˈpəʊz/<,>/ɪmˈpoʊz/<,>v.将(想法、信仰等)强加于(某人)<,>Parents shouldn't impose their dreams on children.<,>父母不应该把自己的梦想强加给孩子。<,>The government imposed new taxes.<,>政府征收了新税。<,>Don't impose on his kindness.<,>不要利用他的善良。<,>im(加强)+pose(放置)→强行放置<,>compose(v.组成)/dispose(v.处理)

utilization<,>/ˌjuːtɪlaɪˈzeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌjutələˈzeɪʃən/<,>n.利用/n.效用<,>The utilization of resources must be efficient.<,>资源利用必须高效。<,>This machine has high utilization rate.<,>这台机器利用率很高。<,>Proper utilization of time is important.<,>合理利用时间很重要。<,>util(用)+ization→利用的状态<,>utility(n.效用)/utensil(n.器具)
stereo<,>/ˈstɛrɪəʊ/<,>/ˈstɛrioʊ/<,>n.立体声/adj.立体声的<,>The music sounds much better in stereo.<,>立体声播放的音乐听起来好多了。<,>He bought a new stereo system for his car.<,>他为他的车买了一套新的立体声音响。<,>This recording was made in stereo.<,>这个录音是用立体声录制的。<,>stereo(立体)+o→立体声<,>stereotype(n.刻板印象)/mono(单声道)

cubic<,>/ˈkjuːbɪk/<,>/ˈkjuːbɪk/<,>adj.立方体的/adj.立方的<,>The room is 10 cubic meters in size.<,>这个房间有10立方米大。<,>He solved the cubic equation with ease.<,>他轻松解出了这个三次方程。<,>The sculpture was made of cubic shapes.<,>这个雕塑由立方体形状组成。<,>cube(立方体)+ic→立方的<,>cubicle(n.小隔间)/cylindrical(圆柱形的)

legislation<,>/ˌlɛdʒɪsˈleɪʃən/<,>/ˌlɛdʒəˈsleɪʃən/<,>n.立法/n.法规<,>The new legislation will take effect next month.<,>新法规将于下个月生效。<,>They are working on environmental legislation.<,>他们正在制定环境法规。<,>The legislation was passed unanimously.<,>这项立法获得一致通过。<,>legis(法律)+lation→立法<,>legitimate(合法的)/regulation(规章)

historian<,>/hɪˈstɔːrɪən/<,>/hɪˈstɔːriən/<,>n.历史学家/n.编史家<,>The historian specializes in medieval Europe.<,>这位历史学家专攻中世纪欧洲史。<,>She is a renowned historian of Chinese art.<,>她是一位著名的中国艺术史学家。<,>The historian uncovered new evidence about the event.<,>历史学家发现了关于这个事件的新证据。<,>history(历史)+ian(人)→历史学家<,>historical(历史的)/historiography(编史)

historic<,>/hɪˈstɒrɪk/<,>/hɪˈstɔːrɪk/<,>adj.历史的/adj.历史性的<,>This is a historic moment for our country.<,>这对我们国家来说是一个历史性时刻。<,>The building is of historic importance.<,>这座建筑具有历史重要性。<,>They signed the historic peace agreement.<,>他们签署了具有历史意义的和平协议。<,>history(历史)+ic→历史的<,>historical(历史上的)/hysteric(歇斯底里的)

mechanics<,>/mɪˈkænɪks/<,>/məˈkænɪks/<,>n.力学/n.机械学<,>He studies quantum mechanics at university.<,>他在大学学习量子力学。<,>The mechanics of the engine are quite complex.<,>这个引擎的机械结构相当复杂。<,>She has a good understanding of fluid mechanics.<,>她对流体力学有很好的理解。<,>mechanic(机械)+s→力学<,>mechanism(机制)/machine(机器)

intellect<,>/ˈɪntəlɛkt/<,>/ˈɪntəlɛkt/<,>n.理智/n.智力/n.才智<,>She is a woman of great intellect.<,>她是一个才智非凡的女性。<,>His intellect sets him apart from his peers.<,>他的才智使他与众不同。<,>The debate challenged their intellects.<,>这场辩论考验了他们的智力。<,>intel(在...之间)+lect(选择)→智力<,>intellectual(智力的)/intelligence(情报)

ideally<,>/aɪˈdɪəli/<,>/aɪˈdiːəli/<,>adv.理想地/adv.理论上<,>Ideally, we should finish by Friday.<,>理想情况下，我们应该在周五前完成。<,>The room is ideally suited for meetings.<,>这个房间非常适合开会。<,>Ideally, everyone would have equal opportunities.<,>理想情况下，每个人都应该有平等的机会。<,>ideal(理想的)+ly→理想地<,>idea(想法)/idle(闲置的)

abstract<,>/ˈæbstrækt/<,>/ˈæbˌstrækt/<,>adj.理论上的/n.抽象派作品<,>His ideas are too abstract for most people.<,>他的想法对大多数人来说太抽象了。<,>She enjoys abstract art.<,>她喜欢抽象艺术。<,>The concept is quite abstract and hard to grasp.<,>这个概念相当抽象，难以理解。<,>abs(离开)+tract(拉)→抽象的<,>extract(提取)/contract(合同)

slang<,>/slæŋ/<,>/slæŋ/<,>n.俚语/n.行话/n.黑话<,>Teenagers often use slang that adults don't understand.<,>青少年经常使用成年人不懂的俚语。<,>This word is considered slang in formal writing.<,>这个词在正式写作中被认为是俚语。<,>He knows all the local slang terms.<,>他知道所有的当地俚语。<,>s(蛇)+lang(长)→像蛇一样长的语言→俚语<,>language(语言)/sling(投掷)
courtesy<,>/ˈkɜːtəsi/<,>/ˈkɜːrtəsi/<,>n.礼貌/n.谦恭<,>He showed great courtesy by holding the door open for her.<,>他很有礼貌地为她开着门。<,>It's common courtesy to say thank you when someone helps you.<,>当有人帮助你时，说声谢谢是基本的礼貌。<,>The courtesy of the staff made our stay very pleasant.<,>工作人员的谦恭有礼让我们的住宿非常愉快。<,>court(宫廷)+esy→宫廷礼仪→礼貌<,>curtsy(n.屈膝礼)/coarse(adj.粗糙的)/curt(adj.简短的)

twilight<,>/ˈtwaɪlaɪt/<,>/ˈtwaɪˌlaɪt/<,>n.黄昏<,>The sky was painted in beautiful colors during twilight.<,>黄昏时天空被染上了美丽的色彩。<,>They took a romantic walk in the twilight.<,>他们在黄昏时分散步很浪漫。<,>Twilight is my favorite time of day.<,>黄昏是我一天中最喜欢的时间。<,>twi(二)+light(光)→昼夜交替时的光→黄昏<,>daylight(n.日光)/night(n.夜晚)/dusk(n.黄昏)

ion<,>/ˈaɪən/<,>/ˈaɪˌɑn/<,>n.离子<,>Positive and negative ions are attracted to each other.<,>正离子和负离子相互吸引。<,>The device measures the concentration of ions in the solution.<,>这个设备测量溶液中的离子浓度。<,>Ions play a crucial role in many chemical reactions.<,>离子在许多化学反应中起着关键作用。<,>i(我)+on(上)→我在上面带电→离子<,>iron(n.铁)/icon(n.图标)/lion(n.狮子)

excursion<,>/ɪkˈskɜːʃn/<,>/ɪkˈskɜːrʒn/<,>n.(尤指集体)远足/n.短途旅行<,>We went on an excursion to the mountains last weekend.<,>上周末我们去山区远足了。<,>The school organized an educational excursion to the museum.<,>学校组织了一次去博物馆的教育性短途旅行。<,>The excursion included a boat trip along the river.<,>这次短途旅行包括沿河的乘船游览。<,>ex(出)+curs(跑)+ion→跑出去→远足<,>excursion(n.远足)/excursive(adj.离题的)/excursionist(n.远足者)

grim<,>/ɡrɪm/<,>/ɡrɪm/<,>adj.严厉的<,>The teacher gave us a grim warning about cheating.<,>老师就作弊给了我们严厉的警告。<,>His grim expression told me something was wrong.<,>他严厉的表情告诉我出问题了。<,>The judge handed down a grim sentence to the criminal.<,>法官对罪犯做出了严厉的判决。<,>g(哥)+rim(边缘)→哥哥在边缘很严厉→严厉的<,>grin(v.露齿而笑)/grime(n.污垢)/gram(n.克)

prism<,>/ˈprɪzəm/<,>/ˈprɪzəm/<,>n.棱镜/n.棱柱(体)<,>Light is separated into different colors when it passes through a prism.<,>光通过棱镜时会被分成不同的颜色。<,>The scientist used a prism to study the properties of light.<,>科学家用棱镜研究光的特性。<,>The building was shaped like a triangular prism.<,>这座建筑呈三角棱柱形状。<,>pri(首要)+sm→首要的光学仪器→棱镜<,>prison(n.监狱)/prism(n.棱镜)/prissy(adj.谨小慎微的)

troublesome<,>/ˈtrʌblsəm/<,>/ˈtrʌbəlsəm/<,>adj.困难的<,>This math problem is quite troublesome to solve.<,>这道数学题很难解。<,>He's a troublesome student who often disrupts the class.<,>他是个难管的学生，经常扰乱课堂。<,>The troublesome weather delayed our flight.<,>恶劣的天气延误了我们的航班。<,>trouble(麻烦)+some(形容词后缀)→带来麻烦的→困难的<,>trouble(n.麻烦)/troubled(adj.烦恼的)/troublemaker(n.惹事生非者)

analogue<,>/ˈænəlɒɡ/<,>/ˈænəˌlɔɡ/<,>n.类似物<,>This synthetic material is an analogue of natural rubber.<,>这种合成材料是天然橡胶的类似物。<,>Digital watches have largely replaced their analogue counterparts.<,>数字手表已在很大程度上取代了类似的模拟手表。<,>Scientists created a drug analogue to study its effects.<,>科学家们创造了一种药物类似物来研究其效果。<,>ana(类似)+logue(说话)→类似的说法→类似物<,>analogy(n.类比)/analogous(adj.类似的)/analog(n.模拟)

similarity<,>/ˌsɪməˈlærəti/<,>/ˌsɪməˈlærəti/<,>n.类似/n.相似/n.类似点<,>There's a striking similarity between the two paintings.<,>这两幅画有惊人的相似之处。<,>We found many similarities in our childhood experiences.<,>我们发现童年经历有许多相似之处。<,>The similarity in their voices made it hard to tell them apart on the phone.<,>他们声音的相似使得在电话中很难区分他们。<,>similar(相似的)+ity(名词后缀)→相似性<,>simile(n.明喻)/similitude(n.类似)/simulate(v.模拟)

flank<,>/flæŋk/<,>/flæŋk/<,>n.肋/n.肋腹/n.侧面<,>The soldier was wounded in the left flank.<,>这名士兵左肋受伤。<,>They attacked the enemy's flank during the battle.<,>他们在战斗中攻击了敌人的侧面。<,>The restaurant is flanked by two tall buildings.<,>这家餐厅两侧是两座高楼。<,>fl(飞)+ank(岸)→飞向岸边→侧面<,>flank(n.侧面)/flank(v.位于...侧面)/flanker(n.侧翼队员)
comprehend<,>/ˌkɒmprɪˈhend/<,>/ˌkɑːmprɪˈhend/<,>v.了解/v.理解/v.领会<,>I cannot comprehend why he made such a decision.<,>我无法理解他为何做出这样的决定。<,>She struggled to comprehend the complex theory.<,>她努力理解这个复杂的理论。<,>Children comprehend stories faster than abstract concepts.<,>孩子们理解故事比抽象概念快。<,>com(共同)+prehend(抓住)→共同抓住→理解<,>apprehend(v.逮捕/v.理解)/comprehensive(adj.全面的)/comprehension(n.理解力)

optimism<,>/ˈɒptɪmɪzəm/<,>/ˈɑːptɪmɪzəm/<,>n.乐观/n.乐观主义<,>Her optimism kept the team motivated during tough times.<,>她的乐观在困难时期保持了团队的积极性。<,>Optimism is essential for overcoming challenges.<,>乐观对于克服挑战至关重要。<,>Despite setbacks, he maintained his optimism.<,>尽管遇到挫折，他仍保持乐观。<,>optim(最好)+ism(主义)→认为最好→乐观主义<,>pessimism(n.悲观主义)/optimal(adj.最佳的)/optimum(n.最佳条件)

sophisticated<,>/səˈfɪstɪkeɪtɪd/<,>/səˈfɪstɪkeɪtɪd/<,>adj.老于世故的/adj.高级的<,>She wore a sophisticated black dress to the gala.<,>她穿了一件高级的黑色礼服参加晚会。<,>The software uses sophisticated algorithms.<,>该软件使用复杂的算法。<,>His sophisticated manners impressed everyone.<,>他老练的举止给大家留下了深刻印象。<,>soph(智慧)+ist(人)+icated→有智慧的人→老练的<,>simple(adj.简单的)/naive(adj.天真的)/complicated(adj.复杂的)

straightforward<,>/ˌstreɪtˈfɔːwəd/<,>/ˌstreɪtˈfɔːrwərd/<,>adj.老实的/adj.坦率的<,>He gave a straightforward answer to the question.<,>他对这个问题给出了直率的回答。<,>The instructions are straightforward and easy to follow.<,>这些说明直截了当，容易遵循。<,>I appreciate your straightforward approach.<,>我欣赏你直率的方式。<,>straight(直的)+forward(向前)→直接向前→坦率的<,>complicated(adj.复杂的)/honest(adj.诚实的)/direct(adj.直接的)

wasteful<,>/ˈweɪstfəl/<,>/ˈweɪstfəl/<,>adj.浪费的<,>Leaving lights on is wasteful of electricity.<,>让灯开着是浪费电的行为。<,>His wasteful habits drained his savings quickly.<,>他浪费的习惯很快耗尽了他的积蓄。<,>The company aims to reduce wasteful practices.<,>公司旨在减少浪费行为。<,>waste(浪费)+ful(形容词后缀)→浪费的<,>thrifty(adj.节俭的)/efficient(adj.高效的)/extravagant(adj.奢侈的)

idleness<,>/ˈaɪdlnəs/<,>/ˈaɪdlnəs/<,>n.懒惰/n.赋闲无事<,>Idleness is the parent of all vice.<,>懒惰是万恶之源。<,>He fell into idleness after losing his job.<,>失业后他变得无所事事。<,>The summer vacation brought welcome idleness.<,>暑假带来了令人愉快的闲暇时光。<,>idle(空闲的)+ness(名词后缀)→懒惰状态<,>industry(n.勤劳)/laziness(n.懒惰)/leisure(n.闲暇)

shabby<,>/ˈʃæbi/<,>/ˈʃæbi/<,>adj.破旧的/adj.褴褛的<,>He lived in a shabby apartment in the old part of town.<,>他住在城里破旧地区的一间破旧公寓里。<,>Her shabby clothes drew sympathetic looks.<,>她褴褛的衣服引来同情的目光。<,>The hotel was rather shabby but clean.<,>这家旅馆相当破旧但很干净。<,>shab(碎布)+by→像碎布一样的→破旧的<,>tattered(adj.破烂的)/worn-out(adj.穿旧的)/elegant(adj.优雅的)

dust<,>/dʌst/<,>/dʌst/<,>n.灰尘<,>The furniture was covered with a thick layer of dust.<,>家具上覆盖着厚厚的灰尘。<,>She wiped the dust off the bookshelf.<,>她擦掉了书架上的灰尘。<,>A cloud of dust rose as the car sped away.<,>汽车疾驰而过，扬起一片灰尘。<,>du(拼音"堵")+st(拼音"石头")→堵住石头的东西→灰尘<,>dirt(n.污垢)/powder(n.粉末)/ash(n.灰烬)

flight<,>/flaɪt/<,>/flaɪt/<,>n.溃退/n.逃跑<,>The enemy troops were in full flight after the battle.<,>敌军在战斗后全面溃退。<,>His sudden flight raised suspicions.<,>他突然逃跑引起了怀疑。<,>The birds took flight at the sound of the gunshot.<,>鸟群听到枪声后飞走了。<,>fl(拼音"飞离")+ight(名词后缀)→飞离→逃跑<,>fright(n.惊吓)/fight(v.战斗)/flee(v.逃跑)

rapture<,>/ˈræptʃə(r)/<,>/ˈræptʃər/<,>n.狂喜/n.欢天喜地<,>She was in rapture when she heard the good news.<,>听到这个好消息，她欣喜若狂。<,>The audience watched in rapture as the performance unfolded.<,>观众们欣喜地看着表演展开。<,>His face showed pure rapture at the sight.<,>看到这一幕，他脸上露出纯粹的狂喜。<,>rap(抓住)+ture(名词后缀)→被快乐抓住→狂喜<,>capture(v.捕获)/enrapture(v.使狂喜)/ecstasy(n.狂喜)
fury<,>/ˈfjʊəri/<,>/ˈfjʊri/<,>n.狂怒/n.暴怒/n.猛烈<,>He was filled with fury when he heard the news.<,>听到这个消息时，他满腔怒火。<,>The fury of the storm destroyed many houses.<,>猛烈的风暴摧毁了许多房屋。<,>She couldn't control her fury and shouted at him.<,>她无法控制自己的愤怒，对他大喊大叫。<,>fur(毛皮)+y→像炸毛一样→狂怒<,>furry(adj.毛茸茸的)/fury(n.狂怒)/furious(adj.狂暴的)
