violent<,>/ˈvaɪələnt/<,>/ˈvaɪələnt/<,>adj.狂暴的<,>The violent storm caused widespread damage.<,>狂暴的风暴造成了广泛的破坏。<,>He has a violent temper and often loses control.<,>他脾气暴躁，经常失控。<,>The movie contains violent scenes that may disturb some viewers.<,>这部电影包含可能令一些观众不安的暴力场景。<,>viol(暴力)+ent(形容词后缀)→狂暴的<,>violet(n.紫罗兰)/violin(n.小提琴)/violate(v.违反)

furious<,>/ˈfjʊəriəs/<,>/ˈfjʊriəs/<,>adj.狂暴的/adj.强烈的<,>She was furious when she found out the truth.<,>当她发现真相时，她非常愤怒。<,>The furious wind blew down several trees.<,>猛烈的风吹倒了几棵树。<,>He gave me a furious look and walked away.<,>他愤怒地看了我一眼，然后走开了。<,>fury(狂怒)+ous(形容词后缀)→狂暴的<,>curious(adj.好奇的)/furious(adj.狂暴的)/serious(adj.严肃的)

satisfaction<,>/ˌsætɪsˈfækʃn/<,>/ˌsætɪsˈfækʃən/<,>n.满足/n.愉快<,>He smiled with satisfaction after completing the project.<,>完成项目后，他满意地笑了。<,>Finding the solution gave her great satisfaction.<,>找到解决方案给了她极大的满足感。<,>Customer satisfaction is our top priority.<,>客户满意是我们的首要任务。<,>satis(足够)+fact(做)+ion(名词后缀)→满足<,>satisfy(v.满足)/satisfaction(n.满足)/dissatisfaction(n.不满)

snack<,>/snæk/<,>/snæk/<,>n.快餐/n.小吃<,>I usually have a snack in the afternoon.<,>我通常在下午吃点心。<,>He bought some snacks for the movie night.<,>他为电影之夜买了一些零食。<,>Healthy snacks are important for children.<,>健康的零食对孩子很重要。<,>sn(蛇)+ack(acknowledge)→蛇承认爱吃零食→小吃<,>snake(n.蛇)/snack(n.小吃)/snap(v.折断)

rapidity<,>/rəˈpɪdəti/<,>/rəˈpɪdəti/<,>n.快/n.迅速/n.陡/n.险峻<,>The rapidity of his response surprised everyone.<,>他反应之快让所有人都感到惊讶。<,>The rapidity of technological change is astounding.<,>技术变化的速度令人震惊。<,>We were amazed by the rapidity of the river's current.<,>我们对河流的湍急感到惊讶。<,>rapid(快速的)+ity(名词后缀)→迅速<,>rapidity(n.迅速)/rapidly(adv.迅速地)/rabid(adj.狂热的)

parade<,>/pəˈreɪd/<,>/pəˈreɪd/<,>v.夸耀(才能等)<,>He likes to parade his knowledge in front of others.<,>他喜欢在别人面前炫耀自己的知识。<,>The celebrities paraded down the red carpet.<,>名人们在红毯上炫耀着走过。<,>She paraded her new dress at the party.<,>她在派对上炫耀自己的新裙子。<,>para(旁边)+de(的)→在旁边展示→炫耀<,>parade(v.炫耀)/paradise(n.天堂)/paragraph(n.段落)

pants<,>/pænts/<,>/pænts/<,>n.裤子/n.男用短衬裤<,>He bought a new pair of pants for the interview.<,>他为面试买了一条新裤子。<,>These pants are too tight for me.<,>这条裤子对我来说太紧了。<,>Don't forget to pack an extra pair of pants for the trip.<,>别忘了为旅行多带一条裤子。<,>pan(平底锅)+ts→像平底锅一样展开的→裤子<,>pants(n.裤子)/pant(v.喘息)/pans(n.平底锅)

bitterness<,>/ˈbɪtənəs/<,>/ˈbɪtərnəs/<,>n.苦味/n.辛酸/n.苦难<,>The bitterness of the medicine made it hard to swallow.<,>药的苦味让人难以下咽。<,>She spoke with bitterness about her past experiences.<,>她带着辛酸讲述了自己的过去经历。<,>Life's bitterness sometimes makes us stronger.<,>生活的苦难有时让我们更坚强。<,>bitter(苦的)+ness(名词后缀)→苦味<,>bitterness(n.苦味)/better(adj.更好的)/bitten(v.咬的过去分词)

wither<,>/ˈwɪðə(r)/<,>/ˈwɪðər/<,>v.枯萎/v.使衰弱<,>The flowers withered in the hot sun.<,>花朵在烈日下枯萎了。<,>His hopes withered as time passed.<,>随着时间的流逝，他的希望逐渐破灭。<,>The plant withered due to lack of water.<,>由于缺水，植物枯萎了。<,>with(和)+er(人)→和人一起老去→枯萎<,>wither(v.枯萎)/weather(n.天气)/whether(conj.是否)
clasp<,>/klɑːsp/<,>/klæsp/<,>v.扣住/v.扣紧/v.钩住<,>She clasped the necklace around her neck.<,>她把项链扣在脖子上。<,>The child clasped his hands together in excitement.<,>孩子兴奋地把双手扣在一起。<,>He clasped the rope tightly to avoid falling.<,>他紧紧抓住绳子以防掉下去。<,>cl(扣)+asp(蛇)→像蛇一样缠绕→扣住<,>grasp(v.抓住)/clash(v.冲突)/clamp(v.夹住)  

fastener<,>/ˈfɑːsnə(r)/<,>/ˈfæsnər/<,>n.扣件/n.钮扣/n.揿钮<,>The jacket has a zipper fastener.<,>这件夹克用的是拉链扣件。<,>She replaced the broken fastener on her bag.<,>她更换了包上坏掉的钮扣。<,>Velcro is a popular type of fastener.<,>魔术贴是一种流行的扣件。<,>fast(固定)+en(使)+er(物)→固定物品的装置<,>fasten(v.系紧)/faster(adj.更快的)/fasting(n.禁食)  

stammer<,>/ˈstæmə(r)/<,>/ˈstæmər/<,>v.口吃地说/n.口吃<,>He tends to stammer when nervous.<,>他紧张时容易口吃。<,>The boy overcame his stammer through therapy.<,>男孩通过治疗克服了口吃。<,>"I-I'm s-sorry," he stammered.<,>"对-对不起，"他结结巴巴地说。<,>stam(停顿)+mer(重复)→说话重复停顿<,>hammer(n.锤子)/summer(n.夏天)/slumber(n.睡眠)  

panic<,>/ˈpænɪk/<,>/ˈpænɪk/<,>n.恐慌/n.惊慌<,>The fire caused panic in the theater.<,>火灾在剧院里引起了恐慌。<,>Don't panic in emergency situations.<,>紧急情况下不要惊慌。<,>She felt a sudden panic when she lost her passport.<,>她发现护照不见时突然惊慌起来。<,>pan(潘神)+ic→源自希腊牧神引起的恐惧<,>picnic(n.野餐)/panorama(n.全景)/pandemic(adj.流行的)  

terrorist<,>/ˈterərɪst/<,>/ˈtɛrərɪst/<,>n.恐怖分子<,>The terrorists attacked the airport.<,>恐怖分子袭击了机场。<,>He was accused of being a terrorist.<,>他被指控为恐怖分子。<,>Counter-terrorism units track terrorist activities.<,>反恐部队追踪恐怖分子的活动。<,>terror(恐怖)+ist(人)→制造恐怖的人<,>tourist(n.游客)/terror(n.恐怖)/territory(n.领土)  

peacock<,>/ˈpiːkɒk/<,>/ˈpiːkɑːk/<,>n.孔雀<,>The peacock displayed its beautiful feathers.<,>孔雀展示了它美丽的羽毛。<,>Peacocks are known for their colorful plumage.<,>孔雀以其多彩的羽毛闻名。<,>There's a peacock roaming freely in the garden.<,>有只孔雀在花园里自由漫步。<,>pea(豌豆)+cock(公鸡)→羽毛像豌豆图案的公鸡<,>peanut(n.花生)/peach(n.桃子)/peal(n.钟声)  

fantastic<,>/fænˈtæstɪk/<,>/fænˈtæstɪk/<,>adj.空想的/adj.奇异的<,>She told a fantastic story about aliens.<,>她讲了一个关于外星人的奇幻故事。<,>The architecture has fantastic designs.<,>这建筑有着奇异的设计。<,>His idea sounds fantastic but impractical.<,>他的想法听起来很空想但不切实际。<,>fantasy(幻想)+tic→充满幻想的<,>fanatic(n.狂热者)/fantasia(n.幻想曲)/fantasize(v.幻想)  

pneumatic<,>/njuːˈmætɪk/<,>/nuːˈmætɪk/<,>adj.空气的/adj.气动的<,>Pneumatic tools use compressed air.<,>气动工具使用压缩空气。<,>The mattress has a pneumatic pump.<,>这个床垫配有气动泵。<,>Pneumatic tires provide a smooth ride.<,>充气轮胎提供平稳的行驶。<,>pneum(空气)+atic→与空气有关的<,>pneumonia(n.肺炎)/pneumatic(n.气胎)/pneumatology(n.圣灵论)  

aerial<,>/ˈeəriəl/<,>/ˈeriəl/<,>adj.空气的/adj.航空的<,>Aerial photography shows the city layout.<,>航拍照片展示了城市布局。<,>The plane performed aerial maneuvers.<,>飞机进行了空中机动。<,>Birds have excellent aerial abilities.<,>鸟类有出色的飞行能力。<,>aer(空气)+ial→与空气相关的<,>aerie(n.鹰巢)/aerobic(adj.有氧的)/aerospace(n.航空航天)  

spatial<,>/ˈspeɪʃl/<,>/ˈspeɪʃəl/<,>adj.空间的/adj.占据空间的<,>He has good spatial awareness.<,>他有很好的空间意识。<,>The sculpture creates interesting spatial effects.<,>这个雕塑创造了有趣的空间效果。<,>Spatial reasoning is important in architecture.<,>空间推理在建筑中很重要。<,>spat(空间)+ial→与空间有关的<,>special(adj.特别的)/spacious(adj.宽敞的)/spatiality(n.空间性)
void<,>/vɔɪd/<,>/vɔɪd/<,>adj.无效的/adj.空的<,>The contract was declared void by the court.<,>法院宣布该合同无效。<,>He stared into the void space of the room.<,>他凝视着房间里空荡荡的空间。<,>Her words left a void in his heart.<,>她的话在他心中留下了一片空虚。<,>voi(声音)+d(消失)→声音消失→空的<,>avoid(v.避免)/devoid(adj.缺乏的)

gnaw<,>/nɔː/<,>/nɔː/<,>v.啃/v.咬断/v.啮<,>The dog gnawed at the bone for hours.<,>那只狗啃骨头啃了好几个小时。<,>Worry began to gnaw at her confidence.<,>忧虑开始侵蚀她的信心。<,>Rats had gnawed through the electrical wires.<,>老鼠咬断了电线。<,>g(啃)+naw(咬)→啃咬<,>saw(n.锯子/v.锯)/paw(n.爪子)

longing<,>/ˈlɒŋɪŋ/<,>/ˈlɔːŋɪŋ/<,>n.渴望/adj.显示渴望的<,>She felt a longing for her hometown.<,>她对家乡充满了思念。<,>He gave her a longing look.<,>他向她投去渴望的目光。<,>The child's longing for attention was obvious.<,>孩子渴望被关注的愿望很明显。<,>long(长)+ing→长时间想要→渴望<,>belonging(n.所有物)/longitude(n.经度)

suspicious<,>/səˈspɪʃəs/<,>/səˈspɪʃəs/<,>adj.可疑的/adj.猜疑的<,>The police found his behavior suspicious.<,>警方发现他的行为可疑。<,>She gave him a suspicious glance.<,>她怀疑地看了他一眼。<,>I'm suspicious of his sudden generosity.<,>我对他突然的慷慨表示怀疑。<,>sus(在...下)+spic(看)+ious→在下面看→怀疑的<,>superstitious(adj.迷信的)/suspension(n.暂停)

shady<,>/ˈʃeɪdi/<,>/ˈʃeɪdi/<,>adj.可疑的/adj.靠不住的<,>He's involved in some shady business deals.<,>他参与了一些可疑的商业交易。<,>We found a shady spot under the tree.<,>我们在树下找到了一处阴凉的地方。<,>That politician has a shady past.<,>那位政客有着不光彩的过去。<,>shade(阴影)+y→在阴影里的→可疑的<,>shaky(adj.摇晃的)/shabby(adj.破旧的)

questionable<,>/ˈkwestʃənəbl/<,>/ˈkwɛstʃənəbəl/<,>adj.可疑的/adj.不可靠的<,>The origins of the money are questionable.<,>这笔钱的来源可疑。<,>His motives for helping are questionable.<,>他帮忙的动机值得怀疑。<,>The study's methodology is questionable.<,>这项研究的方法论不可靠。<,>question(问题)+able→有问题的→可疑的<,>questionnaire(n.问卷)/unquestionable(adj.无可置疑的)

portable<,>/ˈpɔːtəbl/<,>/ˈpɔːrtəbl/<,>adj.可移动的<,>I bought a portable computer for travel.<,>我买了一台便携式电脑用于旅行。<,>The device is small and portable.<,>这个设备小巧便携。<,>Portable heaters are popular in winter.<,>便携式取暖器在冬天很受欢迎。<,>port(携带)+able→可以携带的→便携的<,>potable(adj.可饮用的)/portal(n.入口)

grateful<,>/ˈɡreɪtfʊl/<,>/ˈɡreɪtfəl/<,>adj.感谢的/adj.感激的<,>I'm grateful for your help.<,>我感谢你的帮助。<,>She gave him a grateful smile.<,>她向他报以感激的微笑。<,>We are grateful to have such good friends.<,>我们很感激有这样的好朋友。<,>grate(高兴)+ful→充满高兴的→感激的<,>graceful(adj.优雅的)/grating(adj.刺耳的)

adjustable<,>/əˈdʒʌstəbl/<,>/əˈdʒʌstəbəl/<,>adj.可调整的/adj.可校准的<,>This chair has an adjustable backrest.<,>这把椅子有可调节的靠背。<,>The straps are adjustable for different sizes.<,>这些带子可以根据不同尺寸调节。<,>An adjustable wrench is a useful tool.<,>活动扳手是个有用的工具。<,>adjust(调整)+able→可以调整的<,>adjustment(n.调整)/adjoining(adj.毗邻的)

frightful<,>/ˈfraɪtfʊl/<,>/ˈfraɪtfəl/<,>adj.可怕的/adj.讨厌的<,>We heard a frightful scream in the night.<,>我们在夜里听到了一声可怕的尖叫。<,>What a frightful mess you've made!<,>你搞得一团糟！<,>The accident was a frightful sight.<,>事故现场很可怕。<,>fright(惊吓)+ful→充满惊吓的→可怕的<,>frightening(adj.令人恐惧的)/delightful(adj.令人愉快的)
formidable<,>/ˈfɔːmɪdəbl/<,>/fɔrˈmɪdəbəl/<,>adj.可怕的/adj.难对付的<,>The team faced a formidable opponent in the finals.<,>这支队伍在决赛中遇到了一个强大的对手。<,>She has a formidable reputation in the industry.<,>她在业界有着令人敬畏的声誉。<,>Climbing the mountain was a formidable challenge.<,>攀登那座山是一项艰巨的挑战。<,>for(前)+mid(害怕)+able(能)→能让人害怕的→可怕的<,>dreadful(adj.可怕的)/monstrous(adj.极大的)  

dreadful<,>/ˈdredfl/<,>/ˈdrɛdfəl/<,>adj.可怕的/adj.令人畏惧的<,>The accident was a dreadful sight.<,>那场事故的景象非常可怕。<,>He had a dreadful fear of heights.<,>他有恐高症。<,>The weather was dreadful during the storm.<,>暴风雨期间的天气非常糟糕。<,>dread(恐惧)+ful(充满)→充满恐惧的→可怕的<,>formidable(adj.可怕的)/monstrous(adj.极大的)  

monstrous<,>/ˈmɒnstrəs/<,>/ˈmɑːnstrəs/<,>adj.极大的/adj.可怕的<,>The monstrous waves crashed against the shore.<,>巨大的海浪拍打着海岸。<,>His behavior was monstrous and unacceptable.<,>他的行为非常恶劣，不可接受。<,>The building was of monstrous proportions.<,>那座建筑的规模非常庞大。<,>monster(怪物)+ous(有…性质的)→像怪物一样的→极大的<,>formidable(adj.可怕的)/dreadful(adj.可怕的)  

possibility<,>/ˌpɒsəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌpɑːsəˈbɪləti/<,>n.可能的事<,>There is a possibility of rain tomorrow.<,>明天有可能下雨。<,>We need to consider all possibilities before making a decision.<,>在做决定之前，我们需要考虑所有可能性。<,>The possibility of success motivated him to work harder.<,>成功的可能性激励他更加努力。<,>possible(可能的)+ity(名词后缀)→可能性<,>likelihood(n.可能性)/probability(n.概率)  

likelihood<,>/ˈlaɪklihʊd/<,>/ˈlaɪklihʊd/<,>n.可能（性）<,>In all likelihood, the meeting will be postponed.<,>会议很可能会推迟。<,>There is a high likelihood of success if we plan carefully.<,>如果我们仔细规划，成功的可能性很高。<,>The likelihood of finding a solution is slim.<,>找到解决方案的可能性很小。<,>likely(可能的)+hood(状态)→可能性<,>possibility(n.可能的事)/probability(n.概率)  

respectable<,>/rɪˈspektəbl/<,>/rɪˈspektəbəl/<,>adj.可敬的/adj.人格高尚的<,>He comes from a respectable family.<,>他来自一个受人尊敬的家庭。<,>She has a respectable career in law.<,>她在法律界有着令人尊敬的职业。<,>His behavior was always respectable.<,>他的行为总是值得尊敬。<,>respect(尊敬)+able(能)→值得尊敬的<,>appreciable(adj.可察觉的)/comparable(adj.可比较的)  

appreciable<,>/əˈpriːʃəbl/<,>/əˈpriːʃəbəl/<,>adj.可察觉的<,>There was an appreciable difference in the test results.<,>测试结果有明显的差异。<,>The temperature drop was appreciable after sunset.<,>日落后温度明显下降。<,>Her efforts led to an appreciable improvement.<,>她的努力带来了明显的改善。<,>appreciate(察觉)+able(能)→可察觉的<,>respectable(adj.可敬的)/comparable(adj.可比较的)  

shameful<,>/ˈʃeɪmfl/<,>/ˈʃeɪmfəl/<,>adj.可耻的/adj.不道德的<,>His actions were shameful and unacceptable.<,>他的行为是可耻且不可接受的。<,>It's shameful to treat others with such disrespect.<,>如此不尊重他人是可耻的。<,>The scandal was a shameful chapter in the company's history.<,>那桩丑闻是公司历史上可耻的一页。<,>shame(羞耻)+ful(充满)→充满羞耻的→可耻的<,>respectable(adj.可敬的)/appreciable(adj.可察觉的)  

comparable<,>/ˈkɒmpərəbl/<,>/ˈkɑːmpərəbəl/<,>adj.可比较的/adj.类似的<,>The two products are comparable in quality.<,>这两款产品的质量相当。<,>Her achievements are comparable to those of her peers.<,>她的成就可以和同龄人相提并论。<,>There is no comparable example in history.<,>历史上没有类似的例子。<,>compare(比较)+able(能)→可比较的<,>appreciable(adj.可察觉的)/respectable(adj.可敬的)  

particular<,>/pəˈtɪkjələ(r)/<,>/pərˈtɪkjələr/<,>adj.特称的/adj.苛求的<,>She is very particular about her appearance.<,>她对自己的外表非常挑剔。<,>He didn't give any particular reason for his absence.<,>他没有给出任何特别的缺席理由。<,>This rule applies to this particular case.<,>这条规则适用于这个特定情况。<,>part(部分)+icular(属于…的)→属于某一部分的→特称的<,>specific(adj.特定的)/peculiar(adj.独特的)
whereby<,>/ˌweəˈbaɪ/<,>/ˌwɛrˈbaɪ/<,>adv.靠什么/adv.靠那个<,>He devised a plan whereby he could earn more money.<,>他想出了一个能赚更多钱的计划。<,>This is the system whereby we communicate.<,>这是我们用来沟通的系统。<,>She found a way whereby she could study abroad.<,>她找到了一个可以出国留学的方法。<,>where(哪里)+by(通过)→通过什么方式→靠什么<,>whereas(conj.然而)/whereupon(adv.于是)

ponder<,>/ˈpɒndə(r)/<,>/ˈpɑːndər/<,>v.考虑/v.沉思<,>He pondered the meaning of life for hours.<,>他花了几个小时思考生命的意义。<,>She sat by the window, pondering her decision.<,>她坐在窗边，思考着她的决定。<,>The committee is pondering the proposal carefully.<,>委员会正在仔细考虑这个提议。<,>pond(池塘)+er→像池塘一样深→沉思<,>wonder(v.想知道/n.奇迹)/pander(v.迎合)

exploration<,>/ˌekspləˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌɛkspləˈreɪʃən/<,>n.考察/n.勘探/n.探查<,>The exploration of space has always fascinated scientists.<,>太空探索一直吸引着科学家。<,>They went on an exploration of the Amazon rainforest.<,>他们去亚马逊雨林探险。<,>The book is an exploration of human emotions.<,>这本书是对人类情感的探索。<,>ex(出)+plor(哭喊)+ation→喊出来→探索<,>exploitation(n.剥削)/expiration(n.到期)

generosity<,>/ˌdʒenəˈrɒsəti/<,>/ˌdʒɛnəˈrɑːsəti/<,>n.慷慨/n.宽宏大量<,>Her generosity to the charity was widely praised.<,>她对慈善的慷慨受到广泛赞扬。<,>He showed great generosity in forgiving his enemy.<,>他宽恕敌人，表现出极大的宽容。<,>The millionaire was known for his generosity.<,>这位百万富翁以慷慨著称。<,>gener(产生)+osity(多)→产生很多→慷慨<,>general(n.将军/adj.一般的)/generate(v.产生)

discern<,>/dɪˈsɜːn/<,>/dɪˈsɜːrn/<,>v.弄清楚/v.辨别/v.看出<,>It was hard to discern his true intentions.<,>很难辨别他的真实意图。<,>She could barely discern the shape in the fog.<,>她在雾中几乎看不清形状。<,>With careful observation, you can discern the difference.<,>仔细观察，你就能看出区别。<,>dis(分开)+cern(区分)→分开区分→辨别<,>concern(v.涉及/n.关心)/discard(v.丢弃)

fell<,>/fel/<,>/fɛl/<,>v.砍倒(树等)/v.砍伐<,>They felled the old oak tree to make room for construction.<,>他们砍倒了老橡树，为建筑腾出空间。<,>The lumberjack felled twenty trees in one day.<,>伐木工人一天砍倒了二十棵树。<,>Many forests are being felled for agricultural land.<,>许多森林被砍伐用作农田。<,>fall(落下)的过去式→使倒下→砍倒<,>fall(v.落下)/felt(n.毛毡)

carry<,>/ˈkæri/<,>/ˈkæri/<,>v.刊登<,>The newspaper carried the story on its front page.<,>报纸在头版刊登了这个故事。<,>This magazine carries articles about science and technology.<,>这本杂志刊登科技类文章。<,>The journal will carry his research paper next month.<,>这本期刊下月将刊登他的研究论文。<,>carry(携带)→把信息携带给读者→刊登<,>cart(n.手推车)/care(n.关心)

inaugurate<,>/ɪˈnɔːɡjəreɪt/<,>/ɪˈnɔːɡjəreɪt/<,>v.使就职/v.开始<,>The new president will be inaugurated next month.<,>新总统将于下月就职。<,>The exhibition was inaugurated by the mayor.<,>展览由市长揭幕。<,>They inaugurated a new era of cooperation.<,>他们开启了一个合作的新时代。<,>in(进入)+augur(预示)+ate→进入预示→开始<,>augment(v.增加)/inaugural(adj.就职的)

initiate<,>/ɪˈnɪʃieɪt/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃieɪt/<,>v.开始/v.创始/v.启蒙<,>She initiated the project last year.<,>她去年启动了这个项目。<,>The company initiated a new training program.<,>公司启动了一个新的培训计划。<,>He was initiated into the secret society.<,>他被引入这个秘密社团。<,>in(进入)+it(走)+iate→走进去→开始<,>initial(adj.最初的)/intimate(adj.亲密的)

commence<,>/kəˈmens/<,>/kəˈmɛns/<,>v.开始/v.获得学位<,>The ceremony will commence at 9 am.<,>仪式将于上午9点开始。<,>He commenced his speech with a joke.<,>他以一个笑话开始了演讲。<,>She commenced her studies at Harvard.<,>她开始在哈佛学习。<,>com(共同)+mence(开始)→一起开始<,>commerce(n.商业)/commend(v.称赞)
reclaim<,>/rɪˈkleɪm/<,>/rɪˈkleɪm/<,>v.开垦/v.开拓/v.回收<,>The government plans to reclaim land from the sea for urban development.<,>政府计划填海造地用于城市发展。<,>We should reclaim waste materials for reuse.<,>我们应该回收废料再利用。<,>He reclaimed his reputation after the scandal.<,>他在丑闻后挽回了自己的声誉。<,>re(重新)+claim(要求)→重新要求→回收<,>exclaim(v.呼喊)/proclaim(v.宣布)/acclaim(v.称赞)

evolution<,>/ˌiːvəˈluːʃn/<,>/ˌɛvəˈluʃən/<,>n.进化<,>The theory of evolution explains the diversity of life.<,>进化论解释了生命的多样性。<,>Language evolution is a fascinating subject.<,>语言进化是一个迷人的课题。<,>The company's evolution from a small startup to a multinational is impressive.<,>这家公司从小创业公司到跨国企业的演变令人印象深刻。<,>e(出)+volut(转)+ion→转出来→进化<,>revolution(n.革命)/devolution(n.权力下放)/involution(n.复杂化)

start<,>/stɑːt/<,>/stɑrt/<,>v.开动/v.着手/v.开设<,>Let's start the meeting at 9 o'clock.<,>我们9点开始会议吧。<,>She started a new business last year.<,>她去年开设了新业务。<,>The engine won't start in this cold weather.<,>在这种寒冷天气里发动机无法启动。<,>st(站)+art(艺术)→站在艺术起点→开始<,>starve(v.挨饿)/stark(adj.完全的)/stare(v.凝视)

unlock<,>/ʌnˈlɒk/<,>/ʌnˈlɑk/<,>v.开...的锁/v.开启<,>I can't unlock my phone because I forgot the password.<,>我忘记密码无法解锁手机。<,>This discovery may unlock the secrets of the universe.<,>这一发现可能开启宇宙的奥秘。<,>She unlocked the door with a silver key.<,>她用银钥匙开了门锁。<,>un(否定)+lock(锁)→开锁<,>unload(v.卸货)/unfold(v.展开)/unlockable(adj.可解锁的)

sheriff<,>/ˈʃerɪf/<,>/ˈʃɛrɪf/<,>n.郡长<,>The sheriff is responsible for maintaining law and order in the county.<,>郡长负责维护郡内的法律和秩序。<,>The sheriff arrested the suspect yesterday.<,>郡长昨天逮捕了嫌疑人。<,>In the Wild West, sheriffs were often former gunslingers.<,>在西部拓荒时期，郡长常常是前枪手。<,>sher(分享)+iff(正义)→分享正义的人→郡长<,>sherbet(n.果汁冰糕)/sherry(n.雪利酒)/share(v.分享)

monarch<,>/ˈmɒnək/<,>/ˈmɑnərk/<,>n.君主/n.最高统治者<,>The monarch will address the nation on New Year's Day.<,>君主将在元旦向全国发表讲话。<,>Butterflies are beautiful monarchs of the insect world.<,>蝴蝶是昆虫界美丽的统治者。<,>The monarch's power was limited by the constitution.<,>君主的权力受到宪法限制。<,>mon(单一)+arch(统治)→单一统治者→君主<,>monarchy(n.君主制)/monastic(adj.修道院的)/monogram(n.字母组合)

sovereign<,>/ˈsɒvrɪn/<,>/ˈsɑvrən/<,>n.君主/adj.统治的<,>The sovereign has the power to pardon criminals.<,>君主有权赦免罪犯。<,>This is a matter of sovereign importance.<,>这是具有至高重要性的事情。<,>The country regained its sovereign rights after the war.<,>战后该国恢复了主权。<,>sove(超过)+reign(统治)→超越统治→君主<,>sovereignty(n.主权)/reign(v.统治)/foreign(adj.外国的)

bugle<,>/ˈbjuːɡl/<,>/ˈbjuɡəl/<,>n.军号/n.喇叭<,>The soldier played the bugle at dawn.<,>士兵在黎明时分吹响了军号。<,>A bugle call signaled the start of the race.<,>号角声标志着比赛开始。<,>He collects antique bugles from different armies.<,>他收藏各国军队的古老军号。<,>bug(昆虫)+le→像昆虫叫声的乐器→军号<,>bulge(n.膨胀)/bundle(n.捆)/burgle(v.入室盗窃)

extinct<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋkt/<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋkt/<,>adj.绝种的<,>Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.<,>恐龙已灭绝数百万年。<,>This volcano was thought to be extinct until it erupted last year.<,>这座火山去年喷发前被认为已经熄灭。<,>Many languages are in danger of becoming extinct.<,>许多语言面临灭绝的危险。<,>ex(出)+stinct(刺)→刺出去→灭绝<,>extinguish(v.熄灭)/distinct(adj.不同的)/instinct(n.本能)

decisive<,>/dɪˈsaɪsɪv/<,>/dɪˈsaɪsɪv/<,>adj.决定性的/adj.果断的<,>This was the decisive battle of the war.<,>这是战争的决定性战役。<,>She has a very decisive leadership style.<,>她的领导风格非常果断。<,>The jury reached a decisive verdict.<,>陪审团做出了决定性裁决。<,>de(下)+cis(切)+ive→切下去的→果断的<,>decision(n.决定)/incisive(adj.尖锐的)/precise(adj.精确的)
govern<,>/ˈɡʌvən/<,>/ˈɡʌvərn/<,>v.决定/v.支配/v.控制<,>Laws govern the behavior of citizens.<,>法律决定公民的行为。<,>He tried to govern his temper during the meeting.<,>他试图在会议期间控制自己的脾气。<,>Economic policies govern the country's growth.<,>经济政策支配着国家的增长。<,>govern(管理)+ment(名词后缀)→政府<,>governor(n.州长)/government(n.政府)/governess(n.女家庭教师)  

winding<,>/ˈwaɪndɪŋ/<,>/ˈwaɪndɪŋ/<,>n.蜿蜒曲折的路径/adj.蜿蜒曲折的<,>The car followed the winding road up the mountain.<,>汽车沿着蜿蜒的山路行驶。<,>She told a winding story that confused everyone.<,>她讲了一个曲折的故事，把大家都弄糊涂了。<,>The river has a winding course through the valley.<,>这条河蜿蜒穿过山谷。<,>wind(风)+ing(形容词后缀)→像风一样弯曲的<,>windy(adj.多风的)/winder(n.卷绕机)/unwind(v.解开)  

curly<,>/ˈkɜːli/<,>/ˈkɜːrli/<,>adj.卷曲的/adj.有卷毛的<,>She has beautiful curly hair.<,>她有一头漂亮的卷发。<,>The dog's curly tail wagged happily.<,>狗狗卷曲的尾巴快乐地摇着。<,>He prefers curly fries over straight ones.<,>比起直薯条，他更喜欢卷曲的薯条。<,>curl(卷曲)+y(形容词后缀)→卷曲的<,>curl(n.卷发/v.卷曲)/curler(n.卷发器)/curled(adj.卷曲的)  

reel<,>/riːl/<,>/ril/<,>v.卷/v.绕<,>He reeled in the fishing line quickly.<,>他迅速卷起钓鱼线。<,>The film was reeled onto the projector.<,>胶片被卷到放映机上。<,>She reeled off a list of names from memory.<,>她一口气背出了一串名字。<,>re(反复)+eel(像线一样)→反复绕线<,>real(adj.真实的)/peel(v.剥皮)/heel(n.脚后跟)  

mob<,>/mɒb/<,>/mɑːb/<,>v.团团围住（名人等）<,>Fans mobbed the actor as he left the theater.<,>演员离开剧院时被粉丝团团围住。<,>Protesters mobbed the government building.<,>抗议者围住了政府大楼。<,>The store was mobbed during the sale.<,>商店在大减价时被挤得水泄不通。<,>mob(移动的人群)→围住<,>mobster(n.暴徒)/mobile(adj.移动的)/mobcap(n.女帽)  

polymer<,>/ˈpɒlɪmə/<,>/ˈpɑːlɪmər/<,>n.聚合物/n.多聚物<,>Plastic is a common synthetic polymer.<,>塑料是一种常见的合成聚合物。<,>Natural rubber is a polymer of isoprene.<,>天然橡胶是异戊二烯的聚合物。<,>Scientists developed a new polymer for medical use.<,>科学家开发了一种新的医用聚合物。<,>poly(多)+mer(部分)→多个部分组合<,>monomer(n.单体)/polymerize(v.聚合)/polyester(n.聚酯)  

hurricane<,>/ˈhʌrɪkən/<,>/ˈhɜːrəkeɪn/<,>n.飓风/n.十二级风<,>The hurricane caused massive damage to the coast.<,>飓风对海岸造成了巨大破坏。<,>Residents evacuated before the hurricane hit.<,>居民在飓风来袭前撤离了。<,>Hurricane season lasts from June to November.<,>飓风季节从六月持续到十一月。<,>hurri(匆忙)+cane(可能来自cane,打击)→猛烈的风<,>typhoon(n.台风)/cyclone(n.旋风)/tornado(n.龙卷风)  

sting<,>/stɪŋ/<,>/stɪŋ/<,>n.剧痛/n.刺痛/v.刺<,>The bee sting left a red mark on her arm.<,>蜜蜂的刺在她手臂上留下了红印。<,>His words had a sharp sting of truth.<,>他的话带着尖锐的事实刺痛。<,>She was stung by a jellyfish while swimming.<,>她游泳时被水母刺了。<,>st(站)+ing(进行)→站着被刺<,>sing(v.唱歌)/stink(v.发臭)/stint(v.节约)  

repel<,>/rɪˈpel/<,>/rɪˈpɛl/<,>v.使厌恶/v.拒绝<,>The smell repelled everyone from the room.<,>这个气味让所有人都厌恶地离开了房间。<,>This fabric repels water effectively.<,>这种布料能有效防水。<,>She repelled his advances politely but firmly.<,>她礼貌而坚定地拒绝了他的追求。<,>re(反)+pel(推)→推回去→拒绝<,>repellent(adj.令人厌恶的)/compel(v.强迫)/expel(v.驱逐)  

gigantic<,>/dʒaɪˈɡæntɪk/<,>/dʒaɪˈɡæntɪk/<,>adj.巨大的/adj.巨人似的<,>They built a gigantic statue in the city center.<,>他们在市中心建了一座巨大的雕像。<,>The project requires a gigantic amount of resources.<,>这个项目需要巨量的资源。<,>A gigantic wave crashed against the shore.<,>一个巨浪拍打在岸上。<,>giant(巨人)+ic(形容词后缀)→巨人般的<,>gigantean(adj.巨大的)/gigantism(n.巨人症)/giant(n.巨人)
uphold<,>/ʌpˈhəʊld/<,>/ʌpˈhoʊld/<,>v.维护<,>The court upheld the decision.<,>法院维持了原判。<,>We must uphold the principles of justice.<,>我们必须维护正义的原则。<,>She upheld her family's traditions.<,>她维护了家族的传统。<,>up(向上)+hold(保持)→保持向上→维护<,>withhold(v. 扣留)/upholstery(n. 室内装潢)  

exemplify<,>/ɪɡˈzemplɪfaɪ/<,>/ɪɡˈzemplɪfaɪ/<,>v.举例证明/解释<,>This case exemplifies the need for reform.<,>这个案例证明了改革的必要性。<,>Her work exemplifies the best traditions of the school.<,>她的作品体现了学校的最佳传统。<,>The diagram exemplifies the process clearly.<,>这个图表清楚地解释了该过程。<,>ex(出)+empli(例子)+fy(使)→用例子说明<,>amplify(v. 放大)/simplify(v. 简化)  

rectangle<,>/ˈrektæŋɡl/<,>/ˈrektæŋɡəl/<,>n.矩形/长方形<,>The table is in the shape of a rectangle.<,>这张桌子是长方形的。<,>Draw a rectangle with sides of 5cm and 3cm.<,>画一个边长5厘米和3厘米的长方形。<,>The room was a perfect rectangle.<,>这个房间是个标准的长方形。<,>rect(直)+angle(角)→四个直角→矩形<,>triangle(n. 三角形)/pentangle(n. 五角形)  

administration<,>/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃn/<,>/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃən/<,>n.局/署/处等<,>She works in hospital administration.<,>她在医院行政部门工作。<,>The new administration will take office next month.<,>新政府将于下月就职。<,>This falls under the administration of the local council.<,>这属于地方议会的管辖范围。<,>admin(管理)+istr(人)+ation→管理机构<,>minister(n. 部长)/administrate(v. 管理)  

reside<,>/rɪˈzaɪd/<,>/rɪˈzaɪd/<,>v.居住/驻扎/属于<,>They reside in a small village.<,>他们居住在一个小村庄。<,>The power to make laws resides with Parliament.<,>立法权属于议会。<,>The problem resides in the lack of funding.<,>问题在于缺乏资金。<,>re(再)+side(坐)→长期坐在某处→居住<,>preside(v. 主持)/subside(v. 平息)  

dwell<,>/dwel/<,>/dwel/<,>v.居住/凝思/细想<,>They dwell in the mountains.<,>他们住在山里。<,>Don't dwell on past mistakes.<,>不要老想着过去的错误。<,>The book dwells on the author's childhood.<,>这本书详细描述了作者的童年。<,>d(地)+well(好)→住得好→居住<,>swell(v. 肿胀)/twelve(num. 十二)  

induction<,>/ɪnˈdʌkʃn/<,>/ɪnˈdʌkʃən/<,>n.就职/归纳推理<,>His induction as president was a grand ceremony.<,>他的总统就职典礼很隆重。<,>This is an example of inductive reasoning.<,>这是归纳推理的一个例子。<,>The induction process took three days.<,>入职培训持续了三天。<,>in(入)+duct(引导)+ion→引入→就职<,>deduction(n. 扣除)/conduction(n. 传导)  

Christ<,>/kraɪst/<,>/kraɪst/<,>n.救世主(耶稣基督)<,>They prayed to Christ for help.<,>他们向基督祈祷求助。<,>The painting depicts Christ on the cross.<,>这幅画描绘了十字架上的基督。<,>Christmas celebrates the birth of Christ.<,>圣诞节庆祝基督的诞生。<,>音译"基督"<,>Christmas(n. 圣诞节)/Christian(n. 基督徒)  

symposium<,>/sɪmˈpəʊziəm/<,>/sɪmˈpoʊziəm/<,>n.座谈会<,>He spoke at an international symposium.<,>他在一个国际座谈会上发言。<,>The symposium will last three days.<,>这次座谈会将持续三天。<,>Papers presented at the symposium will be published.<,>座谈会上提交的论文将被出版。<,>sym(共同)+pos(饮)+ium→古希腊人边饮酒边讨论→座谈会<,>seminar(n. 研讨会)/forum(n. 论坛)  

whoever<,>/huːˈevə(r)/<,>/huːˈevər/<,>pron.究竟是谁<,>Whoever said that was mistaken.<,>说这话的人肯定是错了。<,>Whoever wins will get a prize.<,>无论谁赢都会得到奖品。<,>Give it to whoever needs it most.<,>把它给最需要的人。<,>who(谁)+ever(究竟)→究竟是谁<,>whatever(pron. 无论什么)/whichever(pron. 无论哪个)
rectify<,>/ˈrektɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈrektəˌfaɪ/<,>v.纠正/v.调整<,>The company took steps to rectify the error.<,>公司采取措施纠正错误。<,>He needs to rectify his attitude towards work.<,>他需要调整工作态度。<,>The mechanic will rectify the problem with the engine.<,>技工会调整发动机的问题。<,>rect(直)+ify(使)→使变直→纠正<,>correct(v. 改正)/rectitude(n.正直)/rectilinear(adj.直线的)

vein<,>/veɪn/<,>/veɪn/<,>n.静脉/n.血管/n.矿脉<,>The nurse drew blood from his vein.<,>护士从他的静脉抽血。<,>Gold was discovered in the quartz vein.<,>在石英矿脉中发现了黄金。<,>She has a vein of creativity in her writing.<,>她的写作中有一股创造力。<,>vein(血管)→像血管一样的矿脉<,>vain(adj.徒劳的)/veil(n.面纱)/venom(n.毒液)

competitor<,>/kəmˈpetɪtə(r)/<,>/kəmˈpetɪtər/<,>n.竞争者/n.敌手<,>Our main competitor launched a new product.<,>我们的主要竞争对手推出了新产品。<,>She was a strong competitor in the race.<,>她是比赛中强有力的竞争者。<,>The two companies are fierce competitors.<,>这两家公司是激烈的竞争对手。<,>com(共同)+pet(追求)+itor(人)→共同追求的人→竞争者<,>competent(adj.有能力的)/competition(n.比赛)/compile(v.编译)

competitive<,>/kəmˈpetətɪv/<,>/kəmˈpetətɪv/<,>adj.竞争的/adj.比赛的<,>He has a competitive spirit.<,>他有竞争精神。<,>The market is highly competitive.<,>市场竞争非常激烈。<,>She enjoys competitive sports.<,>她喜欢竞技体育。<,>compet(竞争)+itive(形容词后缀)→竞争的<,>comparative(adj.比较的)/cooperative(adj.合作的)/competitive(adj.有竞争力的)

contend<,>/kənˈtend/<,>/kənˈtend/<,>v.竞争/v.坚决主张<,>They must contend with many difficulties.<,>他们必须与许多困难作斗争。<,>I contend that the theory is flawed.<,>我坚决认为这个理论有缺陷。<,>Several teams are contending for the championship.<,>有几支队伍在争夺冠军。<,>con(共同)+tend(伸展)→共同伸展→竞争<,>content(n.内容)/contend(v.竞争)/contempt(n.轻视)

alert<,>/əˈlɜːt/<,>/əˈlɜːrt/<,>adj.警惕的<,>Stay alert while driving at night.<,>夜间开车要保持警惕。<,>The dog was alert to every sound.<,>狗对每个声音都很警觉。<,>We must remain alert to potential dangers.<,>我们必须对潜在危险保持警惕。<,>al(加强)+ert(观察)→加强观察→警惕的<,>inert(adj.惰性的)/avert(v.避免)/assert(v.断言)

warning<,>/ˈwɔːnɪŋ/<,>/ˈwɔːrnɪŋ/<,>n.警告/n.告诫/n.鉴诫<,>The weather service issued a storm warning.<,>气象部门发布了风暴警告。<,>He ignored all the warning signs.<,>他忽略了所有的警告信号。<,>Let this be a warning to you.<,>让这件事成为对你的鉴诫。<,>warn(警告)+ing(名词后缀)→警告<,>morning(n.早晨)/awning(n.遮阳篷)/waning(adj.减弱的)

whale<,>/weɪl/<,>/weɪl/<,>n.鲸<,>We saw a whale breach the surface.<,>我们看到一头鲸跃出水面。<,>Whale watching is popular in this area.<,>观鲸在这个地区很受欢迎。<,>The blue whale is the largest animal on Earth.<,>蓝鲸是地球上最大的动物。<,>whale(鲸)→巨大的海洋生物<,>wail(v.哀嚎)/wale(n.条痕)/whole(adj.完整的)

selection<,>/sɪˈlekʃn/<,>/sɪˈlekʃən/<,>n.选择/n.精选的东西<,>The store has a wide selection of wines.<,>这家商店有各种各样的葡萄酒可供选择。<,>Her selection for the team was unexpected.<,>她被选入球队出人意料。<,>This is a selection of his best works.<,>这是他最佳作品的选集。<,>select(选择)+ion(名词后缀)→选择<,>election(n.选举)/section(n.部分)/selection(n.精选)

thorough<,>/ˈθʌrə/<,>/ˈθɜːroʊ/<,>adj.精心的/adj.详尽的<,>She gave the room a thorough cleaning.<,>她彻底打扫了房间。<,>The investigation was very thorough.<,>调查非常详尽。<,>He is thorough in his work.<,>他工作一丝不苟。<,>through(通过)+o→完全通过的→彻底的<,>though(conj.虽然)/through(prep.通过)/trough(n.槽)
finely<,>/ˈfaɪnli/<,>/ˈfaɪnli/<,>adv.精细地/adv.美好地<,>The fabric was finely woven.<,>这块布料织得很精细。<,>She was dressed finely for the party.<,>她为派对穿得很漂亮。<,>The chef chopped the herbs finely.<,>厨师把香草切得很细。<,>fine(精细的)+ly(副词后缀)→精细地<,>final(adj.最终的)/finance(n.金融)  

literary<,>/ˈlɪtərəri/<,>/ˈlɪtəˌreri/<,>adj.文学的<,>He has a great interest in literary works.<,>他对文学作品很感兴趣。<,>The book is full of literary references.<,>这本书充满了文学典故。<,>She pursued a literary career.<,>她从事文学事业。<,>liter(文字)+ary(形容词后缀)→文学的<,>literal(adj.字面的)/literature(n.文学)  

refinery<,>/rɪˈfaɪnəri/<,>/rɪˈfaɪnəri/<,>n.精炼厂/n.提炼厂<,>The oil refinery produces gasoline.<,>这家炼油厂生产汽油。<,>They built a new sugar refinery.<,>他们新建了一家糖厂。<,>The refinery processes crude oil.<,>这家精炼厂加工原油。<,>refine(精炼)+ry(场所)→精炼厂<,>define(v.定义)/confine(v.限制)  

vigorous<,>/ˈvɪɡərəs/<,>/ˈvɪɡərəs/<,>adj.精力旺盛的/adj.茁壮的<,>He maintains a vigorous exercise routine.<,>他保持着高强度的锻炼习惯。<,>The plant grew with vigorous health.<,>这棵植物长得很茁壮。<,>She gave a vigorous speech.<,>她发表了充满激情的演讲。<,>vigor(活力)+ous(形容词后缀)→精力旺盛的<,>rigorous(adj.严格的)/vigilant(adj.警惕的)  

fright<,>/fraɪt/<,>/fraɪt/<,>n.惊吓/n.恐怖<,>The loud noise gave me a fright.<,>巨大的声响吓了我一跳。<,>She turned pale with fright.<,>她吓得脸色苍白。<,>The movie is full of fright scenes.<,>这部电影有很多恐怖场景。<,>fr(联想freeze冻结)+ight→吓得僵住→惊吓<,>flight(n.飞行)/fight(v.打架)  

astonishment<,>/əˈstɒnɪʃmənt/<,>/əˈstɑːnɪʃmənt/<,>n.惊奇/n.惊讶<,>To my astonishment, he won the race.<,>令我惊讶的是，他赢了比赛。<,>Her face showed astonishment.<,>她脸上露出惊讶的表情。<,>The news caused widespread astonishment.<,>这个消息引起了广泛的震惊。<,>astonish(使惊讶)+ment(名词后缀)→惊讶<,>astonish(v.使惊讶)/astonishing(adj.惊人的)  

dismay<,>/dɪsˈmeɪ/<,>/dɪsˈmeɪ/<,>n.惊慌/n.沮丧/n.灰心<,>He looked at her in dismay.<,>他惊慌地看着她。<,>The team felt dismay after losing.<,>输掉比赛后，队员们很沮丧。<,>To her dismay, the project was canceled.<,>令她灰心的是，项目被取消了。<,>dis(否定)+may(可能)→觉得不可能→沮丧<,>display(v.展示)/dismiss(v.解散)  

empirical<,>/ɪmˈpɪrɪkəl/<,>/ɪmˈpɪrɪkəl/<,>adj.经验主义的<,>The theory is based on empirical evidence.<,>这个理论基于经验证据。<,>They conducted empirical research.<,>他们进行了实证研究。<,>Empirical data supports the hypothesis.<,>经验数据支持这个假设。<,>em(进入)+pir(尝试)+ical→通过尝试获得的→经验主义的<,>imperial(adj.帝国的)/empire(n.帝国)  

longitude<,>/ˈlɒŋɡɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈlɑːndʒətuːd/<,>n.经线/n.经度<,>The ship's longitude was recorded.<,>船的经度被记录下来了。<,>They calculated the longitude accurately.<,>他们精确计算了经度。<,>Longitude lines run north-south.<,>经线是南北走向的。<,>long(长的)+itude(状态)→地球上的长线→经度<,>latitude(n.纬度)/altitude(n.高度)  

support<,>/səˈpɔːt/<,>/səˈpɔːrt/<,>v.经受/v.承受<,>The bridge can support heavy trucks.<,>这座桥能承受重型卡车。<,>She supported the weight bravely.<,>她勇敢地承受了重量。<,>His legs could barely support him.<,>他的腿几乎支撑不住他。<,>sup(在下面)+port(携带)→在下面托着→承受<,>suppose(v.假设)/supply(v.供应)
economics<,>/ˌiːkəˈnɒmɪks/<,>/ˌɛkəˈnɑmɪks/<,>n.经济学/n.经济<,>She studied economics at university.<,>她在大学学习经济学。<,>The economics of the project are questionable.<,>该项目的经济性值得怀疑。<,>The country's economics have improved in recent years.<,>近年来该国的经济状况有所改善。<,>eco(生态)+nom(管理)+ics(学科)→管理生态的学科→经济学<,>economy(n.经济)/economic(adj.经济的)/economical(adj.节约的)

prohibition<,>/ˌprəʊɪˈbɪʃən/<,>/ˌproʊəˈbɪʃən/<,>n.禁止/n.禁令/n.禁律<,>The prohibition of smoking in public places is strictly enforced.<,>公共场所禁止吸烟的规定得到严格执行。<,>During Prohibition, alcohol was banned in the US.<,>禁酒令期间，美国禁止销售酒精饮料。<,>There's a prohibition against parking here.<,>此处禁止停车。<,>pro(前)+hibit(拿住)+ion→提前拿住→禁止<,>inhibition(n.抑制)/exhibition(n.展览)/habitation(n.居住)

shortcut<,>/ˈʃɔːtkʌt/<,>/ˈʃɔrtˌkʌt/<,>n.近路/n.捷径<,>I know a shortcut through the park.<,>我知道穿过公园的近路。<,>There's no shortcut to success.<,>成功没有捷径。<,>He took a shortcut to finish the work faster.<,>他走捷径以便更快完成工作。<,>short(短的)+cut(切)→切短的路→捷径<,>shortcoming(n.缺点)/shortlist(n.候选名单)/shorten(v.缩短)

inlet<,>/ˈɪnlet/<,>/ˈɪnˌlɛt/<,>n.水湾/n.进口<,>The boat entered a small inlet.<,>小船驶入一个小水湾。<,>There's an air inlet in the wall.<,>墙上有个进气口。<,>The inlet pipe brings water into the system.<,>进水管将水引入系统。<,>in(进入)+let(让)→让...进入的地方→进口<,>outlet(n.出口)/inlet(n.进口)/offset(n.抵消)

perfection<,>/pəˈfekʃən/<,>/pərˈfɛkʃən/<,>n.尽善尽美/n.无比精确<,>She strives for perfection in her work.<,>她追求工作中的尽善尽美。<,>The dish was cooked to perfection.<,>这道菜做得完美无缺。<,>His performance was near perfection.<,>他的表现近乎完美。<,>perfect(完美)+ion(名词后缀)→完美状态<,>perfectionist(n.完美主义者)/imperfection(n.不完美)/affection(n.喜爱)

notwithstanding<,>/ˌnɒtwɪθˈstændɪŋ/<,>/ˌnɑtwɪθˈstændɪŋ/<,>prep.尽管/prep.虽然<,>Notwithstanding the rain, the game continued.<,>尽管下雨，比赛仍继续进行。<,>He failed notwithstanding his efforts.<,>尽管努力，他还是失败了。<,>Notwithstanding her age, she's very active.<,>虽然年纪大，她仍然很活跃。<,>not(不)+withstand(抵抗)+ing→不抵抗→尽管<,>withstand(v.抵抗)/understanding(n.理解)/outstanding(adj.杰出的)

prudent<,>/ˈpruːdənt/<,>/ˈprudənt/<,>adj.谨慎的/adj.精明的<,>It would be prudent to save some money.<,>存些钱是谨慎的做法。<,>He made a prudent investment decision.<,>他做出了精明的投资决定。<,>A prudent person thinks before acting.<,>谨慎的人三思而后行。<,>prud(谨慎)+ent(形容词后缀)→谨慎的<,>prudence(n.谨慎)/impudent(adj.鲁莽的)/student(n.学生)

compact<,>/kəmˈpækt/<,>/kəmˈpækt/<,>adj.紧密的/v.使紧凑<,>The apartment is small but compact.<,>公寓虽小但布局紧凑。<,>She compacted the soil around the plant.<,>她把植物周围的土压实。<,>The car has a compact design.<,>这辆车设计紧凑。<,>com(一起)+pact(固定)→固定在一起→紧凑的<,>impact(n.影响)/contract(n.合同)/pact(n.协定)

tightly<,>/ˈtaɪtli/<,>/ˈtaɪtli/<,>adv.紧地/adv.牢固地<,>She held the baby tightly.<,>她紧紧地抱着婴儿。<,>The lid was screwed on tightly.<,>盖子拧得很紧。<,>He gripped the rope tightly.<,>他紧紧抓住绳子。<,>tight(紧的)+ly(副词后缀)→紧紧地<,>lightly(adv.轻轻地)/brightly(adv.明亮地)/rightly(adv.正确地)

barely<,>/ˈbeəli/<,>/ˈbɛrli/<,>adv.勉强/adv.仅仅<,>He barely passed the exam.<,>他勉强通过了考试。<,>There was barely enough food for everyone.<,>食物勉强够每个人吃。<,>She could barely see in the dark.<,>她在黑暗中几乎看不见。<,>bare(赤裸的)+ly(副词后缀)→几乎没有→勉强<,>bare(adj.赤裸的)/barely(adv.勉强)/merely(adv.仅仅)
metallic<,>/məˈtælɪk/<,>/məˈtælɪk/<,>adj.金属的<,>The car has a shiny metallic paint.<,>这辆车有着闪亮的金属漆。<,>She wore a dress with metallic threads.<,>她穿了一件带有金属线的裙子。<,>The robot had a metallic voice.<,>机器人有着金属般的声音。<,>metal(金属)+lic(形容词后缀)→金属的<,>metal(n.金属)/metallurgy(n.冶金学)  

tuna<,>/ˈtjuːnə/<,>/ˈtuːnə/<,>n.金枪鱼<,>I had a tuna sandwich for lunch.<,>我午餐吃了一个金枪鱼三明治。<,>Tuna is rich in omega-3 fatty acids.<,>金枪鱼富含omega-3脂肪酸。<,>We caught a big tuna during our fishing trip.<,>我们在钓鱼时抓到了一条大金枪鱼。<,>tun(桶)+a→金枪鱼体型像桶→金枪鱼<,>tune(n.曲调/v.调整)/tundra(n.苔原)  

henceforth<,>/ˌhensˈfɔːθ/<,>/ˌhɛnsˈfɔrθ/<,>adv.今后/从今以后<,>Henceforth, all meetings will be held online.<,>今后所有会议都将在线上举行。<,>He promised to be more careful henceforth.<,>他承诺从今以后会更加小心。<,>Henceforth, this rule will be strictly enforced.<,>从今以后这条规则将被严格执行。<,>hence(从此)+forth(向前)→从此向前→今后<,>hence(adv.因此)/forth(adv.向前)  

mustard<,>/ˈmʌstəd/<,>/ˈmʌstərd/<,>n.芥子/芥末<,>Would you like some mustard on your hot dog?<,>你的热狗上要加点芥末吗？<,>Mustard seeds are used in Indian cooking.<,>芥子被用于印度烹饪中。<,>The mustard was too spicy for the child.<,>芥末对孩子来说太辣了。<,>must(必须)+ard→必须加的调味料→芥末<,>custard(n.蛋奶冻)/musty(adj.发霉的)  

presentation<,>/ˌpreznˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌpriːzenˈteɪʃən/<,>n.介绍/呈现<,>She gave an excellent presentation about climate change.<,>她就气候变化做了一个出色的介绍。<,>The presentation of the food was very artistic.<,>食物的呈现非常艺术化。<,>He was nervous before his job interview presentation.<,>他在面试介绍前很紧张。<,>present(呈现)+ation(名词后缀)→呈现<,>representation(n.代表)/preservation(n.保存)  

interpret<,>/ɪnˈtɜːprɪt/<,>/ɪnˈtɜːrprɪt/<,>v.口译/解释<,>Can you interpret what he's saying in French?<,>你能用法语口译他在说什么吗？<,>Different people may interpret the law differently.<,>不同的人可能对法律有不同的解释。<,>She interpreted the dream as a warning.<,>她把那个梦解释为一个警告。<,>inter(在...之间)+pret(表达)→在两种语言之间表达→口译<,>interrupt(v.打断)/intercept(v.拦截)  

version<,>/ˈvɜːʃn/<,>/ˈvɜːrʒən/<,>n.解释<,>This is my version of what happened last night.<,>这是我对昨晚发生之事的解释。<,>The film is a modern version of the classic novel.<,>这部电影是那部经典小说的现代版解释。<,>There are several versions of this story.<,>这个故事有几个不同的解释版本。<,>vers(转)+ion→转换说法→解释<,>vision(n.视力)/verse(n.诗句)  

untie<,>/ʌnˈtaɪ/<,>/ʌnˈtaɪ/<,>v.解开/松开/解放<,>Please help me untie this knot.<,>请帮我解开这个结。<,>He untied the boat from the dock.<,>他把船从码头解开了。<,>The prisoner was finally untied after hours.<,>几个小时后囚犯终于被松绑了。<,>un(不)+tie(系)→不系→解开<,>unite(v.联合)/until(conj.直到)  

tackle<,>/ˈtækl/<,>/ˈtækəl/<,>v.解决/对付/n.用具<,>We need to tackle this problem immediately.<,>我们需要立即解决这个问题。<,>He tackled the thief to the ground.<,>他把小偷扑倒在地对付他。<,>The fishing tackle was expensive.<,>这套钓鱼用具很贵。<,>tack(钉)+le→用钉子固定→解决<,>tickle(v.挠痒)/tacky(adj.俗气的)  

dissolve<,>/dɪˈzɒlv/<,>/dɪˈzɑːlv/<,>v.解除(婚约等)<,>They decided to dissolve their marriage.<,>他们决定解除婚姻关系。<,>Sugar will dissolve in hot water.<,>糖会在热水中溶解。<,>The parliament voted to dissolve the committee.<,>议会投票决定解除该委员会。<,>dis(分开)+solve(解决)→分开解决→解除<,>resolve(v.决心)/absolve(v.赦免)
tuberculosis<,>/tjuːˌbɜːkjʊˈləʊsɪs/<,>/tuːˌbɜːrkjəˈloʊsɪs/<,>n.结核病/n.肺结核<,>Tuberculosis is a serious infectious disease that mainly affects the lungs.<,>结核病是一种主要影响肺部的严重传染病。<,>Many people in developing countries still suffer from tuberculosis.<,>许多发展中国家的人仍然患有结核病。<,>Early detection is crucial for treating tuberculosis effectively.<,>早期发现对有效治疗结核病至关重要。<,>tube(管)+culosis(病)→肺部病变→结核病<,>pneumonia(n.肺炎)/bronchitis(n.支气管炎)

incorporate<,>/ɪnˈkɔːpəreɪt/<,>/ɪnˈkɔːrpəreɪt/<,>v.结合/v.合并/v.收编<,>The new design will incorporate the latest technology.<,>新设计将融入最新技术。<,>Our company plans to incorporate the smaller firm next month.<,>我们公司计划下个月合并那家小公司。<,>The recipe incorporates ingredients from three different cultures.<,>这个食谱融合了三种不同文化的食材。<,>in(进入)+corporate(团体)→加入团体→合并<,>corporate(adj.公司的)/cooperate(v.合作)/incorruptible(adj.廉洁的)

construction<,>/kənˈstrʌkʃən/<,>/kənˈstrʌkʃən/<,>n.建筑结构<,>The construction of the new bridge will take two years.<,>新桥的建设将需要两年时间。<,>This building has a unique steel construction.<,>这座建筑有独特的钢结构。<,>Road construction is causing traffic delays downtown.<,>道路施工导致市中心交通延误。<,>con(共同)+struct(建造)+ion→共同建造→建筑<,>destruction(n.破坏)/instruction(n.指导)/reconstruction(n.重建)

economically<,>/ˌiːkəˈnɒmɪkli/<,>/ˌiːkəˈnɑːmɪkli/<,>adv.在经济上/adv.节约地<,>The country is economically stable despite global challenges.<,>尽管面临全球挑战，该国经济依然稳定。<,>She manages her household very economically.<,>她非常节约地管理家庭开支。<,>This car is designed to run economically on fuel.<,>这款车设计为燃油经济型。<,>economic(经济的)+ally(副词后缀)→经济上<,>economical(adj.节约的)/economics(n.经济学)/economy(n.经济)

abbreviation<,>/əˌbriːviˈeɪʃən/<,>/əˌbriːviˈeɪʃən/<,>n.节略/n.缩写/n.缩短<,>"Dr." is an abbreviation for "Doctor".<,>"Dr."是"Doctor"的缩写。<,>The text was full of abbreviations that made it hard to read.<,>文本中满是缩写，难以阅读。<,>Please write the full word instead of using abbreviations.<,>请写出完整单词而不是用缩写。<,>ab(加强)+brevi(短)+ation→使变短→缩写<,>abridge(v.删节)/brevity(n.简短)/abbreviate(v.缩写)

thrifty<,>/ˈθrɪfti/<,>/ˈθrɪfti/<,>adj.节俭的<,>My grandmother was very thrifty and never wasted anything.<,>我祖母非常节俭，从不浪费任何东西。<,>Being thrifty helped them save for their dream house.<,>节俭帮助他们存钱买了梦想中的房子。<,>Thrifty shoppers always look for the best deals.<,>节俭的购物者总是寻找最划算的交易。<,>thrift(节俭)+y(形容词后缀)→节俭的<,>thrift(n.节俭)/wasteful(adj.浪费的)/frugal(adj.节约的)

interview<,>/ˈɪntəvjuː/<,>/ˈɪntərvjuː/<,>v.接见/v.会见/v.会谈<,>The journalist will interview the president tomorrow.<,>记者明天将采访总统。<,>I have a job interview at 2 pm today.<,>我今天下午两点有个工作面试。<,>The police want to interview several witnesses.<,>警方想询问几位目击者。<,>inter(相互)+view(看)→相互见面→面试<,>preview(n.预览)/review(n.复习)/viewpoint(n.观点)

receiver<,>/rɪˈsiːvə(r)/<,>/rɪˈsiːvər/<,>n.接待者/n.收受者<,>The receiver of the award gave an emotional speech.<,>获奖者发表了感人的演讲。<,>Please leave the package with the front desk receiver.<,>请把包裹交给前台接待员。<,>The phone's receiver was damaged in the fall.<,>电话听筒在掉落时损坏了。<,>receive(接收)+er(人)→接收者<,>recipient(n.接受者)/receptionist(n.接待员)/receipt(n.收据)

yeast<,>/jiːst/<,>/jiːst/<,>n.酵母<,>Yeast is essential for making bread rise.<,>酵母对面包发酵至关重要。<,>Brewers use yeast to ferment beer.<,>酿酒师用酵母发酵啤酒。<,>Some people are allergic to yeast products.<,>有些人对酵母制品过敏。<,>yeast→east(东方)→东方发明的发酵技术<,>leaven(n.酵母)/ferment(v.发酵)/bacteria(n.细菌)

doctrine<,>/ˈdɒktrɪn/<,>/ˈdɑːktrɪn/<,>n.教义/n.主义/n.学说<,>The church's doctrine prohibits certain behaviors.<,>教会的教义禁止某些行为。<,>The Monroe Doctrine shaped US foreign policy.<,>门罗主义塑造了美国的外交政策。<,>Darwin's doctrine of evolution changed science forever.<,>达尔文的进化论永远改变了科学。<,>doc(教导)+trine→教导的内容→教义<,>dogma(n.教条)/principle(n.原则)/creed(n.信条)
tutor<,>/ˈtjuːtə(r)/<,>/ˈtuːtər/<,>v.教/v.指导<,>She tutors students in mathematics after school.<,>她放学后辅导学生数学。<,>He was tutored by a famous pianist.<,>他由一位著名钢琴家指导。<,>The program tutors young athletes in both skills and discipline.<,>这个项目在技能和纪律上指导年轻运动员。<,>tut(监护)+or(人)→监护人→指导<,>mentor(n.导师/v.指导)/instructor(n.教练/v.指导)

disillusion<,>/ˌdɪsɪˈluːʒn/<,>/ˌdɪsɪˈluːʒən/<,>v.觉醒/v.使觉醒<,>The harsh reality disillusioned him about fame.<,>残酷的现实让他对名声幻想破灭。<,>She became disillusioned with politics after the scandal.<,>丑闻后她对政治感到失望。<,>The failed experiment disillusioned the young scientist.<,>失败的实验让这位年轻科学家醒悟。<,>dis(否定)+illusion(幻觉)→打破幻觉→觉醒<,>illusion(n.幻觉)/delusion(n.妄想)/disenchant(v.使醒悟)

horn<,>/hɔːn/<,>/hɔːrn/<,>n.角状物/n.喇叭形物<,>The rhinoceros has a large horn on its nose.<,>犀牛鼻子上有个大角。<,>She honked the car horn impatiently.<,>她不耐烦地按汽车喇叭。<,>The Viking helmet had two decorative horns.<,>维京头盔有两个装饰性的角。<,>horn(角)→形状像角的物体<,>thorn(n.荆棘)/corn(n.玉米)/harp(n.竖琴)

reef<,>/riːf/<,>/riːf/<,>n.礁/n.礁石/n.暗礁<,>The shipwreck lies near a coral reef.<,>沉船位于珊瑚礁附近。<,>Divers explored the colorful reef ecosystem.<,>潜水员探索了色彩斑斓的礁石生态系统。<,>The captain carefully navigated around the hidden reef.<,>船长小心地绕过暗礁航行。<,>reef(暗礁)→与"reef knot"(方结)同源<,>beef(n.牛肉)/leaf(n.树叶)/reefer(n.冷藏车)

coke<,>/kəʊk/<,>/koʊk/<,>n.焦炭<,>The steel plant uses coke as a fuel source.<,>钢铁厂使用焦炭作为燃料。<,>Coke is produced by heating coal in the absence of air.<,>焦炭是通过隔绝空气加热煤生产的。<,>The blacksmith put more coke into the furnace.<,>铁匠往熔炉里加了更多焦炭。<,>coke(焦炭)→与饮料"Coca-Cola"缩写相同<,>coal(n.煤)/charcoal(n.木炭)/coke(n.可口可乐)

symphony<,>/ˈsɪmfəni/<,>/ˈsɪmfəni/<,>n.交响乐/n.交响乐团<,>Beethoven's Ninth Symphony is a masterpiece.<,>贝多芬第九交响曲是杰作。<,>The city symphony orchestra performs every Friday.<,>城市交响乐团每周五演出。<,>She closed her eyes to enjoy the symphony.<,>她闭上眼睛欣赏交响乐。<,>sym(共同)+phon(声音)+y→共同发出的声音→交响乐<,>phonetic(adj.语音的)/symphonic(adj.交响乐的)/cacophony(n.刺耳的声音)

intercourse<,>/ˈɪntəkɔːs/<,>/ˈɪntərkɔːrs/<,>n.交际/n.往来/n.交流<,>Cultural intercourse enriches both societies.<,>文化交流使双方社会都更丰富。<,>They maintained social intercourse through letters.<,>他们通过书信保持社交往来。<,>The summit promoted international intercourse.<,>峰会促进了国际交流。<,>inter(相互)+course(过程)→相互交流的过程<,>discourse(n.论述)/interact(v.互动)/interchange(n.交换)

soy<,>/sɔɪ/<,>/sɔɪ/<,>n.大豆/n.黄豆/n.酱油<,>Soy milk is a popular dairy alternative.<,>豆浆是常见的乳制品替代品。<,>The fields were planted with soy beans.<,>田里种满了黄豆。<,>This recipe calls for a teaspoon of soy sauce.<,>这个食谱需要一茶匙酱油。<,>soy(大豆)→源自日语"醤油"(しょうゆ)<,>soil(n.土壤)/soybean(n.大豆)/soya(n.大豆)

parachute<,>/ˈpærəʃuːt/<,>/ˈpærəʃuːt/<,>n.降落伞<,>The skydiver checked his parachute carefully.<,>跳伞者仔细检查了降落伞。<,>The supplies were dropped by parachute.<,>物资通过降落伞空投。<,>Her parachute opened at 3,000 feet.<,>她的降落伞在3000英尺高度打开。<,>para(防护)+chute(坠落)→防止坠落的装置<,>parasol(n.遮阳伞)/paratrooper(n.伞兵)/parachutist(n.跳伞者)

degradation<,>/ˌdeɡrəˈdeɪʃn/<,>/ˌdeɡrəˈdeɪʃən/<,>n.降级/n.退化/n.衰变<,>Soil degradation is a serious environmental issue.<,>土壤退化是严重的环境问题。<,>His demotion was a professional degradation.<,>他的降职是职业上的降级。<,>The degradation of the material was caused by sunlight.<,>材料的衰变是由阳光引起的。<,>de(向下)+grad(等级)+ation→等级下降→降级<,>upgrade(n.升级)/downgrade(n.降级)/degradable(adj.可降解的)
oar<,>/ɔː(r)/<,>/ɔːr/<,>n.桨<,>He rowed the boat with a single oar.<,>他用一支桨划船。<,>The oar broke in the middle of the lake.<,>桨在湖中央断了。<,>She dipped the oar into the water gently.<,>她轻轻地把桨浸入水中。<,>oar和or(或者)发音相同<,>paddle(短桨)/row(划船)

discourse<,>/ˈdɪskɔːs/<,>/ˈdɪskɔːrs/<,>n.讲话/n.演说/n.讲道<,>The professor delivered a discourse on modern art.<,>教授发表了关于现代艺术的演讲。<,>Political discourse has become increasingly polarized.<,>政治言论变得越来越两极分化。<,>His discourse was both enlightening and entertaining.<,>他的演讲既富有启发性又很有趣。<,>dis(分开)+course(过程)→分开讲述的过程→演讲<,>discuss(v.讨论)/discord(n.不和)

ginger<,>/ˈdʒɪndʒə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒɪndʒər/<,>n.姜/n.生姜<,>Ginger adds a spicy flavor to the dish.<,>姜给这道菜增添了辛辣的味道。<,>She drank ginger tea to soothe her sore throat.<,>她喝姜茶来缓解喉咙痛。<,>The recipe calls for fresh ginger root.<,>这个食谱需要新鲜的姜根。<,>ginger和singer(歌手)押韵<,>garlic(大蒜)/turmeric(姜黄)

splash<,>/splæʃ/<,>/splæʃ/<,>v.溅泼/v.泼水/n.溅泼声<,>The kids love to splash in the pool.<,>孩子们喜欢在游泳池里泼水玩。<,>He heard a loud splash as the rock hit the water.<,>当石头击中水面时，他听到很大的溅水声。<,>Be careful not to splash paint on the floor.<,>小心别把油漆溅到地板上。<,>拟声词，模仿水溅起的声音<,>splash和flash(闪光)押韵

architect<,>/ˈɑːkɪtekt/<,>/ˈɑːrkɪtekt/<,>n.建筑师/n.创造者<,>The architect designed a stunning modern building.<,>建筑师设计了一座令人惊叹的现代建筑。<,>He was the chief architect of the new education policy.<,>他是新教育政策的主要制定者。<,>The architect carefully considered every detail of the house.<,>建筑师仔细考虑了房子的每个细节。<,>arch(主要的)+tect(建造者)→主要建造者<,>architecture(n.建筑学)/archaeology(n.考古学)

theory<,>/ˈθɪəri/<,>/ˈθɪri/<,>n.见解/n.看法/n.推测<,>Her theory about the crime proved to be correct.<,>她对犯罪的推测被证明是正确的。<,>Einstein's theory of relativity changed physics forever.<,>爱因斯坦的相对论永远改变了物理学。<,>There are many theories about how the universe began.<,>关于宇宙如何开始有许多理论。<,>theo(神)+ry→神的观点→理论<,>hypothesis(假说)/theorem(定理)

clip<,>/klɪp/<,>/klɪp/<,>v.剪/v.剪辑报刊<,>She clipped the coupon from the newspaper.<,>她从报纸上剪下了优惠券。<,>The gardener clipped the hedge into a perfect shape.<,>园丁把树篱修剪成完美的形状。<,>Please clip these papers together.<,>请把这些文件夹在一起。<,>clip和clap(鼓掌)发音相似<,>snip(剪断)/trim(修剪)

diminish<,>/dɪˈmɪnɪʃ/<,>/dɪˈmɪnɪʃ/<,>v.减少/v.减小<,>The pain will diminish over time.<,>疼痛会随着时间的推移而减轻。<,>His enthusiasm diminished as the project dragged on.<,>随着项目的拖延，他的热情减退了。<,>Nothing could diminish her love for music.<,>没有什么能减少她对音乐的热爱。<,>di(向下)+min(小)+ish→使变小<,>decrease(减少)/minimize(最小化)

lessen<,>/ˈlesn/<,>/ˈlesn/<,>v.减少/v.变少<,>Taking breaks can lessen eye strain.<,>休息可以减轻眼睛疲劳。<,>The medicine helped to lessen the symptoms.<,>药物有助于减轻症状。<,>We need to lessen our environmental impact.<,>我们需要减少对环境的影响。<,>less(更少)+en(使)→使更少<,>reduce(减少)/lower(降低)

inspector<,>/ɪnˈspektə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈspektər/<,>n.检查员/n.巡官<,>The food inspector checked the restaurant's kitchen.<,>食品检查员检查了餐厅的厨房。<,>The police inspector solved the difficult case.<,>警探解决了这个棘手的案件。<,>An inspector will visit the factory next week.<,>检查员下周将访问工厂。<,>in(内)+spect(看)+or(人)→向内看的人<,>detective(侦探)/examiner(考官)
reserve<,>/rɪˈzɜːv/<,>/rɪˈzɜrv/<,>n.缄默/n.自我克制<,>She spoke with reserve, choosing her words carefully.<,>她说话谨慎，字斟句酌。<,>His natural reserve made it hard for him to express his feelings.<,>他天生的缄默使他难以表达自己的情感。<,>It's important to maintain a reserve in professional settings.<,>在专业场合保持自我克制很重要。<,>re(反复)+serve(保持)→反复保持→克制<,>preserve(v.保存/n.保护区)/deserve(v.应受/v.值得)

challenge<,>/ˈtʃælɪndʒ/<,>/ˈtʃæləndʒ/<,>n.艰巨任务<,>Completing the project on time was a real challenge.<,>按时完成这个项目是一项真正的艰巨任务。<,>She saw the competition as a challenge to overcome.<,>她把这次比赛视为需要克服的艰巨任务。<,>The new job presents many challenges.<,>新工作带来了许多艰巨任务。<,>chall(喊叫)+enge→大声喊叫→挑战<,>change(n.变化/v.改变)/charge(v.充电/n.费用)

enterprise<,>/ˈentəpraɪz/<,>/ˈentərpraɪz/<,>n.艰巨的事业/n.事业心<,>Starting a business is a risky enterprise.<,>创业是一项有风险的艰巨事业。<,>He showed great enterprise in solving the problem.<,>他在解决问题时表现出很强的事业心。<,>The space program is a bold enterprise.<,>太空计划是一项大胆的事业。<,>enter(进入)+prise(抓住)→抓住机会进入→事业<,>surprise(n.惊喜/v.使惊奇)/comprise(v.包含/v.由...组成)

resolute<,>/ˈrezəluːt/<,>/ˈrezəluːt/<,>adj.坚决的/adj.果敢的<,>She was resolute in her decision to quit smoking.<,>她坚决要戒烟。<,>The team made a resolute effort to win the game.<,>球队为赢得比赛做出了果敢的努力。<,>His resolute leadership inspired the troops.<,>他果敢的领导激励了部队。<,>re(反复)+solute(解决)→反复解决→坚决的<,>absolute(adj.绝对的)/dissolute(adj.放荡的)

firmness<,>/ˈfɜːmnəs/<,>/ˈfɜːrmnəs/<,>n.坚固/n.坚定/n.稳固<,>The firmness of the foundation ensured the building's safety.<,>地基的坚固保证了建筑的安全。<,>She spoke with firmness in her voice.<,>她说话语气坚定。<,>The firmness of his handshake showed his confidence.<,>他握手的力度显示了他的自信。<,>firm(坚固的)+ness(名词后缀)→坚固<,>firm(adj.坚固的/v.使稳固)/infirm(adj.虚弱的)

sturdy<,>/ˈstɜːdi/<,>/ˈstɜːrdi/<,>adj.牢固的/adj.坚定的<,>The sturdy oak tree withstood the storm.<,>那棵牢固的橡树经受住了暴风雨。<,>He has sturdy beliefs that never waver.<,>他有坚定的信念，从不动摇。<,>This chair is very sturdy and well-made.<,>这把椅子非常牢固，做工精良。<,>st(站立)+urdy→站立不动→牢固的<,>study(n.学习/v.研究)/steady(adj.稳定的)

steady<,>/ˈstedi/<,>/ˈstedi/<,>adj.稳定的/adj.扎实的<,>She has a steady job with good benefits.<,>她有一份稳定的工作，福利很好。<,>His steady progress impressed the teachers.<,>他扎实的进步给老师们留下了深刻印象。<,>Keep a steady hand while painting.<,>画画时要保持手稳。<,>stead(位置)+y→保持位置→稳定的<,>ready(adj.准备好的)/heady(adj.令人陶醉的)

stability<,>/stəˈbɪləti/<,>/stəˈbɪləti/<,>n.稳定<,>Political stability is important for economic growth.<,>政治稳定对经济增长很重要。<,>The medication helps maintain emotional stability.<,>这种药物有助于保持情绪稳定。<,>The new design improves the car's stability at high speeds.<,>新设计提高了汽车在高速行驶时的稳定性。<,>st(站立)+ability(能力)→站立的能力→稳定<,>ability(n.能力)/mobility(n.移动性)

insistent<,>/ɪnˈsɪstənt/<,>/ɪnˈsɪstənt/<,>adj.坚持的<,>He was insistent that we leave immediately.<,>他坚持要我们立即离开。<,>The insistent ringing of the phone disturbed our meeting.<,>电话铃声不断响起，打扰了我们的会议。<,>She gave me an insistent look, urging me to agree.<,>她给了我一个坚持的眼神，催促我同意。<,>in(进入)+sist(站立)+ent→站进去→坚持的<,>consistent(adj.一致的)/persistent(adj.持续的)

persistence<,>/pəˈsɪstəns/<,>/pərˈsɪstəns/<,>n.坚持/n.持续/n.存留<,>Her persistence finally paid off with a promotion.<,>她的坚持最终换来了升职。<,>The persistence of the drought caused crop failures.<,>干旱持续导致农作物歉收。<,>There was a persistence of the smell even after cleaning.<,>即使清洁后气味仍然存留。<,>per(完全)+sist(站立)+ence→完全站立→坚持<,>consistence(n.一致性)/resistance(n.抵抗)
persevere<,>/ˌpɜːsɪˈvɪə(r)/<,>/ˌpɜːrsəˈvɪr/<,>v.坚持/v.不屈不挠<,>She persevered with her studies despite the difficulties.<,>尽管困难重重，她仍坚持学习。<,>He persevered in his efforts to climb the mountain.<,>他坚持不懈地努力攀登那座山。<,>Perseverance is the key to success.<,>坚持不懈是成功的关键。<,>per(完全)+severe(严格)→完全严格→坚持<,>perseverance(n.坚持)/severe(adj.严厉的)/persist(v.坚持)

shrill<,>/ʃrɪl/<,>/ʃrɪl/<,>adj.尖声的/v.尖声地叫<,>The shrill sound of the alarm woke me up.<,>刺耳的警报声把我吵醒了。<,>She shrilled in terror when she saw the spider.<,>看到蜘蛛时，她惊恐地尖叫起来。<,>The whistle gave a shrill blast.<,>哨子发出尖锐的响声。<,>sh(声音)+rill(小溪)→像小溪流水般尖锐的声音<,>thrill(n.兴奋/v.使激动)/shriek(v.尖叫)/squeal(v.长声尖叫)

bridge<,>/brɪdʒ/<,>/brɪdʒ/<,>v.架桥于/v.用桥连接<,>They bridged the river with a wooden structure.<,>他们用木结构在河上架了一座桥。<,>The agreement bridged the gap between the two parties.<,>这项协议弥合了两党之间的分歧。<,>Cultural exchanges can bridge differences.<,>文化交流可以弥合差异。<,>b(连接)+ridge(山脊)→像山脊一样连接两岸<,>abridge(v.删节)/fridge(n.冰箱)/ridge(n.山脊)

rate<,>/reɪt/<,>/reɪt/<,>n.价格/v.对…评定<,>What is the hourly rate for this job?<,>这份工作的时薪是多少？<,>He was rated as one of the best players.<,>他被评为最佳球员之一。<,>The hotel rates are quite reasonable.<,>这家酒店的价格相当合理。<,>rat(计算)+e→计算出来的价格<,>ratio(n.比率)/irate(adj.愤怒的)/berate(v.严厉指责)

hypothesis<,>/haɪˈpɒθəsɪs/<,>/haɪˈpɑːθəsɪs/<,>n.假设/n.前提<,>His hypothesis was proven correct by the experiment.<,>实验证明他的假设是正确的。<,>We need to test this hypothesis before drawing conclusions.<,>在下结论前我们需要验证这个假设。<,>The research is based on a sound hypothesis.<,>这项研究基于一个可靠的假设。<,>hypo(下面)+thesis(论点)→下面的论点→假设<,>thesis(n.论文)/synthesis(n.合成)/antithesis(n.对立)

sham<,>/ʃæm/<,>/ʃæm/<,>n.假冒/n.赝品/v.假装<,>The painting was a sham, not an original.<,>这幅画是赝品，不是原作。<,>He shammed illness to avoid work.<,>他装病逃避工作。<,>Their apology was just a sham.<,>他们的道歉只是假装的。<,>sha(假)+m→假装<,>shame(n.羞愧)/shambles(n.混乱)/shamrock(n.三叶草)

fake<,>/feɪk/<,>/feɪk/<,>n.假货/adj.假的<,>The designer bag turned out to be a fake.<,>那个名牌包原来是假货。<,>He gave a fake name to the police.<,>他向警方提供了假名。<,>Her smile looked fake and forced.<,>她的笑容看起来很假很勉强。<,>f(非)+ake(真)→非真→假的<,>flake(n.薄片)/bake(v.烘烤)/make(v.制作)

presume<,>/prɪˈzjuːm/<,>/prɪˈzuːm/<,>v.假定/v.假设/v.揣测<,>I presume you're here for the interview.<,>我猜你是来面试的。<,>Don't presume to know what I'm thinking.<,>不要揣测我在想什么。<,>The law presumes innocence until proven guilty.<,>法律假定无罪直到被证明有罪。<,>pre(预先)+sume(拿)→预先拿定主意→假定<,>assume(v.假设)/consume(v.消耗)/resume(v.恢复)

beetle<,>/ˈbiːtl/<,>/ˈbiːtl/<,>n.甲虫<,>A beetle was crawling on the windowsill.<,>一只甲虫在窗台上爬行。<,>The scarab beetle was sacred in ancient Egypt.<,>圣甲虫在古埃及是神圣的。<,>He collected various species of beetles.<,>他收集了各种甲虫标本。<,>bee(蜜蜂)+tle→像蜜蜂一样的小昆虫<,>beet(n.甜菜)/bettle(无此词)/needle(n.针)

clamp<,>/klæmp/<,>/klæmp/<,>v.夹住/n.夹子<,>Use a clamp to hold the pieces together.<,>用夹子把这些部件夹在一起。<,>He clamped his hand over her mouth.<,>他用手捂住她的嘴。<,>The police clamped down on illegal parking.<,>警方严厉打击违章停车。<,>clam(蛤蜊)+p→像蛤蜊壳一样夹紧<,>clap(v.鼓掌)/cramp(n.抽筋)/lamp(n.灯)
sandwich<,>/ˈsænwɪdʒ/<,>/ˈsænˌwɪtʃ/<,>v.夹入/v.挤进<,>She sandwiched the letter between two books.<,>她把信夹在两本书之间。<,>The car was sandwiched between two trucks.<,>那辆车被挤在两辆卡车中间。<,>He managed to sandwich a meeting between his appointments.<,>他在约会之间挤进了一个会议。<,>sand(沙子)+wich(谐音“围住”)→像夹心面包一样夹住<,>sandwich(n.三明治)/wedge(v.楔入/n.楔子)

homely<,>/ˈhəʊmli/<,>/ˈhoʊmli/<,>adj.家常的<,>She prepared a homely meal for us.<,>她为我们准备了一顿家常便饭。<,>The restaurant has a homely atmosphere.<,>这家餐厅有一种家常的氛围。<,>Her homely advice was very comforting.<,>她家常的建议让人感到很安慰。<,>home(家)+ly(形容词后缀)→像家一样的<,>homely(adj.相貌平平的)/homemade(adj.自制的)

fowl<,>/faʊl/<,>/faʊl/<,>n.家禽/n.禽肉<,>We keep various fowls in the backyard.<,>我们在后院养了各种家禽。<,>Roast fowl is a traditional dish for Thanksgiving.<,>烤禽肉是感恩节的传统菜肴。<,>The farmer sells fresh fowl at the market.<,>农夫在市场上卖新鲜的家禽。<,>fowl发音似“孵”→家禽会孵蛋<,>foul(adj.难闻的/v.犯规)/owl(n.猫头鹰)

poultry<,>/ˈpəʊltri/<,>/ˈpoʊltri/<,>n.家禽<,>Poultry farming is his main business.<,>家禽养殖是他的主要业务。<,>The supermarket has a wide selection of poultry.<,>超市有各种各样的家禽出售。<,>Avian flu can spread quickly among poultry.<,>禽流感可以在家禽中快速传播。<,>poul(谐音“剖”)+try(尝试)→尝试剖家禽<,>poultry(n.家禽)/poetry(n.诗歌)

heater<,>/ˈhiːtə(r)/<,>/ˈhiːtər/<,>n.加热器<,>Turn on the heater, it's cold in here.<,>打开加热器，这里很冷。<,>The water heater needs to be repaired.<,>热水器需要修理了。<,>She bought a new space heater for winter.<,>她为冬天买了一个新的空间加热器。<,>heat(热)+er(名词后缀)→产生热的东西<,>heater(n.加热器)/hearten(v.鼓励)

deepen<,>/ˈdiːpən/<,>/ˈdiːpən/<,>vt.(使色泽等)加浓<,>The artist deepened the blue in the painting.<,>艺术家加深了画中的蓝色。<,>The mystery deepens as we investigate further.<,>随着我们进一步调查，谜团加深了。<,>Her frown deepened when she heard the news.<,>听到这个消息，她的眉头皱得更紧了。<,>deep(深的)+en(使)→使加深<,>deepen(vt.加深)/dampen(vt.使潮湿)

heighten<,>/ˈhaɪtn/<,>/ˈhaɪtn/<,>v.加高/v.提高/v.增加<,>They heightened the fence for more security.<,>他们加高了围栏以提高安全性。<,>The music heightened the dramatic effect.<,>音乐增强了戏剧效果。<,>Tensions heightened between the two countries.<,>两国之间的紧张局势加剧了。<,>height(高度)+en(使)→使变高<,>heighten(v.提高)/lighten(v.减轻)

line<,>/laɪn/<,>/laɪn/<,>v.加衬里于<,>She lined the drawers with scented paper.<,>她用香纸给抽屉加衬里。<,>The coat is lined with silk for extra warmth.<,>这件外套衬有丝绸以增加保暖性。<,>He lined the box with soft fabric.<,>他用柔软的布料给盒子加衬里。<,>line本身有“线”的意思→像画线一样加衬里<,>line(v.加衬里)/align(v.对齐)

stillness<,>/ˈstɪlnəs/<,>/ˈstɪlnəs/<,>n.寂静/n.无声<,>The stillness of the night was broken by a dog's bark.<,>夜晚的寂静被狗叫声打破了。<,>She enjoyed the stillness of the early morning.<,>她享受清晨的宁静。<,>There was an eerie stillness before the storm.<,>暴风雨前有一种诡异的寂静。<,>still(静止的)+ness(名词后缀)→静止状态<,>stillness(n.寂静)/silence(n.沉默)

lodging<,>/ˈlɒdʒɪŋ/<,>/ˈlɑːdʒɪŋ/<,>n.寄宿/n.住宿/n.住所<,>He found cheap lodging near the university.<,>他在大学附近找到了便宜的住所。<,>The price includes breakfast and lodging.<,>价格包括早餐和住宿。<,>She provides lodging for foreign students.<,>她为外国学生提供寄宿。<,>lodge(寄宿)+ing(名词后缀)→寄宿的地方<,>lodging(n.住宿)/loading(n.装载)
successor<,>/səkˈsesə(r)/<,>/səkˈsɛsər/<,>n.继承人/n.继任者<,>He was named as the successor to the CEO.<,>他被任命为CEO的继任者。<,>The prince is the rightful successor to the throne.<,>王子是王位的合法继承人。<,>The company is looking for a successor to the retiring manager.<,>公司正在寻找退休经理的继任者。<,>suc(在...之后)+cess(走)+or(人)→在后面走的人→继任者<,>predecessor(n.前任)/successive(adj.连续的)/access(n.入口)

succession<,>/səkˈseʃn/<,>/səkˈsɛʃən/<,>n.继承/n.继承权<,>The succession to the throne was disputed.<,>王位继承权存在争议。<,>He took over the business in succession to his father.<,>他继承了父亲的生意。<,>There was a succession of rainy days last week.<,>上周连续下了好几天雨。<,>suc(在...之后)+cess(走)+ion→跟在后面走→继承<,>successive(adj.连续的)/successor(n.继任者)/session(n.会议)

quarterly<,>/ˈkwɔːtəli/<,>/ˈkwɔrtərli/<,>adj.季度的/adv.按季度地<,>The company publishes quarterly reports.<,>公司发布季度报告。<,>We have quarterly meetings to review progress.<,>我们每季度召开会议审查进度。<,>The magazine is issued quarterly.<,>这本杂志每季度发行一次。<,>quarter(四分之一)+ly→每四分之一年的→季度的<,>monthly(adj.每月的)/yearly(adj.每年的)/weekly(adj.每周的)

craft<,>/krɑːft/<,>/kræft/<,>n.技巧/n.工艺<,>She learned the craft of pottery making.<,>她学习了陶器制作的工艺。<,>Writing is a craft that requires practice.<,>写作是一门需要练习的技巧。<,>The artist displayed great craft in his work.<,>这位艺术家在作品中展现了高超的技艺。<,>craft(与"创造"相关)→需要创造力的→工艺<,>draft(n.草稿)/graft(n.嫁接)/crafty(adj.狡猾的)

souvenir<,>/ˌsuːvəˈnɪə(r)/<,>/ˌsuːvəˈnɪr/<,>n.纪念品<,>I bought a souvenir from my trip to Paris.<,>我从巴黎旅行中买了一件纪念品。<,>This keychain is a souvenir of our anniversary.<,>这个钥匙扣是我们周年纪念的纪念品。<,>She collects souvenirs from all the places she visits.<,>她收集所有去过的地方的纪念品。<,>sou(=sub在...下)+venir(来)→带回来的东西→纪念品<,>memory(n.记忆)/keepsake(n.纪念物)/memento(n.纪念品)

documentary<,>/ˌdɒkjuˈmentri/<,>/ˌdɑːkjuˈmentri/<,>adj.纪录的/adj.文献的<,>We watched a documentary about wildlife.<,>我们看了一部关于野生动物的纪录片。<,>This book provides documentary evidence of the event.<,>这本书提供了该事件的文献证据。<,>She works as a documentary filmmaker.<,>她是一名纪录片制作人。<,>document(文件)+ary→与文件有关的→文献的<,>document(n.文件)/drama(n.戏剧)/fictional(adj.虚构的)

marginal<,>/ˈmɑːdʒɪnl/<,>/ˈmɑːrdʒɪnl/<,>adj.边缘的/adj.记在页边的<,>He wrote marginal notes in his textbook.<,>他在课本上写了页边注释。<,>The difference between the two candidates is marginal.<,>两位候选人之间的差异很小。<,>These plants grow in marginal areas.<,>这些植物生长在边缘地带。<,>margin(边缘)+al→边缘的<,>marginalize(v.使边缘化)/central(adj.中心的)/peripheral(adj.外围的)

terminal<,>/ˈtɜːmɪnl/<,>/ˈtɜːrmɪnl/<,>n.计算机终端/n.线接头<,>Please log in at the computer terminal.<,>请在计算机终端登录。<,>The bus terminal was crowded with passengers.<,>公交车站挤满了乘客。<,>Check the battery terminal connections.<,>检查电池接线头的连接。<,>termin(界限)+al→到达终点的地方→终端<,>terminate(v.终止)/terminus(n.终点站)/initial(adj.最初的)

scheme<,>/skiːm/<,>/skim/<,>v.计划/v.搞阴谋<,>They schemed to overthrow the government.<,>他们密谋推翻政府。<,>He is always scheming to get ahead.<,>他总是处心积虑地想出人头地。<,>The company has a new marketing scheme.<,>公司有一个新的营销计划。<,>scheme(与"计划"相关)→策划<,>schema(n.图解)/theme(n.主题)/dream(n.梦想)

geometrical<,>/ˌdʒiːəˈmetrɪkl/<,>/ˌdʒiːəˈmetrɪkəl/<,>adj.几何学的<,>The building has a geometrical design.<,>这座建筑有几何学的设计。<,>She studies geometrical shapes in math class.<,>她在数学课上学习几何形状。<,>The artist used geometrical patterns in his painting.<,>艺术家在他的画作中使用了几何图案。<,>geo(地)+metr(测量)+ical→测量土地的→几何学的<,>geography(n.地理)/geology(n.地质学)/symmetrical(adj.对称的)
bazaar<,>/bəˈzɑː(r)/<,>/bəˈzɑr/<,>n.集市/n.廉价商店<,>The bazaar was filled with colorful fabrics and spices.<,>集市上摆满了五颜六色的布料和香料。<,>She bought a handmade vase at the local bazaar.<,>她在当地的廉价商店买了一个手工花瓶。<,>The annual charity bazaar raised thousands of dollars.<,>年度慈善义卖筹集了数千美元。<,>baa(羊叫)+zaar(市场)→想象集市里羊叫的热闹场景<,>bizarre(adj.奇异的)/bazar(n.市场,同义词)

gathering<,>/ˈɡæðərɪŋ/<,>/ˈɡæðərɪŋ/<,>n.集会/n.聚会/n.聚集<,>A large gathering of people celebrated the festival.<,>一大群人聚集在一起庆祝节日。<,>The family gathering was held at grandma's house.<,>家庭聚会在奶奶家举行。<,>The gathering storm clouds looked ominous.<,>聚集的乌云看起来不祥。<,>gather(收集)+ing(名词后缀)→聚集的行为或结果<,>assembly(n.集会)/meeting(n.会议)/convention(n.大会)

set<,>/set/<,>/sɛt/<,>n.集(合)<,>He has a complete set of Shakespeare's works.<,>他有一套完整的莎士比亚作品集。<,>The math problem involves a set of numbers.<,>这道数学题涉及一组数字。<,>This tea set is very valuable.<,>这套茶具非常珍贵。<,>简单词但多义，注意上下文区分<,>sett(v.安排)/sat(v.坐的过去式)/seat(n.座位)

disorder<,>/dɪsˈɔːdə(r)/<,>/dɪsˈɔrdər/<,>n.疾病/n.小病<,>He suffers from a rare blood disorder.<,>他患有一种罕见的血液疾病。<,>Eating disorders are serious mental health conditions.<,>饮食失调是严重的心理健康问题。<,>The doctor diagnosed it as a minor stomach disorder.<,>医生诊断这是轻微的胃部不适。<,>dis(否定)+order(顺序)→身体顺序紊乱→疾病<,>disease(n.疾病)/ailment(n.小病)/syndrome(n.综合征)

complaint<,>/kəmˈpleɪnt/<,>/kəmˈpleɪnt/<,>n.疾病/n.病痛<,>The patient's main complaint was back pain.<,>患者的主要病痛是背痛。<,>Common complaints include headaches and fatigue.<,>常见病症包括头痛和疲劳。<,>His skin complaint required special treatment.<,>他的皮肤病需要特殊治疗。<,>com(完全)+plain(抱怨)→完全抱怨→病痛<,>compliant(adj.顺从的)/compliment(n.称赞)/plaint(n.悲叹)

forthcoming<,>/ˌfɔːθˈkʌmɪŋ/<,>/ˌfɔrθˈkʌmɪŋ/<,>adj.即将到来的/adj.现成的<,>The forthcoming elections will be crucial.<,>即将到来的选举将至关重要。<,>She was very forthcoming with information.<,>她很爽快地提供了信息。<,>The book's forthcoming release is eagerly awaited.<,>这本书即将发行，人们热切期待。<,>forth(向前)+coming(来)→即将到来<,>forthright(adj.直率的)/incoming(adj.进来的)/oncoming(adj.接近的)

polarity<,>/pəˈlærəti/<,>/poʊˈlærəti/<,>n.截然相反/n.截然对立/n.极性<,>There is a clear polarity between their opinions.<,>他们的观点截然相反。<,>The magnet's polarity determines its behavior.<,>磁铁的极性决定其行为。<,>Political polarity in the country is increasing.<,>该国的政治对立正在加剧。<,>polar(极的)+ity(性质)→极性<,>polarize(v.使两极分化)/polar(n.极地)/popularity(n.流行)

extreme<,>/ɪkˈstriːm/<,>/ɪkˈstrim/<,>n.极端不同的性质<,>Love and hate are two extremes of emotion.<,>爱和恨是情感的两种极端。<,>He went from one extreme to the other.<,>他从一个极端走向另一个极端。<,>The weather reached dangerous extremes.<,>天气达到了危险的极端。<,>ex(超出)+treme(界限)→超出界限→极端<,>extremity(n.极端)/extrinsic(adj.外在的)/intrinsic(adj.内在的)

guitar<,>/ɡɪˈtɑː(r)/<,>/ɡɪˈtɑr/<,>n.吉他/n.六弦琴<,>He plays the guitar beautifully.<,>他吉他弹得很美。<,>She is learning to play acoustic guitar.<,>她正在学习弹奏原声吉他。<,>The guitar solo was the highlight of the concert.<,>吉他独奏是音乐会的亮点。<,>gui(拼音"贵")+tar(star星星)→贵重的星星乐器<,>guitarist(n.吉他手)/sitar(n.西塔尔琴)/lute(n.鲁特琴)

timely<,>/ˈtaɪmli/<,>/ˈtaɪmli/<,>adj.及时的/adj.适时的<,>Her timely intervention prevented an accident.<,>她及时的干预防止了一场事故。<,>The book provides timely advice for new parents.<,>这本书为新父母提供了适时的建议。<,>We appreciate your timely response to our request.<,>我们感谢您对我们请求的及时回应。<,>time(时间)+ly(形容词后缀)→时间上合适的<,>timeless(adj.永恒的)/time-consuming(adj.耗时的)/timid(adj.胆小的)
irritate<,>/ˈɪrɪteɪt/<,>/ˈɪrɪˌteɪt/<,>v.激怒/v.引起不愉快<,>His constant tapping on the table began to irritate me.<,>他不停地敲桌子开始让我感到烦躁。<,>The harsh soap can irritate sensitive skin.<,>这种刺激性肥皂会引发皮肤不适。<,>Her sarcastic remarks really irritate her colleagues.<,>她的讽刺言论真的激怒了同事。<,>ir(进入)+rit(摩擦)+ate→进入摩擦状态→激怒<,>irrigate(v.灌溉)/irritable(adj.易怒的)

drastic<,>/ˈdræstɪk/<,>/ˈdræstɪk/<,>adj.激烈的/adj.严厉的<,>The government took drastic measures to curb inflation.<,>政府采取严厉措施抑制通货膨胀。<,>There was a drastic change in weather overnight.<,>天气在一夜之间发生了剧烈变化。<,>His drastic weight loss worried his family.<,>他急剧的体重下降让家人很担心。<,>dras(行动)+tic→采取行动的→激烈的<,>dramatic(adj.戏剧性的)/elastic(adj.有弹性的)

severe<,>/sɪˈvɪə(r)/<,>/səˈvɪr/<,>adj.艰难的/adj.简朴的<,>The patient is in severe pain.<,>病人处于剧烈疼痛中。<,>She wore a severe black dress to the funeral.<,>她穿着朴素的黑色连衣裙参加葬礼。<,>The region faces severe water shortages.<,>该地区面临严重的水资源短缺。<,>sever(切断)+e→切断的→严厉的<,>sever(v.切断)/persevere(v.坚持)

Christian<,>/ˈkrɪstʃən/<,>/ˈkrɪstʃən/<,>adj.基督教的<,>They attend a Christian church every Sunday.<,>他们每周日都会去基督教教堂。<,>Christian values emphasize love and forgiveness.<,>基督教价值观强调爱与宽恕。<,>The school follows Christian traditions.<,>这所学校遵循基督教传统。<,>Christ(基督)+ian(…的)→基督的<,>Christmas(n.圣诞节)/Christ(n.基督)

elemental<,>/ˌelɪˈmentl/<,>/ˌɛləˈmɛntl/<,>adj.基本的/adj.自然力的<,>Fire and water are elemental forces of nature.<,>火和水是基本的自然力量。<,>She has an elemental understanding of physics.<,>她对物理学有基本的理解。<,>The dance expressed elemental human emotions.<,>这段舞蹈表现了人类基本情感。<,>element(元素)+al→元素的→基本的<,>elementary(adj.初级的)/fundamental(adj.根本的)

radical<,>/ˈrædɪkl/<,>/ˈrædɪkəl/<,>adj.基本的/adj.激进的<,>The party proposed radical changes to the tax system.<,>该政党提议对税收制度进行彻底改革。<,>She holds radical views on education reform.<,>她对教育改革持有激进观点。<,>There's a radical difference between the two approaches.<,>这两种方法有根本区别。<,>rad(根)+ical→根本的→激进的<,>radish(n.萝卜)/radiate(v.辐射)

ultimate<,>/ˈʌltɪmət/<,>/ˈʌltəmɪt/<,>adj.首要的/adj.基本的<,>Our ultimate goal is world peace.<,>我们的终极目标是世界和平。<,>This is the ultimate test of your skills.<,>这是对你技能的终极考验。<,>The ultimate cause of the problem was poor communication.<,>问题的根本原因是沟通不畅。<,>ultim(最后)+ate→最后的→终极的<,>ultimatum(n.最后通牒)/penultimate(adj.倒数第二的)

energetic<,>/ˌenəˈdʒetɪk/<,>/ˌɛnərˈdʒɛtɪk/<,>adj.积极的/adj.精力旺盛的<,>The children are too energetic to sit still.<,>孩子们精力太旺盛，坐不住。<,>She gave an energetic performance on stage.<,>她在舞台上进行了充满活力的表演。<,>He maintains an energetic lifestyle at 70.<,>70岁的他保持着精力充沛的生活方式。<,>energy(能量)+etic→有能量的<,>energize(v.使活跃)/synergetic(adj.协同的)

muscular<,>/ˈmʌskjələ(r)/<,>/ˈmʌskjələr/<,>adj.肌肉发达的/adj.强健的<,>The athlete has a very muscular build.<,>这位运动员体格非常健壮。<,>He's been doing muscular training for months.<,>他进行肌肉训练已经好几个月了。<,>The disease affects the muscular system.<,>这种疾病影响肌肉系统。<,>muscle(肌肉)+ar→肌肉的<,>musical(adj.音乐的)/muscularity(n.肌肉发达)

witty<,>/ˈwɪti/<,>/ˈwɪti/<,>adj.机智的/adj.风趣的<,>She's known for her witty remarks.<,>她以妙语连珠著称。<,>The play is full of witty dialogue.<,>这部剧充满了机智的对话。<,>He gave a witty response to the criticism.<,>他对批评做出了机智的回应。<,>wit(机智)+ty→机智的<,>witness(n.证人)/twitty(adj.神经质的)
mechanism<,>/ˈmekənɪzəm/<,>/ˈmekənɪzəm/<,>n.机械装置/n.机制<,>The clock's mechanism is very intricate.<,>这个钟表的机械装置非常复杂。<,>The body has natural defense mechanisms against diseases.<,>身体有对抗疾病的自然防御机制。<,>He explained the mechanism of the new policy.<,>他解释了新政策的机制。<,>mech(机械)+anism→机械装置<,>machine(n.机器)/mechanics(n.力学)/mechanic(n.技工)

tact<,>/tækt/<,>/tækt/<,>n.机敏/n.圆滑/n.得体<,>She handled the situation with great tact.<,>她非常得体地处理了这个情况。<,>Diplomats need tact in negotiations.<,>外交官在谈判中需要圆滑。<,>His tact prevented an argument.<,>他的机敏避免了一场争论。<,>tact(接触)→接触他人需要技巧→机敏<,>tactic(n.策略)/tactile(adj.触觉的)/tactless(adj.不圆滑的)

ingenious<,>/ɪnˈdʒiːniəs/<,>/ɪnˈdʒiːniəs/<,>adj.精巧制成的/adj.机灵的<,>He came up with an ingenious solution to the problem.<,>他想出了一个机灵的解决方案。<,>The toy has an ingenious design.<,>这个玩具有精巧的设计。<,>Her ingenious mind always finds creative ways.<,>她机灵的头脑总能找到创造性的方法。<,>in(内)+gen(产生)+ious→内在产生的才能→机灵的<,>genius(n.天才)/ingenuous(adj.天真的)/ingenuity(n.机灵)

ingenuity<,>/ˌɪndʒəˈnjuːəti/<,>/ˌɪndʒəˈnuːəti/<,>n.机灵/n.设计新颖<,>The inventor's ingenuity amazed everyone.<,>发明家的机灵让所有人惊叹。<,>The device shows great ingenuity in its construction.<,>这个装置在构造上显示出新颖的设计。<,>Her ingenuity saved the company a lot of money.<,>她的机灵为公司省了很多钱。<,>in(内)+gen(产生)+uity→内在产生的才能→机灵<,>ingenuous(adj.天真的)/genuine(adj.真正的)/genius(n.天才)

framework<,>/ˈfreɪmwɜːk/<,>/ˈfreɪmwɜːrk/<,>n.体制<,>The new framework for education was implemented last year.<,>新的教育体制去年开始实施。<,>We need to work within the legal framework.<,>我们需要在法律体制内工作。<,>The company has a strong management framework.<,>公司有一个强大的管理体制。<,>frame(框架)+work(工作)→工作的框架→体制<,>homework(n.家庭作业)/network(n.网络)/firework(n.烟火)

fence<,>/fens/<,>/fens/<,>n.击剑(术)/n.击剑<,>He won a gold medal in fencing at the Olympics.<,>他在奥运会上获得了击剑金牌。<,>Fencing requires quick reflexes and strategy.<,>击剑需要快速反应和策略。<,>She has been practicing fencing for five years.<,>她已经练习击剑五年了。<,>fenc(防御)+ing→防御的技术→击剑<,>defense(n.防御)/offense(n.进攻)/fencing(n.栅栏)

stall<,>/stɔːl/<,>/stɔːl/<,>n.货摊/n.书摊/n.马厩<,>There was a flower stall at the market.<,>市场上有一个花摊。<,>He set up a book stall near the school.<,>他在学校附近摆了一个书摊。<,>The horses were kept in clean stalls.<,>马被关在干净的马厩里。<,>st(站立)+all→站立的地方→摊位<,>install(v.安装)/still(adj.静止的)/stale(adj.不新鲜的)

fellowship<,>/ˈfeləʊʃɪp/<,>/ˈfeloʊʃɪp/<,>n.伙伴关系/n.联谊会<,>They enjoyed a warm fellowship during the trip.<,>旅途中他们享受着温暖的伙伴关系。<,>The university offers several research fellowships.<,>大学提供几个研究联谊会。<,>He was admitted to the writers' fellowship.<,>他被接纳进入作家联谊会。<,>fellow(伙伴)+ship(关系)→伙伴关系<,>friendship(n.友谊)/scholarship(n.奖学金)/ownership(n.所有权)

Mars<,>/mɑːz/<,>/mɑːrz/<,>n.火星<,>Scientists are studying the possibility of life on Mars.<,>科学家正在研究火星上存在生命的可能性。<,>The Mars rover sent back amazing pictures.<,>火星探测器传回了惊人的照片。<,>Mars is often called the Red Planet.<,>火星常被称为红色星球。<,>Mars(罗马战神)→火星以战神命名→火星<,>Venus(n.金星)/Jupiter(n.木星)/Saturn(n.土星)

ham<,>/hæm/<,>/hæm/<,>n.火腿<,>She made sandwiches with ham and cheese.<,>她用火腿和奶酪做了三明治。<,>The holiday dinner featured a baked ham.<,>节日晚餐的特色是烤火腿。<,>He likes to eat ham with eggs for breakfast.<,>他喜欢早餐吃火腿和鸡蛋。<,>ham(腿)→动物的腿→火腿<,>hamburger(n.汉堡)/hammer(n.锤子)/hamlet(n.小村庄)
piston<,>/ˈpɪstən/<,>/ˈpɪstən/<,>n.活塞<,>The piston moves up and down inside the cylinder.<,>活塞在汽缸内上下运动。<,>He replaced the worn-out piston in the engine.<,>他更换了发动机里磨损的活塞。<,>A faulty piston caused the machine to break down.<,>一个有缺陷的活塞导致机器故障。<,>pis(压)+ton(吨)→能压数吨重物的部件→活塞<,>pistol(n.手枪)/piston(n.活塞)/pistachio(n.开心果)

vigour<,>/ˈvɪɡə(r)/<,>/ˈvɪɡər/<,>n.活力/n.精力/n.元气<,>She performed the dance with great vigour.<,>她充满活力地表演了舞蹈。<,>After the vacation, he returned to work with renewed vigour.<,>假期过后，他精力充沛地重返工作。<,>The old tree still has vigour and produces fruit every year.<,>这棵老树仍然充满活力，每年都结果。<,>vig(生命)+our(我们的)→我们的生命力→活力<,>vigor(n.活力)/rigor(n.严格)/vigil(n.守夜)

cloudy<,>/ˈklaʊdi/<,>/ˈklaʊdi/<,>adj.混浊的/adj.模糊不清的<,>The water in the pond looks cloudy today.<,>今天池塘里的水看起来很混浊。<,>His memory of the event is cloudy.<,>他对这件事的记忆很模糊。<,>The cloudy sky suggests it might rain soon.<,>阴云密布的天空预示着可能很快要下雨。<,>cloud(云)+y(形容词后缀)→像云一样模糊的<,>cloudy(adj.混浊的)/clumsy(adj.笨拙的)/crowdy(adj.拥挤的)

mixer<,>/ˈmɪksə(r)/<,>/ˈmɪksər/<,>n.搅拌器<,>She used an electric mixer to make the cake batter.<,>她用电搅拌器制作蛋糕面糊。<,>The DJ adjusted the sound levels on the audio mixer.<,>DJ在调音台上调整了声音电平。<,>This kitchen mixer comes with three different attachments.<,>这个厨房搅拌器配有三个不同的附件。<,>mix(混合)+er(器具)→混合用的器具→搅拌器<,>mixer(n.搅拌器)/fixer(n.固定器)/miser(n.守财奴)

engagement<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒmənt/<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒmənt/<,>n.婚约/n.约会<,>They announced their engagement at the family gathering.<,>他们在家庭聚会上宣布了订婚。<,>I have a prior engagement that evening.<,>那天晚上我有约在先。<,>The professor's engagement with students goes beyond the classroom.<,>教授与学生的互动超出了课堂范围。<,>en(使)+gage(抵押)+ment→相互抵押承诺→婚约<,>engagement(n.婚约)/endangerment(n.危害)/enlargement(n.放大)

bribe<,>/braɪb/<,>/braɪb/<,>n.贿赂/v.向...行贿<,>The official was arrested for accepting a bribe.<,>这名官员因受贿被捕。<,>He tried to bribe the guard to let him in.<,>他试图贿赂警卫让他进去。<,>Bribery is a serious crime in many countries.<,>在许多国家，行贿是严重犯罪。<,>bri(明亮)+be(存在)→用"光明"手段达到目的→贿赂<,>bribe(n.贿赂)/bride(n.新娘)/bribe(v.行贿)

corrupt<,>/kəˈrʌpt/<,>/kəˈrʌpt/<,>v.使腐化/adj.腐败的<,>Power tends to corrupt absolute power corrupts absolutely.<,>权力导致腐败，绝对权力导致绝对腐败。<,>The corrupt official was sentenced to ten years in prison.<,>这个腐败官员被判十年监禁。<,>The file became corrupt and wouldn't open.<,>文件损坏了，无法打开。<,>cor(完全)+rupt(断裂)→完全断裂→腐败<,>corrupt(adj.腐败的)/erupt(v.爆发)/interrupt(v.打断)

response<,>/rɪˈspɒns/<,>/rɪˈspɑːns/<,>n.回应<,>We're still waiting for a response from the company.<,>我们仍在等待公司的回应。<,>Her quick response saved the child from danger.<,>她的迅速反应使孩子脱离了危险。<,>The patient showed no response to the treatment.<,>患者对治疗没有反应。<,>re(回)+sponse(承诺)→回应承诺→回应<,>response(n.回应)/responsible(adj.负责的)/responsive(adj.反应迅速的)

badge<,>/bædʒ/<,>/bædʒ/<,>n.徽章/n.像章/n.标志<,>The police officer showed his badge before entering.<,>警官在进入前出示了他的徽章。<,>She proudly wore her Girl Scout badge.<,>她自豪地戴着女童子军徽章。<,>The conference badge gives you access to all sessions.<,>会议徽章让你可以参加所有会议。<,>bad(坏的)+ge(哥)→"坏哥哥"需要佩戴标志→徽章<,>badge(n.徽章)/bandage(n.绷带)/barge(n.驳船)

wield<,>/wiːld/<,>/wiːld/<,>v.挥(剑)/v.行使<,>The knight wielded his sword skillfully.<,>骑士熟练地挥舞着他的剑。<,>She wields considerable influence in the industry.<,>她在行业内行使相当大的影响力。<,>The dictator wielded absolute power over the country.<,>独裁者对这个国家行使绝对权力。<,>wield(看作field)+w→在战场上挥舞武器<,>wield(v.挥舞)/yield(v.产生/n.产量)/wheel(n.车轮)
locust<,>/ˈləʊkəst/<,>/ˈloʊkəst/<,>n.蝗虫<,>The farmers were devastated by the swarm of locusts.<,>农民们被蝗虫群摧毁了庄稼。<,>Locusts can travel long distances in search of food.<,>蝗虫可以长途跋涉寻找食物。<,>In some cultures, locusts are considered a delicacy.<,>在一些文化中，蝗虫被视为美味佳肴。<,>lo(老)+cust(壳)→老壳虫→蝗虫<,>locus(n.地点)/custody(n.监护)  

wasp<,>/wɒsp/<,>/wɑːsp/<,>n.黄蜂<,>A wasp stung me while I was gardening.<,>我在园艺时被黄蜂蜇了。<,>Wasps build their nests in sheltered places.<,>黄蜂在隐蔽的地方筑巢。<,>Unlike bees, wasps can sting multiple times.<,>与蜜蜂不同，黄蜂可以多次蜇人。<,>wa(挖)+sp(丝皮)→挖丝皮的昆虫→黄蜂<,>wisp(n.小捆)/gasp(v.喘息)  

royalty<,>/ˈrɔɪəlti/<,>/ˈrɔɪəlti/<,>n.皇家/王族/皇族<,>The royalty attended the state banquet.<,>王室成员出席了国宴。<,>She receives royalties from her book sales.<,>她从书籍销售中获得版税。<,>The castle is steeped in royal history.<,>这座城堡充满了皇室历史。<,>royal(皇家)+ty(名词后缀)→皇室<,>loyalty(n.忠诚)/realty(n.不动产)  

desolate<,>/ˈdesələt/<,>/ˈdesələt/<,>adj.荒芜的/孤独的<,>The desert was a desolate landscape.<,>沙漠是一片荒凉的景象。<,>She felt desolate after her friend moved away.<,>朋友搬走后她感到孤独。<,>The abandoned village looked desolate.<,>废弃的村庄看起来荒芜人烟。<,>de(去掉)+sol(太阳)+ate→没有阳光的→荒芜的<,>isolate(v.隔离)/consolate(v.安慰)[无此词]  

illusion<,>/ɪˈluːʒn/<,>/ɪˈluːʒn/<,>n.幻想/错觉/假象<,>The magician created an illusion of a floating woman.<,>魔术师制造了一个漂浮女人的幻觉。<,>Don't be under the illusion that this will be easy.<,>别幻想这会很容易。<,>The oasis turned out to be an illusion.<,>绿洲原来是个幻觉。<,>il(进入)+lus(光)+ion→进入光影→错觉<,>allusion(n.暗示)/delusion(n.妄想)  

modification<,>/ˌmɒdɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌmɑːdɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.修改<,>The document needs some modification before submission.<,>文件在提交前需要一些修改。<,>Genetic modification is a controversial topic.<,>基因修改是个有争议的话题。<,>They made modifications to the original design.<,>他们对原始设计进行了修改。<,>mod(模式)+ification(化)→模式化→修改<,>modulation(n.调节)/mortification(n.屈辱)  

environmental<,>/ɪnˌvaɪrənˈmentl/<,>/ɪnˌvaɪrənˈmentl/<,>adj.环境的/环境产生的<,>Environmental protection is everyone's responsibility.<,>环境保护是每个人的责任。<,>They conducted an environmental impact assessment.<,>他们进行了环境影响评估。<,>The company has strong environmental policies.<,>该公司有严格的环境政策。<,>environ(环绕)+ment+al→环绕的→环境的<,>governmental(adj.政府的)/experimental(adj.实验的)  

pregnant<,>/ˈpreɡnənt/<,>/ˈpreɡnənt/<,>adj.怀孕的/意义深长的<,>She is six months pregnant with twins.<,>她怀双胞胎已经六个月了。<,>There was a pregnant pause before he answered.<,>在他回答前有一个意味深长的停顿。<,>Her words were pregnant with meaning.<,>她的话意味深长。<,>pre(前)+gn(生)+ant→生产前的→怀孕的<,>poignant(adj.尖锐的)/regent(n.摄政者)  

fossil<,>/ˈfɒsl/<,>/ˈfɑːsl/<,>n.化石<,>The museum has an impressive collection of dinosaur fossils.<,>博物馆有令人印象深刻的恐龙化石收藏。<,>Fossil fuels are non-renewable resources.<,>化石燃料是不可再生资源。<,>They discovered a 200-million-year-old fossil.<,>他们发现了一个2亿年前的化石。<,>foss(挖)+il→挖出来的东西→化石<,>fissile(adj.易分裂的)/focal(adj.焦点的)  

glider<,>/ˈɡlaɪdə(r)/<,>/ˈɡlaɪdər/<,>n.滑翔机/滑翔导弹<,>He enjoys flying gliders on weekends.<,>他喜欢在周末驾驶滑翔机。<,>The military uses gliders for stealth operations.<,>军方使用滑翔导弹进行隐秘行动。<,>The glider soared gracefully on the thermal currents.<,>滑翔机在热气流上优雅地翱翔。<,>glide(滑翔)+er(物)→滑翔的物体→滑翔机<,>slider(n.滑块)/glitter(v.闪烁)
pulley<,>/ˈpʊli/<,>/ˈpʊli/<,>n.滑轮/n.滑车/n.皮带轮<,>The pulley system helps lift heavy objects with less effort.<,>滑轮系统可以用更少的力气举起重物。<,>He fixed the broken pulley on the well.<,>他修好了井上坏掉的滑轮。<,>The conveyor belt runs on a series of pulleys.<,>传送带在一系列滑轮上运行。<,>pull(拉)+ey→拉动用的装置→滑轮<,>pulley vs. pulley block(滑轮组)/pulley vs. gear(齿轮)

slide<,>/slaɪd/<,>/slaɪd/<,>n.滑动/n.滑行<,>The children love to play on the water slide.<,>孩子们喜欢在水滑梯上玩耍。<,>She lost her balance and took a slide down the hill.<,>她失去平衡，滑下了山坡。<,>The microscope has a slide for viewing specimens.<,>显微镜有一个载玻片用来观察标本。<,>sl(滑)+ide→滑动<,>slide vs. glide(滑翔)/slide vs. slip(滑倒)

granite<,>/ˈɡrænɪt/<,>/ˈɡrænɪt/<,>adj.花岗岩的/n.花岗岩/n.花岗石<,>The kitchen countertop is made of polished granite.<,>厨房台面是用抛光花岗岩做的。<,>Granite is a common type of igneous rock.<,>花岗岩是一种常见的火成岩。<,>The mountain's granite cliffs are spectacular.<,>山上的花岗岩悬崖非常壮观。<,>gran(颗粒)+ite→颗粒状岩石→花岗岩<,>granite vs. marble(大理石)/granite vs. quartz(石英)

correlate<,>/ˈkɒrəleɪt/<,>/ˈkɔːrəleɪt/<,>n.互相关联的事物/v.使相互关联<,>There is a clear correlate between smoking and lung cancer.<,>吸烟和肺癌之间有明显的关联。<,>The study correlates income levels with education.<,>这项研究将收入水平与教育相关联。<,>These two variables correlate strongly.<,>这两个变量密切相关。<,>cor(共同)+relate(关联)→共同关联<,>correlate vs. relate(关联)/correlate vs. connect(连接)

walnut<,>/ˈwɔːlnʌt/<,>/ˈwɔːlnʌt/<,>n.核桃/n.胡桃树<,>She added chopped walnuts to the salad.<,>她在沙拉里加了切碎的核桃。<,>The walnut tree in our garden is over 50 years old.<,>我们花园里的胡桃树有50多年树龄了。<,>Walnut wood is prized for furniture making.<,>胡桃木因制作家具而备受推崇。<,>wall(墙)+nut(坚果)→硬壳坚果→核桃<,>walnut vs. pecan(山核桃)/walnut vs. almond(杏仁)

arc<,>/ɑːk/<,>/ɑːrk/<,>n.弧/n.弓形物/n.弧光<,>The rainbow formed a perfect arc across the sky.<,>彩虹在天空中形成一道完美的弧线。<,>The architect designed a building with graceful arcs.<,>建筑师设计了一座有优美弧线的建筑。<,>Electric arcs can be dangerous.<,>电弧可能很危险。<,>arc→arch(拱门)的简写<,>arc vs. arch(拱门)/arc vs. curve(曲线)

exclamation<,>/ˌekskləˈmeɪʃn/<,>/ˌekskləˈmeɪʃn/<,>n.呼喊/n.惊叫/n.感叹<,>She let out an exclamation of surprise.<,>她发出一声惊讶的呼喊。<,>In English, exclamation marks end emphatic statements.<,>在英语中，感叹号用于结束强调句。<,>His speech was full of passionate exclamations.<,>他的演讲充满激情的感叹。<,>ex(出)+claim(喊)+ation→喊出来→呼喊<,>exclamation vs. interjection(感叹词)/exclamation vs. shout(喊叫)

outcome<,>/ˈaʊtkʌm/<,>/ˈaʊtkʌm/<,>n.后果/n.成果<,>The outcome of the experiment was unexpected.<,>实验的结果出人意料。<,>We're still waiting for the election outcome.<,>我们仍在等待选举结果。<,>Positive thinking leads to better outcomes.<,>积极思考会带来更好的结果。<,>out(出)+come(来)→出来的东西→结果<,>outcome vs. result(结果)/outcome vs. consequence(后果)

ruby<,>/ˈruːbi/<,>/ˈruːbi/<,>n.红宝石<,>Her engagement ring has a large ruby.<,>她的订婚戒指上有一颗大红宝石。<,>Ruby is the birthstone for July.<,>红宝石是七月的诞生石。<,>The wine was a deep ruby color.<,>这酒是深红宝石色的。<,>rub(红色)+y→红色的宝石→红宝石<,>ruby vs. diamond(钻石)/ruby vs. sapphire(蓝宝石)

hit<,>/hɪt/<,>/hɪt/<,>n.轰动一时的人(或事)/v.打击<,>The song became an instant hit.<,>这首歌立即走红。<,>Her new book is a literary hit.<,>她的新书是文学界的轰动之作。<,>The boxer delivered a powerful hit.<,>拳击手打出了有力的一击。<,>hit→打击后产生轰动效应<,>hit vs. beat(击败)/hit vs. strike(罢工)
traverse<,>/ˈtrævɜːs/<,>/ˈtrævɚs/<,>v.横越<,>They had to traverse a dense forest to reach the village.<,>他们必须穿过一片茂密的森林才能到达村庄。<,>The bridge traverses the river.<,>这座桥横跨河流。<,>The expedition traversed the desert in record time.<,>探险队以创纪录的时间横越了沙漠。<,>tra(横跨)+verse(转)→横跨转动→横越<,>transverse(adj.横向的)/reverse(v.反转/n.背面)  

transverse<,>/trænzˈvɜːs/<,>/trænzˈvɜːrs/<,>adj.横向的<,>The transverse beam supports the roof.<,>横梁支撑着屋顶。<,>The transverse section of the plant stem was examined under a microscope.<,>植物茎的横切面在显微镜下被检查。<,>The road runs transverse to the river.<,>这条路与河流横向交叉。<,>trans(横跨)+verse(转)→横向转动的<,>traverse(v.横越)/vertical(adj.垂直的)  

bed<,>/bed/<,>/bɛd/<,>n.河床/n.(湖)底<,>The river bed was dry during the drought.<,>干旱期间河床干涸了。<,>They found ancient artifacts at the bottom of the lake bed.<,>他们在湖底发现了古代文物。<,>The children built a sandcastle on the sea bed.<,>孩子们在海床上建了一座沙堡。<,>bed(床)→像床一样平坦的底部<,>bad(adj.坏的)/bid(v.出价)  

harmonious<,>/hɑːˈməʊniəs/<,>/hɑːrˈmoʊniəs/<,>adj.和谐的/adj.协调的<,>The couple has a harmonious relationship.<,>这对夫妇关系和谐。<,>The colors in the painting are harmonious.<,>这幅画的色彩很协调。<,>The team worked in a harmonious atmosphere.<,>团队在和谐的氛围中工作。<,>harmony(和谐)+ous(形容词后缀)→和谐的<,>harmony(n.和谐)/homogeneous(adj.同质的)  

monk<,>/mʌŋk/<,>/mʌŋk/<,>n.和尚/n.僧侣/n.修道士<,>The monk meditated in the temple.<,>和尚在寺庙里冥想。<,>Buddhist monks wear saffron robes.<,>佛教僧侣穿藏红花色长袍。<,>The monk took a vow of silence.<,>修道士立誓保持沉默。<,>monk(谐音"忙客")→寺庙里忙碌的客人<,>monkey(n.猴子)/monarch(n.君主)  

cooperative<,>/kəʊˈɒpərətɪv/<,>/koʊˈɑːpərətɪv/<,>adj.合作的/n.合作社<,>She is very cooperative in group projects.<,>她在小组项目中非常合作。<,>They formed a farmers' cooperative.<,>他们成立了一个农民合作社。<,>The cooperative spirit made the event successful.<,>合作精神使活动取得成功。<,>co(共同)+operate(操作)+ive→共同操作的→合作的<,>corporation(n.公司)/coordinate(v.协调)  

hinge<,>/hɪndʒ/<,>/hɪndʒ/<,>n.合页/n.折叶/n.铰链<,>The door squeaks because the hinge needs oil.<,>门吱吱作响因为铰链需要上油。<,>The cabinet door has a broken hinge.<,>橱柜门的合页坏了。<,>The success of the plan hinges on your participation.<,>计划的成功取决于你的参与。<,>hing(悬挂)+e→悬挂转动的部件<,>fringe(n.边缘)/hinge(v.取决于)  

proper<,>/ˈprɒpə(r)/<,>/ˈprɑːpər/<,>adj.合乎体统的/adj.正派的<,>It's not proper to speak with your mouth full.<,>满嘴食物说话是不体面的。<,>He is a proper gentleman.<,>他是个正派的绅士。<,>Use the proper tools for the job.<,>使用合适的工具做这项工作。<,>proper(自己的)→符合自己身份的→得体的<,>property(n.财产)/prosper(v.繁荣)  

composite<,>/ˈkɒmpəzɪt/<,>/kəmˈpɑːzɪt/<,>adj.合成的/n.合成物<,>The material is a composite of plastic and wood fibers.<,>这种材料是塑料和木纤维的合成物。<,>The composite photograph shows all team members.<,>这张合成照片显示了所有队员。<,>The bridge is made of composite materials.<,>这座桥由复合材料制成。<,>com(共同)+pos(放置)+ite→共同放置的→合成的<,>composition(n.作文)/opposite(adj.相反的)  

synthesis<,>/ˈsɪnθəsɪs/<,>/ˈsɪnθəsɪs/<,>n.综合/n.合成物/n.(化学)合成/n.(声音)合成<,>The synthesis of these ideas led to a new theory.<,>这些思想的综合产生了一个新理论。<,>Artificial insulin is produced by chemical synthesis.<,>人工胰岛素是通过化学合成生产的。<,>This music uses electronic sound synthesis.<,>这首音乐使用了电子声音合成技术。<,>syn(共同)+thesis(放置)→放在一起→合成<,>analysis(n.分析)/synthetic(adj.合成的)
applause<,>/əˈplɔːz/<,>/əˈplɔz/<,>n.喝彩/n.夸奖/n.称赞<,>The audience burst into applause at the end of the performance.<,>演出结束时观众爆发出热烈的掌声。<,>His speech received thunderous applause from the crowd.<,>他的演讲赢得了人群雷鸣般的掌声。<,>She blushed at the unexpected applause.<,>面对突如其来的掌声，她脸红了。<,>app(应用)+lause(类似"loud"响亮)→像应用发出的响亮声音→喝彩<,>applaud(v.鼓掌)/applause(n.掌声)/appliance(n.器具)

applaud<,>/əˈplɔːd/<,>/əˈplɔd/<,>v.鼓掌/v.喝彩<,>The audience applauded enthusiastically for five minutes.<,>观众热情鼓掌长达五分钟。<,>We should applaud his courage in speaking out.<,>我们应该为他敢于直言而鼓掌。<,>The teacher applauded the students' creative ideas.<,>老师为学生们有创意的想法鼓掌。<,>ap(加强)+plaud(鼓掌)→热烈鼓掌<,>applause(n.掌声)/explode(v.爆炸)/appliance(n.电器)
