hurrah<,>/hʊˈrɑː/<,>/həˈrɑ/<,>int.好哇/int.万岁/int.乌拉<,>Hurrah! We won the championship!<,>万岁！我们赢得了冠军！<,>Three cheers for the team: Hip hip hurrah!<,>为队伍欢呼三声：嗨，嗨，万岁！<,>"Hurrah for freedom!" shouted the protesters.<,>"自由万岁！"抗议者们高喊着。<,>拟声词，模仿欢呼声<,>hooray(同义词)/hurricane(n.飓风)/hurry(v.匆忙)

pal<,>/pæl/<,>/pæl/<,>n.好朋友/n.同谋<,>He's been my pal since kindergarten.<,>从幼儿园起他就是我的好朋友。<,>Don't trust him - he's in pal with the thieves.<,>别相信他，他和那些小偷是一伙的。<,>We're just pals, nothing romantic.<,>我们只是好朋友，没有浪漫关系。<,>pal(朋友)来自罗马语"palus"(伙伴)<,>palette(n.调色板)/pale(adj.苍白的)/pail(n.桶)

hospitality<,>/ˌhɒspɪˈtæləti/<,>/ˌhɑːspɪˈtæləti/<,>n.好客/n.殷勤<,>Greek hospitality is legendary.<,>希腊人的好客是出了名的。<,>Thank you for your hospitality during my stay.<,>感谢您在我逗留期间的盛情款待。<,>The hotel is famous for its warm hospitality.<,>这家酒店以热情好客而闻名。<,>hospital(医院)+ity(名词后缀)→像医院般照顾周到→好客<,>hostility(n.敌意)/hospital(n.医院)/hospitable(adj.好客的)

romantic<,>/rəʊˈmæntɪk/<,>/roʊˈmæntɪk/<,>adj.好幻想的/adj.浪漫的<,>She has a romantic view of life.<,>她对生活抱有浪漫的幻想。<,>The movie tells a romantic love story.<,>这部电影讲述了一个浪漫的爱情故事。<,>He's too romantic about country life.<,>他对乡村生活的想象太浪漫了。<,>roman(罗马)+tic→像罗马故事般浪漫<,>romance(n.浪漫)/Roman(n.罗马人)/dramatic(adj.戏剧性的)

howl<,>/haʊl/<,>/haʊl/<,>n.嚎叫/n.哀号/n.吠<,>The wolf let out a long howl at the moon.<,>狼对着月亮发出长长的嚎叫。<,>We heard the howl of the wind during the storm.<,>暴风雨中我们听到了风的呼啸。<,>The dog gave a howl when it got hurt.<,>狗受伤时发出了一声哀嚎。<,>how(如何)+l(拉长音)→拉长声音叫<,>owl(n.猫头鹰)/hole(n.洞)/hollow(adj.中空的)

aerospace<,>/ˈeərəspeɪs/<,>/ˈɛroʊspeɪs/<,>n.航空航天工业<,>He works in the aerospace industry.<,>他在航空航天工业工作。<,>China has made great progress in aerospace technology.<,>中国在航空航天技术方面取得了巨大进步。<,>The aerospace exhibition attracted many visitors.<,>航空航天展览吸引了许多参观者。<,>aero(空气的)+space(空间)→空气和空间→航空航天<,>aeroplane(n.飞机)/spacecraft(n.航天器)/atmosphere(n.大气层)

log<,>/lɒɡ/<,>/lɔːɡ/<,>n.航海日志/n.飞行日志<,>The captain wrote the day's events in the ship's log.<,>船长在航海日志中记录了当天的事件。<,>Pilots must keep a detailed flight log.<,>飞行员必须保持详细的飞行日志。<,>Check the computer log for error messages.<,>检查电脑日志中的错误信息。<,>原意"木头"，古代航海记录刻在木板上<,>blog(n.博客)/logic(n.逻辑)/logo(n.标志)

pedestrian<,>/pəˈdestriən/<,>/pəˈdɛstriən/<,>n.行人/n.步行者<,>Pedestrians should use the crosswalk.<,>行人应该走人行横道。<,>The city is building more pedestrian bridges.<,>这座城市正在建造更多的人行天桥。<,>He was hit by a car while being a pedestrian.<,>他在步行时被车撞了。<,>ped(脚)+estrian(人)→用脚走路的人<,>pedal(n.踏板)/pediatric(adj.儿科的)/pedestal(n.基座)
move<,>/muːv/<,>/muv/<,>n.行动/n.步骤<,>His next move is crucial for the game.<,>他的下一步行动对比赛至关重要。<,>Let's make a move before it gets dark.<,>我们天黑前行动吧。<,>The first move in chess is important.<,>国际象棋的第一步很重要。<,>mov(动)+e→行动<,>movie(n.电影)/motive(n.动机)/remove(v.移除)

hesitate<,>/ˈhezɪteɪt/<,>/ˈhɛzɪˌteɪt/<,>v.犹豫/v.迟疑不决<,>Don't hesitate to ask if you need help.<,>如果需要帮助，请不要犹豫。<,>She hesitated before answering the question.<,>她在回答问题前犹豫了一下。<,>He who hesitates is lost.<,>犹豫者错失良机。<,>hes(粘住)+it+ate→粘住不动→犹豫<,>hibernate(v.冬眠)/hesitation(n.犹豫)/hesitant(adj.犹豫的)

pest<,>/pest/<,>/pɛst/<,>n.害虫<,>Farmers use pesticides to control pests.<,>农民用杀虫剂控制害虫。<,>Mosquitoes are considered pests in summer.<,>蚊子被认为是夏季的害虫。<,>The garden is infested with pests.<,>花园里害虫泛滥。<,>谐音"拍死它"→害虫<,>pet(n.宠物)/past(n.过去)/pester(v.烦扰)

strait<,>/streɪt/<,>/streɪt/<,>n.海峡<,>The Strait of Gibraltar connects the Atlantic and Mediterranean.<,>直布罗陀海峡连接大西洋和地中海。<,>They sailed through the strait at night.<,>他们在夜间驶过海峡。<,>The Taiwan Strait separates Taiwan from mainland China.<,>台湾海峡将台湾与中国大陆分开。<,>stra(拉紧)+it→两边陆地拉紧的水道→海峡<,>straight(adj.直的)/street(n.街道)/strict(adj.严格的)

turtle<,>/ˈtɜːtl/<,>/ˈtɝːtl/<,>n.海龟/n.玳瑁<,>The turtle slowly crawled towards the sea.<,>海龟慢慢爬向大海。<,>We saw a giant turtle at the aquarium.<,>我们在水族馆看到一只巨大的海龟。<,>Turtle shells are used to make ornaments.<,>玳瑁壳被用来制作装饰品。<,>tur(转)+tle→会转头缩进壳里的动物→龟<,>tortoise(n.陆龟)/turn(v.转动)/tutor(n.导师)

custom<,>/ˈkʌstəm/<,>/ˈkʌstəm/<,>n.海关<,>You must declare goods at customs.<,>你必须在海关申报物品。<,>The customs officer checked our passports.<,>海关官员检查了我们的护照。<,>Customs regulations vary by country.<,>各国的海关规定不同。<,>cus(关心)+tom→关心物品进出→海关<,>customer(n.顾客)/costume(n.服装)/accustom(v.使习惯)

seaport<,>/ˈsiːpɔːt/<,>/ˈsiˌpɔrt/<,>n.海港/n.港口/n.港市<,>Shanghai is a major seaport in China.<,>上海是中国的主要海港。<,>The ship docked at the seaport for repairs.<,>船停靠海港进行维修。<,>Many seaports were closed during the storm.<,>暴风雨期间许多海港关闭了。<,>sea(海)+port(港口)→海港<,>airport(n.机场)/passport(n.护照)/export(v.出口)

cable<,>/ˈkeɪbl/<,>/ˈkeɪbəl/<,>n.电缆<,>The workers are laying underground cables.<,>工人们正在铺设地下电缆。<,>The storm damaged the power cables.<,>暴风雨损坏了电力电缆。<,>We receive TV programs via cable.<,>我们通过有线电视接收节目。<,>cab(小屋)+le→连接小屋的线→电缆<,>table(n.桌子)/able(adj.能够的)/cradle(n.摇篮)

pirate<,>/ˈpaɪrət/<,>/ˈpaɪrət/<,>n.海盗<,>Pirates used to attack merchant ships.<,>海盗过去常袭击商船。<,>The children dressed up as pirates for Halloween.<,>孩子们在万圣节装扮成海盗。<,>Pirate copies of the software are illegal.<,>软件的盗版是非法的。<,>pir(尝试)+ate→尝试掠夺的人→海盗<,>private(adj.私人的)/pilot(n.飞行员)/pirouette(n.脚尖旋转)

seaside<,>/ˈsiːsaɪd/<,>/ˈsiˌsaɪd/<,>n.海滨胜地/n.海边<,>We spent our vacation at the seaside.<,>我们在海滨度过了假期。<,>The seaside town is famous for its seafood.<,>这个海滨小镇以海鲜闻名。<,>Children love building sandcastles by the seaside.<,>孩子们喜欢在海边堆沙堡。<,>sea(海)+side(边)→海边<,>bedside(n.床边)/riverside(n.河边)/countryside(n.乡村)
surplus<,>/ˈsɜːpləs/<,>/ˈsɜːrpləs/<,>n.过剩/n.剩余（物资）<,>The farmer sold his surplus crops at the market.<,>农民在市场上卖掉了过剩的农作物。<,>There is a surplus of workers in the industry.<,>这个行业劳动力过剩。<,>We donated the surplus food to the homeless shelter.<,>我们把剩余的食物捐给了无家可归者收容所。<,>sur(超过)+plus(更多)→超过更多→过剩<,>plus(n.加号/adj.正的)/deficit(n.赤字/n.不足)  

overestimate<,>/ˌəʊvərˈestɪmeɪt/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈestɪmeɪt/<,>v.过高估计<,>Don't overestimate your abilities in the interview.<,>面试时不要过高估计自己的能力。<,>We overestimated the time needed to complete the project.<,>我们过高估计了完成项目所需的时间。<,>It's easy to overestimate the importance of money.<,>人们容易过高估计金钱的重要性。<,>over(超过)+estimate(估计)→估计过高<,>underestimate(v.低估)/estimate(v.估计/n.估价)  

excessively<,>/ɪkˈsesɪvli/<,>/ɪkˈsesɪvli/<,>adv.过分/adv.极端地<,>He was drinking excessively at the party.<,>他在聚会上饮酒过度。<,>The teacher criticized the student excessively for a small mistake.<,>老师因为一个小错误过分批评了学生。<,>Prices have risen excessively in recent months.<,>最近几个月物价上涨得过分。<,>excess(过度)+ive(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→过度地<,>excessive(adj.过分的)/access(n.入口/v.接近)  

excess<,>/ɪkˈses/<,>/ɪkˈses/<,>n.过度行为/n.暴行<,>The police were called to deal with the excesses of the rioters.<,>警察被叫来处理暴徒的暴行。<,>Eating in excess can lead to health problems.<,>暴饮暴食会导致健康问题。<,>He was punished for his excesses during the war.<,>他因战争期间的暴行受到惩罚。<,>ex(出)+cess(走)→走出界限→过度<,>access(n.入口/v.接近)/success(n.成功)  

orchard<,>/ˈɔːtʃəd/<,>/ˈɔːrtʃərd/<,>n.果园<,>The apple orchard covers 50 acres of land.<,>这个苹果园占地50英亩。<,>We went cherry picking in the orchard last summer.<,>去年夏天我们去果园摘樱桃。<,>The farmer takes great care of his orange orchard.<,>这位农民非常细心地照料他的柑橘园。<,>or(看作ore矿石)+chard(看作chard甜菜)→像矿石一样珍贵的甜菜园→果园<,>garden(n.花园)/vineyard(n.葡萄园)  

peel<,>/piːl/<,>/piːl/<,>n.果皮/n.蔬菜皮<,>She carefully removed the peel from the apple.<,>她小心地削去苹果皮。<,>Orange peel can be used to make marmalade.<,>橘子皮可以用来做果酱。<,>Potato peel contains many nutrients.<,>土豆皮含有许多营养物质。<,>peel(发音类似"皮")→果皮<,>peel(v.剥皮)/peal(n.钟声)  

stone<,>/stəʊn/<,>/stoʊn/<,>n.果核/n.（水果的）硬核<,>Be careful not to swallow the cherry stone.<,>小心别吞下樱桃核。<,>The peach stone is very hard to crack.<,>桃核非常难砸开。<,>She planted an avocado stone to grow a new tree.<,>她种下了一个牛油果核想长出新树。<,>stone(石头)→像石头一样硬的果核<,>bone(n.骨头)/pit(n.果核)  

slap<,>/slæp/<,>/slæp/<,>v.掴/n.巴掌<,>She slapped him across the face for his rude remark.<,>因为他粗鲁的言论，她打了他一耳光。<,>The sound of the slap echoed through the room.<,>巴掌声在房间里回荡。<,>He gave the mosquito a slap and killed it.<,>他拍了一巴掌打死了蚊子。<,>sl(看作"死啦")+ap(看作"啊啪")→"死啦啊啪"像打耳光的声音<,>clap(v.鼓掌)/flap(v.拍打)  

inland<,>/ˈɪnlənd/<,>/ˈɪnlənd/<,>adj.国内的/adj.内地的<,>They took an inland route to avoid the storm at sea.<,>他们走内陆路线以避开海上的风暴。<,>The inland areas of the country are less developed.<,>这个国家的内陆地区不太发达。<,>Inland transportation costs are usually higher.<,>国内运输成本通常更高。<,>in(在...内)+land(土地)→在土地内部的→内陆的<,>island(n.岛屿)/mainland(n.大陆)  

boiler<,>/ˈbɔɪlə(r)/<,>/ˈbɔɪlər/<,>n.锅炉<,>The boiler in our building broke down yesterday.<,>我们楼里的锅炉昨天坏了。<,>He works as a boiler operator at the power plant.<,>他在发电厂当锅炉操作员。<,>Make sure the boiler pressure doesn't get too high.<,>确保锅炉压力不要过高。<,>boil(煮沸)+er(表示工具)→用于煮沸的装置→锅炉<,>broiler(n.烤炉)/toiler(n.辛苦工作的人)
roller<,>/ˈrəʊlə(r)/<,>/ˈroʊlər/<,>n.滚筒/n.滚柱<,>The painter used a roller to apply the paint evenly.<,>画家用滚筒均匀地涂上颜料。<,>The conveyor belt moves on small rollers.<,>传送带在小滚柱上移动。<,>She bought a new hair roller for styling her curls.<,>她买了一个新的卷发器来卷头发。<,>roll(滚动)+er(名词后缀)→滚动的工具→滚筒<,>ruler(n. 尺子/统治者)/roster(n. 花名册)  

valuable<,>/ˈvæljuəbl/<,>/ˈvæljuəbəl/<,>n.贵重物品/n.财宝<,>She keeps her valuable jewelry in a safe.<,>她把贵重珠宝存放在保险箱里。<,>Time is the most valuable resource we have.<,>时间是我们最宝贵的资源。<,>The museum displayed many valuable artifacts.<,>博物馆展出了许多珍贵文物。<,>value(价值)+able(可…的)→有价值的→贵重物品<,>invaluable(adj. 无价的)/valueless(adj. 无价值的)  

salmon<,>/ˈsæmən/<,>/ˈsæmən/<,>n.鲑鱼/n.大马哈鱼<,>We had grilled salmon for dinner last night.<,>昨晚我们晚餐吃了烤鲑鱼。<,>Salmon swim upstream to lay their eggs.<,>鲑鱼逆流而上去产卵。<,>This river is famous for its wild salmon.<,>这条河以野生大马哈鱼闻名。<,>sal(盐)+mon(山)→洄游鱼类→鲑鱼<,>solemn(adj. 庄严的)/sermon(n. 布道)  

silicon<,>/ˈsɪlɪkən/<,>/ˈsɪlɪkɑːn/<,>n.硅<,>Silicon is widely used in electronics industry.<,>硅被广泛应用于电子工业。<,>Silicon Valley is the hub of tech innovation.<,>硅谷是科技创新的中心。<,>This product contains silicon for better durability.<,>该产品含有硅以提高耐用性。<,>sili(燧石)+con(元素后缀)→硅元素<,>silicone(n. 硅树脂)/silica(n. 二氧化硅)  

regulation<,>/ˌreɡjuˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌreɡjəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.规章/n.规则<,>All employees must comply with safety regulations.<,>所有员工必须遵守安全规章。<,>The new traffic regulation will take effect next month.<,>新交通规则将于下月生效。<,>This device helps in temperature regulation.<,>这个装置有助于温度调节。<,>regulate(调节)+ion(名词后缀)→规章制度<,>regular(adj. 规律的)/legislation(n. 立法)  

regularity<,>/ˌreɡjuˈlærəti/<,>/ˌreɡjəˈlærəti/<,>n.规则性/n.整齐<,>The regularity of his heartbeat showed good health.<,>他心跳的规律性表明健康状况良好。<,>She arranges her books with perfect regularity.<,>她把书籍排列得极其整齐。<,>Regularity in exercise is important for fitness.<,>锻炼的规律性对健康很重要。<,>regular(规律的)+ity(名词后缀)→规则性<,>irregularity(n. 不规则)/similarity(n. 相似性)  

define<,>/dɪˈfaɪn/<,>/dɪˈfaɪn/<,>v.规定/v.立界限<,>The law clearly defines citizens' rights.<,>法律明确规定了公民权利。<,>Can you define the scope of this project?<,>你能界定这个项目的范围吗？<,>This dictionary defines words precisely.<,>这本词典精确地定义词语。<,>de(加强)+fin(界限)+e→划定界限→规定<,>refine(v. 精炼)/confine(v. 限制)  

provision<,>/prəˈvɪʒn/<,>/prəˈvɪʒən/<,>n.规定/n.条款<,>The contract includes a provision about late payments.<,>合同包含关于延迟付款的条款。<,>They made provision for emergency situations.<,>他们为紧急情况做了规定。<,>Article 5 contains important provisions.<,>第五条载有重要规定。<,>provide(提供)+sion(名词后缀)→提供的条款→规定<,>vision(n. 视力)/division(n. 分割)  

replacement<,>/rɪˈpleɪsmənt/<,>/rɪˈpleɪsmənt/<,>n.取代/n.置换<,>We need to find a replacement for the broken part.<,>我们需要找到损坏部件的替代品。<,>Her replacement will start work next Monday.<,>她的接替者将于下周一上岗。<,>Tooth replacement therapy is becoming popular.<,>牙齿置换疗法正变得流行。<,>replace(替换)+ment(名词后缀)→取代<,>displacement(n. 位移)/placement(n. 安置)  

spacious<,>/ˈspeɪʃəs/<,>/ˈspeɪʃəs/<,>adj.广阔的/adj.广大的<,>The new apartment has a spacious living room.<,>新公寓有个宽敞的客厅。<,>This car offers spacious legroom for passengers.<,>这款车为乘客提供了宽敞的腿部空间。<,>The museum's spacious halls can accommodate large crowds.<,>博物馆宽敞的大厅可容纳大量人群。<,>space(空间)+ious(形容词后缀)→空间大的→广阔的<,>specious(adj. 似是而非的)/precious(adj. 珍贵的)
amplitude<,>/ˈæmplɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈæmplɪtuːd/<,>n.振幅/n.广大/n.充足<,>The amplitude of the sound wave determines its volume.<,>声波的振幅决定了它的音量。<,>The amplitude of the ocean waves was impressive during the storm.<,>暴风雨期间海浪的幅度令人印象深刻。<,>We were amazed by the amplitude of the ancient ruins.<,>我们对古代遗址的广阔感到惊讶。<,>ampli(大)+tude(状态)→广大的状态→振幅/广大<,>attitude(n.态度)/altitude(n.海拔)

radial<,>/ˈreɪdiəl/<,>/ˈreɪdiəl/<,>adj.放射状的<,>The bicycle tire has a radial pattern for better grip.<,>自行车轮胎有放射状花纹以提供更好的抓地力。<,>The city was designed with radial streets extending from the central square.<,>这座城市的设计是从中心广场向外放射状延伸的街道。<,>The starfish has a radial symmetry with five arms.<,>海星具有五条臂的放射对称性。<,>radi(光线)+al(形容词后缀)→像光线一样放射的<,>radical(adj.激进的/n.根部)/radiant(adj.发光的)

photoelectric<,>/ˌfəʊtəʊɪˈlektrɪk/<,>/ˌfoʊtoʊɪˈlektrɪk/<,>adj.光电的<,>The photoelectric effect was explained by Albert Einstein.<,>光电效应由阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦解释。<,>Photoelectric sensors are widely used in automatic doors.<,>光电传感器广泛应用于自动门。<,>This device converts light energy into electricity through photoelectric conversion.<,>这个设备通过光电转换将光能转化为电能。<,>photo(光)+electric(电的)→光电的<,>photographic(adj.摄影的)/photosynthesis(n.光合作用)

optical<,>/ˈɒptɪkəl/<,>/ˈɑːptɪkəl/<,>adj.光的/adj.光学的<,>The optical illusion made the straight line appear bent.<,>这个视错觉使直线看起来弯曲了。<,>Optical fibers are used for high-speed data transmission.<,>光纤用于高速数据传输。<,>He went to the optical shop to get his glasses adjusted.<,>他去眼镜店调整眼镜。<,>opt(视力)+ical(形容词后缀)→光学的<,>optional(adj.可选择的)/optimal(adj.最佳的)

shrub<,>/ʃrʌb/<,>/ʃrʌb/<,>n.灌木/n.灌木丛<,>We planted several flowering shrubs in the garden.<,>我们在花园里种了几株开花的灌木。<,>The rabbit hid under a dense shrub to escape the fox.<,>兔子躲在茂密的灌木丛下逃避狐狸。<,>This shrub produces berries that attract birds.<,>这种灌木结出的浆果会吸引鸟类。<,>shrub(发音类似"树丛")→灌木丛<,>scrub(n.矮树丛)/shrug(v.耸肩)

irrigation<,>/ˌɪrɪˈɡeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪrɪˈɡeɪʃn/<,>n.灌溉/n.(医)冲洗法<,>The farmers use a modern irrigation system to water their crops.<,>农民们使用现代灌溉系统浇灌作物。<,>Drip irrigation helps conserve water in dry regions.<,>滴灌有助于在干旱地区节约用水。<,>The doctor recommended nasal irrigation to relieve the sinus congestion.<,>医生建议用鼻腔冲洗来缓解鼻窦充血。<,>irrig(水)+ation(名词后缀)→灌溉<,>irritation(n.刺激)/irregular(adj.不规则的)

inertia<,>/ɪˈnɜːʃə/<,>/ɪˈnɜːrʃə/<,>n.惯性/n.无力<,>The law of inertia states that objects in motion stay in motion.<,>惯性定律指出运动中的物体会保持运动状态。<,>Due to bureaucratic inertia, the project approval was delayed.<,>由于官僚主义的惰性，项目审批被延迟了。<,>She felt a strange inertia that kept her from getting out of bed.<,>她感到一种奇怪的无力感，使她无法起床。<,>in(不)+ert(活动)+ia(状态)→不活动的状态→惯性<,>inert(adj.惰性的)/insert(v.插入)

orchestra<,>/ˈɔːkɪstrə/<,>/ˈɔːrkɪstrə/<,>n.管弦乐队<,>The symphony orchestra performed Beethoven's Ninth Symphony.<,>交响乐团演奏了贝多芬的第九交响曲。<,>She has been playing violin in the school orchestra for three years.<,>她在学校管弦乐队拉小提琴已有三年。<,>The conductor raised his baton to signal the orchestra to begin.<,>指挥举起指挥棒示意乐队开始演奏。<,>orche(舞蹈)+stra(地方)→古代为舞蹈伴奏的地方→管弦乐队<,>orchestrate(v.精心安排)/orchard(n.果园)

blast<,>/blɑːst/<,>/blæst/<,>n.管乐器的声音<,>A loud blast from the trumpet announced the start of the ceremony.<,>小号的一声响亮宣告了仪式的开始。<,>The trombone player produced a powerful blast of sound.<,>长号演奏者发出了强有力的声音。<,>We heard the blast of the hunting horn in the distance.<,>我们听到远处猎号的鸣响。<,>blast(原意"爆炸")→像爆炸一样响亮的声音→管乐器的声音<,>blaze(n.火焰)/blunt(adj.钝的)

pipe<,>/paɪp/<,>/paɪp/<,>n.管乐器<,>He plays the pipe in a traditional folk band.<,>他在一个传统民间乐队中演奏管乐器。<,>The sound of bagpipes filled the Highland air.<,>风笛的声音回荡在高地的空气中。<,>Ancient shepherds often used simple pipes made of reeds.<,>古代牧羊人常用芦苇制成的简单管乐器。<,>pipe(管子)→通过管子发声的乐器→管乐器<,>pipeline(n.管道)/pier(n.码头)
coffin<,>/ˈkɒfɪn/<,>/ˈkɔːfɪn/<,>n.棺材/n.灵柩<,>The coffin was carried by six pallbearers.<,>棺材由六名抬棺人抬着。<,>They lowered the coffin into the grave.<,>他们将棺材放入墓穴中。<,>The coffin was made of solid oak.<,>这口棺材是用实心橡木制成的。<,>cof(共同)+fin(结束)→共同结束生命的地方→棺材<,>casket(n. 小盒子/n.棺材)/shroud(n.裹尸布/v.覆盖)

bureaucracy<,>/bjʊəˈrɒkrəsi/<,>/bjʊˈrɑːkrəsi/<,>n.官僚主义/n.官僚机构<,>The bureaucracy makes it difficult to get anything done quickly.<,>官僚主义使得快速完成任何事情都很困难。<,>He was frustrated by the government bureaucracy.<,>他对政府的官僚机构感到沮丧。<,>The new policy aims to reduce bureaucracy.<,>新政策旨在减少官僚主义。<,>bureau(办公室)+cracy(统治)→办公室统治→官僚主义<,>democracy(n.民主)/autocracy(n.独裁)

monster<,>/ˈmɒnstə(r)/<,>/ˈmɑːnstər/<,>n.怪物/n.畸形的动植物<,>The children were scared of the monster under the bed.<,>孩子们害怕床底下的怪物。<,>Scientists discovered a deep-sea monster.<,>科学家发现了一种深海怪物。<,>That plant is a real monster - it's grown three meters tall!<,>那棵植物真是个怪物——它已经长到三米高了！<,>mon(警告)+ster(人)→需要警告的人→怪物<,>demon(n.恶魔)/mammoth(n.猛犸象/adj.巨大的)

client<,>/ˈklaɪənt/<,>/ˈklaɪənt/<,>n.顾客/n.诉讼委托人<,>The lawyer met with his client to discuss the case.<,>律师与他的委托人会面讨论案件。<,>Our company has many international clients.<,>我们公司有许多国际客户。<,>The social worker helped the client find housing.<,>社会工作者帮助委托人找到了住房。<,>cli(依靠)+ent(人)→依靠的人→委托人<,>customer(n.顾客)/patient(n.病人)

obstinate<,>/ˈɒbstɪnət/<,>/ˈɑːbstɪnət/<,>adj.固执的/adj.顽强的<,>He was too obstinate to admit he was wrong.<,>他太固执了，不肯承认自己错了。<,>The obstinate child refused to eat his vegetables.<,>那个固执的孩子拒绝吃蔬菜。<,>Her obstinate determination helped her succeed.<,>她顽强的决心帮助她取得了成功。<,>ob(反对)+stin(站立)+ate→坚决站着反对→固执的<,>stubborn(adj.顽固的)/tenacious(adj.顽强的)

inherent<,>/ɪnˈhɪərənt/<,>/ɪnˈhɪrənt/<,>adj.固有的/adj.生来的<,>The risks inherent in the project were carefully considered.<,>项目中固有的风险被仔细考虑过了。<,>She has an inherent talent for music.<,>她天生就有音乐天赋。<,>There are inherent weaknesses in the system.<,>这个系统存在固有的弱点。<,>in(里面)+her(粘附)+ent→粘附在里面的→固有的<,>innate(adj.天生的)/intrinsic(adj.本质的)

fixture<,>/ˈfɪkstʃə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪkstʃər/<,>n.固定设备<,>The lighting fixtures in the room were very modern.<,>房间里的照明设备非常现代。<,>He became a fixture at the local café.<,>他成了当地咖啡馆的常客。<,>The bathroom fixtures need to be replaced.<,>浴室的固定设备需要更换。<,>fix(固定)+ture(名词后缀)→固定设备<,>furniture(n.家具)/appliance(n.电器)

pluck<,>/plʌk/<,>/plʌk/<,>v.鼓起(勇气)/v.振作<,>She plucked up the courage to speak in public.<,>她鼓起勇气在公众场合发言。<,>He plucked a rose from the garden.<,>他从花园里摘了一朵玫瑰。<,>The team needs to pluck up their spirits after the defeat.<,>球队需要在失败后振作精神。<,>与"luck(运气)"相似，需要勇气才能抓住运气<,>pick(v.采摘)/plummet(v.骤降)

agitation<,>/ˌædʒɪˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌædʒɪˈteɪʃn/<,>n.鼓动/n.煽动/n.搅动<,>His speech caused great agitation among the crowd.<,>他的演讲在人群中引起了很大的骚动。<,>She stirred the mixture with some agitation.<,>她有些激动地搅拌着混合物。<,>Political agitation led to reforms.<,>政治鼓动导致了改革。<,>ag(做)+it(走)+ation→来回走动→搅动<,>excitement(n.兴奋)/irritation(n.恼怒)

skeleton<,>/ˈskelɪtn/<,>/ˈskelɪtn/<,>n.骨骼/n.骷髅/n.骨架<,>The archaeologists found a dinosaur skeleton.<,>考古学家发现了一具恐龙骨骼。<,>She knows the skeleton of the story but not the details.<,>她知道故事的梗概但不了解细节。<,>The building's steel skeleton was completed last month.<,>建筑物的钢骨架上个月完工了。<,>skele(干枯)+ton→干枯的身体→骨骼<,>framework(n.框架)/structure(n.结构)
thigh<,>/θaɪ/<,>/θaɪ/<,>n.股/n.大腿<,>He pulled a muscle in his thigh while running.<,>他跑步时拉伤了大腿肌肉。<,>She applied ice to her sore thigh.<,>她在酸痛的大腿上敷了冰。<,>The doctor examined the bruise on his thigh.<,>医生检查了他大腿上的淤青。<,>th(身体部位)+igh(高)→大腿是身体较高的部位<,>thigh(n.大腿)/thy(pron.你的)/thick(adj.厚的)

cereal<,>/ˈsɪəriəl/<,>/ˈsɪriəl/<,>n.谷类/n.五谷/n.禾谷<,>I eat cereal with milk for breakfast every morning.<,>我每天早上早餐吃牛奶泡麦片。<,>This cereal contains whole grains and fiber.<,>这种谷物含有全谷物和纤维。<,>Wheat and rice are important cereal crops.<,>小麦和水稻是重要的谷类作物。<,>ce(谷物)+real(真实的)→真正的谷物<,>cereal(n.谷类)/serial(adj.连续的/n.连载小说)

antique<,>/ænˈtiːk/<,>/ænˈtiːk/<,>adj.古代的/n.古物<,>She collects antique furniture from the 18th century.<,>她收藏18世纪的古董家具。<,>This vase is a genuine antique.<,>这个花瓶是真正的古董。<,>The shop specializes in antique jewelry.<,>这家店专门经营古董珠宝。<,>anti(前)+que(状态)→以前的状态→古代的<,>antique(adj.古代的)/unique(adj.独特的)

assessment<,>/əˈsesmənt/<,>/əˈsɛsmənt/<,>n.估定/n.查定<,>The assessment of the property's value took two weeks.<,>对房产价值的评估花了两周时间。<,>We need to complete a risk assessment before starting the project.<,>在开始项目前我们需要完成风险评估。<,>The teacher's assessment of the student's work was fair.<,>老师对学生作业的评价是公正的。<,>assess(评估)+ment(名词后缀)→评估结果<,>assessment(n.评估)/assignment(n.任务)/assertion(n.断言)

constitute<,>/ˈkɒnstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈkɑːnstɪtuːt/<,>v.构成/v.组成<,>Twelve months constitute a year.<,>十二个月构成一年。<,>These results constitute a major breakthrough.<,>这些结果构成了重大突破。<,>Women constitute about half of the workforce.<,>女性约占劳动力的一半。<,>con(共同)+stitute(站立)→共同站立→组成<,>constitute(v.组成)/institute(n.学院/v.建立)/substitute(n.替代品/v.替代)

hound<,>/haʊnd/<,>/haʊnd/<,>n.猎犬<,>The hound chased the fox across the field.<,>猎犬在田野上追逐狐狸。<,>He keeps two hounds for hunting.<,>他养了两只猎犬用于打猎。<,>The detective was like a hound following a scent.<,>那个侦探就像追踪气味的猎犬。<,>hound与sound(声音)相似→猎犬追踪声音<,>hound(n.猎犬)/bound(v.跳跃/adj.必定的)/mound(n.土堆)

gutter<,>/ˈɡʌtə(r)/<,>/ˈɡʌtər/<,>n.沟/n.边沟/n.檐槽<,>The rainwater runs off the roof into the gutter.<,>雨水从屋顶流进檐槽。<,>They cleaned the leaves out of the gutters.<,>他们清理了檐槽里的树叶。<,>The street gutters were clogged with trash.<,>街道的排水沟被垃圾堵塞了。<,>gut(肠子)+ter→像肠子一样的沟槽<,>gutter(n.沟)/butter(n.黄油)/mutter(v.咕哝)

tribute<,>/ˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>/ˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>n.献礼/n.贡物<,>The concert was a tribute to the famous composer.<,>这场音乐会是向那位著名作曲家致敬。<,>Ancient kingdoms paid tribute to more powerful rulers.<,>古代王国向更强大的统治者进贡。<,>The award is a tribute to her years of hard work.<,>这个奖项是对她多年辛勤工作的褒奖。<,>trib(部落)+ute(给予)→部落给予的东西→贡品<,>tribute(n.贡物)/contribute(v.贡献)/distribute(v.分配)

number<,>/ˈnʌmbə(r)/<,>/ˈnʌmbər/<,>v.共计/v.达...之数<,>The crowd numbered in the thousands.<,>人群数量达数千人。<,>The casualties numbered over 100.<,>伤亡人数超过100人。<,>His collection numbers about 500 stamps.<,>他的收藏约有500张邮票。<,>number作动词时表示"总计"<,>number(v.共计)/numb(adj.麻木的)/lumber(n.木材)

commonwealth<,>/ˈkɒmənwelθ/<,>/ˈkɑːmənwelθ/<,>n.联邦<,>Australia is a member of the Commonwealth.<,>澳大利亚是英联邦成员国。<,>The Commonwealth Games are held every four years.<,>英联邦运动会每四年举行一次。<,>The island became a self-governing commonwealth.<,>这个岛成为一个自治的联邦。<,>common(共同的)+wealth(财富)→共同财富→联邦<,>commonwealth(n.联邦)/commonplace(adj.平凡的)/commonality(n.共性)
arch<,>/ɑːtʃ/<,>/ɑrtʃ/<,>n.拱门/v.（使）拱起<,>The bridge has a beautiful stone arch.<,>这座桥有一个漂亮的石拱门。<,>The cat arched its back when it saw the dog.<,>猫看到狗时拱起了背。<,>The trees arched over the pathway, creating a natural tunnel.<,>树木在小路上方拱起，形成了一条天然的隧道。<,>ar(弧形)+ch→拱形结构<,>arc(n.弧)/architect(n.建筑师)/archer(n.弓箭手)

vault<,>/vɔːlt/<,>/vɔlt/<,>n.拱顶/n.（教堂的）地下墓室<,>The cathedral's vault is decorated with golden stars.<,>大教堂的拱顶上装饰着金色的星星。<,>The ancient vault contained many historical artifacts.<,>这个古老的地下墓室保存着许多历史文物。<,>He kept his wine collection in the cellar vault.<,>他把收藏的酒存放在地窖的拱顶室里。<,>vau(空)+lt→中空的结构→拱顶<,>fault(n.错误)/vaunt(v.吹嘘)/volt(n.伏特)

mercury<,>/ˈmɜːkjəri/<,>/ˈmɜːrkjəri/<,>n.汞/n.水银<,>The thermometer contains mercury.<,>温度计里有水银。<,>Mercury is a toxic heavy metal.<,>汞是一种有毒的重金属。<,>The mercury rose quickly on the hot summer day.<,>在炎热的夏日，水银柱迅速上升。<,>Mercury(罗马神话中的墨丘利神)→水银的流动性像墨丘利一样快速<,>mercurial(adj.善变的)/merchant(n.商人)/mercy(n.仁慈)

consolidate<,>/kənˈsɒlɪdeɪt/<,>/kənˈsɑːlɪdeɪt/<,>v.巩固/v.合并<,>The company consolidated its position in the market.<,>公司巩固了其市场地位。<,>They decided to consolidate the two departments.<,>他们决定合并这两个部门。<,>She consolidated her debts into one loan.<,>她把债务合并成了一笔贷款。<,>con(共同)+solid(坚固)+ate(使)→使共同坚固→巩固<,>solidify(v.固化)/console(v.安慰)/consider(v.考虑)

impartial<,>/ɪmˈpɑːʃəl/<,>/ɪmˈpɑːrʃəl/<,>adj.公正的/adj.无偏见的<,>The judge must remain impartial during the trial.<,>法官在审判过程中必须保持公正。<,>She gave an impartial assessment of the situation.<,>她对情况做出了公正的评估。<,>An impartial observer would agree with our conclusion.<,>一个公正的观察者会同意我们的结论。<,>im(不)+partial(偏袒的)→不偏袒的<,>partial(adj.偏袒的)/impatient(adj.不耐烦的)/impact(n.影响)

convention<,>/kənˈvenʃən/<,>/kənˈvenʃən/<,>n.公约/n.（换俘等）协定<,>The Geneva Convention sets rules for wartime conduct.<,>日内瓦公约规定了战时行为的规则。<,>They signed a convention for prisoner exchange.<,>他们签署了一份战俘交换协定。<,>The annual convention attracts thousands of attendees.<,>年度大会吸引了数千名参与者。<,>con(共同)+vent(来)+ion→大家共同遵守的约定<,>invention(n.发明)/intervention(n.干预)/conventional(adj.传统的)

duke<,>/djuːk/<,>/duːk/<,>n.公爵/n.君主<,>The Duke of Edinburgh attended the ceremony.<,>爱丁堡公爵出席了仪式。<,>In medieval times, dukes held great power.<,>在中世纪，公爵拥有很大的权力。<,>The small country was ruled by a duke.<,>这个小国由一位公爵统治。<,>du(二)+ke→地位仅次于国王的贵族<,>duet(n.二重唱)/duke(与"duck"鸭子发音相似)/duchess(n.女公爵)

rooster<,>/ˈruːstə(r)/<,>/ˈrustər/<,>n.公鸡<,>The rooster crows at dawn.<,>公鸡在黎明时分啼叫。<,>We have a red rooster on our farm.<,>我们农场有一只红色的公鸡。<,>The rooster strutted proudly around the yard.<,>公鸡骄傲地在院子里昂首阔步。<,>roost(栖息)+er→栖息在栖木上的鸟→公鸡<,>rooster(与"roaster"烤炉发音相似)/roost(n.栖息处)/roasted(adj.烤的)

studio<,>/ˈstjuːdiəʊ/<,>/ˈstuːdioʊ/<,>n.播音室/n.工作室<,>The artist works in a small studio downtown.<,>这位艺术家在市中心的一个小工作室工作。<,>The radio host is in the studio now.<,>电台主持人现在在播音室里。<,>They built a photography studio in their garage.<,>他们在车库里建了一个摄影工作室。<,>study(学习)+o→学习或工作的地方<,>studio(与"stadium"体育场拼写相似)/studious(adj.勤奋的)/student(n.学生)

earnings<,>/ˈɜːnɪŋz/<,>/ˈɜːrnɪŋz/<,>n.工资/n.收入/n.收益<,>Her monthly earnings have increased recently.<,>她每月的收入最近增加了。<,>The company reported record earnings this quarter.<,>公司报告本季度创纪录的收益。<,>He invested his earnings wisely.<,>他明智地投资了自己的收入。<,>earn(赚取)+ings→赚取的东西<,>earning(与"yearning"渴望发音相似)/earn(v.赚取)/learn(v.学习)
implement<,>/ˈɪmplɪmənt/<,>/ˈɪmpləmənt/<,>n.工具/v.贯彻<,>The new software is a useful implement for data analysis.<,>这个新软件是数据分析的有用工具。<,>The government plans to implement new policies next year.<,>政府计划明年实施新政策。<,>Farmers use various implements to cultivate the land.<,>农民使用各种工具耕种土地。<,>im(进入)+ple(满)+ment→使圆满→贯彻<,>instrument(n.仪器)/complement(n.补充物/v.补充)  

workpiece<,>/ˈwɜːkpiːs/<,>/ˈwɜːrkpiːs/<,>n.工件<,>The machinist carefully measured the workpiece before cutting.<,>机械师在切割前仔细测量了工件。<,>This lathe can handle workpieces up to 2 meters in length.<,>这台车床可以加工长达2米的工件。<,>The quality of the workpiece depends on the precision of the tools.<,>工件的质量取决于工具的精度。<,>work(工作)+piece(件)→工件<,>masterpiece(n.杰作)/workbench(n.工作台)  

combat<,>/ˈkɒmbæt/<,>/ˈkɑːmbæt/<,>v.战斗/v.格斗<,>Soldiers are trained to combat enemy forces.<,>士兵们接受训练以对抗敌军。<,>The new drug helps combat the spread of infection.<,>这种新药有助于对抗感染传播。<,>Martial arts teach you how to combat effectively.<,>武术教你如何有效格斗。<,>com(共同)+bat(打)→一起打→战斗<,>combatant(n.战斗人员)/combative(adj.好斗的)  

impart<,>/ɪmˈpɑːt/<,>/ɪmˈpɑːrt/<,>v.给予/v.传递/v.告诉<,>Teachers aim to impart knowledge to their students.<,>教师旨在向学生传授知识。<,>The spices impart a unique flavor to the dish.<,>这些香料给菜肴增添了独特风味。<,>She imparted some valuable advice about career planning.<,>她传授了一些关于职业规划的宝贵建议。<,>im(进入)+part(部分)→成为一部分→给予<,>impartial(adj.公正的)/impact(n.影响)  

energize<,>/ˈenədʒaɪz/<,>/ˈenərdʒaɪz/<,>v.供给能量<,>The coach's speech energized the team before the game.<,>教练的演讲在赛前给队伍注入了能量。<,>Solar panels energize the entire building.<,>太阳能电池板为整栋建筑供电。<,>A good breakfast helps energize you for the day.<,>一顿丰盛的早餐能为你一天提供能量。<,>energy(能量)+ize(使)→使有能量<,>energetic(adj.精力充沛的)/enervate(v.使衰弱)  

vaccinate<,>/ˈvæksɪneɪt/<,>/ˈvæksəneɪt/<,>v.接种疫苗<,>All children should be vaccinated against measles.<,>所有儿童都应接种麻疹疫苗。<,>The clinic vaccinates hundreds of people every week.<,>这家诊所每周为数百人接种疫苗。<,>Travelers to certain countries may need to be vaccinated.<,>前往某些国家的旅行者可能需要接种疫苗。<,>vaccine(疫苗)+ate(使)→使接种疫苗<,>vaccination(n.接种)/variolation(n.人痘接种)  

flavour<,>/ˈfleɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈfleɪvər/<,>v.调味<,>She flavored the soup with fresh herbs.<,>她用新鲜香草给汤调味。<,>The chef flavors his dishes with exotic spices.<,>厨师用异国香料给他的菜肴调味。<,>Vanilla extract is used to flavor desserts.<,>香草精用于给甜点调味。<,>flavor(味道)+u→使有味道<,>flavoring(n.调味料)/savor(v.品尝)  

insulator<,>/ˈɪnsjuleɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈɪnsəleɪtər/<,>n.隔离者/n.绝缘体<,>Rubber is a good electrical insulator.<,>橡胶是良好的电绝缘体。<,>The ceramic insulator prevents heat loss.<,>陶瓷绝缘体防止热量流失。<,>Insulators are essential for safe power transmission.<,>绝缘体对于安全输电至关重要。<,>insulate(隔离)+or(者)→隔离者<,>isolator(n.隔离器)/conductor(n.导体)  

lattice<,>/ˈlætɪs/<,>/ˈlætɪs/<,>n.格子结构<,>The garden has a beautiful lattice fence.<,>花园有一个漂亮的格子篱笆。<,>Crystals often form a lattice pattern.<,>晶体常形成格子图案。<,>The lattice structure provides both strength and lightness.<,>格子结构既坚固又轻便。<,>lat(板条)+tice→板条组成的→格子<,>latticework(n.格子细工)/grating(n.栅栏)  

dove<,>/dʌv/<,>/doʊv/<,>n.鸽子/n.斑鸠<,>A white dove is a symbol of peace.<,>白鸽是和平的象征。<,>The mourning dove cooed softly on the branch.<,>哀鸽在树枝上轻声咕咕叫。<,>We saw a pair of doves building a nest.<,>我们看到一对斑鸠在筑巢。<,>对比"dive"(v.潜水)<,>pigeon(n.鸽子)/raven(n.渡鸦)
reveal<,>/rɪˈviːl/<,>/rɪˈvil/<,>v.告诉/v.揭示/v.泄露<,>The report revealed shocking details about the incident.<,>这份报告揭示了事件的惊人细节。<,>She refused to reveal her true feelings.<,>她拒绝透露自己的真实感受。<,>The detective revealed the identity of the murderer.<,>侦探揭开了凶手的身份。<,>re(重新)+veal(面纱)→揭开面纱→揭示<,>conceal(v.隐藏)/unveil(v.揭露)/veil(n.面纱)

plateau<,>/ˈplætəʊ/<,>/plæˈtoʊ/<,>n.高原/n.平稳时期<,>The climbers reached a high plateau after days of hiking.<,>登山者经过数日徒步后到达了一片高原。<,>Her progress in learning French has hit a plateau.<,>她的法语学习进展进入了停滞期。<,>The economy has been on a plateau for several months.<,>经济已经连续几个月处于平稳状态。<,>plat(平的)+eau(法语后缀)→平坦的高地→高原<,>plate(n.盘子)/platform(n.平台)/platter(n.大浅盘)

lofty<,>/ˈlɒfti/<,>/ˈlɔːfti/<,>adj.高耸的/adj.高尚的<,>The lofty mountains were covered with snow.<,>高耸的山脉被白雪覆盖。<,>He has lofty ideals about changing the world.<,>他有着改变世界的高尚理想。<,>She spoke in a lofty tone that annoyed everyone.<,>她用一种高高在上的语气说话，惹恼了所有人。<,>loft(阁楼)+y(形容词后缀)→像阁楼一样高的→高耸的<,>lift(v.举起)/aloft(adv.在高处)/loft(n.阁楼)

tower<,>/ˈtaʊə(r)/<,>/ˈtaʊɚ/<,>v.高耸/v.屹立/v.翱翔<,>The skyscraper towers over the city.<,>摩天大楼高耸于城市之上。<,>His achievements tower above those of his peers.<,>他的成就远超同龄人。<,>Eagles were towering in the sky.<,>鹰在天空中翱翔。<,>tow(拉)+er(名词后缀)→像被拉高一样→高耸<,>power(n.力量)/shower(n.淋浴)/flower(n.花)

elevation<,>/ˌelɪˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌɛləˈveɪʃən/<,>n.高度/n.海拔<,>The elevation of this mountain is 3,000 meters.<,>这座山的海拔是3000米。<,>His promotion marked an elevation in status.<,>他的晋升标志着地位的提升。<,>The city has an average elevation of 500 meters.<,>该市的平均海拔为500米。<,>e(出)+lev(轻)+ation(名词后缀)→使轻而上升→高度<,>levitate(v.漂浮)/lever(n.杠杆)/alleviate(v.减轻)

intervene<,>/ˌɪntəˈviːn/<,>/ˌɪntərˈviːn/<,>v.干涉/v.干预<,>The teacher had to intervene in the students' argument.<,>老师不得不干预学生们的争论。<,>The government intervened to stabilize the economy.<,>政府干预以稳定经济。<,>No one intervened when the accident happened.<,>事故发生时没有人干预。<,>inter(在...之间)+vene(来)→来到中间→干预<,>interview(n.面试)/interfere(v.干涉)/prevent(v.阻止)

dry<,>/draɪ/<,>/draɪ/<,>adj.干巴巴的/adj.枯燥的<,>The lecture was so dry that many students fell asleep.<,>讲座太枯燥了，很多学生都睡着了。<,>The desert climate is extremely dry.<,>沙漠气候极其干燥。<,>He told the joke with a dry sense of humor.<,>他用干巴巴的幽默感讲了这个笑话。<,>d(地)+ry(日)→日晒大地→干燥的<,>try(v.尝试)/cry(v.哭泣)/fry(v.油炸)

olive<,>/ˈɒlɪv/<,>/ˈɑːlɪv/<,>n.橄榄/n.橄榄树<,>She added some olives to the salad.<,>她在沙拉里加了些橄榄。<,>The olive branch is a symbol of peace.<,>橄榄枝是和平的象征。<,>Olive trees can live for hundreds of years.<,>橄榄树可以存活数百年。<,>oli(油)+ve→富含油脂的果实→橄榄<,>live(v.生活)/love(n.爱)/alive(adj.活着的)

sentiment<,>/ˈsentɪmənt/<,>/ˈsɛntəmənt/<,>n.感情/n.情绪<,>There is strong public sentiment against the new law.<,>公众对新法律有强烈的反对情绪。<,>She expressed her sentiments in a heartfelt letter.<,>她在一封真诚的信中表达了自己的感情。<,>Market sentiment has improved recently.<,>市场情绪最近有所改善。<,>senti(感觉)+ment(名词后缀)→感觉到的情绪<,>sentence(n.句子)/sensation(n.感觉)/sentinel(n.哨兵)

perception<,>/pəˈsepʃn/<,>/pərˈsɛpʃən/<,>n.感知/n.理解力<,>His perception of colors is different from most people.<,>他对颜色的感知与大多数人不同。<,>The study focuses on visual perception.<,>这项研究专注于视觉感知。<,>Public perception of the issue has changed.<,>公众对这个问题的理解已经改变。<,>per(完全)+cept(拿)+ion→完全拿住→感知<,>conception(n.概念)/reception(n.接待)/deception(n.欺骗)
sensation<,>/senˈseɪʃn/<,>/sɛnˈseɪʃən/<,>n.感觉/n.知觉/n.轰动<,>The news caused a sensation worldwide.<,>这个消息在全世界引起了轰动。<,>She had a tingling sensation in her fingers.<,>她的手指有刺痛感。<,>He lost all sensation in his legs after the accident.<,>事故后他的双腿完全失去了知觉。<,>sens(感觉)+ation(状态)→感觉的状态→知觉<,>sentiment(n.情绪/n.观点)/sensory(adj.感觉的/n.感觉器官)

Thanksgiving<,>/ˌθæŋksˈɡɪvɪŋ/<,>/ˌθæŋksˈɡɪvɪŋ/<,>n.感恩节<,>We celebrate Thanksgiving with a big family dinner.<,>我们用一顿丰盛的家庭晚餐庆祝感恩节。<,>Turkey is the traditional main dish for Thanksgiving.<,>火鸡是感恩节的传统主菜。<,>She expressed her Thanksgiving by helping the homeless.<,>她通过帮助无家可归者来表达感恩。<,>thanks(感谢)+giving(给予)→感恩的给予→感恩节<,>thanksgiver(n.感恩者)/thanksgiving(adj.感恩的)

chill<,>/tʃɪl/<,>/tʃɪl/<,>v.感到寒冷/v.冷藏<,>The wind made me chill to the bone.<,>这风让我感到刺骨的寒冷。<,>Please chill the wine before serving.<,>上酒前请先冷藏。<,>He tried to chill out after a stressful day.<,>紧张的一天后他试着放松。<,>c(冷)+hill(小山)→寒冷的小山→寒冷<,>chilly(adj.寒冷的)/chillness(n.寒冷)

outline<,>/ˈaʊtlaɪn/<,>/ˈaʊtˌlaɪn/<,>v.概述/v.概括<,>Can you outline the main points of your presentation?<,>你能概述一下你演讲的要点吗？<,>The teacher outlined the course syllabus on the first day.<,>老师第一天就概述了课程大纲。<,>The mountains were outlined against the evening sky.<,>群山在傍晚的天空下显出轮廓。<,>out(外)+line(线)→外部的线条→轮廓<,>underline(v.强调/n.下划线)/online(adj.在线的)

notion<,>/ˈnəʊʃn/<,>/ˈnoʊʃən/<,>n.概念/n.看法<,>I have no notion of what you're talking about.<,>我对你所说的毫无概念。<,>She has some old-fashioned notions about marriage.<,>她对婚姻有一些老式的看法。<,>The notion of time differs across cultures.<,>时间的概念因文化而异。<,>not(知道)+ion(状态)→知道的状态→概念<,>motion(n.运动/v.示意)/notional(adj.概念的)

conception<,>/kənˈsepʃn/<,>/kənˈsɛpʃən/<,>n.概念/n.观念/n.想法<,>The conception of this project took months of planning.<,>这个项目的构思花了数月的规划。<,>They have different conceptions of success.<,>他们对成功有不同的观念。<,>The artist's conception was ahead of its time.<,>这位艺术家的想法超前于时代。<,>con(共同)+cept(拿)+ion→共同拿取的想法→概念<,>perception(n.感知/n.看法)/deception(n.欺骗)

summary<,>/ˈsʌməri/<,>/ˈsʌməri/<,>adj.概括的/adj.速决的<,>He gave a summary account of the events.<,>他对事件做了概括性的描述。<,>The meeting ended with a summary decision.<,>会议以快速决定结束。<,>Please provide a summary of your findings.<,>请提供你发现的摘要。<,>sum(总和)+mary→总和的状态→摘要<,>summarize(v.总结)/summation(n.总结)

generalize<,>/ˈdʒenrəlaɪz/<,>/ˈdʒɛnərəˌlaɪz/<,>v.概括出<,>It's dangerous to generalize about all politicians.<,>对所有政客一概而论是危险的。<,>The study results can't be generalized to the whole population.<,>研究结果不能推广到整个人群。<,>She generalized her experience into a theory.<,>她把经验概括成理论。<,>general(一般的)+ize(使)→使一般化→概括<,>specialize(v.专攻)/generalization(n.概括)

impress<,>/ɪmˈpres/<,>/ɪmˈprɛs/<,>v.盖印/v.在...打记号<,>The king's seal was impressed on the document.<,>国王的印章盖在文件上。<,>They impressed their logo on the product.<,>他们在产品上印上了标志。<,>The memory is deeply impressed in my mind.<,>这段记忆深深印在我脑海中。<,>im(进入)+press(压)→压进去→盖印<,>express(v.表达)/oppress(v.压迫)

mend<,>/mend/<,>/mɛnd/<,>v.修理/v.改正<,>He mended the broken chair with some glue.<,>他用胶水修理了坏掉的椅子。<,>It's never too late to mend your ways.<,>改过自新永远不晚。<,>The doctor said the bone would mend in six weeks.<,>医生说骨头六周后会愈合。<,>men(人)+d(做)→人做的修理工作→修理<,>amend(v.修正)/blend(v.混合)
duplicate<,>/ˈdjuːplɪkət/<,>/ˈduːplɪkət/<,>n.复制品/v.复制<,>He made a duplicate of the key.<,>他复制了一把钥匙。<,>Please duplicate this document for the meeting.<,>请为会议复印这份文件。<,>The artist duplicated the famous painting perfectly.<,>这位艺术家完美复制了那幅名画。<,>du(双)+plic(折叠)+ate→折叠成双→复制<,>replicate(v.复制)/duplicity(n.口是心非)/duplex(n.复式公寓)  

complication<,>/ˌkɒmplɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmplɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.复杂/n.混乱/n.并发症<,>The surgery was successful without complications.<,>手术很成功，没有并发症。<,>This legal case has many complications.<,>这个法律案件有很多复杂之处。<,>Adding new rules will only create more complications.<,>增加新规则只会制造更多混乱。<,>com(共同)+plic(折叠)+ation→多重折叠→复杂<,>complexity(n.复杂性)/complex(adj.复杂的)/comply(v.遵从)  

complexity<,>/kəmˈpleksəti/<,>/kəmˈpleksəti/<,>n.复杂性<,>The complexity of the problem requires expert analysis.<,>这个问题的复杂性需要专家分析。<,>He was fascinated by the complexity of the human brain.<,>他对人脑的复杂性着迷。<,>This software handles high levels of complexity.<,>这个软件能处理高度复杂的问题。<,>complex(复杂的)+ity(名词后缀)→复杂性<,>simplicity(n.简单)/complication(n.复杂)/plexus(n.丛)  

satellite<,>/ˈsætəlaɪt/<,>/ˈsæt̬əlaɪt/<,>n.附属国<,>In ancient times, many small states were satellites of Rome.<,>在古代，许多小国是罗马的附属国。<,>The country became an economic satellite of its powerful neighbor.<,>这个国家成为其强大邻国的经济附属国。<,>Satellite nations often have limited sovereignty.<,>附属国通常主权有限。<,>satell(随从)+ite→像随从一样的国家→附属国<,>planet(n.行星)/stellar(adj.星球的)/artificial satellite(人造卫星)  

appendix<,>/əˈpendɪks/<,>/əˈpendɪks/<,>n.附录/n.阑尾<,>The book's appendix contains additional references.<,>书的附录包含额外的参考资料。<,>He had to have his appendix removed.<,>他不得不切除阑尾。<,>Check the appendix for statistical data.<,>查看附录中的统计数据。<,>ap(向)+pend(悬挂)+ix→悬挂在后面的东西→附录<,>pendulum(n.钟摆)/append(v.附加)/pendant(n.垂饰)  

extra<,>/ˈekstrə/<,>/ˈekstrə/<,>n.附加物/n.额外的东西<,>The hotel charges extra for room service.<,>酒店对客房服务额外收费。<,>She always puts in extra effort at work.<,>她工作时总是付出额外努力。<,>This edition comes with bonus extras.<,>这个版本附赠额外内容。<,>ex(超出)+tra→超出常规的→额外的<,>extract(v.提取)/extreme(adj.极端的)/extraneous(adj.外来的)  

incidentally<,>/ˌɪnsɪˈdentəli/<,>/ˌɪnsɪˈdent̬əli/<,>adv.附带地/adv.顺便提及<,>Incidentally, I saw your brother at the mall yesterday.<,>顺便说一句，我昨天在商场看到你弟弟了。<,>He mentioned it incidentally during the conversation.<,>他在谈话中顺便提到了这件事。<,>Incidentally, the meeting has been postponed.<,>顺便说一下，会议已经延期了。<,>incident(事件)+ally→像附带事件一样→附带地<,>accidentally(adv.偶然地)/incident(n.事件)/coincidental(adj.巧合的)  

charge<,>/tʃɑːdʒ/<,>/tʃɑːrdʒ/<,>n.负荷/n.充电/v.装满<,>My phone needs a charge.<,>我的手机需要充电。<,>He was put in charge of the project.<,>他被委派负责这个项目。<,>The battery charges quickly.<,>这个电池充电很快。<,>char(车)+ge→像装车一样→装满<,>discharge(v.释放)/recharge(v.再充电)/charger(n.充电器)  

negative<,>/ˈneɡətɪv/<,>/ˈneɡət̬ɪv/<,>adj.负的/adj.阴性的<,>The test result came back negative.<,>检测结果是阴性的。<,>He has a negative attitude towards everything.<,>他对一切都持消极态度。<,>The battery has a negative terminal.<,>电池有负极。<,>neg(否定)+ative→否定的<,>positive(adj.积极的)/negate(v.否定)/negation(n.否定)  

corrosion<,>/kəˈrəʊʒn/<,>/kəˈroʊʒn/<,>n.腐蚀/n.侵蚀/n.锈<,>The metal showed signs of corrosion.<,>金属出现了腐蚀迹象。<,>Salt water accelerates corrosion.<,>盐水会加速腐蚀。<,>They used special paint to prevent corrosion.<,>他们使用特殊涂料防止锈蚀。<,>cor(完全)+ros(咬)+ion→完全被咬坏→腐蚀<,>erosion(n.侵蚀)/corrosive(adj.腐蚀性的)/rot(n.腐烂)
erosion<,>/ɪˈrəʊʒən/<,>/ɪˈroʊʒən/<,>n.腐蚀/n.侵蚀/n.糜烂<,>Soil erosion is a serious problem in this area.<,>这个地区的水土流失是一个严重的问题。<,>The erosion of the coastline has accelerated due to climate change.<,>由于气候变化，海岸线的侵蚀加速了。<,>Gastric erosion can be caused by excessive alcohol consumption.<,>胃糜烂可能是由过量饮酒引起的。<,>e(出)+ros(咬)+ion→咬掉→侵蚀<,>corrosion(n.腐蚀)/abrasion(n.磨损)/evasion(n.逃避)

subsidiary<,>/səbˈsɪdiəri/<,>/səbˈsɪdieri/<,>adj.辅助的/adj.补充的<,>The company has several subsidiary businesses.<,>这家公司有几家子公司。<,>This information is subsidiary to the main report.<,>这些信息是对主报告的补充。<,>She plays a subsidiary role in the project.<,>她在这个项目中扮演辅助角色。<,>sub(下面)+sid(坐)+iary→坐在下面辅助的<,>subsidy(n.补贴)/subsistence(n.生存)/substantial(adj.大量的)

coach<,>/kəʊtʃ/<,>/koʊtʃ/<,>v.指导/v.训练/v.辅导<,>He coaches the basketball team on weekends.<,>他周末指导篮球队。<,>I need someone to coach me for the interview.<,>我需要有人辅导我面试。<,>She coaches students in mathematics.<,>她辅导学生数学。<,>发音类似"口齿"→教练需要好口才<,>couch(n.长沙发)/poach(v.偷猎)/roach(n.蟑螂)

answer<,>/ˈɑːnsə/<,>/ˈænsər/<,>v.符合/v.适合<,>This house answers all our requirements.<,>这房子符合我们所有的要求。<,>The product doesn't answer to the description.<,>这个产品与描述不符。<,>His behavior answers to his character.<,>他的行为符合他的性格。<,>联想：answer phone(应答电话)→符合来电者需求<,>respond(v.回答)/correspond(v.符合)/resemble(v.相似)

emerge<,>/ɪˈmɜːdʒ/<,>/ɪˈmɜːrdʒ/<,>v.浮现/v.出现/v.显露<,>The sun emerged from behind the clouds.<,>太阳从云层后面露出来了。<,>New evidence has emerged in the case.<,>案件出现了新证据。<,>She emerged as the leader of the group.<,>她成为这个团队的领导者。<,>e(出)+merge(沉没)→从沉没中出来<,>immerge(v.浸入)/submerge(v.淹没)/merge(v.合并)

obedient<,>/əˈbiːdiənt/<,>/oʊˈbiːdiənt/<,>adj.服从的/adj.顺从的<,>The dog is very obedient to its owner.<,>这只狗非常顺从主人。<,>She was an obedient student in class.<,>她在课堂上是个听话的学生。<,>Soldiers must be obedient to orders.<,>士兵必须服从命令。<,>ob(加强)+edi(听)+ent→非常听话的<,>obedience(n.服从)/disobedient(adj.不服从的)/oblige(v.迫使)

obedience<,>/əˈbiːdiəns/<,>/oʊˈbiːdiəns/<,>n.服从/n.顺从<,>Blind obedience is not always a virtue.<,>盲目的服从并不总是美德。<,>The child showed perfect obedience to his parents.<,>这孩子对父母表现出完全的顺从。<,>Military discipline requires absolute obedience.<,>军队纪律要求绝对服从。<,>ob(加强)+edi(听)+ence→听话的状态<,>obedient(adj.服从的)/disobedience(n.不服从)/audience(n.听众)

maintenance<,>/ˈmeɪntənəns/<,>/ˈmeɪntənəns/<,>n.扶养费/n.维持<,>He pays monthly maintenance for his children.<,>他每月支付孩子的抚养费。<,>Regular maintenance can prolong the life of your car.<,>定期保养可以延长汽车寿命。<,>The maintenance of peace is our common goal.<,>维护和平是我们的共同目标。<,>main(主要)+ten(持有)+ance→保持主要状态<,>retention(n.保留)/sustenance(n.生计)/containment(n.遏制)

veto<,>/ˈviːtəʊ/<,>/ˈviːtoʊ/<,>n.否决/n.否决权/n.禁止<,>The president used his veto power on the bill.<,>总统对法案行使了否决权。<,>The proposal was rejected by a veto from the committee.<,>该提案被委员会否决了。<,>Parents have a veto over their children's decisions.<,>父母对孩子的决定有否决权。<,>来自拉丁语"我禁止"<,>vote(v.投票)/vet(n.兽医)/venue(n.场地)

denial<,>/dɪˈnaɪəl/<,>/dɪˈnaɪəl/<,>n.否定/n.拒绝相信<,>His denial of the accusation was firm.<,>他坚决否认指控。<,>The company issued a denial of the rumors.<,>公司发表声明否认谣言。<,>She is in denial about her health problems.<,>她拒绝承认自己的健康问题。<,>de(否定)+ni(说)+al→否定地说<,>deny(v.否认)/renounce(v.放弃)/defy(v.违抗)
Buddhism<,>/ˈbʊdɪzəm/<,>/ˈbʊdɪzəm/<,>n.佛教/n.释教<,>Buddhism originated in India over 2,500 years ago.<,>佛教起源于2500多年前的印度。<,>Many people find peace through the teachings of Buddhism.<,>许多人通过佛教教义找到内心的平静。<,>Buddhism emphasizes compassion and mindfulness.<,>佛教强调慈悲与正念。<,>Buddha(佛)+ism(主义)→佛教<,>Hinduism(n.印度教)/Taoism(n.道教)/Confucianism(n.儒教)

dedicate<,>/ˈdedɪkeɪt/<,>/ˈdɛdəˌkeɪt/<,>v.奉献/v.献身<,>She dedicated her life to helping the poor.<,>她毕生致力于帮助穷人。<,>The book is dedicated to his parents.<,>这本书献给他的父母。<,>He dedicated all his energy to the project.<,>他把全部精力都投入到了这个项目中。<,>de(向下)+dic(说)+ate→郑重宣布→奉献<,>delicate(adj.精致的)/indicate(v.表明)/predicate(n.谓语)

flatter<,>/ˈflætə(r)/<,>/ˈflætər/<,>v.奉承/v.阿谀/v.谄媚<,>He flattered her by praising her cooking skills.<,>他通过称赞她的厨艺来奉承她。<,>Don't flatter yourself - you're not that important.<,>别自以为是，你没那么重要。<,>Her smile flattered him into believing her lies.<,>她的微笑让他轻信了她的谎言。<,>flat(平的)+ter→把话说得平顺→奉承<,>flutter(v.飘动)/falter(v.蹒跚)/clatter(n.咔嗒声)

pineapple<,>/ˈpaɪnæpl/<,>/ˈpaɪnˌæpəl/<,>n.凤梨/n.波萝<,>The pineapple was sweet and juicy.<,>这个菠萝又甜又多汁。<,>She made a delicious pineapple upside-down cake.<,>她做了一个美味的菠萝翻转蛋糕。<,>Pineapple contains an enzyme called bromelain.<,>菠萝含有一种叫菠萝蛋白酶的酶。<,>pine(松树)+apple(苹果)→外形像松果的水果→菠萝<,>apple(n.苹果)/grapefruit(n.葡萄柚)/watermelon(n.西瓜)

seam<,>/siːm/<,>/sim/<,>n.缝口/n.接缝/n.骨缝<,>The seam of his shirt was coming apart.<,>他衬衫的接缝处开始开线了。<,>She carefully stitched the seam of the dress.<,>她仔细地缝制裙子的接缝。<,>Coal seams run deep beneath these mountains.<,>煤层在这些山脉深处延伸。<,>sea(海)+m→像海浪相接处→接缝<,>seem(v.似乎)/beam(n.横梁)/ream(n.令纸)

landscape<,>/ˈlændskeɪp/<,>/ˈlændˌskep/<,>n.风景/n.景色/n.景致<,>The landscape of the countryside was breathtaking.<,>乡村的风景令人叹为观止。<,>He specializes in landscape photography.<,>他专攻风景摄影。<,>The drought has changed the landscape dramatically.<,>干旱使地貌发生了巨大变化。<,>land(土地)+scape(景象)→风景<,>seascape(n.海景)/cityscape(n.城市景观)/moonscape(n.月球表面)

windmill<,>/ˈwɪndmɪl/<,>/ˈwɪndˌmɪl/<,>n.风车<,>The old windmill still stands on the hill.<,>那座古老的风车仍然矗立在小山上。<,>Windmills were used to grind grain in the past.<,>过去风车被用来磨谷物。<,>Modern windmills generate electricity.<,>现代风车用来发电。<,>wind(风)+mill(磨坊)→风车<,>watermill(n.水车)/treadmill(n.跑步机)/windshield(n.挡风玻璃)

plump<,>/plʌmp/<,>/plʌmp/<,>adj.丰满的<,>She has a plump, rosy face.<,>她有一张圆润红润的脸。<,>The plump cushions made the chair more comfortable.<,>丰满的坐垫让椅子更舒适了。<,>The grapes were sweet and plump.<,>这些葡萄又甜又饱满。<,>plum(李子)+p→像李子一样圆润的→丰满的<,>plumb(adj.垂直的)/plump(v.突然放下)/slump(v.暴跌)

abundance<,>/əˈbʌndəns/<,>/əˈbʌndəns/<,>n.丰富/n.充裕<,>The region is known for its abundance of wildlife.<,>该地区以其丰富的野生动物而闻名。<,>We have an abundance of food for the party.<,>我们为派对准备了充足的食物。<,>Her garden produces an abundance of flowers.<,>她的花园盛开着大量鲜花。<,>ab(离开)+und(波浪)+ance→像波浪一样多→丰富<,>abundant(adj.丰富的)/redundant(adj.多余的)/abound(v.大量存在)

indignation<,>/ˌɪndɪɡˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪndɪɡˈneɪʃən/<,>n.愤怒/n.愤慨/n.义愤<,>Her voice trembled with indignation.<,>她的声音因愤怒而颤抖。<,>Public indignation forced the government to act.<,>公众的愤慨迫使政府采取行动。<,>He felt righteous indignation at the injustice.<,>他对这种不公正感到义愤填膺。<,>in(不)+dign(尊严)+ation→因尊严受损而愤怒<,>indignant(adj.愤怒的)/indignity(n.侮辱)/dignity(n.尊严)
shatter<,>/ˈʃætə(r)/<,>/ˈʃætər/<,>v.粉碎/v.破碎/v.毁坏<,>The glass shattered into tiny pieces when it hit the floor.<,>玻璃杯掉到地板上摔得粉碎。<,>The explosion shattered all the windows in the building.<,>爆炸震碎了那栋楼所有的窗户。<,>Her dreams were shattered by the bad news.<,>这个坏消息粉碎了她的梦想。<,>sha(谐音"杀")+tter(拟声"碎")→粉碎<,>scatter(v.散开)/batter(v.猛击)/chatter(v.喋喋不休)

molecular<,>/məˈlekjələ(r)/<,>/məˈlɛkjələr/<,>adj.分子的/adj.克分子的<,>The molecular structure of water is H2O.<,>水的分子结构是H2O。<,>Scientists study molecular biology to understand life processes.<,>科学家研究分子生物学来理解生命过程。<,>This substance has a low molecular weight.<,>这种物质分子量很低。<,>molecule(分子)+ar(形容词后缀)→分子的<,>cellular(adj.细胞的)/particular(adj.特别的)/muscular(adj.肌肉的)

limb<,>/lɪm/<,>/lɪm/<,>n.肢/n.手臂/n.腿<,>He lost a limb in the accident.<,>他在事故中失去了一条肢体。<,>The monkey was swinging from limb to limb.<,>猴子在树枝间荡来荡去。<,>She stretched her limbs after sitting for hours.<,>坐了数小时后她伸展四肢。<,>lim(界限)+b→身体的界限部分→肢体<,>lamb(n.羔羊)/limp(v.跛行)/limbo(n.中间状态)

offset<,>/ˈɒfset/<,>/ˈɔːfset/<,>v.抵销<,>The gains offset the losses this quarter.<,>本季度的收益抵销了亏损。<,>Higher prices were offset by better quality.<,>更高的价格被更好的质量所抵销。<,>We planted trees to offset our carbon emissions.<,>我们种树来抵销碳排放。<,>off(离开)+set(设置)→设置离开→抵销<,>onset(n.开始)/upset(v.打乱)/reset(v.重置)

fraction<,>/ˈfrækʃn/<,>/ˈfrækʃən/<,>n.分数<,>Only a fraction of the students passed the exam.<,>只有一小部分学生通过了考试。<,>She ate a fraction of the cake.<,>她吃了一小块蛋糕。<,>3/4 is a proper fraction.<,>3/4是一个真分数。<,>fract(打破)+ion→打破整体→分数<,>friction(n.摩擦)/fiction(n.小说)/fraction(n.碎片)

distract<,>/dɪˈstrækt/<,>/dɪˈstrækt/<,>v.分散(心思)/v.打扰<,>The noise distracted me from my work.<,>噪音让我无法专心工作。<,>Don't distract the driver while he's operating the vehicle.<,>司机开车时不要打扰他。<,>Her beauty distracted his attention.<,>她的美貌分散了他的注意力。<,>dis(分开)+tract(拉)→把注意力拉开→分散<,>detract(v.贬低)/extract(v.提取)/contract(n.合同)

installment<,>/ɪnˈstɔːlmənt/<,>/ɪnˈstɔːlmənt/<,>n.分期付款<,>I'm paying for the car in monthly installments.<,>我按月分期付款购买这辆车。<,>The final installment of the loan is due next month.<,>贷款的最后一次分期付款下月到期。<,>This novel is published in installments.<,>这部小说是分期连载的。<,>install(安装)+ment→分期"安装"付款→分期付款<,>installation(n.安装)/instalment(英式拼写)/investment(n.投资)

split<,>/splɪt/<,>/splɪt/<,>n.分裂/n.分化/n.派系<,>There was a split in the political party.<,>这个政党内部出现了分裂。<,>The banana split into two when I peeled it.<,>我剥香蕉时它裂成了两半。<,>A split second can make all the difference.<,>一瞬间可能改变一切。<,>s(蛇)+plit(拟声"劈裂")→分裂<,>spit(v.吐痰)/splat(拟声"啪嗒声")/splice(v.拼接)

detach<,>/dɪˈtætʃ/<,>/dɪˈtætʃ/<,>v.分开/v.派遣(军队)<,>Detach the form and send it to the office.<,>把表格撕下来送到办公室。<,>A special unit was detached to deal with the crisis.<,>派遣了一支特殊部队处理危机。<,>She detached herself from the group.<,>她离开了那个团体。<,>de(去掉)+tach(钉住)→把钉住的去掉→分开<,>attach(v.附着)/dispatch(v.派遣)/detached(adj.分离的)

partition<,>/pɑːˈtɪʃn/<,>/pɑːrˈtɪʃən/<,>n.分开/n.分割/n.隔墙<,>The room was divided by a wooden partition.<,>房间用木质隔断分开。<,>After the war, the country was partitioned.<,>战后这个国家被分割了。<,>He partitioned his hard drive into two sections.<,>他把硬盘分成两个区。<,>part(部分)+ition→分成部分→分割<,>petition(n.请愿)/position(n.位置)/portion(n.部分)
interface<,>/ˈɪntəfeɪs/<,>/ˈɪntərfeɪs/<,>n.分界面<,>The interface between the two systems is not compatible.<,>这两个系统的分界面不兼容。<,>She works as a user interface designer.<,>她是一名用户界面设计师。<,>The software has a simple and intuitive interface.<,>该软件具有简单直观的界面。<,>inter(在...之间)+face(面)→在两者之间的面→分界面<,>surface(n.表面)/interact(v.互动)

relay<,>/ˈriːleɪ/<,>/ˈriːleɪ/<,>v.分程传递/v.使接替/v.转播<,>He relayed the message to his colleagues.<,>他将消息转达给了同事。<,>The satellite relays signals to the ground station.<,>卫星将信号转播到地面站。<,>She will relay the information to the team.<,>她会将信息传达给团队。<,>re(重新)+lay(放置)→重新放置→传递<,>delay(v.延迟)/repay(v.偿还)

diverge<,>/daɪˈvɜːdʒ/<,>/daɪˈvɜːrdʒ/<,>v.分岔/v.分歧<,>The road diverges into two paths ahead.<,>这条路在前面分岔成两条。<,>Our opinions diverge on this matter.<,>我们在这个问题上意见分歧。<,>The two rivers diverge at the mountain.<,>这两条河在山处分流。<,>di(分开)+verge(转向)→分开转向→分岔<,>converge(v.汇聚)/emerge(v.出现)

litter<,>/ˈlɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪtər/<,>n.废物/n.杂乱/v.乱扔<,>Please don't litter in the park.<,>请不要在公园里乱扔垃圾。<,>The floor was covered with litter.<,>地板上满是杂物。<,>She littered the desk with papers.<,>她把文件乱扔在桌子上。<,>联想：little(小)+er→小东西→废物<,>glitter(v.闪烁)/letter(n.信件)

abolish<,>/əˈbɒlɪʃ/<,>/əˈbɑːlɪʃ/<,>v.废除/v.取消<,>The government abolished the outdated law.<,>政府废除了过时的法律。<,>They want to abolish the death penalty.<,>他们想要废除死刑。<,>The school abolished the uniform requirement.<,>学校取消了制服要求。<,>ab(离开)+olish(生长)→使停止生长→废除<,>polish(v.磨光)/establish(v.建立)

gangster<,>/ˈɡæŋstə(r)/<,>/ˈɡæŋstər/<,>n.匪徒/n.歹徒/n.暴徒<,>The gangster was arrested by the police.<,>那个歹徒被警察逮捕了。<,>He played the role of a gangster in the movie.<,>他在电影中扮演一个匪徒。<,>The city was terrorized by gangsters.<,>这个城市被暴徒恐吓。<,>gang(帮派)+ster(人)→帮派成员→匪徒<,>monster(n.怪物)/youngster(n.年轻人)

extraordinarily<,>/ɪkˈstrɔːdnrəli/<,>/ɪkˈstrɔːrdənerəli/<,>adv.非常地/adv.特别地<,>She is extraordinarily talented.<,>她非常有才华。<,>The weather was extraordinarily hot this summer.<,>今年夏天天气特别热。<,>He worked extraordinarily hard to succeed.<,>他非常努力地工作以获得成功。<,>extra(超出)+ordinary(普通)→超出普通→非常地<,>ordinarily(adv.普通地)/extraordinary(adj.非凡的)

fly<,>/flaɪ/<,>/flaɪ/<,>v.飞跑/v.逃跑/v.消失<,>Time flies when you're having fun.<,>当你玩得开心时，时间飞逝。<,>The thief flew when he saw the police.<,>小偷看到警察就逃跑了。<,>Her anger flew when she heard the explanation.<,>听到解释后她的怒气消失了。<,>联想：fly(苍蝇)飞得很快→飞跑<,>flee(v.逃跑)/flow(v.流动)

aviation<,>/ˌeɪviˈeɪʃn/<,>/ˌeɪviˈeɪʃn/<,>n.飞行（术）<,>He has a passion for aviation.<,>他对飞行充满热情。<,>The aviation industry is growing rapidly.<,>航空业正在快速发展。<,>She studies aviation at university.<,>她在大学学习飞行术。<,>avi(鸟)+ation(行为)→像鸟一样的行为→飞行<,>navigation(n.导航)/variation(n.变化)

indulge<,>/ɪnˈdʌldʒ/<,>/ɪnˈdʌldʒ/<,>v.放纵（感情）/v.纵情<,>She indulged in shopping last weekend.<,>她上周末纵情购物。<,>He indulges his children too much.<,>他太放纵他的孩子了。<,>They indulged in delicious food at the party.<,>他们在聚会上纵情享用美食。<,>in(进入)+dulge(甜)→进入甜蜜→放纵<,>bulge(v.膨胀)/divulge(v.泄露)
herd<,>/hɜːd/<,>/hɜrd/<,>v.成群/v.放牧<,>The shepherd herded the sheep into the pen.<,>牧羊人把羊群赶进围栏。<,>Tourists herded into the square to watch the parade.<,>游客成群涌入广场观看游行。<,>Buffalo herd together for protection.<,>水牛成群结队以求保护。<,>her(她)+d(的)→她的羊群→放牧<,>heard(hear的过去式)/hard(adj.坚硬的)/herb(n.药草)

magnify<,>/ˈmæɡnɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈmæɡnəˌfaɪ/<,>v.放大/v.扩大<,>This microscope can magnify objects 100 times.<,>这台显微镜能将物体放大100倍。<,>The media tends to magnify small incidents.<,>媒体往往会夸大小事。<,>His success magnified his reputation.<,>他的成功扩大了他的声誉。<,>magn(大)+ify(使)→使变大→放大<,>modify(v.修改)/signify(v.表示)/magnate(n.巨头)

imitation<,>/ˌɪmɪˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪmɪˈteɪʃən/<,>n.仿制品/n.伪制物<,>This purse is an imitation leather product.<,>这个钱包是人造革仿制品。<,>He does hilarious imitations of famous politicians.<,>他模仿著名政治人物的样子很滑稽。<,>Beware of cheap imitations of our products.<,>谨防我们产品的廉价仿制品。<,>imit(模仿)+ation(名词后缀)→仿制品<,>limitation(n.限制)/irritation(n.刺激)/imagination(n.想象力)

pattern<,>/ˈpætn/<,>/ˈpætərn/<,>v.仿制/v.仿造/v.模仿<,>The dress is patterned after a traditional design.<,>这件连衣裙是仿照传统款式制作的。<,>Birds pattern their nests after their parents' style.<,>小鸟模仿父母的风格筑巢。<,>The wallpaper patterns nature scenes.<,>这墙纸仿制了自然景观。<,>pat(拍)+tern(转向)→按图样拍打→仿制<,>partner(n.伙伴)/paternal(adj.父亲的)/patent(n.专利)

reproduce<,>/ˌriːprəˈdjuːs/<,>/ˌriːprəˈduːs/<,>v.仿造<,>The museum reproduces famous paintings for study purposes.<,>博物馆为研究目的仿造名画。<,>This machine can reproduce documents with high accuracy.<,>这台机器能高精度仿造文件。<,>Some animals can reproduce lost body parts.<,>有些动物能再生失去的身体部位。<,>re(再)+produce(生产)→再生产→仿造<,>produce(v.生产)/reduce(v.减少)/introduce(v.介绍)

estate<,>/ɪˈsteɪt/<,>/ɪˈsteɪt/<,>n.财产/n.产业/n.房地产<,>He inherited a large estate from his uncle.<,>他从叔叔那里继承了一大笔财产。<,>The housing estate has over 500 apartments.<,>这个住宅区有500多套公寓。<,>She works in real estate development.<,>她从事房地产开发工作。<,>e(出)+state(状态)→财产状况→产业<,>estimate(v.估计)/estuary(n.河口)/status(n.地位)

hamper<,>/ˈhæmpə(r)/<,>/ˈhæmpər/<,>v.妨碍/v.阻碍/v.牵制<,>Bad weather hampered the rescue efforts.<,>恶劣天气妨碍了救援工作。<,>The long dress hampered her movement.<,>长裙阻碍了她的行动。<,>Lack of funding is hampering our research.<,>资金不足正阻碍我们的研究。<,>ham(火腿)+per(每)→每个火腿都碍事→妨碍<,>hammer(n.锤子)/happen(v.发生)/hamlet(n.小村庄)

handicap<,>/ˈhændikæp/<,>/ˈhændiˌkæp/<,>v.妨碍/v.使不利<,>His injury handicapped his performance.<,>他的伤势妨碍了他的表现。<,>Lack of education can handicap one's career.<,>缺乏教育可能对职业发展不利。<,>The team was handicapped by poor equipment.<,>设备差使这个团队处于不利地位。<,>hand(手)+i(我)+cap(帽子)→手拿帽子妨碍我→妨碍<,>handicraft(n.手工艺)/handshake(n.握手)/handbag(n.手提包)

handy<,>/ˈhændi/<,>/ˈhændi/<,>adj.方便的/adj.便于使用的<,>This pocket knife is very handy for camping.<,>这把小折刀露营时很方便。<,>Keep your passport handy when traveling.<,>旅行时要把护照放在手边。<,>She's handy with tools and can fix many things.<,>她善于使用工具，能修理很多东西。<,>hand(手)+y(形容词后缀)→手边的→方便的<,>candy(n.糖果)/sandy(adj.沙质的)/brandy(n.白兰地)

offence<,>/əˈfens/<,>/əˈfɛns/<,>n.犯罪/n.犯规/n.冒犯<,>Drunk driving is a serious offence.<,>酒后驾驶是严重犯罪。<,>The player received a yellow card for the offence.<,>这名球员因犯规吃到黄牌。<,>I meant no offence by my comment.<,>我的评论无意冒犯。<,>of(反对)+fence(防护)→冲破防护→犯罪<,>defence(n.防御)/fence(n.栅栏)/offend(v.冒犯)
blunder<,>/ˈblʌndə(r)/<,>/ˈblʌndər/<,>v.犯大错/n.大错<,>He made a serious blunder during the presentation.<,>他在演讲中犯了一个严重的错误。<,>It was a blunder to trust him with such an important task.<,>把这么重要的任务交给他是个大错。<,>She blundered into the wrong room.<,>她不小心走进了错误的房间。<,>blun(钝的)+der(后缀)→笨拙的行为→大错<,>plunder(v.掠夺/n.赃物)/blunt(adj.钝的/v.使迟钝)

mirror<,>/ˈmɪrə(r)/<,>/ˈmɪrər/<,>n.反映/n.借鉴<,>Her actions mirror her mother's behavior.<,>她的行为反映了她母亲的行为。<,>This book is a mirror of the society at that time.<,>这本书是当时社会的一面镜子。<,>We can use history as a mirror to guide our future.<,>我们可以以史为鉴，指引未来。<,>mir(惊奇)+ror(后缀)→能映出影像的物体→镜子<,>error(n.错误)/merry(adj.愉快的)

reactor<,>/riˈæktə(r)/<,>/riˈæktər/<,>n.反应堆<,>The nuclear reactor was shut down for maintenance.<,>核反应堆因维护而关闭。<,>Scientists are developing a new type of reactor.<,>科学家正在开发一种新型反应堆。<,>The reactor core must be carefully monitored.<,>必须仔细监测反应堆核心。<,>react(反应)+or(表示物)→发生反应的装置→反应堆<,>actor(n.演员)/reaction(n.反应)

echo<,>/ˈekəʊ/<,>/ˈekoʊ/<,>v.回响<,>Her laughter echoed through the hallway.<,>她的笑声在走廊里回荡。<,>The mountains echoed with the sound of gunfire.<,>枪声在山间回响。<,>His words echoed in my mind long after he left.<,>他离开后很久，他的话仍在我脑海中回响。<,>ech(声音)+o(后缀)→声音的重复→回响<,>ego(n.自我)/epoch(n.纪元)

contrary<,>/ˈkɒntrəri/<,>/ˈkɑːntreri/<,>n.反对命题<,>His opinion is the contrary of mine.<,>他的观点与我的相反。<,>In contrary to popular belief, he is actually very kind.<,>与普遍看法相反，他其实很善良。<,>The results were contrary to our expectations.<,>结果与我们的预期相反。<,>contra(反对)+ary(形容词后缀)→反对的→相反的<,>contrast(n.对比/v.对比)/country(n.国家)

contradict<,>/ˌkɒntrəˈdɪkt/<,>/ˌkɑːntrəˈdɪkt/<,>v.反驳/v.否认<,>Don't contradict your teacher in class.<,>不要在课堂上反驳你的老师。<,>His statement contradicts the facts.<,>他的陈述与事实相矛盾。<,>She didn't dare to contradict her boss.<,>她不敢反驳她的老板。<,>contra(反对)+dict(说)→说反对的话→反驳<,>predict(v.预测)/dictate(v.口述/n.命令)

propagation<,>/ˌprɒpəˈɡeɪʃn/<,>/ˌprɑːpəˈɡeɪʃn/<,>n.繁殖/n.传播/n.蔓延<,>The propagation of plants requires proper care.<,>植物的繁殖需要适当的照料。<,>Social media accelerates the propagation of information.<,>社交媒体加速了信息的传播。<,>The propagation of the disease was alarming.<,>这种疾病的蔓延令人担忧。<,>pro(向前)+pag(固定)+ation(名词后缀)→向前固定→传播<,>propaganda(n.宣传)/propensity(n.倾向)

propagate<,>/ˈprɒpəɡeɪt/<,>/ˈprɑːpəɡeɪt/<,>v.传播/v.普及/v.繁殖<,>Missionaries propagate their religious beliefs.<,>传教士传播他们的宗教信仰。<,>Plants propagate through seeds or cuttings.<,>植物通过种子或插条繁殖。<,>The organization aims to propagate scientific knowledge.<,>该组织旨在普及科学知识。<,>pro(向前)+pag(固定)+ate(动词后缀)→向前固定→传播<,>propose(v.提议)/appropriate(adj.适当的)

toss<,>/tɒs/<,>/tɔːs/<,>v.翻来覆去<,>He tossed and turned all night, unable to sleep.<,>他整夜辗转反侧，无法入睡。<,>She tossed the salad before serving.<,>她在上菜前把沙拉拌了拌。<,>Let's toss a coin to decide who goes first.<,>让我们抛硬币决定谁先走。<,>t(动作)+oss(后缀)→抛掷的动作→翻来覆去<,>boss(n.老板)/loss(n.损失)

decree<,>/dɪˈkriː/<,>/dɪˈkriː/<,>n.法令/n.政令<,>The government issued a new decree on taxation.<,>政府颁布了一项新的税收法令。<,>By royal decree, the festival was extended by two days.<,>根据皇家政令，节日延长了两天。<,>The court's decree must be obeyed.<,>法院的法令必须遵守。<,>de(加强)+cree(区分)→官方区分→法令<,>degree(n.程度)/decrease(v.减少/n.减少)
flannel<,>/ˈflænəl/<,>/ˈflænəl/<,>n.法兰绒<,>He wore a flannel shirt to keep warm.<,>他穿了一件法兰绒衬衫保暖。<,>The baby's blanket was made of soft flannel.<,>婴儿的毯子是用柔软的法兰绒制成的。<,>She prefers flannel sheets in the winter.<,>她冬天更喜欢用法兰绒床单。<,>flan(平面)+nel(小)→平面织物→法兰绒<,>funnel(n.漏斗)/channel(n.通道)/flank(n.侧面)  

valve<,>/vælv/<,>/vælv/<,>n.阀/n.阀门/n.电子管<,>The plumber fixed the leaking valve.<,>水管工修理了漏水的阀门。<,>This amplifier uses vacuum valves.<,>这个放大器使用真空电子管。<,>Turn the valve to control the water flow.<,>转动阀门控制水流。<,>val(价值)+ve→控制价值的部件→阀门<,>vault(n.拱顶)/veil(n.面纱)/vale(n.山谷)  

originate<,>/əˈrɪdʒɪneɪt/<,>/əˈrɪdʒəˌneɪt/<,>v.发源/v.首创<,>The idea originated from a casual conversation.<,>这个想法源于一次随意的谈话。<,>This species originates in South America.<,>这个物种起源于南美洲。<,>He originated a new teaching method.<,>他首创了一种新的教学方法。<,>ori(开始)+gin(产生)+ate→开始产生→发源<,>orientate(v.定向)/original(adj.原始的)/abrogate(v.废除)  

spokesman<,>/ˈspəʊksmən/<,>/ˈspoʊksmən/<,>n.发言人/n.代言人<,>The company spokesman addressed the media.<,>公司发言人向媒体发表了讲话。<,>He served as spokesman for the environmental group.<,>他担任环保组织的代言人。<,>The government spokesman denied the allegations.<,>政府发言人否认了这些指控。<,>spoke(说话)+s+man(人)→说话的人→发言人<,>salesman(n.销售员)/statesman(n.政治家)/spokesperson(n.发言人)  

outlet<,>/ˈaʊtlet/<,>/ˈaʊtˌlɛt/<,>n.发泄方法/n.出口/n.插座<,>Exercise is a good outlet for stress.<,>运动是释放压力的好方法。<,>The river found an outlet to the sea.<,>这条河流找到了入海口。<,>Plug the charger into the outlet.<,>把充电器插到插座上。<,>out(出)+let(让)→让...出去→出口<,>inlet(n.入口)/outset(n.开始)/outlook(n.观点)  

incidence<,>/ˈɪnsɪdəns/<,>/ˈɪnsɪdəns/<,>n.发生率/n.影响/n.入射<,>The incidence of diabetes is increasing.<,>糖尿病的发病率正在上升。<,>The angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection.<,>入射角等于反射角。<,>This policy reduced crime incidence significantly.<,>这项政策显著降低了犯罪率。<,>in(在...上)+cid(落下)+ence→落下的情况→发生率<,>accident(n.事故)/coincidence(n.巧合)/incident(n.事件)  

generate<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪt/<,>/ˈdʒɛnəˌreɪt/<,>v.产生/v.发生/v.生成<,>The dam generates electricity for the region.<,>大坝为该地区发电。<,>His remarks generated much controversy.<,>他的言论引发了很多争议。<,>The software can generate random passwords.<,>这个软件可以生成随机密码。<,>gener(产生)+ate→使产生→生成<,>degenerate(v.退化)/regenerate(v.再生)/general(adj.一般的)  

invoice<,>/ˈɪnvɔɪs/<,>/ˈɪnˌvɔɪs/<,>n.发票/n.发货清单<,>Please send me the invoice for the goods.<,>请把货物的发票发给我。<,>The invoice shows all the items purchased.<,>发票上显示了所有购买的商品。<,>We'll pay within 30 days of receiving the invoice.<,>我们将在收到发票后30天内付款。<,>in(进入)+voice(声音)→记录声音的文件→发票<,>voice(n.声音)/advice(n.建议)/device(n.设备)  

detector<,>/dɪˈtektə(r)/<,>/dɪˈtɛktər/<,>n.探测器/n.发觉者<,>The smoke detector went off in the middle of the night.<,>烟雾探测器在半夜响了。<,>This metal detector can find coins buried deep.<,>这个金属探测器能找到深埋的硬币。<,>He works as a lie detector operator.<,>他是一名测谎仪操作员。<,>detect(探测)+or(人或物)→探测器<,>protector(n.保护者)/director(n.导演)/inspector(n.检查员)  

flame<,>/fleɪm/<,>/fleɪm/<,>v.燃烧/n.火焰<,>The candles flamed brightly in the dark.<,>蜡烛在黑暗中明亮地燃烧着。<,>Flames engulfed the old building quickly.<,>火焰迅速吞没了旧建筑。<,>Her anger flamed up at the accusation.<,>听到指控，她的怒火一下子燃烧起来。<,>fl(飞)+ame(名词后缀)→飞动的火→火焰<,>frame(n.框架)/blame(v.责备)/fame(n.名声)
exert<,>/ɪɡˈzɜːt/<,>/ɪɡˈzɜːrt/<,>v.发挥（威力）/v.施加<,>He exerted all his strength to lift the heavy box.<,>他使出全力抬起那个重箱子。<,>Parents should not exert too much pressure on their children.<,>父母不应该给孩子施加太多压力。<,>She exerted her influence to get the project approved.<,>她发挥自己的影响力使项目获得批准。<,>ex(出)+ert(加入)→把力量加入→发挥<,>insert(v.插入)/expert(n.专家)/exertion(n.努力)

luminous<,>/ˈluːmɪnəs/<,>/ˈluːmɪnəs/<,>adj.发光的/adj.夜明的<,>The watch has luminous hands so you can see it in the dark.<,>这块表有夜光指针，在黑暗中也能看清。<,>The jellyfish gave off a luminous glow in the deep sea.<,>水母在深海中发出荧光。<,>The artist used luminous colors to paint the sunrise.<,>画家用明亮的色彩描绘日出。<,>lumin(光)+ous(形容词后缀)→发光的<,>luminary(n.发光体/n.杰出人物)/illuminate(v.照亮)

beam<,>/biːm/<,>/biːm/<,>v.发光/v.发热/v.开怀大笑<,>The lighthouse beams its light far out to sea.<,>灯塔将光束远远地射向大海。<,>She beamed with joy when she heard the good news.<,>听到好消息时她开心地笑了。<,>The sun beamed down on the beach.<,>阳光照耀着海滩。<,>b(像光束)+eam→光束→发光<,>gleam(v.闪烁)/ream(n.令/n.大量)/seam(n.接缝)

motive<,>/ˈməʊtɪv/<,>/ˈmoʊtɪv/<,>adj.发动的/adj.运动的<,>The police are trying to establish the killer's motive.<,>警方正在试图确定凶手的动机。<,>Profit was the main motive for the investment.<,>利润是这次投资的主要动机。<,>The motive power of the train comes from electricity.<,>列车的动力来自电力。<,>mot(移动)+ive(形容词后缀)→运动的<,>motion(n.运动)/motivate(v.激励)/emotion(n.情感)

dynamo<,>/ˈdaɪnəməʊ/<,>/ˈdaɪnəmoʊ/<,>n.发电机<,>The bicycle's dynamo powers the front light.<,>自行车的发电机为前灯供电。<,>This old factory still uses a steam dynamo.<,>这家老工厂仍在使用蒸汽发电机。<,>She's a real dynamo, always full of energy.<,>她真是个精力充沛的人。<,>dyna(力量)+mo→产生力量的机器→发电机<,>dynamic(adj.动态的)/dynasty(n.王朝)/aerodynamo(n.空气动力)

rattle<,>/ˈrætl/<,>/ˈrætl/<,>v.发出格格声<,>The windows rattled in the strong wind.<,>窗户在大风中格格作响。<,>The baby was happily rattling his toy.<,>婴儿开心地摇着他的玩具发出格格声。<,>The snake rattled its tail as a warning.<,>蛇摇动尾巴发出警告声。<,>rat(老鼠)+tle→像老鼠跑动的声音→格格声<,>battle(n.战斗)/prattle(v.闲聊)/cattle(n.牛)

dioxide<,>/daɪˈɒksaɪd/<,>/daɪˈɑːksaɪd/<,>n.二氧化物<,>Carbon dioxide is a greenhouse gas.<,>二氧化碳是一种温室气体。<,>Silicon dioxide is used in making glass.<,>二氧化硅用于制造玻璃。<,>The plant absorbs carbon dioxide during the day.<,>植物白天吸收二氧化碳。<,>di(二)+oxide(氧化物)→二氧化物<,>monoxide(n.一氧化物)/peroxide(n.过氧化物)

bait<,>/beɪt/<,>/beɪt/<,>n.饵/n.引诱物<,>The fisherman put fresh bait on his hook.<,>渔夫在鱼钩上放了新鲜的鱼饵。<,>The advertisement was just bait to get customers into the store.<,>广告只是吸引顾客进店的诱饵。<,>Don't take the bait and get into an argument with him.<,>别上钩和他争论。<,>b(像鱼钩)+ait→鱼钩上的东西→饵<,>bate(v.减弱)/wait(v.等待)/gait(n.步态)

subsequent<,>/ˈsʌbsɪkwənt/<,>/ˈsʌbsɪkwənt/<,>adj.尔后的<,>Subsequent events proved her right.<,>随后发生的事证明她是对的。<,>The first chapter introduces the characters, and subsequent chapters develop the plot.<,>第一章介绍人物，后续章节展开情节。<,>Subsequent investigations revealed new evidence.<,>随后的调查发现了新证据。<,>sub(下面)+sequ(跟随)+ent→跟随在下面的→尔后的<,>sequence(n.顺序)/consequence(n.结果)

whereas<,>/weərˈæz/<,>/werˈæz/<,>conj.而/conj.却/conj.反之<,>He loves sports, whereas his brother prefers reading.<,>他喜欢运动，而他弟弟更喜欢阅读。<,>Some people like coffee, whereas others prefer tea.<,>有些人喜欢咖啡，而另一些人更喜欢茶。<,>She is very outgoing, whereas her sister is quite shy.<,>她非常外向，而她妹妹却很害羞。<,>where(哪里)+as(作为)→作为对比→而<,>whereby(adv.凭借)/wherein(adv.在其中)
youngster<,>/ˈjʌŋstə(r)/<,>/ˈjʌŋstər/<,>n.儿童/n.少年/n.年轻人<,>The youngster was playing in the park with his friends.<,>这个少年正在公园里和他的朋友们玩耍。<,>Youngsters these days are very tech-savvy.<,>现在的年轻人对科技非常在行。<,>She works as a mentor for underprivileged youngsters.<,>她为贫困青少年做导师。<,>young(年轻的)+ster(人)→年轻人<,>youth(n.青年时期)/younger(adj.较年轻的)/youngish(adj.稍年轻的)

offspring<,>/ˈɒfsprɪŋ/<,>/ˈɔːfsprɪŋ/<,>n.儿女/n.子孙/n.后代<,>The lioness protects her offspring fiercely.<,>母狮凶猛地保护着她的幼崽。<,>His offspring are all successful professionals.<,>他的子女都是成功的专业人士。<,>Genetic traits are passed down to offspring.<,>基因特征会遗传给后代。<,>off(离开)+spring(春天)→春天繁衍的后代<,>descendant(n.后裔)/progeny(n.后代)/heir(n.继承人)

malice<,>/ˈmælɪs/<,>/ˈmælɪs/<,>n.恶意/n.蓄意犯罪<,>He spoke with obvious malice in his voice.<,>他说话时明显带着恶意。<,>The crime was committed with malice aforethought.<,>这起犯罪是蓄意而为的。<,>She bore no malice towards her critics.<,>她对批评她的人并无恶意。<,>mal(坏的)+ice(名词后缀)→恶意<,>malevolent(adj.恶意的)/malicious(adj.恶毒的)/malign(v.诽谤)

spite<,>/spaɪt/<,>/spaɪt/<,>n.恶意/n.怨恨<,>He did it out of pure spite.<,>他这么做纯粹是出于恶意。<,>In spite of the rain, we went for a walk.<,>尽管下雨，我们还是去散步了。<,>She has a lot of spite towards her former boss.<,>她对前老板怀恨在心。<,>spit(吐口水)+e→像吐口水一样发泄怨恨<,>despite(prep.尽管)/respite(n.暂缓)/spiteful(adj.怀恨的)

nightmare<,>/ˈnaɪtmeə(r)/<,>/ˈnaɪtmer/<,>n.恶梦/n.经常的恐惧<,>I had a terrible nightmare last night.<,>昨晚我做了一个可怕的噩梦。<,>The traffic was a complete nightmare this morning.<,>今早的交通简直是一场噩梦。<,>Starting a new business can be a financial nightmare.<,>创业可能会成为财务上的噩梦。<,>night(夜晚)+mare(母马)→中世纪传说中夜晚出现的梦魇<,>daymare(n.白日噩梦)/nightmarish(adj.噩梦般的)/dream(n.梦)

yoke<,>/jəʊk/<,>/joʊk/<,>n.轭/n.牛轭/n.枷锁<,>The oxen were tied together with a wooden yoke.<,>牛被木轭拴在一起。<,>They threw off the yoke of oppression.<,>他们摆脱了压迫的枷锁。<,>The yoke of responsibility weighed heavily on him.<,>责任的枷锁沉重地压在他身上。<,>yolk(蛋黄)→想象蛋黄被蛋壳"束缚"<,>yolk(n.蛋黄)/yokel(n.乡巴佬)/yoga(n.瑜伽)

deprive<,>/dɪˈpraɪv/<,>/dɪˈpraɪv/<,>v.夺去/v.使(人)失去<,>The storm deprived us of electricity for three days.<,>暴风雨使我们断电三天。<,>No one should be deprived of basic human rights.<,>任何人都不应被剥夺基本人权。<,>Sleep deprivation can affect your health.<,>睡眠剥夺会影响你的健康。<,>de(去掉)+prive(私人)→夺走私人所有<,>derive(v.获得)/deprave(v.使堕落)/deprecate(v.反对)

mountainous<,>/ˈmaʊntənəs/<,>/ˈmaʊntənəs/<,>adj.多山的/adj.山一般的<,>They hiked through mountainous terrain.<,>他们徒步穿越了多山的地形。<,>The mountainous waves made sailing dangerous.<,>如山般的巨浪使得航行很危险。<,>This region is known for its mountainous landscapes.<,>这个地区以其多山的景观而闻名。<,>mountain(山)+ous(形容词后缀)→多山的<,>mountain(n.山)/mount(v.爬上)/amount(n.数量)

windy<,>/ˈwɪndi/<,>/ˈwɪndi/<,>adj.多风的/adj.刮风的<,>It's too windy to fly kites today.<,>今天风太大不适合放风筝。<,>The windy city is a nickname for Chicago.<,>"风城"是芝加哥的别称。<,>She wrapped her scarf tightly on the windy day.<,>刮风那天她紧紧裹着围巾。<,>wind(风)+y(形容词后缀)→多风的<,>winding(adj.蜿蜒的)/window(n.窗户)/windfall(n.意外之财)

versatile<,>/ˈvɜːsətaɪl/<,>/ˈvɜːrsətl/<,>adj.多方面的/adj.通用的<,>She's a versatile actress who can play any role.<,>她是位多才多艺的女演员，能扮演任何角色。<,>This versatile tool can be used for many tasks.<,>这个多功能工具可以用于多种任务。<,>His versatile skills make him valuable to the team.<,>他多方面的技能使他成为团队的宝贵人才。<,>vers(转)+atile→能转向各个方面的<,>verse(n.诗句)/version(n.版本)/adverse(adj.不利的)
stew<,>/stjuː/<,>/stuː/<,>v.炖/n.炖菜<,>She likes to stew beef with vegetables.<,>她喜欢用蔬菜炖牛肉。<,>This stew tastes delicious.<,>这道炖菜味道很好。<,>He stewed the chicken for hours.<,>他把鸡肉炖了好几个小时。<,>谐音“死丢”→炖菜需要长时间炖煮<,>brew(v.酿造/n.啤酒)/sew(v.缝纫)/stow(v.装载)

mop<,>/mɒp/<,>/mɑːp/<,>n.拖把/n.墩布/n.洗碗刷<,>She used a mop to clean the floor.<,>她用拖把清洁地板。<,>The mop is in the closet.<,>拖把在壁橱里。<,>He bought a new mop for the kitchen.<,>他为厨房买了一个新拖把。<,>联想“摸破”→拖把用久了会摸破<,>map(n.地图)/mob(n.暴民)/mope(v.忧郁)

halve<,>/hɑːv/<,>/hæv/<,>v.对分/v.平摊<,>They decided to halve the profits.<,>他们决定平分利润。<,>Halve the apple and share it.<,>把苹果对半分着吃。<,>The team halved their workload.<,>团队平摊了工作量。<,>half(一半)+e→对分<,>have(v.有)/halo(n.光环)/hale(adj.健壮的)

symmetrical<,>/sɪˈmetrɪkl/<,>/sɪˈmetrɪkəl/<,>adj.对称的/adj.匀称的<,>The building has a symmetrical design.<,>这座建筑设计对称。<,>Her face is perfectly symmetrical.<,>她的脸非常匀称。<,>The garden is arranged in a symmetrical pattern.<,>花园按对称图案布置。<,>sym(共同)+metr(测量)+ical→对称的<,>asymmetrical(adj.不对称的)/geometrical(adj.几何的)

symmetry<,>/ˈsɪmətri/<,>/ˈsɪmətri/<,>n.对称性/n.匀称<,>The symmetry of the butterfly's wings is amazing.<,>蝴蝶翅膀的对称性令人惊叹。<,>He appreciates the symmetry in architecture.<,>他欣赏建筑中的对称美。<,>The human body has bilateral symmetry.<,>人体具有左右对称性。<,>sym(共同)+metry(测量)→对称<,>asymmetry(n.不对称)/geometry(n.几何学)

provoke<,>/prəˈvəʊk/<,>/prəˈvoʊk/<,>v.挑衅/v.激发<,>His rude remarks provoked her anger.<,>他粗鲁的言论激怒了她。<,>The article provoked a heated debate.<,>这篇文章引发了激烈争论。<,>Don't provoke the dog.<,>别挑衅那只狗。<,>pro(向前)+voke(喊叫)→向前喊叫→挑衅<,>evoke(v.唤起)/revoke(v.撤销)/convoke(v.召集)

resent<,>/rɪˈzent/<,>/rɪˈzent/<,>v.不满/v.怨恨<,>She resents being treated unfairly.<,>她怨恨受到不公平对待。<,>He resents his brother's success.<,>他对哥哥的成功心怀不满。<,>They resent the new regulations.<,>他们对新规定不满。<,>re(反)+sent(感觉)→反感→怨恨<,>consent(v.同意)/dissent(v.不同意)/present(adj.现在的)

alignment<,>/əˈlaɪnmənt/<,>/əˈlaɪnmənt/<,>n.排成直线/n.结盟<,>The wheels need proper alignment.<,>车轮需要正确对齐。<,>The political alignment changed after the election.<,>选举后政治联盟发生了变化。<,>Check the alignment of the text.<,>检查文本的对齐情况。<,>align(对齐)+ment→排成直线<,>assignment(n.任务)/liniment(n.擦剂)/aliment(n.食物)

assert<,>/əˈsɜːt/<,>/əˈsɜːrt/<,>v.断言/v.宣称/v.维护<,>He asserted his innocence.<,>他坚称自己无罪。<,>She asserted her authority.<,>她维护了自己的权威。<,>The lawyer asserted the client's rights.<,>律师维护了当事人的权利。<,>as(加强)+sert(加入)→强行加入观点→断言<,>desert(n.沙漠)/insert(v.插入)/exert(v.施加)

affirm<,>/əˈfɜːm/<,>/əˈfɜːrm/<,>v.断言/v.证实<,>The witness affirmed the suspect's alibi.<,>证人证实了嫌疑人的不在场证明。<,>She affirmed her commitment to the project.<,>她确认了对项目的承诺。<,>The court affirmed the lower court's decision.<,>法院维持了下级法院的判决。<,>af(加强)+firm(坚定)→断言<,>confirm(v.确认)/infirm(adj.虚弱的)/firm(adj.坚固的)
shortage<,>/ˈʃɔːtɪdʒ/<,>/ˈʃɔːrtɪdʒ/<,>n.短缺/n.不足额<,>There is a shortage of clean water in the region.<,>该地区缺乏干净的水。<,>The company faces a shortage of skilled workers.<,>公司面临技术工人短缺的问题。<,>A shortage of funds delayed the project.<,>资金短缺延误了项目。<,>short(短)+age(状态)→短缺的状态<,>storage(n.存储)/shorten(v.缩短)  

ferry<,>/ˈferi/<,>/ˈferi/<,>n.渡船/v.运送<,>We took the ferry to cross the river.<,>我们乘渡船过河。<,>The boat ferries passengers between the islands.<,>这艘船在岛屿之间运送乘客。<,>He ferried the children to school every morning.<,>他每天早上送孩子们去学校。<,>fer(携带)+ry→运送工具<,>fairy(n.仙女)/hurry(v.匆忙)  

jealousy<,>/ˈdʒeləsi/<,>/ˈdʒeləsi/<,>n.妒忌/n.嫉妒/n.猜忌<,>Her jealousy ruined their friendship.<,>她的嫉妒毁了他们的友谊。<,>He felt a pang of jealousy when he saw them together.<,>看到他们在一起时，他感到一阵嫉妒。<,>Jealousy is a destructive emotion.<,>嫉妒是一种破坏性的情绪。<,>jealous(嫉妒的)+y(名词后缀)→嫉妒<,>zeal(n.热情)/jeopardy(n.危险)  

cuckoo<,>/ˈkʊkuː/<,>/ˈkuːkuː/<,>n.杜鹃/n.布谷鸟<,>The cuckoo is known for laying its eggs in other birds' nests.<,>杜鹃以在其他鸟巢中产卵而闻名。<,>We heard the cuckoo calling in the woods.<,>我们听到树林中布谷鸟的叫声。<,>The cuckoo's song signals the arrival of spring.<,>布谷鸟的歌声预示着春天的到来。<,>拟声词，模仿布谷鸟的叫声<,>cockatoo(n.凤头鹦鹉)/kooky(adj.古怪的)  

gamble<,>/ˈɡæmbl/<,>/ˈɡæmbl/<,>n.赌博/v.冒…的险<,>Gambling is illegal in many countries.<,>赌博在许多国家是非法的。<,>He gambled all his savings on the stock market.<,>他把所有积蓄都押在了股市上。<,>Starting a business is always a gamble.<,>创业总是一种冒险。<,>gam(游戏)+ble→赌博游戏<,>ramble(v.漫步)/gambol(v.蹦跳)  

jam<,>/dʒæm/<,>/dʒæm/<,>n.堵塞/v.使…堵塞<,>There was a traffic jam on the highway.<,>高速公路上发生了交通堵塞。<,>She jammed all her clothes into the suitcase.<,>她把所有衣服都塞进了行李箱。<,>The printer jammed again.<,>打印机又卡纸了。<,>与"果酱"同形，想象果酱堵塞瓶口<,>jamb(n.门框)/jump(v.跳跃)  

distinct<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkt/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkt/<,>adj.清楚的<,>There is a distinct difference between the two theories.<,>这两种理论有明显的区别。<,>Her voice was distinct even in the noisy room.<,>即使在嘈杂的房间里，她的声音也很清晰。<,>The outline of the mountain was distinct against the sky.<,>山的轮廓在天空下显得很清晰。<,>di(分开)+stinct(刺)→刺出标记→清楚的<,>extinct(adj.灭绝的)/instinct(n.本能)  

solo<,>/ˈsəʊləʊ/<,>/ˈsoʊloʊ/<,>n.独唱/n.独奏/n.独唱曲<,>She performed a beautiful piano solo.<,>她演奏了一首优美的钢琴独奏曲。<,>This will be his first solo flight.<,>这将是他第一次单独飞行。<,>The album features several guitar solos.<,>这张专辑有几段吉他独奏。<,>sol(单独)+o→单独的表演<,>solar(adj.太阳的)/sole(adj.唯一的)  

dictator<,>/dɪkˈteɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈdɪkteɪtər/<,>n.独裁者/n.专政者<,>The dictator ruled the country with an iron fist.<,>独裁者用铁腕统治国家。<,>He was overthrown as a brutal dictator.<,>他作为一个残暴的独裁者被推翻了。<,>Dictators often suppress freedom of speech.<,>独裁者常常压制言论自由。<,>dict(说)+ator(人)→发号施令的人<,>doctor(n.医生)/dictation(n.听写)  

linger<,>/ˈlɪŋɡə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪŋɡər/<,>v.逗留/v.徘徊/v.拖延<,>The smell of coffee lingered in the air.<,>咖啡的香气在空气中久久不散。<,>He lingered at the door, reluctant to leave.<,>他在门口徘徊，不愿离开。<,>Winter lingers longer in the mountains.<,>山区的冬天持续得更久。<,>ling(长)+er→长时间停留<,>finger(n.手指)/longer(adj.更长的)
tease<,>/tiːz/<,>/tiz/<,>v.逗乐/v.戏弄<,>He likes to tease his little sister by hiding her toys.<,>他喜欢藏起妹妹的玩具来逗她。<,>Don't tease the dog or it might bite you.<,>别戏弄那只狗，它会咬你的。<,>She teased her hair to make it look bigger.<,>她把头发梳蓬松让它看起来更丰满。<,>tea(茶)+se(色)→茶色幽默→逗乐<,>ease(v.减轻/n.安逸)/lease(n.租约/v.出租)

fighter<,>/ˈfaɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈfaɪtər/<,>n.战斗机/n.斗争者<,>The fighter jets roared across the sky during the air show.<,>飞行表演中战斗机呼啸着划过天空。<,>She has always been a fighter for women's rights.<,>她一直是女权斗争的战士。<,>The young boxer is a promising fighter.<,>这位年轻拳击手是个有前途的斗士。<,>fight(战斗)+er(人)→战斗者<,>lighter(n.打火机)/writer(n.作家)

champion<,>/ˈtʃæmpiən/<,>/ˈtʃæmpiən/<,>n.斗士/n.提倡者<,>She became a champion for environmental protection.<,>她成为环保事业的倡导者。<,>The team will defend their champion title this season.<,>这支队伍将在本赛季卫冕冠军头衔。<,>He was the heavyweight boxing champion for five years.<,>他连续五年获得重量级拳击冠军。<,>champ(战场)+ion(名词后缀)→战场上的胜利者<,>campaign(n.运动/v.参加活动)/champagne(n.香槟酒)

insight<,>/ˈɪnsaɪt/<,>/ˈɪnˌsaɪt/<,>n.洞察力/n.洞悉/n.见识<,>Her book provides deep insights into human nature.<,>她的书对人性的洞察非常深刻。<,>The research offers new insights into the disease.<,>这项研究为这种疾病提供了新的见解。<,>He has remarkable insight into market trends.<,>他对市场趋势有非凡的洞察力。<,>in(内)+sight(看)→向内看→洞察<,>incite(v.煽动)/inside(n.内部)

cavity<,>/ˈkævəti/<,>/ˈkævəti/<,>n.洞/n.穴/n.空腔<,>The dentist found a cavity in my tooth.<,>牙医发现我牙齿上有个洞。<,>Bats live in the cavities of old trees.<,>蝙蝠栖息在老树的树洞里。<,>The sculpture has an interesting cavity in its center.<,>这座雕塑中心有个有趣的空洞。<,>cave(洞穴)+ity(名词后缀)→洞穴<,>gravity(n.重力)/captivity(n.囚禁)

jelly<,>/ˈdʒeli/<,>/ˈdʒɛli/<,>n.冻/n.果冻/n.胶状物<,>She made strawberry jelly for dessert.<,>她做了草莓果冻当甜点。<,>The medicine comes in a jelly form.<,>这种药是胶状的。<,>My legs turned to jelly after the long hike.<,>长途徒步后我的腿软得像果冻。<,>jell(凝结)+y(形容词后缀)→胶状物<,>jolly(adj.愉快的)/jealous(adj.嫉妒的)

mobilize<,>/ˈməʊbəlaɪz/<,>/ˈmoʊbəˌlaɪz/<,>v.动员/v.动员起来<,>The government mobilized troops to the disaster area.<,>政府调集部队前往灾区。<,>We need to mobilize all available resources.<,>我们需要动员所有可用资源。<,>The community mobilized to clean up the park.<,>社区居民动员起来清理公园。<,>mobile(移动的)+ize(使...)→使移动→动员<,>immobilize(v.使固定)/demobilize(v.复员)

grease<,>/ɡriːs/<,>/ɡris/<,>n.动物脂/n.脂肪<,>Grease the pan before baking the cake.<,>烤蛋糕前先在平底锅上涂油。<,>The mechanic's hands were covered in grease.<,>修理工的手上沾满了油污。<,>Too much grease in food is unhealthy.<,>食物中脂肪过多不健康。<,>gr(油脂)+ease(轻松)→使运转轻松→润滑脂<,>grace(n.优雅)/crease(n.折痕)

disturbance<,>/dɪˈstɜːbəns/<,>/dɪˈstɜːrbəns/<,>n.动乱/n.干扰<,>The noise outside caused a disturbance in the classroom.<,>外面的噪音干扰了课堂教学。<,>Police were called to deal with the disturbance.<,>警方被叫来处理骚乱。<,>The birds flew away at the slightest disturbance.<,>鸟儿受到轻微惊扰就飞走了。<,>dis(分开)+turb(搅动)+ance→搅动分开→干扰<,>perturb(v.扰乱)/turbine(n.涡轮)

kinetic<,>/kɪˈnetɪk/<,>/kɪˈnɛtɪk/<,>adj.动力学的/adj.活动的<,>Kinetic energy increases with speed.<,>动能随速度增加而增加。<,>The sculpture has kinetic parts that move in the wind.<,>这座雕塑有随风活动的部件。<,>Kinetic theory explains gas behavior.<,>分子运动论解释气体行为。<,>kine(运动)+tic(形容词后缀)→运动的<,>kinematics(n.运动学)/kinetic(adj.运动的)
orient<,>/ˈɔːriənt/<,>/ˈɔːriˌɛnt/<,>n.东方/n.亚洲/n.远东<,>The sun rises in the orient.<,>太阳从东方升起。<,>He has a deep interest in orient culture.<,>他对东方文化有浓厚的兴趣。<,>Many spices originated from the orient.<,>许多香料起源于远东。<,>ori(升起)+ent→太阳升起的地方→东方<,>origin(n.起源)/oriental(adj.东方的)

location<,>/ləʊˈkeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/loʊˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.定位/n.测位<,>The GPS provides accurate location data.<,>GPS提供精确的定位数据。<,>They are trying to determine the location of the ship.<,>他们正在尝试确定船只的位置。<,>The app shows your current location on the map.<,>这个应用在地图上显示你当前的位置。<,>loc(地方)+ation→定位<,>local(adj.当地的)/allocate(v.分配)

theorem<,>/ˈθɪərəm/<,>/ˈθiːərəm/<,>n.定理/n.原理/n.原则<,>Pythagorean theorem is fundamental in geometry.<,>毕达哥拉斯定理是几何学的基础。<,>This theorem applies to many scientific fields.<,>这个原理适用于许多科学领域。<,>He explained the basic theorem of economics.<,>他解释了经济学的基本原则。<,>theo(神)+rem→神的启示→定理<,>theory(n.理论)/thermal(adj.热的)

subscribe<,>/səbˈskraɪb/<,>/səbˈskraɪb/<,>v.订购/v.认购/v.预订<,>I subscribed to the magazine for a year.<,>我订阅了这本杂志一年。<,>Many investors subscribed to the new stock issue.<,>许多投资者认购了新股。<,>She subscribed to several online courses.<,>她预订了几门在线课程。<,>sub(下)+scribe(写)→在下面签字→订阅<,>describe(v.描述)/prescribe(v.开处方)

summit<,>/ˈsʌmɪt/<,>/ˈsʌmɪt/<,>n.顶点/n.最高点/n.极度<,>They reached the summit of the mountain at dawn.<,>他们在黎明时分到达了山顶。<,>The conference was a summit of world leaders.<,>这次会议是世界领导人的峰会。<,>His career is at its summit now.<,>他的职业生涯现在处于巅峰。<,>sum(最高)+mit→最高点<,>submit(v.提交)/summon(v.召唤)

sculpture<,>/ˈskʌlptʃə(r)/<,>/ˈskʌlptʃər/<,>n.雕刻品/n.雕刻（术）<,>The museum has a collection of ancient sculptures.<,>博物馆收藏有古代雕刻品。<,>He studied sculpture in art school.<,>他在艺术学校学习雕刻术。<,>This marble sculpture is priceless.<,>这件大理石雕刻品是无价之宝。<,>sculp(雕刻)+ture→雕刻品<,>sculptor(n.雕刻家)/scripture(n.经文)

electronics<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɒnɪks/<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɑːnɪks/<,>n.电子学<,>He majored in electronics at university.<,>他在大学主修电子学。<,>Modern electronics have changed our lives.<,>现代电子学改变了我们的生活。<,>This store sells electronics components.<,>这家商店销售电子元器件。<,>electron(电子)+ics(学科)→电子学<,>electric(adj.电的)/electricity(n.电)

pressure<,>/ˈpreʃə(r)/<,>/ˈpreʃər/<,>n.大气压力<,>Atmospheric pressure decreases with altitude.<,>大气压力随着海拔升高而降低。<,>The pressure cooker works by increasing internal pressure.<,>压力锅通过增加内部压力工作。<,>Low pressure often brings rainy weather.<,>低气压常常带来雨天。<,>press(压)+ure→压力<,>compress(v.压缩)/depress(v.使沮丧)

capacitor<,>/kəˈpæsɪtə(r)/<,>/kəˈpæsɪtər/<,>n.电容器<,>This circuit needs a new capacitor.<,>这个电路需要一个新电容器。<,>The capacitor stores electrical energy.<,>电容器储存电能。<,>He replaced the faulty capacitor in the radio.<,>他更换了收音机里坏掉的电容器。<,>capacit(容量)+or→电容器<,>capacity(n.容量)/captor(n.捕捉者)

capacitance<,>/kəˈpæsɪtəns/<,>/kəˈpæsɪtəns/<,>n.电容/n.电容量<,>The capacitance of this component is 10μF.<,>这个元件的电容是10微法。<,>Capacitance is measured in farads.<,>电容以法拉为单位测量。<,>Higher capacitance means more energy storage.<,>更高的电容量意味着更多的能量储存。<,>capacit(容量)+ance→电容量<,>capacity(n.容量)/competence(n.能力)
electrode<,>/ɪˈlɛktrəʊd/<,>/ɪˈlɛktroʊd/<,>n.电极/n.电焊条<,>The doctor attached an electrode to my arm for the test.<,>医生在我的手臂上贴了一个电极做测试。<,>Copper is often used as an electrode in batteries.<,>铜常用作电池的电极。<,>The welding electrode needs to be replaced.<,>这根电焊条需要更换了。<,>electr(电)+ode(路)→电极<,>electron(n.电子)/electrolyte(n.电解质)

electrician<,>/ɪˌlɛkˈtrɪʃən/<,>/ɪˌlɛkˈtrɪʃən/<,>n.电工/n.电气技师<,>We need to call an electrician to fix the wiring.<,>我们需要叫电工来修理电线。<,>The electrician installed new lights in our house.<,>电工在我们家安装了新灯。<,>He trained for three years to become a qualified electrician.<,>他培训了三年才成为合格的电工。<,>electr(电)+ician(专业人员)→电工<,>mechanic(n.机械师)/technician(n.技术员)

telex<,>/ˈtelɛks/<,>/ˈtelɛks/<,>n.电传/n.用户电报<,>The company sent the order via telex.<,>公司通过电传送出了订单。<,>Telex was widely used before fax machines became popular.<,>在传真机普及前，电传被广泛使用。<,>Please confirm receipt of this telex message.<,>请确认收到这份电传信息。<,>tele(远)+x(代表exchange)→电传<,>telegram(n.电报)/fax(n.传真)

kindle<,>/ˈkɪndl/<,>/ˈkɪndl/<,>v.点燃/v.着火<,>She used dry leaves to kindle the campfire.<,>她用干树叶点燃了篝火。<,>His speech kindled enthusiasm in the audience.<,>他的演讲点燃了观众的热情。<,>The dry weather kindled fears of forest fires.<,>干燥的天气引发了人们对森林火灾的担忧。<,>kin(亲属)+dle(小)→像亲人一样温暖→点燃<,>candle(n.蜡烛)/handle(v.处理)

geology<,>/dʒiˈɒlədʒi/<,>/dʒiˈɑːlədʒi/<,>n.地质学/n.(某地)地质<,>He studied geology at university.<,>他在大学学习地质学。<,>The geology of this area shows rich mineral deposits.<,>这个地区的地质显示有丰富的矿藏。<,>Plate tectonics is an important concept in geology.<,>板块构造是地质学中的重要概念。<,>geo(地)+logy(学科)→地质学<,>geography(n.地理学)/biology(n.生物学)

basement<,>/ˈbeɪsmənt/<,>/ˈbeɪsmənt/<,>n.地下室/n.地窖/n.底层<,>We store our old furniture in the basement.<,>我们把旧家具存放在地下室。<,>The basement flooded after heavy rain.<,>大雨过后地下室被淹了。<,>There's a small workshop in the basement of the building.<,>这栋楼的地下室有个小车间。<,>base(基础)+ment(名词后缀)→地下室<,>cellar(n.地窖)/garret(n.阁楼)

geographical<,>/ˌdʒiːəˈɡræfɪkl/<,>/ˌdʒiːəˈɡræfɪkl/<,>adj.地理的/adj.地区(性)的<,>The geographical features of this region are unique.<,>这个地区的地理特征很独特。<,>There are geographical variations in climate across the country.<,>全国各地的气候存在地理差异。<,>The study examines geographical distribution of the species.<,>这项研究考察了该物种的地理分布。<,>geo(地)+graph(写)+ical→地理的<,>geometric(adj.几何的)/graphic(adj.图形的)

magistrate<,>/ˈmædʒɪstreɪt/<,>/ˈmædʒɪstreɪt/<,>n.地方法官<,>The magistrate sentenced him to community service.<,>地方法官判他做社区服务。<,>She appeared before the magistrate for speeding.<,>她因超速驾驶出庭受审。<,>The local magistrate handles minor legal cases.<,>地方法官处理轻微的法律案件。<,>magistr(大师)+ate→地方法官<,>minister(n.部长)/magistracy(n.地方法官职位)

mortgage<,>/ˈmɔːɡɪdʒ/<,>/ˈmɔːrɡɪdʒ/<,>n.抵押贷款/v.抵押<,>They took out a mortgage to buy the house.<,>他们申请了抵押贷款买房。<,>The bank may foreclose if mortgage payments are late.<,>如果抵押贷款还款逾期，银行可能会取消赎回权。<,>He mortgaged his property to start the business.<,>他抵押房产来创业。<,>mort(死)+gage(担保)→抵押贷款<,>pledge(n.保证/v.抵押)/collateral(n.抵押品)

hostile<,>/ˈhɒstaɪl/<,>/ˈhɑːstl/<,>adj.敌对的/adj.不友好的<,>The two countries have hostile relations.<,>这两个国家关系敌对。<,>He gave me a hostile look when I entered.<,>我进去时他给了我一个不友好的眼神。<,>The hostile environment makes survival difficult.<,>恶劣的环境使生存变得困难。<,>host(主人)+ile→像对待敌人一样→敌对的<,>hospital(n.医院)/hospitable(adj.好客的)
whisper<,>/ˈwɪspə/<,>/ˈwɪspɚ/<,>v.低声地讲/v.私下说<,>She whispered the secret in my ear.<,>她在我耳边低声说出了这个秘密。<,>They whispered about the surprise party.<,>他们私下讨论了惊喜派对。<,>The wind whispered through the trees.<,>风在树林间低语。<,>whis(拟声词)+per(每)→每次都用小声说→低声讲<,>whistle(v.吹口哨/n.哨子)/whisker(n.胡须)
