underestimate<,>/ˌʌndərˈestɪmeɪt/<,>/ˌʌndɚˈɛstəˌmet/<,>v.低估/v.看轻<,>Never underestimate your opponent's strength.<,>永远不要低估对手的实力。<,>He underestimated the difficulty of the task.<,>他低估了这项任务的难度。<,>The value of teamwork should not be underestimated.<,>团队合作的价值不应被低估。<,>under(在...下)+estimate(估计)→估计不足→低估<,>overestimate(v.高估)/undervalue(v.低估价值)

murmur<,>/ˈmɜːmə/<,>/ˈmɝmɚ/<,>n.低沉连续的声音<,>The murmur of the stream was soothing.<,>小溪的潺潺声令人舒缓。<,>There was a murmur of approval from the crowd.<,>人群中传来一阵赞许的低语。<,>She spoke in a soft murmur.<,>她用轻柔的低语说话。<,>mur(墙)+mur→墙后的声音→低沉声音<,>mumble(v.含糊地说)/mutter(v.咕哝)

equivalent<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələnt/<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələnt/<,>adj.等面(体)积的/adj.等价的<,>The two boxes have equivalent volumes.<,>这两个盒子体积相等。<,>This amount is equivalent to one month's salary.<,>这个金额相当于一个月的工资。<,>Silence is sometimes equivalent to agreement.<,>沉默有时等同于同意。<,>equi(相等)+val(价值)+ent→价值相等的<,>equality(n.平等)/equation(n.等式)

enroll<,>/ɪnˈrəʊl/<,>/ɪnˈroʊl/<,>v.登记/v.招收/v.参军<,>I enrolled in a French course this semester.<,>这学期我报名参加了法语课程。<,>The university enrolls 5,000 new students each year.<,>这所大学每年招收5000名新生。<,>He enrolled in the army after graduation.<,>他毕业后参军了。<,>en(使)+roll(名单)→使进入名单→登记<,>enlist(v.征募)/register(v.登记)

burner<,>/ˈbɜːnə/<,>/ˈbɝnɚ/<,>n.煤气头/n.燃烧器<,>Turn off the burner when you finish cooking.<,>做完饭后关掉煤气灶。<,>The lab equipment includes a Bunsen burner.<,>实验室设备包括一个本生灯。<,>This stove has four burners.<,>这个炉子有四个火头。<,>burn(燃烧)+er(器具)→燃烧的器具<,>furnace(n.熔炉)/oven(n.烤箱)

triumphant<,>/traɪˈʌmfənt/<,>/traɪˈʌmfənt/<,>adj.得胜的/adj.得意洋洋的<,>The team returned with triumphant smiles.<,>队伍带着胜利的笑容归来。<,>She gave a triumphant shout when she won.<,>她获胜时发出了胜利的欢呼。<,>His triumphant attitude annoyed his rivals.<,>他得意洋洋的态度惹恼了对手。<,>triumph(胜利)+ant(形容词后缀)→胜利的<,>triumph(n.胜利)/trumpet(n.喇叭)

clatter<,>/ˈklætə/<,>/ˈklætɚ/<,>n.得得声/n.卡嗒声<,>The clatter of dishes came from the kitchen.<,>厨房传来碗碟的碰撞声。<,>The horse's hooves made a clatter on the cobblestones.<,>马蹄在鹅卵石上发出得得声。<,>She dropped the keys with a loud clatter.<,>她钥匙掉在地上发出响亮的咔嗒声。<,>拟声词，模拟物体碰撞的声音<,>clank(n.叮当声)/rattle(n.嘎嘎声)

morality<,>/məˈræləti/<,>/məˈræləti/<,>n.道德/n.美德/n.品行<,>The story teaches an important lesson about morality.<,>这个故事传授了关于道德的重要一课。<,>His actions showed high morality.<,>他的行为展现了高尚的道德。<,>Public morality is declining in some areas.<,>某些地区的公共道德正在下降。<,>moral(道德的)+ity(名词后缀)→道德<,>mortality(n.死亡率)/immorality(n.不道德)

theft<,>/θeft/<,>/θɛft/<,>n.盗窃/n.偷窃(行为)<,>The store installed cameras to prevent theft.<,>商店安装了摄像头防止盗窃。<,>He was arrested for car theft.<,>他因偷车被捕。<,>Identity theft is a growing problem.<,>身份盗窃是个日益严重的问题。<,>thief(小偷)的名词形式<,>burglary(n.入室盗窃)/robbery(n.抢劫)
attendance<,>/əˈtendəns/<,>/əˈtɛndəns/<,>n.到场/n.出席人数<,>Attendance at the meeting is mandatory.<,>会议出席是强制性的。<,>The teacher took attendance at the beginning of class.<,>老师在课开始时点名。<,>The concert had a record attendance this year.<,>今年音乐会的出席人数创了纪录。<,>attend(参加)+ance(名词后缀)→出席<,>absence(n.缺席)/presence(n.在场)

between<,>/bɪˈtwiːn/<,>/bɪˈtwin/<,>adv.当中/adv.中间<,>She sat between her two best friends.<,>她坐在两个最好的朋友中间。<,>The agreement was made between the two companies.<,>协议是在两家公司之间达成的。<,>There's a fine line between love and hate.<,>爱与恨之间只有一线之隔。<,>be(在)+tween(二)→在两者之间<,>among(prep.在...之中)/amid(prep.在...中间)

yolk<,>/jəʊk/<,>/joʊk/<,>n.蛋黄/n.卵黄<,>Separate the yolk from the egg white carefully.<,>小心地把蛋黄和蛋白分开。<,>The yolk contains most of the egg's nutrients.<,>蛋黄含有鸡蛋的大部分营养。<,>She prefers her eggs with runny yolks.<,>她喜欢蛋黄流心的鸡蛋。<,>yellow(黄色)+olk→蛋黄是黄色的<,>yoke(n.轭/v.结合)/yell(v.喊叫)

cartridge<,>/ˈkɑːtrɪdʒ/<,>/ˈkɑrtrɪdʒ/<,>n.弹药筒<,>He loaded a fresh cartridge into the rifle.<,>他把新的弹药筒装进步枪。<,>The printer needs a new ink cartridge.<,>打印机需要新的墨盒。<,>This game console uses special cartridges.<,>这个游戏机使用特殊的卡带。<,>cart(车)+ridge(脊)→像车脊一样装载弹药<,>carton(n.纸板箱)/cartilage(n.软骨)

detain<,>/dɪˈteɪn/<,>/dɪˈteɪn/<,>v.扣押/v.拘留/v.耽搁<,>The police can detain suspects for 24 hours.<,>警方可以拘留嫌疑人24小时。<,>Bad weather detained us for several hours.<,>恶劣天气耽搁了我们几个小时。<,>He was detained at the airport for questioning.<,>他在机场被扣留问话。<,>de(加强)+tain(保持)→强行保持→拘留<,>retain(v.保留)/obtain(v.获得)

simple<,>/ˈsɪmpl/<,>/ˈsɪmpəl/<,>adj.单纯的/adj.迟钝的<,>She prefers a simple lifestyle.<,>她喜欢简单的生活方式。<,>The instructions are written in simple English.<,>说明书用简单的英语写成。<,>He's not stupid, just simple in some ways.<,>他不笨，只是某些方面比较单纯。<,>sim(相同)+ple(折叠)→单一的<,>simile(n.明喻)/sample(n.样品)

simplicity<,>/sɪmˈplɪsəti/<,>/sɪmˈplɪsɪti/<,>n.单纯/n.质朴<,>The beauty of the design lies in its simplicity.<,>这个设计的美丽在于它的简洁。<,>He spoke with childlike simplicity.<,>他说话带着孩子般的单纯。<,>Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.<,>简单是终极的复杂。<,>simple(简单的)+icity(名词后缀)→简单<,>complexity(n.复杂性)/duplicity(n.口是心非)

fill<,>/fɪl/<,>/fɪl/<,>v.担任(职务)/v.填补<,>She will fill the position of marketing director.<,>她将担任市场总监的职位。<,>Please fill this form with your personal details.<,>请用你的个人信息填写这份表格。<,>The vacancy has been filled internally.<,>这个空缺已由内部人员填补。<,>full(满的)去掉一个l→填满<,>fell(v.砍倒)/full(adj.满的)

jug<,>/dʒʌɡ/<,>/dʒʌɡ/<,>n.带柄水罐/n.大壶<,>She poured milk from the jug into her coffee.<,>她从壶里把牛奶倒入咖啡。<,>The antique jug was worth a fortune.<,>这个古董壶价值连城。<,>He drank a whole jug of water after the marathon.<,>马拉松后他喝了一整壶水。<,>ju(拼音"巨")+g(拼音"罐")→巨大的罐子<,>mug(n.马克杯)/hug(v.拥抱)

algebra<,>/ˈældʒɪbrə/<,>/ˈældʒəbrə/<,>n.代数学<,>Algebra was my favorite subject in school.<,>代数学是我在学校最喜欢的科目。<,>She's struggling with basic algebra concepts.<,>她在代数学基础概念上有困难。<,>The word "algebra" comes from Arabic.<,>"代数"这个词来自阿拉伯语。<,>al(阿拉伯语冠词)+gebra(重组)→源自阿拉伯数学<,>geometry(n.几何学)/arithmetic(n.算术)
attorney<,>/əˈtɜːni/<,>/əˈtɜrni/<,>n.代理人/n.辩护律师<,>She hired an attorney to handle her legal matters.<,>她雇了一位律师来处理她的法律事务。<,>The attorney presented a strong case in court.<,>律师在法庭上提出了强有力的论据。<,>He works as a corporate attorney in a law firm.<,>他在一家律师事务所担任公司律师。<,>at(to)+torn(turn)+ey→转向帮助的人→代理人<,>lawyer(n.律师)/solicitor(n.初级律师)/barrister(n.出庭律师)

deputy<,>/ˈdepjuti/<,>/ˈdɛpjəti/<,>n.代理人/adj.副的<,>The deputy manager will attend the meeting in my absence.<,>我不在时，副经理将参加会议。<,>He was appointed as deputy director of the department.<,>他被任命为该部门的副主任。<,>The sheriff's deputy responded to the emergency call.<,>警长的副手回应了紧急呼叫。<,>de(down)+put(think)+y→被委派思考的人→代理人<,>delegate(n.代表)/representative(n.代表)/substitute(n.替代者)

representative<,>/ˌreprɪˈzentətɪv/<,>/ˌrɛprɪˈzɛntətɪv/<,>adj.代表性的/adj.代议制的<,>This painting is representative of the artist's early style.<,>这幅画代表了艺术家的早期风格。<,>We need a representative sample for the survey.<,>我们需要一个有代表性的调查样本。<,>The country has a representative government.<,>这个国家有一个代议制政府。<,>re(again)+present(呈现)+ative→再次呈现的→代表性的<,>typical(adj.典型的)/symbolic(adj.象征的)/characteristic(adj.特有的)

delegate<,>/ˈdelɪɡət/<,>/ˈdɛlɪɡət/<,>n.代表/n.委员/n.特派员<,>The union sent three delegates to the conference.<,>工会派了三名代表参加会议。<,>She was chosen as a delegate to the United Nations.<,>她被选为联合国代表。<,>The delegate presented the committee's findings.<,>代表提交了委员会的调查结果。<,>de(away)+leg(send)+ate→被派出去的人→代表<,>representative(n.代表)/envoy(n.使者)/emissary(n.特使)

gorilla<,>/ɡəˈrɪlə/<,>/ɡəˈrɪlə/<,>n.大猩猩<,>We saw a family of gorillas at the zoo.<,>我们在动物园看到了一群大猩猩。<,>The silverback gorilla protects his troop.<,>银背大猩猩保护它的族群。<,>Gorillas are highly intelligent primates.<,>大猩猩是非常聪明的灵长类动物。<,>gor(拟声词)+illa→大猩猩的叫声→大猩猩<,>guerrilla(n.游击队)/chimpanzee(n.黑猩猩)/orangutan(n.猩猩)

magnitude<,>/ˈmæɡnɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈmæɡnɪtuːd/<,>n.重大/n.星等<,>The magnitude of the earthquake was 7.2 on the Richter scale.<,>这次地震的震级是里氏7.2级。<,>They underestimated the magnitude of the problem.<,>他们低估了问题的严重性。<,>Astronomers measure the magnitude of stars.<,>天文学家测量恒星的星等。<,>magn(great)+itude(状态)→巨大的状态→重大<,>amplitude(n.振幅)/multitude(n.大量)/altitude(n.高度)

massacre<,>/ˈmæsəkə(r)/<,>/ˈmæsəkər/<,>n.大屠杀/n.残杀<,>The massacre of innocent civilians shocked the world.<,>对无辜平民的大屠杀震惊了世界。<,>Historians still debate the causes of the massacre.<,>历史学家仍在争论大屠杀的原因。<,>The film depicts the infamous school massacre.<,>这部电影描述了那场臭名昭著的校园屠杀。<,>mass(大量)+acre(acre土地)→大量杀死→大屠杀<,>slaughter(n.屠杀)/genocide(n.种族灭绝)/carnage(n.大屠杀)

stride<,>/straɪd/<,>/straɪd/<,>v.大踏步走/n.大步<,>He strode confidently into the meeting room.<,>他自信地大步走进会议室。<,>She took great strides in her career last year.<,>去年她在事业上取得了巨大进步。<,>The athlete's long stride gave him an advantage.<,>运动员的大步幅给了他优势。<,>str(街道)+ide→在街上大步走→大踏步<,>stroll(v.散步)/amble(v.缓行)/march(v.行军)

embassy<,>/ˈembəsi/<,>/ˈɛmbəsi/<,>n.大使馆/n.大使的职务<,>The American Embassy is located in the city center.<,>美国大使馆位于市中心。<,>She works at the French Embassy as a cultural attaché.<,>她在法国大使馆担任文化专员。<,>The ambassador hosted a reception at the embassy.<,>大使在大使馆举办了招待会。<,>em(in)+bass(go)+y→派出去办事的地方→大使馆<,>consulate(n.领事馆)/diplomatic mission(n.外交使团)/high commission(n.高级专员公署)

ambassador<,>/æmˈbæsədə(r)/<,>/æmˈbæsədər/<,>n.大使/n.使节<,>The ambassador presented his credentials to the president.<,>大使向总统递交了国书。<,>She served as ambassador to the United Nations for five years.<,>她担任联合国大使五年。<,>The company appointed him as their brand ambassador.<,>公司任命他为品牌大使。<,>amb(around)+ass(go)+ador→四处走动的人→大使<,>envoy(n.特使)/diplomat(n.外交官)/legate(n.教宗使节)
mansion<,>/ˈmænʃən/<,>/ˈmænʃən/<,>n.大厦/n.大楼/n.宅第<,>The old mansion on the hill was rumored to be haunted.<,>山上的那座老宅邸据说是闹鬼的。<,>He bought a luxurious mansion in Beverly Hills.<,>他在比佛利山庄买了一栋豪华宅邸。<,>The mansion has over twenty rooms and a swimming pool.<,>这座宅邸有二十多个房间和一个游泳池。<,>man(人)+sion(地方)→人住的地方→宅第<,>mason(n.石匠)/marsh(n.沼泽)/mansion(n.大厦)  

multitude<,>/ˈmʌltɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈmʌltɪtuːd/<,>n.大批/n.大群/n.大量<,>A multitude of people gathered in the square for the concert.<,>大批人群聚集在广场上听音乐会。<,>The problem has a multitude of possible solutions.<,>这个问题有许多可能的解决方案。<,>She faced a multitude of challenges when starting her business.<,>她创业时面临大量挑战。<,>multi(多)+tude(状态)→多的状态→大量<,>altitude(n.海拔)/attitude(n.态度)/multitude(n.大量)  

barley<,>/ˈbɑːli/<,>/ˈbɑːrli/<,>n.大麦<,>Barley is often used in the production of beer and whiskey.<,>大麦常用于啤酒和威士忌的生产。<,>The farmer planted barley in his field this year.<,>今年这位农民在他的田里种了大麦。<,>Barley bread was a staple food in ancient times.<,>大麦面包是古代的主食。<,>bar(谷物)+ley→大麦<,>barely(adv.几乎不)/barley(n.大麦)/barn(n.谷仓)  

continental<,>/ˌkɒntɪˈnentl/<,>/ˌkɑːntɪˈnentl/<,>adj.大陆的/adj.大陆性的<,>The continental climate is characterized by hot summers and cold winters.<,>大陆性气候的特点是夏季炎热，冬季寒冷。<,>He took a continental tour last summer.<,>去年夏天他进行了一次大陆旅行。<,>The continental shelf is rich in marine resources.<,>大陆架有丰富的海洋资源。<,>continent(大陆)+al(的)→大陆的<,>contingent(adj.依情况而定的)/continental(adj.大陆的)/continent(n.大陆)  

infinity<,>/ɪnˈfɪnəti/<,>/ɪnˈfɪnəti/<,>n.无穷大<,>The universe is often thought to extend to infinity.<,>宇宙常被认为延伸到无穷大。<,>The concept of infinity is difficult for many people to grasp.<,>无穷大的概念对许多人来说很难理解。<,>The symbol for infinity looks like a sideways eight.<,>无穷大的符号看起来像一个横着的8。<,>in(不)+fin(结束)+ity→没有结束→无穷大<,>finite(adj.有限的)/infinity(n.无穷大)/infirm(adj.虚弱的)  

steak<,>/steɪk/<,>/steɪk/<,>n.大块牛肉/n.牛排<,>He ordered a medium-rare steak for dinner.<,>他晚餐点了一份五分熟的牛排。<,>She grilled the steak to perfection.<,>她把牛排烤得恰到好处。<,>This cut of steak is very tender and flavorful.<,>这块牛排非常嫩且多汁。<,>steak(发音似“撕开”)→撕开吃的肉→牛排<,>stake(n.赌注)/steak(n.牛排)/streak(n.条纹)  

butt<,>/bʌt/<,>/bʌt/<,>n.大酒桶/n.桶<,>The wine was stored in a large wooden butt.<,>葡萄酒储存在一个大木桶里。<,>They rolled the butt of beer into the cellar.<,>他们把啤酒桶滚进了地窖。<,>A butt of ale was shared among the villagers at the festival.<,>节日时村民们分享了一大桶麦芽酒。<,>butt(发音似“不特”)→不是特别的桶→大酒桶<,>but(n.但是)/butt(n.桶)/bunt(v.短打)  

largely<,>/ˈlɑːdʒli/<,>/ˈlɑːrdʒli/<,>adv.主要地<,>The success of the project was largely due to her efforts.<,>这个项目的成功主要归功于她的努力。<,>The population is largely concentrated in urban areas.<,>人口主要集中在城市地区。<,>His argument was largely based on speculation.<,>他的论点主要是基于推测。<,>large(大的)+ly(副词后缀)→主要地<,>largely(adv.主要地)/largess(n.慷慨)/large(adj.大的)  

widely<,>/ˈwaɪdli/<,>/ˈwaɪdli/<,>adv.大大地<,>The news was widely reported in the media.<,>这条新闻被媒体广泛报道。<,>His books are widely read around the world.<,>他的书在世界各地被广泛阅读。<,>The use of smartphones has become widely popular.<,>智能手机的使用已经大大普及。<,>wide(宽的)+ly(副词后缀)→大大地<,>widely(adv.大大地)/width(n.宽度)/widen(v.加宽)  

prairie<,>/ˈpreəri/<,>/ˈpreri/<,>n.大草原/n.牧场<,>The vast prairie stretched as far as the eye could see.<,>广阔的大草原一望无际。<,>Buffalo once roamed freely on the American prairie.<,>野牛曾经在美国大草原上自由漫步。<,>They built a house on the prairie and started a farm.<,>他们在大草原上建了一座房子并开办了一个农场。<,>prai(发音似“普瑞”)+rie→普通又美丽的大草原<,>prairie(n.大草原)/praise(v.赞扬)/prayer(n.祈祷)
smash<,>/smæʃ/<,>/smæʃ/<,>v.打碎/v.打破/v.粉碎<,>He used a hammer to smash the window.<,>他用锤子打碎了窗户。<,>The waves smashed against the rocks.<,>海浪猛烈地拍打着岩石。<,>She smashed her opponent in the tennis match.<,>她在网球比赛中击败了对手。<,>s(象声词)+mash(捣碎)→打碎<,>crash(v.碰撞/n.坠毁)/bash(v.猛击/n.狂欢)/slash(v.砍/n.斜线)

sneeze<,>/sniːz/<,>/sniz/<,>v.打喷嚏<,>Cover your mouth when you sneeze.<,>打喷嚏时要捂住嘴。<,>The dust made him sneeze repeatedly.<,>灰尘让他不停地打喷嚏。<,>Pepper always makes me sneeze.<,>胡椒总是让我打喷嚏。<,>sn(鼻子相关)+eeze(象声词)→打喷嚏<,>freeze(v.冻结/n.冰冻)/breeze(n.微风)/squeeze(v.挤压)

lighter<,>/ˈlaɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈlaɪtər/<,>n.打火机/n.引燃器<,>He flicked the lighter to light a cigarette.<,>他弹开打火机点烟。<,>This lighter is out of fuel.<,>这个打火机没油了。<,>She bought a fancy lighter as a gift.<,>她买了个精美的打火机当礼物。<,>light(光)+er(工具)→发光的工具→打火机<,>fighter(n.战士)/writer(n.作家)/tighter(adj.更紧的)

snore<,>/snɔː(r)/<,>/snɔːr/<,>v.打鼾/v.打呼噜<,>My father snores loudly at night.<,>我父亲晚上打鼾声音很大。<,>The sound of snoring kept me awake.<,>打鼾声让我睡不着。<,>She recorded her husband's snoring as evidence.<,>她录下丈夫的鼾声当证据。<,>sn(鼻子相关)+ore(象声词)→打鼾<,>score(n.分数/v.得分)/store(n.商店/v.储存)/ignore(v.忽视)

thresh<,>/θreʃ/<,>/θreʃ/<,>v.打谷/v.脱粒<,>Farmers used to thresh wheat by hand.<,>农民过去用手工打谷。<,>The machine threshes the grain efficiently.<,>这台机器能高效脱粒。<,>They learned traditional threshing methods.<,>他们学习了传统的打谷方法。<,>thr(动作相关)+esh(象声词)→打谷动作<,>thrash(v.鞭打)/thrust(v.猛推)/threshhold(n.门槛)

forge<,>/fɔːdʒ/<,>/fɔːrdʒ/<,>v.打(铁等)/v.锻造<,>Blacksmiths forge metal into tools.<,>铁匠把金属锻造成工具。<,>They forged a strong friendship during the trip.<,>旅途中他们建立了深厚友谊。<,>The document was found to be forged.<,>这份文件被发现是伪造的。<,>for(为了)+ge(动作)→为制造而击打→锻造<,>forget(v.忘记)/forage(v.搜寻粮草)/gorge(n.峡谷)

passport<,>/ˈpɑːspɔːt/<,>/ˈpæspɔːrt/<,>n.达到目的的手段<,>Education is a passport to success.<,>教育是通向成功的手段。<,>This certificate serves as your passport to the industry.<,>这个证书是你进入行业的敲门砖。<,>Hard work is the best passport to promotion.<,>努力工作是晋升的最佳途径。<,>pass(通过)+port(港口)→通过港口的凭证→通行证<,>password(n.密码)/passage(n.通道)/portfolio(n.作品集)

inaccessible<,>/ˌɪnækˈsesəbl/<,>/ˌɪnækˈsesəbəl/<,>adj.达不到的/adj.难接近的<,>The mountain peak is inaccessible in winter.<,>这座山峰冬季无法到达。<,>The data is inaccessible without proper authorization.<,>没有适当授权无法访问这些数据。<,>Her aloof manner makes her seem inaccessible.<,>她冷淡的态度让人难以接近。<,>in(不)+access(接近)+ible(能...的)→不能接近的<,>incredible(adj.难以置信的)/invisible(adj.看不见的)/inadequate(adj.不足的)

frustrate<,>/frʌˈstreɪt/<,>/ˈfrʌstreɪt/<,>v.挫败<,>The bad weather frustrated our picnic plans.<,>恶劣天气破坏了我们的野餐计划。<,>His constant interruptions frustrated her attempts to concentrate.<,>他不断打断她，使她无法集中注意力。<,>The team was frustrated by their third consecutive loss.<,>球队因连续第三次失败而沮丧。<,>frus(破碎)+trate(使)→使破碎→挫败<,>illustrate(v.说明)/demonstrate(v.演示)/infiltrate(v.渗透)

latent<,>/ˈleɪtnt/<,>/ˈleɪtənt/<,>adj.存在但看不见的<,>The virus can remain latent for years.<,>病毒可以潜伏多年。<,>She has latent musical talent waiting to be discovered.<,>她有尚未被发现的音乐天赋。<,>The photograph revealed latent fingerprints.<,>照片显示了潜藏的指纹。<,>late(晚)+ent(状态)→晚出现的状态→潜在的<,>patent(n.专利)/potent(adj.强有力的)/parent(n.父母)
frail<,>/freɪl/<,>/freɪl/<,>adj.脆弱的/adj.体质弱的<,>The old man's health is frail after the illness.<,>那位老人生病后身体很虚弱。<,>She held the frail butterfly gently in her hands.<,>她轻轻地捧着那只脆弱的蝴蝶。<,>The bridge is too frail to support heavy vehicles.<,>这座桥太脆弱，无法承受重型车辆。<,>frail和fragile都有“脆弱”的意思<,>fragile(adj.易碎的)/frail(adj.虚弱的)/brittle(adj.易碎的)

fragile<,>/ˈfrædʒaɪl/<,>/ˈfrædʒəl/<,>adj.脆弱的/adj.易碎的<,>Handle the package with care, as it contains fragile items.<,>小心搬运这个包裹，里面有易碎物品。<,>Their relationship is fragile after the argument.<,>争吵后他们的关系变得很脆弱。<,>The ecosystem is fragile and easily disrupted.<,>这个生态系统很脆弱，容易受到破坏。<,>frag(破碎)+ile(易于...的)→易碎的<,>frail(adj.虚弱的)/fragment(n.碎片)/fraction(n.小部分)

crisp<,>/krɪsp/<,>/krɪsp/<,>adj.脆的/adj.清新的<,>I love the sound of crisp leaves underfoot in autumn.<,>我喜欢秋天脚下脆叶的声音。<,>The bacon was cooked until crisp.<,>培根被煎得脆脆的。<,>She gave a crisp reply to the question.<,>她对这个问题给出了干脆的回答。<,>crisp和crunchy都有“脆”的意思<,>crispy(adj.酥脆的)/crisp(adj.干脆的)/crunchy(adj.嘎吱脆的)

catalyst<,>/ˈkætəlɪst/<,>/ˈkætəlɪst/<,>n.催化剂/n.刺激因素<,>The new policy acted as a catalyst for economic growth.<,>新政策成为经济增长的催化剂。<,>Enzymes serve as biological catalysts.<,>酶是生物催化剂。<,>Her speech was the catalyst that started the revolution.<,>她的演讲是引发革命的催化剂。<,>cata(向下)+lyst(松开)→使反应松动的物质→催化剂<,>catastrophe(n.大灾难)/catalyze(v.催化)/analysis(n.分析)

promotion<,>/prəˈməʊʃn/<,>/prəˈmoʊʃn/<,>n.促进/n.提升<,>He received a promotion to manager last month.<,>他上个月被提升为经理。<,>The company is running a special promotion this week.<,>公司本周正在进行特别促销。<,>Regular exercise promotes health and well-being.<,>经常锻炼能促进健康和幸福。<,>pro(向前)+mot(移动)+ion→向前移动→提升<,>promote(v.促进)/demotion(n.降级)/motion(n.运动)

reckless<,>/ˈrekləs/<,>/ˈrekləs/<,>adj.粗心大意的/adj.鲁莽的<,>His reckless driving caused a serious accident.<,>他鲁莽的驾驶导致了严重事故。<,>She spent money with reckless abandon.<,>她花钱大手大脚。<,>Don't be reckless with other people's feelings.<,>不要对他人的感情掉以轻心。<,>reck(顾虑)+less(无)→毫无顾虑的→鲁莽的<,>wreck(n.残骸)/feckless(adj.无能的)/ruthless(adj.无情的)

vulgar<,>/ˈvʌlɡə(r)/<,>/ˈvʌlɡər/<,>adj.粗俗的/adj.庸俗的<,>His vulgar jokes made everyone uncomfortable.<,>他粗俗的笑话让每个人都不舒服。<,>The mansion was decorated in vulgar taste.<,>这座豪宅装饰得很庸俗。<,>Using vulgar language is not appropriate in formal settings.<,>在正式场合使用粗俗语言是不合适的。<,>vulg(平民)+ar→平民的→粗俗的<,>vulgarity(n.粗俗)/popular(adj.流行的)/vulnerable(adj.易受伤害的)

massive<,>/ˈmæsɪv/<,>/ˈmæsɪv/<,>adj.粗大的/adj.大而重的<,>They built a massive statue in the city center.<,>他们在市中心建造了一座巨大的雕像。<,>The project requires a massive amount of funding.<,>这个项目需要大量资金。<,>She suffered a massive heart attack.<,>她遭受了严重的心脏病发作。<,>mass(大量)+ive(形容词后缀)→大量的<,>mass(n.质量)/passive(adj.被动的)/massacre(n.大屠杀)

harsh<,>/hɑːʃ/<,>/hɑːrʃ/<,>adj.粗糙的/adj.严厉的<,>The fabric feels harsh against the skin.<,>这种布料摸起来很粗糙。<,>The teacher's harsh criticism discouraged the students.<,>老师严厉的批评让学生们很沮丧。<,>The desert climate is harsh and unforgiving.<,>沙漠气候严酷无情。<,>harsh和rough都有“粗糙”的意思<,>hash(n.剁碎的食物)/hush(v.安静)/rash(adj.鲁莽的)

jungle<,>/ˈdʒʌŋɡl/<,>/ˈdʒʌŋɡəl/<,>n.丛林/n.密林<,>The explorers hacked their way through the dense jungle.<,>探险者在茂密的丛林中开辟道路。<,>The city can be a concrete jungle.<,>城市可能是一个水泥丛林。<,>Many rare species live in the Amazon jungle.<,>许多稀有物种生活在亚马逊丛林中。<,>jungle和forest都指“森林”，但jungle更茂密<,>jingle(v.叮当响)/jumble(v.混杂)/tangle(v.缠结)
follow<,>/ˈfɒləʊ/<,>/ˈfɑːloʊ/<,>v.从事（职业）/v.经营<,>He decided to follow his father's footsteps and become a doctor.<,>他决定追随父亲的脚步成为一名医生。<,>She follows a strict diet to maintain her health.<,>她遵循严格的饮食以保持健康。<,>The company follows ethical business practices.<,>这家公司遵循道德的商业实践。<,>fol(叶子)+low(低)→叶子低垂→追随<,>fellow(n.伙伴)/hollow(adj.空的)/swallow(v.吞咽)

overflow<,>/ˌəʊvəˈfləʊ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈfloʊ/<,>v.从…中溢出<,>The river overflowed after the heavy rain.<,>大雨过后河水泛滥了。<,>Her heart overflowed with joy when she saw her son.<,>当她看到儿子时，她心中充满了喜悦。<,>The cup overflowed with coffee.<,>杯子里的咖啡溢出来了。<,>over(过度)+flow(流动)→流动过度→溢出<,>overfly(v.飞越)/overthrow(v.推翻)/overload(v.超载)

smart<,>/smɑːt/<,>/smɑːrt/<,>v.刺疼/v.扎疼/v.剧痛<,>The antiseptic will smart when applied to the wound.<,>消毒剂涂在伤口上会刺痛。<,>His eyes smarted from the smoke.<,>他的眼睛被烟熏得刺痛。<,>The criticism smarted for days.<,>这个批评让人难受了好几天。<,>s(死)+mart(市场)→在市场上死→刺痛<,>start(v.开始)/smear(v.涂抹)/smirk(v.傻笑)

prick<,>/prɪk/<,>/prɪk/<,>v.刺（穿）/n.刺痛<,>She pricked her finger with a needle.<,>她用针刺破了手指。<,>The cactus pricked his hand.<,>仙人掌刺伤了他的手。<,>He felt a sharp prick when the injection was given.<,>打针时他感到一阵刺痛。<,>p(针)+rick(rickety摇摇欲坠的)→用针刺→刺痛<,>brick(n.砖)/trick(n.诡计)/pick(v.挑选)

thereafter<,>/ˌðeərˈɑːftə(r)/<,>/ˌðerˈæftər/<,>adv.此后/adv.以后<,>He left the company and thereafter started his own business.<,>他离开公司后开始自己创业。<,>She moved to London and thereafter we lost contact.<,>她搬到了伦敦，之后我们就失去了联系。<,>The law was passed and thereafter strictly enforced.<,>法律通过后得到了严格执行。<,>there(那里)+after(之后)→在那之后→此后<,>therefore(adv.因此)/thereby(adv.从而)/therein(adv.在其中)

magnetism<,>/ˈmæɡnətɪzəm/<,>/ˈmæɡnətɪzəm/<,>n.磁/n.魅力<,>The magnetism of the Earth protects us from solar radiation.<,>地球的磁场保护我们免受太阳辐射。<,>His personal magnetism drew people to him.<,>他个人的魅力吸引了人们。<,>The rock contains traces of natural magnetism.<,>这块岩石含有天然磁性的痕迹。<,>magnet(磁铁)+ism(性质)→磁性<,>magnesium(n.镁)/magnate(n.巨头)/magnify(v.放大)

porcelain<,>/ˈpɔːsəlɪn/<,>/ˈpɔːrsəlɪn/<,>n.瓷/adj.瓷的/adj.瓷制的<,>The museum has a fine collection of Chinese porcelain.<,>博物馆收藏了一批精美的中国瓷器。<,>She bought a set of porcelain dishes.<,>她买了一套瓷盘。<,>The porcelain vase is very fragile.<,>这个瓷花瓶非常易碎。<,>porce(pour倒)+lain(lie躺)→倒出来躺着的→瓷器<,>pork(n.猪肉)/porch(n.门廊)/porpoise(n.鼠海豚)

initial<,>/ɪˈnɪʃl/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃl/<,>adj.词首的<,>The initial letter of the word is capitalized.<,>这个词的首字母是大写的。<,>She made an initial attempt at solving the problem.<,>她最初尝试解决这个问题。<,>His initial reaction was one of surprise.<,>他最初的反应是惊讶。<,>in(进入)+it(走)+ial(形容词后缀)→开始的<,>initiate(v.开始)/inject(v.注射)/insist(v.坚持)

glossary<,>/ˈɡlɒsəri/<,>/ˈɡlɑːsəri/<,>n.词汇表/n.术语汇编<,>The textbook includes a glossary of technical terms.<,>教科书包含了一个技术术语表。<,>Refer to the glossary if you encounter unfamiliar words.<,>如果遇到不熟悉的单词，请参考词汇表。<,>The appendix contains a glossary of key concepts.<,>附录包含关键概念的术语表。<,>gloss(舌头)+ary(场所)→用舌头说的地方→词汇表<,>glory(n.荣耀)/glass(n.玻璃)/glisten(v.闪光)

vocabulary<,>/vəˈkæbjələri/<,>/voʊˈkæbjəleri/<,>n.词汇表/n.词汇汇编<,>He has a very limited vocabulary in French.<,>他的法语词汇量非常有限。<,>The course aims to expand students' vocabulary.<,>这门课程旨在扩大学生的词汇量。<,>This dictionary contains over 50,000 vocabulary items.<,>这本词典包含超过5万个词汇条目。<,>voc(声音)+abul(能够)+ary(场所)→能够发声的地方→词汇表<,>vocal(adj.声音的)/vocation(n.职业)/evoke(v.唤起)
stem<,>/stɛm/<,>/stɛm/<,>n.词干<,>The stem of the plant was strong and healthy.<,>植物的茎干强壮而健康。<,>She cut the stem of the flower before putting it in the vase.<,>她把花茎剪短后才插进花瓶。<,>In linguistics, a stem is the base form of a word.<,>在语言学中，词干是一个词的基本形式。<,>stem from(源自于)<,>stem vs. steam(蒸汽)

poke<,>/pəʊk/<,>/poʊk/<,>v.戳/v.刺/v.伸（头等）<,>He poked the fire with a stick to make it burn brighter.<,>他用棍子拨了拨火，让它烧得更旺。<,>She poked her head out of the window to see what was happening.<,>她把头伸出窗外看发生了什么事。<,>Don't poke fun at others.<,>不要取笑别人。<,>poke around(到处翻找)<,>poke vs. peak(山峰)

lipstick<,>/ˈlɪpstɪk/<,>/ˈlɪpˌstɪk/<,>n.唇膏/n.口红<,>She applied red lipstick before going to the party.<,>她去参加聚会前涂了红色口红。<,>This lipstick lasts all day without fading.<,>这款口红一整天都不会褪色。<,>He bought his girlfriend an expensive lipstick as a gift.<,>他给女朋友买了一支昂贵的口红作为礼物。<,>lip(嘴唇)+stick(棒状物)→口红<,>lipstick vs. chapstick(润唇膏)

stainless<,>/ˈsteɪnləs/<,>/ˈsteɪnləs/<,>adj.不锈的/adj.纯洁的<,>Stainless steel is widely used in kitchenware.<,>不锈钢广泛用于厨具。<,>She has a stainless reputation in the community.<,>她在社区里有着清白的名声。<,>The doctor wore a stainless white coat.<,>医生穿着一尘不染的白大褂。<,>stain(污点)+less(无)→无污点的<,>stainless vs. spotless(一尘不染的)

sheer<,>/ʃɪə(r)/<,>/ʃɪr/<,>adj.纯粹的/adj.全然的<,>It was sheer luck that we found the missing keys.<,>我们能找到丢失的钥匙纯属运气。<,>The cliff was a sheer drop of 100 meters.<,>悬崖垂直陡峭，有100米高。<,>She wore a dress of sheer silk.<,>她穿着一件薄如蝉翼的丝绸连衣裙。<,>sheer size(巨大的尺寸)<,>sheer vs. shear(剪羊毛)

perpendicular<,>/ˌpɜːpənˈdɪkjʊlə(r)/<,>/ˌpɜːrpənˈdɪkjʊlər/<,>adj.垂直的<,>The tower stands perpendicular to the ground.<,>塔楼与地面垂直。<,>Draw a line perpendicular to the base.<,>画一条与底线垂直的线。<,>The two roads meet at perpendicular angles.<,>两条路以直角相交。<,>per(完全)+pend(悬挂)+icular→完全悬挂的→垂直的<,>perpendicular vs. parallel(平行的)

author<,>/ˈɔːθə(r)/<,>/ˈɔθər/<,>n.创造者/n.创始人<,>Shakespeare is the author of many famous plays.<,>莎士比亚是许多著名戏剧的作者。<,>She is the author of several bestselling novels.<,>她是几本畅销小说的作者。<,>The author will be signing books at the store tomorrow.<,>作者明天将在书店签售。<,>auth(增加)+or(人)→创作的人<,>author vs. authority(权威)

innovation<,>/ˌɪnəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪnəˈveɪʃn/<,>n.创新/n.改革/n.新设施<,>Technological innovation drives economic growth.<,>科技创新推动经济增长。<,>The company is known for its constant innovation.<,>这家公司以不断创新而闻名。<,>This new teaching method is a real innovation.<,>这种新的教学方法是一项真正的创新。<,>in(进入)+nov(新)+ation→创新<,>innovation vs. invention(发明)

initiative<,>/ɪˈnɪʃətɪv/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃətɪv/<,>n.倡议/n.新方案<,>She took the initiative to organize the charity event.<,>她主动组织这次慈善活动。<,>The government launched a new environmental initiative.<,>政府启动了一项新的环保计划。<,>Employees are encouraged to show initiative at work.<,>鼓励员工在工作中发挥主动性。<,>initiate(开始)+ive→主动的行动<,>initiative vs. initial(最初的)

puff<,>/pʌf/<,>/pʌf/<,>v.喘气/v.喷（烟等）<,>He was puffing after running up the stairs.<,>他跑上楼梯后气喘吁吁。<,>The train puffed out of the station.<,>火车喷着烟驶出车站。<,>She puffed on her cigarette nervously.<,>她紧张地抽着烟。<,>puff out(吹灭)<,>puff vs. huff(发怒)
shipwreck<,>/ˈʃɪprek/<,>/ˈʃɪpˌrɛk/<,>n.船舶失事<,>The shipwreck was discovered off the coast of Spain.<,>这起船舶失事是在西班牙海岸附近发现的。<,>Many treasures were lost in the shipwreck.<,>许多珍宝在这次船舶失事中遗失了。<,>The museum displays artifacts from the shipwreck.<,>博物馆展出了这起船舶失事的文物。<,>ship(船)+wreck(失事)→船舶失事<,>shipwright(n.造船工人)/shipyard(n.造船厂)  

report<,>/rɪˈpɔːt/<,>/rɪˈpɔːrt/<,>n.传说/n.议论<,>There's a report that the company is going bankrupt.<,>有传言说这家公司即将破产。<,>The report of his resignation spread quickly.<,>他辞职的传闻迅速传开。<,>Don't believe every report you hear.<,>不要轻信你听到的每一则传闻。<,>re(再)+port(携带)→再次携带信息→传说<,>reporter(n.记者)/support(v.支持)  

infectious<,>/ɪnˈfekʃəs/<,>/ɪnˈfɛkʃəs/<,>adj.传染的/adj.感染性的<,>Laughter is infectious.<,>笑声具有感染力。<,>The disease is highly infectious.<,>这种疾病传染性很强。<,>Her enthusiasm was infectious.<,>她的热情很有感染力。<,>in(进入)+fect(做)+ious(形容词后缀)→进入体内起作用→传染的<,>infect(v.传染)/effect(n.效果)  

romance<,>/rəʊˈmæns/<,>/roʊˈmæns/<,>n.传奇/n.浪漫文学<,>She loves reading medieval romances.<,>她喜欢阅读中世纪传奇故事。<,>The novel is a beautiful romance.<,>这部小说是一部优美的浪漫文学。<,>Their love story is like a romance.<,>他们的爱情故事就像一部传奇。<,>roman(罗马)+ce→源自罗马的故事→传奇<,>romantic(adj.浪漫的)/Rome(n.罗马)  

herald<,>/ˈherəld/<,>/ˈhɛrəld/<,>n.传令官/n.通报者<,>The herald announced the king's arrival.<,>传令官宣布了国王的到来。<,>The cuckoo is a herald of spring.<,>布谷鸟是春天的使者。<,>The newspaper was the herald of the scandal.<,>这家报纸率先报道了这桩丑闻。<,>her(军队)+ald→军队中的传令者→传令官<,>heraldry(n.纹章学)/hero(n.英雄)  

missionary<,>/ˈmɪʃənri/<,>/ˈmɪʃəˌnɛri/<,>n.传教士<,>The missionary traveled to remote villages.<,>这位传教士前往偏远的村庄。<,>Missionaries spread their religion across the world.<,>传教士们在世界各地传播他们的宗教。<,>He worked as a missionary in Africa.<,>他曾在非洲担任传教士。<,>mission(使命)+ary(人)→肩负使命的人→传教士<,>mission(n.使命)/commission(n.委员会)  

sensor<,>/ˈsensə(r)/<,>/ˈsɛnsər/<,>n.传感器/n.灵敏元件<,>The car's parking sensor beeped loudly.<,>汽车的停车传感器发出响亮的哔哔声。<,>This device has a temperature sensor.<,>这个设备装有温度传感器。<,>The motion sensor detected movement.<,>运动传感器检测到了动静。<,>sens(感觉)+or(物)→能感知的物体→传感器<,>sense(n.感觉)/censor(v.审查)  

circular<,>/ˈsɜːkjələ(r)/<,>/ˈsɜːrkjələr/<,>n.传单/n.通报/n.通函<,>They distributed circulars in the neighborhood.<,>他们在社区里分发传单。<,>The company sent out a circular to all employees.<,>公司向所有员工发送了通函。<,>Please read the circular carefully.<,>请仔细阅读这份通报。<,>circ(圆)+ular→循环发放的→传单<,>circle(n.圆圈)/circulate(v.循环)  

leaflet<,>/ˈliːflət/<,>/ˈliflət/<,>n.传单<,>He handed me a leaflet about the concert.<,>他递给我一张关于音乐会的传单。<,>Protesters were distributing leaflets.<,>抗议者正在分发传单。<,>The leaflet contains important information.<,>这张传单包含重要信息。<,>leaf(树叶)+let(小)→像小树叶一样的纸片→传单<,>booklet(n.小册子)/pamphlet(n.小册子)  

convey<,>/kənˈveɪ/<,>/kənˈveɪ/<,>v.传达/v.传播/v.转让<,>Words cannot convey my gratitude.<,>言语无法表达我的感激之情。<,>The pipes convey water to the city.<,>这些管道将水输送到城市。<,>He conveyed the property to his son.<,>他把财产转让给了儿子。<,>con(共同)+vey(道路)→共同走一条路→传达<,>conveyor(n.传送带)/survey(v.调查)
pierce<,>/pɪəs/<,>/pɪrs/<,>v.穿透/v.戳穿<,>The needle pierced her skin.<,>针穿透了她的皮肤。<,>His scream pierced the silence.<,>他的尖叫划破了寂静。<,>The arrow pierced the target.<,>箭射穿了靶子。<,>pier(码头)+ce→像码头一样坚固→穿透<,>piece(n.块/v.拼合)/pier(n.码头)/piercing(adj.刺耳的)

penetration<,>/ˌpenɪˈtreɪʃn/<,>/ˌpɛnɪˈtreɪʃən/<,>n.穿入/n.渗透<,>The penetration of the bullet was deep.<,>子弹的穿入很深。<,>Market penetration is crucial for new products.<,>市场渗透对新产品至关重要。<,>The penetration of light through the curtains was beautiful.<,>光线透过窗帘很美。<,>penetr(穿透)+ation(名词后缀)→穿入<,>penetrate(v.穿透)/penetrable(adj.可穿透的)/penetrant(adj.渗透的)

antenna<,>/ænˈtenə/<,>/ænˈtɛnə/<,>n.触角/n.天线<,>The insect's antenna was broken.<,>昆虫的触角断了。<,>We need to adjust the TV antenna.<,>我们需要调整电视天线。<,>The robot has sensitive antennae.<,>这个机器人有灵敏的天线。<,>ant(蚂蚁)+enna→像蚂蚁的触角→天线<,>antennae(复数形式)/antennal(adj.触角的)/antennule(n.小触角)

virgin<,>/ˈvɜːdʒɪn/<,>/ˈvɜrdʒɪn/<,>n.处女/adj.处女的<,>She remained a virgin until marriage.<,>她婚前一直是处女。<,>Virgin forests are rare now.<,>原始森林现在很少见了。<,>The virgin snow covered the ground.<,>洁白的雪覆盖了大地。<,>vir(力量)+gin→有力量保持纯洁→处女<,>virginal(adj.处女的)/virginity(n.童贞)/Virgo(n.处女座)

transaction<,>/trænˈzækʃn/<,>/trænˈzækʃən/<,>n.交易/n.处理<,>The bank records all transactions.<,>银行记录所有交易。<,>Online transactions are convenient.<,>网上交易很方便。<,>The transaction was completed smoothly.<,>交易顺利完成。<,>trans(跨越)+action(行动)→跨越的行动→交易<,>transact(v.办理)/transactor(n.办理人)/interaction(n.互动)

penalty<,>/ˈpenəlti/<,>/ˈpɛnəlti/<,>n.处罚/n.刑罚/n.罚款<,>He received a penalty for speeding.<,>他因超速被罚款。<,>The death penalty is controversial.<,>死刑是有争议的。<,>The team suffered a penalty kick.<,>球队被判罚点球。<,>pen(惩罚)+alty→处罚<,>penal(adj.刑罚的)/penalize(v.处罚)/penance(n.忏悔)

exclusive<,>/ɪkˈskluːsɪv/<,>/ɪkˈsklusɪv/<,>adj.除外的<,>This is an exclusive club.<,>这是个高级俱乐部。<,>She gave an exclusive interview.<,>她做了独家专访。<,>The offer is exclusive to members.<,>这个优惠仅限会员。<,>ex(出)+clus(关闭)+ive→关在外面→除外的<,>exclude(v.排除)/exclusion(n.排除)/inclusive(adj.包含的)

notorious<,>/nəʊˈtɔːriəs/<,>/noʊˈtɔriəs/<,>adj.臭名昭著的<,>He is a notorious criminal.<,>他是个臭名昭著的罪犯。<,>The area is notorious for theft.<,>这个地区以盗窃闻名。<,>She became notorious for her lies.<,>她因谎言而臭名昭著。<,>not(知道)+orious→众所周知的坏→臭名昭著<,>notoriety(n.恶名)/notable(adj.显著的)/noticeable(adj.明显的)

scandal<,>/ˈskændl/<,>/ˈskændəl/<,>n.丑事/n.丑闻/n.耻辱<,>The scandal ruined his career.<,>丑闻毁了他的事业。<,>She was involved in a financial scandal.<,>她卷入了一起财务丑闻。<,>The scandal shocked the nation.<,>这起丑闻震惊了全国。<,>scan(扫描)+dal→被扫描出来的坏事→丑闻<,>scandalize(v.使震惊)/scandalous(adj.可耻的)/sandal(n.凉鞋)

specimen<,>/ˈspesɪmən/<,>/ˈspɛsəmən/<,>n.抽样/n.样品<,>The doctor took a blood specimen.<,>医生取了血样。<,>This is a specimen of his work.<,>这是他工作的样本。<,>The museum has rare specimens.<,>博物馆有稀有标本。<,>speci(种类)+men→某一种类的代表→样品<,>species(n.物种)/special(adj.特别的)/specific(adj.特定的)
extraction<,>/ɪkˈstrækʃən/<,>/ɪkˈstrækʃən/<,>n.抽出/n.提取法<,>The extraction of oil from the ground is a complex process.<,>从地下提取石油是一个复杂的过程。<,>Tooth extraction can be painful.<,>拔牙可能会很疼。<,>The extraction of DNA is crucial for genetic research.<,>DNA的提取对于基因研究至关重要。<,>ex(出)+tract(拉)+ion(名词后缀)→拉出来→提取<,>abstract(adj.抽象的/n.摘要)/contract(n.合同/v.收缩)  

adore<,>/əˈdɔːr/<,>/əˈdɔːr/<,>v.崇拜/v.爱慕/v.很喜欢<,>She adores her grandmother and visits her every week.<,>她非常爱她的祖母，每周都去看望她。<,>I absolutely adore chocolate ice cream.<,>我超级喜欢巧克力冰淇淋。<,>He adores his wife and always brings her flowers.<,>他非常爱他的妻子，总是给她带花。<,>a(加强)+dore(给予)→给予爱→爱慕<,>adorn(v.装饰)/abhor(v.憎恨)/adore vs. worship(更个人化的喜爱)  

worship<,>/ˈwɜːʃɪp/<,>/ˈwɜːrʃɪp/<,>v.崇拜/v.做礼拜<,>They worship every Sunday at the local church.<,>他们每周日在当地教堂做礼拜。<,>Many ancient cultures worshipped the sun.<,>许多古代文化崇拜太阳。<,>She worships her favorite pop star.<,>她崇拜她最喜欢的流行歌手。<,>wor(价值)+ship(状态)→给予最高价值→崇拜<,>warship(n.军舰)/workshop(n.车间)/worship vs. adore(更正式/宗教性)  

bug<,>/bʌɡ/<,>/bʌɡ/<,>n.虫子/n.臭虫<,>There's a bug crawling on the windowsill.<,>有一只虫子在窗台上爬。<,>My computer has a bug and keeps crashing.<,>我的电脑有故障，一直崩溃。<,>Don't let the bed bugs bite!<,>别让臭虫咬了！<,>拟声词，模仿昆虫嗡嗡声<,>bud(n.芽/v.发芽)/bag(n.包)/bug vs. insect(更口语化)  

punch<,>/pʌntʃ/<,>/pʌntʃ/<,>v.打孔/n.冲压机<,>He punched a hole in the paper with a hole puncher.<,>他用打孔机在纸上打了一个孔。<,>The boxer punched his opponent in the face.<,>拳击手一拳打在对手脸上。<,>This machine can punch through metal sheets.<,>这台机器可以冲压金属板。<,>拟声词，模仿击打声<,>pinch(v.捏/n.一撮)/lunch(n.午餐)/punch vs. hit(更强调用拳头)  

strife<,>/straɪf/<,>/straɪf/<,>n.冲突/n.竞争<,>Political strife has divided the nation.<,>政治冲突分裂了这个国家。<,>There was much strife between the two families.<,>两个家族之间有很多纷争。<,>Industrial strife led to a workers' strike.<,>工业冲突导致了工人罢工。<,>str(紧张)+ife→紧张状态→冲突<,>strive(v.努力)/strike(n.罢工/v.打击)/strife vs. conflict(更文学化)  

equator<,>/ɪˈkweɪtə(r)/<,>/ɪˈkweɪtər/<,>n.赤道/n.天球赤道<,>The equator divides the Earth into Northern and Southern Hemispheres.<,>赤道将地球分为北半球和南半球。<,>It's very hot near the equator.<,>赤道附近非常热。<,>The celestial equator is an imaginary circle in the sky.<,>天球赤道是天空中的一个假想圆。<,>equ(平等)+ator→将地球平等分开的线<,>equation(n.等式)/equity(n.公平)/equator vs. meridian(经线)  

gear<,>/ɡɪə(r)/<,>/ɡɪr/<,>n.齿轮/n.传动装置<,>My bike's gears need oiling.<,>我的自行车齿轮需要上油。<,>He shifted gears as the car went uphill.<,>汽车上坡时他换了档。<,>The factory produces precision gears for machines.<,>这家工厂生产机器用的精密齿轮。<,>gear→hear(听)→齿轮转动的声音<,>fear(n.恐惧)/tear(v.撕扯/n.眼泪)/gear vs. cog(更小的齿轮)  

persist<,>/pəˈsɪst/<,>/pərˈsɪst/<,>v.持续/v.存留<,>If symptoms persist, consult a doctor.<,>如果症状持续，请咨询医生。<,>She persisted in her efforts to learn French.<,>她坚持学习法语。<,>The smell of smoke persisted in the room for days.<,>烟味在房间里持续了好几天。<,>per(完全)+sist(站立)→完全站立→坚持<,>insist(v.坚持)/resist(v.抵抗)/persist vs. continue(更强调克服困难)  

breakfast<,>/ˈbrekfəst/<,>/ˈbrekfəst/<,>v.吃早餐<,>We breakfasted on toast and coffee.<,>我们早餐吃了吐司和咖啡。<,>She likes to breakfast in bed on weekends.<,>她喜欢周末在床上吃早餐。<,>They breakfast together every morning before work.<,>他们每天早上上班前一起吃早餐。<,>break(打破)+fast(禁食)→打破夜间禁食→早餐<,>lunch(v.吃午餐)/dinner(v.吃晚餐)/breakfast vs. brunch(早午餐)
dine<,>/daɪn/<,>/daɪn/<,>v.吃饭<,>We will dine at the new Italian restaurant tonight.<,>我们今晚将在新开的意大利餐厅用餐。<,>He prefers to dine alone when he's working late.<,>他加班时更喜欢独自用餐。<,>They dined on fresh seafood by the beach.<,>他们在海滩边享用了新鲜的海鲜。<,>di(日)+ne(内)→日式料理→吃饭<,>diner(n.用餐者)/dinner(n.晚餐)/divine(adj.神圣的)

proceeding<,>/prəˈsiːdɪŋ/<,>/proʊˈsiːdɪŋ/<,>n.程序/n.行动/n.事项<,>The legal proceedings took longer than expected.<,>法律程序比预期花费了更长时间。<,>All conference proceedings will be published next month.<,>所有会议事项将于下月公布。<,>They took proceedings against the company for breach of contract.<,>他们因违约对公司提起了诉讼。<,>pro(向前)+ceed(走)+ing→向前进行的事项<,>preceding(adj.在先的)/procedure(n.程序)/process(n.过程)

length<,>/leŋθ/<,>/leŋθ/<,>n.长度<,>The length of the rope is about 10 meters.<,>这根绳子长约10米。<,>She wore her hair at shoulder length last year.<,>去年她留着齐肩长发。<,>The movie's length was nearly three hours.<,>这部电影时长近三小时。<,>leng(长)+th(名词后缀)→长度<,>long(adj.长的)/lengthen(v.延长)/strength(n.力量)

acknowledge<,>/əkˈnɒlɪdʒ/<,>/əkˈnɑːlɪdʒ/<,>v.承认/v.告知收到<,>He acknowledged his mistake in the report.<,>他承认了报告中的错误。<,>Please acknowledge receipt of this email.<,>请确认收到这封邮件。<,>The crowd acknowledged the performer with loud applause.<,>观众用热烈的掌声向表演者致意。<,>ac(强调)+knowledge(知识)→承认知道<,>knowledge(n.知识)/acknowledgment(n.承认)/edge(n.边缘)

shoulder<,>/ˈʃəʊldə(r)/<,>/ˈʃoʊldər/<,>v.承担/v.挑起<,>He shouldered the responsibility for the project's failure.<,>他承担了项目失败的责任。<,>She shouldered her backpack and left the classroom.<,>她背起书包离开了教室。<,>The company will shoulder all the expenses.<,>公司将承担所有费用。<,>should(应该)+er(人)→应该承担责任的人<,>soldier(n.士兵)/boulder(n.巨石)/holder(n.持有者)

integrity<,>/ɪnˈteɡrəti/<,>/ɪnˈteɡrəti/<,>n.诚实/n.正直<,>He is a man of great integrity and honesty.<,>他是个非常正直诚实的人。<,>Data integrity is crucial for this research.<,>数据完整性对这项研究至关重要。<,>She maintained her artistic integrity despite commercial pressures.<,>尽管有商业压力，她仍保持艺术操守。<,>integer(完整)+ity(状态)→完整状态→正直<,>integral(adj.完整的)/integrate(v.整合)/disintegrate(v.瓦解)

offer<,>/ˈɒfə(r)/<,>/ˈɔːfər/<,>v.出现<,>An opportunity like this doesn't offer itself every day.<,>这样的机会不是每天都会出现。<,>He offered to help me with my luggage.<,>他主动提出帮我拿行李。<,>The university offers a wide range of courses.<,>该大学提供多种课程。<,>of(向外)+fer(带来)→带来出现<,>office(n.办公室)/officer(n.军官)/afford(v.负担得起)

membership<,>/ˈmembəʃɪp/<,>/ˈmembərʃɪp/<,>n.成员资格/n.会员人数<,>My gym membership expires next month.<,>我的健身房会员资格下个月到期。<,>The club has over 500 memberships this year.<,>该俱乐部今年有500多名会员。<,>She applied for membership in the professional association.<,>她申请了专业协会的会员资格。<,>member(成员)+ship(状态)→成员资格<,>ownership(n.所有权)/leadership(n.领导)/fellowship(n.友谊)

systematic<,>/ˌsɪstəˈmætɪk/<,>/ˌsɪstəˈmætɪk/<,>adj.成体系的<,>They conducted a systematic investigation of the problem.<,>他们对这个问题进行了系统调查。<,>Her approach to learning languages is very systematic.<,>她学习语言的方法非常有体系。<,>The company has systematic procedures for quality control.<,>公司有系统的质量控制程序。<,>system(系统)+atic(形容词后缀)→成体系的<,>systemic(adj.全身的)/systematize(v.系统化)/ecosystem(n.生态系统)

kit<,>/kɪt/<,>/kɪt/<,>n.成套工具/n.用具包<,>I bought a first aid kit for my car.<,>我为我的车买了一个急救包。<,>The model airplane kit comes with detailed instructions.<,>这个飞机模型套件附有详细说明。<,>He packed his shaving kit for the business trip.<,>他为商务旅行收拾了剃须用具包。<,>kit(小猫)→小猫玩的一套东西→成套工具<,>kite(n.风筝)/kid(n.小孩)/kitchen(n.厨房)
commend<,>/kəˈmend/<,>/kəˈmɛnd/<,>v.称赞/v.表扬/v.推荐<,>The teacher commended the student for his hard work.<,>老师表扬了这位学生的努力。<,>I commend this book to anyone interested in history.<,>我向对历史感兴趣的任何人推荐这本书。<,>She was commended for her bravery.<,>她因勇敢而受到称赞。<,>com(共同)+mend(信任)→共同信任→推荐<,>command(v.命令/n.指挥)/amend(v.修改/v.改进)

brood<,>/bruːd/<,>/brud/<,>v.沉思/v.郁闭地沉思<,>He brooded over his mistakes for days.<,>他几天来一直在沉思自己的错误。<,>The hen brooded over her eggs.<,>母鸡孵蛋。<,>She sat brooding by the window.<,>她坐在窗边沉思。<,>brood(孵蛋)→像母鸡孵蛋一样沉思<,>blood(n.血液)/broad(adj.宽阔的)

muse<,>/mjuːz/<,>/mjuz/<,>v.沉思/v.默想/v.冥想<,>She mused about the meaning of life.<,>她沉思生命的意义。<,>The poet mused on the beauty of nature.<,>诗人默想自然之美。<,>He sat musing by the fire.<,>他坐在火边冥想。<,>来自希腊神话中的Muse(缪斯女神)→艺术沉思的灵感<,>amuse(v.娱乐/v.消遣)/music(n.音乐)

meditate<,>/ˈmedɪteɪt/<,>/ˈmɛdɪˌteɪt/<,>v.沉思/v.冥想<,>He meditates for an hour every morning.<,>他每天早晨冥想一小时。<,>She meditated on the problem before answering.<,>她在回答前沉思这个问题。<,>The monk meditated in silence.<,>僧侣静默冥想。<,>medi(中间)+tate(处理)→在中间处理思想→冥想<,>mediate(v.调解)/medication(n.药物治疗)

hush<,>/hʌʃ/<,>/hʌʃ/<,>n.沉默/int.嘘！<,>Hush! The baby is sleeping.<,>嘘！宝宝在睡觉。<,>A hush fell over the crowd.<,>人群突然安静下来。<,>She spoke in a hush voice.<,>她低声说话。<,>拟声词，模仿"嘘"声<,>rush(v.冲/n.匆忙)/bush(n.灌木)

immerse<,>/ɪˈmɜːs/<,>/ɪˈmɜːrs/<,>v.沉浸/v.给...施洗礼<,>He immersed himself in his work.<,>他沉浸在工作中。<,>The priest immersed the baby in water.<,>牧师给婴儿施洗礼。<,>She was immersed in the novel.<,>她沉浸在小说中。<,>im(进入)+merse(沉)→沉入→沉浸<,>emerge(v.出现)/submerge(v.淹没)

repeal<,>/rɪˈpiːl/<,>/rɪˈpil/<,>v.撤销<,>The government repealed the unpopular law.<,>政府撤销了不得人心的法律。<,>They voted to repeal the amendment.<,>他们投票撤销修正案。<,>The act was repealed after much protest.<,>该法案在多次抗议后被撤销。<,>re(回)+peal(呼吁)→呼吁收回→撤销<,>appeal(v.上诉/n.呼吁)/reveal(v.揭示)

lathe<,>/leɪð/<,>/leɪð/<,>n.车床/v.用车床加工<,>The worker operated the lathe skillfully.<,>工人熟练地操作车床。<,>He lathed the piece of wood into a bowl.<,>他用车床把木块加工成碗。<,>The metal part was made on a lathe.<,>这个金属部件是用车床制造的。<,>发音类似"lay the"(放置)→车床放置工件加工<,>loath(adj.不情愿的)/lathen(adj.车床加工的)

row<,>/raʊ/<,>/raʊ/<,>n.吵架/v.口角<,>They had a row about money.<,>他们为钱吵架。<,>The neighbors were having a loud row.<,>邻居在大声争吵。<,>It started as a small row but escalated quickly.<,>开始是小口角但迅速升级。<,>发音同"吵"的拼音chao→帮助记忆吵架含义<,>roe(n.鱼卵)/bow(v.鞠躬/n.弓)

mock<,>/mɒk/<,>/mɑːk/<,>v.嘲弄/v.挖苦<,>The children mocked his accent.<,>孩子们嘲弄他的口音。<,>She mocked his attempts to sing.<,>她挖苦他唱歌的尝试。<,>It's cruel to mock people's disabilities.<,>嘲弄别人的残疾是残忍的。<,>mock(模考)→模考成绩差被嘲弄<,>muck(n.粪肥/v.弄脏)/mack(n.雨衣)
reign<,>/reɪn/<,>/reɪn/<,>n.（某君主的）统治时期<,>Queen Victoria's reign lasted for 63 years.<,>维多利亚女王的统治持续了63年。<,>The king's reign was marked by peace and prosperity.<,>这位国王的统治时期以和平与繁荣为特征。<,>During his reign, many reforms were implemented.<,>在他的统治期间，实施了许多改革。<,>reign与rain(雨)同音，联想"统治如雨覆盖全国"<,>sovereign(adj.至高无上的/n.君主)/regime(n.政权)/rein(n.缰绳/v.控制)

supersonic<,>/ˌsuːpəˈsɒnɪk/<,>/ˌsuːpərˈsɑːnɪk/<,>adj.超声的/adj.超声速的<,>The aircraft can travel at supersonic speeds.<,>这架飞机能以超音速飞行。<,>Bats use supersonic waves to navigate.<,>蝙蝠利用超声波来导航。<,>This is a supersonic cleaning device.<,>这是一台超声波清洗设备。<,>super(超)+sonic(声音的)→超音速的<,>subsonic(adj.亚音速的)/ultrasonic(adj.超声的)

ultrasonic<,>/ˌʌltrəˈsɒnɪk/<,>/ˌʌltrəˈsɑːnɪk/<,>adj.超声的/n.超声波<,>Doctors use ultrasonic waves to examine patients.<,>医生用超声波检查病人。<,>The ultrasonic cleaner removes dirt effectively.<,>超声波清洗器能有效去除污垢。<,>This machine emits ultrasonic frequencies.<,>这台机器发射超声波频率。<,>ultra(超)+sonic(声音的)→超声的<,>infrasonic(adj.次声的)/supersonic(adj.超音速的)

surpass<,>/səˈpɑːs/<,>/sərˈpæs/<,>v.超过/v.超越/v.胜过<,>Her performance surpassed all expectations.<,>她的表现超出了所有人的预期。<,>This year's sales have surpassed last year's record.<,>今年的销售额超过去年的记录。<,>No one can surpass him in chess.<,>没人能在国际象棋上胜过他。<,>sur(超)+pass(通过)→超越<,>surplus(n.过剩/adj.过剩的)/bypass(v.绕过/n.旁路)

nickname<,>/ˈnɪkneɪm/<,>/ˈnɪkˌneɪm/<,>n.绰号/n.诨号<,>They gave him the nickname "Speedy".<,>他们给他起了个绰号叫"飞毛腿"。<,>"Bear" was his childhood nickname.<,>"大熊"是他童年的绰号。<,>Do you know the origin of this nickname?<,>你知道这个绰号的由来吗？<,>nick(刻痕)+name(名字)→刻下的名字→绰号<,>surname(n.姓氏)/penname(n.笔名)

waggon<,>/ˈwæɡən/<,>/ˈwæɡən/<,>n.敞篷车厢<,>The goods were loaded onto the waggon.<,>货物被装上了敞篷车厢。<,>They traveled west in a covered waggon.<,>他们乘坐有篷马车向西旅行。<,>The waggon got stuck in the mud.<,>马车陷在泥里了。<,>wag(摇摆)+gon→摇摆的车厢<,>wagon(美式拼写)/waggish(adj.诙谐的)

spectacle<,>/ˈspektəkl/<,>/ˈspektəkəl/<,>n.场面/n.景象/n.奇观<,>The sunset was a magnificent spectacle.<,>日落是个壮观的景象。<,>He made a spectacle of himself at the party.<,>他在聚会上出了洋相。<,>The Olympic opening ceremony was an amazing spectacle.<,>奥运会开幕式是个惊人的场面。<,>spect(看)+acle(名词后缀)→看到的景象<,>spectacular(adj.壮观的)/spectator(n.观众)

resident<,>/ˈrezɪdənt/<,>/ˈrezɪdənt/<,>n.常住者<,>She has been a resident of this city for 20 years.<,>她在这个城市住了20年。<,>The hotel has both guests and permanent residents.<,>这家酒店既有客人也有常住居民。<,>All residents must register at the local police station.<,>所有常住者必须在当地派出所登记。<,>re(再)+sid(坐)+ent→一直坐着的人→常住者<,>president(n.总统)/residence(n.住所)

haunt<,>/hɔːnt/<,>/hɔːnt/<,>v.(鬼魂)经常出没<,>The old castle is said to be haunted.<,>据说那座古堡闹鬼。<,>Memories of the accident still haunt him.<,>事故的记忆仍然困扰着他。<,>This bar used to be a haunt for artists.<,>这个酒吧曾经是艺术家们常去的地方。<,>h(看作home)+aunt(姑姑)→姑姑的家→常去的地方<,>hunt(v.狩猎)/taunt(v.嘲弄)

visit<,>/ˈvɪzɪt/<,>/ˈvɪzɪt/<,>v.拜访<,>I'll visit my grandparents this weekend.<,>这周末我要去看望祖父母。<,>The doctor visits patients at home.<,>医生上门为病人看病。<,>We visited several museums in Paris.<,>我们在巴黎参观了几家博物馆。<,>vis(看)+it→去看→拜访<,>visitor(n.访客)/vision(n.视力)
frequent<,>/ˈfriːkwənt/<,>/ˈfriːkwənt/<,>adj.常见的/adj.频繁的<,>He is a frequent visitor to the library.<,>他是图书馆的常客。<,>There are frequent delays on this train line.<,>这条火车线路经常延误。<,>She made frequent phone calls to her family.<,>她经常给家人打电话。<,>fre(自由)+quent(频繁)→频繁的<,>frequent(v. 常去)/sequence(n.顺序)/consequent(adj.随之发生的)

shovel<,>/ˈʃʌv(ə)l/<,>/ˈʃʌvəl/<,>n.铲/n.铁铲/v.铲<,>He used a shovel to dig a hole in the garden.<,>他用铲子在花园里挖了一个洞。<,>She shoveled snow from the driveway.<,>她把车道上的雪铲掉了。<,>The workers were shoveling coal into the furnace.<,>工人们正把煤铲进炉子里。<,>shove(推)+l(工具)→推的工具→铲子<,>shove(v.推)/hovel(n.简陋小屋)/shuttle(n.梭子)

toad<,>/təʊd/<,>/toʊd/<,>n.蟾蜍/n.癞蛤蟆<,>A toad was sitting by the pond.<,>一只蟾蜍坐在池塘边。<,>She screamed when she saw the toad in her garden.<,>她在花园里看到蟾蜍时尖叫起来。<,>Toads are beneficial as they eat insects.<,>蟾蜍是有益的，因为它们吃昆虫。<,>toad(谐音"透的")→皮肤透水的→蟾蜍<,>toad(n.蟾蜍)/toady(v.谄媚)/todd(n.狐狸)

diesel<,>/ˈdiːz(ə)l/<,>/ˈdiːzəl/<,>n.柴油发动机/n.内燃机<,>The truck runs on diesel fuel.<,>这辆卡车使用柴油燃料。<,>Diesel engines are more fuel-efficient than gasoline engines.<,>柴油发动机比汽油发动机更省油。<,>He works as a diesel mechanic.<,>他是一名柴油机修理工。<,>diesel(音译"迪塞尔")→柴油<,>diesel(n.柴油)/dazzle(v.使目眩)/drizzle(n.细雨)

errand<,>/ˈerənd/<,>/ˈɛrənd/<,>n.差使/n.差事<,>She went out to run some errands.<,>她出去办些差事。<,>Could you do me a quick errand?<,>你能帮我跑个腿吗？<,>He was sent on an errand to deliver the package.<,>他被派去送包裹。<,>err(走)+and(名词后缀)→走动的任务→差事<,>errand(n.差事)/errant(adj.错误的)/erode(v.侵蚀)

ascertain<,>/ˌæsəˈteɪn/<,>/ˌæsərˈteɪn/<,>vt.查明/vt.确定/vt.弄清<,>The police are trying to ascertain the cause of the accident.<,>警方正在努力查明事故原因。<,>We need to ascertain the facts before making a decision.<,>我们需要在做出决定前弄清事实。<,>It was difficult to ascertain his true intentions.<,>很难确定他的真实意图。<,>as(加强)+certain(确定)→使确定→查明<,>ascertain(v.查明)/certain(adj.确定的)/certify(v.证明)

horizon<,>/həˈraɪz(ə)n/<,>/həˈraɪzən/<,>n.地平线<,>The sun was setting on the horizon.<,>太阳正在地平线上落下。<,>New opportunities appeared on the horizon.<,>新的机会出现在地平线上。<,>His knowledge broadened his horizons.<,>他的知识拓宽了他的视野。<,>hori(边界)+zon(区域)→边界区域→地平线<,>horizon(n.地平线)/horizontal(adj.水平的)/vertical(adj.垂直的)

tactics<,>/ˈtæktɪks/<,>/ˈtæktɪks/<,>n.战术/n.兵法<,>The general discussed military tactics with his officers.<,>将军与军官们讨论军事战术。<,>Their marketing tactics were very effective.<,>他们的营销策略非常有效。<,>He used clever tactics to win the debate.<,>他运用聪明的策略赢得了辩论。<,>tact(接触)+ics(学科)→接触的学科→战术<,>tactics(n.战术)/tactic(adj.战术的)/tactile(adj.触觉的)

grassy<,>/ˈɡrɑːsi/<,>/ˈɡræsi/<,>adj.草多的<,>The children played on the grassy hill.<,>孩子们在多草的山上玩耍。<,>We had a picnic in the grassy meadow.<,>我们在长满草的草地上野餐。<,>The backyard is too grassy and needs mowing.<,>后院草太多了，需要修剪。<,>grass(草)+y(形容词后缀)→多草的<,>grassy(adj.草多的)/graceful(adj.优雅的)/greedy(adj.贪婪的)

herb<,>/hɜːb/<,>/ɜːrb/<,>n.草本植物/n.香草<,>She grows various herbs in her kitchen garden.<,>她在菜园里种植各种香草。<,>This recipe calls for fresh herbs.<,>这个食谱需要新鲜的香草。<,>Many herbs have medicinal properties.<,>许多草本植物具有药用价值。<,>her(她)+b(谐音"把")→她把香草种在花园里<,>herb(n.香草)/herd(n.兽群)/herald(n.先驱)
groove<,>/ɡruːv/<,>/ɡruv/<,>n.槽<,>The carpenter cut a groove into the wood.<,>木匠在木头上切了一个槽。<,>The record needle fits into the groove of the vinyl.<,>唱针放入黑胶唱片的凹槽中。<,>Her voice had a smooth groove to it.<,>她的声音有一种流畅的韵律感。<,>groove(沟槽)与move(移动)对比记忆<,>grove(n.小树林)/grave(adj.严肃的/n.坟墓)  

manipulate<,>/məˈnɪp.jʊ.leɪt/<,>/məˈnɪp.jə.leɪt/<,>v.操作/v.操纵/v.控制<,>He knows how to manipulate the machinery.<,>他知道如何操作这台机器。<,>She felt he was trying to manipulate her emotions.<,>她感觉他在试图操纵她的情绪。<,>The magician manipulated the cards skillfully.<,>魔术师熟练地操控着纸牌。<,>mani(手)+pul(拉)+ate→用手拉动→操纵<,>manufacture(v.制造/n.产品)/manicure(n.修指甲)  

hatch<,>/hætʃ/<,>/hætʃ/<,>v.策划/v.密谋<,>The thieves hatched a plan to rob the bank.<,>小偷们密谋抢劫银行。<,>Three eggs have hatched this morning.<,>今天早上有三颗蛋孵化了。<,>They hatched a scheme to overthrow the government.<,>他们策划了一个推翻政府的阴谋。<,>hatch(孵化)与catch(抓住)对比记忆<,>patch(n.补丁)/match(n.比赛/v.匹配)  

warehouse<,>/ˈweə.haʊs/<,>/ˈwer.haʊs/<,>n.仓库/n.货栈<,>The goods are stored in a large warehouse.<,>货物储存在一个大仓库里。<,>They converted the old warehouse into apartments.<,>他们把旧仓库改造成了公寓。<,>The warehouse was destroyed by fire last night.<,>昨晚仓库被大火烧毁了。<,>ware(商品)+house(房子)→存放商品的地方→仓库<,>greenhouse(n.温室)/storehouse(n.宝库)  

cruelty<,>/ˈkruː.əl.ti/<,>/ˈkruː.əl.ti/<,>n.残酷/n.残酷行为<,>The cruelty of war affected him deeply.<,>战争的残酷深深影响了他。<,>Animal cruelty is punishable by law.<,>虐待动物会受到法律惩罚。<,>She couldn't bear the cruelty in his words.<,>她无法忍受他话语中的残忍。<,>cruel(残酷的)+ty(名词后缀)→残酷行为<,>loyalty(n.忠诚)/novelty(n.新奇)  

napkin<,>/ˈnæp.kɪn/<,>/ˈnæp.kɪn/<,>n.餐巾/n.餐巾纸<,>She folded the napkin into a swan shape.<,>她把餐巾折成了天鹅形状。<,>Please put your napkin on your lap.<,>请把餐巾放在膝盖上。<,>He wiped his mouth with a paper napkin.<,>他用纸巾擦了擦嘴。<,>nap(小睡)+kin(小)→小憩时用的布→餐巾<,>handkerchief(n.手帕)/tissue(n.纸巾)  

participate<,>/pɑːˈtɪs.ɪ.peɪt/<,>/pɑːrˈtɪs.ə.peɪt/<,>v.参与<,>All students are encouraged to participate in the discussion.<,>鼓励所有学生参与讨论。<,>She participated in the marathon last year.<,>她去年参加了马拉松比赛。<,>We want more people to participate in the voting.<,>我们希望更多人参与投票。<,>parti(部分)+cip(拿)+ate→拿一部分→参与<,>anticipate(v.预期)/emancipate(v.解放)  

senator<,>/ˈsen.ə.tər/<,>/ˈsen.ə.tɚ/<,>n.参议员<,>The senator gave a speech about education reform.<,>参议员发表了关于教育改革的演讲。<,>She was elected as a senator last year.<,>她去年当选为参议员。<,>The senator proposed a new environmental law.<,>这位参议员提出了一项新的环境法。<,>sen(老的)+ator(人)→元老院成员→参议员<,>senior(adj.年长的/n.上级)/junior(adj.年少的/n.下级)  

reference<,>/ˈref.ər.əns/<,>/ˈref.ɚ.əns/<,>n.参考文献/n.参照物<,>Please list all references at the end of your paper.<,>请在论文末尾列出所有参考文献。<,>He made reference to several historical events.<,>他提到了几个历史事件。<,>This book is an excellent reference for beginners.<,>这本书是初学者的优秀参考书。<,>refer(参考)+ence(名词后缀)→参考文献<,>preference(n.偏爱)/conference(n.会议)  

participant<,>/pɑːˈtɪs.ɪ.pənt/<,>/pɑːrˈtɪs.ə.pənt/<,>n.参加者<,>All participants will receive a certificate.<,>所有参加者都将获得证书。<,>She was an active participant in the workshop.<,>她是研讨会的积极参与者。<,>The study had over 100 participants.<,>这项研究有100多名参与者。<,>participate(参与)去e加ant→参与者<,>contestant(n.参赛者)/attendant(n.服务员)
spectator<,>/spekˈteɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈspekteɪtər/<,>n.参观者/n.观众<,>The spectators cheered loudly when the team scored a goal.<,>当球队进球时，观众们大声欢呼。<,>Thousands of spectators gathered to watch the parade.<,>数千名观众聚集观看游行。<,>He was just a spectator, not a participant in the event.<,>他只是个旁观者，没有参与活动。<,>spect(看)+ator(人)→观看的人→观众<,>spectacle(n.景象)/spectrum(n.光谱)/inspect(v.检查)

parameter<,>/pəˈræmɪtə(r)/<,>/pəˈræmɪtər/<,>n.参数/n.参量<,>We need to define the parameters of the experiment before we start.<,>我们需要在开始前确定实验的参数。<,>The software allows you to adjust various parameters.<,>这个软件允许你调整各种参数。<,>These are the key parameters that affect the system's performance.<,>这些是影响系统性能的关键参数。<,>para(旁边)+meter(测量)→在旁边测量的量→参数<,>perimeter(n.周长)/diameter(n.直径)/thermometer(n.温度计)

recipe<,>/ˈresəpi/<,>/ˈrɛsəpi/<,>n.菜谱/n.烹饪法<,>This recipe for chocolate cake is my grandmother's secret.<,>这个巧克力蛋糕的食谱是我祖母的秘密。<,>I found a great recipe for vegetarian lasagna online.<,>我在网上找到一个很棒的素食千层面食谱。<,>Follow the recipe carefully to get the best results.<,>仔细按照食谱操作才能得到最佳效果。<,>re(再)+cipe(拿)→再次拿取(食材)→食谱<,>receipt(n.收据)/recipient(n.接受者)/reciprocal(adj.相互的)

assumption<,>/əˈsʌmpʃn/<,>/əˈsʌmpʃən/<,>n.假定<,>His argument is based on a false assumption.<,>他的论点基于一个错误的假设。<,>We're working on the assumption that the project will be approved.<,>我们正在假设项目会被批准的情况下工作。<,>Don't make assumptions about people before you get to know them.<,>在了解别人之前不要妄下结论。<,>as(强调)+sumpt(拿)+ion→拿来的想法→假定<,>presumption(n.假定)/consumption(n.消耗)/resumption(n.恢复)

rule<,>/ruːl/<,>/rul/<,>v.裁决/v.裁定<,>The judge will rule on the case next week.<,>法官将在下周对此案作出裁决。<,>The court ruled that the law was unconstitutional.<,>法院裁定该法律违宪。<,>The referee ruled that it was a foul.<,>裁判判定这是一个犯规。<,>rul(统治)+e→做出统治性的决定→裁定<,>ruler(n.统治者)/regulation(n.规章)/overrule(v.否决)

substance<,>/ˈsʌbstəns/<,>/ˈsʌbstəns/<,>n.内容/n.本旨/n.财产<,>The substance of his argument was quite convincing.<,>他论点的实质内容相当有说服力。<,>This chemical substance is highly toxic.<,>这种化学物质有剧毒。<,>He inherited a considerable substance from his uncle.<,>他从叔叔那里继承了一大笔财产。<,>sub(下面)+stance(站立)→站在下面的东西→实质<,>substantial(adj.大量的)/substantiate(v.证实)/substantive(adj.实质的)

friction<,>/ˈfrɪkʃn/<,>/ˈfrɪkʃən/<,>n.摩擦<,>There was some friction between the two departments.<,>两个部门之间有些摩擦。<,>Oil reduces friction in the engine.<,>机油减少发动机的摩擦。<,>The constant friction caused the rope to wear out.<,>持续的摩擦使绳子磨损了。<,>frict(摩擦)+ion→摩擦<,>fraction(n.分数)/fiction(n.小说)/fracture(n.骨折)

sermon<,>/ˈsɜːmən/<,>/ˈsɜːrmən/<,>n.布道/n.讲道/n.说教<,>The priest delivered a powerful sermon on forgiveness.<,>牧师做了一个关于宽恕的有力布道。<,>I don't need another sermon about how I should live my life.<,>我不需要别人再来教导我该如何生活。<,>His speech turned into a long sermon about morality.<,>他的演讲变成了关于道德的冗长说教。<,>serm(说)+on→说教<,>serious(adj.严肃的)/serum(n.血清)/serenade(n.小夜曲)

absent<,>/ˈæbsənt/<,>/ˈæbsənt/<,>adj.不在的<,>She was absent from school yesterday due to illness.<,>她昨天因病没来上学。<,>An absent look on his face suggested he wasn't listening.<,>他脸上心不在焉的表情表明他没在听。<,>The absent father finally returned after ten years.<,>离家十年的父亲终于回来了。<,>ab(离开)+sent(存在)→离开存在→不在的<,>present(adj.在场的)/consent(v.同意)/dissent(v.不同意)

disagreement<,>/ˌdɪsəˈɡriːmənt/<,>/ˌdɪsəˈɡrimənt/<,>n.争论/n.不一致<,>There was a disagreement about how to spend the money.<,>关于如何使用这笔钱存在分歧。<,>The disagreement between the two scientists lasted for years.<,>两位科学家之间的分歧持续了多年。<,>We had a minor disagreement but quickly resolved it.<,>我们有些小争执，但很快解决了。<,>dis(不)+agree(同意)+ment→不同意→分歧<,>agreement(n.协议)/disapproval(n.不赞成)/discontent(n.不满)
awkward<,>/ˈɔːkwəd/<,>/ˈɔːkwərd/<,>adj.令人尴尬的<,>He felt awkward at the party because he didn't know anyone.<,>他在聚会上感到尴尬，因为他不认识任何人。<,>There was an awkward silence after she made that comment.<,>她发表那个评论后，出现了一阵尴尬的沉默。<,>It's awkward to walk in these new shoes.<,>穿这双新鞋走路很不舒服。<,>awk(笨拙的)+ward(方向)→朝笨拙的方向→尴尬的<,>backward(adj.向后的)/forward(adj.向前的)/wayward(adj.任性的)

immortal<,>/ɪˈmɔːtl/<,>/ɪˈmɔːrtl/<,>adj.不朽的/adj.永生的<,>The ancient Greeks believed their gods were immortal.<,>古希腊人相信他们的神是永生的。<,>His contributions to science made him immortal in history.<,>他对科学的贡献使他在历史上不朽。<,>The vampire in the story is immortal and never ages.<,>故事中的吸血鬼是永生的，永远不会变老。<,>im(不)+mortal(会死的)→不会死的→不朽的<,>mortal(adj.终有一死的)/immoral(adj.不道德的)/immobile(adj.不动的)

wretched<,>/ˈretʃɪd/<,>/ˈretʃɪd/<,>adj.不幸的<,>The wretched man lost everything in the fire.<,>那个不幸的男人在火灾中失去了一切。<,>She felt wretched after hearing the bad news.<,>听到这个坏消息后，她感到非常难过。<,>They lived in wretched conditions in the slums.<,>他们在贫民窟里过着悲惨的生活。<,>wretch(可怜的人)+ed(形容词后缀)→可怜的→不幸的<,>wreak(v.造成破坏)/wrench(n.扳手)/wrestle(v.摔跤)

misfortune<,>/ˌmɪsˈfɔːtʃuːn/<,>/ˌmɪsˈfɔːrtʃən/<,>n.不幸/n.灾祸/n.灾难<,>It was a great misfortune that he lost his job.<,>他丢了工作，真是很大的不幸。<,>The earthquake brought misfortune to the whole region.<,>地震给整个地区带来了灾难。<,>She bore her misfortunes with great courage.<,>她以极大的勇气承受着不幸。<,>mis(坏的)+fortune(运气)→坏运气→不幸<,>misfire(v.不发火)/misgiving(n.疑虑)/mislead(v.误导)

incompatible<,>/ˌɪnkəmˈpætəbl/<,>/ˌɪnkəmˈpætəbl/<,>adj.不相容的<,>Their personalities are completely incompatible.<,>他们的性格完全不相容。<,>This software is incompatible with your operating system.<,>这个软件与你的操作系统不兼容。<,>His views are incompatible with the company's policies.<,>他的观点与公司的政策相冲突。<,>in(不)+compatible(兼容的)→不兼容的→不相容的<,>incompetent(adj.无能力的)/incomplete(adj.不完整的)/inconvenient(adj.不方便的)

instability<,>/ˌɪnstəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌɪnstəˈbɪləti/<,>n.不稳定性<,>Political instability affected the country's economy.<,>政治不稳定影响了该国的经济。<,>The chemical shows instability at high temperatures.<,>这种化学品在高温下表现出不稳定性。<,>Emotional instability can affect personal relationships.<,>情绪不稳定会影响人际关系。<,>in(不)+stability(稳定性)→不稳定性<,>inability(n.无能)/insanity(n.精神错乱)/inflexibility(n.不灵活性)

incomplete<,>/ˌɪnkəmˈpliːt/<,>/ˌɪnkəmˈpliːt/<,>adj.不完全的/adj.未完成的<,>The report is still incomplete and needs more work.<,>这份报告还不完整，需要更多工作。<,>His collection of stamps is incomplete without this rare one.<,>没有这张稀有邮票，他的邮票收藏就不完整。<,>The puzzle remains incomplete with one missing piece.<,>缺了一块，拼图还没完成。<,>in(不)+complete(完整的)→不完整的→未完成的<,>incompetent(adj.无能力的)/inconvenient(adj.不方便的)/inconsistent(adj.不一致的)

stuffy<,>/ˈstʌfi/<,>/ˈstʌfi/<,>adj.不透气的/adj.闷热的<,>The room was stuffy with all the windows closed.<,>窗户都关着，房间里很闷热。<,>I feel stuffy in this formal suit.<,>穿着这套正装，我感到很闷热。<,>The stuffy air in the subway made her dizzy.<,>地铁里闷热的空气让她头晕。<,>stuff(填塞)+y(形容词后缀)→塞满的→不透气的<,>stuffy(adj.闷热的)/fluffy(adj.蓬松的)/scruffy(adj.邋遢的)

opaque<,>/əʊˈpeɪk/<,>/oʊˈpeɪk/<,>adj.不透明的<,>The bathroom window is made of opaque glass.<,>浴室的窗户是用不透明的玻璃做的。<,>Her explanation was opaque and hard to understand.<,>她的解释晦涩难懂。<,>The liquid turned opaque when mixed with the powder.<,>这种液体与粉末混合后变得不透明。<,>opa(不透明)+que→不透明的<,>opaque(adj.不透明的)/opalescent(adj.乳白色的)/opine(v.认为)

improper<,>/ɪmˈprɒpə(r)/<,>/ɪmˈprɑːpər/<,>adj.不适当的/adj.不合理的<,>It would be improper to discuss this matter here.<,>在这里讨论这件事是不合适的。<,>He was fired for improper conduct at work.<,>他因工作中的不当行为被解雇。<,>The judge ruled the evidence was improperly obtained.<,>法官裁定证据获取方式不当。<,>im(不)+proper(适当的)→不适当的→不合理的<,>improve(v.改进)/impose(v.强加)/imprison(v.监禁)
dissatisfaction<,>/ˌdɪsˌsætɪsˈfækʃn/<,>/ˌdɪsˌsætɪsˈfækʃn/<,>n.不满/n.不平<,>There was widespread dissatisfaction with the government's policies.<,>民众对政府的政策普遍不满。<,>His dissatisfaction with the service led him to complain.<,>他对服务的不满促使他投诉。<,>She expressed her dissatisfaction with the results.<,>她对结果表示不满。<,>dis(否定)+satisfaction(满意)→不满<,>satisfaction(n.满意)/dissatisfied(adj.不满的)  

watertight<,>/ˈwɔːtətaɪt/<,>/ˈwɔːtərtaɪt/<,>adj.不漏水的/adj.防水的<,>The boat has a watertight compartment to prevent sinking.<,>这艘船有一个防水舱以防止沉没。<,>Make sure the container is watertight before storing liquids.<,>储存液体前确保容器是防水的。<,>The contract was watertight, leaving no loopholes.<,>合同滴水不漏，没有留下任何漏洞。<,>water(水)+tight(紧密的)→防水的<,>airtight(adj.密封的)/lighttight(adj.不透光的)  

inevitably<,>/ɪnˈevɪtəbli/<,>/ɪnˈevɪtəbli/<,>adv.不可避免地<,>If you don't study, you will inevitably fail the exam.<,>如果你不学习，你不可避免地会考试不及格。<,>Technological progress inevitably changes the way we live.<,>技术进步不可避免地改变了我们的生活方式。<,>With age, memory loss inevitably occurs.<,>随着年龄增长，记忆力不可避免地会下降。<,>in(不)+evitable(可避免的)+ly(副词后缀)→不可避免地<,>evitable(adj.可避免的)/inevitable(adj.不可避免的)  

irrespective<,>/ˌɪrɪˈspektɪv/<,>/ˌɪrɪˈspektɪv/<,>adj.不考虑的/adj.不顾的<,>The law applies to everyone, irrespective of their status.<,>法律适用于所有人，不论其地位如何。<,>He continued his work irrespective of the noise around him.<,>他不顾周围的噪音继续工作。<,>The policy is implemented irrespective of public opinion.<,>这项政策不顾公众意见就实施了。<,>ir(不)+respective(相关的)→不考虑的<,>respective(adj.各自的)/irresponsible(adj.不负责任的)  

inaccurate<,>/ɪnˈækjərət/<,>/ɪnˈækjərət/<,>adj.不精密的/adj.不准确的<,>The report was criticized for being inaccurate.<,>这份报告因不准确而受到批评。<,>His watch is inaccurate and always runs slow.<,>他的手表不准确，总是走得慢。<,>The measurements were inaccurate, leading to errors in the experiment.<,>测量不精确导致实验出错。<,>in(不)+accurate(精确的)→不精确的<,>accurate(adj.精确的)/inadequacy(n.不充分)  

unreasonable<,>/ʌnˈriːznəbl/<,>/ʌnˈriːznəbl/<,>adj.不讲道理的/adj.过高的<,>It's unreasonable to expect him to finish the work in one day.<,>期望他一天内完成工作是不合理的。<,>The landlord charged an unreasonable rent for the apartment.<,>房东对这套公寓收取了过高的租金。<,>She was being unreasonable when she refused to listen to any explanations.<,>她拒绝听任何解释时是不讲道理的。<,>un(不)+reasonable(合理的)→不合理的<,>reasonable(adj.合理的)/unreasonably(adv.不合理地)  

undesirable<,>/ˌʌndɪˈzaɪərəbl/<,>/ˌʌndɪˈzaɪrəbl/<,>adj.不合需要的/adj.讨厌的<,>Smoking is an undesirable habit that should be avoided.<,>吸烟是一个应该避免的不良习惯。<,>The neighborhood has a reputation for being undesirable.<,>这个社区以环境不佳而闻名。<,>The job had many undesirable aspects, such as long hours and low pay.<,>这份工作有许多不如意的地方，比如工作时间长和工资低。<,>un(不)+desirable(合意的)→不合需要的<,>desirable(adj.合意的)/undesired(adj.不希望得到的)  

unfit<,>/ʌnˈfɪt/<,>/ʌnˈfɪt/<,>adj.不合适的/adj.无能力的<,>He was declared unfit for military service due to his health.<,>他因健康问题被宣布不适合服兵役。<,>The food was unfit for human consumption.<,>这种食物不适合人类食用。<,>She felt unfit to take on such a big responsibility.<,>她觉得自己无力承担这么大的责任。<,>un(不)+fit(合适的)→不合适的<,>fit(adj.合适的)/unfitness(n.不适当)  

absurd<,>/əbˈsɜːd/<,>/əbˈsɜːrd/<,>adj.不合理的/adj.荒唐的<,>It's absurd to think that the earth is flat.<,>认为地球是平的这种想法很荒唐。<,>His absurd behavior embarrassed everyone at the party.<,>他荒唐的行为让派对上的每个人都感到尴尬。<,>The idea of building a house without a foundation is absurd.<,>没有地基就建房子的想法是荒谬的。<,>ab(离开)+surd(理性的)→不合理的<,>surd(adj.不合理的)/absurdity(n.荒谬)  

irregularity<,>/ɪˌreɡjəˈlærəti/<,>/ɪˌreɡjəˈlærəti/<,>n.不规则/n.不整齐<,>The doctor noticed an irregularity in her heartbeat.<,>医生注意到她的心跳不规则。<,>There were irregularities in the way the election was conducted.<,>选举进行的方式有不规范之处。<,>The surface of the moon is marked by many irregularities.<,>月球表面有许多不规则的地形。<,>ir(不)+regularity(规则性)→不规则<,>regularity(n.规则性)/irregular(adj.不规则的)
disregard<,>/ˌdɪsrɪˈɡɑːd/<,>/ˌdɪsrɪˈɡɑːrd/<,>v.不管/v.不顾/n.忽视<,>He disregarded the warning and went ahead with his plan.<,>他不顾警告，继续执行他的计划。<,>Her disregard for the rules got her into trouble.<,>她对规则的忽视给她带来了麻烦。<,>They showed complete disregard for the safety of others.<,>他们完全无视他人的安全。<,>dis(否定)+regard(关心)→不关心→忽视<,>regard(v.关心/n.注意)/discard(v.丢弃/n.抛弃)

uncertain<,>/ʌnˈsɜːtn/<,>/ʌnˈsɜːrtn/<,>adj.不定的/adj.无常的<,>The weather forecast is uncertain for tomorrow.<,>明天的天气预报不确定。<,>She felt uncertain about her future.<,>她对未来感到不确定。<,>His uncertain temper made him difficult to work with.<,>他反复无常的脾气使他难以共事。<,>un(否定)+certain(确定的)→不确定的<,>certain(adj.确定的)/uncertainty(n.不确定性)

impurity<,>/ɪmˈpjʊərəti/<,>/ɪmˈpjʊrəti/<,>n.杂质/n.不纯<,>The water was tested for impurities.<,>水被检测是否有杂质。<,>The impurity in the metal caused it to weaken.<,>金属中的杂质使其变弱。<,>She was shocked by the impurity of his motives.<,>她对他动机的不纯感到震惊。<,>im(否定)+purity(纯净)→不纯净<,>purity(n.纯净)/impure(adj.不纯的)

inadequate<,>/ɪnˈædɪkwət/<,>/ɪnˈædɪkwət/<,>adj.不充足的/adj.不适当的<,>The food supply was inadequate for the number of refugees.<,>食物供应不足以满足难民的数量。<,>His explanation was inadequate and left many questions unanswered.<,>他的解释不充分，留下了许多未解答的问题。<,>She felt inadequate compared to her more experienced colleagues.<,>与更有经验的同事相比，她感到力不从心。<,>in(否定)+adequate(充足的)→不充足的<,>adequate(adj.充足的)/inadequacy(n.不充分)

invariably<,>/ɪnˈveəriəbli/<,>/ɪnˈveriəbli/<,>adv.不变地/adv.永恒地<,>He invariably arrives late to meetings.<,>他开会总是迟到。<,>The results are invariably the same.<,>结果总是一样的。<,>She is invariably cheerful in the morning.<,>她早上总是很开朗。<,>in(否定)+vary(变化)+ably(能…地)→不变地<,>variable(adj.可变的)/invariable(adj.不变的)

uneasy<,>/ʌnˈiːzi/<,>/ʌnˈiːzi/<,>adj.不安的/adj.拘束的<,>He felt uneasy about the decision.<,>他对这个决定感到不安。<,>There was an uneasy silence in the room.<,>房间里有一种令人不安的沉默。<,>She gave an uneasy laugh.<,>她勉强笑了笑。<,>un(否定)+easy(轻松的)→不轻松的→不安的<,>easy(adj.轻松的)/uneasiness(n.不安)

mammal<,>/ˈmæml/<,>/ˈmæml/<,>n.哺乳动物<,>Humans are mammals.<,>人类是哺乳动物。<,>Whales are the largest mammals in the ocean.<,>鲸鱼是海洋中最大的哺乳动物。<,>The zoo has a special exhibit on nocturnal mammals.<,>动物园有一个关于夜行性哺乳动物的特别展览。<,>mamma(乳房)+al(…的)→哺乳动物<,>mammary(adj.乳房的)/marsupial(n.有袋动物)

supplement<,>/ˈsʌplɪmənt/<,>/ˈsʌplɪmənt/<,>n.补角<,>The two angles are supplements of each other.<,>这两个角互为补角。<,>A 120-degree angle and a 60-degree angle are supplements.<,>120度的角和60度的角互为补角。<,>In geometry, supplementary angles add up to 180 degrees.<,>在几何中，补角相加等于180度。<,>supple(补充)+ment(名词后缀)→补角<,>complement(n.补角)/supplementary(adj.补充的)

complement<,>/ˈkɒmplɪmənt/<,>/ˈkɑːmplɪmənt/<,>v.补充/n.补足（物）<,>The wine complements the meal perfectly.<,>这酒完美地搭配了这顿饭。<,>The team needs players who complement each other's skills.<,>球队需要技能互补的球员。<,>This scarf is a perfect complement to your outfit.<,>这条围巾是你服装的完美搭配。<,>com(完全)+ple(填满)+ment(名词后缀)→补足<,>supplement(n.补充)/compliment(n.赞美)

compensation<,>/ˌkɒmpenˈseɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmpenˈseɪʃn/<,>n.补偿/n.赔偿/n.赔偿费<,>He received compensation for his injuries.<,>他因受伤获得了赔偿。<,>The company offered financial compensation to the affected customers.<,>公司向受影响的顾客提供了经济补偿。<,>No amount of money can be adequate compensation for the loss of a loved one.<,>再多的钱也无法充分补偿失去亲人的痛苦。<,>com(一起)+pens(支付)+ation(名词后缀)→补偿<,>pension(n.养老金)/recompense(n.报酬)
humanitarian<,>/hjuːˌmænɪˈteəriən/<,>/hjuːˌmænɪˈteriən/<,>adj.博爱的/n.慈善家<,>She works for a humanitarian organization.<,>她为一家慈善机构工作。<,>His humanitarian efforts saved many lives.<,>他的人道主义努力挽救了许多生命。<,>The humanitarian was awarded for his contributions.<,>这位慈善家因其贡献而获奖。<,>human(人)+itarian(…的)→关心人的→博爱的<,>humanity(n.人类/n.人性)/humane(adj.人道的/adj.仁慈的)  

barge<,>/bɑːdʒ/<,>/bɑːrdʒ/<,>n.驳船/n.大型游船<,>The goods were transported by barge.<,>货物是用驳船运输的。<,>They took a barge down the river.<,>他们乘游船顺流而下。<,>The wedding party rented a barge for the celebration.<,>婚礼派对租了一艘游船庆祝。<,>bar(棒)+ge→用棒撑的船→驳船<,>bargain(n.交易/v.讨价还价)/bark(n.树皮/v.吠叫)  

fluctuation<,>/ˌflʌktʃuˈeɪʃn/<,>/ˌflʌktʃuˈeɪʃn/<,>n.波动<,>There was a fluctuation in temperature yesterday.<,>昨天温度有波动。<,>The stock market is subject to fluctuation.<,>股市容易波动。<,>Currency fluctuations affect international trade.<,>货币波动影响国际贸易。<,>flu(流)+ctu+ation→流动→波动<,>fluctuate(v.波动)/fluke(n.侥幸/n.鲸尾叶突)  

fluctuate<,>/ˈflʌktʃueɪt/<,>/ˈflʌktʃueɪt/<,>v.波动/v.使波动<,>Prices fluctuate depending on the season.<,>价格随季节波动。<,>Her mood fluctuates throughout the day.<,>她的情绪一天中不断变化。<,>The water level fluctuates with the tide.<,>水位随潮汐波动。<,>flu(流)+ctu+ate→流动→波动<,>fluctuation(n.波动)/fluster(v.使慌乱/n.慌乱)  

invalid<,>/ˈɪnvəlɪd/<,>/ˈɪnvəlɪd/<,>n.病人<,>The invalid needs constant care.<,>这位病人需要持续照料。<,>He became an invalid after the accident.<,>事故后他成了病人。<,>The hospital has a special ward for invalids.<,>医院有专门的病人病房。<,>in(不)+valid(有效的)→无效的→病人<,>invalid(adj.无效的)/invalidity(n.无效/n.病弱)  

ward<,>/wɔːd/<,>/wɔːrd/<,>n.病房/n.病室/n.监房<,>She was moved to a private ward.<,>她被转到私人病房。<,>The prison has a high-security ward.<,>监狱有高度警戒的监房。<,>The children's ward is brightly decorated.<,>儿童病房装饰得很明亮。<,>war(战争)+d→与疾病斗争的地方→病房<,>warden(n.看守人/n.院长)/wardrobe(n.衣柜/n.行头)  

strength<,>/streŋθ/<,>/streŋθ/<,>n.兵力/n.强度<,>The army increased its strength.<,>军队增加了兵力。<,>Test the strength of the material.<,>测试材料的强度。<,>She showed great strength during the crisis.<,>她在危机中表现出巨大力量。<,>strong(强壮的)+th→强度<,>strengthen(v.加强)/length(n.长度)/width(n.宽度)  

icy<,>/ˈaɪsi/<,>/ˈaɪsi/<,>adj.冰冷的/adj.冷冰冰的<,>The road was icy after the snow.<,>雪后道路结冰了。<,>She gave him an icy stare.<,>她冷冷地瞪了他一眼。<,>The wind made my hands feel icy.<,>风让我的手感觉冰冷。<,>ice(冰)+y→冰冷的<,>icy(adj.冰冷的)/spicy(adj.辛辣的)/juicy(adj.多汁的)  

objective<,>/əbˈdʒektɪv/<,>/əbˈdʒektɪv/<,>n.目标/adj.宾格的<,>Our main objective is to win.<,>我们的主要目标是获胜。<,>Keep an objective viewpoint.<,>保持客观的观点。<,>In German, adjectives change in the objective case.<,>德语中形容词在宾格要变化。<,>object(物体)+ive→目标<,>subjective(adj.主观的)/object(n.物体/v.反对)  

villa<,>/ˈvɪlə/<,>/ˈvɪlə/<,>n.别墅<,>They rented a villa by the sea.<,>他们租了海边一栋别墅。<,>The villa has a beautiful garden.<,>这栋别墅有个漂亮的花园。<,>He inherited a villa in Tuscany.<,>他继承了托斯卡纳的一栋别墅。<,>vill(村庄)+a→像村庄的房子→别墅<,>village(n.村庄)/villain(n.恶棍/n.反派角色)
characterize<,>/ˈkærəktəraɪz/<,>/ˈkærɪktəˌraɪz/<,>v.表现…的特性<,>The novel characterizes the protagonist as a brave warrior.<,>这部小说将主角描绘成一名勇敢的战士。<,>His paintings characterize the beauty of nature.<,>他的画作展现了自然的美丽。<,>The study characterizes the behavior of wild animals.<,>这项研究描述了野生动物的行为。<,>character(特征)+ize(使…化)→使具有特征→表现特性<,>character(n.性格)/characteristic(adj.典型的)  

signify<,>/ˈsɪɡnɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈsɪɡnəˌfaɪ/<,>v.表示/意味着<,>A red light signifies danger.<,>红灯表示危险。<,>His silence signifies his disapproval.<,>他的沉默意味着不赞成。<,>This symbol signifies peace in many cultures.<,>这个符号在许多文化中象征和平。<,>sign(标记)+ify(使)→使成为标记→表示<,>signal(n.信号)/signature(n.签名)  

manifest<,>/ˈmænɪfest/<,>/ˈmænəˌfɛst/<,>v.表明/adj.明显的<,>Her joy manifested in a bright smile.<,>她的快乐通过灿烂的笑容表现出来。<,>The symptoms manifested quickly after the infection.<,>感染后症状迅速显现。<,>His talent for music is manifest.<,>他的音乐天赋是显而易见的。<,>mani(手)+fest(敲打)→用手敲打→表明<,>manifesto(n.宣言)/manipulate(v.操纵)  

seemingly<,>/ˈsiːmɪŋli/<,>/ˈsimɪŋli/<,>adv.表面上/外表上<,>Seemingly, he was calm, but inside he was nervous.<,>表面上他很冷静，但内心很紧张。<,>The problem is seemingly simple but actually complex.<,>这个问题看似简单实则复杂。<,>She was seemingly unaware of the changes.<,>她似乎没有察觉到这些变化。<,>seem(似乎)+ing+ly(副词后缀)→表面上<,>seemly(adj.得体的)/seam(n.接缝)  

superficial<,>/ˌsuːpəˈfɪʃl/<,>/ˌsupərˈfɪʃəl/<,>adj.表面的/肤浅的<,>He only has a superficial understanding of the topic.<,>他对这个话题只有肤浅的理解。<,>The wound is superficial and will heal quickly.<,>伤口很浅，很快就会愈合。<,>Their friendship was superficial at best.<,>他们的友谊充其量只是表面上的。<,>super(在…上)+fic(面)+ial→在表面上的<,>superfluous(adj.多余的)/superficies(n.表面)  

criterion<,>/kraɪˈtɪəriən/<,>/kraɪˈtɪriən/<,>n.标准/准则/尺度<,>Academic performance is not the only criterion for success.<,>学业成绩不是成功的唯一标准。<,>The criteria for selection are clearly stated.<,>选拔标准已明确说明。<,>This criterion applies to all applicants.<,>这一标准适用于所有申请者。<,>crit(判断)+erion→判断的依据→标准<,>criticize(v.批评)/critical(adj.关键的)  

norm<,>/nɔːm/<,>/nɔrm/<,>n.标准/规范/平均数<,>This behavior deviates from social norms.<,>这种行为偏离了社会规范。<,>The temperature is above the norm for this season.<,>温度高于本季的平均水平。<,>They aim to establish new industry norms.<,>他们旨在建立新的行业标准。<,>normal(正常的)去掉al→规范<,>normal(adj.正常的)/enormous(adj.巨大的)  

heading<,>/ˈhedɪŋ/<,>/ˈhɛdɪŋ/<,>n.标题/题词/题名<,>The heading of the article caught my attention.<,>文章的标题吸引了我的注意。<,>Please write your name under the heading.<,>请在标题下方写上你的名字。<,>The report has a clear heading and subheadings.<,>报告有清晰的标题和副标题。<,>head(头)+ing→文章的"头"→标题<,>headline(n.头条)/header(n.页眉)  

reason<,>/ˈriːzn/<,>/ˈrizən/<,>v.论证/推断<,>She reasoned that the plan would not work.<,>她推断这个计划行不通。<,>He reasoned his way to a solution.<,>他通过推理找到了解决方法。<,>Let me reason this out step by step.<,>让我一步步推理这个问题。<,>rea(思考)+son→思考的结果→推理<,>reasonable(adj.合理的)/treason(n.叛国罪)  

advocate<,>/ˈædvəkeɪt/<,>/ˈædvəˌkeɪt/<,>v.拥护/n.辩护律师<,>She advocates for environmental protection.<,>她倡导环境保护。<,>The lawyer served as an advocate for the defendant.<,>律师为被告担任辩护人。<,>He advocates a new approach to education.<,>他提倡一种新的教育方法。<,>ad(加强)+voc(声音)+ate→大声疾呼→拥护<,>vocal(adj.声音的)/vocabulary(n.词汇)
discrimination<,>/dɪˌskrɪmɪˈneɪʃən/<,>/dɪˌskrɪmɪˈneɪʃən/<,>n.歧视/n.辨别/n.识别力<,>Racial discrimination is illegal in many countries.<,>在许多国家，种族歧视是非法的。<,>She has a fine discrimination between good and bad art.<,>她对艺术的优劣有敏锐的辨别力。<,>His discrimination in choosing friends is excellent.<,>他选择朋友的识别力很强。<,>dis(分开)+crimin(判断)+ation→分开判断→辨别<,>discriminate(v.歧视/v.辨别)/discriminatory(adj.歧视的)/indiscriminate(adj.不加选择的)

transform<,>/trænsˈfɔːm/<,>/trænsˈfɔːrm/<,>v.变换<,>The caterpillar transformed into a butterfly.<,>毛毛虫变成了蝴蝶。<,>This experience transformed his life completely.<,>这次经历彻底改变了他的生活。<,>We need to transform our old system into a new one.<,>我们需要将旧系统改造成新系统。<,>trans(跨越)+form(形状)→改变形状→变换<,>transformation(n.转变)/reform(v.改革)/conform(v.符合)

loosen<,>/ˈluːsən/<,>/ˈluːsən/<,>v.变松<,>Can you loosen this knot for me?<,>你能帮我把这个结松开吗？<,>He loosened his tie after the meeting.<,>会议结束后他松开了领带。<,>The soil needs to be loosened before planting.<,>种植前需要把土壤松一松。<,>loose(松的)+en(使)→使变松<,>loose(adj.松的)/lose(v.丢失)/loss(n.损失)

alteration<,>/ˌɔːltəˈreɪʃən/<,>/ˌɔːltəˈreɪʃən/<,>n.变更/n.改变<,>There have been several alterations to the original plan.<,>原计划已经做了几处修改。<,>The alteration in her appearance was remarkable.<,>她外貌的改变非常明显。<,>We need to make some alterations to the contract.<,>我们需要对合同做一些修改。<,>alter(改变)+ation→改变<,>alternate(v.交替)/alternative(adj.替代的)/altar(n.祭坛)

fall<,>/fɔːl/<,>/fɔːl/<,>v.变成/v.成为/v.陷入<,>He fell ill after working too hard.<,>他工作太辛苦病倒了。<,>She fell in love with the city at first sight.<,>她对这座城市一见钟情。<,>The country fell into chaos after the revolution.<,>革命后国家陷入了混乱。<,>fall(落下)→状态的变化<,>fell(v.砍伐)/fail(v.失败)/foul(adj.肮脏的)

program<,>/ˈprəʊɡræm/<,>/ˈproʊɡræm/<,>v.编制程序<,>He programmed the computer to solve complex equations.<,>他给计算机编程以解决复杂方程。<,>She is learning how to program in Python.<,>她正在学习用Python编程。<,>The robot was programmed to perform household tasks.<,>这个机器人被编程来执行家务。<,>pro(前)+gram(写)→预先写好→编程<,>programmer(n.程序员)/diagram(n.图表)/telegram(n.电报)

edit<,>/ˈedɪt/<,>/ˈedɪt/<,>v.编辑/v.编纂/v.校订<,>She edits the school newspaper every month.<,>她每月编辑校报。<,>He spent years editing the complete works of Shakespeare.<,>他花了多年时间编纂莎士比亚全集。<,>Please edit this document before sending it out.<,>请在发送前校订这份文件。<,>e(出)+dit(给)→给出→编辑<,>editor(n.编辑)/edition(n.版本)/audit(v.审计)

verge<,>/vɜːdʒ/<,>/vɜːrdʒ/<,>n.边缘/n.边界<,>They built a fence along the verge of the property.<,>他们在房产边界建了围栏。<,>The country was on the verge of economic collapse.<,>这个国家濒临经济崩溃。<,>Wild flowers grew on the verge of the road.<,>路边长着野花。<,>verg(倾斜)+e→倾斜的边缘<,>verger(n.教堂司事)/merge(v.合并)/surge(v.汹涌)

rim<,>/rɪm/<,>/rɪm/<,>n.边/n.边缘/n.(眼镜)框<,>There was frost on the rim of the glass.<,>玻璃杯边缘有霜。<,>He adjusted the rim of his glasses.<,>他调整了眼镜框。<,>The ball hit the rim of the basket but didn't go in.<,>球碰到了篮筐边缘但没进。<,>rim(边缘)→圆形物体的边缘<,>brim(n.边缘)/trim(v.修剪)/grim(adj.严峻的)

hearth<,>/hɑːθ/<,>/hɑːrθ/<,>n.壁炉地面/n.炉边<,>The cat slept by the warm hearth.<,>猫在温暖的炉边睡觉。<,>She swept the ashes from the hearth.<,>她把壁炉地面的灰扫干净。<,>Family gatherings often took place around the hearth.<,>家庭聚会常在炉边举行。<,>heart(心)+h→家中心脏(炉边)<,>earth(n.地球)/health(n.健康)/hearty(adj.衷心的)
fireplace<,>/ˈfaɪəpleɪs/<,>/ˈfaɪərpleɪs/<,>n.壁炉<,>They gathered around the fireplace to keep warm.<,>他们围在壁炉旁取暖。<,>The old house had a beautiful stone fireplace.<,>那栋老房子有一个漂亮的石头壁炉。<,>She placed the photo on the mantel above the fireplace.<,>她把照片放在壁炉上方的壁炉架上。<,>fire(火)+place(地方)→生火的地方→壁炉<,>firewood(n. 柴火)/fireproof(adj. 防火的)  

patron<,>/ˈpeɪtrən/<,>/ˈpeɪtrɑːn/<,>n.庇护人/n.赞助人<,>The artist thanked his patron for supporting his work.<,>艺术家感谢赞助人对他的作品的支持。<,>She is a patron of the local library.<,>她是当地图书馆的赞助人。<,>In ancient times, a patron would protect their clients.<,>在古代，庇护人会保护他们的被庇护者。<,>patr(父亲)+on(人)→像父亲一样保护的人→庇护人<,>patronize(v. 光顾/v.以高人一等的态度对待)/patronage(n. 赞助/n.惠顾)  

diploma<,>/dɪˈpləʊmə/<,>/dɪˈploʊmə/<,>n.毕业文凭/n.学位证书<,>She received her diploma from the university last year.<,>她去年从大学获得了毕业证书。<,>He framed his diploma and hung it on the wall.<,>他把毕业证书装裱起来挂在墙上。<,>You need a high school diploma to apply for this job.<,>申请这份工作需要高中毕业证书。<,>di(双)+ploma(折叠)→古代对折的官方文件→文凭<,>diplomat(n. 外交官)/diplomacy(n. 外交)  

indispensable<,>/ˌɪndɪˈspensəbl/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈspensəbəl/<,>adj.必不可少的/adj.必需的<,>Water is indispensable for life.<,>水是生命不可或缺的。<,>She has become an indispensable member of the team.<,>她已成为团队中不可或缺的一员。<,>This book is an indispensable resource for students.<,>这本书是学生必不可少的资源。<,>in(不)+dispensable(可省略的)→不可省略的→必不可少的<,>dispensable(adj. 非必需的)/necessary(adj. 必要的)  

sullen<,>/ˈsʌlən/<,>/ˈsʌlən/<,>adj.绷着脸不高兴的<,>The child sat in a sullen silence after being scolded.<,>被责骂后，孩子闷闷不乐地坐着不说话。<,>He gave her a sullen look and turned away.<,>他不高兴地看了她一眼，然后转身走开。<,>The sullen sky promised rain all day.<,>阴沉的天空预示着整日有雨。<,>联想：sul(看作sulk v.生气)+len→生气的样子→闷闷不乐的<,>solemn(adj. 严肃的)/sudden(adj. 突然的)  

bandage<,>/ˈbændɪdʒ/<,>/ˈbændɪdʒ/<,>n.绷带/n.包带<,>The nurse wrapped a clean bandage around his wound.<,>护士用干净的绷带包扎了他的伤口。<,>Keep the bandage dry until the wound heals.<,>保持绷带干燥直到伤口愈合。<,>She always carries bandages in her first aid kit.<,>她的急救箱里总是带着绷带。<,>band(带子)+age(名词后缀)→绷带<,>band(n. 带子/v.用带绑扎)/bondage(n. 束缚)  

breakdown<,>/ˈbreɪkdaʊn/<,>/ˈbreɪkdaʊn/<,>n.崩溃/n.倒塌/n.失败<,>The stress caused a nervous breakdown.<,>压力导致了精神崩溃。<,>There was a breakdown in communication between the two departments.<,>两个部门之间的沟通出现了问题。<,>The car had a breakdown on the highway.<,>汽车在高速公路上抛锚了。<,>break(打破)+down(向下)→向下打破→崩溃<,>breakthrough(n. 突破)/breakout(n. 爆发)  

essence<,>/ˈesəns/<,>/ˈesəns/<,>n.本质/n.本体<,>The essence of his argument was hard to understand.<,>他论点的本质很难理解。<,>Vanilla essence is used in many desserts.<,>香草精被用于许多甜点中。<,>In essence, the two proposals are very similar.<,>本质上，这两个提议非常相似。<,>ess(存在)+ence(名词后缀)→存在的根本→本质<,>essential(adj. 必要的)/presence(n. 存在)  

captive<,>/ˈkæptɪv/<,>/ˈkæptɪv/<,>adj.被俘虏的<,>The soldiers held the enemy captive.<,>士兵们俘虏了敌人。<,>The zoo keeps animals captive in small enclosures.<,>动物园将动物关在小围栏里。<,>She held her audience captive with her storytelling.<,>她用讲故事的方式吸引住了观众。<,>capt(抓住)+ive(形容词后缀)→被抓住的→被俘虏的<,>capture(v. 捕获/n.战利品)/captivate(v. 迷住)  

reverse<,>/rɪˈvɜːs/<,>/rɪˈvɜːrs/<,>n.背面/n.反面<,>Write your name on the reverse side of the paper.<,>把你的名字写在纸的背面。<,>The coin landed on the reverse side.<,>硬币反面朝上落地。<,>His actions were the reverse of what he promised.<,>他的行为与他承诺的相反。<,>re(回)+verse(转)→转回去→反面<,>reverse(v. 逆转/adj.相反的)/revert(v. 恢复)
deviation<,>/ˌdiːviˈeɪʃən/<,>/ˌdiviˈeɪʃən/<,>n.背离/n.偏离/n.偏差<,>Any deviation from the rules will be punished.<,>任何违反规则的行为都将受到惩罚。<,>The data shows a significant deviation from the expected results.<,>数据显示与预期结果有显著偏差。<,>His behavior was a deviation from his usual character.<,>他的行为与他平时的性格不符。<,>de(离开)+via(路)+tion→偏离道路→偏差<,>divert(v.转移)/deviate(v.偏离)/variation(n.变化)

arctic<,>/ˈɑːktɪk/<,>/ˈɑːrktɪk/<,>adj.北极的/n.北极<,>The Arctic region is experiencing rapid climate change.<,>北极地区正在经历快速的气候变化。<,>Polar bears are native to the Arctic.<,>北极熊原产于北极地区。<,>They embarked on an expedition to the Arctic.<,>他们开始了北极探险之旅。<,>arc(弧形)+tic→北极地区在地图上呈弧形<,>antarctic(adj.南极的/n.南极)/arctic fox(北极狐)/Arctic Circle(北极圈)

tragic<,>/ˈtrædʒɪk/<,>/ˈtrædʒɪk/<,>adj.悲惨的/adj.悲剧的<,>It was a tragic accident that claimed many lives.<,>这是一场夺去许多人生命的悲惨事故。<,>He played the tragic hero in the play.<,>他在剧中扮演悲剧英雄。<,>The story had a tragic ending.<,>这个故事有一个悲惨的结局。<,>trag(悲剧)+ic→悲剧的<,>comic(adj.喜剧的)/magic(n.魔术)/logic(n.逻辑)

woe<,>/wəʊ/<,>/woʊ/<,>n.悲哀/n.悲痛/n.苦恼<,>She told him all her woes.<,>她向他倾诉了所有的苦恼。<,>Woe betide anyone who breaks the rules.<,>违反规则的人将遭殃。<,>His face was full of woe.<,>他满脸愁容。<,>发音类似"喔"，表示感叹痛苦<,>woeful(adj.悲伤的)/toe(n.脚趾)/roe(n.鱼卵)

grief<,>/ɡriːf/<,>/ɡrif/<,>n.悲哀/n.悲痛/n.悲伤<,>She was overcome with grief at the news.<,>听到这个消息她悲痛欲绝。<,>Time heals all griefs.<,>时间能治愈一切悲伤。<,>He expressed his grief through poetry.<,>他用诗歌表达悲伤。<,>g(哥)+rief(rief看作relief的简写)→哥哥需要安慰→悲伤<,>brief(adj.简短的)/relief(n.缓解)/thief(n.小偷)

firework<,>/ˈfaɪəwɜːk/<,>/ˈfaɪrwɜːrk/<,>n.爆竹/n.花炮/n.烟火<,>The fireworks display was spectacular.<,>烟花表演非常壮观。<,>Children love playing with fireworks during festivals.<,>孩子们喜欢在节日期间玩爆竹。<,>The sky was lit up by colorful fireworks.<,>天空被五彩缤纷的烟火照亮。<,>fire(火)+work(作品)→火的作品→烟火<,>firewall(n.防火墙)/fireplace(n.壁炉)/firefighter(n.消防员)

storm<,>/stɔːm/<,>/stɔːrm/<,>n.爆发/v.猛攻<,>A violent storm hit the coastal area.<,>猛烈的风暴袭击了沿海地区。<,>The protesters stormed the government building.<,>抗议者猛攻政府大楼。<,>He stormed out of the room in anger.<,>他愤怒地冲出了房间。<,>st(街道)+orm(看作arm武器)→街上武装→猛攻<,>store(n.商店)/story(n.故事)/stomach(n.胃)

tyranny<,>/ˈtɪrəni/<,>/ˈtɪrəni/<,>n.暴政/n.专制/n.残暴<,>The people revolted against the king's tyranny.<,>人民反抗国王的暴政。<,>Tyranny often leads to rebellion.<,>专制常常导致反抗。<,>He ruled the country with tyranny for decades.<,>他用暴政统治这个国家数十年。<,>tyr(暴君)+anny→暴君的统治→暴政<,>tyrant(n.暴君)/typhoon(n.台风)/tycoon(n.大亨)

wrath<,>/rɒθ/<,>/ræθ/<,>n.暴怒/n.狂怒/n.愤慨<,>He feared the wrath of his father.<,>他害怕父亲的暴怒。<,>The gods unleashed their wrath upon the city.<,>众神对这座城市发泄了他们的愤怒。<,>Her wrath was terrible to behold.<,>她的愤怒令人害怕。<,>wr(看作wrong错误)+ath(看作anger愤怒)→因错误而愤怒→暴怒<,>wreath(n.花环)/wrest(v.扭夺)/wring(v.拧)

tyrant<,>/ˈtaɪrənt/<,>/ˈtaɪrənt/<,>n.暴君/n.专制君主<,>The tyrant was overthrown by the people.<,>暴君被人民推翻了。<,>He ruled like a tyrant, showing no mercy.<,>他像暴君一样统治，毫不留情。<,>History remembers him as a cruel tyrant.<,>历史将他铭记为残酷的暴君。<,>tyr(暴政)+ant(人)→实施暴政的人→暴君<,>tyranny(n.暴政)/tycoon(n.大亨)/typhoon(n.台风)
panther<,>/ˈpænθə(r)/<,>/ˈpænθər/<,>n.豹/n.黑豹/n.美洲狮<,>The panther moved silently through the jungle.<,>黑豹悄无声息地穿过丛林。<,>He saw a panther at the zoo yesterday.<,>他昨天在动物园看到了一只美洲狮。<,>The black panther is a symbol of strength and courage.<,>黑豹是力量和勇气的象征。<,>pan(全部)+ther(野兽)→所有野兽的代表→豹<,>leopard(n.豹)/tiger(n.老虎)/lion(n.狮子)

leopard<,>/ˈlepəd/<,>/ˈlepərd/<,>n.豹<,>The leopard can't change its spots.<,>豹子改不了斑点(本性难移)。<,>A leopard was spotted near the village.<,>有人在村子附近发现了一只豹子。<,>The leopard's coat provides excellent camouflage.<,>豹子的皮毛提供了极好的伪装。<,>leo(狮子)+pard(豹)→狮豹→豹<,>panther(n.黑豹)/cheetah(n.猎豹)/jaguar(n.美洲豹)

grumble<,>/ˈɡrʌmbl/<,>/ˈɡrʌmbəl/<,>v.抱怨/v.发牢骚<,>He's always grumbling about the weather.<,>他总是抱怨天气。<,>Don't grumble, just get on with your work.<,>别发牢骚了，继续工作吧。<,>I heard someone grumbling in the next room.<,>我听到隔壁房间有人在抱怨。<,>grum(低沉的声音)+ble→发出低沉不满的声音→抱怨<,>mumble(v.含糊地说)/rumble(v.发出隆隆声)/growl(v.咆哮)

announce<,>/əˈnaʊns/<,>/əˈnaʊns/<,>v.报告...的来到<,>They announced the arrival of the president.<,>他们宣布总统的到来。<,>The loudspeaker announced the next train.<,>广播宣布了下一班火车。<,>She announced her engagement to everyone.<,>她向大家宣布了她的订婚消息。<,>an(向)+nounce(报告)→向...报告→宣布<,>denounce(v.谴责)/pronounce(v.发音)/renounce(v.放弃)

vengeance<,>/ˈvendʒəns/<,>/ˈvendʒəns/<,>n.报复/n.报仇/n.复仇<,>He swore vengeance against his enemies.<,>他发誓要向敌人复仇。<,>The movie is about a man seeking vengeance.<,>这部电影讲述了一个寻求复仇的人。<,>She took vengeance on those who wronged her.<,>她向那些冤枉她的人报复。<,>venge(复仇)+ance(名词后缀)→复仇<,>revenge(n.报复)/avenge(v.报仇)/vengeful(adj.复仇的)

fortress<,>/ˈfɔːtrəs/<,>/ˈfɔːrtrəs/<,>n.堡垒/n.要塞<,>The ancient fortress stood on the hill.<,>古老的堡垒矗立在山丘上。<,>They retreated to the fortress for safety.<,>他们撤退到要塞寻求安全。<,>The fortress was impregnable to enemy attacks.<,>这座堡垒对敌人的进攻坚不可摧。<,>fort(强)+ress(地方)→坚固的地方→堡垒<,>fort(n.堡垒)/fortify(v.加强)/fortitude(n.坚韧)

assurance<,>/əˈʃʊərəns/<,>/əˈʃʊrəns/<,>n.保证<,>He gave me his personal assurance.<,>他向我做了个人保证。<,>The company provides quality assurance.<,>公司提供质量保证。<,>She spoke with complete assurance.<,>她说话时充满自信。<,>as(向)+sure(确定)+ance→向...确定→保证<,>insurance(n.保险)/reassurance(n.安慰)/ensure(v.确保)

fuse<,>/fjuːz/<,>/fjuːz/<,>n.保险丝/n.导火线<,>The fuse blew when I turned on the heater.<,>我打开加热器时保险丝烧断了。<,>They lit the fuse and ran away.<,>他们点燃导火线后跑开了。<,>Check the fuse box if the power goes out.<,>如果断电了，检查一下保险丝盒。<,>fus(流)+e→电流流过的装置→保险丝<,>confuse(v.混淆)/diffuse(v.扩散)/refuse(v.拒绝)

reservation<,>/ˌrezəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌrezərˈveɪʃn/<,>n.预定/n.预订/n.保留意见<,>I made a reservation at the restaurant.<,>我在餐厅预订了位置。<,>She has some reservations about the plan.<,>她对这项计划有些保留意见。<,>Do you have a hotel reservation?<,>你预订酒店了吗？<,>re(再)+serve(保留)+ation→再次保留→预订<,>conservation(n.保护)/preservation(n.保存)/observation(n.观察)
