interfere<,>/ˌɪntəˈfɪə(r)/<,>/ˌɪntərˈfɪr/<,>vi.干涉/干预/妨碍<,>Don't interfere in other people's private matters.<,>不要干涉他人的私事。<,>The noise interfered with my concentration.<,>噪音干扰了我的注意力。<,>The government should not interfere with the free market.<,>政府不应干预自由市场。<,>inter(在…之间)+fere(打)→在中间打→干涉<,>intervene(v. 干预)/interrupt(v. 打断)/infer(v. 推断)  

apartment<,>/əˈpɑːtmənt/<,>/əˈpɑːrtmənt/<,>n.一套公寓房间<,>She rents a small apartment downtown.<,>她在市中心租了一套小公寓。<,>The apartment has a beautiful view of the park.<,>这套公寓可以俯瞰公园的美景。<,>They are looking for a two-bedroom apartment.<,>他们正在寻找一套两居室的公寓。<,>a+part(部分)+ment→分成部分居住的地方→公寓<,>department(n. 部门)/compartment(n. 隔间)/apart(adv. 分开地)  

account<,>/əˈkaʊnt/<,>/əˈkaʊnt/<,>vi.说明…的原因/占… n.记述/解释/账目<,>He couldn't account for his absence from work.<,>他无法解释自己为什么没来上班。<,>Please give me your account of what happened.<,>请告诉我你对所发生事情的描述。<,>This product accounts for 30% of our sales.<,>该产品占我们销售额的30%。<,>ac(加强)+count(计算)→账目需要计算→账目<,>discount(n. 折扣)/counter(n. 柜台)/count(v. 计算)  

fitting<,>/ˈfɪtɪŋ/<,>/ˈfɪtɪŋ/<,>adj.适合的/恰当的 n.设备/家具/配件/试穿<,>It's fitting that we celebrate his achievements.<,>我们庆祝他的成就是合适的。<,>The store offers free fitting services for wedding dresses.<,>该店提供免费的婚纱试穿服务。<,>All the fittings in the house are made of brass.<,>房子里所有的配件都是黄铜制成的。<,>fit(适合)+ting→适合的<,>fittingly(adv. 适当地)/outfitting(n. 装备)/benefit(n. 利益)  

stack<,>/stæk/<,>/stæk/<,>n.堆/垛 vt.堆积/堆放于<,>There was a stack of books on his desk.<,>他的桌子上有一堆书。<,>Please stack the chairs after the meeting.<,>会议结束后请把椅子堆起来。<,>The shelves were stacked with old newspapers.<,>架子上堆满了旧报纸。<,>s+tack(钉)→像钉在一起一样堆积→堆<,>stackable(adj. 可堆叠的)/stake(n. 赌注)/stick(n. 棍子)  

radioactive<,>/ˌreɪdiəʊˈæktɪv/<,>/ˌreɪdioʊˈæktɪv/<,>adj.放射性的/有辐射能的<,>The waste from the nuclear plant is highly radioactive.<,>核电站的废料具有高度放射性。<,>Radioactive materials must be handled with care.<,>放射性物质必须小心处理。<,>The doctor used radioactive isotopes for the scan.<,>医生使用放射性同位素进行扫描。<,>radio(射线)+active(活跃的)→放射性的<,>radiation(n. 辐射)/radioactivity(n. 放射性)/radiate(v. 辐射)  

resent<,>/rɪˈzent/<,>/rɪˈzɛnt/<,>vt.对…表示愤恨/怨恨<,>She resents being treated like a child.<,>她怨恨被当作孩子对待。<,>He resented his friend's success.<,>他怨恨朋友的成功。<,>I resent having to work overtime without pay.<,>我讨厌无偿加班。<,>re(反)+sent(感觉)→反感→怨恨<,>resentful(adj. 愤恨的)/consent(v. 同意)/dissent(v. 不同意)  

stride<,>/straɪd/<,>/straɪd/<,>vi.大踏步走 n.大步/步法/进展<,>He strode confidently into the room.<,>他自信地大步走进房间。<,>She has made great strides in her career.<,>她在事业上取得了很大进展。<,>The athlete's stride was long and powerful.<,>这位运动员的步伐又长又有力。<,>st+ride(骑)→像骑马一样迈大步→大步走<,>stride piano(n. 跨步钢琴)/bestride(v. 跨坐)/outstride(v. 超过)
ambiguous<,>/æmˈbɪɡjuəs/<,>/æmˈbɪɡjuəs/<,>adj.引起歧义的/adj.模棱两可的/adj.含糊不清的<,>His answer was ambiguous and didn't clarify the situation.<,>他的回答模棱两可，没有澄清情况。<,>The ambiguous wording of the contract led to disputes.<,>合同含糊不清的措辞导致了争议。<,>She gave me an ambiguous smile that I couldn't interpret.<,>她给了我一个难以解读的含糊微笑。<,>ambi(两边)+guous(引导)→两边引导→模棱两可<,>ambitious(adj.有野心的)/ambient(adj.周围的)

impulsive<,>/ɪmˈpʌlsɪv/<,>/ɪmˈpʌlsɪv/<,>adj.冲动的<,>He made an impulsive decision to quit his job.<,>他冲动地决定辞职。<,>Her impulsive shopping often leaves her with buyer's remorse.<,>她冲动的购物常常让她后悔。<,>Teenagers are known for their impulsive behavior.<,>青少年以冲动行为闻名。<,>im(内)+puls(推)+ive→内心推动→冲动<,>compulsive(adj.强迫的)/repulsive(adj.令人厌恶的)

qualitative<,>/ˈkwɒlɪtətɪv/<,>/ˈkwɑːlɪteɪtɪv/<,>adj.性质的/adj.定性的<,>The research focuses on qualitative rather than quantitative analysis.<,>这项研究侧重于定性而非定量分析。<,>There was a qualitative improvement in their relationship.<,>他们的关系有了质的改善。<,>This method provides qualitative data about customer preferences.<,>这种方法提供了关于客户偏好的定性数据。<,>quality(质量)+ative→关于质量的<,>quantitative(adj.定量的)/qualify(v.使合格)

diverse<,>/daɪˈvɜːs/<,>/daɪˈvɜːrs/<,>adj.不一样的/adj.相异的/adj.多种多样的<,>Our team is culturally diverse.<,>我们的团队在文化上是多元化的。<,>The city offers a diverse range of dining options.<,>这个城市提供多样化的餐饮选择。<,>The ecosystem supports diverse species.<,>这个生态系统支持多种物种。<,>di(分开)+verse(转)→转向不同方向→多样的<,>divert(v.转移)/reverse(adj.相反的)

crisp<,>/krɪsp/<,>/krɪsp/<,>adj.脆的/adj.鲜脆的/adj.挺括的/adj.清新的/adj.干冷的/adj.简明扼要的/n.油炸土豆片<,>The autumn air was crisp and refreshing.<,>秋天的空气清新而凉爽。<,>She wore a crisp white shirt to the interview.<,>她穿着一件挺括的白衬衫去面试。<,>He gave a crisp summary of the report.<,>他对报告做了简明扼要的总结。<,>crisp→发音类似"脆皮"→脆的<,>crispy(adj.酥脆的)/crust(n.外壳)

prime<,>/praɪm/<,>/praɪm/<,>adj.首要的/adj.最好的/n.青春/n.全盛时期/vt.使准备好<,>This is a prime example of good leadership.<,>这是优秀领导的典范。<,>He's in the prime of his career.<,>他正处于事业的巅峰时期。<,>The coach primed the team for the championship.<,>教练让球队为冠军赛做好准备。<,>prime→首要的(与"首要"谐音)<,>premier(adj.首要的)/primary(adj.主要的)

intellect<,>/ˈɪntəlekt/<,>/ˈɪntəlekt/<,>n.智力/n.理解力/n.才智非凡的人<,>She's known for her sharp intellect.<,>她以敏锐的智力闻名。<,>The debate challenged their intellects.<,>这场辩论挑战了他们的智力。<,>Einstein was one of the greatest intellects of the 20th century.<,>爱因斯坦是20世纪最伟大的智者之一。<,>intel(在...之间)+lect(选择)→在信息间选择→智力<,>intelligent(adj.聪明的)/intellectual(adj.智力的)

preference<,>/ˈprefrəns/<,>/ˈprefrəns/<,>n.喜爱/n.偏爱/n.优先/n.偏爱的事物<,>She has a preference for classical music.<,>她偏爱古典音乐。<,>Customers expressed their color preferences.<,>顾客表达了他们对颜色的偏好。<,>Priority will be given in order of preference.<,>将按优先顺序给予优先权。<,>pre(前)+fer(拿)+ence→提前拿→偏爱<,>reference(n.参考)/difference(n.差异)

mild<,>/maɪld/<,>/maɪld/<,>adj.温柔的/adj.温暖的/adj.轻微的<,>The weather was mild for December.<,>对于十二月来说天气很温暖。<,>He has a mild personality that puts people at ease.<,>他性格温和，让人感到放松。<,>She experienced only mild side effects from the medicine.<,>她只经历了药物的轻微副作用。<,>mild→"慢的"→温和的<,>wild(adj.狂野的)/mile(n.英里)

loyal<,>/ˈlɔɪəl/<,>/ˈlɔɪəl/<,>adj.忠诚的/adj.忠心的<,>He has been a loyal friend for over 20 years.<,>20多年来他一直是个忠诚的朋友。<,>The dog remained loyal to its deceased owner.<,>这只狗对已故的主人保持忠诚。<,>She's loyal to the company despite better offers.<,>尽管有更好的工作机会，她仍忠于公司。<,>loyal→"老友"→忠诚的朋友<,>royal(adj.皇家的)/legal(adj.合法的)
impact<,>/ˈɪmpækt/<,>/ˈɪmˌpækt/<,>v.影响/v.作用/v.冲击/n.影响/n.作用/n.冲击<,>The new policy will impact the economy significantly.<,>新政策将对经济产生重大影响。<,>The car crash had a huge impact on his life.<,>车祸对他的生活产生了巨大影响。<,>The speech made a strong impact on the audience.<,>演讲对观众产生了强烈影响。<,>im(进入)+pact(压)→压进去→冲击<,>compact(adj.紧凑的)/impart(v.传授)/impair(v.削弱)

paralysis<,>/pəˈræləsɪs/<,>/pəˈræləsɪs/<,>n.麻痹/n.瘫痪/n.中风/n.无能/n.无力<,>The disease caused paralysis in his legs.<,>这种疾病导致他的双腿瘫痪。<,>Economic paralysis gripped the country after the crisis.<,>危机后，经济瘫痪笼罩着这个国家。<,>She felt a sense of paralysis when faced with the decision.<,>面对这个决定时，她感到一种无力感。<,>para(旁边)+lysis(松开)→身体一侧松开→瘫痪<,>analysis(n.分析)/parasite(n.寄生虫)/paralyze(v.使瘫痪)

court<,>/kɔːt/<,>/kɔːrt/<,>n.法院/n.法庭/n.庭院/n.宫廷/n.球场<,>The case was settled out of court.<,>这个案件在庭外和解了。<,>They played tennis on the grass court.<,>他们在草地球场上打网球。<,>The royal court was full of intrigue.<,>宫廷里充满了阴谋。<,>court(跑)→人们跑来解决问题的地方→法庭<,>cohort(n.一群人)/curt(adj.简短的)/quart(n.夸脱)

chapel<,>/ˈtʃæpəl/<,>/ˈtʃæpəl/<,>n.小教堂/n.祈祷室<,>They got married in a small chapel.<,>他们在一个小教堂里结婚了。<,>The hospital has a chapel for quiet reflection.<,>医院有一个供人安静思考的祈祷室。<,>The chapel choir sings every Sunday.<,>小教堂唱诗班每周日都会唱歌。<,>chap(帽子)+el(小)→戴帽子的小建筑→小教堂<,>channel(n.频道)/chap(n.家伙)/chaperon(n.监护人)

distort<,>/dɪˈstɔːt/<,>/dɪˈstɔːrt/<,>vi.变形/vt.歪曲/vt.曲解/vt.扭曲/vt.使变形<,>The mirror distorted her reflection.<,>镜子使她的影像变形了。<,>He distorted the facts to suit his argument.<,>他歪曲事实以适应他的论点。<,>The loudspeaker distorted the sound.<,>扬声器使声音失真了。<,>dis(分开)+tort(扭曲)→扭曲分开→变形<,>retort(v.反驳)/contort(v.扭曲)/extort(v.勒索)

subsidiary<,>/səbˈsɪdiəri/<,>/səbˈsɪdiəri/<,>adj.辅助的/adj.次要的/adj.附设的/n.子公司/n.附属机构<,>The company has several subsidiaries abroad.<,>这家公司在国外有几家子公司。<,>English is her subsidiary subject.<,>英语是她的副科。<,>The subsidiary clause explains the main point.<,>附属条款解释了主要观点。<,>sub(下面)+sid(坐)+iary→坐在下面的→辅助的<,>subsidy(n.补贴)/subside(v.平息)/subsistence(n.生存)

venture<,>/ˈventʃə(r)/<,>/ˈven(t)ʃər/<,>vi.冒险/vi.大胆行事/n.风险投资/n.风险项目/vt.拿...冒险/vt.敢于<,>They ventured into the unknown territory.<,>他们冒险进入了未知领域。<,>The business venture proved successful.<,>这次商业冒险证明是成功的。<,>He ventured his savings on the new business.<,>他把积蓄冒险投入了新生意。<,>vent(来)+ure→来到危险处→冒险<,>adventure(n.冒险)/venue(n.地点)/invent(v.发明)

discern<,>/dɪˈsɜːn/<,>/dɪˈsɜːrn/<,>vt.看出/vt.察觉出/vt.识别/vt.认出<,>It was hard to discern his true intentions.<,>很难看出他的真实意图。<,>She could barely discern the outline in the fog.<,>她几乎看不清雾中的轮廓。<,>He discerned a pattern in the data.<,>他察觉到了数据中的模式。<,>dis(分开)+cern(分离)→分离出来→辨别<,>concern(v.关心)/discard(v.丢弃)/discreet(adj.谨慎的)

enthusiasm<,>/ɪnˈθjuːziæzəm/<,>/ɪnˈθuːziæzəm/<,>n.热情/n.热心/n.热忱/n.巨大兴趣<,>Her enthusiasm for the project was contagious.<,>她对项目的热情具有感染力。<,>He showed great enthusiasm in learning Chinese.<,>他对学习中文表现出极大的热情。<,>The team played with enthusiasm and energy.<,>球队充满热情和活力地比赛。<,>en(进入)+thus(神)+iasm→进入神的状态→热情<,>enthusiast(n.热心者)/enthuse(v.使热心)/theism(n.有神论)

flexible<,>/ˈfleksəbl/<,>/ˈfleksəbəl/<,>adj.易弯曲的/adj.灵活的<,>The schedule is flexible and can be adjusted.<,>时间表很灵活，可以调整。<,>Yoga makes your body more flexible.<,>瑜伽让你的身体更加柔韧。<,>We need a flexible approach to solve this problem.<,>我们需要灵活的方法来解决这个问题。<,>flex(弯曲)+ible(能...的)→能弯曲的<,>reflex(n.反射)/inflexible(adj.不灵活的)/flexion(n.弯曲)
domain<,>/dəˈmeɪn/<,>/doʊˈmeɪn/<,>n.领域/n.范围/n.领地/n.势力范围<,>This question falls outside the domain of science.<,>这个问题超出了科学的范畴。<,>He is a leading expert in the domain of artificial intelligence.<,>他是人工智能领域的顶尖专家。<,>The king expanded his domain by conquering neighboring lands.<,>国王通过征服邻国扩大了他的领地。<,>dom(统治)+ain→统治的区域→领域<,>dominion(n.主权/n.统治权)/dominate(v.支配/v.控制)/dome(n.圆屋顶)

census<,>/ˈsensəs/<,>/ˈsɛnsəs/<,>n.人口普查/n.统计<,>The government conducts a census every ten years.<,>政府每十年进行一次人口普查。<,>According to the latest census, the population has grown by 5%.<,>根据最新的人口普查，人口增长了5%。<,>The census data helps in urban planning and resource allocation.<,>人口普查数据有助于城市规划和资源分配。<,>cens(评估)+us→评估人口→人口普查<,>consensus(n.一致意见)/censor(v.审查/n.审查员)/sensory(adj.感觉的)

corpse<,>/kɔːps/<,>/kɔːrps/<,>n.死尸/n.尸体<,>The police found a corpse in the abandoned building.<,>警方在废弃建筑中发现了一具尸体。<,>The corpse was identified through dental records.<,>通过牙科记录确认了尸体身份。<,>In some cultures, people hold ceremonies to honor the corpse before burial.<,>在某些文化中，人们会在埋葬前为尸体举行仪式。<,>corp(身体)+se→没有生命的身体→尸体<,>corps(n.军团)/corpus(n.语料库)/corpulent(adj.肥胖的)

willful<,>/ˈwɪlfəl/<,>/ˈwɪlfəl/<,>adj.故意的/adj.特意的<,>His willful disobedience led to serious consequences.<,>他故意违抗导致了严重后果。<,>The court ruled it was a case of willful neglect.<,>法庭裁定这是一起故意疏忽案件。<,>She made a willful decision to ignore the warnings.<,>她故意决定忽视这些警告。<,>will(意愿)+ful(充满)→充满意愿的→故意的<,>wilful(adj.任性的)/willing(adj.乐意的)/willow(n.柳树)

attitude<,>/ˈætɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈætɪtuːd/<,>n.态度/n.看法/n.姿势<,>Her positive attitude towards life is inspiring.<,>她对生活的积极态度令人鼓舞。<,>The dancer's graceful attitude impressed the audience.<,>舞者优雅的姿势给观众留下了深刻印象。<,>We need to change people's attitude towards recycling.<,>我们需要改变人们对回收的态度。<,>att(趋向)+itude(状态)→表现出来的状态→态度<,>altitude(n.海拔)/aptitude(n.才能)/latitude(n.纬度)

relative<,>/ˈrelətɪv/<,>/ˈrɛlətɪv/<,>adj.有关系的/adj.相对的/n.亲属/n.亲戚<,>All things are relative in this world.<,>世界上所有事物都是相对的。<,>She went to visit her relatives during the holidays.<,>假期期间她去拜访了亲戚。<,>The humidity is high relative to the temperature.<,>相对于温度来说湿度很高。<,>relat(关系)+ive→有关系的一相对的<,>relate(v.叙述/v.使联系)/relation(n.关系)/relativity(n.相对性)

compare<,>/kəmˈpeə(r)/<,>/kəmˈper/<,>vt.比较/vt.对照/vt.把...比作<,>Let's compare these two products before buying.<,>购买前让我们比较一下这两款产品。<,>Shakespeare compared the world to a stage.<,>莎士比亚把世界比作舞台。<,>Compared to last year, sales have increased by 20%.<,>与去年相比，销售额增长了20%。<,>com(共同)+pare(平等)→使平等→比较<,>comparison(n.比较)/comparable(adj.可比较的)/compartment(n.隔间)

depict<,>/dɪˈpɪkt/<,>/dɪˈpɪkt/<,>vt.描绘/vt.描述<,>The painting vividly depicts a rural scene.<,>这幅画生动地描绘了一幅乡村景象。<,>The novel depicts the struggles of immigrants.<,>这部小说描述了移民的奋斗历程。<,>The documentary depicts life in war-torn areas.<,>这部纪录片描绘了战乱地区的生活。<,>de(加强)+pict(画)→画出来→描绘<,>picture(n.图画/v.想象)/depiction(n.描写)/pictorial(adj.图画的)

hop<,>/hɒp/<,>/hɑːp/<,>vi.单足跳跃/vi.单足跳行/vi.齐足跳跃/vi.齐足跳行/vt.跳上/n.蹦跳/n.短程航行<,>The rabbit hopped across the field.<,>兔子在田野上跳跃。<,>We'll hop on the next bus to the city center.<,>我们将跳上下一班去市中心的公交车。<,>It's just a short hop from London to Paris by plane.<,>乘飞机从伦敦到巴黎只是一次短途航行。<,>象声词，模仿跳跃的声音<,>hip(n.臀部)/hope(n.希望)/hob(n.炉架)

characteristic<,>/ˌkærəktəˈrɪstɪk/<,>/ˌkærəktəˈrɪstɪk/<,>adj.特有的/adj.典型的/n.特性<,>Symmetry is a characteristic feature of classical architecture.<,>对称是古典建筑的典型特征。<,>What are the main characteristics of this species?<,>这个物种的主要特性是什么？<,>His most noticeable characteristic is his sense of humor.<,>他最显著的特点是他的幽默感。<,>character(特征)+istic→特征的→特性<,>character(n.性格)/characterize(v.以...为特征)/characterization(n.特性描述)
involvement<,>/ɪnˈvɒlvmənt/<,>/ɪnˈvɑːlvmənt/<,>n.连累/n.包含<,>His involvement in the scandal damaged his reputation.<,>他卷入丑闻损害了他的声誉。<,>The project requires the involvement of all team members.<,>这个项目需要所有团队成员的参与。<,>Her involvement in charity work is admirable.<,>她参与慈善工作令人钦佩。<,>in(进入)+volve(卷)+ment(名词后缀)→卷入→连累<,>investment(n.投资)/development(n.发展)/enrollment(n.登记)

pave<,>/peɪv/<,>/peɪv/<,>vt.铺/vt.铺筑<,>They paved the road with asphalt.<,>他们用沥青铺筑了这条路。<,>Her hard work paved the way for her success.<,>她的努力为成功铺平了道路。<,>The city plans to pave the bike path next year.<,>市政府计划明年铺设自行车道。<,>pa(拼音"趴")+ve(拼音"窝")→趴窝需要铺路<,>wave(v.挥手/n.波浪)/cave(n.洞穴)/save(v.节省)

integral<,>/ˈɪntɪɡrəl/<,>/ˈɪntəɡrəl/<,>adj.构成整体所必需的/adj.基本的<,>Teamwork is an integral part of our company culture.<,>团队合作是我们企业文化不可或缺的部分。<,>This component is integral to the machine's operation.<,>这个部件对机器运转至关重要。<,>Mathematics is integral to engineering studies.<,>数学是工程学研究的基础。<,>integer(整数)+al(形容词后缀)→完整的→构成整体的<,>integrate(v.整合)/intact(adj.完整的)/internal(adj.内部的)

lubricate<,>/ˈluːbrɪkeɪt/<,>/ˈluːbrɪkeɪt/<,>vt.使润滑<,>You should lubricate the gears regularly.<,>你应该定期给齿轮上润滑油。<,>The mechanic lubricated the engine before the race.<,>机械师在比赛前给发动机加了润滑油。<,>This oil helps to lubricate dry skin.<,>这种油有助于滋润干燥的皮肤。<,>lubri(谐音"溜不溜")+cate(动词后缀)→让机器溜不溜→润滑<,>lubricant(n.润滑剂)/lubricious(adj.光滑的)/lubricity(n.润滑性)

comet<,>/ˈkɒmɪt/<,>/ˈkɑːmɪt/<,>n.彗星<,>Halley's Comet appears every 76 years.<,>哈雷彗星每76年出现一次。<,>We saw a comet with a long tail last night.<,>昨晚我们看到了一颗长尾巴的彗星。<,>The comet's orbit brings it close to the sun.<,>这颗彗星的轨道使它接近太阳。<,>come(来)+t(拼音"头")→带着长头来的→彗星<,>planet(n.行星)/meteor(n.流星)/asteroid(n.小行星)

deadline<,>/ˈdedlaɪn/<,>/ˈdedlaɪn/<,>n.最后期限<,>The deadline for applications is next Friday.<,>申请截止日期是下周五。<,>I'm working hard to meet the project deadline.<,>我正在努力赶项目的截止日期。<,>She missed the deadline by just five minutes.<,>她只差五分钟就错过了截止时间。<,>dead(死)+line(线)→死线→最后期限<,>headline(n.标题)/guideline(n.指导方针)/timeline(n.时间线)

bully<,>/ˈbʊli/<,>/ˈbʊli/<,>n.恃强欺弱者/vt.威吓/vt.欺负<,>The school has a zero-tolerance policy for bullies.<,>学校对霸凌行为采取零容忍政策。<,>He was bullied as a child but now stands up for others.<,>他小时候被欺负，但现在为他人挺身而出。<,>Don't let anyone bully you into doing something wrong.<,>不要让任何人胁迫你做错事。<,>bull(公牛)+y(形容词后缀)→像公牛一样霸道→欺负<,>bully(n.恶霸)/bulky(adj.庞大的)/bullish(adj.看涨的)

chip<,>/tʃɪp/<,>/tʃɪp/<,>n.屑片/n.碎片/n.炸土豆条/n.集成电路片/n.集成块/n.缺口/n.瑕疵<,>There's a chip in my favorite coffee mug.<,>我最喜欢的咖啡杯上有个缺口。<,>Would you like some chips with your sandwich?<,>你的三明治要配些薯条吗?<,>The computer's performance depends on its microchip.<,>电脑性能取决于它的微芯片。<,>ch(拼音"吃")+ip(IP地址)→吃IP地址的芯片<,>chop(v.砍)/clip(n.夹子)/chin(n.下巴)

medieval<,>/ˌmediˈiːvəl/<,>/ˌmidiˈivəl/<,>adj.中世纪的/adj.中古的<,>This castle dates back to medieval times.<,>这座城堡可以追溯到中世纪。<,>Medieval medicine was often based on superstition.<,>中世纪的医学常常基于迷信。<,>He specializes in medieval European history.<,>他专攻中世纪欧洲史。<,>medi(中间)+eval(时代的)→中间时代的→中世纪的<,>media(n.媒体)/medical(adj.医学的)/medievalism(n.中世纪精神)

tanker<,>/ˈtæŋkə(r)/<,>/ˈtæŋkər/<,>n.油轮<,>The oil tanker spilled its cargo into the ocean.<,>油轮将货物泄漏到了海洋中。<,>The tanker carries thousands of tons of crude oil.<,>这艘油轮运载着数千吨原油。<,>A fire broke out on the chemical tanker yesterday.<,>昨天化学品油轮上发生了火灾。<,>tank(油箱)+er(名词后缀)→装油箱的大船→油轮<,>tank(n.坦克)/banker(n.银行家)/thinker(n.思想家)
involve<,>/ɪnˈvɒlv/<,>/ɪnˈvɑːlv/<,>vt.使卷入/vt.牵涉/vt.包含/vt.含有<,>Don't involve me in your personal problems.<,>别把我卷进你的个人问题里。<,>The job involves a lot of traveling.<,>这份工作需要经常出差。<,>The recipe involves several complicated steps.<,>这个食谱包含几个复杂的步骤。<,>in(进入)+volve(卷)→卷入其中<,>evolve(v.进化)/revolve(v.旋转)/resolve(v.解决)

pistol<,>/ˈpɪstl/<,>/ˈpɪstəl/<,>n.手枪<,>He pulled out a pistol and threatened the cashier.<,>他掏出手枪威胁收银员。<,>The police found a loaded pistol in his car.<,>警察在他车里发现一把上了膛的手枪。<,>She keeps a small pistol in her purse for protection.<,>她在手提包里放了一把小手枪防身。<,>发音类似"劈死头"→手枪能劈开头<,>piston(n.活塞)/pistil(n.雌蕊)/pistachio(n.开心果)

assemble<,>/əˈsembl/<,>/əˈsɛmbəl/<,>vi.集合/vi.召集/vt.集合/vt.聚集/vt.装配<,>The students assembled in the auditorium for the lecture.<,>学生们在礼堂集合听讲座。<,>It took him two hours to assemble the furniture.<,>他花了两个小时组装家具。<,>The president assembled his advisors for an emergency meeting.<,>总统召集顾问们开紧急会议。<,>as(加强)+semble(类似)→把类似的东西放一起→装配<,>resemble(v.相似)/dissemble(v.掩饰)/ensemble(n.整体)

watertight<,>/ˈwɔːtətaɪt/<,>/ˈwɔːtərtaɪt/<,>adj.不透水的/adj.防水的/adj.严密的/adj.无懈可击的<,>The ship's compartments are designed to be watertight.<,>船的隔舱设计成防水的。<,>We need a watertight alibi for the night of the crime.<,>我们需要案发当晚无懈可击的不在场证明。<,>The contract must be watertight to avoid legal issues.<,>合同必须严密以避免法律问题。<,>water(水)+tight(紧的)→防水<,>airtight(adj.密封的)/lighttight(adj.不透光的)/soundproof(adj.隔音的)

transition<,>/trænˈzɪʃn/<,>/trænˈzɪʃən/<,>n.过渡/n.转变<,>The country is in transition to a democratic system.<,>这个国家正在向民主制度过渡。<,>Spring is a transition period between winter and summer.<,>春天是冬夏之间的过渡期。<,>She handled the career transition smoothly.<,>她顺利完成了职业转变。<,>trans(跨越)+it(走)+ion→走过去→过渡<,>transaction(n.交易)/transmission(n.传输)/transfusion(n.输血)

repel<,>/rɪˈpel/<,>/rɪˈpɛl/<,>vt.使厌恶/vt.击退/vt.逐回/vt.驱除/vt.排斥<,>The smell of the garbage repelled me.<,>垃圾的气味让我恶心。<,>The army repelled the enemy attack successfully.<,>军队成功击退了敌人的进攻。<,>Like charges repel each other.<,>同性电荷互相排斥。<,>re(回)+pel(推)→推回去→击退<,>compel(v.强迫)/expel(v.驱逐)/propel(v.推进)

mutter<,>/ˈmʌtə(r)/<,>/ˈmʌtər/<,>n&v.轻声低语/n&v.小声抱怨<,>He was muttering to himself while working.<,>他工作时在自言自语。<,>I heard mutters of discontent among the crowd.<,>我听到人群中不满的嘀咕声。<,>"This is unfair," she muttered under her breath.<,>"这不公平，"她低声抱怨道。<,>拟声词，模仿小声说话的声音<,>butter(n.黄油)/flutter(v.飘动)/stutter(v.口吃)

series<,>/ˈsɪəriːz/<,>/ˈsɪriːz/<,>n.一系列/n.连续/n.丛书/n.连续剧<,>The detective solved a series of murders.<,>侦探破获了一系列谋杀案。<,>I'm reading a book series about ancient history.<,>我正在读一套关于古代历史的丛书。<,>The TV series has won many awards.<,>这部电视剧赢得了许多奖项。<,>ser(连接)+ies→连在一起的东西→系列<,>serious(adj.严肃的)/serial(n.连载)/sermon(n.布道)

complicated<,>/ˈkɒmplɪkeɪtɪd/<,>/ˈkɑːmplɪkeɪtɪd/<,>adj.复杂的/adj.难懂的<,>The instructions are too complicated for beginners.<,>这些说明对初学者来说太复杂了。<,>Their relationship became increasingly complicated.<,>他们的关系变得越来越复杂。<,>This is a complicated mathematical problem.<,>这是一道复杂的数学题。<,>com(一起)+plic(折叠)+ated→全部折叠在一起→复杂的<,>duplicate(v.复制)/implicate(v.牵连)/explicate(v.解释)

junk<,>/dʒʌŋk/<,>/dʒʌŋk/<,>n.废旧物品/n.破烂/vt.丢弃/vt.废弃<,>The garage is full of old junk.<,>车库里堆满了旧杂物。<,>I need to junk my old computer.<,>我需要扔掉旧电脑。<,>Don't believe that junk science.<,>别相信那些伪科学。<,>发音类似"脏壳"→脏的壳就是垃圾<,>junkie(n.吸毒者)/junket(n.公费旅游)/junk mail(垃圾邮件)
maximum<,>/ˈmæksɪməm/<,>/ˈmæksɪməm/<,>adj.最大的/adj.最高的/adj.顶点的/n.最大量/n.顶点<,>The maximum speed limit here is 60 mph.<,>这里的最高限速是每小时60英里。<,>She reached the maximum of her potential.<,>她达到了自己潜能的顶点。<,>This room can hold a maximum of 50 people.<,>这个房间最多可容纳50人。<,>max(最大)+imum(表最高级)→最大的<,>minimum(adj.最小的/n.最小值)/maximize(v.最大化)/minimize(v.最小化)

thrive<,>/θraɪv/<,>/θraɪv/<,>vi.兴旺/vi.繁荣/vi.旺盛<,>Plants thrive in this fertile soil.<,>植物在这肥沃的土壤里茁壮成长。<,>His business began to thrive after the new policy.<,>新政策出台后，他的生意开始兴旺起来。<,>Children thrive when they receive proper care.<,>得到适当照顾的孩子会健康成长。<,>thr(看作three三)+ive→三倍增长→繁荣<,>strive(v.努力)/derive(v.源自)/contrive(v.设计)

imaginative<,>/ɪˈmædʒɪnətɪv/<,>/ɪˈmædʒənətɪv/<,>adj.富有想象力的/adj.爱想象的<,>She wrote an imaginative story about space travel.<,>她写了一篇关于太空旅行的富有想象力的故事。<,>The child has an imaginative mind.<,>这个孩子有着丰富的想象力。<,>His imaginative solution saved the project.<,>他富有想象力的解决方案挽救了整个项目。<,>imagine(想象)+ative(形容词后缀)→富有想象力的<,>imaginary(adj.虚构的)/imaginable(adj.可想象的)/imagination(n.想象力)

penguin<,>/ˈpeŋɡwɪn/<,>/ˈpeŋɡwɪn/<,>n.企鹅<,>We saw a group of penguins in Antarctica.<,>我们在南极看到了一群企鹅。<,>The penguin is a flightless bird.<,>企鹅是一种不会飞的鸟。<,>Children love watching penguins swim in the aquarium.<,>孩子们喜欢看水族馆里的企鹅游泳。<,>pen(笔)+guin(看作queen女王)→像拿着笔的女王→企鹅<,>penguin和dolphin(n.海豚)都是海洋生物

represent<,>/ˌreprɪˈzent/<,>/ˌrɛprɪˈzɛnt/<,>vt.作为...的代表/vt.表示/vt.象征/vt.描绘/vt.表现<,>This painting represents the artist's childhood memories.<,>这幅画代表了艺术家的童年回忆。<,>She was chosen to represent our company at the conference.<,>她被选为我们公司在会议上的代表。<,>The red color often represents danger.<,>红色通常代表危险。<,>re(再)+present(呈现)→再次呈现→代表<,>presentation(n.展示)/representative(n.代表)/misrepresent(v.误传)

dispatch<,>/dɪˈspætʃ/<,>/dɪˈspætʃ/<,>vt.派遣/vt.调遣/vt.发送/n.急件/n.快信/n.新闻报道/n.派遣/n.调遣<,>The general dispatched troops to the border.<,>将军调遣部队前往边境。<,>Please dispatch this package immediately.<,>请立即发送这个包裹。<,>We received a dispatch from our correspondent in Paris.<,>我们收到了驻巴黎记者的新闻报道。<,>dis(分开)+patch(小块)→分成小块快速处理→派遣<,>despatch(同dispatch)/patch(n.补丁)/detach(v.分离)

emergency<,>/ɪˈmɜːdʒənsi/<,>/ɪˈmɜːrdʒənsi/<,>n.紧急情况/n.突然事件<,>Call 911 in case of emergency.<,>遇到紧急情况请拨打911。<,>The hospital has a special entrance for emergency cases.<,>医院有专门的急诊入口。<,>We need to prepare an emergency plan.<,>我们需要制定一个应急计划。<,>emerge(出现)+ency→突然出现的情况→紧急情况<,>emerge(v.出现)/urgency(n.紧急)/mergency(错误拼写)
dim<,>/dɪm/<,>/dɪm/<,>adj.昏暗的/adj.朦胧的/adj.模糊不清的/v.变暗淡<,>The room was dim, lit only by a single candle.<,>房间里很昏暗，只点着一支蜡烛。<,>His memory of the event is dim.<,>他对那件事的记忆很模糊。<,>The lights dimmed as the performance began.<,>演出开始时灯光变暗了。<,>di(双)+m(模糊)→双重模糊→昏暗的<,>dime(n. 一角硬币)/damp(adj.潮湿的)/dimple(n.酒窝)

paralyze<,>/ˈpærəlaɪz/<,>/ˈpærəˌlaɪz/<,>vt.使瘫痪/vt.使麻痹/vt.使丧失作用/vt.使惊愕/vt.使呆若木鸡<,>Fear paralyzed him and he couldn't move.<,>恐惧使他呆若木鸡，无法动弹。<,>The strike paralyzed the city's transportation system.<,>罢工使城市的交通系统瘫痪了。<,>She was paralyzed with shock when she heard the news.<,>听到这个消息时，她震惊得呆住了。<,>para(旁边)+lyze(松开)→身体一侧松开→瘫痪<,>analyze(vt.分析)/parasite(n.寄生虫)/paralysis(n.麻痹)

interpersonal<,>/ˌɪntəˈpɜːsənl/<,>/ˌɪntərˈpɜːrsənl/<,>adj.人与人之间的/adj.关于人与人之间关系的<,>Good interpersonal skills are essential for this job.<,>良好的人际交往能力对这份工作至关重要。<,>They're studying interpersonal communication patterns.<,>他们正在研究人际交流模式。<,>The course focuses on developing interpersonal relationships.<,>这门课程着重培养人际关系。<,>inter(相互)+personal(个人的)→人与人之间的<,>intrapersonal(adj.个人内心的)/international(adj.国际的)/intervene(v.干预)

exemplary<,>/ɪɡˈzempləri/<,>/ɪɡˈzɛmpləri/<,>adj.可作楷模的/adj.典范的<,>Her exemplary behavior earned her a promotion.<,>她堪称楷模的行为为她赢得了晋升。<,>The school was cited for its exemplary safety record.<,>这所学校因其典范的安全记录而受到表彰。<,>He set an exemplary standard for others to follow.<,>他树立了一个供他人效仿的典范标准。<,>ex(出)+empl(拿)+ary→拿出来作为榜样→典范的<,>example(n.例子)/exempt(v.免除)/empirical(adj.经验主义的)

faculty<,>/ˈfæklti/<,>/ˈfækəlti/<,>n.才能/n.能力/n.系/n.科/n.全体教员<,>She has a remarkable faculty for languages.<,>她有非凡的语言才能。<,>The Faculty of Medicine is located in the east wing.<,>医学院位于东翼。<,>The entire faculty attended the meeting.<,>全体教员都参加了会议。<,>fac(做)+ulty→做事的能力→才能<,>faulty(adj.有缺陷的)/facility(n.设施)/factual(adj.事实的)

layoff<,>/ˈleɪɒf/<,>/ˈleɪˌɔːf/<,>n.解雇/n.裁员/n.歇工期/n.停工期<,>The company announced massive layoffs due to financial difficulties.<,>由于财务困难，公司宣布大规模裁员。<,>He's been on layoff for three months now.<,>他现在已经停工三个月了。<,>The layoff affected hundreds of employees.<,>这次裁员影响了数百名员工。<,>lay(放置)+off(离开)→让员工离开→裁员<,>layout(n.布局)/layover(n.中途停留)/layman(n.外行)

wretched<,>/ˈretʃɪd/<,>/ˈrɛtʃɪd/<,>adj.极不愉快的/adj.难受的/adj.可怜的/adj.令人苦恼的/adj.讨厌的/adj.拙劣的<,>They lived in wretched poverty for years.<,>他们在极度贫困中生活了多年。<,>What wretched weather we're having!<,>这天气真糟糕！<,>He gave a wretched performance in the exam.<,>他在考试中表现很差。<,>wretch(可怜的人)+ed→可怜的<,>wreath(n.花环)/wrestle(v.摔跤)/wrench(n.扳手)

absurd<,>/əbˈsɜːd/<,>/əbˈsɜːrd/<,>adj.荒谬的/adj.荒唐的<,>It's absurd to expect a child to understand such complex issues.<,>指望一个孩子理解这么复杂的问题是荒谬的。<,>The idea that the earth is flat is absolutely absurd.<,>地球是平的这种想法完全荒谬。<,>He looked absurd in that oversized suit.<,>他穿着那套过大的西装看起来很可笑。<,>ab(离开)+surd(听)→听起来不对劲→荒谬的<,>obscure(adj.模糊的)/abstruse(adj.深奥的)/abundant(adj.丰富的)

modesty<,>/ˈmɒdəsti/<,>/ˈmɑːdəsti/<,>n.谦虚<,>Despite his achievements, he spoke with great modesty.<,>尽管取得了成就，他说话仍非常谦虚。<,>Her modesty prevented her from taking credit for the work.<,>她的谦虚使她不愿为这项工作居功。<,>Modesty is a virtue in many cultures.<,>谦虚是许多文化中的美德。<,>mod(方式)+esty→适度的方式→谦虚<,>modest(adj.谦虚的)/modern(adj.现代的)/modify(v.修改)

considerate<,>/kənˈsɪdərət/<,>/kənˈsɪdərət/<,>adj.考虑周到的/adj.体贴的/adj.体谅的<,>It was very considerate of you to remember her birthday.<,>你能记得她的生日真是很体贴。<,>He's always considerate of other people's feelings.<,>他总是体谅他人的感受。<,>Please be considerate and keep the noise down after 10pm.<,>请体谅他人，晚上10点后保持安静。<,>consider(考虑)+ate→考虑周到的<,>considerable(adj.相当大的)/consideration(n.考虑)/considered(adj.经过深思熟虑的)
glamor<,>/ˈɡlæmə(r)/<,>/ˈɡlæmər/<,>n.魅力/n.诱惑力<,>She has a natural glamor that attracts everyone.<,>她有一种自然的魅力，吸引着所有人。<,>The glamor of Hollywood is undeniable.<,>好莱坞的诱惑力是不可否认的。<,>He was captivated by her glamor.<,>他被她的魅力迷住了。<,>glam(闪光)+or(名词后缀)→闪耀的魅力<,>glamour(n.魅力)/glamorous(adj.迷人的)/glamorize(v.美化)

clue<,>/kluː/<,>/kluː/<,>n.线索/n.暗示/n.提示<,>The detective found a clue at the crime scene.<,>侦探在犯罪现场发现了一条线索。<,>She gave me a clue about the surprise party.<,>她给了我关于惊喜派对的暗示。<,>Can you give me a clue to solve this puzzle?<,>你能给我一个提示来解决这个谜题吗？<,>clue(发音类似“可路”)→可以找到路的线索<,>cue(n.提示)/glue(n.胶水)/blue(adj.蓝色的)

bracket<,>/ˈbrækɪt/<,>/ˈbrækɪt/<,>n.括号/n.等级段/n.档次/n.壁架/n.托架/vt.把…置于括号内/vt.把…归入同一类<,>Please put your name in brackets.<,>请把你的名字放在括号里。<,>They fall into the high-income bracket.<,>他们属于高收入档次。<,>She bracketed the books on the shelf.<,>她把书放在书架上的托架上。<,>brack(支架)+et(小)→小支架→托架<,>rack(n.架子)/brake(n.刹车)/blanket(n.毯子)

legal<,>/ˈliːɡl/<,>/ˈliːɡl/<,>adj.法律的/adj.合法的<,>It is legal to drive at this age.<,>在这个年龄开车是合法的。<,>He sought legal advice for his case.<,>他为自己的案子寻求法律建议。<,>The document must be signed by a legal representative.<,>这份文件必须由法定代表签署。<,>leg(法律)+al(形容词后缀)→法律的<,>illegal(adj.非法的)/legacy(n.遗产)/legend(n.传说)

midst<,>/mɪdst/<,>/mɪdst/<,>n.中部/n.中间/n.当中<,>He stood in the midst of the crowd.<,>他站在人群中间。<,>In the midst of chaos, she remained calm.<,>在混乱当中，她保持冷静。<,>They found a solution in the midst of discussion.<,>他们在讨论中找到了解决方案。<,>mid(中间)+st(后缀)→中间<,>middle(n.中间)/midday(n.中午)/midnight(n.午夜)

trait<,>/treɪt/<,>/treɪt/<,>n.特征/n.特点/n.特性<,>Honesty is a desirable trait.<,>诚实是一个可取的特征。<,>Her most noticeable trait is her kindness.<,>她最显著的特点是善良。<,>Genetic traits are passed down from parents.<,>遗传特性是从父母那里传下来的。<,>trait(发音类似“特瑞特”)→特别的特质<,>trace(n.痕迹)/treat(v.对待)/train(n.火车)

radius<,>/ˈreɪdiəs/<,>/ˈreɪdiəs/<,>n.半径/n.半径范围<,>The explosion affected everything within a 5-mile radius.<,>爆炸影响了5英里半径范围内的一切。<,>Draw a circle with a radius of 3 cm.<,>画一个半径为3厘米的圆。<,>The school is within walking radius of my house.<,>学校在我家的步行半径范围内。<,>radi(射线)+us(名词后缀)→半径<,>diameter(n.直径)/circumference(n.周长)/radial(adj.放射的)

disintegration<,>/dɪsˌɪntɪˈɡreɪʃn/<,>/dɪsˌɪntɪˈɡreɪʃn/<,>n.破裂/n.分裂/n.瓦解<,>The disintegration of the Soviet Union happened in 1991.<,>苏联的瓦解发生在1991年。<,>The rock shows signs of disintegration.<,>这块岩石显示出破裂的迹象。<,>Social disintegration can lead to chaos.<,>社会分裂可能导致混乱。<,>dis(不)+integration(整合)→不整合→瓦解<,>integration(n.整合)/disintegrate(v.瓦解)/disinterest(n.无兴趣)

signal<,>/ˈsɪɡnəl/<,>/ˈsɪɡnəl/<,>adj.显著的/adj.重大的/n.信号/n.暗号/n.标志/n.表示/vt.发信号/vt.标志着<,>This is a signal achievement in science.<,>这是科学上的一个重大成就。<,>He gave the signal to start the race.<,>他发出了开始比赛的信号。<,>The bell signals the end of class.<,>铃声标志着下课。<,>sign(标记)+al(名词后缀)→信号<,>sign(n.标志)/signature(n.签名)/significant(adj.重要的)

impair<,>/ɪmˈpeə(r)/<,>/ɪmˈper/<,>vt.损害/vt.损伤/vt.削弱<,>Smoking can impair your health.<,>吸烟会损害你的健康。<,>The accident impaired his vision.<,>这次事故损伤了他的视力。<,>Lack of sleep impairs cognitive function.<,>睡眠不足会削弱认知功能。<,>im(不)+pair(配对)→不配对→损害<,>repair(v.修理)/despair(n.绝望)/compare(v.比较)
dolphin<,>/ˈdɒlfɪn/<,>/ˈdɑːlfɪn/<,>n.海豚<,>The dolphin jumped out of the water gracefully.<,>海豚优雅地跃出水面。<,>Dolphins are known for their intelligence and playful nature.<,>海豚以其聪明和爱玩耍的天性而闻名。<,>We went on a boat trip to see dolphins in the wild.<,>我们乘船去看野生海豚。<,>联想：doll（玩偶）+ fin（鳍）→像玩偶一样有鳍的动物→海豚<,>porpoise(n.鼠海豚)/seal(n.海豹)/whale(n.鲸鱼)

sightseeing<,>/ˈsaɪtsiːɪŋ/<,>/ˈsaɪtsiːɪŋ/<,>n.观光/游览<,>We spent the afternoon sightseeing in the old town.<,>我们下午在老城区观光。<,>Sightseeing is one of the main attractions for tourists.<,>观光游览是吸引游客的主要项目之一。<,>They went sightseeing around the famous landmarks.<,>他们游览了著名的地标建筑。<,>sight（景色）+ seeing（看）→看景色→观光<,>tour(n.旅行)/excursion(n.短途旅行)/journey(n.旅程)

stray<,>/streɪ/<,>/streɪ/<,>vi.走失/迷路/分心/走神/离题 adj.迷路的/走失的/孤立的/零星的 n.走失的家畜<,>The cat strayed from home and got lost.<,>猫从家里走失迷路了。<,>Her thoughts strayed during the boring lecture.<,>在无聊的讲座中她走神了。<,>We found a few stray dogs in the neighborhood.<,>我们在附近发现了几只流浪狗。<,>谐音：死追→走失的动物需要死追才能找回<,>astray(adv.迷途地)/strayer(n.迷路者)/strew(v.散播)

planet<,>/ˈplænɪt/<,>/ˈplænɪt/<,>n.行星<,>Earth is the third planet from the sun.<,>地球是距离太阳第三近的行星。<,>Scientists have discovered a new planet in our solar system.<,>科学家在我们的太阳系中发现了一颗新行星。<,>The planet Mars is often called the Red Planet.<,>火星常被称为红色行星。<,>plane（平面）+t→在平面上运行的星体→行星<,>star(n.恒星)/comet(n.彗星)/satellite(n.卫星)

exhaust<,>/ɪɡˈzɔːst/<,>/ɪɡˈzɔːst/<,>vt.使筋疲力尽/用尽/详尽论述 n.排气装置/废气<,>The long hike exhausted all of us.<,>长途徒步让我们都筋疲力尽。<,>The car's exhaust was emitting black smoke.<,>汽车的排气管冒着黑烟。<,>She exhausted all possible solutions to the problem.<,>她详尽论述了所有可能的解决方案。<,>ex（出）+haust（抽）→把力气抽出去→使筋疲力尽<,>fatigue(n.疲劳)/deplete(v.耗尽)/emission(n.排放)

thereafter<,>/ˌðeərˈɑːftə(r)/<,>/ˌðerˈæftər/<,>adv.之后/以后<,>He graduated in 2010 and found a job shortly thereafter.<,>他2010年毕业，之后不久就找到了工作。<,>The law was passed, and thereafter all new buildings had to meet stricter standards.<,>法律通过后，此后所有新建筑都必须符合更严格的标准。<,>She moved to London and lived there thereafter.<,>她搬到伦敦并在那里生活。<,>there（那里）+after（之后）→在那之后<,>thereby(adv.因此)/therein(adv.在其中)/thereupon(adv.于是)

soluble<,>/ˈsɒljəbl/<,>/ˈsɑːljəbl/<,>adj.可溶的/可解决的<,>Sugar is soluble in water.<,>糖可溶于水。<,>The problem is soluble if we work together.<,>如果我们一起努力，这个问题是可以解决的。<,>This medication comes in soluble tablet form.<,>这种药物是可溶性片剂。<,>solu（溶解）+ble（能…的）→能溶解的<,>insoluble(adj.不溶的)/solvent(adj.有溶解力的)/solution(n.解决方案)

feast<,>/fiːst/<,>/fiːst/<,>vi.尽情地吃/宴饮/参加宴会 n.盛宴/筵席/节日<,>They feasted on delicious food at the wedding.<,>他们在婚礼上享用美食。<,>The Christmas feast lasted for hours.<,>圣诞盛宴持续了好几个小时。<,>The town holds an annual feast to celebrate its founding.<,>小镇每年都会举办盛宴庆祝建镇。<,>f（看作"丰"）+east（东方）→东方丰盛的宴会→盛宴<,>festival(n.节日)/banquet(n.正式宴会)/buffet(n.自助餐)

vision<,>/ˈvɪʒn/<,>/ˈvɪʒən/<,>n.想象力/梦幻/视力/视觉<,>She had a vision of becoming a famous singer.<,>她梦想成为著名歌手。<,>His vision began to deteriorate with age.<,>随着年龄增长，他的视力开始下降。<,>The leader presented his vision for the company's future.<,>领导展示了公司未来的愿景。<,>vis（看）+ion（名词后缀）→视觉<,>illusion(n.幻觉)/revision(n.修订)/television(n.电视)

accompany<,>/əˈkʌmpəni/<,>/əˈkʌmpəni/<,>v.陪同/伴随/为…伴奏<,>She asked her friend to accompany her to the doctor.<,>她请朋友陪她去看医生。<,>The singer was accompanied by a pianist.<,>歌手由钢琴家伴奏。<,>Rain often accompanies thunderstorms.<,>下雨常伴随着雷暴。<,>ac（加强）+company（陪伴）→陪伴<,>companion(n.同伴)/escort(v.护送)/attend(v.出席)
armor<,>/ˈɑːmə(r)/<,>/ˈɑrmər/<,>n.盔甲/n.装甲/n.保护物<,>The knight wore a suit of armor to protect himself in battle.<,>骑士穿着盔甲以在战斗中保护自己。<,>The tank's armor is designed to withstand heavy gunfire.<,>坦克的装甲设计用来抵御重火力。<,>Love can be an emotional armor against life's hardships.<,>爱可以成为抵御生活艰辛的情感护甲。<,>arm(武器)+or(物)→防护武器→盔甲<,>armory(n.军械库)/alarm(n.警报/v.警告)/harmony(n.和谐)

acceptance<,>/əkˈseptəns/<,>/əkˈsɛptəns/<,>n.接受/n.承认/n.容忍<,>Her acceptance of the job offer surprised everyone.<,>她接受这份工作邀请让所有人都很惊讶。<,>The theory gained widespread acceptance in the scientific community.<,>这个理论在科学界获得了广泛认可。<,>He showed remarkable acceptance of his difficult circumstances.<,>他对自己的困境表现出惊人的容忍。<,>accept(接受)+ance(状态)→接受的状态<,>except(prep.除...外)/access(n.入口/v.接近)/accent(n.口音)

beneficial<,>/ˌbenɪˈfɪʃl/<,>/ˌbɛnəˈfɪʃəl/<,>adj.有利的/adj.有益的<,>Regular exercise is beneficial to your health.<,>定期锻炼对你的健康有益。<,>The new policy proved beneficial to small businesses.<,>新政策证明对小企业有利。<,>Sunlight is beneficial for plant growth.<,>阳光对植物生长有益。<,>bene(好)+fic(做)+ial(的)→做好事的→有益的<,>benefit(n.好处/v.受益)/beneficiary(n.受益人)/malefic(adj.有害的)

paradise<,>/ˈpærədaɪs/<,>/ˈpærəˌdaɪs/<,>n.天堂/n.乐园<,>Hawaii is often described as a tropical paradise.<,>夏威夷常被描述为热带天堂。<,>The garden was a paradise for butterflies.<,>这个花园是蝴蝶的乐园。<,>After retirement, they found their paradise in the countryside.<,>退休后，他们在乡村找到了自己的天堂。<,>para(旁边)+dise(看作"dice"骰子)→赌场旁边是天堂(讽刺说法)<,>parasite(n.寄生虫)/paradox(n.悖论)/parade(n.游行)

tackle<,>/ˈtækl/<,>/ˈtækəl/<,>vt.对付/vt.处理/vt.与...交涉/vt.阻截/vt.擒抱/n.阻截/n.擒抱/n.用具/n.钓具/n.辘轳/n.滑车<,>We need to tackle this problem immediately.<,>我们需要立即处理这个问题。<,>The football player made a perfect tackle.<,>这名橄榄球运动员完成了一次完美的擒抱。<,>He keeps his fishing tackle in the garage.<,>他把钓鱼用具放在车库里。<,>tack(大头钉)+le(小)→用钉子固定→处理<,>tickle(v.挠痒)/tacky(adj.俗气的)/tact(n.机智)

reckon<,>/ˈrekən/<,>/ˈrɛkən/<,>vt.认为/vt.估计/vt.指望/vt.盼望/vt.测算/vt.测量<,>I reckon it will take about two hours to get there.<,>我估计到那里需要大约两小时。<,>You can reckon on my support.<,>你可以指望我的支持。<,>They reckoned the cost of the project carefully.<,>他们仔细测算过项目成本。<,>reck(注意)+on(在...上)→把注意力放在...上→考虑<,>beckon(v.招手)/recognize(v.认出)/reckless(adj.鲁莽的)

confusion<,>/kənˈfjuːʒn/<,>/kənˈfjuʒən/<,>n.困惑/n.糊涂/n.混淆/n.骚乱<,>There was some confusion about the meeting time.<,>关于会议时间有些困惑。<,>The instructions caused more confusion than clarity.<,>这些说明带来的困惑多于清晰。<,>The sudden power outage created confusion in the theater.<,>突然停电在剧院里引起了骚乱。<,>con(一起)+fus(流)+ion→流到一起→混淆<,>diffusion(n.扩散)/fusion(n.融合)/refuse(v.拒绝)

distract<,>/dɪˈstrækt/<,>/dɪˈstrækt/<,>vt.转移/vt.使分心<,>The noise distracted me from my work.<,>噪音让我无法专心工作。<,>She tried to distract the baby with a toy.<,>她试图用玩具转移宝宝的注意力。<,>Don't distract the driver while he's operating the vehicle.<,>司机开车时不要让他分心。<,>dis(分开)+tract(拉)→把注意力拉开→分心<,>attract(v.吸引)/extract(v.提取)/contract(n.合同)

hinge<,>/hɪndʒ/<,>/hɪndʒ/<,>vi.以...为转移/n.铰链/vt.装铰链<,>The success of the plan hinges on your cooperation.<,>这个计划的成功取决于你的配合。<,>The door needs new hinges.<,>这扇门需要新的铰链。<,>We'll hinge the gate tomorrow.<,>我们明天会给大门装铰链。<,>hing(悬挂)+e→可以悬挂转动的东西→铰链<,>hinged(adj.有铰链的)/fringe(n.边缘)/tinge(n.淡色调)

virtual<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuəl/<,>/ˈvɜrtʃuəl/<,>adj.实质上的/adj.事实上的/adj.实际上的<,>She is the virtual leader of the group.<,>她是这个团队实际上的领导者。<,>We held a virtual meeting online.<,>我们在线上开了个虚拟会议。<,>The two companies have a virtual monopoly in this market.<,>这两家公司在这个市场上几乎垄断。<,>virt(美德)+ual→有美德的→真实的<,>virtue(n.美德)/virtuoso(n.艺术大师)/virtually(adv.实际上)
squeeze<,>/skwiːz/<,>/skwiz/<,>v.压榨/v.挤/n.榨取/n.勒索<,>She squeezed the juice from the oranges.<,>她从橙子里榨出果汁。<,>He squeezed through the narrow gap.<,>他从狭窄的缝隙中挤了过去。<,>The company was accused of squeezing its suppliers.<,>该公司被指控压榨供应商。<,>s+quee(谐音"亏")+ze→压榨让人亏<,>sneeze(v.打喷嚏)/breeze(n.微风)/freeze(v.冻结)

blank<,>/blæŋk/<,>/blæŋk/<,>adj.空白的/adj.茫然的/n.空白/n.空白表格<,>Please fill in the blank spaces.<,>请填写空白处。<,>He gave me a blank look.<,>他茫然地看了我一眼。<,>I need a blank form to apply for the visa.<,>我需要一张空白表格来申请签证。<,>bl(白)+ank(谐音"空")→空白<,>black(adj.黑色的)/bank(n.银行)/blink(v.眨眼)

additional<,>/əˈdɪʃənl/<,>/əˈdɪʃənəl/<,>adj.附加的/adj.追加的<,>We need additional information to process your request.<,>我们需要额外的信息来处理您的请求。<,>There will be an additional charge for late checkout.<,>延迟退房将收取额外费用。<,>She took on additional responsibilities at work.<,>她在工作中承担了额外的责任。<,>add(增加)+ition(名词后缀)+al(形容词后缀)→附加的<,>additive(n.添加剂)/addition(n.增加)/conditional(adj.有条件的)

worthy<,>/ˈwɜːði/<,>/ˈwɜrði/<,>adj.有价值的/adj.值得的<,>This is a worthy cause to support.<,>这是一个值得支持的事业。<,>She proved herself worthy of the promotion.<,>她证明自己值得晋升。<,>The museum contains many worthy artifacts.<,>博物馆里有许多有价值的文物。<,>worth(价值)+y(形容词后缀)→有价值的<,>worthless(adj.无价值的)/worthwhile(adj.值得的)/worship(v.崇拜)

primarily<,>/ˈpraɪmərəli/<,>/praɪˈmɛrəli/<,>adv.首先/adv.主要地<,>The book is primarily intended for beginners.<,>这本书主要是为初学者编写的。<,>He is primarily responsible for the project's success.<,>他主要负责项目的成功。<,>The disease primarily affects older people.<,>这种疾病主要影响老年人。<,>prim(第一)+ary(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→主要地<,>primary(adj.主要的)/prime(adj.首要的)/primal(adj.原始的)

telecommunications<,>/ˌtelɪkəˌmjuːnɪˈkeɪʃnz/<,>/ˌtɛləkəˌmjunəˈkeɪʃənz/<,>n.通信/n.电信<,>The telecommunications industry is growing rapidly.<,>电信行业发展迅速。<,>Modern telecommunications have made the world smaller.<,>现代通信使世界变得更小。<,>He works in the telecommunications department.<,>他在电信部门工作。<,>tele(远)+communication(通信)→电信<,>telephone(n.电话)/telegraph(n.电报)/telescope(n.望远镜)

ferry<,>/ˈferi/<,>/ˈfɛri/<,>n.渡船/vt.渡运<,>We took the ferry to the island.<,>我们乘渡船去了岛上。<,>The boat ferries passengers across the river.<,>这艘船运送乘客过河。<,>There is a ferry service every hour.<,>每小时有一班渡轮服务。<,>fer(带)+ry(名词后缀)→渡运<,>fairy(n.仙女)/furry(adj.毛茸茸的)/ferryman(n.渡船工)

ignore<,>/ɪɡˈnɔː(r)/<,>/ɪɡˈnɔr/<,>vt.不顾/vt.不理/vt.忽视<,>He ignored my advice and got into trouble.<,>他不听我的建议，惹上了麻烦。<,>She pretended to ignore the rude comment.<,>她假装没听到那个粗鲁的评论。<,>The government cannot ignore the people's demands.<,>政府不能忽视人民的要求。<,>i(不)+gnore(知道)→不知道→忽视<,>ignorant(adj.无知的)/ignorance(n.无知)/ignoble(adj.卑贱的)

hemisphere<,>/ˈhemɪsfɪə(r)/<,>/ˈhɛmɪsfɪr/<,>n.地球的半球/n.大脑半球<,>The Northern Hemisphere experiences winter in December.<,>北半球在12月经历冬季。<,>The left hemisphere of the brain controls language.<,>大脑的左半球控制语言。<,>Australia is in the Southern Hemisphere.<,>澳大利亚位于南半球。<,>hemi(半)+sphere(球)→半球<,>atmosphere(n.大气)/biosphere(n.生物圈)/lithosphere(n.岩石圈)

reception<,>/rɪˈsepʃn/<,>/rɪˈsɛpʃən/<,>n.招待会/n.欢迎会/n.接受/n.接待/n.接收效果<,>There was a warm reception for the new manager.<,>新经理受到了热情的接待。<,>The wedding reception was held in a grand hotel.<,>婚宴在一家豪华酒店举行。<,>My phone has poor reception in this area.<,>我的手机在这个地区信号很差。<,>re(再)+cept(拿)+ion(名词后缀)→接待<,>conception(n.概念)/deception(n.欺骗)/perception(n.感知)
applaud<,>/əˈplɔːd/<,>/əˈplɔd/<,>vi.鼓掌/vi.喝彩/vt.向…鼓掌/vt.向…喝彩/vt.称赞/vt.赞许<,>The audience applauded loudly after the performance.<,>演出结束后观众热烈鼓掌。<,>We should applaud her for her bravery.<,>我们应该为她的勇敢喝彩。<,>The critics applauded the director's new film.<,>评论家们称赞了这位导演的新电影。<,>ap(强调)+plaud(鼓掌)→鼓掌喝彩<,>applause(n.鼓掌)/laud(v.赞美)/plausible(adj.貌似合理的)

outward<,>/ˈaʊtwəd/<,>/ˈaʊtwərd/<,>adv.向外地/adj.外面的/adj.外表的<,>He turned his gaze outward to the sea.<,>他把目光转向外面的海洋。<,>The outward appearance of the building is impressive.<,>这座建筑的外观令人印象深刻。<,>She maintained an outward calm despite her nervousness.<,>尽管紧张，她表面上仍保持冷静。<,>out(外)+ward(方向)→向外<,>inward(adv.向内/adj.内部的)/outwards(adv.向外)/outwear(v.穿坏)

lunar<,>/ˈluːnə(r)/<,>/ˈluːnər/<,>adj.月的/adj.月球的<,>The lunar eclipse will be visible tonight.<,>今晚可以看到月食。<,>They are studying the lunar surface.<,>他们正在研究月球表面。<,>The lunar calendar is still used in some cultures.<,>一些文化仍在使用阴历。<,>lun(月亮)+ar(形容词后缀)→月亮的<,>solar(adj.太阳的)/lunatic(adj.疯狂的)/lunacy(n.精神错乱)

jury<,>/ˈdʒʊəri/<,>/ˈdʒʊri/<,>n.陪审团/n.评奖团<,>The jury reached a unanimous verdict.<,>陪审团达成了一致裁决。<,>She served on the jury for the art competition.<,>她担任了艺术比赛的评奖团成员。<,>The jury is still out on this issue.<,>这个问题尚无定论。<,>jur(法律)+y(名词后缀)→陪审团<,>judge(n.法官)/juror(n.陪审员)/injury(n.伤害)

arrogant<,>/ˈærəɡənt/<,>/ˈærəɡənt/<,>adj.傲慢的/adj.自大的<,>His arrogant attitude made him unpopular.<,>他傲慢的态度使他不受欢迎。<,>Don't be so arrogant about your achievements.<,>不要对你的成就如此自大。<,>She gave him an arrogant smile.<,>她对他傲慢地笑了笑。<,>ar(强调)+rog(要求)+ant(形容词后缀)→傲慢的<,>humble(adj.谦逊的)/arrogance(n.傲慢)/errogant(adj.错误的)

idiot<,>/ˈɪdiət/<,>/ˈɪdiət/<,>n.白痴/n.傻子/n.笨蛋<,>Don't be such an idiot!<,>别这么傻了！<,>He felt like an idiot for forgetting her birthday.<,>他因为忘记她的生日而觉得自己像个白痴。<,>Only an idiot would make that mistake.<,>只有笨蛋才会犯那个错误。<,>idio(独特的)+t→独特到愚蠢→白痴<,>genius(n.天才)/idiotic(adj.愚蠢的)/idiom(n.习语)

relay<,>/ˈriːleɪ/<,>/ˈriːleɪ/<,>n.接力赛/n.中继转播/vt.传送/vt.传达/vt.转述/vt.中继转播<,>Our team won the 4x100 meter relay.<,>我们队赢得了4x100米接力赛。<,>Please relay the message to the manager.<,>请把这个消息转达给经理。<,>The news was relayed around the world.<,>这个消息被转播到世界各地。<,>re(再)+lay(放置)→再次放置→转播<,>delay(v.延迟)/relay race(n.接力赛)/relayer(n.中继器)

priest<,>/priːst/<,>/priːst/<,>n.神父/n.牧师<,>The priest conducted the wedding ceremony.<,>神父主持了婚礼仪式。<,>He trained for many years to become a priest.<,>他经过多年训练成为牧师。<,>She went to confess to the priest.<,>她去向神父忏悔。<,>pri(首要)+est(人)→首要的人→神父<,>minister(n.牧师)/clergy(n.神职人员)/priesthood(n.神职)

permeate<,>/ˈpɜːmieɪt/<,>/ˈpɜːrmieɪt/<,>v.弥漫/v.遍布/v.散布/v.渗入/v.渗透<,>The smell of fresh bread permeated the whole house.<,>新鲜面包的香味弥漫了整个房子。<,>His ideas have permeated throughout the organization.<,>他的想法已经渗透到整个组织中。<,>Water can permeate through this membrane.<,>水可以渗透过这层膜。<,>per(完全)+mea(通过)+te→完全通过→渗透<,>permeant(adj.渗透的)/permeable(adj.可渗透的)

schedule<,>/ˈʃedjuːl/<,>/ˈskedʒuːl/<,>n.时刻表/n.日程安排表/n.清单/n.明细表/vt.安排/vt.排定<,>Please check the train schedule before you leave.<,>出发前请查看火车时刻表。<,>We need to schedule a meeting for next week.<,>我们需要为下周安排一次会议。<,>The project is running behind schedule.<,>这个项目比原定计划落后了。<,>sched(纸)+ule→写在纸上的计划→日程表<,>agenda(n.议程)/timetable(n.时间表)

tame<,>/teɪm/<,>/teɪm/<,>adj.驯服的/adj.顺从的/adj.沉闷的/adj.乏味的/vt.制服/vt.控制并利用/vt.驯化/vt.驯服<,>The lion was surprisingly tame around its keeper.<,>这只狮子在饲养员身边出奇地温顺。<,>Some wild animals can never be fully tamed.<,>有些野生动物永远无法完全驯服。<,>The party was rather tame compared to last year's.<,>与去年相比，这次聚会相当乏味。<,>tam(驯服)+e→驯服的<,>lame(adj.跛的)/game(n.游戏)

inherit<,>/ɪnˈherɪt/<,>/ɪnˈherɪt/<,>vt.继承<,>She inherited a large fortune from her grandfather.<,>她从祖父那里继承了一大笔财产。<,>He inherited his father's business when he was only 25.<,>他25岁时就继承了父亲的生意。<,>Some diseases can be inherited genetically.<,>有些疾病可以通过基因遗传。<,>in(内)+her(继承)+it→继承<,>inherent(adj.固有的)/heritage(n.遗产)

overwhelming<,>/ˌəʊvəˈwelmɪŋ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈwelmɪŋ/<,>adj.势不可挡的/adj.压倒的/adj.巨大的<,>The team won with an overwhelming majority.<,>该队以压倒性多数获胜。<,>She felt an overwhelming sense of relief when she heard the news.<,>听到这个消息时，她感到一种巨大的解脱感。<,>The evidence against him was overwhelming.<,>对他不利的证据是压倒性的。<,>over(过度)+whelm(淹没)+ing→过度淹没的→压倒性的<,>underwhelming(adj.未达预期的)/overbearing(adj.专横的)
