psychiatrist<,>/saɪˈkaɪətrɪst/<,>/saɪˈkaɪətrɪst/<,>n.精神科医生/n.精神病专家<,>The psychiatrist helped her overcome her anxiety.<,>这位精神科医生帮助她克服了焦虑。<,>He decided to see a psychiatrist for his depression.<,>他决定去看精神科医生治疗抑郁症。<,>She is a renowned psychiatrist in the field of mental health.<,>她是心理健康领域著名的精神病专家。<,>psych(心理)+iatrist(专家)→精神科医生<,>psychologist(n.心理学家)/psycho(n.精神病患者)/psychiatry(n.精神病学)  

squad<,>/skwɒd/<,>/skwɑːd/<,>n.班/n.小队/n.小组<,>The police squad arrived at the scene quickly.<,>警察小队迅速赶到现场。<,>He was assigned to a special operations squad.<,>他被分配到一个特别行动小组。<,>The football squad is training hard for the upcoming match.<,>足球队正在为即将到来的比赛刻苦训练。<,>squ(挤压)+ad(群体)→紧密的群体→小队<,>squadron(n.中队)/square(n.广场)/squash(v.压碎)  

disrupt<,>/dɪsˈrʌpt/<,>/dɪsˈrʌpt/<,>vt.使中断/vt.扰乱<,>The storm disrupted the power supply.<,>暴风雨中断了电力供应。<,>Protesters disrupted the meeting with loud shouts.<,>抗议者用大声喊叫扰乱了会议。<,>New technologies often disrupt traditional industries.<,>新技术常常扰乱传统行业。<,>dis(分开)+rupt(断裂)→使中断<,>interrupt(v.打断)/erupt(v.爆发)/corrupt(adj.腐败的)  

scar<,>/skɑː(r)/<,>/skɑːr/<,>v.留下伤痕/n.伤疤/n.伤痕/n.创伤<,>The accident scarred his face permanently.<,>那次事故给他的脸留下了永久的伤痕。<,>She has a small scar on her arm from childhood.<,>她手臂上有一个小时候留下的小伤疤。<,>The war left deep scars on the survivors.<,>战争给幸存者留下了深深的创伤。<,>s+car(汽车)→车祸容易留下伤痕<,>scare(v.惊吓)/scarf(n.围巾)/scary(adj.可怕的)  

sergeant<,>/ˈsɑːdʒənt/<,>/ˈsɑːrdʒənt/<,>n.中士/n.警官<,>The sergeant gave orders to the troops.<,>中士向部队下达了命令。<,>Sergeant Smith is investigating the case.<,>史密斯警官正在调查这个案子。<,>He was promoted to sergeant after five years of service.<,>服役五年后，他被提升为中士。<,>serg(服务)+eant(人)→服务的人→警官<,>serge(n.哔叽布料)/servant(n.仆人)/serious(adj.严肃的)  

vital<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>adj.生死攸关的/adj.极其重要的/adj.生命的/adj.有生命力的<,>Water is vital for all living things.<,>水对所有生物都至关重要。<,>This is a vital piece of evidence for the case.<,>这是本案极其重要的证据。<,>She plays a vital role in the company's success.<,>她在公司的成功中起着关键作用。<,>vit(生命)+al(形容词后缀)→有生命力的<,>vitality(n.活力)/vitamin(n.维生素)/fatal(adj.致命的)  

eccentric<,>/ɪkˈsentrɪk/<,>/ɪkˈsentrɪk/<,>adj.古怪的/adj.怪癖的/adj.异乎寻常的/n.古怪的人/n.怪癖的人<,>His eccentric behavior often surprises people.<,>他古怪的行为常常让人吃惊。<,>She collects eccentric hats from around the world.<,>她收集来自世界各地的古怪帽子。<,>The old millionaire was known as the town eccentric.<,>那位老百万富翁是镇上出了名的怪人。<,>ec(出)+centr(中心)+ic→偏离中心的→古怪的<,>concentric(adj.同心的)/egocentric(adj.自我中心的)/eccentricity(n.古怪)  

conflict<,>/ˈkɒnflɪkt/<,>/ˈkɑːnflɪkt/<,>vi.冲突/vi.抵触/n.冲突/n.抵触/n.争论/n.战斗/n.战争<,>Their opinions conflict on this issue.<,>他们在这个问题上的意见相冲突。<,>The conflict between the two countries lasted for years.<,>两国之间的冲突持续了多年。<,>She tries to avoid conflict at work.<,>她尽量避免工作中的冲突。<,>con(共同)+flict(打击)→互相打击→冲突<,>inflict(v.使遭受)/afflict(v.使苦恼)/inflection(n.曲折变化)  

appliance<,>/əˈplaɪəns/<,>/əˈplaɪəns/<,>n.用具/n.器具/n.器械<,>The kitchen is equipped with modern appliances.<,>厨房配备了现代化的器具。<,>This appliance saves a lot of time in housework.<,>这个用具在家务中节省了大量时间。<,>He repairs electrical appliances for a living.<,>他以修理电器为生。<,>apply(应用)+ance(名词后缀)→应用的器具<,>applicant(n.申请人)/application(n.申请)/compliance(n.顺从)  

alloy<,>/ˈælɔɪ/<,>/ˈælɔɪ/<,>n.合金/vt.将...铸成合金<,>Steel is an alloy of iron and carbon.<,>钢是铁和碳的合金。<,>This ring is made of a gold-silver alloy.<,>这枚戒指是由金银合金制成的。<,>They alloyed copper with zinc to make brass.<,>他们将铜和锌熔合成黄铜。<,>al(加强)+loy(绑)→绑在一起→合金<,>loyal(adj.忠诚的)/alloyed(adj.合金的)/alloying(n.合金化)
delusion<,>/dɪˈluːʒn/<,>/dɪˈluːʒn/<,>n.欺骗/n.哄骗<,>He was under the delusion that he could fly.<,>他妄想自己能飞。<,>Her kindness was just a cruel delusion.<,>她的善良只是残酷的欺骗。<,>The cult leader exploited their delusions.<,>邪教头目利用了他们的妄想。<,>de(否定)+lus(玩)+ion→玩虚假把戏→欺骗<,>illusion(n.幻觉)/allusion(n.暗示)/elusion(n.逃避)  

mass<,>/mæs/<,>/mæs/<,>adj.大量的/adj.大规模的/v.聚集/v.集中/n.众多/n.大量/n.团/n.块/n.堆/n.群众/n.质量<,>A mass of clouds gathered in the sky.<,>天空中聚集了大片云层。<,>The mass production reduced costs significantly.<,>大规模生产显著降低了成本。<,>Protesters massed in front of city hall.<,>抗议者在市政厅前聚集。<,>mas(大量)+s→大量堆积<,>mess(n.混乱)/mash(v.捣碎)/moss(n.苔藓)  

detect<,>/dɪˈtekt/<,>/dɪˈtɛkt/<,>vt.察觉/vt.发觉/vt.侦查出<,>The test can detect early signs of disease.<,>该检测能发现疾病早期迹象。<,>I detected a note of sarcasm in her voice.<,>我察觉她话中带刺。<,>Security systems detected unauthorized access.<,>安防系统侦测到未授权访问。<,>de(去掉)+tect(掩盖)→去掉掩盖→发现<,>defect(n.缺点)/protect(v.保护)/inspect(v.检查)  

update<,>/ʌpˈdeɪt/<,>/ˈʌpˌdeɪt/<,>vt.更新/vt.使现代化/n.最新信息<,>Remember to update your antivirus software.<,>记得更新杀毒软件。<,>The news anchor provided live updates.<,>新闻主播提供了实时更新。<,>We need to update our marketing strategy.<,>我们需要更新营销策略。<,>up(向上)+date(日期)→与时俱进<,>upgrade(v.升级)/upload(v.上传)/upkeep(n.维护)  

renaissance<,>/rɪˈneɪsns/<,>/ˈrɛnəˌsɑns/<,>n.文艺复兴/n.文艺复兴时期/n.复兴/n.再生<,>Florence was the cradle of the Renaissance.<,>佛罗伦萨是文艺复兴的发源地。<,>There's a renaissance of interest in traditional crafts.<,>传统工艺正重新受到关注。<,>The art exhibition celebrates the Harlem Renaissance.<,>这个艺术展纪念哈莱姆文艺复兴。<,>re(重新)+naiss(出生)+ance→重生<,>naissance(n.诞生)/renewal(n.更新)/resurgence(n.复苏)  

poisonous<,>/ˈpɔɪzənəs/<,>/ˈpɔɪzənəs/<,>adj.有毒的/adj.恶毒的<,>That mushroom is highly poisonous.<,>那种蘑菇有剧毒。<,>She gave him a poisonous look.<,>她恶毒地瞪了他一眼。<,>The factory released poisonous gases into the air.<,>工厂向空气中排放有毒气体。<,>poison(毒)+ous(形容词后缀)→有毒的<,>venomous(adj.有毒的)/noxious(adj.有害的)/vicious(adj.恶毒的)  

condemn<,>/kənˈdem/<,>/kənˈdɛm/<,>vt.谴责/vt.指责/vt.判...刑/vt.宣告...有罪<,>The UN condemned the human rights violations.<,>联合国谴责侵犯人权的行为。<,>The old building was condemned as unsafe.<,>这栋旧建筑被判定为不安全。<,>He was condemned to life imprisonment.<,>他被判处终身监禁。<,>con(完全)+demn(伤害)→完全伤害→谴责<,>contemn(v.蔑视)/condone(v.宽恕)/commend(v.赞扬)  

assistance<,>/əˈsɪstəns/<,>/əˈsɪstəns/<,>n.协助/n.援助<,>She offered financial assistance to the refugees.<,>她向难民提供了经济援助。<,>The patient needs assistance with daily activities.<,>病人需要日常生活协助。<,>Technical assistance is available 24/7.<,>全天候提供技术支持。<,>as(朝向)+sist(站立)+ance→站在旁边→帮助<,>assistant(n.助手)/consistence(n.一致性)/persistence(n.坚持)  

auction<,>/ˈɔːkʃn/<,>/ˈɔkʃən/<,>n&vt.拍卖<,>They auctioned the painting for charity.<,>他们为慈善拍卖这幅画。<,>The antique vase sold at auction for £10,000.<,>这个古董花瓶在拍卖会上以1万英镑成交。<,>Online auctions have become increasingly popular.<,>网络拍卖越来越受欢迎。<,>auct(增加)+ion→价格不断增加→拍卖<,>action(n.行动)/audition(n.试镜)/caution(n.谨慎)  

propel<,>/prəˈpel/<,>/prəˈpɛl/<,>vt.推进/vt.推动/vt.激励/vt.驱使<,>The boat is propelled by solar energy.<,>这艘船靠太阳能驱动。<,>His ambition propelled him to success.<,>雄心驱使他走向成功。<,>Jet engines propel the aircraft forward.<,>喷气发动机推动飞机前进。<,>pro(向前)+pel(推)→向前推<,>repel(v.击退)/compel(v.强迫)/expel(v.驱逐)
admit<,>/ədˈmɪt/<,>/ədˈmɪt/<,>vi.承认/vt.承认,供认/vt.准许…进入<,>He admitted his mistake in front of everyone.<,>他在众人面前承认了自己的错误。<,>This ticket admits two people to the museum.<,>这张票允许两个人进入博物馆。<,>She admitted to stealing the money.<,>她供认偷了钱。<,>ad(加强)+mit(送)→送入→准许进入<,>permit(v.允许/n.许可证)/commit(v.犯罪/v.承诺)/emit(v.发出/v.散发)

uneven<,>/ʌnˈiːv(ə)n/<,>/ʌnˈivən/<,>adj.不平坦的,不平滑的/adj.不一致的,不相等的<,>The road was uneven and full of potholes.<,>这条路崎岖不平，满是坑洼。<,>Her performance has been uneven this season.<,>她本赛季的表现时好时坏。<,>The distribution of resources is uneven across regions.<,>资源在各地区的分配不均。<,>un(不)+even(平的)→不平的<,>even(adj.平坦的/adv.甚至)/uneventful(adj.平淡无奇的)/unfair(adj.不公平的)

definition<,>/ˌdefɪˈnɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌdɛfəˈnɪʃən/<,>n.定义,释义,定界/n.清晰,鲜明<,>The dictionary provides clear definitions of words.<,>这本词典提供了清晰的词语定义。<,>The photo lacks definition in the background.<,>这张照片的背景不够清晰。<,>We need to agree on a definition of success.<,>我们需要就成功的定义达成一致。<,>de(加强)+fin(界限)+ition→划出界限→定义<,>definite(adj.明确的)/indefinite(adj.模糊的)/refine(v.精炼/v.改善)

mansion<,>/ˈmænʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˈmænʃən/<,>n.大厦,宅邸<,>The old mansion has been converted into a hotel.<,>这座古老的宅邸已被改造成酒店。<,>He lives in a luxurious mansion by the lake.<,>他住在湖边一座豪华的宅邸里。<,>The mansion has over twenty rooms and a swimming pool.<,>这座宅邸有二十多个房间和一个游泳池。<,>man(居住)+sion(场所)→居住的场所→宅邸<,>manor(n.庄园)/manner(n.方式)/mention(v.提及)

mask<,>/mɑːsk/<,>/mæsk/<,>n.面具,面罩,口罩/n.伪装/vt.遮盖,掩饰<,>She wore a mask to protect herself from the virus.<,>她戴着口罩保护自己免受病毒侵害。<,>His smile masked his true feelings.<,>他的微笑掩饰了他真实的感受。<,>The thief wore a mask to hide his identity.<,>小偷戴着面具隐藏身份。<,>联想：mask→"马赛克"→遮盖<,>mash(v.捣碎/n.糊状物)/task(n.任务)/bask(v.晒太阳)

patrol<,>/pəˈtrəʊl/<,>/pəˈtroʊl/<,>v.巡逻,巡查/n.巡逻,巡查/n.巡逻兵,巡逻队<,>The police patrol the streets at night.<,>警察夜间在街道上巡逻。<,>We saw a military patrol near the border.<,>我们在边境附近看到一支军事巡逻队。<,>The security guard makes regular patrols of the building.<,>保安定期巡查大楼。<,>patr(父亲)+ol→像父亲一样守护→巡逻<,>petrol(n.汽油)/control(v.控制)/patron(n.赞助人)

nickel<,>/ˈnɪk(ə)l/<,>/ˈnɪkəl/<,>n.镍/n.五分镍币,五分钱<,>Nickel is used in the production of stainless steel.<,>镍用于不锈钢的生产。<,>I found a nickel on the sidewalk.<,>我在人行道上发现了一枚五分镍币。<,>This coin is made of nickel and copper.<,>这枚硬币由镍和铜制成。<,>nick(刻痕)+el→有刻痕的金属→镍<,>nick(v.刻痕/n.刻痕)/pickle(n.泡菜)/tickle(v.挠痒)

patron<,>/ˈpeɪtr(ə)n/<,>/ˈpeɪtrən/<,>n.资助人,赞助人/n.老主顾,顾客<,>The artist thanked his patron for the support.<,>艺术家感谢赞助人的支持。<,>He's a regular patron of this restaurant.<,>他是这家餐厅的常客。<,>The library was built with funds from wealthy patrons.<,>图书馆是用富裕赞助人的资金建造的。<,>patr(父亲)+on→像父亲一样支持的人→赞助人<,>pattern(n.模式)/patriot(n.爱国者)/patrol(n.巡逻)

entail<,>/ɪnˈteɪl/<,>/ɛnˈteɪl/<,>vt.使承担/vt.使成为必要,需要<,>This job entails working on weekends.<,>这份工作需要周末上班。<,>The project will entail significant costs.<,>这个项目将需要大量费用。<,>Owning a pet entails responsibility.<,>养宠物需要承担责任。<,>en(使)+tail(切割)→使切割→使承担<,>detail(n.细节)/retail(n.零售)/tailor(n.裁缝)

inferior<,>/ɪnˈfɪərɪə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈfɪriər/<,>adj.下等的,劣等的/n.下级,下属<,>This product is of inferior quality.<,>这个产品质量低劣。<,>He felt inferior to his more successful brother.<,>他觉得自己不如更成功的兄弟。<,>She treats her inferiors with respect.<,>她尊重地对待下属。<,>infer(下面)+ior→下面的→下等的<,>superior(adj.上级的/n.上级)/interior(adj.内部的)/exterior(adj.外部的)
apply<,>/əˈplaɪ/<,>/əˈplaɪ/<,>vi.应用/实施/使用/适用/申请/请求/vt.涂/敷/施<,>You should apply sunscreen before going outside.<,>出门前应该涂防晒霜。<,>This rule does not apply to international students.<,>这条规定不适用于留学生。<,>She applied for a scholarship last week.<,>她上周申请了奖学金。<,>ap(强调)+ply(折叠)→反复折叠→应用<,>reply(v.回答)/supply(v.供应)/comply(v.遵从)

propaganda<,>/ˌprɒpəˈɡændə/<,>/ˌprɑːpəˈɡændə/<,>n.宣传<,>The government spread propaganda through posters.<,>政府通过海报进行宣传。<,>This documentary exposes wartime propaganda.<,>这部纪录片揭露了战时宣传。<,>Don't believe everything you read - it might be propaganda.<,>不要轻信你读到的一切——那可能是宣传。<,>pro(向前)+pag(固定)+anda→向前固定思想→宣传<,>agenda(n.议程)/propagate(v.传播)/propensity(n.倾向)

overlook<,>/ˌəʊvəˈlʊk/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈlʊk/<,>vt.忽视/宽恕/俯瞰<,>My office overlooks the central park.<,>我的办公室俯瞰中央公园。<,>She overlooked his rude remark.<,>她宽恕了他粗鲁的言论。<,>Don't overlook the small details in the contract.<,>不要忽视合同中的小细节。<,>over(上面)+look(看)→从上面看→俯瞰<,>oversee(v.监督)/overload(v.超载)/overcast(adj.阴天的)

refuge<,>/ˈrefjuːdʒ/<,>/ˈrefjuːdʒ/<,>n.庇护所/避难处/庇护<,>They sought refuge in the church during the storm.<,>暴风雨期间他们在教堂寻求庇护。<,>The wildlife refuge protects endangered species.<,>野生动物保护区保护濒危物种。<,>He took refuge in alcohol after losing his job.<,>失业后他借酒消愁。<,>re(回)+fug(逃)+e→逃回安全处→避难所<,>refugee(n.难民)/fugitive(n.逃犯)/fugue(n.赋格曲)

dramatic<,>/drəˈmætɪk/<,>/drəˈmætɪk/<,>adj.引人注目的/激动人心的/戏剧的<,>There was a dramatic increase in sales last month.<,>上个月销售额有显著增长。<,>She made a dramatic entrance in a red dress.<,>她穿着红裙戏剧性地登场。<,>The play's dramatic ending left the audience speechless.<,>戏剧的震撼结局让观众哑口无言。<,>drama(戏剧)+tic(形容词后缀)→戏剧的<,>dynamic(adj.动态的)/diplomatic(adj.外交的)/traumatic(adj.创伤的)

incredible<,>/ɪnˈkredəbl/<,>/ɪnˈkredəbl/<,>adj.不能相信的/不可信的/难以置信的/惊人的<,>The view from the mountaintop was incredible.<,>山顶的景色令人难以置信。<,>She told an incredible story about meeting aliens.<,>她讲了一个遇见外星人的离奇故事。<,>He has an incredible memory for names.<,>他对名字的记忆力惊人。<,>in(不)+cred(相信)+ible(能...的)→不能相信的<,>credible(adj.可信的)/incredulous(adj.怀疑的)/creditable(adj.值得赞扬的)

certainty<,>/ˈsɜːtnti/<,>/ˈsɜːrtnti/<,>n.必然的事/确定的事实/确信/确实<,>There's no certainty that the project will succeed.<,>不能确定这个项目会成功。<,>Death is the only certainty in life.<,>死亡是生命中唯一确定的事。<,>She answered with complete certainty.<,>她十分确定地回答。<,>certain(确定的)+ty(名词后缀)→确定性<,>uncertainty(n.不确定性)/certitude(n.确信)/certify(v.证明)

corrode<,>/kəˈrəʊd/<,>/kəˈroʊd/<,>v.腐蚀/侵蚀<,>Acid rain corrodes metal structures.<,>酸雨腐蚀金属结构。<,>Salt water will corrode the pipes over time.<,>盐水会逐渐腐蚀管道。<,>Jealousy can corrode relationships.<,>嫉妒会侵蚀人际关系。<,>cor(完全)+rode(咬)→完全咬坏→腐蚀<,>erode(v.侵蚀)/corrosion(n.腐蚀)/corrosive(adj.腐蚀性的)

spine<,>/spaɪn/<,>/spaɪn/<,>n.脊柱/脊椎/刺/刺毛/书脊<,>He injured his spine in the accident.<,>他在事故中伤到了脊椎。<,>The cactus has sharp spines.<,>仙人掌有尖锐的刺。<,>The book's title is printed on the spine.<,>书名印在书脊上。<,>spin(旋转)+e→身体旋转的中轴→脊柱<,>spin(v.旋转)/spinet(n.小型立式钢琴)/spiny(adj.多刺的)

commend<,>/kəˈmend/<,>/kəˈmend/<,>vt.称赞/表扬/推荐<,>The teacher commended her for excellent work.<,>老师表扬她作业完成得出色。<,>I commend this book to all history lovers.<,>我向所有历史爱好者推荐这本书。<,>His bravery was highly commended.<,>他的勇敢受到高度赞扬。<,>com(共同)+mend(信任)→共同信任→推荐<,>command(v.命令)/recommend(v.推荐)/amend(v.修正)
parasite<,>/ˈpærəsaɪt/<,>/ˈpærəˌsaɪt/<,>n.寄生生物/n.寄生虫<,>The flea is a parasite that feeds on the blood of its host.<,>跳蚤是一种以宿主血液为食的寄生虫。<,>Some plants live as parasites on other plants.<,>有些植物寄生在其他植物上。<,>He was called a social parasite for never working.<,>他因从不工作被称为社会寄生虫。<,>para(旁边)+site(地点)→在旁边生存的生物→寄生虫<,>symbiosis(n.共生)/host(n.宿主)  

artificial<,>/ˌɑːtɪˈfɪʃl/<,>/ˌɑrtəˈfɪʃəl/<,>adj.人工的/adj.人为的/adj.矫揉造作的/adj.模拟的<,>Artificial flowers can look very realistic.<,>人造花可以看起来非常逼真。<,>Her smile seemed artificial and forced.<,>她的笑容显得做作而勉强。<,>The lab created an artificial heart for testing.<,>实验室制造了一个用于测试的人造心脏。<,>arti(技巧)+fic(做)+ial→用技巧做出来的一人造的<,>genuine(adj.真实的)/natural(adj.自然的)  

deficiency<,>/dɪˈfɪʃnsi/<,>/dɪˈfɪʃənsi/<,>n.缺乏/n.不足/n.缺点/n.缺陷<,>Vitamin D deficiency can cause health problems.<,>缺乏维生素D会导致健康问题。<,>The report pointed out several deficiencies in the system.<,>报告指出了系统中的几个缺陷。<,>Iron deficiency often leads to anemia.<,>缺铁常常导致贫血。<,>de(向下)+fic(做)+iency→做得不够→缺乏<,>sufficiency(n.充足)/efficiency(n.效率)  

imaginary<,>/ɪˈmædʒɪnəri/<,>/ɪˈmædʒəˌnɛri/<,>adj.想象中的/adj.假想的<,>The child has an imaginary friend named Bob.<,>这个孩子有个假想的朋友叫鲍勃。<,>The story takes place in an imaginary world.<,>这个故事发生在一个假想的世界里。<,>Her fears were mostly imaginary.<,>她的恐惧多半是想象出来的。<,>image(形象)+ary→形象化的一想象的<,>imaginative(adj.富有想象力的)/imaginable(adj.可想象的)  

formula<,>/ˈfɔːmjələ/<,>/ˈfɔrmjələ/<,>n.公式/n.式/n.原则/n.方案/n.配方<,>The chemical formula for water is H₂O.<,>水的化学式是H₂O。<,>There's no magic formula for success.<,>成功没有神奇的方案。<,>The baby formula is specially designed for infants.<,>婴儿配方奶粉是专为婴儿设计的。<,>form(形式)+ula→形式化的东西→公式<,>formulate(v.规划)/formality(n.正式手续)  

disgust<,>/dɪsˈɡʌst/<,>/dɪsˈɡʌst/<,>n&vt.厌恶/n&vt.憎恶<,>The smell of rotten eggs filled me with disgust.<,>臭鸡蛋的味道让我感到恶心。<,>His behavior disgusted everyone at the party.<,>他的行为让派对上的每个人都感到厌恶。<,>She looked at him with undisguised disgust.<,>她毫不掩饰地用厌恶的眼神看着他。<,>dis(不)+gust(味道)→不好的味道→厌恶<,>disgusting(adj.令人厌恶的)/gusto(n.爱好)  

transcend<,>/trænˈsend/<,>/trænˈsɛnd/<,>vt.超出/vt.超越范围<,>Great art transcends cultural boundaries.<,>伟大的艺术超越文化界限。<,>His kindness transcends mere politeness.<,>他的善良超越了单纯的礼貌。<,>The beauty of the scene transcended description.<,>这景色之美难以形容。<,>trans(跨越)+scend(爬)→爬越→超越<,>ascend(v.上升)/descend(v.下降)  

tribute<,>/ˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>/ˈtrɪbjut/<,>n.颂词/n.称赞/n.礼物/n.贡品<,>They paid tribute to the fallen soldiers.<,>他们向阵亡将士致敬。<,>The album is a tribute to her musical influences.<,>这张专辑是对她音乐影响者的致敬。<,>Ancient kingdoms sent tribute to the emperor.<,>古代王国向皇帝进贡。<,>tribut(给予)+e→给予的东西→贡品<,>attribute(v.归因于)/contribute(v.贡献)  

mob<,>/mɒb/<,>/mɑb/<,>n.暴民/n.乌合之众/vt.成群围住/vt.聚众袭击<,>An angry mob gathered outside the courthouse.<,>一群愤怒的暴民聚集在法院外。<,>Fans mobbed the celebrity as he left the restaurant.<,>当这位名人离开餐厅时，粉丝们围住了他。<,>The store was looted by a mob during the riot.<,>这家商店在骚乱中被暴民洗劫。<,>mobile(移动的)→移动的人群→暴民<,>crowd(n.人群)/gang(n.帮派)  

subordinate<,>/səˈbɔːdɪnət/<,>/səˈbɔrdənət/<,>adj.下级的/adj.级别低的/adj.次要的/adj.从属的/n.部属/n.下级/vt.使处于次要地位/vt.使从属于<,>She is subordinate to the manager in rank.<,>她的职位低于经理。<,>Personal interests should be subordinate to team goals.<,>个人利益应该服从团队目标。<,>He has five subordinates reporting to him.<,>他有五名下属向他汇报。<,>sub(下面)+ordin(顺序)+ate→顺序在下一从属的<,>coordinate(v.协调)/insubordinate(adj.不服从的)
trend<,>/trend/<,>/trɛnd/<,>vi.伸向/vi.倾向/n.倾向<,>The river trends eastward as it flows downstream.<,>这条河向下游延伸时向东偏转。<,>There is a growing trend towards remote work.<,>远程工作正成为一种日益增长的趋势。<,>Her political views trend conservative.<,>她的政治观点倾向于保守。<,>tend(倾向)+rend(撕裂)→向某个方向撕裂→倾向<,>tend(v.倾向于)/trench(n.沟渠)/trendy(adj.时髦的)

achievement<,>/əˈtʃiːvmənt/<,>/əˈtʃivmənt/<,>n.完成/n.成就/n.成绩<,>Winning the championship was her greatest achievement.<,>赢得冠军是她最大的成就。<,>The achievement of peace requires compromise.<,>实现和平需要妥协。<,>His academic achievements are impressive.<,>他的学术成绩令人印象深刻。<,>achieve(达到)+ment(名词后缀)→达到的结果→成就<,>accomplishment(n.成就)/attainment(n.达到)/achiever(n.成功者)

sturdy<,>/ˈstɜːdi/<,>/ˈstɜrdi/<,>adj.强壮的/adj.结实的/adj.坚固的/adj.坚定的/adj.坚强的<,>They built a sturdy wooden cabin in the mountains.<,>他们在山里建了一座坚固的木屋。<,>Despite his age, he remains sturdy and active.<,>尽管年事已高，他仍然强壮活跃。<,>She showed sturdy resistance to the unfair treatment.<,>她对不公平待遇表现出坚定的抵抗。<,>st(站立)+urdy→站立得很稳→坚固的<,>study(v.学习)/sturgeon(n.鲟鱼)/sturdily(adv.坚固地)

desirable<,>/dɪˈzaɪərəbl/<,>/dɪˈzaɪrəbəl/<,>adj.吸引人的/adj.可取的<,>It's desirable to have good communication skills in this job.<,>这份工作需要良好的沟通技巧，这是可取的。<,>The house is in a highly desirable neighborhood.<,>这栋房子位于一个非常吸引人的社区。<,>Peace and stability are desirable for all nations.<,>和平与稳定是所有国家都向往的。<,>desire(渴望)+able(可...的)→值得渴望的→吸引人的<,>desired(adj.渴望的)/desirous(adj.渴望的)/undesirable(adj.不受欢迎的)

consist<,>/kənˈsɪst/<,>/kənˈsɪst/<,>vi.由...组成/vi.在于/vi.一致<,>The committee consists of ten members.<,>委员会由十名成员组成。<,>True happiness consists in contentment.<,>真正的幸福在于知足。<,>His actions don't consist with his words.<,>他的言行不一致。<,>con(共同)+sist(站立)→站在一起→组成<,>insist(v.坚持)/persist(v.坚持)/resist(v.抵抗)

reliable<,>/rɪˈlaɪəbl/<,>/rɪˈlaɪəbəl/<,>adj.可靠的/adj.可依赖的<,>She is a reliable employee who always meets deadlines.<,>她是个可靠的员工，总能按时完成任务。<,>This car is known for being reliable in all weather conditions.<,>这辆车以在各种天气条件下都可靠而闻名。<,>We need reliable data to make informed decisions.<,>我们需要可靠的数据来做出明智的决定。<,>rely(依赖)+able(可...的)→可依赖的<,>liable(adj.有责任的)/reliability(n.可靠性)/unreliable(adj.不可靠的)

compatible<,>/kəmˈpætəbl/<,>/kəmˈpætəbəl/<,>adj.兼容的/adj.能和睦相处的/adj.合得来的<,>This software is compatible with most operating systems.<,>这个软件与大多数操作系统兼容。<,>They found they were surprisingly compatible as roommates.<,>他们发现作为室友，他们出奇地合得来。<,>The new policy needs to be compatible with existing regulations.<,>新政策需要与现有法规兼容。<,>com(共同)+pat(忍受)+ible→能共同忍受的→兼容的<,>compatibility(n.兼容性)/incompatible(adj.不兼容的)/compassion(n.同情)

incentive<,>/ɪnˈsentɪv/<,>/ɪnˈsɛntɪv/<,>n.刺激/n.鼓励<,>The company offers financial incentives for high performance.<,>公司为高绩效提供财务激励。<,>Tax breaks serve as an incentive for businesses to invest.<,>税收减免是企业投资的激励措施。<,>Having a clear goal can be a powerful incentive.<,>有一个明确的目标可以成为强大的动力。<,>in(进入)+cent(唱)+ive→进入歌唱状态→激励<,>incense(n.香/v.激怒)/intensive(adj.密集的)/incentivize(v.激励)

critic<,>/ˈkrɪtɪk/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪk/<,>n.批评家/n.爱挑剔的人<,>The film received mixed reviews from critics.<,>这部电影得到了评论家褒贬不一的评价。<,>She's her own harshest critic when it comes to her artwork.<,>在艺术作品方面，她是对自己最苛刻的批评者。<,>As a food critic, he has dined at the finest restaurants.<,>作为美食评论家，他在最好的餐厅用过餐。<,>crit(判断)+ic→做出判断的人→批评家<,>critical(adj.关键的)/criticism(n.批评)/critique(n.评论)

preliminary<,>/prɪˈlɪmɪnəri/<,>/prɪˈlɪmɪnɛri/<,>adj.预备的/adj.初步的/n.初步做法/n.起始行为<,>The team conducted preliminary tests before the main experiment.<,>团队在主要实验前进行了初步测试。<,>Preliminary results suggest the treatment is effective.<,>初步结果表明治疗是有效的。<,>We need to complete the preliminary paperwork first.<,>我们需要先完成初步的文书工作。<,>pre(前)+limin(门槛)+ary→在门槛前的→预备的<,>primary(adj.主要的)/premier(adj.首要的)/preliminarily(adv.初步地)
obstacle<,>/ˈɒbstək(ə)l/<,>/ˈɑːbstək(ə)l/<,>n.障碍/n.障碍物/n.妨害<,>Lack of education can be an obstacle to success.<,>缺乏教育可能成为成功的障碍。<,>They removed all obstacles from the road.<,>他们清除了路上的所有障碍物。<,>His stubbornness is the main obstacle to our cooperation.<,>他的固执是我们合作的主要障碍。<,>ob(反对)+sta(站立)+cle→站在对立面→障碍<,>object(n.物体/v.反对)/obstruct(v.阻碍)/obstinate(adj.固执的)

profession<,>/prəˈfeʃ(ə)n/<,>/prəˈfɛʃ(ə)n/<,>n.职业/n.公开表示<,>Teaching is a noble profession.<,>教书是一项崇高的职业。<,>He made a profession of his love for her.<,>他公开表达了对她的爱。<,>She entered the medical profession after graduation.<,>毕业后她进入了医疗行业。<,>pro(向前)+fess(说)+ion→在众人面前说→公开表示<,>professional(adj.专业的)/professor(n.教授)/confession(n.坦白)

van<,>/væn/<,>/væn/<,>n.大篷车/n.运货车<,>We rented a van for our camping trip.<,>我们租了一辆大篷车去露营。<,>The delivery van arrived early in the morning.<,>送货卡车一大早就到了。<,>They converted an old van into a mobile home.<,>他们把旧货车改装成了房车。<,>与"fan(粉丝)"对比记忆<,>vanish(v.消失)/vane(n.风向标)/vanguard(n.先锋)

dizzy<,>/ˈdɪzi/<,>/ˈdɪzi/<,>adj.头晕目眩的/adj.眩晕的/vt.令人发晕<,>I feel dizzy after spinning around.<,>转圈后我感到头晕目眩。<,>The heights made her dizzy.<,>高度让她感到眩晕。<,>The rapid changes can dizzy anyone.<,>快速的变化会让任何人头晕。<,>dizz(旋转)+y→旋转的→头晕的<,>drizzle(n.毛毛雨)/dizzying(adj.令人眩晕的)/fizzy(adj.起泡的)

resemblance<,>/rɪˈzembləns/<,>/rɪˈzɛmbləns/<,>n.相似/n.形似<,>The resemblance between the twins is striking.<,>这对双胞胎的相似之处非常明显。<,>There's a strong resemblance to his father.<,>他和他父亲非常相像。<,>The painting bears no resemblance to the original.<,>这幅画与原作毫无相似之处。<,>re(再)+sembl(相似)+ance→再次相似→相似<,>assemble(v.集合)/dissemble(v.掩饰)/semblance(n.外表)

exceptional<,>/ɪkˈsepʃ(ə)n(ə)l/<,>/ɪkˈsɛpʃ(ə)n(ə)l/<,>adj.优越的/adj.杰出的/adj.例外的<,>She showed exceptional talent in music.<,>她在音乐方面表现出非凡的才能。<,>This is an exceptional case that requires special attention.<,>这是一个需要特别关注的例外情况。<,>The service at this hotel is exceptional.<,>这家酒店的服务非常出色。<,>except(除外)+ion+al→例外的→杰出的<,>exception(n.例外)/exceptionally(adv.异常地)/acceptable(adj.可接受的)

constitute<,>/ˈkɒnstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈkɑːnstɪtuːt/<,>vt.组成/vt.形成/vt.设立/vt.任命<,>Twelve months constitute a year.<,>十二个月构成一年。<,>This decision constitutes a turning point.<,>这个决定构成了一个转折点。<,>They constituted a new committee.<,>他们设立了一个新的委员会。<,>con(共同)+stitute(站立)→共同站立→组成<,>constitution(n.宪法)/institute(n.学院)/substitute(n.替代品)

cherish<,>/ˈtʃerɪʃ/<,>/ˈtʃɛrɪʃ/<,>vt.珍爱/vt.珍视/vt.爱护/vt.抱有<,>She cherishes the memories of her childhood.<,>她珍视童年的回忆。<,>We should cherish our friendships.<,>我们应该珍惜友谊。<,>He cherished the hope of becoming a writer.<,>他怀着成为作家的希望。<,>cher(亲爱的)+ish→像对亲爱的物品一样→珍爱<,>perish(v.消亡)/flourish(v.繁荣)/nourish(v.滋养)

discrepancy<,>/dɪˈskrepənsi/<,>/dɪˈskrɛpənsi/<,>n.不符合/n.不一致<,>There's a discrepancy between the two reports.<,>两份报告之间存在差异。<,>The discrepancy in the accounts needs to be investigated.<,>账目中的差异需要调查。<,>We noticed some discrepancies in his statement.<,>我们注意到他的陈述中有一些矛盾之处。<,>dis(分开)+crep(声音)+ancy→声音不齐→不一致<,>discrete(adj.离散的)/discretion(n.谨慎)/decrepit(adj.破旧的)

spectrum<,>/ˈspektrəm/<,>/ˈspɛktrəm/<,>n.谱/n.光谱/n.范围<,>The rainbow shows the full spectrum of colors.<,>彩虹显示了完整的色彩光谱。<,>This issue covers a broad spectrum of opinions.<,>这个问题涵盖了广泛的观点范围。<,>They analyzed the light spectrum of the star.<,>他们分析了这颗星的光谱。<,>spect(看)+rum→看到的东西→光谱<,>spectacle(n.景象)/inspect(v.检查)/perspective(n.观点)
convince<,>/kənˈvɪns/<,>/kənˈvɪns/<,>vt.使确信/vt.使信服/vt.说服<,>He tried to convince me of his innocence.<,>他试图让我相信他是无辜的。<,>I couldn't convince her to change her mind.<,>我没能说服她改变主意。<,>Her arguments finally convinced the jury.<,>她的论点最终说服了陪审团。<,>con(完全)+vince(征服)→完全征服对方→说服<,>persuade(vt.说服)/coerce(vt.强制)/induce(vt.引诱)

prolong<,>/prəˈlɒŋ/<,>/proʊˈlɔːŋ/<,>vt.延长/vt.拉长/vt.拖延<,>The treatment may prolong his life.<,>这种治疗可能会延长他的生命。<,>They prolonged their stay by another week.<,>他们把停留时间延长了一周。<,>The meeting was unnecessarily prolonged.<,>会议被不必要地拖延了。<,>pro(向前)+long(长)→向前拉长→延长<,>elongate(vt.拉长)/protract(vt.延长)/extend(vt.扩展)

missionary<,>/ˈmɪʃənri/<,>/ˈmɪʃəneri/<,>n.传教士<,>The missionary traveled to remote villages.<,>这位传教士去了偏远的村庄。<,>She worked as a missionary in Africa.<,>她在非洲当传教士。<,>Missionary work requires great dedication.<,>传教工作需要极大的奉献精神。<,>mission(使命)+ary(人)→执行使命的人→传教士<,>messenger(n.信使)/minister(n.牧师)/evangelist(n.福音传道者)

terminate<,>/ˈtɜːmɪneɪt/<,>/ˈtɜːrmɪneɪt/<,>v.停止/v.终止<,>The contract will terminate next month.<,>合同将于下月终止。<,>They decided to terminate the project.<,>他们决定终止这个项目。<,>The train service terminates at midnight.<,>火车服务在午夜停止。<,>termin(界限)+ate(使)→使到界限→终止<,>finish(v.完成)/cease(v.停止)/conclude(v.结束)

valve<,>/vælv/<,>/vælv/<,>n.阀/n.活门/n.瓣膜/n.活瓣<,>Turn the valve to control the water flow.<,>转动阀门控制水流。<,>The heart has four valves.<,>心脏有四个瓣膜。<,>A faulty valve caused the leak.<,>一个故障的阀门导致了泄漏。<,>valv(卷)+e→能卷动的装置→阀门<,>vein(n.静脉)/vent(n.通风口)/vane(n.风向标)

refund<,>/ˈriːfʌnd/<,>/ˈriːfʌnd/<,>n.退款/vt.退还<,>They promised a full refund.<,>他们承诺全额退款。<,>I'd like to refund this purchase.<,>我想退还这次购买的商品。<,>The store refused to refund my money.<,>商店拒绝退款给我。<,>re(回)+fund(资金)→资金返回→退款<,>rebate(n.回扣)/reimburse(vt.偿还)/repay(vt.偿还)

remnant<,>/ˈremnənt/<,>/ˈremnənt/<,>n.残留部分<,>Only a remnant of the forest remains.<,>森林只剩下残余部分。<,>She kept a remnant of the old curtain.<,>她保留了一小块旧窗帘。<,>Remnants of the meal were left on the table.<,>饭菜的残余留在桌子上。<,>re(再)+mn(保持)+ant→保持下来的东西→残留<,>residue(n.残余)/remainder(n.剩余部分)/vestige(n.痕迹)

internal<,>/ɪnˈtɜːnl/<,>/ɪnˈtɜːrnl/<,>adj.内的/adj.国内的/adj.内心的<,>The medicine is for internal use only.<,>这种药仅供内服。<,>Internal affairs are confidential.<,>内部事务是保密的。<,>She struggled with internal conflicts.<,>她内心充满矛盾。<,>inter(在...内)+nal→内部的<,>external(adj.外部的)/eternal(adj.永恒的)/infernal(adj.地狱的)

literary<,>/ˈlɪtərəri/<,>/ˈlɪtəreri/<,>adj.文学的/adj.文人的/adj.书卷气的<,>He has great literary talent.<,>他有很高的文学天赋。<,>The book won a literary prize.<,>这本书获得了文学奖。<,>She speaks in a very literary style.<,>她说话非常书卷气。<,>liter(文字)+ary→与文字有关的→文学的<,>literal(adj.字面的)/literate(adj.有文化的)/illiterate(adj.文盲的)

classical<,>/ˈklæsɪkl/<,>/ˈklæsɪkl/<,>adj.古典的/adj.经典的<,>She studies classical music.<,>她学习古典音乐。<,>This is a classical example of Roman architecture.<,>这是罗马建筑的经典范例。<,>He prefers classical literature to modern works.<,>比起现代作品，他更喜欢古典文学。<,>class(等级)+ical→最高等级的→经典的<,>classic(n.杰作)/classy(adj.时髦的)/classify(vt.分类)
privilege<,>/ˈprɪvəlɪdʒ/<,>/ˈprɪvəlɪdʒ/<,>n.特权/n.优惠<,>Education should be a right, not a privilege.<,>教育应该是一项权利，而不是特权。<,>Members enjoy special privileges at the hotel.<,>会员在酒店享有特殊优惠。<,>He abused his privilege as a manager.<,>他滥用了作为经理的特权。<,>priv(私人)+lege(法律)→私人法律→特权<,>privacy(n.隐私)/legacy(n.遗产)/oblige(v.迫使)

substitute<,>/ˈsʌbstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈsʌbstɪtuːt/<,>n.代替人/n.代用品/vt.用…代替<,>Soy milk can be a substitute for cow's milk.<,>豆浆可以代替牛奶。<,>The coach substituted the injured player.<,>教练替换了受伤的球员。<,>There's no substitute for hard work.<,>没有什么能代替努力工作。<,>sub(下面)+stitute(站立)→站在下面备用→代替品<,>constitute(vt.组成)/institute(n.学院)/prostitute(n.妓女)

mortgage<,>/ˈmɔːɡɪdʒ/<,>/ˈmɔːrɡɪdʒ/<,>n.抵押/n.抵押借款/vt.抵押<,>They took out a mortgage to buy the house.<,>他们申请了抵押贷款来买房。<,>The property was mortgaged to the bank.<,>房产被抵押给了银行。<,>Mortgage rates have risen recently.<,>抵押贷款利率最近上涨了。<,>mort(死亡)+gage(担保)→以死亡为担保→抵押<,>mortuary(n.太平间)/mortification(n.屈辱)/engage(v.从事)

blaze<,>/bleɪz/<,>/bleɪz/<,>vi.熊熊燃烧/vi.着火/vi.发光/vi.放光彩/vi.迸发/vi.爆发/n.火焰/n.烈火/n.光辉/n.强烈的光/n.迸发/n.爆发/n.灿烂/n.炫耀<,>The fire blazed all night.<,>大火燃烧了一整夜。<,>Her eyes blazed with anger.<,>她的眼中燃烧着怒火。<,>The sun blazed down on the desert.<,>太阳炙烤着沙漠。<,>bl(明亮)+aze(aze表示状态)→明亮的状态→燃烧<,>blame(v.责备)/blazon(v.宣扬)/blare(v.高声鸣响)

moreover<,>/mɔːrˈəʊvə(r)/<,>/mɔːrˈoʊvər/<,>adv.而且/adv.再者/adv.此外<,>The plan is risky; moreover, it's expensive.<,>这个计划有风险；而且很昂贵。<,>She's qualified, and moreover, she's experienced.<,>她有资格，而且有经验。<,>The food was delicious; moreover, it was healthy.<,>食物很美味，而且健康。<,>more(更多)+over(超过)→更多超过→此外<,>furthermore(adv.此外)/however(adv.然而)/therefore(adv.因此)

scatter<,>/ˈskætə(r)/<,>/ˈskætər/<,>vt.撒/vt.散播/vt.使散开/vt.驱散<,>She scattered seeds in the garden.<,>她在花园里撒种子。<,>The crowd scattered when it started to rain.<,>开始下雨时人群散开了。<,>Leaves were scattered by the wind.<,>树叶被风吹散了。<,>s(分散)+catter(类似chatter)→像聊天一样分散→散开<,>shatter(v.粉碎)/spatter(v.溅洒)/splatter(v.泼溅)

violate<,>/ˈvaɪəleɪt/<,>/ˈvaɪəleɪt/<,>vt.违反/vt.违背/vt.亵渎/vt.侵犯/vt.妨碍<,>He violated the school rules.<,>他违反了校规。<,>The noise violated my peace.<,>噪音打扰了我的安宁。<,>They violated the sacred temple.<,>他们亵渎了神圣的寺庙。<,>viol(暴力)+ate(动词后缀)→用暴力对待→违反<,>violent(adj.暴力的)/violation(n.违反)/inviolate(adj.未受侵犯的)

federal<,>/ˈfedərəl/<,>/ˈfedərəl/<,>adj.联邦的/adj.联盟的<,>Federal laws apply to all states.<,>联邦法律适用于所有州。<,>She works for the federal government.<,>她在联邦政府工作。<,>The Federal Reserve sets interest rates.<,>美联储设定利率。<,>feder(联盟)+al(形容词后缀)→联盟的<,>confederate(adj.同盟的)/federation(n.联邦)/federated(adj.联合的)

verify<,>/ˈverɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈverɪfaɪ/<,>vt.证实/vt.查证/vt.证明<,>Please verify your email address.<,>请验证您的电子邮件地址。<,>The police verified his alibi.<,>警方核实了他的不在场证明。<,>I need to verify the facts before reporting.<,>在报道前我需要核实事实。<,>ver(真实)+ify(使)→使真实→证实<,>verity(n.真实)/verification(n.核实)/verifiable(adj.可证实的)

excursion<,>/ɪkˈskɜːʃn/<,>/ɪkˈskɜːrʒn/<,>n.远足/n.短途旅行<,>We went on an excursion to the mountains.<,>我们去山区远足。<,>The school organized a historical excursion.<,>学校组织了历史之旅。<,>It was just a brief excursion from the city.<,>这只是离开城市的短暂旅行。<,>ex(出)+curs(跑)+ion(名词后缀)→跑出去→远足<,>excursive(adj.离题的)/excursus(n.附注)/cursive(adj.草书的)
inaugurate<,>/ɪˈnɔːɡjəreɪt/<,>/ɪˈnɔːɡjəreɪt/<,>vt.开始/vt.开展/vt.为…举行就职典礼/vt.为…举行开幕式/vt.为…举行落成仪式<,>The president will inaugurate the new policy next month.<,>总统将于下个月启动新政策。<,>The museum was inaugurated by the mayor last year.<,>这座博物馆去年由市长主持落成仪式。<,>They will inaugurate the conference with a keynote speech.<,>他们将用主题演讲为会议揭幕。<,>in(进入)+augur(预示)+ate(动词后缀)→预示进入新阶段→开始<,>initiate(vt.开始)/commence(vt.开始)/launch(vt.启动)

undergo<,>/ˌʌndəˈɡəʊ/<,>/ˌʌndərˈɡoʊ/<,>vt.经历/vt.经受/vt.忍受<,>He had to undergo a difficult surgery last week.<,>他上周不得不经历一次艰难的手术。<,>The company is undergoing major changes this year.<,>公司今年正在经历重大变革。<,>She underwent a lot of hardships during the war.<,>她在战争期间经历了许多苦难。<,>under(在...之下)+go(走)→在困难下行走→经历<,>experience(vt.经历)/endure(vt.忍受)/suffer(vt.遭受)

reward<,>/rɪˈwɔːd/<,>/rɪˈwɔːrd/<,>n.报答/n.奖赏/n.报酬/n.酬金/vt.报答/vt.酬谢/vt.奖励<,>She received a reward for her excellent performance.<,>她因出色的表现获得了奖励。<,>Hard work always brings its own reward.<,>努力工作总会带来回报。<,>The police offered a reward for information about the crime.<,>警方悬赏征集有关犯罪的信息。<,>re(回)+ward(看)→回头看给予回报→奖励<,>award(n.奖品/vt.授予)/prize(n.奖品)/compensate(vt.补偿)

graze<,>/ɡreɪz/<,>/ɡreɪz/<,>vi.吃青草/vt.放牧/vt.擦伤/vt.擦过/vt.掠过/n.擦破<,>The cows are grazing in the field.<,>牛正在田野里吃草。<,>She grazed her knee when she fell.<,>她摔倒时擦伤了膝盖。<,>The bullet just grazed his shoulder.<,>子弹只是擦过他的肩膀。<,>grass(草)+e→与草有关的行为→吃草<,>glaze(vt.上釉)/grasp(vt.抓住)/glare(vi.瞪眼)

coupon<,>/ˈkuːpɒn/<,>/ˈkuːpɑːn/<,>n.礼券/n.优惠券/n.配给券/n.票证<,>I used a coupon to get a discount on my purchase.<,>我用了优惠券来获得购物折扣。<,>This coupon is valid until the end of the month.<,>这张优惠券有效期到月底。<,>They issued food coupons during the war.<,>战争期间他们发放了食品配给券。<,>coup(突然行动)+on→突然得到的优惠→优惠券<,>voucher(n.代金券)/ticket(n.票)/token(n.代币)

multitude<,>/ˈmʌltɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈmʌltɪtuːd/<,>n.大量/n.许多/n.大众/n.民众<,>A multitude of people attended the concert.<,>大量人群参加了音乐会。<,>He faced a multitude of problems at work.<,>他在工作中面临许多问题。<,>The politician spoke to the multitude in the square.<,>政治家向广场上的民众发表讲话。<,>multi(多)+tude(状态)→多的状态→大量<,>majority(n.大多数)/crowd(n.人群)/mass(n.大众)

inhabit<,>/ɪnˈhæbɪt/<,>/ɪnˈhæbɪt/<,>vt.居住于/vt.栖居于<,>Various species inhabit this forest.<,>多种物种栖息在这片森林里。<,>The island is inhabited by indigenous people.<,>这个岛屿居住着土著居民。<,>These birds inhabit coastal areas.<,>这些鸟类栖息在沿海地区。<,>in(在...里)+habit(居住)→居住在...里<,>habitat(n.栖息地)/resident(n.居民)/dwell(vi.居住)

siege<,>/siːdʒ/<,>/siːdʒ/<,>n.包围/n.围困<,>The city was under siege for three months.<,>这座城市被围困了三个月。<,>The army laid siege to the castle.<,>军队包围了城堡。<,>They endured the siege with great courage.<,>他们以极大的勇气忍受着围困。<,>siege与"see"(看)无关，注意拼写→包围<,>besiege(vt.围攻)/blockade(n.封锁)/encircle(vt.包围)

abstract<,>/ˈæbstrækt/<,>/ˈæbstrækt/<,>adj.抽象的/adj.抽象派的/n.摘要/n.梗概/n.抽象派艺术作品<,>Modern art is often very abstract.<,>现代艺术通常非常抽象。<,>Please write an abstract of your research paper.<,>请写一份你研究论文的摘要。<,>She collects abstract paintings.<,>她收藏抽象派画作。<,>abs(离开)+tract(拉)→从具体中拉出来→抽象<,>concrete(adj.具体的)/summary(n.摘要)/extract(vt.提取)

agenda<,>/əˈdʒendə/<,>/əˈdʒendə/<,>n.议程<,>Let's discuss the first item on the agenda.<,>让我们讨论议程上的第一个项目。<,>The meeting agenda was distributed in advance.<,>会议议程提前分发了。<,>Environmental protection is high on the government's agenda.<,>环境保护是政府的重要议程。<,>ag(做)+enda(名词后缀)→要做的事情→议程<,>schedule(n.日程)/program(n.计划)/itinerary(n.行程)
degenerate<,>/dɪˈdʒenəreɪt/<,>/dɪˈdʒɛnəˌreɪt/<,>vi.衰退/vi.堕落/vi.蜕化/adj.衰退的/adj.堕落的/n.堕落者<,>His health began to degenerate after years of heavy drinking.<,>多年酗酒后，他的健康开始衰退。<,>The debate degenerated into a shouting match.<,>辩论演变成了争吵。<,>She was considered a degenerate by her conservative family.<,>她被保守的家人视为堕落者。<,>de(向下)+generate(产生)→向下产生→衰退<,>generate(vt.产生)/regenerate(vt.再生)/deteriorate(vi.恶化)

nurture<,>/ˈnɜːtʃə(r)/<,>/ˈnɜːrtʃər/<,>n.养育/n.培育/n.滋养/vt.养育/vt.培育/vt.滋养<,>Parents should nurture their children's talents.<,>父母应该培养孩子的才能。<,>The school nurtures a love of learning in its students.<,>学校培养学生对学习的热爱。<,>Good soil nurtures healthy plants.<,>肥沃的土壤滋养健康的植物。<,>nurse(护理)+nature(自然)→自然护理→养育<,>nature(n.自然)/nutrition(n.营养)/nurse(vt.护理)

destructive<,>/dɪˈstrʌktɪv/<,>/dɪˈstrʌktɪv/<,>adj.破坏的/adj.毁灭的<,>The hurricane was highly destructive to coastal towns.<,>飓风对沿海城镇极具破坏性。<,>Criticism should be constructive, not destructive.<,>批评应该是建设性的，而不是破坏性的。<,>Drug abuse has a destructive effect on families.<,>吸毒对家庭有毁灭性的影响。<,>de(向下)+struct(建造)+ive(形容词后缀)→向下建造→破坏的<,>constructive(adj.建设性的)/destruction(n.破坏)/structure(n.结构)

appearance<,>/əˈpɪərəns/<,>/əˈpɪrəns/<,>n.出现/n.来到/n.外观<,>His sudden appearance surprised everyone.<,>他的突然出现让所有人惊讶。<,>She pays great attention to her appearance.<,>她非常注重自己的外表。<,>The first appearance of the sun after days of rain was welcome.<,>多日雨后太阳的首次出现令人欣喜。<,>appear(出现)+ance(名词后缀)→出现<,>disappearance(n.消失)/apparent(adj.明显的)/transparency(n.透明)

culture<,>/ˈkʌltʃə(r)/<,>/ˈkʌltʃər/<,>n.文化/n.文明/n.教养/n.培养/n.培养菌<,>Japanese culture fascinates many foreigners.<,>日本文化吸引了许多外国人。<,>He is a man of great culture and learning.<,>他是个很有教养和学识的人。<,>The lab is growing a bacterial culture for testing.<,>实验室正在培养细菌用于测试。<,>cult(耕种)+ure(名词后缀)→耕种的结果→文化<,>agriculture(n.农业)/cultivate(vt.培养)/horticulture(n.园艺)

paternity<,>/pəˈtɜːnəti/<,>/pəˈtɜːrnəti/<,>n.父权/n.父子关系<,>The court ordered a paternity test to determine the father.<,>法院下令进行亲子鉴定以确定父亲身份。<,>He acknowledged paternity of the child.<,>他承认是孩子的父亲。<,>Paternity leave is becoming more common in companies.<,>陪产假在公司中越来越普遍。<,>pater(父亲)+nity(名词后缀)→父权<,>maternity(n.母性)/patriarchy(n.父权制)/fraternity(n.兄弟会)

hasty<,>/ˈheɪsti/<,>/ˈheɪsti/<,>adj.草率的/adj.轻率的/adj.急速的/adj.匆忙的/adj.仓促完成的<,>Don't make hasty decisions you might regret.<,>不要做可能后悔的草率决定。<,>We had a hasty breakfast before catching the train.<,>我们在赶火车前匆忙吃了早餐。<,>His hasty departure raised suspicions.<,>他的匆忙离开引起了怀疑。<,>haste(匆忙)+y(形容词后缀)→匆忙的<,>hasten(vt.加速)/haste(n.匆忙)/tasty(adj.美味的)

anonymous<,>/əˈnɒnɪməs/<,>/əˈnɑːnɪməs/<,>adj.无名的/adj.不具名的/adj.匿名的/adj.无特色的/adj.无个性特征的<,>The donation was made by an anonymous benefactor.<,>这笔捐款是由一位匿名捐助者提供的。<,>She received an anonymous letter threatening her.<,>她收到了一封威胁她的匿名信。<,>The building was anonymous, with no distinguishing features.<,>这座建筑毫无特色，没有明显特征。<,>an(无)+onym(名字)+ous(形容词后缀)→无名的<,>synonym(n.同义词)/antonym(n.反义词)/pseudonym(n.假名)

fake<,>/feɪk/<,>/feɪk/<,>adj.假的/adj.伪造的/n.假货/n.骗子/vt.伪造/vt.捏造/vt.伪装<,>The painting was discovered to be a fake.<,>这幅画被发现是赝品。<,>He faked illness to avoid the exam.<,>他装病逃避考试。<,>She gave a fake name to the police.<,>她向警方提供了假名。<,>谐音"废壳"→假的壳→伪造的<,>make(vt.制造)/bake(vt.烘焙)/flake(n.薄片)

span<,>/spæn/<,>/spæn/<,>n.跨距/n.一段时间/vt.持续/vt.贯穿/vt.包括/vt.横跨/vt.跨越<,>The bridge has a span of 200 meters.<,>这座桥的跨距为200米。<,>Her career spanned four decades.<,>她的职业生涯跨越了四十年。<,>The course spans a wide range of topics.<,>这门课程涵盖了广泛的主题。<,>s(形似桥梁)+pan(平底锅)→平底锅像桥一样有跨度<,>scan(vt.扫描)/spin(vt.旋转)/spank(vt.打屁股)
escort<,>/ˈeskɔːt/<,>/ˈeskɔːrt/<,>n.护卫者/n.护送者/vt.护送/vt.护卫<,>The VIP arrived with an armed escort.<,>这位贵宾在武装护卫下到达。<,>She was escorted to her car by a security guard.<,>她被保安护送到她的车旁。<,>The police escorted the protesters out of the building.<,>警察护送抗议者离开大楼。<,>es(外)+cort(正确)→在外面保证正确→护送<,>export(n.出口/v.输出)/extort(v.敲诈/v.勒索)

bizarre<,>/bɪˈzɑː(r)/<,>/bɪˈzɑːr/<,>adj.奇形怪状的/adj.怪诞的<,>He wore a bizarre costume to the party.<,>他穿了套怪异的服装参加派对。<,>The movie had a bizarre plot twist.<,>这部电影有个怪诞的情节转折。<,>She has a bizarre sense of humor.<,>她有古怪的幽默感。<,>biz(商业)+arre(看作art艺术)→商业艺术有时很怪诞<,>bazaar(n.集市)/blizzard(n.暴风雪)

existence<,>/ɪɡˈzɪstəns/<,>/ɪɡˈzɪstəns/<,>n.存在/n.实在/n.生存<,>The existence of life on other planets is still unproven.<,>其他行星上存在生命尚未被证实。<,>He leads a solitary existence in the mountains.<,>他在山中过着独居生活。<,>This law has been in existence for over 100 years.<,>这条法律已存在100多年了。<,>ex(出)+ist(站)+ence→站出来→存在<,>insistence(n.坚持)/persistence(n.坚持不懈)

ascribe<,>/əˈskraɪb/<,>/əˈskraɪb/<,>vt.把...归因于/vt.把...归属于<,>He ascribed his success to hard work.<,>他把成功归因于努力工作。<,>The painting was wrongly ascribed to Picasso.<,>这幅画被错误地归属于毕加索。<,>They ascribed the accident to human error.<,>他们把事故归因于人为失误。<,>a(向)+scribe(写)→把...写向某处→归因于<,>describe(v.描述)/subscribe(v.订阅/v.同意)

threshold<,>/ˈθreʃhəʊld/<,>/ˈθreʃhoʊld/<,>n.门槛/n.门口/n.入门/n.开端/n.起始点<,>She paused at the threshold before entering.<,>她在门槛处停顿了一下才进去。<,>The country is on the threshold of a new era.<,>这个国家正处在新时代的开端。<,>The noise was just above the threshold of hearing.<,>噪音刚好在听觉阈值之上。<,>thres(踩踏)+hold(保持)→保持踩踏的地方→门槛<,>withhold(v.保留/v.抑制)/household(n.家庭/adj.家用的)

float<,>/fləʊt/<,>/floʊt/<,>v.浮动/v.漂浮/v.飘动<,>Leaves were floating on the surface of the pond.<,>树叶漂浮在池塘表面。<,>The idea was first floated at last week's meeting.<,>这个想法在上周的会议上首次提出。<,>The currency is allowed to float freely.<,>这种货币允许自由浮动。<,>fl(流动)+oat(看作boat船)→像船一样流动→漂浮<,>flood(n.洪水)/flour(n.面粉)

minority<,>/maɪˈnɒrəti/<,>/maɪˈnɔːrəti/<,>n.少数/n.少数民族<,>Only a small minority of people oppose the plan.<,>只有极少数人反对这个计划。<,>The law protects the rights of ethnic minorities.<,>法律保护少数民族的权利。<,>She was in the minority in her opinion.<,>她的意见属于少数派。<,>minor(较小的)+ity(状态)→少数状态<,>majority(n.多数)/priority(n.优先权)

axis<,>/ˈæksɪs/<,>/ˈæksɪs/<,>n.轴/n.轴线/n.中心线/n.坐标轴/n.基准线<,>The Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours.<,>地球每24小时绕轴自转一周。<,>The main axis of the building runs north-south.<,>建筑物的主轴线是南北走向的。<,>The x-axis and y-axis intersect at the origin.<,>x轴和y轴在原点相交。<,>ax(斧头)+is→像斧头柄一样直→轴线<,>axes(axis的复数)/access(n.入口/v.访问)

pole<,>/pəʊl/<,>/poʊl/<,>n.杆/n.极/n.磁极/n.电极<,>They put up a new flag pole in the square.<,>他们在广场上竖起了一根新旗杆。<,>The North Pole is covered with ice.<,>北极被冰覆盖着。<,>Opposite poles of a magnet attract each other.<,>磁体的相反两极相互吸引。<,>pol(杆)+e→杆或极<,>poll(n.投票)/pore(n.毛孔)/polar(adj.极地的)

preferable<,>/ˈprefrəbl/<,>/ˈprefərəbl/<,>adj.更可取的/adj.更好的/adj.更合意的<,>Walking is preferable to driving in this traffic.<,>在这种交通状况下，步行比开车更可取。<,>A dark background is preferable for this photo.<,>这张照片用深色背景更好。<,>Silence would have been preferable to his rude remarks.<,>沉默比他粗鲁的言论更合适。<,>prefer(更喜欢)+able(可...的)→更可取的<,>preference(n.偏爱)/referable(adj.可归因于的)
reference<,>/ˈrefrəns/<,>/ˈrɛfərəns/<,>n.提到/n.论及/n.参考/n.查阅/n.引文/n.参考书目/n.证明书/n.推荐信<,>She made reference to her previous work in the report.<,>她在报告中提到了她之前的工作。<,>Please check the reference section for more details.<,>请查阅参考书目部分获取更多细节。<,>He provided excellent references from his former employer.<,>他提供了前雇主出具的出色推荐信。<,>re(再次)+fer(带来)+ence→再次带来信息→参考<,>refer(v.提到/v.参考)/preference(n.偏爱/n.优先权)/conference(n.会议/n.协商)  

spite<,>/spaɪt/<,>/spaɪt/<,>n.恶意/n.怨恨/vt.刁难/vt.欺侮<,>He did it out of spite, not for any good reason.<,>他这样做是出于恶意，没有任何正当理由。<,>In spite of the rain, we went for a walk.<,>尽管下雨，我们还是去散步了。<,>She always tries to spite her neighbors with petty actions.<,>她总是用一些小动作刁难邻居。<,>spit(吐)+e→像吐口水一样充满恶意→恶意<,>despite(prep.尽管)/spit(v.吐痰/n.唾液)/site(n.地点/n.场所)  

defendant<,>/dɪˈfendənt/<,>/dɪˈfɛndənt/<,>n.被告<,>The defendant pleaded not guilty in court.<,>被告在法庭上表示不认罪。<,>The defendant's lawyer presented strong evidence.<,>被告的律师提供了强有力的证据。<,>The jury found the defendant innocent.<,>陪审团裁定被告无罪。<,>defend(辩护)+ant(人)→需要辩护的人→被告<,>defender(n.防守者/n.后卫)/dependant(n.受抚养者)/defiant(adj.挑衅的/adj.反抗的)  

arrange<,>/əˈreɪndʒ/<,>/əˈreɪndʒ/<,>v.安排/v.准备/v.整理<,>She arranged the flowers beautifully in the vase.<,>她把花瓶里的花整理得很漂亮。<,>We need to arrange a meeting with the client.<,>我们需要安排与客户的会议。<,>He arranged his books alphabetically on the shelf.<,>他按字母顺序把书排列在书架上。<,>ar(加强)+range(排列)→有序排列→整理<,>derange(v.扰乱/v.使精神错乱)/arrangement(n.安排/n.布置)/range(n.范围/v.排列)  

olive<,>/ˈɒlɪv/<,>/ˈɑːlɪv/<,>n.橄榄/n.橄榄树<,>She added some olive oil to the salad.<,>她在沙拉里加了些橄榄油。<,>The olive branch is a symbol of peace.<,>橄榄枝是和平的象征。<,>We have an old olive tree in our garden.<,>我们花园里有棵老橄榄树。<,>oli(油)+ve→富含油的果实→橄榄<,>olive(adj.橄榄色的)/olivine(n.橄榄石)/olivary(adj.橄榄状的)  

coarse<,>/kɔːs/<,>/kɔːrs/<,>adj.粗的/adj.粗糙的/adj.粗劣的/adj.粗俗的<,>The fabric feels very coarse against the skin.<,>这种布料摸起来很粗糙。<,>He was criticized for his coarse language.<,>他因为言语粗俗而受到批评。<,>The bread was made from coarse flour.<,>这面包是用粗面粉做的。<,>coar(粗)+se→粗糙的<,>hoarse(adj.嘶哑的)/course(n.课程/n.路线)/coast(n.海岸/v.滑行)  

exaggerate<,>/ɪɡˈzædʒəreɪt/<,>/ɪɡˈzædʒəreɪt/<,>v.夸大/v.夸张<,>Don't exaggerate the size of the fish you caught!<,>别夸大你钓到的鱼的大小！<,>The media tends to exaggerate minor incidents.<,>媒体倾向于夸大轻微事件。<,>She exaggerated her illness to get sympathy.<,>她夸大病情以博取同情。<,>ex(出)+agger(堆积)+ate→堆出界限→夸大<,>aggravate(v.加重/v.激怒)/aggregate(v.聚集/n.总数)/exalt(v.提升/v.赞扬)  

streamline<,>/ˈstriːmlaɪn/<,>/ˈstrimlaɪn/<,>vt.使成流线型/vt.精简/vt.使效率更高<,>The car's design was streamlined for better aerodynamics.<,>这辆车的设计采用流线型以获得更好的空气动力性能。<,>We need to streamline our production process.<,>我们需要精简生产流程。<,>The company streamlined its operations to reduce costs.<,>公司精简了运营以降低成本。<,>stream(溪流)+line(线)→像溪流一样顺畅的线条→流线型<,>mainline(v.注射毒品/n.干线)/streamer(n.横幅/n.流光)/steamline(错误拼写)  

imply<,>/ɪmˈplaɪ/<,>/ɪmˈplaɪ/<,>vt.暗示/vt.意指<,>His silence implied agreement.<,>他的沉默暗示着同意。<,>Are you implying that I'm lying?<,>你是在暗示我在说谎吗？<,>The study implies a link between diet and health.<,>这项研究暗示饮食与健康之间存在联系。<,>im(进入)+ply(折叠)→把意思折叠在里面→暗示<,>apply(v.申请/v.应用)/reply(v.回答/n.答复)/supply(v.供应/n.供给)  

offset<,>/ˈɒfset/<,>/ˈɔːfset/<,>vt.补偿/vt.抵消<,>The company uses carbon credits to offset its emissions.<,>公司用碳信用来抵消其排放量。<,>The advantages offset the disadvantages.<,>优势抵消了劣势。<,>He offset his travel expenses against tax.<,>他用旅行开支抵税。<,>off(离开)+set(放置)→放开来平衡→抵消<,>onset(n.开始/n.攻击)/upset(v.打乱/adj.心烦的)/inset(n.插入物/v.嵌入)
commitment<,>/kəˈmɪtmənt/<,>/kəˈmɪtmənt/<,>n.承诺/n.许诺/n.保证/n.信奉/n.献身/n.承担的义务<,>She showed great commitment to her work.<,>她对工作表现出极大的投入。<,>He made a commitment to quit smoking.<,>他承诺戒烟。<,>The company has a strong commitment to environmental protection.<,>公司对环境保护有坚定的承诺。<,>com(共同)+mit(送)→共同送出→承诺<,>commission(n.委员会/n.佣金)/admission(n.承认/n.入场许可)  

cavity<,>/ˈkævəti/<,>/ˈkævəti/<,>n.洞/n.穴/n.凹处/n.龋洞<,>The dentist found a cavity in my tooth.<,>牙医发现我牙齿上有个蛀洞。<,>Birds nested in the cavity of the tree.<,>鸟儿在树洞中筑巢。<,>The sculpture had interesting cavities in its surface.<,>雕塑表面有有趣的凹陷。<,>cav(洞)+ity(状态)→空洞状态<,>cave(n.洞穴)/vacant(adj.空的)/concave(adj.凹的)  

coward<,>/ˈkaʊəd/<,>/ˈkaʊərd/<,>n.胆小鬼/n.懦夫<,>He was called a coward for running away.<,>他因为逃跑被称为懦夫。<,>Don't be a coward—stand up for yourself!<,>别做胆小鬼，为自己站出来！<,>The bully only picks on people because he's a coward inside.<,>那个霸凌者只欺负别人，因为他内心是个懦夫。<,>cow(吓唬)+ard(人)→被吓住的人<,>cower(v.畏缩)/brave(adj.勇敢的)/daring(adj.大胆的)  

fossil<,>/ˈfɒsl/<,>/ˈfɑːsl/<,>n.化石/n.食古不化的人/n.老顽固<,>The museum has a collection of dinosaur fossils.<,>博物馆收藏了一批恐龙化石。<,>My grandfather is a fossil when it comes to technology.<,>我祖父在技术方面是个老顽固。<,>Scientists study fossils to learn about ancient life.<,>科学家研究化石以了解古代生物。<,>foss(挖)+il→挖出来的东西<,>foster(v.培养)/fossilize(v.使成化石)/obsolescent(adj.即将淘汰的)  

poke<,>/pəʊk/<,>/poʊk/<,>vi.伸出/vi.突出/vt.戳/vt.捅/vt.用...戳/vt.把...戳向/vt.伸出/vt.突出/n.戳/n.捅<,>Don't poke the bear with a stick.<,>不要用棍子捅熊。<,>She poked her head out the window to see better.<,>她把头伸出窗外以便看得更清楚。<,>He gave me a playful poke in the ribs.<,>他顽皮地戳了一下我的肋骨。<,>拟声词，模仿戳刺的声音<,>joke(n.玩笑)/pole(n.杆)/poke(v.刺探)  

rejection<,>/rɪˈdʒekʃn/<,>/rɪˈdʒekʃn/<,>n.拒绝<,>She felt hurt by his rejection of her proposal.<,>她因他拒绝她的提议而感到受伤。<,>The manuscript received multiple rejections before being published.<,>这份手稿在被出版前遭到多次拒绝。<,>Job rejections can be discouraging but don't give up.<,>求职被拒可能令人沮丧，但不要放弃。<,>re(反)+ject(扔)+ion→扔回去→拒绝<,>injection(n.注射)/projection(n.投射)/ejection(n.驱逐)  

fixture<,>/ˈfɪkstʃə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪkstʃər/<,>n.固定装置/n.固定在某位置的人<,>The lighting fixtures in the room were elegant.<,>房间里的照明装置很优雅。<,>He's been a fixture at the local café for years.<,>多年来他一直是那家咖啡馆的常客。<,>Bathroom fixtures need to be installed properly.<,>浴室固定装置需要正确安装。<,>fix(固定)+ture→固定物<,>mixture(n.混合物)/texture(n.质地)/future(n.未来)  

manufacture<,>/ˌmænjuˈfæktʃə(r)/<,>/ˌmænjəˈfæktʃər/<,>vt.制造/vt.加工/n.制造/n.制造业<,>The company manufactures electronic components.<,>这家公司制造电子元件。<,>Local manufacturing has declined in recent years.<,>当地制造业近年来有所下降。<,>They manufacture toys from recycled materials.<,>他们用回收材料制造玩具。<,>manu(手)+fact(做)+ure→用手做→制造<,>manual(adj.手工的)/factory(n.工厂)/manufactory(n.制造厂)  

collision<,>/kəˈlɪʒn/<,>/kəˈlɪʒn/<,>n.碰撞/n.冲突/n.抵触<,>The two cars were in a head-on collision.<,>两辆车迎面相撞。<,>There was a collision of opinions at the meeting.<,>会议上出现了意见冲突。<,>The collision damaged both vehicles severely.<,>碰撞使两辆车都严重受损。<,>col(共同)+lis(打)+ion→互相打→碰撞<,>collide(v.碰撞)/collusion(n.共谋)/corrosion(n.腐蚀)  

sequence<,>/ˈsiːkwəns/<,>/ˈsiːkwəns/<,>n.连续/n.接续/n.一连串/n.次序/n.顺序<,>Please arrange the cards in the correct sequence.<,>请按正确顺序排列这些卡片。<,>The film had an exciting sequence of chase scenes.<,>电影有一连串激动人心的追逐场景。<,>Scientists mapped the DNA sequence of the virus.<,>科学家绘制了病毒的DNA序列。<,>sequ(跟随)+ence→一个跟着一个<,>consequence(n.结果)/subsequent(adj.随后的)/sequential(adj.连续的)
recruit<,>/rɪˈkruːt/<,>/rɪˈkruːt/<,>vt.招募/vt.吸收<,>The company plans to recruit more employees next month.<,>公司计划下个月招聘更多员工。<,>They are recruiting volunteers for the event.<,>他们正在为活动招募志愿者。<,>Our team needs to recruit new talent to stay competitive.<,>我们团队需要吸收新人才以保持竞争力。<,>re(再次)+cruit(增长)→再次增长→招募<,>recruitment(n. 招募)/recruiter(n. 招聘人员)  

provision<,>/prəˈvɪʒn/<,>/prəˈvɪʒən/<,>n.供应/n.准备/n.条款/n.给养<,>The provision of clean water is essential for the village.<,>为村庄提供清洁的水是至关重要的。<,>We made provision for unexpected expenses.<,>我们为意外开支做了准备。<,>The contract includes a provision about late payments.<,>合同中包含关于延迟付款的条款。<,>pro(向前)+vis(看)+ion→提前看→准备<,>provide(v. 提供)/provisional(adj. 临时的)  

calorie<,>/ˈkæləri/<,>/ˈkæləri/<,>n.大卡/n.卡<,>This snack contains 200 calories per serving.<,>这种零食每份含有200卡路里。<,>She counts calories to maintain her weight.<,>她计算卡路里以保持体重。<,>High-calorie foods can lead to weight gain.<,>高热量食物可能导致体重增加。<,>calor(热)+ie→热量单位<,>caloric(adj. 热量的)/calorimeter(n. 热量计)  

slogan<,>/ˈsləʊɡən/<,>/ˈsloʊɡən/<,>n.标语/n.口号/n.广告语<,>The protesters chanted slogans during the march.<,>抗议者在游行期间高喊口号。<,>Their new advertising slogan is very catchy.<,>他们的新广告语非常吸引人。<,>The company's slogan emphasizes quality and innovation.<,>公司的标语强调质量和创新。<,>slog(叫喊)+an→喊出的口号<,>motto(n. 座右铭)/tagline(n. 标语)  

invariably<,>/ɪnˈveəriəbli/<,>/ɪnˈveriəbli/<,>adv.不变地/adv.始终如一地/adv.总是<,>He is invariably late for meetings.<,>他开会总是迟到。<,>Her work is invariably of high quality.<,>她的工作始终如一地高质量。<,>The results are invariably the same.<,>结果总是一样的。<,>in(不)+vary(变化)+ably→不变地<,>variable(adj. 可变的)/invariable(adj. 不变的)  

commence<,>/kəˈmens/<,>/kəˈmens/<,>v.开始<,>The ceremony will commence at 9 AM.<,>仪式将于上午9点开始。<,>They commenced construction on the new building.<,>他们开始了新楼的建设。<,>Let's commence the meeting with a brief introduction.<,>让我们以简短介绍开始会议。<,>com(一起)+mence(开始)→一起开始<,>commencement(n. 开始)/recommence(v. 重新开始)  

tract<,>/trækt/<,>/trækt/<,>n.传单/n.小册子/n.大片<,>They handed out tracts about environmental protection.<,>他们分发了关于环境保护的小册子。<,>The farmer owns a large tract of land.<,>这位农民拥有一大片土地。<,>The religious group distributes tracts in public places.<,>这个宗教团体在公共场所分发传单。<,>tract(拉)→拉长的传单<,>tractor(n. 拖拉机)/abstract(adj. 抽象的)  

configuration<,>/kənˌfɪɡəˈreɪʃn/<,>/kənˌfɪɡjəˈreɪʃən/<,>n.配置/n.布局/n.构造<,>The computer's configuration needs to be updated.<,>这台电脑的配置需要更新。<,>The configuration of the office affects productivity.<,>办公室的布局影响工作效率。<,>The molecule has a unique configuration.<,>这个分子有独特的构造。<,>con(一起)+figure(形状)+ation→整体形状→构造<,>configure(v. 配置)/reconfiguration(n. 重新配置)  

mercury<,>/ˈmɜːkjəri/<,>/ˈmɜːrkjəri/<,>n.水银/n.汞<,>Mercury is used in thermometers.<,>水银用于温度计。<,>The spill released mercury into the environment.<,>泄漏将汞释放到了环境中。<,>Mercury is a toxic heavy metal.<,>汞是一种有毒的重金属。<,>Mercury(罗马神话中的信使)→水银流动如信使<,>mercurial(adj. 多变的)/mercuric(adj. 汞的)  

frequent<,>/ˈfriːkwənt/<,>/ˈfriːkwənt/<,>adj.时常发生的/adj.常见的<,>He is a frequent visitor to the library.<,>他是图书馆的常客。<,>Frequent rain is expected this week.<,>预计本周会频繁下雨。<,>This is a frequent problem in the system.<,>这是系统中常见的问题。<,>frequ(频繁)+ent→频繁的<,>frequency(n. 频率)/infrequent(adj. 不频繁的)
chunk<,>/tʃʌŋk/<,>/tʃʌŋk/<,>n.厚片/n.大块/n.相当大的部分<,>She broke off a chunk of bread and handed it to me.<,>她掰下一大块面包递给我。<,>A large chunk of the budget is spent on education.<,>预算的很大一部分用于教育。<,>He ate a chunk of cheese for breakfast.<,>他早餐吃了一大块奶酪。<,>联想：chunk与"chunky"(厚实的)同源，表示大块的东西<,>lump(n.块)/hunk(n.大块)/slice(n.薄片)

interact<,>/ˌɪntərˈækt/<,>/ˌɪntərˈækt/<,>vi.相互作用/vi.相互影响<,>The two chemicals interact to produce heat.<,>这两种化学物质相互作用会产生热量。<,>Children learn by interacting with their environment.<,>儿童通过与周围环境互动来学习。<,>How do these two medications interact?<,>这两种药物会如何相互作用？<,>inter(相互)+act(行动)→相互行动→互动<,>interface(n.界面)/intervene(vi.干涉)/intercept(vt.拦截)

commonplace<,>/ˈkɒmənpleɪs/<,>/ˈkɑːmənpleɪs/<,>adj.普通的/adj.平庸的/n.寻常的事物/n.平庸的东西<,>Smartphones have become commonplace nowadays.<,>智能手机如今已经变得很普通。<,>His speech was full of commonplace remarks.<,>他的演讲充满了陈词滥调。<,>Such accidents are a commonplace in this industry.<,>这种事故在这个行业很常见。<,>common(普通的)+place(地方)→普通的地方→平凡的<,>commonwealth(n.联邦)/commonality(n.共性)/platitude(n.陈词滥调)

aggregate<,>/ˈæɡrɪɡət/<,>/ˈæɡrɪɡət/<,>adj.总计的/adj.合计的/n.总数/n.合计/vt.总计达/vt.合计/vt.使聚集/vt.使积聚<,>The aggregate amount of donations reached $1 million.<,>捐款总额达到了100万美元。<,>We need to aggregate the data from different sources.<,>我们需要汇总来自不同来源的数据。<,>In the aggregate, these changes will improve efficiency.<,>总的来说，这些变化将提高效率。<,>ag(加强)+greg(群体)+ate→使成群体→聚集<,>aggravate(vt.加重)/congregate(v.聚集)/segregate(vt.隔离)

seemingly<,>/ˈsiːmɪŋli/<,>/ˈsiːmɪŋli/<,>adv.表面上/adv.看上去<,>Seemingly, he was unaware of the problem.<,>表面上，他似乎不知道这个问题。<,>The task is seemingly simple but actually complex.<,>这个任务看似简单实则复杂。<,>She was seemingly calm during the crisis.<,>危机期间她看上去很平静。<,>seeming(表面上的)+ly(副词后缀)→表面上<,>apparently(adv.显然地)/ostensibly(adv.表面上)/actually(adv.实际上)

attendant<,>/əˈtendənt/<,>/əˈtendənt/<,>adj.伴随的/adj.随之产生的/n.服务人员/n.侍者/n.随从<,>Unemployment and its attendant problems worsened.<,>失业及其伴随的问题恶化了。<,>The flight attendant served drinks to passengers.<,>空乘人员为乘客提供饮料。<,>The king entered with his attendants.<,>国王带着随从们进来了。<,>attend(出席)+ant(人)→出席的人→随从<,>attendance(n.出席)/attention(n.注意)/intendant(n.管理者)

array<,>/əˈreɪ/<,>/əˈreɪ/<,>n.展示/n.陈列/n.一系列/n.排列/n.队形/n.衣服/n.盛装<,>An array of products was displayed in the shop window.<,>商店橱窗里陈列着一系列产品。<,>The soldiers stood in battle array.<,>士兵们以战斗队形站立。<,>She wore her finest array to the ball.<,>她穿着最华丽的盛装参加舞会。<,>ar(加强)+ray(光线)→像光线一样排列→阵列<,>arrange(v.安排)/disarray(n.混乱)/parade(n.游行)

parameter<,>/pəˈræmɪtə(r)/<,>/pəˈræmɪtər/<,>n.界限/n.范围/n.参数<,>We need to define the parameters of the project first.<,>我们需要先确定项目的范围。<,>Temperature is an important parameter in this experiment.<,>温度是这个实验的重要参数。<,>The discussion stayed within acceptable parameters.<,>讨论保持在可接受的范围内。<,>para(旁边)+meter(测量)→在旁边测量的量→参数<,>perimeter(n.周长)/thermometer(n.温度计)/diameter(n.直径)

extinct<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋkt/<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋkt/<,>adj.灭绝的/adj.绝种的/adj.不再活跃的/adj.熄灭了的/adj.已废弃的<,>Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.<,>恐龙已经灭绝数百万年了。<,>The volcano was thought to be extinct until it erupted.<,>这座火山在喷发前被认为已经熄灭了。<,>This is an extinct custom in modern society.<,>这是现代社会中已废弃的习俗。<,>ex(出)+stinct(刺)→刺出去→熄灭<,>extinguish(vt.熄灭)/distinct(adj.明显的)/instinct(n.本能)

discriminate<,>/dɪˈskrɪmɪneɪt/<,>/dɪˈskrɪmɪneɪt/<,>vi.区别/vi.辨别/vi.有差别地对待/vi.歧视<,>Babies can discriminate between different sounds.<,>婴儿能够辨别不同的声音。<,>The law prohibits discriminating against women in the workplace.<,>法律禁止在工作场所歧视女性。<,>It's important to discriminate facts from opinions.<,>区分事实和观点很重要。<,>dis(分开)+crimin(分辨)+ate→分开分辨→辨别<,>discrimination(n.歧视)/indiscriminate(adj.不加选择的)/criminal(n.罪犯)
degrade<,>/dɪˈɡreɪd/<,>/dɪˈɡreɪd/<,>vt.降低…的身份/vt.有辱…的人格/vt.使降解/vt.使退化<,>Plastic bags can take hundreds of years to degrade in nature.<,>塑料袋在自然界中可能需要数百年才能降解。<,>His rude behavior degraded the whole event.<,>他粗鲁的行为降低了整个活动的格调。<,>The harsh chemicals will degrade the fabric over time.<,>这些刺激性化学品会逐渐使织物退化。<,>de(向下)+grade(等级)→降低等级→退化<,>downgrade(vt.降级)/upgrade(vt.升级)/digress(vi.离题)

opaque<,>/əʊˈpeɪk/<,>/oʊˈpeɪk/<,>adj.不透明的/adj.不透光的/adj.难理解的/adj.晦涩的<,>The windows were made of opaque glass for privacy.<,>窗户采用不透明玻璃以保护隐私。<,>His explanation was so opaque that no one understood it.<,>他的解释晦涩难懂，没人能理解。<,>The liquid in the bottle looked opaque under the light.<,>瓶子里的液体在光线下看起来不透明。<,>opa(不)+que(似)→看起来不像→不透明<,>translucent(adj.半透明的)/transparent(adj.透明的)/obscure(adj.模糊的)

repay<,>/rɪˈpeɪ/<,>/rɪˈpeɪ/<,>vt.归还/vt.报答<,>I'll repay the money I borrowed next month.<,>我下个月会归还借的钱。<,>How can I ever repay your kindness?<,>我该如何报答你的好意呢？<,>The company will repay its debts within three years.<,>公司将在三年内偿还债务。<,>re(回)+pay(支付)→支付回去→偿还<,>refund(vt.退款)/reimburse(vt.报销)/reward(vt.奖励)

monetary<,>/ˈmʌnɪt(ə)ri/<,>/ˈmɑːnɪteri/<,>adj.钱的/adj.货币的/adj.金融的<,>The government introduced new monetary policies to control inflation.<,>政府出台了新的货币政策来控制通货膨胀。<,>Monetary donations are also accepted by the charity.<,>该慈善机构也接受金钱捐赠。<,>The euro is the monetary unit of many European countries.<,>欧元是许多欧洲国家的货币单位。<,>monet(钱)+ary(形容词后缀)→钱的<,>fiscal(adj.财政的)/financial(adj.金融的)/pecuniary(adj.金钱的)

grave<,>/ɡreɪv/<,>/ɡreɪv/<,>adj.严重的/adj.严肃的/n.坟墓<,>The patient is in grave condition after the accident.<,>事故后病人情况严重。<,>He maintained a grave expression throughout the meeting.<,>他在整个会议期间都保持严肃的表情。<,>We visited my grandfather's grave on Memorial Day.<,>我们在阵亡将士纪念日去祭拜了祖父的坟墓。<,>grav(重)+e→沉重的→严重的<,>gravel(n.碎石)/gravity(n.重力)/engrave(vt.雕刻)

advantage<,>/ədˈvɑːntɪdʒ/<,>/ədˈvæntɪdʒ/<,>n.优点/n.优势/n.好处<,>Her height gives her an advantage in basketball.<,>她的身高在篮球运动中是个优势。<,>One advantage of living downtown is easy access to public transportation.<,>住在市中心的一个好处是公共交通便利。<,>Taking notes during lectures has many advantages.<,>上课记笔记有很多好处。<,>advant(在前)+age(状态)→领先状态→优势<,>disadvantage(n.缺点)/benefit(n.利益)/edge(n.优势)

controversy<,>/ˈkɒntrəvɜːsi/<,>/ˈkɑːntrəvɜːrsi/<,>n.争论/n.辩论<,>The new law has sparked much controversy.<,>新法律引发了很多争议。<,>There's ongoing controversy about the effects of social media.<,>关于社交媒体影响的争论持续不断。<,>The scientific controversy lasted for decades.<,>这场科学辩论持续了几十年。<,>contro(反对)+vers(转)+y→相互反对转动→争论<,>contradiction(n.矛盾)/argument(n.争论)/dispute(n.争执)

command<,>/kəˈmɑːnd/<,>/kəˈmænd/<,>n&vt.命令/n&vt.指挥/n&vt.控制<,>The general issued a command to retreat.<,>将军下达了撤退的命令。<,>She commands great respect from her colleagues.<,>她赢得了同事们的极大尊重。<,>He has a good command of three languages.<,>他精通三种语言。<,>com(完全)+mand(命令)→完全命令→控制<,>demand(vt.要求)/commend(vt.称赞)/mandate(n.授权)

compulsory<,>/kəmˈpʌlsəri/<,>/kəmˈpʌlsəri/<,>adj.必须做的/adj.强制性的/adj.必修的<,>Military service is compulsory in some countries.<,>在一些国家服兵役是强制性的。<,>English is a compulsory subject in most schools.<,>英语在大多数学校是必修科目。<,>Wearing seat belts is compulsory for all passengers.<,>所有乘客都必须系安全带。<,>com(共同)+puls(推)+ory→共同推着做→强制的<,>optional(adj.可选的)/mandatory(adj.强制的)/voluntary(adj.自愿的)

performance<,>/pəˈfɔːməns/<,>/pərˈfɔːrməns/<,>n.演出/n.履行/n.执行/n.完成/n.工作情况/n.表现/n.工作性能<,>The orchestra gave an outstanding performance last night.<,>昨晚管弦乐队的演出非常出色。<,>Her job performance has improved significantly.<,>她的工作表现有了显著提高。<,>This car has excellent fuel performance.<,>这辆车的燃油性能非常出色。<,>perform(执行)+ance(名词后缀)→执行的结果→表现<,>execution(n.执行)/achievement(n.成就)/show(n.表演)
serial<,>/ˈsɪəriəl/<,>/ˈsɪriəl/<,>adj.连续的/adj.顺序排列的/n.连续剧/n.连载故事<,>The serial numbers on the products help in tracking them.<,>产品上的序列号有助于追踪它们。<,>She loves watching Korean serials in her free time.<,>她喜欢在空闲时间看韩剧。<,>The books were arranged in serial order on the shelf.<,>这些书按顺序排列在书架上。<,>seri(系列)+al→连续的<,>cereal(n.谷物)/series(n.系列)

anticipate<,>/ænˈtɪsɪpeɪt/<,>/ænˈtɪsəˌpeɪt/<,>vt.预料/vt.预期/vt.期望/vt.先于…行动/vt.提前使用<,>We anticipate a rise in sales next month.<,>我们预计下个月的销售额会上升。<,>He anticipated his opponent's move and countered it.<,>他预料到了对手的动作并进行了反击。<,>She always anticipates her children's needs.<,>她总是提前考虑到孩子们的需求。<,>anti(前)+cip(拿)+ate→提前拿到→预料<,>participate(v.参与)/emancipate(v.解放)

detach<,>/dɪˈtætʃ/<,>/dɪˈtætʃ/<,>vt.拆卸/vt.使分开/vt.使分离<,>Please detach the coupon from the magazine.<,>请从杂志上撕下优惠券。<,>The soldier was detached from his unit for special training.<,>这名士兵被从部队调离去参加特别训练。<,>It's hard to detach emotionally from this place.<,>很难从情感上脱离这个地方。<,>de(分开)+tach(钉)→把钉子分开→拆卸<,>attach(v.连接)/dispatch(v.派遣)

slash<,>/slæʃ/<,>/slæʃ/<,>vt.砍/vt.大幅度削减/n.砍/n.砍痕/n.斜线号<,>The robber slashed the tires of the car.<,>劫匪砍破了汽车的轮胎。<,>The company decided to slash prices to attract customers.<,>公司决定大幅降价以吸引顾客。<,>Use a slash to separate the alternatives.<,>用斜线号分隔选项。<,>s(死)+lash(鞭打)→死命鞭打→砍<,>flash(n.闪光)/clash(v.冲突)

fabricate<,>/ˈfæbrɪkeɪt/<,>/ˈfæbrəˌkeɪt/<,>vt.捏造/vt.伪造/vt.编造/vt.建造<,>He fabricated an excuse for being late.<,>他为迟到编造了一个借口。<,>The bridge was fabricated from steel beams.<,>这座桥是用钢梁建造的。<,>It's illegal to fabricate evidence in court.<,>在法庭上伪造证据是违法的。<,>fabric(织物)+ate→像编织织物一样编造<,>fabric(n.织物)/fabulous(adj.极好的)

comic<,>/ˈkɒmɪk/<,>/ˈkɑːmɪk/<,>adj.喜剧的/adj.滑稽的/n.连环漫画/n.喜剧演员<,>The comic performance had everyone laughing.<,>这场喜剧表演让每个人都笑了。<,>He collects vintage comic books.<,>他收集老式连环漫画书。<,>The comic delivered his lines perfectly.<,>这位喜剧演员完美地表演了他的台词。<,>com(欢乐)+ic→喜剧的<,>cosmic(adj.宇宙的)/comedy(n.喜剧)

perfection<,>/pəˈfekʃn/<,>/pərˈfekʃən/<,>n.完美/n.完善<,>She strives for perfection in everything she does.<,>她力求在每件事上都做到完美。<,>The dish was cooked to perfection.<,>这道菜做得恰到好处。<,>Perfection is impossible to achieve.<,>完美是不可能达到的。<,>perfect(完美)+ion→完美<,>infection(n.感染)/affection(n.喜爱)

vague<,>/veɪɡ/<,>/veɪɡ/<,>adj.不明确的/adj.含糊的/adj.暧昧的<,>His instructions were too vague to follow.<,>他的指示太含糊，无法遵循。<,>I have a vague memory of that event.<,>我对那个事件有模糊的记忆。<,>She gave a vague answer to avoid the question.<,>她给出了一个含糊的回答来回避问题。<,>vag(漫游)+ue→思想漫游→含糊的<,>vogue(n.时尚)/value(n.价值)

pope<,>/pəʊp/<,>/poʊp/<,>n.教皇/n.罗马主教<,>The Pope addressed the crowd in St. Peter's Square.<,>教皇在圣彼得广场向人群发表讲话。<,>The election of a new Pope is a significant event.<,>新教皇的选举是一个重大事件。<,>Many Catholics look to the Pope for guidance.<,>许多天主教徒寻求教皇的指导。<,>pop(人民)+e→人民的领袖→教皇<,>pipe(n.管道)/poke(v.戳)

exception<,>/ɪkˈsepʃn/<,>/ɪkˈsɛpʃən/<,>n.例外/n.除外<,>Everyone must attend the meeting without exception.<,>每个人都必须参加会议，无一例外。<,>This rule has very few exceptions.<,>这条规则几乎没有例外。<,>She made an exception for her best friend.<,>她为自己的好朋友破了一次例。<,>ex(出)+cept(拿)+ion→拿出去→例外<,>excerpt(n.摘录)/exemption(n.免除)
ego<,>/ˈiːɡəʊ/<,>/ˈiːɡoʊ/<,>n.自我/n.自己/n.自尊<,>His ego was bruised by the criticism.<,>批评伤了他的自尊。<,>She has a very strong ego.<,>她有很强的自我意识。<,>He needs to control his ego.<,>他需要控制自己的自负。<,>ego(拉丁语"我")→自我<,>alter ego(另一个自我)/id(本我)/superego(超我)

urge<,>/ɜːdʒ/<,>/ɜːrdʒ/<,>vt.鼓励/vt.推进/vt.催促/vt.竭力主张/vt.强烈要求/n.冲动/n.强烈的欲望<,>She urged him to finish his homework.<,>她催促他完成作业。<,>I had a sudden urge to travel.<,>我突然有去旅行的强烈欲望。<,>The doctor urged him to quit smoking.<,>医生强烈建议他戒烟。<,>urg(驱动)+e→催促<,>surge(n.巨浪/vi.汹涌)/purge(vt.净化)/merge(vt.合并)

spouse<,>/spaʊs/<,>/spaʊs/<,>n.配偶<,>She introduced her spouse at the party.<,>她在聚会上介绍了自己的配偶。<,>Both spouses must sign the contract.<,>夫妻双方都必须在合同上签字。<,>His spouse is a doctor.<,>他的配偶是医生。<,>spous(承诺)+e→承诺终身的人→配偶<,>house(n.房子)/mouse(n.老鼠)/blouse(n.女衬衫)

score<,>/skɔː(r)/<,>/skɔːr/<,>n.得分/n.比数/n.成绩/n.二十/vt.打分/vt.画线于/vt.获胜<,>The final score was 3-2.<,>最终比分是3比2。<,>She scored high on the test.<,>她在考试中取得了高分。<,>He scored a goal in the last minute.<,>他在最后一分钟进了一球。<,>scor(切)+e→刻痕记数→得分<,>scorn(vt.轻蔑)/scare(vt.惊吓)/store(n.商店)

isle<,>/aɪl/<,>/aɪl/<,>n.小岛/n.岛<,>They spent their vacation on a small isle.<,>他们在一个小岛上度假。<,>The isle is famous for its beaches.<,>这个岛以海滩闻名。<,>Only birds inhabit the rocky isle.<,>只有鸟类栖息在这个岩石小岛上。<,>is(岛)+le(小)→小岛<,>aisle(n.过道)/islet(n.小岛)/peninsula(n.半岛)

enclosure<,>/ɪnˈkləʊʒə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈkloʊʒər/<,>n.围场/n.四周有篱笆的场地/n.附件<,>The animals were kept in an enclosure.<,>动物们被关在围场里。<,>Please see the enclosure for details.<,>详情请见附件。<,>The garden has a wooden enclosure.<,>花园有一个木制的围栏。<,>en(进入)+clos(关闭)+ure→围起来的地方→围场<,>disclosure(n.披露)/closure(n.关闭)/exposure(n.暴露)

graduate<,>/ˈɡrædʒuət/<,>/ˈɡrædʒuət/<,>adj.研究生的/v.毕业/n.毕业生/n.研究生<,>She will graduate next month.<,>她下个月就要毕业了。<,>He is a graduate of Harvard University.<,>他是哈佛大学的毕业生。<,>She's applying to graduate schools.<,>她正在申请研究生院。<,>grad(步)+uate→一步步完成学业→毕业<,>undergraduate(n.本科生)/postgraduate(n.研究生)/degrade(vt.降级)

famine<,>/ˈfæmɪn/<,>/ˈfæmɪn/<,>n.饥荒/n.严重的缺乏<,>The country suffered from famine last year.<,>这个国家去年遭受了饥荒。<,>There is a famine of good ideas.<,>缺乏好的想法。<,>Many people died during the great famine.<,>许多人在大饥荒中死去。<,>fam(饥饿)+ine→饥荒<,>feminine(adj.女性的)/famine relief(饥荒救济)/famine area(饥荒地区)

quota<,>/ˈkwəʊtə/<,>/ˈkwoʊtə/<,>n.定额/n.限额/n.配额<,>The factory has reached its production quota.<,>工厂已经达到了生产配额。<,>Each team has a quota of five players.<,>每队有五名队员的限额。<,>They imposed a quota on imports.<,>他们对进口实行了配额限制。<,>quot(数量)+a→定额<,>quote(vt.引用)/quaint(adj.古雅的)/quasar(n.类星体)

unanimous<,>/juːˈnænɪməs/<,>/juːˈnænɪməs/<,>adj.全体一致的/adj.一致同意的<,>The decision was unanimous.<,>这个决定是全体一致通过的。<,>They reached a unanimous agreement.<,>他们达成了一致协议。<,>The jury was unanimous in its verdict.<,>陪审团一致作出了裁决。<,>un(一个)+anim(精神)+ous→一个精神的→一致的<,>anonymous(adj.匿名的)/animosity(n.敌意)/magnanimous(adj.宽宏大量的)
scorn<,>/skɔːn/<,>/skɔrn/<,>n.轻蔑/n.鄙视/vt.轻蔑/vt.鄙视/vt.拒绝/vt.不屑<,>She looked at him with scorn.<,>她轻蔑地看着他。<,>He scorned their offer of help.<,>他不屑地拒绝了他们的帮助。<,>His scornful remarks hurt her feelings.<,>他轻蔑的言语伤害了她的感情。<,>s(死)+corn(玉米)→死玉米→鄙视<,>scare(vt.惊吓)/score(n.分数/vt.得分)  

thermal<,>/ˈθɜːməl/<,>/ˈθɜrməl/<,>adj.热的/adj.由热造成的/adj.保暖的<,>The thermal springs are popular in winter.<,>这些温泉在冬天很受欢迎。<,>She wore a thermal vest to keep warm.<,>她穿了件保暖背心御寒。<,>Thermal energy can be converted into electricity.<,>热能可以转化为电能。<,>therm(热)+al(形容词后缀)→热的<,>terminal(n.终端/adj.末端的)/thermos(n.热水瓶)  

sulfur<,>/ˈsʌlfə(r)/<,>/ˈsʌlfɚ/<,>n.硫<,>Sulfur is used in making matches.<,>硫磺用于制造火柴。<,>The water smelled of sulfur.<,>这水有硫磺味。<,>Sulfur dioxide is a harmful gas.<,>二氧化硫是一种有害气体。<,>sul(看作"soul"灵魂)+fur(皮毛)→灵魂的皮毛→硫<,>sulphur(英式拼写)/solder(n.焊料)  

visual<,>/ˈvɪʒuəl/<,>/ˈvɪʒuəl/<,>adj.看的/adj.视觉的<,>The visual effects in the movie are amazing.<,>这部电影的视觉效果很棒。<,>She has a strong visual memory.<,>她有很强的视觉记忆力。<,>The chart provides a visual representation of the data.<,>这张图表提供了数据的可视化呈现。<,>vis(看)+ual(形容词后缀)→视觉的<,>vital(adj.至关重要的)/virtual(adj.虚拟的)  

terrain<,>/təˈreɪn/<,>/təˈreɪn/<,>n.地形/n.地势<,>The rough terrain made hiking difficult.<,>崎岖的地形使徒步变得困难。<,>They studied the terrain before the battle.<,>他们在战斗前研究了地形。<,>This vehicle can handle all types of terrain.<,>这种车辆能适应各种地形。<,>terr(地)+ain(名词后缀)→地形<,>terrace(n.平台)/terrible(adj.可怕的)  

grief<,>/ɡriːf/<,>/ɡrif/<,>n.悲伤/n.悲痛/n.悲伤的事/n.悲痛的缘由<,>She was overcome with grief when her dog died.<,>她的狗去世时，她悲痛欲绝。<,>Time heals all griefs.<,>时间能治愈一切悲伤。<,>His behavior caused his parents much grief.<,>他的行为给父母带来了很多痛苦。<,>g(看作"grave"坟墓)+rief(看作"relief"缓解)→坟墓前的悲伤<,>brief(adj.简短的)/belief(n.信仰)  

rap<,>/ræp/<,>/ræp/<,>vi.说唱/vt.敲击/vt.急敲/vt.突然厉声说出/vt.责备/vt.训斥/n.敲击/n.急敲<,>He likes to rap with his friends.<,>他喜欢和朋友一起说唱。<,>She rapped the table to get attention.<,>她敲了敲桌子以引起注意。<,>The teacher gave him a rap on the knuckles for being late.<,>老师因为他迟到而责备了他。<,>r(看作"run"跑)+ap(看作"app"应用)→跑应用→说唱<,>wrap(vt.包裹)/trap(n.陷阱)  

upgrade<,>/ˌʌpˈɡreɪd/<,>/ˈʌpˌɡred/<,>vt.提升/vt.使升级/n.向上的斜坡<,>They upgraded their computer system.<,>他们升级了电脑系统。<,>We got a free upgrade to business class.<,>我们免费升级到了商务舱。<,>The road has a steep upgrade ahead.<,>前方道路有个陡峭的上坡。<,>up(向上)+grade(等级)→升级<,>downgrade(vt.降级)/upward(adv.向上)  

instruct<,>/ɪnˈstrʌkt/<,>/ɪnˈstrʌkt/<,>vt.教/vt.指示/vt.通知/vt.教育<,>The teacher instructed the students carefully.<,>老师认真地教导学生。<,>He instructed me to wait here.<,>他指示我在这里等候。<,>The manual instructs users how to install the software.<,>手册指导用户如何安装软件。<,>in(里面)+struct(建造)→在里面建造知识→教育<,>construct(vt.建造)/instrument(n.仪器)  

appendix<,>/əˈpendɪks/<,>/əˈpɛndɪks/<,>n.阑尾/n.附录<,>The book has a useful appendix.<,>这本书有个有用的附录。<,>He had his appendix removed last year.<,>他去年切除了阑尾。<,>Check the appendix for more details.<,>查看附录获取更多细节。<,>ap(加强)+pend(悬挂)+ix→悬挂在书后的部分→附录<,>pendulum(n.钟摆)/depend(vi.依靠)
virtually<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuəli/<,>/ˈvɜːrtʃuəli/<,>adv.事实上/adv.实质上<,>Virtually all the students passed the exam.<,>事实上，所有的学生都通过了考试。<,>The project is virtually complete.<,>这个项目实质上已经完成了。<,>He was virtually unknown before the movie.<,>在这部电影之前，他几乎无人知晓。<,>virtual(虚拟的)+ly(副词后缀)→事实上<,>actually(adv.实际上)/practically(adv.几乎)

agreeable<,>/əˈɡriːəbl/<,>/əˈɡriːəbl/<,>adj.令人愉快的/adj.惬意的/adj.同意的/adj.乐意的<,>The weather was very agreeable during our vacation.<,>我们度假期间的天气非常宜人。<,>She found his company quite agreeable.<,>她觉得和他在一起很愉快。<,>He was agreeable to the suggestion.<,>他同意这个建议。<,>agree(同意)+able(能…的)→令人愉快的<,>pleasant(adj.令人愉快的)/willing(adj.乐意的)

economy<,>/ɪˈkɒnəmi/<,>/ɪˈkɑːnəmi/<,>n.经济/n.节约/n.节省<,>The country's economy is growing rapidly.<,>这个国家的经济正在快速增长。<,>We need to practice economy in our daily life.<,>我们需要在日常生活中厉行节约。<,>She bought the car for economy reasons.<,>她买这辆车是为了节省开支。<,>eco(家)+nomy(管理)→管理家庭财务→经济<,>economics(n.经济学)/frugality(n.节俭)

community<,>/kəˈmjuːnəti/<,>/kəˈmjuːnəti/<,>n.社区/n.社会/n.团体/n.界/n.群落<,>She is an active member of the local community.<,>她是当地社区的活跃成员。<,>The scientific community welcomed the discovery.<,>科学界对这一发现表示欢迎。<,>A diverse community of plants and animals lives here.<,>这里生活着多样的动植物群落。<,>com(共同)+muni(服务)+ty(名词后缀)→共同服务的地方→社区<,>society(n.社会)/colony(n.殖民地;群体)

version<,>/ˈvɜːʃn/<,>/ˈvɜːrʒn/<,>n.译文/n.说法/n.改写本<,>This is the English version of the novel.<,>这是这部小说的英文译本。<,>There are different versions of what happened.<,>对于发生的事情有不同的说法。<,>She wrote a modern version of the fairy tale.<,>她写了一个现代版的童话故事。<,>vers(转)+ion(名词后缀)→转换的文本→译文<,>edition(n.版本)/interpretation(n.解释)

sprinkle<,>/ˈsprɪŋkl/<,>/ˈsprɪŋkl/<,>v.撒/v.洒/n.少量/n.少数<,>She sprinkled sugar on the cookies.<,>她在饼干上撒了糖。<,>There was a sprinkle of rain in the morning.<,>早上下了点小雨。<,>Only a sprinkle of people attended the meeting.<,>只有少数人参加了会议。<,>spr(喷)+inkle(小)→喷洒少量→撒<,>scatter(v.分散)/drizzle(n.毛毛雨)

bronze<,>/brɒnz/<,>/brɑːnz/<,>n.青铜/n.青铜色/n.古铜色/n.青铜制品/n.铜牌<,>The statue is made of bronze.<,>这座雕像是青铜制成的。<,>She won a bronze medal in the competition.<,>她在比赛中获得了铜牌。<,>His skin had a healthy bronze after the vacation.<,>度假后他的皮肤呈现出健康的古铜色。<,>bron(褐)+ze→青铜色<,>brass(n.黄铜)/copper(n.铜)

conception<,>/kənˈsepʃn/<,>/kənˈsepʃn/<,>n.思想/n.观念/n.概念/n.构想/n.设想/n.怀孕<,>The conception of the project took several months.<,>这个项目的构想花了几个月时间。<,>He has a different conception of success.<,>他对成功有不同的观念。<,>The drug should not be taken after conception.<,>怀孕后不应服用这种药物。<,>con(共同)+cept(拿)+ion(名词后缀)→共同拿出的想法→概念<,>concept(n.概念)/perception(n.感知)

municipal<,>/mjuːˈnɪsɪpl/<,>/mjuːˈnɪsɪpl/<,>adj.市的/adj.市政的<,>The municipal government announced new policies.<,>市政府宣布了新政策。<,>We visited the municipal museum yesterday.<,>我们昨天参观了市立博物馆。<,>Municipal water supplies are usually safe to drink.<,>市政供水通常可以安全饮用。<,>muni(服务)+cip(拿)+al(形容词后缀)→为市民服务的→市政的<,>metropolitan(adj.大都市的)/urban(adj.城市的)

detain<,>/dɪˈteɪn/<,>/dɪˈteɪn/<,>vt.拘留/vt.扣留/vt.留住/vt.耽搁<,>The police detained him for questioning.<,>警方拘留了他进行询问。<,>Bad weather detained us for an hour.<,>恶劣的天气耽搁了我们一个小时。<,>She was detained at the office by urgent work.<,>紧急工作把她留在了办公室。<,>de(下)+tain(握)→握在下面→拘留<,>retain(vt.保留)/contain(vt.包含)
institute<,>/ˈɪnstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈɪnstɪtuːt/<,>n.研究所/n.学院/vt.建立/vt.设立<,>She works at a research institute.<,>她在一家研究所工作。<,>They decided to institute a new policy.<,>他们决定制定一项新政策。<,>The institute offers various courses.<,>该学院提供多种课程。<,>in(进入)+stitute(建立)→建立机构→学院<,>constitute(vt.组成)/substitute(n.替代品/v.替代)  

endure<,>/ɪnˈdjʊə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈdʊr/<,>v.忍受/v.容忍/v.持久/v.持续<,>She had to endure a lot of pain.<,>她不得不忍受很多痛苦。<,>Their love endured through difficult times.<,>他们的爱情在困难时期持续了下来。<,>This fabric can endure frequent washing.<,>这种面料经得起频繁洗涤。<,>en(使)+dure(持续)→使持续→忍受<,>ensure(v.确保)/endanger(v.危及)  

detail<,>/ˈdiːteɪl/<,>/dɪˈteɪl/<,>n.细节/n.枝节/n.零件/vt.详细说明<,>Please pay attention to every detail.<,>请注意每一个细节。<,>He detailed his plan to the team.<,>他向团队详细说明了他的计划。<,>The car's details are impressive.<,>这辆车的细节令人印象深刻。<,>de(加强)+tail(切)→切分得很细→细节<,>retail(n.零售/v.零售)/entail(v.需要/v.使必要)  

subculture<,>/ˈsʌbˌkʌltʃə(r)/<,>/ˈsʌbˌkʌltʃər/<,>n.亚文化<,>Hip-hop is an important subculture.<,>嘻哈是一种重要的亚文化。<,>The study focuses on youth subcultures.<,>这项研究关注青年亚文化。<,>This subculture has its own fashion.<,>这种亚文化有自己的时尚风格。<,>sub(下面)+culture(文化)→主流文化下的文化→亚文化<,>culture(n.文化)/agriculture(n.农业)  

appropriate<,>/əˈprəʊpriət/<,>/əˈproʊpriət/<,>adj.适当的/adj.恰当的/vt.私吞/vt.拨款供专用<,>This dress is appropriate for the occasion.<,>这件连衣裙适合这个场合。<,>He was accused of appropriating funds.<,>他被指控挪用资金。<,>The government appropriated money for education.<,>政府拨款用于教育。<,>ap(加强)+propri(拥有)+ate→占为己有→私吞<,>approximate(adj.近似的/v.接近)/proper(adj.合适的)  

criterion<,>/kraɪˈtɪəriən/<,>/kraɪˈtɪriən/<,>n.标准/n.准则<,>What is your main criterion for choosing a job?<,>你选择工作的主要标准是什么？<,>This criterion applies to all applicants.<,>这个标准适用于所有申请者。<,>They set strict criteria for the competition.<,>他们为比赛制定了严格的标准。<,>crit(判断)+erion→判断的依据→标准<,>critic(n.评论家)/critical(adj.关键的)  

essence<,>/ˈesns/<,>/ˈɛsəns/<,>n.本质/n.实质/n.要素/n.精髓/n.精华<,>The essence of his argument was clear.<,>他论点的本质很清楚。<,>This perfume captures the essence of flowers.<,>这款香水捕捉了花的精华。<,>Time is of the essence in this project.<,>在这个项目中时间至关重要。<,>ess(存在)+ence→存在的根本→本质<,>essential(adj.必要的)/absence(n.缺席)  

pore<,>/pɔː(r)/<,>/pɔːr/<,>vi.仔细阅读/vi.审视/n.毛孔/n.细孔<,>She pored over the documents for hours.<,>她仔细阅读文件好几个小时。<,>Sweat comes out through pores.<,>汗液通过毛孔排出。<,>He pored through the old photographs.<,>他仔细翻看旧照片。<,>por(通过)+e→通过小孔→毛孔<,>pour(v.倾倒)/poor(adj.贫穷的)  

utility<,>/juːˈtɪləti/<,>/juˈtɪləti/<,>n.效用/n.有用<,>This tool has great utility in the kitchen.<,>这个工具在厨房里很有用。<,>The utility of this method is questionable.<,>这种方法的有用性值得怀疑。<,>They discussed the utility of the new system.<,>他们讨论了新系统的效用。<,>util(使用)+ity→使用的性质→效用<,>utilize(v.利用)/futility(n.无用)  

manual<,>/ˈmænjuəl/<,>/ˈmænjuəl/<,>adj.用手的/adj.手工做的/n.手册/n.指南<,>He prefers manual labor to office work.<,>比起办公室工作，他更喜欢体力劳动。<,>Read the manual before using the machine.<,>使用机器前请阅读手册。<,>She gave me a manual of instructions.<,>她给了我一本操作指南。<,>manu(手)+al→与手有关的→手工的<,>manufacture(v.制造)/manuscript(n.手稿)
maneuver<,>/məˈnuːvə(r)/<,>/məˈnuːvər/<,>vi.设法变动位置/vi.用策略/vt.操纵/n.谨慎而熟练的动作/n.策略/n.演习<,>The pilot had to maneuver the plane through the storm.<,>飞行员必须设法操纵飞机穿过风暴。<,>She maneuvered her way into the crowded room.<,>她巧妙地挤进了拥挤的房间。<,>The army conducted a large-scale maneuver.<,>军队进行了大规模演习。<,>man(手)+euver(工作)→用手工作→操纵<,>manure(n.肥料)/manual(adj.手工的/n.手册)  

symphony<,>/ˈsɪmfəni/<,>/ˈsɪmfəni/<,>n.交响乐/n.和谐<,>The orchestra played a beautiful symphony.<,>管弦乐队演奏了一首美妙的交响曲。<,>Their teamwork was like a perfect symphony.<,>他们的团队合作就像完美的和谐。<,>Beethoven's Ninth Symphony is famous worldwide.<,>贝多芬的第九交响曲世界闻名。<,>sym(共同)+phon(声音)+y→共同的声音→交响乐<,>symptom(n.症状)/sympathy(n.同情)  

eloquent<,>/ˈeləkwənt/<,>/ˈeləkwənt/<,>adj.雄辩的/adj.明白显示出的<,>His eloquent speech moved the audience.<,>他雄辩的演讲打动了听众。<,>The ruins are eloquent of past glory.<,>这些废墟清楚地显示过去的辉煌。<,>She gave an eloquent description of her journey.<,>她对旅程做了生动的描述。<,>e(出)+loqu(说)+ent→能说出来的→雄辩的<,>colloquial(adj.口语的)/soliloquy(n.独白)  

optimistic<,>/ˌɒptɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>/ˌɑːptɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>adj.乐观的<,>She remains optimistic about her future.<,>她对未来保持乐观。<,>His optimistic attitude inspired everyone.<,>他乐观的态度激励了每个人。<,>Despite the difficulties, they were optimistic.<,>尽管有困难，他们依然乐观。<,>optim(最好)+istic→认为最好的→乐观的<,>pessimistic(adj.悲观的)/optimal(adj.最佳的)  

dual<,>/ˈdjuːəl/<,>/ˈduːəl/<,>adj.双的/adj.两重的<,>The car has dual exhaust pipes.<,>这辆车有双排气管。<,>She has dual citizenship.<,>她有双重国籍。<,>The device serves a dual purpose.<,>这个设备有双重用途。<,>du(二)+al→双的<,>duel(n.决斗)/duet(n.二重奏)  

submarine<,>/ˌsʌbməˈriːn/<,>/ˈsʌbməriːn/<,>adj.水底的/n.潜水艇<,>Submarine cables connect continents.<,>海底电缆连接各大洲。<,>The navy deployed a submarine for the mission.<,>海军为任务部署了一艘潜水艇。<,>Submarine volcanoes are fascinating.<,>海底火山很迷人。<,>sub(下)+marine(海洋)→海下面的→潜水艇<,>submerge(v.淹没)/subterranean(adj.地下的)  

aspect<,>/ˈæspekt/<,>/ˈæspekt/<,>n.方面/n.朝向/n.样子<,>We must consider every aspect of the problem.<,>我们必须考虑问题的每个方面。<,>The house has a southern aspect.<,>这房子朝南。<,>Her stern aspect frightened the children.<,>她严厉的样子吓到了孩子们。<,>a(向)+spect(看)→看的方向→朝向<,>respect(n.尊重)/inspect(v.检查)  

aggressive<,>/əˈɡresɪv/<,>/əˈɡresɪv/<,>adj.侵略的/adj.有进取心的<,>Aggressive nations threaten world peace.<,>侵略性国家威胁世界和平。<,>He's an aggressive salesman.<,>他是个有进取心的销售员。<,>The dog became aggressive when provoked.<,>狗被激怒时变得具有攻击性。<,>ag(向)+gress(走)+ive→走向别人→侵略的<,>progress(n.进步)/digress(v.离题)  

stump<,>/stʌmp/<,>/stʌmp/<,>vi.脚步沉重地走/n.树桩/vt.使为难<,>He stumped up the stairs angrily.<,>他生气地脚步沉重走上楼梯。<,>The old tree was cut down, leaving only a stump.<,>老树被砍倒，只留下树桩。<,>The math problem stumped the students.<,>这道数学题难住了学生。<,>stum(笨重)+p→笨重地走→脚步沉重<,>stumble(v.绊倒)/stamp(n.邮票)  

behavior<,>/bɪˈheɪvjə(r)/<,>/bɪˈheɪvjər/<,>n.行为/n.举止<,>His behavior at the party was inappropriate.<,>他在派对上的行为不得体。<,>Animal behavior is fascinating to study.<,>研究动物行为很有趣。<,>Good behavior is rewarded in this school.<,>这所学校奖励良好行为。<,>be(使)+have(有)+ior→使有→行为<,>misbehavior(n.不当行为)/havoc(n.大破坏)
federation<,>/ˌfedəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌfedəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.联合会/n.联邦<,>The European Federation is an important political entity.<,>欧洲联邦是一个重要的政治实体。<,>He joined the local business federation.<,>他加入了当地的商业联合会。<,>The federation of states was formed to promote economic cooperation.<,>这个联邦的成立是为了促进经济合作。<,>fed(信任)+er(人)+ation(名词后缀)→信任的联合→联邦<,>confederation(n.同盟)/federate(v.联合)/federal(adj.联邦的)

minimize<,>/ˈmɪnɪmaɪz/<,>/ˈmɪnəˌmaɪz/<,>vt.使减少到最低限度/vt.极力贬低/vt.对…作最低估计<,>We must minimize the risk of failure.<,>我们必须将失败的风险降到最低。<,>He always tries to minimize my achievements.<,>他总是试图贬低我的成就。<,>The company aims to minimize costs this year.<,>公司今年的目标是尽量减少成本。<,>mini(小)+mize(动词后缀)→使变小→最小化<,>maximize(vt.最大化)/minimal(adj.最小的)/minimum(n.最小值)

descend<,>/dɪˈsend/<,>/dɪˈsend/<,>vi.下来/vi.下降/vt.走下/vt.爬下<,>The plane began to descend for landing.<,>飞机开始下降准备着陆。<,>She descended the stairs slowly.<,>她慢慢地走下楼梯。<,>Darkness descended upon the town.<,>黑暗笼罩了小镇。<,>de(向下)+scend(爬)→向下爬→下降<,>ascend(vi.上升)/descent(n.下降)/condescend(vi.屈尊)

signify<,>/ˈsɪɡnɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈsɪɡnəˌfaɪ/<,>vi.有重要性/vt.表示…的意思/vt.意味/vt.预示<,>What does this symbol signify?<,>这个符号表示什么意思？<,>His silence signifies agreement.<,>他的沉默意味着同意。<,>This decision signifies a major change.<,>这个决定预示着一个重大变化。<,>sign(标记)+ify(动词后缀)→用标记表示→象征<,>signature(n.签名)/significant(adj.重要的)/signification(n.含义)

logical<,>/ˈlɒdʒɪkl/<,>/ˈlɑːdʒɪkl/<,>adj.逻辑的/adj.合乎常理的<,>His argument was perfectly logical.<,>他的论点完全合乎逻辑。<,>It's logical to save money for emergencies.<,>为紧急情况存钱是合乎常理的。<,>The detective used logical reasoning to solve the case.<,>侦探用逻辑推理解决了这个案子。<,>log(逻辑)+ical(形容词后缀)→逻辑的<,>illogical(adj.不合逻辑的)/analogical(adj.类推的)/logistics(n.后勤)

reconciliation<,>/ˌrekənsɪliˈeɪʃn/<,>/ˌrekənsɪliˈeɪʃn/<,>n.和解/n.调和<,>They finally reached a reconciliation after years of conflict.<,>经过多年的冲突，他们终于达成了和解。<,>The reconciliation of their differences took time.<,>调和他们的分歧需要时间。<,>The priest helped with their reconciliation.<,>牧师帮助他们和解。<,>re(重新)+con(共同)+cili(召集)+ation(名词后缀)→重新召集到一起→和解<,>conciliation(n.调解)/reconcile(vt.使和解)/irreconcilable(adj.不可调和的)

weird<,>/wɪəd/<,>/wɪrd/<,>adj.古怪的/adj.离奇的/adj.怪诞的/adj.神秘而可怕的<,>She has a weird sense of humor.<,>她有古怪的幽默感。<,>I had a weird dream last night.<,>昨晚我做了一个离奇的梦。<,>The old house had a weird atmosphere.<,>那栋老房子有一种神秘而可怕的氛围。<,>weir(鱼梁)+d→像鱼梁一样不规则的→古怪的<,>strange(adj.奇怪的)/eerie(adj.怪异的)/bizarre(adj.奇异的)

characterize<,>/ˈkærəktəraɪz/<,>/ˈkærəktəˌraɪz/<,>vt.成为…的特征/vt.以…为特征/vt.描绘的特性/vt.描述<,>Kindness characterizes her personality.<,>善良是她性格的特征。<,>The author characterizes the hero as brave.<,>作者将主人公描绘为勇敢的人。<,>This period was characterized by rapid change.<,>这个时期的特点是快速变化。<,>character(特征)+ize(动词后缀)→使具有特征→描述特征<,>characterization(n.描述)/characteristic(n.特征)/character(n.性格)

descent<,>/dɪˈsent/<,>/dɪˈsent/<,>n.下降/n.下倾/n.斜坡/n.坡道/n.血统/n.世系<,>The plane made a rapid descent.<,>飞机快速下降。<,>He is of French descent.<,>他有法国血统。<,>The path has a steep descent.<,>这条路有一个陡峭的下坡。<,>de(向下)+scent(爬)→向下爬→下降<,>ascent(n.上升)/descendant(n.后代)/condescension(n.屈尊)

ridiculous<,>/rɪˈdɪkjələs/<,>/rɪˈdɪkjələs/<,>adj.荒谬的/adj.可笑的<,>That's a ridiculous idea!<,>那是个荒谬的想法！<,>He looked ridiculous in that hat.<,>他戴那顶帽子看起来很可笑。<,>The prices they charge are ridiculous.<,>他们收取的价格很荒谬。<,>rid(笑)+icul(小)+ous(形容词后缀)→可笑的<,>ridicule(n.嘲笑)/ludicrous(adj.荒唐的)/absurd(adj.荒谬的)
turbulent<,>/ˈtɜːbjələnt/<,>/ˈtɜːrbjələnt/<,>adj.动荡的/adj.混乱的/adj.汹涌的/adj.狂暴的<,>The country went through a turbulent period of political unrest.<,>这个国家经历了一段政治动荡的时期。<,>The turbulent waves made sailing dangerous.<,>汹涌的波涛使航行变得危险。<,>His turbulent emotions were hard to control.<,>他狂暴的情绪难以控制。<,>turb(搅动)+ulent(多…的)→搅动多的→动荡的<,>turbine(n.涡轮机)/disturb(vt.打扰)/perturb(vt.使不安)

overt<,>/ˈəʊvɜːt/<,>/oʊˈvɜːrt/<,>adj.公开的/adj.不隐蔽的<,>His overt dislike for the plan was obvious to everyone.<,>他对这个计划的公开厌恶是显而易见的。<,>The government took overt action to suppress the protest.<,>政府采取了公开行动镇压抗议。<,>She made an overt attempt to win his favor.<,>她公开试图赢得他的好感。<,>over(在...上)+t(明显)→在表面上的→公开的<,>covert(adj.隐蔽的)/avert(vt.避免)/overture(n.序曲)

refute<,>/rɪˈfjuːt/<,>/rɪˈfjuːt/<,>vt.驳斥/vt.驳倒<,>The scientist refuted the theory with solid evidence.<,>这位科学家用确凿的证据驳斥了这个理论。<,>It's hard to refute such a well-constructed argument.<,>很难驳倒这样一个精心构建的论点。<,>He refuted all the accusations against him.<,>他驳斥了所有对他的指控。<,>re(反)+fute(打)→反过来打→驳斥<,>refuse(v.拒绝)/confute(vt.驳倒)/rebut(vt.反驳)

precedent<,>/ˈpresɪdənt/<,>/ˈpresɪdənt/<,>n.先例/n.范例/n.【法】判例/n.惯例<,>This ruling set a dangerous precedent for future cases.<,>这项裁决为未来的案件设定了一个危险的先例。<,>There is no precedent for such a situation in our company's history.<,>我们公司历史上没有这种情况的先例。<,>The judge referred to a legal precedent in making his decision.<,>法官在做出决定时参考了一个法律判例。<,>pre(前)+ced(走)+ent→先前走过的→先例<,>president(n.总统)/precede(v.领先)/precedence(n.优先)

severe<,>/sɪˈvɪə(r)/<,>/sɪˈvɪr/<,>adj.严重的/adj.严厉的/adj.严格的/adj.严峻的/adj.艰难的/adj.朴素的/adj.不加装饰的<,>The patient is in severe pain and needs immediate treatment.<,>病人疼痛严重，需要立即治疗。<,>The teacher was severe but fair with all students.<,>这位老师对所有学生都很严厉但公平。<,>The room had a severe appearance with no decorations.<,>这个房间没有装饰，显得很朴素。<,>sever(切断)+e→切断情面的→严厉的<,>persevere(v.坚持)/sever(vt.切断)/several(adj.几个的)

emerge<,>/iˈmɜːdʒ/<,>/iˈmɜːrdʒ/<,>vi.出现/vi.涌现/vi.冒出<,>The sun emerged from behind the clouds.<,>太阳从云层后面出现了。<,>New evidence has emerged in the investigation.<,>调查中出现了新的证据。<,>She emerged as the leader of the group.<,>她成为这个小组的领导者。<,>e(出)+merge(沉没)→从沉没中出来→出现<,>submerge(v.淹没)/immerge(v.浸入)/emergency(n.紧急情况)

exemplify<,>/ɪɡˈzemplɪfaɪ/<,>/ɪɡˈzemplɪfaɪ/<,>vt.是...的典型/vt.例示/vt.举例证明<,>This painting exemplifies the artist's early style.<,>这幅画是艺术家早期风格的典型代表。<,>Let me exemplify my point with a simple example.<,>让我用一个简单的例子来说明我的观点。<,>His actions exemplify the spirit of selflessness.<,>他的行为是无私精神的典范。<,>ex(出)+empl(拿)+ify(使)→拿出例子→举例证明<,>example(n.例子)/exempt(vt.免除)/exemplar(n.模范)

lease<,>/liːs/<,>/liːs/<,>n.租约/n.租契/vt.出租/vt.租得/vt.租有<,>We signed a two-year lease for the apartment.<,>我们签了一份为期两年的公寓租约。<,>The company leases office space in the city center.<,>该公司在市中心租用办公场所。<,>He leased the car instead of buying it.<,>他租了这辆车而不是购买它。<,>leas(放松)+e→放松使用权→租约<,>release(vt.释放)/please(vt.使高兴)/least(adj.最少的)

exploit<,>/ɪkˈsplɔɪt/<,>/ɪkˈsplɔɪt/<,>vt.剥削/vt.利用/vt.开拓/n.业绩/n.功绩<,>The company was accused of exploiting its workers.<,>该公司被指控剥削工人。<,>We need to exploit this opportunity to expand our business.<,>我们需要利用这个机会扩大我们的业务。<,>His exploits in the war made him a national hero.<,>他在战争中的功绩使他成为民族英雄。<,>ex(出)+ploit(折叠)→把折叠的东西展开→开拓<,>explore(v.探索)/explosion(n.爆炸)/exploit(n.业绩)
