slap<,>/slæp/<,>/slæp/<,>vt.掴/vt.掌击/vt.拍/adv.啪的一声放/n.掴/n.掌击/n.拍<,>She slapped him across the face for his rude remark.<,>因为他粗鲁的言论，她打了他一耳光。<,>He slapped the book down on the table angrily.<,>他生气地把书啪的一声放在桌子上。<,>The sound of a slap echoed through the room.<,>一记耳光的声音在房间里回荡。<,>s(象声)+lap(大腿)→拍大腿的声音→掌击<,>slip(v.滑倒)/slope(n.斜坡)/slap(vt.掌击)
anniversary<,>/ˌænɪˈvɜːsəri/<,>/ˌænɪˈvɜːrsəri/<,>n.周年纪念日<,>They celebrated their 10th wedding anniversary.<,>他们庆祝了结婚十周年纪念日。<,>The company marked its 50th anniversary with a big party.<,>公司举办盛大派对庆祝成立50周年。<,>Our school anniversary is coming next month.<,>我们学校的周年庆下个月就要到了。<,>anni(年)+vers(转)+ary→一年转一次→周年纪念<,>annual(adj.每年的)/versatile(adj.多才多艺的)

register<,>/ˈredʒɪstə(r)/<,>/ˈredʒɪstər/<,>v.登记/注册/指示/自动记下/表示/表达/注意到/记住/把挂号 n.登记/注册/登记表/注册簿<,>Please register your details at the reception.<,>请在接待处登记您的详细信息。<,>The thermometer registered 30 degrees.<,>温度计显示30度。<,>She registered her surprise at the news.<,>她对这消息表示惊讶。<,>re(再)+gist(带来)+er→再次带来→登记<,>registry(n.登记处)/gesture(n.手势)

communicate<,>/kəˈmjuːnɪkeɪt/<,>/kəˈmjuːnɪkeɪt/<,>v.通讯/交际/交流/连接/相通/传达/传播/传染<,>We communicate by email every day.<,>我们每天都通过电子邮件交流。<,>The rooms communicate through a hallway.<,>这些房间通过走廊相连。<,>Doctors must communicate bad news carefully.<,>医生必须谨慎传达坏消息。<,>com(共同)+muni(服务)+cate→共同服务→交流<,>community(n.社区)/commute(v.通勤)

evidence<,>/ˈevɪdəns/<,>/ˈevɪdəns/<,>n.根据/证据/证人<,>There is no evidence to support his claim.<,>没有证据支持他的说法。<,>The fingerprints were important evidence.<,>指纹是重要的证据。<,>She was called as an evidence in court.<,>她被传唤出庭作证。<,>e(出)+vid(看)+ence→看得见的东西→证据<,>evident(adj.明显的)/video(n.视频)

jerk<,>/dʒɜːk/<,>/dʒɜːrk/<,>v.猝然一动/猛拉 n.急推/急拉/急扭<,>He jerked the door open.<,>他猛地拉开门。<,>The bus stopped with a jerk.<,>公共汽车突然颠了一下停住了。<,>Don't jerk the fishing line like that.<,>不要那样猛拉鱼线。<,>谐音"杰克"→杰克突然猛拉<,>junk(n.垃圾)/jolly(adj.愉快的)

fling<,>/flɪŋ/<,>/flɪŋ/<,>vt.扔/掷/使扑/使投身 n.尽情欢乐的一阵/一时的放纵<,>She flung her bag on the sofa.<,>她把包扔在沙发上。<,>They had a brief fling last summer.<,>去年夏天他们有过短暂的风流韵事。<,>He flung himself into his work.<,>他全身心投入工作。<,>fl(飞)+ing→飞出去→扔<,>cling(v.紧贴)/sling(n.吊带)

stun<,>/stʌn/<,>/stʌn/<,>vt.使震惊/使目瞪口呆/把...打昏/使昏迷<,>The news stunned everyone.<,>这个消息震惊了所有人。<,>The blow stunned him for a moment.<,>这一击让他昏迷了一会儿。<,>Her beauty stunned the audience.<,>她的美貌让观众目瞪口呆。<,>谐音"死党"→死党的话让人震惊<,>stunt(n.特技)/sun(n.太阳)

acid<,>/ˈæsɪd/<,>/ˈæsɪd/<,>adj.酸的/酸性的/尖刻的/刻薄的 n.酸<,>Lemons have an acid taste.<,>柠檬有酸味。<,>His acid remarks hurt her feelings.<,>他尖刻的评论伤害了她的感情。<,>The soil is too acid for these plants.<,>这种土壤对这些植物来说太酸了。<,>ac(尖)+id→尖酸的<,>arid(adj.干旱的)/avid(adj.渴望的)

autonomy<,>/ɔːˈtɒnəmi/<,>/ɔːˈtɑːnəmi/<,>n.自治/自治权/人身自由/自主权<,>The region has considerable autonomy.<,>该地区拥有相当大的自治权。<,>Teenagers need some autonomy.<,>青少年需要一定的自主权。<,>The university has academic autonomy.<,>这所大学有学术自主权。<,>auto(自己)+nomy(管理)→自我管理→自治<,>automatic(adj.自动的)/economy(n.经济)

transmission<,>/trænzˈmɪʃn/<,>/trænzˈmɪʃn/<,>n.传播/发射/传送/传递/传染<,>The transmission of data was interrupted.<,>数据传输中断了。<,>This car has automatic transmission.<,>这辆车是自动变速的。<,>Mosquitoes are responsible for the transmission of malaria.<,>蚊子传播疟疾。<,>trans(跨越)+miss(发送)+ion→发送过去→传播<,>transaction(n.交易)/mission(n.任务)
blush<,>/blʌʃ/<,>/blʌʃ/<,>n.脸红/vi.脸红<,>She couldn't help but blush when he complimented her.<,>当他称赞她时，她忍不住脸红了。<,>A faint blush appeared on his cheeks when he realized his mistake.<,>当他意识到自己的错误时，脸颊上出现了一丝红晕。<,>The bride had a lovely blush on her face during the ceremony.<,>新娘在仪式上脸上带着可爱的红晕。<,>blush与flush都有"脸红"的意思，但blush多因害羞而脸红，flush则多因兴奋或愤怒而脸红<,>brush(n.刷子/v.刷)/flush(v.脸红/n.冲洗)

dubious<,>/ˈdjuːbiəs/<,>/ˈduːbiəs/<,>adj.怀疑的/adj.犹豫不决的/adj.无把握的/adj.有问题的/adj.靠不住的<,>I'm dubious about the truth of his statement.<,>我对他说的话的真实性表示怀疑。<,>She gave a dubious look when hearing the outrageous claim.<,>听到这个离谱的说法时，她露出了怀疑的表情。<,>The company's dubious accounting practices raised red flags.<,>这家公司可疑的会计做法引起了警惕。<,>dub(怀疑)+ious(形容词后缀)→怀疑的<,>dubitable(adj.可疑的)/indubitable(adj.不容置疑的)

intuition<,>/ˌɪntjuˈɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪntuˈɪʃn/<,>n.直觉/n.由直觉获知的信息<,>Her intuition told her something was wrong.<,>她的直觉告诉她有些不对劲。<,>He made the decision based on pure intuition rather than facts.<,>他完全凭直觉而非事实做出了这个决定。<,>Mothers often have strong intuition about their children's needs.<,>母亲们通常对孩子的需求有很强的直觉。<,>in(内)+tuit(看)+ion→内心的看法→直觉<,>tuition(n.学费/n.教学)/instinct(n.本能)

artillery<,>/ɑːˈtɪləri/<,>/ɑːrˈtɪləri/<,>n.火炮/n.大炮/n.炮兵<,>The artillery fire could be heard miles away.<,>炮火声几英里外都能听到。<,>He served in the artillery during the war.<,>战争期间他在炮兵部队服役。<,>The ancient castle's walls were damaged by enemy artillery.<,>古城堡的城墙被敌人的大炮破坏了。<,>art(艺术)+ill(病)+ery→战争"艺术"带来的"病"痛→火炮<,>armory(n.军械库)/arsenal(n.兵工厂)

educational<,>/ˌedʒuˈkeɪʃənl/<,>/ˌedʒuˈkeɪʃənl/<,>adj.教育的/adj.教育性的<,>The museum offers many educational programs for children.<,>博物馆为儿童提供了许多教育项目。<,>This documentary has great educational value.<,>这部纪录片具有很高的教育价值。<,>Educational reforms are needed to improve the school system.<,>需要教育改革来完善学校体系。<,>educate(教育)+tion(名词后缀)+al(形容词后缀)→教育的<,>education(n.教育)/educator(n.教育家)

pose<,>/pəʊz/<,>/poʊz/<,>v.造成/v.引起/v.提出/v.陈述/v.摆姿势/v.假装/v.冒充/v.装腔作势/n.样子/n.姿势<,>She posed for a photograph by the fountain.<,>她在喷泉边摆姿势拍照。<,>The new regulations pose a challenge for small businesses.<,>新规定给小企业带来了挑战。<,>He posed as a doctor to gain people's trust.<,>他冒充医生以获取人们的信任。<,>pos(放置)+e→摆出某种姿势→摆姿势<,>position(n.位置)/compose(v.组成)/oppose(v.反对)

finite<,>/ˈfaɪnaɪt/<,>/ˈfaɪnaɪt/<,>adj.有限的/adj.有限制的/adj.限定的<,>Earth's natural resources are finite.<,>地球的自然资源是有限的。<,>We only have a finite amount of time to complete the project.<,>我们完成这个项目的时间是有限的。<,>The universe may not be finite in extent.<,>宇宙在范围上可能不是有限的。<,>fin(界限)+ite→有界限的→有限的<,>infinite(adj.无限的)/definite(adj.明确的)

amend<,>/əˈmend/<,>/əˈmend/<,>vt.修改/vt.修订/vt.改进/n.赔罪/n.赔偿<,>The constitution was amended to include new rights.<,>宪法经过修改加入了新的权利。<,>He tried to amend his mistakes by working extra hours.<,>他试图通过加班来弥补自己的错误。<,>The company amended its policy after customer complaints.<,>公司在客户投诉后修改了政策。<,>a(加强)+mend(修补)→修改，修正<,>mend(v.修理)/emend(v.校订)

erupt<,>/ɪˈrʌpt/<,>/ɪˈrʌpt/<,>vi.喷发/vi.喷出/vi.爆发/vi.突然发生<,>The volcano erupted without warning.<,>火山毫无预警地喷发了。<,>Violence erupted during the protest.<,>抗议活动中爆发了暴力事件。<,>She erupted into laughter at the funny joke.<,>听到这个有趣的笑话，她突然大笑起来。<,>e(出)+rupt(破裂)→破裂而出→喷发<,>rupture(n.破裂)/interrupt(v.打断)

exquisite<,>/ɪkˈskwɪzɪt/<,>/ˈɛkskwɪzɪt/<,>adj.精美的/adj.精致的/adj.敏锐的/adj.有高度鉴赏力的/adj.剧烈的/adj.感觉强烈的<,>She wore an exquisite diamond necklace.<,>她戴着一条精美的钻石项链。<,>The chef prepared an exquisite five-course meal.<,>厨师准备了一顿精致的五道菜大餐。<,>He has an exquisite sense of taste in wine.<,>他对葡萄酒有着敏锐的鉴赏力。<,>ex(出)+quis(寻求)+ite→精心寻求出来的→精致的<,>requisite(adj.必需的)/quisitive(adj.好奇的)
collide<,>/kəˈlaɪd/<,>/kəˈlaɪd/<,>vi.碰撞/vi.互撞/vi.冲突/vi.抵触<,>The two cars collided at the intersection.<,>两辆车在十字路口相撞。<,>Their opinions collided during the meeting.<,>他们在会议上意见相冲突。<,>The cyclist collided with a pedestrian.<,>骑自行车的人与行人相撞。<,>col(共同)+lide(滑)→一起滑→碰撞<,>collision(n.碰撞)/coincide(vi.一致)/slide(v.滑动)

remedy<,>/ˈremədi/<,>/ˈrɛmədi/<,>n.补救办法/n.纠正办法/n.药品/n.治疗法/vt.补救/vt.纠正/vt.医治/vt.治疗<,>There is no simple remedy for this problem.<,>这个问题没有简单的解决办法。<,>This herb is a traditional remedy for colds.<,>这种草药是治疗感冒的传统药物。<,>The company is trying to remedy the situation.<,>公司正在努力补救这种情况。<,>re(再)+med(治疗)+y→再次治疗→补救<,>medicine(n.药物)/remedial(adj.治疗的)/reimburse(vt.偿还)

cardinal<,>/ˈkɑːdɪnəl/<,>/ˈkɑrdənəl/<,>adj.最重要的/adj.基本的/n.红衣主教/n.基数<,>This is a cardinal rule in our company.<,>这是我们公司的一条基本规则。<,>The cardinal directions are north, south, east, and west.<,>基本方向是东、南、西、北。<,>He was appointed as a cardinal last year.<,>他去年被任命为红衣主教。<,>card(心)+inal→心一样的→最重要的<,>carnal(adj.肉体的)/cord(n.绳索)/coronal(adj.冠状的)

consent<,>/kənˈsent/<,>/kənˈsɛnt/<,>n.同意/n.赞成/vi.同意/vi.赞成<,>She gave her consent to the proposal.<,>她同意了这个提议。<,>They consented to our plan.<,>他们同意了我们的计划。<,>Silence does not imply consent.<,>沉默不等于同意。<,>con(共同)+sent(感觉)→共同感觉→同意<,>content(n.内容)/dissent(vi.不同意)/resent(vt.怨恨)

insist<,>/ɪnˈsɪst/<,>/ɪnˈsɪst/<,>v.坚持/v.坚持要求/v.坚决认为<,>I insist that you should apologize.<,>我坚持你应该道歉。<,>He insisted on paying the bill.<,>他坚持要付账。<,>She insists that she is innocent.<,>她坚称自己是无辜的。<,>in(加强)+sist(站立)→一直站着→坚持<,>persist(vi.坚持)/resist(vt.抵抗)/assist(vt.帮助)

fusion<,>/ˈfjuːʒn/<,>/ˈfjuʒən/<,>n.联合/n.合并/n.核聚变<,>The fusion of different cultures creates something new.<,>不同文化的融合创造出新事物。<,>Nuclear fusion produces enormous energy.<,>核聚变产生巨大能量。<,>The restaurant offers a fusion of Eastern and Western cuisine.<,>这家餐厅提供东西方融合的菜肴。<,>fus(流)+ion→流到一起→融合<,>confusion(n.混乱)/diffusion(n.扩散)/infusion(n.灌输)

volume<,>/ˈvɒljuːm/<,>/ˈvɑljəm/<,>n.卷/n.册/n.书卷/n.容积/n.体积/n.音量<,>Please turn down the volume of the TV.<,>请把电视音量调低。<,>The encyclopedia consists of 20 volumes.<,>这套百科全书共有20卷。<,>This box has a volume of one cubic meter.<,>这个箱子的体积是一立方米。<,>volu(卷)+me→卷起来的东西→卷<,>voluble(adj.健谈的)/voluminous(adj.庞大的)/volunteer(n.志愿者)

mutual<,>/ˈmjuːtʃuəl/<,>/ˈmjutʃuəl/<,>adj.相互的/adj.共同的<,>We have mutual respect for each other.<,>我们相互尊重。<,>They found mutual interests in music.<,>他们在音乐方面找到了共同兴趣。<,>The agreement benefits both parties mutually.<,>这个协议对双方都有利。<,>mut(改变)+ual→相互改变→相互的<,>mutable(adj.易变的)/commute(v.通勤)/immutable(adj.不变的)

therefore<,>/ˈðeəfɔː(r)/<,>/ˈðɛrˌfɔr/<,>adv.因此/adv.所以<,>He was ill and therefore absent.<,>他生病了，所以缺席。<,>It rained heavily; therefore the game was canceled.<,>雨下得很大，因此比赛取消了。<,>She studied hard and therefore passed the exam.<,>她努力学习，因此通过了考试。<,>there(那里)+fore(之前)→在那之前→因此<,>thereby(adv.从而)/thereof(adv.其)/wherefore(adv.为何)

exchange<,>/ɪksˈtʃeɪndʒ/<,>/ɪksˈtʃendʒ/<,>n.交换/n.交流/n.兑换/vt.交换/vt.交流/vt.兑换<,>We exchanged phone numbers.<,>我们交换了电话号码。<,>Where can I exchange my dollars for euros?<,>我在哪里可以把美元兑换成欧元？<,>Cultural exchange promotes understanding.<,>文化交流促进理解。<,>ex(出)+change(换)→换出→交换<,>interchange(vt.交换)/exchangeable(adj.可交换的)/changeling(n.被调换的孩子)
indignant<,>/ɪnˈdɪɡnənt/<,>/ɪnˈdɪɡnənt/<,>adj.愤怒的/adj.愤慨的/adj.义愤的<,>She was indignant at the unfair treatment.<,>她对不公平的待遇感到愤怒。<,>His indignant reply silenced the critics.<,>他愤怒的回答让批评者哑口无言。<,>The crowd grew indignant as the speaker ignored their questions.<,>当演讲者无视他们的问题时，人群变得愤怒起来。<,>in(不)+dign(尊严)+ant→因尊严受损而愤怒<,>indigenous(adj.本土的)/indignity(n.侮辱)  

hesitate<,>/ˈhezɪteɪt/<,>/ˈhezɪteɪt/<,>vi.犹豫/vi.踌躇/vi.含糊/vi.不情愿<,>Don't hesitate to ask if you need help.<,>如果需要帮助，请不要犹豫。<,>She hesitated before answering the difficult question.<,>她在回答这个难题前犹豫了一下。<,>He hesitated to accept the offer because of the risks involved.<,>由于涉及风险，他不情愿接受这个提议。<,>hes(粘附)+it+ate→粘着不动→犹豫<,>hesitation(n.犹豫)/hasten(v.加速)  

decimal<,>/ˈdesɪml/<,>/ˈdesɪml/<,>adj.十进位的/n.小数<,>The metric system is based on decimal units.<,>公制以十进制单位为基础。<,>Convert the fraction to a decimal for easier calculation.<,>将分数转换为小数以便于计算。<,>The decimal point separates the whole number from the fractional part.<,>小数点将整数部分和小数部分分开。<,>decim(十)+al→与十有关的<,>decimate(v.大批杀死)/decibel(n.分贝)  

cynical<,>/ˈsɪnɪkl/<,>/ˈsɪnɪkl/<,>adj.愤世嫉俗的/adj.怀疑的<,>He has a cynical view of human nature.<,>他对人性持愤世嫉俗的看法。<,>Her cynical smile showed she didn't believe the promises.<,>她怀疑的微笑表明她不相信这些承诺。<,>The journalist's cynical articles often criticize social norms.<,>这位记者愤世嫉俗的文章经常批评社会规范。<,>cyn(狗)+ical→像狗一样吠叫→愤世嫉俗的<,>skeptical(adj.怀疑的)/sarcastic(adj.讽刺的)  

ventilate<,>/ˈventɪleɪt/<,>/ˈventɪleɪt/<,>vt.使通风/vt.把…公开/vt.公开讨论<,>Open the windows to ventilate the room.<,>打开窗户让房间通风。<,>The committee decided to ventilate the issue at the next meeting.<,>委员会决定在下次会议上公开讨论这个问题。<,>Properly ventilated areas reduce the risk of infection.<,>通风良好的区域降低了感染风险。<,>vent(风)+ilate→让风进来→通风<,>vent(n.通风口)/invent(v.发明)  

scoop<,>/skuːp/<,>/skuːp/<,>v.舀出/v.抢在之前报道新闻/n.勺子/n.抢先报道的新闻<,>She used a scoop to serve the ice cream.<,>她用勺子舀冰淇淋。<,>The newspaper scooped the story about the celebrity's divorce.<,>这家报纸抢先报道了这位名人离婚的消息。<,>This scoop of dirt needs to be removed from the garden.<,>这勺土需要从花园里清除掉。<,>scoop(铲子)→形状像铲子<,>scoot(v.迅速移动)/scope(n.范围)  

companion<,>/kəmˈpæniən/<,>/kəmˈpæniən/<,>n.同伴/n.共事者/n.伴侣<,>My dog is my faithful companion.<,>我的狗是我忠实的伙伴。<,>She found a companion to travel with in Europe.<,>她找到了一个同伴一起去欧洲旅行。<,>The book is a companion to the popular TV series.<,>这本书是那部热门电视剧的配套读物。<,>com(共同)+pan(面包)+ion→一起分享面包的人→同伴<,>company(n.公司)/compassion(n.同情)  

culminate<,>/ˈkʌlmɪneɪt/<,>/ˈkʌlmɪneɪt/<,>vi.告终<,>The year-long project will culminate in a final presentation.<,>这个为期一年的项目将以最终展示告终。<,>Their argument culminated in a shouting match.<,>他们的争论以大声争吵告终。<,>The festival culminates with a spectacular fireworks display.<,>这个节日以壮观的烟花表演告终。<,>culmin(顶点)+ate→达到顶点→告终<,>cultivate(v.培养)/accumulate(v.积累)  

breakdown<,>/ˈbreɪkdaʊn/<,>/ˈbreɪkdaʊn/<,>n.垮台/n.破裂/n.衰弱/n.故障/n.明细<,>The breakdown of negotiations led to renewed conflict.<,>谈判破裂导致冲突再起。<,>She suffered a nervous breakdown from overwork.<,>她因过度工作而神经衰弱。<,>Please give me a breakdown of the costs involved.<,>请给我一份相关费用的明细。<,>break(打破)+down(向下)→向下打破→垮台<,>breakthrough(n.突破)/breakout(n.爆发)  

directory<,>/dəˈrektəri/<,>/dəˈrektəri/<,>n.人名地址录/n.工商行名录/n.号码簿<,>Look up his phone number in the directory.<,>在电话簿里查他的电话号码。<,>The business directory lists all local companies.<,>工商行名录列出了所有本地公司。<,>She found her old address in the school alumni directory.<,>她在学校校友录中找到了她的旧地址。<,>direct(指导)+ory→指导查找信息的工具<,>directory(adj.指导的)/director(n.导演)
behave<,>/bɪˈheɪv/<,>/bɪˈheɪv/<,>vi.表现/vi.举止/vi.运转/vi.做出反应/vt.检点自己的行为<,>Children should behave well in public.<,>孩子们在公共场合应该表现良好。<,>The machine behaves strangely after the update.<,>更新后这台机器运转异常。<,>He needs to behave himself at the meeting.<,>他需要在会议上检点自己的行为。<,>be(使)+have(有)→使有(好的表现)→表现<,>behavior(n.行为)/misbehave(v.行为不端)

accomplish<,>/əˈkʌmplɪʃ/<,>/əˈkɑːmplɪʃ/<,>vt.达到/vt.完成<,>She accomplished her goal of running a marathon.<,>她完成了跑马拉松的目标。<,>The team accomplished the project ahead of schedule.<,>团队提前完成了这个项目。<,>It's important to accomplish small tasks daily.<,>每天完成小任务很重要。<,>ac(强调)+compl(完成)+ish→完成<,>complete(adj.完整的)/comply(v.遵从)/compliment(n.赞美)

strand<,>/strænd/<,>/strænd/<,>n.股/n.缕/n.一个组成部分/vt.使搁浅<,>A strand of hair fell on her shoulder.<,>一缕头发落在她的肩上。<,>The ship was stranded on the reef.<,>船在礁石上搁浅了。<,>DNA is made up of two strands.<,>DNA由两条链组成。<,>s(丝)+trand(看作thread线)→丝线→缕<,>string(n.细绳)/stand(v.站立)/strain(v.拉紧)

constituent<,>/kənˈstɪtʃuənt/<,>/kənˈstɪtʃuənt/<,>adj.组成的/adj.构成的/n.选民/n.选区居民/n.成分/n.组成/n.配料<,>Flour is a constituent of bread.<,>面粉是面包的配料之一。<,>She met with her constituents regularly.<,>她定期与选民会面。<,>The constituent parts of the machine were imported.<,>这台机器的组件是进口的。<,>con(共同)+stitu(站立)+ent→共同站在一起→组成部分<,>constitute(v.组成)/institute(n.学院)/substitute(n.替代品)

engine<,>/ˈendʒɪn/<,>/ˈɛndʒən/<,>n.引擎/n.发动机/n.机车<,>The car's engine needs repair.<,>汽车的引擎需要修理。<,>The train was pulled by a steam engine.<,>火车由蒸汽机车牵引。<,>He works as an engine driver.<,>他的工作是火车司机。<,>en(使)+gin(产生)+e→产生动力的装置→发动机<,>energy(n.能量)/engineer(n.工程师)/ingenious(adj.灵巧的)

irritate<,>/ˈɪrɪteɪt/<,>/ˈɪrɪˌteɪt/<,>vt.使恼怒/vt.使烦躁/vt.使不适/vt.使疼痛<,>Loud noises irritate me.<,>噪音让我烦躁。<,>The soap irritated my skin.<,>肥皂使我的皮肤不适。<,>His constant complaining irritates everyone.<,>他不停的抱怨让所有人都恼怒。<,>ir(进入)+rit(擦)+ate→擦进去→刺激<,>irritation(n.刺激)/irritable(adj.易怒的)/irrigate(v.灌溉)

scope<,>/skəʊp/<,>/skoʊp/<,>n.范围/n.余地/n.机会<,>The project is beyond the scope of our work.<,>这个项目超出了我们的工作范围。<,>There's scope for improvement in your writing.<,>你的写作还有改进的余地。<,>The telescope has a wide scope of view.<,>这台望远镜视野广阔。<,>s(看作see看)+cope(处理)→能看到的处理范围→范围<,>microscope(n.显微镜)/telescope(n.望远镜)/landscape(n.风景)

responsible<,>/rɪˈspɒnsəbl/<,>/rɪˈspɑːnsəbl/<,>adj.需负责任的/adj.承担责任的/adj.有责任感的/adj.负责可靠的/adj.责任重大的/adj.重要的<,>Parents are responsible for their children.<,>父母要对孩子负责。<,>She is a responsible employee.<,>她是个负责任的员工。<,>This is a responsible position in the company.<,>这是公司里一个责任重大的职位。<,>re(回)+spons(承诺)+ible→能承诺的→负责的<,>response(n.回应)/responsive(adj.反应迅速的)/irresponsible(adj.不负责任的)

linen<,>/ˈlɪnɪn/<,>/ˈlɪnən/<,>n.日用织品/n.亚麻织品/n.亚麻布<,>She bought new linen for the bed.<,>她买了新的亚麻床品。<,>The table was covered with white linen.<,>桌子铺着白色亚麻桌布。<,>Linen clothes are cool in summer.<,>亚麻衣服夏天穿很凉快。<,>line(线)+n→用线织成的→亚麻布<,>linear(adj.线性的)/lining(n.衬里)/linseed(n.亚麻籽)

expectancy<,>/ɪkˈspektənsi/<,>/ɪkˈspektənsi/<,>n.预料/n.期待/n.盼望<,>Life expectancy has increased in recent years.<,>近年来预期寿命提高了。<,>There was an air of expectancy before the announcement.<,>宣布前有一种期待的气氛。<,>The children waited with great expectancy.<,>孩子们满怀期待地等待着。<,>expect(期待)+ancy(状态)→期待的状态<,>expectation(n.期望)/unexpected(adj.意外的)/expectant(adj.期待的)
illuminate<,>/ɪˈluːmɪneɪt/<,>/ɪˈluməˌneɪt/<,>vt.照明/vt.照亮/vt.阐明/vt.启发<,>The streetlights illuminate the road at night.<,>夜晚路灯照亮了道路。<,>His explanation helped to illuminate the complex issue.<,>他的解释有助于阐明这个复杂的问题。<,>The teacher's guidance illuminated the students' minds.<,>老师的指导启发了学生们的思维。<,>il(进入)+lumin(光)+ate(使)→使进入光→照亮<,>illustrate(vt.说明/vt.图解)/luminous(adj.发光的/adj.明亮的)

liner<,>/ˈlaɪnə(r)/<,>/ˈlaɪnər/<,>n.衬里/n.大客轮<,>She sewed a silk liner into the jacket.<,>她在夹克里缝了一条丝绸衬里。<,>The luxury liner will depart at noon.<,>这艘豪华客轮将在中午启航。<,>The ocean liner can carry over 3,000 passengers.<,>这艘远洋客轮可载3000多名乘客。<,>line(线)+er(物)→沿着线航行的大船<,>linear(adj.线的/adj.直线的)/liner notes(唱片内页说明)

identify<,>/aɪˈdentɪfaɪ/<,>/aɪˈdɛntəˌfaɪ/<,>vt.认出/vt.鉴定/vt.把...等同于<,>Can you identify the man in this photo?<,>你能认出照片中的这个人吗？<,>The expert will identify the antique's age.<,>专家将鉴定这件古董的年代。<,>She identifies happiness with success.<,>她把幸福等同于成功。<,>ident(相同)+ify(使)→使认出相同点<,>identity(n.身份/n.同一性)/identical(adj.相同的/adj.同一的)

citizenship<,>/ˈsɪtɪzənʃɪp/<,>/ˈsɪtəzənˌʃɪp/<,>n.公民的身份/n.公民的职责和权力<,>He obtained Canadian citizenship last year.<,>他去年获得了加拿大公民身份。<,>Voting is both a right and a responsibility of citizenship.<,>投票既是公民的权利也是责任。<,>Dual citizenship is allowed in some countries.<,>一些国家允许双重国籍。<,>citizen(公民)+ship(状态)→公民身份<,>residentship(n.居住权)/fellowship(n.伙伴关系/n.奖学金)

label<,>/ˈleɪbl/<,>/ˈleɪbəl/<,>n.标签/n.标记/n.符号/vt.贴标签于/vt.把...称为<,>Please read the label before taking the medicine.<,>服药前请阅读标签。<,>He labeled all the boxes clearly.<,>他给所有箱子都贴上了清晰的标签。<,>They labeled him as a troublemaker.<,>他们称他为麻烦制造者。<,>lab(实验室)+el→实验室用的标记<,>libel(n.诽谤/vt.诽谤)/lapel(n.翻领/n.西服领)

slippery<,>/ˈslɪpəri/<,>/ˈslɪpəri/<,>adj.滑的/adj.狡猾的<,>The floor is slippery when wet.<,>地板湿的时候很滑。<,>Be careful with that slippery salesman.<,>小心那个狡猾的推销员。<,>The politician gave a slippery answer to the question.<,>这位政客对问题给出了圆滑的回答。<,>slip(滑)+pery→容易滑的<,>slither(v.滑动/v.滑行)/slipper(n.拖鞋)

forum<,>/ˈfɔːrəm/<,>/ˈfɔrəm/<,>n.论坛/n.讨论会/n.专题讨论节目<,>The online forum has many active users.<,>这个在线论坛有很多活跃用户。<,>We'll discuss this issue at the next forum.<,>我们将在下次讨论会上讨论这个问题。<,>The TV forum debated environmental policies.<,>电视专题节目就环境政策进行了辩论。<,>for(为了)+um(场所)→为了讨论的场所<,>form(n.形式/v.形成)/quorum(n.法定人数)

contempt<,>/kənˈtempt/<,>/kənˈtɛmpt/<,>n.轻视/n.蔑视<,>She looked at him with utter contempt.<,>她以极其轻蔑的目光看着他。<,>His behavior brought contempt upon himself.<,>他的行为招致了别人的蔑视。<,>The judge held the perjurer in contempt.<,>法官对作伪证者表示蔑视。<,>con(共同)+tempt(轻视)→共同轻视<,>attempt(v.尝试/n.企图)/contemplate(v.沉思/v.注视)

modify<,>/ˈmɒdɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈmɑdəˌfaɪ/<,>vt.更改/vt.修改/vt.修饰<,>We need to modify our plans slightly.<,>我们需要稍微修改一下计划。<,>The car was modified for racing.<,>这辆车经过改装用于比赛。<,>Adjectives modify nouns.<,>形容词修饰名词。<,>mod(方式)+ify(使)→使改变方式<,>moderate(adj.适中的/v.缓和)/modernize(v.使现代化)

environment<,>/ɪnˈvaɪrənmənt/<,>/ɪnˈvaɪrənmənt/<,>n.环境/n.外界/n.围绕<,>We must protect the environment.<,>我们必须保护环境。<,>The children grew up in a loving environment.<,>孩子们在充满爱的环境中长大。<,>The software runs in a Windows environment.<,>这个软件在Windows环境下运行。<,>en(进入)+viron(周围)+ment→进入周围→环境<,>envelop(vt.包住/n.信封)/environs(n.郊区/n.附近)
clone<,>/kləʊn/<,>/kloʊn/<,>v.无性繁殖/v.克隆/n.无性繁殖系/n.克隆/n.复制品/n.翻版<,>Scientists successfully cloned a sheep named Dolly.<,>科学家们成功克隆了一只名叫多莉的羊。<,>The new smartphone is just a clone of the previous model.<,>这款新手机只是上一款的翻版。<,>He felt like a clone of his father in terms of personality.<,>他在性格上感觉像是父亲的复制品。<,>cl(close)+one(一个)→复制出一个一模一样的→克隆<,>clown(n.小丑)/colon(n.冒号)/clank(n.叮当声)  

betray<,>/bɪˈtreɪ/<,>/bɪˈtreɪ/<,>vt.背叛/vt.出卖/vt.失信于/vt.辜负/vt.泄露/vt.暴露<,>He betrayed his country by selling secrets to the enemy.<,>他向敌人出卖机密，背叛了自己的国家。<,>Her trembling hands betrayed her nervousness.<,>她颤抖的双手暴露了她的紧张。<,>Don't betray my trust by sharing this confidential information.<,>不要辜负我的信任，泄露这个机密信息。<,>be(使)+tray(托盘)→像托盘一样把秘密倒出去→背叛<,>portray(v.描绘)/bewray(v.无意中泄露)/betroth(v.订婚)  

progressive<,>/prəˈɡresɪv/<,>/prəˈɡresɪv/<,>adj.前进的/adj.渐进的/adj.进行式的<,>The company has made progressive improvements in its products.<,>该公司的产品取得了逐步的改进。<,>She holds progressive views on social issues.<,>她对社交问题持有进步的观点。<,>His disease follows a progressive course.<,>他的病情呈渐进性发展。<,>pro(向前)+gress(走)+ive→向前走的→前进的<,>aggressive(adj.侵略的)/digressive(adj.离题的)/regressive(adj.退步的)  

pledge<,>/pledʒ/<,>/plɛdʒ/<,>n.保证/n.誓言/vt.保证/vt.许诺<,>They pledged to donate 10% of their profits to charity.<,>他们承诺将利润的10%捐给慈善机构。<,>She gave a pledge never to reveal the secret.<,>她发誓永远不会泄露这个秘密。<,>The ring was a pledge of his love.<,>这枚戒指是他爱情的保证。<,>pl(please)+edge(边缘)→在边缘处也要让人满意→保证<,>sledge(n.雪橇)/pledget(n.小拭子)/plunge(v.投入)  

exempt<,>/ɪɡˈzempt/<,>/ɪɡˈzɛmpt/<,>adj.被免除的/adj.被豁免的/vt.免除/vt.豁免<,>Children are exempt from paying the entrance fee.<,>儿童免收门票。<,>His diplomatic status exempts him from taxes.<,>他的外交身份使他免于纳税。<,>The new law exempts small businesses from certain regulations.<,>新法律豁免了小企业的某些规定。<,>ex(出)+empt(拿)→拿出去→免除<,>example(n.例子)/excerpt(n.摘录)/attempt(v.尝试)  

deliberate<,>/dɪˈlɪbərət/<,>/dɪˈlɪbərɪt/<,>adj.故意的/adj.蓄意的/adj.慎重的/adj.深思熟虑的/v.仔细考虑/v.思考<,>It was a deliberate attempt to mislead the public.<,>这是故意误导公众的企图。<,>The jury took hours to deliberate the verdict.<,>陪审团花了数小时来审议裁决。<,>She spoke in a slow, deliberate manner.<,>她说话缓慢而谨慎。<,>de(完全)+liber(自由)+ate→完全自由地思考→深思熟虑<,>liberate(v.解放)/delicate(adj.精致的)/elaborate(adj.精心制作的)  

physiological<,>/ˌfɪziəˈlɒdʒɪkəl/<,>/ˌfɪziəˈlɑːdʒɪkəl/<,>adj.生理的/adj.生理学的<,>The drug has both psychological and physiological effects.<,>这种药物具有心理和生理双重影响。<,>Physiological changes occur during puberty.<,>青春期会发生生理变化。<,>The study focuses on the physiological responses to stress.<,>这项研究专注于对压力的生理反应。<,>physio(自然)+logical(学科的)→研究自然身体的学科→生理学的<,>psychological(adj.心理的)/pathological(adj.病理的)/philosophical(adj.哲学的)  

shaft<,>/ʃɑːft/<,>/ʃæft/<,>n.柄/n.杆/n.束/n.光线/n.轴/n.竖井/n.升降井<,>The arrow's shaft was made of lightweight wood.<,>箭杆是用轻质木材制成的。<,>A shaft of sunlight entered the dark room.<,>一束阳光照进黑暗的房间。<,>Miners descended into the shaft to extract coal.<,>矿工们下到竖井中采煤。<,>sh(shape)+aft(after)→在后面形成形状→轴<,>shift(v.移动)/craft(n.工艺)/draft(n.草稿)  

aesthetic<,>/iːsˈθetɪk/<,>/ɛsˈθɛtɪk/<,>adj.美学的/adj.审美的/adj.悦目的/adj.雅致的<,>The building's design has great aesthetic appeal.<,>这座建筑的设计具有很高的美学吸引力。<,>She has an aesthetic sense for interior decoration.<,>她对室内装饰有审美感。<,>The garden was arranged with aesthetic consideration.<,>花园的布置考虑了审美因素。<,>a(一个)+esthet(感觉)+ic→一种感觉→美学的<,>anesthetic(n.麻醉剂)/ascetic(adj.苦行的)/athletic(adj.运动的)  

atmosphere<,>/ˈætməsfɪə(r)/<,>/ˈætməsfɪr/<,>n.大气/n.空气/n.气氛/n.环境<,>The Earth's atmosphere protects us from harmful radiation.<,>地球的大气层保护我们免受有害辐射。<,>There was a tense atmosphere in the meeting room.<,>会议室里气氛紧张。<,>The restaurant has a cozy and romantic atmosphere.<,>这家餐厅有着温馨浪漫的氛围。<,>atmo(空气)+sphere(球体)→环绕地球的空气→大气<,>hemisphere(n.半球)/biosphere(n.生物圈)/chromosphere(n.色球层)
decorate<,>/ˈdekəreɪt/<,>/ˈdɛkəˌreɪt/<,>vt.装饰/vt.装潢/vt.修饰<,>They decorated the room with balloons for the party.<,>他们用气球装饰房间来准备派对。<,>She loves to decorate cakes with intricate designs.<,>她喜欢用复杂的设计装饰蛋糕。<,>The Christmas tree was beautifully decorated with lights and ornaments.<,>圣诞树被美丽的灯光和装饰品装点。<,>decor(装饰)+ate(动词后缀)→装饰<,>decoration(n.装饰)/decorative(adj.装饰的)/ornament(v.装饰)  

electrician<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɪʃn/<,>/ɪˈlɛktrɪʃən/<,>n.电工/n.电气技师<,>We need to call an electrician to fix the wiring.<,>我们需要叫电工来修理电线。<,>The electrician installed new lights in our house.<,>电工在我们家安装了新灯。<,>He trained for years to become a certified electrician.<,>他经过多年培训成为认证电工。<,>electr(电)+ician(专业人员)→电工<,>electric(adj.电的)/electronic(adj.电子的)/electricity(n.电)  

occupation<,>/ˌɒkjuˈpeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑːkjuˈpeɪʃn/<,>n.占领/n.占据/n.职业/n.从事的活动/n.消遣<,>His occupation is a teacher.<,>他的职业是教师。<,>The building was under enemy occupation during the war.<,>战争期间这座建筑被敌人占领。<,>Gardening is her favorite occupation on weekends.<,>园艺是她周末最喜欢的消遣。<,>oc(强调)+cup(拿)+ation→占据<,>occupy(v.占据)/occupational(adj.职业的)/preoccupation(n.全神贯注)  

tendency<,>/ˈtendənsi/<,>/ˈtɛndənsi/<,>n.趋向/n.趋势/n.倾向<,>She has a tendency to procrastinate.<,>她有拖延的倾向。<,>There's a growing tendency towards remote work.<,>远程工作有增长趋势。<,>The data shows a clear upward tendency in sales.<,>数据显示销售额有明显上升趋势。<,>tend(伸展)+ency(状态)→趋势<,>trend(n.趋势)/inclination(n.倾向)/propensity(n.习性)  

release<,>/rɪˈliːs/<,>/rɪˈlis/<,>n&vt.释放/n&vt.排放/n&vt.解除/n&vt.解脱/n&vt.放开/n&vt.松开/n&vt.发布/n&vt.发行<,>The company will release a new product next month.<,>公司下个月将发布新产品。<,>The prisoner was released after serving his sentence.<,>囚犯服刑后被释放。<,>She released her grip on the rope.<,>她松开了握着的绳子。<,>re(重新)+lease(放松)→释放<,>relieve(v.缓解)/leash(n.皮带)/releaser(n.释放者)  

caption<,>/ˈkæpʃn/<,>/ˈkæpʃən/<,>n.说明文字/n.字幕<,>The photo had a funny caption underneath it.<,>照片下面有个有趣的说明文字。<,>Turn on the captions if you can't hear the dialogue.<,>如果听不清对话就打开字幕。<,>The caption explained the historical context of the painting.<,>说明文字解释了这幅画的历史背景。<,>cap(抓住)+tion→抓住内容→说明<,>capture(v.捕捉)/captionless(adj.无说明的)/subtitle(n.字幕)  

hardy<,>/ˈhɑːdi/<,>/ˈhɑrdi/<,>adj.能吃苦耐劳的/adj.坚强的/adj.耐寒的<,>The hardy mountaineers climbed in freezing temperatures.<,>吃苦耐劳的登山者在严寒中攀登。<,>These plants are hardy enough to survive winter.<,>这些植物很耐寒，能越冬。<,>His hardy spirit helped him overcome many difficulties.<,>他坚强的精神帮助他克服了许多困难。<,>hard(硬)+y(形容词后缀)→坚强的<,>hardiness(n.耐寒性)/hardly(adv.几乎不)/hardihood(n.大胆)  

purify<,>/ˈpjʊərɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈpjʊrəˌfaɪ/<,>vt.使纯净/vt.提纯/vt.使纯洁<,>The water is purified before drinking.<,>水在饮用前被净化。<,>They purify gold to remove impurities.<,>他们提纯黄金去除杂质。<,>The ritual is meant to purify the soul.<,>这个仪式旨在净化灵魂。<,>pur(纯净)+ify(使)→使纯净<,>pure(adj.纯净的)/purification(n.净化)/purifier(n.净化器)  

toll<,>/təʊl/<,>/toʊl/<,>v.敲/n.过路费/n.过桥费/n.伤亡人数/n.损失<,>We had to pay a toll to cross the bridge.<,>我们过桥必须付过路费。<,>The church bell tolled at midnight.<,>教堂的钟在午夜敲响。<,>The war took a heavy toll on civilians.<,>战争给平民造成重大伤亡。<,>原指"敲钟计数"引申为"收费/损失"<,>tollgate(n.收费站)/tollbooth(n.收费亭)/tollhouse(n.收费所)  

variation<,>/ˌveəriˈeɪʃn/<,>/ˌvɛriˈeɪʃən/<,>n.变化/n.变动/n.变异/n.变奏<,>There are many regional variations in pronunciation.<,>发音有很多地区性变化。<,>The composer wrote variations on a familiar theme.<,>作曲家写了熟悉主题的变奏曲。<,>Temperature variations affect plant growth.<,>温度变化影响植物生长。<,>vary(变化)+ation→变化<,>variable(adj.可变的)/variety(n.多样)/variant(n.变体)
moral<,>/ˈmɒrəl/<,>/ˈmɔːrəl/<,>adj.道德的/adj.有道德的/n.品行/n.道德规范/n.寓意<,>He is a man of high moral standards.<,>他是一个道德标准很高的人。<,>The moral of the story is to be kind to others.<,>这个故事的寓意是对他人要友善。<,>She made a moral decision to return the lost wallet.<,>她做出了一个道德决定，归还了丢失的钱包。<,>mor(习俗)+al(形容词后缀)→符合习俗的→道德的<,>morale(n.士气)/morality(n.道德)/immoral(adj.不道德的)  

rig<,>/rɪɡ/<,>/rɪɡ/<,>vt.操纵/vt.垄断/vt.给装配帆及索具/vt.用临时替代材料迅速搭起/n.船桅的装置/n.成套器械<,>They rigged the election in their favor.<,>他们操纵了选举以利于自己。<,>The sailors rigged the ship for the storm.<,>水手们为暴风雨装配了船只。<,>He rigged up a temporary shelter with some branches.<,>他用树枝迅速搭起了一个临时避难所。<,>rig(捆绑)→把东西捆绑在一起→操纵<,>rug(n.地毯)/rag(n.破布)/rigid(adj.僵硬的)  

eject<,>/ɪˈdʒekt/<,>/ɪˈdʒɛkt/<,>vt.驱逐/vt.逐出/vt.喷射/vt.排出/vt.弹出<,>The pilot ejected from the crashing plane.<,>飞行员从坠毁的飞机中弹射出来。<,>The volcano ejected lava and ash into the air.<,>火山向空中喷出熔岩和灰烬。<,>They were ejected from the club for bad behavior.<,>他们因行为不端被逐出俱乐部。<,>e(出)+ject(投掷)→投掷出去→喷射<,>inject(vt.注射)/reject(vt.拒绝)/project(vt.投射)  

defect<,>/ˈdiːfekt/<,>/ˈdiːfɛkt/<,>vi.变节/vi.叛变/n.缺点/n.缺陷/n.欠缺<,>The product was recalled due to a manufacturing defect.<,>该产品因制造缺陷被召回。<,>He defected to another country for political reasons.<,>他因政治原因叛逃到另一个国家。<,>Her only defect is being too kind sometimes.<,>她唯一的缺点是有时太善良。<,>de(离开)+fect(做)→做不好→缺陷<,>perfect(adj.完美的)/effect(n.效果)/infect(vt.感染)  

reinforce<,>/ˌriːɪnˈfɔːs/<,>/ˌriːɪnˈfɔːrs/<,>vt.增强/vt.加强/vt.增援<,>We need to reinforce the walls to make them stronger.<,>我们需要加固墙壁使其更坚固。<,>The general sent troops to reinforce the front line.<,>将军派兵增援前线。<,>Positive feedback reinforces good behavior.<,>积极的反馈能强化良好行为。<,>re(再)+in(进入)+force(力量)→再次加入力量→加强<,>enforce(vt.实施)/reinforcement(n.增援)/force(n.力量)  

casual<,>/ˈkæʒuəl/<,>/ˈkæʒuəl/<,>adj.偶然的/adj.非正式的/adj.临时的/adj.不定期的/adj.漠不关心的/adj.冷淡的<,>He wore casual clothes to the party.<,>他穿着便装去参加聚会。<,>We had a casual meeting at the coffee shop.<,>我们在咖啡店偶然相遇。<,>She gave him a casual glance and walked away.<,>她漫不经心地看了他一眼就走开了。<,>cas(落下)+ual(形容词后缀)→偶然落下的→偶然的<,>causal(adj.因果的)/usual(adj.通常的)/casualty(n.伤亡)  

slack<,>/slæk/<,>/slæk/<,>vi.懈怠/vi.懒散/adj.懈怠的/adj.马虎的/adj.萧条的/adj.清淡的/adj.不活跃的/adj.松的/n.松弛部分/n.宽松裤<,>Don't slack off during the final exams.<,>期末考试期间不要懈怠。<,>The rope was too slack to hold the weight.<,>绳子太松了，承受不住重量。<,>Business is slack during the summer months.<,>夏季的生意很清淡。<,>slack(松弛的)→与"lack(缺乏)"联想→缺乏紧张感→懈怠的<,>snack(n.小吃)/slick(adj.光滑的)/slacken(vt.放松)  

rim<,>/rɪm/<,>/rɪm/<,>n.边/n.缘/vt.环绕边缘<,>She wore glasses with gold rims.<,>她戴着一副金框眼镜。<,>The cup has a chipped rim.<,>这个杯子的边缘有缺口。<,>Mountains rim the valley on three sides.<,>山脉环绕着山谷的三面。<,>rim(边缘)→与"brim(边缘)"同源→边缘<,>brim(n.边缘)/trim(vt.修剪)/grim(adj.严峻的)  

property<,>/ˈprɒpəti/<,>/ˈprɑːpərti/<,>n.财产/n.所有物/n.房产/n.物业/n.性质/n.性能<,>This house is my most valuable property.<,>这栋房子是我最有价值的财产。<,>The chemical has unique properties.<,>这种化学物质有独特的性质。<,>He manages several commercial properties downtown.<,>他管理着市中心的几处商业物业。<,>proper(自己的)+ty(名词后缀)→属于自己的东西→财产<,>poverty(n.贫穷)/propriety(n.得体)/proper(adj.适当的)  

rip<,>/rɪp/<,>/rɪp/<,>v.扯破/v.撕坏/n.裂口/n.裂缝<,>She ripped her dress on a nail.<,>她的裙子被钉子钩破了。<,>There's a big rip in the old curtain.<,>旧窗帘上有个大裂口。<,>He ripped the paper in half angrily.<,>他生气地把纸撕成两半。<,>rip(撕开)→与"ripe(成熟的)"对比→成熟的果实容易撕开<,>ripe(adj.成熟的)/rib(n.肋骨)/rip-off(n.骗局)
outbreak<,>/ˈaʊtbreɪk/<,>/ˈaʊtˌbreɪk/<,>n.爆发/n.突然发生<,>There was an outbreak of violence in the city.<,>城市里爆发了暴力事件。<,>The outbreak of the disease was quickly contained.<,>这种疾病的爆发很快得到了控制。<,>Scientists are studying the causes of the outbreak.<,>科学家正在研究这次爆发的原因。<,>out(外)+break(打破)→突然打破→爆发<,>breakout(n. 越狱/n. 突围)/outburst(n. 爆发/n. 突发)  

manipulate<,>/məˈnɪpjuleɪt/<,>/məˈnɪpjəˌleɪt/<,>vt.操纵/vt.控制/vt.影响/vt.操作/vt.使用<,>He knows how to manipulate public opinion.<,>他知道如何操纵舆论。<,>The machine is easy to manipulate.<,>这台机器很容易操作。<,>She felt she was being manipulated.<,>她感觉自己被操控了。<,>mani(手)+pul(拉)+ate(动词后缀)→用手拉动→操纵<,>manufacture(v. 制造/n. 产品)/maneuver(v. 操纵/n. 策略)  

similar<,>/ˈsɪmələ(r)/<,>/ˈsɪməlɚ/<,>adj.相似的/adj.类似的<,>The two houses are similar in size.<,>这两栋房子大小相似。<,>We have similar tastes in music.<,>我们在音乐方面有相似的品味。<,>His situation is similar to mine.<,>他的处境和我类似。<,>simil(相同)+ar(形容词后缀)→相似的<,>same(adj. 相同的)/simile(n. 明喻)/dissimilar(adj. 不同的)  

contradict<,>/ˌkɒntrəˈdɪkt/<,>/ˌkɑːntrəˈdɪkt/<,>vt.反驳/vt.否认…的真实性/vt.与…发生矛盾/vt.与…抵触<,>Her statement contradicts the facts.<,>她的陈述与事实相矛盾。<,>Don't contradict your parents in public.<,>不要在公开场合反驳你的父母。<,>The two witnesses contradicted each other.<,>两位证人的证词互相矛盾。<,>contra(反对)+dict(说)→反着说→反驳<,>contrary(adj. 相反的)/predict(v. 预测)/dictate(v. 口述)  

melody<,>/ˈmelədi/<,>/ˈmɛlədi/<,>n.旋律/n.曲调/n.悦耳的音乐<,>She hummed a familiar melody.<,>她哼着一首熟悉的旋律。<,>The melody of the song is very catchy.<,>这首歌的旋律非常朗朗上口。<,>He composed a beautiful melody.<,>他创作了一段优美的旋律。<,>mel(甜)+ody(歌)→甜美的歌→旋律<,>harmony(n. 和声)/rhythm(n. 节奏)/lullaby(n. 摇篮曲)  

likelihood<,>/ˈlaɪklihʊd/<,>/ˈlaɪkliˌhʊd/<,>n.可能/n.可能性<,>There's a strong likelihood of rain tomorrow.<,>明天很有可能下雨。<,>In all likelihood, he will be promoted.<,>他极有可能会被晋升。<,>The likelihood of success is small.<,>成功的可能性很小。<,>likely(可能的)+hood(名词后缀)→可能性<,>probability(n. 概率)/possibility(n. 可能性)/unlikelihood(n. 不大可能)  

converge<,>/kənˈvɜːdʒ/<,>/kənˈvɜrdʒ/<,>vi.会合/vi.互相靠拢/vi.聚集/vi.集中/vi.趋近<,>The roads converge at the square.<,>这些道路在广场汇合。<,>Our opinions are converging.<,>我们的意见正在趋同。<,>The light rays converge at this point.<,>光线在这个点汇聚。<,>con(共同)+verge(转向)→共同转向→会合<,>diverge(v. 分歧)/emerge(v. 出现)/submerge(v. 淹没)  

compose<,>/kəmˈpəʊz/<,>/kəmˈpoʊz/<,>vt.组成/vt.构成/vt.创作/vt.为…谱曲/vt.使平静/vt.使镇静<,>Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.<,>水由氢和氧组成。<,>He composed a symphony last year.<,>他去年创作了一部交响乐。<,>She tried to compose herself before the interview.<,>面试前她努力让自己平静下来。<,>com(一起)+pose(放置)→放在一起→组成<,>composer(n. 作曲家)/dispose(v. 处理)/oppose(v. 反对)  

catholic<,>/ˈkæθlɪk/<,>/ˈkæθəlɪk/<,>adj.天主教的/adj.普遍的/adj.广泛的/n.天主教徒<,>She was raised in a Catholic family.<,>她在一个天主教家庭长大。<,>He has catholic tastes in literature.<,>他在文学方面兴趣广泛。<,>The Catholic Church has a long history.<,>天主教会有着悠久的历史。<,>cathol(普遍)+ic(形容词后缀)→普遍的<,>Christian(adj. 基督教的/n. 基督徒)/universal(adj. 普遍的)  

partial<,>/ˈpɑːʃl/<,>/ˈpɑːrʃl/<,>adj.部分的/adj.不公平的/adj.偏爱的/adj.偏袒的<,>The project is only partially completed.<,>这个项目只完成了一部分。<,>The judge was accused of being partial.<,>法官被指控有偏袒行为。<,>I'm very partial to chocolate.<,>我特别偏爱巧克力。<,>part(部分)+ial(形容词后缀)→部分的<,>impartial(adj. 公正的)/partly(adv. 部分地)/particle(n. 粒子)
aid<,>/eɪd/<,>/eɪd/<,>n.帮助/n.救护/n.助手/n.辅助手段/vt.帮助/vt.援助<,>She offered her aid to the injured man.<,>她向受伤的男子提供了帮助。<,>First aid is essential in emergencies.<,>急救在紧急情况下至关重要。<,>He works as an aid in the local hospital.<,>他在当地医院担任助手。<,>ai(爱)+d(的)→爱心帮助→援助<,>aide(n. 助手)/raid(n.袭击/v.突袭)

supersonic<,>/ˌsuːpəˈsɒnɪk/<,>/ˌsuːpərˈsɑːnɪk/<,>adj.超声的/adj.超音速的<,>The jet flew at supersonic speed.<,>这架喷气式飞机以超音速飞行。<,>Supersonic waves are used in medical imaging.<,>超声波用于医学成像。<,>Breaking the sound barrier creates a supersonic boom.<,>突破音障会产生超音速爆鸣。<,>super(超)+sonic(声音的)→超音速的<,>subsonic(adj.亚音速的)/ultrasonic(adj.超声的)

optimism<,>/ˈɒptɪmɪzəm/<,>/ˈɑːptɪmɪzəm/<,>n.乐观/n.乐观主义<,>Her optimism kept the team motivated.<,>她的乐观精神让团队保持干劲。<,>Optimism is key to overcoming challenges.<,>乐观是克服困难的关键。<,>Despite setbacks, he maintained his optimism.<,>尽管遇到挫折，他仍保持乐观。<,>opt(选择)+im(最高级)+ism(主义)→选择最好态度→乐观主义<,>pessimism(n.悲观主义)/optimal(adj.最佳的)

confident<,>/ˈkɒnfɪdənt/<,>/ˈkɑːnfɪdənt/<,>adj.确信的/adj.肯定的/adj.自信的<,>She gave a confident presentation.<,>她做了一个自信的演讲。<,>I'm confident we'll succeed.<,>我确信我们会成功。<,>His confident manner impressed the interviewers.<,>他自信的态度给面试官留下了深刻印象。<,>con(完全)+fid(信任)+ent→完全信任的→自信的<,>confidant(n.知己)/diffident(adj.羞怯的)

retain<,>/rɪˈteɪn/<,>/rɪˈteɪn/<,>vt.保留/vt.保持<,>The wall retains heat well.<,>这堵墙保温效果很好。<,>He retained his title as champion.<,>他保住了冠军头衔。<,>This soil retains moisture.<,>这种土壤能保持水分。<,>re(再)+tain(拿住)→再次拿住→保留<,>attain(vt.达到)/detain(vt.拘留)

drastic<,>/ˈdræstɪk/<,>/ˈdræstɪk/<,>adj.严厉的/adj.极端的/adj.激烈的/adj.迅猛的<,>Drastic measures were taken to control the outbreak.<,>采取了严厉措施来控制疫情。<,>The company made drastic cuts to its workforce.<,>公司大幅裁员。<,>There's been a drastic change in weather.<,>天气发生了剧烈变化。<,>dras(行动)+tic→采取行动的→激烈的<,>elastic(adj.有弹性的)/dramatic(adj.戏剧性的)

epoch<,>/ˈiːpɒk/<,>/ˈepək/<,>n.时期/n.时代<,>The invention marked a new epoch in communication.<,>这项发明标志着通信的新纪元。<,>We live in the digital epoch.<,>我们生活在数字时代。<,>The Jurassic epoch saw the dominance of dinosaurs.<,>侏罗纪时期恐龙占统治地位。<,>ep(在...上)+och(时代)→在时代之上→纪元<,>epic(adj.史诗的)/echo(n.回声)

saleable<,>/ˈseɪləbl/<,>/ˈseɪləbl/<,>adj.适合销售的<,>The product is highly saleable in Asian markets.<,>这个产品在亚洲市场很畅销。<,>They redesigned the packaging to make it more saleable.<,>他们重新设计了包装使其更适销。<,>Freshness is key to keeping vegetables saleable.<,>新鲜度是保持蔬菜适销的关键。<,>sale(销售)+able(能...的)→能销售的<,>salable(adj.可销售的)/sealable(adj.可密封的)

crew<,>/kruː/<,>/kruː/<,>n.全体船员/n.一队工作人员<,>The ship's crew prepared for departure.<,>全体船员准备启航。<,>A film crew arrived to shoot the scene.<,>一个电影摄制组来拍摄这个场景。<,>The cabin crew served meals during the flight.<,>机组人员在飞行期间提供餐食。<,>cr(crew发音似"可入")+ew(表示人)→可以进入工作的人→工作人员<,>crow(n.乌鸦)/brew(vt.酿造)

manufacturer<,>/ˌmænjuˈfæktʃərə(r)/<,>/ˌmænjəˈfæktʃərər/<,>n.制造商/n.制造厂<,>The car manufacturer recalled faulty vehicles.<,>汽车制造商召回了有问题的车辆。<,>This is a leading electronics manufacturer.<,>这是一家领先的电子产品制造商。<,>The manufacturer guarantees the quality of its products.<,>制造商保证其产品质量。<,>manu(手)+fact(做)+ure(场所)→用手制作的场所→制造厂<,>manufacture(vt.制造)/fracture(n.骨折)
defeat<,>/dɪˈfiːt/<,>/dɪˈfiːt/<,>n.战胜/n.挫败/vt.战胜/vt.挫败<,>The team suffered a crushing defeat in the championship.<,>这支队伍在锦标赛中遭遇惨败。<,>He defeated his opponent in the debate.<,>他在辩论中战胜了对手。<,>They worked hard to defeat the proposed law.<,>他们努力挫败这项提案。<,>de(向下)+feat(做)→把对方做下去→战胜<,>feat(n.功绩/壮举)/defect(n.缺陷/vi.叛逃)

valid<,>/ˈvælɪd/<,>/ˈvælɪd/<,>adj.有效的/adj.正当的/adj.有根据的/adj.有理的<,>Your passport must be valid for at least six months.<,>你的护照有效期必须至少还有六个月。<,>She presented valid arguments during the meeting.<,>她在会议上提出了有理有据的论点。<,>The coupon is only valid until the end of this month.<,>这张优惠券本月底前有效。<,>val(价值)+id→有价值的→有效的<,>invalid(adj.无效的/n.病人)/vapid(adj.乏味的)

inertia<,>/ɪˈnɜːʃə/<,>/ɪˈnɜːrʃə/<,>n.不活动/n.惰性/n.惯性<,>The inertia of the bureaucracy slows down reforms.<,>官僚机构的惰性拖慢了改革进程。<,>Objects in motion tend to stay in motion due to inertia.<,>运动的物体会因惯性保持运动状态。<,>He couldn't overcome his inertia to start exercising.<,>他无法克服惰性开始锻炼。<,>in(不)+ert(动)+ia→不动→惰性<,>insert(vt.插入)/inert(adj.惰性的)

encourage<,>/ɪnˈkʌrɪdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈkɜːrɪdʒ/<,>vt.鼓励/vt.怂恿/vt.促进/vt.助长/vt.激发<,>The teacher encouraged students to ask questions.<,>老师鼓励学生提问。<,>Warm weather encourages plant growth.<,>温暖的天气促进植物生长。<,>His success encouraged me to pursue my dreams.<,>他的成功激励我追求梦想。<,>en(使)+courage(勇气)→使有勇气→鼓励<,>discourage(vt.使气馁)/courage(n.勇气)

vacuum<,>/ˈvækjuːm/<,>/ˈvækjuːm/<,>v.收集/v.用真空吸尘器打扫/n.真空/n.真空吸尘器<,>She vacuumed the living room every morning.<,>她每天早晨用吸尘器打扫客厅。<,>Space is not a perfect vacuum.<,>太空并非绝对真空。<,>The new vacuum cleaner is very efficient.<,>这台新吸尘器效率很高。<,>vac(空)+uum→真空<,>vacuous(adj.空洞的)/vacation(n.假期)

extravagant<,>/ɪkˈstrævəɡənt/<,>/ɪkˈstrævəɡənt/<,>adj.奢侈的/adj.过度的/adj.过分的/adj.放肆的<,>She wore an extravagant diamond necklace to the party.<,>她戴着一条奢华的钻石项链参加派对。<,>The project was criticized for its extravagant costs.<,>这个项目因成本过高受到批评。<,>His extravagant claims were hard to believe.<,>他夸张的说法令人难以相信。<,>extra(超出)+vag(漫游)+ant→漫游超出界限→过分的<,>vagrant(n.流浪者)/vague(adj.模糊的)

accommodate<,>/əˈkɒmədeɪt/<,>/əˈkɑːmədeɪt/<,>vt.容纳/vt.向...提供住处/vt.使适应/vt.顺应<,>The hotel can accommodate 500 guests.<,>这家酒店可容纳500位客人。<,>We need to accommodate the new regulations.<,>我们需要适应新规定。<,>The university accommodates students with disabilities.<,>大学为残疾学生提供住宿。<,>ac(向)+com(共同)+mod(方式)+ate→使方式相同→适应<,>commodity(n.商品)/moderate(adj.适中的)

bubble<,>/ˈbʌbl/<,>/ˈbʌbəl/<,>vi.冒泡/vi.起泡/vi.沸腾/n.泡/n.泡沫/n.水泡/n.气泡/n.幻想的计划<,>The boiling water was bubbling vigorously.<,>沸水剧烈地冒着气泡。<,>The children blew soap bubbles in the park.<,>孩子们在公园吹肥皂泡。<,>His business plan turned out to be just a bubble.<,>他的商业计划原来只是个泡影。<,>拟声词，模仿气泡破裂的声音<,>pebble(n.鹅卵石)/babble(v.含糊不清地说)

morality<,>/məˈræləti/<,>/məˈræləti/<,>n.道德/n.道德性/n.德行/n.品行/n.道德观/n.道德规则<,>The novel explores complex questions of morality.<,>这部小说探讨了复杂的道德问题。<,>Different cultures have different moralities.<,>不同文化有不同的道德观。<,>His actions were questioned on grounds of morality.<,>他的行为在道德层面受到质疑。<,>moral(道德的)+ity(名词后缀)→道德<,>mortality(n.死亡率)/immoral(adj.不道德的)

yield<,>/jiːld/<,>/jiːld/<,>v.出产/v.让出/v.放弃/v.屈服/v.顺从/v.倒塌/v.垮掉/n.产量<,>The farm yields a good harvest this year.<,>农场今年获得丰收。<,>He yielded his seat to the elderly woman.<,>他把座位让给了那位老妇人。<,>The door yielded to his strong push.<,>门被他用力推开了。<,>yield sign(让行标志)帮助记忆<,>field(n.领域)/wield(vt.挥舞)
electronic<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɒnɪk/<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɑːnɪk/<,>adj.电子的/n.电子学/电子设备<,>She works in the electronic music industry.<,>她在电子音乐行业工作。<,>This device uses electronic components.<,>这个设备使用了电子元件。<,>Electronic books are becoming more popular.<,>电子书越来越受欢迎。<,>electr(电)+onic(形容词后缀)→电子的<,>electric(adj.电的)/electrical(adj.电气的)  

transplant<,>/trænsˈplɑːnt/<,>/trænsˈplænt/<,>v.移栽/移植/使迁移/n.移植<,>The doctor performed a heart transplant.<,>医生进行了心脏移植手术。<,>We transplanted the flowers to the garden.<,>我们把花移植到了花园里。<,>He had to transplant his family to a new city.<,>他不得不把家人迁移到新城市。<,>trans(转移)+plant(种植)→移植<,>transport(v.运输)/implant(v.植入)  

terrace<,>/ˈterəs/<,>/ˈterəs/<,>n.排屋/地坪/草坪<,>They sat on the terrace enjoying the view.<,>他们坐在露台上欣赏风景。<,>The house has a beautiful terrace garden.<,>这房子有一个漂亮的露台花园。<,>The cafe has outdoor seating on the terrace.<,>咖啡馆在露台上有户外座位。<,>terr(地)+ace(名词后缀)→地坪<,>terrain(n.地形)/territory(n.领土)  

deficit<,>/ˈdefɪsɪt/<,>/ˈdefəsɪt/<,>n.赤字/亏空/亏损<,>The country has a large budget deficit.<,>这个国家有巨大的预算赤字。<,>There's a deficit in our water supply.<,>我们的供水不足。<,>The company reported a financial deficit.<,>公司报告了财务亏损。<,>de(向下)+fic(做)+it→做少了→赤字<,>deficient(adj.不足的)/defect(n.缺陷)  

sacred<,>/ˈseɪkrɪd/<,>/ˈseɪkrɪd/<,>adj.神圣的/宗教的/神圣不可侵犯的<,>This temple is a sacred place.<,>这座寺庙是神圣的地方。<,>They performed a sacred ritual.<,>他们举行了神圣的仪式。<,>Freedom of speech is a sacred right.<,>言论自由是神圣不可侵犯的权利。<,>sacr(神圣)+ed(形容词后缀)→神圣的<,>sacrifice(n.牺牲)/secret(adj.秘密的)  

cathedral<,>/kəˈθiːdrəl/<,>/kəˈθiːdrəl/<,>n.大教堂<,>Notre Dame is a famous cathedral in Paris.<,>巴黎圣母院是巴黎著名的大教堂。<,>The cathedral's architecture is magnificent.<,>大教堂的建筑非常壮观。<,>They got married in the local cathedral.<,>他们在当地的大教堂结婚了。<,>cathedra(主教座)+al(名词后缀)→大教堂<,>church(n.教堂)/chapel(n.小教堂)  

elegant<,>/ˈelɪɡənt/<,>/ˈeləɡənt/<,>adj.优美的/文雅的/讲究的/简练的<,>She wore an elegant dress to the party.<,>她穿着优雅的裙子参加派对。<,>His solution was simple and elegant.<,>他的解决方案简单而巧妙。<,>The restaurant has an elegant atmosphere.<,>这家餐厅氛围高雅。<,>e(出)+leg(选择)+ant→精心挑选出来的→优雅的<,>elegance(n.优雅)/arrogant(adj.傲慢的)  

synthesis<,>/ˈsɪnθəsɪs/<,>/ˈsɪnθəsɪs/<,>n.综合/合成<,>This drug is a synthesis of several compounds.<,>这种药物是几种化合物的合成。<,>His theory is a synthesis of different ideas.<,>他的理论是不同观点的综合。<,>Photosynthesis is vital for plants.<,>光合作用对植物至关重要。<,>syn(共同)+thesis(放置)→放在一起→合成<,>synthetic(adj.合成的)/analysis(n.分析)  

incidentally<,>/ˌɪnsɪˈdentəli/<,>/ˌɪnsɪˈdentəli/<,>adv.顺便提及地/顺便提一句<,>Incidentally, I saw your brother yesterday.<,>顺便说一句，我昨天看到你弟弟了。<,>Incidentally, that restaurant is closed today.<,>顺便提一下，那家餐厅今天关门。<,>He mentioned it incidentally in conversation.<,>他在谈话中顺便提到了这件事。<,>incident(事件)+al+ly→附带地提到<,>accidentally(adv.意外地)/intentionally(adv.故意地)  

polar<,>/ˈpəʊlə(r)/<,>/ˈpoʊlər/<,>adj.地极的/近地极的/磁极的/截然对立的<,>Polar bears live in the Arctic.<,>北极熊生活在北极地区。<,>They have polar opposite opinions.<,>他们的意见截然相反。<,>The Earth has polar ice caps.<,>地球有极地冰盖。<,>pole(极)+ar(形容词后缀)→极地的<,>polarity(n.极性)/solar(adj.太阳的)
shark<,>/ʃɑːk/<,>/ʃɑrk/<,>n.鲨鱼/n.勒索者/n.诈骗者/n.放高利贷的人<,>The shark swam swiftly through the ocean.<,>鲨鱼在海洋中迅速游动。<,>He was known as a loan shark in the neighborhood.<,>他在附近以放高利贷者闻名。<,>Beware of the shark in the business deal.<,>小心商业交易中的诈骗者。<,>shark(鲨鱼)与hark(倾听)形似，但意义不同<,>shark(n.鲨鱼)/hark(v.倾听)/stark(adj.完全的)

linger<,>/ˈlɪŋɡə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪŋɡər/<,>vi.继续逗留/vi.留恋徘徊/vi.继续存留/vi.缓慢消失<,>The smell of her perfume lingered in the room.<,>她香水的味道在房间里久久不散。<,>He lingered at the door, reluctant to leave.<,>他在门口徘徊，不愿离开。<,>The pain lingered for weeks after the accident.<,>事故后疼痛持续了好几周。<,>ling(长)+er(动作)→长时间停留→逗留<,>linger(vi.逗留)/finger(n.手指)/longer(adj.更长的)

historian<,>/hɪˈstɔːriən/<,>/hɪˈstɔriən/<,>n.历史学家/n.史学工作者<,>The historian spent years researching ancient civilizations.<,>这位历史学家花了多年时间研究古代文明。<,>She is a renowned historian of medieval Europe.<,>她是研究中世纪欧洲的著名历史学家。<,>The historian's book provides new insights into the war.<,>这位历史学家的书对战争提供了新的见解。<,>history(历史)+ian(人)→研究历史的人→历史学家<,>historian(n.历史学家)/historical(adj.历史的)/hysterical(adj.歇斯底里的)

cumulative<,>/ˈkjuːmjələtɪv/<,>/ˈkjumjəˌleɪtɪv/<,>adj.积累的/adj.渐增的<,>The cumulative effect of the medication was remarkable.<,>这种药物的累积效果非常显著。<,>Her knowledge was the cumulative result of years of study.<,>她的知识是多年学习的积累结果。<,>The cumulative score determined the winner of the competition.<,>累积得分决定了比赛的获胜者。<,>cumul(堆积)+ative(形容词后缀)→堆积的→积累的<,>cumulative(adj.积累的)/accumulate(v.积累)/cumulus(n.积云)

prototype<,>/ˈprəʊtətaɪp/<,>/ˈproʊtəˌtaɪp/<,>n.原型<,>The engineer built a prototype of the new machine.<,>工程师建造了新机器的原型。<,>This car is the prototype for the upcoming model.<,>这辆车是即将推出的车型的原型。<,>The prototype was tested extensively before production.<,>生产前对原型进行了广泛测试。<,>proto(原始)+type(类型)→原始类型→原型<,>prototype(n.原型)/archetype(n.原型)/stereotype(n.刻板印象)

overpass<,>/ˈəʊvəpɑːs/<,>/ˈoʊvərˌpæs/<,>n.天桥/n.立交桥<,>Pedestrians should use the overpass to cross the busy road.<,>行人应使用天桥穿过繁忙的道路。<,>The new overpass reduced traffic congestion significantly.<,>新的立交桥显著减少了交通拥堵。<,>From the overpass, we had a great view of the city.<,>从立交桥上，我们看到了城市的壮丽景色。<,>over(在上)+pass(通过)→在上面通过→天桥<,>overpass(n.天桥)/underpass(n.地下通道)/bypass(n.旁路)

species<,>/ˈspiːʃiːz/<,>/ˈspiʃiz/<,>n.种/n.类<,>This species of bird is native to Australia.<,>这种鸟原产于澳大利亚。<,>Many species are endangered due to habitat loss.<,>许多物种因栖息地丧失而濒临灭绝。<,>Scientists discovered a new species of fish in the deep ocean.<,>科学家在深海发现了一种新的鱼类。<,>speci(外观)+es(复数)→外观相似的群体→物种<,>species(n.物种)/specimen(n.标本)/special(adj.特殊的)

slip<,>/slɪp/<,>/slɪp/<,>v.滑跤/v.滑落/v.溜/v.下降/v.跌落/n.疏漏/n.差错<,>She slipped on the wet floor and fell.<,>她在湿滑的地板上滑倒了。<,>He slipped the note into her pocket unnoticed.<,>他悄悄地把纸条塞进了她的口袋。<,>There was a slip in the calculations that led to the error.<,>计算中的一个疏漏导致了错误。<,>s(蛇)+lip(嘴唇)→像蛇一样滑溜→滑落<,>slip(v.滑落)/slit(n.裂缝)/slap(v.拍打)

temperament<,>/ˈtemprəmənt/<,>/ˈtɛmpərəmənt/<,>n.气质/n.性格<,>Her cheerful temperament makes her popular among friends.<,>她开朗的性格使她在朋友中很受欢迎。<,>The child has a calm and patient temperament.<,>这孩子性情平和有耐心。<,>Artists often have a creative temperament.<,>艺术家通常具有创造性的气质。<,>temper(调节)+ament→调节出来的特性→气质<,>temperament(n.气质)/temperature(n.温度)/temperate(adj.温和的)

cite<,>/saɪt/<,>/saɪt/<,>vt.引用/vt.引证/vt.传唤/vt.传讯/vt.表彰/vt.嘉奖<,>The author cited several sources in his research paper.<,>作者在研究论文中引用了多个来源。<,>She was cited for her outstanding contributions to the community.<,>她因对社区的杰出贡献而受到表彰。<,>The court cited him to appear as a witness.<,>法院传唤他作为证人出庭。<,>cit(唤起)+e→唤起注意→引用<,>cite(vt.引用)/site(n.地点)/sight(n.视力)
acquaintance<,>/əˈkweɪntəns/<,>/əˈkweɪntəns/<,>n.认识/n.了解/n.熟人<,>I made his acquaintance at a business conference.<,>我是在一次商务会议上认识他的。<,>She has a wide circle of acquaintances.<,>她交友广泛。<,>He has only a nodding acquaintance with the subject.<,>他对这个课题只有粗浅的了解。<,>ac(强调)+quaint(知道)+ance(名词后缀)→认识的人→熟人<,>acquaint(v.使认识)/acquiesce(v.默许)/quaint(adj.古雅的)

moan<,>/məʊn/<,>/moʊn/<,>vi.呻吟/vi.呜咽/vi.抱怨/vt.抱怨/n.呻吟声/n.呜咽声/n.怨声<,>The wounded soldier moaned in pain.<,>受伤的士兵痛苦地呻吟着。<,>She's always moaning about her workload.<,>她总是抱怨工作量大。<,>The wind moaned through the trees.<,>风呜咽着穿过树林。<,>联想：moan(谐音"闷")→闷闷不乐就会抱怨<,>groan(vi.呻吟)/mourn(v.哀悼)/mean(v.意思是)

quench<,>/kwentʃ/<,>/kwentʃ/<,>vt.止/vt.扑灭<,>Firefighters worked hard to quench the blaze.<,>消防员努力扑灭大火。<,>This drink will quench your thirst.<,>这种饮料能解渴。<,>Nothing could quench his desire for knowledge.<,>没有什么能熄灭他对知识的渴望。<,>quen(谐音"困")+ch→困住火势→扑灭<,>squelch(vt.压制)/drench(vt.使湿透)/wrench(n.扳手)

shed<,>/ʃed/<,>/ʃed/<,>vt.脱落/vt.脱去/vt.流出/vt.流下/vt.发出/n.棚/n.小屋/n.货棚<,>Trees shed their leaves in autumn.<,>树木在秋天落叶。<,>She shed tears of joy at the news.<,>听到这个消息她流下了喜悦的泪水。<,>We keep gardening tools in the shed.<,>我们把园艺工具放在小棚里。<,>s(蛇)+hed(head的缩写)→蛇蜕皮就像脱去头部<,>shred(n.碎片)/shelter(n.避难所)/shade(n.阴影)

spice<,>/spaɪs/<,>/spaɪs/<,>n.香料/n.调味品/n.趣味/n.情趣/vt.使增添趣味/vt.加香料于<,>Add some spice to make the dish more flavorful.<,>加些香料让菜肴更美味。<,>His jokes added spice to the conversation.<,>他的笑话为谈话增添了趣味。<,>Variety is the spice of life.<,>变化是生活的调味品。<,>sp(专家)+ice(冰)→专家用冰制作香料<,>slice(n.薄片)/splice(vt.拼接)/spite(n.恶意)

rating<,>/ˈreɪtɪŋ/<,>/ˈreɪtɪŋ/<,>n.等级/n.品级/n.评定结果/n.收视率<,>The show has a high rating this season.<,>这个节目本季收视率很高。<,>He received an excellent performance rating.<,>他获得了优秀的工作表现评定。<,>The hotel has a five-star rating.<,>这家酒店是五星级的。<,>rat(老鼠)+ing(进行时)→老鼠在评定食物等级<,>raiding(n.袭击)/writing(n.写作)/ration(n.定量)

assertive<,>/əˈsɜːtɪv/<,>/əˈsɜːrtɪv/<,>adj.断定的/adj.过分自信的<,>She needs to be more assertive at work.<,>她需要在工作中更果断些。<,>His assertive manner sometimes puts people off.<,>他过分自信的态度有时让人反感。<,>An assertive approach can be effective in negotiations.<,>果断的态度在谈判中可能很有效。<,>as(如同)+sert(插入)+ive→如同插入观点般自信<,>assent(v.同意)/desert(n.沙漠)/insert(v.插入)

autonomous<,>/ɔːˈtɒnəməs/<,>/ɔːˈtɑːnəməs/<,>adj.自治的/adj.独立自主的<,>The region is now fully autonomous.<,>该地区现在完全自治。<,>Autonomous vehicles are becoming more common.<,>自动驾驶汽车越来越普遍。<,>The university has autonomous status.<,>这所大学有自治地位。<,>auto(自动)+nom(法律)+ous→自动遵守法律的→自治的<,>anonymous(adj.匿名的)/automatic(adj.自动的)/anatomy(n.解剖学)

referee<,>/ˌrefəˈriː/<,>/ˌrefəˈriː/<,>vi.当裁判/n.裁判员/n.证明人/n.推荐人/n.仲裁者<,>He refereed the football match last weekend.<,>他上周末担任了足球比赛的裁判。<,>She acted as a referee for my job application.<,>她担任了我工作申请的推荐人。<,>The dispute was settled by an independent referee.<,>争议由独立仲裁者解决。<,>refer(参考)+ee(人)→需要参考的人→裁判<,>reference(n.参考)/refrain(v.克制)/revere(v.尊敬)

aerial<,>/ˈeəriəl/<,>/ˈeriəl/<,>adj.飞机的/adj.航空的/adj.空中的/n.天线<,>Aerial photography provides unique views of the landscape.<,>航拍提供了独特的景观视角。<,>The bird performed amazing aerial maneuvers.<,>这只鸟展示了惊人的空中特技。<,>We need to adjust the TV aerial for better reception.<,>我们需要调整电视天线以获得更好的接收效果。<,>aer(空气)+ial(形容词后缀)→空气中的→空中的<,>aerie(n.鹰巢)/aerobic(adj.有氧的)/arterial(adj.动脉的)
trial<,>/ˈtraɪəl/<,>/ˈtraɪəl/<,>n.试/n.试验/n.审判/n.讨厌的人<,>The new drug is undergoing clinical trials.<,>这种新药正在进行临床试验。<,>He faced trial for theft.<,>他因盗窃罪面临审判。<,>She's been a real trial to her parents.<,>她一直让父母很头疼。<,>tri(三)+al→古代三权分立→审判<,>trail(n.踪迹/v.跟踪)/trivial(adj.琐碎的)/triangle(n.三角形)

perception<,>/pəˈsepʃn/<,>/pərˈsepʃn/<,>n.感知/n.觉察/n.认识/n.观念/n.看法<,>His perception of the problem was quite different.<,>他对这个问题的看法很不一样。<,>Visual perception is important for drivers.<,>视觉感知对司机很重要。<,>She has a keen perception of people's feelings.<,>她对人的情感有敏锐的觉察。<,>per(完全)+cept(拿)+ion→完全抓住→感知<,>conception(n.概念)/reception(n.接待)/deception(n.欺骗)

elapse<,>/ɪˈlæps/<,>/ɪˈlæps/<,>vi.消逝/vi.过去<,>Three years have elapsed since we last met.<,>自从我们上次见面已经过去三年了。<,>Time elapsed slowly in the waiting room.<,>在候诊室里时间过得很慢。<,>Only a few minutes elapsed before the alarm sounded.<,>仅仅几分钟后警报就响了。<,>e(出)+lapse(滑)→滑出去→消逝<,>collapse(v.倒塌/n.崩溃)/lapse(n.失误/v.失效)/eclipse(n.日食/v.使黯然失色)

symmetry<,>/ˈsɪmətri/<,>/ˈsɪmətri/<,>n.对称/n.匀称/n.整齐<,>The building has perfect symmetry.<,>这座建筑完全对称。<,>She admired the symmetry of the snowflake.<,>她赞叹雪花的对称美。<,>The garden was designed with careful symmetry.<,>这个花园设计得十分对称。<,>sym(共同)+metry(测量)→两边测量相同→对称<,>asymmetry(n.不对称)/geometry(n.几何)/meter(n.仪表/v.计量)

visualize<,>/ˈvɪʒuəlaɪz/<,>/ˈvɪʒuəlaɪz/<,>vt.想象/vt.设想<,>Try to visualize yourself succeeding.<,>试着想象自己成功的样子。<,>I can't visualize what the finished product will look like.<,>我无法想象成品会是什么样子。<,>He visualized the scene in his mind.<,>他在脑海中想象那个场景。<,>vis(看)+ual+ize(使)→使看得见→想象<,>visible(adj.可见的)/vision(n.视力/v.想象)/visage(n.面容)

reap<,>/riːp/<,>/rip/<,>vt.收割/vt.收获/vt.获得/vt.得到<,>Farmers reap wheat in summer.<,>农民们在夏天收割小麦。<,>You will reap what you sow.<,>种瓜得瓜，种豆得豆。<,>She reaped the benefits of her hard work.<,>她收获了辛勤工作的成果。<,>与ripe(成熟的)一起记→成熟后才能收割<,>leap(v.跳跃/n.飞跃)/heap(n.堆/v.堆积)/pear(n.梨)

insect<,>/ˈɪnsekt/<,>/ˈɪnsekt/<,>n.昆虫/n.虫<,>An insect landed on my arm.<,>一只虫子落在了我的胳膊上。<,>The museum has a large insect collection.<,>博物馆有大量的昆虫标本。<,>Some insects can transmit diseases.<,>有些昆虫会传播疾病。<,>in(进入)+sect(切)→昆虫身体分节像被切过<,>infect(v.传染)/insert(v.插入)/inspect(v.检查)

presume<,>/prɪˈzjuːm/<,>/prɪˈzum/<,>vi.擅自行事/vt.推测/vt.假定/vt.相信/vt.冒昧/vt.擅自/vt.认定/vt.推定<,>I presume you're tired after the long journey.<,>我想长途旅行后你一定累了。<,>Don't presume to tell me what to do.<,>别擅自告诉我该做什么。<,>The law presumes innocence until guilt is proved.<,>法律在证明有罪前推定无罪。<,>pre(预先)+sume(拿)→预先拿定→假定<,>assume(v.假定)/resume(v.恢复/n.简历)/consume(v.消耗)

complement<,>/ˈkɒmplɪmənt/<,>/ˈkɑːmplɪmənt/<,>n.补充/n.互为补充的东西/n.编制名额/n.装备定额/n.补语/vt.补充/vt.与...相配<,>The wine complements the meal perfectly.<,>这酒与饭菜搭配得恰到好处。<,>The ship has its full complement of sailors.<,>这艘船水手编制已满。<,>Red and green are complementary colors.<,>红色和绿色是互补色。<,>com(完全)+ple(满)+ment→完全填满→补充<,>compliment(n.赞美/v.恭维)/implement(n.工具/v.实施)/supplement(n.增补/v.补充)

cable<,>/ˈkeɪbl/<,>/ˈkeɪbəl/<,>n.缆/n.索/n.电缆/n.电报/vt.给...发电报/vt.用电报传送<,>The bridge is supported by steel cables.<,>这座桥由钢缆支撑。<,>We received the news by cable.<,>我们通过电报收到这个消息。<,>They cabled congratulations to the winner.<,>他们发电报向获胜者祝贺。<,>与table(桌子)对比记忆→桌子有线(cable)连着<,>able(adj.能够的)/fable(n.寓言)/stable(adj.稳定的)
nasty<,>/ˈnɑːsti/<,>/ˈnæsti/<,>adj.令人讨厌的/令人厌恶的/难弄的/困难的/严重的/恶劣的/险恶的/下流的/道德败坏的<,>He gave me a nasty look when I interrupted him.<,>当我打断他时，他给了我一个厌恶的眼神。<,>The weather turned nasty during our hike.<,>我们徒步旅行时天气变得恶劣了。<,>She has a nasty habit of gossiping about others.<,>她有个爱说别人闲话的坏习惯。<,>nas(鼻子)+ty(形容词后缀)→闻起来难闻的→令人厌恶的<,>hasty(adj.匆忙的)/tasty(adj.美味的)/dusty(adj.布满灰尘的)

intense<,>/ɪnˈtens/<,>/ɪnˈtɛns/<,>adj.强烈的/紧张的/认真的/热情的<,>The intense heat made it difficult to breathe.<,>强烈的热气让人难以呼吸。<,>She has an intense personality and always gives 100%.<,>她性格热情，总是全力以赴。<,>They had an intense discussion about the project.<,>他们就这个项目进行了激烈的讨论。<,>in(内)+tense(拉紧)→内部拉紧的→强烈的<,>intensive(adj.密集的)/intent(n.意图)/tense(adj.紧张的)

border<,>/ˈbɔːdə(r)/<,>/ˈbɔːrdər/<,>vi.近似/与...接壤/n.边/边缘/边界/vt.给...加上边/围/邻接<,>Canada borders the United States to the north.<,>加拿大与美国北部接壤。<,>She embroidered a floral border on the handkerchief.<,>她在手帕上绣了花边。<,>The village is located near the border of two provinces.<,>这个村庄位于两省交界处附近。<,>bor(边缘)+der(名词后缀)→边界<,>boarder(n.寄宿者)/bored(adj.无聊的)/order(n.顺序)

estate<,>/ɪˈsteɪt/<,>/ɪˈsteɪt/<,>n.地产/房地产<,>He inherited a large estate from his grandfather.<,>他从祖父那里继承了一大笔地产。<,>The real estate market has been booming recently.<,>最近房地产市场一直很繁荣。<,>They live on a beautiful country estate.<,>他们住在一个美丽的乡村庄园里。<,>e(出)+state(状态)→拥有的财产→地产<,>estimate(v.估计)/estuary(n.河口)/status(n.地位)

articulate<,>/ɑːˈtɪkjuleɪt/<,>/ɑrˈtɪkjəleɪt/<,>adj.善于表达的/发音清晰的/表达得清楚有力的/vt.明确有力地表达/清楚地吐/清晰地发<,>She is an articulate speaker who always gets her point across.<,>她是个口齿伶俐的演讲者，总能清楚地表达观点。<,>The professor articulated his theory in simple terms.<,>教授用简单的语言清楚地阐述了他的理论。<,>He struggled to articulate his feelings about the incident.<,>他努力想清楚地表达对这件事的感受。<,>art(艺术)+iculate(连接)→像艺术一样连接表达→善于表达的<,>article(n.文章)/particulate(adj.微粒的)/artificial(adj.人造的)

adhere<,>/ədˈhɪə(r)/<,>/ədˈhɪr/<,>vi.黏附/附着/遵守/坚持/追随/支持<,>The sticker won't adhere to the wet surface.<,>贴纸不会粘在潮湿的表面上。<,>We must adhere to the company's safety regulations.<,>我们必须遵守公司的安全规定。<,>She adheres to her principles no matter what.<,>无论发生什么，她都坚持自己的原则。<,>ad(向)+here(粘)→粘向→黏附<,>cohere(vi.连贯)/inhere(vi.固有)/here(adv.这里)

expense<,>/ɪkˈspens/<,>/ɪkˈspɛns/<,>n.花费/消费/费用/开支/业务费用<,>The expense of living in this city is very high.<,>在这个城市生活的费用很高。<,>Don't worry about the expense - the company will cover it.<,>别担心费用问题-公司会承担。<,>They spared no expense in organizing the wedding.<,>他们不惜花费地筹办婚礼。<,>ex(出)+pense(支付)→支付出去→花费<,>expensive(adj.昂贵的)/expand(v.扩展)/expend(v.花费)

traverse<,>/trəˈvɜːs/<,>/trəˈvɜːrs/<,>vt.横渡/横越<,>They traversed the desert on camels.<,>他们骑着骆驼穿越沙漠。<,>The bridge traverses the river at its narrowest point.<,>这座桥横跨河流最窄处。<,>It took them two weeks to traverse the mountain range.<,>他们花了两周时间穿越山脉。<,>tra(横)+verse(转)→横着转→横越<,>reverse(v.反转)/transverse(adj.横向的)/universe(n.宇宙)

rigorous<,>/ˈrɪɡərəs/<,>/ˈrɪɡərəs/<,>adj.严密的/缜密的/严格的/严厉的<,>The scientists conducted a rigorous experiment.<,>科学家们进行了严密的实验。<,>The training program is physically rigorous.<,>这个训练项目对身体要求严格。<,>She maintains a rigorous schedule every day.<,>她每天保持着严格的时间表。<,>rig(僵硬)+or+ous(形容词后缀)→僵硬的→严格的<,>vigorous(adj.精力充沛的)/rigid(adj.僵硬的)/rigor(n.严格)

yell<,>/jel/<,>/jɛl/<,>n&vi.号叫/叫喊<,>Don't yell at me - I can hear you just fine.<,>别对我大喊大叫-我能听清楚。<,>The coach yelled instructions from the sidelines.<,>教练在场边大声喊出指示。<,>We heard a yell coming from the woods.<,>我们听到树林里传来一声叫喊。<,>联想：yell(谐音"耶")→兴奋地叫喊<,>bell(n.铃)/hell(n.地狱)/well(adv.好)
contemporary<,>/kənˈtem.pər.ər.i/<,>/kənˈtem.pə.rer.i/<,>adj.现代的/adj.当代的/adj.同时代的<,>Contemporary art often reflects current social issues.<,>当代艺术常常反映当下的社会问题。<,>Shakespeare was contemporary with Queen Elizabeth I.<,>莎士比亚与伊丽莎白女王一世是同时代的人。<,>This building is a fine example of contemporary architecture.<,>这座建筑是现代建筑的典范。<,>con(共同)+tempor(时间)+ary→同一时间的→同时代的<,>temporary(adj.临时的)/contemporaneous(adj.同时期的)  

tribe<,>/traɪb/<,>/traɪb/<,>n.部落/n.族<,>The Maasai are a famous tribe in Africa.<,>马赛人是非洲一个著名的部落。<,>She belongs to the tribe of artists who reject commercialism.<,>她属于拒绝商业主义的艺术家群体。<,>Each tribe had its own unique customs and traditions.<,>每个部落都有自己独特的风俗和传统。<,>tri(三)+be(存在)→三个群体→部落<,>tribunal(n.法庭)/tribute(n.贡品)  

activate<,>/ˈæk.tɪ.veɪt/<,>/ˈæk.tə.veɪt/<,>vt.使活动起来/vt.使开始作用<,>Pressing this button will activate the alarm system.<,>按下这个按钮会启动警报系统。<,>Vitamin D helps activate calcium absorption.<,>维生素D有助于激活钙的吸收。<,>The enzyme is activated by heat.<,>这种酶通过加热被激活。<,>act(行动)+ivate(使)→使行动→激活<,>deactivate(vt.使无效)/motivate(vt.激励)  

mobilize<,>/ˈməʊ.bɪ.laɪz/<,>/ˈmoʊ.bə.laɪz/<,>vi.动员起来/vt.动员/vt.调动/vt.鼓动起<,>The government mobilized troops to deal with the emergency.<,>政府动员军队应对紧急情况。<,>We need to mobilize all available resources.<,>我们需要调动所有可用资源。<,>Protesters mobilized quickly after the announcement.<,>公告发布后抗议者迅速动员起来。<,>mob(移动)+ilize(使)→使移动→动员<,>immobilize(vt.使固定)/demobilize(vt.复员)  

mock<,>/mɒk/<,>/mɑːk/<,>vi.嘲笑/vi.嘲弄/adj.模拟的/adj.演习的/adj.假的/adj.假装的/vt.嘲笑/vt.嘲弄/vt.模仿<,>They mocked his accent behind his back.<,>他们在背后嘲笑他的口音。<,>The soldiers underwent a mock battle.<,>士兵们进行了一场模拟战斗。<,>Her smile was a mock display of friendliness.<,>她的微笑是假装友好的表现。<,>mo(没有)+ck(实质)→没有实质→假的<,>mocha(n.摩卡咖啡)/muck(n.淤泥)  

minibus<,>/ˈmɪn.i.bʌs/<,>/ˈmɪn.i.bʌs/<,>n.小型公共汽车<,>The school children travel by minibus.<,>学生们乘坐小型公共汽车出行。<,>We rented a minibus for our group trip.<,>我们为团体旅行租了一辆小型巴士。<,>The minibus can seat up to 15 passengers.<,>这辆小型巴士最多可坐15人。<,>mini(小)+bus(巴士)→小型巴士<,>miniskirt(n.迷你裙)/minimal(adj.最小的)  

repetitive<,>/rɪˈpet.ə.tɪv/<,>/rɪˈpet̬.ə.t̬ɪv/<,>adj.重复的/adj.反复性的<,>Factory work can be very repetitive.<,>工厂工作可能非常重复。<,>He complained about the repetitive nature of the tasks.<,>他抱怨这些任务的重复性。<,>The song has a repetitive chorus.<,>这首歌有重复的副歌。<,>repeat(重复)+itive(形容词后缀)→重复的<,>competitive(adj.竞争的)/repetition(n.重复)  

gear<,>/ɡɪər/<,>/ɡɪr/<,>n.齿轮/n.传动装置/n.挡/n.用具/n.设备/n.衣服/vt.使适应/vt.使适合<,>Shift into first gear when starting the car.<,>发动汽车时挂一挡。<,>All our camping gear is packed.<,>我们所有的露营装备都打包好了。<,>The course is geared toward beginners.<,>这个课程是为初学者设计的。<,>g(形状像齿轮)+ear(耳朵)→齿轮像耳朵<,>fear(n.恐惧)/tear(v.撕破)  

facilitate<,>/fəˈsɪl.ɪ.teɪt/<,>/fəˈsɪl.ə.teɪt/<,>vt.使...变得容易/vt.使便利<,>Computers facilitate the learning process.<,>电脑使学习过程变得容易。<,>The new highway facilitates transportation.<,>新高速公路便利了交通。<,>The guide will facilitate your tour of the museum.<,>导游将使你的博物馆参观更加便利。<,>facil(容易)+itate(使)→使容易<,>felicitate(vt.祝贺)/fabricate(vt.制造)  

precipitate<,>/prɪˈsɪp.ɪ.teɪt/<,>/prɪˈsɪp.ə.teɪt/<,>v.使突然发生/v.猛然抛下/v.使沉淀<,>The scandal precipitated his resignation.<,>丑闻导致他突然辞职。<,>Chemicals were precipitated at the bottom of the test tube.<,>化学物质沉淀在试管底部。<,>His hasty decision precipitated the crisis.<,>他的仓促决定引发了危机。<,>pre(前)+cipit(头)+ate→头朝前→猛然落下<,>precipitation(n.降水)/precise(adj.精确的)
endow<,>/ɪnˈdaʊ/<,>/ɪnˈdaʊ/<,>vt.资助/vt.捐赠/vt.给予/vt.赋予/vt.认为…具有某种特质<,>The university was endowed by a wealthy businessman.<,>这所大学由一位富商资助。<,>She was endowed with great musical talent.<,>她天生具有非凡的音乐天赋。<,>He endowed the hospital with a large sum of money.<,>他向医院捐赠了一大笔钱。<,>en(使)+dow(给予)→给予→捐赠<,>donate(v.捐赠)/bestow(v.授予)/bequeath(v.遗赠)

financial<,>/faɪˈnænʃəl/<,>/fəˈnænʃəl/<,>adj.财政的/adj.金融的<,>He works in the financial district of New York.<,>他在纽约金融区工作。<,>The company is facing financial difficulties.<,>公司正面临财务困难。<,>She keeps track of her financial transactions carefully.<,>她仔细记录自己的金融交易。<,>fin(钱)+ance(状态)+ial(…的)→金融的<,>fiscal(adj.财政的)/monetary(adj.货币的)/economic(adj.经济的)

respective<,>/rɪˈspektɪv/<,>/rɪˈspektɪv/<,>adj.各自的/adj.各个的/adj.分别的<,>The students went back to their respective homes after school.<,>放学后学生们各自回家了。<,>They were given tasks according to their respective abilities.<,>根据各自的能力给他们分配了任务。<,>The three winners received medals in their respective categories.<,>三位获胜者分别在各自类别中获得了奖牌。<,>re(回)+spect(看)+ive→回头看各自的<,>respectful(adj.恭敬的)/respectable(adj.可敬的)/irrespective(adj.不考虑的)

quiver<,>/ˈkwɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈkwɪvər/<,>vi.颤抖/vi.发抖/vi.抖动/n.颤抖/n.抖动/n.颤声<,>Her voice quivered with emotion.<,>她的声音因激动而颤抖。<,>The leaves quivered in the breeze.<,>树叶在微风中抖动。<,>He felt a quiver of excitement run through him.<,>他感到一阵兴奋的颤抖传遍全身。<,>quive(快速移动)+r→快速抖动→颤抖<,>shiver(v.颤抖)/tremble(v.发抖)/quake(v.震动)

slot<,>/slɒt/<,>/slɑːt/<,>n.狭缝/n.狭槽/n.位置/n.空位/vt.把…放入狭长开口中/vt.把…纳入其中/vt.使有位置<,>Put the coin into the slot.<,>把硬币投进投币口。<,>She slotted a fresh cassette into the recorder.<,>她把新磁带放进录音机。<,>We need to find a time slot for the meeting.<,>我们需要为会议找个时间段。<,>s(蛇)+lot(许多)→蛇钻进许多狭缝<,>slit(n.裂缝)/groove(n.凹槽)/notch(n.凹口)

harden<,>/ˈhɑːdn/<,>/ˈhɑːrdn/<,>v.变硬<,>The clay will harden when it dries.<,>黏土干了就会变硬。<,>His attitude hardened after the argument.<,>争论后他的态度变得强硬了。<,>The cold weather hardened the ground.<,>寒冷的天气使地面变硬了。<,>hard(硬的)+en(使)→使变硬<,>soften(v.变软)/strengthen(v.加强)/toughen(v.变坚韧)

rot<,>/rɒt/<,>/rɑːt/<,>v.腐烂/v.腐朽/n.腐烂/n.腐朽<,>The fruit began to rot in the hot weather.<,>水果在炎热天气里开始腐烂。<,>Dampness can cause wood to rot.<,>潮湿会使木材腐朽。<,>Stop talking rot!<,>别胡说八道！<,>r(草)+ot(小)→小草腐烂<,>decay(v.腐烂)/decompose(v.分解)/spoil(v.变质)

define<,>/dɪˈfaɪn/<,>/dɪˈfaɪn/<,>vt.给…下定义/vt.限定<,>Can you define what success means to you?<,>你能定义成功对你意味着什么吗？<,>The boundaries of the property are clearly defined.<,>地产的边界被明确限定。<,>This period defined her artistic style.<,>这个时期界定了她的艺术风格。<,>de(加强)+fin(界限)+e→划出界限→下定义<,>refine(v.精炼)/confine(v.限制)/definite(adj.明确的)

predict<,>/prɪˈdɪkt/<,>/prɪˈdɪkt/<,>vt.预言/vt.预告/vt.预测<,>It's hard to predict the weather accurately.<,>准确预测天气很难。<,>The economist predicted a recession.<,>经济学家预测会出现经济衰退。<,>No one could have predicted the outcome.<,>没人能预见到这个结果。<,>pre(前)+dict(说)→提前说→预测<,>forecast(v.预报)/prophesy(v.预言)/anticipate(v.预期)

dictate<,>/dɪkˈteɪt/<,>/ˈdɪkteɪt/<,>v.口授/v.命令/n.规定/n.要求<,>She dictated a letter to her secretary.<,>她向秘书口授了一封信。<,>The boss dictates how the work should be done.<,>老板规定工作该如何进行。<,>Follow the dictates of your conscience.<,>遵循你良心的要求。<,>dict(说)+ate(使)→使说出→口授<,>dictation(n.听写)/dictator(n.独裁者)/edict(n.法令)
memorize<,>/ˈmeməraɪz/<,>/ˈmeməˌraɪz/<,>vt.记住/vt.熟记<,>She tried to memorize the poem for the competition.<,>她努力熟记这首诗以参加比赛。<,>He memorized all the important dates in history.<,>他记住了历史上所有重要的日期。<,>It's easier to memorize information when you understand it.<,>理解信息后更容易记住。<,>memory(记忆)+ize(动词后缀)→记住<,>remember(v.记得)/recall(v.回忆)/memorial(n.纪念碑)

render<,>/ˈrendə(r)/<,>/ˈrɛndər/<,>vt.使得/vt.致使/vt.给予/vt.提供/vt.翻译<,>The storm rendered the roads impassable.<,>暴风雨使得道路无法通行。<,>He rendered assistance to the injured man.<,>他向受伤的男子提供了帮助。<,>The poem was rendered into English from French.<,>这首诗是从法语翻译成英语的。<,>ren(再)+der(给)→再次给予→提供<,>surrender(v.投降)/tender(adj.温柔的)/gender(n.性别)

undermine<,>/ˌʌndəˈmaɪn/<,>/ˌʌndərˈmaɪn/<,>vt.暗中破坏/vt.逐渐削弱/vt.侵蚀...的基础<,>Constant criticism can undermine a person's confidence.<,>持续的批评会逐渐削弱一个人的信心。<,>The river undermined the foundations of the old bridge.<,>河水侵蚀了老桥的桥基。<,>These allegations are designed to undermine his reputation.<,>这些指控旨在破坏他的声誉。<,>under(在...下)+mine(挖)→在下面挖→暗中破坏<,>underline(v.强调)/overmine(v.过度开采)/determine(v.决定)

subjective<,>/səbˈdʒektɪv/<,>/səbˈdʒɛktɪv/<,>adj.主观的/adj.个人的<,>Art appreciation is highly subjective.<,>艺术欣赏是非常主观的。<,>This is just my subjective opinion.<,>这只是我个人的看法。<,>The decision was based on subjective criteria.<,>这个决定是基于主观标准的。<,>subject(主题)+ive(形容词后缀)→主观的<,>objective(adj.客观的)/project(n.项目)/reject(v.拒绝)

blossom<,>/ˈblɒsəm/<,>/ˈblɑːsəm/<,>vi.开花/vi.发展/vi.长成/n.花<,>The cherry trees will blossom in April.<,>樱花树将在四月开花。<,>Her talent blossomed under good training.<,>她的才华在良好的训练下得以发展。<,>She picked a blossom from the apple tree.<,>她从苹果树上摘了一朵花。<,>bloom(开花)+some(一些)→开一些花→开花<,>bloom(v.开花)/bosom(n.胸部)/blossom(n.花)

radical<,>/ˈrædɪkl/<,>/ˈrædɪkəl/<,>adj.根本的/adj.基本的/adj.激进的/n.激进分子<,>We need radical changes in the education system.<,>我们需要对教育体系进行根本性改革。<,>He holds radical political views.<,>他持有激进的政治观点。<,>The radicals protested against the government.<,>激进分子抗议政府。<,>radic(根)+al(形容词后缀)→根本的<,>radicle(n.胚根)/radix(n.根)/radial(adj.放射状的)

manifest<,>/ˈmænɪfest/<,>/ˈmænəˌfɛst/<,>adj.明显的/adj.显然的/adj.明了的/vt.显示/vt.表明/vt.证明/vt.使显现<,>The symptoms manifested themselves immediately.<,>症状立即显现出来了。<,>His anger was manifest in his tone.<,>他的愤怒在语气中表现得很明显。<,>The document manifests his innocence.<,>这份文件证明了他的清白。<,>mani(手)+fest(打击)→用手打击→明显可见的<,>manifesto(n.宣言)/manifold(adj.多样的)/manipulate(v.操纵)

blunt<,>/blʌnt/<,>/blʌnt/<,>adj.钝的/adj.率直的/adj.直言不讳的/vt.使迟钝/vt.使减弱/vt.使钝<,>The knife was too blunt to cut the meat.<,>这把刀太钝了，切不动肉。<,>She was blunt about her disapproval.<,>她直言不讳地表示反对。<,>Age had blunted his reflexes.<,>年龄使他的反应迟钝了。<,>bl(不)+unt(尖)→不尖的→钝的<,>blunder(n.大错)/blunt(v.使钝)/blurt(v.脱口而出)

endeavor<,>/ɪnˈdevə(r)/<,>/ɛnˈdɛvər/<,>n&v.努力/n&v.尽力/n&v.尝试<,>We will endeavor to finish the project on time.<,>我们将努力按时完成这个项目。<,>His scientific endeavors earned him a Nobel Prize.<,>他的科学努力为他赢得了诺贝尔奖。<,>She made every endeavor to help the poor.<,>她尽一切努力帮助穷人。<,>en(使)+deavor(职责)→使尽职责→努力<,>endear(v.使受喜爱)/endanger(v.危及)/devote(v.奉献)

relieve<,>/rɪˈliːv/<,>/rɪˈliv/<,>vt.使轻松/vt.使宽慰/vt.缓解/vt.减轻/vt.解除/vt.使得到调剂/vt.接替<,>The medicine relieved my headache.<,>这药缓解了我的头痛。<,>The news relieved her anxiety.<,>这个消息减轻了她的焦虑。<,>The guard will be relieved at midnight.<,>卫兵将在午夜被接替。<,>re(再)+lieve(轻)→再次变轻→减轻<,>believe(v.相信)/relief(n.缓解)/retrieve(v.取回)
quartz<,>/kwɔːts/<,>/kwɔːrts/<,>n.石英<,>The countertop is made of quartz.<,>这个台面是用石英做的。<,>Quartz crystals are used in watches.<,>石英晶体用于手表。<,>She collects quartz stones from different regions.<,>她收集来自不同地区的石英石。<,>quart(四)+z→石英晶体常呈四方柱状<,>quart(n.夸脱)/quartet(n.四重奏)

air-conditioning<,>/ˈeə kənˌdɪʃənɪŋ/<,>/ˈer kənˌdɪʃənɪŋ/<,>n.空调设备/n.空调系统<,>The office has central air-conditioning.<,>办公室有中央空调。<,>We need to repair the air-conditioning unit.<,>我们需要修理空调机组。<,>Air-conditioning makes summer more bearable.<,>空调让夏天更舒适。<,>air(空气)+condition(调节)+ing→调节空气的装置<,>conditioner(n.调节器)/ventilation(n.通风)

adjacent<,>/əˈdʒeɪs(ə)nt/<,>/əˈdʒeɪsənt/<,>adj.邻近的/adj.毗连的<,>Our hotel room was adjacent to the pool.<,>我们的酒店房间紧挨着游泳池。<,>The two buildings have adjacent parking lots.<,>这两栋楼有相邻的停车场。<,>Please sit in the adjacent chair.<,>请坐在旁边的椅子上。<,>ad(向)+jac(躺)+ent→躺在旁边的<,>adjoining(adj.毗邻的)/proximate(adj.最近的)

employment<,>/ɪmˈplɔɪmənt/<,>/ɪmˈplɔɪmənt/<,>n.工作/n.雇用/n.使用<,>He found employment at a local factory.<,>他在当地工厂找到了工作。<,>The employment rate has risen this year.<,>今年就业率上升了。<,>This tool is for employment in emergencies only.<,>这个工具仅供紧急情况下使用。<,>employ(雇用)+ment(状态)→被雇用的状态<,>unemployment(n.失业)/deployment(n.部署)

transport<,>/trænˈspɔːt/<,>/ˈtrænspɔːrt/<,>vt.运输/n.运输/n.运输工具<,>They transport goods by truck.<,>他们用卡车运输货物。<,>Public transport is convenient in this city.<,>这个城市的公共交通很方便。<,>The ship is used for transport across the river.<,>这艘船用于渡河运输。<,>trans(转移)+port(运)→从一个地方运到另一个地方<,>transportation(n.运输)/transit(n.过境)

specific<,>/spəˈsɪfɪk/<,>/spəˈsɪfɪk/<,>adj.特有的/adj.明确的/adj.具体的/n.详情/n.细节<,>Please give specific instructions.<,>请给出具体的指示。<,>This plant is specific to tropical regions.<,>这种植物是热带地区特有的。<,>We need to discuss the specifics of the plan.<,>我们需要讨论计划的细节。<,>speci(种类)+fic(做)→做出分类的→明确的<,>special(adj.特殊的)/specimen(n.标本)

analogy<,>/əˈnælədʒi/<,>/əˈnælədʒi/<,>n.比拟/n.类比/n.类推<,>He explained the concept using an analogy.<,>他用类比解释这个概念。<,>The teacher drew an analogy between cells and cities.<,>老师把细胞和城市作类比。<,>This analogy helps understand the complex theory.<,>这个类比有助于理解复杂理论。<,>ana(类似)+logy(说话)→用类似的话说明<,>analogous(adj.类似的)/anthology(n.选集)

application<,>/ˌæplɪˈkeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌæplɪˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.申请/n.申请书/n.施用/n.涂抹/n.应用/n.实施/n.实用性<,>She submitted her job application yesterday.<,>她昨天提交了工作申请。<,>This cream is for external application only.<,>这种药膏仅供外用。<,>The application of new technology improved efficiency.<,>新技术的应用提高了效率。<,>apply(应用)+cation→应用的行为或结果<,>applicant(n.申请人)/appliance(n.器具)

productive<,>/prəˈdʌktɪv/<,>/prəˈdʌktɪv/<,>adj.多产的/adj.富饶的/adj.富有成效的<,>It was a very productive meeting.<,>这是一个非常富有成效的会议。<,>The writer is remarkably productive.<,>这位作家非常高产。<,>The soil here is very productive.<,>这里的土壤非常肥沃。<,>pro(向前)+duct(引导)+ive→能向前引导出成果的<,>productivity(n.生产力)/reproductive(adj.生殖的)

prune<,>/pruːn/<,>/pruːn/<,>vt.修剪/vt.修整/vt.删除/vt.削减<,>He prunes the rose bushes every spring.<,>他每年春天修剪玫瑰丛。<,>We need to prune unnecessary expenses.<,>我们需要削减不必要的开支。<,>The editor pruned redundant paragraphs from the article.<,>编辑删除了文章中多余的段落。<,>prun(修剪)+e→修剪的动作<,>plum(n.李子)/prudent(adj.谨慎的)
engage<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ/<,>vt.使从事于/vt.聘用/vt.吸引/vt.占用/vt.使订婚<,>She tried to engage the audience with her speech.<,>她试图用演讲吸引观众。<,>He was engaged as a consultant for the project.<,>他被聘为这个项目的顾问。<,>They got engaged last Christmas.<,>他们在去年圣诞节订婚了。<,>en(使)+gage(保证)→使保证→使从事<,>enrage(vt.激怒)/mortgage(n.抵押)

chord<,>/kɔːd/<,>/kɔːrd/<,>n.和弦/n.和音/n.弦/n.心弦<,>The pianist played a beautiful chord.<,>钢琴家弹奏了一个优美的和弦。<,>Her words struck a deep chord with me.<,>她的话深深触动了我的心弦。<,>He tightened the chord of his violin.<,>他调紧了小提琴的琴弦。<,>cord(绳索)→联想琴弦的形状<,>cord(n.绳索)/chorus(n.合唱)

semester<,>/sɪˈmestə(r)/<,>/sɪˈmestər/<,>n.学期<,>The new semester starts next Monday.<,>新学期下周一开学。<,>I took five courses last semester.<,>我上学期修了五门课。<,>She plans to study abroad next semester.<,>她计划下学期出国学习。<,>semi(半)+ester(年)→半年→学期<,>seminar(n.研讨会)

strategy<,>/ˈstrætədʒi/<,>/ˈstrætədʒi/<,>n.战略/n.策略<,>The company developed a new marketing strategy.<,>公司制定了新的营销策略。<,>Military strategy requires careful planning.<,>军事战略需要周密计划。<,>Her strategy for the exam was to focus on key points.<,>她的考试策略是抓重点。<,>strat(层)+egy→层层推进→策略<,>tactic(n.战术)

remainder<,>/rɪˈmeɪndə(r)/<,>/rɪˈmeɪndər/<,>n.余下的部分/n.剩下的人数<,>Only a small remainder of the cake was left.<,>蛋糕只剩下一小块了。<,>The remainder of the group will arrive tomorrow.<,>小组的其他成员明天到达。<,>He spent the remainder of his life in peace.<,>他在平静中度过余生。<,>remain(剩余)+der→剩余部分<,>reminder(n.提醒物)

hypothesis<,>/haɪˈpɒθəsɪs/<,>/haɪˈpɑːθəsɪs/<,>n.假设/n.假说/n.前提<,>Scientists tested their hypothesis through experiments.<,>科学家通过实验验证他们的假设。<,>Her hypothesis proved to be correct.<,>她的假说被证明是正确的。<,>The research is based on a reasonable hypothesis.<,>这项研究基于合理的假设。<,>hypo(在...下)+thesis(论点)→基础论点→假设<,>thesis(n.论文)

revolve<,>/rɪˈvɒlv/<,>/rɪˈvɑːlv/<,>vi.旋转<,>The Earth revolves around the Sun.<,>地球围绕太阳旋转。<,>The discussion revolved around environmental issues.<,>讨论围绕着环境问题展开。<,>The fan was revolving slowly.<,>风扇在缓慢转动。<,>re(再)+volve(转)→再转→旋转<,>evolve(v.进化)

collapse<,>/kəˈlæps/<,>/kəˈlæps/<,>n&vi.倒坍/n&vi.瓦解/n&vi.崩溃/n&vi.突然失败<,>The old building collapsed during the earthquake.<,>老建筑在地震中倒塌了。<,>His health collapsed due to overwork.<,>他的健康因过度工作而崩溃。<,>The company faced financial collapse.<,>公司面临财务崩溃。<,>col(一起)+lapse(滑落)→一起滑落→倒塌<,>lapse(n.失误)

territory<,>/ˈterətri/<,>/ˈterətɔːri/<,>n.领土/n.版图/n.领域<,>They expanded their territory through wars.<,>他们通过战争扩张领土。<,>This topic falls within his research territory.<,>这个主题属于他的研究领域。<,>Wild animals mark their territory with scent.<,>野生动物用气味标记领地。<,>terr(地)+itory→土地范围→领土<,>terror(n.恐怖)

summon<,>/ˈsʌmən/<,>/ˈsʌmən/<,>vt.召唤/vt.传唤/vt.鼓起/vt.振作/vt.召集/vt.召开<,>The king summoned his advisors to the palace.<,>国王召集顾问们进宫。<,>She summoned her courage to speak in public.<,>她鼓起勇气当众发言。<,>The witness was summoned to court.<,>证人被传唤到法庭。<,>sum(总)+mon(提醒)→全部提醒→召集<,>common(adj.普通的)
flare<,>/fleə(r)/<,>/fler/<,>vi.闪耀/vi.烧旺/vi.突发/vi.突然发怒/n.闪光信号/n.照明弹<,>The fire began to flare in the wind.<,>火在风中开始熊熊燃烧。<,>Tempers flared during the debate.<,>辩论中情绪突然激动起来。<,>They sent up a flare to signal for help.<,>他们发射了一颗照明弹求救。<,>fl(火焰)+are→火焰闪耀<,>glare(v.怒目而视/n.强光)/flair(n.天赋/n.才能)  

accurate<,>/ˈækjərət/<,>/ˈækjərət/<,>adj.准确的/adj.正确无误的<,>Her description was remarkably accurate.<,>她的描述非常准确。<,>This watch keeps accurate time.<,>这块表走时很准。<,>We need accurate data for the research.<,>我们需要准确的研究数据。<,>ac(加强)+cur(关心)+ate→一再关心使其精确<,>approximate(adj.大约的)/inaccurate(adj.不准确的)  

legend<,>/ˈledʒənd/<,>/ˈlɛdʒənd/<,>n.传说/n.传奇故事/n.传奇人物<,>The legend has been passed down for generations.<,>这个传说已经流传了好几代。<,>He became a legend in his own lifetime.<,>他在世时就成了传奇人物。<,>The movie is based on an ancient Greek legend.<,>这部电影基于一个古希腊传说。<,>leg(读)+end(结束)→被传诵到结尾的故事<,>myth(n.神话)/fable(n.寓言)  

maintain<,>/meɪnˈteɪn/<,>/menˈten/<,>vt.维持/vt.维修/vt.保养/vt.主张/vt.赡养<,>It's hard to maintain this old car.<,>这辆旧车很难保养。<,>He maintains his innocence throughout the trial.<,>他在整个审判过程中坚持自己无罪。<,>She has to maintain a family of five.<,>她要养活一个五口之家。<,>main(手)+tain(拿)→用手拿住→维持<,>sustain(vt.维持)/retain(vt.保留)  

expertise<,>/ˌekspɜːˈtiːz/<,>/ˌɛkspɚˈtiz/<,>n.专门知识/n.专长<,>His expertise in finance is widely recognized.<,>他在金融方面的专长广受认可。<,>The job requires special technical expertise.<,>这份工作需要特殊的技术专长。<,>She has considerable expertise in French cuisine.<,>她在法国料理方面颇有造诣。<,>expert(专家)+ise(状态)→专家的状态<,>experience(n.经验)/specialization(n.专门化)  

bargain<,>/ˈbɑːɡən/<,>/ˈbɑrɡən/<,>vi.讨价还价/n.特价商品/n.协议/n.交易<,>She bargained with the vendor over the price.<,>她与小贩讨价还价。<,>I got this jacket at a bargain price.<,>我以特价买了这件夹克。<,>They struck a bargain after long negotiations.<,>经过长时间谈判，他们达成了协议。<,>bar(酒吧)+gain(获得)→在酒吧获得便宜货<,>haggle(vi.讨价还价)/deal(n.交易)  

erect<,>/ɪˈrekt/<,>/ɪˈrɛkt/<,>adj.竖直的/adj.挺直的/vt.建造/vt.使竖立<,>He stood erect during the ceremony.<,>他在仪式上站得笔直。<,>They plan to erect a new monument here.<,>他们计划在这里竖立一座新纪念碑。<,>The tower was erected in the 12th century.<,>这座塔建于12世纪。<,>e(出)+rect(直)→直出来→竖立<,>direct(adj.直接的)/correct(adj.正确的)  

professional<,>/prəˈfeʃənl/<,>/prəˈfɛʃənl/<,>adj.职业的/adj.专业的/adj.专门的/n.自由职业者/n.专业人员<,>She takes a very professional approach to her work.<,>她的工作方式非常专业。<,>He turned professional at the age of 18.<,>他18岁就转为职业选手了。<,>We need to hire a professional for this job.<,>我们需要为这项工作聘请专业人员。<,>profess(声称)+ion+al→声称有专长的<,>amateur(adj.业余的)/occupational(adj.职业的)  

nil<,>/nɪl/<,>/nɪl/<,>n.无/n.零<,>Our chances of success are practically nil.<,>我们成功的机会几乎是零。<,>The score was three goals to nil.<,>比分是三比零。<,>His contribution to the project was nil.<,>他对这个项目的贡献为零。<,>与"null"(无效的)同源<,>zero(n.零)/naught(n.零)  

identification<,>/aɪˌdentɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/aɪˌdɛntəfəˈkeʃən/<,>n.身份证明/n.鉴定/n.验明/n.认出/n.认同<,>Show your identification at the entrance.<,>在入口处出示你的身份证明。<,>The identification of the body took several days.<,>尸体的辨认花了好几天。<,>She has a strong identification with the feminist movement.<,>她强烈认同女权运动。<,>ident(相同)+ify+ation→确认相同<,>identity(n.身份)/certification(n.证明)
migrant<,>/ˈmaɪɡrənt/<,>/ˈmaɪɡrənt/<,>n.移居者/n.移民/n.候鸟/n.迁移动物<,>Many migrant workers move to cities for better job opportunities.<,>许多农民工为了更好的工作机会搬到城市。<,>The swallows are migrants that fly south in winter.<,>燕子是冬季南飞的候鸟。<,>Migrant birds travel thousands of miles each year.<,>候鸟每年要飞行数千英里。<,>migr(移动)+ant(人/物)→移动的人或物<,>immigrant(n.移民)/emigrant(n.移居外国者)/migratory(adj.迁徙的)

protein<,>/ˈprəʊtiːn/<,>/ˈproʊtiːn/<,>n.蛋白质<,>Eggs are a good source of protein.<,>鸡蛋是很好的蛋白质来源。<,>This protein shake helps muscle recovery after workout.<,>这种蛋白质奶昔有助于锻炼后的肌肉恢复。<,>Vegetarians need to find alternative protein sources.<,>素食者需要寻找替代的蛋白质来源。<,>pro(首要)+tein(保持)→维持生命首要物质<,>proton(n.质子)/peptide(n.肽)/amino acid(n.氨基酸)

annual<,>/ˈænjuəl/<,>/ˈænjuəl/<,>adj.每年的/adj.一年一次的/n.年报/n.年鉴/n.一年生的植物<,>We hold an annual company meeting in December.<,>我们每年十二月举行公司年会。<,>The garden is full of colorful annual flowers.<,>花园里种满了色彩缤纷的一年生花卉。<,>Please refer to the annual report for detailed statistics.<,>详细统计数据请参考年报。<,>ann(年)+ual(形容词后缀)→每年的<,>anniversary(n.周年纪念)/perennial(adj.多年生的)/biannual(adj.一年两次的)

exclusive<,>/ɪkˈskluːsɪv/<,>/ɪkˈskluːsɪv/<,>adj.奢华的/adj.高级的/adj.独有的/adj.排斥的/adj.不包括...的/n.独家新闻<,>This club is very exclusive and hard to get into.<,>这个俱乐部非常高端，很难加入。<,>The magazine published an exclusive interview with the president.<,>该杂志发表了总统的独家专访。<,>The offer is exclusive to our VIP customers.<,>这个优惠仅限我们的VIP客户。<,>ex(出)+clus(关闭)+ive→关在外面→排外的<,>inclusive(adj.包含的)/conclusive(adj.决定性的)/elusive(adj.难捉摸的)

repertoire<,>/ˈrepətwɑː(r)/<,>/ˈrepərtwɑːr/<,>n.全部节目<,>The orchestra has a wide repertoire of classical music.<,>这个管弦乐队能演奏多种古典乐曲目。<,>Her repertoire includes songs from different eras.<,>她的演唱曲目包含不同时代的歌曲。<,>The actor added Shakespeare to his repertoire.<,>这位演员将莎士比亚戏剧加入了他的表演剧目。<,>re(反复)+pert(携带)+oire→反复携带的节目单<,>report(n.报告)/repository(n.仓库)/repertory(n.仓库/全部剧目)

poverty<,>/ˈpɒvəti/<,>/ˈpɑːvərti/<,>n.贫穷/n.贫困<,>Many families live in poverty in this area.<,>这个地区许多家庭生活在贫困中。<,>Education is key to breaking the cycle of poverty.<,>教育是打破贫困循环的关键。<,>The documentary exposed the harsh reality of urban poverty.<,>这部纪录片揭露了城市贫困的残酷现实。<,>pover(穷)+ty(状态)→贫穷状态<,>property(n.财产)/prosperity(n.繁荣)/impoverish(v.使贫困)

resort<,>/rɪˈzɔːt/<,>/rɪˈzɔːrt/<,>vi.求助/vi.凭借/vi.诉诸/n.求助/n.凭借/n.诉诸/n.求助的对象/n.采用的手段/n.常去之地/n.胜地<,>We had to resort to legal action to solve the dispute.<,>我们不得不诉诸法律手段来解决争端。<,>This seaside resort is popular with tourists.<,>这个海滨度假胜地很受游客欢迎。<,>Violence should never be the first resort.<,>暴力绝不应该是首选手段。<,>re(再)+sort(出去)→反复去的地方→度假胜地<,>retort(v.反驳)/consort(n.配偶)/assort(v.分类)

testify<,>/ˈtestɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈtestɪfaɪ/<,>vi.作证/vi.证明/vi.表明/vi.说明/vt.作证/vt.证明<,>The witness will testify in court tomorrow.<,>证人明天将在法庭作证。<,>Her success testifies to her hard work.<,>她的成功证明了她的努力。<,>I can testify that he was with me at the time.<,>我可以作证他当时和我在一起。<,>test(证据)+ify(使)→用证据证明<,>testament(n.证明)/attest(v.证明)/protest(v.抗议)

pearl<,>/pɜːl/<,>/pɜːrl/<,>n.珍珠/n.珠状物/n.珍品<,>She wore a beautiful pearl necklace.<,>她戴着一条漂亮的珍珠项链。<,>The morning dew looked like pearls on the grass.<,>晨露像珍珠一样挂在草上。<,>This ancient manuscript is a real pearl of literature.<,>这份古老的手稿是真正的文学瑰宝。<,>pear(梨)+l→形状像梨的珍珠<,>peal(n.钟声)/peel(v.剥皮)/peril(n.危险)

conclusive<,>/kənˈkluːsɪv/<,>/kənˈkluːsɪv/<,>adj.确实的/adj.最后的/adj.决定性的<,>The DNA test provided conclusive evidence.<,>DNA检测提供了确凿的证据。<,>After a conclusive debate, the committee made its decision.<,>经过决定性辩论后，委员会做出了决定。<,>The results were not conclusive and need further study.<,>结果尚无定论，需要进一步研究。<,>con(完全)+clus(关闭)+ive→完全关闭的→决定性的<,>inclusive(adj.包含的)/exclusive(adj.排他的)/elusive(adj.难捉摸的)
margin<,>/ˈmɑːdʒɪn/<,>/ˈmɑːrdʒɪn/<,>n.页边空白/n.差数，差额/n.余地/n.边缘<,>Please leave a wide margin on the left side of the page.<,>请在页面左侧留出宽边距。<,>The company's profit margin has increased this year.<,>公司今年的利润率有所提高。<,>There's no margin for error in this experiment.<,>这个实验不容许有任何误差。<,>marg(边缘)+in→边缘<,>marginal(adj.边缘的/不重要的)/marine(adj.海的/n.海军)

apt<,>/æpt/<,>/æpt/<,>adj.易于…的，有…倾向的/adj.恰当的，适宜的/adj.聪明的，反应敏捷的<,>He is apt to forget people's names.<,>他容易忘记别人的名字。<,>That was an apt remark for the occasion.<,>那是对那个场合很恰当的评论。<,>She's an apt student who learns quickly.<,>她是个聪明的学生，学得很快。<,>apt(适应)→容易适应的→有…倾向的<,>adept(adj.熟练的)/inapt(adj.不恰当的)

remain<,>/rɪˈmeɪn/<,>/rɪˈmeɪn/<,>vi.剩下，余留，保持；仍然是/n.残余；残骸；遗迹<,>Only a few apples remain on the tree.<,>树上只剩下几个苹果。<,>Please remain seated during takeoff.<,>起飞时请保持坐姿。<,>Archaeologists found the remains of an ancient city.<,>考古学家发现了一座古城的遗迹。<,>re(再)+main(留)→再留下→剩余<,>remnant(n.残余物)/retain(v.保留)

pregnancy<,>/ˈpreɡnənsi/<,>/ˈpreɡnənsi/<,>n.怀孕<,>She's in her third month of pregnancy.<,>她怀孕三个月了。<,>Pregnancy requires special care and attention.<,>怀孕需要特别的照顾和关注。<,>They announced her pregnancy at the family gathering.<,>他们在家庭聚会上宣布了她怀孕的消息。<,>pregn(拿住)+ancy→体内"拿住"胎儿→怀孕<,>pregnant(adj.怀孕的)/impregnate(v.使怀孕)

shabby<,>/ˈʃæbi/<,>/ˈʃæbi/<,>adj.破旧的，衣衫褴褛的/adj.卑鄙的/adj.不公正的<,>He wore a shabby old coat.<,>他穿着一件破旧的外套。<,>That was a shabby trick to play on your friend.<,>那是对你朋友耍的卑鄙手段。<,>The refugees lived in shabby conditions.<,>难民们生活在破败的环境中。<,>shab(疤)+by→有疤痕的→破旧的<,>scabby(adj.结痂的)/sham(n.赝品)

toss<,>/tɒs/<,>/tɔːs/<,>vi.掷钱币来决定；翻来覆去/vt.扔，抛，掷；猛抬；拌；掷；使摇动，使颠簸/n.掷钱币来决定；猛抬头<,>Let's toss a coin to decide who goes first.<,>让我们掷硬币决定谁先走。<,>She tossed the ball to her teammate.<,>她把球扔给了队友。<,>The ship was tossed by the waves during the storm.<,>暴风雨中船被海浪颠簸。<,>toss(投掷)→投掷动作<,>boss(n.老板)/loss(n.损失)

demand<,>/dɪˈmɑːnd/<,>/dɪˈmænd/<,>vt.要求，需要；询问/n.要求，需要<,>Customers are demanding better service.<,>顾客要求更好的服务。<,>There's a high demand for skilled workers.<,>对熟练工人的需求量很大。<,>The teacher demanded an explanation for his absence.<,>老师要求他对缺席做出解释。<,>de(加强)+mand(命令)→强烈命令→要求<,>command(v.命令)/remand(v.遣回)

reel<,>/riːl/<,>/riːl/<,>vi.摇摇晃晃地移动，蹒跚；眩晕，发昏/n.卷轴，卷筒，卷盘/vt.卷，绕<,>He reeled drunkenly down the street.<,>他醉醺醺地在街上蹒跚而行。<,>The angler cast his line from the reel.<,>钓鱼者从卷轴上放出钓线。<,>She reeled the silk thread onto the spool.<,>她把丝线绕到线轴上。<,>reel(卷轴)→像卷轴一样转动→眩晕<,>real(adj.真实的)/peel(v.剥皮)

pathetic<,>/pəˈθetɪk/<,>/pəˈθetɪk/<,>adj.差劲的，令人生厌的/adj.引起怜悯的，可怜的，可悲的<,>That was a pathetic attempt at humor.<,>那是个差劲的幽默尝试。<,>The homeless puppy looked pathetic in the rain.<,>雨中无家可归的小狗看起来很可怜。<,>His excuses were pathetic and unconvincing.<,>他的借口很可悲且没有说服力。<,>path(感情)+etic→引起感情的→可怜的<,>sympathetic(adj.同情的)/apathetic(adj.冷漠的)
