dissipate<,>/ˈdɪsɪpeɪt/<,>/ˈdɪsɪpeɪt/<,>vi.消散，消失/vt.使消散，使消失；浪费，挥霍<,>The fog dissipated as the sun rose.<,>太阳升起时雾气消散了。<,>He dissipated his fortune on gambling.<,>他把财产挥霍在赌博上。<,>Her anger dissipated after the apology.<,>道歉后她的怒气消散了。<,>dis(分开)+sip(扔)+ate→四处扔→消散<,>disperse(v.分散)/disseminate(v.传播)
flask<,>/flɑːsk/<,>/flæsk/<,>n.长颈瓶/n.酒瓶/n.烧瓶<,>She poured the wine into a glass flask.<,>她把酒倒入玻璃长颈瓶中。<,>The chemist used a flask to heat the liquid.<,>化学家用烧瓶加热液体。<,>He carried a flask of whiskey in his pocket.<,>他口袋里揣着一瓶威士忌。<,>fla(谐音“瓶”)+sk(联想“烧”)→烧瓶<,>flash(n.闪光/v.闪现)/flask(n.烧瓶)/flank(n.侧面)  

accuse<,>/əˈkjuːz/<,>/əˈkjuz/<,>vt.指责/vt.归咎于<,>The manager accused him of being late.<,>经理指责他迟到。<,>She was accused of stealing the money.<,>她被指控偷钱。<,>He accused the weather for the delay.<,>他把延误归咎于天气。<,>ac(强调)+cuse(理由)→强调理由→指责<,>excuse(v.原谅/n.借口)/abuse(v.滥用/n.虐待)/accustom(v.使习惯)  

disturbance<,>/dɪˈstɜːbəns/<,>/dɪˈstɜːrbəns/<,>n.扰乱/n.打扰/n.骚乱/n.混乱/n.心神不安<,>The noise caused a disturbance in the classroom.<,>噪音扰乱了课堂秩序。<,>He was arrested for creating a public disturbance.<,>他因制造公共骚乱被捕。<,>The news caused her great emotional disturbance.<,>这个消息使她情绪非常不安。<,>dis(分开)+turb(搅动)+ance(状态)→搅乱的状态<,>perturb(v.使不安)/turbulent(adj.动荡的)/distort(v.扭曲)  

visceral<,>/ˈvɪsərəl/<,>/ˈvɪsərəl/<,>adj.内脏的/adj.发自肺腑的<,>Visceral fat is harmful to health.<,>内脏脂肪对健康有害。<,>She had a visceral reaction to the horror movie.<,>她对恐怖片有本能的恐惧反应。<,>His speech evoked visceral emotions in the audience.<,>他的演讲引发了观众内心的强烈共鸣。<,>viscer(内脏)+al(的)→内脏的<,>viscous(adj.粘稠的)/vascular(adj.血管的)/viral(adj.病毒的)  

simultaneous<,>/ˌsɪməlˈteɪniəs/<,>/ˌsaɪməlˈteɪniəs/<,>adj.同时发生的/adj.同步的<,>The two events happened at simultaneous times.<,>这两个事件同时发生。<,>They made simultaneous announcements in different cities.<,>他们在不同城市同步发布声明。<,>The dancers performed with simultaneous movements.<,>舞者们动作整齐划一。<,>simul(相同)+taneous(形容词后缀)→同时的<,>instantaneous(adj.瞬间的)/spontaneous(adj.自发的)/contemporaneous(adj.同时代的)  

instructional<,>/ɪnˈstrʌkʃənl/<,>/ɪnˈstrʌkʃənl/<,>adj.指导的/adj.教育的<,>The video has clear instructional value.<,>这个视频有明确的教学价值。<,>She works in the instructional design department.<,>她在教学设计部门工作。<,>These are instructional materials for beginners.<,>这些是初学者的教学材料。<,>instruct(指导)+ion(名词后缀)+al(的)→指导的<,>constructional(adj.建设的)/destructional(adj.破坏的)/recreational(adj.娱乐的)  

guarantee<,>/ˌɡærənˈtiː/<,>/ˌɡærənˈti/<,>n.保证/n.担保物/vt.保证/vt.担保<,>The product comes with a one-year guarantee.<,>该产品有一年质保。<,>He guaranteed the loan with his house.<,>他用房子为贷款作担保。<,>I can guarantee you'll be satisfied.<,>我保证你会满意。<,>guar(守护)+ant(人)+ee(被...的人)→担保人<,>warranty(n.保修单)/guerrilla(n.游击队)/guardian(n.监护人)  

odor<,>/ˈəʊdə(r)/<,>/ˈoʊdər/<,>n.气味<,>The kitchen was filled with the odor of garlic.<,>厨房里弥漫着大蒜的气味。<,>There's a strange odor coming from the basement.<,>地下室传来奇怪的气味。<,>The flowers give off a pleasant odor.<,>这些花散发出怡人的香气。<,>odo(气味)+r→气味<,>ardor(n.热情)/order(n.顺序)/older(adj.更老的)  

predecessor<,>/ˈpriːdɪsesə(r)/<,>/ˈpredəsesər/<,>n.前任/n.前辈/n.前身<,>He learned from the mistakes of his predecessor.<,>他从前任的错误中吸取教训。<,>This model is better than its predecessor.<,>这个型号比它的前身更好。<,>She met with her predecessor to discuss the project.<,>她会见前任讨论项目。<,>pre(前)+de(离开)+cess(走)+or(人)→走在前面的人<,>successor(n.继任者)/processor(n.处理器)/precedent(n.先例)  

acquire<,>/əˈkwaɪə(r)/<,>/əˈkwaɪər/<,>vt.取得/vt.获得/vt.学到<,>She acquired a new skill last summer.<,>去年夏天她学会了一项新技能。<,>The company acquired three smaller firms.<,>该公司收购了三家小企业。<,>He acquired a taste for classical music.<,>他逐渐喜欢上了古典音乐。<,>ac(强调)+quire(寻求)→努力寻求→获得<,>require(v.需要)/inquire(v.询问)/acquit(v.宣判无罪)
literal<,>/ˈlɪtərəl/<,>/ˈlɪtərəl/<,>adj.照字面的/adj.原义的/adj.逐字的<,>He took the literal meaning of the word.<,>他按字面意思理解这个词。<,>She gave a literal translation of the poem.<,>她对这首诗进行了逐字翻译。<,>The literal interpretation of the law caused confusion.<,>对法律的字面解释引起了混乱。<,>liter(文字)+al(形容词后缀)→文字的→照字面的<,>literary(adj.文学的)/literate(adj.有文化的)

notion<,>/ˈnəʊʃn/<,>/ˈnoʊʃn/<,>n.概念/n.观念/n.意图/n.想法/n.念头<,>She has a vague notion of what she wants to do.<,>她对自己想做什么有个模糊的概念。<,>He rejected the notion that money equals happiness.<,>他拒绝了金钱等于幸福的观念。<,>I had a sudden notion to go traveling.<,>我突然有了去旅行的念头。<,>not(知道)+ion(名词后缀)→知道的东西→概念<,>motion(n.运动)/nation(n.国家)/potion(n.药剂)

default<,>/dɪˈfɔːlt/<,>/dɪˈfɔlt/<,>v.不履行义务/v.拖欠/n.违约/n.拖欠/n.弃权/n.预设/n.缺省<,>He defaulted on his loan payments.<,>他拖欠了贷款还款。<,>The program will run with default settings.<,>程序将以默认设置运行。<,>They won the game by default when their opponents withdrew.<,>由于对手退出，他们不战而胜。<,>de(向下)+fault(错误)→犯错误→违约<,>fault(n.错误)/feat(n.功绩)/defeat(v.击败)

arc<,>/ɑːk/<,>/ɑrk/<,>n.弧形/n.弧/n.电弧/n.弧光<,>The rainbow formed a perfect arc in the sky.<,>彩虹在空中形成一道完美的弧线。<,>Electric arcs can be dangerous.<,>电弧可能很危险。<,>She drew an arc with her finger in the sand.<,>她在沙地上用手指画了一道弧线。<,>arch(拱门)的简写形式<,>ark(n.方舟)/art(n.艺术)/arcade(n.拱廊)

beverage<,>/ˈbevərɪdʒ/<,>/ˈbevərɪdʒ/<,>n.饮料<,>Would you like a hot beverage?<,>你想喝杯热饮吗？<,>Alcoholic beverages are not allowed here.<,>这里不允许饮用酒精饮料。<,>She ordered a refreshing beverage.<,>她点了一杯提神饮料。<,>bev(喝)+erage(名词后缀)→喝的东西→饮料<,>leverage(n.杠杆作用)/average(n.平均数)

captive<,>/ˈkæptɪv/<,>/ˈkæptɪv/<,>adj.被俘虏的/adj.被捕获的/n.俘虏<,>The captive animals were released back into the wild.<,>被捕获的动物被放归野外。<,>He held his audience captive with his storytelling.<,>他用讲故事的方式牢牢吸引住了听众。<,>The soldiers were held captive for three years.<,>这些士兵被俘虏了三年。<,>capt(抓住)+ive(形容词后缀)→被抓住的→被俘虏的<,>capture(v.捕获)/captivate(v.迷住)

insane<,>/ɪnˈseɪn/<,>/ɪnˈseɪn/<,>adj.极蠢的/adj.荒唐的/adj.精神病的/adj.精神失常的/adj.疯狂的<,>That's an insane idea!<,>那是个疯狂的想法！<,>He was declared legally insane.<,>他被法律认定为精神失常。<,>Working 80 hours a week is insane.<,>一周工作80小时太疯狂了。<,>in(不)+sane(理智的)→不理智的→疯狂的<,>sane(adj.理智的)/insanity(n.精神错乱)

attribute<,>/əˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>/əˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>vt.把...归因于/n.属性<,>She attributes her success to hard work.<,>她把成功归因于努力工作。<,>Patience is an important attribute for a teacher.<,>耐心是教师的重要品质。<,>The painting was attributed to Picasso.<,>这幅画被归为毕加索的作品。<,>at(向)+tribute(给予)→把...给予→归因于<,>contribute(v.贡献)/distribute(v.分配)

cemetery<,>/ˈsemətri/<,>/ˈseməteri/<,>n.墓地/n.公墓<,>They visited their grandparents' graves in the cemetery.<,>他们去公墓祭拜了祖父母的坟墓。<,>The old cemetery was overgrown with weeds.<,>这座古老的墓地长满了杂草。<,>The cemetery was peaceful in the moonlight.<,>月光下的墓地很宁静。<,>cemet(睡觉)+ery(场所)→长眠之地→墓地<,>symmetry(n.对称)/cemetery(n.公墓)

genetic<,>/dʒəˈnetɪk/<,>/dʒəˈnetɪk/<,>adj.遗传的/n.遗传学<,>Genetic factors play a role in many diseases.<,>遗传因素在许多疾病中起作用。<,>She studies genetic engineering.<,>她研究基因工程。<,>The twins share the same genetic makeup.<,>这对双胞胎有相同的基因构成。<,>gene(基因)+tic(形容词后缀)→基因的→遗传的<,>generic(adj.通用的)/genesis(n.起源)
stitch<,>/stɪtʃ/<,>/stɪtʃ/<,>v.缝/v.绣/n.一针/n.线迹/n.缝法/n.针法/n.编结法/n.突然剧痛<,>She stitched a beautiful flower onto the fabric.<,>她在布料上绣了一朵美丽的花。<,>I felt a sharp stitch in my side after running.<,>跑步后我感到侧身一阵剧痛。<,>This knitting pattern requires a special stitch.<,>这种编织花样需要一种特殊的针法。<,>stitch(缝) + ing(进行时)→正在缝补<,>switch(v. 切换/n.开关)/snitch(v.告密/n.告密者)  

triumph<,>/ˈtraɪʌmf/<,>/ˈtraɪəmf/<,>vi.成功/n.凯旋/n.胜利<,>Their team triumphed in the final match.<,>他们的队伍在决赛中获胜。<,>The return of the hero was a great triumph.<,>英雄的归来是一场伟大的胜利。<,>She felt a sense of triumph after completing the project.<,>完成项目后她感到一种胜利的喜悦。<,>tri(三) + umph(拟声词)→三次欢呼→胜利<,>trumpet(n.小号/v.吹嘘)/trivial(adj.琐碎的)  

vice<,>/vaɪs/<,>/vaɪs/<,>n.罪恶/n.恶习/n.缺点/n.虎钳<,>Gambling is a harmful vice.<,>赌博是一种有害的恶习。<,>The mechanic held the pipe steady with a vice.<,>技工用虎钳固定住管子。<,>His only vice is eating too much chocolate.<,>他唯一的缺点就是吃太多巧克力。<,>vice(副的) + president→副总统→缺点<,>vise(n.签证)/voice(n.声音)  

detection<,>/dɪˈtekʃn/<,>/dɪˈtekʃən/<,>n.察觉/n.发觉/n.侦查/n.探测<,>Early detection of the disease is crucial.<,>这种疾病的早期发现很关键。<,>The detection of radiation requires special equipment.<,>探测辐射需要特殊设备。<,>His detection of the error saved the company money.<,>他发现了错误，为公司节省了资金。<,>de(去掉) + tect(覆盖) + ion→去掉覆盖→发现<,>defection(n.背叛)/deterioration(n.恶化)  

bowel<,>/ˈbaʊəl/<,>/ˈbaʊəl/<,>n.肠/n.内部/n.深处<,>The doctor examined his bowel movements.<,>医生检查了他的排便情况。<,>They explored the bowels of the ancient castle.<,>他们探索了古堡的深处。<,>A healthy diet promotes good bowel function.<,>健康饮食有助于肠道功能。<,>bow(弓) + el(小)→弯曲如弓的肠子<,>bowl(n.碗)/howl(v.嚎叫)  

arouse<,>/əˈraʊz/<,>/əˈraʊz/<,>vt.引起/vt.唤起/vt.唤醒<,>The loud noise aroused the sleeping baby.<,>巨大的声响吵醒了熟睡的婴儿。<,>His speech aroused great enthusiasm.<,>他的演讲激起了极大的热情。<,>The movie aroused my curiosity about history.<,>这部电影引起了我对历史的好奇。<,>a(加强) + rouse(唤醒)→唤起<,>arise(v.出现)/raise(v.举起)  

optimum<,>/ˈɒptɪməm/<,>/ˈɑːptɪməm/<,>adj.最合适的/adj.最优的/adj.最佳的<,>This temperature is optimum for plant growth.<,>这个温度最适合植物生长。<,>We need to find the optimum solution.<,>我们需要找到最佳解决方案。<,>He performed at his optimum level during the competition.<,>他在比赛中表现出了最佳水平。<,>opt(选择) + imum(最)→最优选择<,>optimal(adj.最佳的)/option(n.选择)  

suppress<,>/səˈpres/<,>/səˈpres/<,>vt.压制/vt.镇压/vt.禁止发表/vt.查禁/vt.抑制/vt.忍住/vt.阻止…的生长<,>The government suppressed the rebellion.<,>政府镇压了叛乱。<,>She suppressed a laugh during the serious meeting.<,>在严肃的会议上她忍住了笑。<,>This medication helps suppress coughs.<,>这种药有助于止咳。<,>sup(下) + press(压)→压下去→镇压<,>express(v.表达)/oppress(v.压迫)  

pudding<,>/ˈpʊdɪŋ/<,>/ˈpʊdɪŋ/<,>n.布丁<,>We had chocolate pudding for dessert.<,>我们吃了巧克力布丁作为甜点。<,>She makes the best rice pudding.<,>她做的米布丁最好吃。<,>The proof of the pudding is in the eating.<,>布丁好不好，吃了才知道(实践出真知)。<,>pud(拟声词) + ding(叮)→布丁<,>padding(n.填充物)/puddle(n.水坑)  

wrinkle<,>/ˈrɪŋkl/<,>/ˈrɪŋkəl/<,>v.起皱纹/n.皱纹<,>She wrinkled her nose at the strange smell.<,>闻到奇怪的气味，她皱起了鼻子。<,>His face was full of wrinkles from years of smiling.<,>他脸上因常年微笑而布满皱纹。<,>This fabric won't wrinkle easily.<,>这种布料不容易起皱。<,>wr(扭曲) + inkle(小)→小扭曲→皱纹<,>twinkle(v.闪烁)/sprinkle(v.洒)
consensus<,>/kənˈsen.səs/<,>/kənˈsen.səs/<,>n.一致/n.一致同意<,>The committee reached a consensus on the new policy.<,>委员会就新政策达成了一致。<,>There is a general consensus that climate change is a serious issue.<,>人们普遍认为气候变化是一个严重的问题。<,>The consensus among experts is that the treatment is effective.<,>专家们一致认为这种治疗是有效的。<,>con(共同)+sens(感觉)+us→共同的感觉→一致<,>consent(v.同意/n.许可)/census(n.人口普查)/consequence(n.结果)

boring<,>/ˈbɔː.rɪŋ/<,>/ˈbɔːr.ɪŋ/<,>adj.令人厌烦的/adj.乏味的/adj.无聊的<,>The lecture was so boring that many students fell asleep.<,>讲座太无聊了，很多学生都睡着了。<,>I find this movie boring because the plot is predictable.<,>我觉得这部电影很乏味，因为情节可以预测。<,>He has a boring job that doesn't challenge him.<,>他有一份不具挑战性的无聊工作。<,>bore(使厌烦)+ing→令人厌烦的<,>bored(adj.感到无聊的)/boring(adj.令人无聊的)/boaring(v.钻孔)

classic<,>/ˈklæs.ɪk/<,>/ˈklæs.ɪk/<,>adj.最优秀的/adj.典型的/adj.标准的/adj.传统式样的/adj.典雅的/n.文学名著/n.经典作品/n.杰作/n.优秀的典范<,>This is a classic example of Renaissance architecture.<,>这是文艺复兴时期建筑的典型例子。<,>She was wearing a classic black dress to the party.<,>她穿着一件典雅的黑色连衣裙去参加派对。<,>"Pride and Prejudice" is considered a classic of English literature.<,>《傲慢与偏见》被认为是英国文学的经典之作。<,>class(等级)+ic→最高等级的→最优秀的<,>classical(adj.古典的)/classy(adj.优等的)/classification(n.分类)

supervise<,>/ˈsuː.pə.vaɪz/<,>/ˈsuː.pɚ.vaɪz/<,>v.监督/v.管理/v.指导<,>The teacher supervises the students during the exam.<,>老师在考试期间监督学生。<,>He was hired to supervise the construction project.<,>他被雇来监督这个建设项目。<,>It's important to supervise children when they're swimming.<,>孩子们游泳时监督他们很重要。<,>super(在上面)+vis(看)+e→在上面看→监督<,>supervisor(n.监督人)/supervision(n.监督)/supervisory(adj.监督的)

gossip<,>/ˈɡɒs.ɪp/<,>/ˈɡɑː.sɪp/<,>vi.传播流言蜚语/n.流言蜚语/n.爱说长道短的人<,>She loves to gossip about her neighbors.<,>她喜欢八卦她的邻居。<,>The gossip spread quickly through the office.<,>流言在办公室里迅速传播。<,>Don't believe everything you hear - it's just gossip.<,>不要相信你听到的一切——那只是流言蜚语。<,>go(去)+ssip(看作sip啜饮)→到处去啜饮消息→传播流言<,>gossipy(adj.爱说闲话的)/gossamer(n.蛛丝)/gospel(n.福音)

describe<,>/dɪˈskraɪb/<,>/dɪˈskraɪb/<,>vt.形容/vt.描写/vt.画出<,>Can you describe what the suspect looks like?<,>你能描述一下嫌疑犯的样子吗？<,>The author describes the scene in great detail.<,>作者非常详细地描写了这个场景。<,>The diagram describes the process of photosynthesis.<,>这个图表描述了光合作用的过程。<,>de(加强)+scribe(写)→描写<,>description(n.描述)/descriptive(adj.描写的)/inscribe(v.刻写)

dilemma<,>/dɪˈlem.ə/<,>/dɪˈlem.ə/<,>n.窘境/n.困境<,>She faced a dilemma: to tell the truth or to protect her friend.<,>她面临一个困境：是说真话还是保护她的朋友。<,>It's a moral dilemma that has no easy solution.<,>这是一个没有简单解决方案的道德困境。<,>The company is in a financial dilemma.<,>公司陷入了财务困境。<,>di(二)+lemma(假设)→在两个假设之间→困境<,>dilettante(n.业余爱好者)/dilate(v.扩大)/dilapidated(adj.破旧的)

engagement<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ.mənt/<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ.mənt/<,>n.订婚/n.婚约/n.约会<,>They announced their engagement at the family dinner.<,>他们在家庭晚餐上宣布了订婚的消息。<,>I have a prior engagement and can't attend the meeting.<,>我有约在先，不能参加会议。<,>The professor has a speaking engagement next week.<,>教授下周有一个演讲约会。<,>engage(从事)+ment→从事的状态→订婚/约会<,>engaged(adj.已订婚的)/engaging(adj.迷人的)/engagement(n.交战)

wealthy<,>/ˈwel.θi/<,>/ˈwel.θi/<,>adj.富的/adj.富裕的<,>The wealthy businessman donated millions to charity.<,>这位富有的商人向慈善机构捐赠了数百万。<,>They live in a wealthy neighborhood.<,>他们住在一个富裕的社区。<,>She comes from a wealthy family.<,>她来自一个富裕的家庭。<,>wealth(财富)+y→富有的<,>healthy(adj.健康的)/stealthy(adj.隐秘的)/wealth(n.财富)

slum<,>/slʌm/<,>/slʌm/<,>n.贫民窟<,>The government is working to improve conditions in the slums.<,>政府正在努力改善贫民窟的条件。<,>He grew up in a slum but became very successful.<,>他在贫民窟长大，但后来非常成功。<,>The documentary exposes the harsh reality of life in the slums.<,>这部纪录片揭露了贫民窟生活的残酷现实。<,>s(看作soil土壤)+lum(看作lump块)→土壤块→贫民窟<,>slump(v.暴跌/n.萧条)/slumber(v.睡眠)/slummy(adj.贫民窟的)
foam<,>/fəʊm/<,>/foʊm/<,>vi.起泡沫/vi.吐白沫/n.泡沫/n.泡沫材料/n.泡沫状物<,>The beer had a thick foam on top.<,>啤酒上面有一层厚厚的泡沫。<,>The waves foamed as they crashed against the rocks.<,>海浪拍打岩石时泛起泡沫。<,>She used foam padding to protect the fragile items.<,>她用泡沫材料包裹易碎物品。<,>联想：foam→form(形状)→泡沫有各种形状<,>fame(n.名声)/foil(n.箔/vt.挫败)  

disregard<,>/ˌdɪsrɪˈɡɑːd/<,>/ˌdɪsrɪˈɡɑːrd/<,>vt.不理会/vt.漠视/n.忽视/n.漠视<,>He completely disregarded my advice.<,>他完全无视我的建议。<,>This safety rule should not be treated with disregard.<,>这条安全规则不容忽视。<,>Her disregard for authority got her into trouble.<,>她对权威的漠视给自己惹了麻烦。<,>dis(否定)+regard(注意)→不注意→忽视<,>discard(vt.丢弃)/disgrace(n.耻辱)  

administration<,>/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃn/<,>/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃn/<,>n.管理/n.管理部门/n.行政机关/n.实行/n.执行<,>The new administration will take office next month.<,>新行政部门将于下月就职。<,>Hospital administration requires special training.<,>医院管理需要专门培训。<,>The administration of justice is very important.<,>司法执行非常重要。<,>administer(管理)+ation→管理行为<,>admonition(n.警告)/admiration(n.钦佩)  

occasional<,>/əˈkeɪʒənl/<,>/əˈkeɪʒənl/<,>adj.偶尔的/adj.间或发生的<,>He makes occasional visits to his hometown.<,>他偶尔回故乡看看。<,>We have occasional rain in the desert.<,>沙漠里偶尔会下雨。<,>She smokes an occasional cigarette.<,>她偶尔抽支烟。<,>occasion(场合)+al→特定场合的→偶尔的<,>occupational(adj.职业的)/obsessional(adj.强迫性的)  

dwell<,>/dwel/<,>/dwel/<,>vi.居住<,>They dwell in a small village.<,>他们住在一个小村庄里。<,>Don't dwell on past mistakes.<,>不要老想着过去的错误。<,>Fairies are said to dwell in these woods.<,>据说仙女们居住在这片森林里。<,>d(地)+well(好)→好地方适合居住<,>swell(v.肿胀)/dwindle(v.减少)  

incorporate<,>/ɪnˈkɔːpəreɪt/<,>/ɪnˈkɔːrpəreɪt/<,>vt.包含/vt.加上/vt.吸收/vt.把...合并/vt.使并入<,>The design incorporates many safety features.<,>这个设计包含许多安全特性。<,>We'll incorporate your suggestions into the plan.<,>我们会把你的建议纳入计划。<,>The company was incorporated in 1995.<,>该公司成立于1995年。<,>in(进入)+corporate(团体的)→使成为团体一部分<,>incorporeal(adj.无形的)/incarcerate(vt.监禁)  

debate<,>/dɪˈbeɪt/<,>/dɪˈbeɪt/<,>n.争论/v.争论/n.辩论/v.辩论<,>The debate about climate change continues.<,>关于气候变化的争论仍在继续。<,>They debated the issue for hours.<,>他们就这个问题辩论了好几个小时。<,>After much debate, we decided to cancel the trip.<,>经过多次讨论，我们决定取消这次旅行。<,>de(加强)+bate(打)→言语上的打击→辩论<,>rebate(n.回扣)/debase(vt.贬低)  

extinguish<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>/ɪkˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>vt.熄灭/vt.扑灭/vt.使消亡/vt.使破灭<,>Firefighters extinguished the blaze quickly.<,>消防员迅速扑灭了大火。<,>Nothing could extinguish his passion for music.<,>没有什么能熄灭他对音乐的热情。<,>The storm extinguished all the candles.<,>暴风雨吹灭了所有的蜡烛。<,>ex(出)+stingu(刺)+ish→把刺拔出→熄灭<,>distinguish(v.区分)/extinct(adj.灭绝的)  

vulnerable<,>/ˈvʌlnərəbl/<,>/ˈvʌlnərəbl/<,>adj.易受伤的/adj.脆弱的/adj.易受攻击的/adj.难防御的<,>Children are particularly vulnerable to this disease.<,>儿童特别容易感染这种疾病。<,>The troops were in a vulnerable position.<,>部队处于易受攻击的位置。<,>She felt vulnerable after the breakup.<,>分手后她感到很脆弱。<,>vuln(伤)+er+able→易受伤的<,>voluble(adj.健谈的)/valuable(adj.有价值的)  

furniture<,>/ˈfɜːnɪtʃə(r)/<,>/ˈfɜːrnɪtʃər/<,>n.家具<,>We need to buy new furniture for the living room.<,>我们需要为客厅购置新家具。<,>The antique furniture is very valuable.<,>这件古董家具非常珍贵。<,>All the furniture was destroyed in the fire.<,>所有家具都在火灾中损毁了。<,>furn(装备)+iture→家中装备→家具<,>furnace(n.熔炉)/future(n.未来)
segment<,>/ˈsɛɡmənt/<,>/ˈsɛɡmənt/<,>n.部分/n.片段/n.瓣<,>The orange was divided into several segments.<,>这个橙子被分成了几瓣。<,>He studied a segment of the population.<,>他研究了人口的一部分。<,>The worm's body is made up of many segments.<,>蠕虫的身体由许多节段组成。<,>seg(切割)+ment→切下的部分→片段<,>fragment(n.碎片)/section(n.部分)/portion(n.一部分)

counterpart<,>/ˈkaʊntəpɑːt/<,>/ˈkaʊntərpɑːrt/<,>n.与对方地位相当的人/n.与另一方作用相当的物<,>The Foreign Minister met his Chinese counterpart yesterday.<,>外交部长昨天会见了中国外交部长。<,>The CEO discussed the deal with her counterpart in the rival company.<,>首席执行官与竞争对手公司的首席执行官讨论了这笔交易。<,>This machine has no counterpart in our factory.<,>我们工厂没有与这台机器相当的设备。<,>counter(对应)+part(部分)→对应的部分→对应的人或物<,>equivalent(n.等价物)/parallel(n.平行物)/opposite(n.对立面)

preach<,>/priːtʃ/<,>/priːtʃ/<,>vi.布道/vi.说教/vt.宣讲/vt.竭力鼓吹<,>The priest preached about forgiveness.<,>牧师宣讲关于宽恕的道理。<,>He's always preaching about the benefits of exercise.<,>他总是鼓吹锻炼的好处。<,>She preached tolerance to her followers.<,>她向追随者宣扬宽容。<,>pre(前)+ach(说)→在前面说→布道<,>teach(v.教导)/reach(v.到达)/breach(n.违反)

flank<,>/flæŋk/<,>/flæŋk/<,>n.肋/n.肋腹/n.侧边/n.侧翼/vt.位于...的侧面<,>The castle was flanked by two towers.<,>城堡两侧各有一座塔楼。<,>He felt a pain in his left flank.<,>他感到左肋疼痛。<,>The general ordered an attack on the enemy's flank.<,>将军下令攻击敌人的侧翼。<,>fl(飞)+ank(岸)→飞向岸边→侧翼<,>blank(adj.空白的)/frank(adj.坦率的)/plank(n.木板)

donate<,>/dəʊˈneɪt/<,>/ˈdoʊneɪt/<,>vt.捐赠/vt.赠送<,>She donated a large sum to the charity.<,>她向慈善机构捐赠了一大笔钱。<,>Many people donated blood after the accident.<,>事故发生后许多人献血。<,>He donated his old clothes to the homeless shelter.<,>他把旧衣服捐给了无家可归者收容所。<,>don(给予)+ate→给予出去→捐赠<,>dominate(v.支配)/denote(v.表示)/devote(v.奉献)

pendulum<,>/ˈpendjələm/<,>/ˈpendʒələm/<,>n.摆/n.钟摆/n.摇摆不定的事态<,>The pendulum swung back and forth.<,>钟摆来回摆动。<,>Public opinion is like a pendulum.<,>民意就像钟摆一样摇摆不定。<,>The pendulum clock keeps accurate time.<,>摆钟走时准确。<,>pend(悬挂)+ulum→悬挂着摆动的东西→钟摆<,>pendant(n.垂饰)/pending(adj.未决的)/impending(adj.即将发生的)

defiance<,>/dɪˈfaɪəns/<,>/dɪˈfaɪəns/<,>n.违抗/n.藐视<,>He acted in defiance of the rules.<,>他的行为违抗了规则。<,>The protesters showed defiance towards the authorities.<,>抗议者表现出对当局的藐视。<,>Her defiance made the situation worse.<,>她的违抗使情况更糟。<,>de(不)+fi(信任)+ance→不信任→违抗<,>defiant(adj.挑衅的)/reliance(n.依赖)/compliance(n.顺从)

sovereign<,>/ˈsɒvrɪn/<,>/ˈsɑːvrən/<,>adj.拥有最高统治权的/adj.至高无上的/adj.具有独立主权的/n.君主/n.元首<,>The sovereign power resides in the people.<,>最高权力属于人民。<,>Singapore is a sovereign state.<,>新加坡是一个主权国家。<,>The sovereign addressed the nation on television.<,>国家元首在电视上向全国发表讲话。<,>sove(超过)+reign(统治)→超越统治的→至高无上的<,>reign(v.统治)/foreign(adj.外国的)/terrain(n.地形)

cater<,>/ˈkeɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈkeɪtər/<,>vi.满足需要/vi.迎合/vi.提供饮食及服务<,>The restaurant caters for weddings.<,>这家餐厅承办婚宴。<,>TV programs must cater to different tastes.<,>电视节目必须迎合不同的口味。<,>Our service caters to your every need.<,>我们的服务满足您的各种需求。<,>cat(猫)+er→猫喜欢被迎合→迎合<,>caterpillar(n.毛毛虫)/cauter(v.烧灼)/crater(n.火山口)

attractive<,>/əˈtræktɪv/<,>/əˈtræktɪv/<,>adj.有吸引力的/adj.引起注意的<,>She is a very attractive woman.<,>她是个非常有魅力的女人。<,>The offer was very attractive to investors.<,>这个报价对投资者很有吸引力。<,>The garden looks attractive in spring.<,>春天花园看起来很迷人。<,>at(向)+tract(拉)+ive→把注意力拉过来的→有吸引力的<,>abstract(adj.抽象的)/distractive(adj.分散注意力的)/contractive(adj.收缩的)
significant<,>/sɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt/<,>/sɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt/<,>adj.相当数量的/adj.重要的/adj.意义重大的/adj.意味深长的<,>There has been a significant increase in sales this year.<,>今年销售额有了显著增长。<,>Her smile was significant of her approval.<,>她的微笑意味着她同意了。<,>This discovery is significant for scientific research.<,>这一发现对科学研究意义重大。<,>sign(标记)+i+fic(做)+ant→做了标记的→重要的<,>insignificant(adj.不重要的)/magnificent(adj.宏伟的)

duplicate<,>/ˈdjuːplɪkeɪt/<,>/ˈduːplɪkeɪt/<,>adj.完全一样的/n.复制品/vt.复制/vt.重复<,>Please duplicate this document for the meeting.<,>请为会议复印这份文件。<,>He made a duplicate of the key.<,>他配了一把钥匙。<,>The experiment was duplicated in three different labs.<,>这个实验在三个不同的实验室重复进行。<,>du(双)+plic(重叠)+ate→使双重→复制<,>replicate(v.复制)/complicate(v.使复杂化)

bleed<,>/bliːd/<,>/bliːd/<,>vi.出血/vi.泌脂/vt.勒索<,>His nose started to bleed after the accident.<,>事故后他的鼻子开始流血。<,>The company was bleeding money due to poor management.<,>由于管理不善，公司资金大量流失。<,>She bled him for thousands of dollars.<,>她从他那里勒索了数千美元。<,>bl(血)+eed(动作)→流血<,>breed(v.繁殖)/blend(v.混合)

rein<,>/reɪn/<,>/reɪn/<,>n.缰绳/vt.控制/vt.约束<,>She pulled on the reins to stop the horse.<,>她拉紧缰绳让马停下来。<,>We need to rein in our spending.<,>我们需要控制开支。<,>He gave free rein to his imagination.<,>他让自己的想象力自由发挥。<,>re(回)+in(里面)→拉回里面→控制<,>reign(n.统治)/rain(n.雨)

decrease<,>/dɪˈkriːs/<,>/dɪˈkriːs/<,>v.减少/n.减少<,>The number of students has decreased this year.<,>今年学生人数减少了。<,>There was a decrease in temperature overnight.<,>夜间气温下降了。<,>We need to decrease our carbon footprint.<,>我们需要减少碳足迹。<,>de(向下)+crease(生长)→向下生长→减少<,>increase(v.增加)/crest(n.顶峰)

flutter<,>/ˈflʌtə(r)/<,>/ˈflʌtər/<,>vi.振翼/vi.飘动/n.紧张<,>The butterfly fluttered its wings.<,>蝴蝶拍打着翅膀。<,>Flags were fluttering in the breeze.<,>旗帜在微风中飘扬。<,>She felt a flutter of excitement before the performance.<,>表演前她感到一阵兴奋。<,>fl(飞)+utter(完全)→完全飞起来→振翼<,>flatter(v.奉承)/flitter(v.飞来飞去)

volunteer<,>/ˌvɒlənˈtɪə(r)/<,>/ˌvɑːlənˈtɪr/<,>v.自愿/n.志愿者<,>She volunteers at the local hospital.<,>她在当地医院做志愿者。<,>He volunteered to help with the project.<,>他自愿帮忙完成这个项目。<,>Many volunteers participated in the rescue operation.<,>许多志愿者参与了救援行动。<,>volunt(意志)+eer(人)→自愿的人<,>voluntary(adj.自愿的)/involuntary(adj.无意的)

overlap<,>/ˌəʊvəˈlæp/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈlæp/<,>v.重叠/n.重叠部分<,>The two circles overlap in the middle.<,>两个圆在中间重叠。<,>There is some overlap between the two theories.<,>这两种理论有些重叠之处。<,>Our working hours overlap by two hours.<,>我们的工作时间有两小时重叠。<,>over(上面)+lap(重叠)→在上面重叠<,>overlay(v.覆盖)/overlook(v.忽视)

materialism<,>/məˈtɪəriəlɪzəm/<,>/məˈtɪriəlɪzəm/<,>n.唯物主义<,>Modern society is often criticized for its materialism.<,>现代社会常因物质主义受到批评。<,>His philosophy is based on materialism.<,>他的哲学基于唯物主义。<,>Materialism emphasizes physical matter over spiritual values.<,>唯物主义强调物质重于精神价值。<,>material(物质)+ism(主义)→唯物主义<,>idealism(n.唯心主义)/spiritualism(n.精神主义)

installment<,>/ɪnˈstɔːlmənt/<,>/ɪnˈstɔːlmənt/<,>n.分期付款/n.部分<,>I'm paying for the car in monthly installments.<,>我按月分期付款购买这辆车。<,>The novel was published in installments.<,>这部小说是分期发表的。<,>The final installment of the payment is due next month.<,>最后一期付款下月到期。<,>in(进入)+stall(放置)+ment→分期放置→分期付款<,>installation(n.安装)/reinstall(v.重新安装)
mourn<,>/mɔːn/<,>/mɔrn/<,>v.哀悼/v.感到痛心<,>The whole nation mourned the death of the beloved leader.<,>全国人民哀悼这位深受爱戴的领导人的逝世。<,>She mourned for her lost childhood.<,>她为自己逝去的童年感到痛心。<,>He still mourns his wife after 10 years.<,>十年后他仍在哀悼亡妻。<,>mourn发音似"默哀"→哀悼<,>moan(v.呻吟/n.抱怨)/mournful(adj.悲哀的)  

cane<,>/keɪn/<,>/keɪn/<,>n.手杖/n.茎<,>The old man walks with a cane.<,>老人拄着手杖走路。<,>Sugar cane is widely grown in tropical regions.<,>甘蔗在热带地区广泛种植。<,>He tapped his cane impatiently on the floor.<,>他不耐烦地用手杖敲击地板。<,>cane与"can能"同音→手杖能助行<,>lane(n.小巷)/vane(n.风向标)  

trifle<,>/ˈtraɪfl/<,>/ˈtraɪfəl/<,>vi.嘲笑/vi.轻视/n.琐事<,>Don't trifle with her feelings.<,>不要玩弄她的感情。<,>It's just a trifle, don't worry about it.<,>这只是小事一桩，别担心。<,>He trifled away his fortune.<,>他把财产挥霍在琐事上。<,>tri(三)+fle→把事分成三份→琐碎<,>trivial(adj.琐碎的)/truffle(n.松露)  

migrate<,>/maɪˈɡreɪt/<,>/ˈmaɪɡreɪt/<,>vi.迁徙/vi.移栖/vi.移居<,>Birds migrate south for the winter.<,>鸟类迁徙到南方过冬。<,>Many people migrated to cities for work.<,>许多人迁移到城市工作。<,>These fish migrate upstream to spawn.<,>这些鱼洄游到上游产卵。<,>migr(移动)+ate→迁移<,>emigrate(v.移出)/immigrate(v.移入)  

Easter<,>/ˈiːstə(r)/<,>/ˈistər/<,>n.复活节<,>We color eggs for Easter.<,>我们为复活节彩绘鸡蛋。<,>Easter Sunday is a joyful celebration.<,>复活节周日是个欢乐的庆典。<,>The Easter bunny brings candy for children.<,>复活节兔子给孩子们带来糖果。<,>east(东方)+er→太阳从东方复活→复活节<,>eastern(adj.东方的)/Easterly(adj.向东的)  

submit<,>/səbˈmɪt/<,>/səbˈmɪt/<,>vi.屈从/vi.忍受/vt.提交<,>You must submit your application by Friday.<,>你必须在周五前提交申请。<,>He refused to submit to their demands.<,>他拒绝屈从于他们的要求。<,>I submit that the proposal needs revision.<,>我认为这个提案需要修改。<,>sub(下)+mit(送)→从下面送上去→提交<,>admit(v.承认)/commit(v.承诺)  

novelty<,>/ˈnɒvlti/<,>/ˈnɑːvlti/<,>n.新奇事物/n.新奇感/n.新颖物品<,>The novelty of the toy soon wore off.<,>这个玩具的新奇感很快就消失了。<,>She enjoys collecting Christmas novelties.<,>她喜欢收集圣诞小玩意。<,>Travel provides a sense of novelty.<,>旅行带来新奇感。<,>novel(新的)+ty→新奇<,>novel(n.小说)/novice(n.新手)  

occupy<,>/ˈɒkjupaɪ/<,>/ˈɑːkjupaɪ/<,>vt.占领/vt.占用/vt.占有<,>Troops occupied the capital city.<,>军队占领了首都。<,>This project occupies most of my time.<,>这个项目占用了我的大部分时间。<,>Her speech occupied twenty minutes.<,>她的演讲占了二十分钟。<,>oc(加强)+cupy(抓)→牢牢抓住→占领<,>occupant(n.占有者)/preoccupy(v.使全神贯注)  

string<,>/strɪŋ/<,>/strɪŋ/<,>n.细绳/n.一串/n.一行<,>She tied the package with string.<,>她用细绳捆扎包裹。<,>A string of pearls adorned her neck.<,>一串珍珠装饰着她的脖子。<,>The programmer fixed a string of code.<,>程序员修复了一行代码。<,>string本身就像一根绳子<,>sting(v.刺痛)/strong(adj.强壮的)  

boom<,>/buːm/<,>/bum/<,>vi.激增/n.繁荣/n.隆隆声<,>The economy is booming this year.<,>今年经济正在蓬勃发展。<,>We heard the boom of distant thunder.<,>我们听到远处雷声隆隆。<,>There's a baby boom after the war.<,>战后出现了婴儿潮。<,>象声词，模拟爆炸/繁荣的声音<,>bloom(v.开花)/doom(n.厄运)
absence<,>/ˈæbsəns/<,>/ˈæbsəns/<,>n.缺席,不在/n.缺席的时间,外出期/n.缺乏,不存在<,>His absence from the meeting was noticed by everyone.<,>他缺席会议被所有人注意到了。<,>She returned after a long absence.<,>她在长时间缺席后回来了。<,>There was a complete absence of evidence.<,>完全缺乏证据。<,>ab(离开)+sence(存在)→不存在<,>presence(n.出席)/absent(adj.缺席的)/abscond(v.潜逃)

abolish<,>/əˈbɒlɪʃ/<,>/əˈbɑːlɪʃ/<,>vt.彻底废除,废止<,>The government abolished the outdated law.<,>政府废除了过时的法律。<,>Slavery was abolished in the 19th century.<,>奴隶制在19世纪被废除。<,>They are campaigning to abolish the death penalty.<,>他们正在开展废除死刑的运动。<,>a(不)+bolish(生长)→不让其生长→废除<,>demolish(vt.拆除)/polish(vt.磨光)/establish(vt.建立)

attract<,>/əˈtrækt/<,>/əˈtrækt/<,>vt.吸引,引起...注意<,>The bright colors attract butterflies.<,>鲜艳的颜色吸引了蝴蝶。<,>Her performance attracted much attention.<,>她的表演引起了很多关注。<,>The museum attracts thousands of visitors each year.<,>这个博物馆每年吸引成千上万的游客。<,>at(向)+tract(拉)→拉过来→吸引<,>abstract(adj.抽象的)/distract(vt.分散注意力)/contract(n.合同)

cautious<,>/ˈkɔːʃəs/<,>/ˈkɔːʃəs/<,>adj.十分小心的,谨慎的<,>Be cautious when crossing the road.<,>过马路时要小心。<,>He gave a cautious reply to the question.<,>他对这个问题给出了谨慎的回答。<,>She's cautious about making new friends.<,>她对结交新朋友很谨慎。<,>caut(小心)+ious(形容词后缀)→小心的<,>conscious(adj.有意识的)/precautious(adj.预防的)/curious(adj.好奇的)

snatch<,>/snætʃ/<,>/snætʃ/<,>vi.一把抓住/vt.夺,夺走,抢走/vt.一下子拉,一把抓住/vt.抓住机会做,抽空做/n.片断<,>He snatched the letter from my hand.<,>他从我手中抢走了信。<,>She snatched a few hours' sleep.<,>她抓紧时间睡了几个小时。<,>I only caught a snatch of their conversation.<,>我只听到他们谈话的片段。<,>s(快速)+natch(抓)→快速抓住<,>scratch(vt.抓)/match(n.比赛)/patch(n.补丁)

blink<,>/blɪŋk/<,>/blɪŋk/<,>vi.眨眼睛/vi.闪亮,闪烁/n.眨眼睛/n.一瞬间<,>She blinked in the bright sunlight.<,>她在明亮的阳光下眨着眼睛。<,>The lights blinked on and off.<,>灯光忽明忽暗。<,>It happened in the blink of an eye.<,>这事发生在一瞬间。<,>bl(光亮)+ink(小)→小闪光→眨眼<,>brink(n.边缘)/blank(adj.空白的)/link(vt.连接)

summit<,>/ˈsʌmɪt/<,>/ˈsʌmɪt/<,>n.最高点,峰顶/n.最高级会议<,>They reached the summit at noon.<,>他们在中午到达了山顶。<,>The leaders met at the economic summit.<,>领导人们在经济峰会上会面。<,>This is the summit of his career.<,>这是他事业的顶峰。<,>sum(最高)+mit(送)→送到最高处→顶峰<,>submit(vt.提交)/summon(vt.召唤)/summer(n.夏天)

perfume<,>/ˈpɜːfjuːm/<,>/pərˈfjuːm/<,>n.香水,香料,香气/vt.使充满芳香/vt.洒香水于<,>She wears a light floral perfume.<,>她用着淡淡的花香香水。<,>The roses perfumed the whole room.<,>玫瑰使整个房间充满香气。<,>He bought an expensive French perfume for his wife.<,>他为妻子买了一瓶昂贵的法国香水。<,>per(完全)+fume(烟)→完全散发香气<,>fume(n.烟)/perforate(vt.穿孔)/perform(vt.表演)

magnify<,>/ˈmæɡnɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈmæɡnɪfaɪ/<,>vt.放大,扩大/vt.夸大,夸张<,>This microscope can magnify objects 100 times.<,>这台显微镜能把物体放大100倍。<,>He tends to magnify small problems.<,>他倾向于夸大一些小问题。<,>The photo was magnified to show details.<,>照片被放大以显示细节。<,>magn(大)+ify(使)→使变大→放大<,>magnificent(adj.壮丽的)/magnitude(n.量级)/modify(vt.修改)

redundant<,>/rɪˈdʌndənt/<,>/rɪˈdʌndənt/<,>adj.多余的,过剩的<,>Many workers were made redundant.<,>许多工人被裁员了。<,>The second paragraph seems redundant.<,>第二段似乎是多余的。<,>The system has redundant backup components.<,>这个系统有多余的备用部件。<,>red(再)+und(波浪)+ant→波浪再起→多余的<,>abundant(adj.丰富的)/redundancy(n.冗余)/recurrent(adj.反复出现的)
situated<,>/ˈsɪtʃueɪtɪd/<,>/ˈsɪtʃueɪtɪd/<,>adj.位于…的/坐落在…的/处于…境地的<,>The hotel is situated near the beach.<,>这家酒店位于海滩附近。<,>She found herself in a difficult situation.<,>她发现自己处境艰难。<,>The castle is situated on a hill.<,>城堡坐落在山上。<,>sit(坐)+uate(动词后缀)+ed(形容词后缀)→坐落于<,>located(adj.位于)/positioned(adj.放置的)  

recession<,>/rɪˈseʃn/<,>/rɪˈseʃən/<,>n.衰退/衰退期<,>The country is facing an economic recession.<,>该国正面临经济衰退。<,>Many businesses closed during the recession.<,>许多企业在衰退期间倒闭了。<,>The recession led to high unemployment rates.<,>经济衰退导致了高失业率。<,>re(回)+cess(走)+ion(名词后缀)→经济后退<,>depression(n.萧条)/inflation(n.通货膨胀)  

doubtless<,>/ˈdaʊtləs/<,>/ˈdaʊtləs/<,>adv.无疑地/肯定地<,>She will doubtless succeed in her career.<,>她无疑会在事业上取得成功。<,>Doubtless, he is the best candidate for the job.<,>毫无疑问，他是这份工作的最佳人选。<,>He will doubtless arrive on time.<,>他肯定会准时到达。<,>doubt(怀疑)+less(无)→无疑<,>certainly(adv.当然)/undoubtedly(adv.无疑)  

negative<,>/ˈneɡətɪv/<,>/ˈneɡətɪv/<,>adj.否定的/消极的/负的/阴性的/n.负片/底片/负数<,>He gave a negative answer to the question.<,>他对这个问题给出了否定的回答。<,>Her test results came back negative.<,>她的检测结果是阴性。<,>Don't focus on the negative aspects.<,>不要只关注消极方面。<,>neg(否定)+ative(形容词后缀)→否定的<,>positive(adj.肯定的/n.正片)/neutral(adj.中立的)  

impose<,>/ɪmˈpəʊz/<,>/ɪmˈpoʊz/<,>vt.把…强加/征<,>The government imposed new taxes.<,>政府征收了新税。<,>Don't impose your opinions on others.<,>不要把你的意见强加于人。<,>They imposed strict rules on the students.<,>他们对学生实行了严格的规则。<,>im(在…上)+pose(放)→强加<,>force(v.强迫)/levy(v.征税)  

statement<,>/ˈsteɪtmənt/<,>/ˈsteɪtmənt/<,>n.陈述/声明/结算单/报表<,>She made a public statement about the incident.<,>她就这一事件发表了公开声明。<,>Please check your bank statement regularly.<,>请定期检查你的银行对账单。<,>His statement was recorded by the police.<,>他的陈述被警方记录了下来。<,>state(陈述)+ment(名词后缀)→声明<,>declaration(n.宣布)/report(n.报告)  

trademark<,>/ˈtreɪdmɑːk/<,>/ˈtreɪdmɑːrk/<,>n.商标/牌号/特征/标记<,>The company registered its trademark.<,>该公司注册了商标。<,>His smile is his trademark.<,>他的微笑是他的标志。<,>This product has a famous trademark.<,>这个产品有一个著名的商标。<,>trade(贸易)+mark(标记)→商标<,>brand(n.品牌)/logo(n.标识)  

factor<,>/ˈfæktə(r)/<,>/ˈfæktər/<,>n.因素/因子/系数<,>Time is an important factor in this project.<,>时间是这个项目的重要因素。<,>Several factors contributed to his success.<,>几个因素促成了他的成功。<,>The weather is a key factor for the event.<,>天气是这次活动的关键因素。<,>fact(做)+or(名词后缀)→起作用的因素<,>element(n.元素)/component(n.组成部分)  

analogous<,>/əˈnæləɡəs/<,>/əˈnæləɡəs/<,>adj.类似的/相似的/可比拟的<,>The two situations are analogous.<,>这两种情况类似。<,>This process is analogous to baking a cake.<,>这个过程类似于烤蛋糕。<,>Their experiences are analogous to ours.<,>他们的经历与我们的相似。<,>ana(类似)+log(说)+ous(形容词后缀)→类似的<,>similar(adj.相似的)/comparable(adj.可比的)  

substance<,>/ˈsʌbstəns/<,>/ˈsʌbstəns/<,>n.物质/实质/大意/要旨/根据/理由<,>Water is a vital substance for life.<,>水是生命的重要物质。<,>The substance of his argument was clear.<,>他论点的要旨很明确。<,>There is no substance to these rumors.<,>这些谣言毫无根据。<,>sub(在…下)+stance(站)→实质内容<,>material(n.材料)/essence(n.本质)
complexion<,>/kəmˈplekʃn/<,>/kəmˈplɛkʃən/<,>n.肤色/n.面色/n.局面/n.性质<,>Her fair complexion makes her prone to sunburn.<,>她白皙的肤色使她容易晒伤。<,>The political complexion of the country has changed dramatically.<,>该国的政治局面发生了巨大变化。<,>This lotion will improve your skin complexion.<,>这款乳液会改善你的肤色。<,>complex(复杂)+ion→复杂的面色或局面<,>completion(n.完成)/complexity(n.复杂性)  

continuity<,>/ˌkɒntɪˈnjuːəti/<,>/ˌkɑːntɪˈnuːəti/<,>n.连续/n.持续<,>There was no continuity between the two film scenes.<,>这两个电影场景之间缺乏连续性。<,>The continuity of care is important for patients.<,>持续的护理对病人很重要。<,>The TV series lost its continuity after the main actor left.<,>男主角离开后，这部电视剧失去了连贯性。<,>contin(继续)+uity(状态)→持续状态<,>continual(adj.连续的)/continuous(adj.不间断的)  

sculpture<,>/ˈskʌlptʃə(r)/<,>/ˈskʌlptʃər/<,>n.雕刻/n.雕塑/n.雕刻作品/n.雕塑品<,>The museum has a collection of ancient Greek sculptures.<,>博物馆收藏有古希腊雕塑品。<,>He learned the art of sculpture in Italy.<,>他在意大利学习了雕刻艺术。<,>This ice sculpture will melt by tomorrow.<,>这个冰雕到明天就会融化。<,>sculp(雕刻)+ture→雕刻品<,>sculptor(n.雕刻家)/architecture(n.建筑)  

target<,>/ˈtɑːɡɪt/<,>/ˈtɑːrɡɪt/<,>n.靶/n.标的/n.目标<,>The arrow hit the center of the target.<,>箭射中了靶心。<,>Our target is to finish the project by Friday.<,>我们的目标是在周五前完成这个项目。<,>The advertisement targets young consumers.<,>这个广告针对年轻消费者。<,>tar(柏油)+get(得到)→像柏油一样粘住目标<,>budget(n.预算)/forget(v.忘记)  

momentum<,>/məˈmentəm/<,>/moʊˈmentəm/<,>n.动力/n.冲力/n.势头/n.动量<,>The team gained momentum in the second half.<,>球队在下半场势头强劲。<,>The car's momentum carried it over the cliff.<,>汽车的冲力使它冲下了悬崖。<,>We need to maintain the momentum of our success.<,>我们需要保持成功的势头。<,>moment(瞬间)+um→瞬间爆发的力量<,>momentary(adj.瞬间的)/monument(n.纪念碑)  

wax<,>/wæks/<,>/wæks/<,>n.蜡/n.蜂蜡/vt.给...上蜡<,>She used wax to remove unwanted hair.<,>她用蜡脱毛。<,>The floor needs to be waxed regularly.<,>地板需要定期打蜡。<,>Bees produce wax to build their honeycombs.<,>蜜蜂分泌蜂蜡建造蜂巢。<,>wax→max(最大)→蜡膜可以最大化保护表面<,>wane(v.减少)/fax(n.传真)  

sensation<,>/senˈseɪʃn/<,>/sɛnˈseɪʃən/<,>n.感觉能力/n.感觉/n.知觉/n.轰动/n.引起轰动的事件<,>The news caused a sensation worldwide.<,>这个消息引起了全球轰动。<,>I lost all sensation in my fingers due to the cold.<,>由于寒冷，我的手指完全失去了知觉。<,>The new product created a sensation in the market.<,>这个新产品在市场上引起了轰动。<,>sens(感觉)+ation→感觉状态<,>sensitive(adj.敏感的)/sentiment(n.情绪)  

urban<,>/ˈɜːbən/<,>/ˈɜːrbən/<,>adj.都市的/adj.住在都市的<,>Urban life is fast-paced and exciting.<,>都市生活节奏快且令人兴奋。<,>Many young people prefer urban to rural areas.<,>许多年轻人更喜欢都市而非乡村。<,>The urban population has been growing rapidly.<,>城市人口一直在快速增长。<,>urb(城市)+an→城市的<,>suburban(adj.郊区的)/rural(adj.乡村的)  

furthermore<,>/ˌfɜːðəˈmɔː(r)/<,>/ˌfɜːrðərˈmɔːr/<,>adv.而且/adv.此外<,>The plan is too risky; furthermore, it's too expensive.<,>这个计划太冒险了，而且太贵。<,>He's qualified for the job, and furthermore, he has relevant experience.<,>他有资格做这份工作，此外他还有相关经验。<,>Furthermore, we need to consider the environmental impact.<,>此外，我们还需要考虑环境影响。<,>further(进一步)+more(更多)→更进一步说<,>moreover(adv.此外)/however(adv.然而)  

timely<,>/ˈtaɪmli/<,>/ˈtaɪmli/<,>adj.及时的/adj.适时的<,>Your timely intervention prevented a disaster.<,>你及时的干预避免了一场灾难。<,>The rain came at a timely moment for the crops.<,>这场雨对庄稼来说来得正是时候。<,>We appreciate your timely response to our request.<,>我们感谢您对我们请求的及时回应。<,>time(时间)+ly→符合时间的→及时的<,>untimely(adj.不合时宜的)/timid(adj.胆小的)
cape<,>/keɪp/<,>/keɪp/<,>n.斗篷/n.披肩/n.海角/n.岬<,>She wore a red cape to the party.<,>她穿了一件红色斗篷去参加派对。<,>The cape juts out into the ocean.<,>这个海角伸入海洋中。<,>He wrapped his cape tightly around himself in the cold wind.<,>他在寒风中紧紧裹住自己的披肩。<,>cape(斗篷)与shape(形状)相似，都有ape<,>cape(n.斗篷) vs. cap(n.帽子) vs. cope(v.处理)

discard<,>/dɪsˈkɑːd/<,>/dɪsˈkɑrd/<,>vt.丢弃/vt.抛弃/vt.遗弃<,>Please discard the empty bottles properly.<,>请妥善丢弃空瓶子。<,>He decided to discard his old habits.<,>他决定抛弃旧习惯。<,>The team had to discard their original plan.<,>团队不得不放弃最初的计划。<,>dis(不)+card(纸牌)→不要的牌→丢弃<,>discard(vt.丢弃) vs. disregard(vt.忽视) vs. discharge(vt.释放)

delicate<,>/ˈdelɪkət/<,>/ˈdɛlɪkɪt/<,>adj.纤细的/adj.易碎的/adj.微妙的/adj.精美的<,>Handle the delicate glassware with care.<,>小心处理易碎的玻璃器皿。<,>This is a delicate situation that requires tact.<,>这是个需要机智处理的微妙局面。<,>She wore a delicate lace dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件精美的蕾丝连衣裙去参加派对。<,>de(加强)+lic(引诱)+ate→非常吸引人的→精美的<,>delicate(adj.精美的) vs. dedicate(v.奉献) vs. delegate(n.代表)

rebel<,>/ˈrebəl/<,>/ˈrɛbəl/<,>vi.反叛/vi.造反/vi.反对/vi.不服从/n.反叛分子/n.反对者<,>The people decided to rebel against the unjust ruler.<,>人民决定反抗不公正的统治者。<,>She was always the rebel in her family.<,>她一直是家里的叛逆者。<,>Teenagers often rebel against their parents' rules.<,>青少年常常反抗父母的规矩。<,>re(反)+bel(战争)→反战→造反<,>rebel(v.反叛) vs. repel(v.击退) vs. revel(v.狂欢)

subsidy<,>/ˈsʌbsədi/<,>/ˈsʌbsɪdi/<,>n.津贴/n.补助金<,>The government provides subsidies for low-income families.<,>政府为低收入家庭提供补助金。<,>Farmers receive agricultural subsidies each year.<,>农民每年都会收到农业补贴。<,>The housing subsidy helped them afford the apartment.<,>住房津贴帮助他们负担得起公寓。<,>sub(下面)+sid(坐)+y→坐在下面支持→补助<,>subsidy(n.补贴) vs. subsidiary(adj.附属的) vs. subside(v.平息)

bounce<,>/baʊns/<,>/baʊns/<,>v.弹起/v.反弹/v.颠跳/n.弹/n.反弹<,>The ball bounced off the wall.<,>球从墙上弹了回来。<,>Her check bounced due to insufficient funds.<,>她的支票因为资金不足被退票了。<,>The children were bouncing on the trampoline.<,>孩子们在蹦床上跳来跳去。<,>boun(拟声词，弹跳的声音)+ce→弹跳<,>bounce(v.弹跳) vs. bound(v.跳跃) vs. ounce(n.盎司)

obscene<,>/əbˈsiːn/<,>/əbˈsin/<,>adj.淫秽的/adj.下流的/adj.可憎的/adj.可恶的<,>The movie was banned for its obscene content.<,>这部电影因淫秽内容被禁。<,>His obscene language shocked everyone.<,>他下流的语言震惊了所有人。<,>The amount of waste was obscene.<,>浪费的数量是可憎的。<,>ob(反对)+scene(场景)→反对的场景→淫秽的<,>obscene(adj.淫秽的) vs. obscure(adj.模糊的) vs. observe(v.观察)

tissue<,>/ˈtɪʃuː/<,>/ˈtɪʃu/<,>n.组织/n.薄绢/n.薄纸/n.手巾纸<,>She used a tissue to wipe her tears.<,>她用纸巾擦眼泪。<,>The doctor examined the muscle tissue.<,>医生检查了肌肉组织。<,>Gift wrapping tissue comes in many colors.<,>礼品包装纸有很多颜色。<,>tiss(编织)+ue→编织物→薄绢<,>tissue(n.纸巾) vs. issue(n.问题) vs. statue(n.雕像)

Thanksgiving<,>/ˌθæŋksˈɡɪvɪŋ/<,>/ˌθæŋksˈɡɪvɪŋ/<,>n.感恩节<,>We celebrate Thanksgiving with a big family dinner.<,>我们用大家庭晚餐庆祝感恩节。<,>Thanksgiving is a time to express gratitude.<,>感恩节是表达感激之情的时刻。<,>The Thanksgiving parade is an annual tradition.<,>感恩节游行是年度传统。<,>thanks(感谢)+giving(给予)→感恩的给予<,>Thanksgiving(n.感恩节) vs. thanksgivings(n.感恩祷告)

proficiency<,>/prəˈfɪʃnsi/<,>/prəˈfɪʃənsi/<,>n.熟练/n.精通<,>He has achieved proficiency in three languages.<,>他已经精通三种语言。<,>Her proficiency in math is impressive.<,>她的数学熟练程度令人印象深刻。<,>The job requires proficiency with computers.<,>这份工作需要精通电脑。<,>pro(前)+fic(做)+iency→提前做好→精通<,>proficiency(n.精通) vs. efficiency(n.效率) vs. deficiency(n.缺乏)
modest<,>/ˈmɒdɪst/<,>/ˈmɑːdɪst/<,>adj.谦虚的/adj.适中的/adj.羞怯的<,>She is very modest about her achievements.<,>她对自己的成就非常谦虚。<,>They live in a modest house.<,>他们住在一栋适中的房子里。<,>He gave a modest smile when praised.<,>受到表扬时，他露出了羞怯的微笑。<,>mod(方式)+est→做事有分寸的→谦虚的<,>moderate(adj.适度的)/humble(adj.谦逊的)/arrogant(adj.傲慢的)

cast<,>/kɑːst/<,>/kæst/<,>vt.投/vt.扔/vt.抛/vt.浇铸/n.演员表/n.全体演员/n.石膏绷带/n.铸型/n.铸件/n.投/n.抛<,>He cast a stone into the pond.<,>他把一块石头扔进了池塘。<,>The statue was cast in bronze.<,>这座雕像是用青铜浇铸的。<,>The cast of the play was excellent.<,>这部戏的演员阵容非常出色。<,>cast(扔)→投掷<,>caste(n.社会等级)/blast(n.爆炸)/fast(adj.快的)

vocational<,>/vəʊˈkeɪʃənl/<,>/voʊˈkeɪʃənl/<,>adj.职业的/adj.业务的<,>She is taking a vocational course in nursing.<,>她正在参加护理职业课程。<,>Vocational training is important for job seekers.<,>职业培训对求职者很重要。<,>He has vocational skills in carpentry.<,>他有木工职业技能。<,>vocation(职业)+al→职业的<,>avocation(n.业余爱好)/vocation(n.职业)/educational(adj.教育的)

crush<,>/krʌʃ/<,>/krʌʃ/<,>vt.压碎/vt.碾碎/vt.镇压<,>She crushed the can with her foot.<,>她用脚踩扁了罐头。<,>The machine crushes rocks into powder.<,>这台机器把石头碾成粉末。<,>The government crushed the rebellion.<,>政府镇压了叛乱。<,>cr(压)+ush→压碎<,>crash(n.碰撞)/brush(n.刷子)/rush(v.冲)

hatred<,>/ˈheɪtrɪd/<,>/ˈheɪtrɪd/<,>n.憎恶/n.憎恨/n.仇恨<,>She felt a deep hatred for her enemy.<,>她对敌人怀有深深的仇恨。<,>His words were full of hatred.<,>他的话充满了憎恨。<,>Hatred only leads to more suffering.<,>仇恨只会带来更多的痛苦。<,>hat(e)(恨)+red→憎恨<,>hate(v.憎恨)/heat(n.热)/heart(n.心)

slice<,>/slaɪs/<,>/slaɪs/<,>n.薄片/n.切片/n.部分/vt.切/vt.削/vt.剁<,>She cut a slice of bread.<,>她切了一片面包。<,>He sliced the apple into thin pieces.<,>他把苹果切成薄片。<,>A large slice of the budget was spent on education.<,>预算的一大部分用于教育。<,>sl(切)+ice→切片<,>splice(v.拼接)/spice(n.香料)/slide(v.滑动)

electron<,>/ɪˈlektrɒn/<,>/ɪˈlektrɑːn/<,>n.电子<,>An electron has a negative charge.<,>电子带负电荷。<,>Electrons orbit the nucleus of an atom.<,>电子围绕原子核旋转。<,>The movement of electrons creates electricity.<,>电子的运动产生电。<,>electr(电)+on→电子<,>proton(n.质子)/neutron(n.中子)/photon(n.光子)

embed<,>/ɪmˈbed/<,>/ɪmˈbed/<,>vt.把…嵌入/vt.扎牢/vt.使深留脑中<,>The bullet was embedded in the wall.<,>子弹嵌入了墙中。<,>He embedded the post in concrete.<,>他把柱子固定在混凝土中。<,>The memory is deeply embedded in her mind.<,>这段记忆深深印在她的脑海中。<,>em(进入)+bed(床)→嵌入<,>embark(v.上船)/embody(v.体现)/ember(n.余烬)

incline<,>/ɪnˈklaɪn/<,>/ɪnˈklaɪn/<,>n.斜坡/vt.使倾斜<,>The car rolled down the incline.<,>汽车沿着斜坡滑了下去。<,>He inclined his head to listen.<,>他侧着头倾听。<,>The road inclines steeply at this point.<,>道路在这里陡峭地倾斜。<,>in(向)+cline(倾斜)→斜坡<,>decline(v.下降)/recline(v.斜倚)/include(v.包含)

elevate<,>/ˈelɪveɪt/<,>/ˈelɪveɪt/<,>vt.提升…的职位/vt.提高/vt.改善/vt.使情绪高昂/vt.举起/vt.使上升<,>She was elevated to manager last year.<,>她去年被提升为经理。<,>Exercise can elevate your mood.<,>锻炼可以改善你的情绪。<,>He elevated the heavy box with effort.<,>他费力地举起了那个重箱子。<,>e(出)+lev(举)+ate→举起<,>levitate(v.飘浮)/alleviate(v.减轻)/elevator(n.电梯)
designate<,>/ˈdezɪɡneɪt/<,>/ˈdɛzɪɡˌneɪt/<,>vt.指派/vt.委任/vt.标出/vt.把…定名为<,>The manager will designate a team leader for the project.<,>经理将为这个项目指派一名团队领导。<,>The red line on the map designates the boundary.<,>地图上的红线标出了边界。<,>The area was designated as a national park.<,>该地区被定为国家公园。<,>de(强调)+sign(标记)+ate(动词后缀)→明确标记→指派<,>delegate(vt.委派)/design(n.设计/vt.设计)/resign(vt.辞职)  

promising<,>/ˈprɒmɪsɪŋ/<,>/ˈprɑːmɪsɪŋ/<,>adj.有希望的/adj.有前途的<,>She is a promising young artist.<,>她是一位有前途的年轻艺术家。<,>The weather looks promising for our picnic tomorrow.<,>明天的天气看起来适合我们的野餐。<,>This new drug shows promising results in early trials.<,>这种新药在早期试验中显示出良好的效果。<,>pro(向前)+mis(发送)+ing→向前发送的→有前途的<,>compromise(n.妥协)/premise(n.前提)/promissory(adj.约定的)  

slick<,>/slɪk/<,>/slɪk/<,>adj.圆滑的/adj.口齿伶俐的/adj.精巧的/adj.巧妙的/adj.灵巧的/adj.光滑的/adj.滑溜的<,>The salesman had a slick manner that made customers trust him.<,>这位销售员圆滑的举止让顾客信任他。<,>The roads were slick after the rain.<,>雨后道路很滑。<,>He came up with a slick solution to the problem.<,>他想出了一个巧妙的解决方案。<,>s(像蛇)+lick(舔)→像蛇一样滑溜的→光滑的<,>sleek(adj.光滑的)/click(n.咔嗒声)/slack(adj.松弛的)  

practicable<,>/ˈpræktɪkəbl/<,>/ˈpræktɪkəbəl/<,>adj.可行的/adj.适用的<,>The plan sounds interesting, but is it practicable?<,>这个计划听起来有趣，但它可行吗？<,>This method is not practicable in real-world situations.<,>这种方法在现实情况下不适用。<,>We need to find a more practicable solution.<,>我们需要找到一个更可行的解决方案。<,>practic(实践)+able(能…的)→能实践的→可行的<,>practical(adj.实际的)/practiced(adj.熟练的)/impracticable(adj.不可行的)  

item<,>/ˈaɪtəm/<,>/ˈaɪtəm/<,>n.条/n.条款<,>Please check each item on the list carefully.<,>请仔细检查清单上的每一项。<,>The contract includes several important items.<,>合同包含几个重要条款。<,>The first item on the agenda is the budget discussion.<,>议程上的第一条是预算讨论。<,>it(它)+em(名词后缀)→它作为一个条目→条款<,>iter(n.重复)/idem(pron.同上)/itemize(vt.逐条列出)  

counsel<,>/ˈkaʊnsl/<,>/ˈkaʊnsəl/<,>n.律师/n.法律顾问/n.忠告/n.劝告/vt.劝告/vt.提议<,>You should seek legal counsel before signing the contract.<,>在签署合同前你应该寻求法律顾问。<,>He counseled patience in dealing with the situation.<,>他建议在处理这种情况时要耐心。<,>The school counselor counseled the student about career options.<,>学校辅导员为学生提供了职业选择的建议。<,>coun(一起)+sel(拿)→一起拿主意→劝告<,>council(n.委员会)/consult(v.咨询)/console(vt.安慰)  

canvas<,>/ˈkænvəs/<,>/ˈkænvəs/<,>n.帆布/n.帆布画布/n.油画<,>The artist stretched the canvas before painting.<,>艺术家在绘画前绷紧了画布。<,>We need a canvas tent for the camping trip.<,>我们需要一顶帆布帐篷去露营。<,>Her latest work is an oil painting on canvas.<,>她最新的作品是一幅帆布油画。<,>can(能)+vas(走)→能行走的布→帆布<,>canvass(vt.游说)/vase(n.花瓶)/cavass(n.详细检查)  

superintendent<,>/ˌsuːpərɪnˈtendənt/<,>/ˌsuːpərɪnˈtɛndənt/<,>n.主管人/n.监管人/n.负责人/n.警长<,>The school superintendent oversees all the schools in the district.<,>学校主管人监督该地区的所有学校。<,>The building superintendent fixed the plumbing issue quickly.<,>大楼负责人迅速解决了管道问题。<,>He was promoted to superintendent of the police department.<,>他被提升为警察局的警长。<,>super(上)+intend(管理)+ent(人)→在上面管理的人→主管人<,>supervisor(n.监督人)/intendant(n.管理人)/superintend(vt.监督)  

probability<,>/ˌprɒbəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌprɑːbəˈbɪləti/<,>n.可能性/n.可能发生的事/n.概率<,>There's a high probability of rain tomorrow.<,>明天下雨的可能性很大。<,>In probability theory, we study random events.<,>在概率论中，我们研究随机事件。<,>What's the probability of winning the lottery?<,>中彩票的概率是多少？<,>prob(测试)+ability(能力)→可测试性→概率<,>probable(adj.很可能的)/probation(n.试用期)/improbability(n.不大可能)  

contention<,>/kənˈtenʃn/<,>/kənˈtɛnʃən/<,>n.论点/n.争论/n.争辩<,>His main contention is that the policy will hurt small businesses.<,>他的主要论点是该政策将损害小企业。<,>The two scholars were in contention over the interpretation of the text.<,>两位学者对文本的解释存在争论。<,>This issue remains a point of contention between the two parties.<,>这个问题仍然是两党之间的争论点。<,>con(一起)+tent(伸展)+ion→一起伸展观点→争论<,>content(n.内容)/intention(n.意图)/retention(n.保留)
lofty<,>/ˈlɒfti/<,>/ˈlɔːfti/<,>adj.高傲的/adj.傲慢的/adj.崇高的/adj.高尚的/adj.高耸的/adj.极高的<,>She had a lofty attitude towards her colleagues.<,>她对同事态度傲慢。<,>The lofty mountains were covered in snow.<,>高耸的山脉被白雪覆盖。<,>His lofty ideals inspired many people.<,>他崇高的理想激励了许多人。<,>loft(阁楼)+y(形容词后缀)→高耸的<,>haughty(adj.傲慢的)/elevated(adj.高尚的)

explicit<,>/ɪkˈsplɪsɪt/<,>/ɪkˈsplɪsɪt/<,>adj.详述的/adj.明确的/adj.明晰的/adj.直言的/adj.露骨的<,>The instructions were explicit and easy to follow.<,>这些说明很明确，容易遵循。<,>She was explicit about her disapproval of the plan.<,>她直言不讳地表示反对这个计划。<,>The movie contains explicit scenes of violence.<,>这部电影含有露骨的暴力场景。<,>ex(出)+plic(折叠)+it→把意思折叠出来→明确的<,>implicit(adj.含蓄的)/elicit(v.引出)

rely<,>/rɪˈlaɪ/<,>/rɪˈlaɪ/<,>vi.依靠/vi.依赖/vi.信赖/vi.指望<,>You can rely on me to keep your secret.<,>你可以相信我保守你的秘密。<,>Many people rely on public transportation.<,>许多人依赖公共交通。<,>Don't rely too much on luck.<,>不要太指望运气。<,>re(再)+ly(绑)→再次绑住→依赖<,>reply(v.回答)/relay(n.接力/v.转播)

slide<,>/slaɪd/<,>/slaɪd/<,>v.滑/v.悄悄地移动/n.滑动/n.滑道/n.滑面/n.幻灯片<,>The children love to slide down the hill.<,>孩子们喜欢从山坡上滑下来。<,>She slid the letter under the door.<,>她把信从门缝下悄悄塞进去。<,>Please prepare some slides for the presentation.<,>请为演讲准备一些幻灯片。<,>sl(滑)+ide→滑动<,>glide(v.滑行)/slip(v.滑倒)

utilize<,>/ˈjuːtəlaɪz/<,>/ˈjuːtəlaɪz/<,>vt.利用<,>We should utilize solar energy more effectively.<,>我们应该更有效地利用太阳能。<,>The old factory was utilized as a community center.<,>这座旧工厂被用作社区中心。<,>He utilized his time wisely during the vacation.<,>他在假期里明智地利用时间。<,>util(用)+ize(动词后缀)→利用<,>use(v.使用)/utility(n.效用)

sticky<,>/ˈstɪki/<,>/ˈstɪki/<,>adj.黏性的/adj.胶粘的/adj.湿热的<,>The tape is too sticky to remove easily.<,>这胶带太粘了，不容易撕掉。<,>It's a sticky summer day.<,>这是一个湿热的夏日。<,>His fingers were sticky with honey.<,>他的手指沾了蜂蜜，黏糊糊的。<,>stick(粘)+y(形容词后缀)→黏性的<,>tacky(adj.黏的)/humid(adj.潮湿的)

prevail<,>/prɪˈveɪl/<,>/prɪˈveɪl/<,>vi.流行/vi.盛行<,>This custom still prevails in some rural areas.<,>这个习俗在一些农村地区仍然盛行。<,>Justice will prevail in the end.<,>正义终将获胜。<,>A sense of optimism prevailed among the team.<,>团队中弥漫着乐观的情绪。<,>pre(前)+vail(强大)→在前面强大→盛行<,>prevalent(adj.流行的)/avail(v.有益于)

excessive<,>/ɪkˈsesɪv/<,>/ɪkˈsesɪv/<,>adj.过多的/adj.极度的<,>Excessive drinking is harmful to health.<,>过度饮酒有害健康。<,>She showed excessive concern about minor details.<,>她对小细节表现出过分的关注。<,>The price seems excessive for such a small item.<,>对于这么小的物品来说，价格似乎过高了。<,>ex(出)+cess(走)+ive(形容词后缀)→走出去的→过度的<,>extreme(adj.极端的)/exceed(v.超过)

denial<,>/dɪˈnaɪəl/<,>/dɪˈnaɪəl/<,>n.否认/n.拒绝/n.拒绝给予<,>His denial of the accusation was firm.<,>他坚决否认这项指控。<,>The government issued a denial of the rumor.<,>政府发表声明否认这个谣言。<,>Her request met with a flat denial.<,>她的请求遭到了断然拒绝。<,>deny(否认)+al(名词后缀)→否认<,>refusal(n.拒绝)/rejection(n.拒绝)

assault<,>/əˈsɔːlt/<,>/əˈsɔːlt/<,>n.攻击/n.袭击<,>The soldier was charged with assault.<,>这名士兵被指控袭击他人。<,>The city suffered an air assault during the war.<,>这座城市在战争期间遭受了空袭。<,>Verbal assault can be as harmful as physical violence.<,>言语攻击可能和身体暴力一样有害。<,>as(朝向)+sault(跳)→跳向→攻击<,>attack(n.攻击)/insult(n.侮辱)
implicit<,>/ɪmˈplɪsɪt/<,>/ɪmˈplɪsɪt/<,>adj.不言明的/adj.含蓄的/adj.内含的/adj.固有的/adj.无疑问的<,>Her implicit trust in him was touching.<,>她对他的含蓄信任令人感动。<,>The message was implicit in his tone.<,>信息隐含在他的语气中。<,>There was an implicit understanding between them.<,>他们之间有一种不言而喻的默契。<,>im(向内)+plic(折叠)+it→向内折叠的→含蓄的<,>explicit(adj.明确的/adj.清楚的)/implicate(v.牵连/v.暗示)

intensify<,>/ɪnˈtensɪfaɪ/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnsəˌfaɪ/<,>v.增强/v.加剧<,>The storm is expected to intensify overnight.<,>预计风暴会在夜间加剧。<,>They intensified their efforts to find a solution.<,>他们加大了寻找解决方案的力度。<,>The conflict has intensified in recent weeks.<,>冲突在最近几周加剧了。<,>in(使)+tens(伸展)+ify(使)→使伸展→增强<,>intensity(n.强度/n.强烈)/intensive(adj.密集的/adj.加强的)

feminine<,>/ˈfemənɪn/<,>/ˈfɛmənɪn/<,>adj.女性的/adj.女子的/adj.女子气的<,>She has a very feminine voice.<,>她的声音非常女性化。<,>The dress has a feminine design.<,>这条裙子设计得很女性化。<,>He was criticized for his feminine mannerisms.<,>他因女性化的举止受到批评。<,>femin(女人)+ine(…的)→女性的<,>masculine(adj.男性的/adj.男子气的)/feminism(n.女权主义)

purity<,>/ˈpjʊərəti/<,>/ˈpjʊrəti/<,>n.纯净/n.纯洁/n.纯正<,>The purity of the water is tested regularly.<,>水的纯净度定期检测。<,>She was admired for her moral purity.<,>她因道德纯洁而受到钦佩。<,>The purity of the diamond was unquestionable.<,>这颗钻石的纯度毋庸置疑。<,>pur(纯净)+ity(状态)→纯净<,>impurity(n.杂质/n.不纯)/purify(v.净化/v.提纯)

pattern<,>/ˈpætn/<,>/ˈpætərn/<,>n.型/n.式样/n.模/n.模型/vt.仿制/vt.使…仿效<,>The fabric has a floral pattern.<,>这块布料有花卉图案。<,>Children often pattern their behavior after adults.<,>孩子们常常模仿大人的行为。<,>The weather pattern has been unusual this year.<,>今年的天气模式很不寻常。<,>pat(拍打)+tern(形状)→拍打出的形状→图案<,>patent(n.专利/adj.明显的)/patter(v.喋喋不休/n.行话)

settle<,>/ˈsetl/<,>/ˈsɛtl/<,>v.安排/v.安放/v.调停/v.支付/v.核算/v.安家/v.飞落/v.停留/v.安定<,>They settled their differences amicably.<,>他们友好地解决了分歧。<,>He settled in Canada after retirement.<,>退休后他在加拿大定居。<,>The dust settled slowly after the explosion.<,>爆炸后灰尘慢慢落下。<,>set(放置)+tle→安放<,>settler(n.移民者/n.殖民者)/unsettle(v.使不安/v.扰乱)

heighten<,>/ˈhaɪtn/<,>/ˈhaɪtn/<,>v.提高/v.加强<,>The news heightened our anxiety.<,>这个消息加剧了我们的焦虑。<,>They heightened the fence for security.<,>他们加高了围栏以加强安全。<,>The music heightened the dramatic effect.<,>音乐增强了戏剧效果。<,>height(高度)+en(使)→使变高→提高<,>height(n.高度/n.海拔)/lighten(v.减轻/v.照亮)

vehicle<,>/ˈviːəkl/<,>/ˈviːhɪkl/<,>n.车辆/n.机动车/n.传播媒介/n.工具/n.手段<,>Bicycles are a popular vehicle in this city.<,>自行车是这个城市流行的交通工具。<,>Television is a powerful advertising vehicle.<,>电视是一种强大的广告媒介。<,>The virus can be a vehicle for disease.<,>病毒可以成为疾病的传播媒介。<,>veh(运送)+icle(小)→运送的小工具→车辆<,>vessel(n.船/n.容器)/vehicular(adj.车辆的/adj.交通工具的)

scrape<,>/skreɪp/<,>/skreɪp/<,>v.刮/v.擦/v.勉强过日子/n.刮/n.擦/n.刮擦声<,>She scraped the mud off her shoes.<,>她刮掉了鞋子上的泥。<,>They're just scraping by on his salary.<,>他们靠他的工资勉强维持生活。<,>I heard a scrape at the window.<,>我听到窗户上有刮擦声。<,>scrap(碎片)+e→刮出碎片→刮擦<,>scrap(n.碎片/v.废弃)/scratch(v.抓/n.抓痕)

web<,>/web/<,>/wɛb/<,>n.网/n.网络/n.错综复杂的事物<,>A spider was spinning its web.<,>一只蜘蛛正在织网。<,>The internet is a vast web of information.<,>互联网是一个巨大的信息网络。<,>He was caught in a web of lies.<,>他陷入了一个谎言的网络。<,>we(编织)+b→编织出的东西→网<,>website(n.网站)/weave(v.编织/n.织法)
femininity<,>/ˌfeməˈnɪnəti/<,>/ˌfɛməˈnɪnɪti/<,>n.女性气质<,>Her femininity shines through her graceful movements.<,>她优雅的举止展现了她的女性气质。<,>The dress accentuated her femininity.<,>这条裙子突显了她的女性气质。<,>Society often associates femininity with gentleness and empathy.<,>社会常常将女性气质与温柔和同理心联系在一起。<,>feminine(女性的)+ity(名词后缀)→女性气质<,>masculinity(n.男性气质)/feminism(n.女权主义)

plateau<,>/ˈplætəʊ/<,>/plæˈtoʊ/<,>n.高原/n.稳定时期<,>The climbers reached the plateau after days of hiking.<,>登山者们经过数天的徒步后到达了高原。<,>Her progress in learning the language has reached a plateau.<,>她在语言学习上的进步进入了一个稳定期。<,>The economy has been on a plateau for the past six months.<,>过去六个月经济一直处于稳定状态。<,>plat(平的)+eau(名词后缀)→平坦的高地→高原<,>plate(n.盘子)/platter(n.大浅盘)

tragic<,>/ˈtrædʒɪk/<,>/ˈtrædʒɪk/<,>adj.悲惨的/adj.可悲的/adj.悲剧的<,>It was a tragic accident that claimed many lives.<,>这是一场夺去许多人生命的悲惨事故。<,>His tragic story moved everyone to tears.<,>他悲惨的故事让每个人都感动得流泪。<,>She has a talent for playing tragic roles in theater.<,>她擅长在戏剧中扮演悲剧角色。<,>trag(悲剧)+ic(形容词后缀)→悲剧的<,>magic(n.魔术/adj.神奇的)/logic(n.逻辑)

grin<,>/ɡrɪn/<,>/ɡrɪn/<,>n.咧嘴笑<,>He gave me a mischievous grin.<,>他对我露出一个淘气的咧嘴笑。<,>She couldn't suppress a grin when she heard the good news.<,>听到好消息时，她忍不住咧嘴笑了。<,>The child's grin revealed a missing front tooth.<,>孩子的咧嘴笑露出了一颗缺失的门牙。<,>grin与green(绿色)发音相似，可以联想"笑得脸都绿了"<,>grim(adj.严峻的)/grind(v.磨碎)

grip<,>/ɡrɪp/<,>/ɡrɪp/<,>vt.握紧/vt.抓牢/vt.吸引住注意力/n.紧握<,>She gripped the railing tightly as the ship rocked.<,>船摇晃时她紧紧抓住栏杆。<,>The movie's opening scene gripped the audience immediately.<,>电影的开场场景立刻吸引了观众的注意力。<,>He has a firm grip on the situation.<,>他对局势有很好的掌控。<,>grip与grab(抓住)都有"抓"的意思<,>gripe(v.抱怨)/grit(n.砂砾)

reliance<,>/rɪˈlaɪəns/<,>/rɪˈlaɪəns/<,>n.依靠/n.依赖<,>Our reliance on technology has increased significantly.<,>我们对技术的依赖显著增加了。<,>He has complete reliance on his assistant.<,>他完全依赖他的助手。<,>Too much reliance on others can hinder personal growth.<,>过度依赖他人会阻碍个人成长。<,>rely(依赖)+ance(名词后缀)→依赖<,>alliance(n.联盟)/resilience(n.韧性)

explore<,>/ɪkˈsplɔː(r)/<,>/ɪkˈsplɔr/<,>v.探险/v.探索/v.仔细查阅<,>They set out to explore the uncharted island.<,>他们出发去探索那个未知的岛屿。<,>Scientists are exploring new treatments for the disease.<,>科学家们正在探索治疗这种疾病的新方法。<,>I need more time to explore all the options.<,>我需要更多时间来研究所有选项。<,>ex(出)+plore(流出)→探索未知领域<,>explode(v.爆炸)/exploit(v.开发)

display<,>/dɪˈspleɪ/<,>/dɪˈspleɪ/<,>n.陈列/n.展览/vt.显示<,>The museum has a special display of ancient artifacts.<,>博物馆有一个古代文物的特别展览。<,>Her phone displays beautiful high-resolution images.<,>她的手机能显示漂亮的高分辨率图像。<,>He displayed great courage in the face of danger.<,>面对危险时，他表现出极大的勇气。<,>dis(分开)+play(折叠)→展开显示<,>displease(v.使不悦)/displace(v.取代)

electricity<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɪsəti/<,>/ɪˌlɛkˈtrɪsɪti/<,>n.电<,>The storm caused a power outage and cut off electricity.<,>暴风雨导致停电，切断了电力供应。<,>This device runs on electricity.<,>这个设备靠电力运行。<,>She could feel the electricity in the air before the concert.<,>音乐会前她能感受到空气中的兴奋气氛。<,>electric(电的)+ity(名词后缀)→电<,>electronic(adj.电子的)/electrify(v.使通电)

climate<,>/ˈklaɪmət/<,>/ˈklaɪmɪt/<,>n.气候/n.风土/n.风气<,>The tropical climate is perfect for growing coconuts.<,>热带气候非常适合种植椰子。<,>The political climate in the country is tense.<,>该国的政治氛围很紧张。<,>We need to address the issue of climate change.<,>我们需要解决气候变化的问题。<,>cli(倾斜)+mate(伙伴)→地球倾斜造成的伙伴→气候<,>acclimate(v.适应气候)/climax(n.高潮)
tentative<,>/ˈtentətɪv/<,>/ˈtɛntətɪv/<,>adj.试探的/adj.试验的<,>She made a tentative suggestion during the meeting.<,>她在会议上提出了一个试探性的建议。<,>We have a tentative agreement on the project.<,>我们对这个项目达成了初步协议。<,>His tentative approach showed his uncertainty.<,>他试探性的方法显示出他的不确定。<,>tent(尝试)+ative(形容词后缀)→试探的<,>tempt(v.诱惑)/tenacious(adj.顽强的)

disorder<,>/dɪsˈɔːdə(r)/<,>/dɪsˈɔːrdər/<,>n.混乱/n.杂乱/n.骚乱<,>The room was in complete disorder after the party.<,>派对结束后房间一片混乱。<,>He suffers from a rare blood disorder.<,>他患有一种罕见的血液疾病。<,>The protest led to public disorder in the city.<,>抗议导致了城市的公共骚乱。<,>dis(否定)+order(秩序)→没有秩序→混乱<,>disarray(n.混乱)/disorganize(v.扰乱)/order(n.秩序)

aggravate<,>/ˈæɡrəveɪt/<,>/ˈæɡrəˌveɪt/<,>vt.加重/vt.加剧/vt.使恶化/vt.激怒/vt.使恼火<,>His comments only aggravated the situation.<,>他的评论只会使情况恶化。<,>The noise aggravated her headache.<,>噪音加重了她的头痛。<,>Don't aggravate me with your constant complaints.<,>不要用你不断的抱怨来激怒我。<,>ag(加强)+grav(重)+ate(动词后缀)→使加重<,>aggregate(v.聚集/n.合计)/mitigate(v.减轻)/irritate(v.激怒)

criticize<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsaɪz/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪˌsaɪz/<,>vt.批评/vt.评论/vt.非难<,>The teacher criticized his poor handwriting.<,>老师批评了他糟糕的书写。<,>She criticized the government's new policy.<,>她批评了政府的新政策。<,>It's easy to criticize but hard to create.<,>批评容易创造难。<,>crit(判断)+icize(动词后缀)→做出判断→批评<,>critique(n.评论)/critic(n.批评家)/praise(v.表扬)

preside<,>/prɪˈzaɪd/<,>/prɪˈzaɪd/<,>vi.主持/vi.主管<,>She will preside over the meeting tomorrow.<,>她将主持明天的会议。<,>The judge presided at the trial.<,>法官主持了审判。<,>He has presided the company for 10 years.<,>他主管这家公司已有10年。<,>pre(前)+sid(坐)+e→坐在前面→主持<,>reside(v.居住)/subside(v.平息)/president(n.总统)

economic<,>/ˌiːkəˈnɒmɪk/<,>/ˌɛkəˈnɑːmɪk/<,>adj.经济的/adj.经济学的/n.经济学/n.经济状况<,>The country is facing economic difficulties.<,>这个国家正面临经济困难。<,>She studies economic theory at university.<,>她在大学学习经济理论。<,>The economic growth has slowed down.<,>经济增长已经放缓。<,>eco(家)+nom(管理)+ic→管理家庭的→经济的<,>economy(n.经济)/economical(adj.节约的)/economics(n.经济学)

transistor<,>/trænˈzɪstə(r)/<,>/trænˈzɪstər/<,>n.晶体管/n.晶体管收音机<,>The invention of the transistor revolutionized electronics.<,>晶体管的发明彻底改变了电子学。<,>He still uses an old transistor radio.<,>他仍然使用一台老式晶体管收音机。<,>This circuit uses several transistors.<,>这个电路使用了几个晶体管。<,>trans(跨越)+ist+or→传递信号的装置→晶体管<,>resistor(n.电阻器)/conductor(n.导体)/semiconductor(n.半导体)

statistics<,>/stəˈtɪstɪks/<,>/stəˈtɪstɪks/<,>n.统计学/n.统计表<,>Statistics show that crime rates have fallen.<,>统计数据显示犯罪率已经下降。<,>She is good at mathematics and statistics.<,>她擅长数学和统计学。<,>Please refer to the statistics in the report.<,>请参考报告中的统计表。<,>stat(状态)+istics→研究状态的学科→统计学<,>static(adj.静态的)/status(n.状态)/statistician(n.统计学家)

grim<,>/ɡrɪm/<,>/ɡrɪm/<,>adj.讨厌的/adj.糟糕的/adj.严厉的/adj.冷酷的/adj.无情的<,>The situation looks grim for the company.<,>公司的形势看起来很糟糕。<,>He had a grim expression on his face.<,>他脸上带着冷酷的表情。<,>The teacher gave us a grim warning.<,>老师给了我们严厉的警告。<,>grim(冷酷的)→与grin(露齿笑)相反<,>grin(v.露齿而笑)/grime(n.污垢)/grimace(n.鬼脸)

giggle<,>/ˈɡɪɡl/<,>/ˈɡɪɡəl/<,>n.咯咯笑/n.傻笑<,>The children burst into giggles at the clown's antics.<,>小丑的滑稽动作让孩子们咯咯笑起来。<,>She tried to suppress a giggle during the serious meeting.<,>在严肃的会议上她努力忍住傻笑。<,>His silly joke caused a giggle among the audience.<,>他愚蠢的笑话引起了观众的咯咯笑。<,>giggle(咯咯笑)→与gargle(漱口)对比记忆<,>chuckle(n.轻声笑)/snicker(n.窃笑)/titter(n.偷笑)
offspring<,>/ˈɒfsprɪŋ/<,>/ˈɔːfsprɪŋ/<,>n.子女/n.子孙/n.后代/n.崽<,>The lioness protects her offspring fiercely.<,>母狮会凶猛地保护她的幼崽。<,>He is the offspring of a famous artist.<,>他是一位著名艺术家的后代。<,>Many animals care for their offspring until they can survive on their own.<,>许多动物会照顾它们的幼崽直到它们能够独立生存。<,>off(离开)+spring(春天)→春天离开父母→后代<,>spring(n.春天/v.跳跃)/descendant(n.后裔)/progeny(n.子孙)

arrest<,>/əˈrest/<,>/əˈrɛst/<,>vt.逮捕/vt.拘留/vt.停止/vt.阻止/n.逮捕/n.拘留/n.扣留<,>The police arrested the suspect at the scene.<,>警方在现场逮捕了嫌疑人。<,>The new drug may arrest the spread of the disease.<,>这种新药可能会阻止疾病的传播。<,>Her beauty arrested his attention immediately.<,>她的美貌立刻吸引了他的注意。<,>ar(加强)+rest(休息)→强行休息→拘留<,>rest(n.休息/v.依靠)/assert(v.断言)/asset(n.资产)

mature<,>/məˈtjʊə(r)/<,>/məˈtʃʊr/<,>adj.成熟的/adj.成年人的/adj.深思熟虑的/adj.到期的/adj.应支付的/vt.使成熟<,>This cheese needs more time to mature.<,>这种奶酪需要更多时间成熟。<,>She showed a mature attitude towards the problem.<,>她对这个问题表现出了成熟的态度。<,>The insurance policy will mature next month.<,>这份保险单下个月到期。<,>mat(垫子)+ure(状态)→像垫子一样经过时间沉淀→成熟<,>immature(adj.不成熟的)/nature(n.自然)/manure(n.肥料)

alleviate<,>/əˈliːvieɪt/<,>/əˈliviˌeɪt/<,>vt.减轻/vt.缓解/vt.缓和<,>The medicine helped to alleviate her pain.<,>这种药帮助减轻了她的疼痛。<,>We need to find ways to alleviate poverty.<,>我们需要找到缓解贫困的方法。<,>His kind words alleviated my anxiety.<,>他善意的话语缓解了我的焦虑。<,>al(加强)+lev(轻)+iate(使)→使变轻→减轻<,>elevate(vt.提升)/levitate(v.飘浮)/relieve(vt.缓解)

notification<,>/ˌnəʊtɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌnoʊtəfəˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.通知/n.告示/n.通知书<,>I received a notification about the meeting change.<,>我收到了会议变更的通知。<,>The app sends push notifications to users.<,>这个应用程序会向用户发送推送通知。<,>Please check the notification board for updates.<,>请查看通知板获取最新信息。<,>not(知道)+ify(使)+cation→使知道的东西→通知<,>certification(n.认证)/identification(n.识别)/ratification(n.批准)

overflow<,>/ˌəʊvəˈfləʊ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈfloʊ/<,>vi.满得外溢/vi.外流/vi.泛滥/vi.充满/vi.洋溢/vt.淹没/vt.从...中溢出/vt.多得无法容纳/n.容纳不下的物/n.溢出/n.满出/n.溢流口/n.溢流管<,>The river overflowed after heavy rains.<,>大雨过后河水泛滥了。<,>Her heart overflowed with joy.<,>她心中充满了喜悦。<,>The crowd overflowed the small auditorium.<,>人群多得挤满了小礼堂。<,>over(过度)+flow(流)→流得过多→溢出<,>inflow(n.流入)/outflow(n.流出)/flyover(n.立交桥)

provoke<,>/prəˈvəʊk/<,>/prəˈvoʊk/<,>vt.对...挑衅/vt.激怒/vt.激起/vt.引起<,>His rude remarks provoked an argument.<,>他粗鲁的言论引发了一场争论。<,>The article provoked strong reactions from readers.<,>这篇文章引起了读者的强烈反应。<,>Don't provoke the dog, it might bite.<,>别激怒那只狗，它可能会咬人。<,>pro(向前)+voke(喊叫)→向前喊叫→挑衅<,>evoke(vt.唤起)/revoke(vt.撤销)/convoke(vt.召集)

threaten<,>/ˈθretn/<,>/ˈθrɛtən/<,>v.威胁/v.恐吓/v.预示快要来临/v.构成威胁/v.可能发生<,>The manager threatened to fire him if he was late again.<,>经理威胁说如果他再迟到就解雇他。<,>Dark clouds threatened rain.<,>乌云预示着要下雨了。<,>Pollution threatens marine life.<,>污染威胁着海洋生物。<,>threat(威胁)+en(使)→使受到威胁→恐吓<,>treat(v.对待/n.款待)/thread(n.线/v.穿过)/heathen(n.异教徒)

enrich<,>/ɪnˈrɪtʃ/<,>/ɪnˈrɪtʃ/<,>vt.充实/vt.使丰富/vt.使富裕/vt.使富有<,>Reading can enrich your vocabulary.<,>阅读可以丰富你的词汇量。<,>The discovery of oil enriched the country.<,>石油的发现使这个国家富裕起来。<,>Traveling abroad enriched her life experience.<,>出国旅行丰富了她的生活经历。<,>en(使)+rich(富有)→使富有→丰富<,>impoverish(vt.使贫穷)/embellish(vt.装饰)/establish(vt.建立)

foil<,>/fɔɪl/<,>/fɔɪl/<,>n.箔/n.金属薄片/n.陪衬/n.衬托/vt.挫败/vt.使受挫折<,>Aluminum foil is used for wrapping food.<,>铝箔用于包装食物。<,>The hero's bravery was foiled by the villain's cunning.<,>英雄的勇敢被恶棍的狡猾所挫败。<,>Her plain dress served as a foil to her sister's glamorous outfit.<,>她朴素的裙子衬托出姐姐华丽的服装。<,>f(像箔的形状)+oil(油)→涂油的薄片→箔<,>coil(n.线圈/v.盘绕)/soil(n.土壤/v.弄脏)/boil(v.煮沸)
strain<,>/streɪn/<,>/streɪn/<,>v.扭伤/拉伤/尽力使用/紧张/拉紧/尽力/n.拉紧/过劳/极度紧张/张力/扭伤/拉伤/旋律/品种/家系/气质/个性特点<,>He strained his back while lifting the heavy box.<,>他在搬重箱子时拉伤了背部。<,>She strained to hear the faint sound.<,>她努力去听那微弱的声音。<,>The rope broke under the strain.<,>绳子在拉力下断了。<,>str(拉扯)+ain(后缀)→拉紧/扭伤<,>restrain(v.抑制/限制)/constrain(v.强迫/限制)/drain(v.排水/n.消耗)

negotiate<,>/nɪˈɡəʊʃieɪt/<,>/nɪˈɡoʊʃieɪt/<,>v.洽谈/协商/谈判/顺利通过/成功越过<,>The two companies are negotiating a merger.<,>两家公司正在谈判合并事宜。<,>She negotiated the sharp turn with skill.<,>她熟练地通过了急转弯。<,>They refused to negotiate with the terrorists.<,>他们拒绝与恐怖分子谈判。<,>neg(否定)+oti(空闲)+ate(动词后缀)→不让空闲→谈判<,>navigate(v.导航)/narrate(v.叙述)/nauseate(v.使恶心)

cellar<,>/ˈselə(r)/<,>/ˈselər/<,>n.地窖/地下室/酒窖<,>We stored the wine in the cellar.<,>我们把酒储存在地窖里。<,>The old house has a damp cellar.<,>这栋老房子有个潮湿的地下室。<,>He went down to the cellar to get some potatoes.<,>他去地窖拿了些土豆。<,>cell(小房间)+ar(场所)→地下小房间→地窖<,>collar(n.衣领)/caller(n.呼叫者)/cell(n.细胞)

tangle<,>/ˈtæŋɡl/<,>/ˈtæŋɡəl/<,>v.缠结/乱作一团/n.乱糟糟的一堆/混乱/复杂的问题/困惑<,>Her hair was in a tangle after the wind.<,>风吹过后她的头发乱成一团。<,>The wires got tangled together.<,>电线缠在一起了。<,>He's involved in a legal tangle.<,>他卷入了一场法律纠纷。<,>tan(纠缠)+gle(小)→小纠缠→缠结<,>triangle(n.三角形)/tango(n.探戈舞)/twinkle(v.闪烁)

package<,>/ˈpækɪdʒ/<,>/ˈpækɪdʒ/<,>n.包裹/包装/一揽子交易/vt.把…打包/包装<,>She received a package from her friend.<,>她收到了朋友寄来的包裹。<,>The government announced a new economic package.<,>政府宣布了新的一揽子经济计划。<,>He carefully packaged the fragile items.<,>他仔细地包装易碎物品。<,>pack(打包)+age(名词后缀)→包裹<,>packet(n.小包)/page(n.页)/patage(n.不存在词)

intrigue<,>/ɪnˈtriːɡ/<,>/ɪnˈtriːɡ/<,>vi.耍阴谋/施诡计/vt.激起…的好奇心/迷住/n.阴谋/诡计/密谋<,>The political intrigue was uncovered by journalists.<,>记者揭露了这起政治阴谋。<,>The novel's plot intrigued me.<,>小说的情节吸引了我。<,>They were intriguing against the government.<,>他们正在密谋反对政府。<,>in(进入)+trigue(复杂)→进入复杂状态→阴谋<,>integral(adj.完整的)/intrinsic(adj.内在的)/intrude(v.侵入)

orient<,>/ˈɔːrient/<,>/ˈɔːrient/<,>vi.转向特定方向/适应/vt.使适应/使熟悉情况/使朝向/n.东方/亚洲/东半球<,>We need to orient the map to the north.<,>我们需要把地图朝北摆放。<,>It took him time to orient himself to the new job.<,>他花时间适应新工作。<,>The company is orienting towards Asian markets.<,>公司正转向亚洲市场。<,>ori(升起)+ent→太阳升起的地方→东方<,>origin(n.起源)/ornament(n.装饰)/oriental(adj.东方的)

crisis<,>/ˈkraɪsɪs/<,>/ˈkraɪsɪs/<,>n.危机/存亡之际/关键阶段<,>The country is facing an economic crisis.<,>该国正面临经济危机。<,>He remained calm during the crisis.<,>他在危机期间保持冷静。<,>The patient is in a medical crisis.<,>病人处于医疗危急状态。<,>cri(判断)+sis(状态)→需要判断的状态→危机<,>critic(n.评论家)/criticism(n.批评)/criticize(v.批评)

handicap<,>/ˈhændikæp/<,>/ˈhændikæp/<,>n.缺陷/障碍/不利条件/vt.妨碍/使不利<,>His injury was a handicap in the race.<,>他的伤势是比赛中的不利条件。<,>The stairs handicap wheelchair users.<,>楼梯给轮椅使用者造成了障碍。<,>She overcame her physical handicap.<,>她克服了身体缺陷。<,>hand(手)+i+cap(帽子)→手持帽子乞讨→残疾<,>handicraft(n.手工艺)/handshake(n.握手)/handout(n.施舍物)

survival<,>/səˈvaɪvl/<,>/sərˈvaɪvl/<,>n.幸存/幸存者/残存物<,>Survival skills are important in the wilderness.<,>在野外生存技能很重要。<,>He was the sole survival of the accident.<,>他是事故的唯一幸存者。<,>This custom is a survival from ancient times.<,>这个习俗是古代的遗存。<,>sur(超过)+viv(生命)+al→超越生命→幸存<,>revival(n.复兴)/vivid(adj.生动的)/vivacious(adj.活泼的)
shatter<,>/ˈʃætə(r)/<,>/ˈʃætər/<,>vi.碎裂/vt.使粉碎,砸碎/vt.使破灭/vt.使震惊<,>The glass shattered into a thousand pieces.<,>玻璃碎成了无数片。<,>The news shattered his dreams.<,>这个消息粉碎了他的梦想。<,>Her scream shattered the silence.<,>她的尖叫声打破了寂静。<,>sha(谐音"杀")+tter→杀碎→粉碎<,>scatter(v.散开/n.分散)/batter(v.猛击/n.击球手)

plea<,>/pliː/<,>/pliː/<,>n.恳求,请求/n.抗辩,答辩,辩护/n.借口,托辞<,>He made a plea for help.<,>他恳求帮助。<,>The defendant entered a plea of not guilty.<,>被告提出无罪抗辩。<,>She used tiredness as a plea to leave early.<,>她以疲劳为借口提前离开。<,>plea(谐音"please")→请→恳求<,>plead(v.恳求/v.辩护)/flea(n.跳蚤)/glee(n.欢乐)

persuasion<,>/pəˈsweɪʒn/<,>/pərˈsweɪʒn/<,>n.说服,劝说/n.信念,信仰<,>She used gentle persuasion to change his mind.<,>她用温和的劝说改变了他的想法。<,>People of different political persuasions attended the meeting.<,>不同政治信仰的人参加了会议。<,>His persuasion skills are excellent.<,>他的说服技巧非常出色。<,>per(完全)+suas(劝告)+ion→完全劝服→说服<,>dissuasion(n.劝阻)/pervasion(n.扩散)/assuasion(n.缓和)

nutrition<,>/njuˈtrɪʃn/<,>/nuˈtrɪʃn/<,>n.营养<,>Good nutrition is essential for health.<,>良好的营养对健康至关重要。<,>The book provides information about child nutrition.<,>这本书提供了关于儿童营养的信息。<,>She studies nutrition at university.<,>她在大学学习营养学。<,>nutri(营养)+tion→营养<,>malnutrition(n.营养不良)/nutritious(adj.有营养的)/nutrient(n.营养素)

transfer<,>/trænsˈfɜː(r)/<,>/trænsˈfɜːr/<,>v.搬,转移/v.调动,转学/v.转让,过户/v.乘车,转乘<,>He transferred the money to another account.<,>他把钱转到了另一个账户。<,>She transferred to a new school last year.<,>她去年转到了新学校。<,>You need to transfer at the next station.<,>你需要在下一站换乘。<,>trans(转移)+fer(带来)→转移<,>transform(v.转变)/transmit(v.传输)/transact(v.交易)

indifferent<,>/ɪnˈdɪfrənt/<,>/ɪnˈdɪfrənt/<,>adj.冷漠的/adj.不积极的/adj.一般的/adj.平平的<,>He was indifferent to her feelings.<,>他对她的感受漠不关心。<,>She gave an indifferent performance in the play.<,>她在剧中的表现平平。<,>The food was indifferent, nothing special.<,>食物一般，没什么特别的。<,>in(不)+different(不同的)→没有不同→冷漠的<,>different(adj.不同的)/indifference(n.冷漠)

eagle<,>/ˈiːɡl/<,>/ˈiːɡl/<,>n.鹰<,>An eagle soared high in the sky.<,>一只鹰在高空中翱翔。<,>The eagle is a symbol of freedom.<,>鹰是自由的象征。<,>He has eyes like an eagle.<,>他有鹰一般锐利的眼睛。<,>ea(看作eye)+gle(看作gleam)→目光如鹰般锐利<,>beagle(n.小猎犬)/eager(adj.渴望的)
