acute<,>/əˈkjuːt/<,>/əˈkjuːt/<,>adj.严重的/adj.急性的/adj.灵敏的/adj.敏锐的/adj.精明的<,>He has an acute sense of smell.<,>他有敏锐的嗅觉。<,>She suffered from acute pain.<,>她遭受了剧烈的疼痛。<,>It was an acute observation.<,>这是个敏锐的观察。<,>acu(尖)+te→尖锐的→敏锐的<,>cute(adj.可爱的)/acute(adj.严重的)
limitation<,>/ˌlɪmɪˈteɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌlɪmɪˈteɪʃən/<,>n.限制/n.限度/n.局限<,>There are limitations to what technology can achieve.<,>技术能实现的东西是有限度的。<,>He was aware of his own limitations.<,>他清楚自己的局限。<,>The study has several limitations that should be considered.<,>这项研究有几个应该考虑的局限性。<,>limit(限制)+ation(名词后缀)→限制<,>limitation(n.限制)/limitation(n.限度)/limitation(n.局限)

jog<,>/dʒɒɡ/<,>/dʒɑːɡ/<,>n.慢跑/v.慢跑/n.轻轻碰撞/v.轻轻碰撞<,>I go for a jog every morning to stay healthy.<,>我每天早晨慢跑以保持健康。<,>She jogged my elbow and made me spill my coffee.<,>她轻轻碰了我的胳膊肘，让我把咖啡洒了。<,>He gave the table a jog to move it slightly.<,>他轻轻推了一下桌子，让它稍微移动。<,>jog(慢跑)→像钟摆一样有节奏的运动<,>jog(n.慢跑)/jog(v.轻轻碰撞)/jog(n.轻轻碰撞)

terrify<,>/ˈterɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈterəfaɪ/<,>vt.使害怕/vt.使惊吓<,>The loud noise terrified the little girl.<,>巨大的噪音吓坏了小女孩。<,>He was terrified of speaking in public.<,>他害怕在公共场合讲话。<,>The horror movie terrified the audience.<,>这部恐怖电影吓坏了观众。<,>terr(恐怖)+ify(使)→使害怕<,>terrify(vt.使害怕)/terrify(vt.使惊吓)/terrible(adj.可怕的)

handbook<,>/ˈhændbʊk/<,>/ˈhændbʊk/<,>n.手册/n.便览<,>This handbook contains all the rules and regulations.<,>这本手册包含了所有的规章制度。<,>She referred to the employee handbook for guidance.<,>她参考员工手册寻求指导。<,>The handbook provides useful tips for new students.<,>这本手册为新生提供了有用的提示。<,>hand(手)+book(书)→手册<,>handbook(n.手册)/handbook(n.便览)/notebook(n.笔记本)

ascertain<,>/ˌæsəˈteɪn/<,>/ˌæsərˈteɪn/<,>vt.弄清/vt.查明/vt.确定<,>We need to ascertain the facts before making a decision.<,>我们需要在做出决定前弄清事实。<,>The police are trying to ascertain the cause of the accident.<,>警方正在努力查明事故的原因。<,>It is difficult to ascertain the truth in this situation.<,>在这种情况下很难确定真相。<,>as(强调)+certain(确定)→弄清<,>ascertain(vt.弄清)/ascertain(vt.查明)/ascertain(vt.确定)

crucial<,>/ˈkruːʃ(ə)l/<,>/ˈkruːʃəl/<,>adj.至关重要的/adj.决定性的<,>This meeting is crucial for the future of the company.<,>这次会议对公司的未来至关重要。<,>Timing is crucial in this project.<,>在这个项目中，时机是决定性的。<,>Her testimony was crucial to the case.<,>她的证词对案件至关重要。<,>cruc(十字)+ial(形容词后缀)→决定性的<,>crucial(adj.至关重要的)/crucial(adj.决定性的)/critical(adj.关键的)

contribute<,>/kənˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>/kənˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>v.捐献/v.捐款/v.投稿<,>He contributes to charity every month.<,>他每月向慈善机构捐款。<,>She contributed an article to the magazine.<,>她向杂志投了一篇文章。<,>Everyone can contribute to the success of the team.<,>每个人都能为团队的成功做出贡献。<,>con(共同)+tribute(给予)→捐献<,>contribute(v.捐献)/contribute(v.捐款)/contribute(v.投稿)

insert<,>/ɪnˈsɜːt/<,>/ɪnˈsɜːrt/<,>vt.插入/vt.嵌入/vt.登载<,>Please insert the key into the lock.<,>请把钥匙插入锁中。<,>The magazine will insert an advertisement next week.<,>杂志下周将登载一则广告。<,>He inserted a comment into the discussion.<,>他在讨论中插入了一条评论。<,>in(进入)+sert(放)→插入<,>insert(vt.插入)/insert(vt.嵌入)/insert(vt.登载)

faith<,>/feɪθ/<,>/feɪθ/<,>n.信任/n.信心/n.信仰/n.信条<,>She has faith in her team's ability to win.<,>她对自己的团队能获胜有信心。<,>His faith helped him through difficult times.<,>他的信仰帮助他度过了困难时期。<,>We must keep faith with our promises.<,>我们必须信守诺言。<,>faith(信任)→与"fate"(命运)相关<,>faith(n.信任)/faith(n.信心)/faith(n.信仰)/faith(n.信条)

inspiration<,>/ˌɪnspəˈreɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌɪnspəˈreɪʃən/<,>n.灵感/n.鼓舞人心的人<,>The beautiful scenery was her inspiration for the painting.<,>美丽的风景是她这幅画的灵感来源。<,>He is an inspiration to all who know him.<,>他是所有认识他的人心中的鼓舞。<,>She found inspiration in nature.<,>她从大自然中找到了灵感。<,>in(进入)+spir(呼吸)+ation(名词后缀)→灵感<,>inspiration(n.灵感)/inspiration(n.鼓舞人心的人)/aspiration(n.渴望)
endurance<,>/ɪnˈdjʊərəns/<,>/ɪnˈdʊrəns/<,>n.忍耐力/n.持久/n.耐久<,>Marathon running requires great endurance.<,>马拉松需要极强的耐力。<,>His endurance of pain was remarkable.<,>他对疼痛的忍耐力惊人。<,>The material has excellent endurance to high temperatures.<,>这种材料具有极好的耐高温性。<,>endure(忍耐)+ance(名词后缀)→忍耐力<,>insurance(n.保险)/assurance(n.保证)/endanger(v.危及)  

highlight<,>/ˈhaɪlaɪt/<,>/ˈhaɪˌlaɪt/<,>vt.强调/vt.突出/vt.使显著/n.最精彩的部分/n.最重要的事件<,>The report highlights the need for better education.<,>报告强调了改善教育的必要性。<,>The concert's highlight was her solo performance.<,>音乐会最精彩的部分是她的独奏。<,>He used a marker to highlight the key points.<,>他用记号笔标出了重点。<,>high(高)+light(光)→使显著<,>spotlight(n.聚光灯)/headlight(n.前灯)/delight(n.高兴)  

candidate<,>/ˈkændɪdət/<,>/ˈkændɪdeɪt/<,>n.候选人/n.投考者/n.申请求职者<,>There are three candidates for the position.<,>这个职位有三名候选人。<,>She was a strong candidate for the scholarship.<,>她是奖学金的强力竞争者。<,>All candidates must submit their applications by Friday.<,>所有申请者必须在周五前提交材料。<,>candid(坦诚的)+ate(人)→候选人<,>certificate(n.证书)/delicate(adj.精致的)/candied(adj.糖渍的)  

strive<,>/straɪv/<,>/straɪv/<,>vi.努力/vi.奋斗/vi.力求<,>We must strive for excellence in our work.<,>我们必须力求工作精益求精。<,>She strove to overcome her fears.<,>她努力克服自己的恐惧。<,>They are striving to reduce pollution.<,>他们正努力减少污染。<,>str(看作strong)+ive→努力变强→奋斗<,>stride(v.大步走)/thrive(v.兴旺)/strife(n.冲突)  

database<,>/ˈdeɪtəbeɪs/<,>/ˈdeɪtəbeɪs/<,>n.数据库<,>The company maintains a large customer database.<,>公司维护着一个庞大的客户数据库。<,>You can search the database for relevant articles.<,>你可以在数据库中搜索相关文章。<,>New information is added to the database daily.<,>数据库每天都会添加新信息。<,>data(数据)+base(基础)→数据库<,>basement(n.地下室)/debate(n.辩论)/dateline(n.日期线)  

intelligible<,>/ɪnˈtelɪdʒəbl/<,>/ɪnˈtelɪdʒəbəl/<,>adj.可理解的/adj.明白易懂的/adj.清楚的<,>His explanation was barely intelligible.<,>他的解释几乎听不懂。<,>The instructions must be intelligible to all users.<,>说明书必须让所有用户都能看懂。<,>She spoke slowly to make herself intelligible.<,>她说得很慢以便让人听懂。<,>intel(在...之间)+lig(选择)+ible→可理解的<,>eligible(adj.合格的)/illegible(adj.难辨认的)/intellectual(adj.智力的)  

parallel<,>/ˈpærəlel/<,>/ˈpærəlel/<,>adj.并列的/adj.平行的/adj.类似的/adj.对应的/adj.并联的/n.可相比拟的事物/n.相似处/n.平行线/n.平行面/n.纬线/vt.与...相似/vt.与...相当/vt.比得上<,>The road runs parallel to the river.<,>这条路与河流平行。<,>There are interesting parallels between the two novels.<,>这两部小说有有趣的相似之处。<,>No one can parallel his achievements in this field.<,>在这个领域没人比得上他的成就。<,>para(旁边)+llel(线条)→平行线<,>paralyze(vt.使瘫痪)/parade(n.游行)/paradise(n.天堂)  

reject<,>/rɪˈdʒekt/<,>/rɪˈdʒekt/<,>vt.拒绝/vt.拒纳/vt.退回/vt.摈弃/n.被拒货品/n.不合格产品<,>The committee rejected his proposal.<,>委员会拒绝了他的提议。<,>The machine automatically rejects defective products.<,>机器会自动剔除次品。<,>She felt rejected by her friends.<,>她觉得被朋友们排斥了。<,>re(反)+ject(扔)→扔回去→拒绝<,>inject(vt.注射)/project(n.项目)/object(n.物体)  

hospitality<,>/ˌhɒspɪˈtæləti/<,>/ˌhɑːspɪˈtæləti/<,>n.友好款待/n.好客<,>We were overwhelmed by their hospitality.<,>他们的热情款待让我们受宠若惊。<,>The hotel is famous for its hospitality.<,>这家酒店以好客著称。<,>In this country, hospitality is considered a virtue.<,>在这个国家，好客被视为美德。<,>hospital(医院)+ity→像医院般照顾→好客<,>hostility(n.敌意)/hostel(n.旅社)/hospitable(adj.好客的)  

sheer<,>/ʃɪə(r)/<,>/ʃɪr/<,>adv.垂直地/adv.陡峭地/vi.急转向/vi.偏离/adj.完全的/adj.十足的/adj.陡峭的/adj.垂直的/adj.极薄的/adj.透明的<,>The cliff drops sheer to the sea.<,>悬崖垂直地插入海中。<,>It was sheer luck that we met.<,>我们相遇纯属运气。<,>She wore a sheer blouse.<,>她穿着一件透明的衬衫。<,>she(她)+er→她完全透明→十足的<,>shear(v.剪)/cheer(v.欢呼)/steer(v.驾驶)
imitation<,>/ˌɪmɪˈteɪʃən/<,>/ˌɪmɪˈteɪʃən/<,>n.模仿/n.仿制，伪制品/n.赝品<,>His imitation of the teacher's accent was spot-on.<,>他模仿老师的口音简直惟妙惟肖。<,>The painting is a clever imitation of the original masterpiece.<,>这幅画是对原作的巧妙仿制。<,>Be careful when buying luxury goods to avoid purchasing imitations.<,>购买奢侈品时要小心，以免买到赝品。<,>imit(模仿)+ation(名词后缀)→模仿的行为或产物<,>imitate(v.模仿)/limitation(n.限制)/initiation(n.开始)

compliment<,>/ˈkɒmplɪmənt/<,>/ˈkɑːmplɪmənt/<,>n.赞美，恭维/n.致意，问候/vt.赞美，恭维<,>She blushed at the unexpected compliment.<,>意外的赞美让她脸红了。<,>Please give my compliments to the chef for the delicious meal.<,>请代我向厨师致意，这顿饭很美味。<,>He complimented her on her excellent presentation skills.<,>他称赞她出色的演讲技巧。<,>com(完全)+pli(满足)+ment→让人完全满足的话→赞美<,>complement(n.补充物)/implement(n.工具)/supplement(n.增补)

blunder<,>/ˈblʌndə(r)/<,>/ˈblʌndər/<,>vi.跌跌撞撞地走/vi.慌乱地走/vi.犯错误/n.错误<,>In the dark, he blundered into a chair.<,>黑暗中他跌跌撞撞地撞上了椅子。<,>The company blundered by launching the product too early.<,>公司因过早推出产品而犯了大错。<,>Her speech was full of embarrassing blunders.<,>她的演讲充满了令人尴尬的错误。<,>bl(笨拙的)+under(在...下)→在笨拙状态下行动→犯错<,>plunder(v.掠夺)/thunder(n.雷声)/blunt(adj.钝的)

breach<,>/briːtʃ/<,>/britʃ/<,>n.破坏，违反/n.破裂，不和/n.缺口，裂口/vt.攻破，在...造成缺口/vt.破坏，违反<,>The data breach exposed millions of users' information.<,>这次数据泄露暴露了数百万用户的资料。<,>There was a serious breach in the dam after the flood.<,>洪水过后大坝出现了严重裂口。<,>Don't breach the contract or you'll face legal consequences.<,>不要违反合同，否则你将面临法律后果。<,>break(打破)的变体→打破规则或物体<,>beach(n.海滩)/preach(v.布道)/bleach(v.漂白)

original<,>/əˈrɪdʒənl/<,>/əˈrɪdʒənl/<,>adj.最初的/adj.新颖的/adj.原版的/n.原件，原作<,>The original plan was much more ambitious.<,>最初的计划要宏大得多。<,>Her artwork shows truly original thinking.<,>她的艺术作品展现了真正新颖的思维。<,>Keep the original document and send a copy.<,>保留原件，寄送复印件。<,>origin(起源)+al(形容词后缀)→与起源有关的<,>origin(n.起源)/aboriginal(adj.土著的)/originality(n.独创性)

comply<,>/kəmˈplaɪ/<,>/kəmˈplaɪ/<,>vi.遵从/vi.依从/vi.服从<,>All students must comply with the school rules.<,>所有学生都必须遵守校规。<,>The company failed to comply with safety regulations.<,>该公司未能遵守安全规定。<,>He reluctantly complied with their request.<,>他不情愿地服从了他们的要求。<,>com(共同)+ply(折叠)→共同折叠→顺从<,>apply(v.申请)/reply(v.回答)/supply(v.供应)

deviate<,>/ˈdiːvieɪt/<,>/ˈdiːvieɪt/<,>vi.背离/vi.偏离<,>The plane deviated from its scheduled route due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，飞机偏离了预定航线。<,>We should not deviate from our core values.<,>我们不应背离核心价值观。<,>His behavior deviated significantly from the norm.<,>他的行为明显偏离了常规。<,>de(离开)+via(路)+ate→离开道路→偏离<,>deviant(adj.偏离的)/deviation(n.偏差)/devious(adj.迂回的)

assignment<,>/əˈsaɪnmənt/<,>/əˈsaɪnmənt/<,>n.任务/n.指定的作业/n.分配，指派<,>The reporter received a dangerous overseas assignment.<,>记者接到了一项危险的海外任务。<,>Please complete the reading assignment by Friday.<,>请在周五前完成阅读作业。<,>Her assignment to the research team was unexpected.<,>她被分配到研究小组是出人意料的。<,>assign(分配)+ment(名词后缀)→分配的任务<,>alignment(n.排列)/consignment(n.托运)/designment(n.设计)

album<,>/ˈælbəm/<,>/ˈælbəm/<,>n.粘贴簿/n.集邮簿/n.相册<,>She keeps all her childhood photos in a special album.<,>她把所有童年照片都保存在一本特别的相册里。<,>The band released their new album last month.<,>乐队上个月发行了新专辑。<,>My stamp album contains some rare specimens.<,>我的集邮簿里有一些稀有邮票。<,>alb(白色)+um→古代白色书写板→记录本<,>alum(n.明矾)/albumen(n.蛋白)/albino(n.白化病患者)

stimulus<,>/ˈstɪmjələs/<,>/ˈstɪmjələs/<,>n.促进/n.刺激<,>The tax cut served as an economic stimulus.<,>减税起到了经济刺激的作用。<,>Light is a stimulus for plant growth.<,>光是植物生长的刺激因素。<,>The competition provided a stimulus for innovation.<,>竞争促进了创新。<,>stimul(刺激)+us→刺激物<,>stimulate(v.刺激)/stipend(n.津贴)/stimulant(n.兴奋剂)
electric<,>/ɪˈlektrɪk/<,>/ɪˈlɛktrɪk/<,>adj.电的/adj.电动的<,>She bought an electric car to reduce pollution.<,>她买了一辆电动车以减少污染。<,>The electric fan stopped working during the heatwave.<,>电风扇在热浪期间停止工作了。<,>He plays the electric guitar in a band.<,>他在乐队里弹电吉他。<,>electr(电)+ic(形容词后缀)→电的<,>electronic(adj.电子的)/electrical(adj.电的，电气科学的)  

bewilder<,>/bɪˈwɪldə(r)/<,>/bɪˈwɪldər/<,>vt.使迷惑/vt.使难住<,>The complex instructions bewildered the new employees.<,>复杂的说明让新员工感到困惑。<,>His sudden change of mood bewildered his friends.<,>他突然的情绪变化让朋友们很困惑。<,>The maze was designed to bewilder visitors.<,>这个迷宫是为了迷惑游客而设计的。<,>be(使)+wild(荒野)+er→使进入荒野般迷茫→使迷惑<,>bewildering(adj.令人困惑的)/perplex(vt.使困惑)  

regiment<,>/ˈredʒɪmənt/<,>/ˈrɛdʒəmənt/<,>n.团/n.大量/vt.严格地管制/vt.严密地编组<,>He served in the 5th Army Regiment.<,>他曾在第五陆军团服役。<,>A regiment of ants marched across the picnic blanket.<,>一大群蚂蚁爬过野餐毯。<,>The school regiments students into strict study schedules.<,>学校将学生编入严格的学习计划中。<,>reg(统治)+i+ment(名词后缀)→统治单位→团<,>regime(n.政权)/regimen(n.养生法)/regal(adj.帝王的)  

diminish<,>/dɪˈmɪnɪʃ/<,>/dɪˈmɪnɪʃ/<,>vi.变少/vi.变小/vi.降低/vt.减少/vt.减小/vt.降低<,>The water supply diminished after months of drought.<,>数月干旱后供水减少了。<,>His influence diminished after the scandal.<,>丑闻后他的影响力下降了。<,>We must not diminish the importance of this discovery.<,>我们绝不能贬低这一发现的重要性。<,>di(向下)+min(小)+ish(动词后缀)→变小<,>minimize(vt.使最小化)/minus(n.减号/prep.减去)  

surpass<,>/səˈpɑːs/<,>/sərˈpæs/<,>vt.超过/vt.优于/vt.多于/vt.超过…的界限/vt.非…所能办到<,>Her performance surpassed all expectations.<,>她的表现超出了所有人的预期。<,>The new model surpasses the old one in efficiency.<,>新型号在效率上超过了旧型号。<,>His achievements surpass those of his predecessors.<,>他的成就超越了前辈们。<,>sur(超过)+pass(通过)→超越<,>surpassing(adj.非凡的)/surplus(n.过剩/adj.过剩的)  

various<,>/ˈveəriəs/<,>/ˈvɛriəs/<,>adj.各种各样的/adj.不同的<,>We offer various solutions to the problem.<,>我们提供多种问题解决方案。<,>The museum has artifacts from various historical periods.<,>博物馆收藏有各个历史时期的文物。<,>She cited various reasons for her decision.<,>她列举了各种理由来解释她的决定。<,>vari(变化)+ous(形容词后缀)→多样的<,>variable(adj.易变的)/variety(n.多样性)  

depression<,>/dɪˈpreʃn/<,>/dɪˈprɛʃən/<,>n.抑郁/n.沮丧/n.不景气/n.萧条/n.洼地/n.凹陷<,>He suffered from depression after losing his job.<,>失业后他患上了抑郁症。<,>The Great Depression affected millions of people.<,>大萧条影响了数百万人。<,>There was a small depression in the ground where the meteor hit.<,>陨石撞击处地面有个小凹坑。<,>de(向下)+press(压)+ion(名词后缀)→情绪被压下→抑郁<,>depress(vt.使沮丧)/impression(n.印象)  

affiliate<,>/əˈfɪlieɪt/<,>/əˈfɪliˌeɪt/<,>vt.使隶属于/n.附属机构/n.分公司<,>The local club is affiliated with the national organization.<,>当地俱乐部隶属于全国性组织。<,>She works for an affiliate of a major tech company.<,>她在一家大型科技公司的分公司工作。<,>The university is affiliated to several research institutes.<,>该大学附属于多家研究所。<,>af(加强)+fili(子女)+ate→使成为子女→使隶属于<,>affiliation(n.附属)/filial(adj.子女的)  

unfold<,>/ʌnˈfəʊld/<,>/ʌnˈfoʊld/<,>v.展开/v.打开/v.显露/v.展现<,>She unfolded the letter carefully.<,>她小心地展开信件。<,>The events unfolded exactly as predicted.<,>事件完全按照预测的那样发展。<,>A beautiful landscape unfolded before us.<,>一片美丽的景色展现在我们面前。<,>un(打开)+fold(折叠)→展开<,>unfolded(adj.展开的)/enfold(vt.包裹)  

extent<,>/ɪkˈstent/<,>/ɪkˈstɛnt/<,>n.广度/n.范围/n.程度<,>We don't yet know the full extent of the damage.<,>我们还不知道损坏的全部程度。<,>The park covers an extent of 500 acres.<,>这个公园占地500英亩。<,>To some extent, I agree with your opinion.<,>在某种程度上，我同意你的观点。<,>ex(出)+tent(伸展)→伸展出的范围→广度<,>extend(v.延伸)/extensive(adj.广泛的)
equivalent<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələnt/<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələnt/<,>adj.相等的/adj.等量的/n.相等物/n.等价物<,>The two words are equivalent in meaning.<,>这两个词在意义上是相等的。<,>She gave me the equivalent of $100 in local currency.<,>她给了我相当于100美元的当地货币。<,>This job has no equivalent in our company.<,>这个职位在我们公司没有对应的岗位。<,>equi(相等)+val(价值)+ent→等价的<,>equal(adj.相等的)/equilibrium(n.平衡)/equivocal(adj.模棱两可的)

sensational<,>/senˈseɪʃənl/<,>/sɛnˈseʃənəl/<,>adj.轰动的/adj.耸人听闻的/adj.使人感动的/adj.非常好的<,>The news of the scandal was sensational.<,>这个丑闻的消息非常轰动。<,>She gave a sensational performance at the concert.<,>她在音乐会上表演得非常出色。<,>The movie has some sensational special effects.<,>这部电影有一些非常棒的特效。<,>sens(感觉)+ation+al→引起强烈感觉的→轰动的<,>sensitive(adj.敏感的)/sentimental(adj.多愁善感的)/sensible(adj.明智的)

wedge<,>/wedʒ/<,>/wɛdʒ/<,>n.楔/vt.楔入/vt.塞入<,>He used a wedge to keep the door open.<,>他用一个楔子让门保持开着。<,>She wedged her foot in the door to prevent it from closing.<,>她把脚塞进门里防止门关上。<,>The company is trying to wedge itself into the new market.<,>公司正试图挤进新市场。<,>wed(结婚)+ge→像结婚一样紧密结合→楔入<,>edge(n.边缘)/hedge(n.树篱)/pledge(n.保证)

alienate<,>/ˈeɪliəneɪt/<,>/ˈeɪliəˌneɪt/<,>vt.使疏远/vt.使不友好/vt.离间/vt.转让/vt.让渡<,>His rude behavior alienated his friends.<,>他粗鲁的行为疏远了他的朋友。<,>The government's policies have alienated many voters.<,>政府的政策让许多选民感到不满。<,>She decided to alienate part of her property to her son.<,>她决定把部分财产转让给儿子。<,>ali(别的)+en+ate→使变成别的→疏远<,>align(vt.使结盟)/allege(vt.宣称)/alleviate(vt.减轻)

brink<,>/brɪŋk/<,>/brɪŋk/<,>n.边缘/n.边沿<,>The country is on the brink of economic collapse.<,>这个国家正处于经济崩溃的边缘。<,>He stood on the brink of the cliff, looking down.<,>他站在悬崖边上往下看。<,>Their relationship is on the brink of breaking up.<,>他们的关系濒临破裂。<,>b(不)+rink(溜冰场)→不在溜冰场中心→边缘<,>blink(v.眨眼)/brick(n.砖)/briny(adj.咸的)

plague<,>/pleɪɡ/<,>/pleɪɡ/<,>n.瘟疫/n.鼠疫/n.灾难/n.祸患/vt.使痛苦/vt.给...造成困难<,>The plague killed millions of people in the Middle Ages.<,>中世纪时瘟疫夺去了数百万人的生命。<,>Financial problems have been plaguing the company for years.<,>财务问题多年来一直困扰着这家公司。<,>The region was plagued by drought last year.<,>该地区去年遭受旱灾。<,>plag(打击)+ue→打击人的东西→瘟疫<,>plaque(n.匾)/plagiarism(n.剽窃)/plangent(adj.哀鸣的)

perpetual<,>/pəˈpetʃuəl/<,>/pərˈpɛtʃuəl/<,>adj.永久的/adj.永恒的/adj.长期的/adj.无休止的/adj.没完没了的<,>They lived in perpetual fear of being discovered.<,>他们生活在永远害怕被发现的恐惧中。<,>The perpetual snow covers the mountain peaks.<,>终年不化的积雪覆盖着山顶。<,>Their perpetual arguing drove everyone crazy.<,>他们没完没了的争吵让大家都疯了。<,>per(贯穿)+pet(追求)+ual→一直追求→永久的<,>perpetrate(vt.犯罪)/perpetuity(n.永恒)/perplex(vt.使困惑)

retrospect<,>/ˈretrəspekt/<,>/ˈrɛtrəˌspɛkt/<,>n.回顾<,>In retrospect, I should have taken the job.<,>回想起来，我当初应该接受那份工作。<,>The book provides an interesting retrospect of the author's life.<,>这本书有趣地回顾了作者的一生。<,>The documentary offers a retrospect of the war years.<,>这部纪录片回顾了战争年代。<,>retro(向后)+spect(看)→向后看→回顾<,>prospect(n.前景)/inspect(vt.检查)/introspect(vt.反省)

fascinate<,>/ˈfæsɪneɪt/<,>/ˈfæsəˌneɪt/<,>vt.强烈地吸引/vt.迷住<,>The children were fascinated by the magician's tricks.<,>孩子们被魔术师的把戏迷住了。<,>She has always been fascinated by ancient history.<,>她一直对古代历史非常着迷。<,>The idea of traveling to Mars fascinates many people.<,>去火星旅行的想法吸引着许多人。<,>fasc(捆)+in+ate→像被捆住一样被吸引→迷住<,>fascia(n.带)/fascism(n.法西斯主义)/fastidious(adj.挑剔的)

colonial<,>/kəˈləʊniəl/<,>/kəˈloʊniəl/<,>adj.殖民地的<,>The country gained independence from colonial rule in 1947.<,>这个国家于1947年从殖民统治中获得独立。<,>Many colonial buildings still stand in the old city.<,>老城里仍有许多殖民时期的建筑。<,>The colonial policies had a lasting impact on the region.<,>殖民政策对该地区产生了持久的影响。<,>colon(殖民地)+ial→殖民地的<,>colony(n.殖民地)/colonize(vt.殖民)/colonel(n.上校)
warfare<,>/ˈwɔːfeə(r)/<,>/ˈwɔːrfer/<,>n.战争/n.斗争/n.冲突<,>Modern warfare relies heavily on technology.<,>现代战争高度依赖技术。<,>Psychological warfare is often used in negotiations.<,>心理战经常被用于谈判中。<,>The two tribes engaged in constant warfare.<,>这两个部落之间不断发生冲突。<,>war(战争)+fare(进展)→战争<,>welfare(n.福利)/warrior(n.战士)/farewell(n.告别)

draft<,>/drɑːft/<,>/dræft/<,>n.草稿/n.汇票/n.征兵/n.通风/vt.起草/vt.征募<,>He made a rough draft of his speech.<,>他写了一份演讲的草稿。<,>The bank issued a draft for the payment.<,>银行开出了一张付款汇票。<,>The government drafted young men into the army.<,>政府征召年轻人入伍。<,>dr(拉)+aft(后面)→拉出来→起草<,>craft(n.工艺)/daft(adj.愚蠢的)/graft(n.嫁接)

complex<,>/ˈkɒmpleks/<,>/kəmˈpleks/<,>adj.复合的/adj.复杂的/n.综合体/n.情结<,>The problem is too complex for a simple solution.<,>这个问题太复杂，无法用简单的方法解决。<,>She has a complex about her appearance.<,>她对自己的外貌有心理情结。<,>The shopping complex includes a cinema and restaurants.<,>这个商业综合体包括电影院和餐厅。<,>com(一起)+plex(折叠)→折叠在一起→复杂<,>simplex(adj.单一的)/duplex(adj.双重的)/perplex(vt.使困惑)

assumption<,>/əˈsʌmpʃn/<,>/əˈsʌmpʃn/<,>n.假定/n.臆断/n.担任/n.承担<,>His argument is based on a false assumption.<,>他的论点基于一个错误的假设。<,>She took over the assumption of leadership.<,>她承担起了领导责任。<,>Don't make assumptions about people you don't know.<,>不要对你不认识的人妄加臆断。<,>as(加强)+sumpt(拿)+ion→拿住→承担<,>consumption(n.消耗)/presumption(n.推测)/resumption(n.恢复)

humidity<,>/hjuːˈmɪdəti/<,>/hjuːˈmɪdəti/<,>n.湿度/n.潮湿/n.湿气<,>The high humidity makes the heat feel worse.<,>高湿度使炎热感觉更难受。<,>Plants need proper humidity to grow well.<,>植物需要适当的湿度才能生长良好。<,>The humidity in the bathroom caused mold to grow.<,>浴室的湿气导致了霉菌生长。<,>humid(潮湿的)+ity(名词后缀)→湿度<,>humidity(n.湿度)/humility(n.谦逊)/humidifier(n.加湿器)

rank<,>/ræŋk/<,>/ræŋk/<,>vi.列入/n.军衔/n.地位/n.排/vt.评定等级<,>He holds the rank of captain in the navy.<,>他在海军中拥有上尉军衔。<,>The university ranks among the top 10 in the country.<,>这所大学位列全国前十。<,>They stood in ranks waiting for inspection.<,>他们列队等待检阅。<,>ran(跑)+k→跑在前面→等级<,>bank(n.银行)/tank(n.坦克)/frank(adj.坦率的)

pamphlet<,>/ˈpæmflət/<,>/ˈpæmflət/<,>n.小册子<,>The tourist office provides free pamphlets about local attractions.<,>旅游局提供关于当地景点的免费小册子。<,>She wrote a pamphlet on healthy eating.<,>她写了一本关于健康饮食的小册子。<,>Political pamphlets were distributed before the election.<,>选举前分发了政治宣传小册子。<,>pam(手掌)+phlet(折叠)→手掌大小的折叠物→小册子<,>booklet(n.小册子)/leaflet(n.传单)/tablet(n.药片)

preparatory<,>/prɪˈpærətri/<,>/prɪˈpærətɔːri/<,>adj.预备的<,>He took a preparatory course before the exam.<,>他在考试前参加了预备课程。<,>The preparatory work took longer than expected.<,>准备工作比预期花费了更长时间。<,>The team held preparatory meetings before the project started.<,>团队在项目开始前举行了预备会议。<,>pre(前)+par(准备)+atory→预备的<,>preparation(n.准备)/preparative(adj.准备的)/prepared(adj.准备好的)

neglect<,>/nɪˈɡlekt/<,>/nɪˈɡlekt/<,>n.忽视/vt.忽视/vt.疏忽<,>The old house showed signs of neglect.<,>这栋老房子显示出被忽视的迹象。<,>Don't neglect your health while working hard.<,>努力工作同时不要忽视健康。<,>The child suffered from parental neglect.<,>这个孩子遭受了父母的疏忽照顾。<,>neg(不)+lect(选择)→不选择→忽视<,>select(vt.选择)/collect(vt.收集)/elect(vt.选举)

addition<,>/əˈdɪʃn/<,>/əˈdɪʃn/<,>n.加法/n.附加物<,>The children are learning simple addition in math class.<,>孩子们正在数学课上学习简单的加法。<,>The new wing is a welcome addition to the hospital.<,>新楼是医院受欢迎的增建部分。<,>In addition to English, she speaks French fluently.<,>除了英语，她还流利地讲法语。<,>add(加)+ition(名词后缀)→加法<,>edition(n.版本)/audition(n.试听)/condition(n.条件)
vein<,>/veɪn/<,>/veɪn/<,>n.静脉/n.血管/n.叶脉/n.纹理/n.方式/n.风格<,>The doctor found a problem in his vein.<,>医生在他的静脉中发现了问题。<,>The leaf's veins are clearly visible.<,>叶子的叶脉清晰可见。<,>She spoke in a humorous vein.<,>她以幽默的风格讲话。<,>vein与vain(徒劳的)发音相同<,>vein(静脉)/vane(风向标)/vain(徒劳的)

carve<,>/kɑːv/<,>/kɑːrv/<,>vt.切/vt.把…切碎/vt.雕刻/vt.刻<,>He carved the turkey into slices.<,>他把火鸡切成片。<,>She carved her initials into the tree.<,>她把名字的首字母刻在树上。<,>The artist carved a beautiful statue from marble.<,>艺术家用大理石雕刻出一尊美丽的雕像。<,>car(车)+ve→像车一样切割<,>carve(雕刻)/curve(曲线)/cave(洞穴)

veil<,>/veɪl/<,>/veɪl/<,>n.面纱/n.面罩/n.遮盖物/n.掩饰物/vt.掩盖/vt.掩饰<,>The bride wore a white veil.<,>新娘戴着白色面纱。<,>A veil of mist covered the mountains.<,>一层薄雾笼罩着群山。<,>He tried to veil his disappointment.<,>他试图掩饰自己的失望。<,>veil与vail(屈服)发音相同<,>veil(面纱)/vail(屈服)/vein(静脉)

shrink<,>/ʃrɪŋk/<,>/ʃrɪŋk/<,>vi.起皱/vi.收缩/vi.退缩/vi.畏缩<,>The sweater shrank in the wash.<,>毛衣洗后缩水了。<,>He shrank from the responsibility.<,>他畏缩不敢承担责任。<,>The economy is shrinking this year.<,>今年经济在萎缩。<,>sh(湿)+rink(溜冰场)→湿的溜冰场会收缩<,>shrink(收缩)/shriek(尖叫)/shank(小腿)

hierarchy<,>/ˈhaɪərɑːki/<,>/ˈhaɪərɑːrki/<,>n.等级制度/n.统治集团/n.领导层<,>The company has a strict hierarchy.<,>公司有严格的等级制度。<,>He climbed the corporate hierarchy quickly.<,>他在公司领导层中晋升很快。<,>The hierarchy made the decision.<,>统治集团做出了决定。<,>hier(神圣)+archy(统治)→神圣统治<,>hierarchy(等级)/anarchy(无政府状态)/monarchy(君主制)

ancestor<,>/ˈænsestə(r)/<,>/ˈænsestər/<,>n.祖宗/n.祖先/n.原型/n.先驱<,>My ancestors came from Ireland.<,>我的祖先来自爱尔兰。<,>This machine is the ancestor of modern computers.<,>这台机器是现代计算机的原型。<,>He was a pioneer ancestor in this field.<,>他是这个领域的先驱祖先。<,>ance(前)+estor(人)→前面的人<,>ancestor(祖先)/descendant(后代)/ancient(古代的)

hazardous<,>/ˈhæzədəs/<,>/ˈhæzərdəs/<,>adj.危险的/adj.冒险的<,>Working at heights is hazardous.<,>高空作业是危险的。<,>This chemical is hazardous to health.<,>这种化学品对健康有害。<,>It was a hazardous journey.<,>这是一次冒险的旅程。<,>hazard(危险)+ous→危险的<,>hazardous(危险的)/hazard(危险)/haphazard(随意的)

locality<,>/ləʊˈkæləti/<,>/loʊˈkæləti/<,>n.地区/n.地点<,>This is a quiet locality.<,>这是一个安静的地区。<,>The accident happened in this locality.<,>事故发生在这个地点。<,>He knows every locality in the city.<,>他知道城市的每个地区。<,>local(当地的)+ity→地点<,>locality(地点)/location(位置)/locale(场所)

proceeding<,>/prəˈsiːdɪŋ/<,>/prəˈsiːdɪŋ/<,>n.诉讼<,>Legal proceedings were started against him.<,>对他提起了法律诉讼。<,>The proceedings lasted for months.<,>诉讼持续了数月。<,>She was present at the court proceedings.<,>她出席了法庭诉讼。<,>pro(向前)+ceed(走)+ing→向前走的过程<,>proceeding(诉讼)/preceding(在先的)/proceeds(收益)

artery<,>/ˈɑːtəri/<,>/ˈɑːrtəri/<,>n.动脉/n.干线/n.要道<,>The coronary artery supplies blood to the heart.<,>冠状动脉为心脏供血。<,>This is the main artery of the city.<,>这是城市的主要干线。<,>The highway is an important traffic artery.<,>这条公路是重要的交通要道。<,>art(艺术)+ery→动脉像艺术品一样重要<,>artery(动脉)/vein(静脉)/aorta(主动脉)
panic<,>/ˈpænɪk/<,>/ˈpænɪk/<,>v.恐慌/v.惊慌失措/n.恐慌/n.惊慌/n.慌乱<,>She panicked when she saw the spider.<,>当她看到蜘蛛时惊慌失措。<,>The crowd panicked and ran in all directions.<,>人群恐慌，四处奔逃。<,>Don't panic, everything will be fine.<,>别慌，一切都会好起来的。<,>pan(潘神)+ic→潘神引起的恐惧→恐慌<,>picnic(n.野餐)/pandemic(adj.流行的/n.流行病)

underestimate<,>/ˌʌndərˈestɪmeɪt/<,>/ˌʌndərˈɛstəˌmeɪt/<,>vt.对…估计不足/vt.低估/n.估计不足/n.低估<,>Never underestimate your opponent's strength.<,>永远不要低估对手的实力。<,>We underestimated the time it would take to finish the project.<,>我们低估了完成项目所需的时间。<,>His abilities are often underestimated by his colleagues.<,>他的能力经常被同事低估。<,>under(不足)+estimate(估计)→低估<,>overestimate(vt.高估)/undervalue(vt.低估…的价值)

fold<,>/fəʊld/<,>/foʊld/<,>vt.折叠/vt.合拢/n.褶/n.折叠的部分<,>Fold the paper in half before cutting it.<,>在剪之前把纸对折。<,>She folded her arms and waited patiently.<,>她双臂交叉，耐心等待。<,>The map has a fold right in the middle.<,>地图正中间有一道折痕。<,>f+old(旧)→旧东西容易折叠→折叠<,>mold(n.模具/vt.塑造)/hold(vt.握住/n.控制)

transient<,>/ˈtrænziənt/<,>/ˈtrænʃənt/<,>adj.短暂的/adj.转瞬即逝的/adj.临时的/adj.暂住的<,>Their happiness was transient.<,>他们的快乐是短暂的。<,>He found a transient job at the local diner.<,>他在当地餐馆找到了一份临时工作。<,>The city has many transient workers.<,>这座城市有很多暂住工人。<,>trans(穿过)+ient→很快穿过去→短暂的<,>permanent(adj.永久的)/resident(n.居民)

hurl<,>/hɜːl/<,>/hɜrl/<,>vt.猛投/vt.狠掷/vt.大声叫骂<,>He hurled the ball across the field.<,>他把球猛掷过场地。<,>The protesters hurled insults at the politicians.<,>抗议者大声辱骂政客。<,>She hurled her bag onto the bed in anger.<,>她生气地把包扔到床上。<,>hurl与hurt(伤害)发音相似→猛投可能造成伤害<,>curl(vt.卷曲/n.卷发)/haul(vt.拖曳)

competitive<,>/kəmˈpetətɪv/<,>/kəmˈpɛtətɪv/<,>adj.竞争的/adj.比赛的/adj.好竞争的/adj.求胜心切的/adj.有竞争力的<,>She has a very competitive nature.<,>她非常好胜。<,>Our prices are highly competitive.<,>我们的价格很有竞争力。<,>He joined the competitive swimming team.<,>他加入了竞技游泳队。<,>compete(竞争)+itive→竞争的<,>cooperative(adj.合作的)/comparative(adj.比较的)

dean<,>/diːn/<,>/din/<,>n.教长/n.主任牧师/n.学院院长/n.系主任/n.训导主任<,>The dean of the college will give a speech today.<,>学院院长今天将发表演讲。<,>He was appointed dean of the medical school.<,>他被任命为医学院院长。<,>The dean is responsible for student discipline.<,>训导主任负责学生纪律。<,>dean与dear(亲爱的)发音相似→院长是受尊敬的人<,>dine(vt.进餐)/dene(n.沙丘)

sponge<,>/spʌndʒ/<,>/spʌndʒ/<,>v.用湿海绵擦/v.揩/v.过寄生生活/n.海绵<,>She sponged the spilled milk off the table.<,>她用海绵擦掉洒在桌子上的牛奶。<,>He sponges off his friends instead of getting a job.<,>他不找工作，靠朋友接济生活。<,>Natural sponges are harvested from the ocean.<,>天然海绵是从海洋中采集的。<,>sponge与spoon(勺子)相似→都是清洁工具<,>splurge(vt.挥霍)/plunge(vt.投入)

abuse<,>/əˈbjuːs/<,>/əˈbjus/<,>vt.滥用/vt.虐待/vt.辱骂/vt.毁谤/n.滥用/n.虐待/n.辱骂<,>He was accused of abusing his power.<,>他被指控滥用职权。<,>Child abuse is a serious crime.<,>虐待儿童是严重的罪行。<,>She endured years of verbal abuse.<,>她忍受了多年的言语辱骂。<,>ab(不)+use(使用)→不正确使用→滥用<,>accuse(vt.控告)/amuse(vt.娱乐)

scheme<,>/skiːm/<,>/skim/<,>v.密谋/v.策划/n.计划/n.方案/n.阴谋<,>They schemed to overthrow the government.<,>他们密谋推翻政府。<,>The company has a new marketing scheme.<,>公司有一个新的营销计划。<,>His scheme to get rich quick failed.<,>他快速致富的计划失败了。<,>scheme与scene(场景)相似→阴谋需要场景<,>theme(n.主题)/schema(n.图解)
insulate<,>/ˈɪnsjʊleɪt/<,>/ˈɪnsəˌleɪt/<,>vt.使绝缘/vt.使隔热/vt.使隔音/vt.隔离/vt.使隔绝<,>The walls are insulated to keep the house warm in winter.<,>墙壁做了隔热处理，使房子在冬天保持温暖。<,>He insulated himself from the noise by wearing earplugs.<,>他戴上耳塞以隔绝噪音。<,>The country has been insulated from the global economic crisis.<,>该国已与全球经济危机隔离。<,>in(不)+sul(单独)+ate(动词后缀)→使单独→隔离<,>isolate(vt.使隔离/vt.使孤立)/insulin(n.胰岛素)

consequently<,>/ˈkɒnsɪkwəntli/<,>/ˈkɑːnsɪkwentli/<,>adv.因此/adv.因而/adv.所以<,>He didn't study hard, and consequently failed the exam.<,>他没有努力学习，因此考试不及格。<,>The road was icy; consequently, driving was dangerous.<,>路面结冰，因此开车很危险。<,>She missed the train and consequently was late for work.<,>她错过了火车，所以上班迟到了。<,>con(共同)+sequ(跟随)+ent(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→跟随而来→因此<,>subsequent(adj.随后的/adj.后来的)/sequence(n.顺序/n.序列)

drain<,>/dreɪn/<,>/dreɪn/<,>vi.慢慢减少/vt.排去/vt.放水/vt.渐渐耗尽/n.耗竭/n.排水沟/n.排水管<,>Leave the dishes to drain before putting them away.<,>让盘子沥干水分后再收起来。<,>The long war drained the country's resources.<,>长期的战争耗尽了国家的资源。<,>There's a bad smell coming from the drain.<,>排水沟里传来难闻的气味。<,>dr(干)+ain→使变干→排去<,>train(n.火车/v.训练)/grain(n.谷物/n.纹理)

reluctance<,>/rɪˈlʌktəns/<,>/rɪˈlʌktəns/<,>n.不愿/n.勉强<,>She showed great reluctance to attend the meeting.<,>她非常不愿意参加会议。<,>His reluctance to help surprised me.<,>他不愿帮忙让我很惊讶。<,>They accepted the decision with reluctance.<,>他们勉强接受了这个决定。<,>re(反)+luct(斗争)+ance(名词后缀)→反着斗争→不愿<,>reluctant(adj.不情愿的/adj.勉强的)/resultant(adj.作为结果的/n.合力)

rape<,>/reɪp/<,>/reɪp/<,>n&vt.强奸<,>He was sentenced to ten years in prison for rape.<,>他因强奸罪被判十年监禁。<,>The novel deals with the sensitive topic of rape.<,>这部小说涉及强奸这个敏感话题。<,>She bravely testified against her rapist in court.<,>她勇敢地在法庭上指证强奸她的人。<,>rap(抢夺)+e→强行夺取→强奸<,>tape(n.磁带/vt.录音)/grape(n.葡萄)

isolate<,>/ˈaɪsəleɪt/<,>/ˈaɪsəˌleɪt/<,>vt.使隔离/vt.使孤立<,>The patient was isolated to prevent the spread of infection.<,>病人被隔离以防止感染扩散。<,>Living in the countryside can make you feel isolated.<,>住在乡下可能会让你感到孤立。<,>Scientists have isolated the virus causing the disease.<,>科学家已分离出导致这种疾病的病毒。<,>iso(单独)+late(放)→单独放置→隔离<,>insulate(vt.使绝缘/vt.隔离)/desolate(adj.荒凉的/vt.使荒芜)

popularity<,>/ˌpɒpjuˈlærəti/<,>/ˌpɑːpjəˈlærəti/<,>n.普及/n.流行/n.声望<,>The band's popularity grew rapidly after their first hit.<,>这个乐队在第一首热门歌曲后迅速走红。<,>Social media has contributed to the popularity of the product.<,>社交媒体促进了该产品的流行。<,>His popularity among students makes him an excellent teacher.<,>他在学生中的声望使他成为一位出色的老师。<,>popular(流行的)+ity(名词后缀)→流行<,>population(n.人口)/polarity(n.极性/n.对立)

nickname<,>/ˈnɪkneɪm/<,>/ˈnɪkˌneɪm/<,>n.绰号/n.诨名/vt.给...起绰号<,>His nickname "Speedy" comes from his running ability.<,>他的绰号"飞毛腿"源于他的跑步能力。<,>They nicknamed him "Red" because of his hair color.<,>他们因为他头发的颜色给他起了个"红毛"的绰号。<,>The nickname stuck with him throughout his school years.<,>这个绰号伴随了他整个学生时代。<,>nick(刻痕)+name(名字)→刻在名字上的标记→绰号<,>surname(n.姓氏)/penname(n.笔名)

subsequent<,>/ˈsʌbsɪkwənt/<,>/ˈsʌbsɪkwənt/<,>adj.随后的/adj.后来的<,>Subsequent events proved that he was right.<,>随后发生的事件证明他是对的。<,>The first chapter introduces the characters, and subsequent chapters develop the plot.<,>第一章介绍人物，随后的章节展开情节。<,>Subsequent investigations revealed new evidence.<,>后来的调查发现了新的证据。<,>sub(下面)+sequ(跟随)+ent(形容词后缀)→跟随在下面的→随后的<,>consequent(adj.随之发生的)/sequential(adj.连续的/adj.顺序的)

metabolic<,>/ˌmetəˈbɒlɪk/<,>/ˌmetəˈbɑːlɪk/<,>adj.代谢作用的/adj.新陈代谢的<,>Exercise increases your metabolic rate.<,>运动能提高你的新陈代谢率。<,>Metabolic disorders can cause serious health problems.<,>代谢紊乱会导致严重的健康问题。<,>The drug affects the body's metabolic processes.<,>这种药物会影响人体的代谢过程。<,>meta(变化)+bol(抛)+ic(形容词后缀)→物质变化的→代谢的<,>metabolism(n.新陈代谢)/metaphor(n.隐喻)
humanity<,>/hjuːˈmænəti/<,>/hjuːˈmænəti/<,>n.人类/n.人性/n.人道/n.博爱/n.人文学科<,>Acts of kindness restore our faith in humanity.<,>善举让我们重拾对人性的信心。<,>She dedicated her life to serving humanity.<,>她毕生致力于为人类服务。<,>The humanities include subjects like history and philosophy.<,>人文学科包括历史和哲学等学科。<,>human(人)+ity(状态)→人类/人性<,>humane(adj.人道的)/humanitarian(n.人道主义者)

innovation<,>/ˌɪnəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪnəˈveɪʃn/<,>n.新方法/n.新事物/n.革新/n.创新<,>Technological innovation drives economic growth.<,>科技创新推动经济增长。<,>This product represents a major innovation in design.<,>这款产品代表了设计上的重大创新。<,>We encourage innovation in our company culture.<,>我们的企业文化鼓励创新。<,>in(进入)+nov(新)+ation→创新<,>renovation(n.翻新)/invention(n.发明)

litter<,>/ˈlɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪtər/<,>vi.乱扔废弃物/vt.乱扔东西/n.废弃物/n.一窝/n.杂乱的东西<,>Please don't litter in the park.<,>请不要在公园里乱扔垃圾。<,>The cat had a litter of five kittens.<,>这只猫生了一窝五只小猫。<,>The floor was littered with papers.<,>地板上散落着纸张。<,>联想：little(小的)→小东西乱扔→废弃物<,>glitter(n.闪光/v.闪烁)/letter(n.信件)

charge<,>/tʃɑːdʒ/<,>/tʃɑːrdʒ/<,>v.索价/v.控告/v.使充电/v.使充满/v.向前冲/n.费用/n.管理/n.控告/n.指责/n.电荷<,>The restaurant charges $20 for this dish.<,>这道菜餐厅收费20美元。<,>He was charged with theft.<,>他被指控盗窃。<,>Please charge your phone before the trip.<,>请在旅行前给手机充电。<,>char(炭)+ge→像炭火一样充满能量→充电<,>change(n.变化/v.改变)/discharge(v.释放/n.排放)

shutter<,>/ˈʃʌtə(r)/<,>/ˈʃʌtər/<,>n.百叶窗/n.快门<,>She closed the shutters to keep out the sun.<,>她关上百叶窗挡住阳光。<,>Press the shutter button to take a photo.<,>按下快门按钮拍照。<,>The old house had wooden shutters.<,>这栋老房子有木制百叶窗。<,>shut(关闭)+ter→关闭的装置→百叶窗/快门<,>shudder(v.发抖/n.颤抖)/shuttle(n.穿梭/v.往返)

alternate<,>/ɔːlˈtɜːnət/<,>/ˈɔːltərnət/<,>adj.交替的/adj.轮流的/v.轮流/v.交替<,>We alternate between English and Chinese in class.<,>我们在课堂上交替使用英语和汉语。<,>The team members take alternate shifts.<,>团队成员轮流值班。<,>The pattern has alternate stripes of blue and white.<,>这个图案有蓝白相间的条纹。<,>alter(改变)+nate→交替改变<,>alternative(n.选择/adj.替代的)/alter(v.改变)

biography<,>/baɪˈɒɡrəfi/<,>/baɪˈɑːɡrəfi/<,>n.传记<,>I'm reading a biography of Albert Einstein.<,>我正在读爱因斯坦的传记。<,>The biography provides insight into the artist's life.<,>这本传记让我们深入了解这位艺术家的生活。<,>She wrote an authorized biography of the president.<,>她写了一本总统的授权传记。<,>bio(生命)+graph(写)+y→写生命的故事→传记<,>autobiography(n.自传)/biology(n.生物学)

procedure<,>/prəˈsiːdʒə(r)/<,>/prəˈsiːdʒər/<,>n.程序/n.手续/n.步骤<,>Follow the correct procedure when applying for a visa.<,>申请签证时要遵循正确的程序。<,>The surgical procedure lasted three hours.<,>这个外科手术持续了三小时。<,>There's a standard procedure for handling complaints.<,>处理投诉有标准程序。<,>pro(向前)+ced(走)+ure→向前走的步骤→程序<,>process(n.过程/v.处理)/proceed(v.继续进行)

sample<,>/ˈsɑːmpl/<,>/ˈsæmpl/<,>n.样品/n.样本/vt.抽样/vt.品尝/vt.体验<,>Would you like to sample our new product?<,>您想试用我们的新产品吗？<,>The doctor took a blood sample for testing.<,>医生取了血样进行检测。<,>This is a free sample of the perfume.<,>这是这款香水的免费样品。<,>sam(相似)+ple→相似的样品<,>example(n.例子)/simple(adj.简单的)

plunge<,>/plʌndʒ/<,>/plʌndʒ/<,>n.纵身投入/n.猛冲/n.猛跌/v.纵身投入/v.猛冲/v.猛跌<,>He plunged into the cold water without hesitation.<,>他毫不犹豫地跳入冰冷的水中。<,>The stock market took a sudden plunge yesterday.<,>股市昨天突然暴跌。<,>She plunged her hands into the flour.<,>她把双手插入面粉中。<,>pl(扑)+unge→扑进去→猛冲<,>plunder(v.掠夺/n.赃物)/plunge(v.暴跌)
skeptical<,>/ˈskeptɪkəl/<,>/ˈskɛptɪkəl/<,>adj.表示怀疑的<,>She was skeptical about his promises.<,>她对他的承诺表示怀疑。<,>Many people are skeptical of new technologies.<,>许多人对新技术持怀疑态度。<,>His skeptical attitude made it hard to convince him.<,>他怀疑的态度让人很难说服他。<,>skept(怀疑)+ical(形容词后缀)→怀疑的<,>cynical(adj.愤世嫉俗的)/skeptic(n.怀疑论者)

ultraviolet<,>/ˌʌltrəˈvaɪələt/<,>/ˌʌltrəˈvaɪəlɪt/<,>adj.紫外的<,>Ultraviolet rays can damage your skin.<,>紫外线会损害你的皮肤。<,>This lamp emits ultraviolet light.<,>这盏灯发出紫外线。<,>Ultraviolet radiation is invisible to the human eye.<,>紫外线辐射是人眼看不见的。<,>ultra(超过)+violet(紫色)→超过紫色的→紫外的<,>infrared(adj.红外线的)/violet(n.紫色)

planetary<,>/ˈplænɪtəri/<,>/ˈplænɪteri/<,>n.行星的<,>Planetary motion follows specific laws.<,>行星运动遵循特定规律。<,>Scientists study planetary atmospheres.<,>科学家研究行星大气层。<,>The planetary system includes many celestial bodies.<,>行星系统包括许多天体。<,>planet(行星)+ary(形容词后缀)→行星的<,>planet(n.行星)/planetary(adj.行星的)

visa<,>/ˈviːzə/<,>/ˈviːzə/<,>n.签证<,>I need to apply for a visa to travel abroad.<,>我需要申请签证才能出国旅行。<,>Her visa expires next month.<,>她的签证下个月到期。<,>The embassy approved his visa application.<,>大使馆批准了他的签证申请。<,>vis(看)+a→官方看过→签证<,>visa(n.签证)/vista(n.远景)

diagnose<,>/ˈdaɪəɡnəʊz/<,>/ˈdaɪəɡnoʊs/<,>vt.诊断/判断<,>The doctor diagnosed him with pneumonia.<,>医生诊断他患有肺炎。<,>It's hard to diagnose the problem without more information.<,>没有更多信息很难判断问题所在。<,>Early diagnosis can save lives.<,>早期诊断可以挽救生命。<,>dia(通过)+gnos(知道)+e→通过知道→诊断<,>diagnosis(n.诊断)/prognosis(n.预后)

petition<,>/pəˈtɪʃən/<,>/pəˈtɪʃən/<,>v.请愿/正式请求/n.请愿书/申请书/诉状<,>They petitioned the government for better healthcare.<,>他们向政府请愿要求更好的医疗保健。<,>She signed a petition to save the local library.<,>她签署了一份请愿书以拯救当地图书馆。<,>The lawyer filed a petition in court.<,>律师向法院提交了诉状。<,>pet(寻求)+ition→寻求→请愿<,>competition(n.竞争)/repetition(n.重复)

vicinity<,>/vɪˈsɪnəti/<,>/vɪˈsɪnəti/<,>n.周围地区/邻近地区<,>There are several restaurants in the vicinity.<,>附近有几家餐馆。<,>The explosion was heard in the vicinity.<,>爆炸声在附近都能听到。<,>He lives in the vicinity of the school.<,>他住在学校附近。<,>vicin(邻近)+ity(名词后缀)→邻近地区<,>vicinity(n.邻近)/vicinity(n.附近)

naive<,>/naɪˈiːv/<,>/naɪˈiːv/<,>adj.幼稚的/天真的/轻信的<,>She was naive to believe his lies.<,>她太天真了，竟然相信他的谎言。<,>His naive approach to the problem surprised everyone.<,>他对这个问题的天真态度让所有人惊讶。<,>Don't be so naive about business deals.<,>别对商业交易这么轻信。<,>nai(出生)+ive→像刚出生的一样的→天真的<,>naive(adj.天真的)/native(adj.本地的)

essential<,>/ɪˈsenʃəl/<,>/ɪˈsenʃəl/<,>adj.必要的/本质的/n.要素/必需品<,>Water is essential for life.<,>水是生命必需的物质。<,>The essential difference between them is clear.<,>他们之间的本质区别很明显。<,>Don't forget to pack the essentials for the trip.<,>别忘了带上旅行必需品。<,>essent(存在)+ial→存在的一本质的<,>essential(adj.必要的)/existential(adj.存在的)

expenditure<,>/ɪkˈspendɪtʃə(r)/<,>/ɪkˈspendɪtʃər/<,>n.经费/支出额/花费/支出/消耗<,>The company reduced its expenditure last year.<,>公司去年减少了支出。<,>Military expenditure has increased significantly.<,>军费开支大幅增加。<,>We need to track our monthly expenditures.<,>我们需要跟踪每月的支出。<,>ex(出)+pend(花费)+iture→花费出去→支出<,>expenditure(n.支出)/expense(n.费用)
vent<,>/vent/<,>/vɛnt/<,>n.通风口/n.排放口/n.开衩/vt.表达/vt.发泄<,>There's a vent in the ceiling to let the hot air out.<,>天花板上有个通风口让热空气排出。<,>He vented his anger by shouting at the wall.<,>他对着墙大喊以发泄愤怒。<,>The dress has a vent at the back for ease of movement.<,>这件裙子后面有个开衩方便活动。<,>vent(风)→通风口→发泄情绪<,>invent(v.发明/v.编造)/prevent(v.防止/v.阻止)

haunt<,>/hɔːnt/<,>/hɔnt/<,>vt.常出没于/vt.使苦恼/vt.使担忧/vt.萦绕在心头/n.常去的地方<,>The old castle is said to be haunted by ghosts.<,>据说那座古堡有鬼魂出没。<,>Memories of the accident still haunt me.<,>事故的记忆仍然困扰着我。<,>This café was our favorite haunt in college.<,>这家咖啡馆是我们大学时常去的地方。<,>haunt(家)→常去的地方→鬼魂常出没<,>hunt(v.打猎/v.搜寻)/taunt(v.嘲笑/n.嘲弄)

precede<,>/prɪˈsiːd/<,>/prɪˈsid/<,>vt.在...之前/vt.先于<,>The lightning preceded the thunder by a few seconds.<,>闪电比雷声早了几秒钟。<,>Dinner will be preceded by a short speech.<,>晚餐开始前会有个简短的演讲。<,>In the alphabet, 'A' precedes 'B'.<,>在字母表中，A在B之前。<,>pre(前)+cede(走)→走在前面<,>proceed(v.继续/v.行进)/recede(v.后退/v.减弱)

gasp<,>/ɡɑːsp/<,>/ɡæsp/<,>vi.喘气/vi.倒抽气/vt.喘着气说出/n.喘气/n.倒抽气<,>She gasped when she saw the surprise party.<,>看到惊喜派对时她倒抽了一口气。<,>"Help me," he gasped, clutching his chest.<,>"救救我，"他捂着胸口喘着气说。<,>After running, I was left gasping for air.<,>跑完后我气喘吁吁。<,>grasp(抓住)+p→喘不过气来<,>grasp(v.抓住/v.理解)/gap(n.缺口/n.间隔)

stroll<,>/strəʊl/<,>/stroʊl/<,>n.散步/n.闲逛/vi.散步/vi.闲逛<,>We took a leisurely stroll along the beach.<,>我们沿着海滩悠闲地散步。<,>He strolled into the office an hour late.<,>他迟到了一小时慢悠悠地走进办公室。<,>Sunday afternoons are perfect for a park stroll.<,>周日下午最适合在公园散步。<,>st(街道)+roll(滚动)→在街上滚动→散步<,>scroll(n.卷轴/v.滚动)/troll(n.巨怪/v.拖钓)

furnish<,>/ˈfɜːnɪʃ/<,>/ˈfɜrnɪʃ/<,>vt.供应/vt.提供/vt.装备<,>The hotel furnished us with all necessary amenities.<,>酒店为我们提供了所有必要的便利设施。<,>We need to furnish the new apartment.<,>我们需要为新公寓配备家具。<,>The evidence furnished by the witness was crucial.<,>证人提供的证据很关键。<,>furn(家具)+ish(动词后缀)→提供家具<,>burnish(v.擦亮/v.润色)/varnish(n.清漆/v.粉饰)

differentiate<,>/ˌdɪfəˈrenʃieɪt/<,>/ˌdɪfəˈrɛnʃiˌeɪt/<,>vi.区分/vi.区别/vt.区分/vt.区别/vt.使不同/vt.使有差异<,>Can you differentiate between these two species?<,>你能区分这两个物种吗？<,>The special training differentiates our program from others.<,>特别训练使我们的项目与众不同。<,>Children learn to differentiate colors at an early age.<,>孩子们很小就学会区分颜色。<,>different(不同)+iate(使)→使不同<,>defer(v.推迟/v.听从)/infer(v.推断/v.暗示)

contact<,>/ˈkɒntækt/<,>/ˈkɑntækt/<,>n.接触/n.联系/n.交往/vt.与...接触/vt.与...取得联系<,>Please contact me if you have any questions.<,>如有任何问题请与我联系。<,>Eye contact is important in communication.<,>眼神交流在沟通中很重要。<,>The two surfaces are in direct contact.<,>这两个表面直接接触。<,>con(共同)+tact(接触)→共同接触<,>contract(n.合同/v.收缩)/content(n.内容/adj.满足的)

garment<,>/ˈɡɑːmənt/<,>/ˈɡɑrmənt/<,>n.衣服<,>The garment industry employs thousands in this city.<,>服装业在这个城市雇用了数千人。<,>She designs garments for a famous fashion brand.<,>她为一家著名时尚品牌设计服装。<,>This delicate garment requires special care.<,>这件精致的衣服需要特别护理。<,>gar(装饰)+ment(名词后缀)→装饰物→衣服<,>garment(衣服)/garnish(v.装饰/n.装饰品)

discharge<,>/dɪsˈtʃɑːdʒ/<,>/dɪsˈtʃɑrdʒ/<,>v.释放/v.排出/v.卸货/n.释放/n.放电<,>The factory was fined for discharging pollutants.<,>这家工厂因排放污染物被罚款。<,>The patient was discharged from hospital yesterday.<,>病人昨天出院了。<,>Lightning is caused by atmospheric discharge.<,>闪电是由大气放电引起的。<,>dis(不)+charge(装载)→卸货→释放<,>charge(v.充电/v.收费)/recharge(v.再充电/v.恢复精力)
exclude<,>/ɪkˈskluːd/<,>/ɪkˈskluːd/<,>vt.把…排除在外<,>They excluded him from the meeting.<,>他们把他排除在会议之外。<,>No one should be excluded because of their background.<,>任何人都不应因背景而被排除在外。<,>The price excludes taxes and fees.<,>这个价格不含税费。<,>ex(出)+clud(关闭)+e→关在外面→排除<,>include(vt.包括)/conclude(vt.结束)/preclude(vt.阻止)

scary<,>/ˈskeəri/<,>/ˈskeri/<,>adj.可怕的/骇人的/惊慌的/害怕的/胆小的/易受惊的<,>The movie was too scary for children.<,>这部电影对孩子们来说太可怕了。<,>She gave me a scary look.<,>她给了我一个可怕的眼神。<,>Walking alone at night can be scary.<,>晚上独自走路可能会很吓人。<,>scar(伤疤)+y→有伤疤的→可怕的<,>scar(n.伤疤)/scare(vt.惊吓)/scared(adj.害怕的)

criticism<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsɪzəm/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪˌsɪzəm/<,>n.批评/批判/评论/评论文章<,>He can't take any criticism.<,>他不能接受任何批评。<,>Her criticism was constructive.<,>她的批评是有建设性的。<,>The book received mixed criticism.<,>这本书收到了褒贬不一的评论。<,>critic(批评家)+ism→批评<,>critic(n.批评家)/critique(n.评论)/critical(adj.批评的)

enlighten<,>/ɪnˈlaɪtn/<,>/ɪnˈlaɪtn/<,>vt.启发/开导<,>Can you enlighten me on this topic?<,>你能在这个话题上启发我吗？<,>His words enlightened me.<,>他的话启发了我。<,>The teacher enlightened the students with examples.<,>老师用例子启发学生。<,>en(使)+light(光)+en→使有光→启发<,>lighten(vt.减轻)/brighten(vt.使明亮)/heighten(vt.提高)

utmost<,>/ˈʌtməʊst/<,>/ˈʌtˌmoʊst/<,>adj.最远的/n.极限<,>She tried her utmost to finish the work.<,>她尽了最大努力完成工作。<,>This is of the utmost importance.<,>这是最重要的。<,>He pushed himself to the utmost.<,>他把自己逼到了极限。<,>ut(外)+most(最)→最外面的→最远的<,>uttermost(adj.极度的)/outermost(adj.最外面的)/innermost(adj.最里面的)

prospective<,>/prəˈspektɪv/<,>/prəˈspektɪv/<,>adj.预期的/未来的/可能的<,>He is a prospective buyer.<,>他是一个潜在的买家。<,>The prospective benefits are huge.<,>预期的收益是巨大的。<,>They discussed prospective plans.<,>他们讨论了未来的计划。<,>pro(向前)+spect(看)+ive→向前看的→未来的<,>perspective(n.观点)/retrospective(adj.回顾的)/introspective(adj.内省的)

deduct<,>/dɪˈdʌkt/<,>/dɪˈdʌkt/<,>v.减去/扣除<,>Tax will be deducted from your salary.<,>税会从你的工资中扣除。<,>You can deduct these expenses.<,>你可以扣除这些费用。<,>They deducted 10% for the discount.<,>他们扣除了10%作为折扣。<,>de(向下)+duct(引导)→向下引导→减去<,>deduction(n.扣除)/conduct(vt.引导)/induct(vt.使就职)

plaster<,>/ˈplɑːstə/<,>/ˈplæstər/<,>n.灰浆/灰泥/石膏/橡皮膏/膏药/vt.在…上抹灰泥/厚厚地涂抹<,>He broke his arm and it's in plaster.<,>他手臂骨折了，打了石膏。<,>She plastered the wall with posters.<,>她在墙上贴满了海报。<,>Apply the plaster to the wound.<,>把膏药贴在伤口上。<,>plas(塑造)+ter→用来塑造的材料→灰泥<,>plastic(n.塑料)/plastered(adj.醉醺醺的)/plasterboard(n.石膏板)

consultancy<,>/kənˈsʌltənsi/<,>/kənˈsʌltənsi/<,>n.顾问/顾问服务公司<,>He works for a management consultancy.<,>他在一家管理咨询公司工作。<,>She set up her own consultancy.<,>她成立了自己的咨询公司。<,>We hired a consultancy for advice.<,>我们聘请了一家咨询公司提供建议。<,>consult(咨询)+ancy→咨询公司<,>consultant(n.顾问)/consultation(n.咨询)/consultative(adj.咨询的)

metropolitan<,>/ˌmetrəˈpɒlɪtən/<,>/ˌmetrəˈpɑːlɪtən/<,>adj.大都市的/大都会的/首都的<,>He lives in the metropolitan area.<,>他住在大都市区。<,>Metropolitan life is fast-paced.<,>大都市生活节奏快。<,>The museum has a metropolitan feel.<,>这个博物馆有大都会的感觉。<,>metro(母亲)+polit(城市)+an→母亲城市→大都市的<,>metropolis(n.大都市)/cosmopolitan(adj.世界性的)/megalopolis(n.特大城市)
portray<,>/pɔːˈtreɪ/<,>/pɔrˈtreɪ/<,>vt.描写/vt.描绘/vt.扮演/vt.饰演<,>The artist portrayed the queen in a beautiful gown.<,>艺术家描绘了穿着华丽礼服的皇后。<,>He portrayed the villain in the movie.<,>他在电影中饰演反派角色。<,>The novel portrays life in rural America.<,>这部小说描写了美国乡村的生活。<,>port(部分)+ray(光线)→用光线描绘部分→描绘<,>betray(vt.背叛)/array(n.阵列/vt.排列)  

garbage<,>/ˈɡɑːbɪdʒ/<,>/ˈɡɑrbɪdʒ/<,>n.垃圾/n.废物/n.废话/n.无用的资料<,>Take out the garbage before it smells.<,>在垃圾发臭前把它扔掉。<,>His speech was full of garbage.<,>他的演讲全是废话。<,>Don't save garbage files on your computer.<,>别在电脑上保存无用文件。<,>gar(看作"garb"服装)+bage(袋子)→装废物的袋子→垃圾<,>garage(n.车库)/garb(n.服装)  

suspicious<,>/səˈspɪʃəs/<,>/səˈspɪʃəs/<,>adj.猜疑的/adj.疑心的/adj.可疑的/adj.表示怀疑的<,>The police found his behavior suspicious.<,>警方觉得他的行为可疑。<,>She gave him a suspicious look.<,>她怀疑地看了他一眼。<,>I'm suspicious of his motives.<,>我对他的动机表示怀疑。<,>sus(在...下面)+pic(看)+ious→在下面看的→怀疑的<,>suspicion(n.怀疑)/superstitious(adj.迷信的)  

scrub<,>/skrʌb/<,>/skrʌb/<,>v.用力擦洗/v.把...擦净/v.取消/n.矮树丛/n.灌木丛<,>She scrubbed the floor until it shone.<,>她把地板擦得发亮。<,>The launch was scrubbed due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，发射取消了。<,>We walked through the scrub to reach the beach.<,>我们穿过灌木丛到达海滩。<,>s(看作"soil"泥土)+crub(擦)→擦掉泥土→擦洗<,>shrub(n.灌木)/scrap(n.碎片)  

complain<,>/kəmˈpleɪn/<,>/kəmˈpleɪn/<,>vi.抱怨/vi.诉苦/vi.控告/vi.投诉<,>Customers may complain about poor service.<,>顾客可能会投诉服务质量差。<,>She's always complaining about her job.<,>她总是抱怨自己的工作。<,>He complained to the manager about the noise.<,>他向经理投诉噪音问题。<,>com(共同)+plain(平坦)→把不满摊平→抱怨<,>explain(v.解释)/plain(adj.简单的)  

homogeneous<,>/ˌhɒməˈdʒiːniəs/<,>/ˌhoʊməˈdʒiːniəs/<,>adj.同种类的/adj.同性质的/adj.有相同特征的<,>The population was homogeneous in terms of income.<,>这个群体在收入方面是同质的。<,>The mixture should be homogeneous before baking.<,>烘烤前混合物应该是均匀的。<,>They come from a homogeneous cultural background.<,>他们来自同质文化背景。<,>homo(相同)+gene(基因)+ous→基因相同的→同种类的<,>heterogeneous(adj.异质的)/homogenize(v.使均匀)  

affirm<,>/əˈfɜːm/<,>/əˈfɜrm/<,>vt.断言/vt.坚持声称/vt.证实/vt.确认<,>The witness affirmed that he saw the accident.<,>证人确认他目睹了事故。<,>She affirmed her commitment to the project.<,>她确认了对项目的承诺。<,>The court affirmed the lower court's decision.<,>法院维持了下级法院的判决。<,>af(加强)+firm(坚定)→非常坚定→断言<,>confirm(v.确认)/inform(v.通知)  

profound<,>/prəˈfaʊnd/<,>/prəˈfaʊnd/<,>adj.深度的/adj.深切的/adj.深远的/adj.知识渊博的/adj.见解深刻的/adj.深奥的<,>The book had a profound impact on me.<,>这本书对我产生了深远影响。<,>He has a profound understanding of physics.<,>他对物理学有深刻理解。<,>Her words showed profound wisdom.<,>她的话显示出深刻的智慧。<,>pro(向前)+found(基础)→深入基础的→深刻的<,>profuse(adj.大量的)/found(v.建立)  

marble<,>/ˈmɑːbl/<,>/ˈmɑrbl/<,>n.大理石/n.弹子/n.弹子游戏<,>The floor was made of white marble.<,>地板是白色大理石的。<,>Children were playing marbles in the yard.<,>孩子们在院子里玩弹子游戏。<,>He collected marbles as a hobby.<,>他收集弹子作为爱好。<,>mar(海)+ble→像海水一样有纹路的石头→大理石<,>maple(n.枫树)/mumble(v.咕哝)  

anxiety<,>/æŋˈzaɪəti/<,>/æŋˈzaɪəti/<,>n.焦虑/n.忧虑/n.渴望/n.热望<,>She felt anxiety before the exam.<,>考试前她感到焦虑。<,>His anxiety about the future kept him awake.<,>对未来的忧虑让他睡不着。<,>She had an anxiety to succeed.<,>她渴望成功。<,>anx(窒息)+iety→窒息般的感觉→焦虑<,>anguish(n.极度痛苦)/anxious(adj.焦虑的)
adjust<,>/əˈdʒʌst/<,>/əˈdʒʌst/<,>vi.适应/vt.调整/vt.调节/vt.校正<,>It took him a while to adjust to the new environment.<,>他花了一段时间才适应新环境。<,>Please adjust the volume to a comfortable level.<,>请将音量调节到舒适的水平。<,>The mechanic adjusted the car's brakes.<,>机械师校正了汽车的刹车。<,>ad(加强)+just(正确)→使正确→调整<,>adapt(v.适应)/adjoin(v.毗连)/adjudge(v.判决)

aspiration<,>/ˌæspəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌæspəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.强烈的愿望/n.志向/n.抱负<,>Her aspiration is to become a doctor.<,>她的志向是成为一名医生。<,>He has high aspirations for his career.<,>他对自己的事业有很高的抱负。<,>The team shares the aspiration to win the championship.<,>全队都有赢得冠军的强烈愿望。<,>a(加强)+spir(呼吸)+ation→强烈的呼吸→强烈的愿望<,>inspiration(n.灵感)/respiration(n.呼吸)/desperation(n.绝望)

vigorous<,>/ˈvɪɡərəs/<,>/ˈvɪɡərəs/<,>adj.朝气蓬勃的/adj.有力的/adj.用力的<,>The plants grew with vigorous vitality.<,>植物生长得朝气蓬勃。<,>He made a vigorous effort to finish the project on time.<,>他用力地努力按时完成项目。<,>The debate was vigorous and lively.<,>辩论有力而生动。<,>vigor(活力)+ous(形容词后缀)→有活力的→朝气蓬勃的<,>rigorous(adj.严格的)/vigor(n.活力)/vigilant(adj.警惕的)

vocal<,>/ˈvəʊkl/<,>/ˈvoʊkl/<,>adj.喜欢畅所欲言的/adj.直言不讳的/adj.嗓音的/adj.发声的/n.声乐节目<,>She is very vocal about her political views.<,>她对自己的政治观点直言不讳。<,>Vocal training is essential for singers.<,>嗓音训练对歌手至关重要。<,>The concert featured both instrumental and vocal performances.<,>音乐会包括器乐和声乐节目。<,>voc(声音)+al(形容词后缀)→声音的→嗓音的<,>vocation(n.职业)/vowel(n.元音)/vocalize(v.发声)

deem<,>/diːm/<,>/dim/<,>vt.认为/vt.视为<,>The court deemed the evidence insufficient.<,>法院认为证据不足。<,>He deemed it necessary to apologize.<,>他认为有必要道歉。<,>This book is deemed a classic.<,>这本书被视为经典。<,>deem与seem形似，但意思不同<,>seem(v.似乎)/redeem(v.赎回)/esteem(v.尊重)

origin<,>/ˈɒrɪdʒɪn/<,>/ˈɔːrɪdʒɪn/<,>n.起源/n.起因/n.出身/n.血统<,>The origin of the universe is still a mystery.<,>宇宙的起源仍然是个谜。<,>He is of noble origin.<,>他出身高贵。<,>The origin of the conflict was a misunderstanding.<,>冲突的起因是误会。<,>ori(开始)+gin→开始的地方→起源<,>original(adj.原始的)/orient(n.东方)/aboriginal(adj.土著的)

clash<,>/klæʃ/<,>/klæʃ/<,>vi.发生冲突/vi.不协调/vi.砰地相撞/vi.发出刺耳的撞击声/n.冲突/n.不协调/n.刺耳的撞击声<,>The two groups clashed over the issue.<,>两个团体在这个问题上发生了冲突。<,>Her dress clashes with her shoes.<,>她的裙子和鞋子不协调。<,>We heard a loud clash of metal.<,>我们听到金属刺耳的撞击声。<,>clash与crash形似，但crash指撞击事故<,>crash(v.撞毁)/flash(v.闪光)/splash(v.溅起)

overturn<,>/ˌəʊvəˈtɜːn/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈtɜːrn/<,>vi.倾覆/vi.翻转/vi.翻倒/vt.使翻转/vt.使倾覆/vt.使倒下/vt.颠覆/vt.推翻<,>The boat overturned in the storm.<,>船在风暴中倾覆了。<,>The court overturned the previous decision.<,>法院推翻了先前的判决。<,>He accidentally overturned the vase.<,>他不小心打翻了花瓶。<,>over(翻转)+turn(转)→翻转→倾覆<,>overthrow(v.推翻)/overtake(v.超过)/overtime(n.加班)

compel<,>/kəmˈpel/<,>/kəmˈpel/<,>vt.强迫/vt.迫使屈服<,>The law compels citizens to pay taxes.<,>法律强迫公民纳税。<,>His illness compelled him to resign.<,>他的疾病迫使他辞职。<,>Nothing can compel me to give up.<,>没有什么能迫使我放弃。<,>com(共同)+pel(推)→一起推→强迫<,>repel(v.击退)/expel(v.驱逐)/propel(v.推进)

depress<,>/dɪˈpres/<,>/dɪˈpres/<,>vt.使沮丧/vt.使不景气/vt.按下<,>The bad news depressed everyone.<,>这个坏消息使每个人都沮丧。<,>The economic crisis has depressed the market.<,>经济危机使市场不景气。<,>Depress the button to start the machine.<,>按下按钮启动机器。<,>de(向下)+press(压)→向下压→使沮丧<,>impress(v.留下印象)/oppress(v.压迫)/suppress(v.镇压)
capable<,>/ˈkeɪpəbl/<,>/ˈkeɪpəbəl/<,>adj.有能力的/adj.有才能的<,>She is a capable leader who can handle any challenge.<,>她是一位能干的领导者，能够应对任何挑战。<,>He proved himself capable of completing the task on time.<,>他证明了自己有能力按时完成任务。<,>The team is capable of achieving great results.<,>这个团队有能力取得出色的成果。<,>cap(拿)+able(能)→能拿的→有能力的<,>capacity(n.容量/n.能力)/capability(n.能力/n.才能)

burden<,>/ˈbɜːdn/<,>/ˈbɜːrdn/<,>n.重担/n.精神负担/vt.加重压于/vt.烦扰/vt.负担/vt.装载<,>The heavy burden of responsibility weighed on his shoulders.<,>沉重的责任负担压在他的肩上。<,>She didn't want to burden her family with her problems.<,>她不想用自己的问题来烦扰家人。<,>The truck was burdened with too much cargo.<,>卡车装载了过多的货物。<,>burd(负担)+en(使)→使负担<,>burdensome(adj.繁重的)/burdened(adj.负担沉重的)

salute<,>/səˈluːt/<,>/səˈlut/<,>vi.敬礼/vi.致意/vt.向...敬礼/vt.向...致意/vt.赞扬/vt.颂扬/n.敬礼/n.致意<,>The soldiers saluted their commanding officer.<,>士兵们向他们的指挥官敬礼。<,>We salute your courage and dedication.<,>我们赞扬你的勇气和奉献精神。<,>He raised his hand in salute as the car passed by.<,>当汽车经过时，他举手致意。<,>sal(健康)+ute→祝愿健康→致意<,>salutation(n.问候/n.致意)/salutary(adj.有益的)

clasp<,>/klɑːsp/<,>/klæsp/<,>n.扣子/n.钩子/n.紧抱/n.紧握/vt.抱紧/vt.握紧/vt.扣住/vt.扣紧<,>She fastened the clasp of her necklace.<,>她扣上了项链的扣子。<,>The child clasped his mother's hand tightly.<,>孩子紧紧握住母亲的手。<,>They shared a warm clasp before parting.<,>分别前他们紧紧拥抱了一下。<,>cl(紧)+asp(抓住)→紧紧抓住<,>clash(v.冲突/n.碰撞)/clasped(adj.紧握的)

symposium<,>/sɪmˈpəʊziəm/<,>/sɪmˈpoʊziəm/<,>n.讨论会/n.专题报告会/n.专题论文集<,>The university is hosting a symposium on climate change.<,>大学正在举办一个关于气候变化的专题讨论会。<,>His paper was published in the symposium proceedings.<,>他的论文发表在专题论文集中。<,>Experts from various fields attended the symposium.<,>来自各个领域的专家参加了这次研讨会。<,>sym(共同)+pos(放置)+ium→把问题放在一起讨论→讨论会<,>symposiums(n.讨论会复数)/symposia(n.讨论会复数)

hover<,>/ˈhɒvə(r)/<,>/ˈhʌvər/<,>vi.翱翔/vi.逗留在近旁/vi.徘徊/vi.彷徨/vi.犹豫<,>The helicopter hovered above the building.<,>直升机在大楼上空盘旋。<,>She hovered near the door, unsure whether to enter.<,>她在门附近徘徊，不确定是否要进去。<,>The bird hovered in the air before diving for its prey.<,>鸟在空中盘旋，然后俯冲捕食。<,>h(高)+over(在...上)→在高处盘旋<,>hovercraft(n.气垫船)/hovered(adj.盘旋的)

random<,>/ˈrændəm/<,>/ˈrændəm/<,>adj.任意的/adj.随机的<,>He made a random selection from the menu.<,>他从菜单上随机选择了一道菜。<,>The survey was conducted on a random sample of the population.<,>这项调查是在人口中随机抽取的样本上进行的。<,>She took a book at random from the shelf.<,>她从书架上随便拿了一本书。<,>ran(跑)+dom(领域)→在领域里乱跑→随机的<,>randomly(adv.随机地)/randomness(n.随机性)

dine<,>/daɪn/<,>/daɪn/<,>vi.进餐/vt.宴请<,>We usually dine at 7 o'clock in the evening.<,>我们通常在晚上7点进餐。<,>The company will dine its important clients tonight.<,>公司今晚将宴请重要客户。<,>They dined on lobster and champagne.<,>他们享用龙虾和香槟。<,>din(吃饭)+e→进餐<,>diner(n.用餐者/n.小餐馆)/dining(n.进餐)

personality<,>/ˌpɜːsəˈnæləti/<,>/ˌpɜːrsəˈnæləti/<,>n.人格/n.个性/n.人物<,>Her cheerful personality makes her popular.<,>她开朗的个性使她受欢迎。<,>The test measures different aspects of personality.<,>这个测试衡量个性的不同方面。<,>He is a well-known personality in the entertainment industry.<,>他是娱乐界的知名人物。<,>person(人)+ality(性质)→人的性质→个性<,>personal(adj.个人的)/personification(n.拟人化)

sanction<,>/ˈsæŋkʃn/<,>/ˈsæŋkʃən/<,>vt.批准/vt.认可/n.批准/n.认可/n.约束因素/n.约束力/n.国际制裁<,>The government sanctioned the new policy.<,>政府批准了新政策。<,>The UN imposed economic sanctions on the country.<,>联合国对该国实施了经济制裁。<,>Social norms act as sanctions on individual behavior.<,>社会规范对个人行为起到约束作用。<,>sanct(神圣)+ion→神圣的批准→认可<,>sanctioned(adj.批准的)/sanctuary(n.避难所)
alert<,>/əˈlɜːt/<,>/əˈlɜrt/<,>adj.警觉的/adj.留神的/adj.注意的/vt.使认识到/vt.使意识到/n.警戒/n.戒备/n.警报<,>She remained alert during the entire meeting.<,>她在整个会议期间都保持警觉。<,>The security guard was alert to any suspicious activity.<,>保安对任何可疑活动都很警觉。<,>The weather alert warned of an approaching storm.<,>天气警报警告有暴风雨即将来临。<,>al(加强)+ert(活动)→加强活动→警觉的<,>inert(adj.惰性的)/avert(v.避免)/assert(v.断言)

deduce<,>/dɪˈdjuːs/<,>/dɪˈduːs/<,>vt.推论/vt.推断/vt.演绎<,>From the evidence, we can deduce that he was at the scene.<,>从证据中，我们可以推断他当时在场。<,>Sherlock Holmes could deduce a person's occupation from small details.<,>福尔摩斯可以从细节推断一个人的职业。<,>Scientists deduced the age of the fossil through carbon dating.<,>科学家通过碳测年法推断化石的年龄。<,>de(向下)+duce(引导)→向下引导→推断<,>induce(v.诱导)/reduce(v.减少)/seduce(v.引诱)

oak<,>/əʊk/<,>/oʊk/<,>n.栎树/n.橡树/n.栎木/n.橡木<,>The old oak tree in the yard provides shade in summer.<,>院子里那棵老橡树在夏天提供阴凉。<,>This table is made of solid oak.<,>这张桌子是用实心橡木做的。<,>Acorns from the oak tree attract squirrels.<,>橡树上的橡果吸引了松鼠。<,>oak(橡树)→发音类似"OK"，橡树是"OK"的树<,>soak(v.浸泡)/cloak(n.斗篷)/croak(v.呱呱叫)

client<,>/ˈklaɪənt/<,>/ˈklaɪənt/<,>n.委托人/n.当事人/n.顾客<,>The lawyer met with his client to discuss the case.<,>律师与委托人会面讨论案件。<,>Our company values every client's feedback.<,>我们公司重视每位顾客的反馈。<,>The social worker listened carefully to her client's concerns.<,>社会工作者认真倾听当事人的担忧。<,>cli(依靠)+ent(人)→依靠的人→客户<,>patent(n.专利)/silent(adj.安静的)/talent(n.才能)

sip<,>/sɪp/<,>/sɪp/<,>v.小口地喝/v.抿/v.呷/n.小口喝/n.一小口的量<,>She sipped her tea slowly to enjoy the flavor.<,>她小口啜饮茶水以享受味道。<,>He took a sip of water before continuing his speech.<,>他喝了一小口水后继续演讲。<,>The baby sipped milk from a straw cup.<,>婴儿用吸管杯小口喝奶。<,>sip→"吸"的谐音→小口吸饮<,>slip(v.滑倒)/zip(n.拉链)/dip(v.蘸)

dutiful<,>/ˈdjuːtɪfl/<,>/ˈduːtɪfl/<,>adj.恭敬顺从的/adj.尽职的<,>The dutiful son visited his parents every weekend.<,>这个孝顺的儿子每周末都去看望父母。<,>She was a dutiful employee who never missed a deadline.<,>她是个尽职的员工，从不误期。<,>The soldier carried out his orders in a dutiful manner.<,>士兵尽职地执行了命令。<,>duty(责任)+ful(充满)→充满责任感的<,>beautiful(adj.美丽的)/fruitful(adj.多产的)/grateful(adj.感激的)

contend<,>/kənˈtend/<,>/kənˈtɛnd/<,>vi.争夺/vi.竞争/vi.搏斗/vi.争斗/vt.声称/vt.主张<,>Three teams will contend for the championship.<,>三支队伍将争夺冠军。<,>The lawyer contended that his client was innocent.<,>律师坚称他的当事人是无辜的。<,>They had to contend with strong winds during the climb.<,>他们在攀登过程中不得不与强风搏斗。<,>con(共同)+tend(伸展)→共同伸展→竞争<,>content(n.内容)/consent(v.同意)/context(n.上下文)

conversion<,>/kənˈvɜːʃn/<,>/kənˈvɜːrʒn/<,>n.转变/n.变换/n.改变信仰/n.皈依<,>The conversion of the old factory into apartments took two years.<,>将旧工厂改造成公寓花了两年时间。<,>His conversion to Buddhism surprised his family.<,>他皈依佛教让家人很惊讶。<,>The software allows for easy file conversion between formats.<,>这个软件可以轻松实现文件格式转换。<,>con(完全)+vers(转)+ion→完全转变<,>conversation(n.对话)/version(n.版本)/diversion(n.转移)

brilliant<,>/ˈbrɪliənt/<,>/ˈbrɪljənt/<,>adj.光辉的/adj.卓越的<,>The stars were brilliant in the night sky.<,>夜空中的星星闪闪发光。<,>She gave a brilliant performance in the play.<,>她在剧中表现出色。<,>Einstein was a brilliant scientist.<,>爱因斯坦是位卓越的科学家。<,>brilli(发光)+ant(形容词后缀)→发光的<,>radiant(adj.辐射的)/vibrant(adj.充满活力的)/elegant(adj.优雅的)

gamble<,>/ˈɡæmbl/<,>/ˈɡæmbəl/<,>vi.赌博/vi.打赌/vi.投机/vi.冒险/vt.赌/vt.以...为赌注/n.赌博/n.投机/n.冒险<,>He lost all his savings in one night of gambling.<,>他一夜赌博输光了所有积蓄。<,>Starting a business is always a gamble.<,>创业总是一种冒险。<,>They gambled their future on this risky investment.<,>他们把未来押在这次风险投资上。<,>gam(游戏)+ble→赌博游戏<,>ramble(v.漫步)/scramble(v.争夺)/shamble(v.蹒跚)
bound<,>/baʊnd/<,>/baʊnd/<,>adj.一定的/adj.有义务的/v.跳跃/v.弹回/v.成为…的界限/n.跳跃/n.界限/n.限制<,>She is bound to succeed with her talent and hard work.<,>凭借她的天赋和努力，她一定会成功。<,>The ball bounded off the wall and came back to him.<,>球从墙上弹回，又回到了他身边。<,>There are no bounds to his ambition.<,>他的野心没有界限。<,>boun(跳)+d→跳跃<,>bond(n.债券/n.纽带)/bounce(v.弹跳)/boundary(n.边界)

specification<,>/ˌspesɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌspɛsəfɪˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.规格/n.规范/n.明确说明/n.说明书<,>The product must meet the exact specifications provided by the client.<,>产品必须符合客户提供的精确规格。<,>Please read the specifications carefully before assembling the furniture.<,>组装家具前请仔细阅读说明书。<,>The contract includes detailed specifications of the project.<,>合同中包含了项目的详细说明。<,>specific(具体的)+ation→具体说明→规范<,>specialization(n.专业化)/identification(n.识别)

deport<,>/dɪˈpɔːt/<,>/dɪˈpɔːrt/<,>vt.把…驱逐出境<,>The government decided to deport the illegal immigrants.<,>政府决定将非法移民驱逐出境。<,>He was deported for violating the immigration laws.<,>他因违反移民法被驱逐出境。<,>The criminal was deported back to his home country.<,>这名罪犯被驱逐回他的祖国。<,>de(离开)+port(运送)→运出去→驱逐<,>export(v.出口)/import(v.进口)/report(v.报告)

counter<,>/ˈkaʊntə(r)/<,>/ˈkaʊntər/<,>n.柜台/n.计数器/n.筹码<,>She placed her order at the coffee counter.<,>她在咖啡柜台点了单。<,>The geiger counter detected high radiation levels.<,>盖革计数器检测到高辐射水平。<,>He put all his counters on the blackjack table.<,>他把所有筹码都放在了二十一点赌桌上。<,>count(计数)+er→计数器<,>encounter(v.遭遇)/country(n.国家)

rhythm<,>/ˈrɪðəm/<,>/ˈrɪðəm/<,>n.韵律/n.节奏<,>The song has a catchy rhythm that makes you want to dance.<,>这首歌有朗朗上口的节奏，让人想跳舞。<,>She has a natural sense of rhythm when playing the drums.<,>她打鼓时有天生的节奏感。<,>The poet used an unusual rhythm in this verse.<,>诗人在这节诗中使用了不寻常的韵律。<,>rhyme(押韵)+thm→韵律<,>rhyme(n.押韵)/arithmetic(n.算术)

layman<,>/ˈleɪmən/<,>/ˈleɪmən/<,>n.门外汉/n.外行<,>As a layman, I find this medical terminology confusing.<,>作为外行，我觉得这些医学术语很困惑。<,>The professor explained quantum physics in layman's terms.<,>教授用外行人能懂的语言解释量子物理。<,>This book is written for the layman, not experts.<,>这本书是为外行而非专家写的。<,>lay(外行的)+man(人)→外行人<,>layoff(n.解雇)/layperson(n.外行)

conserve<,>/kənˈsɜːv/<,>/kənˈsɜːrv/<,>vt.保护/vt.保藏/vt.保存<,>We need to conserve water during the drought.<,>干旱期间我们需要节约用水。<,>This museum works to conserve ancient artifacts.<,>这个博物馆致力于保护古代文物。<,>He conserved his energy for the final sprint.<,>他为最后的冲刺保存了体力。<,>con(共同)+serve(保持)→共同保持→保存<,>preserve(v.保存)/reserve(v.保留)

stroke<,>/strəʊk/<,>/stroʊk/<,>n.中风/n.一举/n.划水/n.击/n.钟声/n.笔画/n.抚摸/vt.抚摸<,>He suffered a stroke last year but has recovered well.<,>他去年中风了，但恢复得很好。<,>With one stroke of his pen, he signed the historic agreement.<,>他大笔一挥，签署了这项历史性协议。<,>She stroked the cat gently.<,>她轻轻抚摸着猫。<,>strike(击打)的变体<,>strike(v.打击)/streak(n.条纹)

breed<,>/briːd/<,>/briːd/<,>v.繁殖/v.养育/v.酿成/n.品种<,>This kennel breeds champion show dogs.<,>这个犬舍培育冠军赛犬。<,>Poverty often breeds crime.<,>贫困常常滋生犯罪。<,>This is a rare breed of sheep.<,>这是一种稀有品种的羊。<,>breed与bleed(流血)形似但意不同<,>bleed(v.流血)/bread(n.面包)

tease<,>/tiːz/<,>/tiːz/<,>vt.戏弄/vt.取笑/vt.挑逗<,>The children teased the new student about his accent.<,>孩子们取笑新同学的口音。<,>She likes to tease her little brother.<,>她喜欢逗她的小弟弟。<,>The wind teased her hair as she walked along the beach.<,>她沿着海滩散步时，风撩拨着她的头发。<,>tea(茶)+se→喝茶时的玩笑话→取笑<,>ease(n.轻松)/cease(v.停止)
rash<,>/ræʃ/<,>/ræʃ/<,>adj.轻率的/adj.鲁莽的/n.疹/n.皮疹/n.爆发的一连串<,>He made a rash decision without thinking.<,>他未经思考就做出了轻率的决定。<,>She developed a rash after eating seafood.<,>她吃了海鲜后起了皮疹。<,>A rash of burglaries has been reported in the neighborhood.<,>社区里报告了一连串的入室盗窃。<,>rash(匆忙)→轻率的<,>crash(v.碰撞/n.崩溃)/trash(n.垃圾)/bash(v.猛击)  

fragrance<,>/ˈfreɪɡrəns/<,>/ˈfreɪɡrəns/<,>n.芳香/n.香味/n.香水<,>The fragrance of roses filled the garden.<,>玫瑰的芳香弥漫了整个花园。<,>She loves wearing light fragrances in summer.<,>她喜欢在夏天喷淡香水。<,>This soap has a fresh citrus fragrance.<,>这块肥皂有清新的柑橘香味。<,>fragr(芳香)+ance(名词后缀)→香味<,>flagrant(adj.臭名昭著的)/fragment(n.碎片)  

management<,>/ˈmænɪdʒmənt/<,>/ˈmænɪdʒmənt/<,>n.管理/n.处理/n.管理部门/n.管理人员<,>Good management is key to a company's success.<,>良好的管理是公司成功的关键。<,>The management has decided to cut costs.<,>管理部门决定削减成本。<,>She's studying business management at university.<,>她正在大学学习商业管理。<,>manage(管理)+ment(名词后缀)→管理<,>manager(n.经理)/mismanagement(n.管理不善)  

cylinder<,>/ˈsɪlɪndə(r)/<,>/ˈsɪlɪndər/<,>n.圆柱体/n.圆筒/n.气缸/n.泵体<,>The gas is stored in a metal cylinder.<,>气体储存在金属圆筒里。<,>Engine power depends on the number of cylinders.<,>发动机功率取决于气缸数量。<,>Students learned to calculate the volume of a cylinder.<,>学生们学习了计算圆柱体的体积。<,>cyl(圆)+inder→圆柱体<,>calendar(n.日历)/cylinder block(气缸体)  

fort<,>/fɔːt/<,>/fɔːrt/<,>n.堡垒/n.城堡<,>The old fort stands on the hill overlooking the city.<,>古老的堡垒矗立在小山上俯瞰着城市。<,>They took refuge in the coastal fort during the storm.<,>暴风雨期间他们在海岸堡垒中避难。<,>The children built a small fort with blankets and chairs.<,>孩子们用毯子和椅子搭了个小堡垒。<,>fort(强)→坚固的地方→堡垒<,>forte(n.长处)/fortify(v.加强)  

avoid<,>/əˈvɔɪd/<,>/əˈvɔɪd/<,>vt.避免/vt.躲开/vt.撤销<,>You should avoid eating too much sugar.<,>你应该避免吃太多糖。<,>He crossed the street to avoid meeting his ex-wife.<,>他穿过马路以避免遇见前妻。<,>The company wants to avoid legal problems.<,>公司想避免法律问题。<,>a(不)+void(空)→不空着→避免<,>void(adj.空的/n.空虚)/avid(adj.渴望的)  

comprehensive<,>/ˌkɒmprɪˈhensɪv/<,>/ˌkɑːmprɪˈhensɪv/<,>adj.广泛的/adj.综合的/adj.理解的<,>The school offers a comprehensive curriculum.<,>学校提供综合课程。<,>She gave a comprehensive explanation of the problem.<,>她对问题做了全面的解释。<,>We need a comprehensive approach to solve this issue.<,>我们需要综合的方法来解决这个问题。<,>com(完全)+prehend(抓住)+ive→完全抓住的→综合的<,>comprehension(n.理解)/apprehensive(adj.忧虑的)  

tunnel<,>/ˈtʌnl/<,>/ˈtʌnl/<,>v.挖/v.开/n.隧道/n.坑道/n.地道<,>They are tunneling through the mountain.<,>他们正在挖穿这座山。<,>The rabbit disappeared into its tunnel.<,>兔子消失在地道里。<,>The Channel Tunnel connects England and France.<,>英吉利海峡隧道连接英国和法国。<,>tun(桶)+nel→像桶一样的通道→隧道<,>tunnel vision(视野狭窄)/funnel(n.漏斗)  

assign<,>/əˈsaɪn/<,>/əˈsaɪn/<,>vt.指派/vt.分配/vt.布置/vt.指定<,>The teacher will assign homework every Friday.<,>老师每周五都会布置作业。<,>They assigned me to the marketing department.<,>他们把我分配到了市场部。<,>Each student was assigned a research topic.<,>每个学生都被指定了一个研究课题。<,>as(向)+sign(标记)→做标记分配<,>design(v.设计/n.图案)/resign(v.辞职)  

withdraw<,>/wɪðˈdrɔː/<,>/wɪðˈdrɔː/<,>v.收回/v.撤回/v.撤退<,>He decided to withdraw his application.<,>他决定撤回申请。<,>The army was forced to withdraw from the area.<,>军队被迫从该地区撤退。<,>You can withdraw cash at any ATM.<,>你可以在任何ATM机上取现。<,>with(回)+draw(拉)→拉回→撤回<,>withdrawal(n.撤退/n.提款)/withhold(v.扣留)
straightforward<,>/ˌstreɪtˈfɔːwəd/<,>/ˌstreɪtˈfɔrwərd/<,>adj.正直的/adj.坦率的/adj.易懂的/adj.简单的<,>He gave a straightforward answer to the question.<,>他对这个问题给出了坦率的回答。<,>The instructions are straightforward and easy to follow.<,>这些说明简单易懂。<,>She has a straightforward personality.<,>她性格直率。<,>straight(直的)+forward(向前)→直来直去→坦率的<,>forthright(adj.直率的)/complicated(adj.复杂的)/honest(adj.诚实的)

elaborate<,>/ɪˈlæbərət/<,>/ɪˈlæbərət/<,>adj.复杂的/adj.精心制作的/v.详述/v.详细制定<,>She wore an elaborate dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件精心制作的礼服去参加派对。<,>He elaborated on his plan for the project.<,>他详细阐述了他的项目计划。<,>The cake had an elaborate design.<,>蛋糕有一个复杂的设计。<,>e(出)+labor(劳动)+ate→劳动出来的→精心制作的<,>complex(adj.复杂的)/simple(adj.简单的)/detailed(adj.详细的)

expert<,>/ˈekspɜːt/<,>/ˈekspɜːrt/<,>adj.熟练的/n.专家<,>She is an expert in ancient history.<,>她是古代历史方面的专家。<,>He showed expert skill in playing the piano.<,>他展示了熟练的钢琴演奏技巧。<,>The company hired an expert to solve the problem.<,>公司聘请了一位专家来解决这个问题。<,>ex(出)+pert(尝试)→尝试过很多→专家<,>specialist(n.专家)/amateur(n.业余爱好者)/skilled(adj.熟练的)

decade<,>/ˈdekeɪd/<,>/ˈdekeɪd/<,>n.十年/n.十年期<,>Technology has advanced rapidly in the past decade.<,>在过去十年里，技术发展迅速。<,>She has been working here for over a decade.<,>她在这里工作已经超过十年了。<,>The 1960s was a turbulent decade.<,>20世纪60年代是一个动荡的十年。<,>dec(十)+ade→十年<,>century(n.世纪)/year(n.年)/millennium(n.千年)

fulfill<,>/fʊlˈfɪl/<,>/fʊlˈfɪl/<,>vt.履行/vt.实现/vt.完成/vt.满足/vt.使满意<,>He fulfilled his promise to help her.<,>他履行了帮助她的承诺。<,>The job fulfills all my expectations.<,>这份工作满足了我所有的期望。<,>She worked hard to fulfill her dreams.<,>她努力工作以实现她的梦想。<,>ful(满)+fill(填)→填满→实现<,>accomplish(vt.完成)/satisfy(vt.满足)/fail(vt.失败)

crowd<,>/kraʊd/<,>/kraʊd/<,>vi.聚集/vi.挤/vi.涌/n.群/n.一批/vt.挤/vt.挤满<,>A large crowd gathered to watch the parade.<,>一大群人聚集起来观看游行。<,>People crowded into the small room.<,>人们挤进了这个小房间。<,>The streets were crowded with tourists.<,>街道上挤满了游客。<,>crow(乌鸦)+d→像乌鸦一样聚集→人群<,>group(n.群)/throng(n.人群)/empty(adj.空的)

congress<,>/ˈkɒŋɡres/<,>/ˈkɑːŋɡres/<,>n.代表大会/n.国会/n.议会<,>The bill was passed by Congress.<,>该法案由国会通过。<,>He attended an international medical congress.<,>他参加了一个国际医学代表大会。<,>The congress will discuss important issues.<,>议会将讨论重要问题。<,>con(共同)+gress(走)→走到一起→代表大会<,>parliament(n.议会)/assembly(n.集会)/meeting(n.会议)

mechanical<,>/mɪˈkænɪkl/<,>/məˈkænɪkl/<,>adj.机械的/adj.机械制造的/adj.机械学的/adj.力学的/adj.呆板的<,>He has a mechanical engineering degree.<,>他拥有机械工程学位。<,>The toy has simple mechanical parts.<,>这个玩具有简单的机械部件。<,>Her performance was mechanical and lacked emotion.<,>她的表演呆板，缺乏情感。<,>mechan(机械)+ical→机械的<,>automatic(adj.自动的)/manual(adj.手工的)/dynamic(adj.动态的)

divine<,>/dɪˈvaɪn/<,>/dɪˈvaɪn/<,>adj.神的/adj.神授的/adj.天赐的/adj.极好的/adj.极美的<,>They believed the victory was a divine intervention.<,>他们认为胜利是神的干预。<,>She has a divine singing voice.<,>她有一副极美的歌喉。<,>The view from the top was simply divine.<,>从顶部看去的景色简直美极了。<,>div(神)+ine→神的<,>holy(adj.神圣的)/heavenly(adj.天国的)/terrible(adj.糟糕的)

slaughter<,>/ˈslɔːtə(r)/<,>/ˈslɔːtər/<,>n.屠杀/n.杀戮/n.屠宰/vt.屠杀/vt.杀戮/vt.屠宰<,>The slaughter of innocent civilians shocked the world.<,>对无辜平民的屠杀震惊了世界。<,>They slaughter animals for food.<,>他们屠宰动物作为食物。<,>The battle resulted in a terrible slaughter.<,>这场战斗导致了可怕的杀戮。<,>slaught(击打)+er→击打致死→屠杀<,>massacre(n.大屠杀)/kill(vt.杀死)/butcher(vt.屠宰)
foul<,>/faʊl/<,>/faʊl/<,>adj.难闻的/adj.发臭的/adj.令人不愉快的/adj.糟透了的/adj.污浊的/adj.肮脏的/adj.下流的/adj.辱骂性的/adj.恶劣的/adj.有暴风雨的/adj.邪恶的/adj.罪恶的/vt.对…犯规/vt.弄脏/vt.弄污/n.犯规<,>The smell from the garbage was foul.<,>垃圾散发出的气味很难闻。<,>He was sent off for a foul on the striker.<,>他因对前锋犯规被罚下场。<,>She gave him a foul look.<,>她恶狠狠地看了他一眼。<,>foul与fowl(家禽)发音相同，但意思不同<,>vile(adj.卑鄙的)/filthy(adj.肮脏的)/nasty(adj.令人不快的)

output<,>/ˈaʊtpʊt/<,>/ˈaʊtˌpʊt/<,>n.产量/n.输出/n.输出功率/vt.输出<,>The factory's output has increased this year.<,>今年工厂的产量增加了。<,>The computer outputs data to the printer.<,>计算机将数据输出到打印机。<,>Agricultural output is vital for the economy.<,>农业产出对经济至关重要。<,>out(出)+put(放)→放出来→输出<,>input(n.输入/vt.输入)/outcome(n.结果)/outlet(n.出口)

intricate<,>/ˈɪntrɪkət/<,>/ˈɪn.trɪ.kət/<,>adj.错综复杂的/adj.复杂精细的<,>The design features intricate patterns.<,>这个设计以复杂的图案为特色。<,>She solved the intricate puzzle quickly.<,>她很快解开了这个复杂的谜题。<,>The plot of the novel is intricate.<,>这部小说的情节错综复杂。<,>in(内)+tric(复杂)+ate→内部复杂的<,>complex(adj.复杂的)/complicated(adj.难懂的)/elaborate(adj.精心制作的)

fatigue<,>/fəˈtiːɡ/<,>/fəˈtiːɡ/<,>v.疲劳/n.疲劳/n.劳累<,>After the long hike, he felt extreme fatigue.<,>长途徒步后，他感到极度疲劳。<,>The soldiers were suffering from battle fatigue.<,>士兵们正遭受战斗疲劳。<,>Mental fatigue can affect your work performance.<,>精神疲劳会影响你的工作表现。<,>fat(胖)+igue→胖人容易疲劳<,>exhaustion(n.精疲力竭)/tiredness(n.疲倦)/weariness(n.疲劳)

agony<,>/ˈæɡəni/<,>/ˈæɡ.ə.ni/<,>n.痛苦/n.苦恼<,>She was in agony after the accident.<,>事故后她处于极度痛苦中。<,>The decision caused him great agony.<,>这个决定让他非常痛苦。<,>He screamed in agony when he broke his leg.<,>他摔断腿时痛苦地尖叫。<,>ago(以前)+ny→以前的痛苦记忆<,>anguish(n.极度痛苦)/torment(n.折磨)/suffering(n.苦难)

contemplate<,>/ˈkɒntəmpleɪt/<,>/ˈkɑːn.t̬əm.pleɪt/<,>vt.盘算/vt.计议/vt.思量/vt.周密考虑/vt.注视/vt.凝视<,>He sat quietly, contemplating his future.<,>他安静地坐着，思考着自己的未来。<,>She contemplated the beautiful sunset.<,>她凝视着美丽的日落。<,>They are contemplating moving to another city.<,>他们正在考虑搬到另一个城市。<,>con(共同)+templ(神庙)+ate→在神庙中共同思考<,>consider(v.考虑)/ponder(v.沉思)/meditate(v.冥想)

majority<,>/məˈdʒɒrəti/<,>/məˈdʒɔːr.ə.t̬i/<,>n.多数/n.大多数<,>The majority of people voted for the new law.<,>大多数人投票支持新法律。<,>She won the election by a large majority.<,>她以压倒性多数赢得了选举。<,>In the majority of cases, the treatment is effective.<,>在大多数情况下，这种治疗是有效的。<,>major(主要的)+ity→大多数<,>minority(n.少数)/plurality(n.多数)/consensus(n.共识)

drag<,>/dræɡ/<,>/dræɡ/<,>v.拖/v.拉/v.迫使/v.硬拉/v.拖着脚步走/n.累赘/n.一吸/n.一抽<,>He dragged the heavy box across the floor.<,>他拖着沉重的箱子穿过地板。<,>Don't drag your feet when you walk.<,>走路时不要拖着脚。<,>She took a long drag on her cigarette.<,>她深深地吸了一口烟。<,>d(低)+rag(破布)→低处拖破布<,>pull(v.拉)/haul(v.拖运)/tug(v.用力拖)

zinc<,>/zɪŋk/<,>/zɪŋk/<,>n.锌<,>Zinc is an essential mineral for the body.<,>锌是人体必需的矿物质。<,>The roof was covered with zinc sheets.<,>屋顶覆盖着锌板。<,>Zinc oxide is used in sunscreen.<,>氧化锌用于防晒霜中。<,>zinc发音类似"锌克"→锌<,>iron(n.铁)/copper(n.铜)/aluminum(n.铝)

costume<,>/ˈkɒstjuːm/<,>/ˈkɑː.stuːm/<,>n.服装/n.服饰/n.戏装/n.成套服装<,>She wore a beautiful costume to the party.<,>她穿了一件漂亮的服装去参加派对。<,>The actors were in historical costumes.<,>演员们穿着历史戏服。<,>Halloween costumes can be very creative.<,>万圣节服装可以非常有创意。<,>cost(花费)+ume→花费制作的服装<,>outfit(n.全套服装)/attire(n.盛装)/garb(n.特定服装)
clamp<,>/klæmp/<,>/klæmp/<,>vt.夹紧/vt.夹住/vt.固定/n.夹头/n.夹具/n.夹钳<,>He used a clamp to hold the pieces of wood together.<,>他用夹具把木块固定在一起。<,>The mechanic tightened the clamp on the hose.<,>机械师拧紧了软管上的夹子。<,>She clamped the papers down with a heavy book.<,>她用一本厚书把文件压住。<,>clam(蛤蜊)+p→像蛤蜊一样夹紧<,>clap(v.鼓掌)/clasp(v.紧握/n.扣子)/camp(n.营地)

issue<,>/ˈɪʃuː/<,>/ˈɪʃuː/<,>v.发行/v.分发/v.发出/n.问题/n.发行/n.分发<,>The government issued a new set of stamps.<,>政府发行了一套新邮票。<,>This magazine comes out in monthly issues.<,>这本杂志每月发行一期。<,>We need to address the issue of climate change.<,>我们需要解决气候变化的问题。<,>is(出)+sue(跟随)→跟随而出→发行<,>tissue(n.纸巾)/sue(v.起诉)/pursue(v.追求)

maturity<,>/məˈtʃʊərəti/<,>/məˈtʃʊrəti/<,>n.成熟<,>The cheese needs time to reach full maturity.<,>奶酪需要时间才能完全成熟。<,>He showed great maturity in handling the situation.<,>他在处理这种情况时表现得很成熟。<,>The bond will be repaid at maturity.<,>债券将在到期时偿还。<,>mat(母亲)+urity→像母亲一样成熟<,>immature(adj.不成熟的)/mature(adj.成熟的)/maternity(n.母性)

vain<,>/veɪn/<,>/veɪn/<,>adj.徒劳的/adj.自负的<,>All our efforts were in vain.<,>我们所有的努力都白费了。<,>He's very vain about his appearance.<,>他对自己的外表非常自负。<,>She made a vain attempt to stop the leak.<,>她徒劳地试图阻止泄漏。<,>vain(空的)→徒劳的<,>vein(n.静脉)/vane(n.风向标)/pain(n.疼痛)

decree<,>/dɪˈkriː/<,>/dɪˈkriː/<,>n.法令/n.政令/n.判决/n.裁决/vt.判决/vt.命令<,>The king issued a royal decree.<,>国王颁布了一项皇家法令。<,>The court decreed that the company must pay compensation.<,>法院判决该公司必须支付赔偿金。<,>The government decreed a state of emergency.<,>政府下令进入紧急状态。<,>de(加强)+cree(区分)→官方区分→法令<,>degree(n.学位/n.程度)/discreet(adj.谨慎的)

conservation<,>/ˌkɒnsəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnsərˈveɪʃn/<,>n.保存/n.保护/n.避免浪费/n.守恒<,>Energy conservation is important for the environment.<,>节约能源对环境很重要。<,>The building is under conservation order.<,>这栋建筑受保护令保护。<,>The law of conservation of energy states that energy cannot be created or destroyed.<,>能量守恒定律指出能量不能被创造或毁灭。<,>con(共同)+serv(保持)+ation→共同保持→保护<,>conversation(n.谈话)/reservation(n.保留/n.预订)

supplement<,>/ˈsʌplɪment/<,>/ˈsʌplɪment/<,>n.增补/n.补充/n.增刊/n.副刊/vt.增补/vt.补充<,>She takes vitamin supplements every day.<,>她每天服用维生素补充剂。<,>The newspaper has a Sunday supplement.<,>这份报纸有周日增刊。<,>He supplements his income by working part-time.<,>他通过兼职工作来补充收入。<,>sup(下)+ple(满)+ment→从下面填满→补充<,>implement(vt.实施/n.工具)/complement(n.补充物/vt.补充)

contrast<,>/ˈkɒntrɑːst/<,>/ˈkɑːntræst/<,>vi.形成对比/vi.对比之下显出区别/n.对比/n.对照/n.反差/vt.对比/vt.对照<,>The black and white colors contrast sharply.<,>黑白颜色形成鲜明对比。<,>In contrast to his brother, he is very quiet.<,>与他兄弟相比，他很安静。<,>The artist used contrast effectively in his painting.<,>艺术家在画作中有效地运用了对比。<,>contra(相反)+st(站)→站在对面→对比<,>contest(n.比赛)/contact(n.接触)/contract(n.合同)

verdict<,>/ˈvɜːdɪkt/<,>/ˈvɜːrdɪkt/<,>n.裁定/n.定论/n.判断性意见<,>The jury reached a unanimous verdict.<,>陪审团达成了一致裁决。<,>The public verdict on the new policy was negative.<,>公众对新政策的评价是负面的。<,>The judge will deliver the verdict tomorrow.<,>法官将于明天宣布判决。<,>ver(真实)+dict(说)→说出真相→裁决<,>predict(v.预测)/addict(n.上瘾者)/contradict(v.反驳)

stereo<,>/ˈsteriəʊ/<,>/ˈsterioʊ/<,>adj.立体的/adj.立体声的/n.立体声<,>He bought a new stereo system.<,>他买了一套新的立体声音响。<,>The movie was recorded in stereo sound.<,>这部电影是用立体声录制的。<,>The photograph gives a stereo effect.<,>这张照片呈现出立体效果。<,>stere(固体)+o→立体的<,>stereotype(n.刻板印象)/sterile(adj.无菌的)/stern(adj.严厉的)
defy<,>/dɪˈfaɪ/<,>/dɪˈfaɪ/<,>vt.违抗/vt.蔑视/vt.使成为不可能/vt.惹/vt.激<,>He defied his parents' wishes and dropped out of school.<,>他违抗父母的意愿，辍学了。<,>Her beauty defies description.<,>她的美丽难以形容。<,>The child defied his teacher by talking back.<,>那孩子顶撞老师，违抗他的命令。<,>de(否定)+fy(做)→不做→违抗<,>deny(v. 否认)/deify(v. 神化)/defile(v. 弄脏)

doctrine<,>/ˈdɒktrɪn/<,>/ˈdɑːktrɪn/<,>n.教义/n.教条/n.主义<,>The church teaches the doctrine of original sin.<,>教会讲授原罪的教义。<,>He rejected the doctrine of predestination.<,>他拒绝接受宿命论的教条。<,>The Monroe Doctrine shaped US foreign policy.<,>门罗主义塑造了美国的外交政策。<,>doct(教导)+rine→教义<,>document(n. 文件)/doctor(n. 医生)/doctrinaire(adj. 教条的)

paragraph<,>/ˈpærəɡrɑːf/<,>/ˈpærəɡræf/<,>n.段/n.节<,>Please read the first paragraph aloud.<,>请大声朗读第一段。<,>This paragraph summarizes the main argument.<,>这一段总结了主要论点。<,>Each paragraph should focus on one idea.<,>每个段落应围绕一个中心思想。<,>para(旁边)+graph(写)→分段写→段落<,>paragon(n. 模范)/paradigm(n. 范例)/paraphrase(v. 释义)

mediate<,>/ˈmiːdieɪt/<,>/ˈmiːdieɪt/<,>vi.调解/vi.斡旋/vt.经调解解决/vt.经斡旋促成<,>The UN is trying to mediate between the two countries.<,>联合国正试图在这两国之间进行调解。<,>He mediated a settlement to the dispute.<,>他调解促成了争端的解决。<,>She has a talent for mediating conflicts.<,>她有调解冲突的天赋。<,>medi(中间)+ate→在中间→调解<,>meditate(v. 冥想)/immediate(adj. 立即的)/median(adj. 中间的)

pursuit<,>/pəˈsjuːt/<,>/pərˈsuːt/<,>n.追求/n.寻求/n.追赶/n.追逐/n.事/n.嗜好/n.消遣<,>He devoted his life to the pursuit of knowledge.<,>他毕生追求知识。<,>The police were in pursuit of the suspect.<,>警方正在追捕嫌疑人。<,>Gardening is her favorite pursuit.<,>园艺是她最爱的消遣。<,>pur(向前)+suit(跟随)→向前跟随→追求<,>pursue(v. 追求)/pursuant(adj. 依照的)/pursuer(n. 追求者)

prophet<,>/ˈprɒfɪt/<,>/ˈprɑːfɪt/<,>n.先知/n.预言者<,>Mohammed is the prophet of Islam.<,>穆罕默德是伊斯兰教的先知。<,>He claimed to be a prophet of doom.<,>他自称是末日预言者。<,>The ancient prophets foretold the coming of a savior.<,>古代先知预言了救世主的到来。<,>pro(前)+phet(说)→提前说的人→先知<,>profit(n. 利润)/prophetic(adj. 预言的)/prophesy(v. 预言)

cycle<,>/ˈsaɪkl/<,>/ˈsaɪkl/<,>n.自行车/n.摩托车/n.循环/v.循环<,>I ride my cycle to work every day.<,>我每天骑自行车上班。<,>The water cycle is essential to life on Earth.<,>水循环对地球上的生命至关重要。<,>The seasons cycle endlessly.<,>四季循环永无止境。<,>cycl(圆)+e→循环<,>recycle(v. 回收)/bicycle(n. 自行车)/cyclone(n. 旋风)

amplify<,>/ˈæmplɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈæmplɪfaɪ/<,>vt.放大/vt.增强/vt.扩大/vt.详述/vt.进一步阐述<,>We need to amplify the sound for the back rows.<,>我们需要放大声音让后排听到。<,>He amplified his argument with more evidence.<,>他用更多证据进一步阐述了他的论点。<,>The microscope amplifies tiny objects.<,>显微镜放大了微小物体。<,>ampl(大)+ify(使)→使变大→放大<,>ample(adj. 充足的)/amplitude(n. 振幅)/amplification(n. 放大)

lure<,>/lʊə(r)/<,>/lʊr/<,>vt.吸引/vt.引诱/vt.诱惑/n.吸引力/n.诱惑物/n.诱饵/n.鱼饵<,>The company uses bonuses to lure top talent.<,>公司用奖金吸引顶尖人才。<,>The shiny lure attracted many fish.<,>闪亮的鱼饵吸引了许多鱼。<,>Don't be lured by get-rich-quick schemes.<,>不要被快速致富的计划诱惑。<,>lur(诱)+e→诱惑<,>allure(v. 诱惑)/lurid(adj. 耸人听闻的)/lurk(v. 潜伏)

disposal<,>/dɪˈspəʊzl/<,>/dɪˈspoʊzl/<,>n.丢掉/n.销毁/n.处理/n.排列/n.布置<,>Waste disposal is a serious environmental issue.<,>废物处理是一个严重的环境问题。<,>He has a large sum of money at his disposal.<,>他有一大笔钱可供支配。<,>The disposal of nuclear waste requires caution.<,>核废料的处理需要谨慎。<,>dis(分开)+pos(放)+al→分开摆放→处理<,>dispose(v. 处理)/depose(v. 免职)/expose(v. 暴露)
settlement<,>/ˈsetlmənt/<,>/ˈsɛtlmənt/<,>n.解决/n.协议/n.居留地/n.小社区<,>The two parties reached a settlement after long negotiations.<,>双方经过长时间谈判达成了协议。<,>The early settlers established a small settlement by the river.<,>早期的定居者在河边建立了一个小社区。<,>The legal settlement was finalized last week.<,>法律上的解决方案上周已最终确定。<,>settle(安顿)+ment(名词后缀)→安顿下来的地方→居留地<,>agreement(n.协议)/colony(n.殖民地)/resolution(n.解决)

whirl<,>/wɜːl/<,>/wɜrl/<,>vi.旋转/vi.急转/vi.发晕/vi.变混乱/n.旋转/n.回旋/n.混乱/n.一连串的事<,>The leaves whirled in the autumn wind.<,>树叶在秋风中旋转。<,>My head was whirling after the roller coaster ride.<,>坐完过山车后我的头直发晕。<,>A whirl of activities kept her busy all day.<,>一连串的活动让她整天都很忙。<,>whirl与twirl(旋转)同源<,>swirl(v.打旋/n.漩涡)/twirl(v.快速旋转)/hurl(v.猛投)

recede<,>/rɪˈsiːd/<,>/rɪˈsid/<,>vi.退/vi.退去/vi.渐渐远去/vi.向后倾斜/vi.缩进<,>The flood waters began to recede after the storm.<,>暴风雨过后洪水开始退去。<,>His hairline is receding as he ages.<,>随着年龄增长他的发际线在后退。<,>The coastline receded into the distance as the ship sailed away.<,>随着船只驶离，海岸线渐渐远去。<,>re(回)+cede(走)→往回走→退去<,>concede(v.让步)/precede(v.领先)/secede(v.脱离)

literature<,>/ˈlɪtrətʃə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪtərətʃər/<,>n.文学/n.文学作品/n.文献/n.图书资料<,>She is studying English literature at university.<,>她在大学学习英国文学。<,>The library has an extensive collection of scientific literature.<,>图书馆有大量科学文献收藏。<,>This novel is considered a classic of American literature.<,>这部小说被认为是美国文学的经典之作。<,>liter(文字)+ature(状态)→文字作品→文学<,>literal(adj.字面的)/literate(adj.有文化的)/illiterate(adj.文盲的)

digest<,>/daɪˈdʒest/<,>/daɪˈdʒɛst/<,>vt.消化/vt.领会/n.文摘<,>It takes time to digest a heavy meal.<,>消化一顿大餐需要时间。<,>I need some time to digest what you just told me.<,>我需要些时间来理解你刚才告诉我的事。<,>Reader's Digest is a popular magazine worldwide.<,>《读者文摘》是全球流行的杂志。<,>di(分开)+gest(运送)→分开运送→消化<,>ingest(v.摄取)/suggest(v.建议)/congest(v.拥挤)

slump<,>/slʌmp/<,>/slʌmp/<,>vi.大幅度下降/vi.暴跌/vi.突然倒下/n.萧条期/n.低潮<,>Sales slumped during the economic crisis.<,>经济危机期间销售额大幅下降。<,>He slumped onto the sofa after a long day at work.<,>工作一整天后他瘫倒在沙发上。<,>The economy is in a prolonged slump.<,>经济处于长期萧条中。<,>slump与plump(丰满的)对比记忆<,>plump(adj.丰满的)/slur(v.含糊地说)/slum(n.贫民窟)

prejudice<,>/ˈpredʒudɪs/<,>/ˈprɛdʒədɪs/<,>n.偏见/n.成见/vt.使有偏见/vt.对...不利/vt.损害<,>We should judge people without prejudice.<,>我们应该不带偏见地评判他人。<,>His remarks prejudiced the jury against the defendant.<,>他的言论使陪审团对被告产生了偏见。<,>Such behavior might prejudice your chances of promotion.<,>这种行为可能会损害你晋升的机会。<,>pre(预先)+judice(判断)→预先判断→偏见<,>judge(n.法官)/justice(n.正义)/injury(n.伤害)

clearance<,>/ˈklɪərəns/<,>/ˈklɪrəns/<,>n.净空/n.余隙/n.许可/n.批准/n.票据交换/n.清算/n.清除/n.清理/n.出空<,>The bridge has a clearance of 5 meters.<,>这座桥的净空高度为5米。<,>You need security clearance to enter this area.<,>你需要安全许可才能进入这个区域。<,>The store is having a clearance sale this weekend.<,>这家商店本周末正在进行清仓大甩卖。<,>clear(清除)+ance(名词后缀)→清除的过程<,>appearance(n.出现)/disappearance(n.消失)/endurance(n.耐力)

customary<,>/ˈkʌstəməri/<,>/ˈkʌstəˌmɛri/<,>adj.习惯上的/adj.惯常的/adj.合乎习俗的<,>It's customary to shake hands when you meet someone.<,>见面握手是惯常的礼节。<,>She gave the customary speech at the opening ceremony.<,>她在开幕式上做了惯例的讲话。<,>It's not customary to tip in this country.<,>在这个国家给小费不是习俗。<,>custom(习俗)+ary(形容词后缀)→习俗的<,>customer(n.顾客)/accustom(v.使习惯)/costume(n.服装)

immigrant<,>/ˈɪmɪɡrənt/<,>/ˈɪməɡrənt/<,>n.移民/n.侨民<,>Many immigrants came to America seeking a better life.<,>许多移民来到美国寻求更好的生活。<,>She is an immigrant from China living in Canada.<,>她是生活在加拿大的中国移民。<,>The city has a large immigrant population.<,>这个城市有大量移民人口。<,>im(进入)+migr(迁移)+ant(人)→迁移进来的人→移民<,>emigrant(n.移居外国者)/migrant(n.移民)/migrate(v.迁移)

veto<,>/ˈviːtəʊ/<,>/ˈviːtoʊ/<,>n.否决/vt.否决<,>The president used his veto power to reject the bill.<,>总统行使否决权驳回了该法案。<,>They vetoed the proposal to build a new highway.<,>他们否决了修建新高速公路的提案。<,>Each member of the council has the right to veto.<,>理事会每位成员都有否决权。<,>来自拉丁语"我禁止"<,>vote(v.投票)/vet(v.审查)/venue(n.地点)

thorn<,>/θɔːn/<,>/θɔːrn/<,>n.刺/n.荆棘/n.带刺小灌木<,>Be careful - the rose has sharp thorns.<,>小心——这朵玫瑰有尖锐的刺。<,>He removed a thorn from the lion's paw.<,>他从狮子的爪子上拔出了一根刺。<,>The path was overgrown with thorns and brambles.<,>小径长满了荆棘和悬钩子。<,>t(形似刺的形状)+horn(角)→像角一样的刺<,>throne(n.王座)/horn(n.角)/thorny(adj.多刺的)

disposition<,>/ˌdɪspəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌdɪspəˈzɪʃn/<,>n.性情/n.性格/n.意向/n.倾向/n.排列/n.部署<,>She has a cheerful disposition that brightens everyone's day.<,>她性格开朗，能让每个人的心情都好起来。<,>The general made a clever disposition of his troops.<,>将军巧妙地部署了他的部队。<,>There is a disposition to criticize rather than praise.<,>人们倾向于批评而非表扬。<,>dis(分开)+posit(放置)+ion→分开放置→部署<,>exposition(n.阐述)/deposition(n.沉积物)/predisposition(n.倾向)
