stabilize<,>/ˈsteɪbəlaɪz/<,>/ˈsteɪbəlaɪz/<,>v.稳定/v.稳固<,>The government took measures to stabilize prices.<,>政府采取措施稳定物价。<,>Her condition has stabilized after the surgery.<,>手术后她的情况已经稳定。<,>They used sandbags to stabilize the foundation.<,>他们用沙袋稳固地基。<,>stable(稳定的)+ize(使)→使稳定<,>staple(n.主食)/stadium(n.体育场)/stability(n.稳定性)

compensate<,>/ˈkɒmpenseɪt/<,>/ˈkɑːmpenseɪt/<,>v.补偿/v.弥补/v.抵消<,>The company will compensate employees for overtime work.<,>公司将补偿员工的加班工作。<,>Nothing can compensate for the loss of a loved one.<,>没有什么能弥补失去所爱之人的痛苦。<,>Her intelligence compensates for her lack of experience.<,>她的聪明才智弥补了经验的不足。<,>com(全部)+pens(支付)+ate→全部支付→补偿<,>pension(n.养老金)/recompense(v.报酬)/dispense(v.分配)

conscious<,>/ˈkɒnʃəs/<,>/ˈkɑːnʃəs/<,>adj.意识到的/adj.自觉的/adj.神志清醒的/adj.有意的/adj.存心的<,>She was conscious of someone watching her.<,>她意识到有人在看她。<,>After the accident, he remained conscious but confused.<,>事故后，他保持清醒但很困惑。<,>He made a conscious decision to change his lifestyle.<,>他有意决定改变生活方式。<,>con(全部)+sci(知道)+ous→全部知道的→有意识的<,>conscience(n.良心)/subconscious(adj.潜意识的)/unconscious(adj.无意识的)

transaction<,>/trænˈzækʃn/<,>/trænˈzækʃn/<,>n.交易/n.业务<,>The bank charges a fee for each transaction.<,>银行对每笔交易都收取费用。<,>They completed the real estate transaction smoothly.<,>他们顺利完成了房地产交易。<,>All business transactions should be properly documented.<,>所有商业交易都应妥善记录。<,>trans(穿过)+act(行动)+ion→双方互动的行动→交易<,>interaction(n.互动)/fraction(n.分数)/traction(n.牵引力)

constant<,>/ˈkɒnstənt/<,>/ˈkɑːnstənt/<,>adj.经常的/adj.不断的/adj.连续发生的/adj.永恒的/adj.忠实的/n.常数/n.恒量<,>Her constant complaints annoyed everyone.<,>她不断的抱怨惹恼了所有人。<,>The speed of light is a fundamental constant in physics.<,>光速是物理学中的一个基本常数。<,>He has been a constant friend throughout my life.<,>他是我一生中始终如一的朋友。<,>con(共同)+stant(站立)→始终站在一起→忠实的<,>instant(adj.立即的)/distant(adj.遥远的)/consistent(adj.一致的)
bribe<,>/braɪb/<,>/braɪb/<,>vt.向…贿赂/vt.买通/n.贿赂/n.行贿物<,>He was accused of bribing a government official.<,>他被指控贿赂一名政府官员。<,>The businessman offered a bribe to secure the contract.<,>商人提供贿赂以确保合同。<,>Bribery is a serious crime in many countries.<,>贿赂在许多国家是严重的犯罪行为。<,>bri(break)+be→打破规则→贿赂<,>bride(n.新娘)/bribe(vt.贿赂)/bribe(n.贿赂)

certify<,>/ˈsɜːtɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈsɜːrtɪfaɪ/<,>vt.证明/vt.证实/vt.发证书给<,>The doctor will certify the cause of death.<,>医生将证明死亡原因。<,>This document certifies that you have completed the course.<,>这份文件证明你已完成课程。<,>She is certified to teach English as a foreign language.<,>她获得了教授英语作为外语的证书。<,>cert(sure)+ify(make)→使确定→证明<,>certificate(n.证书)/certify(vt.证明)/rectify(vt.纠正)

intermittent<,>/ˌɪntəˈmɪtənt/<,>/ˌɪntərˈmɪtənt/<,>adj.间歇的/adj.断断续续的<,>The intermittent rain made the picnic difficult.<,>断断续续的雨使野餐变得困难。<,>He suffers from intermittent headaches.<,>他患有间歇性头痛。<,>The machine works with intermittent beeping sounds.<,>这台机器工作时发出断断续续的哔哔声。<,>inter(between)+mit(send)+ent→在中间发送→间歇的<,>intermittent(adj.间歇的)/permanent(adj.永久的)/intermediate(adj.中间的)

outrage<,>/ˈaʊtreɪdʒ/<,>/ˈaʊtreɪdʒ/<,>n.义愤/n.愤慨/n.暴行/n.骇人听闻的事件/vt.激起…的义愤/vt.激怒<,>The news of the corruption caused public outrage.<,>腐败的消息引起了公愤。<,>His rude behavior was an outrage to the guests.<,>他粗鲁的行为激怒了客人。<,>The terrorist attack was an outrage against humanity.<,>这次恐怖袭击是对人类的暴行。<,>out(beyond)+rage(anger)→超出愤怒→激怒<,>outrage(n.义愤)/outrageous(adj.骇人的)/courage(n.勇气)

solitary<,>/ˈsɒlɪtri/<,>/ˈsɑːləteri/<,>adj.单独的/adj.独自的/adj.单个的/adj.唯一的/adj.孤独的/adj.隐居的<,>He leads a solitary life in the countryside.<,>他在乡下过着隐居的生活。<,>A solitary tree stood in the middle of the field.<,>田野中央孤零零地立着一棵树。<,>She enjoys solitary walks on the beach.<,>她喜欢独自在海滩上散步。<,>sol(alone)+itary→单独的<,>solitary(adj.孤独的)/solidarity(n.团结)/solicit(vt.恳求)

diffuse<,>/dɪˈfjuːz/<,>/dɪˈfjuːz/<,>v.扩散/v.弥漫/v.传播/v.散布/adj.冗长的/adj.漫无边际的/adj.四散的/adj.弥漫的<,>The light diffused softly through the curtains.<,>光线柔和地透过窗帘漫射进来。<,>His speech was too diffuse and hard to follow.<,>他的演讲太冗长，难以理解。<,>The smell of flowers diffused throughout the room.<,>花香弥漫了整个房间。<,>dif(apart)+fuse(pour)→分开倒→扩散<,>diffuse(v.扩散)/confuse(v.混淆)/refuse(v.拒绝)

scramble<,>/ˈskræmbl/<,>/ˈskræmbl/<,>vi.攀登/vi.爬/vi.争夺/vi.抢夺/vt.扰乱/vt.搞乱/n.攀登/n.爬行/n.争夺/n.抢夺<,>They had to scramble up the steep hill.<,>他们不得不爬上陡峭的山坡。<,>The children scrambled for the toys.<,>孩子们争抢玩具。<,>The news scrambled his thoughts.<,>这个消息扰乱了他的思绪。<,>scram(混乱)+ble→混乱中争夺<,>scramble(v.争夺)/scramble(n.攀登)/scrap(n.碎片)

orchestra<,>/ˈɔːkɪstrə/<,>/ˈɔːrkɪstrə/<,>n.管弦乐队<,>The orchestra played a beautiful symphony.<,>管弦乐队演奏了一首美妙的交响曲。<,>She is the conductor of the school orchestra.<,>她是学校管弦乐队的指挥。<,>We have tickets for the orchestra section.<,>我们有管弦乐队区域的票。<,>orche(舞蹈)+stra→舞蹈伴奏的乐队→管弦乐队<,>orchestra(n.管弦乐队)/orchestrate(vt.精心安排)/orchard(n.果园)

immerse<,>/ɪˈmɜːs/<,>/ɪˈmɜːrs/<,>vt.使浸没/vt.使沉浸在/vt.使专心于<,>He immersed himself in his studies.<,>他专心于学习。<,>Immerse the vegetables in cold water.<,>把蔬菜浸在冷水中。<,>She was immersed in a good book.<,>她沉浸在一本好书中。<,>im(into)+merse(dip)→浸入→沉浸<,>immerse(vt.沉浸)/emerge(vi.浮现)/submerge(vt.淹没)

sufficient<,>/səˈfɪʃnt/<,>/səˈfɪʃnt/<,>adj.足够的/adj.充分的<,>We have sufficient evidence to prove his guilt.<,>我们有足够的证据证明他有罪。<,>Make sure you have sufficient time to complete the task.<,>确保你有足够的时间完成任务。<,>The food was sufficient for everyone.<,>食物足够每个人吃。<,>suf(under)+fic(make)+ent→在下面做足→足够的<,>sufficient(adj.足够的)/efficient(adj.高效的)/deficient(adj.不足的)
marshal<,>/ˈmɑːʃəl/<,>/ˈmɑːrʃəl/<,>n.元帅/n.最高指挥官/n.总指挥/n.司仪/n.执法官/n.警察局长/n.消防队长/vt.整理/vt.排列/vt.集结<,>The marshal led the troops into battle.<,>元帅率领部队投入战斗。<,>She marshaled her thoughts before speaking.<,>她在发言前整理了自己的思路。<,>The fire marshal inspected the building for safety violations.<,>消防队长检查了建筑物是否存在安全隐患。<,>mar(战争)+shal(仆人)→战争中的仆人→元帅<,>martial(adj.军事的)/marsh(n.沼泽)/march(v.行军/n.三月)  

champagne<,>/ʃæmˈpeɪn/<,>/ʃæmˈpeɪn/<,>n.香槟酒<,>They celebrated with a bottle of champagne.<,>他们开了一瓶香槟庆祝。<,>The champagne bubbled in the glass.<,>香槟在杯中冒着气泡。<,>This region is famous for its champagne production.<,>这个地区以生产香槟酒闻名。<,>champ(战场)+agne→胜利后喝的酒→香槟<,>campaign(n.战役/v.发起运动)/champion(n.冠军)  

claim<,>/kleɪm/<,>/kleɪm/<,>vt.声称/vt.主张/vt.索取/vt.使失踪或死亡/vt.需要/vt.值得/n.要求/n.认领/n.索赔/n.声称/n.断言<,>He claims to have seen a UFO.<,>他声称看到了不明飞行物。<,>She filed a claim for compensation.<,>她提出了赔偿要求。<,>The accident claimed three lives.<,>这次事故夺走了三条生命。<,>clam(喊叫)+im→大声喊出→声称<,>acclaim(v.欢呼/n.称赞)/exclaim(v.呼喊)/proclaim(v.宣布)  

widespread<,>/ˈwaɪdspred/<,>/ˈwaɪdspred/<,>adj.分布广泛的/adj.普遍的<,>There is widespread support for the new policy.<,>新政策获得了广泛支持。<,>The disease has become widespread in the region.<,>这种疾病在该地区广泛传播。<,>Widespread flooding affected thousands of people.<,>大范围的洪水影响了数千人。<,>wide(宽的)+spread(传播)→广泛传播的<,>wide-ranging(adj.范围广泛的)/far-reaching(adj.深远的)  

antique<,>/ænˈtiːk/<,>/ænˈtiːk/<,>adj.古时的/adj.古老的/n.古物/n.古玩/n.古董<,>She collects antique furniture.<,>她收藏古董家具。<,>This vase is a genuine antique.<,>这个花瓶是真正的古董。<,>The shop specializes in antique jewelry.<,>这家店专营古董珠宝。<,>anti(前)+que→以前的→古董<,>ancient(adj.古代的)/unique(adj.独特的)  

communication<,>/kəˌmjuːnɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/kəˌmjuːnɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.通讯/n.交流/n.交际/n.通信工具/n.交通联系<,>Good communication is key to a successful relationship.<,>良好的沟通是成功关系的关键。<,>The hurricane disrupted all communication lines.<,>飓风中断了所有通讯线路。<,>Nonverbal communication includes gestures and facial expressions.<,>非语言交流包括手势和面部表情。<,>com(共同)+muni(服务)+cation→共同服务→交流<,>communion(n.共享)/community(n.社区)  

chronic<,>/ˈkrɒnɪk/<,>/ˈkrɑːnɪk/<,>adj.慢性的/adj.久病的/adj.长久的/adj.不断的/adj.积习难改的<,>He suffers from chronic back pain.<,>他患有慢性背痛。<,>Chronic unemployment is a serious problem in the area.<,>长期失业是该地区的严重问题。<,>She's a chronic procrastinator.<,>她是个积习难改的拖延者。<,>chron(时间)+ic→长时间的→慢性的<,>synchronous(adj.同步的)/anachronism(n.时代错误)  

toxic<,>/ˈtɒksɪk/<,>/ˈtɑːksɪk/<,>adj.有毒的/adj.因中毒引起的<,>The chemical plant leaked toxic fumes.<,>化工厂泄漏了有毒气体。<,>Their relationship became toxic over time.<,>随着时间的推移，他们的关系变得有害。<,>Some mushrooms are highly toxic to humans.<,>有些蘑菇对人类有剧毒。<,>tox(毒)+ic→有毒的<,>intoxicate(v.使中毒)/detoxify(v.解毒)  

contest<,>/ˈkɒntest/<,>/ˈkɑːntest/<,>n.竞赛/n.争夺/vt.争夺/vt.与...竞争/vt.对...提出质疑/vt.辩驳<,>She won first prize in the singing contest.<,>她在歌唱比赛中获得一等奖。<,>They contested the will in court.<,>他们对遗嘱提出了法律质疑。<,>The election results were hotly contested.<,>选举结果引发了激烈争议。<,>con(共同)+test(测试)→共同测试→竞赛<,>protest(n.抗议/v.反对)/detest(v.憎恶)  

author<,>/ˈɔːθə(r)/<,>/ˈɔːθər/<,>n.著作家/n.作者<,>The author is working on a new novel.<,>这位作家正在创作一部新小说。<,>He's the author of several bestselling books.<,>他是几本畅销书的作者。<,>The report didn't name its authors.<,>报告没有署作者姓名。<,>auth(增加)+or→创作内容的人→作者<,>authority(n.权威)/authentic(adj.真实的)
lever<,>/ˈliːvə(r)/<,>/ˈlɛvər/<,>n.杠/n.杠杆/n.途径/n.手段/n.工具/vt.撬动/vt.撬起<,>They used a long lever to lift the heavy rock.<,>他们用一根长杠杆撬起了那块沉重的石头。<,>Education is a powerful lever for social change.<,>教育是社会变革的有力工具。<,>He levered the door open with a crowbar.<,>他用撬棍把门撬开了。<,>lev(升起)+er(工具)→能升起的工具→杠杆<,>level(n.水平/adj.平的)/liver(n.肝脏)/leave(v.离开)  

preserve<,>/prɪˈzɜːv/<,>/prɪˈzɜːrv/<,>vt.保护/vt.维持/vt.保存/vt.保藏/vt.腌制<,>We must preserve our natural resources for future generations.<,>我们必须为后代保护自然资源。<,>This jar can preserve food for months.<,>这个罐子可以保存食物数月。<,>She knows how to preserve fruits in sugar.<,>她知道如何用糖腌制水果。<,>pre(预先)+serve(保持)→预先保持→保存<,>reserve(v.保留/n.储备)/persevere(v.坚持)/deserve(v.应得)  

establish<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃ/<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃ/<,>vt.建立/vt.设立/vt.确立/vt.证实<,>The company was established in 1995.<,>这家公司成立于1995年。<,>He established his reputation as a reliable businessman.<,>他确立了自己作为可靠商人的声誉。<,>The new evidence established his innocence.<,>新证据证实了他的清白。<,>e(加强)+stable(稳定的)+ish(使)→使稳定→建立<,>stable(adj.稳定的/n.马厩)/establishment(n.机构)/stabilize(v.稳定)  

expansion<,>/ɪkˈspænʃn/<,>/ɪkˈspænʃn/<,>n.扩大/n.扩充/n.扩张/n.膨胀<,>The rapid expansion of the city caused traffic problems.<,>城市的快速扩张导致了交通问题。<,>Heat causes the expansion of metals.<,>热会导致金属膨胀。<,>The company plans expansion into Asian markets.<,>公司计划向亚洲市场扩张。<,>ex(出)+pans(伸展)+ion→向外伸展→扩张<,>expense(n.费用)/extend(v.延伸)/expansive(adj.广阔的)  

wrench<,>/rentʃ/<,>/rɛntʃ/<,>vt.猛拧/vt.猛扭/vt.挣脱/vt.使扭伤/n.痛苦/n.难受/n.猛扭/n.猛拉/n.扳手<,>He wrenched the door open with all his strength.<,>他用尽全力猛地拉开门。<,>The breakup was a wrench for both of them.<,>分手对他们两人来说都很痛苦。<,>I need a wrench to tighten this bolt.<,>我需要扳手来拧紧这个螺栓。<,>wren(扭)+ch→扭的动作→猛扭<,>wretch(n.可怜的人)/drench(v.浸透)/trench(n.沟渠)  

relevant<,>/ˈreləvənt/<,>/ˈrɛləvənt/<,>adj.有关的/adj.切题的<,>Please provide only relevant information.<,>请只提供相关信息。<,>His experience is highly relevant to this job.<,>他的经验与这份工作高度相关。<,>This law is still relevant today.<,>这条法律今天仍然适用。<,>re(再)+lev(举)+ant→能再举起的→有关的<,>irrelevant(adj.无关的)/elevate(v.提升)/relieve(v.缓解)  

expand<,>/ɪkˈspænd/<,>/ɪkˈspænd/<,>v.扩大/v.膨胀<,>The business has expanded rapidly in recent years.<,>近年来业务迅速扩大。<,>Metals expand when heated.<,>金属受热会膨胀。<,>We need to expand our marketing efforts.<,>我们需要扩大营销力度。<,>ex(出)+pand(伸展)→向外伸展→扩大<,>expend(v.花费)/extend(v.延伸)/expansion(n.扩张)  

gaze<,>/ɡeɪz/<,>/ɡeɪz/<,>n&vi.凝视/n&vi.盯/n&vi.注视<,>She gazed at the stars for hours.<,>她凝视星空数小时。<,>His intense gaze made her uncomfortable.<,>他强烈的注视让她感到不适。<,>The child gazed in wonder at the fireworks.<,>孩子惊奇地注视着烟花。<,>gaze与glaze(上釉)形似但义异<,>glare(v.怒视)/graze(v.吃草)/glaze(v.上釉)  

proclaim<,>/prəˈkleɪm/<,>/proʊˈkleɪm/<,>vt.宣告/vt.宣布/vt.声明/vt.显示<,>The king proclaimed a national holiday.<,>国王宣布了一个全国性节日。<,>His accent proclaims him to be a foreigner.<,>他的口音显示他是个外国人。<,>They proclaimed their love to the whole world.<,>他们向全世界宣告了他们的爱情。<,>pro(向前)+claim(喊)→向前喊→宣告<,>exclaim(v.呼喊)/acclaim(v.欢呼)/reclaim(v.收回)  

magistrate<,>/ˈmædʒɪstreɪt/<,>/ˈmædʒɪstreɪt/<,>n.地方行政官/n.地方法官/n.治安官<,>The magistrate heard the case in the local court.<,>地方法官在地方法庭审理了此案。<,>He served as a magistrate for twenty years.<,>他担任治安官二十年。<,>The magistrate imposed a fine on the offender.<,>地方法官对违法者处以罚款。<,>magistr(大师)+ate(人)→掌握权力的人→地方法官<,>master(n.主人)/minister(n.部长)/magistracy(n.地方法官职位)
retrieve<,>/rɪˈtriːv/<,>/rɪˈtriv/<,>vi.重新得到/vi.取回/vi.收回/vi.挽回/vi.补救/vi.检索<,>He managed to retrieve his lost wallet from the taxi.<,>他成功从出租车里找回了丢失的钱包。<,>The software helps to retrieve deleted files.<,>这个软件可以帮助恢复被删除的文件。<,>She tried to retrieve the situation by apologizing.<,>她试图通过道歉来挽回局面。<,>re(重新)+trieve(找到)→重新找到→取回<,>receive(v.收到)/relieve(v.缓解)/retreat(v.撤退)

survey<,>/ˈsɜːveɪ/<,>/ˈsɜːrveɪ/<,>v.俯瞰/v.眺望/v.全面审视/v.调查/v.测量/v.勘定/n.调查/n.测量<,>They conducted a survey of public opinion.<,>他们进行了一项民意调查。<,>From the hilltop, we can survey the whole city.<,>从山顶我们可以俯瞰整个城市。<,>The engineers surveyed the land before construction.<,>工程师们在施工前勘测了土地。<,>sur(上)+vey(看)→从上面看→俯瞰<,>serve(v.服务)/survive(v.生存)/surge(v.汹涌)

jeopardize<,>/ˈdʒepədaɪz/<,>/ˈdʒepərdaɪz/<,>vt.危及/vt.危害<,>Smoking will jeopardize your health.<,>吸烟会危害你的健康。<,>His careless words jeopardized the negotiation.<,>他 careless 的言论危及了谈判。<,>Don't jeopardize your future by making hasty decisions.<,>不要因草率决定而危害你的未来。<,>jeopard(危险)+ize(使)→使处于危险中→危害<,>hazard(n.危险)/venture(v.冒险)/peril(n.危险)

spy<,>/spaɪ/<,>/spaɪ/<,>vi.当间谍/vi.暗中监视/n.间谍/vt.看见/vt.发现<,>He was accused of spying for a foreign country.<,>他被指控为外国当间谍。<,>I spied a rare bird in the garden.<,>我在花园里发现了一只稀有鸟类。<,>The company installed cameras to spy on employees.<,>公司安装了摄像头来监视员工。<,>s(秘密)+py(看)→秘密地看→间谍<,>pie(n.馅饼)/sly(adj.狡猾的)/sky(n.天空)

displace<,>/dɪsˈpleɪs/<,>/dɪsˈpleɪs/<,>vt.取代/vt.替代/vt.迫使...离开家园/vt.使离开原位<,>Computers have displaced typewriters in offices.<,>电脑已经取代了办公室里的打字机。<,>The war displaced millions of people.<,>战争使数百万人流离失所。<,>He displaced the book on the shelf.<,>他把书架上的书挪了位置。<,>dis(不)+place(位置)→使不在原位→取代<,>replace(v.替换)/misplace(v.放错位置)/display(v.展示)

predominant<,>/prɪˈdɒmɪnənt/<,>/prɪˈdɑːmɪnənt/<,>adj.占主导地位的/adj.显著的<,>English is the predominant language in international business.<,>英语是国际商务中的主导语言。<,>Red is the predominant color in her paintings.<,>红色是她画作中的主色调。<,>The predominant feature of the landscape is the mountain.<,>这个景观最显著的特征是那座山。<,>pre(前)+dominant(统治的)→在前面统治的→主导的<,>dominant(adj.支配的)/prominent(adj.突出的)/preeminent(adj.卓越的)

recipe<,>/ˈresəpi/<,>/ˈresəpi/<,>n.烹饪法/n.食谱/n.方法/n.秘诀/n.诀窍<,>This is my grandmother's secret recipe for apple pie.<,>这是我祖母的苹果派秘方。<,>Hard work is the recipe for success.<,>努力工作是成功的秘诀。<,>Can you share your recipe for this delicious soup?<,>你能分享这道美味汤的做法吗？<,>re(再)+cipe(拿)→再次拿取的方法→食谱<,>receipt(n.收据)/recipient(n.接受者)/reciprocal(adj.相互的)

ideology<,>/ˌaɪdiˈɒlədʒi/<,>/ˌaɪdiˈɑːlədʒi/<,>n.思想/n.思想意识<,>Political ideologies often influence government policies.<,>政治意识形态经常影响政府政策。<,>His ideology is based on equality and justice.<,>他的思想基于平等和正义。<,>The book explores different educational ideologies.<,>这本书探讨了不同的教育思想。<,>ideo(思想)+logy(学科)→思想体系<,>ideal(n.理想)/idol(n.偶像)/idiom(n.习语)

mental<,>/ˈmentl/<,>/ˈmentl/<,>adj.心理的/adj.精神的/adj.思想上的/adj.精神病的/adj.智力的<,>She suffers from mental health issues.<,>她患有心理健康问题。<,>Chess is a good mental exercise.<,>国际象棋是很好的智力锻炼。<,>He has a quick mental calculation ability.<,>他有快速心算的能力。<,>ment(心智)+al(的)→心智的<,>metal(n.金属)/mantle(n.斗篷)/mortal(adj.致命的)

decent<,>/ˈdiːsnt/<,>/ˈdiːsnt/<,>adj.像样的/adj.过得去的/adj.体面的/adj.宽厚的/adj.大方的/adj.正派的/adj.合乎礼仪的/adj.得体的<,>He earns a decent salary.<,>他有一份不错的薪水。<,>It's not decent to talk with your mouth full.<,>满嘴食物说话是不礼貌的。<,>She comes from a decent family.<,>她出身于一个体面的家庭。<,>de(加强)+cent(一百)→百分百好的→体面的<,>descent(n.下降)/recent(adj.最近的)/docent(n.讲师)
seam<,>/siːm/<,>/siːm/<,>n.缝/n.接缝/n.煤层<,>The seam of her dress was coming apart.<,>她裙子的缝线开始松开了。<,>They found a rich seam of coal in the mountain.<,>他们在山里发现了一条丰富的煤层。<,>He carefully stitched the seam of the pillow.<,>他仔细地缝合了枕头的接缝。<,>sea(海)+m→像海一样连绵不断→接缝<,>seem(v.似乎)/beam(n.横梁/v.微笑)  

investigate<,>/ɪnˈvestɪɡeɪt/<,>/ɪnˈvɛstɪɡeɪt/<,>v.调查/v.研究<,>The police will investigate the crime scene.<,>警方将调查犯罪现场。<,>Scientists investigate the effects of climate change.<,>科学家研究气候变化的影响。<,>She decided to investigate the matter herself.<,>她决定亲自调查这件事。<,>in(进入)+vestig(足迹)+ate→追踪足迹→调查<,>invest(v.投资)/interrogate(v.审问)  

racial<,>/ˈreɪʃl/<,>/ˈreɪʃəl/<,>adj.种族的/adj.人种的<,>Racial discrimination is a serious social issue.<,>种族歧视是一个严重的社会问题。<,>The school promotes racial harmony among students.<,>学校促进学生间的种族和谐。<,>They studied racial differences in genetic traits.<,>他们研究了遗传特征中的种族差异。<,>rac(种族)+ial(形容词后缀)→种族的<,>radical(adj.激进的/n.激进分子)/special(adj.特殊的)  

illusion<,>/ɪˈluːʒn/<,>/ɪˈluːʒən/<,>n.幻想/n.错误的观念/n.错觉/n.幻觉/n.假象<,>The magician created an illusion of a disappearing coin.<,>魔术师制造了硬币消失的幻觉。<,>He was under the illusion that he could win easily.<,>他错误地以为自己能轻松获胜。<,>The desert heat created a mirage illusion.<,>沙漠的热气造成了海市蜃楼的假象。<,>il(不)+lus(光)+ion→不真实的光→幻觉<,>allusion(n.暗示)/delusion(n.妄想)  

considerable<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbl/<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbəl/<,>adj.相当大的/adj.重要的<,>She spent a considerable amount of time on the project.<,>她在这个项目上花费了大量时间。<,>The storm caused considerable damage to the crops.<,>暴风雨对庄稼造成了相当大的损害。<,>He is a considerable figure in the scientific community.<,>他是科学界的重要人物。<,>consider(考虑)+able(能...的)→值得考虑的→重要的<,>considerate(adj.体贴的)/inconsiderable(adj.微不足道的)  

productivity<,>/ˌprɒdʌkˈtɪvəti/<,>/ˌproʊdʌkˈtɪvəti/<,>n.生产力/n.生产率<,>The new machines improved the factory's productivity.<,>新机器提高了工厂的生产率。<,>Employee productivity increased after the training.<,>培训后员工的生产力提高了。<,>They measure agricultural productivity per acre.<,>他们测量每英亩的农业生产力。<,>product(产品)+ivity(性质)→生产能力<,>production(n.生产)/reproductivity(n.繁殖力)  

proposition<,>/ˌprɒpəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌprɑːpəˈzɪʃən/<,>n.论点/n.主张/n.建议/n.提案/n.命题<,>He presented a proposition to improve efficiency.<,>他提出了一个提高效率的建议。<,>The professor discussed the mathematical proposition in class.<,>教授在课堂上讨论了这个数学命题。<,>Her proposition about climate change was well-received.<,>她关于气候变化的主张得到了好评。<,>pro(向前)+posit(放置)+ion→向前提出的→建议<,>preposition(n.介词)/opposition(n.反对)  

reserve<,>/rɪˈzɜːv/<,>/rɪˈzɜːrv/<,>vt.保留/vt.留存/vt.预订/n.储备/n.保留/n.拘谨/n.矜持/n.替补队员/n.后备部队/n.自然保护区<,>Please reserve a table for two at the restaurant.<,>请在餐厅预订一张两人桌。<,>The army keeps a reserve of emergency supplies.<,>军队储备了应急物资。<,>She spoke with reserve about her personal life.<,>她谨慎地谈论自己的私生活。<,>re(再)+serve(保持)→再次保持→保留<,>preserve(v.保存)/deserve(v.应得)  

savage<,>/ˈsævɪdʒ/<,>/ˈsævɪdʒ/<,>adj.残暴的/adj.凶猛的/adj.粗鲁的/adj.未开化的/adj.野蛮的/n.野蛮人/n.粗鲁的人/vt.乱咬/vt.激烈抨击<,>The savage attack left the victim severely injured.<,>这次凶残的袭击使受害者严重受伤。<,>Early explorers encountered savage tribes in the jungle.<,>早期的探险家在丛林中遇到了未开化的部落。<,>The critic savaged the author's new book.<,>评论家猛烈抨击了作者的新书。<,>sav(森林)+age(状态)→森林状态→野蛮的<,>salvage(v.抢救)/sausage(n.香肠)  

heap<,>/hiːp/<,>/hiːp/<,>n.堆/n.大量<,>There was a heap of clothes on the floor.<,>地板上有一堆衣服。<,>She has a heap of work to finish by Friday.<,>她有一大堆工作要在周五前完成。<,>They piled the stones in a heap by the roadside.<,>他们把石头堆在路边。<,>hear(听)+p→听到一大堆消息→大量<,>leap(v.跳跃)/heat(n.热量)
sympathy<,>/ˈsɪmpəθi/<,>/ˈsɪmpəθi/<,>n.同情/n.一致/n.支持/n.赞同<,>She felt deep sympathy for the victims of the earthquake.<,>她对地震的受害者深感同情。<,>There is a strong sympathy between the two friends.<,>这两位朋友之间有着强烈的一致感。<,>The workers went on strike in sympathy with their colleagues.<,>工人们为支持同事而罢工。<,>sym(共同)+path(感情)+y→共同感情→同情<,>empathy(n. 同理心)/apathy(n. 冷漠)/antipathy(n. 反感)

consumer<,>/kənˈsjuːmə(r)/<,>/kənˈsuːmər/<,>n.消费者/n.用户/n.消耗者<,>Consumers are becoming more environmentally conscious.<,>消费者正变得更加环保意识。<,>The company conducted a survey of its consumers.<,>该公司对其用户进行了调查。<,>He is a big consumer of energy drinks.<,>他是能量饮料的大量消耗者。<,>con(完全)+sum(拿取)+er(人)→完全拿取的人→消费者<,>customer(n. 顾客)/producer(n. 生产者)/consumption(n. 消费)

cripple<,>/ˈkrɪpl/<,>/ˈkrɪpəl/<,>n.跛子/n.伤残人/vt.使跛/vt.使受伤致残/vt.严重削弱/vt.使陷入瘫痪<,>The accident left him a cripple for life.<,>那次事故使他终身残疾。<,>The economic sanctions have crippled the country's industry.<,>经济制裁严重削弱了该国的工业。<,>The snowstorm crippled the city's transportation system.<,>暴风雪使城市的交通系统陷入瘫痪。<,>crip(弯曲)+ple(小)→弯曲的小东西→跛子<,>crippled(adj. 残废的)/ripple(n. 波纹)/crisp(adj. 脆的)

brief<,>/briːf/<,>/brif/<,>adj.简短的/adj.短暂的/vt.向...介绍基本情况/vt.做...的提要/n.概要/n.摘要<,>Please keep your speech brief and to the point.<,>请保持你的演讲简短扼要。<,>The manager briefed the team on the new project.<,>经理向团队简要介绍了新项目。<,>Here is a brief of the main points discussed at the meeting.<,>这是会议讨论要点的摘要。<,>brief(短的)→来自拉丁语brevis(短的)<,>relief(n. 缓解)/belief(n. 信念)/grief(n. 悲痛)

console<,>/kənˈsəʊl/<,>/kənˈsoʊl/<,>vt.安慰/vt.慰问/n.控制台/n.操纵台<,>She tried to console her crying child.<,>她试图安慰她哭泣的孩子。<,>The president consoled the families of the victims.<,>总统慰问了遇难者家属。<,>The technician was working at the computer console.<,>技术员正在计算机控制台前工作。<,>con(共同)+sole(单独)→共同分担孤独→安慰<,>consolation(n. 安慰)/control(n. 控制)/consult(v. 咨询)

initiative<,>/ɪˈnɪʃətɪv/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃətɪv/<,>n.主动性/n.首创精神/n.主动的行动/n.倡议/n.主动权<,>She showed great initiative in solving the problem.<,>她在解决问题时表现出极大的主动性。<,>The company launched a new environmental initiative.<,>该公司发起了一项新的环保倡议。<,>Our team has the initiative in this negotiation.<,>我们团队在这次谈判中掌握主动权。<,>init(开始)+iative→开始行动的能力→主动性<,>initial(adj. 最初的)/native(adj. 本地的)/creative(adj. 创造性的)

recover<,>/rɪˈkʌvə(r)/<,>/rɪˈkʌvər/<,>v.重新获得/v.挽回/v.恢复<,>It took him months to recover from the illness.<,>他花了几个月时间才从疾病中恢复。<,>The police recovered the stolen jewelry.<,>警方找回了被盗的珠宝。<,>She tried to recover her lost reputation.<,>她试图挽回失去的声誉。<,>re(重新)+cover(覆盖)→重新覆盖→恢复<,>discover(v. 发现)/uncover(v. 揭露)/cover(v. 覆盖)

clockwise<,>/ˈklɒkwaɪz/<,>/ˈklɑːkwaɪz/<,>adv.顺时针方向地<,>Turn the knob clockwise to tighten it.<,>顺时针方向转动旋钮将其拧紧。<,>The dancers moved in a clockwise direction.<,>舞者们按顺时针方向移动。<,>The hurricane was spinning clockwise.<,>飓风正顺时针旋转。<,>clock(钟)+wise(方向)→像钟表指针方向一样的→顺时针方向<,>counterclockwise(adv. 逆时针方向)/otherwise(adv. 否则)/likewise(adv. 同样地)

embark<,>/ɪmˈbɑːk/<,>/ɪmˈbɑːrk/<,>vi.上船/vi.着手/vi.开始工作<,>Passengers embarked at the cruise terminal.<,>乘客们在邮轮码头登船。<,>They are about to embark on a new business venture.<,>他们即将开始一项新的商业冒险。<,>The students embarked on their research project with enthusiasm.<,>学生们满怀热情地开始了他们的研究项目。<,>em(进入)+bark(船)→进入船→上船<,>disembark(v. 下船)/remark(v. 评论)/bark(v. 吠叫)

medication<,>/ˌmedɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌmɛdɪˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.药物治疗/n.药物<,>The doctor prescribed some medication for his pain.<,>医生给他开了一些止痛药。<,>She is on medication for her heart condition.<,>她正在接受心脏病的药物治疗。<,>Always check the dosage of your medication carefully.<,>务必仔细检查药物的剂量。<,>medic(医疗)+ation→医疗行为→药物治疗<,>medicine(n. 医学)/medicate(v. 用药治疗)/medicinal(adj. 药用的)
drill<,>/drɪl/<,>/drɪl/<,>v.钻/v.打/v.训练/n.钻头/n.操练/n.训练<,>They drilled a hole in the wall.<,>他们在墙上钻了一个洞。<,>The soldiers were drilled in basic combat skills.<,>士兵们接受了基本战斗技能的训练。<,>He bought a new drill for his workshop.<,>他为他的车间买了一个新钻头。<,>dr(驱动)+ill(病)→像病一样反复→训练<,>grill(v.烧烤/n.烤架)/dwell(v.居住/v.详述)

friction<,>/ˈfrɪkʃn/<,>/ˈfrɪkʃən/<,>n.不和/n.抵触/n.摩擦<,>There was friction between the two colleagues.<,>两位同事之间存在矛盾。<,>Friction causes the machine to heat up.<,>摩擦导致机器发热。<,>The oil reduces friction in the engine.<,>机油减少了发动机的摩擦。<,>frict(摩擦)+ion(名词后缀)→摩擦<,>fiction(n.小说/n.虚构)/fraction(n.小部分/n.分数)

confer<,>/kənˈfɜː(r)/<,>/kənˈfɜːr/<,>vi.商谈/vi.商议/vt.授予/vt.赋予<,>The committee will confer tomorrow.<,>委员会明天将进行商议。<,>The university conferred an honorary degree on her.<,>大学授予她荣誉学位。<,>They conferred about the project.<,>他们就这个项目进行了商谈。<,>con(共同)+fer(带来)→共同带来观点→商谈<,>refer(v.提到/v.参考)/infer(v.推断/v.推论)

intelligent<,>/ɪnˈtelɪdʒənt/<,>/ɪnˈtelɪdʒənt/<,>adj.聪明的/adj.理智的<,>She is an intelligent student.<,>她是个聪明的学生。<,>He made an intelligent decision.<,>他做出了一个理智的决定。<,>The robot has intelligent programming.<,>这个机器人有智能编程。<,>intel(在...之间)+lig(选择)+ent→能在不同事物间做出选择的→聪明的<,>intellectual(adj.智力的/n.知识分子)/diligent(adj.勤奋的)

clerk<,>/klɑːk/<,>/klɜːrk/<,>n.店员/n.办事员/n.职员<,>The clerk helped me find the book.<,>店员帮我找到了这本书。<,>He works as a bank clerk.<,>他在银行当职员。<,>The clerk filed the documents.<,>办事员整理了文件。<,>clerk(源自拉丁语clericus，意为牧师)→过去由牧师担任文书工作→职员<,>clan(n.宗族/n.家族)/clank(n.叮当声/v.发出叮当声)

acknowledge<,>/əkˈnɒlɪdʒ/<,>/əkˈnɑːlɪdʒ/<,>vt.承认/vt.确认/vt.表示谢意<,>She acknowledged her mistake.<,>她承认了自己的错误。<,>Please acknowledge receipt of this email.<,>请确认收到这封邮件。<,>We acknowledge your contribution.<,>我们感谢你的贡献。<,>ac(向)+knowledge(知识)→向知识靠拢→承认<,>knowledge(n.知识)/acknowledgment(n.承认/n.感谢)

equip<,>/ɪˈkwɪp/<,>/ɪˈkwɪp/<,>vt.装备/vt.配备/vt.使有准备<,>They equipped the lab with new instruments.<,>他们为实验室配备了新仪器。<,>The course will equip you with necessary skills.<,>这门课程将使你掌握必要的技能。<,>The soldiers were well equipped.<,>士兵们装备精良。<,>e(出)+quip(船)→使船能出海→装备<,>equipment(n.设备)/equivalent(adj.相等的/n.等价物)

deferential<,>/ˌdefəˈrenʃl/<,>/ˌdefəˈrenʃl/<,>adj.恭敬的/adj.恭顺的<,>He was deferential to his elders.<,>他对长辈很恭敬。<,>She spoke in a deferential tone.<,>她用恭敬的语气说话。<,>The student showed deferential behavior.<,>这个学生表现出恭敬的态度。<,>defer(顺从)+ent+ial→顺从的→恭敬的<,>different(adj.不同的)/referential(adj.参考的)

manuscript<,>/ˈmænjuskrɪpt/<,>/ˈmænjuskrɪpt/<,>n.手稿/n.原稿/n.手写本<,>The author submitted his manuscript to the publisher.<,>作者把手稿交给了出版社。<,>This is a medieval manuscript.<,>这是一本中世纪的手写本。<,>The manuscript needs editing.<,>这份原稿需要编辑。<,>manu(手)+script(写)→手写的东西→手稿<,>manual(adj.手工的/n.手册)/script(n.剧本/n.笔迹)

luxury<,>/ˈlʌkʃəri/<,>/ˈlʌɡʒəri/<,>n.奢侈/n.奢侈品<,>They live a life of luxury.<,>他们过着奢侈的生活。<,>The hotel offers luxury accommodations.<,>这家酒店提供豪华住宿。<,>She bought a luxury car.<,>她买了一辆豪华车。<,>lux(光)+ury→光彩夺目的→奢侈品<,>luxurious(adj.奢侈的)/luxuriant(adj.茂盛的)
overthrow<,>/ˌəʊvəˈθrəʊ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈθroʊ/<,>vt.推翻/vt.打倒/vt.使终止/vt.摒弃/n.推翻/n.终止/n.结束<,>The rebels planned to overthrow the government.<,>叛乱者计划推翻政府。<,>The scandal led to the overthrow of the CEO.<,>丑闻导致了CEO的下台。<,>They sought to overthrow the old traditions.<,>他们试图摒弃旧传统。<,>over(超过)+throw(扔)→扔过头→推翻<,>overtake(vt.追上/vt.超过)/overlook(vt.忽略/vt.俯瞰)  

knit<,>/nɪt/<,>/nɪt/<,>vi.编结/vi.编织/vi.愈合/vt.编结/vt.编织/vt.使紧密地结合/vt.使紧凑/vt.皱紧/vt.皱<,>She likes to knit sweaters for her grandchildren.<,>她喜欢给孙辈们织毛衣。<,>The broken bone will knit in about six weeks.<,>骨折大约六周后会愈合。<,>They were knit together by shared experiences.<,>共同的经历使他们紧密联系在一起。<,>k(形似编织针)+nit(小东西)→编织小东西<,>knot(n.结/vt.打结)/nit(n.虱卵)/snit(n.焦急状态)  

inflict<,>/ɪnˈflɪkt/<,>/ɪnˈflɪkt/<,>vt.把...强加给/vt.使...遭受/vt.使...承担<,>The hurricane inflicted severe damage on the coast.<,>飓风给海岸造成了严重破坏。<,>Don't inflict your problems on others.<,>不要把你的问题强加给别人。<,>The judge inflicted a heavy fine on the company.<,>法官对公司处以重罚。<,>in(进入)+flict(打击)→打击进去→使遭受<,>conflict(n.冲突/vi.冲突)/afflict(vt.使痛苦)/inflection(n.弯曲/n.变音)  

worthwhile<,>/ˌwɜːθˈwaɪl/<,>/ˌwɜːrθˈwaɪl/<,>adj.值得花时间做的<,>It's worthwhile to visit the museum.<,>参观博物馆是值得的。<,>She found the course very worthwhile.<,>她发现这门课程非常值得。<,>The investment proved worthwhile in the long run.<,>从长远来看，这笔投资是值得的。<,>worth(价值)+while(时间)→值得花时间的<,>worthy(adj.值得的)/worthless(adj.无价值的)/worth(adj.值...的)  

inland<,>/ˈɪnlənd/<,>/ˈɪnlənd/<,>adv.在内地/adv.向内地/adj.内陆的/adj.内地的<,>They traveled inland to explore the mountains.<,>他们前往内陆探索山区。<,>The inland regions have a drier climate.<,>内陆地区气候更干燥。<,>The river flows inland for hundreds of miles.<,>这条河向内陆流经数百英里。<,>in(内)+land(陆地)→内陆的<,>island(n.岛屿)/mainland(n.大陆)/wetland(n.湿地)  

stumble<,>/ˈstʌmbl/<,>/ˈstʌmbl/<,>vi.绊脚/vi.绊倒/vi.跌跌撞撞地走/vi.结结巴巴<,>He stumbled over a rock in the dark.<,>他在黑暗中绊到了一块石头。<,>The drunk man stumbled down the street.<,>醉汉跌跌撞撞地沿街走着。<,>She stumbled through her speech nervously.<,>她紧张地结结巴巴完成了演讲。<,>stum(树桩)+ble→被树桩绊倒<,>tumble(vi.跌倒/vt.使摔倒)/fumble(vi.摸索)/humble(adj.谦逊的)  

specialty<,>/ˈspeʃəlti/<,>/ˈspeʃəlti/<,>n.特产/n.名产/n.特色菜/n.专业/n.专长<,>Lobster is the specialty of this restaurant.<,>龙虾是这家餐厅的特色菜。<,>Her specialty is pediatric medicine.<,>她的专业是儿科医学。<,>The region is famous for its cheese specialty.<,>该地区以其特色奶酪闻名。<,>special(特别的)+ty(名词后缀)→特别的东西→特产/专长<,>specialize(vi.专攻)/specialist(n.专家)/especially(adv.特别地)  

vary<,>/ˈveəri/<,>/ˈveri/<,>vi.变化/vi.有差异/vt.改变/vt.使多样化<,>Prices vary depending on the season.<,>价格随季节变化。<,>Her mood varies from day to day.<,>她的情绪每天都在变化。<,>Try to vary your exercise routine.<,>试着让你的锻炼方式多样化。<,>var(变化)+y→变化<,>very(adv.非常)/variety(n.多样性)/variable(adj.易变的)  

readily<,>/ˈredɪli/<,>/ˈredɪli/<,>adv.乐意地/adv.欣然地/adv.容易地/adv.很快地/adv.立即<,>She readily agreed to help us.<,>她欣然同意帮助我们。<,>The information is readily available online.<,>这些信息在网上很容易找到。<,>The stain came out readily with soap.<,>污渍用肥皂很容易就洗掉了。<,>ready(准备好的)+ly(副词后缀)→乐意地<,>already(adv.已经)/steady(adj.稳定的)/ready(adj.准备好的)  

coherent<,>/kəʊˈhɪərənt/<,>/koʊˈhɪrənt/<,>adj.条理清楚的/adj.连贯的/adj.一致的/adj.协调的<,>She gave a coherent explanation of the theory.<,>她对这一理论给出了条理清晰的解释。<,>The team needs a coherent strategy.<,>团队需要一个协调一致的战略。<,>His argument was logical and coherent.<,>他的论点逻辑清晰、连贯一致。<,>co(共同)+her(粘附)+ent→共同粘在一起的→连贯的<,>incoherent(adj.不连贯的)/adherent(n.追随者)/cohesion(n.凝聚力)
intercourse<,>/ˈɪntəkɔːs/<,>/ˈɪntərkɔːrs/<,>n.性交/n.交流/n.交往/n.交际<,>Social intercourse is essential for mental health.<,>社交活动对心理健康至关重要。<,>They had a brief intercourse before parting ways.<,>他们在分别前有过短暂的交流。<,>Cultural intercourse promotes mutual understanding.<,>文化交流促进相互理解。<,>inter(相互)+course(过程)→相互交流的过程<,>discourse(n.演讲/v.谈论)/interact(v.互动)  

convenience<,>/kənˈviːniəns/<,>/kənˈvinjəns/<,>n.方便/n.便利设施<,>The hotel offers conveniences like free Wi-Fi.<,>这家酒店提供免费Wi-Fi等便利设施。<,>Online shopping is a great convenience.<,>网购非常方便。<,>For your convenience, we have 24-hour service.<,>为了方便您，我们提供24小时服务。<,>con(共同)+ven(来)+ience→一起来就方便<,>convention(n.惯例/n.会议)/inconvenience(n.不便)  

decency<,>/ˈdiːsnsi/<,>/ˈdisənsi/<,>n.得体/n.宽容/n.大方/n.正派/n.合乎礼仪/n.体面<,>He acted with decency and kindness.<,>他行为得体且善良。<,>Basic decency requires honesty.<,>基本的礼仪要求诚实。<,>She donated money out of decency.<,>她出于大方捐了钱。<,>decen(得体)+cy(状态)→得体的状态<,>decent(adj.得体的)/indecency(n.不得体)  

falsehood<,>/ˈfɔːlshʊd/<,>/ˈfɔlsˌhʊd/<,>n.谬误/n.虚假/n.谎言/n.说谎<,>Spreading falsehood is unethical.<,>散布谎言是不道德的。<,>The story was full of falsehoods.<,>这个故事充满了虚假。<,>He was caught in a falsehood.<,>他被发现说谎。<,>false(虚假)+hood(状态)→虚假的状态<,>fallacy(n.谬误)/truth(n.真相)  

discipline<,>/ˈdɪsəplɪn/<,>/ˈdɪsəplən/<,>n.纪律/n.训练/n.惩罚/n.学科/vt.训练/vt.惩罚/vt.处罚<,>Military discipline is very strict.<,>军队纪律非常严格。<,>She disciplines herself to study daily.<,>她严格要求自己每天学习。<,>Physics is a challenging discipline.<,>物理学是一门有挑战性的学科。<,>disciple(门徒)+ine→门徒需要训练<,>disciple(n.门徒)/principle(n.原则)  

ponder<,>/ˈpɒndə(r)/<,>/ˈpɑːndər/<,>v.思索/v.考虑/v.沉思<,>He pondered over the problem for hours.<,>他花了几个小时思考这个问题。<,>She pondered whether to accept the offer.<,>她考虑是否接受这个提议。<,>Let me ponder the implications.<,>让我思考一下其中的含义。<,>pond(重量)+er→称重→权衡思考<,>wonder(v.想知道)/ponderous(adj.笨重的)  

objective<,>/əbˈdʒektɪv/<,>/əbˈdʒɛktɪv/<,>adj.客观的/adj.无偏见的/n.目标/n.目的<,>Journalists should be objective.<,>记者应该客观。<,>Our main objective is customer satisfaction.<,>我们的主要目标是客户满意。<,>He gave an objective analysis.<,>他做了客观的分析。<,>object(物体)+ive→像物体一样实在→客观的<,>subjective(adj.主观的)/objection(n.反对)  

exert<,>/ɪɡˈzɜːt/<,>/ɪɡˈzɜːrt/<,>vt.用/vt.尽/vt.运用/vt.行使<,>He exerted all his strength.<,>他用尽了全力。<,>Parents exert influence on children.<,>父母对孩子施加影响。<,>She exerted her authority wisely.<,>她明智地行使了权力。<,>ex(出)+ert(加入)→加入力量→尽力<,>insert(vt.插入)/exertion(n.努力)  

scandal<,>/ˈskændl/<,>/ˈskændəl/<,>n.丑事/n.丑闻/n.流言蜚语/n.反感/n.愤慨<,>The scandal ruined his career.<,>丑闻毁了他的事业。<,>The newspaper exposed the scandal.<,>报纸揭露了这桩丑闻。<,>She was upset by the scandal.<,>她因流言蜚语而心烦。<,>scan(审视)+dal→被审视的坏事→丑闻<,>sandal(n.凉鞋)/scandalous(adj.可耻的)  

composite<,>/ˈkɒmpəzɪt/<,>/kəmˈpɑːzət/<,>adj.混合成的/adj.综合成的/n.合成物/n.复合材料<,>The material is a composite of plastic and wood.<,>这种材料是塑料和木材的合成物。<,>The composite image shows all features.<,>合成图像显示了所有特征。<,>They used composite materials in construction.<,>他们在建筑中使用了复合材料。<,>com(共同)+pos(放)+ite→放在一起→合成的<,>opposite(adj.相反的)/composition(n.成分)
hinder<,>/ˈhɪndə(r)/<,>/ˈhɪndər/<,>vt.阻碍/vt.妨碍<,>Bad weather may hinder the progress of the construction.<,>恶劣天气可能会阻碍施工进度。<,>Lack of funding could hinder research efforts.<,>资金不足可能会妨碍研究工作。<,>His injury didn't hinder him from winning the race.<,>他的伤势并未妨碍他赢得比赛。<,>hind(后面)+er→拖后腿→阻碍<,>hint(n.暗示/v.暗示)/hind(adj.后面的)/hinterland(n.内地)

scent<,>/sent/<,>/sent/<,>n.香味/n.气味/n.臭迹/n.踪迹/n.线索/n.香水/vt.嗅到/vt.察觉<,>The scent of roses filled the air.<,>空气中弥漫着玫瑰的香味。<,>The dog picked up the scent of the fox.<,>狗嗅到了狐狸的气味。<,>She wore a light floral scent.<,>她喷了淡淡的花香香水。<,>scent与sent同音，记住"香水送(sent)人"<,>sent(v.送，send过去式)/cent(n.分币)/scene(n.场景)

estimate<,>/ˈestɪmeɪt/<,>/ˈɛstəˌmeɪt/<,>vt.估计/vt.评价/n.估计/n.评价/n.看法<,>Can you estimate how long the project will take?<,>你能估计这个项目需要多长时间吗？<,>The mechanic gave me an estimate for the repairs.<,>机械师给了我修理的估价。<,>In my estimate, we'll need about 20 more workers.<,>据我估计，我们还需要大约20名工人。<,>esti(价值)+mate(同伴)→评估同伴价值<,>esteem(n.尊重/v.尊重)/ultimate(adj.最终的)/intimate(adj.亲密的)

diploma<,>/dɪˈpləʊmə/<,>/dɪˈploʊmə/<,>n.毕业文凭/n.毕业证书/n.资格证书<,>She proudly displayed her college diploma on the wall.<,>她自豪地把大学文凭挂在墙上。<,>You'll need a high school diploma to apply for this job.<,>申请这份工作需要高中毕业证书。<,>He earned a diploma in computer programming.<,>他获得了计算机编程的资格证书。<,>di(双)+ploma(折叠)→古代对折的官方文件<,>diplomat(n.外交官)/diplomatic(adj.外交的)/dilemma(n.困境)

exhibit<,>/ɪɡˈzɪbɪt/<,>/ɪɡˈzɪbɪt/<,>vt.显示/vt.陈列/vt.展览/n.展览品<,>The museum will exhibit rare artifacts next month.<,>博物馆下个月将展出稀有文物。<,>She exhibited great courage during the crisis.<,>她在危机中表现出极大的勇气。<,>Don't touch the exhibits in the gallery.<,>不要触摸画廊里的展品。<,>ex(出)+hibit(持有)→拿出来展示<,>inhibit(v.抑制)/prohibit(v.禁止)/habit(n.习惯)

brand<,>/brænd/<,>/brænd/<,>n.商标/n.牌子/vt.铭刻/vt.打烙印于/vt.加污名于/vt.谴责<,>This brand of coffee is very popular.<,>这个牌子的咖啡很受欢迎。<,>The scandal branded him as dishonest.<,>丑闻给他打上了不诚实的烙印。<,>Cattle were branded with the ranch's symbol.<,>牛被打上了牧场的标志烙印。<,>brand与band(乐队)相似，记住"乐队有品牌"<,>blend(v.混合)/bland(adj.平淡的)/brink(n.边缘)

suspension<,>/səˈspenʃn/<,>/səˈspɛnʃən/<,>n.暂停/n.中止/n.暂令停止参加/n.暂时剥夺/n.悬架/n.悬置机构/n.悬浮液/n.悬/n.挂/n.吊<,>The player received a three-game suspension.<,>这名球员被禁赛三场。<,>The bridge's suspension system needs repair.<,>这座桥的悬挂系统需要修理。<,>The car has excellent suspension for rough roads.<,>这辆车的悬架非常适合崎岖道路。<,>sus(下)+pens(悬挂)+ion→悬挂在下面<,>suspense(n.悬念)/suspicion(n.怀疑)/sustain(v.维持)

alcohol<,>/ˈælkəhɒl/<,>/ˈælkəˌhɔl/<,>n.酒精/n.乙醇<,>The doctor advised him to avoid alcohol.<,>医生建议他避免饮酒。<,>This sanitizer contains 70% alcohol.<,>这款消毒剂含有70%的酒精。<,>Alcohol consumption should be moderate.<,>酒精摄入应该适度。<,>al(阿拉伯语冠词)+cohol→源自阿拉伯语<,>alcoholism(n.酗酒)/alcoholic(adj.酒精的)/aldehyde(n.醛)

inevitable<,>/ɪnˈevɪtəbl/<,>/ɪnˈɛvɪtəbəl/<,>adj.不可避免的/adj.必然的<,>Death is the inevitable end of life.<,>死亡是生命不可避免的终结。<,>Conflict seemed inevitable between the two rivals.<,>两个对手之间的冲突似乎不可避免。<,>Technological progress is inevitable.<,>技术进步是必然的。<,>in(不)+evitable(可避免的)→不可避免的<,>evitable(adj.可避免的)/incredible(adj.难以置信的)/invincible(adj.无敌的)

deny<,>/dɪˈnaɪ/<,>/dɪˈnaɪ/<,>vt.否定/vt.拒绝相信<,>He denied stealing the money.<,>他否认偷了钱。<,>The company denied the allegations.<,>公司否认了这些指控。<,>She was denied entry to the country.<,>她被拒绝入境。<,>de(向下)+ny(说不)→否定<,>defy(v.违抗)/decay(v.腐烂)/delay(v.延迟)
trench<,>/trentʃ/<,>/trɛntʃ/<,>n.沟/n.沟渠<,>They dug a trench to drain the water from the field.<,>他们挖了一条沟来排干田里的水。<,>The soldiers took cover in the trench during the battle.<,>士兵们在战斗中躲在战壕里。<,>The trench was filled with muddy water after the rain.<,>雨后沟里满是泥水。<,>trench(沟渠)→与French(法语)对比记忆<,>ditch(n.沟渠)/drain(n.排水沟)/moat(n.护城河)

subtract<,>/səbˈtrækt/<,>/səbˈtrækt/<,>vt.减/vt.减去/vt.去掉<,>Subtract five from ten and you get five.<,>十减五等于五。<,>Please subtract the discount from the total amount.<,>请从总金额中减去折扣。<,>He subtracted all the unnecessary details from his report.<,>他从报告中删去了所有不必要的细节。<,>sub(下)+tract(拉)→往下拉→减去<,>abstract(adj.抽象的)/contract(n.合同)/distract(v.分散注意力)

recreation<,>/ˌrekriˈeɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛkriˈeʃən/<,>n.娱乐活动/n.消遣<,>Reading is my favorite recreation on weekends.<,>阅读是我周末最喜欢的消遣。<,>The park provides various recreation facilities for visitors.<,>公园为游客提供各种娱乐设施。<,>She finds recreation in painting landscapes.<,>她通过画风景画来消遣。<,>re(再)+creation(创造)→再创造→娱乐<,>relaxation(n.放松)/amusement(n.娱乐)/pastime(n.消遣)

frustration<,>/frʌˈstreɪʃn/<,>/frʌˈstreɪʃən/<,>n.挫败/n.挫折/n.受挫<,>He felt great frustration when his project failed.<,>当项目失败时，他感到非常沮丧。<,>Her constant frustration with the slow progress was evident.<,>她对进展缓慢的持续沮丧是显而易见的。<,>The team's frustration grew as they kept losing games.<,>随着不断输掉比赛，球队的挫折感越来越强。<,>frust(徒劳)+ration→徒劳的感觉→挫折<,>disappointment(n.失望)/setback(n.挫折)/anger(n.愤怒)

allowance<,>/əˈlaʊəns/<,>/əˈlaʊəns/<,>n.津贴/n.补贴/n.零用钱<,>My parents give me a weekly allowance of $20.<,>我父母每周给我20美元的零花钱。<,>The company provides a housing allowance for its employees.<,>公司为员工提供住房补贴。<,>He saved his allowance to buy a new bike.<,>他攒下零用钱买了一辆新自行车。<,>allow(允许)+ance→允许使用的钱→津贴<,>salary(n.薪水)/pocket money(n.零花钱)/subsidy(n.补贴)

hurricane<,>/ˈhʌrɪkən/<,>/ˈhɜːrɪkeɪn/<,>n.飓风<,>The hurricane caused widespread damage to the coastal town.<,>飓风给沿海城镇造成了广泛的破坏。<,>Residents were evacuated before the hurricane hit.<,>飓风来袭前居民被疏散了。<,>Meteorologists are tracking the path of the hurricane.<,>气象学家正在追踪飓风的路径。<,>hurri(匆忙)+cane→来得匆忙的风→飓风<,>typhoon(n.台风)/tornado(n.龙卷风)/cyclone(n.气旋)

hike<,>/haɪk/<,>/haɪk/<,>vi.徒步旅行/n.徒步旅行/n.增加/vt.提高<,>We plan to hike in the mountains this weekend.<,>我们计划这个周末去山里徒步旅行。<,>The price hike made the product less affordable.<,>价格上涨使产品变得不那么实惠。<,>The company hiked salaries by 10% this year.<,>公司今年将工资提高了10%。<,>hike(徒步)→与bike(自行车)对比记忆<,>trek(n.长途跋涉)/walk(n.步行)/increase(n.增加)

ancient<,>/ˈeɪnʃənt/<,>/ˈeɪnʃənt/<,>adj.古代的/adj.古老的/adj.年老的<,>We visited the ancient ruins of Rome.<,>我们参观了罗马的古遗址。<,>This ancient tree is over 500 years old.<,>这棵古树有500多年的历史。<,>My grandfather has some ancient ideas about education.<,>我祖父对教育有一些陈旧的观念。<,>anci(古老)+ent→古老的<,>antique(adj.古董的)/old(adj.老的)/medieval(adj.中世纪的)

mission<,>/ˈmɪʃn/<,>/ˈmɪʃən/<,>n.使命/n.任务/n.使团<,>The astronauts completed their mission successfully.<,>宇航员们成功完成了他们的任务。<,>Her mission in life is to help the poor.<,>她的人生使命是帮助穷人。<,>A trade mission was sent to negotiate with foreign companies.<,>一个贸易代表团被派去与外国公司谈判。<,>miss(送)+ion→送出去的任务→使命<,>assignment(n.任务)/purpose(n.目的)/delegation(n.代表团)

cognitive<,>/ˈkɒɡnətɪv/<,>/ˈkɑːɡnətɪv/<,>adj.认知的/adj.认识能力的<,>Cognitive development is important in early childhood.<,>认知发展在幼儿期很重要。<,>The study focuses on cognitive processes in learning.<,>这项研究专注于学习中的认知过程。<,>As we age, our cognitive abilities may decline.<,>随着年龄增长，我们的认知能力可能会下降。<,>cogn(知道)+itive→认知的<,>intellectual(adj.智力的)/mental(adj.精神的)/perceptive(adj.感知的)
adopt<,>/əˈdɒpt/<,>/əˈdɑːpt/<,>vt.收养/vt.采用/vt.采取/vt.正式通过/vt.批准<,>They decided to adopt a child from the orphanage.<,>他们决定从孤儿院领养一个孩子。<,>The company will adopt new technology to improve efficiency.<,>公司将采用新技术以提高效率。<,>The committee adopted the proposal unanimously.<,>委员会一致通过了这项提案。<,>ad(加强)+opt(选择)→选择→采用<,>adapt(v.适应/v.改编)/adept(adj.熟练的/n.专家)  

expire<,>/ɪkˈspaɪə(r)/<,>/ɪkˈspaɪər/<,>vi.期满/vi.终止/vi.断气/vi.死亡<,>My passport will expire next month.<,>我的护照下个月就到期了。<,>The contract expires at the end of this year.<,>合同在今年年底终止。<,>He expired peacefully in his sleep.<,>他在睡梦中安详地离世了。<,>ex(出)+spire(呼吸)→呼出最后一口气→死亡<,>inspire(v.鼓舞)/aspire(v.渴望)/perspire(v.出汗)  

smuggle<,>/ˈsmʌɡl/<,>/ˈsmʌɡəl/<,>vt.走私/vt.非法私运/vt.偷运/vt.偷带<,>They were caught trying to smuggle drugs across the border.<,>他们试图走私毒品过境时被抓获。<,>He smuggled a letter out of the prison.<,>他把一封信偷偷带出了监狱。<,>She smuggled her favorite snacks into the cinema.<,>她把最爱的零食偷带进了电影院。<,>s(私)+muggle(麻瓜)→像麻瓜一样偷偷行动→走私<,>struggle(v.奋斗/n.斗争)/snuggle(v.依偎)  

hustle<,>/ˈhʌsl/<,>/ˈhʌsəl/<,>v.催促/v.赶紧做/v.猛推/v.挤/v.强迫/n.忙碌/n.奔忙/n.挤<,>You need to hustle if you want to catch the train.<,>如果你想赶上火车就得快点。<,>The salesman hustled me into buying the product.<,>推销员硬是说服我买了这个产品。<,>There's a lot of hustle and bustle in the city center.<,>市中心非常繁忙喧闹。<,>hus(房子)+tle→在房子里忙碌→奔忙<,>bustle(v.忙碌/n.喧闹)/hassle(n.麻烦/v.烦扰)  

oppose<,>/əˈpəʊz/<,>/əˈpoʊz/<,>vt.反对/vt.反抗<,>Many people oppose the new law.<,>许多人反对这项新法律。<,>She opposed her father's decision to sell the house.<,>她反对父亲卖房子的决定。<,>The two teams opposed each other in the final.<,>两支队伍在决赛中对抗。<,>op(反)+pose(放)→放在对立面→反对<,>propose(v.提议)/suppose(v.假设)/dispose(v.处理)  

device<,>/dɪˈvaɪs/<,>/dɪˈvaɪs/<,>n.器械/n.装置/n.设计/n.手段/n.策略<,>This device can measure your heart rate.<,>这个装置可以测量你的心率。<,>He invented a clever device for opening bottles.<,>他发明了一个巧妙的开瓶装置。<,>She used every device to get what she wanted.<,>她用尽各种手段来得到她想要的。<,>de(加强)+vice(代替)→代替人工的装置→器械<,>advice(n.建议)/devise(v.设计)/divide(v.分割)  

commentary<,>/ˈkɒməntri/<,>/ˈkɑːmənteri/<,>n.实况报道/n.解说词/n.评论/n.评论文章<,>The sports commentary was very exciting.<,>体育比赛的实况报道非常精彩。<,>She wrote a commentary on the latest political events.<,>她就最新政治事件写了一篇评论文章。<,>The DVD includes director's commentary.<,>这张DVD包含导演的解说。<,>comment(评论)+ary(场所)→评论的场所→评论文章<,>commend(v.称赞)/commerce(n.商业)  

sue<,>/suː/<,>/suː/<,>v.控告/v.起诉/v.要求/v.请求<,>He threatened to sue the newspaper for libel.<,>他威胁要起诉该报诽谤。<,>She sued the company for unfair dismissal.<,>她以不公正解雇为由起诉了公司。<,>They are suing for peace.<,>他们正在求和。<,>s(法律)+ue→法律行动→起诉<,>pursue(v.追求)/ensue(v.接着发生)/issue(n.问题/v.发行)  

conservative<,>/kənˈsɜːvətɪv/<,>/kənˈsɜːrvətɪv/<,>adj.保守的/adj.守旧的/adj.不时兴的/adj.传统的/n.保守的人<,>He has very conservative views on marriage.<,>他对婚姻持非常保守的观点。<,>She wears conservative clothes to the office.<,>她穿着传统的衣服去办公室。<,>The Conservative Party won the election.<,>保守党赢得了选举。<,>con(完全)+serve(保持)+ative→完全保持现状的→保守的<,>progressive(adj.进步的)/liberal(adj.自由的)  

belly<,>/ˈbeli/<,>/ˈbeli/<,>n.肚子/n.腹部<,>The baby kicked its mother's belly.<,>宝宝踢了妈妈的肚子。<,>He has a big belly from drinking too much beer.<,>他因喝太多啤酒而有了大肚子。<,>The snake was moving on its belly.<,>蛇用腹部爬行。<,>bell(钟)+y→像钟一样鼓起的部位→肚子<,>jelly(n.果冻)/bully(n.恶霸/v.欺负)
access<,>/ˈækses/<,>/ˈæksɛs/<,>n.接近/n.通道,入口/n.接近的机会/vt.存取<,>The only access to the village is by boat.<,>进入这个村庄的唯一途径是乘船。<,>Students have free access to the library.<,>学生可以自由进入图书馆。<,>He accessed the data from the remote server.<,>他从远程服务器上获取了数据。<,>ac(强调)+cess(走)→走过去→接近<,>assess(v.评估)/excess(n.过量)/accede(v.同意)

conference<,>/ˈkɒnf(ə)r(ə)ns/<,>/ˈkɑːnfərəns/<,>n.会议,讨论会/n.讨论,商谈<,>The annual conference will be held in Paris this year.<,>今年的年度会议将在巴黎举行。<,>They are in conference with the director.<,>他们正在与主管商谈。<,>The peace conference lasted for three days.<,>和平会议持续了三天。<,>con(共同)+fer(带来)+ence→共同带来观点→会议<,>confer(v.商讨)/reference(n.参考)/inference(n.推论)

primitive<,>/ˈprɪmɪtɪv/<,>/ˈprɪmɪtɪv/<,>adj.原始的,早期的/adj.简单的/adj.粗糙的/n.原人/n.原始事物<,>Primitive man made tools from stones.<,>原始人用石头制作工具。<,>They lived in a primitive hut with no electricity.<,>他们住在一个没有电的简陋小屋里。<,>This is a very primitive method of farming.<,>这是一种非常原始的耕作方法。<,>prim(第一)+itive→最早的→原始的<,>prime(adj.主要的)/primate(n.灵长类)/privacy(n.隐私)

knob<,>/nɒb/<,>/nɑːb/<,>n.球形把手,球形柄/n.旋钮/n.小块<,>Turn the knob to adjust the volume.<,>转动旋钮调节音量。<,>He grasped the door knob tightly.<,>他紧紧抓住门把手。<,>There's a knob of butter left in the dish.<,>盘子里还剩一小块黄油。<,>kn(结)+ob→像结一样的东西→球形把手<,>knob(n.瘤)/knock(v.敲)/knot(n.结)

advisable<,>/ədˈvaɪzəb(ə)l/<,>/ədˈvaɪzəbəl/<,>adj.可取的/adj.适当的<,>It's advisable to book tickets in advance.<,>提前订票是明智的。<,>It would be advisable to consult a lawyer.<,>咨询律师是适当的。<,>Early arrival is advisable for this popular event.<,>对于这个热门活动，建议早点到场。<,>ad(加强)+vis(看)+able→值得看的→可取的<,>advise(v.建议)/visible(adj.可见的)/available(adj.可用的)

overcome<,>/ˌəʊvəˈkʌm/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈkʌm/<,>vt.战胜,克服/vt.压倒,使受不了<,>She overcame her fear of public speaking.<,>她克服了公开演讲的恐惧。<,>The soldiers overcame the enemy's defenses.<,>士兵们攻破了敌人的防线。<,>We were overcome by the heat during the hike.<,>我们在徒步旅行时热得受不了。<,>over(在...上)+come(来)→来到上面→克服<,>overcome(v.压倒)/overload(v.超载)/overlook(v.忽视)

cabin<,>/ˈkæbɪn/<,>/ˈkæbɪn/<,>n.小屋/n.船舱,机舱<,>They rented a cabin in the woods for the weekend.<,>他们在树林里租了一间小屋度周末。<,>Our cabin on the ship was quite comfortable.<,>我们在船上的船舱相当舒适。<,>The pilot remained in the cabin during the flight.<,>飞行员在飞行期间一直待在机舱里。<,>cab(小房间)+in→小房间→小屋<,>cabinet(n.橱柜)/cable(n.电缆)/cabbage(n.卷心菜)

recite<,>/rɪˈsaɪt/<,>/rɪˈsaɪt/<,>v.背诵,朗诵/v.列举,一一说出<,>The child recited a poem at the school concert.<,>这个孩子在学校音乐会上朗诵了一首诗。<,>He recited all the names from memory.<,>他凭记忆一一说出了所有名字。<,>Can you recite the multiplication table?<,>你能背诵乘法表吗？<,>re(再)+cite(召唤)→再次召唤→背诵<,>recital(n.朗诵)/cite(v.引用)/excite(v.使兴奋)

oppress<,>/əˈpres/<,>/əˈpres/<,>vt.压迫,压制/vt.使沉重,使烦恼<,>The dictator oppressed his people for decades.<,>这个独裁者压迫了他的人民几十年。<<,>The heat was oppressing us during the hike.<,>徒步旅行时炎热让我们很难受。<,>She felt oppressed by all the responsibilities.<,>所有这些责任让她感到压抑。<,>op(反)+press(压)→反着压→压迫<,>press(v.压)/express(v.表达)/depress(v.使沮丧)

current<,>/ˈkʌrənt/<,>/ˈkɜːrənt/<,>adj.当前的/adj.通用的/adj.流行的/n.潮流/n.电流/n.趋势<,>The current situation is quite challenging.<,>当前形势相当具有挑战性。<,>This slang is current among teenagers.<,>这种俚语在青少年中很流行。<,>Be careful of the strong current in this river.<,>小心这条河里湍急的水流。<,>curr(跑)+ent→跑动的→当前的<,>currency(n.货币)/occur(v.发生)/recur(v.重现)
heel<,>/hiːl/<,>/hil/<,>n.脚后跟/n.踵/n.后跟<,>She twisted her heel while running.<,>她跑步时扭伤了脚后跟。<,>He wore shoes with high heels.<,>他穿了一双高跟鞋。<,>The heel of the bread was left uneaten.<,>面包的根部没被吃掉。<,>heel(heel脚后跟)与heal(治愈)发音相似<,>heal(v.治愈)/peel(v.剥皮)/feel(v.感觉)

gloom<,>/ɡluːm/<,>/ɡlum/<,>n.昏暗/n.阴暗/n.忧郁/n.沮丧<,>The room was filled with gloom after the lights went out.<,>灯灭后，房间里一片昏暗。<,>He couldn't shake off the gloom after hearing the bad news.<,>听到坏消息后，他无法摆脱沮丧。<,>The gloom of the forest made her feel uneasy.<,>森林的阴暗让她感到不安。<,>gloom(阴暗)与bloom(开花)形似<,>bloom(v.开花)/groom(n.新郎)/loom(v.隐约出现)

adore<,>/əˈdɔː(r)/<,>/əˈdɔr/<,>vt.崇拜/vt.敬慕/vt.爱慕/vt.热爱/vt.非常喜欢<,>She adores her grandmother and visits her every week.<,>她非常爱她的祖母，每周都去看望她。<,>He adores classical music and collects many records.<,>他非常喜欢古典音乐，收藏了许多唱片。<,>The fans adored the pop star and followed him everywhere.<,>粉丝们崇拜这位流行歌星，到处追随他。<,>adore(a+dore→给予爱→崇拜)<,>adorn(v.装饰)/abhor(v.憎恶)/adore(v.崇拜)

persist<,>/pəˈsɪst/<,>/pərˈsɪst/<,>vi.坚持/vi.持续<,>Despite the difficulties, he persisted in his efforts.<,>尽管有困难，他仍坚持努力。<,>The rain persisted for three days.<,>雨持续下了三天。<,>She persisted in asking questions until she got the answer.<,>她坚持提问，直到得到答案。<,>per(始终)+sist(站立)→始终站立→坚持<,>insist(v.坚持)/resist(v.抵抗)/desist(v.停止)

caution<,>/ˈkɔːʃn/<,>/ˈkɔʃən/<,>n.小心/n.谨慎/n.注意/n.警告/vt.警告/vt.劝…小心<,>He proceeded with caution on the icy road.<,>他在结冰的路上小心前行。<,>The sign cautions drivers about the sharp turn ahead.<,>标志警告司机前方有急转弯。<,>She cautioned her son against talking to strangers.<,>她告诫儿子不要和陌生人说话。<,>caut(小心)+ion(名词后缀)→小心<,>precaution(n.预防)/captious(adj.挑剔的)/cautious(adj.谨慎的)

offensive<,>/əˈfensɪv/<,>/əˈfɛnsɪv/<,>adj.冒犯的/adj.无礼的/adj.使人不快的/adj.进攻的/adj.攻击性的/n.进攻/n.攻势<,>His offensive remarks angered everyone.<,>他无礼的言论激怒了所有人。<,>The team launched an offensive against their opponents.<,>队伍向对手发起了进攻。<,>The smell from the factory was offensive to the neighbors.<,>工厂的气味让邻居们感到不快。<,>off(反对)+fens(打击)+ive→反对打击→冒犯的<,>defensive(adj.防御的)/offense(n.冒犯)/fence(n.栅栏)

texture<,>/ˈtekstʃə(r)/<,>/ˈtɛkstʃər/<,>n.质地/n.结构<,>The fabric has a smooth texture.<,>这种面料质地光滑。<,>She loves the texture of handmade paper.<,>她喜欢手工纸的质感。<,>The texture of the cake was light and fluffy.<,>蛋糕的结构轻盈松软。<,>text(编织)+ure(名词后缀)→编织的状态→质地<,>textile(n.纺织品)/context(n.上下文)/pretext(n.借口)

closet<,>/ˈklɒzɪt/<,>/ˈklɑːzət/<,>adj.私下的/adj.隐蔽的/n.橱/n.壁橱/vt.把…引进密室会谈<,>He keeps his shoes in the closet.<,>他把鞋子放在壁橱里。<,>She has a closet full of designer clothes.<,>她有一个装满设计师服装的衣橱。<,>The politicians were closeted for hours discussing the issue.<,>政治家们密谈数小时讨论这个问题。<,>close(关闭)+et(小)→关闭的小空间→壁橱<,>closet(n.壁橱)/closet(adj.秘密的)/closet(vt.密谈)

speculate<,>/ˈspekjuleɪt/<,>/ˈspɛkjəˌleɪt/<,>v.推测/v.推断/v.投机/v.做投机买卖<,>Scientists speculate about life on other planets.<,>科学家们推测其他星球上的生命。<,>He speculated in the stock market and lost money.<,>他在股市投机，亏了钱。<,>It's useless to speculate without evidence.<,>没有证据的推断是无用的。<,>spec(看)+ul+ate(动词后缀)→看情况→推测<,>spectacle(n.景象)/inspect(v.检查)/expect(v.期待)

dismantle<,>/dɪsˈmæntl/<,>/dɪsˈmæntəl/<,>vt.拆开/vt.拆卸<,>They dismantled the old machine for parts.<,>他们拆开旧机器取零件。<,>The workers dismantled the stage after the concert.<,>工人们在音乐会后拆卸了舞台。<,>He dismantled his argument point by point.<,>他逐点拆解了他的论点。<,>dis(分开)+mantle(覆盖)→分开覆盖物→拆卸<,>mantle(n.斗篷)/dismay(v.使沮丧)/dismember(v.肢解)
monster<,>/ˈmɒnstə(r)/<,>/ˈmɑːnstər/<,>adj.大的/adj.庞大的/n.怪物/n.极其残酷的人/n.巨人/n.巨兽/n.巨大的东西<,>The monster in the movie scared all the children.<,>电影里的怪物吓坏了所有孩子。<,>He built a monster truck for the competition.<,>他造了一辆巨型卡车参加比赛。<,>She is a monster when she gets angry.<,>她生气时像个恶魔。<,>mon(提醒)+ster(人)→提醒人注意的怪物<,>master(n.主人/v.掌握)/minister(n.部长/v.照料)  

bud<,>/bʌd/<,>/bʌd/<,>vi.发芽/vi.萌芽/n.花蕾/n.叶芽<,>The roses are beginning to bud in spring.<,>春天玫瑰开始发芽。<,>She carefully removed a bud from the plant.<,>她小心地从植物上摘下一个花蕾。<,>New ideas bud in creative minds.<,>新想法在创新头脑中萌芽。<,>b(像花苞)+ud(向上)→向上生长的花苞<,>mud(n.泥土)/bid(v.出价/n.投标)  

confirm<,>/kənˈfɜːm/<,>/kənˈfɜːrm/<,>vt.证实/vt.肯定/vt.确认/vt.批准<,>Please confirm your attendance by Friday.<,>请在周五前确认是否出席。<,>The experiment confirmed our hypothesis.<,>实验证实了我们的假设。<,>The Senate confirmed the new judge.<,>参议院批准了新法官的任命。<,>con(完全)+firm(坚定)→完全坚定→确认<,>affirm(v.断言)/conform(v.符合/v.遵守)  

bug<,>/bʌɡ/<,>/bʌɡ/<,>n.虫子/n.小病/n.故障/n.缺陷/n.窃听器/vt.烦扰/vt.纠缠/vt.装窃听器<,>There's a bug in the computer program.<,>电脑程序有个漏洞。<,>Stop bugging me with questions!<,>别再用问题烦我了！<,>The spy planted a bug in the office.<,>间谍在办公室装了窃听器。<,>b(像虫子)+ug(丑陋)→丑陋的小虫<,>hug(v.拥抱)/rug(n.地毯)  

prescient<,>/ˈpresiənt/<,>/ˈpreʃənt/<,>adj.预知的/adj.预见的<,>Her prescient warning saved many lives.<,>她预见性的警告挽救了许多生命。<,>The novel showed prescient insights about technology.<,>这部小说对技术有先见之明的洞察。<,>His prescient investment made him rich.<,>他预见性的投资让他致富。<,>pre(前)+sci(知道)+ent→提前知道的<,>precise(adj.精确的)/president(n.总统)  

acquaint<,>/əˈkweɪnt/<,>/əˈkweɪnt/<,>vt.使认识/vt.使了解/vt.使熟悉<,>Let me acquaint you with our procedures.<,>让我带你熟悉我们的流程。<,>We became acquainted at the conference.<,>我们在会议上相识。<,>She acquainted herself with the new software quickly.<,>她很快熟悉了新软件。<,>ac(强调)+quaint(知道)→使知道<,>quaint(adj.古雅的)/acquire(v.获得)  

elastic<,>/ɪˈlæstɪk/<,>/ɪˈlæstɪk/<,>adj.有弹性的/adj.灵活的/n.松紧带<,>The elastic band snapped when stretched too far.<,>橡皮筋拉得太长时断了。<,>Her schedule is elastic enough for emergencies.<,>她的日程安排足够灵活应对紧急情况。<,>This material is highly elastic.<,>这种材料弹性很好。<,>e(出)+last(持续)+ic→能持续拉伸的<,>plastic(n.塑料)/ecstatic(adj.狂喜的)  

consequent<,>/ˈkɒnsɪkwənt/<,>/ˈkɑːnsɪkwənt/<,>adj.作为结果的/adj.随之发生的<,>The consequent damage from the hurricane was severe.<,>飓风造成的后续破坏很严重。<,>His resignation and consequent job search took months.<,>他辞职后随之而来的求职花了数月。<,>Errors and consequent delays frustrated the team.<,>错误及由此产生的延误让团队沮丧。<,>con(共同)+sequ(跟随)+ent→跟随而来的<,>subsequent(adj.随后的)/sequential(adj.连续的)  

vast<,>/vɑːst/<,>/væst/<,>adj.巨大的/adj.大量的/adj.浩瀚的<,>The vast desert stretched for miles.<,>浩瀚的沙漠绵延数英里。<,>She inherited a vast fortune.<,>她继承了一大笔财富。<,>There's a vast difference between the two theories.<,>这两种理论差别巨大。<,>vas(走)+t(延伸)→延伸很广的<,>fast(adj.快的)/vest(n.背心)  

intervene<,>/ˌɪntəˈviːn/<,>/ˌɪntərˈviːn/<,>vi.干涉/vi.干预/vi.干扰/vi.阻挠<,>The teacher intervened in the students' argument.<,>老师介入了学生的争论。<,>The government intervened to stabilize the economy.<,>政府干预以稳定经济。<,>Nothing intervened to stop the accident.<,>没有任何干预阻止事故的发生。<,>inter(在...间)+vene(来)→来到中间→干预<,>interview(n.面试)/interfere(v.干涉)
symbol<,>/ˈsɪmbəl/<,>/ˈsɪmbəl/<,>n.象征/n.符号/n.标志<,>The dove is a symbol of peace.<,>鸽子是和平的象征。<,>Can you explain the meaning of this symbol?<,>你能解释这个符号的含义吗？<,>The company's logo is a powerful symbol of its brand.<,>公司的标志是其品牌的强大象征。<,>sym(共同)+bol(抛)→共同抛出的标志→象征<,>symptom(n.症状)/simile(n.明喻)/cymbal(n.铙钹)

ignite<,>/ɪɡˈnaɪt/<,>/ɪɡˈnaɪt/<,>vi.着火/vt.点燃/vt.引发<,>The dry grass ignited quickly in the hot sun.<,>干草在烈日下迅速燃烧起来。<,>His speech ignited the crowd's enthusiasm.<,>他的演讲点燃了人群的热情。<,>Be careful not to ignite the gas leak.<,>小心别点燃泄漏的煤气。<,>ign(火)+ite→使着火<,>indite(vt.创作)/incite(vt.煽动)/igneous(adj.火的)

commercial<,>/kəˈmɜːʃəl/<,>/kəˈmɜːrʃəl/<,>adj.商业的/adj.商务的/adj.商品化的<,>The commercial district is always busy.<,>商业区总是很繁忙。<,>This product has great commercial potential.<,>这个产品有很大的商业潜力。<,>Commercial flights were suspended during the storm.<,>暴风雨期间商业航班暂停了。<,>com(共同)+merc(贸易)+ial→共同贸易的→商业的<,>commodity(n.商品)/mercantile(adj.贸易的)/commerce(n.商业)

revelation<,>/ˌrevəˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛvəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.被提示的真相/n.新发现/n.揭示<,>The book contains shocking revelations about the war.<,>这本书包含了关于战争的惊人真相。<,>Her talent was a revelation to everyone.<,>她的才华让所有人感到意外。<,>The revelation of the secret caused a scandal.<,>秘密的揭露引发了丑闻。<,>re(再)+vel(面纱)+ation→再次揭开面纱→揭示<,>revolution(n.革命)/reverie(n.幻想)/revelry(n.狂欢)

available<,>/əˈveɪləbl/<,>/əˈveɪləbəl/<,>adj.现成可使用的/adj.通用的/adj.可得到的<,>Is this seat available?<,>这个座位有人吗？<,>The manager is not available right now.<,>经理现在没空。<,>Fresh fruits are available in the market.<,>市场上可以买到新鲜水果。<,>a(强调)+vail(价值)+able→有价值的→可得到的<,>unavailable(adj.不可获得的)/availability(n.可用性)/avail(vt.利用)

innumerable<,>/ɪˈnjuːmərəbl/<,>/ɪˈnuːmərəbəl/<,>adj.无数的/adj.数不清的<,>There are innumerable stars in the sky.<,>天空中有数不清的星星。<,>The project faced innumerable difficulties.<,>这个项目面临无数困难。<,>She has received innumerable awards for her work.<,>她的工作获得了无数奖项。<,>in(不)+numer(数)+able→数不清的<,>numerous(adj.许多的)/enumerate(vt.列举)/numeric(adj.数字的)

advocate<,>/ˈædvəkeɪt/<,>/ˈædvəˌkeɪt/<,>vt.拥护/vt.提倡/n.拥护者<,>She advocates for women's rights.<,>她倡导妇女权利。<,>He is a strong advocate of free education.<,>他是免费教育的坚定拥护者。<,>The lawyer will advocate on your behalf.<,>律师将为你辩护。<,>ad(向)+voc(声音)+ate→为...发声→拥护<,>vocative(adj.称呼的)/equivocate(vi.说模棱两可的话)/invoke(vt.调用)

confine<,>/kənˈfaɪn/<,>/kənˈfaɪn/<,>vt.限制/vt.使局限/vt.禁闭<,>Please confine your remarks to the topic.<,>请把你的评论限制在主题范围内。<,>The dog was confined to a small yard.<,>狗被关在一个小院子里。<,>The virus is confined to this region.<,>病毒被限制在这个地区。<,>con(共同)+fin(界限)+e→共同的界限→限制<,>define(vt.定义)/refine(vt.精炼)/confines(n.界限)

quest<,>/kwest/<,>/kwɛst/<,>n.寻找/n.搜索/n.追求<,>They went on a quest for the lost treasure.<,>他们去寻找失落的宝藏。<,>His lifelong quest was to find a cure.<,>他毕生的追求是找到治疗方法。<,>The quest for knowledge never ends.<,>对知识的追求永无止境。<,>quest本身即表示"寻求"<,>question(n.问题)/request(n.请求)/conquest(n.征服)

frequency<,>/ˈfriːkwənsi/<,>/ˈfrikwənsi/<,>n.屡次/n.次数/n.频率<,>The frequency of earthquakes has increased.<,>地震发生的频率增加了。<,>This radio station broadcasts on a different frequency.<,>这个电台以不同的频率广播。<,>He visits us with surprising frequency.<,>他来访的频率高得惊人。<,>frequ(频繁)+ency→频繁程度→频率<,>frequent(adj.频繁的)/sequence(n.序列)/consequence(n.结果)
elicit<,>/ɪˈlɪsɪt/<,>/ɪˈlɪsɪt/<,>vt.诱出/vt.探出<,>The detective tried to elicit a confession from the suspect.<,>侦探试图从嫌疑人那里诱出供词。<,>Her questions were designed to elicit more information.<,>她的问题旨在探出更多信息。<,>The teacher used various methods to elicit responses from the students.<,>老师用各种方法引导学生回答。<,>e(出)+licit(引出)→引出→诱出<,>explicit(adj.明确的)/implicit(adj.含蓄的)/illicit(adj.非法的)  

relegate<,>/ˈrelɪɡeɪt/<,>/ˈrɛlɪˌɡeɪt/<,>vt.使降位/vt.使降级/vt.把…委托给<,>The team was relegated to a lower division.<,>该队被降级到低一级的联赛。<,>He relegated the task to his assistant.<,>他把任务委托给了助手。<,>Old files are relegated to the basement.<,>旧文件被移交到地下室存放。<,>re(回)+leg(送)+ate→送回去→降级<,>delegate(v.委派/n.代表)/allegate(v.宣称)/rejuvenate(v.使年轻)  

trivial<,>/ˈtrɪviəl/<,>/ˈtrɪviəl/<,>adj.琐碎的/adj.不重要的<,>Don't waste time on trivial matters.<,>不要浪费时间在琐事上。<,>The mistake was trivial and easily corrected.<,>这个错误微不足道，很容易纠正。<,>They had a trivial argument about what to watch.<,>他们就看什么节目发生了小争执。<,>tri(三)+via(路)+l→三岔路口→琐碎的<,>trifle(n.琐事)/tribunal(n.法庭)/trilogy(n.三部曲)  

burial<,>/ˈberiəl/<,>/ˈbɛriəl/<,>n.葬/n.掩埋/n.葬礼<,>The burial took place at sunset.<,>葬礼在日落时分举行。<,>Archaeologists discovered an ancient burial site.<,>考古学家发现了一处古代墓葬。<,>Proper burial customs vary across cultures.<,>不同文化有各自的丧葬习俗。<,>bury(埋葬)+al(名词后缀)→埋葬<,>burrow(n.地洞)/beryl(n.绿宝石)/burly(adj.魁梧的)  

luggage<,>/ˈlʌɡɪdʒ/<,>/ˈlʌɡɪdʒ/<,>n.行李<,>Please check your luggage at the counter.<,>请在柜台托运您的行李。<,>He struggled with his heavy luggage.<,>他费力地搬着沉重的行李。<,>The airline lost my luggage during the flight.<,>航空公司弄丢了我托运的行李。<,>lug(拖拽)+age(集合名词)→拖拽的东西→行李<,>baggage(n.行李)/language(n.语言)/lugubrious(adj.悲哀的)  

drawback<,>/ˈdrɔːbæk/<,>/ˈdrɔˌbæk/<,>n.缺点/n.欠缺/n.不利条件<,>The main drawback of this plan is the cost.<,>这个计划的主要缺点是成本高。<,>Lack of experience is a serious drawback.<,>缺乏经验是个严重的不利条件。<,>One drawback of city life is the noise.<,>城市生活的一个缺点是噪音。<,>draw(拉)+back(回)→拉后腿→缺点<,>setback(n.挫折)/feedback(n.反馈)/drawbridge(n.吊桥)  

longevity<,>/lɒnˈdʒevəti/<,>/lɑːnˈdʒevəti/<,>n.长寿/n.寿命<,>Good habits contribute to longevity.<,>良好习惯有助于长寿。<,>The longevity of this tradition is remarkable.<,>这一传统的延续时间令人瞩目。<,>Scientists study the longevity of different species.<,>科学家研究不同物种的寿命。<,>long(长)+ev(年龄)+ity→长寿<,>longitude(n.经度)/longing(n.渴望)/longanimity(n.坚忍)  

military<,>/ˈmɪlətri/<,>/ˈmɪləˌteri/<,>adj.军事的/adj.军用的/n.军队/n.武装力量<,>Military service is compulsory in some countries.<,>在某些国家服兵役是强制性的。<,>The military base is heavily guarded.<,>该军事基地戒备森严。<,>He comes from a military family.<,>他出身于军人家庭。<,>milit(军事)+ary→军事的<,>militia(n.民兵)/militant(adj.好战的)/militarize(v.军事化)  

dynamic<,>/daɪˈnæmɪk/<,>/daɪˈnæmɪk/<,>adj.动力的/adj.动力学的/adj.动态的/adj.有活力的<,>The company needs dynamic leadership.<,>公司需要充满活力的领导。<,>This is a dynamic process that keeps changing.<,>这是一个不断变化的动态过程。<,>The dynamic performance impressed the audience.<,>充满活力的表演给观众留下深刻印象。<,>dynam(力量)+ic→有力量的→有活力的<,>dynamo(n.发电机)/dynamite(n.炸药)/aerodynamic(adj.空气动力学的)  

wardrobe<,>/ˈwɔːdrəʊb/<,>/ˈwɔːrdroʊb/<,>n.衣柜/n.全部衣物<,>She organized her wardrobe by color.<,>她按颜色整理衣柜。<,>A new wardrobe was delivered today.<,>今天送来了一个新衣柜。<,>His summer wardrobe needs updating.<,>他的夏季衣物需要更新了。<,>ward(守卫)+robe(长袍)→存放衣物的柜子<,>warden(n.看守人)/warder(n.狱吏)/wardrobe malfunction(走光)
reluctant<,>/rɪˈlʌktənt/<,>/rɪˈlʌktənt/<,>adj.不情愿的/勉强的<,>He was reluctant to admit his mistake.<,>他不情愿地承认了自己的错误。<,>She gave a reluctant smile.<,>她勉强地笑了笑。<,>The cat was reluctant to leave its warm spot.<,>这只猫不愿意离开它温暖的地方。<,>re(反)+luct(挣扎)+ant→挣扎反抗的→不情愿的<,>reluctance(n.不情愿)/deliberate(adj.故意的)/hesitant(adj.犹豫的)

conscientious<,>/ˌkɒnʃiˈenʃəs/<,>/ˌkɑːnʃiˈenʃəs/<,>adj.认真的/勤勤恳恳的<,>She is a conscientious worker.<,>她是个勤勤恳恳的员工。<,>He took a conscientious approach to his studies.<,>他对学习采取认真的态度。<,>The doctor was conscientious in her care of patients.<,>这位医生对病人的照顾很认真。<,>con(共同)+sci(知道)+entious→知道并认真做的<,>conscious(adj.有意识的)/scrupulous(adj.谨慎的)/diligent(adj.勤奋的)

passion<,>/ˈpæʃn/<,>/ˈpæʃən/<,>n.激情/热情/酷爱<,>He spoke with great passion about the project.<,>他满怀激情地谈论这个项目。<,>Music has always been her passion.<,>音乐一直是她的酷爱。<,>The team played with passion and determination.<,>这支队伍带着热情和决心比赛。<,>pass(感觉)+ion→强烈的感觉→激情<,>compassion(n.同情)/passionate(adj.热情的)/fashion(n.时尚)

generate<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪt/<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪt/<,>vt.发生/引起/生殖<,>The wind turbines generate electricity.<,>风力涡轮机发电。<,>His remarks generated a lot of controversy.<,>他的言论引起了很多争议。<,>The new policy is expected to generate jobs.<,>新政策预计会产生就业机会。<,>gener(产生)+ate→使产生<,>general(adj.一般的)/generation(n.一代)/degenerate(v.退化)

extreme<,>/ɪkˈstriːm/<,>/ɪkˈstriːm/<,>adj.极度的/最后的/n.极端/过分<,>She was in extreme pain after the accident.<,>事故后她极度疼痛。<,>He holds extreme views on politics.<,>他对政治持有极端观点。<,>They went to extreme lengths to win the competition.<,>他们竭尽全力去赢得比赛。<,>extr(超出)+eme→超出正常范围的<,>extremity(n.极端)/ultimate(adj.最终的)/radical(adj.激进的)

tuck<,>/tʌk/<,>/tʌk/<,>vt.把边塞到下面/把...夹入/把...藏入/n.褶/裥<,>She tucked her hair behind her ears.<,>她把头发别在耳后。<,>He tucked the letter into his pocket.<,>他把信塞进口袋。<,>The shirt has a neat tuck at the waist.<,>这件衬衫在腰部有一个整齐的褶。<,>联想：tuck像"贴靠"→把东西贴靠藏起来<,>truck(n.卡车)/tuck(n.食物)/pluck(v.拔)

authoritative<,>/ɔːˈθɒrətətɪv/<,>/əˈθɔːrəteɪtɪv/<,>adj.有权威性的/可信的/专断的/命令式的<,>This is an authoritative book on the subject.<,>这是关于这个主题的权威著作。<,>She spoke in an authoritative tone.<,>她用命令式的语气说话。<,>The report provides authoritative data.<,>报告提供了权威数据。<,>author(作者)+itative→像作者一样有权威的<,>authoritarian(adj.专制的)/authentic(adj.真实的)/official(adj.官方的)

athlete<,>/ˈæθliːt/<,>/ˈæθliːt/<,>n.运动员/体育家<,>She is a professional athlete.<,>她是职业运动员。<,>The athletes trained hard for the Olympics.<,>运动员们为奥运会刻苦训练。<,>He was voted Athlete of the Year.<,>他被选为年度最佳运动员。<,>athl(竞赛)+ete→参加竞赛的人<,>athletic(adj.运动的)/marathon(n.马拉松)/gymnast(n.体操运动员)

upright<,>/ˈʌpraɪt/<,>/ˈʌpraɪt/<,>adv.挺直着/竖立着/adj.垂直的/正直的/诚实的<,>Stand upright when you sing.<,>唱歌时要站直。<,>He is an upright citizen.<,>他是个正直的公民。<,>The piano stood upright against the wall.<,>钢琴直立靠在墙边。<,>up(上)+right(直)→直立的<,>uprightness(n.正直)/righteous(adj.正义的)/erect(adj.直立的)

extract<,>/ˈekstrækt/<,>/ˈekstrækt/<,>vt.取出/抽出/采掘/提炼/榨取/获得/索取/摘录/n.摘录/选段/提出物/精/汁<,>They extract oil from olives.<,>他们从橄榄中榨取油。<,>She read an extract from the novel.<,>她读了小说的一段摘录。<,>The dentist extracted my wisdom tooth.<,>牙医拔掉了我的智齿。<,>ex(出)+tract(拉)→拉出来→提取<,>abstract(adj.抽象的)/extraction(n.提取)/distract(v.分心)
obscure<,>/əbˈskjʊə(r)/<,>/əbˈskjʊr/<,>adj.不著名的/adj.不重要的/adj.费解的/adj.模糊不清的/vt.使变糊/vt.掩盖<,>The artist remained obscure throughout his life.<,>这位艺术家一生默默无闻。<,>The meaning of the ancient text is obscure.<,>这篇古文的含义晦涩难懂。<,>Fog obscured the view of the mountains.<,>雾气遮蔽了山景。<,>ob(against)+scure(cover)→掩盖<,>obscure(adj.模糊的)/obscene(adj.淫秽的)/obsequious(adj.谄媚的)

dismay<,>/dɪsˈmeɪ/<,>/dɪsˈmeɪ/<,>n.失望/n.气馁/n.惊恐/vt.使失望/vt.使气馁/vt.使惊恐<,>She looked at the test results with dismay.<,>她沮丧地看着考试成绩。<,>The news of the accident filled them with dismay.<,>事故的消息使他们惊恐万分。<,>His failure dismayed his parents.<,>他的失败让父母失望。<,>dis(away)+may(ability)→使失去能力→使气馁<,>dismay(n.沮丧)/display(v.展示)/dismiss(v.解散)

expend<,>/ɪkˈspend/<,>/ɪkˈspɛnd/<,>vt.花费/vt.消费/vt.消耗<,>They expended great effort to finish the project on time.<,>他们花费了很大努力按时完成项目。<,>The body expends energy during exercise.<,>身体在运动时消耗能量。<,>Don't expend all your savings on unnecessary things.<,>不要把所有积蓄花在不必要的东西上。<,>ex(out)+pend(weigh)→称量出去→花费<,>expend(v.花费)/expand(v.扩张)/extend(v.延伸)

forge<,>/fɔːdʒ/<,>/fɔrdʒ/<,>vt.打制/vt.锻造/vt.伪造<,>Blacksmiths forge metal into tools.<,>铁匠将金属锻造成工具。<,>They forged a strong friendship during the trip.<,>他们在旅途中建立了深厚的友谊。<,>He was arrested for forging documents.<,>他因伪造文件被捕。<,>for(strong)+ge(make)→强力制作→锻造<,>forge(v.锻造)/forage(v.搜寻)/forgo(v.放弃)

demonstrate<,>/ˈdemənstreɪt/<,>/ˈdɛmənˌstreɪt/<,>vt.说明/vt.论证/vt.表露<,>The teacher demonstrated the experiment to the class.<,>老师向全班演示了这个实验。<,>The research demonstrates the effectiveness of the new drug.<,>研究证明了新药的有效性。<,>She demonstrated great courage in the face of danger.<,>她在危险面前表现出极大的勇气。<,>de(fully)+monstrate(show)→充分展示→说明<,>demonstrate(v.证明)/remonstrate(v.抗议)/demon(v.恶魔)

region<,>/ˈriːdʒən/<,>/ˈridʒən/<,>n.地区/n.地带/n.区域/n.范围/n.幅度<,>This plant grows only in tropical regions.<,>这种植物只生长在热带地区。<,>The pain was localized in the abdominal region.<,>疼痛集中在腹部区域。<,>Prices vary by region.<,>价格因地区而异。<,>reg(rule)+ion→统治的范围→区域<,>region(n.地区)/religion(n.宗教)/regimen(n.养生法)

deceive<,>/dɪˈsiːv/<,>/dɪˈsiv/<,>vi.行骗/vt.欺骗/vt.蒙蔽<,>He deceived me into believing his story.<,>他骗我相信了他的故事。<,>Appearances can be deceiving.<,>外表可能具有欺骗性。<,>She deceived her parents about her grades.<,>她在成绩上欺骗了父母。<,>de(away)+ceive(take)→偷偷拿走→欺骗<,>deceive(v.欺骗)/conceive(v.构想)/perceive(v.察觉)

preview<,>/ˈpriːvjuː/<,>/ˈpriˌvju/<,>n.预映/n.预演/n.预告<,>We attended a preview of the new movie.<,>我们参加了新电影的预映。<,>The band gave a preview of their upcoming album.<,>乐队预演了他们即将发行的专辑。<,>Watch the preview before deciding to see the film.<,>看电影前先看看预告片。<,>pre(before)+view(see)→提前看→预演<,>preview(n.预告)/review(n.评论)/interview(n.面试)

ingenious<,>/ɪnˈdʒiːniəs/<,>/ɪnˈdʒinjəs/<,>adj.设计独特的/adj.别致的/adj.巧妙的/adj.灵巧的/adj.善于创造发明的<,>He came up with an ingenious solution to the problem.<,>他想出了一个巧妙的解决问题的方法。<,>The device is an ingenious invention.<,>这个装置是个巧妙的发明。<,>Her ingenious plan saved the company money.<,>她巧妙的计划为公司节省了资金。<,>in(in)+geni(birth)+ous→天生的才能→灵巧的<,>ingenious(adj.巧妙的)/ingenuous(adj.天真的)/genius(n.天才)

questionnaire<,>/ˌkwestʃəˈneə(r)/<,>/ˌkwɛstʃəˈnɛr/<,>n.问卷/n.征求意见表<,>Please fill out this questionnaire about your shopping habits.<,>请填写这份关于您购物习惯的问卷。<,>The company sent out a customer satisfaction questionnaire.<,>公司发出了一份客户满意度调查表。<,>Researchers analyzed data from the questionnaires.<,>研究人员分析了问卷数据。<,>question(问题)+naire(后缀)→问题表→问卷<,>questionnaire(n.问卷)/question(n.问题)/inquiry(n.询问)
breakthrough<,>/ˈbreɪkθruː/<,>/ˈbreɪkˌθru/<,>n.突破/n.突破性进展/n.重要的新发现<,>Scientists have made a major breakthrough in cancer research.<,>科学家们在癌症研究上取得了重大突破。<,>This new technology is a real breakthrough for the industry.<,>这项新技术是该行业的一个真正突破。<,>Her discovery was hailed as a scientific breakthrough.<,>她的发现被誉为科学上的重大突破。<,>break(打破)+through(穿过)→突破<,>breakdown(n.故障/n.崩溃)/breakout(n.爆发/n.越狱)

snack<,>/snæk/<,>/snæk/<,>n.快餐/n.小吃/n.点心<,>I usually have a small snack in the afternoon.<,>我通常在下午吃些点心。<,>The vending machine offers various snacks and drinks.<,>自动售货机提供各种小吃和饮料。<,>Let's stop for a quick snack at the convenience store.<,>我们在便利店停下来吃点快餐吧。<,>sn(蛇)+ack(acknowledge承认)→蛇承认喜欢吃零食<,>snake(n.蛇)/snack(n.小吃)/snip(v.剪断)

yoke<,>/jəʊk/<,>/joʊk/<,>n.牛轭/n.束缚/n.枷锁/vt.结合/vt.联结<,>The oxen were tied together with a wooden yoke.<,>牛被木轭连在一起。<,>They finally threw off the yoke of oppression.<,>他们终于摆脱了压迫的枷锁。<,>The two companies were yoked together in the merger.<,>两家公司在合并中结合在一起。<,>y(why)+o(哦)+ke(可)→为什么哦可以束缚牛<,>yolk(n.蛋黄)/joke(n.笑话)/poke(v.戳)

destination<,>/ˌdestɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌdɛstəˈneɪʃən/<,>n.目的地/n.终点/n.目标<,>Our destination is the Grand Canyon.<,>我们的目的地是大峡谷。<,>After a long journey, we finally reached our destination.<,>长途旅行后，我们终于到达了目的地。<,>The package was sent to the wrong destination.<,>包裹被送到了错误的目的地。<,>destine(注定)+ation(名词后缀)→注定的地方→目的地<,>destiny(n.命运)/station(n.车站)/designation(n.指定)

throne<,>/θrəʊn/<,>/θroʊn/<,>n.御座/n.宝座/n.王位/n.王权<,>The king sat on his golden throne.<,>国王坐在他的金色宝座上。<,>She ascended the throne at the age of 25.<,>她25岁时登上了王位。<,>The dispute was about the succession to the throne.<,>这场争论是关于王位继承的。<,>th(太后)+rone(音似"荣")→太后荣耀地坐在宝座上<,>throne(n.王位)/throng(n.人群)/throb(v.跳动)

privacy<,>/ˈprɪvəsi/<,>/ˈpraɪvəsi/<,>n.个人自由/n.隐私/n.私生活/n.私事<,>Everyone has the right to privacy.<,>每个人都有隐私权。<,>She values her privacy and doesn't give interviews.<,>她重视自己的隐私，不接受采访。<,>The new law protects consumers' online privacy.<,>新法律保护消费者的网络隐私。<,>private(私人的)+cy(名词后缀)→隐私<,>private(adj.私人的)/publicity(n.公开)/privilege(n.特权)

reciprocal<,>/rɪˈsɪprəkl/<,>/rɪˈsɪprəkəl/<,>adj.相互的/adj.互惠的<,>Our relationship is based on reciprocal respect.<,>我们的关系建立在相互尊重的基础上。<,>The two countries signed a reciprocal trade agreement.<,>两国签署了互惠贸易协定。<,>Kindness is often reciprocal.<,>善意常常是相互的。<,>re(回)+cip(拿)+rocal→互相拿取→互惠的<,>reciprocate(v.回报)/reciprocity(n.互惠)/reception(n.接待)

vertical<,>/ˈvɜːtɪkl/<,>/ˈvɜrtɪkəl/<,>adj.垂直的/adj.竖式的<,>The cliff has a nearly vertical drop.<,>悬崖几乎是垂直下降的。<,>Please draw a vertical line on the paper.<,>请在纸上画一条垂直线。<,>The vertical takeoff of the helicopter was impressive.<,>直升机的垂直起飞令人印象深刻。<,>vert(转)+ical→向上转的→垂直的<,>horizontal(adj.水平的)/vertical(adj.垂直的)/vertex(n.顶点)

inventory<,>/ˈɪnvəntri/<,>/ˈɪnvənˌtɔri/<,>n.详细目录/n.存货清单<,>The store takes inventory every month.<,>这家商店每月盘点存货。<,>Please check the inventory before placing the order.<,>下订单前请核对库存清单。<,>The inventory showed we were running low on supplies.<,>库存显示我们的供应品快用完了。<,>in(进入)+vent(来)+ory→进来的东西→存货<,>invent(v.发明)/inventory(n.库存)/venture(n.冒险)

vivid<,>/ˈvɪvɪd/<,>/ˈvɪvɪd/<,>adj.鲜艳的/adj.生动的/adj.栩栩如生的<,>She gave a vivid description of her trip.<,>她生动地描述了她的旅行。<,>The painting shows vivid colors.<,>这幅画色彩鲜艳。<,>I had a vivid dream last night.<,>昨晚我做了一个生动的梦。<,>viv(生命)+id→有生命的→生动的<,>vivid(adj.生动的)/vividly(adv.生动地)/revive(v.复活)
flush<,>/flʌʃ/<,>/flʌʃ/<,>vi.发红/adj.齐平的，同高的<,>Her face began to flush with embarrassment.<,>她的脸因尴尬而开始发红。<,>The tiles should be flush with the wall.<,>瓷砖应该与墙面齐平。<,>The river is flush with the banks after the heavy rain.<,>大雨过后，河水与河岸齐平。<,>flu(流动)+sh→血液流动→发红<,>blush(vi.脸红)/flash(v.闪光/n.闪光灯)  

heir<,>/eə(r)/<,>/ɛr/<,>n.继承人<,>He is the sole heir to the family fortune.<,>他是家族财产的唯一继承人。<,>The prince is the heir to the throne.<,>王子是王位的继承人。<,>She was named as the heir in her uncle's will.<,>她在叔叔的遗嘱中被指定为继承人。<,>发音类似"air(空气)"→继承人需要呼吸空气<,>hair(n.头发)/here(adv.这里)  

screw<,>/skruː/<,>/skru/<,>n.螺丝/vt.用螺钉固定，拧，拧紧<,>He used a screwdriver to tighten the screw.<,>他用螺丝刀拧紧了螺丝。<,>Screw the lid on tightly to avoid leaks.<,>把盖子拧紧以防泄漏。<,>She screwed the shelves to the wall.<,>她用螺丝把架子固定在墙上。<,>s(蛇)+crew(全体船员)→蛇拧螺丝的船员<,>strew(vt.撒播)/chew(v.咀嚼)  

kit<,>/kɪt/<,>/kɪt/<,>n.成套工具，成套用品；配套元件/vt.装备<,>The first aid kit should be easily accessible.<,>急救箱应该放在容易拿到的地方。<,>He bought a model airplane kit for his son.<,>他给儿子买了一套飞机模型套件。<,>The soldiers were kitted out with the latest gear.<,>士兵们配备了最新装备。<,>kit(小猫)→小猫玩成套玩具<,>kid(n.小孩)/kite(n.风筝)  

virtue<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuː/<,>/ˈvɜːrtʃuː/<,>n.善，美德；优点，长处<,>Honesty is a virtue that should be cultivated.<,>诚实是一种应该培养的美德。<,>One of the virtues of this plan is its simplicity.<,>这个计划的优点之一是简单。<,>She was praised for her virtues of patience and kindness.<,>她因耐心和善良的美德而受到赞扬。<,>vir(男人)+tue→男人的美德<,>virtual(adj.虚拟的)/virtuoso(n.艺术大师)  

emphasize<,>/ˈemfəsaɪz/<,>/ˈɛmfəˌsaɪz/<,>vt.强调，着重<,>The teacher emphasized the importance of punctuation.<,>老师强调了标点符号的重要性。<,>He emphasized his point by raising his voice.<,>他提高声音强调自己的观点。<,>The report emphasizes the need for immediate action.<,>报告强调了立即采取行动的必要性。<,>em(使)+phas(显示)+ize→使显示出来→强调<,>emphasis(n.强调)/empathize(v.移情)  

turnover<,>/ˈtɜːnəʊvə(r)/<,>/ˈtɜːrnoʊvər/<,>n.营业额，成交量；人员调整，人员更替率<,>The shop has a monthly turnover of $50,000.<,>这家店的月营业额是5万美元。<,>The company has a high staff turnover rate.<,>这家公司的员工流动率很高。<,>They aim to increase turnover by 20% this year.<,>他们的目标是今年将营业额提高20%。<,>turn(转)+over(翻)→翻转→营业额周转<,>turn over(短语动词：翻转)/overturn(v.推翻)  

mortal<,>/ˈmɔːtl/<,>/ˈmɔːrtl/<,>adj.终有一死的；致命的；你死我活的/n.凡人，人类<,>All human beings are mortal.<,>所有人终有一死。<,>The wound was mortal and he died within minutes.<,>这是致命伤，他几分钟内就死了。<,>The two enemies were locked in mortal combat.<,>两个敌人陷入了你死我活的战斗。<,>mort(死)+al→终有一死的<,>immortal(adj.不朽的)/moral(adj.道德的)  

coverage<,>/ˈkʌvərɪdʒ/<,>/ˈkʌvərɪdʒ/<,>n.新闻报道；覆盖范围<,>The event received extensive media coverage.<,>这个事件得到了媒体的广泛报道。<,>This insurance policy provides worldwide coverage.<,>这份保险提供全球范围的保障。<,>The network has good coverage in rural areas.<,>这个网络在农村地区有良好的覆盖。<,>cover(覆盖)+age(状态)→覆盖范围<,>average(n.平均数)/beverage(n.饮料)  

figure<,>/ˈfɪɡə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪɡjər/<,>vi.出现；合乎情理/n.数字；人物；算术；体型；轮廓；画像；图形/vt.计算；认为<,>She figured prominently in the news.<,>她在新闻中很突出。<,>That figures, given his past behavior.<,>考虑到他过去的行为，这合乎情理。<,>He's good at figures and calculations.<,>他擅长数字和计算。<,>fig(无花果)+ure→无花果形状→图形<,>finger(n.手指)/failure(n.失败)
brutal<,>/ˈbruːtl/<,>/ˈbruːtl/<,>adj.野兽般的/adj.残忍的/adj.无情的/adj.冷酷的/adj.难以忍受的<,>The brutal murder shocked the entire town.<,>这起残忍的谋杀案震惊了整个小镇。<,>The prisoners were subjected to brutal treatment.<,>囚犯们遭受了残酷的对待。<,>The brutal winter made survival difficult.<,>严酷的冬天使生存变得困难。<,>brut(野兽)+al(形容词后缀)→野兽般的<,>brute(n.野兽)/brutish(adj.粗野的)/brutality(n.残忍)

slight<,>/slaɪt/<,>/slaɪt/<,>adj.轻微的/adj.微小的/v.侮慢/v.轻视/v.冷落<,>There was a slight improvement in his condition.<,>他的情况有轻微好转。<,>She felt slighted by his lack of attention.<,>她因他的忽视而感到被冷落。<,>He gave a slight nod of approval.<,>他微微点头表示同意。<,>s(小)+light(轻)→轻微的<,>sleight(n.技巧)/slim(adj.苗条的)/slit(n.裂缝)

ore<,>/ɔːr/<,>/ɔːr/<,>n.矿/n.矿石<,>The mine produces high-quality iron ore.<,>这个矿出产高品质的铁矿石。<,>They discovered a rich vein of gold ore.<,>他们发现了一条丰富的金矿脉。<,>The country exports large quantities of copper ore.<,>该国出口大量铜矿石。<,>or(金)+e→矿石<,>oar(n.桨)/or(conj.或者)/core(n.核心)

corrupt<,>/kəˈrʌpt/<,>/kəˈrʌpt/<,>adj.堕落的/adj.腐败的/adj.贪赃舞弊的/vt.腐蚀/vt.使堕落<,>The corrupt official was sentenced to prison.<,>这个腐败的官员被判入狱。<,>Power tends to corrupt absolute power corrupts absolutely.<,>权力导致腐败，绝对权力导致绝对腐败。<,>The file was corrupted and couldn't be opened.<,>文件损坏了，无法打开。<,>cor(完全)+rupt(破裂)→完全破裂→腐败<,>erupt(v.爆发)/disrupt(v.扰乱)/interrupt(v.打断)

preclude<,>/prɪˈkluːd/<,>/prɪˈkluːd/<,>vt.排除/vt.阻止/vt.妨碍<,>His age precluded him from joining the army.<,>他的年龄使他无法参军。<,>This agreement doesn't preclude future negotiations.<,>这份协议不排除未来的谈判。<,>Bad weather precluded any possibility of a picnic.<,>恶劣的天气排除了野餐的可能性。<,>pre(前)+clude(关闭)→提前关闭→阻止<,>include(v.包含)/exclude(v.排除)/conclude(v.结束)

previous<,>/ˈpriːviəs/<,>/ˈpriːviəs/<,>adj.先的/adj.前的/adj.以前的<,>She had no previous experience in teaching.<,>她以前没有教学经验。<,>On the previous day, they had visited the museum.<,>前一天，他们参观了博物馆。<,>This problem was mentioned in the previous chapter.<,>这个问题在前一章提到过。<,>pre(前)+vi(路)+ous(形容词后缀)→前面的路→以前的<,>precious(adj.珍贵的)/premise(n.前提)/preview(n.预览)

regime<,>/reɪˈʒiːm/<,>/reɪˈʒiːm/<,>n.政治制度/n.政权<,>The new regime promised democratic reforms.<,>新政权承诺进行民主改革。<,>Under the old regime, many freedoms were restricted.<,>在旧政权下，许多自由受到限制。<,>The country has changed its economic regime.<,>该国改变了经济制度。<,>reg(统治)+ime→统治方式→政权<,>regimen(n.养生法)/regiment(n.团)/region(n.地区)

transmit<,>/trænzˈmɪt/<,>/trænzˈmɪt/<,>vt.传送/vt.传递/vt.传染/vt.播送/vt.发射<,>Mosquitoes can transmit diseases.<,>蚊子可以传播疾病。<,>The radio station transmits 24 hours a day.<,>这个广播电台24小时不间断播送。<,>Parents transmit values to their children.<,>父母把价值观传递给孩子。<,>trans(跨越)+mit(发送)→传送<,>transfer(v.转移)/transit(n.运输)/transient(adj.短暂的)

commemorate<,>/kəˈmeməreɪt/<,>/kəˈmeməreɪt/<,>vt.纪念/vt.庆祝<,>A monument was built to commemorate the battle.<,>建立了一座纪念碑来纪念这场战役。<,>We commemorate the founding of our nation every year.<,>我们每年都庆祝国家的成立。<,>The stamp commemorates the famous scientist.<,>这枚邮票纪念这位著名科学家。<,>com(共同)+memor(记忆)+ate(动词后缀)→共同记忆→纪念<,>memory(n.记忆)/memorial(n.纪念碑)/memorize(v.记住)

argue<,>/ˈɑːɡjuː/<,>/ˈɑːrɡjuː/<,>vi.争论/vi.争辩/vi.辩论/vt.主张/vt.说服<,>They argued about politics for hours.<,>他们就政治问题争论了几个小时。<,>The lawyer argued the case persuasively.<,>律师有说服力地辩论了这个案子。<,>I would argue that education is the key to success.<,>我认为教育是成功的关键。<,>arg(明亮)+ue→把问题辩明→辩论<,>augment(v.增加)/allegue(v.断言)/argot(n.行话)
consumption<,>/kənˈsʌmpʃn/<,>/kənˈsʌmpʃən/<,>n.消耗/n.消费/n.肺病<,>Excessive consumption of sugar can lead to health problems.<,>过量摄入糖分会导致健康问题。<,>The country's energy consumption has increased dramatically.<,>该国的能源消耗急剧增加。<,>He died of consumption at a young age.<,>他年轻时死于肺病。<,>con(共同)+sumpt(拿)+ion→共同拿取→消耗<,>assumption(n.假定/n.设想)/presumption(n.推测/n.冒昧)

premature<,>/ˈpremətʃə(r)/<,>/ˌpriːməˈtʃʊr/<,>adj.比预期时间早的/adj.不成熟的/adj.仓促的<,>The baby was born two months premature.<,>这个婴儿早产了两个月。<,>It would be premature to make a decision now.<,>现在做决定还为时过早。<,>His premature departure surprised everyone.<,>他仓促的离开让所有人感到惊讶。<,>pre(前)+mature(成熟)→在成熟之前→不成熟的<,>premier(adj.首要的/n.总理)/premeditate(v.预谋)

superior<,>/suːˈpɪəriə(r)/<,>/suːˈpɪriər/<,>adj.上级的/adj.较高的/adj.优越的/adj.有优越感的/adj.高傲的/n.上级/n.长官<,>This product is superior in quality to others.<,>这个产品质量优于其他产品。<,>She has a superior attitude towards her colleagues.<,>她对同事态度高傲。<,>He reported the problem to his superior.<,>他向长官报告了这个问题。<,>super(超)+ior(比较级)→超过其他的→优越的<,>inferior(adj.下级的/adj.劣等的)/superficial(adj.表面的/adj.肤浅的)

drought<,>/draʊt/<,>/draʊt/<,>n.干旱/n.旱灾<,>The region has suffered from severe drought for years.<,>该地区多年来遭受严重干旱。<,>Farmers are struggling due to the prolonged drought.<,>由于长期干旱，农民们正在苦苦挣扎。<,>The drought caused water shortages in many cities.<,>干旱导致许多城市缺水。<,>dr(干)+ought(应该)→应该干→干旱<,>draught(n.通风/n.一饮)/brought(v.带来)

periodical<,>/ˌpɪəriˈɒdɪkl/<,>/ˌpɪriˈɑːdɪkl/<,>adj.周期的/adj.定期的/adj.时而发生的/n.期刊<,>She subscribes to several scientific periodicals.<,>她订阅了几种科学期刊。<,>The company conducts periodical performance reviews.<,>公司定期进行绩效评估。<,>He suffers from periodical headaches.<,>他时常头痛。<,>period(周期)+ical→周期的<,>periodic(adj.周期的)/period(时期)

leaflet<,>/ˈliːflət/<,>/ˈliːflət/<,>v.散发传单/n.传单/n.散页印刷品/n.小册子<,>They were leafleting outside the station.<,>他们在车站外散发传单。<,>I picked up a leaflet about local attractions.<,>我拿了一份关于当地景点的小册子。<,>The leaflet contains important safety information.<,>这份传单包含重要的安全信息。<,>leaf(页)+let(小)→小页→传单<,>booklet(n.小册子)/pamphlet(n.小册子)

accessory<,>/əkˈsesəri/<,>/ækˈsesəri/<,>n.附件/n.零件/n.配件/n.装饰品/n.同谋/n.帮凶/n.包庇犯<,>She bought matching accessories for her dress.<,>她为裙子买了相配的饰品。<,>The store sells phone accessories.<,>这家店出售手机配件。<,>He was charged as an accessory to the crime.<,>他被指控为犯罪同谋。<,>access(接近)+ory→接近主体的东西→附件<,>access(n.通道)/assessor(n.估价员)

compromise<,>/ˈkɒmprəmaɪz/<,>/ˈkɑːmprəmaɪz/<,>v.妥协/v.危及/v.放弃/n.妥协/n.和解/n.折中办法<,>Both sides had to compromise to reach an agreement.<,>双方不得不妥协以达成协议。<,>Don't compromise your principles.<,>不要放弃你的原则。<,>We found a good compromise between quality and price.<,>我们在质量和价格之间找到了很好的折中方案。<,>com(共同)+promise(承诺)→共同承诺→妥协<,>comprise(v.包含)/promise(n.承诺)

retort<,>/rɪˈtɔːt/<,>/rɪˈtɔːrt/<,>n&v.反驳/n&v.回嘴<,>"That's not true!" she retorted angrily.<,>"那不是真的！"她愤怒地反驳道。<,>His sharp retort silenced the critic.<,>他尖锐的反驳让批评者哑口无言。<,>She always has a quick retort ready.<,>她总是能迅速回嘴。<,>re(回)+tort(扭)→扭回去→反驳<,>retort(n.蒸馏器)/distort(v.扭曲)

electrify<,>/ɪˈlektrɪfaɪ/<,>/ɪˈlektrəfaɪ/<,>vt.使充电/vt.使电气化/vt.使激动/vt.使兴奋<,>The news electrified the audience.<,>这个消息让观众兴奋不已。<,>The government plans to electrify rural areas.<,>政府计划使农村地区电气化。<,>His performance electrified the crowd.<,>他的表演让观众激动不已。<,>electr(电)+ify(使)→使带电→使兴奋<,>electric(adj.电的)/electrocute(v.电刑处死)

fringe<,>/frɪndʒ/<,>/frɪndʒ/<,>adj.附加的/n.刘海/n.饰以流苏的边/n.边缘/n.外围/vt.成为...的边缘<,>She has straight hair with bangs fringe.<,>她留着直发和齐刘海。<,>The lampshade has a beaded fringe.<,>灯罩上有珠饰流苏。<,>This issue is on the fringe of our discussion.<,>这个问题在我们讨论的边缘。<,>fr(自由)+inge→自由的边缘地带<,>brim(n.边缘)/verge(n.边缘)/fray(v.磨损)

beyond<,>/bɪˈjɒnd/<,>/bɪˈjɑːnd/<,>adv.在更远处/adv.再往后/prep.在...的那边/prep.远于/prep.迟于/prep.越出<,>The mountains beyond the valley are covered with snow.<,>山谷那边的山脉覆盖着积雪。<,>This task is beyond my ability.<,>这项任务超出了我的能力范围。<,>We stayed beyond midnight at the party.<,>我们在聚会上待到午夜之后。<,>be(在)+yond(那边)→在那一边<,>behind(prep.在...后面)/above(prep.在...上方)/within(prep.在...之内)

hazard<,>/ˈhæzəd/<,>/ˈhæzərd/<,>n.危险/n.公害/vt.尝试着做/vt.冒...风险<,>Smoking is a serious health hazard.<,>吸烟是严重的健康危害。<,>He hazarded a guess at the answer.<,>他冒险猜测答案。<,>Working at heights without protection is hazardous.<,>无保护的高空作业很危险。<,>haz(机会)+ard→冒险的机会<,>danger(n.危险)/risk(n.风险)/peril(n.危险)

justify<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪfaɪ/<,>vt.证明...是正当的<,>Can you justify your decision?<,>你能证明你的决定是正当的吗？<,>The results justify the effort we put in.<,>结果证明我们的努力是值得的。<,>He tried to justify his actions with excuses.<,>他试图用借口为自己的行为辩护。<,>just(正义)+ify(使)→使...正当<,>verify(v.核实)/rectify(v.纠正)/testify(v.作证)

dreadful<,>/ˈdredfl/<,>/ˈdredfl/<,>adj.糟透了的/adj.极不合意的/adj.极端的/adj.极其大的/adj.可怕的<,>We had dreadful weather during our vacation.<,>我们度假期间天气糟透了。<,>He made a dreadful mistake in the report.<,>他在报告中犯了一个可怕的错误。<,>The accident scene was dreadful to witness.<,>事故现场看起来很可怕。<,>dread(恐惧)+ful(充满)→充满恐惧的<,>awful(adj.糟糕的)/terrible(adj.可怕的)/frightful(adj.可怕的)

voluntary<,>/ˈvɒləntri/<,>/ˈvɑːlənteri/<,>adj.自愿的/adj.志愿的<,>She does voluntary work at the hospital.<,>她在医院做志愿工作。<,>Participation in the program is completely voluntary.<,>参与这个项目完全是自愿的。<,>He made a voluntary confession to the police.<,>他向警方自愿供认。<,>vol(意志)+unt+ary→凭意志的→自愿的<,>compulsory(adj.强制的)/obligatory(adj.义务的)/spontaneous(adj.自发的)

proof<,>/pruːf/<,>/pruːf/<,>adj.耐...的/adj.能防...的/n.证据/n.证明/n.校样/n.样张<,>This material is water-proof.<,>这种材料是防水的。<,>Do you have any proof of identity?<,>你有身份证明吗？<,>The editor checked the final proof before printing.<,>编辑在印刷前检查了最终校样。<,>pro(向前)+of→向前展示→证明<,>evidence(n.证据)/testimony(n.证词)/verification(n.核实)
militant<,>/ˈmɪlɪtənt/<,>/ˈmɪlɪtənt/<,>adj.激进的/adj.好斗的/n.激进分子/n.斗士<,>He was known for his militant views on social issues.<,>他因对社会问题的激进观点而闻名。<,>The militant group carried out several attacks last year.<,>这个激进组织去年发动了多次袭击。<,>She became a militant for women's rights.<,>她成为了一名女权斗士。<,>milit(军事)+ant(形容词后缀)→像军事一样的→激进的<,>military(adj.军事的)/militia(n.民兵)/militate(v.产生作用)

dilute<,>/daɪˈluːt/<,>/daɪˈlut/<,>adj.稀释的/adj.冲淡的/v.稀释/v.冲淡<,>The juice was too strong, so I diluted it with water.<,>果汁太浓了，所以我用水稀释它。<,>He gave a diluted version of the truth.<,>他给出了一个淡化事实的版本。<,>The medicine comes in both concentrated and dilute forms.<,>这种药有浓缩和稀释两种形式。<,>di(分开)+lute(洗)→洗开→稀释<,>pollute(v.污染)/absolute(adj.绝对的)/dilatory(adj.拖延的)
